      1. 3.6.1. Ham and Bean Soup
      2. 3.6.2. Tomato Soup
    13. 3.7. Drinks
      1. 3.7.1. Vegetable Shake

test

Honey Garlic Chicken Noodle Bowls

These Honey Garlic Chicken Noodle Bowls can be prepped in about 45 minutes. They are made up of sweet potato glass noodles, ground chicken, a variety of vegetables, and a sauce to bring it all together.

CourseCuisineTime - 45 minutes
Main DishAsian, meal prepPrep - 15 minutes
Cook - 30 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
597kcal5 servings
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates66g53%
Fat21g17%
Protein36g29%

Ingredients:

For the Meat and Vegetables

  • 2 lbs (908 g) ground chicken (93/7)
  • 8 oz (227 g) sweet potato glass noodles
  • 1 small (125 g) onion
  • 1 medium (150 g) red pepper
  • 8 oz (227 g) mushrooms
  • 8 oz (227 g) shredded cabbage i buy this pre shredded
  • 4 cloves (15 g) garlic
  • 5 stalks (25 g) green onions
  • 2 tbsp (30 g) oil
  • salt and pepper

For the Sauce

  • 2 tbsp (30 g) soy sauce
  • cup (84 g) honey
  • cup (80 g) oyster sauce
  • 2 tsp (10 g) sesame oil
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) sriracha

Instructions:

For the Noodles

  1. Place the noodles into a bowl and pour over enough hot water to submerge them. Allow them to soften while you prepare the rest of your ingredients.

For the Stir Fry

  1. Heat a large skillet over medium high heat and add 1 tbsp of oil and throw in the ground chicken. Season lightly with salt and pepper.
  2. Keep an eye on the chicken while you cut up your vegetables and tend to it as needed. Cook the chicken until it has browned and no pink remains. When finished, remove it from the skillet and set aside.
  3. While the chicken is cooking, wash and cut all of your vegetables. Cut the onion into thin slices, the red pepper into a large dice, the mushrooms into thin slices, shred the cabbage (if necessary), mince the garlic, and cut the tops off the green onions on a bias.
  4. Once the chicken has finished and you have removed it from the pan, add tbsp of oil and add in the onions and peppers first. Allow these to cook and brown for a couple of minutes before adding the other vegetables.
  5. Make some room in the center of the pan and add another tbsp of oil and the mushrooms. Allow the mushrooms to brown and release their water before you stir them around too much.
  6. Once the mushrooms have browned, add the cabbage and garlic. Stir to distribute everything in the pan.

For the Sauce

  1. In a bowl, stir together the soy sauce, honey, oyster sauce, sesame oil, and sriracha. Mix vigorously to make sure that the honey gets evenly stirred in.

Construction

  1. Place the skillet over medium heat. Add in the chicken and pour about half of the sauce over the top. Stir to combine so that the chicken and vegetables are coated.
  2. Drain the water away from the noodles and add them into the pan. Pour the remaining sauce over the top and stir. Taste test and add salt and pepper as needed.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide the contents of the pan evenly between 5 containers. This meal will last up to 5 days in the fridge.

Teriyaki Rotisserie Chicken Bowls

These Teriyaki Rotisserie Chicken Bowls can be prepped with no cooking other than using a microwave by utilizing a rotisserie chicken bought from the store. This meal can be tossed together in 20 minutes and provide you with your lunches for the week.

CourseCuisineTime - 20 minutes
Main DishAsian, meal prepPrep - 20 minutes
Cook - 5 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
557kcal5 servings
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates63g53%
Fat17g14%
Protein38g32%

Ingredients:

  • 1.5 lbs (681 g) pulled rotisserie chicken
  • 9 tbsp (135 g) teriyaki sauce
  • 2 tsp (10 g) sesame seeds
  • 2 (10 g) green onions

For the Rice

  • 4 cups (568 g) cooked rice
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) soy sauce
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) rice vinegar
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) crunchy chili garlic oil

For the Slaw

  • 12 oz (340 g) shredded cabbage
  • 1 cup (100 g) matchstick carrots
  • 2 tbsp (30 g) rice vinegar
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) crunchy chili garlic oil
  • 1 tbsp (21 g) honey

Instructions:

  1. Cook the frozen rice in the microwave according to the packaging.
  2. In a large bowl, add the carrots, cabbage, vinegar, chili garlic oil, and honey.
  3. Mix to combine, season with salt to taste and adjust flavor as needed.
  4. Butcher your rotisserie chicken and pull away the meat. Measure out 1.5lbs or 681g of the chicken into a bowl.
  5. Add 4 tbsp or 60g of teriyaki sauce and mix.
  6. Add the rice to the bowl and mix in the soy sauce, vinegar, and chili oil.
  7. Divide the ingredients evenly between 5 containers. Top with sesame seeds and green onions if you wish.
  8. After reheating, top each dish with 1 tbsp of teriyaki sauce.

Sweet Chili Noodle Bowls

These Sweet Chili Noodle Bowls are a combination of noodles, chicken, lettuce, cabbage, cucumbers, pickled carrots and a sweet chili vinaigrette. They are meant to be eaten cold and are a wonderful lunch option for a hot summer day.

CourseCuisineTime - 45 minutes
Main DishAsian, meal prepPrep - 20 minutes
Cook - 25 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
569kcal5 servings
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates64g53%
Fat18g15%
Protein37g31%

Ingredients:

For the Chicken

  • 2 lbs (908 g) boneless skinless chicken breasts
  • 2 tbsp (24 g) gochujang
  • 1 tsp (5 g) oil
  • salt and pepper to taste

For the Noodles and Vegetables

  • 10 oz (275 g) sweet potato glass noodles
  • 1 medium head (125 g) romaine lettuce
  • 4.5 oz (125 g) red cabbage
  • 1 medium (150 g) seedless cucumber
  • 2 medium (125 g) pickled carrots

For the Sweet Chili Vinaigrette

  • cup (60 g) light oil avocado, vegetable, or light olive will work
  • 1 tbsp (23.5 g) sriracha
  • 1 tbsp (23.5 g) vinegar
  • 3 tbsp (45 g) lime juice
  • 3 tbsp (36 g) sugar
  • 1 tsp (3 g) sesame seeds

For the Pickled Carrots

  • 4 medium (200 g) carrots
  • 1 cups (360 g) vinegar
  • 1 cups (360 g) water
  • 1 tbsp (12 g) sugar
  • 1 tsp (3 g) salt

Instructions:

For the Pickled Carrots

  1. I would recommend making a big batch of these carrots as they last for weeks in the fridge and they rock. They go on everything. For this particular recipe you'll only need about 2 carrots worth but making a bigger batch is nice to do. It also helps to prepare these the night before you make the meal so they have time to pickle but this is not absolutely necessary. 30 minutes to brine will work.
  2. Wash and peel the outer layer of your carrots. Using a vegetable peeler, go down the length of the carrot to create ribbons.
  3. For the brine, mix together the water, vinegar, salt, and sugar. Stir to combine and pour over top of the carrots in a glass jar. If you don't have enough to cover the carrots, you can just add more water and vinegar in equal parts.

For the Noodles

  1. I have found that the sweet potato glass noodles linked above work the best for this application. They don't dry out in the fridge over the week and have a soft bite. They are my favorite noodle to use right now. Can't speak highly enough about them. I bought mine at a local Asian grocery but I have also seen them at Central Market and on Amazon.
  2. To soften the noodles, I place them into a large bowl and pour boiling water over the top to soak while I prepare the rest of the ingredients. Get them started first so they will be ready when needed.

For the Chicken

  1. This meal is meant to be eaten cold and because of this, chicken breast is a fine choice. I usually stick to chicken thighs when I meal prep because they reheat better in the microwave and retain moisture. Since we don't have to worry about that, chicken breast is perfect.
  2. Cut or pound your chicken breasts until they are of even thickness throughout. This will help them cook faster and more evenly. Shoot for about 1/2" in thickness.
  3. Season the chicken breast with salt and pepper and coat the chicken with 2 tbsp of gochujang.
  4. I cook the chicken in the air fryer as it is easy and you get awesome color and flavor. You can cook the chicken however you prefer.
  5. Preheat your air fryer to 400F (204C) and cook the chicken for 4-5 minutes on each side. Cook in batches to not overcrowd the air fryer. Adjust the cooking time if you have thicker or thinner pieces of chicken.
  6. Once the chicken has finished cooking, set it aside to rest for a few minutes before cutting it into thin slices.

For the Vegetables

  1. While the chicken is cooking, chop up all of your vegetables.
  2. Cut up the romaine lettuce into thin pieces until you have about 2 cups worth.
  3. For the red cabbage you can use the preshredded stuff in the bag or buy the smallest head of cabbage you can find. Cut the cabbage into thin slices.
  4. Cut the cucumber in half length-wise and scoop out the seeds with a spoon. Cut the halves on a bias into thin slices.

For the Dressing

  1. Mix all of the ingredients in a bowl or jar with a lid and shake to emulsify the fat with the vinegar and lime juice.
  2. Divide evenly into 5 smaller ramekins.

Plating

  1. Drain all of the water away from the noodles and cut the chicken into thin slices if you have not yet.
  2. This recipe makes 5 servings so lay out 5 of your meal prep containers.
  3. Divide the noodles, chicken, cucumbers, cabbage, and lettuce evenly between the containers. Each container gets a healthy pinch of the carrots and 1 of the ramekins of the vinaigrette.
  4. To eat, pour the vinaigrette over the top of the dish, season lightly with salt and pepper, replace the lid on the container and shake up the ingredients to coat with the vinaigrette.

Honey Miso Noodles

Honey Miso Noodles made with chicken thighs, vegetables, and a sauce from red miso paste, soy sauce, honey, and chicken broth. These noodles are have a nice balance of savory and sweet from the umami in the miso paste and sweetness from the honey.

CourseCuisineTime - 45 minutes
Main DishAsian, meal prepPrep - 15 minutes
Cook - 30 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
565kcal6 servings
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates66g55%
Fat17g14%
Protein36g30%

Ingredients:

For the Sauce

  • 3 tbsp (60 g) honey
  • 2 tbsp (30 g) soy sauce gluten free if needed
  • 3 tbsp (45 g) red miso paste
  • cup (60 g) chicken broth
  • 1 tbsp (23 g) rice vinegar

For the Chicken and Noodles

  • 12 oz (336 g) lo mein noodles spaghetti noodles work too, gluten free if needed
  • 1 medium (200 g) sweet onion
  • 5 medium (300 g) carrots
  • 2 medium (300 g) zucchini
  • 3 (15 g) green onions
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) minced garlic
  • 2 lbs (1135 g) boneless skinless chicken thighs
  • 1 tsp (3 g) garlic powder
  • 1 tbsp (23 g) olive oil
  • 1 tbsp (6 g) sesame seeds optional for garnish
  • salt and pepper to taste

Instructions:

  1. To make the best use of your time, read through the entire recipe before you start and cook things like the noodles and chicken simultaneously to make things move faster.

For the Sauce

  1. Combine the honey, soy sauce, miso paste, rice vinegar, and chicken broth together. Stir to combine and dissolve the miso paste.

For the Chicken

  1. Preheat your oven to 425F.
  2. In a large bowl, add your chicken and season lightly with salt and pepper. Add in 1 tsp of garlic powder, 1 tsp of oil, and 1/4 of the sauce mixture you just made. Toss it around to evenly distribute.
  3. Place the chicken onto a large sheet pan smooth side down. Bake for 8-10 minutes on the top rack.
  4. After 10 minutes, turn the oven to broil and cook for 4-5 minutes to encourage the chicken to brown. Watch it carefully as it will be prone to burning under the broiler. Sometimes it helps to leave the oven door cracked open a bit.
  5. Once the chicken has browned and developed some color, pull it out of the oven and allow it to rest for at least 10 minutes. Temp it and make sure it is at 165F to ensure it is done.
  6. Cut the chicken into small bite sized pieces.

For the Noodles

  1. In a large bowl, add the noodles, chicken, vegetables, and the remaining sauce you made. Stir to combine and season with salt and pepper to taste.

For the Vegetables

  1. Wash and cut all of your vegetables. Cut the onion into thin slices and the zucchini into a julienne (thin strips). Using a vegetable peeler, go down the length of the carrot to create thin ribbons. Rougly chop the ribbons in smaller pieces with a knife. (You can use the matchstick carrots from the store to save time)
  2. In a large skillet add a bit of oil over medium high heat. Add in the onions and season lightly with salt. Cook for a couple of minutes until they have begun to brown.
  3. Make room in the center of the pan and add more oil if needed. Add the zucchini and allow it to cook down and brown a bit.
  4. Make room in the center of the pan again and add the carrots and garlic. Cook for a couple of more minutes to soften up the vegetables a bit.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 6 servings. Divide your ingredients evenly into 6 containers. Top each dish with chopped green onions and sesame seeds.

Thai Coconut Chicken Red Curry

This Thai Coconut Chicken Red Curry is made using red Thai curry paste, coconut milk, chicken thighs and a mixture of different root vegetables. Served with a side of rice and a lime wedge, this meal has loads of flavor and reheats extremely well in the microwave.

CourseCuisineTime - 50 minutes
Main DishAsian, meal prepPrep - 10 minutes
Cook - 40 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
601kcal6 servings
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates57g47%
Fat24g20%
Protein38g31%

Ingredients:

  • 2 lbs (1135 g) boneless skinless chicken thighs
  • 1 medium (150 g) green pepper
  • 1 bunch (100 g) green onions
  • 3 medium (200 g) carrots
  • 2 medium (400 g) russet potatoes
  • cup (60 g) red Thai curry paste
  • 1 can (400 g) light coconut milk
  • 1 tbsp (8 g) cumin
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) minced ginger
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) minced garlic
  • 1 tbsp (14 g) brown sugar
  • 2 tbsp (32 g) peanut butter
  • 1 tbsp (23 g) lime juice
  • 1 cups (360 g) chicken broth
  • 1 tbsp (6 g) cornstarch optional to thicken
  • 2 tbsp (25 g) dry roasted peanuts
  • 1 tbsp (23 g) oil
  • 4 cups (675 g) cooked rice
  • 1 lime optional for garnish
  • 1 bunch cilantro optional for garnish

Instructions:

For the Rice

  1. Make enough rice to yield4cups of cooked rice. 1 cup of dry rice will make between 2-3 cups of cooked rice depending on what type of rice you use.

For the Curry

  1. Wash and cut all of your vegetables. Cut the pepper into a large dice, green onions (both the whites and greens) into a small dice, the potatoes into large dice, and the carrots into a medium to large dice.
  2. In a large stock pot over medium high heat, add a bit of oil and add in your carrots, peppers, green onions, and ginger. Saut for a couple of minutes until they develop some color.
  3. Make room in the center of the pot and add in a bit more oil and place the cumin and garlic into the oil to bloom it. Add in the red curry paste and brown sugar and stir everything together.
  4. Season the chicken lightly with salt and pepper on both sides. Make room in the center of pot and and add in the chicken. Cook it for a couple of minutes on each side to brown. Make sure you don't burn the vegetables.
  5. Once the chicken has browned, add in the coconut milk, chicken broth, and potatoes. Bring to a light boil and cover with a lid. Reduce the heat to medium low and allow it to simmer for 12-15 minutes.
  6. Once it has simmer for 12-15 minutes and the potatoes have softened, pull out the chicken and set aside. Add in the peanut butter and lime juice.
  7. Cut the chicken into bite sized pieces and return to the pot.
  8. If you need to thicken your curry, make a cornstarch slurry by mixing together equal parts of cornstarch and cold water. Start with 1 tbsp of each and slowly stir it in to thicken the sauce. If you need more, add more until you reach your desired thickness.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 6 servings. Each dish gets cup of cooked rice. Divide the curry mixture evenly into each container. Top each dish with crushed peanuts, cilantro, and a slice of a lime wedge.

30 Minute Stir Fry

This 30 Minute Stir Fry is made up of ground turkey, vegetables, and a side of rice. With two skillets working at once, you can have this meal finished in 30 minutes easily.

CourseCuisineTime - 30 minutes
Main DishAsian, meal prepPrep - 10 minutes
Cook - 20 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
530kcal5 servings
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates45g42%
Fat20g18%
Protein42g39%

Ingredients:

For the Turkey

  • 2 lbs (908 g) ground turkey (93/7)
  • 8 oz (227 g) mushrooms
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) oil

For the Vegetables

  • 1 medium (200 g) sweet onion
  • lb (227 g) green beans
  • 1 medium (150 g) red pepper
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) oil
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) minced ginger
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) minced garlic
  • 2 tsp (10 g) soy sauce
  • salt and pepper to taste

For the Rice

  • 3 cups (563 g) cooked rice

For the Sauce

  • 3 tbsp (45 g) soy sauce
  • 2 tbsp (30 g) gochujang
  • 2 tbsp (30 g) mirin can sub with half the amount of honey
  • 1 tsp (5 g) sesame oil
  • 2 tsp (10 g) rice vinegar

Instructions:

For the Rice

  1. Cook enough rice to yield 3 cups of cooked rice. 1 cup of dry rice will make 2-3 cups of cooked rice depending on what kind of rice you make.

For the Turkey and Vegetables

  1. In a large skillet over medium high heat, add some oil and brown the turkey. Season lightly with salt and pepper.
  2. Cut all of your vegetables while the turkey cooks. Cut the mushrooms into a medium dice, the onion and pepper into a large dice, and the green beens into small pieces.
  3. Once the turkey has browned, add in the mushrooms and allow them to cook down.
  4. In another skillet over medium high heat, add some oil and the onions and peppers first. Allow them to develop some color and soften then add in the ginger and green beans. A minute or two later, add in the garlic and stir to combine.
  5. Drizzle 2 tsp of soy sauce over the top of the vegetables and adjust flavor to taste with salt and pepper.

For the Sauce

  1. While everything is cooking you can prepare you sauce by combining the soy sauce, gochujang, mirin, rice vinegar, and sesame oil in a bowl and mixing.
  2. Once the mushrooms have cooked down, pour the sauce over the top and mix, allow it to cook and thicken up a bit. While this is happening you can start to plate your rice and vegetables.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Each dish gets cup of rice and you can divide the vegetables and turkey evenly between the dishes.

Ground Pork Pancit

Filipino Pancit made with ground pork, rice sticks and a variety of vegetables. This dish is flavored with chicken stock, lime juice, soy sauce, and oyster sauce.

CourseCuisineTime - 45 minutes 45 minutes 45 minutes
Main DishAsian, Filipino, meal prepPrep - 10 minutes 10 minutes 10 minutes
Cook - 35 minutes 35 minutes 35 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
682kcal5 servings
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates45g36%
Fat37g29%
Protein43g34%

Ingredients:

For the Pancit

  • 3 lbs (1362 g) ground pork (85/15) beef or turkey works as well
  • 8 oz (227 g) shredded cabbage or coleslaw mix
  • 1 medium (200 g) sweet onion
  • lb (227 g) carrots
  • lb (227 g) celery
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) minced garlic
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) minced ginger
  • 8 oz (227 g) rice sticks
  • 5 (25 g) green onions
  • 1 (15 g) jalapeo optional

For the Sauce

  • 3 tbsp (45 g) lime juice
  • cup (60 g) chicken stock
  • 2 tbsp (30 g) oyster sauce
  • 2 tbsp (35 g) soy sauce

Instructions:

For the Rice Sticks

  1. Add the rice sticks to a bowl of hot water and allow them to soak to soften while you cook the other ingredients.

For the Pork and Vegetables

  1. In a large skillet or wok, add in the pork and brown.
  2. While the pork is cooking, cut all of your vegetables. Cut the onion into thin slices, celery into a small dice, and the carrots into ribbons using a vegetable peeler. If you wanted to buy matchstick carrots, you could use those as well. Chop the tops off of some green onions and thinly slice a jalapeo for garnishing.
  3. Once the pork has finished cooking, remove it from the pan and place into a large bowl, reserving all of the grease in the pan. You will use this to cook the vegetables. If there is more than 2 tbsp of grease in the pan, remove the excess.
  4. Add the onions and celery to the pan with the rendered fat. Allow them to cook for about 5 minutes. Then add in the garlic and ginger and cook for a minute or two until they become fragrant.
  5. Next add in the carrots and cabbage. Season lightly with salt and cook for 3-5 more minutes until the cabbage has wilted slightly and softened.

For the Sauce

  1. In a bowl, mix together the chicken stock, soy sauce, lime juice, and oyster sauce. Stir to combine.

For the Pancit

  1. Drain the water away from your rice sticks and pass a knife through them a few times to break them into smaller pieces.
  2. In the large bowl that is holding your pork, add the rice sticks, vegetables, and sauce. Mix to combine and season with salt and pepper to taste. Additionally, if you feel you should add more lime or soy sauce, do so.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 6 servings. Divide the Pancit into 6 containers. Top with green onions, jalapeo, and a lime wedge.

Reheating

  1. Some brands of rice sticks tend to dry out more than others in the fridge over the course of the week. If you find that happens to you, add a splash of chicken stock over the top of your meal before reheating and it will help.

Korean Chicken Stew Dakdoritang

Dakdoritang is a Spicy Korean Chicken Stew dish. It is full of intense flavors from gochujang and gochugaru and its stewy qualities make it a wonderful dish for meal prepping. Filled with potatoes, carrots, celery, and chicken and served with rice this stew is something you'll find yourself wanting to make often

CourseCuisineTime - 1 hour
Main DishAsian, Korean, meal prepPrep - 15 minutes
Cook - 45 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
520kcal6 servings
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates63g56%
Fat15g13%
Protein33g29%

Ingredients:

For the Rice

  • 4 cups (675 g) cooked rice

For the Stew

  • 2 lbs (908 g) boneless skinless chicken thighs
  • lb (227 g) celery
  • lb (227 g) carrots
  • 1 lbs (454 g) russet potatoes
  • 2 tbsp (30 g) minced ginger
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) minced garlic
  • 1 bunch (50 g) green onions
  • 1 cups (360 g) chicken stock
  • 2 tbsp (30 g) oil

For the Sauce

  • 3 tbsp (45 g) gochujang
  • 1 tbsp (12 g) gochugaru
  • 1 tbsp (36 g) honey
  • cup (60 g) soy sauce
  • 1 tbsp (8 g) cornstarch slurry

Instructions:

For the Rice

  1. Cook enough rice to have 4 cups of cooked rice. 1 cup of dry rice will yield about 2-3 cups of cooked rice depending on what kind you use.

For the Stew

  1. Start by washing cutting all of your vegetables.
  2. Slice the green onions and separate out the whites and green tops. You will use the tops for garnishing the final dish.
  3. Cut the carrots, celery, and potatoes into a large dice. I cut the celery and the carrots down the center to halve it then cut it on a bias into smaller pieces. The potatoes get cut into cubes of about inch in size. You can peel them or leave them as they are.
  4. Season your chicken lightly with salt and pepper.
  5. In a large stock pot over medium high heat, add some oil and the scallions, carrots, potatoes, celery, and ginger. Season lightly with salt and cook for 5-7 minutes to allow the flavors to develop. Add in the garlic and stir.
  6. Make some room in the bottom of the pot (there won't be much room, do your best) and add in the chicken to get some browning. Cook it for 3-4 minutes. Flipping over when ready.
  7. While the vegetables and chicken are cooking you can prepare your sauce. Mix together the soy sauce, honey, gochujang, and gochugaru. These are Korean ingredients. I get them at Whole Foods, you may be able to find them at your regular store and certainly at your local asian grocer. If you don't love spicy food, add less gochugaru. If you can't find gochugaru you can substitute ground chili powder (the one that is just ground chili, not the chili powder mixture with cumin etc.)
  8. Pour the sauce over the meat and vegetables and stir. Pour the chicken stock over the top and mix.
  9. Cover the pot and reduce the heat to medium low. Simmer with the lid on for 20 minutes.
  10. While stewing, you can plate up your rice into your containers. Each container gets cup of rice.
  11. After 20 minutes, remove the lid, stir the contents of the pot and taste. Season with salt and pepper to taste. When I made this recipe I used chicken bone broth which is a tad bit thicker than regular stock. The starch from the potatoes should help to thicken the sauce. If you still have a very watery consistency, you can either add a small amount of a cornstarch slurry or allow the pot to boil with the lid off to boil off some of the water.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 6 servings. Each dish gets cup of rice and you can divide the stew evenly between the 6 containers. Top each dish with the chopped green onions.

Crispy Lemon Pork Noodles

This noodle dish is made with ground pork that has developed a deep brown crust for loads of flavor. It is accompanied by carrots, spinach, and mushrooms then tossed in a sweet lemon sauce.

CourseCuisineTime - 40 minutes 40 minutes 40 minutes
Main DishAsian, meal prepPrep - 10 minutes 10 minutes 10 minutes
Cook - 30 minutes 30 minutes 30 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
730kcal6 servings
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates65g45%
Fat33g23%
Protein44g30%

Ingredients:

For the Noodles

  • 10 oz (280 g) pad thai rice noodles

For the Pork

  • 2 lbs (908 g) ground turkey (93/7) any ground meat works
  • tbsp (8 g) olive oil
  • salt and pepper to taste

For the Stir Fry

  • 1 medium (200 g) onion
  • 1 lb (454 g) mushrooms
  • lb (227 g) carrots
  • 6 oz (170 g) spinach
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) minced garlic
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) minced ginger
  • tbsp (8 g) oil
  • 5 tbsp (25 g) green onions optional for garnish

For the Sauce

  • 3 tbsp (45 g) lemon juice
  • cup (58 g) soy sauce
  • 2 tsp (10 g) sesame oil
  • cup (60 g) chicken stock
  • 1 tbsp (14 g) sugar
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) chili garlic sauce

For the Beef

  • 2 lbs (908 g) ground beef (85/15) any ground meat works
  • tbsp (8 g) olive oil
  • salt and pepper to taste

Instructions:

For the Noodles

  1. Prepare the noodles according to the packaging. Alternatively, you could fill a large bowl with hot water and allow them to soak and soften while you cook. This is what I do.

For the Pork

  1. Heat a large skillet over medium high to high heat and add a bit of oil. If you have cast iron that is preferred as I find it is easier to develop a crust on the meat with cast iron.
  2. Add the pork to the pan and brown on all sides. Season lightly with salt and pepper.
  3. Remove from skillet once finished.

For the Stir Fry

  1. Wash and cut all of your vegetables while the beef is cooking. Cut the onion and mushrooms into thin slices. Roughly chop the spinach into smaller pieces. Create ribbons with the carrots using a vegetable peeler by peeling down the length of the carrot. Cut those ribbons into smaller pieces.
  2. In the same skillet as the beef was cooked after it has finished, add a bit more oil and add in the onions, garlic and ginger. Cook for a couple of minutes to brown then add in the carrots and mushrooms.
  3. Salt lightly to encourage water to come out of the mushrooms and cook for a few minutes until the mushrooms have cooked down and the carrots softened.
  4. Add in the chopped spinach and fold in, allowing it to wilt.
  5. Season lightly with salt and pepper.

For the Sauce

  1. In a bowl, mix the chicken stock, lemon juice, soy sauce, sugar, chili garlic sauce, and sesame oil. Stir to combine.

For the Final Dish

  1. Drain the water from the noodles and add the beef, vegetables, and sauce to the bowl with the noodles. Stir to combine.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 6 servings. Divide your ingredients evenly between your 6 containers. Top with chopped green onions for garnish if you wish.

For the Turkey

  1. Heat a large skillet over medium high to high heat and add a bit of oil. If you have cast iron that is preferred as I find it is easier to develop a crust on the meat with cast iron.
  2. Add the turkey to the pan and brown on all sides. Season lightly with salt and pepper.
  3. Remove from skillet once finished.

For the Beef

  1. Heat a large skillet over medium high to high heat and add a bit of oil. If you have cast iron that is preferred as I find it is easier to develop a crust on the meat with cast iron.
  2. Add the beef to the pan and brown on all sides. Season lightly with salt and pepper.
  3. Remove from skillet once finished.

Yellow Coconut Curry Chicken

Yellow Coconut Curry Chicken made with chicken breasts, coconut milk, and vegetables. The curry is paired with a sweet and spicy cabbage slaw made with a chili garlic sauce.

CourseCuisineTime - 50 minutes 50 minutes 50 minutes
Main DishAsian, meal prepPrep - 10 minutes 10 minutes 10 minutes
Cook - 40 minutes 40 minutes 40 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
733kcal6 servings
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates65g45%
Fat31g21%
Protein47g32%

Ingredients:

For the Rice

  • 5 cups (750 g) cooked rice

For the Curry

  • 2 lbs (1135 g) boneless skinless chicken thighs
  • 1 medium (200 g) onion
  • 1 medium (150 g) green pepper
  • 1 medium (150 g) red pepper
  • 1 cup (100 g) matchstick carrots
  • 2 tbsp (10 g) curry powder
  • 1 tbsp (8 g) turmeric
  • 13.5 oz (382 g) canned coconut milk get the canned one, it is creamier than the carton
  • 1 cup (240 g) chicken stock
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) garlic minced
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) ginger minced
  • 2 tbsp (12 g) cornstarch
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) cold water
  • 2 tbsp (30 g) oil

For the Chili Garlic Slaw

  • 10 oz (283 g) coleslaw mix the thinner cut the better
  • 1 tbsp (16 g) sugar
  • 3 tbsp (45 g) rice vinegar
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) chili garlic sauce or sambal

Instructions:

For the Rice

  1. Cook enough rice to yield 5 cups of cooked rice. 1 cup of dry rice will make about 2-3 cups of cooked rice depending on what kind of rice you use.

For the Curry

  1. Cut your chicken into a large dice, about 1 inch cubes. Season lightly with salt and pepper.
  2. Wash and cut your vegetables. Cut the onion into thin slices and the peppers into a large dice. If you buy matchstick carrots pre cut you don't need to do anything to them. If you buy whole carrots you can do whatever you prefer. I would recommend using a vegetable peeler to make shredded carrots.
  3. Mince your garlic and ginger.
  4. In a large pot over medium high heat, add a bit of oil and cook the onions, carrots, and the garlic until the onions have slightly browned.
  5. Add in the peppers and garlic and cook for a couple of minutes until the peppers have a bit of color.
  6. While the vegetables are cooking you can begin cooking the chicken in a different pot to save time or just wait and use the same one to save on dishes.
  7. Add a bit of oil to the pot and add the chicken. Brown on all sides for a few minutes. You are not cooking all the way through here, just getting some browning.
  8. Create some space in the center of the pot and add a bit of oil. Pour the curry powder and turmeric into the oil to bloom the spices.
  9. Add the vegetables back into the pot and pour in the can of coconut milk and chicken stock. Stir to combine and bring to a light boil.
  10. Once boiling, lower the heat to low and cover with a lid. Allow to simmer for 10-12 minutes.
  11. After simmering, cut into a piece of chicken to ensure it is done.
  12. Create a cornstarch slurry by mixing cornstarch with cold water. Slowly stir into the curry to thicken.
  13. Season the curry with salt and pepper to taste.

For the Slaw

  1. While the chicken is simmering you can prepare the slaw.
  2. Into a large bowl, add the coleslaw mix, vinegar, sugar, chili garlic sauce and a bit of salt. Mix to combine and allow to marinate.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide your curry and coleslaw evenly into your 5 containers and add 1 cup of rice to each.

Korean Ground Chicken Bowls

Korean Ground Chicken made with lean ground chicken mixed with broccoli, carrots, onions, and ginger. It is flavored with a sauce made of gojuchang, syrup, soy sauce, chicken broth, and garlic.

CourseCuisineTime - 40 minutes 40 minutes
Main DishAsian, meal prepPrep - 10 minutes 10 minutes
Cook - 30 minutes 30 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
802kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates67g45%
Fat42g28%
Protein39g26%

Ingredients:

For the Chicken and Sauce

  • 2 lbs (908 g) ground pork (80/20) ground beef will also work
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) oil
  • 3 tbsp (45 g) maple syrup
  • 3 tbsp (45 g) gochujang
  • 1 tsp (10 g) sesame oil
  • 2 tbsp (30 g) soy sauce
  • 2 tbsp (30 g) chicken stock or broth
  • 2 tsp (10 g) minced garlic

For the Rice

  • 5 cups (750 g) cooked rice

For the Stir Fry Vegetables

  • 1 cups (150 g) matchstick carrots
  • 1 medium (200 g) onion
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) minced ginger
  • 1 medium (150 g) green pepper
  • 12 oz (340 g) broccoli fresh is preferred for this recipe
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) oil

Instructions:

For the Rice

  1. Cook enough rice to have 5 cups of cooked rice. 1 cup of dry rice will make around 2-3 cups of cooked rice depending on what kind you use.

For the Chicken and Sauce

  1. Cook the chicken in a large skillet over medium high heat with a bit of oil. Give it a chance to brown before you break it up and mix/flip it. Season lightly with salt and pepper.
  2. While the chicken is cooking you can prepare your sauce and cut your vegetables. Mix the soy sauce, gochujang, sesame oil, chicken stock, garlic, and maple syrup.
  3. Once the chicken has finished cooking, pour in the sauce and stir to coat.

For the Stir Fry Vegetables

  1. While the chicken is cooking, prepare all of your vegetables. Cut your onion into thin slices, the broccoli into small florets, green pepper into a large dice and the ginger into a mince. If you don't buy the pre cut carrots you will need to cut them into matchsticks as well.
  2. Heat a large pot over medium high heat and add a bit of oil. Add in the onion, peppers, and ginger and allow to develop color. After a couple of minutes add in the carrots and broccoli. It may help speed up the cooking process to add a splash of water and cover the pot to steam the carrots and broccoli. Season lightly with salt and pepper.
  3. Once the vegetables have finished, add in the chicken and stir to combine.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Add 1 cup of rice to each dish and divide the chicken mixture evenly.

Honey Garlic Chicken

This Honey Garlic Chicken dish is the meal prep version of the Honey Garlic Chicken Lettuce Wraps. Each dish is filled with rice, chicken, broccoli, and caramelized onions. You could serve the meal with pickled onions and sriracha mayo too if you wish.

CourseCuisineTime - 1 hour
Main DishAsianPrep - 30 minutes
Cook - 25 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
461kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates50g48%
Fat10g9%
Protein43g41%

Ingredients:

For the Chicken

  • 2 lbs (1135 g) boneless skinless chicken thighs 10 thighs
  • 1 tbsp (30 g) oyster sauce
  • 2 tbsp (50 g) honey
  • 1 tbsp (20 g) soy sauce
  • 2 cloves (10 g) minced garlic
  • 1 tsp (5 g) sesame oil
  • 1 tsp (5 g) sriracha
  • 1 medium (200 g) sweet onion

For the Rice

  • 3 cups (563 g) cooked rice

For the Broccoli

  • 1 lb (454 g) frozen broccoli fresh is fine
  • salt and pepper to taste

Instructions:

For the Rice

  1. Cook enough rice to yield 3 cups of cooked rice. 1 cup of dry rice will make around 2-3 cups of cooked rice depending on what kind you use.

For the Chicken

  1. In a large bowl add the oyster sauce, honey, soy sauce, sesame oil, sriracha, and garlic. Stir to incorporate. Add in the chicken and toss to coat. Place in the fridge and allow to marinate for at least 30 minutes.
  2. If you don't have an air fryer, preheat your oven to 425F.
  3. NOTE: I prefer to cook the chicken in the air fryer. I think you get the best color and flavor doing it that way but it will take longer to cook as you have to cook it in batches. I do 400F for about 12 minutes, flipping halfway through. Don't crowd the chicken in the fryer as the fryer relies on air circulation to cook properly. Cook the onions separately after the chicken is done.
  4. Cut the onion into thin slices.
  5. Place the chicken on a sheet pan and bake for 10-12 minutes.
  6. Remove the pan from the oven and turn the oven to broil. Add the onions in the spaces around the chicken. If the chicken has released a lot of water it may be helpful to drain some of it off the pan.
  7. Place the sheet pan on the top rack and watch it carefully so it doesn't burn. The goal is to brown the chicken and develop color. It will take 5-10 minutes. If there is too much liquid on the pan it can prevent browning.
  8. Stir the onions around after a few minutes. You may need to remove the chicken and continue cooking the onions until they are caramelized.

**For the Broccoli **

  1. Cook the broccoli according to the packaging or steam if if using fresh.
  2. Season with salt and pepper.

Plating

  1. To each dish, divide the chicken, broccoli, and rice evenly then add cup of rice. This recipe makes 5 servings.

Honey Garlic Chicken Lettuce Wraps

Honey Chicken Lettuce Wraps inspired by Korean flavors and the dish Ssam. These lettuce wraps are filled with rice, chicken, pickled carrots, and caramelized onions. They take less than 30 minutes to cook and can be made on a single sheet pan in the oven.

CourseCuisineTime - 1 hour
Main DishAsianPrep - 30 minutes
Cook - 25 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
440kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates42g45%
Fat15g16%
Protein35g38%

Ingredients:

For the Chicken

  • 2 lbs (908 g) boneless skinless chicken thighs
  • 1 tbsp (30 g) oyster sauce
  • 2 tbsp (50 g) honey
  • 1 tbsp (20 g) soy sauce
  • 2 cloves (10 g) minced garlic
  • 1 tsp (5 g) sesame oil
  • 1 tsp (5 g) sriracha
  • 1 medium (200 g) sweet onion

For the Pickled Carrots

  • 4 (150 g) carrots
  • 1 cup (360 ml) vinegar
  • 1 cup (360 ml) water
  • 1 tbsp (12 g) sugar
  • 2 tsp (6 g) salt

For the Rice

  • 2 cups (350 g) cooked rice

For the Sriracha Mayo

  • 3 tbsp (42 g) mayonnaise
  • 2 tsp (10 g) sriracha

For the Wraps

  • 2 heads (340 g) romaine lettuce

Instructions:

For the Rice

  1. Cook enough rice to yield 2 cups of cooked rice. 1 cup of dry rice will make around 2-3 cups of cooked rice depending on what kind you use.

For the Chicken

  1. In a large bowl add the oyster sauce, honey, soy sauce, sesame oil, sriracha, and garlic. Stir to incorporate. Add in the chicken and toss to coat. Place in the fridge and allow to marinate for at least 30 minutes.
  2. Preheat your oven to 425F.
  3. Cut the onion into thin slices.
  4. Place the chicken on a sheet pan and bake for 10-12 minutes.
  5. Remove the pan from the oven and turn the oven to broil. Add the onions in the spaces around the chicken. If the chicken has released a lot of water it may be helpful to drain some of it off the pan.
  6. Place the sheet pan on the top rack and watch it carefully so it doesn't burn. The goal is to brown the chicken and develop color. It will take 5-10 minutes. If there is too much liquid on the pan it can prevent browning.
  7. Stir the onions around after a few minutes. You may need to remove the chicken and continue cooking the onions until they are caramelized.
  8. Once finished cooking, allow the chicken to rest for 5 minutes then cut into thin slices.

For the Pickled Carrots

  1. You should make these in advanced. They will last a very long time in the fridge. Having them on hand at all times isn't a bad idea. They can be added to a lot of things.
  2. Mix together the vinegar, water, sugar and salt.
  3. Using a vegetable peeler, create carrot ribbons and add to the brine. Place in the refrigerator to store.

For the Sriracha Mayo

  1. Mix the mayo and sriracha together.

For the Wraps

  1. Wash and dry the lettuce leaves on a paper towel.
  2. To construct the wraps place a layer of rice down first, then the chicken and onions, pickled carrots and season lightly with salt. Top with the sriracha mayo.
  3. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide the ingredients 5 ways.

Storage

  1. You can meal prep this if you wish but don't construct the wraps in advance. You will want to store the hot and cold components of the meal separately so that you can heat the chicken and rice without wilting the lettuce.

Korean Spicy Chicken

Korean Spicy Chicken made from thinly sliced chicken breast marinated in soy sauce, gochujang, sesame oil, sugar and syrup. Serve with a side of rice and broccoli to give yourself a nice meal.

CourseCuisineTime - 55 minutes 55 minutes 55 minutes
Main DishAsian, meal prepPrep - 30 minutes 30 minutes 30 minutes
Cook - 25 minutes 25 minutes 25 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
696kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates69g49%
Fat29g20%
Protein41g29%

Ingredients:

For the Chicken

  • 2 lbs (908 g) pork shoulder
  • 3 tbsp (45 g) maple syrup
  • 2 tbsp (24 g) sugar
  • 3 tbsp (45 g) gochujang
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) sesame oil
  • 1 tbsp (20 g) soy sauce

For the Rice

  • 5 cups (750 g) cooked rice

For the Stir Fry Vegetables

  • 1 medium (200 g) zucchini
  • 1 large (125 g) carrot
  • 1 small (125 g) onion
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) minced ginger
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) minced garlic
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) oil

For the Broccoli

  • 1 lb (454 g) broccoli frozen is fine

Instructions:

For the Rice

  1. Cook enough rice to have 5 cups of cooked rice. 1 cup of dry rice will make around 2-3 cups of cooked rice depending on what kind you use.

For the Chicken

  1. Cut your chicken into thin slices of about -" thick. If your meat is partially frozen it will be easier. Add to a large bowl.
  2. Mix the chicken with the soy sauce, gochujang, sesame oil, sugar, and maple syrup. Allow to marinate while you cut and cook the vegetables.

For the Stir Fry Vegetables and Chicken

  1. Wash and cut your zucchini and carrot into matchstick sized pieces. Cut your onion into thin slices.
  2. Heat a skillet over medium high heat and add a bit of oil. Add in the onion, carrots, and ginger and allow to develop color. After a couple of minutes add in the garlic and zucchini and cook for an additional 1-2 minutes, adding oil if needed.
  3. Remove the vegetables from the pan and return the pan to the heat. Add in the chicken and cook for a few minutes on each side.
  4. When the chicken is about 80% of the way cooked, add in the stir fry vegetables and mix. Finish cooking until the chicken is cooked through. Season with salt and pepper.

For the Broccoli

  1. If you are using fresh broccoli, steam it on the stove until it is soft. If using frozen, follow the instructions on the packaging.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Add cup of rice to each dish and divide the remaining ingredients evenly.

For the Pork

  1. Cut your pork into thin slices of about -" thick. If your meat is partially frozen it will be easier. Add to a large bowl.
  2. Mix the pork with the soy sauce, gochujang, sesame oil, sugar, and maple syrup. Allow to marinate while you cut and cook the vegetables.

For the Stir Fry Vegetables and Pork

  1. Wash and cut your zucchini and carrot into matchstick sized pieces. Cut your onion into thin slices.
  2. Heat a skillet over medium high heat and add a bit of oil. Add in the onion, carrots, and ginger and allow to develop color. After a couple of minutes add in the garlic and zucchini and cook for an additional 1-2 minutes, adding oil if needed.
  3. Remove the vegetables from the pan and return the pan to the heat. Add in the pork and cook for a few minutes on each side.
  4. When the pork is about 80% of the way cooked, add in the stir fry vegetables and mix. Finish cooking until the pork is cooked through. Season with salt and pepper.

Sticky Beef and Brussels

Sticky Beef and Brussels made from ground beef, Brussels sprouts, shredded carrots and served with a side of rice. This one can be completed in 30 minutes or less if you make good use of your time while cooking.

CourseCuisineTime - 30 minutes 30 minutes 30 minutes
Main CourseAsian, meal prepPrep - 10 minutes 10 minutes 10 minutes
Cook - 20 minutes 20 minutes 20 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
729kcal6
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates67g47%
Fat32g22%
Protein42g29%

Ingredients:

  • 2 lbs (908 g) ground beef 85/15
  • 1 lb (454 g) Brussels sprouts frozen
  • 1 cup (125 g) shredded carrots you can buy these preshredded or do it yourself
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) oil
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) ginger grated
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) garlic grated
  • 5 cups (750 g) cooked rice

For the Sauce

  • cup (84 g) honey
  • 2 tbsp (30 g) soy sauce
  • 5 tbsp (75 g) chicken stock
  • 1 tsp (5 g) sesame oil
  • 2 tsp (10 g) rice vinegar

Instructions:

For the Rice

  1. Cook enough rice to yield 5 cups of cooked rice. 1 cup of dry rice will make about 2-3 cups of cooked rice depending on what kind you use.

For the Beef and Brussels

  1. Add a bit of oil to a skillet over medium high heat. Add the beef and cook until it has browned. Season lightly with salt and then set aside. NOTE: For proper browning, don't break up the meat immediately when you put it in the skillet. Give it some time to develop color.
  2. While the beef is cooking, microwave your frozen Brussels sprouts according to the package. Cut the Brussels sprouts into quarters.
  3. Using a vegetable peeler, shred your carrots into thin strips. Feel free to buy pre-shredded carrots.
  4. In a different skillet, add some oil over medium high heat and place the Brussels sprouts in the pan cut side down so they can develop color. After 3-5 minutes, create some room in the center and add the ginger and garlic and more oil if needed. Cook for 1-2 minutes.
  5. Add in the carrots and cook 2-3 minutes or until soft.

For the Sauce

  1. Mix together the honey, soy sauce, stock, vinegar, and sesame oil until combined.
  2. Add the beef and sauce into the skillet with the vegetables and allow the sauce to thicken with the heat. Stir and season to taste.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide your ingredients evenly between your 5 containers.

Honey Garlic Turkey Bowls

Honey Garlic Turkey Bowls made from ground turkey mixed with garlicky green beans and tossed in an Asian inspired sauce. This dish is served with a side of mixed vegetables and rice.

CourseCuisineTime - 35 minutes
Main DishAsian, meal prepPrep - 10 minutes
Cook - 25 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
468kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates49g50%
Fat16g16%
Protein33g33%

Ingredients:

For the Rice

  • 3 cups (563 g) cooked rice

For the Vegetables

  • 1 medium (200 g) sweet onion
  • 1 medium (150 g) red pepper
  • 1 small (150 g) zucchini
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) olive oil
  • salt and pepper to taste

For the Turkey

  • 1 lbs (681 g) ground turkey (93/7)
  • 6 oz (170 g) green beans
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) garlic minced
  • 1 tbsp (21 g) honey
  • 2 tsp (10 g) sriracha
  • 2 tbsp (37 mL) chicken stock
  • 1 tbsp (15 mL) soy sauce
  • 1 tbsp (15 mL) olive oil
  • salt and pepper to taste

Instructions:

For the Rice

  1. Cook enough rice to have 3 cups of cooked rice. 1 cup of uncooked rice will yield around 3 cups of cooked rice.

For the Vegetables

  1. Wash and cut your red pepper and zucchini into a large dice. Cut your sweet onion into a large dice as well.
  2. Cut your green beans into small pieces, about " in length.
  3. In a large skillet, heat some olive oil over medium high heat.
  4. Add the onion first and cook for 2-3 minutes then make some room and add in the red peppers and zucchini. Cook until soft and remove from the pan. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

For the Turkey

  1. Heat some olive oil over medium high heat. Add in the ground turkey and cook until browned.
  2. In another skillet over medium high heat, add a bit of oil and the green beans. Cook for 4-5 minutes so that they can develop color. Add in 1 tbsp of minced garlic and cook an additional 2-3 minutes and season with salt to taste. Be sure not to burn the garlic.
  3. Combine the turkey and green beans in one skillet. Add in 1 Tbsp of honey, 2 Tbsp chicken stock, 2 tsp sriracha, and 1 tbsp soy sauce. Stir to incorporate and season with salt and pepper to taste.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Add cup of cooked rice and to each container and divide the remaining ingredients equally.

Lo Mein

Ground chicken or turkey mixed with a wide variety of vegetables and lo mein noodles in a flavorful sauce made from soy sauce, honey, sriracha, and hoisin sauce.

CourseCuisineTime - 40 minutes
Main DishAsian, meal prepPrep - 20 minutes
Cook - 20 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
557kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates57g49%
Fat19g16%
Protein40g34%

Ingredients:

  • 2 lbs (908 g) ground turkey or chicken
  • lb (113 g) carrots
  • medium (100 g) onion
  • 1 medium (150 g) red pepper
  • lb (227 g) mushrooms
  • 2 cups (120 g) coleslaw mix
  • 1 cups (45 g) spinach
  • 2 tbsp (30 ml) olive oil
  • 7 oz (200 g) lo mein noodles or pad thai rice noodles for gluten free

For the Sauce

  • 1 tbsp (30 g) honey
  • 2 tbsp (35 g) soy sauce
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) sriracha
  • tbsp (18 g) hoisin sauce
  • 1 tsp (4 g) ground ginger
  • 1 tbsp (23 g) water

Instructions:

For the Noodles

  1. Prepare the noodles according to the instructions on the package.

For the Turkey

  1. Add some oil to a skillet over medium high heat. Add in the turkey and cook it until it has browned. Season lightly with salt and pepper. Remove from heat.

For the Vegetables

  1. Wash and prepare all of your vegetables. Cut your red pepper, onion, and mushrooms into thin slices so they cook quickly. Use a vegetable peeler to create ribbons out of your carrots. You'll want to do all of this prep work before you start cooking them, the cooking process goes fast.
  2. In a large pot, add some oil and add the onion. Cook for 2-3 minutes or until they have begun to develop color.
  3. Add in the coleslaw mix. Stir and cook for a minute or two.
  4. Make room in the pot and add the red pepper to the pot. Allow them to develop a bit of color then add in the shredded carrots and stir. Continue to cook until the vegetables have softened.
  5. Stir in the spinach and allow it to wilt.
  6. For the mushrooms I prefer to cook them separately so they can develop color. If you are feeling lazy you can throw them in at any point of the cooking process. I like to add them to a dry skillet over medium heat, salt them, and cook them until they have browned. Add them to the pot with the other vegetables.

For the Lo Mein

  1. Mix all of the sauce ingredients together in a bowl.
  2. Drain the water from the noodles and add them to a skillet with the sauce. You just want to toss the noodles with the sauce so they are evenly coated.
  3. Add the noodles and turkey to the large pot with the vegetables. Stir to incorporate and season with salt and pepper as needed.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide your ingredients evenly 5 ways.

Spring Rolls

These Spring Rolls are made using rice paper, rice noodles, chicken breasts, lettuce, carrots, and cilantro. They are served with a side of peanut sauce for lots of flavor.

CourseCuisineTime - 40 minutes
Appetizer, SnackAsianPrep - 25 minutes
Cook - 15 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
107kcal15 spring rolls
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates15.5g67%
Fat2.1g9%
Protein6.4g27%

Ingredients:

For the Spring Rolls

  • 15 sheets (135 g) rice paper
  • 1 lb (454 g) boneless skinless chicken breast
  • 1 tbsp (14 g) mayo
  • 2 tsp (5 g) sriracha
  • 2 oz (75 g) rice sticks
  • 3 cups (250 g) romaine lettuce
  • 1 large (200 g) cucumber
  • bunch (20 g) cilantro
  • 2 tbsp (30 g) rice vinegar
  • 1 medium (100 g) pickled carrots

For the Peanut Sauce

  • 3 tbsp (50 g) peanut butter
  • 4 tsp (20 g) soy sauce
  • 2 tsp (10 g) sriracha
  • 4 tsp (20 g) lime juice
  • 1 tbsp (30 g) honey
  • water to consistency

Instructions:

For the Spring Rolls

  1. Cut the chicken to even thickness and cover with the mayo and sriracha on all sides. Air Fry at 400F for 8-12 minutes, flipping it halfway. You could also do shrimp or pork if you wanted.
  2. You'll need to prep the pickled carrots in advance as well if you don't already have them in your fridge. You can either use a vegetable peeler to create ribbons or just buy pre-shredded carrots. To pickle them mix 1 part water and 1 part vinegar with 1 tbsp of sugar and 1 tsp of salt. Put them in a container and allow them to pickle overnight. Make a bunch. These are great and they will last in the fridge for weeks.
  3. To start your prep work, place the rice noodles in a bowl of hot water and allow them to soak for 10-15 minutes or until they have softened.
  4. Wash and cut your lettuce into thin slices and pick the leaves away from the cilantro stems.
  5. Using a vegetable peeler, create ribbons out of your cucumber.
  6. Once the chicken has finished cooking, cut it into thin slices.
  7. To prep the rice paper, submerge it in warm water or hold it under the faucet. Place it down on your work surface and flatten.
  8. Add a small amount of rice noodles, lettuce (dressed with rice vinegar), chicken, pickled carrots, cucumber, and cilantro. I like to include a drizzle of sriracha as well.
  9. Roll the ingredients in the wrap and fold in the sides. Repeat for the remaining rolls.

For the Peanut Sauce

  1. Melt the peanut butter and mix all of the ingredients together until smooth. Add water as needed to thin out.

Storage

  1. To store this for meal prep you should keep it in your fridge, deconstructed, and make the spring rolls whenever you plan to eat them. Store the lettuce and cilantro in a container, the chicken, the cucumbers, pickled carrots, and rice stick in their own containers. Store the rice sticks submerged in water to prevent them from drying out.

Serving

  1. When it comes time to prep the Spring Rolls, remove the containers from your fridge, set up a prep station, and make however many you want. This recipe will make 15 Spring Rolls.
  2. Serve the spring rolls with the peanut sauce. If your sauce thickens up in the fridge you can add water and stir until you reach the correct consistency.

Japanese Curry

*Chicken thighs, potatoes and carrots make up this Japanese Curry. The "stewy" quality of Japanese Curry makes for a perfect meal prep meal that reheats like a dream in the microwave. Japanese Curry has a bit more umami flavor than Indian Curry and is more mild in flavor profile, making it the superior curry in my opinion *

CourseCuisineTime - 1 hour 1 hour 1 hour
Main DishAsian, Japanese, meal prepPrep - 20 minutes 20 minutes 20 minutes
Cook - 40 minutes 40 minutes 40 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
601kcal5 servings
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates70g53%
Fat15g11%
Protein46g35%

Ingredients:

  • 2 lbs (908 g) boneless skinless chicken thighs
  • medium (100 g) onion
  • tbsp (8 g) garlic minced
  • lb (227 g) carrots
  • lb (341 g) potatoes
  • 5 cups (750 g) cooked rice
  • 1 lb (454 g) frozen broccoli
  • 2 tbsp (12 g) curry powder
  • 1 tbsp (12 g) cornstarch
  • 1 tbsp (22 g) cold water
  • 2 tbsp (30 g) olive oil
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) soy sauce

Instructions:

For the Rice

  1. Cook enough rice to yield 5 cups of cooked rice. 1 cup of dry rice will make around 2-3 cups of cooked rice depending on what type of rice you use.

For the Curry

  1. Wash and cut your potatoes, carrots, and onion. Peel the carrots and potatoes. Cut the potatoes into a large dice (around inch cubes), your carrots into thin rounds, and the onion into a small dice.
  2. In a large pot over medium high heat, add 1 tbsp of oil and add the onions. Season lightly with salt and allow them to cook for 1-2 minutes then add in the curry powder and stir, add the remaining oil as needed.
  3. Make room in the bottom of your pot and add the chicken and garlic, use more of the remaining oil as needed. Allow the chicken to cook for around 3 minutes on each side to develop color.
  4. Add 1 cup of water to the pot and reduce the heat to medium. Allow the chicken to cook in the water for around 10 minutes to finish the cooking process. Flip half way through.
  5. Remove the chicken from the pot and set aside. Add in the carrots and potatoes with an extra 1 cups of water, cover the pot and cook for 10-15 minutes or until the carrots and potatoes have softened.
  6. While the curry is stewing, cut the chicken into bite size pieces. If you find that the chicken isn't cooked all of the way through, that's okay, we are going to be adding it back to the pot.
  7. In a bowl, mix together the cornstarch and cold water to form a slurry. Once the carrots and potatoes have softened, slowly drizzle in the cornstarch slurry to the mix while constantly stirring. This will thicken the sauce.
  8. Add the chopped chicken back to the pot and stir in the soy sauce. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

For the Broccoli

  1. Cook your frozen broccoli according to the packaging. I use the microwave for ease but feel free to use fresh broccoli if you wish. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide your ingredients evenly between your 5 and add cup of rice to each.

Peanut Chicken Noodles

Peanut Chicken Noodles made with chicken breasts, rice noodles, and broccoli slaw for a quick meal that comes together in under 30 minutes.

CourseCuisineTime - 30 minutes
Main DishAsian, meal prepPrep - 5 minutes
Cook - 25 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
489kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates47g45%
Fat14g13%
Protein42g40%

Ingredients:

  • 2 lbs Chicken breast
  • 1/2 lb pad Thai noodles
  • 12 oz broccoli slaw
  • 1 medium sweet onion
  • 2 tbsp olive oil
  • 1 tbsp garlic
  • 1 tsp garlic powder
  • 2 tbsp peanut butter
  • 1/2 cup chicken stock
  • 1 tbsp soy sauce
  • 1 tbsp rice vinegar
  • 1 tbsp sambal or sriracha
  • 2 stalks green onions optional
  • Lemon wedges for spritzing optional

Instructions:

  1. Prepare the chicken. You can cook it any way you wish. I used the air fryer for ease. Stovetop would be best as it is easier to properly cook. If you cook it on the stovetop cut or pound the breasts to even thickness throughout so they cook evenly. Slice into pieces after cooking.
  2. If you use the air fryer/oven, preheat to 400F. Cut the chicken into bite sized pieces and toss with some oil, garlic powder, salt and pepper. Air fry for 8-10 minutes. Shake occasionally. Dont over cook. You may have to bake it a bit longer if you use the oven.
  3. While the chicken is cooking place your noodles into some boiling water. You dont want to overcook these. They will go fast, 2-3 minutes probably. Once they have finished cooking, rinse and cover with cold water until ready to use.
  4. Cut your onion into slices. Add to a skillet over medium high heat with some oil and garlic. Saut a few minutes until they have softened and began to develop color.
  5. Add the broccoli slaw and pour a few tablespoons of water in to help it cook faster.
  6. Mix together the stock, sambal, soy sauce, vinegar, and peanut butter.
  7. Strain the noodles and add the vegetables, noodles, and chicken to a large bowl. Pour the sauce over top. Mix to combine.
  8. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide evenly 5 ways and top with green onions and a lemon wedge if preferred.

Peanut Ginger Chicken Rice Bowls

Peanut Ginger Chicken made with ground chicken, sweet potatoes, broccoli, red peppers, rice and served with a side of peanut ginger sauce.

CourseCuisineTime - 40 minutes 40 minutes 40 minutes
Main DishAsian, meal prepPrep - 10 minutes 10 minutes 10 minutes
Cook - 30 minutes 30 minutes 30 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
761kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates68g44%
Fat31g20%
Protein54g35%

Ingredients:

For the Bowls

  • 2 lbs (1135 g) ground chicken 92/8
  • lb (227 g) broccoli florets
  • 1 medium (150 g) red bell pepper
  • 1 large (200 g) sweet potato
  • 5 cups (750 g) cooked rice
  • 2 tbsp (30 g) olive oil
  • salt and pepper to taste

For the Peanut Sauce

  • cup (66 g) peanut butter
  • 2 tbsp (30 g) lime juice
  • 3 tbsp (45 g) water
  • 1 tbsp (20 g) soy sauce
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) brown sugar
  • 1 tsp (5 g) sriracha
  • 2 tsp (10 g) minced ginger

Instructions:

For the Rice

  1. Cook enough rice to yield 2 cups of cooked rice. 1 cup of dry rice will yield around 2-3 cups of cooked rice depending on what kind you use.

For the Vegetables

  1. Wash and cut your potatoes and broccoli into a large dice. You want them to be similar in size, roughly " cubes for the potatoes and match the broccoli to that size as best you can.
  2. Cut the red pepper into thin strips and cut the strips in half so you have pieces around 2 inches in length.
  3. Preheat your oven to 425F. On two separate oil sprayed sheet pans, add the potatoes and broccoli to their own pan and drizzle/toss each with oil and salt lightly.
  4. You can choose to either saut the peppers or roast them with the broccoli for ease, your choice. If you saut them, cook over medium high heat for 3-4 minutes or until they have softened.
  5. Roast the broccoli and potatoes for 8-10 minutes, remove from the oven and flip. Return to the oven to finish cooking, probably 3-5 minutes for the broccoli and 10 minutes for the potatoes. You'll want to watch the broccoli closely to ensure it is not burning. It is likely the broccoli will cook faster than the potatoes.
  6. Once everything has finished cooking, add to a large bowl.

For the Ground Chicken

  1. Heat a bit of oil over medium high heat. Add in the chicken and brown. Be sure to allow it time to develop color, do not stir it around too early or often. Often times with chicken, a lot of water will release into the pan, try to remove this as it occurs to help promote more even browning.
  2. Once the chicken has finished browning, season lightly with salt and pepper and add to the large bowl with the vegetables.

For the Bowls

  1. Measure out 2 cups of rice and add to the bowl with the vegetables and chicken. Stir to combine and taste. Season with salt and pepper as needed.

For the Peanut Sauce

  1. In a microwave safe bowl, add the peanut butter and microwave it for 20-30 seconds or until it has melted.
  2. Add the remaining ingredients for the sauce and stir to incorporate.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide your chicken and vegetable mixture evenly between your 5 containers. Divide the peanut sauce evenly in smaller separate containers as you will not want to reheat this in the microwave.

Pad See Ew

Pad See Ew translates to fried soy sauce noodles. This is a Thai inspired dish made meal prep friendly. It's a great way to use up any vegetables you have sitting in your fridge.

CourseCuisineTime - 40 minutes
Main DishAsianPrep - 25 minutes
Cook - 15 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
527kcal7
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates67g59%
Fat13g11%
Protein32g28%

Ingredients:

  • 1 lb rice noodles pad thai noodles
  • 2 lbs ground chicken any chicken works fine if you can't find ground
  • 2 small zucchini
  • 1 medium red pepper
  • 3 carrots
  • 1 tbsp garlic minced
  • 1 tbsp ginger minced
  • 2 small shallots
  • 2 tbsp olive oil

For the Sauce

  • 3 tbsp soy sauce
  • 5 tbsp oyster sauce
  • 3 tbsp rice wine vinegar
  • 3 tbsp water
  • 1 tbsp brown sugar
  • 2 tsp sambal oelek or sriracha

Instructions:

For the Noodles

  1. Prepare your noodles according to the directions on your package. Drain them after they have completed soaking/cooking.

For the Vegetables

  1. Prepare all of your vegetables before you start cooking, this one cooks quickly.
  2. Wash everything and cut the ginger, garlic, and shallot into a small dice. Use a vegetable peeler to cut the carrots into thin ribbons, cut the zucchini into similar sized ribbons (I have to do this with a knife, the peeler doesn't work for me on the zucchini). Cut the pepper into thin strips.

For the Sauce

  1. Mix together the soy sauce, oyster sauce, water, vinegar, sambal, and sugar.

Preparation

  1. Heat a large skillet/wok over high heat. Add in a bit of olive oil and cook the chicken. Allow it to develop color before flipping or stirring it. You may find that excess water will gather in the pan as it cooks. Remove this with a spoon to keep it from steaming the meat.
  2. After the chicken has cooked remove it from the pan and add in more oil. Add the shallot, ginger, and garlic. Cook for a few minutes or until the shallot has begun to soften.
  3. Next add the carrots and peppers, stirring occasionally for 1-2 minutes. Lastly add in the zucchini and stir to combine. You may find adding a bit of water to the pan will help them cook faster.
  4. If your pan is big enough you can construct everything there, if it is not, get a bigger pot/bowl and combine the chicken, noodles, vegetables and sauce together. Stir to incorporate.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 7 servings. Divide everything evenly into your 7 containers.

Sawsawan Rice Bowls

Ground pork and turkey cooked with a variety of rice and vegetables including coleslaw mix, onions, carrots, and garlic. This is served with a side of sawsawan, a Filipino sauce that goes great on meat and rice.

CourseCuisineTime - 30 minutes 30 minutes 30 minutes
Main DishAsian, meal prepPrep - 10 minutes 10 minutes 10 minutes
Cook - 20 minutes 20 minutes 20 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
751kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates46g36%
Fat50g39%
Protein30g23%

Ingredients:

For the Main Dish

  • 2 lb (454 g) ground pork 75/25
  • 1 lb (908 g) coleslaw mix
  • medium (100 g) onion
  • 1 cup (100 g) shredded carrots
  • 1 (15 g) jalapeo optional
  • 4 cloves (16 g) garlic
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) olive oil
  • 4 cups (600 g) cooked rice

For the Sawsawan

  • 3 tbsp (25 g) red onion minced
  • 3 tbsp (25 g) cucumber minced
  • 1 small (10 g) serrano pepper optional
  • 6 tbsp (90 ml) vinegar
  • 4 tsp (20 ml) soy sauce
  • cup (60 ml) water
  • 1 tbsp (10 g) sugar

Instructions:

For the Rice

  1. Cook enough rice to yield 4 cups of cooked rice. 1 cup of dry rice will make between 2-3 cups of cooked rice depending on what kind you use.

For the Main Dish

  1. Heat a large skillet over medium high heat. Add in the pork and brown. Season lightly with salt and pepper.
  2. After the meat has cooked, removed it from the pan and place in a large bowl.
  3. Add some olive oil to the pan and add the onion, garlic, carrots, and jalapeo. Cook for 3-5 minutes or until the onion start to develop some color.
  4. Add in the coleslaw mix and cook an additional 3-5 minutes or until the cabbage has cooked through. Add to the bowl with the meat.
  5. Measure out 3 cups of cooked rice and add to the bowl. Mix everything together and season lightly with salt and pepper. The sawsawan has soy sauce in it so you don't want to over salt the mixture.

For the Sawsawan

  1. Wash and dice the cucumber until you have around cup. Dice the onion as well until you have a similar amount. If you are using a serrano cut it into thin slices.
  2. In a bowl, mix together the vinegar, water, soy sauce, and sugar. Mix until the sugar has dissolved. Give it a taste and adjust flavors as needed. If you aren't a big vinegar person, you may want to dilute it with a bit of water. The way it is written in the recipe is how my family has always prepared it.
  3. Add in the cucumbers, onion, and serrano. You may have extra after you allocate a bit for each dish. You can keep any extra in your fridge. It is great on rice and any meat!

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide your ingredients evenly 5 ways. Store the sawsawan in a smaller separate container as you don't want to heat this in the microwave. If you have containers with lids that would be preferred as it is a liquid.
  2. The sawsawan is meant to either be poured over the meal or have each bite dipped into the sauce.

Sriracha Ranch Turkey Bowls

Ground turkey flavored with ranch dressing mix, sriracha, and rice vinegar and served with a side of sauteed onions and zucchini. This is a quick dish for those weeks you don't want to spend time in the kitchen.

CourseCuisineTime - 30 minutes 30 minutes 30 minutes
Main DishAmerican, Asian, meal prepPrep - 5 minutes 5 minutes 5 minutes
Cook - 25 minutes 25 minutes 25 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
659kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates54g42%
Fat32g25%
Protein40g31%

Ingredients:

For the Turkey

  • 2 lbs (908 g) ground beef 85/15
  • 2 tbsp (24 g) ranch dressing mix
  • 2 tbsp (30 ml) rice vinegar
  • 2 tbsp (30 ml) sriracha
  • 1 tsp (5 ml) olive oil
  • Salt and pepper to taste

For the Rice

  • 5 cups (750 g) cooked rice

For the Zucchini and Onions

  • 2 small (300 g) sweet onions
  • 2 medium (500 g) zucchinis
  • 1 tbsp (15 ml) olive oil
  • 1 tsp (3 g) garlic powder
  • salt and pepper to taste

Instructions:

For the Rice

  1. Cook enough rice to yield 5 cups of cooked rice. 1 cup of dry rice will yield around 2-3 cups of cooked rice depending on what kind of rice you use.

For the Turkey

  1. Heat a bit of olive oil in a large skillet over medium high heat. Add the turkey and cook until it has browned. Boil off any water that remains in the skillet from the turkey.
  2. Mix the vinegar, ranch mix, and sriracha together. Pour over the turkey and stir to incorporate. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

For the Zucchini and Onions

  1. Peel your oniona and cut into thin slices. Heat some oil over medium high heat in a skillet and add the onions. Cook them until they have begun to caramelize. Season with salt and pepper.
  2. Wash and cut the zucchini into a large dice. Add some oil to the pan and cook for a few minutes until they have begun to soften and develop color. Season with salt, pepper, and garlic powder to taste.
  3. You can cook the onions and zucchini together if you wish, they are separated in the image to show detail.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide your ingredients evenly 5 ways. Add 1 cup of rice to each dish.

For the Beef

  1. Heat a bit of olive oil in a large skillet over medium high heat. Add the beef and cook until it has browned. Boil off any water that remains in the skillet from the beef.
  2. Mix the vinegar, ranch mix, and sriracha together. Pour over the beef and stir to incorporate. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

Island Teriyaki Chicken

Chicken thighs tossed in a flavorful sauce of citrus, garlic, ginger, and sugar. This dish is served with a side of rice and vegetables.

CourseCuisineTime - 40 minutes 40 minutes 40 minutes
Main DishAsian, meal prepPrep - 10 minutes 10 minutes 10 minutes
Cook - 30 minutes 30 minutes 30 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
597kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates60g46%
Fat16g12%
Protein53g41%

Ingredients:

For the Chicken

  • 3 lbs (1362 g) chicken thighs
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) olive oil

For the Rice

  • 5 cups (750 g) cooked rice

For the Sauce

  • 2 tbsp (18 g) ginger minced
  • 1 tbsp (18 g) garlic minced
  • cup (24 g) green onions chopped
  • 5 tbsp (72 ml) soy sauce
  • 5 tbsp (72 ml) pineapple juice
  • 2 tbsp (29 g) brown sugar
  • 2 tbsp (36 ml) lime juice
  • 2 tsp (8 g) cornstarch
  • 2 tsp (10 ml) water

For the Vegetables

  • 2 medium (500 g) zucchini
  • 2 medium (300 g) red peppers
  • 1 tbsp (15 ml) olive oil

Instructions:

For the Rice

  1. Cook enough rice to yield 5 cups of cooked rice. 1 cup of dry rice will yield around 2-3 cups of cooked rice depending on the type you have.

For the Sauce

  1. Add all of the sauce ingredients to a small pot except for the cornstarch and water and bring to a light boil.
  2. Mix the cornstarch and water into a slurry. Once the sauce is boiling, reduce the heat to low and slowly stir in the cornstarch to thicken.

For the Chicken

  1. Heat 1 Tbsp of oil in a large skillet over medium high heat. Cook the chicken in batches for 3-4 minutes on each side. You know the chicken is ready to flip when the white begins to creep up the side of the thigh.
  2. After the chicken has cooked, chop it into one inch pieces and return to the pan to develop color on each side.
  3. Pour the sauce over the top and toss to coat.

For the Vegetables

  1. Wash and cut your zucchini and peppers into a medium dice.
  2. Add some oil to a large skillet over medium high heat and cook until the vegetables have softened. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide your ingredients evenly 5 ways and add 1 cup of rice to each container.

Thai Peanut Chicken

Chicken thighs tossed in a coconut peanut butter sauce and served with a zucchini and carrot mixture. I like to add sriracha to the top of the chicken to add more spice and flavor but this is completely optional.

CourseCuisineTime - 40 minutes 40 minutes 40 minutes
Main DishAsian, meal prepPrep - 10 minutes 10 minutes 10 minutes
Cook - 30 minutes 30 minutes 30 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
670kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates49g38%
Fat32g25%
Protein46g36%

Ingredients:

  • 2 lbs (1135 g) boneless skinless chicken thighs
  • 2 medium (500 g) zucchini
  • 1 cups (150 g) shredded carrots
  • 5 cups (675 g) cooked rice

For the Sauce

  • 5 tbsp (75 g) peanut butter
  • 5 tbsp (75 g) coconut cream
  • 2 tbsp (30 ml) soy sauce
  • 2 tsp (10 ml) honey
  • 2 tsp (10 ml) lime juice
  • 5 tsp (25 ml) sriracha optional
  • 5 tsp (10 g) green onions optional

Instructions:

For the Rice

  1. Cook enough rice to yield 5 cups of cooked rice. 1 cup of dry rice will yield between 2-3 cups of cooked rice depending on the type of rice you use.

For the Sauce

  1. In a saucepan, add the peanut butter, coconut cream, lime juice, honey, and soy sauce. Heat over low heat and stir just until everything melts and comes together.

For the Chicken

  1. Heat a grill pan or a large skillet over medium high heat. Add in 1 tbsp of oil and cook the chicken in batches for about 4 minutes each side. You know the chicken is ready to turn when the white begins to creep up the sides of the chicken thigh.
  2. After the chicken is done cooking, allow it to rest for a couple of minutes and cut into 1 inch pieces. Return the chicken back to the pan and allow to develop color on each side.
  3. Pour the sauce over the top and mix to incorporate.

For the Vegetables

  1. Wash and cut the zucchini into a medium dice.
  2. Heat a large skillet over medium heat. Add in 1 tbsp of oil and add in the zucchini. Cook for 3-4 minutes and then add in the carrots.
  3. Cook the vegetables together until they are soft and season with salt and pepper to taste.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide your ingredients evenly between your containers. Each dish gets 1 cup of rice. Top with sriracha and green onions if you wish.

Miso Ginger Turkey with Rice

Ground turkey cooked with onions and broccoli slaw. This meal is flavored by the miso ginger dressing that is made in the blender from vinegar and carrots. If you need new flavors in your diet, try this recipe out.

CourseCuisineTime - 35 minutes 35 minutes 35 minutes
Main DishAsian, meal prepPrep - 10 minutes 10 minutes 10 minutes
Cook - 25 minutes 25 minutes 25 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
706kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates54g41%
Fat36g27%
Protein41g31%

Ingredients:

For the Meat Mixture

  • 2 lbs (908 g) ground beef 85/15
  • 12 oz (340 g) broccoli slaw
  • medium (100 g) sweet onion
  • 1 tbsp (15 ml) olive oil
  • 1 tbsp (15 ml) soy sauce
  • 2 tsp (2 g) sesame seeds optional

For the Miso Ginger Dressing

  • 1 cup (100 g) carrots shredded
  • 1 tbsp (22 ml) olive oil
  • 1 tsp (5 ml) sesame oil
  • 2 tbsp (37 ml) rice wine vinegar
  • 1 tbsp (30 g) white miso paste
  • 2 tsp (10 g) ginger minced
  • 2 tbsp (30 ml) water

For the Rice

  • 5 cups (750 g) cooked rice

Instructions:

For the Rice

  1. Cook enough rice to have 5 cups of cooked rice. 1 cup of dry rice will yield about 3 cups of cooked rice depending on what kind you use.

For the Meat Mixture

  1. Heat tbsp of oil in a large skillet over medium high heat.
  2. Add the turkey and cook until it has browned. Boil off any water if there is any remaining in the skillet. Lightly season with salt and pepper.
  3. Heat another skillet over medium high heat and add tbsp of oil.
  4. Dice the onion add to the skillet. Cook for 2-3 minutes and then add in the broccoli slaw.
  5. Cook until the slaw has softened. You may find it helpful to add some water to the skillet to create steam and cook the vegetables faster.
  6. Once both the turkey and vegetables have finished cooking, combine the two into one mixture and add 1 tbsp of soy sauce. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

For the Miso Ginger Dressing

  1. Add all of the ingredients to a blender. Blend until you reach your desired consistency. Longer for smoother, shorter for a coarse dressing. I prefer to shoot for somewhere in the middle.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide your ingredients evenly between your 5 containers. 1 cup of rice goes into each dish. Top each with sesame seeds if you desire.

Sesame Beef and Lentils

Ground beef and green lentils flavored in a sesame oil, soy sauce, sugar, and sriracha mixture. This is served with a side of rice and sesame garlic green beans and carrots.

CourseCuisineTime - 35 minutes 35 minutes 35 minutes
Main DishAsian, meal prepPrep - 10 minutes 10 minutes 10 minutes
Cook - 25 minutes 25 minutes 25 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
655kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates75g54%
Fat23g16%
Protein40g28%

Ingredients:

For the Meat Mixture

  • 1 lb (681 g) ground beef 85/15
  • lb (302 g) green lentils dried
  • 1 tsp (5 ml) sesame oil
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) ginger minced
  • 5 green onions use the whites too
  • 1 tbsp (22 ml) soy sauce
  • 1 tbsp (22 g) brown sugar honey would work as well
  • 1 tsp (5 g) sriracha
  • 2 tsp (8 g) sesame seeds

For the Vegetables

  • 1 lb (454 g) green beans I use frozen, cut beans
  • 5 oz (142 g) carrots shredded. I buy precut carrots
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) garlic
  • 1 tsp (5 ml) sesame oil
  • Salt and pepper to taste

For the Rice

  • 5 cups (875 g) cooked rice

Instructions:

For the Rice

  1. Cook enough rice to yield 5 cups of cooked rice. 1 cup of dry rice will make between 2-4 cups of cooked rice depending on the type you use.

For the Lentils

  1. Rinse your lentils and sift through them to remove any debris.
  2. Bring a large pot of water to a boil and add in the lentils. Cook until they are soft and then drain the water. It will take between 12-15 minutes.

For the Meat Mixture

  1. Heat a large skillet over medium high heat and cook the beef. Once the beef has browned, drain the fat.
  2. Make some room in the middle of the pan. Heat 1 tsp of sesame oil over medium high heat. Add in the green onions and the ginger and cook for one minute or until fragrant.
  3. Add in the lentils, soy sauce, brown sugar, and sriracha. Stir to incorporate and adjust flavors as you see fit.

For the Vegetables

  1. If you use frozen green beans, thaw them out in the microwave.
