  2. Heat a skillet over high heat and add in the sesame oil. Add in the green beans and carrots and allow them to get some color. After 1-2 mintues, add in the garlic and season with salt and pepper to taste. You do not want the garlic to burn.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide your ingredients evenly 5 ways. Sprinkle the sesame seeds over the top.

Pad Thai

A quick A quick recipe for a simple version of Pad Thai. Rice noodles, chicken and a flavorful sauce to bring everything together, this recipe provides a lot of flavor.

CourseCuisineTime - 30 minutes 30 minutes
Main DishAsian, meal prepPrep - 5 minutes 5 minutes
Cook - 25 minutes 25 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
489kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates40g39%
Fat17g16%
Protein45g44%

Ingredients:

  • 5 oz (142 g) rice noodles
  • 2 lbs (908 g) boneless skinless chicken breast
  • 1 lb (454 g) frozen stir fry vegetables You can use fresh, the frozen combo is just easier.
  • 1 Tbsp (15 g) garlic
  • 2 (2 ) eggs
  • 1 tbsp (15 ml) olive oil
  • 2 Tbsp (32 g) melted peanut butter
  • cup (120 ml) Pad Thai sauce I use my grocery store brand sauce from a jar.
  • Lime
  • cup (35 g) crushed peanuts
  • 3 (10 g) green onions

Instructions:

  1. Cook the noodles according to the instructions on the package.
  2. Cut your raw chicken into thin slices of about - thick.
  3. Fill a large pot with water, salt it, and bring it to a light boil.
  4. Add in the chicken and cook until white throughout. It will only take a couple of minutes. Be careful not to over cook it.
  5. Thaw the vegetables in the microwave and drain any water.
  6. In a large skillet over medium high heat, add some olive oil and saut the garlic and vegetables for a few minutes.
  7. Push the vegetables out of the way, add a bit more oil and crack the eggs into the pan and scramble.
  8. Add in chicken, noodles, sauce and peanut butter. Stir to incorporate.
  9. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide the food evenly between 5 containers. Top with lime wedge, green onion, and peanuts.

Turkey Bulgogi

Bulgogi is a Korean dish frequently made from sirloin or ribeye. It is a sweet tasting meat that is flavored with an Asian pear. This recipe is made from ground turkey to make it more meal prep friendly.

CourseCuisineTime - 35 minutes 35 minutes 35 minutes
Main DishAsianPrep - 10 minutes 10 minutes 10 minutes
Cook - 25 minutes 25 minutes 25 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
781kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates56g38%
Fat40g27%
Protein49g33%

Ingredients:

  • 2 lbs (1135 g) ground beef (85/15)
  • 3 tbsp (45 ml) soy sauce
  • 1 tbsp (23 g) sriracha
  • 1 tbsp (23 g) garlic
  • 1 tbsp (12 g) ginger
  • medium (100 g) onion
  • 2 small (250 g) asian pear any pear is fine if you can't find an Asian one
  • 2 tbsp (30 ml) olive oil
  • 5 cups (875 g) cooked rice
  • 2 (500 g) zucchini
  • 2 cups (250 g) shredded carrots

Instructions:

For the Rice

  1. Cook enough rice to have at least 5 cups of cooked rice. 1 cup of dry rice will yield about 3 cups of cooked rice.

For the Turkey

  1. Dice the onion and cut the ginger and garlic into a small mince.
  2. Heat 1 tbsp of oil in a skillet over medium high heat, add the onion, garlic, and ginger. Cook until the onions are soft.
  3. Add the turkey to the skillet and brown.
  4. While the turkey is cooking, grate the pear into a mush. You could use a blender or a food processor here.
  5. Once the turkey has finished cooking, add in the pear, soy sauce, sriracha, and season with salt and pepper to taste.

For the Vegetables

  1. Cut the zucchini into a medium dice.
  2. Heat 1 tbsp of oil in a skillet over medium heat. Add the zucchini and shredded carrots and cook until soft. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide your ingredients evenly between your 5 containers.

For the Beef

  1. Dice the onion and cut the ginger and garlic into a small mince.
  2. Heat 1 tbsp of oil in a skillet over medium high heat, add the onion, garlic, and ginger. Cook until the onions are soft.
  3. Add the beef to the skillet and brown.
  4. While the beef is cooking, grate the pear into a mush. You could use a blender or a food processor here.
  5. Once the turkey has finished cooking, add in the pear, soy sauce, sriracha, and season with salt and pepper to taste.

Honey Sambal Chicken

Chicken thighs coated in a honey and sambal sauce for a spicy and sweet flavor profile. This is served with a side of green beans and fried rice.

CourseCuisineTime - 40 minutes 40 minutes 40 minutes
Main DishAsian, meal prepPrep - 10 minutes 10 minutes 10 minutes
Cook - 30 minutes 30 minutes 30 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
667kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates61g42%
Fat20g14%
Protein61g42%

Ingredients:

  • 3 lbs (1362 g) boneless skinless chicken thighs
  • 5 cups (750 g) cooked rice
  • 1 tbsp (15 ml) sesame oil
  • 1 lb (454 g) green beans
  • medium (100 g) onion
  • 2 cups (300 g) frozen mixed vegetables
  • 2 (2 ) eggs
  • 4 tbsp (60 ml) soy sauce
  • 3 tbsp (45 ml) Sambal olek
  • 2 tbsp (42 g) honey
  • 1/4 cup (60 ml) water
  • 1 tbsp (8 g) cornstarch
  • 1 tbsp (15 ml) water
  • 2 tbsp (30 ml) olive oil

Instructions:

For the Rice

  1. Cook enough rice to yield 5 cups. Its best if you have day old rice but fresh rice will work.
  2. Dice an onion and saut in a pan with 1 tbsp olive oil until soft. Add in thawed frozen vegetables. Stir in rice. Crack the eggs in and scramble. Add 4 tbsp soy sauce, 1 tbsp sesame oil and season with pepper to taste.

For the Chicken

  1. Heat a skillet/grill pan over medium heat and cook the chicken. Cut into 1 inch chunks and add back to pan to brown.
  2. In a sauce pan add 2 tbsp soy sauce, 2 tbsp honey, 3 tbsp Sambal and cup water. Bring to a light boil.
  3. Make a slurry with the cornstarch and 1 tbsp of cold water. Reduce heat and stir into sauce to thicken.
  4. Coat meat with sauce.
  5. If you use raw green beans, boil or cook them as preferred.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide ingredients into 5 servings.

Chicken Kelaguen

This is a Chamorro dish and is a staple in the Mariana Islands. It is a combination of chicken, lemon juice, onions, peppers, and hot sauce and is served cold, making it perfect for a quick snack right out of the fridge.

CourseCuisineTime - 1 hour 20 minutes
SnackAsian, meal prepPrep - 30 minutes
Cook - 1 hour

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
157kcal10
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates2.2g7%
Fat7.9g28%
Protein19.2g68%

Ingredients:

  • 1 (1135 g) broiler chicken 4-5lbs (use 1135g of the pulled meat)
  • 3 (120 g) lemons
  • 1 medium (200 g) sweet onion
  • Salt to taste it will need quite a bit
  • 2 Tbsp (30 g) Tabasco
  • 2 small (15 g) serrano peppers optional
  • 5 (20 g) green onions
  • 1 Tbsp (10 g) olive oil
  • Pepper to taste

Instructions:

  1. Preheat your oven to 400F. In a baking dish place the chicken breast side up. Remove the giblets from the cavity and pat the chicken dry with a paper towel. Drizzle with olive oil and season with salt and pepper. Cook the bird for 1 hour (plus or minus 10 minutes) on a lower middle rack in the oven. Use a meat thermometer to temp the meat and ensure it is around 165F.
  2. Once the chicken has cooked and cooled, tear the meat away from the bones, remove the skin, and dice the chicken into small pieces.
  3. Finley chop the onion, green onion, and serranos into small pieces and set aside.
  4. Spread the chicken out in a shallow dish and add the juice of three lemons, diced sweet onion, serranos, salt, green onion, and hot sauce. Mix everything together and taste, adjust the salt and hot sauce levels to suit your liking.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 10 servings. Divide it evenly 10 ways. My finished product weighed about 1550g so each serving will be around 150g, which is roughly a fist sized amount if you don't have a scale.

Kung Pao Chicken

A vegetable heavy dish that provides an easy way to get your daily servings. Stir frys are great to get in a wide variety of vegetables.

CourseCuisineTime - 50 minutes 50 minutes 50 minutes
Main DishAsian, meal prepPrep - 30 minutes 30 minutes 30 minutes
Cook - 20 minutes 20 minutes 20 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
654kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates69g50%
Fat21g15%
Protein48g34%

Ingredients:

  • 2 lbs (908 g) boneless skinless chicken thighs
  • 1 bunch (500 g) broccoli
  • 1 large (250 g) zucchini
  • 1 medium (150 g) green pepper
  • 1 medium (150 g) red pepper
  • 1 medium (200 g) yellow onion
  • 2 Tbsp (10 g) ginger minced
  • 2 Tbsp (30 g) garlic minced
  • 2 (200 g) carrots
  • cup (33 g) dry roasted peanuts
  • 1 tsp (2 g) red pepper flakes
  • Salt and pepper
  • 2 Tbsp (30 ml) olive oil
  • 5 cups (675 g) cooked rice

For the Chicken Marinade

  • 1 Tbsp (20 ml) rice wine vinegar or dry sherry
  • 2 Tbsp (30 ml) soy sauce
  • 1 Tbsp (8 g) cornstarch

For the Sauce

  • cup (60 ml) balsamic vinegar
  • cup (60 ml) soy sauce
  • 1 Tbsp (20 ml) hoisin sauce
  • 1 Tbsp (20 ml) sesame oil
  • 1 Tbsp (20 ml) cornstarch

Instructions:

  1. Cook the rice using your preferred method (rice cooker or saucepan). Be sure you make enough to have 5cups worth of cooked rice.
  2. Cut the chicken into 1 inch cubes and trim the fat. Add to a bowl along with the ingredients for the marinade. Allow to marinate for 20 minutes.
  3. Steam the broccoli for 3-5 minutes to allow it to soften. You still want to have a little crunch to the broccoli as it will cook further with the remaining vegetables.
  4. Cut the onions into strips. Cut the peppers and zucchini into a large dice. Cut the carrots on a bias into thin slices.
  5. In a large skillet, heat 1 Tbsp of oil over medium high heat. Once the pan has heated, add the red pepper flakes and cook for a few seconds then add 2 Tbsp garlic and ginger. Stir frequently.
  6. Cook the vegetables in order of how long they take to cook. You want to make sure you dont overcrowd the skillet, use two if necessary. Once the garlic and ginger has cooked for a minute add in the onions, cook for 2 minutes then add in the carrots.
  7. Once the carrots have cooked for a few minutes add in the peppers and zucchini. Add in the broccoli once everything is finished and season with salt and pepper. Remove from the skillet.
  8. Add 1 Tbsp of oil to the skillet and cook the chicken. Again dont overcrowd the pan, cook in batches if necessary.
  9. Once all of the chicken has cooked add everything into the skillet and stir in the peanuts and the sauce. Stir to incorporate and cook for 5 minutes to allow the flavors to meld. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide the ingredients evenly between your containers and add cup of rice to each.

Teppanyaki Steak, Chicken & Vegetables

Steak, chicken, and vegetables cooked in a teppanyaki-esque style to resemble the meals served at teppanyaki restaurants. This is a great way to get a variety of vegetables and lots of protein.

CourseCuisineTime - 35 minutes 35 minutes 35 minutes
Main DishAsian, meal prepPrep - 10 minutes 10 minutes 10 minutes
Cook - 25 minutes 25 minutes 25 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
747kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates57g37%
Fat26g16%
Protein70g45%

Ingredients:

For the Meat

  • 2 lbs (908 g) sirloin steak
  • 1 lb (454 g) boneless skinless chicken breast
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) soy sauce
  • 2 Tbsp (30 ml) olive oil

For the Vegetables

  • 1 bunch (500 g) broccoli
  • lb (227 g) carrots
  • 8 oz (227 g) mushrooms
  • 1 large (300 g) zucchini
  • 1 medium (200 g) sweet onion
  • 1 Tbsp (15 g) garlic
  • 1 Tbsp (5 g) ginger
  • 1 Tbsp (9 g) sesame seeds
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) olive oil
  • 2 Tbsp (30 ml) soy sauce

For the Sauce

  • cup (60 ml) soy sauce
  • 2 Tbsp (30 ml) white vinegar
  • 2 Tbsp (10 g) onion minced
  • 1 tsp (1 g) ginger minced
  • 1 tsp (5 ml) lemon juice
  • 2 lb (908 g) boneless skinless chicken breast
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) soy sauce
  • 2 Tbsp (30 ml) olive oil

For the Rice

  • 5 cups (675 g) cooked rice

Instructions:

For the Meat

  1. Take your steak out of its packaging and rest on a plate at room temperature while you prepare the vegetables.
  2. Pound the chicken so it is of even thickness throughout.
  3. Use a cast iron pan or a grill pan to cook the meat, if you dont have one, whatever you have will work fine.
  4. Heat the pan over medium high high heat and add 1 tbsp of olive oil. Season both sides of your steak with salt and pepper. Add to the pan and cook for 3 minutes on each side. You want a hot pan so you get a good sear on the meat.
  5. Allow your steak to rest for 10 minutes and cut the steak into 1 inch cubes. If it is still too rare for you liking, remember that it will cook in the microwave upon reheating.
  6. Season the chicken lightly with salt and pepper and add to the pan and cook for 3-5 minutes on each side. Then remove it from the heat and cut it into 1 inch cubes.
  7. Add the chicken back to the pan to finish cooking at add 1 Tbsp of soy sauce and a sprinkle of sesame seeds.

For the Vegetables

  1. Wash all your vegetables. Cut the broccoli into florets and steam for around 3 minutes so they are just beginning to become soft. You will finish the cooking with the rest of the vegetables.
  2. Quarter the mushrooms, peel and chop the carrots into thin slices about thick, cut the zucchini into strips about 3 long and thick, chop the onion so you have 1 pieces.
  3. In a large skillet heat 1 Tbsp of olive oil and add the onion, garlic, and ginger. Let it cook for 1-2 minutes and add the carrots.
  4. After another 1-2 minutes add the mushrooms, zucchini and broccoli. You want to cook it in stages to allow the harder vegetables to become soft. If you need to use two skillets to prevent overcrowding, do so.
  5. Add in 2 Tbsp of soy sauce to the vegetables and mix. Sprinkle with pepper to taste.

For the Sauce

  1. Mix all of the ingredients together. Store in a separate container.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide your ingredients evenly between each of your containers.

For the Rice

  1. Cook enough rice to have 5 cups of cooked rice. 1 cup of dry rice will yield 3 cups of cooked rice.

Chicken Lettuce Wraps

Ground chicken cooked with Asian flavors and eaten with shredded carrots and bean sprouts in a romaine lettuce leaf. Served with a peanut sauce.

CourseCuisineTime - 25 minutes 25 minutes
Main DishAsian, meal prepPrep - 5 minutes 5 minutes
Cook - 20 minutes 20 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
514kcal4
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates61g54%
Fat13g11%
Protein38g33%

Ingredients:

For the Wraps

  • 1 lb (567 g) ground chicken (99/1)
  • small (75 g) onion onion
  • cup (60 g) hoisin sauce
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) olive oil
  • 1 Tbsp (5 g) ginger minced
  • 1 Tbsp (15 g) garlic minced
  • 1 Tbsp (15 g) Sriracha
  • 2 Tbsp (30 ml) soy sauce
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) rice wine vinegar
  • 8 oz (227 g) can of chopped water chestnuts
  • Salt and pepper to taste

For the Peanut Sauce

  • 2 Tbsp (32 g) peanut butter
  • 1 Tbsp (23 ml) water
  • 1 tsp (7 ml) soy sauce
  • 1 tsp (7 ml) rice wine vinegar
  • 1 tsp (7 g) honey
  • 1 tsp (5 ml) sesame oil
  • tsp (1 ml) garlic minced
  • tsp (2 ml) ginger minced

For the Toppings/Wrap

  • 1 cup (100 g) shredded carrots
  • 1 cup (100 g) bean sprouts
  • cup (50 g) red onion sliced
  • 1 head (300 g) romaine lettuce

For the Rice

  • 4 cups (700 g) cooked rice

Instructions:

For the Chicken

  1. Heat 1 Tbsp of olive oil in a skillet over medium high heat. Saut of a diced yellow onion, 1 Tbsp minced ginger, and 1 Tbsp of minced garlic for 2 minutes and then add the chicken.
  2. Once the chicken is cooked, stir in cup hoisin sauce, 1 Tbsp rice wine vinegar, 2 Tbsp soy sauce, 1 Tbsp Sriracha, and water chestnuts and cook until heated.
  3. Tear off individual pieces of lettuce and rinse with water. Clean bean sprouts and carrots as well. Cut the red onion into thin slices.

For the Peanut Sauce

  1. Mix all ingredients in a bowl and whisk to create a smooth mixture.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 4 servings. Because of the lettuce, I wouldnt prep more than 4 at a time. Divide the meat, peanut sauce, carrots, bean sprouts, and red onion into 4 portions. In each container put 2 pieces of lettuce to use for your wraps. Add 1 cup of rice to each dish. I like to store the toppings inside of the lettuce boat to make for easy removal before microwaving.

For the Rice

  1. Cook enough rice to yield 4 cups of cooked rice. 1 cup of dry rice will make about 3 cups of cooked rice.

Thai Turkey Burgers with Sweet Potato Fries

Asian flavors melded into a classical American dish. The turkey burgers are meant to be topped with the peanut slaw and eaten together. The slaw provides a great fresh aspect to the dish.

CourseCuisineTime - 1 hour 1 hour 1 hour
Main DishAmerican, Asian, meal prepPrep - 30 minutes 30 minutes 30 minutes
Cook - 30 minutes 30 minutes 30 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
707kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates63g44%
Fat28g19%
Protein52g36%

Ingredients:

For the Burgers

  • 2 lbs (1135 g) ground turkey (93/7)
  • cup (12 g) cilantro finely chopped
  • 2 Tbsp (10 g) ginger minced
  • 5 cloves (20 g) garlic minced
  • 1 (20 g) jalapeo pepper diced
  • 3 small (100 g) shallots minced
  • 1.333 Tbsp (20 ml) fish sauce
  • 2 Tbsp (30 ml) soy sauce
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) olive oil

For the Peanut Slaw

  • 2 cups (140 g) red cabbage
  • 1 cup (100 g) shredded carrots
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) soy sauce
  • 2 Tbsp (32 g) natural peanut butter
  • 2 Tbsp (30 ml) rice wine vinegar
  • 1 inch (10 g) chunk of ginger
  • 1 clove (5 g) garlic
  • 2 Tbsp (42 g) honey
  • 3 Tbsp (45 ml) water
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) lime juice

For the Sweet Potato Fries

  • 4 large (1100 g) sweet potatoes cut into strips
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) olive oil
  • 2 tsp (10 ml) garlic powder
  • Salt and pepper to taste

Instructions:

For the Sweet Potato Fries

  1. Preheat your oven to 400F.
  2. Cut your sweet potatoes into strips about inch thick. Use a mandolin if you have one, it will be much faster and you will get uniform cuts.
  3. Spread the potatoes out on sheet pan and drizzle with olive oil. Season with 2 tsp of garlic powder.
  4. Bake for 10 minutes and then turn the fries and bake an addition 5-8 minutes. Watch them carefully to make sure they dont burn.
  5. Season with salt and pepper to taste once they have finished cooking.

For the Turkey Burgers

  1. Mince the 3 shallots, 5 cloves of garlic, and 2 Tbsp worth of ginger. Cut the jalapeo into a small dice.
  2. Heat 1 tsp of olive oil in a skillet and saut the shallots, garlic, ginger, and jalapeo until the onions have browned. Stir often to prevent burning.
  3. In a large bowl, mix together the 2 lbs of ground turkey, shallot/ginger/garlic/jalapeo mixture, 1 Tbsp + 1 tsp of fish sauce, cilantro, 2 Tbsp of soy sauce, 1 Tbsp olive oil. Using your hands, fold the mixture until everything has been incorporated thoroughly.
  4. Form 10 patties about an inch thick.
  5. Heat a grill pan or a skillet over medium high heat. Cook the burgers for 5-7 minutes on each side. They are finished when they have reached an internal temperature of 165F.

For the Peanut Slaw

  1. While the burgers are cooking you can begin to prep the slaw. In a large bowl, mix together 2 cups of red cabbage and 1 cup of shredded carrots.
  2. Make the dressing in a blender by combining 2 Tbsp of peanut butter, 2 Tbsp rice wine vinegar, a 1 inch chunk of ginger, 1 clove of garlic, 2 Tbsp of honey, 3 Tbsp of water, and 1 Tbsp of lime juice. Blend until smooth. Taste and adjust flavors as necessary. Pour the sauce over the cabbage mix and toss.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide your turkey burgers and sweet potato fries evenly between your 5 containers. Keep the peanut slaw in a separate container as you do not want to microwave it.

Maple Sriracha Meatballs with Zucchini Lo Mein

Turkey meatballs topped with a sauce made from maple syrup, sriracha, honey, ginger, and soy sauce. Zucchini noodles replace traditional lo mein noodles to lessen the carb load.

CourseCuisineTime - 1 hour 10 minutes 1 hour 10 minutes
Main DishAsian, meal prepPrep - 25 minutes 25 minutes
Cook - 45 minutes 45 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
837kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates55g35%
Fat44g28%
Protein55g35%

Ingredients:

For the Meatballs

  • 2 lbs (908 g) ground pork
  • 2 tsp (6 g) salt
  • 1 tsp (2 g) pepper
  • 2 Tbsp (30 ml) Maple Sriracha sauce
  • cup (75 g) grated carrots use a blender or food processor
  • 1 Tbsp (5 g) ginger minced

For the Maple Sriracha Sauce

  • cup (120 ml) soy sauce
  • 2 Tbsp (10 g) ginger
  • cup (40 g) sweet onion diced
  • cup (84 g) honey
  • cup (80 g) maple syrup
  • 2 Tbsp (30 ml) sriracha

For the Vegetables

  • 2 Tbsp (40 ml) maple sriracha sauce
  • 1 large bunch (500 g) broccoli
  • Salt and pepper to taste

For the Rice

  • 5 cups (675 g) cooked rice

Instructions:

For the Meatballs and Sauce

  1. Preheat your oven to 375F.
  2. Prepare your sauce first. Mix all of the ingredients in a blender and blend until smooth.
  3. In a bowl, mix 2 lbs turkey, 2 tsp salt, 1 tsp pepper, 2 Tbsp Maple Sriracha sauce, cup grated carrots, and 1 Tbsp minced ginger.
  4. Form the meat mixture into balls 1 inches in diameter. It should make around 20 meatballs.
  5. Place the meatballs on a greased sheet pan and bake for 35 minutes or until an internal temperature of 165F is reached.
  6. While the meatballs are cooking you can begin to cook your zucchini noodles and broccoli.

For the Vegetables

  1. Steam your broccoli using your preferred method.
  2. Heat a skillet over medium heat and add 1 tbsp of olive oil.
  3. Leave your zucchini raw and add 2 Tbsp of the Maple Sriracha sauce. Stir to coat. You dont want to cook it as it will soften in the microwave upon reheating.

For the Maple Sriracha Sauce

  1. Using the same skillet, add in the remainder of your Maple Sriracha sauce over medium heat.
  2. Bring the sauce to a boil and cook for 2 minutes.
  3. Reduce the heat to low and allow it to simmer until thickened, around 10 minutes.
  4. Once the meatballs have finished cooking, add them to the sauce and coat each meat ball thoroughly.
  5. If you have extra sauce, you may want to coat the broccoli as well.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide your ingredients evenly into each of your 5 containers.

For the Rice

  1. Cook enough rice to have 5 cups of cooked rice. 1 cup of dry rice will yield about 3 cups of cooked rice.

Teriyaki Chicken & Mixed Vegetables

A meal prep version of the classic Asian dish. The teriyaki sauce in this recipe uses pineapple juice as a sweetener instead of sugar.

CourseCuisineTime - 1 hour 1 hour 1 hour
Main DishAsian, meal prepPrep - 35 minutes 35 minutes 35 minutes
Cook - 30 minutes 30 minutes 30 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
661kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates66g47%
Fat21g15%
Protein53g37%

Ingredients:

For the Chicken

  • 2 lbs (1135 g) boneless skinless chicken thighs
  • of the teriyaki sauce
  • 2 Tbsp (30 ml) soy sauce
  • 2 Tbsp (30 ml) pineapple juice
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) olive oil

For the Vegetables

  • 1 large (300 g) zucchini
  • 1 large (300 g) yellow squash
  • 1 medium (150 g) red pepper
  • 3 (300 g) carrots
  • 1 Tbsp (15 g) garlic
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) olive oil

For the Teriyaki Sauce

  • cup (60 ml) pineapple juice
  • cup (60 ml) soy sauce
  • 1 Tbsp (15 g) garlic minced
  • 1 tsp (2 g) ginger minced
  • 3 Tbsp (63 g) honey
  • 3 Tbsp (45 ml) rice wine vinegar
  • 2 tsp (5 ml) cornstarch
  • Pinch pepper

For the Rice

  • 5 cups (675 g) cooked rice
  • 3 Tbsp (45 ml) olive oil

Instructions:

For the Rice

  1. Cook enough rice to have 5 cups worth. 1 cup of dry rice makes about 3 cups of cooked rice. Stir in 3 tbsp of olive oil.

For the Teriyaki Sauce

  1. In a sauce pot over medium heat, add cup pineapple juice, cup soy sauce, 2 cloves minced garlic, 1 tsp minced ginger, 3 Tbsp honey, 3 Tbsp rice wine vinegar, 2 tsp cornstarch, and a pinch of pepper.
  2. Bring to a light boil for 1 minute, then reduce the heat to low and simmer to thicken (will take around 10 minutes). Stir often. Add cornstarch in a slurry as needed if it is not thickening.
  3. The sauce is finished once it is thick enough to coat the back of a spoon.

For the Chicken

  1. Cut your chicken into 1 inch pieces and add to a large ziplock bag.
  2. Add of the teriyaki sauce, 2 Tbsp of soy sauce, and 2 Tbsp pineapple juice. Remove as much air as possible and marinate for at least 30 minutes.
  3. Heat a grill pan or skillet over medium high heat. (Grill pan is best).
  4. Cook the chicken in batches to ensure you sear the meat and do not steam it.
  5. Once all of the chicken has finished cooking, add all of it back to the pan. Add in about of the remaining teriyaki sauce. The remainder will be used for the vegetables.
  6. Stir to coat and remove from heat.

For the Vegetables

  1. Wash all of your vegetables and peel your carrots.
  2. Cut your zucchini, squash, and red pepper into a large dice. Cut your carrots into thin slices on a bias.
  3. Heat a large skillet over medium high heat. Add 1 Tbsp of olive oil.
  4. Add the carrots, red pepper and 1 Tbsp of garlic to the pan first. Allow them to cook for a few minutes and then add in the zucchini and squash.
  5. Once the carrots have softened, add in the remaining teriyaki sauce and toss to coat. Season with salt and pepper to taste if necessary.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide your chicken and vegetables evenly 5 ways to each of your containers.

Chamorro Chicken with Vegetables & Pineapple Salsa

This recipe is a version of a classical dish from the Chamorro people of the Northern Mariana Islands. Chicken marinated in soy sauce, vinegar, and pineapple juice provides lots of flavor.

CourseCuisineTime - 1 hour 20 minutes 1 hour 20 minutes 1 hour 20 minutes
Main DishAsian, meal prepPrep - 45 minutes 45 minutes 45 minutes
Cook - 35 minutes 35 minutes 35 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
581kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates57g47%
Fat20g16%
Protein44g36%

Ingredients:

For the Chicken

  • 2 lbs (1135 g) boneless skinless chicken thighs
  • (100 g) red onion
  • cup (60 ml) soy sauce
  • cup (60 ml) apple cider vinegar
  • cup (63 ml) water
  • cup (60 ml) pineapple juice
  • 1 tsp (3 g) salt
  • 3 cloves (15 g) garlic minced

For the Rice

  • 5 cups (675 g) cooked rice
  • 3 tbsp olive oil

For the Pineapple Salsa

  • 2 cups (275 g) pineapple frozen works, fresh is better
  • 1 small (100 g) red pepper
  • 1 (20 g) jalapeo pepper
  • 2 Tbsp (5 g) cilantro
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) lime juice
  • Salt and pepper to taste

For the Vegetables

  • 2 (300 g) red peppers
  • 2 (400 g) zucchini
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) olive oil

Instructions:

For the Rice

  1. Cook the rice using your preferred method (rice cooker or saucepan). Be sure you make enough to have 2 cups worth of cooked rice.
  2. Drizzle in 3 tbsp of olive oil to add extra calories.

For the Chicken

  1. Cut the chicken thighs into a large dice, around 1 inch pieces and add to a large ziplock bag.
  2. Dice of a red onion. Add the onion, cup of soy sauce, cup of apple cider vinegar, cup of water, cup of pineapple juice, 1 tsp salt, and 3 cloves of minced garlic to the ziplock bag and remove as much air as possible. Let the chicken marinate in the refrigerator for at least 30 minutes.
  3. While the chicken is marinating, prepare the salsa and vegetables.
  4. After the chicken has finished marinating, heat a large grill pan or skillet over medium high heat.
  5. Cook the chicken in batches to ensure you dont over crowd the pan. The chicken is finished when it is no longer pink in the middle or has an internal temperature of at least 165. There is no need to drain the marinade from the chicken before cooking. The marinade will create a glaze over the chicken while cooking. If you have leftover marinade when the chicken has finished, add it to the pan and reduce it to a syrup consistency (around 10-15 minutes). Add the chicken back to the pan and coat evenly.

For the Salsa

  1. Cut the pineapple, bell pepper, jalapeo, and 2 Tbsp of cilantro into a small dice and mix together.
  2. Add in the lime juice and season with salt and pepper to taste. Mix thoroughly.

For the Vegetables

  1. Cut the zucchini and red bell peppers into a large dice.
  2. In a large skillet, add 1 Tbsp of olive oil and saut the vegetables until they are soft.
  3. Season with salt and pepper to taste

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide the chicken and vegetables evenly. Store the pineapple salsa in a separate, small container as you dont want to reheat this. To each dish, add 1 of a cup of rice.

Garlic Sriracha Chicken

Grilled chicken thighs coated with a Greek yogurt, garlic sriracha sauce. If you like spicy food then this meal is for you! Not a fan of spicy food? Just cut back on the sriracha.

CourseCuisineTime - null
Main DishAsian, meal prepPrep - 5 minutes 5 minutes 5 minutes
Cook - 25 minutes 25 minutes 25 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
586kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates47g38%
Fat21g17%
Protein54g44%

Ingredients:

  • 2 lbs (1135 g) boneless skinless chicken thighs
  • 4 Tbsp (60 ml) olive oil
  • 20 oz (567 g) frozen broccoli
  • cup (170 g) plain Greek yogurt
  • 2 Tbsp (30 ml) sriracha
  • 2 tsp (5 g) garlic powder
  • Salt and pepper
  • 5 cups (675 g) cooked rice
  • 5 Tbsp (10 g) green onions

Instructions:

For the Rice

  1. Cook enough rice to have 5 cups of cooked rice. 1 cup of uncooked rice will yield around 3 cups of cooked rice. Measure out the rice and stir in 3 Tbsp of oil.

For the Chicken

  1. Drizzle 1 Tbsp of olive oil over the chicken and ensure it is distributed across each of the thighs.
  2. Lightly season the chicken with salt and pepper.
  3. Heat a grill pan or a skillet over medium high heat and cook the chicken in batches if necessary to prevent overcrowding. It has finished cooking when the inside is no longer pink and reaches an internal temperature of at least 165F.
  4. Let the chicken rest for at least 5 minutes and then cut it into a large dice.

For the Garlic Sriracha Sauce

  1. In a bowl, mix together cup plain Greek yogurt, 2 Tbsp sriracha (more if you like spicy, less if you dont), and 2 tsp garlic powder.
  2. Heat the skillet over medium heat and add the chicken in. Pour the garlic sriracha sauce over the top of the chicken and stir to coat evenly.

For the Broccoli

  1. Because we are using frozen broccoli, it has already been cooked at one point. There is no need to cook the broccoli as it will cook when you reheat your meals. If you want to cook it, go for it. Regardless of which option you choose, lightly season it with salt and pepper before you eat it.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Add 1 cup of rice to each dish and divide the chicken and broccoli evenly. Top each dish with 1 Tbsp of chopped green onions.

Orange Chicken & Vegetables

A meal prepped version of the Chinese takeout dish. This version is not breaded or deep fried making it a healthier option than the one you would get from the Chinese restaurant.

CourseCuisineTime - 35 minutes 35 minutes 35 minutes
Main DishAsian, meal prepPrep - 10 minutes 10 minutes 10 minutes
Cook - 25 minutes 25 minutes 25 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
627kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates68g50%
Fat17g12%
Protein51g37%

Ingredients:

For the Chicken

  • 2 lbs (1135 g) boneless skinless chicken thighs
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) olive oil
  • 1 Tbsp (6 g) sesame seeds

For the Vegetables

  • 1 (250 g) zucchini
  • 1 (250 g) yellow squash
  • 2 (200 g) carrots
  • 1 (150 g) green pepper
  • 1 (150 g) red pepper
  • (100 g) sweet onion
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) olive oil

For the Sauce

  • cup (84 g) honey
  • cup (60 ml) white vinegar
  • cup (120 ml) orange juice
  • 2 Tbsp (30 ml) soy sauce
  • 2 tsp (6 g) cornstarch
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) cold water

For the Rice

  • 5 cups (675 g) cooked rice

Instructions:

For the Rice

  1. Cook enough rice to have 5 cups of rice. 1 cup of dry rice will yield 3 cups of cooked rice.

For the Chicken

  1. Drizzle 1 Tbsp of olive oil over the chicken and ensure it is distributed across each of the thighs.
  2. Lightly season the chicken with salt and pepper.
  3. Heat a grill pan or a skillet over medium high heat and cook the chicken in batches if necessary to prevent overcrowding. It has finished cooking when the inside is no longer pink and reaches an internal temperature of at least 165F.
  4. Let the chicken rest for at least 5 minutes and then cut it into a large dice.

For the Vegetables

  1. Wash and cut all of the vegetables into a large dice.
  2. Heat 1 Tbsp of olive oil in a large skillet. Add in the onions and carrots first and cook for 1-2 minutes.
  3. Add the peppers and squash next and cook until soft.

For the Sauce

  1. In a small sauce pot add cup honey, cup white vinegar, cup orange juice, and 2 Tbsp soy sauce. Bring to a light boil.
  2. Mix together 2 tsp cornstarch and 1 Tbsp cold water into a slurry. Pour into the sauce and stir to thicken.
  3. Pour the sauce over the chicken and vegetables and top the chicken with 2 Tbsp of sesame seeds.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide the chicken and vegetables evenly between your containers.

Teriyaki Ginger Chicken Stir Fry

It doesnt get quicker than a stir fry meal. If you buy frozen, precooked chicken this meal can be made in minutes. Using a bottled teriyaki sauce also makes it super quick and easy.

CourseCuisineTime - 25 minutes 25 minutes 25 minutes
Main DishAsian, meal prepPrep - 5 minutes 5 minutes 5 minutes
Cook - 20 minutes 20 minutes 20 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
573kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates61g49%
Fat15g12%
Protein48g38%

Ingredients:

  • 2 lbs (1135 g) boneless skinless chicken thighs
  • 20 oz (567 g) broccoli fresh or frozen
  • 1 lb (454 g) green beans
  • 2 Tbsp (30 ml) olive oil
  • cup (120 g) teriyaki ginger sauce I use the Kikkoman Teriyaki Triple Ginger sauce
  • 1 Tbsp (6 ml) sesame seeds
  • 5 cups (750 g) cooked rice
  • Salt and pepper to taste

Instructions:

For the Rice

  1. Cook enough rice to have 5 cups of cooked rice. 1 cup of uncooked rice will yield around 3 cups of cooked rice.

For the Chicken

  1. Lightly season the chicken with salt and pepper.
  2. Add 1-2 Tbsp of of olive oil to a grill pan or skillet over medium high heat and cook the chicken in batches if necessary to prevent overcrowding. It has finished cooking when the inside is no longer pink and reaches an internal temperature of at least 165F.
  3. Let it rest for a few minutes after cooking and cut into a large dice.

For the Vegetables

  1. Cook the broccoli in the microwave until it is no longer frozen. It doesnt have to be hot as you will be cooking more in the skillet.
  2. Start a large pot of water over high heat. Add the green beans and bring to a boil. Boil for 5-7 minutes or until the beans have softened but still slightly crisp.
  3. Add the chicken back to the skillet and pour cup of the teriyaki sauce over the top. Stir to coat and then add the green beans and broccoli. Stir everything so that the vegetables can pick up the residual sauce. Sprinkle 1 Tbsp of sesame seeds over the top.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. To each of your containers add 1 cup of rice and divide the stir fry evenly.

Beef & Broccoli Stir Fry

An easy recipe with great flavor. This meal is as good as any you would get from a Chinese takeout menu. Make sure you get your pan nice an hot to get a good sear on the beef!

CourseCuisineTime - 30 minutes 30 minutes 30 minutes
Main DishAsian, meal prepPrep - 10 minutes 10 minutes 10 minutes
Cook - 20 minutes 20 minutes 20 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
717kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates74g50%
Fat27g18%
Protein45g30%

Ingredients:

  • 2 lbs (908 g) sirloin steak
  • 1 bunch (500 g) broccoli
  • (100 g) sweet onion
  • 1 lb (454 g) carrots
  • 2 Tbsp (30 ml) olive oil
  • 1 Tbsp (5 g) ginger
  • 3 tsp (8 g) cornstarch
  • 5 cups (750 g) cooked rice
  • 5 Tbsp (10 g) green onions chopped
  • Salt and pepper to taste
  • 1 Tbsp (8 g) sesame seeds

For the Sauce

  • cup (120 ml) soy sauce
  • 1 Tbsp (15 g) sriracha
  • cup (60 ml) water
  • 1 Tbsp (5 g) ginger minced
  • 1 tsp (3 gl) cornstarch
  • 3 Tbsp (37 g) brown sugar

Instructions:

For the rice

  1. Cook enough rice to have 5 cups of cooked rice. 1 cup of uncooked rice will yield around 3 cups of cooked rice.

For the Beef and Broccoli

  1. Prepare all of your ingredients before you start cooking. Cut your onion and carrots into a large dice, cut your broccoli into florets. Mince the enough ginger to yield 2 Tbsp.
  2. Heat a large skillet over medium high heat and add ~1 Tbsp of olive oil.
  3. Cut the steak into thin slices (about inch thick, against the grain of the meat. It may help to cut if the meat is slightly frozen.
  4. Very lightly season the beef with salt and sprinkle 3 tsp of cornstarch over the top. Try and coat all sides of the meat.
  5. Cook the beef in the pan in batches. You want to get a sear on the meat so dont overcrowd the pan and make sure your pan is hot. After 1 minute, flip the pieces and cook an additional minute. Remove from pan.
  6. Add olive oil if necessary and cook the remaining beef.
  7. Once the beef has finished add ~1 Tbsp of olive oil to the pan. Add in the onions, carrots, and minced ginger. Cook for 3 minutes and then add in the broccoli. Continue cooking until the broccoli begins to soften. It may be helpful to parboil it first.

For the Sauce

  1. In a sauce pot, add cup soy sauce, 1 Tbsp sriracha, 1 Tbsp minced ginger, 2 Tbsp of water and 3 Tbsp brown sugar over medium heat. Allow the sugar to melt and stir frequently. Bring to a light boil.
  2. Mix 1 tsp cornstarch into the remaining 2 Tbsp of water. Add to the pot and stir to thicken.
  3. Combine the beef and vegetables back into the skillet and pour the sauce over the top. Stir to coat evenly. Top with sesame seeds.
  4. This recipe makes 5 servings. Add 1 cup of rice and 1 Tbsp green onions to each dish and divide the meat mixture evenly.

For the Chicken and Broccoli

  1. Prepare all of your ingredients before you start cooking. Cut your onion and carrots into a large dice, cut your broccoli into florets. Mince the enough ginger to yield 2 Tbsp.
  2. Heat a large skillet over medium high heat and add ~1 Tbsp of olive oil.
  3. Cut the chicken into thin slices (about inch thick, against the grain of the meat. It may help to cut if the meat is slightly frozen.
  4. Very lightly season the beef with salt and sprinkle 3 tsp of cornstarch over the top. Try and coat all sides of the meat.
  5. Cook the chicken in the pan in batches. You want to get a sear on the meat so dont overcrowd the pan and make sure your pan is hot. After 1 minute, flip the pieces and cook an additional minute. Remove from pan.
  6. Add olive oil if necessary and cook the remaining beef.
  7. Once the chicken has finished add ~1 Tbsp of olive oil to the pan. Add in the onions, carrots, and minced ginger. Cook for 3 minutes and then add in the broccoli. Continue cooking until the broccoli begins to soften. It may be helpful to parboil it first.

Asian Ground Turkey Bowls

Ground turkey mixed in an Asian inspired sauce and served with a side of rice, and vegetables. Topping this dish with a few peanuts after reheating would be a great addition.

CourseCuisineTime - 35 minutes
Main DishAsian, meal prepPrep - 10 minutes
Cook - 25 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
415kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates36g42%
Fat16g19%
Protein32g38%

Ingredients:

For the Rice

  • 2 cups (375 g) cooked rice

For the Vegetables

  • 1 medium (200 g) sweet onion
  • 1 medium (150 g) green pepper
  • 2 cups (250 g) shredded carrots
  • 1 tbsp (15 mL) olive oil
  • salt and pepper to taste

For the Turkey

  • 2 lbs (681 g) ground turkey 93/7
  • 8 oz (227 g) mushrooms
  • 1 tbsp (21 g) honey
  • 2 tsp (10 g) sriracha
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) garlic minced
  • tsp (1 g) ground ginger
  • 1 tsp (5 mL) sesame oil
  • 1 tbsp (15 mL) olive oil
  • 3 tbsp (45 mL) soy sauce
  • salt and pepper to taste

Instructions:

For the Vegetables

  1. Wash and cut your green pepper into a large dice. Cut your sweet onion into a large dice as well.
  2. Cut your mushrooms into quarters if they are small or more if they are larger mushrooms.
  3. In a large skillet, heat 1 Tbsp of olive oil over medium high heat.
  4. Add the onion first and cook for 1-2 minutes then add in the green peppers. Cook until soft and remove from the pan. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

For the Turkey

  1. Heat 1 Tbsp of olive oil over medium high heat. Add in the ground turkey and 1 Tbsp minced garlic to cook.
  2. When the turkey is half way browned, add in the chopped mushrooms and cook together until the turkey has fully browned.
  3. When the turkey has finished, add in 1 Tbsp of honey, 3 Tbsp soy sauce, 2 tsp sriracha, 1 tsp sesame oil, and tsp ground ginger. Stir to incorporate and season with salt and pepper to taste.

For the Rice

  1. Cook enough rice to have 2 cups of cooked rice. 1 cup of uncooked rice will yield around 3 cups of cooked rice.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. You do not need to cook the shredded carrots because they will cook when reheated in the microwave. Add cup of rice and carrots to each container and divide the remaining ingredients equally.

Honey Garlic Chicken Noodle Bowls

These Honey Garlic Chicken Noodle Bowls can be prepped in about 45 minutes. They are made up of sweet potato glass noodles, ground chicken, a variety of vegetables, and a sauce to bring it all together.

CourseCuisineTime - 45 minutes
Main DishAsian, meal prepPrep - 15 minutes
Cook - 30 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
597kcal5 servings
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates66g53%
Fat21g17%
Protein36g29%

Ingredients:

For the Meat and Vegetables

  • 2 lbs (908 g) ground chicken (93/7)
  • 8 oz (227 g) sweet potato glass noodles
  • 1 small (125 g) onion
  • 1 medium (150 g) red pepper
  • 8 oz (227 g) mushrooms
  • 8 oz (227 g) shredded cabbage i buy this pre shredded
  • 4 cloves (15 g) garlic
  • 5 stalks (25 g) green onions
  • 2 tbsp (30 g) oil
  • salt and pepper

For the Sauce

  • 2 tbsp (30 g) soy sauce
  • cup (84 g) honey
  • cup (80 g) oyster sauce
  • 2 tsp (10 g) sesame oil
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) sriracha

Instructions:

For the Noodles

  1. Place the noodles into a bowl and pour over enough hot water to submerge them. Allow them to soften while you prepare the rest of your ingredients.

For the Stir Fry

  1. Heat a large skillet over medium high heat and add 1 tbsp of oil and throw in the ground chicken. Season lightly with salt and pepper.
  2. Keep an eye on the chicken while you cut up your vegetables and tend to it as needed. Cook the chicken until it has browned and no pink remains. When finished, remove it from the skillet and set aside.
  3. While the chicken is cooking, wash and cut all of your vegetables. Cut the onion into thin slices, the red pepper into a large dice, the mushrooms into thin slices, shred the cabbage (if necessary), mince the garlic, and cut the tops off the green onions on a bias.
  4. Once the chicken has finished and you have removed it from the pan, add tbsp of oil and add in the onions and peppers first. Allow these to cook and brown for a couple of minutes before adding the other vegetables.
  5. Make some room in the center of the pan and add another tbsp of oil and the mushrooms. Allow the mushrooms to brown and release their water before you stir them around too much.
  6. Once the mushrooms have browned, add the cabbage and garlic. Stir to distribute everything in the pan.

For the Sauce

  1. In a bowl, stir together the soy sauce, honey, oyster sauce, sesame oil, and sriracha. Mix vigorously to make sure that the honey gets evenly stirred in.

Construction

  1. Place the skillet over medium heat. Add in the chicken and pour about half of the sauce over the top. Stir to combine so that the chicken and vegetables are coated.
  2. Drain the water away from the noodles and add them into the pan. Pour the remaining sauce over the top and stir. Taste test and add salt and pepper as needed.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide the contents of the pan evenly between 5 containers. This meal will last up to 5 days in the fridge.

Peaches and Cream Baked Oatmeal

Peaches and Cream Baked Oatmeal made from frozen peaches layered and swirled cream cheese inside of an oatmeal and egg bake. This is a great meal for those weeks you prefer something sweet to have in the morning.

CourseCuisineTime - 55 minutes
BreakfastAmerican, meal prepPrep - 10 minutes
Cook - 45 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
392kcal6
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates49g59%
Fat13g15%
Protein20g24%

Ingredients:

  • 3 cups (240 g) old fashioned oats
  • 2 scoops (60 g) vanilla protein powder
  • 1 tsp (4 g) baking powder
  • 1 lb (454 g) peaches frozen, fresh, or canned
  • 2 tbsp (42 g) maple syrup
  • 1 tbsp (14 g) butter
  • 10 tbsp (150 g) liquid egg whites or 2 eggs
  • 2 cups (480 g) 2% milk
  • 4 oz (113 g) plain cream cheese i used whipped, regular is fine you'll just need to melt it down
  • 2 tbsp (25 g) sugar
  • tsp (2 g) salt

Instructions:

For the Baked Oatmeal

  1. Preheat your oven to 375F.
  2. Measure out your peaches. If you would like a sweeter end product, sprinkle 1 teaspoon (5g) of sugar over the top and allow them to macerate. It may help speed up the process if you thaw them in the microwave first.
  3. In a large bowl, mix together the oats, protein powder, salt, and baking powder.
  4. Add in the egg whites, milk, syrup, 1 tbsp of melted butter, and the peaches. Reserve a few to put on top.
  5. Spray a 13"x9" pan with oil and add the oat mixture.
  6. Mix together the cream cheese and sugar. You can microwave it for a bit to help it soften. Put a few spoonfuls of the cream cheese around your pan and swirl it around as best as you can.
  7. You can garnish the top with fresh peach slices if you wish.
  8. Bake for 40-45 minutes.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 6 servings. Cut the oatmeal into 6 equal pieces.

Teriyaki Rotisserie Chicken Bowls

These Teriyaki Rotisserie Chicken Bowls can be prepped with no cooking other than using a microwave by utilizing a rotisserie chicken bought from the store. This meal can be tossed together in 20 minutes and provide you with your lunches for the week.

CourseCuisineTime - 20 minutes
Main DishAsian, meal prepPrep - 20 minutes
Cook - 5 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
557kcal5 servings
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates63g53%
Fat17g14%
Protein38g32%

Ingredients:

  • 1.5 lbs (681 g) pulled rotisserie chicken
  • 9 tbsp (135 g) teriyaki sauce
  • 2 tsp (10 g) sesame seeds
  • 2 (10 g) green onions

For the Rice

  • 4 cups (568 g) cooked rice
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) soy sauce
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) rice vinegar
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) crunchy chili garlic oil

For the Slaw

  • 12 oz (340 g) shredded cabbage
  • 1 cup (100 g) matchstick carrots
  • 2 tbsp (30 g) rice vinegar
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) crunchy chili garlic oil
  • 1 tbsp (21 g) honey

Instructions:

  1. Cook the frozen rice in the microwave according to the packaging.
  2. In a large bowl, add the carrots, cabbage, vinegar, chili garlic oil, and honey.
  3. Mix to combine, season with salt to taste and adjust flavor as needed.
  4. Butcher your rotisserie chicken and pull away the meat. Measure out 1.5lbs or 681g of the chicken into a bowl.
  5. Add 4 tbsp or 60g of teriyaki sauce and mix.
  6. Add the rice to the bowl and mix in the soy sauce, vinegar, and chili oil.
  7. Divide the ingredients evenly between 5 containers. Top with sesame seeds and green onions if you wish.
  8. After reheating, top each dish with 1 tbsp of teriyaki sauce.

Double Chocolate Brownie Baked Oatmeal

Double Chocolate Brownie Baked Oatmeal. Great for either a meal prepped breakfast or as a pre-bedtime snack. I like to eat mine by dumping some milk over the top after reheating.

CourseCuisineTime - 55 minutes
Main DishAmerican, meal prepPrep - 15 minutes
Cook - 40 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
360kcal6 servings
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates49g61%
Fat8g10%
Protein23g28%

Ingredients:

  • 3 cups (240 g) old fashioned oats
  • 3 scoops (90 g) vanilla protein powder i use whey
  • 1 tsp (4 g) baking powder
  • 1/4 cup (20 g) cocoa powder
  • 2 tbsp (42 g) maple syrup
  • 1 tbsp (14 g) butter
  • 10 tbsp (150 g) liquid egg whites or 2 whole eggs
  • 2 cups (480 g) milk
  • 1 cup (226 g) unsweetened apple sauce
  • 4 tbsp (56 g) mini chocolate chips
  • 1 tsp (5 g) milk

Instructions:

FOR THE BAKED OATMEAL

  1. Preheat your oven to 350F (177C).
  2. In a large bowl, mix together the oats, protein powder, cocoa powder, and baking powder.
  3. Add in the egg whites, milk, syrup, 1 tbsp of melted butter, apple sauce, and 2 tbsp of chocolate chips.
  4. Spray a 13x9 pan with oil and add the oat mixture.
  5. Top with 1 tbsp of chocolate chips.
  6. Bake for 35-40 minutes.
  7. Melt the last tbsp of chocolate chips in the microwave with 1 tsp of milk.
  8. Place the melted chocolate into a piping bag and drizzle over the top.

PLATING

  1. This recipe makes 6 servings. Cut the oatmeal into 6 equal pieces.

Turkey and Kale Power Bowl

This Turkey and Kale Power Bowl is served with a side of Sriracha Lime Mayo and Pickled Red Onions. Made up of 93/7 ground turkey, onions, peppers, kale and quinoa this meal is high in volume and flavor.

CourseCuisineTime - 45 minutes
Main DishAmerican, meal prepPrep - 20 minutes
Cook - 25 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
574kcal5 servings
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates36g33%
Fat30g28%
Protein40g37%

Ingredients:

For the Pickled Onions

  • 1 medium (200 g) red onion
  • 1 tbsp (12 g) sugar
  • 1 tsp (6 g) salt
  • 1 cups (360 g) white vinegar
  • 1 cups (360 g) water

For the Quinoa

  • 1 cup (180 g) dry quinoa
  • 2 cups (480 g) water

For the Turkey

  • 2 lbs (908 g) ground turkey (93/7)
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) oil
  • 2 tsp (6 g) paprika
  • 1 tsp (3 g) ground coriander
  • salt and pepper to taste

For the Vegetables

  • 1 small (125 g) sweet onion
  • 2 medium (300 g) red peppers
  • 1 bunch (150 g) kale
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) minced garlic
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) oil
  • salt and pepper to taste

For the Sriracha Lime Mayo

  • cup (56 g) mayonnaise
  • cup (56 g) plain nonfat Greek yogurt
  • 4 tsp (20 g) lime juice
  • 4 tsp (20 g) sriracha
  • salt to taste

Instructions:

For the Quinoa

  1. Rinse your quinoa under some water to clean off any impurities.
  2. Cook your quinoa according to the packaging. I use a rice cooker with a 1 cup quinoa to 2 cups water ratio.

For the Pickled Onions

  1. Cut your red onion into thin slices from root to shoot.
  2. In large mason jar, add 1 tsp of salt, 1 tbsp of sugar, 1 cups water, and 1 cups distilled vinegar. Stir to dissolve the solids.
  3. Add the onions into the mason jar and top with more water and vinegar if necessary to cover the onions. Cap the jar and move it into the fridge to allow the onions to pickle.

For the Vegetables

  1. Wash your red peppers and kale first.
  2. Cut the peppers into a small to medium dice and the onion into a small dice.
  3. Remove the leaves from the stems of the kale and roughly chop them into smaller pieces. Massage the kale leaves by squeezing them in your hands for 20-30 seconds. This will help soften the leaves and take away some bitterness.
  4. In a large skillet over medium high heat, add 1 tbsp of oil and dump in your onions and peppers. Salt lightly.
  5. Once the onions have started to develop some color, add in your kale and cover for 1 minute to help it wilt down.
  6. Stir the contents of the skillet and then add 1 tbsp of minced garlic and season the vegetables to taste. Reserve to the side until the remainder of your components are ready.

For the Turkey

  1. In a large skillet over medium high heat, drizzle in 1 tbsp of oil and add the turkey to brown. Season with salt and pepper to your liking.
  2. Flip the turkey over after a few minutes to brown the other side. When it is about 85% of the way finished, add in 2 tsp of paprika and 1 tsp ground coriander.
  3. Mix in the seasonings until they are well distributed. Once the turkey is finished cooking, set it aside until everything else is ready.

For the Sriracha Lime Mayo

  1. In a small bowl, mix the mayo, yogurt, lime juice, and sriracha together. Season with salt to taste.
  2. Divide the mayo out into 5 small ramekins to be placed into the final dish.

For the Final Dish + Plating

  1. In a large skillet with the vegetables, add in the turkey and quinoa. Mix thoroughly to incorporate. Taste test and adjust flavors as needed.
  2. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide the contents of the skillet evenly between 5 servings. Each dish gets one ramekin of the sriracha lime mayo.
  3. If you are taking the meals away from your home, I would also add in some of the pickled red onions to each dish. If you eat the meals at home, you can take the onions from the jar after you reheat.

Hidden Vegetable Mac and Cheese

This Mac and Cheese is macro friendly with 50 grams of protein and is full of nutrients from vegetables hidden in the cheese sauce. The sauce is made up of carrots, cauliflower, milk, and cheese.

CourseCuisineTime - 1 hour
Main DishAmerican, meal prepPrep - 30 minutes
Cook - 30 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
596kcal6 servings
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates54g43%
Fat20g16%
Protein50g40%

Ingredients:

  • 2 lbs (908 g) boneless skinless chicken breast
  • 12 oz (340 g) macaroni noodles gluten free if needed
  • 1 lb (454 g) frozen cauliflower
  • 3 medium (300 g) carrots
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) oil
  • 8 oz (227 g) cheddar cheese block is best
  • 2 cups (480 g) pasta water
  • 1 cups (360 g) 2% milk
  • salt and pepper to taste
  • any other seasoning you like is optional

Instructions:

For the Vegetables

  1. Wash and cut your carrots into smaller pieces so that they roast quicker.
  2. On a lightly oiled sheet pan, place the carrots and frozen cauliflower. Drizzle over 1 tbsp of oil and lightly season with salt and pepper. Toss to coat.
  3. Roast at 425F (218C) for 20-25 minutes, flipping half way through.

For the Chicken

  1. Trim the excess fat and skin from the chicken and either cut or pound the chicken so that is even in thickness throughout. I shoot for about " in thickness.
  2. Season both sides lightly with salt and pepper and place onto a sheet pan. Place into the oven at 425F for 15 minutes or until the chicken reaches 165F.
  3. Once the chicken has finished, allow it to rest for 10 minutes before cutting it into a very small dice.

For the Macaroni

  1. Cook the macaroni according to the packaging. Shoot for just past al dente on the doneness. Reserve 2 cups of the pasta water for your cheese sauce. Be sure not to use too much water in your pot. Too much water will dilute the starchy pasta water that we will use to thicken the sauce later.
  2. Once cooked, rinse and store in cold water to stop the cooking process until you are ready to use later.

For the Cheese Sauce

  1. NOTE: If you wanted to add a bit of mustard powder, paprika, or another spice you could certainly do that. I like to personally keep it to salt and pepper but you should make it how you like it. Using a blend of different cheese can also add layers of flavor if you don't mind buying a few blocks of cheese.
  2. Shred your block of cheese using a box grater or food processor.
  3. Once the vegetables have finished roasting, place them into a blender with 2 cups of pasta water, 1 cups of milk, and about of all of the cheese you just shredded. Blend on high speed for 30-60s or until smooth.

For the Mac & Cheese

  1. In a 13"x9" baking dish, pour about half of the cheese sauce into the bottom.
  2. Drain the water away from your macaroni and dump the noodles into the pan.
  3. Add in the chopped chicken and pour the remaining cheese sauce over the top.
  4. Stir to evenly distribute the cheese sauce and give it a taste test. Adjust with salt and pepper to taste. Mix again if necessary.
  5. Top the dish with the remaining shredded cheese and place back into the oven at 425F for 10 minutes to brown the cheese and thicken the sauce. For the last two minutes, I like to turn the oven to broil to help the cheese brown.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 6 servings. Cut the dish into 6 equal portions and place into each meal prep container. Top with chopped parsley for a garnish if you wish.

Sweet Chili Noodle Bowls

These Sweet Chili Noodle Bowls are a combination of noodles, chicken, lettuce, cabbage, cucumbers, pickled carrots and a sweet chili vinaigrette. They are meant to be eaten cold and are a wonderful lunch option for a hot summer day.

CourseCuisineTime - 45 minutes
Main DishAsian, meal prepPrep - 20 minutes
Cook - 25 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
569kcal5 servings
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates64g53%
Fat18g15%
Protein37g31%

Ingredients:

For the Chicken

  • 2 lbs (908 g) boneless skinless chicken breasts
  • 2 tbsp (24 g) gochujang
  • 1 tsp (5 g) oil
  • salt and pepper to taste

For the Noodles and Vegetables

  • 10 oz (275 g) sweet potato glass noodles
  • 1 medium head (125 g) romaine lettuce
  • 4.5 oz (125 g) red cabbage
  • 1 medium (150 g) seedless cucumber
  • 2 medium (125 g) pickled carrots

For the Sweet Chili Vinaigrette

  • cup (60 g) light oil avocado, vegetable, or light olive will work
  • 1 tbsp (23.5 g) sriracha
  • 1 tbsp (23.5 g) vinegar
  • 3 tbsp (45 g) lime juice
  • 3 tbsp (36 g) sugar
  • 1 tsp (3 g) sesame seeds

For the Pickled Carrots

  • 4 medium (200 g) carrots
  • 1 cups (360 g) vinegar
  • 1 cups (360 g) water
  • 1 tbsp (12 g) sugar
  • 1 tsp (3 g) salt

Instructions:

For the Pickled Carrots

  1. I would recommend making a big batch of these carrots as they last for weeks in the fridge and they rock. They go on everything. For this particular recipe you'll only need about 2 carrots worth but making a bigger batch is nice to do. It also helps to prepare these the night before you make the meal so they have time to pickle but this is not absolutely necessary. 30 minutes to brine will work.
  2. Wash and peel the outer layer of your carrots. Using a vegetable peeler, go down the length of the carrot to create ribbons.
  3. For the brine, mix together the water, vinegar, salt, and sugar. Stir to combine and pour over top of the carrots in a glass jar. If you don't have enough to cover the carrots, you can just add more water and vinegar in equal parts.

For the Noodles

  1. I have found that the sweet potato glass noodles linked above work the best for this application. They don't dry out in the fridge over the week and have a soft bite. They are my favorite noodle to use right now. Can't speak highly enough about them. I bought mine at a local Asian grocery but I have also seen them at Central Market and on Amazon.
  2. To soften the noodles, I place them into a large bowl and pour boiling water over the top to soak while I prepare the rest of the ingredients. Get them started first so they will be ready when needed.

For the Chicken

  1. This meal is meant to be eaten cold and because of this, chicken breast is a fine choice. I usually stick to chicken thighs when I meal prep because they reheat better in the microwave and retain moisture. Since we don't have to worry about that, chicken breast is perfect.
  2. Cut or pound your chicken breasts until they are of even thickness throughout. This will help them cook faster and more evenly. Shoot for about 1/2" in thickness.
  3. Season the chicken breast with salt and pepper and coat the chicken with 2 tbsp of gochujang.
  4. I cook the chicken in the air fryer as it is easy and you get awesome color and flavor. You can cook the chicken however you prefer.
  5. Preheat your air fryer to 400F (204C) and cook the chicken for 4-5 minutes on each side. Cook in batches to not overcrowd the air fryer. Adjust the cooking time if you have thicker or thinner pieces of chicken.
  6. Once the chicken has finished cooking, set it aside to rest for a few minutes before cutting it into thin slices.

For the Vegetables

  1. While the chicken is cooking, chop up all of your vegetables.
  2. Cut up the romaine lettuce into thin pieces until you have about 2 cups worth.
  3. For the red cabbage you can use the preshredded stuff in the bag or buy the smallest head of cabbage you can find. Cut the cabbage into thin slices.
  4. Cut the cucumber in half length-wise and scoop out the seeds with a spoon. Cut the halves on a bias into thin slices.

For the Dressing

  1. Mix all of the ingredients in a bowl or jar with a lid and shake to emulsify the fat with the vinegar and lime juice.
  2. Divide evenly into 5 smaller ramekins.

Plating

  1. Drain all of the water away from the noodles and cut the chicken into thin slices if you have not yet.
  2. This recipe makes 5 servings so lay out 5 of your meal prep containers.
  3. Divide the noodles, chicken, cucumbers, cabbage, and lettuce evenly between the containers. Each container gets a healthy pinch of the carrots and 1 of the ramekins of the vinaigrette.
  4. To eat, pour the vinaigrette over the top of the dish, season lightly with salt and pepper, replace the lid on the container and shake up the ingredients to coat with the vinaigrette.

Salsa Verde Beef Bowls

These Salsa Verde Beef Bowls are made up of ground beef, red onions, poblano peppers, cabbage, cilantro lime rice and salsa verde to pour over the top. This is a quick and easy recipe that can be finished in under an hour.

CourseCuisineTime - 45 minutes
Main Coursemeal prep, MexicanPrep - 10 minutes
Cook - 35 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
540kcal5 servings
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates39g37%
Fat24g22%
Protein42g40%

Ingredients:

For the Rice

  • 3 cups (450 g) cooked rice
  • 2 tbsp (30 g) lime juice
  • cup (20 g) chopped cilantro
  • salt to taste

For the Beef and Vegetables

  • 2 lbs (908 g) ground beef (90/10)
  • 2 (150 g) poblano peppers green bell pepper is fine too
  • 1 medium (200 g) red onion
  • 1 small (227 g) green cabbage alternatively you can buy 8oz of preshredded cabbage in a bag
  • 2 tbsp (30 g) oil
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) minced garlic
  • 1 tsp (3 g) cumin
  • 1 tsp (3 g) chili powder
  • 1 tsp (3 g) smoked paprika
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) lime juice
  • salt and pepper to taste
  • 1 cups (300 g) salsa verde pick out your favorite jar from the store
  • 1 jalapeo optional for garnish

Instructions:

For the Rice

  1. Make enough rice to yield3cups of cooked rice. 1 cup of dry rice will make between 2-3 cups of cooked rice depending on what type of rice you use.
  2. Once the rice has finished, add 3 cups of rice to a bowl and mix in 2 tbsp of lime juice and cup chopped cilantro.

For the Beef and Vegetables

  1. While the rice is cooking, prepare your beef and vegetables. For the nutritional estimates provided, I have included 2 tbsp of oil to use in the cooking process. Use that amount as needed in the cooking of the beef and vegetables.
  2. In a large skillet over medium high heat, add about a tsp of the oil and cook the beef until it has browned. The beef should have enough fat that you won't need to use a ton of oil.
  3. While the beef is browning, wash and cut all of your vegetables.
  4. Cut the red onion into thin slices, the peppers into a medium dice, and shred the cabbage by cutting into thin slices. Mince up 1 tbsp worth of garlic. Chop the cilantro into small pieces for the cilantro lime rice once the rice has finished.
  5. Once the beef is finished browning, remove it from the skillet (or use a separate skillet) and add 1 tbsp of oil over medium heat. Toast the cumin, chili powder, and smoked paprika in the oil for about 30 seconds and then raise the temperature to medium high and add in the onions and peppers to cook. Add more oil if needed.
  6. Allow the onions and peppers to cook and brown for 4-5 minutes then add it the shredded cabbage and continue cooking until it has softened, around 3-5 minutes. Season lightly with salt and pepper.
  7. Once the vegetables have softened, add back the beef to the pan as well as the cilantro lime rice and squeeze about 1 tbsp of lime juice over the top. Mix everything until well incorporated.
  8. Taste test and adjust flavors with salt, pepper, and extra lime juice as necessary.

For the Salsa Verde

  1. Shake up your jar of salsa and divide it into 5 smaller containers of cup each.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide the contents of the pan evenly between your 5 containers and add a small container of salsa to each.

Breakfast Burritos

Freezer Friendly Breakfast Burritos made of turkey sausage, eggs, peppers, onion, spinach, and cheese. These can be prepped in advanced and stored into the freezer to give you breakfast each morning in about a minute.

CourseCuisineTime - 1 hour 10 minutes
BreakfastAmerican, meal prepPrep - 30 minutes
Cook - 40 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
349kcal17 burritos
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates39g56%
Fat14g20%
Protein16g23%

Ingredients:

For the Turkey Sausage

  • 1 lb (454 g) ground turkey 93/7
  • 1 tbsp (12 g) brown sugar
  • 1 tsp (6 g) salt
  • 1 tsp (3 g) pepper
  • 1 tsp (3 g) cayenne pepper
  • 1 tsp (3 g) smoked paprika
  • 1 tsp (3 g) onion powder
  • 1 tsp (3 g) garlic powder
  • 1 tsp (1 g) oregano
  • 1 tsp (2 g) rubbed sage
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) oil

For the Burrito Filling

  • 8 large (560 g) eggs
  • 2 tbsp (30 g) milk
  • 1 medium (150 g) green pepper
  • 1 medium (150 g) red pepper
  • 1 medium (200 g) sweet onion
  • 5 oz (140 g) spinach
  • 2 cups (170 g) frozen shredded hash browns
  • 2 tbsp (30 g) oil
  • 1 cup (120 g) shredded cheese
  • 17 9 inch flour tortillas

Instructions:

For the Turkey Sausage

  1. In a large bowl add the turkey and all of the seasonings and brown sugar. Mix thoroughly to incorporate into the meat.
  2. In a large skillet over medium high heat, add 1 tbsp of oil and add in the turkey. Brown it on both sides and cook it until no pink color remains.
  3. Break up the sausage into small pieces and set aside until you are ready for it later.

For the Burrito Filling

  1. While the turkey is cooking, wash and prep all of your vegetables.
  2. Cut the peppers and onion into a small dice and roughly chop the spinach into smaller pieces. Measure out 2 cups of frozen shredded hash browns.
  3. In a large skillet over medium high heat add 1 tbsp of oil and add in the peppers and onions. Allow them to cook down and soften. Season lightly with salt early to help encourage some of the water to be released faster.
  4. Once the onions have begun to turn translucent, add in the hash browns and spinach. Stir to combine and wilt the spinach.
  5. Crack 8 eggs into a bowl, add in 2 tbsp of milk and beat until they are smooth.
  6. You can cook the eggs in the same skillet or in a separate one at the same time as the vegetables cook. If you use the same skillet, create some room in the center to cook the eggs.
  7. Add in 1 tbsp of oil and pour the eggs into the center to make scrambled eggs. Cook them for a few minutes until they have finished.
  8. Once done, remove from the heat and stir in the sausage. Mix and give it a taste test. Adjust flavor with salt and pepper as necessary.
  9. Allow the mixture to cool before you construct the burritos, put it in the fridge for a few minutes if necessary.

Constructing the Burritos

  1. I made 17 burritos out of this recipe using 9 inch tortillas. You may yield more or less.
  2. Measure out 1 cup (120g) of shredded cheese.
  3. Lay out some tortillas on your work space and place a couple of large spoonfuls of the filling on top of each. I used about 70-80g of filling for each burrito.
  4. Add about 1 tbsp of shredded cheese to the top of the filling and roll the burrito up by folding in the sides first, then rolling the center over the top. Repeat until all of your filling is used up.
  5. If you are going to vacuum seal these, place the burritos onto a sheet pan or in a baking dish as you finish them. Flash freeze the burritos by placing them into your freezer, uncovered, for a few hours until they are frozen solid. If you don't plan on vacuum sealing you can just roll them in foil or place them in a zip top bag.
  6. Once the burritos have frozen solid, place them into your vacuum bags and remove the air. Store in your freezer.

Reheating

  1. To reheat, I recommend wrapping the burrito inside of a damp paper towel and microwaving for 60-75 seconds or until it is hot in the center.

HamBULKer Helper

This HamBULKer Helper is a weight gain friendly meal prep with over 1,000 calories per dish to help you easily get in the energy you need to grow muscle. A combination of pasta, beef, potatoes and cheese make up the bulk of the calories but this meal still includes a decent serving of vegetables too.

CourseCuisineTime - 1 hour
Main DishAmerican, meal prepPrep - 30 minutes
Cook - 30 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
1000kcal5 servings
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates94g47%
Fat42g21%
Protein62g31%

Ingredients:

  • 2 lbs (908 g) ground beef 85/15
  • 1 medium (200 g) onion
  • 4 medium (227 g) carrots
  • 4 stalks (112 g) celery
  • 3 medium (500 g) potatoes
  • 12 oz (340 g) elbow pasta gluten free if needed
  • 14.5 oz (411 g) petite diced tomatoes canned
  • 6 oz (170 g) spinach
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) minced garlic
  • 2 cups (480 g) 2% milk
  • 3 cups (720 g) chicken broth
  • 1 cup (112 g) shredded cheddar cheese
  • cup (60 g) grated parmesan cheese
  • cup (68 g) ketchup
  • 1 tbsp (3 g) dried basil
  • 1 tsbp (6 g) paprika
  • salt and pepper to taste

Instructions:

For the Beef

  1. In a large stock pot over medium high heat, add the beef and allow it to brown and the fat to render off.
  2. Once browned, remove it from the pot, keeping all of the fat that was rendered off inside the pot. This will be used to cook the vegetables.

For the Vegetables

  1. While the beef is cooking, wash and cut the onion, carrots, and celery into a small dice of roughly the same size. Grate the garlic. Cut the potatoes into a medium dice of about " cubes. Roughly chop the spinach into smaller pieces.
  2. Once the beef has finished and only the fat remains left in the pot, add in the onions, carrots, celery, and garlic. Season lightly with salt to encourage the water to come out quicker. Allow this to brown and soften for 8-10 minutes.
  3. Once the vegetables have softened, season with 1 each of dried basil and paprika.
  4. Add in the potatoes, 2 cups of milk, 3 cups of chicken broth, 1 can of petite diced tomatoes, the beef and 12oz of elbow pasta.
  5. Bring this mixture to a light boil, stirring occasionally then reduce the heat to low, cover, and cook for 10-15 minutes or until the potatoes have softened and the noodles have finished.
  6. Test the potatoes for doneness by sticking a fork into them. Once they have softened, add in 1 cup of shredded cheddar cheese, cup of grated parmesan cheese, cup of ketchup, and all of the spinach you chopped earlier.
  7. Mix well to incorporate the cheeses and wilt the spinach. Taste test, season with salt and pepper to adjust flavor as needed.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide the mixture of the pot evenly 5 ways.

Orange Creamsicle Baked Oatmeal

Orange Creamsicle Baked Oatmeal. Inspired by one of my favorite summer snacks, this baked oatmeal combines oranges and cream cheese inside a baked oatmeal. There are even some carrots snuck in for some hidden vegetables.

CourseCuisineTime - 55 minutes
BreakfastAmerican, meal prepPrep - 15 minutes
Cook - 40 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
382kcal6
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates49g61%
Fat12g15%
Protein19g23%

Ingredients:

  • 3 cups (240 g) old fashioned oats
  • 2 scoops (60 g) vanilla protein powder
  • 1 tsp (4 g) baking powder
  • 20 oz (300 g) canned mandarin oranges fresh can work as well
  • 1 tbsp (8 g) orange zest
  • 2 medium (150 g) carrots
  • 1 tbsp (14 g) butter
  • 10 tbsp (150 g) liquid egg whites or 2 eggs
  • 1 cups (240 g) 2% milk
  • 1 cup (240 g) orange juice
  • 4 oz (113 g) plain cream cheese
  • 2 tbsp (20 g) sugar
  • 1 tsp (4 g) vanilla

Instructions:

For the Baked Oatmeal

  1. Preheat your oven to 375F.
  2. Wash and grate your carrots into fine pieces using a box grater or a microplane.
  3. Wash one orange and zest it until you have 1 tbsp or 8g of orange zest.
  4. Canned Mandarin Oranges work best for this recipe because they are already peeled. Use two 10oz cans and drain away any of the syrup. I had 300g worth once I did this.
  5. You can also use regular mandarin oranges but they have a "skin" on the outside of each piece that makes them a bit tough. Peel all of your oranges and remove as much of the stringy bits as possbile. Separate the pieces. Removing the translucent "skin" on the outside of each orange piece will give you a softer bite as this can get chewy when baked. Cutting it off with the peel by using a knife is the fastest way to do it.
  6. In a large bowl, mix together the oats, protein powder, and baking powder.
  7. Add in the egg whites, milk, orange juice, 1 tbsp of melted butter, carrots, zest, and orange slices.
  8. Spray a 13"x9" pan with oil and add the oat mixture. You can also line this with parchment for easier clean up.
  9. Mix together the cream cheese, vanilla, and sugar. You can microwave it for a bit to help it soften. Put a few spoonfuls of the cream cheese around your pan and swirl it around as best as you can.
  10. Bake for 35-45 minutes.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 6 servings. Cut the oatmeal into 6 equal pieces.

Velveted Chicken for Stir Fry

This is how I batch prep chicken to store in Snack City in my freezer to use in stir fry's. It drastically cuts down on the time it takes to prep dinner each night and is super easy to pull out of the freezer and throw into a wok.

CourseCuisineTime - 55 minutes 10 minutes 5 minutes 10 minutes
Main Dishmeal prepPrep - 45 minutes 10 minutes 5 minutes 2 minutes
Cook - 10 minutes 0 minutes 8 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
495kcal14 servings
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates62g54%
Fat8g7%
Protein43g38%

Ingredients:

  • 1 cups (360 g) chicken stock
  • cup (120 g) soy sauce I use low sodium
  • 3 tbsp (48 g) oyster sauce
  • 2 tbsp (35 g) mirin
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) water
  • 2 tbsp (16 g) cornstarch

For the Stir Fry

  • 120 g velveted chicken
  • 35 g sweet onion
  • 10 g ginger
  • 15 g garlic
  • 35 g red pepper
  • 35 g green pepper
  • 100 g cabbage
  • 75 g zucchini
  • 5 g oil
  • 10 g gochujang
  • 4 g gochugaru
  • 50 g brown stir fry sauce
  • 100 g cooked rice
  • 30 g pickled carrots
  • 30 g cucumber
  • 5 g green onion

Instructions:

For the Chicken

  1. Place your chicken into the freezer for about an hour before you start to prep. This will make it easier to cut and handle.
  2. Cut the chicken into thin slices of about "-" in thickness. Place into a large bowl.
  3. Into the bowl, add the egg whites, soy sauce, and cornstarch. Mix well until everything has been well incorprated. Store in the fridge for 30 minutes to give it time to marinate.
  4. Heat a large pot of water on the stove and bring it to a light boil. If you are doing the full 5 pounds of chicken you will likely want to cook this in batches so it doesn't cool down the water too much when you drop it in.
  5. Add the chicken to the boiling water and cook it for about 2-3 minutes or just until it is cooked all of the way through and no longer pink in the center. It won't take long since it has been cut so thin.
  6. Remove from the water using a spider or a colander and place on a large sheet pan to dry.
  7. Repeat this process until all of your chicken has been cooked.
  8. You can use a paper towel to help soak up any excess liquid on the sheet pan or on the chicken to help dry it out.
  9. Once the chicken has cooled a bit, place the sheet pan uncovered into your freezer for a couple of hours until the chicken has frozen solid.
  10. Freezing uncovered, in a singler layer is how we flash freeze in a home kitchen. This helps ensure that the food has a chance to freeze as individual pieces instead of in one big clump. It is a requirement for if you are going to vacuum seal this, which you should.
  11. Once the chicken has frozen solid, remove it from the freezer, break up the pieces, and transfer to a zip top bag. I use the Zwilling Fresh & Save Vacuum Bags.
  12. Take out all of the air, and store them in your freezer for later use.

For the Carrots

  1. Wash and peel the outer layer of your carrots.
  2. Using a vegetable peeler, go down the length of the carrot to create ribbons.
  3. For the brine, mix together the water, vinegar, salt, and sugar. Stir to combine and pour over top of the carrots in a glass jar. If you don't have enough to cover the carrots, you can just add more water and vinegar in equal parts.

For the Sauce

  1. Mix all of the ingredients together and store in a glass jar in the fridge. It will last for a couple of weeks. Shake it up prior to use.

For the Stir Fry

  1. Heat a large wok over high heat. Add in some oil.
  2. Add the vegetables to the wok, with the aromatics on the bottom so they can develop color first.
  3. Once the vegetables are about 50% of the way cooked, add in the frozen chicken and allow it to cook for a 1-2 minutes.
  4. Add in the gochujang and gochugaru, stir until everything has a been coated.
  5. Make a well in the center of the wok and pour in the brown sauce. Once it starts to bubble and thicken, add in the rice. Stir to mix and allow it to heat up.
  6. Transfer the contents of the wok to a bowl, top with pickled carrots, cucumber, and green onions.

Chicken Meatballs

Chicken meatballs made from ground chicken, seasonings, and oats instead of breadcrumbs. These meatballs are the perfect addition to Snack City in your freezer. They can be eaten plain, sauced, or used to add in meals. They have been my favorite resident of Snack City lately.

CourseCuisineTime - 1 hour 10 minutes
SnackAmerican, meal prepPrep - 30 minutes
Cook - 40 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
36kcal83 meatballs
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates0.6g10%
Fat1.2g20%
Protein5.6g93%

Ingredients:

  • 5 lbs (2270 g) ground chicken i used 96% lean. You can make this in a food processor if needed
  • 1 cup (80 g) rolled oats
  • 2 (100 g) eggs beaten
  • 1 tbsp (12 g) garlic powder
  • 1 tbsp (12 g) onion powder
  • 1 tsp (10 g) salt
  • 2 tsp (8 g) pepper
  • oil spray

Instructions:

**For the Meatballs **

  1. Preheat your oven to 400F.
  2. If you need grind your chicken, do so. I make ground chicken by placing boneless skinless chicken thighs into the food processor until it resembles ground meat. I do a bunch at once and freeze the excess.
  3. In a large bowl, add your ground chicken, rolled oats, eggs, onion powder, garlic powder, salt, and pepper. Mix it together until everything is fully incorporated.
  4. Line a few large baking sheets with foil in preparation for the meatballs. It may help to spray lightly with oil.
