  5. Using a cookie scoop, create meatballs and spread out on to your sheet pans. Space them out evenly with some room between each so that they will brown more easily.
  6. Once you have all of the meatballs created, form them into a tighter ball by tossing each meatball between your hands a few times. It will help to spray your hands with a bit of oil to keep the chicken from sticking.
  7. Roast your meatballs in the oven for 17-20 minutes.
  8. Doing one sheet pan at a time will lead to better browning. If you try to place a pan onto each rack, the one on the top rack will struggle to get brown due to the steam being released from the bottom pan. They will still taste awesome and I do two at once for speed but just be aware that you will sacrifice some browning. When the meatballs are finished, remove from the oven and allow to cool.
  9. Once all of your meatballs have been cooled, transfer them to one single sheet pan and move to your freezer to flash freeze. This just means that you freeze them, uncovered in a single layer, so that they have a chance to freeze individually.
  10. Once they have frozen solid, transfer them over into a ziplock bag, remove all of the air and move them into Snack City in your freezer.
  11. I made 83 meatballs out of this recipe. The nutrition information you see here is for 83 meatballs. If you end up having more or less than that, your nutrition information will be slightly different. Use the table below this recipe to enter how many meatballs you made for the better nutritional estimate.

Serving

  1. To reheat these, I air fry them at 400F for about 5 minutes or until they are hot. You can also microwave them.
  2. I eat them with some ketchup, cover them in buffalo sauce, or incorporate them in a regular meal.

Ground Chicken Taco Bowls

Ground Chicken Taco Bowls paired with shredded cabbage, rice, and a side of salsa roja. This is a flavorful and filling dish for under 500 calories.

CourseCuisineTime - 35 minutes
Main Dishmeal prep, MexicanPrep - 10 minutes
Cook - 25 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
481kcal5 servings
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates47g46%
Fat14g13%
Protein41g40%

Ingredients:

For the Meat

  • 2 lbs (908 g) ground chicken (95/5) I put boneless skinless chicken thighs in the food processor
  • cup (180 g) tomato sauce
  • 1 tsp (3 g) paprika
  • 1 tsp (3 g) garlic powder
  • 1 tsp (3 g) chili powder
  • 1 tsp (3 g) cumin
  • tbsp (8 g) oil
  • Salt and pepper to taste

For the Cabbage

  • 12 oz (563 g) shredded cabbage You can buy these pre shredded as coleslaw or salad mix
  • tbsp (7 g) oil
  • 1 tsp (3 g) garlic powder
  • Salt and pepper to taste

For the Rice

  • 3 cups (563 g) cooked rice
  • tbsp (8 g) oil
  • 1 tbsp (8 g) chili powder
  • 1 tsp (3 g) paprika
  • 1 (60 g) Roma tomato diced

For the Salsa Roja

  • 4 (240 g) Roma tomatoes
  • 1 small (100 g) white onion
  • 2 (60 g) jalapeos
  • 5 cloves (25 g) garlic
  • tbsp (7 g) oil
  • bunch (20 g) cilantro
  • 2 Tbsp (30 g) lime juice
  • Salt to taste

Instructions:

For the Rice

  1. Prepare enough rice to have 3 cups of cooked rice. 1 cup of dry rice will yield between 2-3 cups of cooked rice depending on what kind you use.
  2. Dice 1 Roma tomato and remove the seeds.
  3. Once the rice has finished, measure out 3 cups and add in the oil, chili powder, paprika, diced Roma tomato, and salt to taste.

For the Salsa Roja

  1. You can either boil, roast, or air fry this. I use the air fryer. Preheat the air fryer to 400F.
  2. Wash your tomatoes, jalapeos, and cilantro. Cut the stems off the jalapeos and cut your onion in half. Peel your garlic cloves.
  3. Add the halved onion, jalapeo peppers, tomatoes, and garlic to a large bowl and drizzle over tbsp of oil and salt to your liking. Toss to coat. The tomatoes have finished cooking when they begin to change color and the skin starts to break.
  4. Air fry for 8-10 minutes, turning every few minutes until the tomatoes and onions have softened and developed color.
  5. Add the tomatoes, onions, garlic, jalapeos, bunch of cilantro, and the juice of 1 lime to a blender or food processor Blend until smooth.
  6. Add salt to taste. Adjust flavor with salt and lime juice as needed.
  7. Portion out into smaller, separate cups for the meals. You will probably have extra.

For the Shredded Cabbage

  1. Heat tbsp of olive oil over medium high heat. Add in the shredded cabbage and cook for 4-5 minutes. Season with 1 tsp garlic powder and salt and pepper to taste.
  2. You can drizzle in a bit of water to create steam and help them cook faster. Once finished, set aside until you are ready to plate.

For the Taco Meat

  1. Heat tbsp of oil over medium high heat and add in your ground chicken. Allow it to brown and cook.
  2. Once the chicken is about 90% of the way cooked, add cup of tomato sauce, 1 tsp paprika, 1 tsp chili powder, 1 tsp cumin, 1 tsp garlic powder, and salt and pepper to taste. Stir to combine and cook for an additional few minutes to cook out the tomato sauce. Taste test and adjust flavors as needed.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide your chicken, cabbage, and rice evenly between the containers. Each meal gets 1 of your salsa cups as well.

PB and J Baked Oatmeal

PB and J Baked Oatmeal made from a homemade strawberry jelly and peanut butter combined inside of an oatmeal and egg bake. A great breakfast or bedtime snack with a decent dose of protein.

CourseCuisineTime - 1 hour 10 minutes
BreakfastAmerican, meal prepPrep - 10 minutes
Cook - 1 hour

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
376kcal6 servings
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates45g56%
Fat12g15%
Protein22g27%

Ingredients:

  • 3 cups (240 g) old fashioned oats
  • 2 scoops (60 g) vanilla protein powder
  • 1 tsp (4 g) baking powder
  • 3 tbsp (48 g) peanut butter
  • 2 tbsp (42 g) maple syrup
  • 10 tbsp (150 g) liquid egg whites or 2 eggs
  • 2 cups (480 g) milk

For the Strawberry Jelly

  • 1 lb (454 g) frozen strawberries
  • 1 tsp (6 g) splenda or 5-6x sugar/maple syrup
  • 2 tsp (8 g) pectin optional but recommended

For the Peanut Butter Drizzle

  • 2 tbsp (32 g) peanut butter

Instructions:

For the Strawberry Jelly

  1. I usually make a double or triple batch of this and keep it in the fridge for use in other things as well. If you want to give it time to set up a bit you should make it the night before but that isn't required if you are just using it for this baked oatmeal. If you have this prepped in your fridge you can prep this baked oatmeal in 5 minutes.
  2. In a large pot over medium heat, add in your frozen strawberries and allow them to cook down. As they begin to thaw, break them up with a spatula to help them cook faster.
  3. Sprinkle the splenda over the top and bring to a light boil. You can use real sugar or maple syrup if you wish, you will just need to use more of it. Allow it to lightly boil, stirring often so it doesn't stick to the bottom.
  4. After a few minutes, add in the pectin and continue mixing. The pectin is what helps to make it into a jelly. You don't need to add the pectin for use in the baked oatmeal but if you want to use it for a jelly with other things, you should add it.
  5. After it has been lightly boiling for 10-15 minutes you can pull it off the heat and transfer to a storage container. Place it in the fridge to cool as you prep the other ingredients.

For the Baked Oatmeal

  1. Preheat your oven to 350F.
  2. In a large bowl, mix together the oats, protein powder, and baking powder.
  3. Add in the egg whites, milk, syrup, and 3 tbsp of peanut butter. Stir to combine.
  4. Spray a 13"x9" pan with oil and add the oat mixture.
  5. Spoon the jelly over the top and swirl it into the oat mixture using a butter knife.
  6. Bake for 35-40 minutes.

For the Peanut Butter Drizzle

  1. Melt 2 tbsp of peanut butter in the microwave for few seconds until melted.
  2. Add to a small ziplock bag and cut a small hole in the corner. Pipe the peanut butter over the top of the finished baked oatmeal.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 6 servings. Cut the oatmeal into 6 equal pieces.

Firecracker Beef & Brussels

Firecracker Beef & Brussels sprouts served with a side of rice. The firecracker sauce is made using combination of red pepper flakes, hot sauce and honey for a spicy, sweet, and flavor packed bite.

CourseCuisineTime - 40 minutes
Main DishAmerican, meal prepPrep - 15 minutes
Cook - 25 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
620kcal5 servings
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates63g49%
Fat21g16%
Protein44g34%

Ingredients:

For the Rice

  • 3 cups (563 g) cooked rice

For the Beef and Brussels

  • 2 lbs (908 g) ground beef 90/10
  • 1 lb (454 g) Brussels sprouts
  • medium (100 g) onion
  • 2 medium (200 g) poblano peppers
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) minced garlic
  • 1 tbsp (6 g) red pepper flakes
  • 4 stalks (20 g) green onions optional for garnish
  • 1 lime optional for garnish
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) oil

For the Sauce

  • cup (60 g) hot sauce I use Frank's Red Hot
  • 1 tbsp (20 g) apple cider vinegar
  • 5 tbsp (84 g) honey
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) cornstarch
  • water to thin if necessary

Instructions:

For the Rice

  1. Make enough rice to yield3 cups of cooked rice. 1 cup of dry rice will make between 2-3 cups of cooked rice depending on what type of rice you use.

For the Beef & Brussels

  1. Wash and cut all of your vegetables first.
  2. Cut the stems off of your Brussels sprouts and remove any of the damaged outer layers. Cut them in half.
  3. Cut the onion, green onions, and peppers into a small dice. Mince your garlic if you're using fresh.
  4. Place the Brussels sprout halves into a large bowl and drizzle over tbsp of oil. Season with salt and pepper to your liking.
  5. Preheat your air fryer to 400F.
  6. Place the Brussels sprouts into the air fryer basket and air fry for 5-8 minutes or until they have browned and softened. Watch them closely so they don't burn. If you don't have an air fryer you could cook them in the oven.
  7. In a large skillet over medium high heat, add tbsp of oil and add the onions, peppers, and 1 of red pepper flakes. Cook for 3-5 minutes to brown and soften. Add in the garlic.
  8. Move the onions and peppers to the perimeter of the skillet and add in your beef. Season with salt and pepper. Allow the beef to brown.
  9. When the beef is cooking, prepare your sauce. Mix the honey, hot sauce, vinegar, and cornstarch together. Stir well to incorporate the cornstarch so it doesn't clump up.
  10. When the beef is about 90% of the way cooked, add in the Brussels sprouts, pour in the sauce and mix into the beef allowing it to thicken. Stir to combine. If you feel that your sauce is too thick, you can drizzle in some water to thin it out.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide your ingredients evenly into your 5 containers. Each dish gets (112g) cup of cooked rice.
  2. Top each dish with green onions and a lime wedge if you wish. I like to squeeze lime juice over the dish after reheating.

Creamy White Enchilada Chicken & Potatoes

Creamy White Enchilada Chicken with green chilies, vegetables, cheese over the top, and served with a side of potatoes. This dish is a meal prepped version of the midwestern classic Creamy White Chicken Enchiladas that everyone's mom used to make.

CourseCuisineTime - 1 hour 30 minutes
Main DishAmerican, meal prepPrep - 30 minutes
Cook - 1 hour

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
500kcal6 servings
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates44g42%
Fat17g16%
Protein42g40%

Ingredients:

For the Chicken and Vegetable Bake

  • 2 lbs (908 g) boneless skinless chicken breasts
  • salt and pepper to taste
  • medium (100 g) onion
  • 1 medium (150 g) green pepper
  • 1 medium (150 g) red pepper
  • lb (227 g) mushrooms
  • 2 medium (120 g) Roma tomatoes
  • tbsp (8 g) oil
  • salt and pepper to taste
  • cup (84 g) shredded cheese monterrey jack or cheddar
  • 3 tbsp chopped cilantro optional for garnish

For the Sauce

  • 2 tbsp (28 g) butter
  • cup (28 g) flour gluten free if needed
  • 1 cups (360 g) chicken broth
  • cup (120 g) milk i used 2%
  • cup (120 g) plain nonfat Greek yogurt
  • 1 tsp (3 g) onion powder
  • 1 tsp (3 g) garlic powder
  • 8 oz (226 g) canned green chilies
  • salt to taste

For the Potatoes

  • 4 medium (1000 g) russet potatoes
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) oil
  • salt and pepper to taste

Instructions:

  1. Please read through the entire instructions before you begin so you can feel the flow of how this recipe will go and see what you can cook simultaneously. This will save you time.

For the Sauce Part 1

  1. We are going to start by making the sauce as it needs to cool a bit before we finish it later on in the cooking process.
  2. In a medium sized pot or skillet, melt 2 tbsp of butter over medium heat.
  3. Add in the flour and stir together with the butter to form a roux. Mix until completely incorporated.
  4. Slowly drizzle in the chicken broth while constantly stirring and allow to thicken.
  5. Mix in 1 tsp of onion and garlic powder until dissolved. Allow the mixture to come to a light boil and thicken until it resembles a gravy like consistency.
  6. Remove from the heat and allow it to cool. Put it in the fridge to speed up the process.

For the Chicken

  1. Start a large pot of water over high heat. Add in the chicken and boil for 15-20 minutes or until cooked.
  2. You can also use a crockpot to cook this if you start it far enough in advance.
  3. Once the chicken has finished cooking, shred it with two forks in a large bowl (or use a hand mixer). You can do this while your vegetables or sauce is cooking. Season the chicken lightly with salt and pepper.

For the Vegetables

  1. Wash and cut all of your vegetables. Cut the onion, peppers, and tomatoes into a small dice. Cut the mushrooms into thin slices. Cut the potatoes into a large dice.
  2. Add the potatoes to a large bowl and drizzle in 1 tbsp of oil and salt and pepper to your liking. Toss the potatoes to coat.
  3. Cook the potatoes in an air fryer at 400F for 20-25 minutes, shaking the basket a few times during the process. Once they have browned to your liking, they are done, reserve them off to the side until later. If you have a small air fryer it may require you to cook in two batches and it may not take as long each round.
  4. If you don't have an air fryer you can spread the potatoes on a large sheet pan and roast at 450F for 15-20 minutes, flipping just over half way through.
  5. In a large skillet over medium high heat, add tbsp of oil and add in your vegetables, minus the tomatoes. Saut until they have lightly browned and softened. This will likely take between 5-8 minutes. Season with salt and pepper.
  6. Once the vegetables have finished cooking, reserve them off to the side.

For the Sauce Part 2

  1. Once your sauce has cooled toward room temperature, place it back over medium heat and slowly stir in the milk and greek yogurt. We need to bring these up to temperature together otherwise we risk the milk curdling and becoming grainy.
  2. Add in the green chilies and season with salt to taste.

For the Chicken Bake

  1. Turn your oven to the broil setting.
  2. In the large bowl with your shredded chicken, add the vegetables, tomatoes, and pour the sauce over the top. Stir to incorporate.
  3. Place the mixture in a large casserole dish (13"x9") and top with cup of shredded cheese.
  4. Place the dish underneath the broiler in the oven for 5-10 minutes to brown the cheese. Once the cheese has browned, pull it out of the oven. Make sure you watch it closely as it is prone to burning underneath the broiler.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 6 servings. Divide the potatoes evenly between your containers. Cut the chicken in the casserole dish into 6 pieces and add one piece to each container. Garnish with chopped cilantro if you wish.

Deconstructed Big Mac Bowls

Deconstructed Big Mac Bowls, a meal prep version of the fast food classic. Ground beef, potatoes, cabbage and a calorie friendly mac sauce to top it all off.

CourseCuisineTime - 35 minutes
Main DishAmerican, meal prepPrep - 10 minutes
Cook - 25 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
541kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates35g33%
Fat25g24%
Protein44g42%

Ingredients:

For the Hamburger and Cabbage

  • 2 lbs (908 g) ground beef (93/7)
  • medium (100 g) onion
  • 12 oz (340 g) shredded cabbage
  • 1 Tbsp (15 g) olive oil
  • 1 tsp (4 g) garlic powder
  • 15 (50 g) dill pickle chips optional
  • Salt and pepper to taste
  • cup (25 g) shredded cheese

For the Potatoes

  • 4 medium (750 g) russet potatoes
  • 1 Tbsp (15 g) olive oil
  • Salt and pepper

For the Mac Sauce

  • cup (75 g) plain non fat Greek yogurt
  • 2 tbsp (28 g) mayonnaise
  • 1 tbsp (12 g) ketchup
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) sweet relish
  • tsp (2 g) vinegar
  • tsp (2 g) onion powder
  • salt to taste

Instructions:

For the Potatoes

  1. Preheat your oven to 450F.
  2. Wash each of your potatoes thoroughly. Cut them into a medium sized dice.
  3. Add the potatoes to a large bowl and drizzle 1 Tbsp of olive oil over the potatoes. Sprinkle with salt and pepper to your liking. Toss the potatoes to coat and spread onto a sheet pan.
  4. Roast for 10-12 minutes and then toss them around and cook an additional 10-12 minutes or until desired doneness is achieved.

For the Beef

  1. Cut your onion into a small dice.
  2. Heat a large skillet over medium high heat. Add 2 tsp of oil and your diced onion. Cook the onion until it has developed a good amount of browning. We want to bring out the natural sweetness so take it past the point where it is translucent and it has a deep brown color. Adding a bit of water can help speed up this process.
  3. Once the onion has browned, make room in the center of your skillet and add your ground beef. Use a bit more oil if necessary.
  4. Cook the beef until it has browned and season with salt and pepper to taste.

For the Cabbage

  1. Heat 1 tsp of oil over medium heat. Add in the cabbage, 1 tsp garlic powder, and salt to taste.
  2. Cook for about 3-4 minutes. You can add a bit of water to create steam and help it cook faster.

For the Mac Sauce

  1. Add all of the ingredients to a bowl and stir to mix. Divide the sauce into small., separate containers to store.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide your hamburger, potatoes, and cabbage evenly between your 5 containers. Top the hamburger with a bit of shredded cheese and a few pickle chips. Each container gets 1 ramekin of the mac sauce.

Honey Miso Noodles

Honey Miso Noodles made with chicken thighs, vegetables, and a sauce from red miso paste, soy sauce, honey, and chicken broth. These noodles are have a nice balance of savory and sweet from the umami in the miso paste and sweetness from the honey.

CourseCuisineTime - 45 minutes
Main DishAsian, meal prepPrep - 15 minutes
Cook - 30 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
565kcal6 servings
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates66g55%
Fat17g14%
Protein36g30%

Ingredients:

For the Sauce

  • 3 tbsp (60 g) honey
  • 2 tbsp (30 g) soy sauce gluten free if needed
  • 3 tbsp (45 g) red miso paste
  • cup (60 g) chicken broth
  • 1 tbsp (23 g) rice vinegar

For the Chicken and Noodles

  • 12 oz (336 g) lo mein noodles spaghetti noodles work too, gluten free if needed
  • 1 medium (200 g) sweet onion
  • 5 medium (300 g) carrots
  • 2 medium (300 g) zucchini
  • 3 (15 g) green onions
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) minced garlic
  • 2 lbs (1135 g) boneless skinless chicken thighs
  • 1 tsp (3 g) garlic powder
  • 1 tbsp (23 g) olive oil
  • 1 tbsp (6 g) sesame seeds optional for garnish
  • salt and pepper to taste

Instructions:

  1. To make the best use of your time, read through the entire recipe before you start and cook things like the noodles and chicken simultaneously to make things move faster.

For the Sauce

  1. Combine the honey, soy sauce, miso paste, rice vinegar, and chicken broth together. Stir to combine and dissolve the miso paste.

For the Chicken

  1. Preheat your oven to 425F.
  2. In a large bowl, add your chicken and season lightly with salt and pepper. Add in 1 tsp of garlic powder, 1 tsp of oil, and 1/4 of the sauce mixture you just made. Toss it around to evenly distribute.
  3. Place the chicken onto a large sheet pan smooth side down. Bake for 8-10 minutes on the top rack.
  4. After 10 minutes, turn the oven to broil and cook for 4-5 minutes to encourage the chicken to brown. Watch it carefully as it will be prone to burning under the broiler. Sometimes it helps to leave the oven door cracked open a bit.
  5. Once the chicken has browned and developed some color, pull it out of the oven and allow it to rest for at least 10 minutes. Temp it and make sure it is at 165F to ensure it is done.
  6. Cut the chicken into small bite sized pieces.

For the Noodles

  1. In a large bowl, add the noodles, chicken, vegetables, and the remaining sauce you made. Stir to combine and season with salt and pepper to taste.

For the Vegetables

  1. Wash and cut all of your vegetables. Cut the onion into thin slices and the zucchini into a julienne (thin strips). Using a vegetable peeler, go down the length of the carrot to create thin ribbons. Rougly chop the ribbons in smaller pieces with a knife. (You can use the matchstick carrots from the store to save time)
  2. In a large skillet add a bit of oil over medium high heat. Add in the onions and season lightly with salt. Cook for a couple of minutes until they have begun to brown.
  3. Make room in the center of the pan and add more oil if needed. Add the zucchini and allow it to cook down and brown a bit.
  4. Make room in the center of the pan again and add the carrots and garlic. Cook for a couple of more minutes to soften up the vegetables a bit.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 6 servings. Divide your ingredients evenly into 6 containers. Top each dish with chopped green onions and sesame seeds.

Thai Coconut Chicken Red Curry

This Thai Coconut Chicken Red Curry is made using red Thai curry paste, coconut milk, chicken thighs and a mixture of different root vegetables. Served with a side of rice and a lime wedge, this meal has loads of flavor and reheats extremely well in the microwave.

CourseCuisineTime - 50 minutes
Main DishAsian, meal prepPrep - 10 minutes
Cook - 40 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
601kcal6 servings
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates57g47%
Fat24g20%
Protein38g31%

Ingredients:

  • 2 lbs (1135 g) boneless skinless chicken thighs
  • 1 medium (150 g) green pepper
  • 1 bunch (100 g) green onions
  • 3 medium (200 g) carrots
  • 2 medium (400 g) russet potatoes
  • cup (60 g) red Thai curry paste
  • 1 can (400 g) light coconut milk
  • 1 tbsp (8 g) cumin
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) minced ginger
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) minced garlic
  • 1 tbsp (14 g) brown sugar
  • 2 tbsp (32 g) peanut butter
  • 1 tbsp (23 g) lime juice
  • 1 cups (360 g) chicken broth
  • 1 tbsp (6 g) cornstarch optional to thicken
  • 2 tbsp (25 g) dry roasted peanuts
  • 1 tbsp (23 g) oil
  • 4 cups (675 g) cooked rice
  • 1 lime optional for garnish
  • 1 bunch cilantro optional for garnish

Instructions:

For the Rice

  1. Make enough rice to yield4cups of cooked rice. 1 cup of dry rice will make between 2-3 cups of cooked rice depending on what type of rice you use.

For the Curry

  1. Wash and cut all of your vegetables. Cut the pepper into a large dice, green onions (both the whites and greens) into a small dice, the potatoes into large dice, and the carrots into a medium to large dice.
  2. In a large stock pot over medium high heat, add a bit of oil and add in your carrots, peppers, green onions, and ginger. Saut for a couple of minutes until they develop some color.
  3. Make room in the center of the pot and add in a bit more oil and place the cumin and garlic into the oil to bloom it. Add in the red curry paste and brown sugar and stir everything together.
  4. Season the chicken lightly with salt and pepper on both sides. Make room in the center of pot and and add in the chicken. Cook it for a couple of minutes on each side to brown. Make sure you don't burn the vegetables.
  5. Once the chicken has browned, add in the coconut milk, chicken broth, and potatoes. Bring to a light boil and cover with a lid. Reduce the heat to medium low and allow it to simmer for 12-15 minutes.
  6. Once it has simmer for 12-15 minutes and the potatoes have softened, pull out the chicken and set aside. Add in the peanut butter and lime juice.
  7. Cut the chicken into bite sized pieces and return to the pot.
  8. If you need to thicken your curry, make a cornstarch slurry by mixing together equal parts of cornstarch and cold water. Start with 1 tbsp of each and slowly stir it in to thicken the sauce. If you need more, add more until you reach your desired thickness.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 6 servings. Each dish gets cup of cooked rice. Divide the curry mixture evenly into each container. Top each dish with crushed peanuts, cilantro, and a slice of a lime wedge.

Broccoli Bites

These Broccoli Bites are the most highly palatable form of vegetables I have ever encountered. If you are looking for an easy way to get in more vegetables, this recipe is it. If you have a food processor these can probably be prepared in minutes.

CourseCuisineTime - 35 minutes
Appetizer, SnackAmerican, meal prepPrep - 15 minutes
Cook - 20 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
16kcal48 bites
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates3.2g106%
Fat0.1g3%
Protein0.5g16%

Ingredients:

  • 2 lbs (908 g) frozen broccoli
  • medium (100 g) onion
  • 1 cup (120 g) maseca
  • 3 tsp (12 g) garlic powder
  • 1 tsp (8 g) salt
  • 2 tsp (4 g) pepper
  • cup (60 g) water
  • (10 g) oil spray optional for reheating

Instructions:

For the Broccoli Bites

  1. Thaw out your broccoli in the microwave.
  2. NOTE: If you have a food processor you can probably just add all of the ingredients (minus the oil spray) and pulse it until it forms a "dough".
  3. If you don't have a food processor, pour out all of your broccoli onto a cutting board and chop it as fine as you reasonably can.
  4. Cut your onion into as small of a dice as you can.
  5. In a large bowl, add the broccoli, onion, salt, pepper, garlic powder, and maseca. Mix to combine.
  6. Add in the water and stir to hydrate. Keep moving everything around until the maseca becomes sticky and a dough like consistency starts to form.
  7. Line a large baking sheet (I used 17"x11") with foil or parchment and spread out the broccoli mix. Press it into all sides of the sheet pan to get a dense, thin product.
  8. The thinner you make these the crispier they will get in the air fryer. If your sheet pan is too small and you try to fit the entire mixture on to it, your final bites will probably be too thick. It may be necessary in this case to use two sheet pans. You want about "-" in thickness.
  9. Place the sheet pan into the freezer and allow it to freeze until solid. This will make it a breeze to form into pieces. You would have to do it by hand otherwise which would get messy and time consuming.
  10. You can just form them by hand and air fry immediately if you don't need them for Snack City.
  11. Once frozen solid, remove from the pan and cut into 48 pieces. I achieved this by cutting it into 8 rows and 6 columns.
  12. Transfer the bites to a ziplock bag and store them inside of Snack City in your freezer.

Cooking and Serving

  1. Preheat your air fryer to 400F. Place the frozen broccoli bites into the air fryer. (Spray with oil if you wish). Air fry for 16-20 minutes, flipping half way. Cooking times may vary depending on thickness, just keep an eye on them.
  2. Serve your broccoli bites with a bit of pasta sauce for dipping. Choose your favorited jarred sauce at the store.
  3. Note that the nutrition information doesn't include the pasta sauce, just the broccoli bites.

Dark Chocolate Cherry Baked Oatmeal

Dark Chocolate Cherry Baked Oatmeal made from frozen cherries and dark chocolate chips combined inside of an oatmeal and egg bake. This is a great meal for those weeks you prefer something sweet to have in the morning.

CourseCuisineTime - 50 minutes
BreakfastAmerican, meal prepPrep - 10 minutes
Cook - 40 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
384kcal6
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates56g65%
Fat10g11%
Protein19g22%

Ingredients:

  • 3 cups (240 g) old fashioned oats
  • 2 scoops (60 g) vanilla protein powder
  • 1 tsp (4 g) baking powder
  • 1 lb (450 g) frozen cherries
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) sugar
  • 2 tbsp (42 g) maple syrup
  • 1 tbsp (14 g) butter
  • 10 tbsp (150 g) liquid egg whites or 2 eggs
  • 2 cups (480 g) milk
  • 2 tbsp (28 g) dark chocolate chips

For the Chocolate Drizzle

  • 1 tbsp (14 g) dark chocolate chips
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) milk

Instructions:

For the Baked Oatmeal

  1. Preheat your oven to 375F.
  2. If your cherries are whole, cut them into halves or quarters. Sprinkle 1 tbsp of sugar over the top of the cherries and allow them to macerate.
  3. In a large bowl, mix together the oats, protein powder, and baking powder.
  4. Add in the egg whites, milk, syrup, 1 tbsp of melted butter, 2 tbsp of the chocolate chips, and the cherries. If you get the big dark chocolate chips you should cut them up a bit so you get more coverage.
  5. Spray a 13"x9" pan with oil and add the oat mixture.
  6. Bake for 35-40 minutes.

For the Chocolate Drizzle

  1. Melt 1 tbsp of the dark chocolate chips and 1 tsp or so of milk in the microwave for few seconds until they melt. Stir to combine and continue to thin with milk until you get a consistency that will allow you to pipe over the top.
  2. Add the chocolate to a small ziplock bag and cut a small hole in the corner. Pipe the chocolate over the top of the baked oatmeal.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 6 servings. Cut the oatmeal into 6 equal pieces.

Pasta e Fagioli

Pasta e Fagioli (fagioli is Italian for beans) made using macaroni, white and red kidney beans, vegetables, and ground beef. This meal is freezer friendly, easy to make a huge batch, and it's a one pot meal.

CourseCuisineTime - 50 minutes
Main DishItalian, meal prepPrep - 10 minutes
Cook - 40 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
642kcal7 servings
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates72g53%
Fat21g15%
Protein42g31%

Ingredients:

For the Pasta

  • 2 lbs (908 g) ground beef (85/15)
  • 15 oz (425 g) canned white kidney beans
  • 15 oz (425 g) canned red kidney beans
  • 29 oz (822 g) canned tomato sauce
  • 14.5 oz (411 g) canned petite diced tomatoes
  • 32 oz (908 g) chicken broth
  • 2 cups (480 g) water
  • 12 oz (340 g) macaroni noodles gluten free if needed
  • 1 medium (200 g) onion
  • 3 cloves (15 g) garlic
  • 3 stalks (150 g) celery
  • 3 medium (200 g) carrots
  • 6 oz (170 g) spinach
  • 1 tbsp (8 g) crushed red pepper flakes
  • 2 tsp (4 g) oregano

Instructions:

For the Pasta

  1. In a large stock pot over medium high heat, brown your ground beef. You want to make sure you get good color on this meat as it will develop a ton of flavor for this dish.
  2. While the beef is cooking wash and cut all of your vegetables. Cut the onion, celery, carrots, and garlic into a small dice and roughly chop the spinach into smaller pieces.
  3. Once the beef has finished browning, remove it from the pot and set aside but leave all of the grease that was rendered off in the pan. If you have more than 2 or 3 tablespoons of grease, you can remove anything in excess of this if you wish.
  4. You should now have 2-3 tablespoons of the beef fat heating in the stock pot over medium high heat, add in the crushed red pepper to bloom the spices for a few seconds and then add in the carrots, onion, celery, and garlic. Season lightly with salt, add the oregano, and cook until the onions have become translucent and are beginning to take on color.
  5. After the vegetables have cooked for 5-10 minutes, add the beef back to the pot. Add the petite diced tomatoes, tomato sauce, both cans of beans, the chicken broth, water, and macaroni noodles. Stir to combine and bring to a light boil.
  6. Once boiling, cover the pot, reduce the heat to medium low and allow the noodles to soften. It should only take a few minutes.
  7. After the noodles have cooked, add in your chopped spinach, allow it to wilt into the mixture and season with salt and pepper to taste.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 7 servings. Divide the total amount evenly into your 7 containers.

Ham and Bean Soup

Ham and Bean Soup made up of ham, shredded chicken, white beans, potatoes, and vegetables. A great option to add to your soup rotation for the winter. Soups are great options for meal prep if you don't have to travel with your meals because they keep the best in the fridge over the week.

CourseCuisineTime - 1 hour 1 hour 1 hour
Main Course, SoupAmerican, meal prepPrep - 15 minutes 15 minutes 15 minutes
Cook - 45 minutes 45 minutes 45 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
635kcal5 servings
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates67g47%
Fat13g9%
Protein62g43%

Ingredients:

For the Soup

  • 1 lbs (568 g) ham steak
  • 1 lb (454 g) boneless skinless chicken breasts
  • 4 medium (1000 g) potatoes
  • 2 medium (200 g) carrots
  • 3 stalks (200 g) celery
  • 1 medium (200 g) onion
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) garlic minced
  • 2 tbsp (30 g) oil
  • 1 can (878 g) great northern beans
  • 4 cups (946 g) chicken broth
  • 3 cups (720 g) water
  • 1 tsp (4 g) granulated chicken bouillon
  • salt and pepper to taste

Instructions:

For the Soup

  1. Wash and cut your vegetables. Cut the onion, carrots, and celery into a small dice. Cut the potatoes into a large dice. Cut the kale away from the stems and roughly chop. Massage the kale by squeezing the leaves a bit.
  2. Into a large pot, add 2 tbsp of oil over medium high heat.
  3. Add your garlic, onions, celery, and carrots. Season lightly with salt and allow them to brown for a few minutes.
  4. While the vegetables are cooking, cut your ham steak into a large dice.
  5. Once the vegetables have softened and developed color, add in the ham, chicken and the potatoes to the pot. Pour in the chicken broth and water.
  6. Rinse and drain the beans and add them to the pot.
  7. Cover the pot and bring it to a boil. Once boiling you can reduce the heat to low and cook for about 15 minutes.
  8. After 15 minutes, pull out the chicken and shred with two forks or a mixer. Season the shredded chicken with salt and pepper.
  9. Add in the kale to the pot while you shred the chicken.
  10. Add the shredded chicken and 1 tsp of granulated chicken bouillon to the pot and stir.
  11. Taste the broth to test for seasoning and adjust with salt and pepper to taste. The ham is quite salty so it make sure you test first before adding any salt.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 4 servings. Divide your soup evenly into 4 containers and allow to cool before you store in your fridge.
  2. NOTE: A nice addition to the top of this soup after you reheat it is some chili garlic oil. The extra fat mixes with the broth for lots of flavor and heat.

Chimichurri Chicken Fried Rice

Chimichurri Chicken Fried Rice made using day old rice, chicken thighs, and a variety of vegetables. Instead of flavoring with soy sauce like in traditional fried rice, this one is flavored with a tangy chimichurri sauce that goes awesome with any meats and rice.

CourseCuisineTime - 45 minutes 45 minutes 45 minutes
Main DishArgentinian, meal prepPrep - 15 minutes 15 minutes 15 minutes
Cook - 30 minutes 30 minutes 30 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
703kcal5 servings
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates61g44%
Fat31g22%
Protein44g32%

Ingredients:

For the Rice

  • 6 cups (900 g) cooked rice

For the Chicken

  • 2 lbs (1135 g) boneless skinless chicken thighs
  • 2 tbsp (28 g) mayo
  • 3 tsp (9 g) chili powder
  • 1 tsp (5 g) garlic powder
  • 2 tsp (8 g) salt
  • 2 tsp (3 g) pepper

For the Fried Rice

  • lb (227 g) mushrooms
  • medium (100 g) onion
  • 1 cup (100 g) carrots shredded
  • 1 medium (150 g) red pepper
  • 2 (120 g) Roma tomatoes
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) oil

For the Chimichurri

  • bunch (20 g) parsley
  • bunch (20 g) cilantro
  • 1 tbsp (10 g) minced onion
  • 1 tsp (1 g) dried oregano
  • cup (60 g) red wine vinegar
  • 3 cloves (15 g) garlic
  • 3 tbsp (45 g) oil
  • salt to taste

Instructions:

For the Rice

  1. Fried Rice is always better when you use day old rice so ideally you would cook the rice for this recipe the day before you plan to make it. You can use fresh rice when you make it and it will still turn out well, but the day old rice really does make a difference.
  2. Make enough rice to yield 6 cups of cooked rice. 1 cup of dry rice will make between 2-3 cups of cooked rice depending on what type of rice you use.

For the Chicken

  1. Mix together the mayo, garlic powder, chili powder, salt, and pepper. Add the chicken and ensure that all surfaces are covered.
  2. I use the air fryer to cook the chicken. I think it works better for browning and is easier. Preheat your air fryer to 400F. Air fry for 10-12 minutes flipping around the 8 minute mark.
  3. If you don't have an air fryer you can cook in the oven. Preheat your oven to 425F. Bake for 10 minutes, turn the chicken and remove any liquid on the pan. Turn the oven to broil and return the pan to the oven on the top rack. Watch the chicken carefully as it is prone to burn. Cook it for 5 more minutes or until it has browned.

For the Chimichurri

  1. Wash your parsley and cilantro. Dry with paper towels and cut off the stems. You don't need to pick off all of the leaves, just cut off the stem under the leaves.
  2. Roughly chop the leaves of the parsley and cilantro, dice the onion, and chop the garlic into smaller pieces.
  3. Place the parsley, cilantro, onion, garlic, oregano, and red wine vinegar into a blender or food processor. Slowly add in the oil to emulsify with the vinegar and blend up all of the components. If you are using a large blender, it may be a struggle to get everything moving. You'll likely have to either a) use a smaller container for your blender or b) scrape down the sides often until it all comes together.
  4. Season with salt to taste.

For the Fried Rice

  1. Wash and cut all of your vegetables before you start. Cut the onion, mushrooms, carrots, and red pepper into a small dice. Cut the tomatoes into a small dice, scoop out the seeds from the center.
  2. In a large skillet, add 1 tbsp of oil over medium high heat. Add in the onions, red peppers and carrots and cook for a few minutes until soft.
  3. Add in the mushrooms and season lightly with salt. Allow them to cook down.
  4. Add in 5 cups of cooked, day old rice and break apart to incorporate.
  5. Your chicken should be finished around this time. While the vegetables are cooking, chop it into bite sized pieces.
  6. Add the chicken and all of the chimichurri to the pan and mix to combine. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide your ingredients evenly between your 5 containers. Sprinkle the diced tomatoes over the top of each dish.

30 Minute Stir Fry

This 30 Minute Stir Fry is made up of ground turkey, vegetables, and a side of rice. With two skillets working at once, you can have this meal finished in 30 minutes easily.

CourseCuisineTime - 30 minutes
Main DishAsian, meal prepPrep - 10 minutes
Cook - 20 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
530kcal5 servings
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates45g42%
Fat20g18%
Protein42g39%

Ingredients:

For the Turkey

  • 2 lbs (908 g) ground turkey (93/7)
  • 8 oz (227 g) mushrooms
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) oil

For the Vegetables

  • 1 medium (200 g) sweet onion
  • lb (227 g) green beans
  • 1 medium (150 g) red pepper
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) oil
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) minced ginger
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) minced garlic
  • 2 tsp (10 g) soy sauce
  • salt and pepper to taste

For the Rice

  • 3 cups (563 g) cooked rice

For the Sauce

  • 3 tbsp (45 g) soy sauce
  • 2 tbsp (30 g) gochujang
  • 2 tbsp (30 g) mirin can sub with half the amount of honey
  • 1 tsp (5 g) sesame oil
  • 2 tsp (10 g) rice vinegar

Instructions:

For the Rice

  1. Cook enough rice to yield 3 cups of cooked rice. 1 cup of dry rice will make 2-3 cups of cooked rice depending on what kind of rice you make.

For the Turkey and Vegetables

  1. In a large skillet over medium high heat, add some oil and brown the turkey. Season lightly with salt and pepper.
  2. Cut all of your vegetables while the turkey cooks. Cut the mushrooms into a medium dice, the onion and pepper into a large dice, and the green beens into small pieces.
  3. Once the turkey has browned, add in the mushrooms and allow them to cook down.
  4. In another skillet over medium high heat, add some oil and the onions and peppers first. Allow them to develop some color and soften then add in the ginger and green beans. A minute or two later, add in the garlic and stir to combine.
  5. Drizzle 2 tsp of soy sauce over the top of the vegetables and adjust flavor to taste with salt and pepper.

For the Sauce

  1. While everything is cooking you can prepare you sauce by combining the soy sauce, gochujang, mirin, rice vinegar, and sesame oil in a bowl and mixing.
  2. Once the mushrooms have cooked down, pour the sauce over the top and mix, allow it to cook and thicken up a bit. While this is happening you can start to plate your rice and vegetables.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Each dish gets cup of rice and you can divide the vegetables and turkey evenly between the dishes.

Lazy Lasagna

Lazy Lasagna, instead of having to construct all of the layers and bake everything in the oven you'll cut out a few steps and make a pasta dish that tastes like lasagna but in half of the time.

CourseCuisineTime - 45 minutes 45 minutes 45 minutes
Main DishItalian, meal prepPrep - 10 minutes 10 minutes 10 minutes
Cook - 35 minutes 35 minutes 35 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
832kcal7 servings
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates72g42%
Fat31g18%
Protein66g39%

Ingredients:

For the Lasagna

  • 12 oz (340 g) fusili pasta any pasta should work, gluten free if necessary
  • 1 lb (454 g) italian sausage
  • 1.5 lb (651 g) ground turkey (93/7)
  • 6 oz (170 g) spinach
  • 12 oz (340 g) broccoli slaw
  • 6 oz (170 g) tomato paste
  • 14.5 oz (411 g) petite diced tomatoes
  • 2 tsp (4 g) dried basil
  • 2 tsp (4 g) dried oregano
  • 1 cup (112 g) shredded mozzarella cheese
  • 6 tbsp (90 g) parmesan cheese
  • 2 cups (454 g) cottage cheese
  • salt and pepper to taste

Instructions:

For the Fusili

  1. Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil and cook the noodles according to their packaging. Reserve aside until ready once they are finished.

For the Lasagna

  1. In a large skillet over medium high heat, add the sausage first to brown. Remove the casing first if you buy the kind in link form. The sausage should have lots of fat in it so we are cooking it first to help some of that fat render out to cook the other ingredients.
  2. Once the sausage is about half way finished, add in the ground turkey. Season lightly with salt and pepper. Cook until about 90% of the way finished.
  3. While the meat is browning, cut up the broccoli slaw and spinach. Cutting the broccoli slaw into a small dice will help it to almost dissolve into the sauce. Roughly chop the spinach.
  4. Once the turkey is about 90% of the way cooked, make room in the center of the pan and allow any of the fat to collect in the center. Add in the chopped broccoli slaw and season lightly with salt. Allow it to saut in the fat and soften. Adding a bit of water can help it to cook faster by steaming the broccoli.
  5. After the broccoli slaw has cooked for a couple of minutes, add in the tomato paste, petite diced tomatoes, oregano, basil, and chopped spinach. Let the spinach wilt and the tomatoes to cook down by bringing the mixture to light boil.
  6. If your noodles have not been drained yet, drain the water and put them back into the pot. Add in the cottage cheese and parmesan cheese.
  7. Once the tomato sauce has cooked for a few minutes, season with salt and pepper to taste and add to the pot with your noodles. Mix everything until incorporated. Taste test and adjust seasonings as necessary.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide your ingredients evenly into your 5 containers.
  2. Measure out the mozzarella cheese and divide it evenly over the top of each dish. You can also garnish with parsley if you wish.

Ground Pork Pancit

Filipino Pancit made with ground pork, rice sticks and a variety of vegetables. This dish is flavored with chicken stock, lime juice, soy sauce, and oyster sauce.

CourseCuisineTime - 45 minutes 45 minutes 45 minutes
Main DishAsian, Filipino, meal prepPrep - 10 minutes 10 minutes 10 minutes
Cook - 35 minutes 35 minutes 35 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
682kcal5 servings
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates45g36%
Fat37g29%
Protein43g34%

Ingredients:

For the Pancit

  • 3 lbs (1362 g) ground pork (85/15) beef or turkey works as well
  • 8 oz (227 g) shredded cabbage or coleslaw mix
  • 1 medium (200 g) sweet onion
  • lb (227 g) carrots
  • lb (227 g) celery
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) minced garlic
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) minced ginger
  • 8 oz (227 g) rice sticks
  • 5 (25 g) green onions
  • 1 (15 g) jalapeo optional

For the Sauce

  • 3 tbsp (45 g) lime juice
  • cup (60 g) chicken stock
  • 2 tbsp (30 g) oyster sauce
  • 2 tbsp (35 g) soy sauce

Instructions:

For the Rice Sticks

  1. Add the rice sticks to a bowl of hot water and allow them to soak to soften while you cook the other ingredients.

For the Pork and Vegetables

  1. In a large skillet or wok, add in the pork and brown.
  2. While the pork is cooking, cut all of your vegetables. Cut the onion into thin slices, celery into a small dice, and the carrots into ribbons using a vegetable peeler. If you wanted to buy matchstick carrots, you could use those as well. Chop the tops off of some green onions and thinly slice a jalapeo for garnishing.
  3. Once the pork has finished cooking, remove it from the pan and place into a large bowl, reserving all of the grease in the pan. You will use this to cook the vegetables. If there is more than 2 tbsp of grease in the pan, remove the excess.
  4. Add the onions and celery to the pan with the rendered fat. Allow them to cook for about 5 minutes. Then add in the garlic and ginger and cook for a minute or two until they become fragrant.
  5. Next add in the carrots and cabbage. Season lightly with salt and cook for 3-5 more minutes until the cabbage has wilted slightly and softened.

For the Sauce

  1. In a bowl, mix together the chicken stock, soy sauce, lime juice, and oyster sauce. Stir to combine.

For the Pancit

  1. Drain the water away from your rice sticks and pass a knife through them a few times to break them into smaller pieces.
  2. In the large bowl that is holding your pork, add the rice sticks, vegetables, and sauce. Mix to combine and season with salt and pepper to taste. Additionally, if you feel you should add more lime or soy sauce, do so.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 6 servings. Divide the Pancit into 6 containers. Top with green onions, jalapeo, and a lime wedge.

Reheating

  1. Some brands of rice sticks tend to dry out more than others in the fridge over the course of the week. If you find that happens to you, add a splash of chicken stock over the top of your meal before reheating and it will help.

Moroccan Tomato Chicken

Moroccan Tomato Chicken made from marinated chicken thighs, roasted vegetables, rice, and a yogurt sauce to go over the top. The chicken is broiled in the oven to develop lots of color and flavor.

CourseCuisineTime - 55 minutes 55 minutes 55 minutes
Main Dishmeal prep, moroccanPrep - 15 minutes 15 minutes 15 minutes
Cook - 40 minutes 40 minutes 40 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
671kcal5 servings
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates57g42%
Fat26g19%
Protein52g38%

Ingredients:

For the Chicken

  • 3 lbs (1362 g) boneless skinless chicken thighs
  • cup (60 g) plain nonfat Greek yogurt
  • 2 tbsp (30 g) tomato paste
  • 2 tsp (8 g) salt
  • 2 tsp (6 g) cumin
  • 1 tsp (3 g) turmeric
  • 2 tsp (6 g) chili powder
  • 2 tbsp (30 g) lemon juice
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) minced garlic
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) minced ginger

For the Vegetables

  • 1 large (250 g) zucchini
  • 1 medium (200 g) red onion
  • lb (227 g) carrots
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) oil
  • salt and pepper to taste

For the Rice

  • 5 cups (750 g) cooked rice

For the Mayo Sauce

  • cup (60 g) plain nonfat Greek yogurt
  • 3 tbsp (39 g) mayo
  • 1 tsp (5 g) lemon juice
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) water

Instructions:

For the Rice

  1. Cook enough rice to have5cups of cooked rice. 1 cup of dry rice will yield about 2-3 cups of cooked rice depending on what kind you use.

For the Vegetables

  1. Preheat your oven to 425F.
  2. Wash and cut all of your vegetables. You can really cut them into any shape you wish. I cut the carrots into sticks and the zucchini and onion into a large dice.
  3. Add the vegetables to a large bowl and toss with 1 tbsp of oil and season lightly with salt and pepper.
  4. Spread out on a large sheet pan and roast for 15-18 minutes, flipping around the 10 minute mark.

For the Chicken

  1. While the vegetables are cooking, cut your chicken thighs into small, bite sized pieces, around 1 inch cubes.
  2. In a large bowl mix together the greek yogurt, tomato paste, lemon juice, salt, cumin, turmeric, chili powder, salt, minced garlic, and minced ginger.
  3. Add in the chicken and mix until all of the pieces are evenly coated.
  4. Spread out the chicken on a large sheet pan, make sure you have space between the pieces so they will brown evenly.
  5. Turn your oven to broil and place the pan on the top rack. Make sure you watch this closely, if your rack is too close the broiler it will be prone to burning.
  6. After 6-8 minutes, remove from the oven and toss the chicken. Spoon away any water that has been released onto the pan as this will prevent further browning.
  7. Put the chicken back under the broiler for an additional 4-5 minutes or until adequate browning is achieved. Again, watch it closely so it doesn't burn, stirring if necessary.

For the Mayo Sauce

  1. Mix the yogurt, mayo, lemon juice, and water together in a bowl. Season lightly with salt.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide your ingredients evenly between the 5 containers. Each dish gets 1 cup of rice. Store the yogurt sauce in smaller separate containers as you don't want to reheat this.

Garlic Lime Beef

Ground beef flavored with garlic, lime juice and soy sauce mixed into a skillet type meal with sweet potatoes, black beans, onions, red peppers and spinach. Serve with a lime slice to drizzle over the top before eating for an added layer of freshness.

CourseCuisineTime - 50 minutes 50 minutes
Main Dishmeal prepPrep - 15 minutes 15 minutes
Cook - 35 minutes 35 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
423kcal5 servings
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates38g42%
Fat13g14%
Protein38g42%

Ingredients:

For the Beef

  • 2 lbs (908 g) ground beef (93/7)
  • 3 tbsp (45 g) lime juice
  • 2 tbsp (30 g) soy sauce
  • 1 tbsp (21 g) honey
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) minced garlic

For the Vegetables

  • 1 medium (200 g) sweet onion
  • 1 medium (150 g) red pepper
  • 2 small (500 g) sweet potatoes
  • 4 cups (100 g) spinach
  • 1 can (439 g) black beans
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) oil

Instructions:

For the Vegetables

  1. Wash and cut your vegetables. Mince the garlic. Cut the sweet potato into a large dice ("-" cubes). Cut the onion into slices and the red pepper into a small dice. Roughly chop the spinach into smaller pieces.
  2. I cook the sweet potatoes in the air fryer. If you don't have an air fryer you can use an oven but it will likely require the use of more oil to roast.
  3. Preheat your air fryer to 400F or your oven to 425F. Add your sweet potatoes to the air fryer basket and spray with oil. Air fry for 10-15 minutes, shaking every couple of minutes to mix.
  4. If you use the oven, toss the potatoes in a bit of oil and spread on a sheet pan. Cook for 10 minutes and then flip and cook an additional 5-10 minutes.

For the Beef

  1. In a large bowl, add in the lime juice, soy sauce, honey, and minced garlic. Mix to combine. It may help to microwave the honey for a bit to make it more viscous.
  2. Add in the beef and mix with the marinade until it has all been incorporated. Using your hands will be easiest.
  3. In a large skillet, cook the beef over medium high heat. Because we added a bunch of liquid to this the beef is going to release more liquid as normal. Because of this it won't brown up until that water has been boiled off. Allow that water to evaporate. It make take a bit longer to cook the beef than it normally does.
  4. Once the beef has cooked and all of the water has evaporated, you will be left with all of the fat that has been rendered off of the beef. We will use this to cook the vegetables. If you have more than 2 tbsp of the fat in the pan, spoon the excess out so that you only have about 2 tbsp of fat left in the pan.
  5. Push the meat to the outside of the pan and add the onions and peppers to the middle and cook until they have developed color and softened. Season lightly with salt.
  6. Once the onions and peppers have cooked, add in the spinach and allow it to wilt.
  7. Add the potatoes and drained black beans to the pan and mix to combine.
  8. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
  9. Wash and cut a lime into wedges to garnish each dish.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 6 servings. Divide your ingredients evenly between your 6 containers.

Italian Beef and Rice

Italian Beef and Rice, a meal prep friendly version of the Italian Beef Sandwich. Ground beef mixed with tangy Italian dressing and pepperoncinis served with jammy sweet onions and red bell peppers. Top it with a slice of provolone cheese for even more richness.

CourseCuisineTime - 40 minutes 40 minutes 40 minutes
Main DishAmerican, meal prepPrep - 10 minutes 10 minutes 10 minutes
Cook - 30 minutes 30 minutes 30 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
774kcal5 servings
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates51g36%
Fat42g30%
Protein47g33%

Ingredients:

For the Rice

  • 5 cups (750 g) cooked rice

For the Beef

  • 2 lbs (1135 g) ground beef (85/15)
  • 7 tbsp (105 g) Italian salad dressing buy your favorite bottled dressing
  • 1 cup (120 g) sliced pepperoncinis
  • salt and pepper to taste

For the Peppers and Onions

  • 2 small (300 g) sweet onions
  • 2 medium (300 g) red bell peppers
  • salt and pepper to taste

Instructions:

For the Rice

  1. Cook enough rice to have5cups of cooked rice. 1 cup of dry rice will yield about 2-3 cups of cooked rice depending on what kind you use.

For the Beef

  1. In a large skillet over medium high heat, add the ground beef and brown it. Wash and cut your vegetables while the beef is cooking. To save on using oil, we are going to use the grease released by the beef to cook the vegetables.
  2. Once the beef has browned, drain away the fat and reserve for the vegetables.
  3. Mix in 7 tbsp of Italian dressing and 1 cup of sliced pepperocinis. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

For the Peppers and Onions

  1. Wash and cut your peppers and onions into thin slices. Try and cut the peppers to roughly " in thickness.
  2. In a large skillet over medium high heat, add in some of the grease from the ground beef. FYI, you don't have to wait until the beef has finished cooking to take this from the pan. You can spoon out the grease as it is produced so that you can cook the beef and vegetables simultaneously to save time.
  3. Add in the peppers and onions and salt lightly. Cook the peppers and onions for 10-15 minutes until the onions have deeply caramelized and the peppers are very soft. Make sure you stir frequently to ensure they don't burn.
  4. Adding a small amount of water to the pan can help to cook these faster through steam.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Each dish gets 1 cup of cooked rice and you can divide your remaining ingredients evenly between your 5 containers.

Mexican Beef and Potatoes

Mexican Beef and Potatoes made from ground beef, tomaotes, potatoes, rice and topped with cotija cheese. Serve with a lime wedge to spritz over the top for added freshness.

CourseCuisineTime - 30 minutes 30 minutes 30 minutes
Main Dishmeal prep, MexicanPrep - 10 minutes 10 minutes 10 minutes
Cook - 20 minutes 20 minutes 20 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
694kcal5 servings
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates56g43%
Fat34g26%
Protein40g30%

Ingredients:

For the Rice

  • 4 cups (600 g) cooked rice

For the Beef & Potatoes

  • 2 lbs (908 g) ground beef (85/15)
  • 1 can (425 g) petite diced tomatoes
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) oil
  • 1 bunch (100 g) green onions
  • 2 medium (300 g) russet potatoes
  • 8 oz (227 g) shredded cabbage or coleslaw mix
  • 1 lime
  • 1 medium (20 g) jalapeo pepper optional
  • 2 tsp (8 g) cumin
  • 1 tbsp (12 g) chili powder
  • 2 tsp (8 g) garlic powder
  • 5 tbsp (40 g) cotija cheese

For the Turkey & Potatoes

  • 2 lbs (908 g) ground turkey (93/7)
  • 1 can (425 g) petite diced tomatoes
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) oil
  • 1 bunch (100 g) green onions
  • 2 medium (300 g) russet potatoes
  • 8 oz (227 g) shredded cabbage or coleslaw mix
  • 1 lime
  • 1 medium (20 g) jalapeo pepper optional
  • 2 tsp (8 g) cumin
  • 1 tbsp (12 g) chili powder
  • 2 tsp (8 g) garlic powder
  • 5 tbsp (40 g) cotija cheese

Instructions:

For the Rice

  1. Cook enough rice to have 4 cups of cooked rice. 1 cup of dry rice will yield about 2-3 cups of cooked rice depending on what kind you use.

For the Beef & Potatoes

  1. Wash and cut your potatoes, green onions, lime, and jalapeo.
  2. Cut the potatoes into a large dice, the green onions into slices separating the whites from the greens. Cut the lime into wedges and jalapeo into thin slices.
  3. I used the air fryer to cook the potatoes for speed purposes. You can use your oven if needed. Preheat the air fryer to 400F or your oven to 425F. Add the potatoes to the air fryer basket and cook for 8-12 minutes or until they have properly browned.
  4. If you use the oven, you'll need to toss the potatoes in a bit of oil and spread on a sheet pan. Roast for 8-10 minutes, then flip and return to the oven for an additional 5-7 minutes.
  5. In a large skillet over medium high heat, add a bit of oil and begin to brown the ground beef.
  6. Once the beef is about 90% of the way cooked, make room in the center of the skillet and add in the whites of the green onions and the shredded cabbage. Season lightly with salt.
  7. After the cabbage has cooked down a bit, add in the canned petite diced tomatoes. Stir to incorporate. Once the potatoes have finished cooking you can add them to the pan as well.
  8. Add two cups of rice as well as the garlic powder, cumin, and chili powder. Stir everything together to incorporate and adjust seasonings to taste.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide your ingredients evenly into your 5 containers and top with cotija cheese, jalapeo slices, and a lime wedge.

For the Turkey & Potatoes

  1. Wash and cut your potatoes, green onions, lime, and jalapeo.
  2. Cut the potatoes into a large dice, the green onions into slices separating the whites from the greens. Cut the lime into wedges and jalapeo into thin slices.
  3. I used the air fryer to cook the potatoes for speed purposes. You can use your oven if needed. Preheat the air fryer to 400F or your oven to 425F. Add the potatoes to the air fryer basket and cook for 8-12 minutes or until they have properly browned.
  4. If you use the oven, you'll need to toss the potatoes in a bit of oil and spread on a sheet pan. Roast for 8-10 minutes, then flip and return to the oven for an additional 5-7 minutes.
  5. In a large skillet over medium high heat, add a bit of oil and begin to brown the ground turkey.
  6. Once the turkey is about 90% of the way cooked, make room in the center of the skillet and add in the whites of the green onions and the shredded cabbage. Season lightly with salt.
  7. After the cabbage has cooked down a bit, add in the canned petite diced tomatoes. Stir to incorporate. Once the potatoes have finished cooking you can add them to the pan as well.
  8. Add two cups of rice as well as the garlic powder, cumin, and chili powder. Stir everything together to incorporate and adjust seasonings to taste.

Korean Chicken Stew Dakdoritang

Dakdoritang is a Spicy Korean Chicken Stew dish. It is full of intense flavors from gochujang and gochugaru and its stewy qualities make it a wonderful dish for meal prepping. Filled with potatoes, carrots, celery, and chicken and served with rice this stew is something you'll find yourself wanting to make often

CourseCuisineTime - 1 hour
Main DishAsian, Korean, meal prepPrep - 15 minutes
Cook - 45 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
520kcal6 servings
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates63g56%
Fat15g13%
Protein33g29%

Ingredients:

For the Rice

  • 4 cups (675 g) cooked rice

For the Stew

  • 2 lbs (908 g) boneless skinless chicken thighs
  • lb (227 g) celery
  • lb (227 g) carrots
  • 1 lbs (454 g) russet potatoes
  • 2 tbsp (30 g) minced ginger
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) minced garlic
  • 1 bunch (50 g) green onions
  • 1 cups (360 g) chicken stock
  • 2 tbsp (30 g) oil

For the Sauce

  • 3 tbsp (45 g) gochujang
  • 1 tbsp (12 g) gochugaru
  • 1 tbsp (36 g) honey
  • cup (60 g) soy sauce
  • 1 tbsp (8 g) cornstarch slurry

Instructions:

For the Rice

  1. Cook enough rice to have 4 cups of cooked rice. 1 cup of dry rice will yield about 2-3 cups of cooked rice depending on what kind you use.

For the Stew

  1. Start by washing cutting all of your vegetables.
  2. Slice the green onions and separate out the whites and green tops. You will use the tops for garnishing the final dish.
  3. Cut the carrots, celery, and potatoes into a large dice. I cut the celery and the carrots down the center to halve it then cut it on a bias into smaller pieces. The potatoes get cut into cubes of about inch in size. You can peel them or leave them as they are.
  4. Season your chicken lightly with salt and pepper.
  5. In a large stock pot over medium high heat, add some oil and the scallions, carrots, potatoes, celery, and ginger. Season lightly with salt and cook for 5-7 minutes to allow the flavors to develop. Add in the garlic and stir.
  6. Make some room in the bottom of the pot (there won't be much room, do your best) and add in the chicken to get some browning. Cook it for 3-4 minutes. Flipping over when ready.
  7. While the vegetables and chicken are cooking you can prepare your sauce. Mix together the soy sauce, honey, gochujang, and gochugaru. These are Korean ingredients. I get them at Whole Foods, you may be able to find them at your regular store and certainly at your local asian grocer. If you don't love spicy food, add less gochugaru. If you can't find gochugaru you can substitute ground chili powder (the one that is just ground chili, not the chili powder mixture with cumin etc.)
  8. Pour the sauce over the meat and vegetables and stir. Pour the chicken stock over the top and mix.
  9. Cover the pot and reduce the heat to medium low. Simmer with the lid on for 20 minutes.
  10. While stewing, you can plate up your rice into your containers. Each container gets cup of rice.
  11. After 20 minutes, remove the lid, stir the contents of the pot and taste. Season with salt and pepper to taste. When I made this recipe I used chicken bone broth which is a tad bit thicker than regular stock. The starch from the potatoes should help to thicken the sauce. If you still have a very watery consistency, you can either add a small amount of a cornstarch slurry or allow the pot to boil with the lid off to boil off some of the water.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 6 servings. Each dish gets cup of rice and you can divide the stew evenly between the 6 containers. Top each dish with the chopped green onions.

Fire Roasted Tomato Beef with Rice and Refried Beans

Ground beef coated with a homemade enchilada sauce and mixed with a variety of vegetables. This meat is served with a side of rice and refried beans.

CourseCuisineTime - 45 minutes 45 minutes 45 minutes
Main Dishmeal prep, MexicanPrep - 15 minutes 15 minutes 15 minutes
Cook - 30 minutes 30 minutes 30 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
687kcal6
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates79g53%
Fat21g14%
Protein47g31%

Ingredients:

For the Beef and Sauce

  • 2 lbs (908 g) ground beef (90/10)
  • 14.5 oz (411 g) can fire roasted tomatoes
  • 2 Tbsp (20 g) red onion diced
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) white vinegar
  • 1 Tbsp (8 g) chili powder
  • 1 tsp (1 g) oregano
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) olive oil

For the Vegetables

  • 1 medium (200 g) zucchini
  • 8 oz (227 g) mushrooms
  • 1 medium (150 g) red pepper
  • 1 medium (200 g) red onion
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) olive oil

For the Rice & Beans

  • 6 cups (900 g) cooked rice
  • 2 can (908 g) refried beans

For the Turkey and Sauce

  • 2 lbs (908 g) ground turkey (93/7)
  • 14.5 oz (411 g) can fire roasted tomatoes
  • 2 Tbsp (20 g) red onion diced
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) white vinegar
  • 1 Tbsp (8 g) chili powder
  • 1 tsp (1 g) oregano
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) olive oil

For the Rice

  • 3 cups (450 g) cooked rice

Instructions:

For the Rice

  1. Cook enough rice to have 6 cups of cooked rice. 1 cup of uncooked rice will yield around 2-3 cups of cooked rice.

For the Enchilada Sauce

  1. Add 2 Tbsp of diced red onion, 1 can of fire roasted tomatoes, 1 Tbsp vinegar, 1 Tbsp chili powder, 1 tsp oregano, and 1 tsp salt to a blender. Blend until smooth.

For the Beef

  1. In a large skillet over medium high heat, begin to brown the beef.
  2. When the beef is about 85% of the way cooked, add in the enchilada sauce and reduce the heat to medium low. Allow it to simmer to cook out the tomatoes.

For the Vegetables

  1. Wash and cut your vegetables into a large dice.
  2. Heat another large skillet over medium high heat and add 1 Tbsp of olive oil. Saut the vegetables in order of how long it will take them to cook. Onions and peppers, then zucchini, then mushrooms.
  3. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

For the Beef and Vegetable Mix

  1. Once the vegetables have cooked down and finished cooking, add them to the skillet with the beef and sauce and toss to mix. Season with salt to taste.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 6 servings. Add 1 cup of the rice and about 1 cup of the beans to each container. The beans don't need to be cooked, you can just open the cans and divide the entirety of them between your containers. Split the beef mixture evenly into each container. Top with cilantro if you wish.

For the Turkey

  1. In a large skillet over medium high heat, begin to brown the turkey.
  2. When the turkey is about 85% of the way cooked, add in the enchilada sauce and reduce the heat to medium low. Allow it to simmer to cook out the tomatoes.

For the Turkey and Vegetable Mix

  1. Once the vegetables have cooked down and finished cooking, add them to the skillet with the turkey and sauce and toss to mix. Season with salt to taste.

Honey BBQ Chicken with Potato Wedges

Honey BBQ chicken thighs baked and broiled to create some awesome Maillard browning. Served with a side of roasted broccoli and cajun seasoned potato wedges.

CourseCuisineTime - 50 minutes 50 minutes 50 minutes
Main DishAmerican, meal prepPrep - 15 minutes 15 minutes 15 minutes
Cook - 35 minutes 35 minutes 35 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
661kcal5 servings
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates57g40%
Fat27g19%
Protein58g40%

Ingredients:

For the Broccoli

  • 1 lbs (680 g) broccoli
  • 2 tbsp (30 g) oil
  • salt and pepper

For the Potatoes

  • 5 large (1500 g) russet potatoes
  • 1 tbsp (30 g) oil
  • 2 tsp (6 g) garlic powder
  • 2 tsp (6 g) paprika
  • 1 tsp (8 g) chili powder
  • salt and pepper to taste

For the Chicken

  • 2 lbs (1135 g) boneless skinless chicken thighs
  • cup (120 g) BBQ sauce vinegar based is preferred
  • 2 tbsp (42 g) honey
  • salt and pepper to taste

Instructions:

Recipe Note

  1. I use my air fryer to cook the potatoes and the oven to cook the broccoli and chicken. If you need to use the oven to cook all 3 components you will want to prepare accordingly to work quickly and to ensure you have the space in the oven.

For the Broccoli

  1. Preheat your oven to 425 F.
  2. Wash and cut your broccoli into florets. I buy the precut stuff to make it easier and faster.
  3. Toss the broccoli in 2 tbsp of oil and salt and pepper to taste.
  4. Spread the broccoli out on a sheet pan and roast for 8-10 minutes then remove from the oven and turn. Roast another 5-8 minutes or until the broccoli has nice color to it.

For the Potatoes

  1. Wash and cut your potatoes into small wedges.
  2. Toss the potatoes in a bowl with 2 tbsp of oil and the chili powder, garlic powder, paprika, salt and pepper.
  3. For the air fryer, air fry the potatoes at 400F for 10-12 minutes, shaking the basket half way through. You will likely have to do two batches to prevent overcrowding.
  4. For the oven, spread the potatoes out on a sheet pan and roast at 425F for about 15 minutes, flipping about 10 minutes in. If you cook them at the same time as the broccoli it may require more time to get brown due to the amount of moisture in the oven.

For the Chicken

  1. Mix together the BBQ sauce and the honey. Reserve about of the mixture.
  2. Lightly season the chicken with salt and pepper and coat with of the BBQ sauce mixture.
  3. Place on a sheet pan and bake at 425F for 12 minutes.
  4. Remove the chicken from the oven and cut into 1" pieces. Turn your oven to broil.
  5. Add the chicken back to the pan and cover with the remaining BBQ sauce.
  6. Add the chicken to the top rack of your oven and broil for about 5 minutes or until it has developed good browning throughout. Watch it closely as it will be prone to burn. Check on the chicken every minute or so and stir when needed.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide your ingredients evenly 5 ways.

Crispy Lemon Pork Noodles

This noodle dish is made with ground pork that has developed a deep brown crust for loads of flavor. It is accompanied by carrots, spinach, and mushrooms then tossed in a sweet lemon sauce.

CourseCuisineTime - 40 minutes 40 minutes 40 minutes
Main DishAsian, meal prepPrep - 10 minutes 10 minutes 10 minutes
Cook - 30 minutes 30 minutes 30 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
730kcal6 servings
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates65g45%
Fat33g23%
Protein44g30%

Ingredients:

For the Noodles

  • 10 oz (280 g) pad thai rice noodles

For the Pork

  • 2 lbs (908 g) ground turkey (93/7) any ground meat works
  • tbsp (8 g) olive oil
  • salt and pepper to taste

For the Stir Fry

  • 1 medium (200 g) onion
  • 1 lb (454 g) mushrooms
  • lb (227 g) carrots
  • 6 oz (170 g) spinach
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) minced garlic
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) minced ginger
  • tbsp (8 g) oil
  • 5 tbsp (25 g) green onions optional for garnish

For the Sauce

  • 3 tbsp (45 g) lemon juice
  • cup (58 g) soy sauce
  • 2 tsp (10 g) sesame oil
  • cup (60 g) chicken stock
  • 1 tbsp (14 g) sugar
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) chili garlic sauce

For the Beef

  • 2 lbs (908 g) ground beef (85/15) any ground meat works
  • tbsp (8 g) olive oil
  • salt and pepper to taste

Instructions:

For the Noodles

  1. Prepare the noodles according to the packaging. Alternatively, you could fill a large bowl with hot water and allow them to soak and soften while you cook. This is what I do.

For the Pork

  1. Heat a large skillet over medium high to high heat and add a bit of oil. If you have cast iron that is preferred as I find it is easier to develop a crust on the meat with cast iron.
  2. Add the pork to the pan and brown on all sides. Season lightly with salt and pepper.
  3. Remove from skillet once finished.

For the Stir Fry

  1. Wash and cut all of your vegetables while the beef is cooking. Cut the onion and mushrooms into thin slices. Roughly chop the spinach into smaller pieces. Create ribbons with the carrots using a vegetable peeler by peeling down the length of the carrot. Cut those ribbons into smaller pieces.
  2. In the same skillet as the beef was cooked after it has finished, add a bit more oil and add in the onions, garlic and ginger. Cook for a couple of minutes to brown then add in the carrots and mushrooms.
  3. Salt lightly to encourage water to come out of the mushrooms and cook for a few minutes until the mushrooms have cooked down and the carrots softened.
  4. Add in the chopped spinach and fold in, allowing it to wilt.
  5. Season lightly with salt and pepper.

For the Sauce

  1. In a bowl, mix the chicken stock, lemon juice, soy sauce, sugar, chili garlic sauce, and sesame oil. Stir to combine.

For the Final Dish

  1. Drain the water from the noodles and add the beef, vegetables, and sauce to the bowl with the noodles. Stir to combine.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 6 servings. Divide your ingredients evenly between your 6 containers. Top with chopped green onions for garnish if you wish.

For the Turkey

  1. Heat a large skillet over medium high to high heat and add a bit of oil. If you have cast iron that is preferred as I find it is easier to develop a crust on the meat with cast iron.
  2. Add the turkey to the pan and brown on all sides. Season lightly with salt and pepper.
  3. Remove from skillet once finished.

For the Beef

  1. Heat a large skillet over medium high to high heat and add a bit of oil. If you have cast iron that is preferred as I find it is easier to develop a crust on the meat with cast iron.
  2. Add the beef to the pan and brown on all sides. Season lightly with salt and pepper.
  3. Remove from skillet once finished.

Chili Mac

Chili Mac, a one pot meal that can be finished in under an hour. Made from ground beef, a variety of vegetables, and macaroni noodles in a tomato sauce.

CourseCuisineTime - 45 minutes 45 minutes
Main DishAmerican, meal prepPrep - 15 minutes 15 minutes
Cook - 30 minutes 30 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
488kcal7 servings
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates44g44%
Fat19g19%
Protein36g36%

Ingredients:

For the Chili Mac

  • 2 lbs (908 g) ground turkey (93/7)
  • 1 medium (200 g) onion
  • lb (227 g) carrots
  • lb (227 g) mushrooms
  • 6 oz (170 g) spinach
  • 1 medium (150 g) poblano pepper
  • 1 small (15 g) jalapeo optional
  • 15 oz (425 g) crushed tomatoes
  • 14.5 oz (411 g) petite diced tomatoes
  • 8 oz (227 g) macaroni noodles gluten free if needed
  • 3 tbsp (24 g) chili powder
  • 2 tbsp (10 g) cumin
  • cup (56 g) shredded cheese
  • 1 cups (400 g) milk any kind works
  • 2 tbsp (30 g) oil
  • salt and pepper to taste

Instructions:

For the Chili Mac

  1. Wash and cut all of your vegetables. Cut the onion, jalapeo, and poblano pepper into a small dice. Cut the mushrooms into thin slices. Use a vegetable peeler to create ribbons with the carrots and then cut into smaller pieces. Roughly chop the spinach into smaller pieces.
  2. In a large stock pot, add a bit of oil over medium high heat. Add in the onions and peppers, salt lightly.
  3. After a couple of minutes add in the mushrooms and carrots. Cook for a couple of minutes.
  4. Push the vegetables to the perimeter and make room in the bottom of the pot and add in the meat. Allow it to brown and cook throughout.
  5. Once the meat has cooked, add in the petite diced tomatoes, crushed tomatoes, milk, macaroni, chili powder, and cumin. Stir the mixture and bring to a light boil.
  6. Once boiling, reduce the heat to low and cover. Cook for the allotted time on your macaroni's packaging.
  7. After the timer on the macaroni has expired, remove the lid and test a noodle to ensure it has cooked to at least al dente. Add in the spinach and cheese and stir. If the mixture is still quite soupy, allow it to cook uncovered to boil off some of the water.
  8. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 7 servings. Divide your ingredients evenly between your 7 containers.

Yellow Coconut Curry Chicken

Yellow Coconut Curry Chicken made with chicken breasts, coconut milk, and vegetables. The curry is paired with a sweet and spicy cabbage slaw made with a chili garlic sauce.

CourseCuisineTime - 50 minutes 50 minutes 50 minutes
Main DishAsian, meal prepPrep - 10 minutes 10 minutes 10 minutes
Cook - 40 minutes 40 minutes 40 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
733kcal6 servings
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates65g45%
Fat31g21%
Protein47g32%

Ingredients:

For the Rice

  • 5 cups (750 g) cooked rice

For the Curry

  • 2 lbs (1135 g) boneless skinless chicken thighs
  • 1 medium (200 g) onion
  • 1 medium (150 g) green pepper
  • 1 medium (150 g) red pepper
  • 1 cup (100 g) matchstick carrots
  • 2 tbsp (10 g) curry powder
  • 1 tbsp (8 g) turmeric
  • 13.5 oz (382 g) canned coconut milk get the canned one, it is creamier than the carton
  • 1 cup (240 g) chicken stock
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) garlic minced
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) ginger minced
  • 2 tbsp (12 g) cornstarch
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) cold water
  • 2 tbsp (30 g) oil

For the Chili Garlic Slaw

  • 10 oz (283 g) coleslaw mix the thinner cut the better
  • 1 tbsp (16 g) sugar
  • 3 tbsp (45 g) rice vinegar
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) chili garlic sauce or sambal

Instructions:

For the Rice

  1. Cook enough rice to yield 5 cups of cooked rice. 1 cup of dry rice will make about 2-3 cups of cooked rice depending on what kind of rice you use.

For the Curry

  1. Cut your chicken into a large dice, about 1 inch cubes. Season lightly with salt and pepper.
  2. Wash and cut your vegetables. Cut the onion into thin slices and the peppers into a large dice. If you buy matchstick carrots pre cut you don't need to do anything to them. If you buy whole carrots you can do whatever you prefer. I would recommend using a vegetable peeler to make shredded carrots.
  3. Mince your garlic and ginger.
  4. In a large pot over medium high heat, add a bit of oil and cook the onions, carrots, and the garlic until the onions have slightly browned.
  5. Add in the peppers and garlic and cook for a couple of minutes until the peppers have a bit of color.
  6. While the vegetables are cooking you can begin cooking the chicken in a different pot to save time or just wait and use the same one to save on dishes.
  7. Add a bit of oil to the pot and add the chicken. Brown on all sides for a few minutes. You are not cooking all the way through here, just getting some browning.
  8. Create some space in the center of the pot and add a bit of oil. Pour the curry powder and turmeric into the oil to bloom the spices.
  9. Add the vegetables back into the pot and pour in the can of coconut milk and chicken stock. Stir to combine and bring to a light boil.
  10. Once boiling, lower the heat to low and cover with a lid. Allow to simmer for 10-12 minutes.
  11. After simmering, cut into a piece of chicken to ensure it is done.
  12. Create a cornstarch slurry by mixing cornstarch with cold water. Slowly stir into the curry to thicken.
  13. Season the curry with salt and pepper to taste.

For the Slaw

  1. While the chicken is simmering you can prepare the slaw.
  2. Into a large bowl, add the coleslaw mix, vinegar, sugar, chili garlic sauce and a bit of salt. Mix to combine and allow to marinate.

Plating
