  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide your curry and coleslaw evenly into your 5 containers and add 1 cup of rice to each.

Steak Fajita Bowls

Steak Fajita Bowls comprised of sirloin steak soaked in a spiced lime juice marinade and combined with a mixture of peppers, onions, and grape tomatoes.

CourseCuisineTime - 35 minutes 35 minutes 35 minutes
Main Dishmeal prep, MexicanPrep - 20 minutes 20 minutes 20 minutes
Cook - 15 minutes 15 minutes 20 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
765kcal5 servings
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates57g39%
Fat37g25%
Protein51g35%

Ingredients:

For the Steak

  • 2 lbs (1135 g) center cut sirloin steak
  • 2 tsp (6 g) onion powder
  • 2 tsp (6 g) garlic powder
  • 1 tbsp (8 g) chili powder
  • 1 tsp (4 g) cayenne pepper
  • 2 tsp (6 g) salt
  • 1 tsp (2 g) pepper
  • 1 tsp (5 g) oil
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) lime juice

For the Rice

  • 5 cups (750 g) cooked rice

For the Vegetables

  • 2 medium (300 g) red peppers
  • 2 medium (300 g) green peppers
  • 1 medium (200 g) sweet onion
  • 10 oz (283 g) grape tomatoes
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) oil
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) lime juice
  • salt and pepper to taste

Instructions:

**For the Rice **

  1. Cook enough rice to yield 5 cups of cooked rice. 1 cup of dry rice will make around 2-3 cups of cooked rice depending on what kind of rice you use.

For the Steak

  1. Cut the steak, against the grain and on a slight bias, into thin strips of about inch thick. You are looking for bite sized pieces.
  2. Place the steak into a large bowl and add the onion powder, garlic powder, chili powder, cayenne pepper, salt, pepper, lime juice, and oil. Toss everything together so it is evenly coated. Allow it to marinade for a few minutes while you cut the vegetables.
  3. Preheat your air fryer to 400F. Once at temperature add in a portion of the steak and cook for 2-3 minutes. It won't take long at all since it is cut thin and you don't want to over cook it. Cook it in batches to ensure proper cooking.
  4. You can also cook the steak on a skillet over high heat if you don't have an air fryer.

For the Vegetables

  1. Cut the onion and peppers into thin slices and the tomatoes in halves.
  2. In a large skillet over medium high heat, add some oil and the sweet onions. Sal early to encourage water release and browning.
  3. Allow the onions to develop some color then add in the peppers and lightly salt again to pull out the water. Once they have begun to soften, add in the tomatoes and cook until the tomatoes have softened and cooked out.
  4. Add some lime juice over the top of the vegetables and season with salt and pepper to taste.
  5. Mix in the steak and stir to incorporate.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide your ingredients evenly into your 5 containers. Each dish gets 1 cup of cooked rice.

For the Chicken

  1. Cut the chicken into thin strips of about inch thick. You are looking for bite sized pieces.
  2. Place the chicken into a large bowl and add the onion powder, garlic powder, chili powder, cayenne pepper, salt, pepper, lime juice, and oil. Toss everything together so it is evenly coated. Allow it to marinade for a few minutes while you cut the vegetables.
  3. Preheat your air fryer to 400F. Once at temperature add in a portion of the chicken and cook for 4-5 minutes. It won't take long at all since it is cut thin and you don't want to over cook it. Cook it in batches to ensure proper cooking.
  4. You can also cook the chicken on a skillet over high heat if you don't have an air fryer.

Sloppy Joe Sweet Potato Skillet

Ground beef, a variety of vegetables, and sweet potatoes cooked together in a spicy sloppy joe adjacent tomato sauce and topped with mozzarella cheese. Loads of flavor and nutrients in this meal.

CourseCuisineTime - 45 minutes 45 minutes 45 minutes
Main DishAmerican, meal prepPrep - 15 minutes 15 minutes 15 minutes
Cook - 30 minutes 30 minutes 30 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
671kcal5 servings
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates56g42%
Fat29g21%
Protein47g35%

Ingredients:

For the Sweet Potatoes

  • 3 medium (900 g) sweet potatoes
  • 1 tbsp (23 g) oil

For the Vegetables

  • 2 medium (400 g) zucchini
  • 1 medium (200 g) sweet onion
  • 1 medium (150 g) green pepper
  • 1 medium (150 g) red pepper
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) oil
  • salt and pepper to taste

For the Meat Sauce

  • 2 lbs (908 g) ground beef (90/10)
  • 14.5 oz (283 g) petite diced tomatoes 1 can
  • 6 oz (170 g) tomato paste
  • 3 tbsp (45 g) ketchup
  • 2 tbsp (30 g) mustard
  • 2 tsp (10 g) Worcestershire sauce
  • 2 tsp (6 g) red pepper flakes
  • 1 tbsp (8 g) onion powder
  • cup (56 g) mozzarella cheese
  • salt and pepper to taste
  • parsley optional for garnish

Instructions:

For the Sweet Potatoes

  1. Preheat your oven to 450F.
  2. Wash and cut your sweet potatoes into a small to medium dice. Toss in 1 tbsp of oil and a bit of salt and pepper.
  3. Roast for 10 minutes, remove from oven and turn the potatoes. Cook for an additional 5 minutes or until browned.

For the Vegetables

  1. Wash and cut all of your vegetables. Cut the onion into a small dice, and the peppers and zucchini into a large dice.
  2. In a large skillet over medium high heat, add some oil and cook the onions first for about 3-5 minutes or until they have started to brown.
  3. Make some room in the center of your pan and add the peppers. Season lightly with salt to help draw out the water. Cook for a few minutes to soften and brown the peppers.
  4. Make room in the pan again and add the zucchini, add oil as needed. Cook until the zucchini has browned and softened. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

For the Meat Sauce

  1. If you want to go faster you can cook this at the same time as your vegetables.
  2. In a large skillet or pot, brown the ground beef over medium high heat. Season lightly with salt and pepper.
  3. Once the beef has finished, add in the tomatoes, tomato paste, ketchup, mustard, Worcestershire, onion powder, and red pepper flakes. If you like your food spicy, add more pepper flakes. The amount in this recipe is enough for even the spice haters to handle. If you like spicy, at least double it.
  4. Turn the heat down to medium and allow the tomatoes to cook out a bit, about 5-10 minutes.
  5. Add in the sweet potatoes and vegetables to the meat sauce. Stir and season with salt and pepper to taste.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide your ingredients evenly between 5 containers. Top each dish with cheese and chopped parsley for garnish.

Tater Tots

Tater Tots made from frozen shredded hash browns and air fried for an awesome, crispy, addicting treat to add to Snack City inside of your freezer. These tots are formed using a cookie scoop to make formation of the tots a breeze.

CourseCuisineTime - 35 minutes
SnackAmerican, meal prepPrep - 20 minutes
Cook - 15 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
22kcal49 tots
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates4.7g117%
Fat0.2g5%
Protein0.3g7%

Ingredients:

  • 2 lbs (1135 g) frozen shredded hash browns
  • cup (40 g) cornstarch
  • 4 tsp (16 g) seasoned salt
  • (10 g) oil spray

Instructions:

For the Tater Tots

  1. Place all of your frozen, shredded hash browns in a microwave safe dish. Microwave them for a minute or two until they are thawed. They don't need to be hot here, we just want them to be malleable and easy to cut.
  2. Spread out all of your potatoes on a large cutting board. Cut the hash browns into a small dice by passing a knife through them a few times. We don't need perfect cuts, just shoot for a small dice.
  3. In a large bowl, add the potatoes, cornstarch, and seasoned salt. You can use regular salt if you don't have seasoned salt. I would only use 3 tsp if you do.
  4. Mix the potatoes until all of the ingredients have been incorporated.
  5. Using a standard sized cookie scoop, pack the scoop with potatoes and press them into the scoop using your thumb. Release the tots onto a sheet pan and continue this process until the potatoes are gone.

Cooking and Storing the Tater Tots

  1. Once you have formed all of the tater tots you can either cook them at this step or place them straight into the freezer. It makes no difference.
  2. If you choose to freeze at this step, place the sheet pan into the freezer and allow the tots to flash freeze until frozen solid then transfer into a ziplock bag, remove as much air as possible, and place into the freezer.
  3. To cook the tots, preheat your air fryer to 400F. Place the tater tots, straight from the freezer, into your air fryer and spray the tops lightly with oil. Cook for 12-15 minutes or until they have achieved your preferred level of browning.
  4. I got 49 tots out of this recipe with a standard sized cookie scoop that I packed level with the top. If your yield is greater or less, you will want to reference the table below to update the nutritional estimates.

Buffalo Chicken Pasta

Buffalo Chicken Pasta made with a combination of penne, chicken breast, vegetables and sauced with a cream cheese and buffalo sauce mixture. This pasta is an awesome dish for meal prepping.

CourseCuisineTime - 45 minutes 45 minutes 45 minutes
Main DishAmerican, meal prepPrep - 15 minutes 15 minutes 15 minutes
Cook - 30 minutes 30 minutes 30 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
814kcal5 servings
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates95g55%
Fat26g15%
Protein49g28%

Ingredients:

For the Chicken

  • 2 lbs (908 g) boneless skinless chicken breast
  • 1 tsp (3 g) onion powder
  • 1 tsp (3 g) garlic powder
  • salt and pepper to taste

For the Pasta

  • 18 oz (510 g) penne pasta gluten free if needed
  • 1 medium (200 g) onion
  • 6 oz (170 g) spinach
  • 1 cups (150 g) matchstick carrots
  • 10 oz (283 g) riced cauliflower frozen, florets are fine if you don't have riced
  • 6 tbsp (90 g) buffalo sauce
  • 8 oz (227 g) cream cheese
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) oil
  • salt and pepper to taste

Instructions:

For the Pasta

  1. In the large pot with the drained noodles, add in the cream cheese, vegetables, buffalo sauce, and chopped chicken. Lightly stir everything together to incorporate and melt the cream cheese. Taste test and season with salt and pepper as needed.

For the Chicken

  1. Cut and/or pound the chicken breast until they are all of even thickness, ideally around -1 inch in thickness.
  2. Season the chicken with garlic powder, onion powder, and lightly with salt and pepper.
  3. Cook the chicken in your air fryer at 400F for 7-10 minutes, flipping half way through. The chicken is done when it has reached 165F internally. You do not want to overcook it.
  4. If you do not have an air fryer you can pan fry, grill, or bake the chicken.
  5. Cut the chicken into 1" pieces and set aside.

For the Vegetables

  1. If you are using frozen riced cauliflower, thaw it out in the microwave and drain the water out of the bag.
  2. Cut the onion and matchstick carrots into a small dice and roughly chop the spinach.
  3. Heat a large skillet over medium high heat and add some oil. Add in the onions and carrots and cook for 3-5 minutes or until they have begun to brown and soften. Salt lightly.
  4. Add in the riced cauliflower and spinach, salt lightly, and cook until the spinach has wilted.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide the pasta evenly between your 5 containers.

Korean Ground Chicken Bowls

Korean Ground Chicken made with lean ground chicken mixed with broccoli, carrots, onions, and ginger. It is flavored with a sauce made of gojuchang, syrup, soy sauce, chicken broth, and garlic.

CourseCuisineTime - 40 minutes 40 minutes
Main DishAsian, meal prepPrep - 10 minutes 10 minutes
Cook - 30 minutes 30 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
802kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates67g45%
Fat42g28%
Protein39g26%

Ingredients:

For the Chicken and Sauce

  • 2 lbs (908 g) ground pork (80/20) ground beef will also work
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) oil
  • 3 tbsp (45 g) maple syrup
  • 3 tbsp (45 g) gochujang
  • 1 tsp (10 g) sesame oil
  • 2 tbsp (30 g) soy sauce
  • 2 tbsp (30 g) chicken stock or broth
  • 2 tsp (10 g) minced garlic

For the Rice

  • 5 cups (750 g) cooked rice

For the Stir Fry Vegetables

  • 1 cups (150 g) matchstick carrots
  • 1 medium (200 g) onion
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) minced ginger
  • 1 medium (150 g) green pepper
  • 12 oz (340 g) broccoli fresh is preferred for this recipe
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) oil

Instructions:

For the Rice

  1. Cook enough rice to have 5 cups of cooked rice. 1 cup of dry rice will make around 2-3 cups of cooked rice depending on what kind you use.

For the Chicken and Sauce

  1. Cook the chicken in a large skillet over medium high heat with a bit of oil. Give it a chance to brown before you break it up and mix/flip it. Season lightly with salt and pepper.
  2. While the chicken is cooking you can prepare your sauce and cut your vegetables. Mix the soy sauce, gochujang, sesame oil, chicken stock, garlic, and maple syrup.
  3. Once the chicken has finished cooking, pour in the sauce and stir to coat.

For the Stir Fry Vegetables

  1. While the chicken is cooking, prepare all of your vegetables. Cut your onion into thin slices, the broccoli into small florets, green pepper into a large dice and the ginger into a mince. If you don't buy the pre cut carrots you will need to cut them into matchsticks as well.
  2. Heat a large pot over medium high heat and add a bit of oil. Add in the onion, peppers, and ginger and allow to develop color. After a couple of minutes add in the carrots and broccoli. It may help speed up the cooking process to add a splash of water and cover the pot to steam the carrots and broccoli. Season lightly with salt and pepper.
  3. Once the vegetables have finished, add in the chicken and stir to combine.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Add 1 cup of rice to each dish and divide the chicken mixture evenly.

Stewed Pork and Beans

Stewed Pork and Beans made using ham, pork, sausage, and black beans. This recipe was inspired by the Brazilian dish Feijoada but I adapted it to make it a bit more meal prep friendly. The traditional dish is made using many parts of the pig and calabresa sausage which is not easy to find in the States.

CourseCuisineTime - 1 hour
Main DishAmerican, Brazilian, meal prepPrep - 15 minutes
Cook - 45 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
548kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates46g41%
Fat21g18%
Protein44g39%

Ingredients:

For the Stew

  • 14 oz (397 g) smoked turkey sausage
  • lb (227 g) ham steak
  • lb (227 g) pork ribeye
  • 1 can (425 g) black beans 15oz
  • 1 medium (200 g) sweet onion
  • 1 cup (240 g) chicken broth
  • 1 cup (240 g) water
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) oil
  • 1 tbsp (8 g) cornstarch if needed for thickening
  • Salt and pepper to taste

For the Rice

  • 2 cups (375 g) cooked rice

For the Collard Greens

  • 14 oz (397 g) frozen collard greens fresh is fine, frozen is just easier to find
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) oil
  • 1 tsp (3 g) garlic powder
  • salt and pepper to taste

Instructions:

For the Rice

  1. Cook enough rice to have 2 cups of cooked rice. 1 cup of dry rice will yield about 2-3 cups of cooked rice depending on what kind you use.

For the Stew

  1. Cut your onion into a small dice and saut in oil over medium high heat until it has begun to develop color and soften.
  2. While the onion is cooking you can cut your pork and ham into a large dice. Cut the sausage into rings on a bias.
  3. Once the onions have developed color, add in the pork ribeye and allow to develop color on all sides, then add in the ham and sausage and do the same.
  4. Pour in the chicken broth, water, and black beans. Reduce the heat to low, cover with a lid and allow to cook for 15-20 minutes.
  5. After the 20 minutes if your mixture is still quite liquidy, you can remove the lid and boil off some of the water to thicken it or you can make a cornstarch slurry by mixing equal parts of cornstarch and cold water. Stir that into the mixture to thicken.
  6. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

For the Collard Greens

  1. The Brazilian dish Feijoada is traditionally served with a collard green like vegetable. Many of you know that I despise leafy greens. Collard greens are no different. I put them in this recipe for variation from my normal vegetables I use and for tradition. If you don't like collard greens, swap them out for anything else.
  2. If you're using frozen collard greens, thaw them out in the microwave according to the packaging. Drain as much of the water away as possible.
  3. In a pan over medium heat, add some oil and saut the collard greens. Cook for a few minutes and season with salt, pepper, and garlic powder.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide your ingredients evenly between the 5 containers. Each dish gets cup of rice.

Sweets and Sausage Skillet

Chicken sausage, sweet potatoes, onions, peppers, and green beans roasted together for a quick and easy meal prep dish. This meal is packed with flavor from the sausage and is an easy way to get a big serving of vegetables.

CourseCuisineTime - 45 minutes
Main DishAmerican, meal prepPrep - 20 minutes
Cook - 25 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
467kcal6
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates51g54%
Fat19g20%
Protein23g24%

Ingredients:

  • 28 oz (794 g) chicken sausage
  • 4 medium (1000 g) sweet potatoes
  • 1 medium (200 g) sweet onion
  • 2 medium (300 g) red peppers
  • 12 oz (340 g) frozen cut green beans
  • 2 tbsp (30 g) oil
  • salt and pepper to taste

Instructions:

For the Skillet

  1. Preheat your oven to 425F.
  2. Wash and cut your onion, sweet potatoes, and peppers into a medium dice. Cut your sausage into thin slices on a bias.
  3. In a large bowl, add the onion and sweet potatoes. Toss in 2 tbsp of oil.
  4. Spread the onions and potatoes out on a large sheet pan. Bake for 12-14 minutes, remove from the oven and turn. Cook an additional 12-14 minutes or until you are happy with the browning on the potatoes.
  5. Place the sausage and peppers on another sheet pan. Try to get the sausage to lay flat on the pan as this will allow it to brown. Add to the oven and cook for 8-10 minutes then flip and cook an additional 5-8 or until the sausage has browned.
  6. Cook the green beans in the microwave according to the packaging. Drain as much water from them as possible after cooking.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 6 servings. Divide your ingredients evenly into your 6 containers.

Huli Huli Chicken

Chicken thighs marinated in a sweet, tangy sauce and broiled in the oven. Served with the chicken is a side of rice as well as a zucchini and pineapple mixture.

CourseCuisineTime - 1 hour 15 minutes 1 hour 15 minutes 1 hour 15 minutes
Main DishAmerican, meal prepPrep - 15 minutes 15 minutes 15 minutes
Cook - 30 minutes 30 minutes 30 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
602kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates64g49%
Fat16g12%
Protein50g38%

Ingredients:

For the Chicken

  • 2 lbs (1135 g) boneless skinless chicken thighs
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) oil
  • cup (48 g) brown sugar
  • 3 tbsp (45 g) soy sauce
  • 2 tbsp (30 g) rice vinegar
  • 2 tsp (10 g) Worcestershire sauce
  • 2 tsp (10 g) minced garlic
  • 2 tsp (10 g) minced ginger
  • 2 tbsp (30 g) ketchup
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) water
  • salt and pepper to taste
  • sesame seeds optional

For the Rice

  • 5 cups (750 g) cooked rice

For the Vegetables

  • 2 medium (400 g) zucchini
  • 1 cups (283 g) pineapple frozen is fine
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) oil

Instructions:

For the Rice

  1. Cook enough rice to have 5 cups of cooked rice. 1 cup of dry rice will make around 2-3 cups of cooked rice depending on what kind of rice you use.

For the Chicken

  1. In a large bowl, mix together the brown sugar, oil, soy sauce, vinegar, ketchup, water, Worcestershire, garlic and ginger. Stir to combine and reserve about cup of the sauce for later.
  2. Place the chicken into the bowl and mix it around to coat. Allow it to marinate in the fridge for at least 30 minutes.
  3. Preheat your oven to 425F. Once the chicken has had time to marinate, place it on a sheet pan and bake for 10 minutes.
  4. After 10 minutes, remove from the oven and turn the oven to broil. Cut the chicken into 1 inch pieces and coat with the sauce that you reserved earlier. Mix to cover.
  5. Place the chicken back into the oven on the top rack and watch carefully to ensure it doesn't burn sometimes leaving a little crack in the oven door can help. Broiling the meat will help to promote better browning and flavor.

For the Vegetables

  1. Thaw your pineapple in the microwave if you use frozen.
  2. Wash and cut your zucchini into a medium dice.
  3. In a large skillet over medium high heat, add some oil and saut the zucchini until browned. Salting it early can help it cook faster.
  4. Once browned, add in the pineapple and salt to taste.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide your ingredients evenly into your 5 containers. Each dish gets 1 cup of rice.

Air Fryer Crinkle Cut Fries

Crinkle Cut Fries to add to Snack City. These fries are cooked in the air fryer and require no oil to prepare making them the perfect macro friendly addition to Snack City.

CourseCuisineTime - 40 minutes
SnackAmerican, meal prepPrep - 30 minutes
Cook - 10 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
120kcal15
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates27g90%
Fat0g0%
Protein3g10%

Ingredients:

  • 5 lbs russet potatoes
  • salt to taste

Instructions:

For Snack City

  1. Wash and cut all of your potatoes into fry shape using your crinkle cutter. Obviously you can use a knife if you want but the crinkle cutter makes for a better result in the fryer because there is more surface area to get crispy. I've linked the crinkle cutter I use above, it's only $8.
  2. Add your potatoes to a bowl of salted water. You don't need to go crazy with the salt here, just throw some in. Allow the potatoes to soak at least 20 minutes.
  3. Drain the water from the potatoes and spread out onto a couple of paper towel lined sheet pans. Pat the potatoes dry and salt lightly. Remove the paper towels and make sure the potatoes are in a single layer. Add to the freezer on the pans and allow to flash freeze until frozen solid. This is important for proper storage so the potatoes don't stick together when you put them in the bag.
  4. Once frozen, transfer the potatoes into a ziplock bag and you can store them inside of Snack City in your freezer.

Cooking the Fries

  1. To cook the fries I preheat the air fryer to 400F and add the frozen fries for 10-12 minutes depending on how many I am making.
  2. Shake the basket around once or twice during the cooking process and pull them out when they have reached your preferred doneness level. I find I don't need to use any oil but if you wanted to spray the top with oil during the cooking, have away.

Serving Size

  1. If you don't use any oil these are just plain potatoes so for tracking purposes you would just need to weigh out your portion and track as a russet potato. For this recipe I decided to use a 150g serving for the nutrition information. That's roughly a large handful of the frozen fries.

Air Fryer Chicken Fingers

Chicken Fingers breaded, air fried, and frozen to add to Snack City in your freezer. Use these for a late night snack or for a meal when you're in a pinch. Kid tested and approved When I make this for Snack City I do 8-10lbs of chicken at a time. If you have only one small air fryer like myself, it will take a few batches to cook.

CourseCuisineTime - 1 hour 30 minutes
SnackAmerican, meal prepPrep - 30 minutes
Cook - 1 hour

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
179kcal20 servings
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates13.1g33%
Fat3.7g9%
Protein23.4g60%

Ingredients:

  • 5 lbs (2270 g) boneless skinless chicken breast
  • 2 cups (250 g) corn chex ground
  • cups (60 g) tapioca flour or cornstarch
  • 2 eggs
  • 3 tbsp (45 g) water
  • salt and pepper to taste
  • 2 tbsp (30 g) oil spray

Instructions:

For the Chicken Fingers

  1. Cut your chicken breasts into chicken finger sized pieces. I shoot for between 1"-1.5" in diameter and 4-5" long. Season with salt and pepper.
  2. Prep your breading by placing the corn chex into a blender or food processor and blending into a flour. Lightly season the breading with salt and pepper.
  3. Set up three bowls, one with the eggs and water beaten together, one with the cornstarch, and one with the breading. You can also use large ziplock bags for the breading steps if you wish.
  4. Coat the chicken in cornstarch, then dunk in the egg wash, and then transfer to the corn chex and coat evenly. Shake off any excess and place on a sheet pan to prepare to be air fried.
  5. Keep one of your hands as the wet hand for the eggs and one as the dry hand for the breading, this will keep it from gunking up on your fingers.
  6. Once all of your chicken is breaded, preheat your air fryer to 400F. Place the chicken in a single layer in the basket and spray lightly with oil. Cook for 7-8 minutes then flip and lightly spray the other side. Cook for an additional 5-6 minutes or until golden brown.
  7. Place the cooked pieces on a wire rack to cool and repeat this process until you have cooked all of the chicken.

Storage

  1. Once all of the chicken has cooled, transfer it into a ziplock bag and remove all of the air. Store inside of Snack City in your freezer.
  2. To reheat, add to your air fryer at 400F for 7-10 minutes.
  3. The nutrition values are an estimate for if you split the 5 lbs of chicken into 20 servings. If you need exact calorie information, you may want to calculate the exact values for your specific batch.

Baked Penne

Baked penne pasta mixed with a ground beef tomato sauce, topped with ricotta, mozzarella, and parmesan cheeses.

CourseCuisineTime - 1 hour 10 minutes
Main DishItalian, meal prepPrep - 20 minutes
Cook - 50 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
566kcal8
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates48g41%
Fat21g17%
Protein48g41%

Ingredients:

  • 12 oz (340 g) penne pasta noodles uncooked, gluten free if needed
  • 2 lbs (1135 g) ground beef 90/10
  • 43.5 oz (1233 g) petite diced tomates 3 cans
  • 14.5 oz (411 g) crushed tomatoes 1 can
  • 1 medium (200 g) onion
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) minced garlic
  • 1 tbsp (2 g) oregano dried
  • 1 tbsp (2 g) basil dried
  • 15 oz (425 g) low fat ricotta cheese
  • 1 cup (112 g) mozzarella cheese shredded
  • cup (50 g) parmesan cheese shredded
  • 10 oz (283 g) spinach 1 bag
  • salt and pepper to taste

Instructions:

For the Beef and Tomato Sauce

  1. In a large pot over medium high heat, add the ground beef and brown.
  2. While the beef is cooking, dice the onion and add to the pot with the beef. Add the minced garlic as well. Season lightly with salt and pepper.
  3. Once the meat has browned, add in the cans of petite diced and crushed tomatoes. Stir in the oregano and basil. Allow the mixture to boil for 10-20 minutes to cook out the tomato flavor.
  4. Chop up the spinach and add to the pot. Stir to incorporate and wilt the leaves.

For the Casserole

  1. Preheat your oven to 400F.
  2. While the beef and sauce is cooking, bring a large pot of water to a boil and cook the noodles according to the packaging. Drain the water.
  3. Once the noodles and sauce have finished cooking, combine the two together and season with salt and pepper to taste.
  4. In a large casserole or baking dish, add about half of the noodle mixture in a single layer. Spread out the ricotta cheese over the top of this layer and pour the remaining noodle mixture over the top.
  5. Top the entire dish with the parmesan and mozzarella cheese.
  6. Place the dish on a sheet pan to protect from any leakage and place into the oven. Bake for 30 minutes. Watch it closely as you don't want to burn the cheese. If it gets too brown you can cover it with a piece of aluminum foil.
  7. Allow the casserole to rest and cool before cutting into it.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 8 servings. Divide the tray into 8 equal sized pieces and add to each of your dishes.

Chili Garlic Chicken with Rice and Beans

Chili Garlic Chicken made by broiling marinated chicken thighs and served with a side of vegetables, rice, and beans.

CourseCuisineTime - 40 minutes
Main Coursemeal prep, MexicanPrep - 10 minutes
Cook - 30 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
496kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates44g41%
Fat15g14%
Protein46g43%

Ingredients:

For the Chicken

  • 2 lbs (1135 g) boneless skinless chicken thighs
  • tbsp (8 g) oil
  • 1 tbsp (8 g) chili powder
  • 1 tsp (3 g) garlic powder
  • 1 tsp (3 g) onion powder
  • 2 tsp (10 ml) lemon juice
  • 2 tsp (8 g) salt
  • 5 tsp cilantro chopped, optional

For the Vegetables

  • 2 medium (400 g) zucchini
  • 1 medium (150 g) red pepper
  • medium (100 g) onion
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) oil

For the Rice and Beans

  • 2 cups (375 g) cooked rice
  • 1 can (438 g) pinto beans 15.5oz
  • tbsp (8 g) oil
  • 1 tbsp (9 g) ranch dressing mix
  • 1 tsp (3 g) garlic powder
  • 1 tsp (3 g) onion powder
  • salt to taste

Instructions:

For the Rice and Beans

  1. Cook enough rice to make 2 cups of cooked rice. 1 cup of dry rice will make about 2-3 cups of cooked rice depending on what kind you use.
  2. Drain and rinse the pinto beans.
  3. Once the rice has cooked, measure out 2 cups and add in the beans, seasonings, and oil. Mix to combine.

For the Chicken

  1. Preheat your oven to 400F and put the sheet pan inside while it is coming to temperature.
  2. In a large bowl, add the chicken thighs, chili powder, onion powder, garlic powder, lemon juice, salt and oil. Mix thoroughly to combine.
  3. When the oven has heated, add the chicken to the hot sheet pan in a single layer and bake for 15 minutes.
  4. After 15 minutes, turn the oven to broil, move the chicken to a top shelf and broil for 3-5 minutes or until color starts to develop. Watch it carefully as you don't want it to burn.

For the Vegetables

  1. Wash and cut all of your vegetables into a large dice.
  2. Preheat a skillet over medium high heat and add oil. Cook the onions until they have begun to develop color, then add the zucchini and peppers. Season with salt to taste.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide your ingredients evenly between your 5 containers. Garnish with cilantro if you wish.

Lemon Blueberry Baked Oatmeal

Frozen blueberries layered and swirled cream cheese inside of a lemon flavored oatmeal and egg bake. This is a great meal for those weeks you prefer something sweet to have in the morning.

CourseCuisineTime - 50 minutes
BreakfastAmerican, meal prepPrep - 10 minutes
Cook - 40 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
366kcal6
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates50.8g65%
Fat9.3g11%
Protein19.8g25%

Ingredients:

  • 3 cups (240 g) old fashioned oats
  • 2 scoops (60 g) vanilla protein powder
  • 1 tsp (4 g) baking powder
  • 3 cups (450 g) blueberries frozen is fine
  • 2 tbsp (42 g) maple syrup
  • 1 tbsp (14 g) butter
  • 10 tbsp (150 g) liquid egg whites or 3 eggs
  • 2 cups (480 g) skim milk
  • 3 tbsp (45 g) lemon juice
  • 4 oz (113 g) plain cream cheese i used whipped, regular is fine you'll just need to melt it down
  • 2 tbsp (20 g) sugar
  • 1 tsp (4 g) splenda optional
  • 1 tbsp (5 g) lemon zest

Instructions:

For the Baked Oatmeal

  1. Preheat your oven to 350F.
  2. Measure out your berries. If you would like a sweeter end product, sprinkle a teaspoon of splenda or sugar over the top of the strawberries and allow them to macerate. It may help speed up the process if you thaw them in the microwave first.
  3. In a large bowl, mix together the oats, protein powder, and baking powder.
  4. Add in the egg whites, milk, syrup, 1 tbsp of melted butter, lemon juice, and the berries.
  5. Spray a 13"x9" pan with oil and add the oat mixture.
  6. Mix together the cream cheese and sugar. You can microwave it for a bit to help it soften. Put a few spoonfuls of the cream cheese around your pan and swirl it around as best as you can.
  7. Bake for 35-40 minutes.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 6 servings. Top with lemon zest. Cut the oatmeal into 6 equal pieces.

Stuffed Hash Browns

Stuffed Hash Browns made in the air fryer. These hash browns are perfect to add to Snack City in your freezer for an easy morning breakfast.

CourseCuisineTime - 35 minutes
Breakfast, SnackAmerican, meal prepPrep - 35 minutes
Cook - 0 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
62kcal36 hash browns
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates10.2g78%
Fat1.3g10%
Protein2.5g19%

Ingredients:

  • 3 lbs (1362 g) frozen shredded hash browns country style
  • cup (85 g) tapioca flour corn starch works too
  • 1 tbsp (14 g) seasoned salt or regular salt
  • 1 medium (150 g) green pepper
  • 1 medium (150 g) red pepper
  • medium (100 g) sweet onion
  • lb (227 g) diced ham
  • cup (84 g) shredded cheese
  • (10 g) oil spray

Instructions:

For the Hash Browns

  1. Place all of your frozen hash browns into a microwave safe bowl. Microwave for 5-6 minutes or until they have thawed and are easier to work with and mold. You can use regular potatoes and shred them on your own if you wish. If you do this you will need to squeeze out as much water from them as possible using a clean towel.
  2. Wash and cut your peppers and onion into a small dice. Dry the ham with a paper towel to get as much moisture off of it as possible.
  3. Once the hash browns have thawed, stir in the tapioca flour (or corn starch), seasoned salt, peppers, onions, ham, and cheese.
  4. Spray a small ramekin or dish with a bit of oil and pack the potatoes into shape. You will want to pack them densely. I used about 60g ( cup) worth for each hash brown. Hit the ramekin upside down against the counter top or your hand lightly to release the hash brown. If you find that they aren't staying together you can add more starch. Some brands of hash browns are less starchy than others.
  5. You can cook these in advanced or freeze them as they are now. If you are going to freeze (this is what I do) place them on a sheet pan and flash freeze them to solidify. Once they have frozen solid, transfer to a ziplock bag and store in the freezer.
  6. If you choose to cook them in advance, preheat your air fryer to 400F. Place the hash browns in the air fryer in a single layer, cooking in batches if necessary. Spray the tops with a bit of oil to help with browning. Cook for 12-15 minutes, flipping half way and spraying the underside with a bit of oil.
  7. You can probably use an oven to cook these but they likely won't get as crispy and will take longer to cook. I have not attempted it, FYI.

Storage

  1. Once the hash browns have frozen solid if not precooking or have cooled if you did precook, add them to a ziplock bag, remove the air and freeze. To reheat, use the air fryer if you want to keep them crispy.
  2. Reheating the uncooked hash browns in the air fryer at 400F for 12-15 minutes. Spray the tops with oil and turn half way.
  3. This recipe makes 36 hash browns. The nutrition information is for each one.

Korean Spicy Chicken

Korean Spicy Chicken made from thinly sliced chicken breast marinated in soy sauce, gochujang, sesame oil, sugar and syrup. Serve with a side of rice and broccoli to give yourself a nice meal.

CourseCuisineTime - 55 minutes 55 minutes 55 minutes
Main DishAsian, meal prepPrep - 30 minutes 30 minutes 30 minutes
Cook - 25 minutes 25 minutes 25 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
696kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates69g49%
Fat29g20%
Protein41g29%

Ingredients:

For the Chicken

  • 2 lbs (908 g) pork shoulder
  • 3 tbsp (45 g) maple syrup
  • 2 tbsp (24 g) sugar
  • 3 tbsp (45 g) gochujang
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) sesame oil
  • 1 tbsp (20 g) soy sauce

For the Rice

  • 5 cups (750 g) cooked rice

For the Stir Fry Vegetables

  • 1 medium (200 g) zucchini
  • 1 large (125 g) carrot
  • 1 small (125 g) onion
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) minced ginger
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) minced garlic
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) oil

For the Broccoli

  • 1 lb (454 g) broccoli frozen is fine

Instructions:

For the Rice

  1. Cook enough rice to have 5 cups of cooked rice. 1 cup of dry rice will make around 2-3 cups of cooked rice depending on what kind you use.

For the Chicken

  1. Cut your chicken into thin slices of about -" thick. If your meat is partially frozen it will be easier. Add to a large bowl.
  2. Mix the chicken with the soy sauce, gochujang, sesame oil, sugar, and maple syrup. Allow to marinate while you cut and cook the vegetables.

For the Stir Fry Vegetables and Chicken

  1. Wash and cut your zucchini and carrot into matchstick sized pieces. Cut your onion into thin slices.
  2. Heat a skillet over medium high heat and add a bit of oil. Add in the onion, carrots, and ginger and allow to develop color. After a couple of minutes add in the garlic and zucchini and cook for an additional 1-2 minutes, adding oil if needed.
  3. Remove the vegetables from the pan and return the pan to the heat. Add in the chicken and cook for a few minutes on each side.
  4. When the chicken is about 80% of the way cooked, add in the stir fry vegetables and mix. Finish cooking until the chicken is cooked through. Season with salt and pepper.

For the Broccoli

  1. If you are using fresh broccoli, steam it on the stove until it is soft. If using frozen, follow the instructions on the packaging.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Add cup of rice to each dish and divide the remaining ingredients evenly.

For the Pork

  1. Cut your pork into thin slices of about -" thick. If your meat is partially frozen it will be easier. Add to a large bowl.
  2. Mix the pork with the soy sauce, gochujang, sesame oil, sugar, and maple syrup. Allow to marinate while you cut and cook the vegetables.

For the Stir Fry Vegetables and Pork

  1. Wash and cut your zucchini and carrot into matchstick sized pieces. Cut your onion into thin slices.
  2. Heat a skillet over medium high heat and add a bit of oil. Add in the onion, carrots, and ginger and allow to develop color. After a couple of minutes add in the garlic and zucchini and cook for an additional 1-2 minutes, adding oil if needed.
  3. Remove the vegetables from the pan and return the pan to the heat. Add in the pork and cook for a few minutes on each side.
  4. When the pork is about 80% of the way cooked, add in the stir fry vegetables and mix. Finish cooking until the pork is cooked through. Season with salt and pepper.

Sticky Beef and Brussels

Sticky Beef and Brussels made from ground beef, Brussels sprouts, shredded carrots and served with a side of rice. This one can be completed in 30 minutes or less if you make good use of your time while cooking.

CourseCuisineTime - 30 minutes 30 minutes 30 minutes
Main CourseAsian, meal prepPrep - 10 minutes 10 minutes 10 minutes
Cook - 20 minutes 20 minutes 20 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
729kcal6
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates67g47%
Fat32g22%
Protein42g29%

Ingredients:

  • 2 lbs (908 g) ground beef 85/15
  • 1 lb (454 g) Brussels sprouts frozen
  • 1 cup (125 g) shredded carrots you can buy these preshredded or do it yourself
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) oil
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) ginger grated
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) garlic grated
  • 5 cups (750 g) cooked rice

For the Sauce

  • cup (84 g) honey
  • 2 tbsp (30 g) soy sauce
  • 5 tbsp (75 g) chicken stock
  • 1 tsp (5 g) sesame oil
  • 2 tsp (10 g) rice vinegar

Instructions:

For the Rice

  1. Cook enough rice to yield 5 cups of cooked rice. 1 cup of dry rice will make about 2-3 cups of cooked rice depending on what kind you use.

For the Beef and Brussels

  1. Add a bit of oil to a skillet over medium high heat. Add the beef and cook until it has browned. Season lightly with salt and then set aside. NOTE: For proper browning, don't break up the meat immediately when you put it in the skillet. Give it some time to develop color.
  2. While the beef is cooking, microwave your frozen Brussels sprouts according to the package. Cut the Brussels sprouts into quarters.
  3. Using a vegetable peeler, shred your carrots into thin strips. Feel free to buy pre-shredded carrots.
  4. In a different skillet, add some oil over medium high heat and place the Brussels sprouts in the pan cut side down so they can develop color. After 3-5 minutes, create some room in the center and add the ginger and garlic and more oil if needed. Cook for 1-2 minutes.
  5. Add in the carrots and cook 2-3 minutes or until soft.

For the Sauce

  1. Mix together the honey, soy sauce, stock, vinegar, and sesame oil until combined.
  2. Add the beef and sauce into the skillet with the vegetables and allow the sauce to thicken with the heat. Stir and season to taste.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide your ingredients evenly between your 5 containers.

Carrot Cake Baked Oatmeal

Carrot Cake Baked Oatmeal made from grated carrots, spices, a "frosting", and oats. This is a great meal for those weeks you prefer something sweet to have in the morning.

CourseCuisineTime - 45 minutes
BreakfastAmerican, meal prepPrep - 15 minutes
Cook - 30 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
423kcal6
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates53g58%
Fat14g15%
Protein23g25%

Ingredients:

  • 3 cups (240 g) old fashioned oats
  • 2 scoops (60 g) vanilla protein powder
  • 1 tsp (4 g) baking powder
  • 4 large (340 g) carrots grated
  • 2 tbsp (42 g) syrup
  • 1 tbsp (14 g) butter
  • 10 tbsp (150 g) liquid egg whites or 2 whole eggs
  • 2 cups (600 g) 2% milk
  • 1 tsp (3 g) ground ginger
  • 2 tsp (6 g) cinnamon
  • 1 tsp (3 g) nutmeg
  • cup (48 g) brown sugar

For the Frosting

  • 4 oz (100 g) cream cheese
  • cup (100 g) plain nonfat Greek yogurt
  • 1 tbsp (12 g) splenda

Instructions:

For the Oatmeal Bake

  1. Preheat your oven to 350F.
  2. In a large bowl, mix together the oats, protein powder, spices and baking powder.
  3. Wash and shred/grate your carrots into small pieces. I use the small shredding side of my cheese grater for this. Sprinkle the brown sugar over the carrots and mix.
  4. In the bowl with the carrots, add the butter, egg whites, syrup, milk. Pour in the dry ingredients and mix to combine.
  5. Spray a 13"x9" pan with oil and add the oat mixture. Spread evenly.
  6. Bake for 30-35 minutes.

For the Frosting

  1. Melt the cream cheese and mix in the yogurt and splenda.
  2. Place into a ziplock bag (or piping bag) and set aside.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 6 servings. Cut the oatmeal into 6 equal pieces. Once the oatmeal bake has cooled a bit, top with the frosting. I frost my oatmeal the day I cook it, it is probably better to keep your frosting in the fridge and frost the day of eating but it doesn't make a huge difference.

Notes

  1. I think adding some raisins and walnuts would be a nice addition, however I left them out of the recipe because it seems like I am in the minority for adding raisins specifically. Add them if you want.

Air Fryer Hash Browns

Hash Browns made in the air fryer using only 3 ingredients. These hash browns are perfect to add to Snack City in your freezer for a quick morning treat.

CourseCuisineTime - 40 minutes
Breakfast, SnackAmerican, meal prepPrep - 15 minutes
Cook - 25 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
61kcal15 hash browns
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates13.8g106%
Fat0.3g2%
Protein0.7g5%

Ingredients:

  • 30 oz (850 g) frozen shredded hash browns country style
  • cup (30 g) tapioca flour corn starch works too
  • 3 tsp (12 g) seasoned salt or regular salt
  • (5 g) oil spray

Instructions:

For the Hash Browns

  1. Place all of your frozen hash browns into a microwave safe bowl. Microwave for 5-6 minutes or until they have thawed and are easier to work with and mold. You can use regular potatoes and shred them on your own if you wish. If you do this you will need to squeeze out as much water from them as possible using a clean towel.
  2. Once the hash browns have thawed, stir in the tapioca flour (or corn starch) and salt.
  3. Spray a small ramekin or dish with a bit of oil and pack the potatoes into shape. You will want to pack them densely. I used about 60g ( cup) worth for each hash brown. Hit the ramekin upside down against the counter top or your hand to release the hash brown. I yielded 15 hash browns in total.
  4. You can cook these in advanced or freeze them as they are now. If you are going to freeze (this is what I do) place them on a sheet pan and flash freeze them to solidify. Once they have frozen solid, transfer to a ziplock bag and store in the freezer.
  5. Preheat your air fryer to 400F. Place the hash browns in the air fryer in a single layer, cooking in batches if necessary. Spray the tops with a bit of oil to help with browning. Cook for 12-15 minutes, flipping half way and spraying the underside with a bit of oil.
  6. You can probably use an oven to cook these but they likely won't get as crispy and will take longer to cook. I have not attempted it, FYI.

Storage

  1. Once the hash browns have cooled, add them to a ziplock bag, remove the air and freeze. To reheat, use the air fryer if you want to keep them crispy.
  2. This recipe makes 15 hash browns. The nutrition information is for each one.

Cheeseburger Chowder

Cheeseburger Chowder, a cheeseburger in soup form made from ground beef, potatoes, carrots, celery, and onion in a cheesy, creamy broth.

CourseCuisineTime - 1 hour 10 minutes
Main DishAmerican, meal prepPrep - 10 minutes
Cook - 1 hour

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
568kcal6 servings
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates31g28%
Fat29g27%
Protein47g43%

Ingredients:

  • 2 lbs (908 g) ground beef 93/7
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) oil
  • 3 medium (200 g) carrots
  • 5-6 medium (200 g) celery stalks
  • 1 medium (200 g) sweet onion
  • 3 medium (550 g) russet potatoes
  • 1 bunch (30 g) curly parsley optional
  • 32 oz (946 g) bone broth chicken stock is a fine alternative
  • 2 cups (480 g) water
  • 1 tbsp (21 g) butter
  • 2 tbsp (21 g) flour use gluten free if needed. I used an oat/tapioca flour mixture when I made this.
  • 1 cups (360 g) 2% milk
  • 1 cup (112 g) shredded cheddar cheese
  • 1 tbsp (12 g) granulated chicken bouillon
  • 2 tbsp (15 g) cornstarch
  • 2 tbsp (30 g) cold water
  • salt and pepper to taste

Instructions:

For the Chowder

  1. Wash and cut your carrots, celery, onion, potatoes and parsley. Cut the carrots into half circles, celery and onion into a small dice, and the potatoes into a medium to large dice. Roughly chop the parsley leaves into small pieces.
  2. In a large pot, add some oil over medium high heat. Add in the onion, celery, and carrots and cook to develop some color, around 5-8 minutes.
  3. Once the vegetables have developed some color, make some room in the middle of the pot and add the beef. Brown the meat as best as you can.
  4. Once the beef has cooked, add in the potatoes, broth, and enough water to just cover the contents of the pot. I used 2 cups, you may need more or less. Reduce the heat to medium, cover the pot and allow it to boil until the potatoes have softened, around 10 minutes.
  5. When the potatoes have about 5 minutes left, start making your bechamel sauce. If you have never done this before, I recommend watching a quick tutorial on how to do it. Here is Papa Gordon making one, https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9aeCJGmEXqE
  6. In a skillet over medium heat, make a roux by melting the butter and stirring in the flour. Add in the milk in batches, stirring constantly until a smooth sauce forms and it begins to thicken. Once smooth, add in the cheese and melt.
  7. Pour in the cheese sauce to the pot with the soup and mix.
  8. To thicken the soup you will want to add a cornstarch slurry, mix 1 tbsp of cornstarch with 1 tbsp of cold water together at a and stir it into the mixture until you have achieved your desired thickness. I used 2 tbsp when I made it but depending on how much liquid you have, you may need more or less.
  9. Stir in 1 tbsp of granulated chicken bouillon and salt and pepper to taste. Add in cup of chopped fresh parsley if you wish.

Plating

  1. Soup is actually very meal prep friendly. You can use this recipe as a meal prepped dish or as a regular meal. This recipe makes 6 servings. Divide the soup evenly between your dishes. Top with fresh parsley for garnish.

Peanut Butter Chocolate Chip Baked Oatmeal

Peanut Butter Chocolate Chip Baked Oatmeal made from powdered peanut butter, chocolate chips, bananas, and oats. This is a great meal for those weeks you prefer something sweet to have in the morning.

CourseCuisineTime - 50 minutes 50 minutes
BreakfastAmerican, meal prepPrep - 10 minutes 10 minutes
Cook - 40 minutes 40 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
432kcal6
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates54g60%
Fat14g15%
Protein22g24%

Ingredients:

  • 3 cups (240 g) old fashioned oats
  • 2 scoops (60 g) vanilla protein powder
  • 1 tsp (4 g) baking powder
  • 2 medium (250 g) bananas ripe
  • 2 tbsp (42 g) honey
  • 1 tbsp (14 g) butter
  • 10 tbsp (150 g) liquid egg whites or 2 whole eggs
  • 2 cups (480 g) skim milk
  • 3 tbsp (45 g) mini chocolate chips
  • 4 tbsp (64 g) peanut butter

For the Peanut Butter Drizzle

  • 1 tbsp (16 g) peanut butter
  • Water to thin if necessary

Instructions:

For the Oatmeal Bake

  1. Preheat your oven to 350F.
  2. In a large bowl, mix together the oats, protein powder, and baking powder.
  3. In a separate bowl, add the bananas, peanut butter, and butter. Microwave them for a bit to soften and mash until they are smooth.
  4. Whisk together the mashed banana, peanut butter, butter, egg whites, honey, and milk. Pour in the dry ingredients and 2 tbsp of the chocolate chips. Mix to combine.
  5. Spray a 13"x9" pan with oil and add the oat mixture. Top with the remaining chocolate chips.
  6. Bake for 30-35 minutes.
  7. Melt the remaining peanut butter and drizzle it over the top of the baked oatmeal. Thin it with a bit of water if needed.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 6 servings. Cut the oatmeal into 6 equal pieces.

Honey Garlic Turkey Bowls

Honey Garlic Turkey Bowls made from ground turkey mixed with garlicky green beans and tossed in an Asian inspired sauce. This dish is served with a side of mixed vegetables and rice.

CourseCuisineTime - 35 minutes
Main DishAsian, meal prepPrep - 10 minutes
Cook - 25 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
468kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates49g50%
Fat16g16%
Protein33g33%

Ingredients:

For the Rice

  • 3 cups (563 g) cooked rice

For the Vegetables

  • 1 medium (200 g) sweet onion
  • 1 medium (150 g) red pepper
  • 1 small (150 g) zucchini
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) olive oil
  • salt and pepper to taste

For the Turkey

  • 1 lbs (681 g) ground turkey (93/7)
  • 6 oz (170 g) green beans
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) garlic minced
  • 1 tbsp (21 g) honey
  • 2 tsp (10 g) sriracha
  • 2 tbsp (37 mL) chicken stock
  • 1 tbsp (15 mL) soy sauce
  • 1 tbsp (15 mL) olive oil
  • salt and pepper to taste

Instructions:

For the Rice

  1. Cook enough rice to have 3 cups of cooked rice. 1 cup of uncooked rice will yield around 3 cups of cooked rice.

For the Vegetables

  1. Wash and cut your red pepper and zucchini into a large dice. Cut your sweet onion into a large dice as well.
  2. Cut your green beans into small pieces, about " in length.
  3. In a large skillet, heat some olive oil over medium high heat.
  4. Add the onion first and cook for 2-3 minutes then make some room and add in the red peppers and zucchini. Cook until soft and remove from the pan. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

For the Turkey

  1. Heat some olive oil over medium high heat. Add in the ground turkey and cook until browned.
  2. In another skillet over medium high heat, add a bit of oil and the green beans. Cook for 4-5 minutes so that they can develop color. Add in 1 tbsp of minced garlic and cook an additional 2-3 minutes and season with salt to taste. Be sure not to burn the garlic.
  3. Combine the turkey and green beans in one skillet. Add in 1 Tbsp of honey, 2 Tbsp chicken stock, 2 tsp sriracha, and 1 tbsp soy sauce. Stir to incorporate and season with salt and pepper to taste.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Add cup of cooked rice and to each container and divide the remaining ingredients equally.

Berries and Cream Baked Oatmeal

Frozen berries layered and swirled cream cheese inside of an oatmeal and egg bake. This is a great meal for those weeks you prefer something sweet to have in the morning.

CourseCuisineTime - 50 minutes
BreakfastAmerican, meal prepPrep - 10 minutes
Cook - 40 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
369kcal6
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates52g65%
Fat9.3g11%
Protein19.3g24%

Ingredients:

  • 3 cups (240 g) old fashioned oats
  • 2 scoops (60 g) vanilla protein powder
  • 1 tsp (4 g) baking powder
  • 4 cups (450 g) mixed berries frozen is fine
  • 2 tbsp (42 g) maple syrup
  • 1 tbsp (14 g) butter
  • 10 tbsp (150 g) liquid egg whites or 2 eggs
  • 2 cups (480 g) skim milk
  • 4 oz (113 g) plain cream cheese i used whipped, regular is fine you'll just need to melt it down
  • 2 tbsp (20 g) sugar
  • 1 tsp (4 g) splenda optional

Instructions:

For the Baked Oatmeal

  1. Preheat your oven to 375F.
  2. Measure out your berries. If you would like a sweeter end product, sprinkle a teaspoon of splenda or sugar over the top of the strawberries and allow them to macerate. It may help speed up the process if you thaw them in the microwave first.
  3. In a large bowl, mix together the oats, protein powder, and baking powder.
  4. Add in the egg whites, milk, syrup, 1 tbsp of melted butter, and most of the berries. Reserve a few to put on top.
  5. Spray a 13"x9" pan with oil and add the oat mixture.
  6. Mix together the cream cheese and sugar. You can microwave it for a bit to help it soften. Put a few spoonfuls of the cream cheese around your pan and swirl it around as best as you can.
  7. Bake for 35-40 minutes.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 6 servings. Cut the oatmeal into 6 equal pieces.

Chicken Tinga Taco Bowls

Chicken Tinga Taco Bowls made from shredded chicken breasts in a seasoned tomato sauce and served with a side of Mexican rice and sauted garlic cabbage.

CourseCuisineTime - 50 minutes 50 minutes
Main Dishmeal prep, MexicanPrep - 20 minutes 20 minutes
Cook - 30 minutes 30 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
569kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates58g48%
Fat17g14%
Protein45g37%

Ingredients:

For the Chicken

  • 2 lbs (1135 g) boneless skinless chicken thighs
  • medium (100 g) sweet onion
  • 14 oz (397 g) crushed tomatoes canned
  • 2 (25 g) chipotle peppers in adobo sauce chopped
  • 2 tsp (12 g) chili powder
  • 1 tsp (4 g) cumin
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) olive oil
  • salt and pepper to taste
  • 5 tsp (5 g) cilantro chopped, optional

For the Rice

  • 5 cups (750 g) cooked rice
  • 2 medium (200 g) tomato
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) olive oil
  • 1 tbsp (12 g) chili powder
  • 2 tsp (6 g) paprika
  • salt to taste

For the Coleslaw Mix

  • 12 oz (340 g) coleslaw mix
  • tbsp (8 g) olive oil
  • 1 tsp (3 g) garlic powder
  • salt to taste

For the Salsa

  • 8 oz (227 g) salsa use your favorite kind

Instructions:

For the Rice

  1. Cook enough rice to yield 5 cups of cooked rice. 1 cup of dry rice will make between 2-3 cups of cooked rice depending on what kind you use.
  2. Wash and chop your tomato into a small dice. Remove the seeds and watery inside.
  3. After the rice has finished cooking, mix in 1 tbsp of olive oil, 1 tbsp of chili powder, 2 tsp paprika, and salt to taste.

For the Chicken

  1. Add the chicken thighs to a large pot and cover with water. Bring the pot to a boil over medium high heat and cover the pot with a lid. Allow to boil for 15-20 minutes or until the chicken has cooked through.
  2. Once the chicken has finished cooking, remove the breasts from the pot and place them into a large bowl. Shred the chicken with two forks or using a hand mixer.
  3. Drain the water from the pot, rinse out any of the proteins left behind and return to the stove to cook the tomato sauce in.

For the Sauce

  1. While the chicken is cooking prepare the remaining ingredients. Cut your onion and chipotle peppers into a small dice. Measure out your seasonings.
  2. Add some oil to your pot over medium high heat. Add in the onion and cook for 1-2 minutes, then add in the seasonings and allow them to toast for a minute. Then add the chopped chipotle peppers and crushed tomatoes.
  3. Reduce the heat to low and allow the tomatoes to simmer for 5-10 minutes. Stir in the chicken and season with salt and pepper to taste.

For the Coleslaw

  1. In a skillet over medium heat, add a bit of oil and saut the coleslaw mix. Season with salt early to help draw out some of the water. If you cover it with a lid it may help speed up the process.
  2. Season with garlic powder, salt, and pepper to taste.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide your ingredients evenly between your 5 containers. Store your salsa in a smaller, separate container as you don't want to heat this with your meal.

Strawberries and Cream Baked Oatmeal

Sliced strawberries layered and swirled cream cheese inside of an oatmeal and egg bake. This is a great meal for those weeks you prefer something sweet to have in the morning.

CourseCuisineTime - 50 minutes
BreakfastAmerican, meal prepPrep - 10 minutes
Cook - 40 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
345kcal6
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates47g62%
Fat9g12%
Protein19g25%

Ingredients:

  • 3 cups (240 g) old fashioned oats
  • 2 scoops (60 g) vanilla protein powder
  • 1 tsp (4 g) baking powder
  • 4 cups (450 g) strawberries frozen is fine
  • 2 tsp (8 g) sugar or sub 1/2 sugar alternative
  • 2 tbsp (42 g) maple syrup
  • 1 tbsp (14 g) butter
  • 10 tbsp (150 g) liquid egg whites or 2 eggs
  • 2 cups (480 g) skim milk
  • 4 oz (113 g) plain cream cheese i used whipped, regular is fine you'll just need to melt it down
  • 2 tbsp (20 g) sugar

Instructions:

For the Baked Oatmeal

  1. Preheat your oven to 375F.
  2. If your strawberries are whole, cut them into thin slices. If you would like a sweeter end product, sprinkle 2 tsp sugar or 1 tsp splenda the top of the strawberries and allow them to macerate.
  3. In a large bowl, mix together the oats, protein powder, and baking powder.
  4. Add in the egg whites, milk, syrup, 1 tbsp of melted butter, and most of the strawberries. Reserve a few to put on top.
  5. Spray a 13"x9" pan with oil and add the oat mixture.
  6. Mix together the cream cheese and sugar. You can microwave it for a bit to help it soften. Put a few spoonfuls of the cream cheese around your pan and swirl it around as best as you can.
  7. Bake for 35-40 minutes.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 6 servings. Cut the oatmeal into 6 equal pieces.

Creamy Chicken and Noodles

Shredded chicken breasts with carrots, celery, and broccoli in a creamy, savory sauce and mixed with noodles. A one pot meal that takes little effort.

CourseCuisineTime - 45 minutes 45 minutes 45 minutes
Main DishAmerican, meal prepPrep - 15 minutes 15 minutes 15 minutes
Cook - 30 minutes 30 minutes 30 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
712kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates91g57%
Fat17g10%
Protein49g31%

Ingredients:

  • 2 lbs (908 g) boneless skinless chicken breast
  • 1 lb (454 g) fusilli pasta noodles gluten free if needed
  • medium (100 g) onion
  • lb (227 g) carrots
  • lb (227 g) celery
  • lb (227 g) frozen broccoli
  • 2 tbsp (30 g) olive oil
  • 4 cups (960 g) chicken broth
  • 2 cups (600 g) milk
  • salt and pepper to taste

Instructions:

For the Chicken and Vegetables

  1. Wash and cut your celery, carrots, and onion into a small dice.
  2. In a large stock pot, add some oil over medium high heat. Add the vegetables and cook for about 5 minutes or until they have begun to develop color and soften.
  3. Add the chicken to the bottom of the pot and pour the chicken broth over the top. If you don't have enough liquid to cover the top of the chicken, add a bit of water. Bring to a boil then reduce the heat to medium low and cover. Cook covered for 15-20 minutes.
  4. Remove the chicken from the pot and set aside.
  5. Add the noodles and milk to the pot, bring to a boil and cook for the time the package of noodles specifies, likely 10-12 minutes. Be sure to stir frequently.
  6. While the noodles are cooking, shred the chicken. Place the broccoli in the microwave and cook it according to its packaging.
  7. Chop the broccoli into small pieces.
  8. Once the noodles have finished cooking, add the chicken and broccoli to the pot and stir. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide your ingredients evenly between your 5 containers.

Pepper Jack Cheeseburger Bowls

A meal prep version of a cheeseburger. Ground beef with pepper jack cheese, spicy potatoes, and burger toppings come together in a bowl and served with ketchup.

CourseCuisineTime - 45 minutes
Main DishAmerican, meal prepPrep - 15 minutes
Cook - 30 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
532kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates45g42%
Fat22g20%
Protein38g36%

Ingredients:

For the Hamburger and Broccoli

  • 1 lbs (908 g) ground beef (93/7) or turkey
  • 1 lb (454 g) mushrooms
  • 5 Tbsp (70 g) shredded pepper jack cheese
  • 1 lb (454 g) frozen broccoli
  • 1 Tbsp (23 g) olive oil
  • 10 Tbsp (150 g) ketchup
  • 5 (150 g) dill pickle spears
  • 2 (120 g) Roma tomatoes
  • Salt and pepper to taste

For the Potatoes

  • 5 small (750 g) russet potatoes
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) olive oil
  • 1 tsp (3 g) cayenne pepper
  • 1 tsp (3 g) garlic powder
  • 1 tbsp (6 g) chili powder
  • salt and pepper to taste

Instructions:

For the Potatoes

  1. Preheat your oven to 450F.
  2. Wash each of your potatoes thoroughly. Cut them into a medium dice.
  3. In a large bowl, drizzle 1 Tbsp of olive oil over the potatoes. Sprinkle with salt, pepper, 1 tsp of cayenne pepper, garlic powder and 1 tbsp chili powder. Toss the potatoes to coat and spread onto a sheet pan.
  4. Bake for 10-15 minutes and then flip them to the other side and cook an additional 10-12 minutes or until desired doneness is achieved.

For the Broccoli

  1. Add a sheet pan to the oven while it is preheating to 450F. Add 1 Tbsp of olive oil to a large bowl with the broccoli and salt and pepper. Lay the broccoli out on the hot sheet pan and roast for 10 minutes. Remove from the oven, turn, and cook an additional 5-8 minutes.

For the Hamburger and Mushrooms

  1. Heat a skillet over medium high heat. Add the ground beef and cook. Once it has browned, season with salt and pepper to taste.
  2. Wash and cut your mushrooms into thin slices. If you want these to develop color, cook them in a dry skillet over medium heat and salt them to pull out the water. They will cook down and brown in about 5-8 minutes. You could also just throw them in with the beef if you don't care to cook them separately.
  3. Mix the mushrooms and beef together and stir to incorporate.

For the Bowls

  1. Cut 2 Roma tomatoes into slices.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide your hamburger, potatoes, and broccoli evenly between your 5 containers. Top the hamburger with 1 Tbsp of shredded pepper jack cheese. Add 1 pickle spear and 2 slices of Roma tomatoes. Store 2 Tbsp of ketchup sauce in a smaller, separate container.

Lo Mein

Ground chicken or turkey mixed with a wide variety of vegetables and lo mein noodles in a flavorful sauce made from soy sauce, honey, sriracha, and hoisin sauce.

CourseCuisineTime - 40 minutes
Main DishAsian, meal prepPrep - 20 minutes
Cook - 20 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
557kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates57g49%
Fat19g16%
Protein40g34%

Ingredients:

  • 2 lbs (908 g) ground turkey or chicken
  • lb (113 g) carrots
  • medium (100 g) onion
  • 1 medium (150 g) red pepper
  • lb (227 g) mushrooms
  • 2 cups (120 g) coleslaw mix
  • 1 cups (45 g) spinach
  • 2 tbsp (30 ml) olive oil
  • 7 oz (200 g) lo mein noodles or pad thai rice noodles for gluten free

For the Sauce

  • 1 tbsp (30 g) honey
  • 2 tbsp (35 g) soy sauce
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) sriracha
  • tbsp (18 g) hoisin sauce
  • 1 tsp (4 g) ground ginger
  • 1 tbsp (23 g) water

Instructions:

For the Noodles

  1. Prepare the noodles according to the instructions on the package.

For the Turkey

  1. Add some oil to a skillet over medium high heat. Add in the turkey and cook it until it has browned. Season lightly with salt and pepper. Remove from heat.

For the Vegetables

  1. Wash and prepare all of your vegetables. Cut your red pepper, onion, and mushrooms into thin slices so they cook quickly. Use a vegetable peeler to create ribbons out of your carrots. You'll want to do all of this prep work before you start cooking them, the cooking process goes fast.
  2. In a large pot, add some oil and add the onion. Cook for 2-3 minutes or until they have begun to develop color.
  3. Add in the coleslaw mix. Stir and cook for a minute or two.
  4. Make room in the pot and add the red pepper to the pot. Allow them to develop a bit of color then add in the shredded carrots and stir. Continue to cook until the vegetables have softened.
  5. Stir in the spinach and allow it to wilt.
  6. For the mushrooms I prefer to cook them separately so they can develop color. If you are feeling lazy you can throw them in at any point of the cooking process. I like to add them to a dry skillet over medium heat, salt them, and cook them until they have browned. Add them to the pot with the other vegetables.

For the Lo Mein

  1. Mix all of the sauce ingredients together in a bowl.
  2. Drain the water from the noodles and add them to a skillet with the sauce. You just want to toss the noodles with the sauce so they are evenly coated.
  3. Add the noodles and turkey to the large pot with the vegetables. Stir to incorporate and season with salt and pepper as needed.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide your ingredients evenly 5 ways.

Chocolate Chip Banana Bread Baked Oatmeal

Ripe bananas baked into an oatmeal and egg mixture and topped with chocolate chips for a Chocolate Chip Banana Bread Baked Oatmeal. This is a great meal for those weeks you prefer something sweet to have in the morning.

CourseCuisineTime - 50 minutes
BreakfastAmerican, meal prepPrep - 10 minutes
Cook - 40 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
389kcal6
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates59g67%
Fat9g10%
Protein19g21%

Ingredients:

  • 3 cups (240 g) old fashioned oats
  • 2 scoops (60 g) vanilla protein powder
  • 1 tsp (4 g) baking powder
  • 4 medium (500 g) bananas ripe
  • 2 tbsp (42 g) honey
  • 1 tbsp (14 g) butter
  • 10 tbsp (150 g) liquid egg whites or 2 whole eggs
  • 2 cups (480 g) 2% milk
  • 2 tbsp (28 g) mini chocolate chips

Instructions:

For the Oatmeal Bake

  1. Preheat your oven to 375F.
  2. In a large bowl, mix together the oats, protein powder, and baking powder.
  3. In a separate bowl, add 3 of the ripe bananas and mash. It may help to microwave them for a bit to soften. Cut the other banana into slices to go on top of the oatmeal.
  4. Whisk together the mashed banana, egg whites, honey, milk, and 1 tbsp of melted butter. Pour in the dry ingredients and 1 tbsp of the chocolate chips. Mix to combine.
  5. Spray a 13"x9" pan with oil and add the oat mixture. Top with the sliced banana and chocolate chips.
  6. Bake for 35-40 minutes.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 6 servings. Cut the oatmeal into 6 equal pieces.

Japanese Curry

*Chicken thighs, potatoes and carrots make up this Japanese Curry. The "stewy" quality of Japanese Curry makes for a perfect meal prep meal that reheats like a dream in the microwave. Japanese Curry has a bit more umami flavor than Indian Curry and is more mild in flavor profile, making it the superior curry in my opinion *

CourseCuisineTime - 1 hour 1 hour 1 hour
Main DishAsian, Japanese, meal prepPrep - 20 minutes 20 minutes 20 minutes
Cook - 40 minutes 40 minutes 40 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
601kcal5 servings
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates70g53%
Fat15g11%
Protein46g35%

Ingredients:

  • 2 lbs (908 g) boneless skinless chicken thighs
  • medium (100 g) onion
  • tbsp (8 g) garlic minced
  • lb (227 g) carrots
  • lb (341 g) potatoes
  • 5 cups (750 g) cooked rice
  • 1 lb (454 g) frozen broccoli
  • 2 tbsp (12 g) curry powder
  • 1 tbsp (12 g) cornstarch
  • 1 tbsp (22 g) cold water
  • 2 tbsp (30 g) olive oil
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) soy sauce

Instructions:

For the Rice

  1. Cook enough rice to yield 5 cups of cooked rice. 1 cup of dry rice will make around 2-3 cups of cooked rice depending on what type of rice you use.

For the Curry

  1. Wash and cut your potatoes, carrots, and onion. Peel the carrots and potatoes. Cut the potatoes into a large dice (around inch cubes), your carrots into thin rounds, and the onion into a small dice.
  2. In a large pot over medium high heat, add 1 tbsp of oil and add the onions. Season lightly with salt and allow them to cook for 1-2 minutes then add in the curry powder and stir, add the remaining oil as needed.
  3. Make room in the bottom of your pot and add the chicken and garlic, use more of the remaining oil as needed. Allow the chicken to cook for around 3 minutes on each side to develop color.
  4. Add 1 cup of water to the pot and reduce the heat to medium. Allow the chicken to cook in the water for around 10 minutes to finish the cooking process. Flip half way through.
  5. Remove the chicken from the pot and set aside. Add in the carrots and potatoes with an extra 1 cups of water, cover the pot and cook for 10-15 minutes or until the carrots and potatoes have softened.
  6. While the curry is stewing, cut the chicken into bite size pieces. If you find that the chicken isn't cooked all of the way through, that's okay, we are going to be adding it back to the pot.
  7. In a bowl, mix together the cornstarch and cold water to form a slurry. Once the carrots and potatoes have softened, slowly drizzle in the cornstarch slurry to the mix while constantly stirring. This will thicken the sauce.
  8. Add the chopped chicken back to the pot and stir in the soy sauce. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

For the Broccoli

  1. Cook your frozen broccoli according to the packaging. I use the microwave for ease but feel free to use fresh broccoli if you wish. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide your ingredients evenly between your 5 and add cup of rice to each.

Spicy Adobo Chicken and Peppers

This is a quick and simple meal that requires very little effort. Chicken thighs, rice, peppers, and onions mixed in diced chipotle peppers in adobo sauce to give the heat.

CourseCuisineTime - 35 minutes
Main Dishmeal prep, MexicanPrep - 10 minutes
Cook - 25 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
504kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates39g37%
Fat18g17%
Protein47g45%

Ingredients:

  • 2 lbs (908 g) boneless skinless chicken thighs
  • 1 tbsp (23 g) olive oil
  • 1 medium (150 g) red bell pepper
  • 1 medium (150 g) green bell pepper
  • 1 medium (200 g) onion
  • 3 cups (525 g) cooked rice
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) lime juice
  • 4 tbsp (60 g) chipotle peppers in adobo sauce
  • 1 tsp (3 g) garlic powder
  • salt and pepper to taste

Instructions:

For the Rice

  1. Cook enough rice to yield 3 cups of cooked rice. 1 cup of dry rice will yield between 2-3 cups of cooked rice.

For the Chicken

  1. I prefer to cook this in the air fryer. If you don't have one you can use the bake and broil method in the oven. Preheat your air fryer to 400F or your oven to 425F.
  2. Cut the chipotle peppers into a mince with some of the adobo sauce until you have about cup worth.
  3. Season the chicken with salt and pepper and add about 2 tbsp of the chipotle peppers and adobo sauce. Toss the chicken to coat with the sauce.
  4. Place the chicken into your air fryer basket and air fry for 8-12 minutes, flipping halfway.
  5. If you bake it, place it on a sheet pan in the oven on the top rack for 10 minutes, then turn the oven to broil and broil for about 3 minutes each side or until it has developed color. The thickness of your chicken will impact cooking time. If it needs more or less time, pull it out when it is done.

For the Peppers and Onion

  1. Wash and cut your peppers into a large dice. Cut the onion into slices.
  2. In a large skillet, heat some oil over medium high heat. Add the onions and cook for 4-5 minutes until they have begun to caramelize.
  3. Add more oil if needed and add in the peppers. Season with salt to help bring out some of the moisture. Cook for 3-4 minutes and remove from the pan.

For the Finished Dish

  1. Cut the chicken into a medium dice.
  2. Into a large skillet, add the chicken and allow it to develop a bit more color on all sides. Add in the peppers and onions, 3 cups of cooked rice and the remaining chipotle peppers. Toss to coat evenly.
  3. Add the garlic powder and lime juice. Stir to incorporate and season with salt and pepper to taste.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide the ingredients evenly 5 ways.

Peanut Chicken Noodles

Peanut Chicken Noodles made with chicken breasts, rice noodles, and broccoli slaw for a quick meal that comes together in under 30 minutes.

CourseCuisineTime - 30 minutes
Main DishAsian, meal prepPrep - 5 minutes
Cook - 25 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
489kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates47g45%
Fat14g13%
Protein42g40%

Ingredients:

  • 2 lbs Chicken breast
  • 1/2 lb pad Thai noodles
  • 12 oz broccoli slaw
  • 1 medium sweet onion
  • 2 tbsp olive oil
  • 1 tbsp garlic
  • 1 tsp garlic powder
  • 2 tbsp peanut butter
  • 1/2 cup chicken stock
  • 1 tbsp soy sauce
  • 1 tbsp rice vinegar
  • 1 tbsp sambal or sriracha
  • 2 stalks green onions optional
  • Lemon wedges for spritzing optional

Instructions:

  1. Prepare the chicken. You can cook it any way you wish. I used the air fryer for ease. Stovetop would be best as it is easier to properly cook. If you cook it on the stovetop cut or pound the breasts to even thickness throughout so they cook evenly. Slice into pieces after cooking.
  2. If you use the air fryer/oven, preheat to 400F. Cut the chicken into bite sized pieces and toss with some oil, garlic powder, salt and pepper. Air fry for 8-10 minutes. Shake occasionally. Dont over cook. You may have to bake it a bit longer if you use the oven.
  3. While the chicken is cooking place your noodles into some boiling water. You dont want to overcook these. They will go fast, 2-3 minutes probably. Once they have finished cooking, rinse and cover with cold water until ready to use.
  4. Cut your onion into slices. Add to a skillet over medium high heat with some oil and garlic. Saut a few minutes until they have softened and began to develop color.
  5. Add the broccoli slaw and pour a few tablespoons of water in to help it cook faster.
  6. Mix together the stock, sambal, soy sauce, vinegar, and peanut butter.
  7. Strain the noodles and add the vegetables, noodles, and chicken to a large bowl. Pour the sauce over top. Mix to combine.
  8. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide evenly 5 ways and top with green onions and a lemon wedge if preferred.

Peanut Ginger Chicken Rice Bowls

Peanut Ginger Chicken made with ground chicken, sweet potatoes, broccoli, red peppers, rice and served with a side of peanut ginger sauce.

CourseCuisineTime - 40 minutes 40 minutes 40 minutes
Main DishAsian, meal prepPrep - 10 minutes 10 minutes 10 minutes
Cook - 30 minutes 30 minutes 30 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
761kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates68g44%
Fat31g20%
Protein54g35%

Ingredients:

For the Bowls

  • 2 lbs (1135 g) ground chicken 92/8
  • lb (227 g) broccoli florets
  • 1 medium (150 g) red bell pepper
  • 1 large (200 g) sweet potato
  • 5 cups (750 g) cooked rice
  • 2 tbsp (30 g) olive oil
  • salt and pepper to taste

For the Peanut Sauce

  • cup (66 g) peanut butter
  • 2 tbsp (30 g) lime juice
  • 3 tbsp (45 g) water
  • 1 tbsp (20 g) soy sauce
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) brown sugar
  • 1 tsp (5 g) sriracha
  • 2 tsp (10 g) minced ginger

Instructions:

For the Rice

  1. Cook enough rice to yield 2 cups of cooked rice. 1 cup of dry rice will yield around 2-3 cups of cooked rice depending on what kind you use.

For the Vegetables

  1. Wash and cut your potatoes and broccoli into a large dice. You want them to be similar in size, roughly " cubes for the potatoes and match the broccoli to that size as best you can.
  2. Cut the red pepper into thin strips and cut the strips in half so you have pieces around 2 inches in length.
  3. Preheat your oven to 425F. On two separate oil sprayed sheet pans, add the potatoes and broccoli to their own pan and drizzle/toss each with oil and salt lightly.
  4. You can choose to either saut the peppers or roast them with the broccoli for ease, your choice. If you saut them, cook over medium high heat for 3-4 minutes or until they have softened.
  5. Roast the broccoli and potatoes for 8-10 minutes, remove from the oven and flip. Return to the oven to finish cooking, probably 3-5 minutes for the broccoli and 10 minutes for the potatoes. You'll want to watch the broccoli closely to ensure it is not burning. It is likely the broccoli will cook faster than the potatoes.
  6. Once everything has finished cooking, add to a large bowl.

For the Ground Chicken

  1. Heat a bit of oil over medium high heat. Add in the chicken and brown. Be sure to allow it time to develop color, do not stir it around too early or often. Often times with chicken, a lot of water will release into the pan, try to remove this as it occurs to help promote more even browning.
  2. Once the chicken has finished browning, season lightly with salt and pepper and add to the large bowl with the vegetables.

For the Bowls

  1. Measure out 2 cups of rice and add to the bowl with the vegetables and chicken. Stir to combine and taste. Season with salt and pepper as needed.

For the Peanut Sauce

  1. In a microwave safe bowl, add the peanut butter and microwave it for 20-30 seconds or until it has melted.
  2. Add the remaining ingredients for the sauce and stir to incorporate.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide your chicken and vegetable mixture evenly between your 5 containers. Divide the peanut sauce evenly in smaller separate containers as you will not want to reheat this in the microwave.

Chicken and Vegetable Rice Bowls with Orange Dijon Vinaigrette

Chicken breasts, mushrooms, zucchini, carrots, and onions mixed with a serving of rice and a side of an Orange Dijon Vinaigrette to pour over the top.

CourseCuisineTime - 45 minutes
Main DishAmerican, meal prepPrep - 10 minutes
Cook - 35 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
476kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates36g37%
Fat18g18%
Protein43g44%

Ingredients:

For the Rice Bowl

  • 2 lbs (908 g) boneless skinless chicken breast
  • medium (100 g ) onion
  • 2 medium (400 g) zucchini
  • 1 cups (150 g) shredded carrots
  • 8 oz (227 g) mushrooms
  • 2 tbsp (30 ml) olive oil
  • 3 cups (450 g) cooked rice

For the Vinaigrette

  • 2 tbsp (30 ml) orange juice freshly squeezed
  • 2 tbsp (30 ml) olive oil
  • cup (60 g) white wine vinegar
  • 1 tbsp (15 ml) Dijon mustard
  • tsp (2 g) garlic powder
  • tsp (2 g) oregano

Instructions:

For the Rice Bowls

  1. Cook enough rice to yield 3 cups of cooked rice. 1 cup of dry rice will make between 2-3 cups of cooked rice depending on what type you use.
