  2. Wash and cut all of your vegetables. Cut the onion into a small dice and the mushrooms, zucchini into a medium dice. You can cut your shredded carrots if you wish so they aren't so long, but you don't need to if you don't want to.
  3. Cut the chicken into a medium dice of similar size to your mushrooms and zucchini.
  4. Heat a large skillet over medium high heat and add some olive oil. Saut the onions for 2-3 minutes or until they begin to brown, then make some space in the center and add the carrots and zucchini. Add oil as necessary. Cook until the zucchini begins to develop some color, 2-3 minutes.
  5. Make some room in the center of the pan again and add the mushrooms. Cook until they have softened. Season with salt to taste and add the vegetable mixture to a large bowl.
  6. Heat some more oil in the pan over medium high to high heat and saut the chicken in batches until it is all cooked through. Season lightly with salt. It will cook quickly because it is in small pieces. Be careful not to overcook it but also try to get proper browning (don't stir too frequently).
  7. Measure out 3 cups of rice and add to the bowl with the vegetables. Add the chicken as well. Stir to incorporate and season with salt and pepper as needed.

**For the Vinaigrette **

  1. Add all of the ingredients to a bowl and whisk to emulsify.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide your ingredients evenly 5 ways. Store your vinaigrette in smaller, separate containers as you do not want to heat this up with your meal. Each dish gets 1 container of the vinaigrette.

California Burrito Bowls

California Burrito Bowls made with marinated chicken thighs, Mexican rice, potatoes, and vegetables. Served with a side of fresh Pico de Gallo for lots of low calorie flavor.

CourseCuisineTime - 1 hour 10 minutes
Main DishAmerican, meal prepPrep - 40 minutes
Cook - 30 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
521kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates39g37%
Fat21g20%
Protein44g42%

Ingredients:

For the Chicken

  • 2 lbs (1135 g) boneless skinless chicken thighs
  • 2 tsp (10 ml) soy sauce
  • 1 tbsp (15 ml) olive oil
  • 1 tbsp (22 ml) lime juice
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) adobo sauce canned chipotle peppers in adobo
  • 1 tsp (3 g) garlic powder
  • 1 tsp (3 g) onion powder
  • 1 tsp (3 g) paprika
  • tsp (2 g) salt
  • tsp (2 g) pepper

For the Rice

  • 2 cups (300 g) cooked rice
  • cup (120 g) tomato sauce
  • 1 tsp (3 g) cumin
  • 2 tbsp (10 g) cilantro chopped
  • salt to taste

For the Potatoes

  • 2 medium (350 g) russet potatoes
  • tbsp (8 g) olive oil
  • salt to taste

For the Vegetables

  • 1 medium (200 g) zucchini
  • 1 medium (150 g) bell pepper
  • tbsp (8 g) olive oil

For the Chipotle Mayo

  • 3 tbsp (45 g) mayo
  • 3 tbsp (45 g) plain nonfat Greek yogurt
  • 1 tsp (5 g) adobo sauce
  • 1 tsp (5 ml) lime juice
  • salt to taste

For the Pico de Gallo

  • 4 (160 g) Roma tomatoes
  • small (100 g) red onion
  • 1 tbsp (15 ml) lime juice
  • 1 small (15 g) jalapeno
  • 2 tbsp (10 g) cilantro
  • salt to taste

Instructions:

  1. Make sure you read through all of the instructions before you start. You want to multitask on your cooking to make things go smoothly.

For the Rice

  1. Cook enough rice to yield 2 cups of cooked rice. 1 cup of dry rice will yield between 2-3 cups of cooked rice depending on the kind you use.
  2. Heat a skillet over medium heat and add the tomato sauce. Cook for 2-3 minutes stirring occasionally.
  3. Add in the rice, cumin, cilantro, and salt to taste. Mix to combine.

For the Chicken

  1. In a bowl ziplock mix together the oil, soy sauce, lime juice, adobo sauce, garlic powder, onion powder, paprika, salt and pepper.
  2. In a large ziplock bag, add the chicken and pour over the sauce. Mix to coat the chicken and remove as much air as possible. Marinate for 30 minutes.
  3. Preheat your oven to 400F. (You can also cook this on the stovetop as well). Add your chicken to a wire rimmed baking sheet and roast for 20 minutes.
  4. Allow the chicken to rest and then cut into small pieces.
  5. If you'd like to add even more flavor to your chicken you can heat a skillet over medium high heat and cook the chicken for a few minutes to develop color on all sides. This is optional.

For the Vegetables

  1. Wash and cut your peppers and zucchini into a medium to large dice.
  2. Heat some oil in a large skillet over medium high heat. Cook the peppers and zucchini until they have begun to soften. Add salt and pepper to taste.

For the Pico de Gallo

  1. Wash all of your vegetables. Cut the tomatoes in half and remove the seeds. Cut them into a small dice.
  2. Place the tomatoes into a strainer and add salt. This will encourage excess water to come out of the tomatoes.
  3. Cut the onion, jalapeo, and cilantro into a small dice.
  4. Once the excess water has been drained, add the tomatoes, onion, jalapeo, and cilantro to a large bowl. Pour the lime juice over and salt to taste. Mix thoroughly.

For the Potatoes

  1. Wash and cut your potatoes into a medium dice.
  2. Preheat your oven or air fryer to 400F. Toss the potatoes in the oil and salt and roast for 15-20 minutes or until they have achieved proper browning, turning half way through. I used the air fryer at 400F for 15 minutes.

For the Chipotle Mayo

  1. Mix all of the ingredients together.

For the Bowl

  1. In a large bowl, add the chicken, rice, vegetables, and potatoes. Mix to combine and season as needed.
  2. In smaller separate containers, divide the pico evenly.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide all of your ingredients evenly between your 5 containers. Each container gets a side of pico and a side of mayo. I personally keep the mayo in a container in the fridge and add it to the top after reheating.

Mediterranean Chicken Rice Bowls

Chicken thighs, zucchini, mushrooms and rice mixed together in a Greek dressing and served with a side of hummus and marinated vegetables.

CourseCuisineTime - 1 hour 10 minutes 1 hour 10 minutes 1 hour 10 minutes
Main Dishmeal prep, MediterraneanPrep - 30 minutes 30 minutes 30 minutes
Cook - 40 minutes 40 minutes 40 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
676kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates56g41%
Fat28g20%
Protein50g37%

Ingredients:

For the Dressing

  • 3 tbsp (45 g) olive oil
  • 3 tbsp (45 ml) red wine vinegar
  • 2 tbsp (30 ml) lemon juice
  • 2 cloves (10 g) garlic
  • 1 tsp (2 g) oregano
  • tsp (1 g) salt
  • tsp (1 g) pepper
  • 1 tsp (5 g) dijon

For the Bowls

  • 2 lbs (1135 g) boneless skinless chicken thighs
  • 5 cups (750 g) cooked rice
  • cup (68 g) black olives sliced
  • 1 medium (200 g ) tomato
  • medium (100 g) cucumber
  • small (35 g) red onion
  • 2 small (400 g) zucchini
  • 8 oz (227 g) mushrooms
  • 10 tbsp (140 g) hummus store bought is easiest
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) olive oil
  • 5 tbsp (50 g) crumbled feta cheese

Instructions:

For the Rice

  1. Cook enough rice to yield 5 cups of cooked rice. 1 cup of dry rice will yield around 2-3 cups of cooked rice depending on the type of rice you use.

For the Dressing

  1. In a jar or a bowl, add all of the ingredients and shake/whisk until the oil has emulsified.

For the Chicken

  1. Place your chicken thighs into a large ziplock bag and pour half of the dressing over the top. Shake to mix and remove as much air from the bag as possible. Marinate for at least 20 minutes.
  2. Heat a grill pan or a skillet over medium high heat. Cook the chicken for 3-4 minutes each side. Cook it in batches if necessary.
  3. Cut the chicken into bite sized pieces and return to the hot pan to develop color on all sides, about 2-3 minutes.

For the Vegetables

  1. While the chicken is cooking, wash all of your vegetables.
  2. Cut the cucumber in half longways and remove the seeds. Cut into a small dice.
  3. Cut the red onion and tomato into a small dice.
  4. Cut the zucchini and mushrooms into a large dice.
  5. In a large skillet, add some olive oil over medium high heat. Add the zucchini and cook for 3-4 minutes or until they start to develop some color. Add the mushrooms and salt. Cook until the mushrooms have developed color and place into a large bowl.

For the Vegetable Dressing

  1. Mix together the cucumber, of the tomatoes, and red onion and place into a strainer and add salt. This will pull some of the excess water out.
  2. Drain the water and pour the vegetables into a bowl. Pour of the remaining dressing from your jar over the top and mix.

For the Bowls

  1. Measure out 3 cups of cooked rice and add to the large bowl with the zucchini and mushrooms.
  2. Add in the chicken, remaining tomatoes, drained olives, and the remaining dressing to the bowl. Mix and season with salt and pepper to taste.
  3. In smaller separate containers, add 2 tbsp of hummus and some of the vegetables that have been marinating in the dressing. You may have extra.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide your ingredients evenly 5 ways. Each dish gets a hummus/vegetable side. Top with feta cheese.

Sweet Chili Chicken Rice Bowls

These Sweet Chili Chicken Rice Bowls are packed with vegetables including carrots, bell peppers, and green beans. The sweet chili sauce and pineapple chunks make for a spicy and sweet flavor in every bite.

CourseCuisineTime - 40 minutes 40 minutes 40 minutes
Main DishAmerican, meal prepPrep - 10 minutes 10 minutes 10 minutes
Cook - 30 minutes 30 minutes 30 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
624kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates73g54%
Fat16g11%
Protein46g34%

Ingredients:

For the Rice

  • 5 cups (750 g) cooked rice

For the Sweet Chili Sauce

  • cup (45 g) sugar
  • 5 tbsp (75 ml) water
  • 1 tbsp (18 ml) rice vinegar regular vinegar is fine
  • 1 tbsp (18 g) sambal oelek any hot sauce will do, sambal is best
  • 2 tbsp (38 g) ketchup
  • 1 tsp (7 g) cornstarch
  • salt to taste

For the Bowls

  • 2 lbs (1135 g) boneless skinless chicken thighs
  • 1 medium (150 g) red pepper
  • 1 medium (150 g) yellow pepper
  • 12 oz (340 g) green beans fresh
  • 1 cup (375 g) pineapple I used canned chunks, frozen or fresh are great as well
  • 1 cup (100 g) carrots shredded. I buy these pre-shredded.
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) garlic minced
  • salt and pepper to taste
  • 3 tbsp (45 ml) olive oil

Instructions:

For the Rice

  1. Cook enough rice to yield 5 cups of cooked rice. 1 cup of dry rice will make around 2-3 cups of cooked rice depending on which type you use.

For the Chicken

  1. Preheat your oven to 400F.
  2. Drizzle the chicken lightly with olive oil and season with salt and pepper.
  3. Roast for 20-25 minutes. Don't cook the chicken past 165F. If your chicken is on the thicker side it may take a bit longer.

For the Vegetables

  1. Wash and cut your peppers and green beans. Cut the peppers into a large dice and the green beans into " pieces.
  2. You may want to steam your green beans in the microwave for a bit so they can cook through and not be so crisp.
  3. In a large skillet, heat a bit of oil over medium high heat. Add in the carrots and green beans. Cook for 2-3 minutes.
  4. Add in the garlic and stir. Make some room in the pan for the peppers and add a bit more oil. Add in the peppers to the center of the pan and cook until they have begun to soften, around 3-4 minutes.
  5. Place all of the vegetables into a large bowl.

For the Sauce

  1. Add the ketchup, water, vinegar, sugar, and sambal into a small sauce pot and bring to a boil over medium high heat. Stir to dissolve the sugar.
  2. Mix the cornstarch with 1 tsp of water to create a slurry.
  3. Once the sauce has reached a light boil, reduce to a simmer and stir in the cornstarch mixing constantly.
  4. Season with salt to taste.

For the Bowls

  1. Cut the chicken into a small dice.
  2. Pour the sauce over the chicken and coat it evenly.
  3. Add the chicken, rice, and pineapple to the bowl with the vegetables. Mix thoroughly and taste. Season with salt and pepper to your liking. Drizzle in 1 tbsp of olive oil.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide your mixture evenly between 5 containers.

Tex Mex Rice Bowls

Chicken breasts with rice, black beans, and vegetables mixed with a Mexican style red sauce. This dish is served with a side of pico de gallo for added freshness.

CourseCuisineTime - 50 minutes 50 minutes 50 minutes
Main Dishmeal prep, MexicanPrep - 15 minutes 15 minutes 15 minutes
Cook - 35 minutes 35 minutes 35 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
626kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates58g44%
Fat22g17%
Protein49g37%

Ingredients:

For the Pico de Gallo

  • 4 (240 g) Roma tomatoes
  • (100 g) red onion
  • 1 (15 g) jalapeo
  • bunch (15 g) cilantro
  • lime juice to taste
  • salt to taste

For the Red Sauce

  • 14 oz (411 g) fire roasted tomatoes canned
  • 1 tbsp (15 ml) vinegar
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) olive oil
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) garlic
  • 2 tbsp (20 g) red onion minced
  • 1 tbsp (8 g) chili powder
  • 1 tsp (2 g) oregano

For the Bowls

  • 2 lbs (1135 g) boneless skinless chicken thighs
  • 1 medium (200 g) zucchini
  • 1 medium (150 g) red pepper
  • 8 oz (227 g) mushrooms
  • 4 cups (600 g) cooked rice
  • 14 oz (411 g) black beans canned
  • 3 tbsp (52 ml) olive oil
  • salt and pepper to taste

Instructions:

For the Rice

  1. Cook enough rice to yield3cups of cooked rice. 1 cup of dry rice will make between 2-3 cups of cooked rice depending on what kind you use.

For the Chicken

  1. Preheat your oven to 400F.
  2. Pound or cut your chicken breast so it is even in thickness throughout. Drizzle with a bit of olive oil, salt, and pepper and place into a baking dish. Roast for 20-25 minutes or until the thickest part of the chicken reaches 165F.
  3. Cut into small pieces after it has finished cooking and rested for a couple of minutes.

For the Pico de Gallo

  1. Cut the tomatoes in half the long way and scoop out the seeds. Dice the tomatoes so they are about inch cubes and place in a large bowl.
  2. Diceof a red onion and add to the the tomatoes.
  3. Cut the stems off of the jalapeo pepper. Cut the pepper into a small dice and add to the mixture.
  4. NOTE: If you arent a fan of heat, then take out the ribs and seeds before chopping up the peppers.
  5. Cut the stems off of a small bunch of cilantro and finely chop the leaves until you have cup, add to the bowl.
  6. Cut a lime in half and squeeze its juice into the mixing bowl. Stir all of the ingredients together and add salt and pepper to taste.

For the Vegetables

  1. Wash and cut all of the vegetables into a medium dice.
  2. In a large skillet over medium high heat, add some oil and cook the zucchini and peppers for 2-3 minutes. Then add the mushrooms and salt lightly. Cook until the mushrooms have started to develop some color. Dump into a large bowl.

For the Red Sauce

  1. Add all of the sauce ingredients to a blender and blend until smooth.
  2. In a large skillet over medium high heat, add the sauce and cook for 1-2 minutes, stirring constantly.
  3. Add in the chicken and toss to coat. Dump the chicken into the bowl with the vegetables.

For the Bowls

  1. Measure out the rice and rinse the canned beans. Add to the bowl and mix. Drizzle in 2 tbsp of olive oil. Season with salt and pepper to taste. A touch of lime juice is nice as well.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide your ingredients 5 ways. Store the pico in a smaller, separate container.

Sawsawan Rice Bowls

Ground pork and turkey cooked with a variety of rice and vegetables including coleslaw mix, onions, carrots, and garlic. This is served with a side of sawsawan, a Filipino sauce that goes great on meat and rice.

CourseCuisineTime - 30 minutes 30 minutes 30 minutes
Main DishAsian, meal prepPrep - 10 minutes 10 minutes 10 minutes
Cook - 20 minutes 20 minutes 20 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
751kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates46g36%
Fat50g39%
Protein30g23%

Ingredients:

For the Main Dish

  • 2 lb (454 g) ground pork 75/25
  • 1 lb (908 g) coleslaw mix
  • medium (100 g) onion
  • 1 cup (100 g) shredded carrots
  • 1 (15 g) jalapeo optional
  • 4 cloves (16 g) garlic
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) olive oil
  • 4 cups (600 g) cooked rice

For the Sawsawan

  • 3 tbsp (25 g) red onion minced
  • 3 tbsp (25 g) cucumber minced
  • 1 small (10 g) serrano pepper optional
  • 6 tbsp (90 ml) vinegar
  • 4 tsp (20 ml) soy sauce
  • cup (60 ml) water
  • 1 tbsp (10 g) sugar

Instructions:

For the Rice

  1. Cook enough rice to yield 4 cups of cooked rice. 1 cup of dry rice will make between 2-3 cups of cooked rice depending on what kind you use.

For the Main Dish

  1. Heat a large skillet over medium high heat. Add in the pork and brown. Season lightly with salt and pepper.
  2. After the meat has cooked, removed it from the pan and place in a large bowl.
  3. Add some olive oil to the pan and add the onion, garlic, carrots, and jalapeo. Cook for 3-5 minutes or until the onion start to develop some color.
  4. Add in the coleslaw mix and cook an additional 3-5 minutes or until the cabbage has cooked through. Add to the bowl with the meat.
  5. Measure out 3 cups of cooked rice and add to the bowl. Mix everything together and season lightly with salt and pepper. The sawsawan has soy sauce in it so you don't want to over salt the mixture.

For the Sawsawan

  1. Wash and dice the cucumber until you have around cup. Dice the onion as well until you have a similar amount. If you are using a serrano cut it into thin slices.
  2. In a bowl, mix together the vinegar, water, soy sauce, and sugar. Mix until the sugar has dissolved. Give it a taste and adjust flavors as needed. If you aren't a big vinegar person, you may want to dilute it with a bit of water. The way it is written in the recipe is how my family has always prepared it.
  3. Add in the cucumbers, onion, and serrano. You may have extra after you allocate a bit for each dish. You can keep any extra in your fridge. It is great on rice and any meat!

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide your ingredients evenly 5 ways. Store the sawsawan in a smaller separate container as you don't want to heat this in the microwave. If you have containers with lids that would be preferred as it is a liquid.
  2. The sawsawan is meant to either be poured over the meal or have each bite dipped into the sauce.

Chimichurri Rice Bowls

Ground turkey, rice, sweet potatoes, and broccoli mixed together and served with a side of chimichurri sauce to go over the top. This meal is incredibly flavorful and a breeze to prep.

CourseCuisineTime - 40 minutes
Main DishAmerican, Argentinian, meal prepPrep - 15 minutes
Cook - 25 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
542kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates43g40%
Fat24g22%
Protein38g36%

Ingredients:

For the Main Dish

  • 2 lbs (908 g) ground turkey 93/7
  • 1 lb (454 g) frozen broccoli
  • 2 cups (300 g) cooked rice
  • 2 medium (500 g) sweet potatoes
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) olive oil
  • salt and pepper to taste

For the Chimichurri

  • cup (25 g) parsley chopped
  • cup (25 g) cilantro chopped
  • cup (60 ml) red wine vinegar
  • 3 tbsp (45 g) olive oil
  • 3 cloves (15 g) garlic
  • 2 tbsp (15 g) shallot minced
  • 1 tbsp (3 g) oregano

Instructions:

For the Rice

  1. Cook enough rice to yield 2 cups of cooked rice. 1 cup of dry rice will make between 2-3 cups of cooked rice depending on what kind you use.

For the Potatoes and Broccoli

  1. Wash and cut your potatoes into a large dice. If your broccoli is in large florets, cut it as well.
  2. I used an air fryer to cook these. Set your air fryer to the air fry setting at 400F. Add the potatoes and spray lightly with oil. Shake every few minutes. Once the potatoes have finished, remove and add the broccoli and cook for 8 minutes.
  3. If you don't have an air fryer, preheat your oven to 425F.
  4. Toss the potatoes in a bit of oil and spread on a sheet pan. Season lightly with salt and pepper. Roast for 10 minutes and then flip.
  5. When you remove the tray to flip the potatoes, add the broccoli and cook an additional 8-10 minutes. If your broccoli has lots of ice on the outside, you may want to use a separate sheet pan so the water that melts off doesn't soak the potatoes.

For the Turkey

  1. Heat a bit of oil in a large skillet over medium high heat. Add the turkey and brown. Cook off any water that remains in the pan. Season lightly with salt and pepper.
  2. Once the rice, broccoli, potatoes, and turkey have all cooked. Mix them all together in a giant bowl/pan. Season to taste.

For the Chimichurri

  1. Wash your parsley and cilantro. Dry with paper towels and cut of the stems. You don't need to pick off all of the leaves, just cut off the stem under the leaves.
  2. Roughly chop the leaves until you have 25 grams ( cup) worth of each.
  3. Peel the garlic and mince the onion until you have 15 grams (2 tbsp) worth.
  4. Place all of the ingredients into a blender or food processor and blend until it is homogenous and all of the ingredients are broken down.

Plating

  1. Divide the chimichurri evenly 5 ways. Store in a smaller separate container to place within your meal prep container. You could just mix in the chimichurri with the food but I find it better to keep on the side.
  2. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide the meat mixture evenly 5 ways between all of your containers.

Buffalo Chicken Rice Bowls

Chicken thighs, rice, mushrooms, zucchini, and onion cooked together and mixed with buffalo sauce. This is a highly palatable meal that is low on the calorie end and fairly satiating making it perfect for meal prep.

CourseCuisineTime - 40 minutes 40 minutes 40 minutes
Main DishAmerican, meal prepPrep - 10 minutes 10 minutes 10 minutes
Cook - 30 minutes 30 minutes 30 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
602kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates46g39%
Fat26g22%
Protein45g38%

Ingredients:

  • 2 lbs (1135 g) boneless skinless chicken thighs
  • 1 tbsp (8 g) chili powder
  • 2 tsp (6 g) salt
  • 1 tsp (2 g) pepper
  • 5 cups (750 g) cooked rice
  • 2 medium (400 g) zucchini
  • 8 oz (227 g) mushrooms
  • medium (100 g) onion
  • cup (56 g) cheddar cheese shredded
  • 3 tbsp (45 g) olive oil
  • 6 tbsp (90 g) buffalo sauce

Instructions:

For the Rice

  1. Cook enough rice to yield 5 cups of cooked rice. 1 cup of dry rice will make around 2-3 cups of cooked rice depending on what kind you use.

For the Chicken

  1. In a large bowl add the chicken, a bit of oil, chili powder, salt, and pepper. Toss to coat.
  2. You can cook your chicken however you like. I baked mine at 425F for 10 minutes and then broiled it on the top rack for 5 minutes to develop color. Cut into 1 inch pieces. If you would rather pan fry it follow the instructions in the next step.
  3. Heat a grill pan or a skillet over medium high heat and add some oil. Cook the chicken thighs for 4-5 minutes on each side. Cut them into a large dice and return to the pan to develop color.

For the Vegetables

  1. Wash and cut your zucchini into a small dice and mushrooms into a large dice. Cut the onion into a small dice.
  2. Heat a large skillet over medium high heat. Add oil and saute the onions for a couple of minutes.
  3. Add a bit more oil and add in the mushrooms, season with salt to help bring out the water. Allow them to cook and develop color.
  4. Add in the zuchinni and cook until soft.
  5. Measure out 3 cups of cooked rice and add to a large bowl. Mix in the chicken, vegetables, cheese, and buffalo sauce. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide your ingredients evenly 5 ways.

Honey Mustard Turkey

Ground turkey flavored with a honey mustard sauce made from Greek yogurt instead of mayo. The turkey is served with a side of roasted broccoli and sweet potatoes.

CourseCuisineTime - 50 minutes 50 minutes 50 minutes
Main DishAmerican, meal prepPrep - 20 minutes 20 minutes 20 minutes
Cook - 30 minutes 30 minutes 30 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
670kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates65g50%
Fat31g24%
Protein33g25%

Ingredients:

For the Turkey

  • 1 lbs (681 g) ground beef 85/15
  • 8 oz (227 g) fresh green beans
  • 3 (20 g) green onions
  • 1 tbsp (22 g) olive oil
  • salt and pepper to taste

For the Honey Mustard

  • cup (60 g) mayo
  • 2 tbsp (42 g) honey
  • 2 tbsp (30 g) mustard I think it's best to use half dijon and half yellow
  • salt to taste

For the Broccoli

  • 1 lb (454 g) broccoli
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) olive oil
  • salt and pepper to taste

For the Sweet Potatoes

  • 3 large (1200 g) sweet potatoes
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) olive oil
  • salt and pepper to taste

Instructions:

For the Sweet Potatoes

  1. Preheat your oven to 425F.
  2. Wash and cut your sweet potatoes into a large dice. Toss in a large bowl with oil, salt, and pepper.
  3. Spread on a sheet pan and roast for 10 minutes, then turn. Cook an additional 10 minutes or until you have achieved your preferred level of browning.

For the Broccoli

  1. Wash and cut your broccoli into florets. Toss with oil, salt, and pepper.
  2. Spread on a sheet pan and roast for 5-7 minutes and turn. Cook an additional 4-5 minutes. If your florets are smaller they will take less time to cook.

For the Turkey

  1. Heat some oil in a large skillet over medium high heat. Add the turkey and brown. Cook off any water remaining.
  2. Season lightly with salt and pepper and remove from pan.
  3. Wash and roughly chop the green beans and onions into small pieces. You can cook these in a separate pan if you want this to go faster.
  4. Once the turkey has finished, add a bit more oil to the pan and cook the onion and green beans together. It may help to add a bit of water to steam the green beans so they cook faster. Cook for a few minutes.
  5. Add the turkey back to the pan and stir to incorporate. Lightly season to taste. Turn off the heat.
  6. In a bowl, mix the yogurt, mustard, and honey together. Stir into the turkey.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide the ingredients evenly between your 5 containers.

Chorizo Breakfast Bowls

Chorizo, scrambled eggs, and a pepper, onion, and potato mixture. There is only a bit of chorizo in this dish but it provides so much flavor that any more may be too rich.

CourseCuisineTime - 35 minutes 35 minutes 35 minutes
Breakfastmeal prep, MexicanPrep - 10 minutes 10 minutes 10 minutes
Cook - 25 minutes 25 minutes 25 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
591kcal4
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates36g34%
Fat36g34%
Protein32g30%

Ingredients:

  • 8 (8 ) eggs
  • 1 lb (680 g) Yukon gold potatoes
  • medium (100 g) onion
  • 2 medium (300 g) bell peppers
  • 12 oz (340 g) chorizo
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) olive oil
  • salt and pepper to taste

Instructions:

For the Potatoes

  1. Preheat your oven to 425F
  2. Wash and cut your potatoes into a medium dice.
  3. Add to a sheet pan with some olive oil and sprinkle with salt and pepper. Roast for 10 minutes and then flip. Cook an additional 8-10 minutes or until you achieve proper browning.

For the Pepper and Onion Mix

  1. Wash and chop your onion and peppers into a medium dice. Saut in olive oil until softened. Stir in the potatoes.

For the Chorizo and Scrambled Eggs

  1. Cook the chorizo and scrambled eggs, together is fine, separate if you'd prefer the separation. Be careful not to overcook your eggs as you will be reheating them again in the microwave if you are meal prepping this dish.

Plating

  1. Divide ingredients evenly 4 ways. This recipe makes 4 servings.

Ham & Apple Breakfast Scramble

A hearty breakfast loaded with sweet potatoes, ham, green pepper, golden delicious apples and scrambled eggs. It packs a ton of flavor into every bite to start your day off right.

CourseCuisineTime - 30 minutes 30 minutes 30 minutes
BreakfastAmerican, meal prepPrep - 10 minutes 10 minutes 10 minutes
Cook - 20 minutes 20 minutes 20 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
568kcal4
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates44g41%
Fat28g26%
Protein34g32%

Ingredients:

  • lb (340 g) ham steak
  • 10 eggs
  • cup (60 ml) milk
  • 2 (600 g) large sweet potato
  • (75 g) small onion
  • 1 (125 g) small green pepper
  • 1 (125 g) golden delicious apple
  • 1 (125 g) avocado
  • 2 Tbsp (30 ml) olive oil

Instructions:

  1. Preheat your oven to 400F.
  2. Wash and peel your sweet potato. Cut it into a small/medium dice. Drizzle 1 Tbsp olive oil over the top and roast at 400F for 10 minutes and flip. Cook an additional 5-10 minutes. or until proper browning has been achieved.
  3. Cut the onion and pepper in a small dice. Add some oil to a skillet over medium high heat. Cook until the onions are soft and translucent. Remove from pan.
  4. Scramble 6 eggs with the milk and cook over medium heat until cooked. Set aside.
  5. Cut the ham into a large dice and saut in skillet until browned.
  6. Cut the apple into a large dice. Dont cook this as it will cook in the microwave and you want it to maintain texture.
  7. Add all of you ingredients (minus the avocado) into the pan and stir to incorporate.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 4 servings. Divide your ingredients evenly between your 4 containers. Top with a few slices of avocado if desired.

Creamy Salsa Verde Grain Bowls

Shelled edamame, corn, black beans and red bell peppers cooked together and served over the top of a bed of rice. This dish is served with a side of creamy salsa verde to pour over the top for added flavor.

CourseCuisineTime - 35 minutes 35 minutes 35 minutes
Main Dishmeal prep, MexicanPrep - 10 minutes 10 minutes 10 minutes
Cook - 25 minutes 25 minutes 25 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
683kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates102g68%
Fat16g10%
Protein32g21%

Ingredients:

For the Plant Mix

  • 1 lb (454 g) shelled edamame frozen
  • 1 medium (150 g) red pepper
  • 14.5 oz (411 g) black beans 1 can
  • 1 cup (170 g) corn frozen or canned
  • 1 tbsp (6 g) cumin
  • 2 tsp (4 g) chili powder
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) olive oil
  • 1-2 tbsp (30 ml) water
  • 1 cup dry lentils
  • salt and pepper to taste

For The Salsa Verde

  • 5 small (300 g) tomatillos
  • 1 (15 g) jalapeo pepper
  • 1 (10 g) serrano pepper
  • 1 small (150 g) white onion
  • 3 cloves (15 g) garlic
  • bunch (12 g) cilantro
  • 1 (15 ml) lime, juiced
  • 1 small (125 g) avocado
  • 1 tbsp (5 g) olive oil
  • salt to taste

For the Rice

  • 3 cups (562.5 g) cooked rice
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) olive oil
  • salt and pepper to taste

Instructions:

For the Salsa Verde

  1. Preheat your oven to 400F.
  2. Wash all of your vegetables. Cut the tops off of the peppers and cut the onion in half.
  3. Place the tomatoes, peppers, peeled garlic, and the onion to a sheet pan. Cover with oil and salt. Roast for 10-15 minutes or until all of the vegetables have softened.
  4. Place the roasted vegetables to a blender, add in bunch of cilantro, 1 tbsp of lime juice, and salt. Add lime juice and salt to taste. Adjust as needed.
  5. Allow the salsa to cool to room temperature and blend in the avocado until it is creamy and smooth.

For the Rice

  1. Cook enough rice to yield 4 cups of cooked rice. 1 cup of dry rice will yield between 2-3 cups of cooked rice depending on the type of rice you use.
  2. Measure out 3 cups of rice. Add in the olive oil and salt and pepper to taste.

For the Plant Mix

  1. Rinse the lentils and clean out any debris. Start a pot of water over high heat and bring to a boil. Boil the lentils until they have softened and drain.
  2. Place the frozen corn and shelled edamame into the microwave and cook until it has thawed. Drain off any water.
  3. Wash and cut the pepper into slices.
  4. Heat a large skillet over medium high heat and add a bit of oil. Add in the red peppers and cook until soft. Remove from the pan and heat a bit more oil.
  5. Drain and rinse your black beans.
  6. Add in the corn, edamame, lentils and black beans. Cook for a few minutes, stirring every so often do develop some color on the pieces. Add oil as necessary.
  7. After they have cooked for a few minutes, add back the peppers and stir in the cumin, chili powder, and salt and pepper. Add in 1-2 tbsp of water to help the seasonings incorporate.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Add cup of rice to each dish, divide the plant mixture evenly 5 ways, and store the salsa verde in a separate smaller container. It is likely you will have extra salsa.

Sriracha Ranch Turkey Bowls

Ground turkey flavored with ranch dressing mix, sriracha, and rice vinegar and served with a side of sauteed onions and zucchini. This is a quick dish for those weeks you don't want to spend time in the kitchen.

CourseCuisineTime - 30 minutes 30 minutes 30 minutes
Main DishAmerican, Asian, meal prepPrep - 5 minutes 5 minutes 5 minutes
Cook - 25 minutes 25 minutes 25 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
659kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates54g42%
Fat32g25%
Protein40g31%

Ingredients:

For the Turkey

  • 2 lbs (908 g) ground beef 85/15
  • 2 tbsp (24 g) ranch dressing mix
  • 2 tbsp (30 ml) rice vinegar
  • 2 tbsp (30 ml) sriracha
  • 1 tsp (5 ml) olive oil
  • Salt and pepper to taste

For the Rice

  • 5 cups (750 g) cooked rice

For the Zucchini and Onions

  • 2 small (300 g) sweet onions
  • 2 medium (500 g) zucchinis
  • 1 tbsp (15 ml) olive oil
  • 1 tsp (3 g) garlic powder
  • salt and pepper to taste

Instructions:

For the Rice

  1. Cook enough rice to yield 5 cups of cooked rice. 1 cup of dry rice will yield around 2-3 cups of cooked rice depending on what kind of rice you use.

For the Turkey

  1. Heat a bit of olive oil in a large skillet over medium high heat. Add the turkey and cook until it has browned. Boil off any water that remains in the skillet from the turkey.
  2. Mix the vinegar, ranch mix, and sriracha together. Pour over the turkey and stir to incorporate. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

For the Zucchini and Onions

  1. Peel your oniona and cut into thin slices. Heat some oil over medium high heat in a skillet and add the onions. Cook them until they have begun to caramelize. Season with salt and pepper.
  2. Wash and cut the zucchini into a large dice. Add some oil to the pan and cook for a few minutes until they have begun to soften and develop color. Season with salt, pepper, and garlic powder to taste.
  3. You can cook the onions and zucchini together if you wish, they are separated in the image to show detail.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide your ingredients evenly 5 ways. Add 1 cup of rice to each dish.

For the Beef

  1. Heat a bit of olive oil in a large skillet over medium high heat. Add the beef and cook until it has browned. Boil off any water that remains in the skillet from the beef.
  2. Mix the vinegar, ranch mix, and sriracha together. Pour over the beef and stir to incorporate. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

Pepper Jack Turkey Breakfast Bowls

Ground turkey topped with a slice of melty pepper jack cheese and served with a side of potatoes o'brien and 2 hardboiled eggs.

CourseCuisineTime - 40 minutes 40 minutes 40 minutes
BreakfastAmerican, meal prepPrep - 10 minutes 10 minutes 10 minutes
Cook - 30 minutes 30 minutes 30 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
607kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates39g33%
Fat30g26%
Protein46g40%

Ingredients:

For the Turkey

  • 2 lbs (908 g) ground turkey 93/7
  • 6 tbsp (100 g) tomato paste
  • cup (60 g) ketchup
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) dijon mustard
  • 1 tbsp (15 ml) olive oil
  • cup (120 ml) water
  • Salt and pepper to taste
  • 3 slices (75 g) pepper jack cheese

For the Potatoes O'Brien

  • 5 small (750 g) potatoes
  • 2 medium (300 g) bell peppers
  • medium (100 g) onion
  • 1 tbsp (23 ml) olive oil
  • Salt and pepper to taste

For the Eggs

  • 10 eggs

Instructions:

For the Hard Boiled Eggs

  1. Place 10 eggs in to a sauce pot and cover with water and a splash or two of vinegar.
  2. Bring to a boil and cover with a tight fitting lid. Remove from the heat and set a timer for 12 minutes.
  3. Drain the water and rinse with cold water to stop the cooking. Peel the eggs and cut them in half.

For the Potatoes

  1. Preheat your oven to 425F.
  2. Wash and cut your potatoes, peppers, and onion into a small dice. Toss in a bowl with olive oil, salt, and pepper until everything has been coated evenly.
  3. Spread out on a sheet pan or two and bake for 10-12 minutes, remove from the oven and flip. Return to the oven for another 8-10 minutes or until proper browning is achieved.

For the Turkey

  1. Heat some olive oil over medium high heat. Add in the turkey and cook until it has browned and any remaining water has been boiled off.
  2. Add in the tomato paste, ketchup, mustard, and water. Stir to incorporate. Allow it to cook for a few minutes so that the flavors can come together.
  3. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide your ingredients evenly between your 5 containers. Add a slices of pepper jack cheese to the top of the turkey mixture.

Chicken Paprikash

Chicken Paprikash is a popular, paprika heavy Hungarian dish that is traditionally served with noodles or rice. Often times it is served with the chicken on the bone but for meal prep purposes we use boneless skinless chicken thighs to make eating as easy as possible.

CourseCuisineTime - 50 minutes 50 minutes 50 minutes
Main DishHungarian, meal prepPrep - 10 minutes 10 minutes 10 minutes
Cook - 40 minutes 40 minutes 40 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
612kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates58g45%
Fat20g15%
Protein50g39%

Ingredients:

For the Rice

  • 5 cups (750 g) cooked rice
  • 3 tbsp olive oil

For the Chicken

  • 2 lbs (1135 g) boneless skinless chicken thighs
  • 1 tbsp (15 ml) olive oil
  • medium (100 g) onion
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) minced garlic
  • 3 tbsp (24 g) paprika
  • 1 tsp (3 g) chili powder
  • 15 oz (425 g) crushed tomatoes
  • 1 cup (240 ml) chicken broth
  • cup (113 g) plain nonfat Greek yogurt
  • Salt and pepper to taste

For the Broccoli

  • 1 lb (454 g) broccoli florets

Instructions:

For the Rice

  1. Cook enough rice to yield 5 cups of cooked rice. 1 cup of dry rice will yield around 3 cups of cooked rice depending on what kind of rice you use. Mix in the olive oil and season lightly with salt.

For the Chicken

  1. Measure out your yogurt and place it on the counter while you cook everything else so that it can come up to room temperature.
  2. Heat some olive oil in a large skillet over medium high heat. Add in the chicken thighs and cook for 3-4 minutes on each side.
  3. After the chicken has cooked, cut it into a large dice and return back to the pan to develop color on all sides.
  4. While the chicken is cooking cut your onion into a small dice and mince your garlic.
  5. After the chicken has finished cooking, remove it from the pan. You should have plenty of oil remaining in the skillet to cook the onions and garlic.
  6. Add the onions and garlic and sautee for a couple of minutes. Sprinkle the paprika and chili powder over the onions and toast the spices for a bit. Make sure you are constantly stirring as the spices can burn rather quickly.
  7. Pour in the tomatoes and chicken broth and bring to a light boil. Lower the heat to low and allow the sauce to reduce and thicken. It will probably take 10-15 minutes.
  8. After the sauce has thickened, stir one spoonful of the hot tomato mixture into the yogurt to bring it up to temperature. If you pour the yogurt directly into the sauce it will curdle the milk and become grainy.
  9. Add spoonfuls of the yogurt to the skillet slowly and stir to incorporate. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

For the Broccoli

  1. Steam the broccoli for 4-5 minutes until it has softened a bit but is not mushy. (I reccommend cutting the broccoli into small pieces and just throwing the broccoli in with the tomato sauce while it reduces, but this won't be as pretty to look at)

Sloppy Joe Breakfast Bowls

Sloppy Joes in breakfast form. This recipe uses ground turkey coated in a sweet tomato based sauce and paired with roasted sweet potatoes and hard boiled eggs.

CourseCuisineTime - 40 minutes 40 minutes 40 minutes
BreakfastAmerican, meal prepPrep - 10 minutes 10 minutes 10 minutes
Cook - 30 minutes 30 minutes 30 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
688kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates49g38%
Fat35g27%
Protein44g34%

Ingredients:

  • 1 lbs (681 g) Ground beef 85/15
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) Olive Oil
  • 1 medium (150 g) Green Bell Pepper
  • medium (100 g) Sweet Onion
  • cup (74 g) Tomato Paste
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) Worcestershire Sauce
  • 1 Tbsp (15 g) Dijon Mustard
  • 3 Tbsp (45 g) Ketchup
  • 1 Tbsp (5 g) Onion Powder
  • 1 tsp (3 g) Red Pepper Flakes
  • 12 Hardboiled Eggs
  • 4 medium (1000 g) Sweet Potato
  • Salt and pepper to taste

Instructions:

For the Potatoes

  1. Preheat your oven to 425F. Cut potatoes into a small/medium dice. Roast with tbsp oil for 20 minutes. Flip half way. Cook until you get optimal browning.

For the Turkey

  1. Cut the pepper and onion into a small dice. Add Tbsp of olive oil in a skillet and add the pepper and onion. Cook until translucent and add the ground turkey. Cook until browned.
  2. Once the turkey has cooked, stir in tomato paste, Worcestershire sauce, Dijon mustard, ketchup, onion powder, red pepper flakes, and salt and pepper.

For the Hard Boiled Eggs

  1. Place 10 eggs in a pot of water and bring to a boil. Once boiling, turn off the heat and cover for 12 minutes. Rinse with cold water and peel.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide your ingredients eveny 5 ways. 1 dish will only get 4 egg halves.

Naked Nashville Hot Chicken

Grilled chicken breasts coated in a classic Nashville Hot Chicken sauce made. It is spicy with a touch of sweetness and loads of flavor. This meal is served with a side of roasted potatoes and vegetables.

CourseCuisineTime - 45 minutes 45 minutes 45 minutes
Main DishAmerican, meal prepPrep - 15 minutes 15 minutes 15 minutes
Cook - 30 minutes 30 minutes 30 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
664kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates71g47%
Fat13g8%
Protein65g43%

Ingredients:

For the Chicken and Sauce

  • 3 lbs (1362 g) boneless skinless chicken breast
  • 1 tbsp (15 ml) olive oil
  • 3 tbsp (45 g) vinegar based hot sauce I use Franks Red Hot
  • 1 tsp (3 g) cayenne pepper
  • 1 tsp (3 g) chili powder
  • 2 tsp (8 g) garlic powder
  • 3 tbsp (36 g) brown sugar
  • 1 tbsp (15 ml) water
  • Salt and pepper to taste

For the Potatoes

  • 10 small (1500 g) russet potatoes
  • 5 tbsp (30 ml) olive oil
  • Salt and pepper to taste

For the Vegetables

  • 1 lb (454 g) frozen peas and carrots
  • 1 tbsp (14 g) butter
  • Salt and pepper to taste

Instructions:

For the Potatoes

  1. Preheat your oven to 425F.
  2. Wash and cut your potatoes into a large dice.
  3. Toss the potatoes with 1 tbsp of oil and salt and pepper. Spread on a sheet pan and bake for 12 mintues and then remove from oven and flip. Cook an additional 10-15 minutes or until you have achieved proper browning.

For the Chicken

  1. Cut your chicken breast into thin pieces. I prefer to cut mine into pieces about " thick and 1-2 inches in length and width.
  2. Toss the chicken in oil to evenly coat each side and lightly season with salt and pepper.
  3. Heat a grill pan or skillet over medium high heat. Cook the chicken for a couple of minutes on each side until it has cooked throughout.

For the Sauce

  1. Mix the hot sauce, cayenne pepper, chili powder, garlic powder, brown sugar, and water together.
  2. Heat a skillet over medium heat. Add the sauce and bring to a light boil. We are just trying to caramalize the sugars a bit so it thickens, we don't want to reduce the sauce too much.
  3. Add in the chicken and stir to coat.

For the Vegetables

  1. Microwave the frozen peas and carrots and add 1 tbsp of butter and salt and pepper to taste.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide your ingredients evenly 5 ways.

Apple Pie Baked Oatmeal

Sliced Apples cooked in reduced brown sugar and cinnamon and layered inside of an oatmeal and egg mixture. This is a great meal for those weeks you prefer something sweet to have in the morning.

CourseCuisineTime - 50 minutes
BreakfastAmerican, meal prepPrep - 10 minutes
Cook - 40 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
361kcal6
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates52g65%
Fat9g11%
Protein18g22%

Ingredients:

  • 3 cups (240 g) old fashioned oats
  • 2 scoops (60 g) vanilla protein powder
  • 1 tsp (4 g) baking powder
  • 4 medium (600 g) apples peeled
  • cup (48 g) brown sugar
  • 1 tbsp (8 g) cinnamon
  • 2 tbsp (28 g) butter
  • 2 eggs
  • 2 cups (480 g) skim milk
  • 5 tbsp (60 g) vanilla Greek yogurt optional for frosting

Instructions:

For the Apples

  1. Wash and peel the apples. Cut them in half and remove the cores. Cut them into thin slices.
  2. Heat a large skillet over medium heat. Add 1 tbsp of butter and then add the apples.
  3. Sprinkle the cinnamon and brown sugar over the top. Cook until the sugar has reduced and the apples have become soft.

For the Oatmeal Bake

  1. Preheat your oven to 375F.
  2. In a large bowl, mix together the oats, protein powder, and baking powder.
  3. In a separate bowl, whisk together the eggs, milk, and 1 tbsp of melted butter. Pour over the top of the apples and oats and mix.
  4. Spray a 13"x9" pan with oil and add the oat mixture and apples.
  5. Bake for 30-35 minutes.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 6 servings. Cut the oatmeal into 6 equal pieces. You can use vanilla greek yogurt as a frosting if you wish.

Island Teriyaki Chicken

Chicken thighs tossed in a flavorful sauce of citrus, garlic, ginger, and sugar. This dish is served with a side of rice and vegetables.

CourseCuisineTime - 40 minutes 40 minutes 40 minutes
Main DishAsian, meal prepPrep - 10 minutes 10 minutes 10 minutes
Cook - 30 minutes 30 minutes 30 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
597kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates60g46%
Fat16g12%
Protein53g41%

Ingredients:

For the Chicken

  • 3 lbs (1362 g) chicken thighs
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) olive oil

For the Rice

  • 5 cups (750 g) cooked rice

For the Sauce

  • 2 tbsp (18 g) ginger minced
  • 1 tbsp (18 g) garlic minced
  • cup (24 g) green onions chopped
  • 5 tbsp (72 ml) soy sauce
  • 5 tbsp (72 ml) pineapple juice
  • 2 tbsp (29 g) brown sugar
  • 2 tbsp (36 ml) lime juice
  • 2 tsp (8 g) cornstarch
  • 2 tsp (10 ml) water

For the Vegetables

  • 2 medium (500 g) zucchini
  • 2 medium (300 g) red peppers
  • 1 tbsp (15 ml) olive oil

Instructions:

For the Rice

  1. Cook enough rice to yield 5 cups of cooked rice. 1 cup of dry rice will yield around 2-3 cups of cooked rice depending on the type you have.

For the Sauce

  1. Add all of the sauce ingredients to a small pot except for the cornstarch and water and bring to a light boil.
  2. Mix the cornstarch and water into a slurry. Once the sauce is boiling, reduce the heat to low and slowly stir in the cornstarch to thicken.

For the Chicken

  1. Heat 1 Tbsp of oil in a large skillet over medium high heat. Cook the chicken in batches for 3-4 minutes on each side. You know the chicken is ready to flip when the white begins to creep up the side of the thigh.
  2. After the chicken has cooked, chop it into one inch pieces and return to the pan to develop color on each side.
  3. Pour the sauce over the top and toss to coat.

For the Vegetables

  1. Wash and cut your zucchini and peppers into a medium dice.
  2. Add some oil to a large skillet over medium high heat and cook until the vegetables have softened. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide your ingredients evenly 5 ways and add 1 cup of rice to each container.

Lemon Garlic Pasta

Brown rice fusilli and ground turkey mixed in a lemon, garlic and butter sauce. A flavorful dish that includes frozen peas and chopped kale to provide some nutrients that heats up wonderfully in the microwave.

CourseCuisineTime - 40 minutes 40 minutes 40 minutes
Main DishItalian, meal prepPrep - 10 minutes 10 minutes 10 minutes
Cook - 30 minutes 30 minutes 30 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
794kcal6
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates76g49%
Fat35g22%
Protein43g27%

Ingredients:

  • 2 lb (908 g) ground beef 85/15
  • 1 lb (454 g) brown rice fusilli pasta any kind of pasta works
  • 1 lb (454 g) frozen peas
  • cup (60 ml) lemon juice
  • medium (100 g) onion
  • 1 tbsp (14 g) butter
  • 6 cloves (30 g) garlic
  • 14.5 oz (411 g) petite diced tomatos 1 can
  • 1 bunch (50 g) lacinato kale regular kale or spinach is fine
  • cup (80 g) parmesan cheese shredded
  • 2 tbsp (30 ml) olive oil
  • cup (120 ml) pasta water

Instructions:

For the Pasta

  1. Cook the noodles per the instructions on the package and reserve at least cup of the pasta water for the sauce.
  2. In a large skillet, heat some olive oil over medium high heat and brown the turkey.
  3. While the turkey is cooking, cut the onion and garlic into a small dice and squeeze the juice out of the lemons.
  4. In a large pot, saute the onions in a bit of olive oil over medium heat until they are soft. Add in the butter and garlic and cook until fragrant.
  5. Stir in 2 tbsp of lemon juice and, peas, and canned tomatoes. Allow the flavors to cook and come together for a couple of minutes.
  6. Add in the noodles, turkey, kale, parmesan cheese, and cup of pasta water. Stir and season with salt, pepper, and the remaining lemon juice to taste.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 6 servings. Divide your ingredients evenly 6 ways.

Maple Buffalo Chicken with Roasted Potatoes

Pan fried chicken thighs tossed with a mixture of buffalo sauce and maple syrup. This dish is served with a side of green beans and roasted potatoes. The sweetness of the maple syrup and the tangyness of the buffalo sauce makes an unconventional pairing that creates a perfect savory and sweet flavor profile.

CourseCuisineTime - 50 minutes 50 minutes 50 minutes
Main DishAmerican, meal prepPrep - 10 minutes 10 minutes 10 minutes
Cook - 40 minutes 40 minutes 40 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
661kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates70g51%
Fat22g16%
Protein45g32%

Ingredients:

For the Chicken and Sauce

  • 2 lbs (1135 g) boneless skinless chicken thighs
  • 1 tbsp (15 ml) olive oil
  • cup (60 g) buffalo sauce
  • 3 tbsp (60 g) maple syrup
  • salt and pepper to taste

For the Potatoes

  • 5 large (1500 g) russet potatoes
  • 2 tbsp (30 ml) olive oil
  • 8 oz (227 g) mushrooms
  • salt and pepper to taste

For the Green Beans

  • 1 lb (454 g) green beans fresh or frozen

Instructions:

For the Potatoes

  1. Preheat the oven to 450F.
  2. Wash and cut your potatoes and mushrooms into a medium dice. The smaller you cut the faster they will roast.
  3. In a large bowl, add the potatoes, olive oil, and a bit of salt and pepper. Toss to coat and place on a large sheet pan.
  4. Roast for 10-15 minutes and remove from the oven. Flip the potatoes and add the mushrooms. Cook an additional 10 minutes or until you have achieved the crispiness you desire.

For the Chicken

  1. Heat some oil in a large grill pan or skillet over medium high heat.
  2. Add the chicken thighs and cook for 3-4 minutes on each side. You know they are ready to turn when the white starts to creep up around the side of the thigh. Cook in batches to not overcrowd the pan.
  3. While the chicken is cooking, stir together the buffalo sauce and syrup in a bowl.
  4. Chop the chicken into 1 inch pieces and return to the pan to develop color on all sides of the meat.
  5. Pour the sauce over and mix to incorporate.

For the Green Beans

  1. If you use frozen green beans, cook them in the microwave until they are thawed. If you use fresh, steam them until they are soft.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide your ingredients evenly 5 ways.

Honey Ginger Chicken

Chicken thighs tossed in a garlic, ginger and honey based sauce and served with a side of rice and steamed vegetables. Broccoli, cabbage, and kale make up the trio of vegetables in this dish. They are tossed in a garlic butter and ginger sauce.

CourseCuisineTime - 50 minutes 50 minutes 50 minutes
Main Dishmeal prepPrep - 10 minutes 10 minutes 10 minutes
Cook - 40 minutes 40 minutes 40 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
658kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates50g40%
Fat24g19%
Protein51g40%

Ingredients:

For the Chicken

  • 3 lbs (1362 g) boneless skinless chicken thighs
  • 1 tbsp (23 ml) olive oil
  • 2 tsp sesame seeds optional

For the Sauce

  • 1 tbsp (18 g) ginger minced
  • 2 tsp (12 g) garlic minced
  • 3 tbsp (75 g) honey
  • 2 tsp (12 ml) apple cider vinegar
  • 2 tbsp (36 ml) soy sauce

For the Vegetables

  • 12 oz (340 g) broccoli florets
  • 3 cups (60 g) kale chopped
  • 3 cups (240 g) cabbage chopped
  • 2 tsp (10 g) garlic minced
  • 2 tsp (10 g) ginger minced
  • 1 tbsp (14 g) butter
  • 1 tbsp (23 ml) soy sauce
  • cup (60 ml) water

For the Rice

  • 5 cups (875 g) cooked rice

Instructions:

For the Rice

  1. Cook enough rice to yield 5 cups of cooked rice. 1 cup of dry rice will make 2-3 cups of cooked rice depending on what type of rice you use.

For the Sauce

  1. Heat a small sauce pot over medium heat and add a bit of oil. Stir in the garlic and ginger and cook for a minute or two. Stir frequently so they don't burn.
  2. Stir in the vinegar, honey, and soy sauce and stir frequently. Set aside once everything has incorporated.

For the Chicken

  1. Heat some oil in a large grill pan or skillet over medium high heat.
  2. Add the chicken thighs and cook for 3-4 minutes on each side. You know they are ready to turn when the white starts to creep up around the side of the thigh. Cook in batches to not overcrowd the pan.
  3. Chop the chicken into 1 inch pieces and return to the pan to develop color on all sides of the meat.
  4. Pour the sauce over the chicken and toss to coat.

For the Vegetables

  1. Heat a large pot over medium low heat. Add in the butter, garlic, and ginger. Stir frequently to make sure they don't burn. Allow the garlic to start to develop a little bit of color.
  2. Add in the broccoli, kale, and cabbage then pour the water and soy sauce over the top.
  3. Place a tight fitting lid over the top of the pot and allow the vegetables to steam for 4-5 minutes.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide your ingredients evenly 5 ways and add 1 cup of rice to each dish.

Cheeseburger Mac & Roasted Brocc

This dish is a play on the classic boxed hamburger helper. This specific version uses brown rice penne, ground beef, spinach, and carrots to increase the nutrient density of the meal.

CourseCuisineTime - 45 minutes 45 minutes 45 minutes
Main DishAmerican, meal prepPrep - 10 minutes 10 minutes 10 minutes
Cook - 35 minutes 35 minutes 35 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
743kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates74g50%
Fat31g21%
Protein42g28%

Ingredients:

For the Pasta

  • 1 lbs (681 g) ground beef 85/15
  • medium (100 g) onion
  • 1 cup (100 g) shredded carrots
  • 5 tbsp (75 g) tomato paste
  • tsp (2 g) garlic powder
  • tsp (2 g) chili powder
  • 1 tbsp (5 g) oat flour wheat flour is fine
  • 2 cups (480 ml) vegetable broth
  • 2 cups (480 ml) milk 2%
  • 12 oz (340 g) brown rice penne Any pasta will work. I use Trader Joes Brown Rice Penne
  • cup (56 g) cheddar cheese shredded
  • 3 cups (90 g) spinach
  • Salt and pepper to taste

For the Broccoli

  • 3 cups (510 g) broccoli 1-2 bunches
  • 1 tbsp (22 g) olive oil
  • Salt and pepper to taste

Instructions:

For the Pasta

  1. Heat a large pot over medium high heat and add in the ground beef to brown.
  2. Cut the onion and carrots into a small dice. Cut the spinach into smaller pieces to break up the leaves. I use shredded carrots to make the chopping easier but regular carrots also work.
  3. Once the beef has browned, add in the onion and carrots and cook for 4-5 minutes.
  4. Add in the tomato paste, vegetable broth, milk, oat flour, chili powder, and garlic powder. Stir to incorporate and raise the heat to bring to a boil.
  5. Once the pot has begun to boil, add in the pasta, reduce the heat to low and cover. Cook for 7-10 minutes or until the noodles have softened. Cook times will vary depending on the type of pasta you use.
  6. If you find that there is still a lot of liquid remaining in the pot, remove the lid and allow some of the liquid to boil off.
  7. Add the cheese and spinach to the pot. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

For the Broccoli

  1. Preheat your oven to 450F.
  2. Wash and cut your broccoli into florets. Toss in 1 tbsp of olive oil. Spread the broccoli on to a couple of sheet pans.
  3. Cook the broccoli for 10 minutes then remove from the oven and turn. Cook for an additional 5-7 minutes.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide your ingredients evenly between 5 containers.

Thai Peanut Chicken

Chicken thighs tossed in a coconut peanut butter sauce and served with a zucchini and carrot mixture. I like to add sriracha to the top of the chicken to add more spice and flavor but this is completely optional.

CourseCuisineTime - 40 minutes 40 minutes 40 minutes
Main DishAsian, meal prepPrep - 10 minutes 10 minutes 10 minutes
Cook - 30 minutes 30 minutes 30 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
670kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates49g38%
Fat32g25%
Protein46g36%

Ingredients:

  • 2 lbs (1135 g) boneless skinless chicken thighs
  • 2 medium (500 g) zucchini
  • 1 cups (150 g) shredded carrots
  • 5 cups (675 g) cooked rice

For the Sauce

  • 5 tbsp (75 g) peanut butter
  • 5 tbsp (75 g) coconut cream
  • 2 tbsp (30 ml) soy sauce
  • 2 tsp (10 ml) honey
  • 2 tsp (10 ml) lime juice
  • 5 tsp (25 ml) sriracha optional
  • 5 tsp (10 g) green onions optional

Instructions:

For the Rice

  1. Cook enough rice to yield 5 cups of cooked rice. 1 cup of dry rice will yield between 2-3 cups of cooked rice depending on the type of rice you use.

For the Sauce

  1. In a saucepan, add the peanut butter, coconut cream, lime juice, honey, and soy sauce. Heat over low heat and stir just until everything melts and comes together.

For the Chicken

  1. Heat a grill pan or a large skillet over medium high heat. Add in 1 tbsp of oil and cook the chicken in batches for about 4 minutes each side. You know the chicken is ready to turn when the white begins to creep up the sides of the chicken thigh.
  2. After the chicken is done cooking, allow it to rest for a couple of minutes and cut into 1 inch pieces. Return the chicken back to the pan and allow to develop color on each side.
  3. Pour the sauce over the top and mix to incorporate.

For the Vegetables

  1. Wash and cut the zucchini into a medium dice.
  2. Heat a large skillet over medium heat. Add in 1 tbsp of oil and add in the zucchini. Cook for 3-4 minutes and then add in the carrots.
  3. Cook the vegetables together until they are soft and season with salt and pepper to taste.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide your ingredients evenly between your containers. Each dish gets 1 cup of rice. Top with sriracha and green onions if you wish.

Miso Ginger Turkey with Rice

Ground turkey cooked with onions and broccoli slaw. This meal is flavored by the miso ginger dressing that is made in the blender from vinegar and carrots. If you need new flavors in your diet, try this recipe out.

CourseCuisineTime - 35 minutes 35 minutes 35 minutes
Main DishAsian, meal prepPrep - 10 minutes 10 minutes 10 minutes
Cook - 25 minutes 25 minutes 25 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
706kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates54g41%
Fat36g27%
Protein41g31%

Ingredients:

For the Meat Mixture

  • 2 lbs (908 g) ground beef 85/15
  • 12 oz (340 g) broccoli slaw
  • medium (100 g) sweet onion
  • 1 tbsp (15 ml) olive oil
  • 1 tbsp (15 ml) soy sauce
  • 2 tsp (2 g) sesame seeds optional

For the Miso Ginger Dressing

  • 1 cup (100 g) carrots shredded
  • 1 tbsp (22 ml) olive oil
  • 1 tsp (5 ml) sesame oil
  • 2 tbsp (37 ml) rice wine vinegar
  • 1 tbsp (30 g) white miso paste
  • 2 tsp (10 g) ginger minced
  • 2 tbsp (30 ml) water

For the Rice

  • 5 cups (750 g) cooked rice

Instructions:

For the Rice

  1. Cook enough rice to have 5 cups of cooked rice. 1 cup of dry rice will yield about 3 cups of cooked rice depending on what kind you use.

For the Meat Mixture

  1. Heat tbsp of oil in a large skillet over medium high heat.
  2. Add the turkey and cook until it has browned. Boil off any water if there is any remaining in the skillet. Lightly season with salt and pepper.
  3. Heat another skillet over medium high heat and add tbsp of oil.
  4. Dice the onion add to the skillet. Cook for 2-3 minutes and then add in the broccoli slaw.
  5. Cook until the slaw has softened. You may find it helpful to add some water to the skillet to create steam and cook the vegetables faster.
  6. Once both the turkey and vegetables have finished cooking, combine the two into one mixture and add 1 tbsp of soy sauce. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

For the Miso Ginger Dressing

  1. Add all of the ingredients to a blender. Blend until you reach your desired consistency. Longer for smoother, shorter for a coarse dressing. I prefer to shoot for somewhere in the middle.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide your ingredients evenly between your 5 containers. 1 cup of rice goes into each dish. Top each with sesame seeds if you desire.

Chicken Nourish Bowls

Grilled chicken thighs with shaved Brussels sprouts, bell peppers, and sweet potatoes. This is a simple recipe with only a handful of ingredients but provides a lot of variety of flavors.

CourseCuisineTime - 40 minutes 40 minutes 40 minutes
Main DishAmerican, meal prepPrep - 10 minutes 10 minutes 10 minutes
Cook - 30 minutes 30 minutes 30 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
569kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates44g37%
Fat20g17%
Protein52g44%

Ingredients:

  • 2 lbs (1135 g) boneless skinless chicken thighs
  • 3 large (900 g) sweet potatoes
  • 12 oz (340 g) Brussels sprouts shaved
  • 1 medium (200 g) sweet onion
  • 1 medium (300 g) bell peppers
  • 2 tsp (4 g) cumin
  • 1 tbsp (8 g) chili powder
  • 4 tbsp (45 g) olive oil
  • 10 tbsp (300 g) salsa buy your favorite jarred salsa

Instructions:

For the Sweet Potatoes

  1. Preheat your oven to 400F.
  2. Wash and cut your potatoes into a large dice. I leave the skin on, feel free to remove it if you wish.
  3. Toss the potatoes in 2 tbsp of olive oil and lightly season with salt and pepper.
  4. Bake for 10 minutes, remove from the oven and stir. Bake for an additional 8-10 minutes or until you have reached your desired level of doneness. If you want your potatoes to develop color, don't over crowd the pan and give them time to brown before turning.

For the Chicken

  1. Heat a large skillet or grill pan over medium high heat. Add in tbsp of olive oil.
  2. Season the chicken lightly with salt and pepper. Add it into the pan and cook for about 4 minutes on each side. You know the chicken is ready to turn when the white has started to creep up around the edges of the thigh. Cook the chicken in batches if necessary, you don't want to overcrowd the pan.
  3. Remove the chicken from the pan and cut into a large dice. Return to the pan to develop color on all sides of the meat. Add in the cumin and chili powder and mix.

For the Brussels Sprouts

  1. Heat another skillet over medium heat and add a splash of olive oil. Add in the shaved Brussels sprouts. Allow them to saut for a couple of minutes then add 2-3 tbsp of water to help them cook. The water will create steam.
  2. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

For the Peppers and Onions

  1. Wash and cut your peppers into thin strips. Cut the onion into similar sized strips.
  2. Heat some olive oil over medium high heat in a large skillet. Add in the onions first and allow them to cook for 2-3 minutes.
  3. Add in the peppers and cook until soft.
  4. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide all of your ingredients into 5 containers. In each containter, add a 2 tbsp serving of salsa.

Sesame Beef and Lentils

Ground beef and green lentils flavored in a sesame oil, soy sauce, sugar, and sriracha mixture. This is served with a side of rice and sesame garlic green beans and carrots.

CourseCuisineTime - 35 minutes 35 minutes 35 minutes
Main DishAsian, meal prepPrep - 10 minutes 10 minutes 10 minutes
Cook - 25 minutes 25 minutes 25 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
655kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates75g54%
Fat23g16%
Protein40g28%

Ingredients:

For the Meat Mixture

  • 1 lb (681 g) ground beef 85/15
  • lb (302 g) green lentils dried
  • 1 tsp (5 ml) sesame oil
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) ginger minced
  • 5 green onions use the whites too
  • 1 tbsp (22 ml) soy sauce
  • 1 tbsp (22 g) brown sugar honey would work as well
  • 1 tsp (5 g) sriracha
  • 2 tsp (8 g) sesame seeds

For the Vegetables

  • 1 lb (454 g) green beans I use frozen, cut beans
  • 5 oz (142 g) carrots shredded. I buy precut carrots
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) garlic
  • 1 tsp (5 ml) sesame oil
  • Salt and pepper to taste

For the Rice

  • 5 cups (875 g) cooked rice

Instructions:

For the Rice

  1. Cook enough rice to yield 5 cups of cooked rice. 1 cup of dry rice will make between 2-4 cups of cooked rice depending on the type you use.

For the Lentils

  1. Rinse your lentils and sift through them to remove any debris.
  2. Bring a large pot of water to a boil and add in the lentils. Cook until they are soft and then drain the water. It will take between 12-15 minutes.

For the Meat Mixture

  1. Heat a large skillet over medium high heat and cook the beef. Once the beef has browned, drain the fat.
  2. Make some room in the middle of the pan. Heat 1 tsp of sesame oil over medium high heat. Add in the green onions and the ginger and cook for one minute or until fragrant.
  3. Add in the lentils, soy sauce, brown sugar, and sriracha. Stir to incorporate and adjust flavors as you see fit.

For the Vegetables

  1. If you use frozen green beans, thaw them out in the microwave.
  2. Heat a skillet over high heat and add in the sesame oil. Add in the green beans and carrots and allow them to get some color. After 1-2 mintues, add in the garlic and season with salt and pepper to taste. You do not want the garlic to burn.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide your ingredients evenly 5 ways. Sprinkle the sesame seeds over the top.

Mediterranean Turkey Bowls

Ground turkey, tomatoes, olives, and spinach mixed in a red wine sauce to give a tangy flavor that works great for meal prep. This dish is served with a side of lemon rice and tzatziki sauce.

CourseCuisineTime - 35 minutes 35 minutes 35 minutes
Main DishGreek, meal prepPrep - 10 minutes 10 minutes 10 minutes
Cook - 25 minutes 25 minutes 25 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
695kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates51g39%
Fat35g26%
Protein44g33%

Ingredients:

For the Turkey

  • 2 lbs (908 g) ground beef 85/15
  • 1 tbsp (22 ml) olive oil
  • 3 tbsp (45 ml) red wine vinegar
  • cup (100 g) black olives canned
  • 4 (240 g) Roma tomatoes seeded
  • 1 cups (100 g) spinach chopped, frozen
  • 1 tsp (3 g) onion powder
  • 1 tsp (3 g) garlic powder

For the Rice

  • 5 cups (750 g) cooked rice
  • 2 tbsp (30 ml) olive oil
  • 4 tbsp (60 ml) lemon juice

For the Tzatziki Sauce

  • 10 tbsp (300 g) Tzatziki sauce I use storebought, you can make it if needed

Instructions:

For the Turkey

  1. Heat 1 tbsp of oil in a skillet over medium high heat. Add in the beef and brown.
  2. While the beef is cooking, cut the tomatoes into a medium dice. Cut out the seeds. Cut the olives as well if you bought whole ones.
  3. Once the beef has browned, add in the tomatoes, olives, tbsp of olive oil, red wine vinegar, chopped spinach, onion powder, and garlic powder. I use frozen, chopped spinach because it's easier but fresh spinach is fine. Just make sure you allow it to wilt a bit in the pan so you aren't left with huge leaves.
  4. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

For the Rice

  1. Cook enough rice to have 5 cups of cooked rice. 1 cup of dry rice will make between 2-3 cups depending on which kind you choose.
  2. Once the rice has finished cooking, measure out 5 cups of cooked rice and add in 2 tbsp of olive oil and 4 tbsp of lemon juice. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

For the Tzatziki Sauce

  1. I use a storebought Tzatziki sauce for ease but you can make it if you need to. There is a recipe included with the Chicken Souvlaki recipe linked here https://mealprepmanual.com/chicken-souvlaki-with-roasted-vegetables/

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide your ingredients evenly 5 ways and add 2 tbsp of Tzatziki sauce to each.

Flank Steak Fajitas

Grilled flank steak marinated in lime juice and seasonings served with pan fried peppers and onions. This is a great low carb meal option.

CourseCuisineTime - 30 minutes 30 minutes
Main Dishmeal prep, MexicanPrep - 10 minutes 10 minutes
Cook - 20 minutes 20 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
671kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates53g39%
Fat27g20%
Protein54g40%

Ingredients:

For the Steak

  • 2 lbs (1135 g) flank steak
  • 2 Tbsp (30 g) olive oil
  • 1 Tbsp (8 g) chili powder
  • 2 Tbsp (30 g) garlic minced
  • 2 tsp (5 g) ground coriander
  • Salt and pepper to taste
  • 1 Tbsp (15 g) lime juice

For the Peppers and Onions

  • 4 medium (600 g) bell peppers any color
  • 1 medium (200 g) sweet onion
  • 1 Tbsp (15 g) olive oil
  • Cilantro optional
  • Salt and pepper to taste
  • 1 lime for garnish

For the Rice

  • 5 cups (750 g) cooked rice

Instructions:

  1. Lightly season the steak with salt and pepper. Place it in a large ziplock bag and add 2 Tbsp olive oil, 1 Tbsp chili powder, 2 Tbsp minced garlic, 2 tsp ground coriander, and the juice of 1 lime.
  2. Remove as much air as possible and allow to marinate for at least 10 minutes.
  3. While the steak is marinating, wash and cut your peppers into strips. Cut your onion into similar sized slices.
  4. Heat a large skillet over medium high heat (cast iron is best here). Add in 1 Tbsp of olive oil and cook the peppers and onions until they become soft.
  5. Season with salt and pepper and drizzle a bit of lime juice over the top.
  6. To cook the steak, heat a grill pan over medium high heat, add a bit of olive oil and grill the meat for 3-4 minutes each side for a medium steak.
  7. Remove from the pan and allow to rest for a few minutes. This will make sure the meat retains its moisture.
  8. Cut the meat into thin slices against the grain to prevent chewiness.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide your ingredients evenly 5 ways and add to your containers.

For the Rice

  1. Cook enough rice to have 5 cups worth of cooked rice. 1 cup of dry rice yields about 3 cups of cooked rice. NOTE: You can blend some cilantro and spinach with water and use that water to cook your rice in. It's a super sneaky way to add in a serving of leafy greens.

For the Steak and Peppers

  1. Lightly season the steak with salt and pepper. Place it in a large ziplock bag and add 2 Tbsp olive oil, 1 Tbsp chili powder, 2 Tbsp minced garlic, 2 tsp ground coriander, and the juice of 1 lime.
  2. Remove as much air as possible and allow to marinate for at least 10 minutes.
  3. While the steak is marinating, wash and cut your peppers into strips. Cut your onion into similar sized slices.
  4. Heat a large skillet over medium high heat (cast iron is best here). Add in 1 Tbsp of olive oil and cook the peppers and onions until they become soft.
  5. Season with salt and pepper and drizzle a bit of lime juice over the top.
  6. To cook the steak, heat a grill pan over medium high heat, add a bit of olive oil and grill the meat for 3-4 minutes each side for a medium steak.
  7. Remove from the pan and allow to rest for a few minutes. This will make sure the meat retains its moisture.
  8. Cut the meat into thin slices against the grain to prevent chewiness.

Chipotle BBQ Chicken with Cilantro Lime Rice

Chicken thighs tossed in BBQ sauce, adobo sauce, and a touch of lime juice to give a slightly smoky, spicy flavor. The chicken is served with a side of cilantro lime rice and vegetables.

CourseCuisineTime - 55 minutes 55 minutes 55 minutes
Main DishAmerican, meal prepPrep - 15 minutes 15 minutes 15 minutes
Cook - 40 minutes 40 minutes 40 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
627kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates57g43%
Fat21g16%
Protein52g40%

Ingredients:

For the Chicken

  • 3 lbs (1362 g) boneless skinless chicken thighs
  • 2 tbsp (30 g) olive oil
  • cup (75 g) BBQ sauce vinegar based (I like the brand Gates BBQ)
  • 1 tsp (5 g) adobo sauce Buy a can of chipotle peppers in adobo sauce and use only the sauce
  • 1 tsp (5 g) lime juice
  • 3 (10 g) green onions

For the Cilantro Lime Rice

  • 5 cups (750 g) cooked riced
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) olive oil
  • cup (10 g) cilantro chopped
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) lime juice
  • Salt to taste

For the Calabacitas

  • 1 large (300 g) zucchini
  • medium (100 g) onion
  • lb (227 g) mushrooms
  • 2 medium (300 g) bell peppers
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) olive oil

Instructions:

For the Rice

  1. Cook enough rice to yield 5 cups of cooked rice. 1 cup of dry rice yields about 3 cups of cooked rice.
  2. Once the riced has cooked, measure out 5cups of cooked rice and place in a large bowl.
  3. Mix in the oil, lime juice, cilantro, and salt to taste.

For the Sauce

  1. Mix together the BBQ sauce, adobo sauce, and lime juice.

For the Chicken

  1. You can cook the chicken however you prefer. I find it best to grill it or use a cast iron skillet but you can make whatever you have work.
  2. Heat a cast iron grill pan or skillet over medium high heat. Add oil and cook the chicken for 3-5 minutes on each side or until the chicken has cooked through. You know the chicken is ready to turn when you see the white start to creep up around the sides of the chicken.
  3. Remove the chicken from the pan and cut into 1 inch, bite sized pieces. Return to the pan to develop color on all sides of the chicken.
  4. Once the chicken has browned, pour the BBQ sauce over the top and stir the chicken to coat.

For the Calabacitas

  1. Wash and cut your vegetables into a large dice.
  2. Heat some oil over medium heat in a large skillet. Add the onions and peppers first and cook for 3-4 minutes.
  3. Add in the zucchini and mushrooms next, adding more oil if needed. It also may be helpful to use a separate pan or to remove the onions and peppers before adding the zucchini and mushrooms. You don't want to overcrowd the pan.
  4. Mix all of the vegetables together. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide your ingredients evenly between your 5 containers.

BBQ Turkey Skillet

Ground turkey tossed in BBQ sauce and mixed with sweet potatoes, red pepper, and kale. This is a super quick and tasty dish for those weeks you don't want to spend a lot of time in the kitchen.

CourseCuisineTime - 30 minutes
Main DishAmerican, meal prepPrep - 10 minutes
Cook - 20 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
463kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates34g37%
Fat20g21%
Protein37g40%

Ingredients:

  • 2 lbs (908 g) ground turkey 93/7
  • 2 large (600 g) sweet potatoes
  • 1 medium (150 g) red pepper
  • medium (100 g) sweet onion
  • 2 tbsp (37 g) olive oil
  • 1 bunch (100 g) lacinato kale
  • 2 tsp (10 ml) lemon juice
  • cup (75 g) BBQ sauce vinegar based (anything will work though)
  • Salt and pepper to taste

Instructions:

For the Sweet Potatoes

  1. Preheat your oven to 425.
  2. Wash and cut your sweet potatoes into a large dice. Toss in 1 tbsp of olive oil and season with salt and pepper. Bake for 10 minutes, then flip and cook an additional 8-10 minutes or until soft.

For the Vegetables

  1. While the potatoes are cooking, cut your onion and red pepper into a small dice.
  2. Wash and remove the kale leaves from the stems. Rougly chop the leaves and place into a bowl.
  3. Drizzle 2 tsp of lemon juice and a few pinches of salt over the kale. Massage the kale by squeezing it in your hands 5-8 times. This will help to break down the fibers and keep it from being so tough.
  4. In a skillet, heat tbsp of oil. Add in the onion and red pepper and cook until soft.
  5. Once they have softened, add the kale and turn off the heat. Allow the residual heat to wilt the kale.

For the Turkey

  1. Heat 1 tbsp of oil over medium high heat in a separate large skillet. Brown the turkey and then mix in the BBQ sauce.
  2. Once everything has finished cooking, combine all of the ingredients in a large pot/bowl and mix to incorporate. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide your ingredients evenly 5 ways.

Cajun Chicken with Lentils and Potatoes

Shredded chicken breasts and red lentils served with a side of roasted potatoes and zucchini. This is a meal made using cheap ingredients making it perfect for those of you who need something that is budget friendly.

CourseCuisineTime - 1 hour 1 hour 1 hour
Main DishAmerican, meal prepPrep - 15 minutes 15 minutes 15 minutes
Cook - 45 minutes 45 minutes 45 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
737kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates89g55%
Fat19g11%
Protein51g32%

Ingredients:

  • 2 lbs (981 g) chicken thighs
  • lb (227 g) red lentils dry
  • 2 large (227 g) carrots
  • 2 stalks (114 g) celery
  • medium (100 g) onion
  • tbsp (8 g) minced garlic
  • 3 tbsp (53 g) olive oil
  • cup (120 ml) tomato sauce
  • 2 cups (480 ml) chicken broth
  • 2 tbsp (18 g) Cajun seasoning
  • 3 lbs (1362 g) russet potatoes
  • 2 large (500 g) zucchini
  • Salt and pepper
  • 5 tbsp (10 g) Parsley optional

Instructions:

  1. Preheat your oven to 425F.
  2. Cut your onion, celery, and carrots into a small dice. Cut your potatoes and zucchini into a medium dice.
  3. Rinse your lentils and sift through them to pick out any debris.
  4. Add 1 tbsp of oil to a large pot and saut the carrots, onion, celery, and garlic until they have become fragrant and softened.
  5. Add the lentils, chicken broth, tomato sauce and chicken breast. Bring to a boil and reduce the heat to low. Cover and simmer for 25 minutes.
  6. While the chicken is cooking, toss the potatoes in 2 tbsp of oil and 2 tbsp of Cajun seasoning. Bake for 12 minutes then turn and bake an additional 12-15 minutes or until you achieve optimal browning. Season to taste.
  7. Heat the remaining oil in a large skillet and saut the zucchini until soft. Season to taste.
  8. Once the chicken is done, remove it from the pot and shred with two forks. Return to the pot and stir. Add tbsp cajun season and stir. Adjust seasonings as needed.
  9. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide your ingredients evenly 5 ways.

Chicken Pancit

Pancit is a Filipino dish made using meat (traditionally pork), vegetables, and thin rice noodles. It is full of flavor, high volume, and fairly low in calories. It also happens to work wonderfully for meal prep.

CourseCuisineTime - 50 minutes 50 minutes
Main DishFilipino, meal prepPrep - 25 minutes 25 minutes
Cook - 25 minutes 25 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
664kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates83g60%
Fat23g16%
Protein31g22%

Ingredients:

  • 2 lbs (908 g) boneless skinless chicken thighs
