  • 3 cups (210 g) shredded cabbage or coleslaw mix for ease
  • 2 cup (200 g) shredded carrots
  • 2 stalks (200 g) celery
  • 1 medium (200 g) sweet onion
  • 2 Tbsp (30 ml) garlic minced
  • 2 Tbsp (10 ml) ginger minced
  • 4 Tbsp (60 ml) olive oil
  • 1 (20 g) jalapeo
  • 2 (60 ml) lemon juiced
  • 4-5 Tbsp (60 ml) soy sauce
  • 4 Tbsp (60 ml) oyster sauce
  • 1 cup chicken stock optional
  • 10 (30 g) green onions
  • 13 oz (368 g) rice noodles I use the brand Dynasty Maifun Rice sticks.

Instructions:

  1. Cut up all of the vegetables. Cut the onion into slices. Mince the garlic and ginger. Cut the celery. Shred the cabbage.
  2. Bring a pot of water to a boil and boil the chicken until cooked then cut into small chunks. If you want your chicken to have more flavor you could grill it or pan fry it. In traditional pancit the meat is often poached.
  3. Cook the noodles in the chicken water until soft. Regular water or broth is fine if you choose to cook the chicken another way.
  4. Heat 2 Tbsp of olive oil over medium high heat. Add in the garlic, ginger, and onions. Once they have developed some color add the celery and carrots. After a couple minutes add in the chicken, noodles, and cabbage. Add oil as needed.
  5. Mix in the oyster sauce and soy sauce. Taste and adjust flavors as needed. Season with black pepper.
  6. This recipes makes 5 servings. Serve each dish with lemon, green onion and jalapeo if you wish. The lemon shouldnt be omitted. Im also serving mine with a side of sambal. If you find that your noodles dry out over the course of the week, pouring a bit of chicken stock over the top before reheating can help.

Turkey Sausage Breakfast Skillet

Turkey sausage cooked with green peppers and carrots to add in some vegetables in your breakfast. Served with a side of eggs and home fries.

CourseCuisineTime - 35 minutes 35 minutes 35 minutes
BreakfastAmerican, meal prepPrep - 10 minutes 10 minutes 10 minutes
Cook - 25 minutes 25 minutes 25 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
745kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates61g44%
Fat39g28%
Protein36g26%

Ingredients:

  • 10 (10 ) eggs
  • cup (60 ml) skim milk
  • 1 lb (454 g) ground pork breakfast sausage
  • 7 (1000 g) russet potatoes
  • (100 g) sweet onion
  • 2 (300 g) green peppers
  • 1 cup (100 g) shredded carrots
  • 2 Tbsp (30 ml) olive oil
  • Cooking spray
  • Salt and pepper to taste

Instructions:

For the Home Fries

  1. Preheat your oven to 425F.
  2. Wash and cut your potatoes into a small dice (around - cubes). You want these small so they cook faster.
  3. Toss the potatoes in 1 Tbsp of olive oil and season with salt and pepper. Bake for 10 minutes, then remove from the oven and turn. Bake an additional 5-8 minutes or until they have crisped up.

For the Sausage

  1. Wash your peppers. Cut the onion and peppers into a small dice. Chop the shredded carrots into smaller pieces.
  2. Heat 1 Tbsp of olive oil over medium high heat in a large skillet. Add the onion, peppers, and carrots to the skillet and cook for 3 minutes.
  3. Add the sausage to the pan and brown.

For the Eggs

  1. Crack 10 eggs into a bowl, add in cup milk and beat. The secret to perfect scrambled eggs is to beat them until frothy and no egg whites remain unincorporated.
  2. Heat a skillet over medium heat, spray with cooking spray, and cook your eggs until finished. Make sure not to over cook them as you will be reheating them in the microwave.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide all of your ingredients evenly between your containers.

Pad Thai

A quick A quick recipe for a simple version of Pad Thai. Rice noodles, chicken and a flavorful sauce to bring everything together, this recipe provides a lot of flavor.

CourseCuisineTime - 30 minutes 30 minutes
Main DishAsian, meal prepPrep - 5 minutes 5 minutes
Cook - 25 minutes 25 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
489kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates40g39%
Fat17g16%
Protein45g44%

Ingredients:

  • 5 oz (142 g) rice noodles
  • 2 lbs (908 g) boneless skinless chicken breast
  • 1 lb (454 g) frozen stir fry vegetables You can use fresh, the frozen combo is just easier.
  • 1 Tbsp (15 g) garlic
  • 2 (2 ) eggs
  • 1 tbsp (15 ml) olive oil
  • 2 Tbsp (32 g) melted peanut butter
  • cup (120 ml) Pad Thai sauce I use my grocery store brand sauce from a jar.
  • Lime
  • cup (35 g) crushed peanuts
  • 3 (10 g) green onions

Instructions:

  1. Cook the noodles according to the instructions on the package.
  2. Cut your raw chicken into thin slices of about - thick.
  3. Fill a large pot with water, salt it, and bring it to a light boil.
  4. Add in the chicken and cook until white throughout. It will only take a couple of minutes. Be careful not to over cook it.
  5. Thaw the vegetables in the microwave and drain any water.
  6. In a large skillet over medium high heat, add some olive oil and saut the garlic and vegetables for a few minutes.
  7. Push the vegetables out of the way, add a bit more oil and crack the eggs into the pan and scramble.
  8. Add in chicken, noodles, sauce and peanut butter. Stir to incorporate.
  9. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide the food evenly between 5 containers. Top with lime wedge, green onion, and peanuts.

Chicken Fajitas

Chicken breast marinated in olive oil, chili powder, and lime juice cooked with a mixture of red /green peppers and onions and serve over sweet potato rice.

CourseCuisineTime - null
Main Dishmeal prep, MexicanPrep - 40 minutes 40 minutes 40 minutes
Cook - 25 minutes 25 minutes 25 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
643kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates49g39%
Fat29g23%
Protein46g37%

Ingredients:

For the Chicken

  • 2 lbs (908 g) boneless skinless chicken breast
  • 2 Tbsp (30 g) garlic
  • 2 tsp (2 g) oregano
  • 1 tsp (2 g) coriander
  • 1 tsp (2 g) cumin
  • 1 Tbsp (8 g) chili powder
  • 2 Tbsp (30 ml) olive oil
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) lime juice
  • Salt and pepper

For the Peppers

  • 1 medium (150 g) red pepper
  • 2 medium (300 g) green peppers
  • 1 (200 g) sweet onion
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) olive oil

For the Potatoes

  • 2 (500 g) sweet potatoes
  • 1 Tbsp (8 g) chili powder
  • Salt and pepper
  • (30 g) queso fresco

For the Cauliflower Rice

  • 5 cups (500 g) cauliflower rice frozen is easiest
  • 1 tbsp (8 g) chili powder
  • salt and pepper to taste

For the Rice

  • 5 cups (675 g) cooked rice
  • 10 tbsp (150 g) melted queso

Instructions:

  1. Cut the chicken into thin strips - thick.
  2. In a large bowl add the chicken, 2 Tbsp garlic, 2 tsp oregano, 1 tsp coriander, 1 tsp cumin, 1 Tbsp chili powder, 2 Tbsp of oil and around 1 tsp of salt. Mix thoroughly and refrigerate for 30 minutes.
  3. If you have a cast iron pan, use it to cook the peppers and chicken. Heat it over medium high heat.
  4. Add 1 Tbsp of oil to the pan and cook the peppers and onions until they are soft. Cook in batches if necessary. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
  5. After the peppers and onions have cooked, cook the chicken (in batches if necessary).
  6. Once all the chicken has finished cooking, add all the peppers, onions, and chicken back to the pan and add lime juice.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide your rice, chicken, and peppers evenly between each of your containers. Top each dish with queso fresco.

For the Cauliflower Rice

  1. Microwave/boil the cauliflower rice to cook it. Mix in the chili powder and salt and pepper to taste.

For the Rice

  1. Cook enough rice to make 5 cups of cooked rice. 1 cup of dry rice will yield about 3 cups of cooked rice.

Cheese Pizza Bites

Gluten free Cheese Pizza Bites that are freezer friendly for you to have available to you whenever you need a quick snack.

CourseCuisineTime - 35 minutes
SnackItalian, meal prepPrep - 25 minutes
Cook - 9 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
29kcal24 bites
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates3.7g92%
Fat0.8g20%
Protein1.9g47%

Ingredients:

  • cup (90 g) oat flour
  • 3 tbsp (45 g) liquid egg whites
  • cup (165 g) plain non fat Greek yogurt
  • 1 tsp (4 g) baking powder
  • tsp (2 g) onion powder
  • tsp (2 g) garlic powder
  • tsp (1 g) salt
  • cup (100 g) marinara sauce
  • 5 tbsp (40 g) shredded mozzarella cheese

Instructions:

For the Crust

  1. Preheat your oven to 425F.
  2. In a large bowl, mix the oat flour, egg whites, Greek yogurt, baking powder, salt, onion powder, and garlic powder until combined.
  3. Spray a mini muffin tin with oil. Put a spoonful of dough into 24 wells. Do your best to get the wells filled evenly. I find that a small cookie scoop is easiest but a spoon works as well. With some practice you'll get better at eyeballing the size.
  4. Form the dough into the shape of the well. I find this step easiest if you use a pointy spoon, put the spoon in the center of the dough, and drag the back of the spoon up the sides while applying a little pressure on the well of the muffin tin on all sides. I like to fill all of the wells first, then go through and form the wells, then redistribute any dough as needed to make them more even.
  5. Parbake the dough for 3 minutes.

For the Topping

  1. Measure out the sauce and cheese. (If you're not worried about exact calories, just eyeball it. Your life will be easier.
  2. Top each pizza bite with sauce and cheese over the top. Bake for an additional 6-7 minutes.
  3. Remove from oven and allow to cool.

Storage

  1. Once the bites are at room temperature, add them to a gallon ziplock bag. Label the bag with the name and date and freeze.
  2. To the reheat the pizza bites, microwave them for 1-2 minutes or until thawed based on the power of your microwave.

Smores Pizza Bites

A gluten free pizza bite that is freezer friendly for you to have available to you whenever you need a quick snack.

CourseCuisineTime - 35 minutes
SnackAmerican, meal prepPrep - 25 minutes
Cook - 9 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
29kcal24 bites
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates4.5g90%
Fat0.6g12%
Protein1.4g27%

Ingredients:

  • cup (90 g) oat flour
  • 3 tbsp (45 g) liquid egg whites
  • cup (165 g) plain non fat Greek yogurt
  • 1 tsp (4 g) baking powder
  • tsp (2 g) stevia
  • 2 tbsp (28 g) chocolate chips
  • cup (28 g) mini marshmallows

Instructions:

For the Crust

  1. Preheat your oven to 425F.
  2. In a large bowl, mix the oat flour, egg whites, Greek yogurt, baking powder, and stevia until combined.
  3. Spray a mini muffin tin with oil. Put a spoonful of dough into 24 wells. Do your best to get the wells filled evenly. I find that a small cookie scoop is easiest but a spoon works as well. With some practice you'll get better at eyeballing the size.
  4. Form the dough into the shape of the well. I find this step easiest if you use a pointy spoon, put the spoon in the center of the dough, and drag the back of the spoon up the sides while applying a little pressure on the well of the muffin tin on all sides. I like to fill all of the wells first, then go through and form the wells, then redistribute any dough as needed to make them more even.
  5. Parbake the dough for 3 minutes.

For the Topping

  1. Measure out the marshmallows and chocolate chips. (If you're not worried about exact calories, just eyeball it. Your life will be easier.
  2. Top each pizza bite with the toppings. Bake for an additional 3-5 minutes. Watch them carefully to make sure the marshmallows don't melt and they brown like you want them to.
  3. Remove from oven and allow to cool.

Storage

  1. Once the bites are at room temperature, add them to a gallon ziplock bag. Label the bag with the name and date and freeze.
  2. To the reheat the pizza bites, microwave them for 1-2 minutes or until thawed based on the power of your microwave.

Supreme Pizza Bites

A gluten free pizza bite that is freezer friendly for you to have available to you whenever you need a quick snack.

CourseCuisineTime - 45 minutes
SnackItalian, meal prepPrep - 25 minutes
Cook - 20 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
37kcal24 bites
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates4g57%
Fat1.3g18%
Protein2.4g34%

Ingredients:

  • cup (90 g) oat flour
  • 3 tbsp (45 g) liquid egg whites
  • cup (165 g) plain non fat Greek yogurt
  • 1 tsp (4 g) baking powder
  • tsp (2 g) onion powder
  • tsp (2 g) garlic powder
  • tsp (1 g) salt
  • cup (100 g) marinara sauce
  • 5 tbsp (40 g) shredded mozzarella cheese
  • 2 oz (57 g) turkey sausage Jimmy Dean sells a bag of frozen precooked sausage, I use it for ease.
  • 4 slices (8 g) pepperoni
  • cup (38 g) onion diced
  • cup (38 g) pepper diced

Instructions:

For the Crust

  1. Preheat your oven to 425F.
  2. In a large bowl, mix the oat flour, egg whites, Greek yogurt, baking powder, salt, onion powder, and garlic powder until combined.
  3. Spray a mini muffin tin with oil. Put a spoonful of dough into 24 wells. Do your best to get the wells filled evenly. I find that a small cookie scoop is easiest but a spoon works as well. With some practice you'll get better at eyeballing the size.
  4. Form the dough into the shape of the well. I find this step easiest if you use a pointy spoon, put the spoon in the center of the dough, and drag the back of the spoon up the sides while applying a little pressure on the well of the muffin tin on all sides. I like to fill all of the wells first, then go through and form the wells, then redistribute any dough as needed to make them more even.
  5. Parbake the dough for 3 minutes.

For the Topping

  1. Weigh out the sauce, cheese, onion, peppers, sausage, and pepperoni. Cut the pepperoni into small pieces to fit on top. (If you're not worried about exact calories, just eyeball it. Your life will be easier.)
  2. Top each pizza bite with sauce, then the toppings and cheese over the top. Bake for an additional 6-7 minutes.
  3. Remove from oven and allow to cool.

Storage

  1. Once the bites are at room temperature, add them to a gallon ziplock bag. Label the bag with the name and date and freeze.
  2. To the reheat the pizza bites, microwave them for 1-2 minutes or until thawed based on the power of your microwave.

Pepperoni Pizza Bites

A gluten free pizza bite that is freezer friendly for you to have available to you whenever you need a quick snack.

CourseCuisineTime - 45 minutes
SnackItalian, meal prepPrep - 35 minutes
Cook - 10 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
33kcal48 bites
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates3.5g58%
Fat1.1g18%
Protein2.2g36%

Ingredients:

  • 1 cup (180 g) oat flour
  • 6 tbsp (90 g) liquid egg whites
  • 1 cup (330 g) plain non fat Greek yogurt
  • 2 tsp (8 g) baking powder
  • 1 tsp (4 g) onion powder
  • 1 tsp (4 g) garlic powder
  • tsp (3 g) salt
  • 1 cup (240 g) marinara sauce
  • tbsp (84 g) shredded mozzarella cheese
  • 15 slices (30 g) pepperoni

Instructions:

For the Crust

  1. Preheat your oven to 425F.
  2. In a large bowl, mix the oat flour, egg whites, Greek yogurt, baking powder, salt, onion powder, and garlic powder until combined.
  3. Spray a mini muffin tin with oil. Put a spoonful of dough into 48 wells. Do your best to get the wells filled evenly. I find that a small cookie scoop is easiest but a spoon works as well. With some practice you'll get better at eyeballing the size.
  4. Form the dough into the shape of the well. I find this step easiest if you use a pointy spoon, put the spoon in the center of the dough, and drag the back of the spoon up the sides while applying a little pressure on the well of the muffin tin on all sides. I like to fill all of the wells first, then go through and form the wells, then redistribute any dough as needed to make them more even.
  5. Parbake the dough for 4-6 minutes.

For the Topping

  1. Measure out the sauce and cheese and pepperoni. Cut the pepperoni into small pieces to fit on top. (If you're not worried about exact calories, just eyeball it. Your life will be easier.)
  2. Top each pizza bite with sauce, cheese, then pepperoni over the top. Bake for an additional 6-10 minutes.
  3. Remove from oven and allow to cool.

Storage

  1. Once the bites are at room temperature, add them to a Fresh & Save Bag, label the bag with the name and date and freeze.
  2. To the reheat the pizza bites, air fry or microwave them. I air fry at 400F until they are hot or microwave them for 1-2 minutes or until thawed based on the power of your microwave. Air frying to reheat is my preferred method.

Sausage Pizza Bites

A gluten free pizza bite that is freezer friendly for you to have available to you whenever you need a quick snack.

CourseCuisineTime - 35 minutes
SnackItalian, meal prepPrep - 25 minutes
Cook - 9 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
42kcal24 bites
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates3.3g47%
Fat2g28%
Protein2.7g38%

Ingredients:

  • cup (90 g) oat flour
  • 3 tbsp (45 g) liquid egg whites
  • cup (165 g) plain non fat Greek yogurt
  • 1 tsp (4 g) baking powder
  • tsp (2 g) onion powder
  • tsp (2 g) garlic powder
  • tsp (1 g) salt
  • cup (100 g) marinara sauce
  • 5 tbsp (40 g) shredded mozzarella cheese
  • 4 oz (114 g) sausage

Instructions:

For the Crust

  1. Preheat your oven to 425F.
  2. In a large bowl, mix the oat flour, egg whites, Greek yogurt, baking powder, salt, onion powder, and garlic powder until combined.
  3. Spray a mini muffin tin with oil. Put a spoonful of dough into 24 wells. Do your best to get the wells filled evenly. I find that a small cookie scoop is easiest but a spoon works as well. With some practice you'll get better at eyeballing the size.
  4. Form the dough into the shape of the well. I find this step easiest if you use a pointy spoon, put the spoon in the center of the dough, and drag the back of the spoon up the sides while applying a little pressure on the well of the muffin tin on all sides. I like to fill all of the wells first, then go through and form the wells, then redistribute any dough as needed to make them more even.
  5. Parbake the dough for 3 minutes.

For the Topping

  1. Brown the sausage and break into small pieces.
  2. Measure out the sauce and cheese. (If you're not worried about exact calories, just eyeball it. Your life will be easier.)
  3. Top each pizza bite with sauce, sausage, then cheese over the top. Bake for an additional 6-7 minutes.
  4. Remove from oven and allow to cool.

Storage

  1. Once the bites are at room temperature, add them to a gallon ziplock bag. Label the bag with the name and date and freeze.
  2. To the reheat the pizza bites, microwave them for 1-2 minutes or until thawed based on the power of your microwave. Air frying to reheat is my preferred method.

Shredded BBQ Chicken

A simple recipe comprised of only 7 ingredients, this meal is perfect for days you don't want to spend a lot of time in the kitchen as you will use the crockpot to cook the chicken and can buy frozen green beans to save time.

CourseCuisineTime - 6 hours 6 hours 6 hours
Main DishAmerican, meal prepPrep - 10 minutes 10 minutes 10 minutes
Cook - 6 hours 6 hours 6 hours

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
664kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates81g54%
Fat15g10%
Protein52g35%

Ingredients:

  • 2 lbs (1135 g) boneless skinless chicken breast
  • cup (180 ml) vinegar based BBQ sauce I use the brand Gates
  • 9-10 medium (1135 g) russet potatoes
  • 3 tbsp (45 ml) olive oil
  • 20 oz (567 g) frozen green beans fresh is fine
  • Salt and pepper

Instructions:

  1. Cook the chicken with 1 cup of water or broth in a crockpot on low for 6 hours or high for 2-3.
  2. Once cooked remove from liquid and shred. Mix in the BBQ sauce.
  3. Preheat oven to 425F
  4. Cut potatoes into wedges and toss in olive oil. Season with salt and pepper.
  5. Bake for 10 minutes and then flip. Cook an additional 10 minutes or until desired crispiness is achieved
  6. Cook green beans as instructed on package. Season with salt and pepper.
  7. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide evenly 5 ways.

Chicken Vindaloo

Chicken Vindaloo is an Indian curry dish usually make with pork. This recipe uses chicken, potatoes and peppers and is served with a side of rice.

CourseCuisineTime - 45 minutes 45 minutes 45 minutes
Main DishIndian, meal prepPrep - 10 minutes 10 minutes 10 minutes
Cook - 35 minutes 35 minutes 35 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
678kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates72g49%
Fat20g13%
Protein53g36%

Ingredients:

  • 2.5 lbs (1135 g) boneless skinless chicken thighs
  • 1 cup (240 ml) coconut milk full fat, canned
  • 14 oz (397 g) crushed tomatoes
  • 2 tbsp (30 g) garlic
  • 2 medium (300 g) bell peppers You can use the frozen blend of onions and peppers if you're feeling lazy
  • medium (100 g) onion
  • 2 Tbsp (16 g) cumin
  • 1 Tbsp (8 g) curry powder
  • 2 tsp (5 g) turmeric
  • 5 cups (750 g) cooked rice
  • 1 lb (454 g) russet potatoes
  • 1 tbsp (15 ml) olive oil

Instructions:

For the Rice

  1. Cook enough rice to yield 5 cups of cooked rice. 1 cup of dry rice will make around 3 cups of cooked rice.

For the Chicken

  1. Heat a grill pan or skillet over medium high heat. Add oil and cook the chicken for 3-5 minutes on each side or until cooked through. Cut it into slices.
  2. Wash and cut your potatoes into a large dice. Heat a pot of water over high heat and boil the potatoes until they are soft.
  3. Cut the onion and pepper into strips.
  4. In a skillet heat some olive oil over medium heat. Add the garlic, onion, and peppers. Cook for 2-3 mintues.
  5. Add tomatoes and coconut milk to the skillet. Add the cumin, curry powder, and turmeric. Simmer for 10 min uncovered and allow the sauce to thicken.
  6. Add potatoes and chicken to the pan and mix. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide your ingredients evenly 5 ways. Add cup of rice to each dish.

Jalapeo Apple Sweet Potato Hash with Ham and Eggs

Sweet potatoes mixed with jalapeos, bell pepper, onion, and apple for a crisp and flavorful breakfast hash. This hash is served with a side of ham and eggs for protein.

CourseCuisineTime - 40 minutes 40 minutes 40 minutes
BreakfastAmerican, meal prepPrep - 10 minutes 10 minutes 10 minutes
Cook - 30 minutes 30 minutes 30 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
613kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates57g48%
Fat28g23%
Protein33g27%

Ingredients:

  • 12 eggs
  • 1 lb (454 g) ham steak
  • 4 medium (900 g) sweet potatoes
  • 2 (20 g) jalapeo pepper
  • 2 medium (300 g) red pepper
  • 1 medium (200 g) sweet onion
  • 2 (200 g) golden delicious apple
  • 2 tbsp (38 ml) olive oil
  • Salt and pepper to taste

Instructions:

  1. Preheat oven to 425F.
  2. Hard boil 12 eggs.
  3. Wash and cut potatoes into a medium dice. Toss in 2 tbsp of olive oil and bake for 10 minutes. Flip and cook an additional 10 minutes.
  4. Cut the onion and red pepper into a small dice. Cut the jalapeo into slices. Cut out the seeds if you dont like heat.
  5. Heat tbsp of oil in a pan over medium heat. Saut the onions for a few minutes and then add in the pepper and jalapeo. Cook until soft.
  6. Cut the apple into a medium dice.
  7. Remove from heat. Add the potatoes and apple to the pan with the peppers. Season with salt and pepper.
  8. Cook the ham however you please. You dont even need to if you dont want to.
  9. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide into 5 servings.

Buffalo Chicken Breakfast Bowls

A change from the traditional style breakfasts, this meal has buffalo chicken with potatoes, mushrooms, peppers and eggs that you can mix together in one big scramble.

CourseCuisineTime - 40 minutes 40 minutes 40 minutes
BreakfastAmerican, meal prepPrep - 10 minutes 10 minutes 10 minutes
Cook - 30 minutes 30 minutes 30 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
497kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates38g39%
Fat23g23%
Protein35g36%

Ingredients:

  • 1 lb (454 g) boneless skinless chicken breast
  • 10 (10 ) eggs
  • 1 medium (150 g) green pepper
  • 4 oz (113 g) mushrooms sliced
  • 4 medium (1000 g) russet potatoes
  • 2-3 Tbsp (30 ml) buffalo sauce
  • 4 Tbsp (60 ml) olive oil
  • Salt and pepper to taste

Instructions:

For the Potatoes

  1. Preheat your oven to 400F.
  2. Wash and cut your potatoes into a medium dice.
  3. Spread on a sheet pan and drizzle with 2 Tbsp of olive oil. Season with salt and pepper.
  4. Bake for 10 minutes then remove and flip. Cook an additional 5-7 minutes or until crispy

For the Chicken

  1. Butterfly the chicken breast so it will cook quicker and more evenly. Season with salt and pepper.
  2. Add 1 Tbsp of olive oil in a grill pan or skillet over medium heat. Cook the chicken until it has reached an internal temperature of at least 165F.
  3. Cut into a small dice of about " cubes. Mix in buffalo sauce.

For the Peppers and Mushrooms

  1. Wash and cut the pepper into a large dice. Add 1 Tbsp of olive oil to a skillet over medium heat.
  2. Cook the peppers for 3-4 minutes and then add in the mushrooms. Cook until soft.

For the Eggs

  1. Scramble and cook 10 eggs.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide your ingredients evenly between 5 containers.

Salsa Chicken

Shredded chicken breasts cooked in the crockpot paired with sauted peppers and onions with refried black beans.

CourseCuisineTime - 6 hours 6 hours 6 hours
Main Dishmeal prep, MexicanPrep - 10 minutes 10 minutes 10 minutes
Cook - 6 hours 6 hours 6 hours

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
652kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates57g41%
Fat20g14%
Protein61g44%

Ingredients:

  • 2 lbs (908 g) boneless skinless chicken breast
  • 14 oz (397 g) can chicken broth
  • 2 cups (448 g) salsa
  • 3 cans (1275 g) black beans 45oz
  • 1 tbsp (8 g) cumin
  • 1 cup (112 g) jack cheese
  • 3 medium (450 g) bell peppers
  • 1 medium (200 g) onion
  • 2 tbsp (30 ml) olive oil
  • (2 g) Cilantro

Instructions:

  1. Put the chicken and broth in a crockpot. Cook on low for 5-7 hours or high for 4 hours.
  2. Remove the chicken from crockpot when finished cooking and shred. Add salsa and mix. Season to taste.
  3. Cut onion and peppers into strips. Saut in oil until soft.
  4. Add black beans to a pot. Bring to a light boil and mash the beans into a paste. Add oil if necessary. Cook until the liquid has reduced (probably 8-10 minutes). Add cumin, salt and pepper to taste.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide your ingredients 5 ways. Top the beans with jack cheese.

Deconstructed Chicken Pot Pie

Shredded chicken with peas, celery, carrots, and onions served over top of a bed of mashed potatoes. This is a deconstructed version of the traditional Chicken Pot Pie where the potatoes replace the pie crust.

CourseCuisineTime - 50 minutes 50 minutes 50 minutes
Main DishAmerican, meal prepPrep - 10 minutes 10 minutes 10 minutes
Cook - 40 minutes 40 minutes 40 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
642kcal4
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates76g55%
Fat20g14%
Protein40g29%

Ingredients:

  • 1 lb (681 g) boneless skinless chicken thighs
  • 2 lbs (908 g) carrots
  • 3 stalks (300 g) celery
  • (100 g) onion
  • 2 lb (908 g) potatoes
  • 6 oz (170 g) frozen peas
  • 14 oz (397 g) chicken broth
  • cup (120 ml) milk
  • 2 tbsp (28 g) butter
  • 2 tbsp (30 ml) cornstarch
  • 2 tbsp (30 ml) water
  • 2 tbsp (30 ml) olive oil
  • Salt and pepper to taste

Instructions:

For the Chicken

  1. Wash 3 stalks of celery and peel 3 carrots. Cut the vegetables and of an onion into a small dice.
  2. Heat 1 Tbsp of olive oil in a large pot over medium high heat. Add the vegetables and cook until the onions are translucent.
  3. Add the chicken breast and 14.5 oz can of chicken broth. Cover the pot and reduce the heat to medium low. Cook for 25-30 minutes or until the chicken has cooked through.
  4. Once the chicken has cooked remove it from the pot and shred with two forks.
  5. Mix 2 Tbsp of cornstarch with 2 Tbsp of cold water and add to the pot to create a gravy. Stir to incorporate and bring to a boil to thicken.
  6. Once the sauce has thickened, add the shredded chicken and peas.

For the Roasted Carrots

  1. Preheat your oven to 400F.
  2. Wash and peel 7-9 carrots and cut on a bias to pieces about 1" thick and 2-3" long.
  3. Transfer the carrots to a sheet pan, oil and bake for 20 minutes, flipping halfway through.

For the Potatoes

  1. Wash and cut the potatoes into a large dice. Boil in a large pot of water until soft.
  2. Drain the water and add cup of milk and butter. Mash until smooth

Plating

  1. Divide your ingredients evenly between 4 containers.

Frango Assado

Frango Assado is a Brazilian dish comprised of chicken and traditionally served with rice, beans, and farofa. Farofa is used for flavor and texture and is usually made from cassava flour but it can be hard to find in the US. When I lived in So Paulo I would eat this meal multiple times per week. It's one of those nostalgic foods for me.

CourseCuisineTime - 1 hour 35 minutes 1 hour 35 minutes
Main DishBrazilian, meal prepPrep - 1 hour 1 hour
Cook - 35 minutes 35 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
442kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates38g40%
Fat13g13%
Protein42g45%

Ingredients:

For the Chicken

  • 2.5 lbs (1135 g) boneless skinless chicken thighs
  • 1 (1 ) lime
  • 2 tsp (6 g) chili powder
  • 2 tsp (2 g) oregano
  • 2 tsp (6 g) cumin
  • 1 tsp (3 g) paprika
  • 1 tsp (3 g) salt

For the Beans

  • 2 cans (795 g) pinto beans
  • medium (100 g) onion
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) garlic
  • tbsp (7 ml) olive oil
  • cup (160 ml) chicken broth
  • 2 tsp (2 g) basil
  • 2 tsp (6 g) paprika
  • Salt and pepper to taste

For the Rice

  • 1 cup (180 g) dry rice
  • (100 g) onion
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) garlic
  • tbsp (7 ml) olive oil
  • 2 cups (240 ml) water
  • Salt and pepper to taste

For the Farofa

  • 3 tbsp (30 g) cornmeal
  • tbsp (7 ml) olive oil
  • Salt and pepper to taste
  • 2 (120 g) tomatoes

Instructions:

For the Chicken

  1. Mix all of the chicken spices and juice from the lime in a ziplock bag. Add the chicken. Marinate at least 1 hour.
  2. Bake at 400F for 20-22 min.

For the Rice

  1. Dice onion and mince garlic.
  2. Add oil to a pan and add onion and 1 tbsp of garlic. Cook until onion is translucent.
  3. Add dry rice and allow to brown a bit. Add water, bring to a boil and reduce to simmer. Cover for 20 minutes. Salt and pepper to taste.

For the Beans

  1. In another pan add oil and saut other half of onion and 1 tbsp of garlic until translucent. Add in of beans and mash.
  2. Pour in broth and remaining beans. Allow them to thicken and add the seasonings.

For the Farofa

  1. Add oil to a skillet and mix in cornmeal. Cook until it has toasted. Season with salt and pepper.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide ingredients evenly 5 ways.

Honey Sambal Chicken

Chicken thighs coated in a honey and sambal sauce for a spicy and sweet flavor profile. This is served with a side of green beans and fried rice.

CourseCuisineTime - 40 minutes 40 minutes 40 minutes
Main DishAsian, meal prepPrep - 10 minutes 10 minutes 10 minutes
Cook - 30 minutes 30 minutes 30 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
667kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates61g42%
Fat20g14%
Protein61g42%

Ingredients:

  • 3 lbs (1362 g) boneless skinless chicken thighs
  • 5 cups (750 g) cooked rice
  • 1 tbsp (15 ml) sesame oil
  • 1 lb (454 g) green beans
  • medium (100 g) onion
  • 2 cups (300 g) frozen mixed vegetables
  • 2 (2 ) eggs
  • 4 tbsp (60 ml) soy sauce
  • 3 tbsp (45 ml) Sambal olek
  • 2 tbsp (42 g) honey
  • 1/4 cup (60 ml) water
  • 1 tbsp (8 g) cornstarch
  • 1 tbsp (15 ml) water
  • 2 tbsp (30 ml) olive oil

Instructions:

For the Rice

  1. Cook enough rice to yield 5 cups. Its best if you have day old rice but fresh rice will work.
  2. Dice an onion and saut in a pan with 1 tbsp olive oil until soft. Add in thawed frozen vegetables. Stir in rice. Crack the eggs in and scramble. Add 4 tbsp soy sauce, 1 tbsp sesame oil and season with pepper to taste.

For the Chicken

  1. Heat a skillet/grill pan over medium heat and cook the chicken. Cut into 1 inch chunks and add back to pan to brown.
  2. In a sauce pan add 2 tbsp soy sauce, 2 tbsp honey, 3 tbsp Sambal and cup water. Bring to a light boil.
  3. Make a slurry with the cornstarch and 1 tbsp of cold water. Reduce heat and stir into sauce to thicken.
  4. Coat meat with sauce.
  5. If you use raw green beans, boil or cook them as preferred.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide ingredients into 5 servings.

Chicken Tikka Masala

Chicken thighs coated in tikka masala sauce with rice and broccoli. Using a store bought tikka masala sauce can speed up the time it takes to cook this meal. Using premade sauces for ease isnt something I do often but it greatly speeds up the process.

CourseCuisineTime - 30 minutes 30 minutes 30 minutes
Main DishIndian, meal prepPrep - 5 minutes 5 minutes 5 minutes
Cook - 25 minutes 25 minutes 25 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
715kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates67g44%
Fat25g16%
Protein57g38%

Ingredients:

  • 2 lbs (1135 g) boneless skinless chicken thighs
  • 16 oz (454 g) frozen broccoli
  • 6 oz (170 g) frozen peas
  • 8 oz (227 g) shredded carrots
  • 1.25 cups (313 g) tikka masala sauce Use jarred. Its just way easier. I use Hy-Vee Brand.
  • 5 cups (750 g) cooked rice
  • 4 tbsp (60 ml) olive oil
  • Parsley

Instructions:

  1. Cook enough rice to have 5 cups worth. Once cooked, mix in 3 tbsp of olive oil for the extra calories.
  2. Heat tbsp of oil in a cast iron grill or skillet over medium heat. Cook the chicken. Cut into 1 inch pieces.
  3. In a skillet, heat tbsp of oil over medium heat and add the peas and carrots. Cook for a few minutes.
  4. Add the chicken and sauce. Stir to incorporate.
  5. Cook the broccoli in the microwave.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide your ingredients evenly between 5 containers. Put 1 cup of rice in each dish.

Italian Turkey Bowls

Ground turkey cooked in a homemade Italian dressing and served with green beans and roasted sweet potatoes. This meal can be made in only 30 minutes.

CourseCuisineTime - 30 minutes 30 minutes 30 minutes
Main DishAmerican, meal prepPrep - 10 minutes 10 minutes 10 minutes
Cook - 25 minutes 25 minutes 25 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
642kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates43g37%
Fat35g30%
Protein38g32%

Ingredients:

  • 2 lbs (908 g) ground beef (85/15)
  • 1 lb (454 g) green beans fresh or frozen
  • 3 medium (900 g) sweet potatoes
  • Basil optional
  • 2 tbsp (30 ml) olive oil

For the Dressing

  • 1/4 cup (60 ml) red wine vinegar
  • 1 tbsp (15 ml) olive oil
  • 1 tsp (5 ml) lemon juice
  • 1 tsp (4 g) garlic powder
  • 1/2 tsp (2 g) onion powder
  • 1 tsp (1 g) dried basil
  • Pinch (Pinch) salt and pepper

Instructions:

  1. Preheat your oven to 450F.
  2. Cut your potatoes into thin ( or less) half moon shaped pieces. Toss in tbsp olive oil and spread on a sheet pan.
  3. Bake for 10 minutes and flip. Cook an additional 8-10 minutes.
  4. While the potatoes are cooking, heat a skillet over medium high heat. Add in the turkey and brown.
  5. Mix all of the ingredients for the dressing together. Mix into the meat.
  6. Microwave the green beans until they are no longer frozen.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide your ingredients evenly between 5 containers.

Chipotle Citrus Chicken

Chicken thighs marinated in adobo sauce and citrus to give outstanding flavor to the meat. This chicken is served with a side of zucchini and a Mexican inspired fried rice.

CourseCuisineTime - 1 hour 1 hour 1 hour
Main Dishmeal prep, MexicanPrep - 40 minutes 40 minutes 40 minutes
Cook - 30 minutes 30 minutes 30 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
607kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates57g44%
Fat18g13%
Protein54g41%

Ingredients:

For the Chicken

  • 2.5 lbs (1135 g) boneless skinless chicken thighs
  • 1 (85 g) orange juiced
  • 1 (30 g) lime juiced
  • 1 (10 g) chipotle pepper in adobo sauce
  • 3 tbsp (45 g) adobo sauce
  • 1 tbsp (8 g) Cumin
  • 1 tsp (3 g) Salt
  • 1 tsp (2 g) Pepper
  • 1 tbsp (8 g) Chili powder
  • 1 tbsp (15 ml) Olive oil

For the Rice

  • 4 cups (600 g) cooked rice
  • 2 tbsp (30 ml) olive oil
  • 1 cup (366 g) canned black beans
  • 1 (150 g) green pepper
  • 1 (150 g) red pepper
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) garlic
  • 1/2 medium (100 g) onion
  • 2 medium (500 g) zucchini

Instructions:

**For the Chicken **

  1. In a large ziplock bag, add the chicken, juice from the lime, juice from the orange, chipotle pepper and adobo sauce, cumin, chili powder, salt and pepper. Mix together and allow to marinate for 30 minutes.
  2. Once the chicken has marinated, heat a grill pan over medium heat add oil and cook the chicken.
  3. Cut the chicken into one inch pieces and return to the pan to get even color.

For the Rice

  1. While the chicken is marinating, chop your peppers and onion into a small dice. Cut the zucchini into a large dice.
  2. Cook enough rice to yield 4 cups of cooked rice. 1 cup of dry rice will yield about 3 cups of cooked rice.
  3. In a skillet, heat some oil over medium heat. Saut the onion and garlic until the onion has softened. Add the peppers and cook until soft.
  4. Add in 4 cups of cooked rice, 1 cup of rinsed black beans and season with salt, pepper, and lime juice to taste.

For the Zucchini

  1. Heat some oil in another pan and saut the zucchini until soft.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide the ingredients evenly between 5 containers.

Dijon Balsamic Turkey with Garlic Parmesan Red Potatoes

Ground turkey flavored with dijon mustard, balsamic vinegar, and honey and served with a side of zucchini, red peppers, and garlic parmesan red potatoes.

CourseCuisineTime - 55 minutes 55 minutes 55 minutes
Main DishAmerican, meal prepPrep - 20 minutes 20 minutes 20 minutes
Cook - 35 minutes 35 minutes 35 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
664kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates60g44%
Fat26g19%
Protein48g35%

Ingredients:

  • 2 lbs (908 g) ground turkey (93/7)
  • 2.5 lbs (1135 g) red potatoes
  • 2 small (300 g) zucchini
  • 2 small (200 g) red peppers
  • 1/4 cup (60 ml) balsamic vinegar
  • 1.5 tbsp (32 g) honey
  • 1.5 tbsp (22.5 g) Dijon mustard
  • 3 tbsp (45 ml) olive oil
  • cup (78 g) grated Parmesan cheese
  • 2.5 tbsp (38 g) garlic minced
  • 1/2 (100 g) sweet onion
  • Salt and pepper

Instructions:

  1. Preheat oven to 425F.
  2. Wash and cut potatoes into 1 pieces. Add to a large bowl with 2 tbsp oil, salt and pepper, 1 tbsp garlic and cup grated Parmesan. Toss to coat.
  3. Add potatoes to a greased sheet pan and bake for 15 minutes, flip and cook an additional 10.
  4. While the potatoes are cooking, dice the onion and saut with the garlic a few minutes.
  5. Add the turkey and brown.
  6. Mix together the honey, balsamic, and mustard. Add to the turkey once all the water from the meat has boiled off. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
  7. Cut the zucchini and peppers into 1 inch chunks. Saut in oil until soft. Season to taste.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide your ingredients evenly 5 ways. Top with balsamic glaze if you wish.

Pollo Verde

Pollo Verde from shredded chicken mixed with a homemade salsa verde and served with a side of peppers, onions, and pinto beans.

CourseCuisineTime - 4 hours 4 hours 4 hours
Main Dishmeal prep, MexicanPrep - 10 minutes 10 minutes 10 minutes
Cook - 4 hours 4 hours 4 hours

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
683kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates70g50%
Fat26g18%
Protein42g30%

Ingredients:

  • 2 lbs (908 g) boneless skinless chicken thighs
  • 1 large (300 g) zucchini
  • 1 large (200 g) red pepper
  • 1 medium (200 g) sweet onion
  • 5 Tbsp (75 ml) olive oil
  • 5 (250 g) tomatillos
  • 2 (40 g) jalapeos use serranos if you like it spicy
  • 1/4 bunch (15 g) cilantro
  • 1 (30 ml) lime
  • 4 cloves (20 g) garlic
  • 1 small (100 g) white onion
  • 2 cups (438 g) pinto beans
  • 2 Tbsp (16 g) cotija cheese
  • 5 cups (750 g) cooked rice

Instructions:

For the Chicken

  1. In a crockpot or instant pot, add 1-2 cups of water. Salt it and then add the chicken. Cook until it is shreddable. Empty most of the liquid and shred the meat.

For the Salsa

  1. In a pot of boiling water, add the tomatillos, garlic, white onion (halved) and the jalapeos. Boil until the tomatillos have turned army green. Add to a blender with cilantro, lime juice and salt to taste. Blend to desired consistency.
  2. Mix The Salsa into the chicken and stir.

For the Vegetables

  1. Cut your red pepper, onion, and zucchini into a large dice. Saut with olive oil until soft. .

For the Beans

  1. Rinse and drain the beans.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide your ingredients evenly between 5 dishes. Divide the Cotija beans evenly and sprinkle over the beans.

For the Rice

  1. Cook enough rice to have 5 cups of cooked rice. 1 cup of cooked rice will yield about 3 cups of cooked rice. Stir in 3 Tbsp of olive oil to the cooked rice.

Mini Pumpkin Muffins

Mini muffins made from pumpkin and oat flour and topped with a cream cheese frosting. The frosting here is made from Greek yogurt and fat free cream cheese but if you wanted them to taste even better you could use the real thing.

CourseCuisineTime - 24 minutes
Dessert, SnackAmerican, meal prepPrep - 15 minutes
Cook - 9 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
45kcal12 muffins
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates6.9g86%
Fat0.9g11%
Protein2.3g28%

Ingredients:

For the Muffins

  • 4/5 cup (80 g) oat flour
  • 1 tsp (4 g) baking powder
  • 1.5 tsp (6 g) stevia
  • 1 egg
  • 3 tbsp (45 g) liquid egg whites
  • 1/3 cup (75 g) canned pumpkin
  • 1.5 tsp (5.5 g) cinnamon
  • 1 tsp (3 g) Pumpkin pie spice

**For the Frosting **

  • 1.5 tbsp (20 g) fat free cream cheese
  • 1.5 tbsp (20 g) plain non fat Greek yogurt
  • 1.5 tbsp (10 g) powdered sugar
  • 8 tbsp (20 g) fat free whipped cream

Instructions:

  1. Preheat your oven to 375F.
  2. Mix the baking powder, cinnamon, pumpkin pie spice, oat flour, and stevia together until combined. Then add the eggs and pumpkin
  3. Fill 12 wells of a mini muffin tin and bake for 8-9 minutes.
  4. Mix the sugar, yogurt, and cream cheese together until smooth. Gently mix in the whipped cream.
  5. Top each muffin with frosting.
  6. Makes 12. Nutrition info is for each muffin.

Jalapeo Apple Turkey Bowls

Ground turkey with jalapeos and apple for a spicy and sweet flavor, served with a roasted potato medley and broccoli.

CourseCuisineTime - 40 minutes 40 minutes 40 minutes
Main DishAmerican, meal prepPrep - 10 minutes 10 minutes 10 minutes
Cook - 30 minutes 30 minutes 30 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
743kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates64g45%
Fat31g21%
Protein46g32%

Ingredients:

  • 2 lbs (908 g) ground beef (85/15)
  • 1 medium (120 g) apples
  • 2 (60 g) jalapeo pepper
  • 2 medium (450 g) sweet potato
  • 7-8 small (337 g) red potatoes
  • 7-8 small (337 g) yellow potatoes
  • 20 oz (568 g) chopped frozen broccoli
  • 1/4 cup (60 ml) soy sauce
  • 2 tbsp (42 g) honey
  • 1 tbsp (15 ml) Worcestershire sauce
  • 2 tsp (10 g) garlic minced
  • 3 tbsp (45 ml) olive oil
  • 1 tsp (1 ml) oregano

Instructions:

  1. Preheat your oven to 450F
  2. Cut the potatoes into a large dice.
  3. Coat potatoes in 2 tbsp oil and toss with oregano and salt and pepper. Bake for 10 minutes and turn. Cook 10 more minutes or until desired doneness
  4. Heat oil in a pan over medium high heat. Brown the turkey and remove/boil off any water in the pan.
  5. Cut the jalapeo and Apple. Make room in the pan to saut the jalapeo. Cook for 3-4 minutes.
  6. In a bowl, mix together the soy sauce, honey, Worcestershire, and garlic. Add to the turkey.
  7. Remove from heat and stir in the apples.
  8. You can cook the broccoli if you wish. Not necessary though. Divide all of your ingredients evenly 5 ways.

Honey Nut Bars

Almonds, cashews, sunflower, pumpkin, and chia seeds held together with a honey mixture and topped with dark chocolate. A cheaper alternative to store bought counterparts.

CourseCuisineTime - 1 hour 20 minutes
SnackAmerican, meal prepPrep - 1 hour
Cook - 20 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
278kcal14
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates24.6g52%
Fat17.2g36%
Protein6.2g13%

Ingredients:

  • 1 cup (140 g) cashews
  • 1 cup (140 g) almonds
  • cup (90 g) pumpkin seeds
  • cup (33 g) sunflower seeds
  • cup (43 g) chia seeds
  • cup (60 g) dried cranberries
  • 1 Tbsp (16 g) peanut butter
  • cup (168 g) honey
  • 2 Tbsp (32 g) coconut oil
  • 1 Tbsp (20 g) maple syrup
  • 1 tsp (4 ml) vanilla extract
  • 5 Tbsp (75 g) melted dark chocolate
  • Cooking spray

Instructions:

  1. Preheat your oven to 350F.
  2. Add all of the nuts, seeds, and dried fruit to a large bowl. Chop the almonds and cashews before adding if you would prefer smaller pieces.
  3. In a smaller bowl, mix together cup of honey, 2 Tbsp of coconut oil, 1 Tbsp of peanut butter, 1 Tbsp of maple syrup, and 1 tsp of vanilla.
  4. Pour the mixture over the nuts and mix until evenly coated.
  5. In a 13x9 pan or cookie sheet add a lining of parchment paper and spray with oil.
  6. Press the nut mixture into the pan and distribute evenly. Bake for 20 minutes.
  7. Remove from oven and allow to cool for 15 minutes. Then lift out of the pan using the parchment paper and spread 5 Tbsp of melted dark chocolate over the top. Allow to cool in the refrigerator completely.
  8. Once the slab has hardened cut it into 14 bars.
  9. Store the bars in the refrigerator to ensure they stay together.

Po de Queijo - Traditional

Po de queijo is a popular Brazilian treat that is Portuguese for cheese bread. Whats great about these is that they are gluten free so even those who are gluten sensitive can enjoy them!

CourseCuisineTime - 40 minutes 25 minutes
SnackBrazilian, meal prepPrep - 20 minutes 5 minutes
Cook - 20 minutes 20 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
63kcal13
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates7.3g66%
Fat3.2g29%
Protein1.2g10%

Ingredients:

  • 1 cups (180 g) tapioca flour check the health aisles at your store or on Amazon
  • cup (28 g) shredded parmesan cheese
  • 2 tbsp (20 g) shredded mozzarella cheese
  • tsp (2 g) salt
  • cup (60 ml) olive oil
  • cup (144 g) skim milk
  • 1 egg

Instructions:

  1. Preheat your oven to 400F.
  2. Mix all of your ingredients in a blender until the ingredients are homogenized.
  3. Spray two mini muffin tins with oil and fill each well about half way with the batter. It will make about 24 pieces.
  4. Bake for 20 minutes or until golden brown.
  5. These are best after they have rested for a while. The day after is when I prefer to eat them because they become much softer.

Greek Salad

Cucumber, red onion, red pepper, green olives, and feta cheese dressed in an garlic and olive oil dressing. A nice dish to keep in your fridge as a healthy snack.

CourseCuisineTime - 15 minutes
SnackGreek, meal prepPrep - 15 minutes
Cook - null

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
172kcal10
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates6.8g30%
Fat14.9g67%
Protein2.9g13%

Ingredients:

  • 1 large (300 g) cucumber
  • 1 large (200 g) red pepper
  • medium (100 g) red onion
  • 3 (180 g) Roma tomatoes
  • cup (100 g) green olives
  • 4 oz (113 g) feta cheese
  • 2 tsp (10 g) garlic
  • 1 tsp (2 g) oregano
  • cup (60 ml) red wine vinegar
  • cup (120 ml) olive oil
  • tsp (2.5 g) dijon mustard
  • 1 tsp (3 g) salt
  • tsp (1 g) pepper

Instructions:

  1. Cut the cucumber, red pepper, and tomatoes in half and remove all of the seeds. Cut the cucumber, red pepper, and tomatoes into a large dice. Add the cucumber and red pepper to a large bowl.
  2. In a strainer, add the tomatoes and sprinkle with salt. This will encourage the tomatoes to release some of their water.
  3. Cut the red onion into small slices around thick and add to the bowl.
  4. Add the olives to the bowl.
  5. In a smaller bowl, whisk together cup olive oil, red wine vinegar, tsp dijon mustard, 1 tsp oregano, 2 tsp minced garlic and salt and pepper to taste. Pour over the vegetables in the large bowl and add the feta cheese. Toss lightly and allow everything to blend together for 20-30 minutes before eating.
  6. Plating
  7. This recipe makes 10 servings. Divide it evenly 10 ways.

Chicken Kelaguen

This is a Chamorro dish and is a staple in the Mariana Islands. It is a combination of chicken, lemon juice, onions, peppers, and hot sauce and is served cold, making it perfect for a quick snack right out of the fridge.

CourseCuisineTime - 1 hour 20 minutes
SnackAsian, meal prepPrep - 30 minutes
Cook - 1 hour

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
157kcal10
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates2.2g7%
Fat7.9g28%
Protein19.2g68%

Ingredients:

  • 1 (1135 g) broiler chicken 4-5lbs (use 1135g of the pulled meat)
  • 3 (120 g) lemons
  • 1 medium (200 g) sweet onion
  • Salt to taste it will need quite a bit
  • 2 Tbsp (30 g) Tabasco
  • 2 small (15 g) serrano peppers optional
  • 5 (20 g) green onions
  • 1 Tbsp (10 g) olive oil
  • Pepper to taste

Instructions:

  1. Preheat your oven to 400F. In a baking dish place the chicken breast side up. Remove the giblets from the cavity and pat the chicken dry with a paper towel. Drizzle with olive oil and season with salt and pepper. Cook the bird for 1 hour (plus or minus 10 minutes) on a lower middle rack in the oven. Use a meat thermometer to temp the meat and ensure it is around 165F.
  2. Once the chicken has cooked and cooled, tear the meat away from the bones, remove the skin, and dice the chicken into small pieces.
  3. Finley chop the onion, green onion, and serranos into small pieces and set aside.
  4. Spread the chicken out in a shallow dish and add the juice of three lemons, diced sweet onion, serranos, salt, green onion, and hot sauce. Mix everything together and taste, adjust the salt and hot sauce levels to suit your liking.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 10 servings. Divide it evenly 10 ways. My finished product weighed about 1550g so each serving will be around 150g, which is roughly a fist sized amount if you don't have a scale.

Buffalo Chicken Dip

This buffalo chicken dip is best utilized as a snack. You can eat it with carrots/celery/bell peppers or heat it up and eat it by itself.

CourseCuisineTime - 3 hours 20 minutes
SnackAmerican, meal prepPrep - 20 minutes
Cook - 3 hours

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
178kcal10
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates3.7g10%
Fat6.1g16%
Protein27g75%

Ingredients:

  • 2 lbs (908 g) boneless skinless chicken breast
  • 1 cups (339 g) 4% fat cottage cheese
  • 1 cups (341 g) nonfat plain Greek yogurt
  • 6 slices (60 g) bacon cooked
  • 1 cup (118 g) kale chopped
  • 5 Tbsp (75 ml) buffalo sauce
  • Salt and pepper to taste

Instructions:

  1. Add the chicken and 1 cup of water to a crock pot and cook on high for 3 hours or until cooked.
  2. While the chicken is cooking, chop up some kale leaves until you have 1 cups worth. Use a food processor if you have one, you want it small.
  3. Heat a skillet over medium high heat and cook 6 slices of bacon. When the bacon is cooked, remove it from the pan and pat with paper towels. Keep the bacon fat in the pan.
  4. Add the kale to the bacon fat and cook until it has shrunken and is crisp, around 3-5 minutes. CAUTION: Use a lid to shield yourself from splatters when you add the kale. The wet kale can mix with the hot oil and splatter easily.
  5. Drain all the excess fat from the kale. Using the back of a spoon or spatula, try and squeeze out as much grease as possible.
  6. Chop the bacon up into small pieces and set aside with the kale.
  7. Once the chicken has cooked, transfer it into a large bowl and shred thoroughly with two forks. Allow the chicken to cool before mixing in the remaining ingredients. Once it has cooled, mix all of the ingredients together until incorporated.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 10 servings. Divide it evenly 10 ways.

Chicken Salad

This dish is meant to serve as a snack, not a meal. You can keep this in your refrigerator and always have a snack that is quick, easy, and high in protein.

CourseCuisineTime - null
SnackAmerican, meal prepPrep - 10 minutes
Cook - 4 hours

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
249kcal10
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates6.5g15%
Fat13.7g31%
Protein24.8g57%

Ingredients:

  • 2 lbs (1135 g) boneless skinless chicken breast
  • 1 cup (240 ml) chicken broth
  • 1 cup (150 g) red grapes
  • cup (110 g) mayonnaise
  • cup (113 g) plain non fat Greek yogurt
  • 2 Tbsp (30 g) Dijon mustard
  • 1 Tbsp (21 g) honey
  • 2 Tbsp (30 ml) lemon juice
  • cup (50 g) slivered almonds
  • Salt and pepper to taste
  • 3 Tbsp (6 g) parsley chopped (optional)

Instructions:

  1. Place chicken breast in a crockpot with 1 cup of chicken broth and cook on high for 3-4 hours or until cooked through.
  2. Remove the chicken from the crockpot and shred with two forks, allow to cool.
  3. Cut grapes into 4s until you have accumulated 1 cup
  4. In a bowl mix together the cup yogurt, cup mayonnaise, 2 Tbsp lemon juice, and 1 Tbsp honey. Pour over chicken with almonds and grapes and mix thoroughly. Add salt and pepper to taste.

Plating

  1. Divide evenly into 10 snack size portions.

Turkey & Hash Brown Egg Bake

Ground turkey and hash browns with an onion, poblano pepper, and red pepper mixture baked into an egg casserole. Serve over a bed of spinach if you prefer some extra vegetables.

CourseCuisineTime - 43 minutes 43 minutes
BreakfastAmerican, meal prepPrep - 8 minutes 8 minutes
Cook - 35 minutes 35 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
548kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates20g21%
Fat37g40%
Protein34g37%

Ingredients:

  • 1 lb (454 g) pork sausage
  • 10 (10 ) eggs
  • cup (60 ml) skim milk
  • 3 cups (252 g) shredded hash browns
  • (100 g) sweet onion
  • 1 (150 g) poblano pepper
  • 1 (150 g) red pepper
  • cup (56 g) shredded cheese
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) olive oil
  • Salt and pepper to taste
  • 2 cups (75 g) spinach (optional)
  • Cooking spray

Instructions:

  1. Preheat your oven to 375F.
  2. Wash your peppers and chop the peppers and onion into a small dice.
  3. Heat 1 Tbsp of olive oil over medium high heat in a large skillet. Add in the peppers and onions and cook for 2-3 minutes. If you wish, add 2 cup of raw spinach to the pan and wilt.
  4. Add in the ground sausage and brown.
  5. While the sausage is cooking, beat 10 eggs and cup of milk together. Stir in 2 cups of shredded hash browns, 1 tsp salt, 1 tsp pepper, and cup of shredded cheese.
  6. Once the sausage has finished cooking, mix it into the egg/hash brown mixture.
  7. Lightly spray a 13x9 baking dish with cooking spray and pour in the egg mixture. Bake for 20-22 minutes or until the center has set.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Cut the Egg Bake into 5 equal servings.

Buffalo Chicken and Garlic Parmesan Potatoes

A highly palatable meal containing chicken coated in buffalo sauce as well as oven baked garlic parmesan potato wedges and broccoli.

CourseCuisineTime - 40 minutes 40 minutes 40 minutes
Main DishAmerican, meal prepPrep - 10 minutes 10 minutes 10 minutes
Cook - 30 minutes 30 minutes 30 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
693kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates63g44%
Fat24g16%
Protein55g38%

Ingredients:

For the Chicken

  • 2 lbs (1135 g) boneless skinless chicken breast
  • 2-3 Tbsp (30 ml) buffalo sauce
  • 1 tsp (2 g) cornstarch
  • 1 Tbsp (15 g) olive oil
  • 4 Tbsp (56 g) butter

For the Broccoli

  • 1 large bunch (500 g) broccoli

For the Potato Wedges

  • 10 small (1500 g) russet potatoes
  • 2 Tbsp (30 ml) olive oil
  • 4 Tbsp (60 g) garlic minced
  • 2 tsp (6 g) salt
  • 2 tsp (4 g) pepper
  • 2 tsp (4 g) paprika
  • 2 tsp (4 g) cayenne pepper
  • 2 Tbsp (6 g) dried parsley
  • 6 Tbsp (34 g) parmesan cheese grated

Instructions:

For the Potatoes

  1. Preheat your oven to 400F.
  2. Wash each of your potatoes thoroughly. Cut each of them in half long ways 3 times so you have 8 wedges for each potato.
  3. In a large bowl, drizzle 2 Tbsp of olive oil over the potatoes. Sprinkle 2 tsp of salt, pepper, paprika, cayenne, and 2 Tbsp parsley over the potatoes. Add 4 Tbsp of minced garlic and 6 Tbsp of grated parmesan cheese. Toss the potatoes to coat and spread onto a sheet pan.
  4. Bake for 15 minutes and then flip them to the other side and cook an additional 10-12 minutes.

For the Chicken

  1. While the potatoes are cooking cut the chicken breast into one inch cubes.
  2. Heat a large skillet over medium high heat and add in 1 Tbsp of olive oil. Add the chicken and cook until it is white in the center, around 7-8 minutes.
  3. When the chicken is just about cooked through, melt 4 Tbsp of butter and mix in 1 tsp of cornstarch and 2-3 Tbsp of buffalo sauce.

For the Broccoli

  1. Steam the broccoli while your chicken is cooking. Season with salt and pepper.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide all of your ingredients evenly between your containers.

Pork Tenderloin & Roasted Brussels Sprouts

Pork tenderloin served with roasted Brussels sprouts cooked with bacon and green apples. A classic meat and vegetables dish.

CourseCuisineTime - null
Main DishAmerican, meal prepPrep - 10 minutes 10 minutes 10 minutes
Cook - 1 hour 1 hour 1 hour

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
734kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates59g41%
Fat32g22%
Protein52g36%

Ingredients:

  • 2 lbs (908 g) pork tenderloin
  • 2 lbs (908 g) Brussels sprouts
  • 1 (200 g) green apple
  • 1 medium (200 g) sweet onion
  • 2 Tbsp (30 ml) olive oil
  • 8 pieces (80 g) bacon
  • 2 tsp (6 g) garlic powder
  • Salt and pepper

For the Potato

  • 5 small (750 g) potatoes
  • 5 tbsp (70 g) butter
  • 5 tbsp (80 g) sour cream

Instructions:

  1. Preheat your oven to 425F. Sprinkle the pork with salt, pepper, and 2 tsp of garlic powder. Cook in the oven for 45 minutes or until it has reached an internal temperature of 160F.
  2. Cut the apple and onion into a large dice. Remove the stems off of the Brussels sprouts and cut them in half. In a large roasting pan combine the onions and Brussels sprouts and drizzle with 2 Tbsp of olive oil. Season with salt and pepper.
  3. Put the Brussels sprouts and onion in the oven for 30 minutes or until the Brussels sprouts are soft. Add in the apples after they have finished cooking. The apples will cook in the microwave when you reheat the meal. You dont want them to become mushy.
  4. Cook the bacon either on the stove or in the oven until crispy and add to the vegetables with the apples once they have fully cooked.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide your meat and vegetables evenly between your 5 containers. Add 1 potato to each and top with 1 Tbsp of butter and 1 Tbsp sour cream

For the Pork

  1. Preheat your oven to 425F. Sprinkle the pork with salt, pepper, and 2 tsp of garlic powder. Cook in the oven for 45 minutes or until it has reached an internal temperature of 160F.

For the Brussels Sprouts

  1. Cut the apple and onion into a large dice. Remove the stems off of the Brussels sprouts and cut them in half. In a large roasting pan combine the onions and Brussels sprouts and drizzle with 2 Tbsp of olive oil. Season with salt and pepper.
  2. Put the Brussels sprouts and onion in the oven for 30 minutes or until the Brussels sprouts are soft. Add in the apples after they have finished cooking. The apples will cook in the microwave when you reheat the meal. You dont want them to become mushy.
  3. Cook the bacon either on the stove or in the oven until crispy and add to the vegetables with the apples once they have fully cooked.

For the Potatoes

  1. Wash and clear any dirt away from your potaotes. Poke holes in them with a fork and place on a sheet pan.
  2. Bake for 40-50 minutes or unitl soft.

Beef & Potato Stew

Boneless chuck roast cooked with carrots, potatoes, and celery. A heart warming meal that can be served over rice for additional calories.

CourseCuisineTime - null
Main DishAmerican, meal prepPrep - 15 minutes 15 minutes 15 minutes
Cook - 2 hours 25 minutes 2 hours 25 minutes 2 hours 25 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
773kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates83g54%
Fat34g22%
Protein34g22%

Ingredients:

  • 1 lb (681 g) boneless beef chuck roast
  • 1 lb (681 g) baby yellow potatoes
  • 5 medium (500 g) carrots
  • 5 (500 g) celery stalks
  • 1 large (250 g) onion
  • 1 Tbsp (15 g) garlic
  • 2 Tbsp (30 ml) olive oil
  • 4 (15 g) beef bullion cubes
  • 4 cups (960 ml) water
  • 2 tsp (4 g) cornstarch
  • 2 tsp (10 ml) cold water
  • 2 Tbsp (16 g) flour use oat flour for gluten free alternative
  • 2 Tbsp (28 g) butter
  • 5 cups (675 g) cooked rice

Instructions:

  1. Heat a large pot over medium high heat and add 1 Tbsp olive oil. Dice the onion and add to the pot with the garlic.
  2. Cut the steak into 1 inch cubes and add to the pot with an additional Tbsp of olive oil once the onions have become translucent. Season with salt and pepper.
  3. Dissolve the bullion cubes into 4 cups of water and add to the pot once the beef has browned. Bring to a boil and then reduce heat to low, cover the pot and simmer for 1 hour.
  4. Cut the potatoes, celery, and carrots into a large dice and set aside.
  5. After 1 hour, add in the potatoes, celery, carrots, and 2 tsp of cornstarch mixed with 2 tsp of cold water to the pot and stir. Cover and simmer for 1 more hour.
  6. Make a roux by melting 2 Tbsp of butter and mixing in 2 Tbsp of flour in a pan over medium heat. Add to the stew and stir to thicken. You can omit this if you need a gluten free option.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide the stew evenly into your containers and add 1 cup of rice to each.

For the Rice

  1. Cook enough rice to have 5 cups of cooked rice. 1 cup of dry rice will yield about 3 cups of cooked rice.

For the Stew

  1. Heat a large pot over medium high heat and add 1 Tbsp olive oil. Dice the onion and add to the pot with the garlic.
  2. Cut the roast into 1 inch cubes and add to the pot with an additional Tbsp of olive oil once the onions have become translucent. Season with salt and pepper.
  3. Dissolve the bullion cubes into 4 cups of water and add to the pot once the beef has browned. Bring to a boil and then reduce heat to low, cover the pot and simmer for 1 hour.
  4. Cut the potatoes, celery, and carrots into a large dice and set aside.
  5. After 1 hour, add in the potatoes, celery, carrots, and 2 tsp of cornstarch mixed with 2 tsp of cold water to the pot and stir. Cover and simmer for 1 more hour.
  6. Make a roux by melting 2 Tbsp of butter and mixing in 2 Tbsp of flour in a pan over medium heat. Add to the stew and stir to thicken. You can omit this if you need a gluten free option.

Butternut Squash Lasagna

Butternut squash acts as a lower carb replacement to noodles in this dish that is rich in flavor and highly palatable. This recipe works great outside of meal prep as well!

CourseCuisineTime - null
Main DishItalian, meal prepPrep - 30 minutes 30 minutes 30 minutes
Cook - 2 hours 2 hours 2 hours

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
856kcal6
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates32g21%
Fat54g36%
Protein62g41%

Ingredients:

  • 1 large (1135 g) butternut squash
  • 1 lb (681 g) ground beef (85/15)
  • 1 lb (454 g) Italian pork sausage
  • 14 oz (397 g) can petite diced tomatoes
  • 6 oz (170 g) can of tomato paste
  • lb (227 g) sliced mozzarella cheese
  • cup (84 g) shredded parmesan cheese
  • Salt and pepper
  • 1 cup (248 g) part skim ricotta cheese
  • 8 oz (227 g) spinach
  • 2 (2 ) eggs
  • 2 Tbsp (6 g) dried parsley
  • 2 Tbsp (6 g) dried basil
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) olive oil
  • 1 Tbsp (15 g) garlic

Instructions:

  1. Heat a large skillet over medium high heat and brown the sausage and ground beef with 1 Tbsp of garlic.
  2. While cooking the meat, peel the squash and cut into sheets thick. I like to cut off the bulbous portion and cut the top first as it makes for better noodles.
  3. Once the meat has browned, drain half of the fat and add the diced tomatoes, tomato paste, 2 Tbsp parsley, 2 Tbsp basil, and 1 tsp of salt. Stir to incorporate and reduce heat to low. Allow it to simmer for 30 minutes.
  4. Preheat your oven to 350F.
  5. If your bag of spinach is microwave safe, pierce it with a fork and microwave for 3 minutes. Once cooked, chop it into small pieces and allow to cool.
  6. In a large bowl mix together the spinach, 1 cup ricotta cheese, cup parmesan cheese, 2 beaten eggs, and salt and pepper.
  7. Coat a 13x9 baking dish with olive oil and add one third of the meat mixture to the bottom.
  8. Add a layer of squash sheets on top of the meat and season the squash lightly with salt and pepper.
  9. Spread of the ricotta and spinach mixture over the top of the squash.
  10. Place half of the sliced mozzarella cheese over the ricotta.
  11. Start the process again, spreading of the remaining meat over the cheese, followed by the squash, ricotta mixture, and mozzarella cheese.
  12. Top the pan with the remaining meat and cup of parmesan cheese.
  13. Bake for 45-60 minutes. The lasagna is finished cooking once you can easily insert a butter knife anywhere in the pan.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 6 servings. Cut the lasagna into 6 pieces and put 1 piece in each of your containers.

Kung Pao Chicken

A vegetable heavy dish that provides an easy way to get your daily servings. Stir frys are great to get in a wide variety of vegetables.

CourseCuisineTime - 50 minutes 50 minutes 50 minutes
Main DishAsian, meal prepPrep - 30 minutes 30 minutes 30 minutes
Cook - 20 minutes 20 minutes 20 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
654kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates69g50%
Fat21g15%
Protein48g34%

Ingredients:

  • 2 lbs (908 g) boneless skinless chicken thighs
  • 1 bunch (500 g) broccoli
  • 1 large (250 g) zucchini
  • 1 medium (150 g) green pepper
  • 1 medium (150 g) red pepper
  • 1 medium (200 g) yellow onion
  • 2 Tbsp (10 g) ginger minced
  • 2 Tbsp (30 g) garlic minced
  • 2 (200 g) carrots
  • cup (33 g) dry roasted peanuts
  • 1 tsp (2 g) red pepper flakes
  • Salt and pepper
  • 2 Tbsp (30 ml) olive oil
  • 5 cups (675 g) cooked rice

For the Chicken Marinade

  • 1 Tbsp (20 ml) rice wine vinegar or dry sherry
  • 2 Tbsp (30 ml) soy sauce
  • 1 Tbsp (8 g) cornstarch

For the Sauce

  • cup (60 ml) balsamic vinegar
  • cup (60 ml) soy sauce
  • 1 Tbsp (20 ml) hoisin sauce
  • 1 Tbsp (20 ml) sesame oil
  • 1 Tbsp (20 ml) cornstarch

Instructions:

  1. Cook the rice using your preferred method (rice cooker or saucepan). Be sure you make enough to have 5cups worth of cooked rice.
  2. Cut the chicken into 1 inch cubes and trim the fat. Add to a bowl along with the ingredients for the marinade. Allow to marinate for 20 minutes.
  3. Steam the broccoli for 3-5 minutes to allow it to soften. You still want to have a little crunch to the broccoli as it will cook further with the remaining vegetables.
  4. Cut the onions into strips. Cut the peppers and zucchini into a large dice. Cut the carrots on a bias into thin slices.
  5. In a large skillet, heat 1 Tbsp of oil over medium high heat. Once the pan has heated, add the red pepper flakes and cook for a few seconds then add 2 Tbsp garlic and ginger. Stir frequently.
  6. Cook the vegetables in order of how long they take to cook. You want to make sure you dont overcrowd the skillet, use two if necessary. Once the garlic and ginger has cooked for a minute add in the onions, cook for 2 minutes then add in the carrots.
  7. Once the carrots have cooked for a few minutes add in the peppers and zucchini. Add in the broccoli once everything is finished and season with salt and pepper. Remove from the skillet.
  8. Add 1 Tbsp of oil to the skillet and cook the chicken. Again dont overcrowd the pan, cook in batches if necessary.
  9. Once all of the chicken has cooked add everything into the skillet and stir in the peanuts and the sauce. Stir to incorporate and cook for 5 minutes to allow the flavors to meld. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide the ingredients evenly between your containers and add cup of rice to each.

Crockpot Jambalaya

A take on the cajun dish that requires little effort. This particular recipe doesnt include shrimp but it can be easily added for a classical version of jambalaya.

CourseCuisineTime - 2 hours 40 minutes 2 hours 40 minutes 2 hours 40 minutes
Main DishAmerican, meal prepPrep - 10 minutes 10 minutes 10 minutes
Cook - 2 hours 30 minutes 2 hours 30 minutes 2 hours 30 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
650kcal6
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates66g50%
Fat26g20%
Protein38g29%

Ingredients:

  • 1 lbs (681 g) boneless skinless chicken breast
  • 14 oz (397 g) Andouille sausage
  • 28 oz (794 g) can of diced tomatoes
  • 1 cup (240 ml) chicken broth
  • medium (100 g) onion
  • 4 (400 g) carrots
  • 4 stalks (400 g) celery
  • 1 Tbsp (15 g) garlic
  • 1 medium (150 g) green pepper
  • 1 medium (150 g) red pepper
  • 1 (20 g) jalapeo pepper optional
  • 2 Tbsp (30 ml) olive oil
  • 1 Tbsp (8 g) cajun seasoning
  • Salt and pepper to taste
  • 1 Tbsp (8 g) cornstarch
  • 2 Tbsp (30 ml) cold water
  • 7 cups (945 g) cooked rice

Instructions:

  1. Cook the rice using your preferred method. 1 cup of uncooked rice will yield around 3 cups of cooked rice.
  2. Wash your carrots, celery, and peppers. Peel the carrots to prepare for cutting.
  3. Cut your carrots, celery, green pepper, and onion into a small dice.
  4. In a large pot, heat 2 Tbsp of olive oil over medium heat. Add in the carrots, celery, green pepper, onion, and 1 Tbsp of garlic. Cook for 8-10 minutes stirring occasionally.
  5. After the vegetables have cooked add them to a crockpot and lay the chicken breasts on top. Add in the can of diced tomatoes and 1 cup of chicken broth. Stir in 1 Tbsp of cajun seasoning.
  6. Turn the crockpot to high and cook for 2-3 hours
  7. After the jambalaya has cooked for 2 hours, remove the chicken and shred with two forks in a large bowl.
  8. Next you will need to thicken the jambalaya. Mix together 1 Tbsp cornstarch with 2 Tbsp cold water into a slurry and add to the broth and stir. The sauce will thicken as you stir. If you find your sauce isnt getting thick, try adding more of the cornstarch slurry.
  9. Cut the sausage into inch slices and fry in a pan then add to the jambalaya.
  10. Continue to cook for an additional 10 minutes. Stir often. Return the chicken to the jambalaya, add 2 cups of cooked rice and salt and pepper to taste.

Plating

  1. This recipe will make 6 servings. Divide the mixture evenly between your containers.

Sweet Potato Chili

Beef chili loaded with bell peppers and sweet potatoes. This meal is is quick and easy to prepare making it perfect for when your pressed for time.

CourseCuisineTime - 50 minutes 50 minutes 50 minutes
Main DishAmerican, meal prepPrep - 10 minutes 10 minutes 10 minutes
Cook - 40 minutes 40 minutes 40 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
769kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates79g51%
Fat31g20%
Protein43g28%

Ingredients:

  • 2 lbs (908 g) ground beef (85/15)
  • 1 medium (200 g) yellow onion
  • 2 Tbsp (30 g) garlic
  • 3 (450 g) bell peppers if you want it to be colorful, get one of each color
  • 2 medium (500 g) sweet potatoes
  • 28 oz (794 g) can petite diced tomatoes
  • 14.5 oz (411 g) can crushed tomatoes in puree
  • 1 (10 g) chipotle pepper in adobo sauce chopped
  • 3 Tbsp (24 g) chili powder or to taste
  • 2 tsp (6 g) cumin
  • Salt and pepper to taste
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) olive oil
  • 1 (20 g) jalapeo pepper optional
  • 1 lime optional
  • 5 cups (675 g) cooked rice

Instructions:

  1. In a large pot, heat 1 Tbsp of oil over medium high heat.
  2. Once the oil is hot, add 3 Tbsp of chili powder and 2 tsp cumin to toast for a few seconds. Then add the diced onion and garlic and stir. Cook for 2-3 minutes.
  3. Allow the onion and garlic to cook on their own for a couple of minutes then add the turkey and season it with salt and pepper. Cook until brown and drain the of the fat.
  4. While the turkey is cooking, peel and cut the sweet potatoes into 1 inch chunks. Add them to a pot of boiling water and cook for around 5 minutes until they are just soft enough to be pierced by a fork.
  5. Wash and cut the peppers into a large dice. After the beef has browned, add the peppers to the pot.
  6. Add the can of crushed tomatoes and the can of diced tomatoes. Stir to incorporate. Add in the sweet potatoes, chopped chipotle pepper in adobo, and salt and pepper to taste.
  7. Reduce the heat to low and allow to simmer for 20-30 minutes. Taste after it has simmered and adjust the spice levels to your liking.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide the Chili evenly between your containers and topped with a lime wedge and jalapeo slices if desired. Add 1 cup of rice to each dish.

For the Rice

  1. Cook enough rice to have 5 cups of cooked rice. 1 cup of dry rice will yield 3 cups of cooked rice.
  2. In a large pot, heat 1 Tbsp of oil over medium high heat.
  3. Once the oil is hot, add 3 Tbsp of chili powder and 2 tsp cumin to toast for a few seconds. Then add the diced onion and garlic and stir. Cook for 2-3 minutes.
  4. Allow the onion and garlic to cook on their own for a couple of minutes then add the beef and season it with salt and pepper. Cook until brown and drain the of the fat.
  5. While the beef is cooking, peel and cut the sweet potatoes into 1 inch chunks. Add them to a pot of boiling water and cook for around 5 minutes until they are just soft enough to be pierced by a fork.
  6. Wash and cut the peppers into a large dice. After the beef has browned, add the peppers to the pot.
  7. Add the can of crushed tomatoes and the can of diced tomatoes. Stir to incorporate. Add in the sweet potatoes, chopped chipotle pepper in adobo, and salt and pepper to taste.
  8. Reduce the heat to low and allow to simmer for 20-30 minutes. Taste after it has simmered and adjust the spice levels to your liking.

Teppanyaki Steak, Chicken & Vegetables

Steak, chicken, and vegetables cooked in a teppanyaki-esque style to resemble the meals served at teppanyaki restaurants. This is a great way to get a variety of vegetables and lots of protein.

CourseCuisineTime - 35 minutes 35 minutes 35 minutes
Main DishAsian, meal prepPrep - 10 minutes 10 minutes 10 minutes
Cook - 25 minutes 25 minutes 25 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
747kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates57g37%
Fat26g16%
Protein70g45%

Ingredients:

For the Meat

  • 2 lbs (908 g) sirloin steak
  • 1 lb (454 g) boneless skinless chicken breast
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) soy sauce
  • 2 Tbsp (30 ml) olive oil

For the Vegetables

  • 1 bunch (500 g) broccoli
  • lb (227 g) carrots
  • 8 oz (227 g) mushrooms
  • 1 large (300 g) zucchini
  • 1 medium (200 g) sweet onion
  • 1 Tbsp (15 g) garlic
  • 1 Tbsp (5 g) ginger
  • 1 Tbsp (9 g) sesame seeds
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) olive oil
  • 2 Tbsp (30 ml) soy sauce

For the Sauce

  • cup (60 ml) soy sauce
  • 2 Tbsp (30 ml) white vinegar
  • 2 Tbsp (10 g) onion minced
  • 1 tsp (1 g) ginger minced
  • 1 tsp (5 ml) lemon juice
  • 2 lb (908 g) boneless skinless chicken breast
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) soy sauce
  • 2 Tbsp (30 ml) olive oil

For the Rice

  • 5 cups (675 g) cooked rice

Instructions:

For the Meat

  1. Take your steak out of its packaging and rest on a plate at room temperature while you prepare the vegetables.
  2. Pound the chicken so it is of even thickness throughout.
  3. Use a cast iron pan or a grill pan to cook the meat, if you dont have one, whatever you have will work fine.
  4. Heat the pan over medium high high heat and add 1 tbsp of olive oil. Season both sides of your steak with salt and pepper. Add to the pan and cook for 3 minutes on each side. You want a hot pan so you get a good sear on the meat.
  5. Allow your steak to rest for 10 minutes and cut the steak into 1 inch cubes. If it is still too rare for you liking, remember that it will cook in the microwave upon reheating.
  6. Season the chicken lightly with salt and pepper and add to the pan and cook for 3-5 minutes on each side. Then remove it from the heat and cut it into 1 inch cubes.
  7. Add the chicken back to the pan to finish cooking at add 1 Tbsp of soy sauce and a sprinkle of sesame seeds.

For the Vegetables

  1. Wash all your vegetables. Cut the broccoli into florets and steam for around 3 minutes so they are just beginning to become soft. You will finish the cooking with the rest of the vegetables.
  2. Quarter the mushrooms, peel and chop the carrots into thin slices about thick, cut the zucchini into strips about 3 long and thick, chop the onion so you have 1 pieces.
  3. In a large skillet heat 1 Tbsp of olive oil and add the onion, garlic, and ginger. Let it cook for 1-2 minutes and add the carrots.
  4. After another 1-2 minutes add the mushrooms, zucchini and broccoli. You want to cook it in stages to allow the harder vegetables to become soft. If you need to use two skillets to prevent overcrowding, do so.
  5. Add in 2 Tbsp of soy sauce to the vegetables and mix. Sprinkle with pepper to taste.

For the Sauce

  1. Mix all of the ingredients together. Store in a separate container.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide your ingredients evenly between each of your containers.

For the Rice

  1. Cook enough rice to have 5 cups of cooked rice. 1 cup of dry rice will yield 3 cups of cooked rice.

Chicken Enchiladas

Two chicken enchiladas topped with pico de gallo.. The homemade red sauce gives these enchiladas an authentic, robust flavor.

CourseCuisineTime - 4 hours 50 minutes 4 hours 50 minutes
Main Dishmeal prep, MexicanPrep - 20 minutes 20 minutes
Cook - 4 hours 30 minutes 4 hours 30 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
787kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates82g49%
Fat24g14%
Protein60g36%

Ingredients:

For the Enchiladas

  • 2 lbs (1135 g) boneless skinless chicken breast
  • 28 oz (794 g) can fire roasted tomatoes
  • 1.33 tbsp (20 ml) white vinegar
  • cup (40 g) red onion diced
  • 2 Tbsp (30 g) garlic minced
  • 1.33 Tbsp (20 ml) ancho chili powder
  • 2 tsp (10 g) sugar
  • 1 tsp (1 g) oregano
  • 1 tsp (3 g) salt
  • 2 tsp (10 ml) olive oil
  • 15 (600 g) flour tortillas
  • 5 Tbsp (37 g) queso fresco
  • 1 cup (112 g) Mexican shredded cheese

For the Pico de Gallo

  • 5 (300 g) Roma tomatoes
  • medium (100 g) red onion
  • cup (1 g) cilantro chopped
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) lime juice
  • 1 (20 g) jalapeo pepper
  • Salt and pepper to taste

Instructions:

For the Chicken

  1. Add the chicken and 1 cup of water to a crock pot and cook on high for 3 hours or until cooked.
  2. After the chicken has completed cooking, shred it using two forks or a hand mixer.

For the Enchiladas

  1. Dice a red onion until you have of a cup. Heat 2 tsp of olive oil in a skillet over medium high heat and cook the onion and 2 Tbsp minced garlic until the onion is soft. Be sure to stir frequently to ensure the garlic doesnt burn.
  2. Add the onion, garlic, 2 cans of tomatoes, 1 Tbsp vinegar, 2 tsp sugar, 1 Tbsp chili powder, 1 tsp oregano, and 1 tsp salt to a blender. Blend until smooth.
  3. Pour half of the mixture into the skillet over medium low heat and cook for 10-12 minutes.
  4. Once all the chicken is shredded, add it to the pan with the sauce and mix to incorporate.
  5. Divide the meat mixture into 15 equal parts and put one portion into each tortilla along with a sprinkling of shredded Mexican cheese.
