  6. Roll the tortilla up and place it seam side down in a 13x9 pan. Sprinkle the remaining cheese over the top of the enchiladas as well as the last half of the red sauce.
  7. Bake the enchiladas for 10 minutes at 350F.

For the Pico de Gallo

  1. Cut the tomatoes in half the long way and scoop out the seeds. Dice the tomatoes and place in a large bowl.
  2. Dice of a red onion and add to the the tomatoes.
  3. Cut the stem off of the jalapeo pepper. Cut the pepper into small pieces and add to the mixture.
  4. NOTE: If you arent a fan of heat, then take out the ribs before chopping up the peppers.
  5. Cut the stems off of a small bunch of cilantro and finely chop the leaves until you have cup, add to the bowl.
  6. Cut a lime in half and squeeze its juice into the mixing bowl. Stir all of the ingredients together and add salt and pepper to taste.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. To each of your containers add 3 enchiladas and divide the Pico de Gallo evenly 5 ways. You may want to store this in a smaller separate container so you dont have to reheat it in the microwave.

Roasted Turkey with Cauliflower Pure

Roasted turkey served with a cauliflower pure and roasted carrots. A play on the classic Thanksgiving dinner where the cauliflower pure replaces the mashed potatoes and gravy.

CourseCuisineTime - null
Main DishAmerican, meal prepPrep - 20 minutes 20 minutes 20 minutes
Cook - 1 hour 1 hour 1 hour

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
620kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates57g41%
Fat16g11%
Protein63g46%

Ingredients:

For the Turkey

  • 2 lbs (908 g) turkey breast tenderloin
  • Salt and pepper to taste
  • 1 tsp (3 g) garlic powder
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) olive oil

For the Vegetables

  • 1 lb (454 g) bag frozen cauliflower
  • 4 (800 g) russet potatoes
  • 3 Tbsp (42 ) butter
  • cup (28 g) parmesan cheese
  • Salt and pepper to taste
  • 2 Tbsp (32 g) plain Greek yogurt
  • 1 Tbsp (15 g) garlic
  • green onions optional
  • 1 lbs (681 g) carrots
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) olive oil

Instructions:

For the Turkey

  1. Preheat your oven to 350F.
  2. Place your turkey breasts in a baking dish, sprinkle with salt, pepper, and 1 tsp garlic powder. Cook for 45 minutes or until the internal temperature reaches 165F.
  3. When the turkey is finished cooking, let it rest for 10 minutes and slice it into pieces.

For the Cauliflower/Potato Pure

  1. Cut your potatoes into a large dice and place in a pot of boiling water. Boil for 8-10 minutes or until soft.
  2. Microwave the cauliflower until it is thawed.
  3. While the cauliflower is still hot add it to a food processor or blender with the potatoes, garlic, butter, Greek yogurt, parmesan cheese, and 1 tsp each of salt and pepper. Blend until smooth.

For the Carrots

  1. Peel your carrots and cut off the stems. Cut the carrots on a bias into 2 inch pieces.
  2. Add the carrots to a sheet pan and drizzle with 1 Tbsp olive oil.
  3. Using the same 350F oven, bake for 10 minutes then flip. Bake for an additional 8-10 minutes. They have finished cooking when they are soft and have begun to brown.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide all of your ingredients evenly between your 5 containers. Top with green onions if you wish.

Sweet Chili Chicken & Shrimp

Chicken and shrimp with ginger rice drizzled with Thai sweet chili sauce. Serve this dish with a side of zucchini and yellow squash.

CourseCuisineTime - 55 minutes 55 minutes 55 minutes
Main DishAmerican, meal prepPrep - 20 minutes 20 minutes 20 minutes
Cook - 35 minutes 35 minutes 35 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
657kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates56g40%
Fat22g16%
Protein59g43%

Ingredients:

For the Chicken

  • 2 lbs (908 g) boneless skinless chicken breast
  • 2 tsp (6 g) chili powder
  • 2 tsp (6 g) garlic powder
  • Salt and pepper to taste
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) olive oil
  • 5 Tbsp (75 g) Thai sweet chili sauce buy premade

For the Rice

  • 5 cups (675 g) cooked rice
  • 1 Tbsp (5 g) ginger minced
  • 5.333 tsp (80 ml) olive oil
  • Salt to taste

For the Shrimp

  • 1 lb (454 g) shrimp
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) olive oil
  • 1 tsp (5 g) garlic minced
  • tsp (2 g) cumin
  • tsp (2 g) chili powder
  • tsp (2 g) onion powder
  • tsp (1 g) salt
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) lime juice

For the Squash

  • 2 (400 g) zucchini
  • 2 (400 g) yellow squash
  • 1 Tbsp (15 g) garlic minced
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) olive oil

Instructions:

For the Chicken

  1. Pound or butterfly your chicken breast so it has an even thickness throughout. Season both sides of the chicken with salt, pepper, 2 tsp chili powder, and 2 tsp garlic powder.
  2. Heat a grill pan or a large skillet over medium high heat and add 1 Tbsp of olive oil.
  3. Cook the chicken until it is no longer pink in the center and the internal temperature reaches 165. Allow to rest for 8-10 minutes before slicing. Slice your chicken into strips about thick.

For the Shrimp

  1. Mix together the ingredients for the shrimp marinade and stir in the shrimp, set in the fridge to marinate for at least 15 minutes.
  2. Heat a cast iron pan or a grill pan over high heat.
  3. Cook your shrimp for 2 minutes on each side or until fully pink and cooked through.

For the Zucchini

  1. While the chicken is cooking, slice the zucchini and yellow squash into thin (around 1/8). Use a mandolin if you have one.
  2. Heat a skillet over medium high heat and add 1 Tbsp of olive oil. Saut the vegetables and minced garlic until soft. Season with seasoned salt and pepper to taste.

For the Rice

  1. Cook the rice using your preferred method (rice cooker or saucepan). Be sure you make enough to have 2 cups worth of cooked rice.
  2. In a large bowl, take 2 cups of cooked rice and add the minced ginger, olive oil, and salt to taste.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. To each of your containers add cup of the ginger rice and divide the chicken, shrimp, and vegetables evenly. Top each piece of chicken with 1 Tbsp of sweet chili sauce.

Stuffed Peppers

Bell peppers stuffed with hamburger, zucchini, mushrooms, and rice. This meal provides a great way to hide vegetables to where they are nearly unnoticeable.

CourseCuisineTime - 40 minutes 40 minutes 40 minutes
Main DishAmerican, meal prepPrep - 10 minutes 10 minutes 10 minutes
Cook - 30 minutes 30 minutes 30 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
749kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates69g47%
Fat33g22%
Protein43g29%

Ingredients:

  • 5 (750 g) bell peppers
  • 2 lbs (908 g) ground beef (85/15)
  • 1 large (300 g) zucchini
  • 1 medium (200 g) yellow onion
  • 2 Tbsp (30 g) garlic minced
  • 4 oz (114 g) white mushrooms
  • 14.5 oz (411 g) can petite diced tomatoes
  • 7 cups (945 g) cooked rice
  • Salt and pepper to taste
  • 2 Tbsp (30 ml) olive oil

Instructions:

  1. Cook the rice using your preferred method (rice cooker or saucepan). Be sure you make enough to have 7 cups worth of cooked rice.
  2. Heat a large pot of salted water to cook the peppers in. Make sure you have enough water to fully cover the peppers.
  3. Wash and cut the peppers in half lengthwise, through the stem. Cut out the seeds and stem. Boil the pepper halves in the water until soft, around 5-7 minutes.
  4. While the peppers are cooking, heat a skillet over medium high heat and add 1 Tbsp of olive oil.
  5. Cut the onion into a small dice.
  6. Add the onion and garlic to the skillet and saut for 2 minutes then add the ground beef. Season with salt and pepper.
  7. When the beef is cooked through, drain the fat and transfer the meat to a large bowl.
  8. Cut the zucchini into small inch sized pieces and dice the mushrooms.
  9. Add 1 Tbsp of olive oil to the pan and saut the zucchini and mushrooms.
  10. Add the can of tomatoes and 7 cups of cooked rice to the pan and cook for 5 minutes over medium heat.
  11. Season the tomato mixture with salt and pepper to taste and add the beef back to the pan. Mix thoroughly.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Place two pepper halves in each of your containers and divide the meat mixture evenly between them. You wont be able to fit it all inside the pepper.

Shredded Pork & Sweet Potatoes

This dish is one of the easiest you will make. The sweet potatoes & green beans take no more than 25 minutes and the pork cooks in the crock pot so you dont have to spend much time in the kitchen.

CourseCuisineTime - null
Main DishAmerican, meal prepPrep - 15 minutes 15 minutes 15 minutes
Cook - 4 hours 30 minutes 4 hours 30 minutes 4 hours 30 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
704kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates55g40%
Fat32g23%
Protein49g36%

Ingredients:

For the Pork

  • 3 lb (1362 g) pork butt roast
  • 2 tsp (6 g) garlic powder
  • 2 tsp (5 g) onion powder
  • 2 tsp (6 g) chili powder
  • 2 tsp (6 g) paprika
  • 2 tsp (6 g) salt
  • 2 tsp (4 g) pepper
  • tsp (2 g) cayenne pepper
  • 1 cup (240 g) apple cider vinegar
  • cup (120 g) BBQ sauce look for low sugar option. Most vinegar based sauces are lower in sugar

For the Green Beans

  • 1 lb (454 g) cut and washed fresh green beans

For the Sweet Potatoes

  • 5 (875 g) sweet potatoes
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) olive oil
  • salt and pepper to taste

Instructions:

For the Pork

  1. Mix together all of the spices and rub over the pork.
  2. Place in a crockpot on high with 1 cup of apple cider vinegar for 4 hours.
  3. Once cooked, remove from crockpot and shred with two forks.
  4. Turn on your oven to broil.
  5. Line a baking sheet with tin foil. Spread the pork over the baking sheet and place in the oven for 3 minutes. Remove and flip. Cook an additional 3 minutes. Watch carefully so the pork doesn't burn. Placing the pork in the oven will add color and texture to the meat.
  6. Cover the pork with the BBQ sauce.

For the Green Beans

  1. If you buy the pre-cut green beans in the bag, follow the instructions on the bag.
  2. If you buy regular green beans, cut off the ends and boil them for 10 minutes or until they are soft.

For the Sweet Potatoes

  1. Preheat your oven to 400F
  2. Wash and cut the sweet potatoes into a medium dice.
  3. Spread them onto a sheet pan and drizzle with 1 Tbsp of olive oil. Season with salt and pepper.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide the ingredients evenly between your 5 containers.

Chicken Burrito Bowls

Adobo marinated chicken with peppers, cilantro lime rice, and pico de gallo. A dish full of flavor and one that reheats extremely well. A great post-workout meal.

CourseCuisineTime - 1 hour 1 hour 1 hour
Main Dishmeal prep, MexicanPrep - 1 hour 1 hour 1 hour
Cook - 35 minutes 35 minutes 35 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
705kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates59g42%
Fat29g20%
Protein51g36%

Ingredients:

For the Chicken

  • 2 lbs (1335 g) boneless skinless chicken thighs
  • (170 g) can chipotle peppers in adobo sauce
  • medium (100 g) red onion
  • Tbsp (7 ml) olive oil
  • 1 Tbsp (15 g) garlic minced
  • 1 tsp (3 g) salt
  • 1 tsp (2 g) pepper
  • 1 tsp (3 g) cumin

For the Rice

  • 5 cups (875 g) cooked rice
  • 2 Tbsp (2 g) cilantro chopped
  • 3 tbsp (45 ml) olive oil
  • 2 Tbsp (30 ml) lime juice

For the Pico de Gallo

  • 5 (300 g) Roma tomatoes
  • medium (100 g) red onion
  • cup (5 g) cilantro chopped
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) lime juice
  • 1 (20 g) jalapeo pepper
  • Salt and pepper to taste

For the Guacamole

  • 2 (250 g) avocados
  • cup pico de gallo
  • Lime juice
  • Salt and pepper to taste

For the Peppers

  • 2 medium (300 g) red peppers
  • 2 medium (300 g) green peppers
  • medium (100 g) red onion
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) olive oil

Instructions:

For the Chicken

  1. Dice the red onion
  2. In a large zip lock bag, add the chicken, chipotle peppers, red onion, olive oil, garlic, salt, pepper, and cumin. Shake it around to coat the chicken evenly. Try to remove all of the air from the bag and marinate for at least 30 minutes.
  3. Once marinated, preheat a large skillet over medium high heat. Add 1 Tbsp of olive oil to the pan and cook the chicken in batches to prevent overcrowding and proper cooking. The chicken is done when it has an internal temperature of 165F.
  4. Cut the chicken into 1 inch cubes.

For the Peppers

  1. While the chicken is cooking, cut the peppers and onions into strips. Cook them together in a skillet with 1 Tbsp olive oil until onions are translucent.

For the Rice

  1. Cook enough rice to have 2 cups of cooked rice. 1 cup of uncooked rice will yield around 3 cups of cooked rice.
  2. Drizzle 3 tbsp of olive oil over the rice and mix in the cilantro, lime juice, and add salt and pepper to taste.

For the Pico de Gallo

  1. Cut the tomatoes in half the long way and scoop out the seeds. Dice the tomatoes so they are about inch cubes and place in a large bowl.
  2. Dice of a red onion and add to the the tomatoes.
  3. Cut the stems off of the jalapeo pepper. Cut the pepper into a small dice and add to the mixture.
  4. NOTE: If you arent a fan of heat, then take out the ribs and seeds before chopping up the peppers.
  5. Cut the stems off of a small bunch of cilantro and finely chop the leaves until you have cup, add to the bowl.
  6. Cut a lime in half and squeeze its juice into the mixing bowl. Stir all of the ingredients together and add salt and pepper to taste.

For the Guacamole

  1. It is best to make the guacamole on an as needed basis as the avocado will oxidize quickly and turn brown. Luckily it can be made in the time it takes to heat up your meal.
  2. Cut 1 avocado in half and remove the pit. Score the inside of the avocado and extract with a spoon. In a bowl, mash the avocado with a fork until it is smooth.
  3. Add 3 Tbsp of the pico de gallo to the avocado and mix. Add salt, pepper and lime juice to taste.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. In each of your containers put cup of the cilantro lime rice. Divide the remaining ingredients evenly into each of your 5 containers. Store the pico and guacamole in a separate, smaller container.

Brazilian Chicken Stroganoff

This is the Brazilian version of of the classic stroganoff dish. It contains chicken and mushrooms in a wine and cream sauce and served over rice instead of noodles.

CourseCuisineTime - 1 hour 20 minutes 1 hour 20 minutes 1 hour 20 minutes
Main DishBrazilian, meal prepPrep - 20 minutes 20 minutes 20 minutes
Cook - 1 hour 1 hour 1 hour

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
692kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates77g51%
Fat19g12%
Protein54g36%

Ingredients:

For the Stroganoff

  • 2 lbs (1135 g) boneless skinless chicken breast
  • medium (100 g) sweet onion
  • 2 Tbsp (30 g) garlic minced
  • 3 Tbsp (45 ml) olive oil
  • cup (120 ml) dry white wine
  • 1 cups (360 ml) chicken stock
  • cup (180 ml) tomato sauce
  • 1 Tbsp (14 g) butter
  • 8 oz (227 g) white mushrooms
  • 1 cup (227 g) nonfat plain greek yogurt
  • 1 Tbsp (15 g) Dijon mustard
  • cup (5 g) cilantro chopped
  • 1 large bunch (500 g) broccoli
  • 7 cups (1125 g) cooked rice

Instructions:

For the Chicken

  1. Heat a skillet over medium high heat and add 1 Tbsp of olive oil.
  2. Pat the chicken dry with a paper towel and cut into strips around inch thick, season the chicken with salt and pepper.
  3. Fry the chicken in the pan in batches to ensure the pan isnt overcrowded and you achieve proper browning on the meat. Add oil as necessary. You dont need to cook it all of the way through, just achieve proper browning on the meat.
  4. Dice of a sweet onion while the chicken is cooking.
  5. After all of the chicken has cooked, set it aside and add another tablespoon of olive oil to the pan. Add the onion and garlic and cook for 5 minutes.
  6. Add the chicken back to the pan and pour in cup of white wine. Cook until the wine is almost dissolved and turn the heat to low.
  7. Add the tomato sauce and chicken broth to the pan. Partially cover the pan, turn the heat to low, and cook for 35-40 minutes.
  8. Heat a new skillet over medium-medium high heat. Add 1 Tbsp of butter to the skillet and saut the mushrooms until brown and soft.
  9. Once your chicken mixture has cooked for 45 minutes, remove the pan from the heat and add the mushrooms, 1 cup of greek yogurt, cup chopped cilantro, and 1 Tbsp of dijon mustard. Stir to incorporate.

For the Broccoli

  1. In a large pot, add 1 inch of water and steam the broccoli using a steamer basket. Cook on high heat, covered for 5-7 minutes or until the broccoli is soft.
  2. This recipe makes 5 servings. Add cup of rice to each container and split the chicken and broccoli evenly. If you have extra sauce remaining, pour it over the broccoli.

For the Rice

  1. Cook enough rice to have 7 cups of cooked rice using your preferred method. 1 cup of uncooked rice will yield around 3 cups of cooked rice.

**For the Rice **

  1. Cook enough rice to yield 1 cups of cooked rice. 1 cup of dry rice will make around 2-3 cups of cooked rice.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Split the chicken and broccoli evenly. Each dish gets cup of rice. If you have extra sauce remaining, pour it over the broccoli.

Meatballs in Bolognese

Meatballs made from 85/15 ground beef served with homemade bolognese sauce made with fresh basil, parsley, carrots, and celery.

CourseCuisineTime - 1 hour 15 minutes 1 hour 15 minutes 1 hour 15 minutes
Main DishItalian, meal prepPrep - 25 minutes 25 minutes 25 minutes
Cook - 50 minutes 50 minutes 50 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
893kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates79g45%
Fat39g22%
Protein57g32%

Ingredients:

For the Meatballs

  • 2 lbs (908 g) ground beef (85/15)
  • 4 (4 ) eggs
  • cup (120 ml) skim milk
  • 1 cup (60 g) ground Cheerios between 1 -2 cups of whole Cheerios, blended, you can use breadcrumbs as well
  • 1 tsp (3 g) salt
  • 1 tsp (2 g) pepper
  • 2 Tbsp (3 g) fresh parsley
  • 2 tsp (6 g) garlic powder
  • cup (69 g) parmesan cheese grated
  • medium (100 g) sweet onion

For the Bolognese

  • 1 medium (200 g) sweet onion
  • 1 Tbsp (15 g) garlic minced
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) olive oil
  • 28 oz (794 g) can of crushed tomatoes
  • 3 medium (300 g) carrots
  • 3 medium (300 g) celery stalks
  • cup (5 g) fresh parsley
  • 8 fresh basil leaves
  • Salt and pepper to taste

For the Zoodles

  • 3 medium (600 g) zucchini spiralized

For the Rice

  • 5 cups (875 g) cooked rice

Instructions:

For the Meatballs

  1. Preheat your oven to 375F
  2. In a large bowl mix all of the ingredients together using your hands. Be careful not to handle too much or the meatballs will become tough.
  3. Roll the meat into balls about 1.5-2 in diameter and place onto a greased sheet pan.
  4. Bake the meatballs for 15 minutes. Remove them from the oven to turn and then cook for an additional 5 minutes.

For the Bolognese

  1. Chop the onion, celery, and carrots into a small dice.
  2. In a large skillet heat the olive oil over medium high heat and saut 1 Tbsp minced garlic and onion together for a few minutes. Then add the celery and carrot and cook until soft.
  3. Chop the parsley and basil while the vegetables cook.
  4. Add the canned tomatoes, basil, and parsley and reduce the heat to medium low. Cook for 15-20 minutes or until thickened. Add salt and pepper to taste.
  5. If you prefer a smooth sauce, put the mixture into a blender. If you dont mind the carrot and celery chunks, leave it as is.
  6. When the meatballs are finished, add them to the sauce and allow them to cook together

For the Zoodles

  1. Spiralize all of your zucchini. We arent going to cook this because it will cook in the microwave when you reheat your meal. Do not salt this either as it will encourage moisture to release from the squash.
  2. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide the meatballs, sauce, and zucchini evenly into 5 portions

For the Rice

  1. Cook enough rice to have 5 cups of cooked rice. 1 cup of dry rice will yield about 3 cups of cooked rice.

Chicken Lettuce Wraps

Ground chicken cooked with Asian flavors and eaten with shredded carrots and bean sprouts in a romaine lettuce leaf. Served with a peanut sauce.

CourseCuisineTime - 25 minutes 25 minutes
Main DishAsian, meal prepPrep - 5 minutes 5 minutes
Cook - 20 minutes 20 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
514kcal4
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates61g54%
Fat13g11%
Protein38g33%

Ingredients:

For the Wraps

  • 1 lb (567 g) ground chicken (99/1)
  • small (75 g) onion onion
  • cup (60 g) hoisin sauce
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) olive oil
  • 1 Tbsp (5 g) ginger minced
  • 1 Tbsp (15 g) garlic minced
  • 1 Tbsp (15 g) Sriracha
  • 2 Tbsp (30 ml) soy sauce
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) rice wine vinegar
  • 8 oz (227 g) can of chopped water chestnuts
  • Salt and pepper to taste

For the Peanut Sauce

  • 2 Tbsp (32 g) peanut butter
  • 1 Tbsp (23 ml) water
  • 1 tsp (7 ml) soy sauce
  • 1 tsp (7 ml) rice wine vinegar
  • 1 tsp (7 g) honey
  • 1 tsp (5 ml) sesame oil
  • tsp (1 ml) garlic minced
  • tsp (2 ml) ginger minced

For the Toppings/Wrap

  • 1 cup (100 g) shredded carrots
  • 1 cup (100 g) bean sprouts
  • cup (50 g) red onion sliced
  • 1 head (300 g) romaine lettuce

For the Rice

  • 4 cups (700 g) cooked rice

Instructions:

For the Chicken

  1. Heat 1 Tbsp of olive oil in a skillet over medium high heat. Saut of a diced yellow onion, 1 Tbsp minced ginger, and 1 Tbsp of minced garlic for 2 minutes and then add the chicken.
  2. Once the chicken is cooked, stir in cup hoisin sauce, 1 Tbsp rice wine vinegar, 2 Tbsp soy sauce, 1 Tbsp Sriracha, and water chestnuts and cook until heated.
  3. Tear off individual pieces of lettuce and rinse with water. Clean bean sprouts and carrots as well. Cut the red onion into thin slices.

For the Peanut Sauce

  1. Mix all ingredients in a bowl and whisk to create a smooth mixture.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 4 servings. Because of the lettuce, I wouldnt prep more than 4 at a time. Divide the meat, peanut sauce, carrots, bean sprouts, and red onion into 4 portions. In each container put 2 pieces of lettuce to use for your wraps. Add 1 cup of rice to each dish. I like to store the toppings inside of the lettuce boat to make for easy removal before microwaving.

For the Rice

  1. Cook enough rice to yield 4 cups of cooked rice. 1 cup of dry rice will make about 3 cups of cooked rice.

Loaded Meatloaf with Green Beans

Meatloaf made with 93/7 ground turkey, stuffed with onions and carrots, served with a side of green beans and garlic parmesan potato wedges.

CourseCuisineTime - 1 hour 20 minutes 1 hour 20 minutes 1 hour 20 minutes
Main DishAmerican, meal prepPrep - 20 minutes 20 minutes 20 minutes
Cook - 1 hour 1 hour 1 hour

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
692kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates47g36%
Fat35g27%
Protein47g36%

Ingredients:

For the Meat Mixture

  • 2 lbs (908 g) ground beef (85/15)
  • cup (60 g) instant oats
  • 2 (2 ) eggs
  • 1 cup (240 ml) skim milk
  • medium (100 g) sweet onion
  • 1 cup (100 g) shredded carrots
  • cup (23 g) parmesan cheese grated
  • 1 tsp (2 g) pepper
  • 1 tsp (3 g) salt
  • 1 tsp (3 g) Lawrys seasoned salt

For the Potato Wedges

  • 5 small (750 g) russet potatoes
  • 2 Tbsp (30 ml) garlic minced
  • 1 tsp (3 g) salt
  • 1 tsp (2 g) pepper
  • 1 tsp (2 g) paprika
  • 1 tsp (2 g) cayenne pepper
  • 1 Tbsp (1 g) dried parsley
  • 2 Tbsp (11 g) parmesan cheese grated
  • 1 tbsp (15 ml) olive oil

For the Green Beans

  • 1 lb (454 g) green beans fresh

Instructions:

For the Meatloaf

  1. Preheat oven to 350F
  2. Finely chop the onion (and the carrots if desired).
  3. In a large bowl combine the beef, cup oatmeal, 2 lightly beaten eggs, 1 cup of milk, 1 tsp salt, 1 tsp pepper, 1 tsp seasoned salt, cup grated parmesan cheese, and the chopped onion and carrots. Try not to handle too much as the meat will become tough.
  4. Press the mixture into a large loaf pan and bake for 1 hour or until the center registers a temperature of 160F.

For the Potatoes

  1. Wash each of your potatoes thoroughly. Cut each of them in half long ways 3 times so you have 8 wedges for each potato.
  2. You can use the oven at the same time you are cooking the meatloaf. On a cookie sheet, drizzle 1 Tbsp of olive oil over the potatoes.
  3. Sprinkle 1 tsp each of salt, pepper, paprika, cayenne, and 1 Tbsp parsley over the potatoes. Add 2 Tbsp minced garlic and 2 Tbsp of grated parmesan and toss the potatoes to coat.
  4. Bake them for 15 minutes and then flip them to the other side and cook an additional 10-15 minutes. Watch them carefully to ensure they dont burn.

For the Green Beans

  1. If you buy the pre-cut green beans in the bag, follow the instructions on the bag.
  2. If you buy regular green beans, cut off the ends and boil them for 10 minutes or until they are soft.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Cut the meatloaf into 5 equal portions and divide the green beans and potatoes evenly.

Balsamic Chicken & Roasted Vegetables

Balsamic marinated chicken served with red potatoes and cherry tomatoes as well as balsamic roasted vegetables. A flavorful, low calorie meal option which provides more than a serving of vegetables.

CourseCuisineTime - 1 hour 20 minutes
Main DishAmerican, meal prepPrep - 40 minutes
Cook - 40 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
461kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates44g44%
Fat13g13%
Protein41g41%

Ingredients:

For the Chicken

  • 2 lbs (908 g) boneless skinless chicken breast
  • 1 cup (200 g) grape tomatoes
  • 1 lb (454 g) red potatoes
  • medium (100 g) red onion
  • 2 Tbsp (30 ml) olive oil
  • cup (60 ml) balsamic vinegar
  • 1 Tbsp (15 g) Dijon mustard
  • 1 Tbsp (15 g) garlic minced
  • 2 Tbsp (42 g) honey
  • Salt and pepper to taste

For the Roasted Vegetables

  • 1 medium (125 g) red pepper
  • 1 bunch (500 g) broccoli
  • lb (227 g) carrots
  • 2 Tbsp (30 ml) balsamic vinegar
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) olive oil
  • Salt and pepper to taste

Instructions:

For the Chicken

  1. Preheat your oven to 400F
  2. In a bowl mix together cup balsamic vinegar, 2 Tbsp honey, 1 Tbsp dijon mustard, 1 Tbsp minced garlic, and salt & pepper.
  3. Place the chicken in a gallon plastic bag and pour your sauce mixture over the chicken. Remove as much air from the bag as possible. Marinate for at least 30 minutes.
  4. Cut the potatoes and onion into 1-2 inch pieces and put in a 13x9 pan or on a foil lined sheet pan. Drizzle with olive oil and season with salt and pepper and bake for 15 minutes.
  5. After 15 minutes of baking, remove from the oven and add the grape tomatoes and the chicken along with the marinade.
  6. Cook the chicken for 25 minutes or until the internal temperature is at least 165F.

For the Vegetables

  1. Cut the vegetables into 1 pieces.
  2. Cover a sheet pan with aluminum foil and spread out the vegetables evenly. Drizzle with 1 Tbsp olive oil, 2 Tbsp balsamic vinegar and salt and pepper over the top.
  3. Bake for 15 minutes.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Cut the chicken into strips and divide everything evenly into 5 portions.

Hamburger and Sweet Potato Fries

Hamburger patties made from 85/15 ground beef served with fresh tomato slices, romaine lettuce, and a side of sweet potato fries.

CourseCuisineTime - 1 hour 5 minutes 1 hour 5 minutes 1 hour 5 minutes
Main DishAmerican, meal prepPrep - 30 minutes 30 minutes 30 minutes
Cook - 35 minutes 35 minutes 35 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
789kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates68g44%
Fat35g22%
Protein51g33%

Ingredients:

  • 2 lbs (908 g) ground beef (85/15)
  • 2 (2 ) eggs
  • small (100 g) yellow onion
  • 2 tsp (10 g) dijon mustard
  • 2 tsp (10 ml) Worcestershire sauce
  • 1 tsp (5 g) garlic minced
  • 1 tsp (3 g) salt
  • 1 tsp (2 g) pepper
  • 1 tsp (15 ml) olive oil
  • Cooking spray
  • 2 (120 g) Roma tomatoes
  • Romaine lettuce optional
  • 4 large (1100 g) sweet potatoes
  • 1 (20 g) jalapeo pepper
  • 5 slices (100 g) cheese of your choice

Instructions:

  1. In a large bowl whisk two eggs and add in 2 tsp Worcestershire sauce, 2 tsp dijon mustard, 1 tsp minced garlic, finely chopped onion, and 1 tsp salt and pepper
  2. Add in beef and mix together. Try and handle the meat as little as possible as it will get tough
  3. Use a scale if you have one to portion out 4oz balls and shape into a patty. Aim for 10 patties.
  4. Making a shallow imprint with your thumb into the patty will prevent it from puffing up during cooking.
  5. To cook your burgers, use a grill for best results. If you dont have access to a grill heat a skillet over medium to medium high heat and cook with a small amount of oil. The burgers are done when they have reached in internal temperature of 160F.
  6. While your burgers are cooking, wash and peel your sweet potatoes. Preheat your oven to 425. Cut potatoes into x matchstick shapes. Placing the potatoes in ice cold water for at least 30 minutes prior to cooking may help with crispiness. This step is optional.
  7. Line a cookie sheet with foil and spray with oil. Spread the potatoes out over the foil but be sure you dont overcrowd the sheet. Spray the top of the potatoes with oil and season with salt and pepper or your favorite seasoning.
  8. Cook for 10 minutes and then flip the potatoes and cook for 5-10 additional minutes. Watch the potatoes closely as they are prone to burn.
  9. Plating
  10. This recipe makes 5 servings. In each of your containers put two hamburger patties, two pieces of lettuce, tomato slices, one piece of cheese, and split the sweet potato fries evenly 5 ways.

Coconut Chicken Curry

Chicken and red bell peppers in a coconut curry sauce served over roasted spaghetti squash. A low calorie, cheap meal option that packs a lot of flavor and variety.

CourseCuisineTime - 1 hour 10 minutes 1 hour 10 minutes
Main CourseIndian, meal prepPrep - 10 minutes 10 minutes
Cook - 1 hour 1 hour

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
552kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates48g43%
Fat22g19%
Protein41g36%

Ingredients:

For the Curry

  • 2 lbs (908 g) boneless skinless chicken thighs
  • 1 cup (240 g) canned coconut milk
  • 1 (100 g) red onion small
  • 2 (250 g) red peppers
  • 1 Tbsp (15 g) garlic
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) olive oil
  • 1 Tbsp (6 g) curry powder
  • Tbsp (3 g) turmeric
  • Tbsp (3 g) paprika
  • Tbsp (3 g) cayenne pepper
  • Salt and pepper to taste

For the Spaghetti Squash

  • 1 (750 g) spaghetti squash
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) olive oil
  • Salt and pepper to taste

For the Rice

  • 5 cups (875 g) cooked rice
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) olive oil
  • Salt and pepper to taste

Instructions:

For the Squash

  1. Preheat your oven to 425. Cut the spaghetti squash in half the long way. It may help to pierce the squash with a fork and microwave for a few minutes to make it easier to slice. Scoop out any seeds and sprinkle with olive oil, salt, and pepper. Place on a cookie sheet face up and cook for around 40 minutes or until you can easily peel away the flesh.

For the Curry

  1. Heat a skillet over medium high heat and add a bit of olive oil.
  2. Season one side of the chicken with salt and pepper and place season side down in pan and then season the other side. Cook until the center is no longer pink or a has an internal temperature of 165F.
  3. While the chicken is cooking, cut the red onion and peppers into thin strips
  4. When the chicken is finished, add a bit of olive oil to the same pan and saut the onion, peppers, and garlic until soft.
  5. Add coconut milk and all spices. Shake the can of coconut milk before opening until you hear it is in liquid form. Running the can under hot water will help the process. Stir to incorporate.
  6. Reduce the heat to low and cover. Simmer the sauce and allow to thicken until desired consistency. If the sauce is still runny after ~10 minutes, mix 1 Tbsp of cornstarch with Tbsp of cold water and add to the sauce to thicken.
  7. While the sauce is simmering, cut your chicken into 1-2 inch pieces. Add the sliced chicken to sauce once it has thickened.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Add 1 cup of rice to each of your containers and divide the curry mixture evenly between the 5 containers.

For the Rice

  1. Cook enough rice to have 5 cups of cooked rice. 1 cup of dry rice will yield about 3 cups of cooked rice. Mix in 1 tbsp of oil and season to taste.

Sweet Potato Breakfast Hash

Sausage and sweet potatoes cooked with onions and garlic and served with a side of eggs. A calorie dense breakfast option to help you start off your day.

CourseCuisineTime - 30 minutes 30 minutes 30 minutes
BreakfastAmerican, meal prepPrep - 10 minutes 10 minutes 10 minutes
Cook - 20 minutes 20 minutes 20 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
636kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates39g35%
Fat40g36%
Protein31g28%

Ingredients:

  • 3 large (825 g) sweet potatoes
  • medium (100 g) yellow onion
  • 1 tsp (5 g) garlic minced
  • 1 lb (454 g) breakfast sausage I prefer Jimmy Dean Original
  • 12 (10 ) eggs
  • 1 tsp (5 ml) olive oil
  • Salt and pepper to taste

Instructions:

For the Hash

  1. Heat a large skillet over medium high heat. Dice the onion and add to the pan with olive oil and garlic. Allow to cook for 2-3 minutes. Add the sausage to the onion and garlic mixture and stir occasionally until browned.
  2. While the sausage is cooking, fill a saucepan with enough water to cover sweet potatoes and begin to boil water.
  3. Peel the sweet potatoes and cut into inch cubes. Add the potatoes to the water once it is boiling. Cook until sweet potatoes are soft and easily pierced with fork.
  4. Drain the potatoes and add to the sausage mixture. Make sure you drain the fat first.

For the Eggs

  1. You can cook the eggs any way that you like. I prefer boiled or scrambled. If you prefer fried, I would make them fresh the day you plan on eating each meal.
  2. Fill a medium pot with enough water to cover 12 eggs. Bring the pot to a boil and then remove from the heat and cover. Set a timer for 12 minutes.
  3. After 12 minutes drain the water and shower the eggs in cold water to cool. Peel the eggs and cut in half.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide your hash evenly into each of your 5 containers and add 2 eggs to each.

Sausage and Eggs with Sweet Potato Chips

Ground sausage and eggs over a bed of sweet potato chips with grape tomatoes. A breakfast full of flavor that can provide you will energy to start your day.

CourseCuisineTime - 35 minutes 35 minutes 35 minutes
BreakfastAmerican, meal prepPrep - 10 minutes 10 minutes 10 minutes
Cook - 25 minutes 25 minutes 25 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
575kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates52g47%
Fat28g25%
Protein29g26%

Ingredients:

  • 12 oz (341 g) ground sausage
  • 10 (10 ) eggs
  • 6 (1200 g) sweet potatoes
  • 1 cup (150 g) grape tomatoes
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) olive oil
  • Salt and pepper to taste

Instructions:

  1. Preheat your oven to 425F.
  2. Wash and cut your sweet potatoes into 1/4 thick chips. Place them on a sheet pan and drizzle with olive oil, salt, and pepper. Bake for 10-15 minutes or until soft. Flip half way.
  3. Heat a skillet over medium high heat and brown your sausage.
  4. While the sausage is cooking, cut the grape tomatoes into halves.
  5. Once the sausage is done browning, cook the grape tomatoes for 5 minutes in the same skillet.
  6. Cook your eggs however you prefer. In the picture on the previous page they are hard boiled. If you prefer any other form, I would recommend cooking your eggs the day you plan to eat each meal.
  7. Fill a medium pot with enough water to cover 10 eggs. Bring the pot to a boil and then remove from the heat and cover. Set a timer for 12 minutes.
  8. After 12 minutes drain the water and shower the eggs in cold water to cool. Peel the eggs and cut in half.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide your ingredients 5 ways and add to each container.

Almond Butter Breakfast Sandwiches

Waffles made from eggs and almond butter to provide a gluten free, lower carb bread for a breakfast sandwich. These are completely customizable and you can add whatever you like!

CourseCuisineTime - 30 minutes
BreakfastAmerican, meal prepPrep - 10 minutes
Cook - 20 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
397kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates6g9%
Fat29g45%
Protein29g45%

Ingredients:

For the Waffles

  • 4 (4 ) eggs
  • cup (128 g) almond butter peanut butter works too
  • tsp (2 g) baking powder
  • NOTE: Add whatever you would like to the batter to customize my favorite is jalapeos and cheddar cheese.

For the Sandwich Components

  • lb (227 g) sliced ham
  • 5 (5 ) eggs
  • 5 slices (50 g) cheddar cheese thinly sliced

Instructions:

For the Waffles

  1. In a blender, add 4 eggs, cup of almond butter and tsp of baking powder. Blend until smooth. (It seems strange but almond butter is the correct ingredient, NOT almond flour).
  2. For waffles, heat a waffle iron to medium heat. For pancakes, heat a skillet. You will have enough batter for 34, 8-inch waffles or 810, 3-inch pancakes. Spray the waffle iron or skillet with cooking spray before cooking.
  3. Cook the waffles for 5-6 minutes. You know its done when it easily comes out of the waffle iron. The pancakes will take 2-3 minutes each side.
  4. Cut the waffles into 4 pieces to serve as your bread for the sandwich.

For the Sandwich Components

  1. Cut your sliced ham into pieces to fit on the waffle or pancake.
  2. The next step is to cook the eggs. If you want nicely shaped eggs like in the picture, crack them into a ramekin and bake at 350F until they are set. Some people dont like the idea of meal prepped eggs. If this is you, prep the eggs the morning you plan to eat the meal. It will only take a few minutes.

Plating

  1. Divide your ingredients evenly between 5 containers.

Oven Baked Omelette with Home Fries

Ham, eggs, cheese, and peppers baked in the oven for ease of cooking and served with a side of baked home fries. This is a super easy breakfast to make for the work week!

CourseCuisineTime - 35 minutes 35 minutes 35 minutes
BreakfastAmerican, meal prepPrep - 10 minutes 10 minutes 10 minutes
Cook - 25 minutes 25 minutes 25 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
571kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates29g30%
Fat38g39%
Protein29g30%

Ingredients:

For the Omelette

  • 8 eggs
  • 1 cup (114 g) diced ham
  • 1 small (100 g) green pepper
  • 1 small (100 g) red pepper
  • (100 g) yellow onion
  • cup (84 g) shredded cheddar cheese
  • cup (60 ml) skim milk
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) olive oil
  • Salt and pepper to taste

For the Home Fries

  • 2 large (550 g) russet potatoes
  • 2 Tbsp (30 ml) olive oil
  • 1 tsp (3 g) seasoned salt
  • tsp (1 g) pepper
  • 1 (60 g) Roma tomato optional
  • 1 (150 g) avocado optional

For the Bacon

  • 15 strips bacon

Instructions:

For the Omelette

  1. Preheat your oven to 400F.
  2. Wash your peppers and cut them into a small dice. Dice the onion to a similar size.
  3. Heat a skillet over medium high heat and add 1 Tbsp of olive oil. Add in onion and peppers. Saut until onions are translucent.
  4. Scramble 8 eggs and cup of milk together. Add in 1 tsp salt and tsp pepper and mix.
  5. Add in the 1 cup of diced ham, the peppers, onions, and cup of cheese to the eggs. Top the mixture with the remaining cup of cheese.
  6. Pour the egg mixture into a greased 8x8 or 13x9 inch baking pan.
  7. Bake for 20-25 minutes until the eggs have set.

For the Home Fries

  1. Wash and cut your potatoes into a medium dice, about inch pieces.
  2. Spread them out on a sheet pan and drizzle with 1 Tbsp of olive oil. Season with 1 tsp seasoned salt and tsp of pepper.
  3. Bake for 10 minutes and then flip the potatoes. Bake an additional 10 minutes or until they are crispy.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Cut your omelette into 5 sections, split the potatoes evenly 5 ways, and add to each of your 5 containers. Add avocado or tomato the day you eat each meal if you desire.

For the Bacon

  1. Line a sheet pan with foil and spread out the bacon on the pan. Bake for about 20 minutes. If you like it crispy, elevate the bacon onto a cooling rack so it is raised from the pan.

Taco Breakfast Bowls with Salsa Roja

A flavorful breakfast option with hash browns, scrambled eggs, and taco meat. Serve this dish with a side of salsa roja. This meal will become a staple for your breakfasts!

CourseCuisineTime - 40 minutes 40 minutes 40 minutes
Breakfastmeal prep, MexicanPrep - 10 minutes 10 minutes 10 minutes
Cook - 30 minutes 30 minutes 30 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
735kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates32g25%
Fat46g36%
Protein48g38%

Ingredients:

For the Taco Meat

  • 2 lb (908 g) ground beef (85/15)
  • 1 cup (240 ml) tomato sauce
  • 2 tsp (4 g) paprika
  • 2 tsp (4 g) chili powder
  • 2 tsp (4 g) cumin
  • 2 tsp (4 g) garlic powder
  • Salt and pepper to taste

For the Eggs

  • 8 (8 ) eggs
  • cup (60 ml) skim milk
  • Cooking spray
  • Salt and pepper to taste

For the Hash browns

  • 6 cups (454 g) hash browns
  • 4 Tbsp (60 ml) olive oil
  • 4 (240 g) Roma tomatoes

For the Salsa Roja

  • 4 (240 g) Roma tomatoes
  • 1 small (100 g) white onion
  • 1 (20 g) jalapeo pepper
  • 1 (10 g) serrano pepper
  • 3 cloves (15 g) garlic
  • bunch (15 g) cilantro
  • Salt and lime juice to taste

Instructions:

For the Taco Meat

  1. Heat a large skillet over medium high heat and brown the ground beef.
  2. Once cooked, drain the fat and add in cup of tomato sauce, 1 tsp paprika, 1 tsp chili powder, 1 tsp cumin, 1 tsp garlic powder, and salt and pepper to taste. Stir to combine and cook for an additional 5 minutes then remove from heat.

For the Salsa Roja

  1. Start a medium pot of water over high heat to boil.
  2. Wash your tomatoes, peppers, and cilantro. Cut the stems off of the tomatoes and peppers.
  3. Add the small white onion (halved), the peppers, tomatoes, and 3 cloves of garlic to the boiling water. Cook for 6-8 minutes. The tomatoes have finished cooking when they begin to change color and the skin starts to break.
  4. Drain the water from the pot. You may want to remove the skins from the tomatoes to avoid any stringy bits. Add the tomatoes, garlic, jalapeos, bunch of cilantro, juice of of a lime and 1 Tbsp apple cider vinegar to a blender. Blend until smooth.
  5. Add salt to taste. Adjust flavor with salt and lime juice as needed.

For the Hash Browns

  1. Heat a large skillet over medium high heat and add in 2 Tbsp of olive oil. Once the oil has heated, add in 6 cups of hash browns. Cook for 5 minutes and flip. Add in more oil as needed.
  2. Cook for an additional 5-7 minutes. If you like your hash browns crispy, you will want to cook them a bit longer.
  3. Dice 2 tomatoes and mix them into the hash browns.

For the Scrambled Eggs

  1. Crack 8 eggs into a large bowl.
  2. Add in cup milk and beat. The secret to perfect scrambled eggs is to beat them until frothy and no egg whites remain unincorporated.
  3. Heat a skillet over medium heat, spray with cooking spray, and cook your eggs until finished. Make sure not to over cook them as you will be reheating them in the microwave.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide your ingredients evenly 5 ways into each of your containers. Store your salsa in a separate, smaller container as you dont want to heat this in the microwave.

Kielbasa Breakfast Bowls

A fantastic way to get more more vegetables in your breakfasts. Roasted sweet potatoes and zucchini paired with kielbasa sausage cooked with spinach and onions.

CourseCuisineTime - 50 minutes 50 minutes 50 minutes
BreakfastAmerican, meal prepPrep - 20 minutes 20 minutes 20 minutes
Cook - 30 minutes 30 minutes 30 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
746kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates54g41%
Fat44g33%
Protein33g25%

Ingredients:

  • 10 (10 ) eggs
  • (100 g) yellow onion
  • 4 (1100 g) sweet potatoes
  • 2 (500 g) zucchinis
  • 21 oz (397 g) kielbasa sausage
  • 3 cups (90 g) uncooked spinach
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) olive oil
  • Salt and pepper to taste

Instructions:

  1. Fill a medium pot with enough water to cover 10 eggs. Bring the pot to a boil and then remove from the heat and cover. Set a timer for 12 minutes.
  2. After 12 minutes drain the water and shower the eggs in cold water to cool. Peel the eggs and cut in half.
  3. Preheat your oven to 400F.
  4. While the eggs are cooking, wash the zucchini and sweet potatoes. Peel the potatoes. Cut the zucchini and sweet potatoes into a small dice.
  5. Spread the sweet potatoes out on a sheet pan and drizzle with olive oil. Cook for 10 minutes then remove from the oven and flip.
  6. Add the zucchini to the same pan and return to the oven for an additional 10 minutes.
  7. Cut your sausage into slices and fry in a skillet over medium high heat.
  8. Save the grease in the pan that occurs from cooking the sausage to cook the onion in.
  9. Cut the onion into a small dice and do a rough chop on your spinach.
  10. Add the onion and spinach to the skillet and cook for 5-7 minutes or until the onions are soft. Add the sausage back in and mix.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Put two eggs into each container and split the sausage and vegetables evenly 5 ways.

Vegetable Latkes

A latke is a jewish food traditionally made using potatoes. In this dish they are made using broccoli slaw, carrots, and zucchini. These are the perfect healthy snack as they are mainly veggies!

CourseCuisineTime - 40 minutes
Snackmeal prepPrep - 10 minutes
Cook - 30 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
93kcal15
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates4.7g33%
Fat6g42%
Protein4.9g35%

Ingredients:

For the Latke

  • 2 cups (227 g) broccoli slaw
  • 1 cup (100 g) shredded carrots
  • 1 (250 ) zucchini
  • 2 (2 ) eggs
  • cup (63 g) almond flour
  • cup (56 g) parmesan cheese
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) olive oil
  • 1 tsp (2 g) garlic powder
  • 1 tsp (2 g) seasoned salt
  • tsp (1 g) pepper

For the Avocado Cream Sauce

  • 1 small (100 g) avocado
  • cup (113 g) plain non fat Greek yogurt
  • 1 tsp (3 g) dill
  • Salt to taste

Instructions:

For the Latke

  1. Start a medium pot of water over high heat and bring to a boil.
  2. Cut your zucchini into small, matchstick sized pieces to match your carrots and broccoli slaw.
  3. Boil the carrots, broccoli slaw, and zucchini for 5 minutes and then strain.
  4. Using paper towels or cheese cloth, get as much water out of the vegetables as you can.
  5. In a large bowl mix together the vegetables, 2 beaten eggs, cup almond flour, cup parmesan cheese, 1 Tbsp olive oil, 1 tsp garlic powder, 1 tsp seasoned salt, and tsp pepper.
  6. Heat a skillet over medium heat. Spray with cooking spray before cooking. Place the mixture into the pan using a cookie scoop and flatten into a pancake shape with your fingers. If you dont have a cookie scoop make balls about the size of about 1-1 in diameter.
  7. Cook for 2-3 minutes on each side.

For the Avocado Cream Sauce

  1. Add the avocado, cup Greek yogurt, 1 tsp dill and salt to a blender and mix until smooth.

Storage

  1. Keep these in the refrigerator for no more than 5 days. If you wish to freeze them, put them into a ziplock bag and remove as much air as possible. Label and date the bag. I would not freeze the yogurt sauce.

Chimichurri Chicken with Sweet Potato Fries

Grilled chicken thighs served with a side of chimichurri sauce, sweet potato fries, and zucchini. Grilled meat and chimichurri are a match made in heaven.

CourseCuisineTime - 1 hour 20 minutes 1 hour 20 minutes 1 hour 20 minutes
Main DishArgentinian, meal prepPrep - 40 minutes 40 minutes 40 minutes
Cook - 40 minutes 40 minutes 40 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
816kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates66g42%
Fat38g24%
Protein51g32%

Ingredients:

For the Chicken

  • 2 lbs (1135 g) boneless skinless chicken thighs
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) olive oil
  • tsp (1.5 ml) salt
  • 1 Tbsp (8 g) paprika
  • 1 Tbsp (15 g) garlic minced

For the Sweet Potato Fries and Zucchini

  • 2 medium (550 g) sweet potatoes
  • 2 medium (500 g) zucchini
  • 1 Tbsp (20 ml) olive oil
  • Salt and pepper

For the Chimichurri

  • 1 bunch (55 g) flat leaf parsley 2-2.5 cups
  • 4 cloves (20 g) garlic
  • 2 Tbsp (30 ml) red wine vinegar
  • cup (120 ml) olive oil
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) lemon juice
  • 2 Tbsp (10 g) red onion diced
  • 1 tsp (1 g) oregano
  • 5 cups (675 g) cooked rice

For the Zucchini

  • 2 medium (500 g) zucchini
  • 1 tsp (20 ml) olive oil
  • Salt and pepper

Instructions:

  1. Add the chicken thighs to a ziplock bag with 1 Tbsp of olive oil, tsp salt, 1 Tbsp paprika, and 1 Tbsp minced garlic. Shake the chicken around in the bag to coat. Remove as much air as possible and marinate in the refrigerator for at least 30 minutes.
  2. Heat a grill pan over medium high heat and add 1 Tbsp of olive oil.
  3. Cook the chicken in batches if necessary to prevent overcrowding. Cook it for roughly 4 minutes on each side but be careful not to mess with it too much as you want the outside to develop some color.
  4. After the chicken has cooked, remove it from the pan and cut it into a large dice. Add it back to the pan to allow for it to finish cooking and develop more color.

For the Sweet Potato Fries and Zucchini

  1. Preheat your oven to 400F.
  2. Wash and cut your sweet potatoes and zucchini into fry shaped sticks.
  3. Add the zucchini to a bowl with 1 tsp of olive oil and lightly season with salt.
  4. Add the sweet potatoes to a large bowl and add 1 Tbsp of olive oil. Lightly season with salt and pepper. Spread on a sheet pan and bake for 10 minutes, remove from the oven and flip.
  5. While the pan is out of the oven, add the zucchini and bake an additional 8-10 minutes.
  6. Watch the pan carefully to make sure the sweet potatoes dont burn.

For the Chimichurri

  1. In a food processor or a blender, add all of the ingredients and blend until smooth. The sauce should be a vibrant green color, if yours is brown you probably need to add more parsley and blend longer.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide all of your ingredients evenly between 5 containers. Store the chimichurri in a separate, smaller container as you dont want to heat it in the microwave.

For the Zucchini

  1. Preheat your oven to 400F.
  2. Wash and cut the zucchini into matchsticks. Coat with 1 tsp oil.
  3. Add the zucchini to a sheet pan and bake 8-10 minutes.

For the Rice

  1. Cook enough rice to yield 5 cups of cooked rice. 1 cup of dry rice will make about 3 cups of cooked rice.

Chicken and Sausage Gumbo

A meal prep version of the Louisiana classic. Shredded chicken and andouille sausage cooked low and slow in tomatoes and chicken broth.

CourseCuisineTime - 3 hours 3 hours 3 hours
Main DishAmerican, meal prepPrep - 20 minutes 20 minutes 20 minutes
Cook - 3 hours 3 hours 3 hours

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
649kcal6
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates49g39%
Fat31g25%
Protein44g35%

Ingredients:

  • 2 lbs (908 g) boneless skinless chicken breast
  • 14 oz (397 g) Andouille sausage
  • 14 oz (397 g) can diced tomatoes
  • 2 cups (480 g) chicken broth
  • medium (100 g) onion
  • 4 (400 g) carrots
  • 4 stalks (400 g) celery
  • 1 Tbsp (15 g) garlic
  • 1 medium (150 g) green pepper
  • 2 Tbsp (30 ml) olive oil
  • 1 Tbsp (8 g) cajun seasoning
  • Salt and pepper to taste
  • 2 Tbsp (28 g) butter
  • 1 Tbsp (8 g) cornstarch
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) cold water
  • 5 cups (675 g) cooked rice

Instructions:

  1. Cook the rice using your preferred method. 1 cup of uncooked rice will yield around 3 cups of cooked rice.
  2. Wash your carrots, celery, and green pepper. Peel the carrots to prepare for cutting.
  3. Cut your carrots, celery, green pepper, and onion into a small dice.
  4. In a large pot, heat 2 Tbsp of olive oil over medium heat. Add in the carrots, celery, green pepper, onion, and 1 Tbsp of garlic. Cook for 8-10 minutes stirring occasionally.
  5. After the vegetables have cooked, lay the chicken breasts on top of the vegetables and add in a 14oz can of diced tomatoes and 2 cups of chicken broth. Stir in 1 Tbsp of cajun seasoning.
  6. Bring to a boil and then lower the heat to low and simmer for 2 hours.
  7. After the gumbo has cooked for 2 hours, remove the chicken and shred with two forks in a large bowl.
  8. Next you will need to make a roux to thicken the gumbo. Melt 2 Tbsp of butter in a skillet and stir in cup of almond flour (regular flour is fine, I just use almond flour because it is gluten free. Oat flour works as well.)
  9. Cook the roux for 3-4 minutes or until it has started to brown. Add to the gumbo and stir. Raise the heat to medium.
  10. If your sauce hasnt thickened enough, stir together 1 tsp cornstarch and 1 tsp cold water together. Add to the pot and stir to thicken.
  11. Cut the sausage into inch slices and add to the gumbo.
  12. Continue to cook for an additional 10 minutes. Stir often. Return the chicken to the gumbo and add salt and pepper to taste.

Plating

  1. This recipe will make 6 servings. Divide the ingredients evenly between your 6 containers.

Sausage & Chili Covered Sweet Potato

A play on the classic chili dog with the bun replaced by a sweet potato and the hot dog by kielbasa sausage. This meal packs a lot of flavor into every bite.

CourseCuisineTime - 55 minutes 55 minutes 55 minutes
Main DishAmerican, meal prepPrep - 15 minutes 15 minutes 15 minutes
Cook - 40 minutes 40 minutes 40 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
766kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates59g42%
Fat44g31%
Protein35g25%

Ingredients:

For the Chili

  • 1 lb (454 g) ground beef (85/15)
  • cup (132 g) tomato paste
  • 1 cup (240 g) tomato sauce
  • 8 oz (227 g) mushrooms
  • medium (100 g) sweet onion
  • 1 medium (150 g) green pepper
  • 1 medium (150 g) red pepper
  • 2 Tbsp (30 ml) Worcestershire sauce
  • 1 Tbsp (8 g) chili powder
  • 1 tsp (2 g) mustard powder
  • 1 Tbsp (15 g) garlic minced
  • Salt and pepper to taste
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) olive oil

For the Sweet Potatoes

  • 5 large (1000 g) sweet potatoes
  • 14 oz (397 g) kielbasa sausage
  • 5 Tbsp (71 g) Greek yogurt or sour cream
  • (100 g) avocado

Instructions:

For the Chili

  1. Cut of a sweet onion, 1 red bell pepper, 1 green pepper, and 8 oz of mushrooms into a small dice.
  2. Add 1 Tbsp of olive oil into a large pot over medium high heat. Add in the vegetables and 1 Tbsp of minced garlic. Cook until soft. (Add spinach here if you wish for more vegetables)
  3. Once the vegetables have softened, make some space to add the ground beef. Add the ground beef to the pot and season with salt and pepper. Cook until browned and drain the fat.
  4. Add 1 cup of tomato sauce, cup of tomato paste, and 2 Tbsp of Worcestershire sauce to the pot. Bring to a boil then reduce the heat to low and simmer for 12-15 minutes.
  5. Add 1 Tbsp of chili powder and 1 tsp mustard powder. Taste and adjust any seasonings as needed.

For the Sweet Potatoes

  1. Heat your oven to 400F. Carefully poke holes in each sweet potato with a fork and bake for 30 minutes or until soft. Remove the skin once cooked.

For the Sausage

  1. Cut the sausage into 1-2 inch pieces on a bias. Brown the sausage in a large skillet for 5-7 minutes. Add to the chili and mix.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. In each of your containers add 1 sweet potato and cover with the chili. Top each with 1 Tbsp of Greek yogurt and diced avocado.

Ropa Vieja

Ropa Vieja is the national dish of Cuba and translates to Old Clothes. This recipe is slightly modified from the traditional version to add more vegetables.

CourseCuisineTime - 4 hours 4 hours
Main DishCuban, meal prepPrep - 10 minutes 10 minutes
Cook - 4 hours 30 minutes 4 hours 30 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
528kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates50g44%
Fat16g14%
Protein47g41%

Ingredients:

  • 2 lbs (908 g) boneless skinless chicken breast
  • 2 medium (300 g) green peppers
  • 1 medium (150 g) red pepper
  • 1 medium (200 g) sweet onion
  • 2 Tbsp (30 g) garlic minced
  • 3 stalks (300 g) celery
  • 3 (300 g) carrots
  • 6 oz (170 g) can tomato paste
  • 15 oz (425 g) can crushed tomatoes
  • 1 cup (240 ml) chicken broth
  • cup (120 ml) white wine
  • 1 cup (180 g) green olives
  • 2 (20 g) chipotle peppers in adobo sauce
  • 1 Tbsp (8 g) cumin
  • 1 Tbsp (8 g) paprika
  • 1 Tbsp (5 g) oregano
  • 2 bay leaves
  • 2 Tbsp (30 ml) olive oil
  • Salt and pepper to taste
  • 1 cups (169 g) cooked rice
  • 1 cups (217 g) black beans

Instructions:

  1. Wash and cut your peppers and onion into strips. Peel and cut the carrots into small discs about of an inch thick. Cut the celery into a small dice.
  2. Heat a dutch oven or pot to medium high and add 1 Tbsp of olive oil. Add the the peppers, onions, carrots, celery, and 2 Tbsp of minced garlic to the pot. Cook for around 10 minutes until the onions have browned.
  3. Pour in cup of white wine and stir to deglaze the pot.
  4. Add in the chicken, 1 cup of chicken broth, 6 oz of tomato paste, 15 oz of crushed tomatoes, 2 chipotle peppers in adobo, 1 Tbsp cumin, 1 Tbsp paprika, 1 Tbsp oregano, and 2 bay leaves and bring to a boil for 5 minutes.
  5. Reduce the heat to low and cover. Cook for 4 hours.
  6. Remove the chicken from the pot and shred with two forks. Return to the pot with 1 cup of green olives. Simmer uncovered for 25-30 minutes to thicken the sauce. Add salt and pepper to taste.
  7. If you have a lot of juice left in the pot it may be helpful to strain out the excess liquid using a colander. Some liquid is good but you dont want too much in the bottom of your containers when you store your meals.
  8. Cook the rice using your preferred method. 1 cup of uncooked rice will yield around 3 cups of cooked rice.
  9. Heat the beans in a small sauce pot.
  10. Plating
  11. This recipe makes 5 servings. In each of your containers, add cup of black beans and cup of rice. Divide the meat mixture evenly 5 ways, straining out any juice if necessary.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. In each of your containers, add cup of black beans and cup of rice. Divide the meat mixture evenly 5 ways, straining out any juice if necessary.

Boneless Ribs with Cauliflower Mac & Cheese

Country style pork ribs seasoned with a spice rub and topped with BBQ sauce. They are served with a side of cauliflower mac and cheese and coleslaw.

CourseCuisineTime - 50 minutes 50 minutes 50 minutes
Main DishAmerican, meal prepPrep - 15 minutes 15 minutes 15 minutes
Cook - 35 minutes 35 minutes 35 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
953kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates63g38%
Fat58g35%
Protein44g26%

Ingredients:

For the Ribs

  • 2 lbs (908 g) country style pork ribs
  • cup (72 g) BBQ sauce find a vinegar or tomato based sauce
  • 1 tsp (3 ml) salt
  • 1 tsp (2 ml) pepper
  • 1 Tbsp (7 g) cumin
  • 1 Tbsp (7 g) garlic powder
  • 1 Tbsp (7 g) onion powder
  • 1 tsp (3 g) paprika
  • 1 tsp (3 g) chili powder

For the Cauliflower Mac and Cheese

  • 5 cups (250 g) raw macaroni noodles
  • 3 Tbsp (42 g) butter
  • 6 Tbsp (36 g) almond flour regular flour is fine
  • 1 cups (360 ml) whole milk
  • 1 cup (168 g) cheddar jack cheese
  • Salt and pepper to taste

For the Coleslaw

  • 2 cups (142 g) coleslaw mix
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) olive oil
  • cup (56 g) mayonnaise
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) lemon juice
  • 1 Tbsp (21 g) honey

Instructions:

For the Ribs

  1. Preheat your oven to 375F.
  2. In a bowl mix together the seasonings. 1 tsp salt, 1 tsp pepper, 1 Tbsp cumin, 1 Tbsp garlic powder, 1 Tbsp onion powder, 1 tsp paprika, 1 tsp chili powder.
  3. Rub the seasonings into all sides of the meat. Bake for 30 minutes and check temperature. Bake until it has reached an internal temperature of at least 155F.

For the Cauliflower Mac and Cheese

  1. Cook the cauliflower in a microwave until it is no longer frozen. Cut into macaroni noodle sized pieces.
  2. Add in 1 cup of cheese and the Greek yogurt and stir.
  3. Stir in the cauliflower. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Add the remaining cup of cheese to the top after plating each serving!

For the Coleslaw

  1. In a bowl, mix together cup mayonnaise, 1 Tbsp olive oil, 1 Tbsp lemon juice, and 1 Tbsp honey.
  2. Pour over 2 cups of coleslaw mix.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide your ribs and mac and cheese evenly 5 ways into each of your containers. Store the coleslaw in a separate, smaller container because you wont want to microwave it.

For the Mac and Cheese

  1. Cook the macaroni noodles until soft.
  2. In a sauce pan over medium heat, melt the butter and add in the flour to make a roux. Mix thoroughly and cook for 2-3 minutes to brown.
  3. Add in the milk and stir continuously until it is smooth. Bring to a boil and stir until thick.
  4. Add in 1 cup of cheese and stir.
  5. Stir in the noodles. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Add the remaining cup of cheese to the top after plating each serving!

Philly Cheesesteak Bowls

A breadless, meal prep version of the Philadelphia classic. Zucchini and mushrooms are added to provide some volume and compensate for the lack of bread.

CourseCuisineTime - 40 minutes 40 minutes 40 minutes
Main CourseAmerican, meal prepPrep - 10 minutes 10 minutes 10 minutes
Cook - 30 minutes 30 minutes 30 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
742kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates46g34%
Fat42g31%
Protein46g34%

Ingredients:

  • 2 lbs (908 g) chuck roast
  • 2 (400 g) zucchinis
  • 8 oz (227 g) mushrooms sliced
  • 2 (300 g) green peppers
  • 1 (200 g) white onion
  • 2 Tbsp (30 ml) Worcestershire sauce
  • Salt and pepper to taste
  • 2 Tbsp (30 ml) olive oil
  • 5 slices (105 g) provolone cheese

For the Steak Seasoning

  • 1 tsp (3 g) salt
  • 1 tsp (2 g) pepper
  • 1 tsp (3 g) paprika
  • tsp (1 g) cayenne pepper
  • 1 tsp (2.5 g) onion powder
  • tsp (1.5 g) garlic powder
  • 1 Tbsp (3 g) Italian seasoning

For the Rice

  • 5 cups (675 g) cooked rice

Instructions:

  1. Trim away any large pieces of fat from your steak. Slice it into thin pieces about of an inch thick. You want the pieces of meat to be 1x1x in size.
  2. Heat a large skillet over medium high heat and add 1 Tbsp of olive oil.
  3. Mix all of the seasonings and season one side of the meat with half of it. Place the meat seasoned side down in the skillet and season the other side. Cook for about a minute and flip. The meat will cook very quickly because it is so thin.
  4. Add 2 Tbsp of Worcestershire sauce and mix. Keep the juice left over in the pan.
  5. Cut the onion and peppers into strips. Cut your mushrooms into a small dice and the zucchini into a large dice.
  6. Heat another skillet over medium heat. Add a drizzle of olive oil to each. In one add the onions and peppers and in the other add the diced mushrooms. Once the mushrooms have shrunk and are soft, add in the zucchini. Cook until soft.
  7. Season each of the skillets with salt and peppers to taste.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide the ingredients evenly between your 5 containers. Layer the mushroom and zucchini mixture, then the onions and peppers, followed by the steak. Add any remaining sauce to the top for flavor. Add a slice of provolone cheese to the top of each dish.

For the Rice

  1. Cook enough rice to have 5 cups of cooked rice. One cup of dry rice will yield about 3 cups of cooked rice.

Thai Turkey Burgers with Sweet Potato Fries

Asian flavors melded into a classical American dish. The turkey burgers are meant to be topped with the peanut slaw and eaten together. The slaw provides a great fresh aspect to the dish.

CourseCuisineTime - 1 hour 1 hour 1 hour
Main DishAmerican, Asian, meal prepPrep - 30 minutes 30 minutes 30 minutes
Cook - 30 minutes 30 minutes 30 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
707kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates63g44%
Fat28g19%
Protein52g36%

Ingredients:

For the Burgers

  • 2 lbs (1135 g) ground turkey (93/7)
  • cup (12 g) cilantro finely chopped
  • 2 Tbsp (10 g) ginger minced
  • 5 cloves (20 g) garlic minced
  • 1 (20 g) jalapeo pepper diced
  • 3 small (100 g) shallots minced
  • 1.333 Tbsp (20 ml) fish sauce
  • 2 Tbsp (30 ml) soy sauce
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) olive oil

For the Peanut Slaw

  • 2 cups (140 g) red cabbage
  • 1 cup (100 g) shredded carrots
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) soy sauce
  • 2 Tbsp (32 g) natural peanut butter
  • 2 Tbsp (30 ml) rice wine vinegar
  • 1 inch (10 g) chunk of ginger
  • 1 clove (5 g) garlic
  • 2 Tbsp (42 g) honey
  • 3 Tbsp (45 ml) water
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) lime juice

For the Sweet Potato Fries

  • 4 large (1100 g) sweet potatoes cut into strips
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) olive oil
  • 2 tsp (10 ml) garlic powder
  • Salt and pepper to taste

Instructions:

For the Sweet Potato Fries

  1. Preheat your oven to 400F.
  2. Cut your sweet potatoes into strips about inch thick. Use a mandolin if you have one, it will be much faster and you will get uniform cuts.
  3. Spread the potatoes out on sheet pan and drizzle with olive oil. Season with 2 tsp of garlic powder.
  4. Bake for 10 minutes and then turn the fries and bake an addition 5-8 minutes. Watch them carefully to make sure they dont burn.
  5. Season with salt and pepper to taste once they have finished cooking.

For the Turkey Burgers

  1. Mince the 3 shallots, 5 cloves of garlic, and 2 Tbsp worth of ginger. Cut the jalapeo into a small dice.
  2. Heat 1 tsp of olive oil in a skillet and saut the shallots, garlic, ginger, and jalapeo until the onions have browned. Stir often to prevent burning.
  3. In a large bowl, mix together the 2 lbs of ground turkey, shallot/ginger/garlic/jalapeo mixture, 1 Tbsp + 1 tsp of fish sauce, cilantro, 2 Tbsp of soy sauce, 1 Tbsp olive oil. Using your hands, fold the mixture until everything has been incorporated thoroughly.
  4. Form 10 patties about an inch thick.
  5. Heat a grill pan or a skillet over medium high heat. Cook the burgers for 5-7 minutes on each side. They are finished when they have reached an internal temperature of 165F.

For the Peanut Slaw

  1. While the burgers are cooking you can begin to prep the slaw. In a large bowl, mix together 2 cups of red cabbage and 1 cup of shredded carrots.
  2. Make the dressing in a blender by combining 2 Tbsp of peanut butter, 2 Tbsp rice wine vinegar, a 1 inch chunk of ginger, 1 clove of garlic, 2 Tbsp of honey, 3 Tbsp of water, and 1 Tbsp of lime juice. Blend until smooth. Taste and adjust flavors as necessary. Pour the sauce over the cabbage mix and toss.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide your turkey burgers and sweet potato fries evenly between your 5 containers. Keep the peanut slaw in a separate container as you do not want to microwave it.

Roasted Red Pepper Chicken & Vegetables

Chicken breast covered in a roasted red pepper cream sauce over spaghetti squash, served with zucchini and butternut squash. A great low carb alternative to classic pasta dishes.

CourseCuisineTime - 1 hour 5 minutes 1 hour 5 minutes
Main Dishmeal prepPrep - 25 minutes 25 minutes
Cook - 40 minutes 40 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
572kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates54g43%
Fat16g12%
Protein54g43%

Ingredients:

For the Chicken

  • 2 lbs (1135 g) boneless skinless chicken breast
  • 16 oz (454 g) jar roasted red peppers
  • 2 Tbsp (30 ml) olive oil
  • 5 cloves (20 g) garlic minced
  • 1 tsp (1 g) basil
  • cup (114 g) plain non fat Greek yogurt
  • tsp (1 g) pepper
  • Salt to taste

For the Roasted Vegetables

  • 1 (750 g) butternut squash
  • 1 (200 g) zucchini
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) olive oil
  • Salt and pepper to taste

For the Rice

  • 5 cups (875 g) cooked rice

Instructions:

For the Vegetables

  1. Preheat your oven to 400F.
  2. Wash and cut your zucchini into a large dice. Spread out on half of one pan. Lightly drizzle with olive oil and salt.
  3. Peel the butternut squash, remove the seeds and cut into a small dice. Add to the other half of the sheet pan. Lightly season with salt and pepper.
  4. Put the vegetables into the oven. Bake the zucchini for 10-12 minutes and remove from the sheet pan. While out of the oven, stir the butternut squash.
  5. Cook the butternut squash for an additional 10 minutes.

For the Chicken

  1. Place your chicken breasts into a plastic bag or between two pieces of saran wrap. Using a meat tenderizer or another tool, pound the chicken to even thickness to ensure proper cooking. Season lightly with salt and pepper
  2. In a skillet over medium heat, add olive oil and cook your chicken until it reaches an internal temperature of 165F.
  3. While the chicken is cooking, place the roasted red peppers in a blender with 1 or 2 Tbsp of the liquid in the jar and blend until smooth.
  4. In the same skillet you cooked the chicken, add olive oil and 5 cloves of minced garlic and cook for 2 minutes over low-medium heat.
  5. Pour in the blended peppers and add 1 tsp basil, tsp pepper, and stir. Lower the heat to low and simmer for 15 minutes.
  6. While the sauce is simmering, cut your chicken into one inch cubes.
  7. Once the sauce has been simmering for 15 minutes, add in cup of Greek yogurt. Stir and add salt and pepper to taste. Add in your chicken and stir to coat the chicken.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. To each of your containers add 1 cup of rice. Divide the chicken, zucchini, and butternut squash evenly between your 5 containers.

For the Rice

  1. Cook enough rice to have 5 cups of cooked rice. 1 cup of dry rice yields about 3 cups of cooked rice.

Steak Burrito Bowls

Adobo marinated steak with peppers, cilantro lime rice, and pico de gallo. You wont get tired of eating this one. The pico and guac add a great fresh aspect to this dish.

CourseCuisineTime - 1 hour 1 hour 1 hour
Main Dishmeal prep, MexicanPrep - 45 minutes 45 minutes 45 minutes
Cook - 30 minutes 30 minutes 30 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
837kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates55g35%
Fat44g28%
Protein55g35%

Ingredients:

For the Steak

  • 2 lbs (1135 g) steak any cut should work, sirloin or top round are probably best
  • 3 oz (100 g) chipotle peppers in adobo sauce
  • medium (100 g) red onion
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) olive oil
  • 1 Tbsp (15 g) garlic minced
  • 1 tsp (3 g) salt
  • 1 tsp (2 g) pepper
  • 1 tsp (2 g) cumin

For the Rice

  • 5 cups (675 g) cooked rice
  • 4 Tbsp (4 g) cilantro chopped
  • 2 tsp (10 ml) olive oil
  • 2 Tbsp (30 ml) lime juice

For the Pico de Gallo

  • 5 (300 g) Roma tomatoes
  • medium (100 g) red onion
  • cup (4 g) cilantro chopped
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) lime juice
  • 1 (20 g) jalapeo pepper
  • Salt and pepper to taste

For the Guacamole

  • 2 (250 g) avocados
  • cup pico de gallo
  • Lime juice salt, and pepper to taste

For the Peppers

  • 2 medium (300 g) red peppers
  • 2 medium (300 g) green peppers
  • medium (100 g) red onion
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) olive oil

Instructions:

For the Steak

  1. Dice the red onion
  2. In a large zip lock bag, add the steak, can of chipotle peppers, of a red onion, 1 Tbsp olive oil, 1 Tbsp garlic, 1 tsp salt, 1 tsp pepper, and 1 tsp cumin. Shake it around to coat the steak evenly. Try to remove all of the air from the bag and marinate for at least 30 minutes.
  3. Once marinated, preheat a large grill pan or skillet over medium high heat. Add 1 Tbsp of olive oil to the pan and cook the steak in batches to prevent overcrowding and proper cooking. Cook the steak to medium rare, around 3 minutes each side. Remember that you will be reheating it again in the microwave which is additional cooking time.
  4. Cut the steak into 1 inch cubes.

For the Peppers

  1. While the steak is cooking, cut the peppers and onions into strips. Cook them together in a skillet with 1 Tbsp olive oil until onions are translucent.

For the Rice

  1. Cook enough rice to have 5 cups of cooked rice. 1 cup of uncooked rice will yield around 3 cups of cooked rice.
  2. Drizzle the olive oil over the rice and mix in the cilantro, lime juice, and add salt and pepper to taste.

For the Pico de Gallo

  1. Cut the tomatoes in half the long way and scoop out the seeds. Dice the tomatoes so they are about inch cubes and place in a large bowl.
  2. Dice of a red onion and add to the the tomatoes.
  3. Cut the stems off of the jalapeo pepper. Cut the pepper into a small dice and add to the mixture.
  4. NOTE: If you arent a fan of heat, then take out the seeds before chopping up the peppers.
  5. Cut the stems off of a small bunch of cilantro and finely chop the leaves until you have cup, add to the bowl.
  6. Cut a lime in half and squeeze its juice into the mixing bowl. Stir all of the ingredients together and add salt and pepper to taste

For the Guacamole

  1. It is best to make the guacamole on an as needed basis as the avocado will oxidize quickly and turn brown. Luckily it can be made in the time it takes to heat up your meal.
  2. Cut 1 avocado in half and remove the pit. Score the inside of the avocado and extract with a spoon. In a bowl, mash the avocado with a fork until it is smooth.
  3. Add 3 Tbsp of the pico de gallo to the avocado and mix. Add salt, pepper and lime juice to taste.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. In each of your containers put 1 cup of the cilantro lime rice. Divide the remaining ingredients evenly into each of your 5 containers.

Maple Sriracha Meatballs with Zucchini Lo Mein

Turkey meatballs topped with a sauce made from maple syrup, sriracha, honey, ginger, and soy sauce. Zucchini noodles replace traditional lo mein noodles to lessen the carb load.

CourseCuisineTime - 1 hour 10 minutes 1 hour 10 minutes
Main DishAsian, meal prepPrep - 25 minutes 25 minutes
Cook - 45 minutes 45 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
837kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates55g35%
Fat44g28%
Protein55g35%

Ingredients:

For the Meatballs

  • 2 lbs (908 g) ground pork
  • 2 tsp (6 g) salt
  • 1 tsp (2 g) pepper
  • 2 Tbsp (30 ml) Maple Sriracha sauce
  • cup (75 g) grated carrots use a blender or food processor
  • 1 Tbsp (5 g) ginger minced

For the Maple Sriracha Sauce

  • cup (120 ml) soy sauce
  • 2 Tbsp (10 g) ginger
  • cup (40 g) sweet onion diced
  • cup (84 g) honey
  • cup (80 g) maple syrup
  • 2 Tbsp (30 ml) sriracha

For the Vegetables

  • 2 Tbsp (40 ml) maple sriracha sauce
  • 1 large bunch (500 g) broccoli
  • Salt and pepper to taste

For the Rice

  • 5 cups (675 g) cooked rice

Instructions:

For the Meatballs and Sauce

  1. Preheat your oven to 375F.
  2. Prepare your sauce first. Mix all of the ingredients in a blender and blend until smooth.
  3. In a bowl, mix 2 lbs turkey, 2 tsp salt, 1 tsp pepper, 2 Tbsp Maple Sriracha sauce, cup grated carrots, and 1 Tbsp minced ginger.
  4. Form the meat mixture into balls 1 inches in diameter. It should make around 20 meatballs.
  5. Place the meatballs on a greased sheet pan and bake for 35 minutes or until an internal temperature of 165F is reached.
  6. While the meatballs are cooking you can begin to cook your zucchini noodles and broccoli.

For the Vegetables

  1. Steam your broccoli using your preferred method.
  2. Heat a skillet over medium heat and add 1 tbsp of olive oil.
  3. Leave your zucchini raw and add 2 Tbsp of the Maple Sriracha sauce. Stir to coat. You dont want to cook it as it will soften in the microwave upon reheating.

For the Maple Sriracha Sauce

  1. Using the same skillet, add in the remainder of your Maple Sriracha sauce over medium heat.
  2. Bring the sauce to a boil and cook for 2 minutes.
  3. Reduce the heat to low and allow it to simmer until thickened, around 10 minutes.
  4. Once the meatballs have finished cooking, add them to the sauce and coat each meat ball thoroughly.
  5. If you have extra sauce, you may want to coat the broccoli as well.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide your ingredients evenly into each of your 5 containers.

For the Rice

  1. Cook enough rice to have 5 cups of cooked rice. 1 cup of dry rice will yield about 3 cups of cooked rice.

Teriyaki Chicken & Mixed Vegetables

A meal prep version of the classic Asian dish. The teriyaki sauce in this recipe uses pineapple juice as a sweetener instead of sugar.

CourseCuisineTime - 1 hour 1 hour 1 hour
Main DishAsian, meal prepPrep - 35 minutes 35 minutes 35 minutes
Cook - 30 minutes 30 minutes 30 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
661kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates66g47%
Fat21g15%
Protein53g37%

Ingredients:

For the Chicken

  • 2 lbs (1135 g) boneless skinless chicken thighs
  • of the teriyaki sauce
  • 2 Tbsp (30 ml) soy sauce
  • 2 Tbsp (30 ml) pineapple juice
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) olive oil

For the Vegetables

  • 1 large (300 g) zucchini
  • 1 large (300 g) yellow squash
  • 1 medium (150 g) red pepper
  • 3 (300 g) carrots
  • 1 Tbsp (15 g) garlic
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) olive oil

For the Teriyaki Sauce

  • cup (60 ml) pineapple juice
  • cup (60 ml) soy sauce
  • 1 Tbsp (15 g) garlic minced
  • 1 tsp (2 g) ginger minced
  • 3 Tbsp (63 g) honey
  • 3 Tbsp (45 ml) rice wine vinegar
  • 2 tsp (5 ml) cornstarch
  • Pinch pepper

For the Rice

  • 5 cups (675 g) cooked rice
  • 3 Tbsp (45 ml) olive oil

Instructions:

For the Rice

  1. Cook enough rice to have 5 cups worth. 1 cup of dry rice makes about 3 cups of cooked rice. Stir in 3 tbsp of olive oil.

For the Teriyaki Sauce

  1. In a sauce pot over medium heat, add cup pineapple juice, cup soy sauce, 2 cloves minced garlic, 1 tsp minced ginger, 3 Tbsp honey, 3 Tbsp rice wine vinegar, 2 tsp cornstarch, and a pinch of pepper.
  2. Bring to a light boil for 1 minute, then reduce the heat to low and simmer to thicken (will take around 10 minutes). Stir often. Add cornstarch in a slurry as needed if it is not thickening.
  3. The sauce is finished once it is thick enough to coat the back of a spoon.

For the Chicken

  1. Cut your chicken into 1 inch pieces and add to a large ziplock bag.
  2. Add of the teriyaki sauce, 2 Tbsp of soy sauce, and 2 Tbsp pineapple juice. Remove as much air as possible and marinate for at least 30 minutes.
  3. Heat a grill pan or skillet over medium high heat. (Grill pan is best).
  4. Cook the chicken in batches to ensure you sear the meat and do not steam it.
  5. Once all of the chicken has finished cooking, add all of it back to the pan. Add in about of the remaining teriyaki sauce. The remainder will be used for the vegetables.
  6. Stir to coat and remove from heat.

For the Vegetables

  1. Wash all of your vegetables and peel your carrots.
  2. Cut your zucchini, squash, and red pepper into a large dice. Cut your carrots into thin slices on a bias.
  3. Heat a large skillet over medium high heat. Add 1 Tbsp of olive oil.
  4. Add the carrots, red pepper and 1 Tbsp of garlic to the pan first. Allow them to cook for a few minutes and then add in the zucchini and squash.
  5. Once the carrots have softened, add in the remaining teriyaki sauce and toss to coat. Season with salt and pepper to taste if necessary.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide your chicken and vegetables evenly 5 ways to each of your containers.

Pork Carnitas with Salsa Verde & Calabacitas

Carnitas translates to little meats. The pork is cooked slowly in orange and lime juice and then broiled to create crispy, flavorful bites. The pork is a perfect pairing with homemade salsa verde.

CourseCuisineTime - 3 hours 3 hours 3 hours
Main Dishmeal prep, MexicanPrep - 10 minutes 10 minutes 10 minutes
Cook - 3 hours 3 hours 3 hours

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
774kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates59g39%
Fat35g23%
Protein55g36%

Ingredients:

For the Pork

  • 3 lb (1362 g) pork butt roast
