  • 1 medium (200 g) yellow onion
  • 2 Tbsp (30 ml) lime juice
  • cup (60 ml) orange juice
  • 1 tsp (2 g) cumin
  • 1 tsp (1 g) oregano
  • 2 tsp (6 g) salt
  • 1 tsp (2 g) pepper
  • 2 cups (480 ml) water

For the Calabacitas

  • 1 medium (250 g) zucchini
  • 1 small (100 g) green pepper
  • 1 small (100 g) yellow pepper
  • 1 small (100 g) red pepper
  • medium (100 g) sweet onion
  • 8 oz (227 g) mushrooms
  • 3 (180 g) Roma tomatoes seeded
  • 1 tbsp (15 ml) olive oil

For the Salsa Verde

  • 4 (240 g) tomatillos
  • 2 (40 g) jalapeos
  • 4 cloves (20 g) garlic
  • small (75 g) white onion
  • bunch (15 g) cilantro
  • 3-4 Tbsp (45 ml) lime juice
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) apple cider vinegar
  • Salt to taste

For the Rice

  • 5 cups (675 g) cooked rice

Instructions:

For the roast

  1. Trim your roast of large pieces of fat and cut into 2 inch chunks.
  2. Turn on your oven to 300F.
  3. Heat a large, oven safe pot (cast iron or dutch oveon the stove over medium high heat.
  4. Add in the pork, the yellow onion (cut in half), 1 lime (juic eand its rind, 1 orange (juice and its rind, 1 tsp cumin, 1 tsp oregano, 2 tsp salt, 1 tsp pepper, and 2 cups of water. Bring the mixture to a light boil.
  5. Once boiling, cover the pot and place in the oven for 2 hours. If your pot doesnt have a lid, use foil to create a seal.
  6. The meat is done when it is easily broken apart with a fork.
  7. Line a sheet pan with foil and transfer the chunks of meat from your pot to the sheet pan. Break each chunk into 3 or 4 smaller pieces but do not shred the meat.
  8. Remove all of the solid ingredients from the liquid remaining in your pot. They can be thrown away.
  9. Over high heat, reduce the liquid in the pot to create a syrup like sauce. This should take between 15 and 20 minutes. Stir the sauce frequently.
  10. Once the sauce has thickened, add your meat back to the pot and gently cover the meat with the sauce. Be careful not to break up the meat any more than you already have.
  11. Turn your oven to broil. Place the meat back onto the sheet pan and spread out. Broil the pork for 2-3 minutes or until it begins to crisp. Remove from the oven and flip the meat. Broil the other side for an additional 2-3 minutes. Be sure to watch the meat carefully as it can burn quickly.

For the Salsa Verde

  1. Remove the husks from your tomatillos and wash all of your vegetables. Cut the stems off of the jalapeos, peel your garlic, and halve your onion.
  2. Fill a medium pot with water and bring to a boil. Add in the tomatillos, garlic, onion, and jalapeos.
  3. Boil for about 10 minutes or until the tomatillos turn army green.
  4. While the vegetables are boiling, wash the cilantro and cut off the bottom of the stems. Add to your blender.
  5. Cut your limes in half and juice the halves into the blender along with 1 Tbsp of apple cider vinegar and salt.
  6. Add the boiled vegetables into the blender. Blend until the ingredients until there are no large chunks remaining. Add salt to taste.

For the Calabacitas

  1. Wash all of your vegetables and cut them into a large dice, each around the same size. Seed your tomatoes.
  2. Heat a large skillet over medium high heat and add 1 Tbsp of olive oil. Cook the vegetables in batches. Start with the onions and peppers. Once they peppers are soft, remove from the pan and cook the remaining vegetables.
  3. When the mushrooms, zucchini, and tomatoes have cooked, add the onions and peppers back to the pan and season with salt and pepper to taste.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide your meat and vegetables 5 ways and add to each of your containers. Add 1 cup of rice to each Store the salsa verde in a separate, smaller container as you dont want to heat it in the microwave.

For the Chicken

  1. Trim your chicken of large pieces of fat and cut into 2-3 inch chunks.
  2. Turn on your oven to 300F.
  3. Heat a large, oven safe pot (cast iron or dutch oven) on the stove over medium high heat.
  4. Add in the chicken, the yellow onion (cut in half), 1 lime (juic eand its rind, 1 orange (juice and its rind, 1 tsp cumin, 1 tsp oregano, 2 tsp salt, 1 tsp pepper, and 2 cups of water. Bring the mixture to a light boil.
  5. Once boiling, cover the pot and place in the oven for 2 hours. If your pot doesnt have a lid, use foil to create a seal.
  6. The meat is done when it is easily broken apart with a fork.
  7. Line a sheet pan with foil and transfer the chunks of meat from your pot to the sheet pan. Break each chunk into 3 or 4 smaller pieces but do not shred the meat.
  8. Remove all of the solid ingredients from the liquid remaining in your pot. They can be thrown away.
  9. Over high heat, reduce the liquid in the pot to create a syrup like sauce. This should take between 15 and 20 minutes. Stir the sauce frequently.
  10. Once the sauce has thickened, add your meat back to the pot and gently cover the meat with the sauce. Be careful not to break up the meat any more than you already have.
  11. Turn your oven to broil. Place the meat back onto the sheet pan and spread out. Broil the pork for 2-3 minutes or until it begins to crisp. Remove from the oven and flip the meat. Broil the other side for an additional 2-3 minutes. Be sure to watch the meat carefully as it can burn quickly.

For the Rice

  1. Cook enough rice to have 5 cups of cooked rice. 1 cup of dry rice wil yield about 3 cups.

Shepherd's Pie with Sweet Potato Chips

A healthy play on the classic version of Shepherds Pie. Instead of mashed potatoes on top of the meat mixture, this recipe uses a combination of cauliflower and potatoes.

CourseCuisineTime - 50 minutes 50 minutes 50 minutes
Main DishAmerican, meal prepPrep - 10 minutes 10 minutes 10 minutes
Cook - 40 minutes 40 minutes 40 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
805kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates72g46%
Fat37g23%
Protein47g30%

Ingredients:

For the Meat Mixture

  • 1 lbs (681 g) ground beef (85/15)
  • 8 (8 ) eggs
  • 28 oz (794 g) can crushed tomatoes
  • 12 oz (340 g) mixed frozen vegetables
  • 1 medium (200 g) onion
  • 1 Tbsp (15 g) garlic minced
  • 1 Tbsp (2 g) olive oil
  • 1 Tbsp (2 g) dried basil
  • 1 Tbsp (2 g) dried oregano
  • Salt and Pepper to taste

For the Sweet Potato Chips

  • 2 large (550 g) sweet potatoes
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) olive oil
  • 1 tsp (3 g) garlic powder
  • Salt and pepper to taste

For the Cauliflower/Potato Combo

  • 14 oz (397 g) frozen cauliflower
  • 1 (150 g) russet potato
  • cup (60 g) skim milk
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) butter
  • Salt and pepper to taste

For the Cauliflower

  • 14 oz (397 g) frozen cauliflower
  • cup (60 g) skim milk
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) butter
  • Salt and pepper to taste

For the Potatoes

  • 4 (600 g) russet potato
  • cup (60 g) skim milk
  • 4 Tbsp (60 g) butter
  • Salt and pepper to taste

Instructions:

For the Meat Mixture

  1. Start a pot of water large enough to boil the eggs.
  2. Hard boil 8 eggs in a pot of water. Put the eggs in the water and once you reach a rolling boil, remove from the heat and cover for 12 minutes. After 12 minutes, run cool water over the eggs and remove the shell.
  3. In a large pot/pan, add 1 Tbsp of olive oil over medium high heat.
  4. Dice the onion and add to the pan with 1 Tbsp of garlic. Cook until onion is translucent.
  5. Add in 1 lbs of ground beef and brown. Once browned remove the fat.
  6. Add in the canned tomatoes, mixed vegetables, 1 Tbsp oregano, and 1 Tbsp basil
  7. Reduce the heat to low and simmer for 15-20 minutes. Add salt and pepper to taste.
  8. Cut the hardboiled eggs into a large dice and gently fold into the mixture.

For the Cauliflower/Potato topping

  1. Wash and peel your potato and cut it into a large dice.
  2. Bring a large pot of water to a boil and add the cauliflower and potato. Cook until soft. Drain the water from the pot and add in cup of milk and 1 Tbsp butter. Mash the cauliflower and potato until smooth. Season with salt and pepper

For the Sweet Potato Chips

  1. Preheat your oven to 400F.
  2. Wash your sweet potatoes thoroughly. Using a mandolin or knife, cut your potatoes into discs of an inch thick.
  3. Spread the potatoes out on a sheet pan and drizzle with olive oil. Season with salt, pepper, and 1 tsp of garlic powder.
  4. Bake the potatoes for 8-10 minutes then flip them and cook an additional 5-8 minutes.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide your ingredients evenly 5 ways into each of your containers.

For the Cauliflower topping

  1. Bring a large pot of water to a boil and add the cauliflower. Cook until soft. Drain the water from the pot and add in cup of milk and 1 Tbsp butter. Mash the cauliflower until smooth. Season with salt and pepper

For the Potato topping

  1. Wash and peel your potato and cut it into a large dice.
  2. Bring a large pot of water to a boil, add the potato potato. Cook until soft. Drain the water from the pot and add in cup of milk and 1 Tbsp butter. Mash potato until smooth. Season with salt and pepper

Pot Roast over Green Beans & Mashed Cauliflower

An easy recipe with great flavor. Put it in the crockpot and youre almost done. The mashed cauliflower can be mixed with mashed potatoes to mask the taste of the cauliflower.

CourseCuisineTime - 8 hours 20 minutes 8 hours 20 minutes
Main DishAmerican, meal prepPrep - 20 minutes 20 minutes
Cook - 8 hours 8 hours

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
474kcal8
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates27g31%
Fat26g30%
Protein32g37%

Ingredients:

For the Roast

  • 2 lb (1135 g) Chuck Roast
  • 1 (28 g) packet au jus
  • 1 (28 g) packet ranch dressing mix
  • 10 (75 g) pepperoncini peppers

For the Cauliflower Mash

  • 24 oz (681 g) frozen cauliflower
  • 1 lb (454 g) red potatoes
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) butter
  • cup (60 ml) milk
  • Salt and Pepper

For the Green Beans

  • 2 lbs (908 g) green beans

Instructions:

  1. In a crock pot mix together the roast, au jus, ranch dressing mix, and 10 pepperoncinis. Cook on low for 8 hours and then shred the meat.
  2. When the roast is almost finished, cut the potatoes and cauliflower into a large dice and boil until soft.
  3. Once soft, drain the water and use a blender or a potato masher to smoothen out the potatoes and cauliflower. Add in 1 Tbsp of butter, cup of milk, and salt and pepper to taste. Blend until smooth.
  4. Boil the green beans until soft. Season with salt and pepper.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 8 servings. Divide the ingredients 8 ways between your containers. Layer the potato mixture on the bottom, add green beans, and then top it with the beef. Add a couple of spoonfuls of the leftover gravy mixture from the crockpot to the top of each meal.

Chamorro Chicken with Vegetables & Pineapple Salsa

This recipe is a version of a classical dish from the Chamorro people of the Northern Mariana Islands. Chicken marinated in soy sauce, vinegar, and pineapple juice provides lots of flavor.

CourseCuisineTime - 1 hour 20 minutes 1 hour 20 minutes 1 hour 20 minutes
Main DishAsian, meal prepPrep - 45 minutes 45 minutes 45 minutes
Cook - 35 minutes 35 minutes 35 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
581kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates57g47%
Fat20g16%
Protein44g36%

Ingredients:

For the Chicken

  • 2 lbs (1135 g) boneless skinless chicken thighs
  • (100 g) red onion
  • cup (60 ml) soy sauce
  • cup (60 ml) apple cider vinegar
  • cup (63 ml) water
  • cup (60 ml) pineapple juice
  • 1 tsp (3 g) salt
  • 3 cloves (15 g) garlic minced

For the Rice

  • 5 cups (675 g) cooked rice
  • 3 tbsp olive oil

For the Pineapple Salsa

  • 2 cups (275 g) pineapple frozen works, fresh is better
  • 1 small (100 g) red pepper
  • 1 (20 g) jalapeo pepper
  • 2 Tbsp (5 g) cilantro
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) lime juice
  • Salt and pepper to taste

For the Vegetables

  • 2 (300 g) red peppers
  • 2 (400 g) zucchini
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) olive oil

Instructions:

For the Rice

  1. Cook the rice using your preferred method (rice cooker or saucepan). Be sure you make enough to have 2 cups worth of cooked rice.
  2. Drizzle in 3 tbsp of olive oil to add extra calories.

For the Chicken

  1. Cut the chicken thighs into a large dice, around 1 inch pieces and add to a large ziplock bag.
  2. Dice of a red onion. Add the onion, cup of soy sauce, cup of apple cider vinegar, cup of water, cup of pineapple juice, 1 tsp salt, and 3 cloves of minced garlic to the ziplock bag and remove as much air as possible. Let the chicken marinate in the refrigerator for at least 30 minutes.
  3. While the chicken is marinating, prepare the salsa and vegetables.
  4. After the chicken has finished marinating, heat a large grill pan or skillet over medium high heat.
  5. Cook the chicken in batches to ensure you dont over crowd the pan. The chicken is finished when it is no longer pink in the middle or has an internal temperature of at least 165. There is no need to drain the marinade from the chicken before cooking. The marinade will create a glaze over the chicken while cooking. If you have leftover marinade when the chicken has finished, add it to the pan and reduce it to a syrup consistency (around 10-15 minutes). Add the chicken back to the pan and coat evenly.

For the Salsa

  1. Cut the pineapple, bell pepper, jalapeo, and 2 Tbsp of cilantro into a small dice and mix together.
  2. Add in the lime juice and season with salt and pepper to taste. Mix thoroughly.

For the Vegetables

  1. Cut the zucchini and red bell peppers into a large dice.
  2. In a large skillet, add 1 Tbsp of olive oil and saut the vegetables until they are soft.
  3. Season with salt and pepper to taste

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide the chicken and vegetables evenly. Store the pineapple salsa in a separate, small container as you dont want to reheat this. To each dish, add 1 of a cup of rice.

Skirt Steak & Chimichurri with Green Beans & Murshrooms

Grilled skirt steak served with chimichurri sauce, green beans and mushrooms. The chimichurri sauce is the highlight in this meal, bringing strong flavors to the meat.

CourseCuisineTime - 50 minutes 50 minutes 50 minutes
Main DishArgentinian, meal prepPrep - 20 minutes 20 minutes 20 minutes
Cook - 30 minutes 30 minutes 30 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
807kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates49g33%
Fat43g29%
Protein56g37%

Ingredients:

  • 2 lbs (1135 g) skirt steak you may need to buy 2 smaller steaks
  • 8 oz (227 g) mushrooms
  • 2 Tbsp (30 ml) garlic
  • 1 lb (454 g) green beans
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) olive oil
  • Salt and Pepper to taste

For the Chimichurri

  • 1 bunch (55 g) flat leaf parsley 2-2.5 cups
  • 4 cloves (20 g) garlic
  • 2 Tbsp (30 ml) red wine vinegar
  • cup (120 g) olive oil
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) lemon juice
  • 2 Tbsp (26 g) red onion diced
  • 1 tsp (1 g) dried oregano

For the Rice

  • 5 cups (675 g) cooked rice

Instructions:

  1. Bring a large pot of water to a boil and add the green beans. Cook for about 7-8 minutes or until almost cooked through.
  2. In a skillet, heat 1 Tbsp of olive oil over medium high heat. Add the mushrooms and cook for 4-5 minutes then add the green beans and season with salt and pepper to taste.
  3. While the vegetables are cooking heat a grill pan or another skillet over medium high heat. Cast iron is preferred.
  4. Drizzle the steak with olive oil and season with salt and pepper. Make sure you cook your steak one stage below where you prefer your meat because you will be reheating it in the microwave again.

For the Chimichurri

  1. In a food processor or a blender, add all of the ingredients and blend until smooth. The sauce should be a vibrant green color, if yours is brown you probably need to add more parsley and blend longer.
  2. Once your steak has rested for 10 minutes, cut it into slices against the grain, this will prevent the meat from being chewy.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide all of your ingredients evenly between 5 containers. Store the chimichurri in a separate, smaller container as you dont want to heat it in the microwave.

For the Rice

  1. Cook enough rice to have 5 cups of cooked rice. 1 cup of dry rice will yield about 3 cups of cooked rice.
  2. Bring a large pot of water to a boil and add the green beans. Cook for about 7-8 minutes or until almost cooked through.
  3. In a skillet, heat 1 Tbsp of olive oil over medium high heat. Add the mushrooms and cook for 4-5 minutes then add the green beans and season with salt and pepper to taste.
  4. While the vegetables are cooking heat a grill pan or another skillet over medium high heat. Cast iron is preferred.
  5. Drizzle the steak with olive oil and season with salt and pepper. Make sure you cook your steak one stage below where you prefer your meat because you will be reheating it in the microwave again.

Chicken Souvlaki & Roasted Vegetables

Grilled chicken marinated in lemon juice and seasonings served with roasted vegetables and tzatziki sauce. This is a great low carb meal with lots of fresh flavors.

CourseCuisineTime - 1 hour 1 hour
Main DishGreek, meal prepPrep - 30 minutes 30 minutes
Cook - 30 minutes 30 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
616kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates53g39%
Fat16g11%
Protein65g48%

Ingredients:

For the Chicken

  • 3 lbs (1362 g) boneless skinless chicken breast
  • 4 Tbsp (60 g) garlic minced
  • (100 g) red onion
  • 1 Tbsp (2 g) oregano
  • 2 Tbsp (30 ml) lemon juice
  • 2 Tbsp (30 ml) olive oil
  • 2 tsp (6 g) salt
  • 1 tsp (2 g) pepper

For the Roasted Vegetables

  • 2 (300 g) red peppers
  • 8 oz (227 g) mushrooms
  • 2 (400 g) zucchinis
  • 2 Tbsp (30 g) garlic minced
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) Balsamic vinegar
  • Salt and pepper to taste

For the Tzatziki Sauce

  • 1 cup (227 g) plain non fat Greek yogurt
  • 1 tsp (5 g) garlic minced
  • 1 small (100 g) cucumber
  • 1 Tbsp (2 g) dried dill
  • Lemon juice to taste
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) olive oil
  • Salt and pepper to taste

For the Rice

  • 5 cups (675 g) cooked rice

Instructions:

  1. Cut the chicken into a large dice, around 1-2 inches
  2. In a large ziplock bag combine the chicken, 4 Tbsp of minced garlic, of a diced red onion, 1 Tbsp oregano, the juice of 1 lemon, 2 Tbsp olive oil, 2 tsp of salt and 1 tsp of pepper. Let it marinate in the refrigerator for at least 20 minutes.
  3. While the chicken is marinating, preheat your oven to 400F and cut the vegetables into a large dice. Try to make them all the same size.
  4. Spread out the vegetables on a sheet pan and sprinkle with salt and pepper, add 2 Tbsp of minced garlic and 1 Tbsp of balsamic vinegar. Roast for 10-12 minutes.
  5. Prepare the tzatziki sauce by combining all of the ingredients together and mix thoroughly. Store this in a separate container as you dont want to reheat it in the microwave.
  6. After the chicken is done marinating, heat a grill pan or skillet over medium high heat. If you prefer, the chicken can be put on a skewer but this is not necessary and you can just cook it without the skewer.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide all of the ingredients 5 ways and add to your containers.

For the Rice

  1. Cook enough riced to have 5 cups of cooked rice. 1 cup of dry rice yields about 3 cups of cooked rice.
  2. Cut the chicken into a large dice, around 1-2 inches
  3. In a large ziplock bag combine the chicken, 4 Tbsp of minced garlic, of a diced red onion, 1 Tbsp oregano, the juice of 1 lemon, 2 Tbsp olive oil, 2 tsp of salt and 1 tsp of pepper. Let it marinate in the refrigerator for at least 20 minutes.
  4. While the chicken is marinating, preheat your oven to 400F and cut the vegetables into a large dice. Try to make them all the same size.
  5. Spread out the vegetables on a sheet pan and sprinkle with salt and pepper, add 2 Tbsp of minced garlic and 1 Tbsp of balsamic vinegar. Roast for 10-12 minutes.
  6. Prepare the tzatziki sauce by combining all of the ingredients together and mix thoroughly. Store this in a separate container as you dont want to reheat it in the microwave.
  7. After the chicken is done marinating, heat a grill pan or skillet over medium high heat. If you prefer, the chicken can be put on a skewer but this is not necessary and you can just cook it without the skewer.

Homemade Granola Yogurt Parfait

Rolled oats tossed with almonds, sunflower seeds, and dried cranberries in a maple syrup and peanut butter sauce. The granola is served with Greek yogurt and your favorite fruit.

CourseCuisineTime - 20 minutes
Breakfastmeal prepPrep - 10 minutes
Cook - 10 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
437kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates51g57%
Fat18g20%
Protein19g21%

Ingredients:

For the Granola

  • 2 cups (160 g) rolled oats
  • cup (67 g) sunflower seed kernels
  • cup (28 g) sliced almonds
  • cup (113 g) dried cranberries
  • cup (80 g) maple syrup
  • 1 Tbsp (15 g) coconut oil
  • 2 Tbsp (32 g) peanut butter

For the Yogurt and Fruit

  • 2 cups (568 g) plain non fat Greek yogurt
  • Stevia or another zero calorie sweetener to taste
  • 5 servings of your favorite fruit. I used 2 lbs of strawberries here. Strawberries will not always be in season so I want to leave this choice up to you.

Instructions:

  1. Preheat your oven to 325F.
  2. In a large mixing bowl, add cup maple syrup, 1 Tbsp coconut oil, and 2 Tbsp peanut butter. Melt in the microwave and stir.
  3. Add 2 cups of oats, cup sunflower seeds, cup sliced almonds, and cup of dried cranberries to the bowl and stir to evenly coat.
  4. Spread out the granola on a sheet pan and bake for 7-8 minutes. Pull it out and try a small piece. The granola should be lightly toasted. If it needs more time put it back in the oven and watch it carefully. You absolutely do not want to burn this.
  5. Measure out 2 cups of plain Greek yogurt. Use stevia or another zero calorie sweetener to sweeten the Greek yogurt to taste.
  6. Prepare your favorite fruit to add to the containers.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Put cup of Greek yogurt in each container as well as one serving of your fruit. Divide the granola evenly between the containers.

NOTE: The nutritional information on the following page does not include the fruit as it will depend on what you choose. Make sure you account for this in your tracking.

Baked Peach Oatmeal

Rolled oats mixed with frozen peaches and baked into a cake like breakfast food. This is a great meal for those weeks you prefer something sweet to have in the morning.

CourseCuisineTime - 43 minutes
Breakfastmeal prepPrep - 8 minutes
Cook - 35 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
347kcal4
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates42g56%
Fat10g13%
Protein22g29%

Ingredients:

  • 2 cups (160 g) oats
  • 1 cups (360 g) skim milk
  • 1 Tbsp (21 g) honey
  • 2 scoops (60 g) whey protein powder vanilla
  • 2 cups (280 g) frozen peaches
  • 2 Tbsp (28 g) butter or coconut oil
  • 1 tsp (4 ml) vanilla
  • 1 (1 ) egg
  • 1 tsp (4 g) baking powder
  • tsp (1 g) salt
  • Cooking spray

Instructions:

  1. Preheat your oven to 375F.
  2. In a large bowl, mix together 2 cups of oats, 2 scoops of whey protein powder, 1 tsp baking powder, and tsp of salt.
  3. In a separate bowl mix together 1 cups of milk, 1 Tbsp honey, 1 Tbsp melted butter, 1 Tbsp melted coconut oil, 1 egg, and 1 tsp vanilla.
  4. Spray an 8x8 baking dish with cooking spray and add the dry ingredients. Pour the wet ingredients over the top and mix to incorporate.
  5. Add in some of the peaches and hide them in the oatmeal. Place some of the peaches over the top for presentation purposes.
  6. Bake the oatmeal for 35 minutes or until it has set in the middle.
  7. This recipe makes 4 servings. Cut the oatmeal into 4 even pieces and place into each of your containers.

Banana Berry Muffins

A gluten free muffin for you to enjoy as either a breakfast option or a snack. These muffins are made with eggs, bananas, and coconut flour instead of wheat flour.

CourseCuisineTime - 28 minutes
Breakfast, Snackmeal prepPrep - 8 minutes
Cook - 20 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
93kcal9
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates10.8g63%
Fat3.7g21%
Protein4.2g24%

Ingredients:

  • 2 (250 g) ripe bananas frozen and thawed is best
  • 4 (4 ) eggs
  • 1 Tbsp (16 g) peanut butter
  • 1 tsp (4 ml) vanilla
  • 1 tsp (4 g) baking powder
  • cup (37 g) coconut flour
  • 1 cup (140 g) frozen berries

Instructions:

  1. Preheat your oven to 375F
  2. Add all of the ingredients to a blender except the frozen berries. Blend until smooth.
  3. Spray a muffin tin with cooking spray and pour the batter into the wells. It will make around 9 or 10 muffins depending on the size of your bananas.
  4. Top each muffin with the frozen berries.
  5. Bake for 18-20 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center of a muffin comes out clean.
  6. This recipe makes 9 muffins.

Tuscan Egg Bake

Pork sausage, spinach, tomatoes, and feta cheese cooked into an egg bake. This is a wonderful combination of flavors and a small serving of vegetables to start off your day with!

CourseCuisineTime - 40 minutes 40 minutes 40 minutes
Breakfastmeal prepPrep - 5 minutes 5 minutes 5 minutes
Cook - 35 minutes 35 minutes 35 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
494kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates12g15%
Fat35g43%
Protein33g41%

Ingredients:

  • 10 (10 ) eggs
  • 1 lb (454 g) pork breakfast sausage
  • 3 cups (90 g) spinach
  • 3 (180 g) Roma tomatoes
  • 1 tsp (1 g) oregano
  • cup (38 g) feta cheese
  • cup (60 ml) skim milk
  • Salt and pepper to taste
  • Cooking spray
  • 2 cups (300 g) shredded hash browns frozen

Instructions:

  1. Preheat your oven to 400F.
  2. Heat a large skillet over medium high heat and cook the sausage until it has browned.
  3. Once the sausage has browned, add in the spinach and wilt.
  4. In a large bowl, beat together 10 eggs, 1 tsp oregano and cup of milk. Stir in 2 cups of hash browns
  5. Wash and cut your tomatoes into a large dice and remove the seeds. (You can cut one of the tomatoes into slices for presentation purposes if you wish)
  6. Spray a 13x9 pan with cooking spray and add in the eggs, sausage and spinach mixture, cup feta cheese, diced tomatoes, and lightly season with salt and pepper.
  7. Bake for 20 minutes or until the center has set.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Cut the egg bake into 5 even pieces and place into each of your containers.

Sweet Potato Turkey Skillet

Ground turkey and sweet potatoes topped with green onions and shredded cheese. Serve with a side of salsa for more flavor!

CourseCuisineTime - 30 minutes 30 minutes 20 minutes
Main Dishmeal prepPrep - 10 minutes 10 minutes 10 minutes
Cook - 20 minutes 20 minutes 20 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
696kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates81g54%
Fat20g13%
Protein47g31%

Ingredients:

  • 3 (750 g) sweet potatoes
  • 2 lbs (908 g) ground turkey (93/7)
  • (100 g) sweet onion
  • 2 (250 g) poblano peppers green peppers work fine
  • 1 Tbsp (15 g) garlic minced
  • 1 Tbsp (8 g) cumin
  • 1 Tbsp (8 g) chili powder
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) olive oil
  • 5 Tbsp (20 g) green onions
  • cup (56 g) shredded cheese
  • 2 cups (600 g) salsa find one with a good ingredient list
  • Salt and pepper to taste
  • 5 cups (675 g) cooked rice

Instructions:

  1. Wash and cut your sweet potatoes into a large dice.
  2. Start a large pot of water over high heat and bring to a boil. Add in the sweet potatoes and boil until they are easily pierced by a fork. Drain the water once they have finished cooking.
  3. Wash your peppers and cut the pepper and onion into a small dice.
  4. Add 1 Tbsp of olive oil to a skillet over medium high heat. Add the onion, peppers, and 1 Tbsp of minced garlic to the skillet. Cook for 3 minutes.
  5. After the onions and peppers have cooked for a few minutes, add in the ground turkey and cook until it has browned.
  6. Mix in 1 Tbsp chili powder, 1 Tbsp cumin and salt and pepper to taste.
  7. Add in the sweet potatoes and mix.
  8. Store the salsa in a smaller separate container.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide the meat and potato mixture evenly into each of your containers. Top each dish with shredded cheese, 1 Tbsp of green onions, and cup salsa.

For the Rice

  1. Cook enough rice to have 5 cups of cooked rice. 1 cup of dry rice will yield around 3 cups of cooked rice.

For the Turkey

  1. Wash and cut your sweet potatoes into a large dice.
  2. Start a large pot of water over high heat and bring to a boil. Add in the sweet potatoes and boil until they are easily pierced by a fork. Drain the water once they have finished cooking.
  3. Wash your peppers and cut the pepper and onion into a small dice.
  4. Add 1 Tbsp of olive oil to a skillet over medium high heat. Add the onion, peppers, and 1 Tbsp of minced garlic to the skillet. Cook for 3 minutes.
  5. After the onions and peppers have cooked for a few minutes, add in the ground turkey and cook until it has browned.
  6. Mix in 1 Tbsp chili powder, 1 Tbsp cumin, and salt and pepper to taste.
  7. Add in the sweet potatoes and 5 cups of cooked rice and mix.
  8. Store the salsa in a smaller separate container.

Pesto Chicken with Carrots & Green Beans

Grilled chicken breast served with a side of spinach pesto sauce, green beans, and roasted carrots. A great meal for those days you really dont feel like spending time in the kitchen

CourseCuisineTime - 35 minutes 35 minutes 35 minutes
Main Dishmeal prepPrep - 10 minutes 10 minutes 10 minutes
Cook - 25 minutes 25 minutes 25 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
695kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates62g43%
Fat25g17%
Protein57g39%

Ingredients:

For the Chicken

  • 2 lbs (1135 g) boneless skinless chicken breast
  • 1 Tbsp (15 g) garlic minced
  • 1 Tbsp (8 g) onion powder
  • 1 Tbsp (3 g) oregano
  • 1 tsp (2 g) coriander
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) olive oil
  • Salt and pepper to taste
  • parsley chopped, optional

For the Vegetables

  • 1 lb (454 g) green beans fresh
  • 1 lbs (681 g) carrots
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) olive oil
  • Salt and pepper to taste

For the Pesto

  • 2 cups (60 g) spinach
  • 2 Tbsp (30 ml) olive oil
  • 2 Tbsp (56 g) parmesan cheese
  • cup (30 g) walnuts
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) lemon juice
  • Salt to taste

For the Rice

  • 5 cups (675 g) cooked rice

Instructions:

For the Chicken

  1. Pound the chicken using a meat tenderizer until it is even thickness throughout. If you dont have a meat tenderizer, butterfly the chicken to a thinner piece of meat.
  2. Add the chicken to a ziplock bag with 1 Tbsp of olive oil, 1 Tbsp onion powder, 1 Tbsp oregano, 1 tsp coriander and 1 Tbsp minced garlic.
  3. Shake the chicken around in the bag to evenly coat each breast with the seasoning. Remove as much air from the bag as possible and allow to marinate for at least 5 minutes. 30 minutes is preferred but in the interest of time, it is not required.
  4. Heat a grill pan or a skillet over medium high heat. Lightly season the chicken with salt and and cook the chicken in batches if necessary to prevent overcrowding. It has finished cooking when the inside is no longer pink and reaches an internal temperature of at least 165F.
  5. Allow the chicken to rest for at least 5 minutes and cut into slices.

For the Carrots

  1. Preheat your oven to 400F.
  2. Wash and peel your carrots. Cut them into sticks and toss with 1 Tbsp of olive oil.
  3. Spread out on a sheet pan and bake for 15 minutes or until soft.

For the Pesto

  1. Measure out 2 cups of loosely packed spinach. This measurement doesnt have to be exact, it will turn out just fine if you put in more.
  2. Blend the spinach, 2 Tbsp parmesan cheese, 1 Tbsp lemon juice, cup walnuts, 2 Tbsp olive oil and salt to taste.
  3. Store in separate, smaller containers as you do not want to heat this in the microwave.

For the Green Beans

  1. Start a medium sized pot of water over high heat and bring to a boil.
  2. Add in the green beans and boil for 6-7 minutes or until soft.

Plating

  1. The recipe makes 5 servings. Divide your sliced chicken, vegetables, and pesto cups evenly between your containers. Garnish with chopped parsley if you wish.

For the Rice

  1. Cook enough rice to have 5 cups of cooked rice. 1 cup of dry rice yields about 3 cups of cooed rice.

Chili Lime Chicken with Vegetables and Lentils

Grilled chicken thighs marinated in chili powder and lime juice and served with a side of lentils. Lentils provide more protein and a nice change of pace from rice.

CourseCuisineTime - 40 minutes 40 minutes 40 minutes
Main Dishmeal prepPrep - 10 minutes 10 minutes 10 minutes
Cook - 30 minutes 30 minutes 30 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
680kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates68g46%
Fat19g13%
Protein59g40%

Ingredients:

For the Chicken

  • 2 lbs (1135 g) boneless skinless chicken thighs
  • 3 Tbsp (45 ml) lime juice
  • 1 Tbsp (8 g) cumin
  • 1 tsp (2 g) chili powder
  • 1 tsp (2 g) paprika
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) garlic minced
  • 1 tsp (3 g) salt
  • 2 Tbsp (30 ml) olive oil
  • 1 (30 g) jalapeo pepper sliced (optional)

For the Lentils

  • 2 cups (500 g) cooked lentils
  • 1 Tbsp (8 g) cumin
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) lime juice
  • cup (5 g) cilantro chopped
  • Salt and pepper to taste

For the Vegetables

  • 2 medium (500 g) zucchini
  • 1 medium (200 g) red onion
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) olive oil

For the Rice

  • 5 cups (675 g) cooked rice
  • 2 tbsp (30 ml) olive oil

Instructions:

For the Lentils

  1. Rinse your lentils until the water runs clear and sift through them to ensure there are no rocks or other particles.
  2. One cup of dry lentils will yield roughly 2 cups of cooked lentils. Cook a little bit extra to ensure you have enough.
  3. There are two ways you can cook lentils. You can cook them like pasta or cook them like rice. I find it way easier to cook them like pasta. Boil the lentils until they are soft and strain.
  4. Measure out 2 cups of cooked lentils and mix in cup chopped cilantro, 1 Tbsp lime juice, 1 Tbsp cumin, and salt and pepper to taste.

For the Chicken

  1. Poke holes in the chicken thighs using a knife or fork to allow the marinade to enter the meat.
  2. In a ziplock bag, add the chicken, juice of 1 lime, 1 Tbsp cumin, 1 tsp chili powder, 1 tsp paprika, 1 Tbsp of minced garlic, 1 tsp salt, and 1 Tbsp of olive oil.
  3. Shake the chicken around in the bag to evenly coat each thigh with the seasoning. Remove as much air from the bag as possible and allow to marinate for at least 5 minutes. 30 minutes is preferred but in the interest of time, it is not required.
  4. Heat a grill pan over medium high heat and add 1 Tbsp of olive oil.
  5. Cook the chicken in batches if necessary to prevent overcrowding. Cook it for roughly 3 minutes on each side but be careful not to mess with it too much as you want the outside to develop some color.
  6. After the chicken has cooked, remove it from the pan and cut it into a large dice. Add it back to the pan to allow for it to finish cooking and develop more color.

For the Vegetables

  1. Wash and cut your zucchini into a large dice. Cut the red onion into similar sized pieces.
  2. In a large skillet, heat 1 Tbsp of olive oil over medium high heat. Add in the onions and cook for 3-4 minutes, then add the zucchini and cook until soft.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Add cup of lentils to each dish and divide the remainder of the ingredients evenly between your containers. Top with sliced jalapeo if desired.

For the Rice

  1. Cook enough rice to have 5 cups worth. 1 cup of dry rice makes about 3 cups of cooked rice. Mix in 2 tbsp of olive oil.

Enchilada Chicken with Calabacitas

Grilled chicken thighs coated with a homemade enchilada sauce and served with a side of cilantro lime rice, pico de gallo, and calabacitas.

CourseCuisineTime - null
Main Dishmeal prep, MexicanPrep - 10 minutes 10 minutes 10 minutes
Cook - 35 minutes 35 minutes 35 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
665kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates67g47%
Fat19g13%
Protein56g39%

Ingredients:

For the Chicken and Sauce

  • 2 lbs (1135 g) boneless skinless chicken thighs
  • 14.5 oz (411 g) can fire roasted tomatoes
  • 2 Tbsp (20 g) red onion diced
  • 1 Tbsp (15 g) garlic
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) white vinegar
  • 1 Tbsp (8 g) chili powder
  • 1 tsp (1 g) oregano
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) olive oil

For the Vegetables

  • 2 medium (500 g) zucchini
  • 8 oz (227 g) mushrooms
  • 1 large (200 g) red pepper
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) olive oil

For the Cilantro Lime Rice

  • 5 cups (675 g) cooked rice
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) lime juice
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) olive oil
  • cup (10 g) cilantro chopped
  • Salt to taste
  • 2 cups (438 g) black beans

For the Pico de Gallo

  • 4 (240 g) Roma tomatoes
  • medium (100 g) red onion
  • cup (10 g) cilantro chopped
  • 1-2 Tbsp (15 ml) lime juice
  • 1 (20 g) jalapeo pepper
  • Salt and pepper to taste

Instructions:

For the Rice

  1. Cook enough rice to have 2 cups of cooked rice. 1 cup of uncooked rice will yield around 3 cups of cooked rice.
  2. Drizzle 1 Tbsp of olive oil over the rice and mix in cup of cilantro, juice of lime, and add salt to taste. Mix thoroughly.

For the Enchilada Sauce

  1. Add 1 Tbsp garlic, 2 Tbsp of diced red onion, 1 can of fire roasted tomatoes, 1 Tbsp vinegar, 1 Tbsp chili powder, 1 tsp oregano, and 1 tsp salt to a blender. Blend until smooth.

For the Chicken

  1. Poke holes in the chicken to allow the marinade to enter the meat.
  2. Put the chicken in a ziplock bag and add of the enchilada sauce to the bag. Toss the chicken around in the bag to evenly distribute the sauce.
  3. Remove all of the air from the bag and allow to marinate for at least a few minutes.
  4. Add the remainder of the sauce to a pan and bring to a light boil for 15 minutes.
  5. Heat a grill pan or a skillet over medium high heat and cook the chicken in batches if necessary to prevent overcrowding. It has finished cooking when the inside is no longer pink and reaches an internal temperature of at least 165F.
  6. Remove the chicken from the pan and allow it to rest for at least a couple of minutes. Once it has rested, add it back to the skillet with the simmering enchilada sauce and toss to coat.

For the Vegetables

  1. Wash and cut your vegetables into a large dice.
  2. Heat a large skillet over medium high heat and add 1 Tbsp of olive oil. Saut the vegetables until the zucchini has softened.
  3. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

For the Pico de Gallo

  1. Cut the tomatoes in half the long way and scoop out the seeds. Dice the tomatoes so they are about inch cubes and place in a large bowl.
  2. Diceof a red onion and add to the the tomatoes.
  3. Cut the stems off of the jalapeo pepper. Cut the pepper into a small dice and add to the mixture. NOTE: If you arent a fan of heat, then take out the ribs and seeds before chopping up the peppers.
  4. Cut the stems off of a small bunch of cilantro and finely chop the leaves until you have cup, add to the bowl.
  5. Cut a lime in half and squeeze its juice into the mixing bowl. Stir all of the ingredients together and add salt and pepper to taste.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Add 1 cup of the cilantro lime rice to each container, cup of beans and divide the remainder of the ingredients evenly. Store the pico de gallo in a separate, smaller container.

For the Rice and Beans

  1. Cook enough rice to have 5 cups of cooked rice. 1 cup of uncooked rice will yield around 3 cups of cooked rice.
  2. Drizzle 1 Tbsp of olive oil over the rice and mix in cup of cilantro, juice of lime, and add salt to taste. Mix thoroughly.
  3. Drain and rinse 2 cups worth of beans.

Garlic Sriracha Chicken

Grilled chicken thighs coated with a Greek yogurt, garlic sriracha sauce. If you like spicy food then this meal is for you! Not a fan of spicy food? Just cut back on the sriracha.

CourseCuisineTime - null
Main DishAsian, meal prepPrep - 5 minutes 5 minutes 5 minutes
Cook - 25 minutes 25 minutes 25 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
586kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates47g38%
Fat21g17%
Protein54g44%

Ingredients:

  • 2 lbs (1135 g) boneless skinless chicken thighs
  • 4 Tbsp (60 ml) olive oil
  • 20 oz (567 g) frozen broccoli
  • cup (170 g) plain Greek yogurt
  • 2 Tbsp (30 ml) sriracha
  • 2 tsp (5 g) garlic powder
  • Salt and pepper
  • 5 cups (675 g) cooked rice
  • 5 Tbsp (10 g) green onions

Instructions:

For the Rice

  1. Cook enough rice to have 5 cups of cooked rice. 1 cup of uncooked rice will yield around 3 cups of cooked rice. Measure out the rice and stir in 3 Tbsp of oil.

For the Chicken

  1. Drizzle 1 Tbsp of olive oil over the chicken and ensure it is distributed across each of the thighs.
  2. Lightly season the chicken with salt and pepper.
  3. Heat a grill pan or a skillet over medium high heat and cook the chicken in batches if necessary to prevent overcrowding. It has finished cooking when the inside is no longer pink and reaches an internal temperature of at least 165F.
  4. Let the chicken rest for at least 5 minutes and then cut it into a large dice.

For the Garlic Sriracha Sauce

  1. In a bowl, mix together cup plain Greek yogurt, 2 Tbsp sriracha (more if you like spicy, less if you dont), and 2 tsp garlic powder.
  2. Heat the skillet over medium heat and add the chicken in. Pour the garlic sriracha sauce over the top of the chicken and stir to coat evenly.

For the Broccoli

  1. Because we are using frozen broccoli, it has already been cooked at one point. There is no need to cook the broccoli as it will cook when you reheat your meals. If you want to cook it, go for it. Regardless of which option you choose, lightly season it with salt and pepper before you eat it.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Add 1 cup of rice to each dish and divide the chicken and broccoli evenly. Top each dish with 1 Tbsp of chopped green onions.

Orange Chicken & Vegetables

A meal prepped version of the Chinese takeout dish. This version is not breaded or deep fried making it a healthier option than the one you would get from the Chinese restaurant.

CourseCuisineTime - 35 minutes 35 minutes 35 minutes
Main DishAsian, meal prepPrep - 10 minutes 10 minutes 10 minutes
Cook - 25 minutes 25 minutes 25 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
627kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates68g50%
Fat17g12%
Protein51g37%

Ingredients:

For the Chicken

  • 2 lbs (1135 g) boneless skinless chicken thighs
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) olive oil
  • 1 Tbsp (6 g) sesame seeds

For the Vegetables

  • 1 (250 g) zucchini
  • 1 (250 g) yellow squash
  • 2 (200 g) carrots
  • 1 (150 g) green pepper
  • 1 (150 g) red pepper
  • (100 g) sweet onion
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) olive oil

For the Sauce

  • cup (84 g) honey
  • cup (60 ml) white vinegar
  • cup (120 ml) orange juice
  • 2 Tbsp (30 ml) soy sauce
  • 2 tsp (6 g) cornstarch
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) cold water

For the Rice

  • 5 cups (675 g) cooked rice

Instructions:

For the Rice

  1. Cook enough rice to have 5 cups of rice. 1 cup of dry rice will yield 3 cups of cooked rice.

For the Chicken

  1. Drizzle 1 Tbsp of olive oil over the chicken and ensure it is distributed across each of the thighs.
  2. Lightly season the chicken with salt and pepper.
  3. Heat a grill pan or a skillet over medium high heat and cook the chicken in batches if necessary to prevent overcrowding. It has finished cooking when the inside is no longer pink and reaches an internal temperature of at least 165F.
  4. Let the chicken rest for at least 5 minutes and then cut it into a large dice.

For the Vegetables

  1. Wash and cut all of the vegetables into a large dice.
  2. Heat 1 Tbsp of olive oil in a large skillet. Add in the onions and carrots first and cook for 1-2 minutes.
  3. Add the peppers and squash next and cook until soft.

For the Sauce

  1. In a small sauce pot add cup honey, cup white vinegar, cup orange juice, and 2 Tbsp soy sauce. Bring to a light boil.
  2. Mix together 2 tsp cornstarch and 1 Tbsp cold water into a slurry. Pour into the sauce and stir to thicken.
  3. Pour the sauce over the chicken and vegetables and top the chicken with 2 Tbsp of sesame seeds.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide the chicken and vegetables evenly between your containers.

Turkey Sloppy Joe Bowls & Jalapeo Cheddar Potatoes

Ground turkey mixed with tomato sauce and seasonings and served with jalapeo cheddar potatoes and broccoli. This meal has a wide array of flavors and reheats well in the microwave.

CourseCuisineTime - 35 minutes 35 minutes 35 minutes
Main CourseAmerican, meal prepPrep - 10 minutes 10 minutes 10 minutes
Cook - 25 minutes 25 minutes 25 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
823kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates65g42%
Fat42g27%
Protein47g30%

Ingredients:

For the Sloppy Joes

  • 2 lbs (908 g) ground beef (85/15)
  • cup (132 g) tomato paste
  • (100 g) sweet onion
  • 1 (150 g) green pepper
  • 2 Tbsp (30 ml) dijon mustard
  • 1 Tbsp (23 ml) Worcestershire sauce
  • cup (60 g) ketchup
  • 1 tsp (3 g) red pepper flakes
  • 1 Tbsp (8 g) onion powder
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) olive oil
  • Salt and pepper to taste

For the Jalapeo Cheddar Potatoes

  • 8 small (1000 g) potatoes
  • 1 (30 g) jalapeo pepper
  • cup (74 g) shredded cheddar cheese
  • 1 Tbsp (23 ml) olive oil
  • Salt and pepper to taste
  • 1 large bunch (500 g) broccoli

For the Potatoes

  • 2 medium (275 g) potatoes
  • (15 g) jalapeo
  • cup (28 g) cheddar cheese shredded
  • Cooking spray oil

Instructions:

For the Potatoes

  1. Preheat your oven to 425F.
  2. Wash and cut your potatoes into a small to medium dice. You want these small so they cook faster. Aim for about inch cubes. Toss the potatoes in 1 Tbsp of olive oil and spread on a sheet pan.
  3. Bake for 10 minutes then remove from the oven and stir/flip. Bake for an additional 5-8 minutes or until they have developed some color.
  4. Remove the potatoes from the oven and segment them out into 5 even portions on the pan. Top each portion with cheddar cheese and sliced jalapeos, bake until the cheese has melted.

For the Sloppy Joes

  1. Cut your pepper and onion into a small dice. Add 1 Tbsp of olive oil in a skillet and add the pepper and onion. Cook until the onion is translucent and add the ground beef and cook until browned.
  2. Once the beef has cooked, stir in cup tomato paste, 1 Tbsp Worcestershire sauce, 2 Tbsp Dijon mustard, cup ketchup, 1 Tbsp onion powder, 1 tsp red pepper flakes, and salt and pepper to taste.

For the Broccoli

  1. Wash and cut your broccoli into florets and cook using your preferred method.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide all of your ingredients evenly between your containers.

Chicken Parmesan

Baked chicken breast tenders coated in ground corn flakes to make a gluten free breading and topped with a red sauce and cheese. The chicken is served with a side of zucchini noodles.

CourseCuisineTime - 45 minutes 45 minutes
Main CourseItalian, meal prepPrep - 20 minutes 20 minutes
Cook - 25 minutes 25 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
670kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates78g51%
Fat13g8%
Protein60g39%

Ingredients:

  • 2 lbs (908 g) chicken breast tenders
  • 2 cups (75 g) cornflakes you can use breadcrumbs, I use cornflakes because they are gluten free
  • cup (28 g) shredded parmesan cheese
  • 2 (2 ) eggs
  • cup (60 g) tapioca flour cornstarch works as well
  • 10 slices (110 g) thinly sliced provolone cheese
  • 2 (120 g) Roma tomatoes sliced
  • 1 tsp (1 g) oregano
  • 5 Tbsp (5 g) fresh parsley chopped
  • 1 cups (300 g) red pasta sauce
  • 3 (750 g) zucchinis
  • 5 cups (750 g) cooked rice or noodles
  • Cooking spray

Instructions:

For the Chicken

  1. Preheat your oven to 400F
  2. In a blender, add cup shredded parmesan cheese, 1 tsp oregano, and 2 cups of cornflakes. Blend until the cornflakes are reduced to a powder.
  3. Set up 3 bowls. One with cup of tapioca flour (cornstarch works as well), one with 2 beaten eggs, and one with the ground cornflakes.
  4. Dip the chicken breast tenders in the tapioca flour, then the egg wash, and then coat with the ground cornflakes.
  5. Spray a sheet pan with cooking spray and place the chicken on the pan. Lightly spray the tops with more cooking spray.
  6. Cook the chicken for 10 minutes and remove from the oven. Flip the chicken and cook an additional 5 minutes.
  7. Remove from the oven again and top the chicken with 1 cups of pasta sauce. Evenly spread the sauce across the chicken evenly. Place two thinly sliced pieces of provolone cheese over the top of the chicken.
  8. Bake an additional 5 minutes or until the cheese starts to brown and remove from oven.
  9. Top the chicken with chopped parsley.

For the Zoodles and Tomatoes

  1. While the chicken is cooking, wash your zucchini and form them into noodles using a vegetable spiralizer.
  2. There is no need to cook these as they will cook upon reheating in the microwave.
  3. Cut the tomatoes into slices.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide your chicken, zoodles, and sliced tomatoes evenly between your containers.

For the Rice

  1. Cook enough rice to have 5 cups worth. 1 cup of dry rice makes around 3 cups of cooked rice.

Taco Bowls with Cauliflower Rice

Ground beef, shredded Brussels sprouts, and cauliflower rice served with a side of salsa roja. A flavorful dish that can be customized to add your favorite toppings.

CourseCuisineTime - 35 minutes 35 minutes 35 minutes
Main Dishmeal prep, MexicanPrep - 10 minutes 10 minutes 10 minutes
Cook - 25 minutes 25 minutes 25 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
718kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates55g41%
Fat36g26%
Protein43g32%

Ingredients:

For the Meat

  • 2 lbs (908 g) ground beef (85/15)
  • cup (120 ml) tomato sauce
  • 1 tsp (3 g) paprika
  • 1 tsp (3 g) garlic powder
  • 1 tsp (3 g) chili powder
  • 1 tsp (3 g) cumin
  • Salt and pepper to taste

For the Brussels Sprouts

  • 9 oz (255 g) shredded Brussels sprouts You can buy these pre shredded
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) olive oil
  • 1 tsp (3 g) garlic powder
  • Salt and pepper to taste

For the Cauliflower Rice

  • 20 oz (567 g) frozen cauliflower rice
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) olive oil
  • 1 Tbsp (8 g) chili powder
  • 1 tsp (3 g) paprika
  • 1 (60 g) Roma tomato diced

For the Salsa Roja

  • 4 (240 g) Roma tomatoes
  • 1 small (100 g) white onion
  • 2 (60 g) jalapeos
  • 4 cloves (20 g) garlic
  • bunch (10 g) cilantro
  • 2 Tbsp (30 ml) lime juice
  • Salt to taste

For the Rice

  • 5 cups (675 g) rice cooked
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) olive oil
  • 1 Tbsp (8 g) chili powder
  • 1 tsp (3 g) paprika
  • 1 (60 g) Roma tomato diced

Instructions:

For the Taco Meat

  1. Heat a large skillet over medium high heat and brown the ground beef.
  2. Once cooked, drain the fat and add in cup of tomato sauce, 1 tsp paprika, 1 tsp chili powder, 1 tsp cumin, 1 tsp garlic powder, and salt and pepper to taste. Stir to combine and cook for an additional 5 minutes then remove from heat.

For the Salsa Roja

  1. Start a medium pot of water over high heat to boil.
  2. Wash your tomatoes, jalapeos, and cilantro. Cut the stems off of the tomatoes and jalapeos and cut the onion in half
  3. Add the small white onion, the peppers, tomatoes, and 4 cloves of garlic to the boiling water. Cook for 6-8 minutes. The tomatoes have finished cooking when they begin to change color and the skin starts to break.
  4. Drain the water from the pot. You may want to remove the skins from the tomatoes to avoid any stringy bits. Add the tomatoes, onions, garlic, jalapeos, bunch of cilantro, and the juice of 1 lime to a blender. Blend until smooth.
  5. Add salt to taste. Adjust flavor with salt and lime juice as needed.
  6. Portion out into smaller, separate cups once it has cooled.

For the Cauliflower Rice

  1. Microwave the cauliflower rice until it is no longer frozen.
  2. Dice 1 Roma tomato and remove the seeds.
  3. Heat a large skillet over medium heat and add 1 Tbsp of olive oil.
  4. Add the riced cauliflower, 1 Tbsp chili powder, and 1 tsp paprika.
  5. Cook for 3-4 minutes and remove from heat. Stir in the diced tomato. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

For the Brussels Sprouts

  1. Heat 1 Tbsp of olive oil over medium high heat. Add in the shaved Brussels sprouts and cook for 2-3 minutes. They will cook fast. Season with 1 tsp garlic powder and salt and pepper to taste.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Add 1 of your salsa cups to each container and divide the remaining ingredients evenly.

For the Rice

  1. Make enough rice to yield 5 cups, cooked. 1 cup of dry rice will make about 3 cups of cooked rice.
  2. Dice 1 Roma tomato and remove the seeds.
  3. Heat a large skillet over medium heat and add 1 Tbsp of olive oil.
  4. Add the rice, 1 Tbsp chili powder, and 1 tsp paprika.
  5. Cook for 3-4 minutes and remove from heat. Stir in the diced tomato. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

Ground Beef Stroganoff

Ground beef cooked with Greek yogurt and tomato sauce. Served with a side of rice and vegetables. This is a healthier version of the classic Beef Stroganoff.

CourseCuisineTime - 35 minutes 35 minutes 35 minutes
Main Dishmeal prepPrep - 10 minutes 10 minutes 10 minutes
Cook - 25 minutes 25 minutes 25 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
703kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates55g41%
Fat34g25%
Protein45g33%

Ingredients:

For the Stroganoff

  • 2 lbs (908 g) ground beef (85/15)
  • (100 g) sweet onion
  • cup (170 g) plain non fat Greek yogurt
  • cup (120 ml) tomato sauce
  • 2 Tbsp (30 ml) dijon mustard
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) olive oil
  • Salt and pepper to taste

For the Rice

  • 5 cups (750 g) cooked rice

For the Vegetables

  • 1 lb (454 g) whole mushrooms
  • 2 (500 g) zucchinis
  • 1 Tbsp (14 ml) butter
  • Salt and pepper to taste

Instructions:

For the Rice

  1. Cook enough rice to have 5 cups of cooked rice. 1 cup of uncooked rice will yield around 3 cups of cooked rice.

For the Stroganoff

  1. Cut of a sweet onion into a small dice.
  2. Heat 1 Tbsp of olive oil over medium high heat and add in the onion. Cook for 3 minutes then add the ground beef. Cook until it has browned and drain the fat.
  3. Once the beef has browned stir in cup plain Greek yogurt, cup tomato sauce, 2 Tbsp dijon mustard. Reduce the heat to medium low and cook for 5-7 minutes to allow the flavors to come together.
  4. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

For the Vegetables

  1. Wash and cut your zucchini and mushrooms into a large dice.
  2. Heat 1 Tbsp of butter in another skillet. Add in the mushrooms and cook for 3-4 minutes then add in the zucchini and cook until soft.
  3. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Add 1 cup of rice to each dish and divide the beef and vegetables evenly.

Teriyaki Ginger Chicken Stir Fry

It doesnt get quicker than a stir fry meal. If you buy frozen, precooked chicken this meal can be made in minutes. Using a bottled teriyaki sauce also makes it super quick and easy.

CourseCuisineTime - 25 minutes 25 minutes 25 minutes
Main DishAsian, meal prepPrep - 5 minutes 5 minutes 5 minutes
Cook - 20 minutes 20 minutes 20 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
573kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates61g49%
Fat15g12%
Protein48g38%

Ingredients:

  • 2 lbs (1135 g) boneless skinless chicken thighs
  • 20 oz (567 g) broccoli fresh or frozen
  • 1 lb (454 g) green beans
  • 2 Tbsp (30 ml) olive oil
  • cup (120 g) teriyaki ginger sauce I use the Kikkoman Teriyaki Triple Ginger sauce
  • 1 Tbsp (6 ml) sesame seeds
  • 5 cups (750 g) cooked rice
  • Salt and pepper to taste

Instructions:

For the Rice

  1. Cook enough rice to have 5 cups of cooked rice. 1 cup of uncooked rice will yield around 3 cups of cooked rice.

For the Chicken

  1. Lightly season the chicken with salt and pepper.
  2. Add 1-2 Tbsp of of olive oil to a grill pan or skillet over medium high heat and cook the chicken in batches if necessary to prevent overcrowding. It has finished cooking when the inside is no longer pink and reaches an internal temperature of at least 165F.
  3. Let it rest for a few minutes after cooking and cut into a large dice.

For the Vegetables

  1. Cook the broccoli in the microwave until it is no longer frozen. It doesnt have to be hot as you will be cooking more in the skillet.
  2. Start a large pot of water over high heat. Add the green beans and bring to a boil. Boil for 5-7 minutes or until the beans have softened but still slightly crisp.
  3. Add the chicken back to the skillet and pour cup of the teriyaki sauce over the top. Stir to coat and then add the green beans and broccoli. Stir everything so that the vegetables can pick up the residual sauce. Sprinkle 1 Tbsp of sesame seeds over the top.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. To each of your containers add 1 cup of rice and divide the stir fry evenly.

Middle Eastern Chicken with Turmeric Rice

Chicken thighs seasoned with middle eastern spices and grilled to perfection. Paired with the chicken is rice, spiced with turmeric and mixed with carrots, peas, and tomatoes.

CourseCuisineTime - 35 minutes 35 minutes 35 minutes
Main Dishmeal prep, Middle EasternPrep - 10 minutes 10 minutes 10 minutes
Cook - 25 minutes 25 minutes 25 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
659kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates60g43%
Fat21g15%
Protein57g41%

Ingredients:

For the Chicken

  • 2 lbs (1135 g) boneless skinless chicken thighs
  • 1 cup (227 g) plain non fat Greek yogurt
  • (100 g) red onion minced
  • tsp (1 g) salt
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) lemon juice
  • 1 tsp (3 g) cumin
  • 1 tsp (1 g) oregano
  • tsp (2 g) paprika
  • 2 Tbsp (30 ml) olive oil

For the Rice

  • 5 cups (750 g) cooked rice
  • 2 tsp (8 g) turmeric
  • 2 cup (200 g) shredded carrots
  • 2 cup (300 g) frozen peas
  • 2 (120 g) Roma tomatoes
  • 3 tsp (8 g) garlic powder
  • 2 Tbsp (30 ml) olive oil
  • Salt and pepper to taste

Instructions:

For the Rice

  1. Cook enough rice to have 5 cups of cooked rice. 1 cup of uncooked rice will yield around 3 cups of cooked rice.
  2. Once the rice has finished cooking, measure out 5 cups and place in a large bowl.
  3. Cut your Roma tomato into a small dice, remove the seeds. Chop the shredded carrots into smaller pieces.
  4. Mix in 2 tsp turmeric, 2 cup shredded carrots, 2 cup frozen peas, the diced tomato, 3 tsp garlic powder, 2 Tbsp olive oil, and salt and pepper to taste.

For the Chicken

  1. While the rice is cooking add the chicken thighs to a ziplock back with 1 cup of Greek yogurt, of minced red onion, tsp salt, 1 Tbsp lemon juice, 1 tsp cumin, 1 tsp oregano, tsp paprika, and 1 Tbsp olive oil.
  2. Toss the chicken around in the bag to make sure it is evenly coated and then remove the air and allow to marinate for at least 5 minutes. 30 minutes is preferred but in the interest of time, it is not required.
  3. Heat a grill pan over medium high heat and add 1 Tbsp of olive oil.
  4. Cook the chicken in batches if necessary to prevent overcrowding. Cook it for roughly 3 minutes on each side but be careful not to mess with it too much as you want the outside to develop some color.
  5. After the chicken has cooked, remove it from the pan and cut it into a large dice. Add it back to the pan to allow for it to finish cooking and develop more color.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide the chicken and rice evenly between each of your containers.

Salsa Chicken Quinoa Bowls

These Chicken Quinoa Bowls are incredibly versatile. Pictured here is a Salsa Chicken Bowl. You could also make a Buffalo Chicken Bowl or BBQ Chicken.

CourseCuisineTime - 30 minutes 30 minutes 30 minutes
Main Dishmeal prep, MexicanPrep - 10 minutes 10 minutes 10 minutes
Cook - 20 minutes 20 minutes 20 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
713kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates61g41%
Fat25g17%
Protein61g41%

Ingredients:

  • 2 lbs (1135 g) boneless skinless chicken breast
  • 1 large (300 g) zucchini
  • 15 oz (425 g) black beans
  • 1 large (200 g) green pepper
  • 16 oz (454 g) salsa
  • 5 cups (875 g) cooked quinoa
  • 5 Tbsp (82 ml) olive oil
  • Salt and pepper

Instructions:

For the Quinoa

  1. Cook enough quinoa to have 5 cups of cooked quinoa. 1 cup of uncooked quinoa will yield around 3 cups of cooked quinoa. Rinse the quinoa prior to cooking until the water runs clear. Cook using the same method you would use for rice. Mix in 3 Tbsp olive oil for extra calories.

For the Chicken

  1. Butterfly (or pound with a meat tenderizeyour chicken so that it is not so thick and it will cook faster. Cut all the way through so you have 2 pieces. If it is still fairly thick, you may want to pound it until it is inch thin or less. (Butterfly means to cut down the middle so you can open it like a book).
  2. Lightly season the chicken with salt and pepper.
  3. Add 1-2 Tbsp of of olive oil to a grill pan or skillet over medium high heat and cook the chicken in batches if necessary to prevent overcrowding. It has finished cooking when the inside is no longer pink and reaches an internal temperature of at least 165F.
  4. Let it rest for a few minutes after cooking and cut into a medium dice.
  5. Add to a bowl and mix with half the salsa to coat evenly.

For the Vegetables

  1. Wash and cut your pepper and zucchini into a small dice. Sauts until soft.
  2. Drain and rinse the black beans
  3. Plating
  4. This recipe makes 5 servings. Add 1 cup of quinoa and divide the remaining ingredients equally to each container.

Buffalo Chicken Quinoa Bowls

These Chicken Quinoa Bowls are incredibly versatile. Pictured here is a Buffalo Chicken Bowl with Greek yogurt ranch. You could also make a Salsa Chicken Bowl or BBQ Chicken.

CourseCuisineTime - 30 minutes
Main DishAmerican, meal prepPrep - 10 minutes
Cook - 20 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
442kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates27g28%
Fat13g13%
Protein54g57%

Ingredients:

  • 2 lbs (1135 g) boneless skinless chicken breast
  • 1 cup (175 g) celery diced
  • 1 cup (125 g) shredded carrots
  • 1 cup (175 g) green peppers diced
  • 1 cup (227 g) plain non fat Greek yogurt
  • 1 tsp (3 g) ranch dressing seasoning mix
    • cup (60 mL) buffalo sauce
  • 2 cups (438 g) cooked quinoa
  • 2 Tbsp (30 ml) olive oil
  • Salt and pepper

Instructions:

For the Quinoa

  1. Cook enough quinoa to have 2 cups of cooked quinoa. 1 cup of uncooked quinoa will yield around 3 cups of cooked quinoa. Rinse the quinoa prior to cooking until the water runs clear. Cook using the same method you would use for rice.

For the Chicken

  1. Butterfly (or pound with a meat tenderizeyour chicken so that it is not so thick and it will cook faster. Cut all the way through so you have 2 pieces. If it is still fairly thick, you may want to pound it until it is inch thin or less. (Butterfly means to cut down the middle so you can open it like a book).
  2. Lightly season the chicken with salt and pepper.
  3. Add 12 Tbsp of of olive oil to a grill pan or skillet over medium high heat and cook the chicken in batches if necessary to prevent overcrowding. It has finished cooking when the inside is no longer pink and reaches an internal temperature of at least 165F.
  4. Let it rest for a few minutes after cooking and cut into a medium dice.
  5. Add to a bowl and mix with cup buffalo sauce to coat evenly.

For the Vegetables

  1. Wash and cut your pepper and celery into a small dice. You need to have a total of 1 cups each.
  2. Measure out 1 cups of shredded carrots.
  3. You dont need to cook any of these as they will cook in the microwave.

For the Ranch Dressing

  1. Mix together 1 cup of Greek yogurt and 1 tsp of ranch dressing mix. Store in separate, smaller containers.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Add cup of quinoa and carrots, celery, and peppers to each container. Divide the chicken equally and add 1 of your ranch dressing cups to each container.

Deconstructed Cheeseburger Bowls

A meal prep version of the American classic. Ground beef, potato wedges, and burger toppings come together in a bowl that reheats well in the microwave.

CourseCuisineTime - 33 minutes
Main DishAmerican, meal prepPrep - 8 minutes
Cook - 25 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
662kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates47g38%
Fat35g28%
Protein41g33%

Ingredients:

For the Hamburger and Toppings

  • 2 lbs (908 g) ground beef (85/15)
  • 5 Tbsp (35 g) shredded cheese
  • 9 oz (255 g) shredded Brussels sprouts
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) olive oil
  • 1 tsp (2 g) garlic powder
  • 10 Tbsp (150 ml) BBQ sauce Vinegar based
  • 5 (150 g) dill pickle spears
  • 2 (120 g) Roma tomatoes
  • Salt and pepper to taste

For the Potato Wedges

  • 5 small (750 g) russet potatoes
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) olive oil
  • Salt and pepper

Instructions:

For the Potato Wedges

  1. Preheat your oven to 400F.
  2. Wash each of your potatoes thoroughly. Cut each of them in half long ways 3 times so you have 8 wedges for each potato.
  3. In a large bowl, drizzle 1 Tbsp of olive oil over the potatoes. Sprinkle with 1 tsp of salt and pepper. Toss the potatoes to coat and spread onto a sheet pan.
  4. Bake for 10 minutes and then flip them to the other side and cook an additional 10-12 minutes or until desired doneness is achieved.

For the Hamburger

  1. Heat a skillet over medium high heat. Add the ground beef and cook. Once it has browned, season with salt and pepper to taste.

For the Brussels Sprouts

  1. Heat 1 Tbsp of olive oil over medium high heat. Add in the shaved Brussels sprouts and cook for 2-3 minutes. They will cook fast. Season with 1 tsp garlic powder and salt and pepper to taste.

For the Bowls

  1. Cut 2 Roma tomatoes into slices.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide your hamburger, potatoes, and Brussels sprouts evenly between your 5 containers. Top the hamburger with 1 Tbsp of shredded cheese. Add 1 pickle spear and slices of Roma tomatoes. Store 2 Tbsp of BBQ sauce in a separate container.

Firecracker Chicken

Thinly sliced chicken breast coated in firecracker sauce and served with a side of rice and vegetables. If you are a fan of spicy food, this one is for you.

CourseCuisineTime - 35 minutes 35 minutes 35 minutes
Main Dishmeal prepPrep - 10 minutes 10 minutes 10 minutes
Cook - 25 minutes 25 minutes 25 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
624kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates65g50%
Fat22g17%
Protein41g32%

Ingredients:

For the Chicken

  • 2 lbs (908 g) boneless skinless chicken breast
  • 3 Tbsp (45 ml) Franks Red Hot Sauce any hot sauce should work
  • 1 tsp (2 g) red pepper flakes
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) apple cider vinegar
  • (84 g) cup honey
  • 1 Tbsp (8 g) cornstarch
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) cold water
  • 2 Tbsp (30 ml) olive oil
  • Salt and pepper to taste
  • (10 g) Green onions to garnish optional

For the Vegetables

  • 2 medium (500 g) zucchinis
  • 1 large (200 g) red pepper
  • medium (100 g) sweet onion
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) olive oil
  • Salt and pepper to taste

For the Rice

  • 5 cups (750 g) cooked rice
  • 3 Tbsp (45 g) olive oil

Instructions:

For the rice

  1. Cook enough rice to have 5 cups of cooked rice. 1 cup of uncooked rice will yield around 3 cups of cooked rice. Mix in 3 Tbsp of olive oil for extra calories.

For the Chicken

  1. Butterfly your chicken so that it is not so thick and it will cook faster. Cut all the way through so you have 2 pieces. If it is still fairly thick, you may want to pound it until it is inch thin or less. (Butterfly means to cut down the middle so you can open it like a book).
  2. Heat a grill pan over medium high heat and add 1 Tbsp of olive oil. Season the chicken with salt and pepper.
  3. Cook the chicken in batches if necessary to prevent overcrowding. It has finished cooking when the inside is no longer pink and reaches an internal temperature of at least 165F.

For the Vegetables

  1. Cut your vegetables into a large dice.
  2. Heat a large skillet over medium high heat and add 1 Tbsp of olive oil.
  3. Add the onions and peppers first. Cook them for 1-2 minutes and then add in the zucchini and cook until soft.

For the Sauce

  1. In a small sauce pot, add 3 Tbsp hot sauce, 1 tsp red pepper flakes, 1 Tbsp apple cider vinegar, and cup honey. Bring to a light boil.
  2. Mix together 1 Tbsp of cornstarch and 1 Tbsp of cold water to make a slurry. Pour into the pot and stir to thicken.
  3. Pour the sauce over the chicken and coat evenly.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Add 1 cup of rice and divide the remainder of your ingredients evenly between your containers. Top with green onions if you wish.

Beef & Broccoli Stir Fry

An easy recipe with great flavor. This meal is as good as any you would get from a Chinese takeout menu. Make sure you get your pan nice an hot to get a good sear on the beef!

CourseCuisineTime - 30 minutes 30 minutes 30 minutes
Main DishAsian, meal prepPrep - 10 minutes 10 minutes 10 minutes
Cook - 20 minutes 20 minutes 20 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
717kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates74g50%
Fat27g18%
Protein45g30%

Ingredients:

  • 2 lbs (908 g) sirloin steak
  • 1 bunch (500 g) broccoli
  • (100 g) sweet onion
  • 1 lb (454 g) carrots
  • 2 Tbsp (30 ml) olive oil
  • 1 Tbsp (5 g) ginger
  • 3 tsp (8 g) cornstarch
  • 5 cups (750 g) cooked rice
  • 5 Tbsp (10 g) green onions chopped
  • Salt and pepper to taste
  • 1 Tbsp (8 g) sesame seeds

For the Sauce

  • cup (120 ml) soy sauce
  • 1 Tbsp (15 g) sriracha
  • cup (60 ml) water
  • 1 Tbsp (5 g) ginger minced
  • 1 tsp (3 gl) cornstarch
  • 3 Tbsp (37 g) brown sugar

Instructions:

For the rice

  1. Cook enough rice to have 5 cups of cooked rice. 1 cup of uncooked rice will yield around 3 cups of cooked rice.

For the Beef and Broccoli

  1. Prepare all of your ingredients before you start cooking. Cut your onion and carrots into a large dice, cut your broccoli into florets. Mince the enough ginger to yield 2 Tbsp.
  2. Heat a large skillet over medium high heat and add ~1 Tbsp of olive oil.
  3. Cut the steak into thin slices (about inch thick, against the grain of the meat. It may help to cut if the meat is slightly frozen.
  4. Very lightly season the beef with salt and sprinkle 3 tsp of cornstarch over the top. Try and coat all sides of the meat.
  5. Cook the beef in the pan in batches. You want to get a sear on the meat so dont overcrowd the pan and make sure your pan is hot. After 1 minute, flip the pieces and cook an additional minute. Remove from pan.
  6. Add olive oil if necessary and cook the remaining beef.
  7. Once the beef has finished add ~1 Tbsp of olive oil to the pan. Add in the onions, carrots, and minced ginger. Cook for 3 minutes and then add in the broccoli. Continue cooking until the broccoli begins to soften. It may be helpful to parboil it first.

For the Sauce

  1. In a sauce pot, add cup soy sauce, 1 Tbsp sriracha, 1 Tbsp minced ginger, 2 Tbsp of water and 3 Tbsp brown sugar over medium heat. Allow the sugar to melt and stir frequently. Bring to a light boil.
  2. Mix 1 tsp cornstarch into the remaining 2 Tbsp of water. Add to the pot and stir to thicken.
  3. Combine the beef and vegetables back into the skillet and pour the sauce over the top. Stir to coat evenly. Top with sesame seeds.
  4. This recipe makes 5 servings. Add 1 cup of rice and 1 Tbsp green onions to each dish and divide the meat mixture evenly.

For the Chicken and Broccoli

  1. Prepare all of your ingredients before you start cooking. Cut your onion and carrots into a large dice, cut your broccoli into florets. Mince the enough ginger to yield 2 Tbsp.
  2. Heat a large skillet over medium high heat and add ~1 Tbsp of olive oil.
  3. Cut the chicken into thin slices (about inch thick, against the grain of the meat. It may help to cut if the meat is slightly frozen.
  4. Very lightly season the beef with salt and sprinkle 3 tsp of cornstarch over the top. Try and coat all sides of the meat.
  5. Cook the chicken in the pan in batches. You want to get a sear on the meat so dont overcrowd the pan and make sure your pan is hot. After 1 minute, flip the pieces and cook an additional minute. Remove from pan.
  6. Add olive oil if necessary and cook the remaining beef.
  7. Once the chicken has finished add ~1 Tbsp of olive oil to the pan. Add in the onions, carrots, and minced ginger. Cook for 3 minutes and then add in the broccoli. Continue cooking until the broccoli begins to soften. It may be helpful to parboil it first.

Sweet Potato Turkey Chili

A hearty chili packed with sweet potatoes, pinto beans, peppers, and ground turkey. This meal can be made in one pot to help speed up the cleaning process!

CourseCuisineTime - 30 minutes 30 minutes 30 minutes
Main DishAmerican, meal prepPrep - 10 minutes 10 minutes 10 minutes
Cook - 20 minutes 20 minutes 20 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
669kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates72g53%
Fat27g20%
Protein35g26%

Ingredients:

For the Chili

  • 1 lbs (681 g) ground beef (85/15)
  • 14.5 oz (411 g) pinto beans
  • 14.5 oz (411 g) can petite diced tomatoes
  • 14.5 oz (411 g) can crushed tomatoes
  • 1 large (300 g) sweet potato
  • medium (100 g) sweet onion
  • 1 medium (150 g) green pepper
  • 1 medium (150 g) red pepper
  • 2 Tbsp (15 g) chili powder
  • 1 tsp (3 g) cayenne pepper
  • 2 Tbsp (30 ml) olive oil
  • 5 cups (750 g) cooked rice
  • Salt and pepper to taste

For the Topping

  • 5 Tbsp (71 g) Greek yogurt
  • green onions

Instructions:

  1. Before you start cooking youll want to chop all of your vegetables first and start cooking the rice. This will save time. Youll also want to start a pot of water to boil for the sweet potatoes. Cut the onion and bell peppers into a small dice. Cut the sweet potatoes into a medium dice.
  2. Add the sweet potatoes to the boiling water and cook until soft. Drain the water and set aside.
  3. Heat 1 Tbsp of olive oil over medium high heat in a large pot. Add in the peppers and onions and cook for 3-5 minutes or until soft.
  4. Push the pepper and onion mixture to the side and add an additional 1 Tbsp of olive oil to the pot. Lightly season the turkey with salt and pepper and add to the pot. Cook until browned.
  5. Add the crushed tomatoes, petite diced tomatoes, sweet potatoes, 2 Tbsp chili powder, and 1 tsp cayenne pepper, and beans to the pot. Bring to a boil and taste test. Season with salt and pepper and adjust seasonings as needed.
  6. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide all of your ingredients evenly between 5 containers. Add 1 cup of cooked rice to each dish. Top each dish with Greek yogurt and green onions.

Smoked Sausage with Rice & Beans

Here is one of the easiest meals you will ever make. Sausage, rice, and beans is such a classic combination and the frozen broccoli and carrots add an easy source of nutrients.

CourseCuisineTime - 25 minutes
Main Dishmeal prepPrep - 5 minutes
Cook - 20 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
467kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates52g52%
Fat15g15%
Protein32g32%

Ingredients:

  • 28 oz (795 g) turkey kielbasa sausage
  • 2 cups (375 g) cooked rice
  • 2 cups (300 g) shredded carrots
  • 1 lb (454 g) frozen chopped broccoli
  • 1 can (425 g) black beans 15oz drained and rinsed
  • cup (10 g) cilantro optional
  • 1 lime optional
  • Salt and pepper to taste

Instructions:

  1. Cook enough rice to yield 3 cups of cooked rice. (1 cup of dry rice yields around 3 cups of cooked rice)
  2. Slice your kielbasa sausage into bite sized pieces and fry in a large skillet until browned.
  3. This is all of the cooking that is required for this meal. The carrots, broccoli, and beans will cook in the microwave when you reheat your meal. If you plan on eating the meal right away, microwave the broccoli and carrots and heat the beans in a small sauce pan.
  4. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide all of your ingredients evenly between 5 containers. Sprinkle chopped cilantro over the beans and rice. Serve with a lime wedge if youd like.

Asian Ground Turkey Bowls

Ground turkey mixed in an Asian inspired sauce and served with a side of rice, and vegetables. Topping this dish with a few peanuts after reheating would be a great addition.

CourseCuisineTime - 35 minutes
Main DishAsian, meal prepPrep - 10 minutes
Cook - 25 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
415kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates36g42%
Fat16g19%
Protein32g38%

Ingredients:

For the Rice

  • 2 cups (375 g) cooked rice

For the Vegetables

  • 1 medium (200 g) sweet onion
  • 1 medium (150 g) green pepper
  • 2 cups (250 g) shredded carrots
  • 1 tbsp (15 mL) olive oil
  • salt and pepper to taste

For the Turkey

  • 2 lbs (681 g) ground turkey 93/7
  • 8 oz (227 g) mushrooms
  • 1 tbsp (21 g) honey
  • 2 tsp (10 g) sriracha
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) garlic minced
  • tsp (1 g) ground ginger
  • 1 tsp (5 mL) sesame oil
  • 1 tbsp (15 mL) olive oil
  • 3 tbsp (45 mL) soy sauce
  • salt and pepper to taste

Instructions:

For the Vegetables

  1. Wash and cut your green pepper into a large dice. Cut your sweet onion into a large dice as well.
  2. Cut your mushrooms into quarters if they are small or more if they are larger mushrooms.
  3. In a large skillet, heat 1 Tbsp of olive oil over medium high heat.
  4. Add the onion first and cook for 1-2 minutes then add in the green peppers. Cook until soft and remove from the pan. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

For the Turkey

  1. Heat 1 Tbsp of olive oil over medium high heat. Add in the ground turkey and 1 Tbsp minced garlic to cook.
  2. When the turkey is half way browned, add in the chopped mushrooms and cook together until the turkey has fully browned.
  3. When the turkey has finished, add in 1 Tbsp of honey, 3 Tbsp soy sauce, 2 tsp sriracha, 1 tsp sesame oil, and tsp ground ginger. Stir to incorporate and season with salt and pepper to taste.

For the Rice

  1. Cook enough rice to have 2 cups of cooked rice. 1 cup of uncooked rice will yield around 3 cups of cooked rice.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. You do not need to cook the shredded carrots because they will cook when reheated in the microwave. Add cup of rice and carrots to each container and divide the remaining ingredients equally.

Peaches and Cream Baked Oatmeal

Peaches and Cream Baked Oatmeal made from frozen peaches layered and swirled cream cheese inside of an oatmeal and egg bake. This is a great meal for those weeks you prefer something sweet to have in the morning.

CourseCuisineTime - 55 minutes
BreakfastAmerican, meal prepPrep - 10 minutes
Cook - 45 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
392kcal6
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates49g59%
Fat13g15%
Protein20g24%

Ingredients:

  • 3 cups (240 g) old fashioned oats
  • 2 scoops (60 g) vanilla protein powder
  • 1 tsp (4 g) baking powder
  • 1 lb (454 g) peaches frozen, fresh, or canned
  • 2 tbsp (42 g) maple syrup
  • 1 tbsp (14 g) butter
  • 10 tbsp (150 g) liquid egg whites or 2 eggs
  • 2 cups (480 g) 2% milk
  • 4 oz (113 g) plain cream cheese i used whipped, regular is fine you'll just need to melt it down
  • 2 tbsp (25 g) sugar
  • tsp (2 g) salt

Instructions:

For the Baked Oatmeal

  1. Preheat your oven to 375F.
  2. Measure out your peaches. If you would like a sweeter end product, sprinkle 1 teaspoon (5g) of sugar over the top and allow them to macerate. It may help speed up the process if you thaw them in the microwave first.
  3. In a large bowl, mix together the oats, protein powder, salt, and baking powder.
