  4. Add in the egg whites, milk, syrup, 1 tbsp of melted butter, and the peaches. Reserve a few to put on top.
  5. Spray a 13"x9" pan with oil and add the oat mixture.
  6. Mix together the cream cheese and sugar. You can microwave it for a bit to help it soften. Put a few spoonfuls of the cream cheese around your pan and swirl it around as best as you can.
  7. You can garnish the top with fresh peach slices if you wish.
  8. Bake for 40-45 minutes.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 6 servings. Cut the oatmeal into 6 equal pieces.

Easy Breakfast Tacos

These Breakfast Tacos are my go to breakfast or late night meal when I don't have anything prepped. They only take 10-15 minutes and are made from eggs, cheese, and potatoes.

CourseCuisineTime - 15 minutes
Breakfast, Main DishAmerican, MexicanPrep - 5 minutes
Cook - 10 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
152kcal4 Tacos
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates16.3g56%
Fat6.5g22%
Protein7g24%

Ingredients:

For the Tacos

  • 4 (94 g) corn tortillas
  • 1 small (100 g) russet potato
  • 2 large (140 g) eggs
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) milk
  • 2 slices (46 g) cheese
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) hot sauce
  • 1 tbsp (5 g) cilantro chopped
  • tsp (2 g) oil
  • salt to taste

For the Pickled Red Onions

  • 1 medium (200 g) red onion
  • 1 tbsp (12 g) sugar
  • 1 tsp (6 g) salt
  • 1 cups (360 g) white vinegar
  • 1 cups (360 g) water

Instructions:

For the Tacos

  1. Wash and cut your potato into small shoestring french fry shapes.
  2. Place the fries into your air fryer basket and spray with 2g of oil and sprinkle with salt to taste.
  3. Air fry at 400 F for 8-10 minutes shaking the basket half way through.
  4. While the potatoes are cooking, crack 2 eggs into a dish and add a splash of milk and salt. Beat until they are smooth. Cook the eggs in either a pan or in the microwave until they are finished.
  5. In a dry skillet over medium high heat, add 4 corn tortillas to warm and lightly brown. Flip over and add a half slice of cheese to each to begin to melt.
  6. To each tortilla, evenly divide the potatoes and eggs. Top each with hot sauce, pickled onions, and chopped cilantro.
  7. The nutritional estimates are per taco.

For the Pickled Red Onions

  1. These are best made in advance. I always keep these in my fridge. They will last for weeks.
  2. Cut your red onion into thin slices from root to shoot.
  3. In large mason jar, add1tsp of salt,1tbsp of sugar,1cups water, and1cups distilled vinegar. Stir to dissolve the solids.
  4. Add the onions into the mason jar and top with more water and vinegar if necessary to cover the onions. Cap the jar and move it into the fridge to allow the onions to pickle.

Double Chocolate Brownie Baked Oatmeal

Double Chocolate Brownie Baked Oatmeal. Great for either a meal prepped breakfast or as a pre-bedtime snack. I like to eat mine by dumping some milk over the top after reheating.

CourseCuisineTime - 55 minutes
Main DishAmerican, meal prepPrep - 15 minutes
Cook - 40 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
360kcal6 servings
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates49g61%
Fat8g10%
Protein23g28%

Ingredients:

  • 3 cups (240 g) old fashioned oats
  • 3 scoops (90 g) vanilla protein powder i use whey
  • 1 tsp (4 g) baking powder
  • 1/4 cup (20 g) cocoa powder
  • 2 tbsp (42 g) maple syrup
  • 1 tbsp (14 g) butter
  • 10 tbsp (150 g) liquid egg whites or 2 whole eggs
  • 2 cups (480 g) milk
  • 1 cup (226 g) unsweetened apple sauce
  • 4 tbsp (56 g) mini chocolate chips
  • 1 tsp (5 g) milk

Instructions:

FOR THE BAKED OATMEAL

  1. Preheat your oven to 350F (177C).
  2. In a large bowl, mix together the oats, protein powder, cocoa powder, and baking powder.
  3. Add in the egg whites, milk, syrup, 1 tbsp of melted butter, apple sauce, and 2 tbsp of chocolate chips.
  4. Spray a 13x9 pan with oil and add the oat mixture.
  5. Top with 1 tbsp of chocolate chips.
  6. Bake for 35-40 minutes.
  7. Melt the last tbsp of chocolate chips in the microwave with 1 tsp of milk.
  8. Place the melted chocolate into a piping bag and drizzle over the top.

PLATING

  1. This recipe makes 6 servings. Cut the oatmeal into 6 equal pieces.

Turkey and Kale Power Bowl

This Turkey and Kale Power Bowl is served with a side of Sriracha Lime Mayo and Pickled Red Onions. Made up of 93/7 ground turkey, onions, peppers, kale and quinoa this meal is high in volume and flavor.

CourseCuisineTime - 45 minutes
Main DishAmerican, meal prepPrep - 20 minutes
Cook - 25 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
574kcal5 servings
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates36g33%
Fat30g28%
Protein40g37%

Ingredients:

For the Pickled Onions

  • 1 medium (200 g) red onion
  • 1 tbsp (12 g) sugar
  • 1 tsp (6 g) salt
  • 1 cups (360 g) white vinegar
  • 1 cups (360 g) water

For the Quinoa

  • 1 cup (180 g) dry quinoa
  • 2 cups (480 g) water

For the Turkey

  • 2 lbs (908 g) ground turkey (93/7)
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) oil
  • 2 tsp (6 g) paprika
  • 1 tsp (3 g) ground coriander
  • salt and pepper to taste

For the Vegetables

  • 1 small (125 g) sweet onion
  • 2 medium (300 g) red peppers
  • 1 bunch (150 g) kale
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) minced garlic
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) oil
  • salt and pepper to taste

For the Sriracha Lime Mayo

  • cup (56 g) mayonnaise
  • cup (56 g) plain nonfat Greek yogurt
  • 4 tsp (20 g) lime juice
  • 4 tsp (20 g) sriracha
  • salt to taste

Instructions:

For the Quinoa

  1. Rinse your quinoa under some water to clean off any impurities.
  2. Cook your quinoa according to the packaging. I use a rice cooker with a 1 cup quinoa to 2 cups water ratio.

For the Pickled Onions

  1. Cut your red onion into thin slices from root to shoot.
  2. In large mason jar, add 1 tsp of salt, 1 tbsp of sugar, 1 cups water, and 1 cups distilled vinegar. Stir to dissolve the solids.
  3. Add the onions into the mason jar and top with more water and vinegar if necessary to cover the onions. Cap the jar and move it into the fridge to allow the onions to pickle.

For the Vegetables

  1. Wash your red peppers and kale first.
  2. Cut the peppers into a small to medium dice and the onion into a small dice.
  3. Remove the leaves from the stems of the kale and roughly chop them into smaller pieces. Massage the kale leaves by squeezing them in your hands for 20-30 seconds. This will help soften the leaves and take away some bitterness.
  4. In a large skillet over medium high heat, add 1 tbsp of oil and dump in your onions and peppers. Salt lightly.
  5. Once the onions have started to develop some color, add in your kale and cover for 1 minute to help it wilt down.
  6. Stir the contents of the skillet and then add 1 tbsp of minced garlic and season the vegetables to taste. Reserve to the side until the remainder of your components are ready.

For the Turkey

  1. In a large skillet over medium high heat, drizzle in 1 tbsp of oil and add the turkey to brown. Season with salt and pepper to your liking.
  2. Flip the turkey over after a few minutes to brown the other side. When it is about 85% of the way finished, add in 2 tsp of paprika and 1 tsp ground coriander.
  3. Mix in the seasonings until they are well distributed. Once the turkey is finished cooking, set it aside until everything else is ready.

For the Sriracha Lime Mayo

  1. In a small bowl, mix the mayo, yogurt, lime juice, and sriracha together. Season with salt to taste.
  2. Divide the mayo out into 5 small ramekins to be placed into the final dish.

For the Final Dish + Plating

  1. In a large skillet with the vegetables, add in the turkey and quinoa. Mix thoroughly to incorporate. Taste test and adjust flavors as needed.
  2. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide the contents of the skillet evenly between 5 servings. Each dish gets one ramekin of the sriracha lime mayo.
  3. If you are taking the meals away from your home, I would also add in some of the pickled red onions to each dish. If you eat the meals at home, you can take the onions from the jar after you reheat.

Hidden Vegetable Mac and Cheese

This Mac and Cheese is macro friendly with 50 grams of protein and is full of nutrients from vegetables hidden in the cheese sauce. The sauce is made up of carrots, cauliflower, milk, and cheese.

CourseCuisineTime - 1 hour
Main DishAmerican, meal prepPrep - 30 minutes
Cook - 30 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
596kcal6 servings
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates54g43%
Fat20g16%
Protein50g40%

Ingredients:

  • 2 lbs (908 g) boneless skinless chicken breast
  • 12 oz (340 g) macaroni noodles gluten free if needed
  • 1 lb (454 g) frozen cauliflower
  • 3 medium (300 g) carrots
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) oil
  • 8 oz (227 g) cheddar cheese block is best
  • 2 cups (480 g) pasta water
  • 1 cups (360 g) 2% milk
  • salt and pepper to taste
  • any other seasoning you like is optional

Instructions:

For the Vegetables

  1. Wash and cut your carrots into smaller pieces so that they roast quicker.
  2. On a lightly oiled sheet pan, place the carrots and frozen cauliflower. Drizzle over 1 tbsp of oil and lightly season with salt and pepper. Toss to coat.
  3. Roast at 425F (218C) for 20-25 minutes, flipping half way through.

For the Chicken

  1. Trim the excess fat and skin from the chicken and either cut or pound the chicken so that is even in thickness throughout. I shoot for about " in thickness.
  2. Season both sides lightly with salt and pepper and place onto a sheet pan. Place into the oven at 425F for 15 minutes or until the chicken reaches 165F.
  3. Once the chicken has finished, allow it to rest for 10 minutes before cutting it into a very small dice.

For the Macaroni

  1. Cook the macaroni according to the packaging. Shoot for just past al dente on the doneness. Reserve 2 cups of the pasta water for your cheese sauce. Be sure not to use too much water in your pot. Too much water will dilute the starchy pasta water that we will use to thicken the sauce later.
  2. Once cooked, rinse and store in cold water to stop the cooking process until you are ready to use later.

For the Cheese Sauce

  1. NOTE: If you wanted to add a bit of mustard powder, paprika, or another spice you could certainly do that. I like to personally keep it to salt and pepper but you should make it how you like it. Using a blend of different cheese can also add layers of flavor if you don't mind buying a few blocks of cheese.
  2. Shred your block of cheese using a box grater or food processor.
  3. Once the vegetables have finished roasting, place them into a blender with 2 cups of pasta water, 1 cups of milk, and about of all of the cheese you just shredded. Blend on high speed for 30-60s or until smooth.

For the Mac & Cheese

  1. In a 13"x9" baking dish, pour about half of the cheese sauce into the bottom.
  2. Drain the water away from your macaroni and dump the noodles into the pan.
  3. Add in the chopped chicken and pour the remaining cheese sauce over the top.
  4. Stir to evenly distribute the cheese sauce and give it a taste test. Adjust with salt and pepper to taste. Mix again if necessary.
  5. Top the dish with the remaining shredded cheese and place back into the oven at 425F for 10 minutes to brown the cheese and thicken the sauce. For the last two minutes, I like to turn the oven to broil to help the cheese brown.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 6 servings. Cut the dish into 6 equal portions and place into each meal prep container. Top with chopped parsley for a garnish if you wish.

Nashville Hot Chicken Nuggets

Nashville Hot Chicken Nuggets made from ground chicken breasts and sweet potatoes with a jalapeo and spices to give them some heat. Batch prep these to put in Snack City in the freezer and you've got yourself a high protein snack in minutes.

CourseCuisineTime - 1 hour 30 minutes
SnackAmericanPrep - 30 minutes
Cook - 1 hour

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
32kcal90 nuggets
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates2.2g36%
Fat1g16%
Protein3.6g60%

Ingredients:

  • 3 lbs (1362 g) ground chicken I grind my own chicken breasts
  • 3 medium (720 g) sweet potatoes
  • 5 stalks (50 g) green onion
  • 1 (30 g) jalapeo pepper optional
  • 3 (210 g) eggs beaten
  • cup (60 g) flour I use oat, wheat flour will also work
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) minced garlic
  • 3 tbsp (45 g) hot sauce I use Louisiana Hot Sauce
  • 2 tsp (12 g) salt
  • 1.5 tbsp (9 g) paprika
  • 1 tbsp (6 g) chili powder
  • 1 tbsp (6 g) cayenne pepper
  • 1 tbsp (6 g) onion powder
  • 1.5 tbsp (18 g) brown sugar
  • 2 tbsp (30 g) oil
  • oil spray

Instructions:

For the Chicken

  1. I make my own ground chicken by placing chicken breasts into the food processor until they are processed down into a mince. To calculate the leanness I divide the amount of fat by the total weight. For the Kirkland brand chicken breast I use that is 4g/454g or 99% lean ground chicken. If you use a store bought that is fattier, you will want to place the ingredients into a tracker to determine the nutritional information.
  2. Here is a video of how I make the ground chicken in the food processor. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cEcQOVkQpOQ

For the Nuggets

  1. Preheat your oven to 400F
  2. Wash all of your vegetables. Peel and cut your potatoes into smaller chunks, cut the stem from the jalapeo, and cut the ends off of the green onions and chop into smaller pieces.
  3. Using a food processor, blender, or grater, process your sweet potatoes and jalapeo down into a mince. The food processor works the best here but i've also used a blender with success. You want the potato to be in riced form. I do this before I grind up the chicken in the food processor because it feels cleaner.
  4. After the potatoes and jalapeos have been minced, I add in the green onions and process them down a bit as well. I don't like to do this earlier because I prefer to have some larger pieces of the green onions. If they are added at the same time as the potatoes they get chopped down too small.
  5. In a large bowl, add your minced vegetables, ground chicken, 2 tbsp of oil, 3 tbsp of hot sauce, 1 tbsp of minced garlic, flour, 3 beaten eggs, as well as all of your spices and brown sugar. Mix thoroughly to combine and evenly distribute the ingredients.
  6. Spray a couple of large sheet pans with oil.
  7. Place your meat mixture onto the sheet pan using a cookie scoop, ensuring you have plenty of space between each nugget. Wet your fingers to prevent sticking and lightly press the balls into a disc with your fingers. You don't want to go too thin or else they will be prone to sticking.
  8. You want your nuggets to be about 2 inches in diameter and - inch in thickness. I made 90 total nuggets in this recipe. Depending on how big your cookie scoop is you may have a different yield.
  9. Bake for 8 minutes and then flip and bake an additional 4 minutes.
  10. Cool the nuggets on a wire rimmed baking sheet and repeat this process until all of your meat mixture has been used up. Doubling up on sheet pans in the oven will help you go faster but can lead to less optimal browning. I honestly don't care about this because I reheat in the air fryer and can get plenty of browning this way so I put one sheet pan on each rack of my oven.

Storing

  1. Once the nuggets have cooled, arrange them onto a sheet pan and place them into the freezer, uncovered until they have frozen solid. This will help them not stick together in the bags.
  2. Once they are frozen solid, transfer them to a zip top bag, remove all of the air and keep them in Snack City in your freezer. As long as you protect them from air and freezer burn, they will last for months.

Reheating

  1. I reheat using the air fryer at 400F for about 5 minutes. They just need to thaw and get hot. You can also use the microwave or oven.

Breakfast Burritos

Freezer Friendly Breakfast Burritos made of turkey sausage, eggs, peppers, onion, spinach, and cheese. These can be prepped in advanced and stored into the freezer to give you breakfast each morning in about a minute.

CourseCuisineTime - 1 hour 10 minutes
BreakfastAmerican, meal prepPrep - 30 minutes
Cook - 40 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
349kcal17 burritos
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates39g56%
Fat14g20%
Protein16g23%

Ingredients:

For the Turkey Sausage

  • 1 lb (454 g) ground turkey 93/7
  • 1 tbsp (12 g) brown sugar
  • 1 tsp (6 g) salt
  • 1 tsp (3 g) pepper
  • 1 tsp (3 g) cayenne pepper
  • 1 tsp (3 g) smoked paprika
  • 1 tsp (3 g) onion powder
  • 1 tsp (3 g) garlic powder
  • 1 tsp (1 g) oregano
  • 1 tsp (2 g) rubbed sage
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) oil

For the Burrito Filling

  • 8 large (560 g) eggs
  • 2 tbsp (30 g) milk
  • 1 medium (150 g) green pepper
  • 1 medium (150 g) red pepper
  • 1 medium (200 g) sweet onion
  • 5 oz (140 g) spinach
  • 2 cups (170 g) frozen shredded hash browns
  • 2 tbsp (30 g) oil
  • 1 cup (120 g) shredded cheese
  • 17 9 inch flour tortillas

Instructions:

For the Turkey Sausage

  1. In a large bowl add the turkey and all of the seasonings and brown sugar. Mix thoroughly to incorporate into the meat.
  2. In a large skillet over medium high heat, add 1 tbsp of oil and add in the turkey. Brown it on both sides and cook it until no pink color remains.
  3. Break up the sausage into small pieces and set aside until you are ready for it later.

For the Burrito Filling

  1. While the turkey is cooking, wash and prep all of your vegetables.
  2. Cut the peppers and onion into a small dice and roughly chop the spinach into smaller pieces. Measure out 2 cups of frozen shredded hash browns.
  3. In a large skillet over medium high heat add 1 tbsp of oil and add in the peppers and onions. Allow them to cook down and soften. Season lightly with salt early to help encourage some of the water to be released faster.
  4. Once the onions have begun to turn translucent, add in the hash browns and spinach. Stir to combine and wilt the spinach.
  5. Crack 8 eggs into a bowl, add in 2 tbsp of milk and beat until they are smooth.
  6. You can cook the eggs in the same skillet or in a separate one at the same time as the vegetables cook. If you use the same skillet, create some room in the center to cook the eggs.
  7. Add in 1 tbsp of oil and pour the eggs into the center to make scrambled eggs. Cook them for a few minutes until they have finished.
  8. Once done, remove from the heat and stir in the sausage. Mix and give it a taste test. Adjust flavor with salt and pepper as necessary.
  9. Allow the mixture to cool before you construct the burritos, put it in the fridge for a few minutes if necessary.

Constructing the Burritos

  1. I made 17 burritos out of this recipe using 9 inch tortillas. You may yield more or less.
  2. Measure out 1 cup (120g) of shredded cheese.
  3. Lay out some tortillas on your work space and place a couple of large spoonfuls of the filling on top of each. I used about 70-80g of filling for each burrito.
  4. Add about 1 tbsp of shredded cheese to the top of the filling and roll the burrito up by folding in the sides first, then rolling the center over the top. Repeat until all of your filling is used up.
  5. If you are going to vacuum seal these, place the burritos onto a sheet pan or in a baking dish as you finish them. Flash freeze the burritos by placing them into your freezer, uncovered, for a few hours until they are frozen solid. If you don't plan on vacuum sealing you can just roll them in foil or place them in a zip top bag.
  6. Once the burritos have frozen solid, place them into your vacuum bags and remove the air. Store in your freezer.

Reheating

  1. To reheat, I recommend wrapping the burrito inside of a damp paper towel and microwaving for 60-75 seconds or until it is hot in the center.

HamBULKer Helper

This HamBULKer Helper is a weight gain friendly meal prep with over 1,000 calories per dish to help you easily get in the energy you need to grow muscle. A combination of pasta, beef, potatoes and cheese make up the bulk of the calories but this meal still includes a decent serving of vegetables too.

CourseCuisineTime - 1 hour
Main DishAmerican, meal prepPrep - 30 minutes
Cook - 30 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
1000kcal5 servings
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates94g47%
Fat42g21%
Protein62g31%

Ingredients:

  • 2 lbs (908 g) ground beef 85/15
  • 1 medium (200 g) onion
  • 4 medium (227 g) carrots
  • 4 stalks (112 g) celery
  • 3 medium (500 g) potatoes
  • 12 oz (340 g) elbow pasta gluten free if needed
  • 14.5 oz (411 g) petite diced tomatoes canned
  • 6 oz (170 g) spinach
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) minced garlic
  • 2 cups (480 g) 2% milk
  • 3 cups (720 g) chicken broth
  • 1 cup (112 g) shredded cheddar cheese
  • cup (60 g) grated parmesan cheese
  • cup (68 g) ketchup
  • 1 tbsp (3 g) dried basil
  • 1 tsbp (6 g) paprika
  • salt and pepper to taste

Instructions:

For the Beef

  1. In a large stock pot over medium high heat, add the beef and allow it to brown and the fat to render off.
  2. Once browned, remove it from the pot, keeping all of the fat that was rendered off inside the pot. This will be used to cook the vegetables.

For the Vegetables

  1. While the beef is cooking, wash and cut the onion, carrots, and celery into a small dice of roughly the same size. Grate the garlic. Cut the potatoes into a medium dice of about " cubes. Roughly chop the spinach into smaller pieces.
  2. Once the beef has finished and only the fat remains left in the pot, add in the onions, carrots, celery, and garlic. Season lightly with salt to encourage the water to come out quicker. Allow this to brown and soften for 8-10 minutes.
  3. Once the vegetables have softened, season with 1 each of dried basil and paprika.
  4. Add in the potatoes, 2 cups of milk, 3 cups of chicken broth, 1 can of petite diced tomatoes, the beef and 12oz of elbow pasta.
  5. Bring this mixture to a light boil, stirring occasionally then reduce the heat to low, cover, and cook for 10-15 minutes or until the potatoes have softened and the noodles have finished.
  6. Test the potatoes for doneness by sticking a fork into them. Once they have softened, add in 1 cup of shredded cheddar cheese, cup of grated parmesan cheese, cup of ketchup, and all of the spinach you chopped earlier.
  7. Mix well to incorporate the cheeses and wilt the spinach. Taste test, season with salt and pepper to adjust flavor as needed.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide the mixture of the pot evenly 5 ways.

Orange Creamsicle Baked Oatmeal

Orange Creamsicle Baked Oatmeal. Inspired by one of my favorite summer snacks, this baked oatmeal combines oranges and cream cheese inside a baked oatmeal. There are even some carrots snuck in for some hidden vegetables.

CourseCuisineTime - 55 minutes
BreakfastAmerican, meal prepPrep - 15 minutes
Cook - 40 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
382kcal6
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates49g61%
Fat12g15%
Protein19g23%

Ingredients:

  • 3 cups (240 g) old fashioned oats
  • 2 scoops (60 g) vanilla protein powder
  • 1 tsp (4 g) baking powder
  • 20 oz (300 g) canned mandarin oranges fresh can work as well
  • 1 tbsp (8 g) orange zest
  • 2 medium (150 g) carrots
  • 1 tbsp (14 g) butter
  • 10 tbsp (150 g) liquid egg whites or 2 eggs
  • 1 cups (240 g) 2% milk
  • 1 cup (240 g) orange juice
  • 4 oz (113 g) plain cream cheese
  • 2 tbsp (20 g) sugar
  • 1 tsp (4 g) vanilla

Instructions:

For the Baked Oatmeal

  1. Preheat your oven to 375F.
  2. Wash and grate your carrots into fine pieces using a box grater or a microplane.
  3. Wash one orange and zest it until you have 1 tbsp or 8g of orange zest.
  4. Canned Mandarin Oranges work best for this recipe because they are already peeled. Use two 10oz cans and drain away any of the syrup. I had 300g worth once I did this.
  5. You can also use regular mandarin oranges but they have a "skin" on the outside of each piece that makes them a bit tough. Peel all of your oranges and remove as much of the stringy bits as possbile. Separate the pieces. Removing the translucent "skin" on the outside of each orange piece will give you a softer bite as this can get chewy when baked. Cutting it off with the peel by using a knife is the fastest way to do it.
  6. In a large bowl, mix together the oats, protein powder, and baking powder.
  7. Add in the egg whites, milk, orange juice, 1 tbsp of melted butter, carrots, zest, and orange slices.
  8. Spray a 13"x9" pan with oil and add the oat mixture. You can also line this with parchment for easier clean up.
  9. Mix together the cream cheese, vanilla, and sugar. You can microwave it for a bit to help it soften. Put a few spoonfuls of the cream cheese around your pan and swirl it around as best as you can.
  10. Bake for 35-45 minutes.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 6 servings. Cut the oatmeal into 6 equal pieces.

Chicken Meatballs

Chicken meatballs made from ground chicken, seasonings, and oats instead of breadcrumbs. These meatballs are the perfect addition to Snack City in your freezer. They can be eaten plain, sauced, or used to add in meals. They have been my favorite resident of Snack City lately.

CourseCuisineTime - 1 hour 10 minutes
SnackAmerican, meal prepPrep - 30 minutes
Cook - 40 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
36kcal83 meatballs
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates0.6g10%
Fat1.2g20%
Protein5.6g93%

Ingredients:

  • 5 lbs (2270 g) ground chicken i used 96% lean. You can make this in a food processor if needed
  • 1 cup (80 g) rolled oats
  • 2 (100 g) eggs beaten
  • 1 tbsp (12 g) garlic powder
  • 1 tbsp (12 g) onion powder
  • 1 tsp (10 g) salt
  • 2 tsp (8 g) pepper
  • oil spray

Instructions:

**For the Meatballs **

  1. Preheat your oven to 400F.
  2. If you need grind your chicken, do so. I make ground chicken by placing boneless skinless chicken thighs into the food processor until it resembles ground meat. I do a bunch at once and freeze the excess.
  3. In a large bowl, add your ground chicken, rolled oats, eggs, onion powder, garlic powder, salt, and pepper. Mix it together until everything is fully incorporated.
  4. Line a few large baking sheets with foil in preparation for the meatballs. It may help to spray lightly with oil.
  5. Using a cookie scoop, create meatballs and spread out on to your sheet pans. Space them out evenly with some room between each so that they will brown more easily.
  6. Once you have all of the meatballs created, form them into a tighter ball by tossing each meatball between your hands a few times. It will help to spray your hands with a bit of oil to keep the chicken from sticking.
  7. Roast your meatballs in the oven for 17-20 minutes.
  8. Doing one sheet pan at a time will lead to better browning. If you try to place a pan onto each rack, the one on the top rack will struggle to get brown due to the steam being released from the bottom pan. They will still taste awesome and I do two at once for speed but just be aware that you will sacrifice some browning. When the meatballs are finished, remove from the oven and allow to cool.
  9. Once all of your meatballs have been cooled, transfer them to one single sheet pan and move to your freezer to flash freeze. This just means that you freeze them, uncovered in a single layer, so that they have a chance to freeze individually.
  10. Once they have frozen solid, transfer them over into a ziplock bag, remove all of the air and move them into Snack City in your freezer.
  11. I made 83 meatballs out of this recipe. The nutrition information you see here is for 83 meatballs. If you end up having more or less than that, your nutrition information will be slightly different. Use the table below this recipe to enter how many meatballs you made for the better nutritional estimate.

Serving

  1. To reheat these, I air fry them at 400F for about 5 minutes or until they are hot. You can also microwave them.
  2. I eat them with some ketchup, cover them in buffalo sauce, or incorporate them in a regular meal.

PB and J Baked Oatmeal

PB and J Baked Oatmeal made from a homemade strawberry jelly and peanut butter combined inside of an oatmeal and egg bake. A great breakfast or bedtime snack with a decent dose of protein.

CourseCuisineTime - 1 hour 10 minutes
BreakfastAmerican, meal prepPrep - 10 minutes
Cook - 1 hour

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
376kcal6 servings
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates45g56%
Fat12g15%
Protein22g27%

Ingredients:

  • 3 cups (240 g) old fashioned oats
  • 2 scoops (60 g) vanilla protein powder
  • 1 tsp (4 g) baking powder
  • 3 tbsp (48 g) peanut butter
  • 2 tbsp (42 g) maple syrup
  • 10 tbsp (150 g) liquid egg whites or 2 eggs
  • 2 cups (480 g) milk

For the Strawberry Jelly

  • 1 lb (454 g) frozen strawberries
  • 1 tsp (6 g) splenda or 5-6x sugar/maple syrup
  • 2 tsp (8 g) pectin optional but recommended

For the Peanut Butter Drizzle

  • 2 tbsp (32 g) peanut butter

Instructions:

For the Strawberry Jelly

  1. I usually make a double or triple batch of this and keep it in the fridge for use in other things as well. If you want to give it time to set up a bit you should make it the night before but that isn't required if you are just using it for this baked oatmeal. If you have this prepped in your fridge you can prep this baked oatmeal in 5 minutes.
  2. In a large pot over medium heat, add in your frozen strawberries and allow them to cook down. As they begin to thaw, break them up with a spatula to help them cook faster.
  3. Sprinkle the splenda over the top and bring to a light boil. You can use real sugar or maple syrup if you wish, you will just need to use more of it. Allow it to lightly boil, stirring often so it doesn't stick to the bottom.
  4. After a few minutes, add in the pectin and continue mixing. The pectin is what helps to make it into a jelly. You don't need to add the pectin for use in the baked oatmeal but if you want to use it for a jelly with other things, you should add it.
  5. After it has been lightly boiling for 10-15 minutes you can pull it off the heat and transfer to a storage container. Place it in the fridge to cool as you prep the other ingredients.

For the Baked Oatmeal

  1. Preheat your oven to 350F.
  2. In a large bowl, mix together the oats, protein powder, and baking powder.
  3. Add in the egg whites, milk, syrup, and 3 tbsp of peanut butter. Stir to combine.
  4. Spray a 13"x9" pan with oil and add the oat mixture.
  5. Spoon the jelly over the top and swirl it into the oat mixture using a butter knife.
  6. Bake for 35-40 minutes.

For the Peanut Butter Drizzle

  1. Melt 2 tbsp of peanut butter in the microwave for few seconds until melted.
  2. Add to a small ziplock bag and cut a small hole in the corner. Pipe the peanut butter over the top of the finished baked oatmeal.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 6 servings. Cut the oatmeal into 6 equal pieces.

Firecracker Beef & Brussels

Firecracker Beef & Brussels sprouts served with a side of rice. The firecracker sauce is made using combination of red pepper flakes, hot sauce and honey for a spicy, sweet, and flavor packed bite.

CourseCuisineTime - 40 minutes
Main DishAmerican, meal prepPrep - 15 minutes
Cook - 25 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
620kcal5 servings
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates63g49%
Fat21g16%
Protein44g34%

Ingredients:

For the Rice

  • 3 cups (563 g) cooked rice

For the Beef and Brussels

  • 2 lbs (908 g) ground beef 90/10
  • 1 lb (454 g) Brussels sprouts
  • medium (100 g) onion
  • 2 medium (200 g) poblano peppers
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) minced garlic
  • 1 tbsp (6 g) red pepper flakes
  • 4 stalks (20 g) green onions optional for garnish
  • 1 lime optional for garnish
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) oil

For the Sauce

  • cup (60 g) hot sauce I use Frank's Red Hot
  • 1 tbsp (20 g) apple cider vinegar
  • 5 tbsp (84 g) honey
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) cornstarch
  • water to thin if necessary

Instructions:

For the Rice

  1. Make enough rice to yield3 cups of cooked rice. 1 cup of dry rice will make between 2-3 cups of cooked rice depending on what type of rice you use.

For the Beef & Brussels

  1. Wash and cut all of your vegetables first.
  2. Cut the stems off of your Brussels sprouts and remove any of the damaged outer layers. Cut them in half.
  3. Cut the onion, green onions, and peppers into a small dice. Mince your garlic if you're using fresh.
  4. Place the Brussels sprout halves into a large bowl and drizzle over tbsp of oil. Season with salt and pepper to your liking.
  5. Preheat your air fryer to 400F.
  6. Place the Brussels sprouts into the air fryer basket and air fry for 5-8 minutes or until they have browned and softened. Watch them closely so they don't burn. If you don't have an air fryer you could cook them in the oven.
  7. In a large skillet over medium high heat, add tbsp of oil and add the onions, peppers, and 1 of red pepper flakes. Cook for 3-5 minutes to brown and soften. Add in the garlic.
  8. Move the onions and peppers to the perimeter of the skillet and add in your beef. Season with salt and pepper. Allow the beef to brown.
  9. When the beef is cooking, prepare your sauce. Mix the honey, hot sauce, vinegar, and cornstarch together. Stir well to incorporate the cornstarch so it doesn't clump up.
  10. When the beef is about 90% of the way cooked, add in the Brussels sprouts, pour in the sauce and mix into the beef allowing it to thicken. Stir to combine. If you feel that your sauce is too thick, you can drizzle in some water to thin it out.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide your ingredients evenly into your 5 containers. Each dish gets (112g) cup of cooked rice.
  2. Top each dish with green onions and a lime wedge if you wish. I like to squeeze lime juice over the dish after reheating.

Creamy White Enchilada Chicken & Potatoes

Creamy White Enchilada Chicken with green chilies, vegetables, cheese over the top, and served with a side of potatoes. This dish is a meal prepped version of the midwestern classic Creamy White Chicken Enchiladas that everyone's mom used to make.

CourseCuisineTime - 1 hour 30 minutes
Main DishAmerican, meal prepPrep - 30 minutes
Cook - 1 hour

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
500kcal6 servings
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates44g42%
Fat17g16%
Protein42g40%

Ingredients:

For the Chicken and Vegetable Bake

  • 2 lbs (908 g) boneless skinless chicken breasts
  • salt and pepper to taste
  • medium (100 g) onion
  • 1 medium (150 g) green pepper
  • 1 medium (150 g) red pepper
  • lb (227 g) mushrooms
  • 2 medium (120 g) Roma tomatoes
  • tbsp (8 g) oil
  • salt and pepper to taste
  • cup (84 g) shredded cheese monterrey jack or cheddar
  • 3 tbsp chopped cilantro optional for garnish

For the Sauce

  • 2 tbsp (28 g) butter
  • cup (28 g) flour gluten free if needed
  • 1 cups (360 g) chicken broth
  • cup (120 g) milk i used 2%
  • cup (120 g) plain nonfat Greek yogurt
  • 1 tsp (3 g) onion powder
  • 1 tsp (3 g) garlic powder
  • 8 oz (226 g) canned green chilies
  • salt to taste

For the Potatoes

  • 4 medium (1000 g) russet potatoes
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) oil
  • salt and pepper to taste

Instructions:

  1. Please read through the entire instructions before you begin so you can feel the flow of how this recipe will go and see what you can cook simultaneously. This will save you time.

For the Sauce Part 1

  1. We are going to start by making the sauce as it needs to cool a bit before we finish it later on in the cooking process.
  2. In a medium sized pot or skillet, melt 2 tbsp of butter over medium heat.
  3. Add in the flour and stir together with the butter to form a roux. Mix until completely incorporated.
  4. Slowly drizzle in the chicken broth while constantly stirring and allow to thicken.
  5. Mix in 1 tsp of onion and garlic powder until dissolved. Allow the mixture to come to a light boil and thicken until it resembles a gravy like consistency.
  6. Remove from the heat and allow it to cool. Put it in the fridge to speed up the process.

For the Chicken

  1. Start a large pot of water over high heat. Add in the chicken and boil for 15-20 minutes or until cooked.
  2. You can also use a crockpot to cook this if you start it far enough in advance.
  3. Once the chicken has finished cooking, shred it with two forks in a large bowl (or use a hand mixer). You can do this while your vegetables or sauce is cooking. Season the chicken lightly with salt and pepper.

For the Vegetables

  1. Wash and cut all of your vegetables. Cut the onion, peppers, and tomatoes into a small dice. Cut the mushrooms into thin slices. Cut the potatoes into a large dice.
  2. Add the potatoes to a large bowl and drizzle in 1 tbsp of oil and salt and pepper to your liking. Toss the potatoes to coat.
  3. Cook the potatoes in an air fryer at 400F for 20-25 minutes, shaking the basket a few times during the process. Once they have browned to your liking, they are done, reserve them off to the side until later. If you have a small air fryer it may require you to cook in two batches and it may not take as long each round.
  4. If you don't have an air fryer you can spread the potatoes on a large sheet pan and roast at 450F for 15-20 minutes, flipping just over half way through.
  5. In a large skillet over medium high heat, add tbsp of oil and add in your vegetables, minus the tomatoes. Saut until they have lightly browned and softened. This will likely take between 5-8 minutes. Season with salt and pepper.
  6. Once the vegetables have finished cooking, reserve them off to the side.

For the Sauce Part 2

  1. Once your sauce has cooled toward room temperature, place it back over medium heat and slowly stir in the milk and greek yogurt. We need to bring these up to temperature together otherwise we risk the milk curdling and becoming grainy.
  2. Add in the green chilies and season with salt to taste.

For the Chicken Bake

  1. Turn your oven to the broil setting.
  2. In the large bowl with your shredded chicken, add the vegetables, tomatoes, and pour the sauce over the top. Stir to incorporate.
  3. Place the mixture in a large casserole dish (13"x9") and top with cup of shredded cheese.
  4. Place the dish underneath the broiler in the oven for 5-10 minutes to brown the cheese. Once the cheese has browned, pull it out of the oven. Make sure you watch it closely as it is prone to burning underneath the broiler.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 6 servings. Divide the potatoes evenly between your containers. Cut the chicken in the casserole dish into 6 pieces and add one piece to each container. Garnish with chopped cilantro if you wish.

Deconstructed Big Mac Bowls

Deconstructed Big Mac Bowls, a meal prep version of the fast food classic. Ground beef, potatoes, cabbage and a calorie friendly mac sauce to top it all off.

CourseCuisineTime - 35 minutes
Main DishAmerican, meal prepPrep - 10 minutes
Cook - 25 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
541kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates35g33%
Fat25g24%
Protein44g42%

Ingredients:

For the Hamburger and Cabbage

  • 2 lbs (908 g) ground beef (93/7)
  • medium (100 g) onion
  • 12 oz (340 g) shredded cabbage
  • 1 Tbsp (15 g) olive oil
  • 1 tsp (4 g) garlic powder
  • 15 (50 g) dill pickle chips optional
  • Salt and pepper to taste
  • cup (25 g) shredded cheese

For the Potatoes

  • 4 medium (750 g) russet potatoes
  • 1 Tbsp (15 g) olive oil
  • Salt and pepper

For the Mac Sauce

  • cup (75 g) plain non fat Greek yogurt
  • 2 tbsp (28 g) mayonnaise
  • 1 tbsp (12 g) ketchup
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) sweet relish
  • tsp (2 g) vinegar
  • tsp (2 g) onion powder
  • salt to taste

Instructions:

For the Potatoes

  1. Preheat your oven to 450F.
  2. Wash each of your potatoes thoroughly. Cut them into a medium sized dice.
  3. Add the potatoes to a large bowl and drizzle 1 Tbsp of olive oil over the potatoes. Sprinkle with salt and pepper to your liking. Toss the potatoes to coat and spread onto a sheet pan.
  4. Roast for 10-12 minutes and then toss them around and cook an additional 10-12 minutes or until desired doneness is achieved.

For the Beef

  1. Cut your onion into a small dice.
  2. Heat a large skillet over medium high heat. Add 2 tsp of oil and your diced onion. Cook the onion until it has developed a good amount of browning. We want to bring out the natural sweetness so take it past the point where it is translucent and it has a deep brown color. Adding a bit of water can help speed up this process.
  3. Once the onion has browned, make room in the center of your skillet and add your ground beef. Use a bit more oil if necessary.
  4. Cook the beef until it has browned and season with salt and pepper to taste.

For the Cabbage

  1. Heat 1 tsp of oil over medium heat. Add in the cabbage, 1 tsp garlic powder, and salt to taste.
  2. Cook for about 3-4 minutes. You can add a bit of water to create steam and help it cook faster.

For the Mac Sauce

  1. Add all of the ingredients to a bowl and stir to mix. Divide the sauce into small., separate containers to store.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide your hamburger, potatoes, and cabbage evenly between your 5 containers. Top the hamburger with a bit of shredded cheese and a few pickle chips. Each container gets 1 ramekin of the mac sauce.

Spicy Popcorn Chicken

Boneless skinless chicken breasts cut into pieces and breaded in corn chex cereal, then air fried to make a copycat version of the classic popcorn chicken with only a fraction of the oil.

CourseCuisineTime - 1 hour 30 minutes
SnackAmericanPrep - 30 minutes
Cook - 1 hour

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
191kcal20 servings
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates17g37%
Fat3g6%
Protein25g55%

Ingredients:

  • 5 lbs (2270 g) boneless skinless chicken breast
  • 2 cups (300 g) corn chex ground (or use breadcrumbs)
  • cup (75 g) cornstarch tapioca works as well
  • 2 tsp (6 g) cayenne pepper
  • 2 tsp (6 g) paprika
  • 3 tsp (12 g) salt
  • 2 tsp (6 g) pepper
  • 3 (150 g) eggs
  • cup (60 g) hot sauce
  • (15 g) cooking spray

Instructions:

For the Chicken

  1. Cut the chicken into 1"-1.5" cubes. Season lightly with salt and pepper.
  2. Place the chicken into a large ziplock bag or bowl and sprinkle over the cornstarch. Shake/mix to evenly distribute the starch on all of the chicken.
  3. Place the corn chex into a food processor or blender and blend until they have formed a powder.
  4. Mix together the corn chex, salt, pepper, cayenne pepper and paprika in a shallow dish or a large bowl.
  5. Crack 3 eggs into a bowl and add your hot sauce. Beat the eggs.
  6. Dunk the cornstarch coated chicken into the egg wash and then place into the bag/dish with the corn chex. If you're using the bag method, don't overcrowd the bag. Shake to coat adding more corn chex if needed. Make sure you allow the excess egg wash to drain off of the chicken before you put it into the bag. If there is too much egg on the chicken it can cause the breading to clump together. If this happens, you will probably want to dump it out and start over between rounds of coating. With the dish method you can just do them as you go. Keep one hand for the egg dunk and one hand for the breading, that will keep the corn chex from gunking up on your fingers.
  7. I like to set a sheet pan nearby so that I can place the completed pieces on the pan and ready to air fry.
  8. Preheat your air fryer to 400F (204C) on the air fry setting and set the timer for 10 minutes.
  9. Add the chicken to your air fryer basket in a single layer. Spray the top lightly with oil and air fry at 400F (204C) for 8-10 minutes. Shake the basket half way through. Pull the chicken out when the breading has turned a golden brown color and the chicken is finished cooking. In my air fryer this takes right around 8 minutes.
  10. You will need to cook in batches as to not over crowd your air fryer. Store the finished chicken on a wire lined baking sheet to cool.

Storage

  1. If you are going to vacuum seal this, you need to flash freeze the chicken first. To do this, place the sheet pan into your freezer, uncovered, until all of the chicken has frozen solid. Then you can transfer it over to your vacuum sealed bags. If you don't flash freeze first, all of the chicken will freeze in a block when you take all of the air out.
  2. If you are freezing in a regular ziplock freezer bag, allow your chicken to cool to room temperature and place into a large ziplock bag. Remove as much air as possible and seal. Place into the freezer. You don't need to flash freeze, but it can still be helpful.
  3. To reheat, you can use the microwave or your airfryer. Air fry at 400 until they are hot. It will take around 3-8 minutes. Smaller pieces will heat faster and dry out so be cautious.

Nutrition Information Notes

  1. This recipe calls for 300g of corn chex, 3 eggs, and cooking oil spray. I included all of the chex, eggs, and 15 grams of oil for the cooking process in the nutrition information for the calorie estimate. It is highly likely you will have corn chex and eggs left over so this estimate is probably on the higher end. If you need exact nutrition information, you should measure and calculate it yourself but i wanted to err on the high side.
  2. This recipe makes 20 servings. For me, that was about 8 or 9 pieces of chicken. Depending on how big or small you cut your chicken, that could change. If you weighed the total amount of your cooked chicken, and divided by 20, that would give you the weight of 1 serving.

Chocolate Chip Protein Crescent Rolls

Chocolate Chip Protein Crescent Rolls, a more macro friendly version of the crescent rolls from the tube, these ones are made with a flour mixture and casein protein powder to thicken the dough.

CourseCuisineTime - 25 minutes
DessertAmericanPrep - 20 minutes
Cook - 5 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
296kcal6 rolls
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates40g63%
Fat8g12%
Protein15g23%

Ingredients:

  • 12 g vanilla casein protein powder
  • 20 g oat flour
  • 17.5 g cornstarch
  • 1 g baking powder
  • 40 g milk
  • 15 g egg whites
  • 3 g melted butter
  • 12 g chocolate chips

Instructions:

  1. NOTE: The hydration of this dough is very important. Precise measurements are required. Because of this, I can only recommend making this with metric weights. Get a digital scale.
  2. Mix together the casein, oat flour, cornstarch, baking powder in a bowl until well incorporated.
  3. Add in the egg whites and milk. Mix to form a dough
  4. Place the dough in the fridge/freezer for 10 minutes until it has solidified to a place where it is workable.
  5. Place down two pieces of parchment and spray lightly with oil. Roll the dough into a rectangle about 1/8-1/4 thick.
  6. Clean the edges of the rectangle and make sharp cuts down the sides. Cut the dough into right triangles to form the shapes. Reroll out the scraps and repeat.
  7. Spread melted butter over the top and add the chocolate chips.
  8. Roll the fat end of the triangle over the small end to form the roll.
  9. Place onto a sheet pan/cast iron and bake at 350F for 4-8 minutes. I used the air fryer so it doesnt take as long. The oven will probably take closer to the 8 minute mark. Just watch it and pull them out when browned.
  10. Cream cheese frosting on top is a nice touch as well.

Broccoli Bites

These Broccoli Bites are the most highly palatable form of vegetables I have ever encountered. If you are looking for an easy way to get in more vegetables, this recipe is it. If you have a food processor these can probably be prepared in minutes.

CourseCuisineTime - 35 minutes
Appetizer, SnackAmerican, meal prepPrep - 15 minutes
Cook - 20 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
16kcal48 bites
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates3.2g106%
Fat0.1g3%
Protein0.5g16%

Ingredients:

  • 2 lbs (908 g) frozen broccoli
  • medium (100 g) onion
  • 1 cup (120 g) maseca
  • 3 tsp (12 g) garlic powder
  • 1 tsp (8 g) salt
  • 2 tsp (4 g) pepper
  • cup (60 g) water
  • (10 g) oil spray optional for reheating

Instructions:

For the Broccoli Bites

  1. Thaw out your broccoli in the microwave.
  2. NOTE: If you have a food processor you can probably just add all of the ingredients (minus the oil spray) and pulse it until it forms a "dough".
  3. If you don't have a food processor, pour out all of your broccoli onto a cutting board and chop it as fine as you reasonably can.
  4. Cut your onion into as small of a dice as you can.
  5. In a large bowl, add the broccoli, onion, salt, pepper, garlic powder, and maseca. Mix to combine.
  6. Add in the water and stir to hydrate. Keep moving everything around until the maseca becomes sticky and a dough like consistency starts to form.
  7. Line a large baking sheet (I used 17"x11") with foil or parchment and spread out the broccoli mix. Press it into all sides of the sheet pan to get a dense, thin product.
  8. The thinner you make these the crispier they will get in the air fryer. If your sheet pan is too small and you try to fit the entire mixture on to it, your final bites will probably be too thick. It may be necessary in this case to use two sheet pans. You want about "-" in thickness.
  9. Place the sheet pan into the freezer and allow it to freeze until solid. This will make it a breeze to form into pieces. You would have to do it by hand otherwise which would get messy and time consuming.
  10. You can just form them by hand and air fry immediately if you don't need them for Snack City.
  11. Once frozen solid, remove from the pan and cut into 48 pieces. I achieved this by cutting it into 8 rows and 6 columns.
  12. Transfer the bites to a ziplock bag and store them inside of Snack City in your freezer.

Cooking and Serving

  1. Preheat your air fryer to 400F. Place the frozen broccoli bites into the air fryer. (Spray with oil if you wish). Air fry for 16-20 minutes, flipping half way. Cooking times may vary depending on thickness, just keep an eye on them.
  2. Serve your broccoli bites with a bit of pasta sauce for dipping. Choose your favorited jarred sauce at the store.
  3. Note that the nutrition information doesn't include the pasta sauce, just the broccoli bites.

Dark Chocolate Cherry Baked Oatmeal

Dark Chocolate Cherry Baked Oatmeal made from frozen cherries and dark chocolate chips combined inside of an oatmeal and egg bake. This is a great meal for those weeks you prefer something sweet to have in the morning.

CourseCuisineTime - 50 minutes
BreakfastAmerican, meal prepPrep - 10 minutes
Cook - 40 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
384kcal6
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates56g65%
Fat10g11%
Protein19g22%

Ingredients:

  • 3 cups (240 g) old fashioned oats
  • 2 scoops (60 g) vanilla protein powder
  • 1 tsp (4 g) baking powder
  • 1 lb (450 g) frozen cherries
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) sugar
  • 2 tbsp (42 g) maple syrup
  • 1 tbsp (14 g) butter
  • 10 tbsp (150 g) liquid egg whites or 2 eggs
  • 2 cups (480 g) milk
  • 2 tbsp (28 g) dark chocolate chips

For the Chocolate Drizzle

  • 1 tbsp (14 g) dark chocolate chips
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) milk

Instructions:

For the Baked Oatmeal

  1. Preheat your oven to 375F.
  2. If your cherries are whole, cut them into halves or quarters. Sprinkle 1 tbsp of sugar over the top of the cherries and allow them to macerate.
  3. In a large bowl, mix together the oats, protein powder, and baking powder.
  4. Add in the egg whites, milk, syrup, 1 tbsp of melted butter, 2 tbsp of the chocolate chips, and the cherries. If you get the big dark chocolate chips you should cut them up a bit so you get more coverage.
  5. Spray a 13"x9" pan with oil and add the oat mixture.
  6. Bake for 35-40 minutes.

For the Chocolate Drizzle

  1. Melt 1 tbsp of the dark chocolate chips and 1 tsp or so of milk in the microwave for few seconds until they melt. Stir to combine and continue to thin with milk until you get a consistency that will allow you to pipe over the top.
  2. Add the chocolate to a small ziplock bag and cut a small hole in the corner. Pipe the chocolate over the top of the baked oatmeal.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 6 servings. Cut the oatmeal into 6 equal pieces.

Ham and Bean Soup

Ham and Bean Soup made up of ham, shredded chicken, white beans, potatoes, and vegetables. A great option to add to your soup rotation for the winter. Soups are great options for meal prep if you don't have to travel with your meals because they keep the best in the fridge over the week.

CourseCuisineTime - 1 hour 1 hour 1 hour
Main Course, SoupAmerican, meal prepPrep - 15 minutes 15 minutes 15 minutes
Cook - 45 minutes 45 minutes 45 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
635kcal5 servings
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates67g47%
Fat13g9%
Protein62g43%

Ingredients:

For the Soup

  • 1 lbs (568 g) ham steak
  • 1 lb (454 g) boneless skinless chicken breasts
  • 4 medium (1000 g) potatoes
  • 2 medium (200 g) carrots
  • 3 stalks (200 g) celery
  • 1 medium (200 g) onion
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) garlic minced
  • 2 tbsp (30 g) oil
  • 1 can (878 g) great northern beans
  • 4 cups (946 g) chicken broth
  • 3 cups (720 g) water
  • 1 tsp (4 g) granulated chicken bouillon
  • salt and pepper to taste

Instructions:

For the Soup

  1. Wash and cut your vegetables. Cut the onion, carrots, and celery into a small dice. Cut the potatoes into a large dice. Cut the kale away from the stems and roughly chop. Massage the kale by squeezing the leaves a bit.
  2. Into a large pot, add 2 tbsp of oil over medium high heat.
  3. Add your garlic, onions, celery, and carrots. Season lightly with salt and allow them to brown for a few minutes.
  4. While the vegetables are cooking, cut your ham steak into a large dice.
  5. Once the vegetables have softened and developed color, add in the ham, chicken and the potatoes to the pot. Pour in the chicken broth and water.
  6. Rinse and drain the beans and add them to the pot.
  7. Cover the pot and bring it to a boil. Once boiling you can reduce the heat to low and cook for about 15 minutes.
  8. After 15 minutes, pull out the chicken and shred with two forks or a mixer. Season the shredded chicken with salt and pepper.
  9. Add in the kale to the pot while you shred the chicken.
  10. Add the shredded chicken and 1 tsp of granulated chicken bouillon to the pot and stir.
  11. Taste the broth to test for seasoning and adjust with salt and pepper to taste. The ham is quite salty so it make sure you test first before adding any salt.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 4 servings. Divide your soup evenly into 4 containers and allow to cool before you store in your fridge.
  2. NOTE: A nice addition to the top of this soup after you reheat it is some chili garlic oil. The extra fat mixes with the broth for lots of flavor and heat.

Italian Beef and Rice

Italian Beef and Rice, a meal prep friendly version of the Italian Beef Sandwich. Ground beef mixed with tangy Italian dressing and pepperoncinis served with jammy sweet onions and red bell peppers. Top it with a slice of provolone cheese for even more richness.

CourseCuisineTime - 40 minutes 40 minutes 40 minutes
Main DishAmerican, meal prepPrep - 10 minutes 10 minutes 10 minutes
Cook - 30 minutes 30 minutes 30 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
774kcal5 servings
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates51g36%
Fat42g30%
Protein47g33%

Ingredients:

For the Rice

  • 5 cups (750 g) cooked rice

For the Beef

  • 2 lbs (1135 g) ground beef (85/15)
  • 7 tbsp (105 g) Italian salad dressing buy your favorite bottled dressing
  • 1 cup (120 g) sliced pepperoncinis
  • salt and pepper to taste

For the Peppers and Onions

  • 2 small (300 g) sweet onions
  • 2 medium (300 g) red bell peppers
  • salt and pepper to taste

Instructions:

For the Rice

  1. Cook enough rice to have5cups of cooked rice. 1 cup of dry rice will yield about 2-3 cups of cooked rice depending on what kind you use.

For the Beef

  1. In a large skillet over medium high heat, add the ground beef and brown it. Wash and cut your vegetables while the beef is cooking. To save on using oil, we are going to use the grease released by the beef to cook the vegetables.
  2. Once the beef has browned, drain away the fat and reserve for the vegetables.
  3. Mix in 7 tbsp of Italian dressing and 1 cup of sliced pepperocinis. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

For the Peppers and Onions

  1. Wash and cut your peppers and onions into thin slices. Try and cut the peppers to roughly " in thickness.
  2. In a large skillet over medium high heat, add in some of the grease from the ground beef. FYI, you don't have to wait until the beef has finished cooking to take this from the pan. You can spoon out the grease as it is produced so that you can cook the beef and vegetables simultaneously to save time.
  3. Add in the peppers and onions and salt lightly. Cook the peppers and onions for 10-15 minutes until the onions have deeply caramelized and the peppers are very soft. Make sure you stir frequently to ensure they don't burn.
  4. Adding a small amount of water to the pan can help to cook these faster through steam.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Each dish gets 1 cup of cooked rice and you can divide your remaining ingredients evenly between your 5 containers.

Honey BBQ Chicken with Potato Wedges

Honey BBQ chicken thighs baked and broiled to create some awesome Maillard browning. Served with a side of roasted broccoli and cajun seasoned potato wedges.

CourseCuisineTime - 50 minutes 50 minutes 50 minutes
Main DishAmerican, meal prepPrep - 15 minutes 15 minutes 15 minutes
Cook - 35 minutes 35 minutes 35 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
661kcal5 servings
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates57g40%
Fat27g19%
Protein58g40%

Ingredients:

For the Broccoli

  • 1 lbs (680 g) broccoli
  • 2 tbsp (30 g) oil
  • salt and pepper

For the Potatoes

  • 5 large (1500 g) russet potatoes
  • 1 tbsp (30 g) oil
  • 2 tsp (6 g) garlic powder
  • 2 tsp (6 g) paprika
  • 1 tsp (8 g) chili powder
  • salt and pepper to taste

For the Chicken

  • 2 lbs (1135 g) boneless skinless chicken thighs
  • cup (120 g) BBQ sauce vinegar based is preferred
  • 2 tbsp (42 g) honey
  • salt and pepper to taste

Instructions:

Recipe Note

  1. I use my air fryer to cook the potatoes and the oven to cook the broccoli and chicken. If you need to use the oven to cook all 3 components you will want to prepare accordingly to work quickly and to ensure you have the space in the oven.

For the Broccoli

  1. Preheat your oven to 425 F.
  2. Wash and cut your broccoli into florets. I buy the precut stuff to make it easier and faster.
  3. Toss the broccoli in 2 tbsp of oil and salt and pepper to taste.
  4. Spread the broccoli out on a sheet pan and roast for 8-10 minutes then remove from the oven and turn. Roast another 5-8 minutes or until the broccoli has nice color to it.

For the Potatoes

  1. Wash and cut your potatoes into small wedges.
  2. Toss the potatoes in a bowl with 2 tbsp of oil and the chili powder, garlic powder, paprika, salt and pepper.
  3. For the air fryer, air fry the potatoes at 400F for 10-12 minutes, shaking the basket half way through. You will likely have to do two batches to prevent overcrowding.
  4. For the oven, spread the potatoes out on a sheet pan and roast at 425F for about 15 minutes, flipping about 10 minutes in. If you cook them at the same time as the broccoli it may require more time to get brown due to the amount of moisture in the oven.

For the Chicken

  1. Mix together the BBQ sauce and the honey. Reserve about of the mixture.
  2. Lightly season the chicken with salt and pepper and coat with of the BBQ sauce mixture.
  3. Place on a sheet pan and bake at 425F for 12 minutes.
  4. Remove the chicken from the oven and cut into 1" pieces. Turn your oven to broil.
  5. Add the chicken back to the pan and cover with the remaining BBQ sauce.
  6. Add the chicken to the top rack of your oven and broil for about 5 minutes or until it has developed good browning throughout. Watch it closely as it will be prone to burn. Check on the chicken every minute or so and stir when needed.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide your ingredients evenly 5 ways.

Chili Mac

Chili Mac, a one pot meal that can be finished in under an hour. Made from ground beef, a variety of vegetables, and macaroni noodles in a tomato sauce.

CourseCuisineTime - 45 minutes 45 minutes
Main DishAmerican, meal prepPrep - 15 minutes 15 minutes
Cook - 30 minutes 30 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
488kcal7 servings
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates44g44%
Fat19g19%
Protein36g36%

Ingredients:

For the Chili Mac

  • 2 lbs (908 g) ground turkey (93/7)
  • 1 medium (200 g) onion
  • lb (227 g) carrots
  • lb (227 g) mushrooms
  • 6 oz (170 g) spinach
  • 1 medium (150 g) poblano pepper
  • 1 small (15 g) jalapeo optional
  • 15 oz (425 g) crushed tomatoes
  • 14.5 oz (411 g) petite diced tomatoes
  • 8 oz (227 g) macaroni noodles gluten free if needed
  • 3 tbsp (24 g) chili powder
  • 2 tbsp (10 g) cumin
  • cup (56 g) shredded cheese
  • 1 cups (400 g) milk any kind works
  • 2 tbsp (30 g) oil
  • salt and pepper to taste

Instructions:

For the Chili Mac

  1. Wash and cut all of your vegetables. Cut the onion, jalapeo, and poblano pepper into a small dice. Cut the mushrooms into thin slices. Use a vegetable peeler to create ribbons with the carrots and then cut into smaller pieces. Roughly chop the spinach into smaller pieces.
  2. In a large stock pot, add a bit of oil over medium high heat. Add in the onions and peppers, salt lightly.
  3. After a couple of minutes add in the mushrooms and carrots. Cook for a couple of minutes.
  4. Push the vegetables to the perimeter and make room in the bottom of the pot and add in the meat. Allow it to brown and cook throughout.
  5. Once the meat has cooked, add in the petite diced tomatoes, crushed tomatoes, milk, macaroni, chili powder, and cumin. Stir the mixture and bring to a light boil.
  6. Once boiling, reduce the heat to low and cover. Cook for the allotted time on your macaroni's packaging.
  7. After the timer on the macaroni has expired, remove the lid and test a noodle to ensure it has cooked to at least al dente. Add in the spinach and cheese and stir. If the mixture is still quite soupy, allow it to cook uncovered to boil off some of the water.
  8. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 7 servings. Divide your ingredients evenly between your 7 containers.

Sloppy Joe Sweet Potato Skillet

Ground beef, a variety of vegetables, and sweet potatoes cooked together in a spicy sloppy joe adjacent tomato sauce and topped with mozzarella cheese. Loads of flavor and nutrients in this meal.

CourseCuisineTime - 45 minutes 45 minutes 45 minutes
Main DishAmerican, meal prepPrep - 15 minutes 15 minutes 15 minutes
Cook - 30 minutes 30 minutes 30 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
671kcal5 servings
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates56g42%
Fat29g21%
Protein47g35%

Ingredients:

For the Sweet Potatoes

  • 3 medium (900 g) sweet potatoes
  • 1 tbsp (23 g) oil

For the Vegetables

  • 2 medium (400 g) zucchini
  • 1 medium (200 g) sweet onion
  • 1 medium (150 g) green pepper
  • 1 medium (150 g) red pepper
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) oil
  • salt and pepper to taste

For the Meat Sauce

  • 2 lbs (908 g) ground beef (90/10)
  • 14.5 oz (283 g) petite diced tomatoes 1 can
  • 6 oz (170 g) tomato paste
  • 3 tbsp (45 g) ketchup
  • 2 tbsp (30 g) mustard
  • 2 tsp (10 g) Worcestershire sauce
  • 2 tsp (6 g) red pepper flakes
  • 1 tbsp (8 g) onion powder
  • cup (56 g) mozzarella cheese
  • salt and pepper to taste
  • parsley optional for garnish

Instructions:

For the Sweet Potatoes

  1. Preheat your oven to 450F.
  2. Wash and cut your sweet potatoes into a small to medium dice. Toss in 1 tbsp of oil and a bit of salt and pepper.
  3. Roast for 10 minutes, remove from oven and turn the potatoes. Cook for an additional 5 minutes or until browned.

For the Vegetables

  1. Wash and cut all of your vegetables. Cut the onion into a small dice, and the peppers and zucchini into a large dice.
  2. In a large skillet over medium high heat, add some oil and cook the onions first for about 3-5 minutes or until they have started to brown.
  3. Make some room in the center of your pan and add the peppers. Season lightly with salt to help draw out the water. Cook for a few minutes to soften and brown the peppers.
  4. Make room in the pan again and add the zucchini, add oil as needed. Cook until the zucchini has browned and softened. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

For the Meat Sauce

  1. If you want to go faster you can cook this at the same time as your vegetables.
  2. In a large skillet or pot, brown the ground beef over medium high heat. Season lightly with salt and pepper.
  3. Once the beef has finished, add in the tomatoes, tomato paste, ketchup, mustard, Worcestershire, onion powder, and red pepper flakes. If you like your food spicy, add more pepper flakes. The amount in this recipe is enough for even the spice haters to handle. If you like spicy, at least double it.
  4. Turn the heat down to medium and allow the tomatoes to cook out a bit, about 5-10 minutes.
  5. Add in the sweet potatoes and vegetables to the meat sauce. Stir and season with salt and pepper to taste.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide your ingredients evenly between 5 containers. Top each dish with cheese and chopped parsley for garnish.

Tater Tots

Tater Tots made from frozen shredded hash browns and air fried for an awesome, crispy, addicting treat to add to Snack City inside of your freezer. These tots are formed using a cookie scoop to make formation of the tots a breeze.

CourseCuisineTime - 35 minutes
SnackAmerican, meal prepPrep - 20 minutes
Cook - 15 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
22kcal49 tots
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates4.7g117%
Fat0.2g5%
Protein0.3g7%

Ingredients:

  • 2 lbs (1135 g) frozen shredded hash browns
  • cup (40 g) cornstarch
  • 4 tsp (16 g) seasoned salt
  • (10 g) oil spray

Instructions:

For the Tater Tots

  1. Place all of your frozen, shredded hash browns in a microwave safe dish. Microwave them for a minute or two until they are thawed. They don't need to be hot here, we just want them to be malleable and easy to cut.
  2. Spread out all of your potatoes on a large cutting board. Cut the hash browns into a small dice by passing a knife through them a few times. We don't need perfect cuts, just shoot for a small dice.
  3. In a large bowl, add the potatoes, cornstarch, and seasoned salt. You can use regular salt if you don't have seasoned salt. I would only use 3 tsp if you do.
  4. Mix the potatoes until all of the ingredients have been incorporated.
  5. Using a standard sized cookie scoop, pack the scoop with potatoes and press them into the scoop using your thumb. Release the tots onto a sheet pan and continue this process until the potatoes are gone.

Cooking and Storing the Tater Tots

  1. Once you have formed all of the tater tots you can either cook them at this step or place them straight into the freezer. It makes no difference.
  2. If you choose to freeze at this step, place the sheet pan into the freezer and allow the tots to flash freeze until frozen solid then transfer into a ziplock bag, remove as much air as possible, and place into the freezer.
  3. To cook the tots, preheat your air fryer to 400F. Place the tater tots, straight from the freezer, into your air fryer and spray the tops lightly with oil. Cook for 12-15 minutes or until they have achieved your preferred level of browning.
  4. I got 49 tots out of this recipe with a standard sized cookie scoop that I packed level with the top. If your yield is greater or less, you will want to reference the table below to update the nutritional estimates.

Buffalo Chicken Pasta

Buffalo Chicken Pasta made with a combination of penne, chicken breast, vegetables and sauced with a cream cheese and buffalo sauce mixture. This pasta is an awesome dish for meal prepping.

CourseCuisineTime - 45 minutes 45 minutes 45 minutes
Main DishAmerican, meal prepPrep - 15 minutes 15 minutes 15 minutes
Cook - 30 minutes 30 minutes 30 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
814kcal5 servings
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates95g55%
Fat26g15%
Protein49g28%

Ingredients:

For the Chicken

  • 2 lbs (908 g) boneless skinless chicken breast
  • 1 tsp (3 g) onion powder
  • 1 tsp (3 g) garlic powder
  • salt and pepper to taste

For the Pasta

  • 18 oz (510 g) penne pasta gluten free if needed
  • 1 medium (200 g) onion
  • 6 oz (170 g) spinach
  • 1 cups (150 g) matchstick carrots
  • 10 oz (283 g) riced cauliflower frozen, florets are fine if you don't have riced
  • 6 tbsp (90 g) buffalo sauce
  • 8 oz (227 g) cream cheese
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) oil
  • salt and pepper to taste

Instructions:

For the Pasta

  1. In the large pot with the drained noodles, add in the cream cheese, vegetables, buffalo sauce, and chopped chicken. Lightly stir everything together to incorporate and melt the cream cheese. Taste test and season with salt and pepper as needed.

For the Chicken

  1. Cut and/or pound the chicken breast until they are all of even thickness, ideally around -1 inch in thickness.
  2. Season the chicken with garlic powder, onion powder, and lightly with salt and pepper.
  3. Cook the chicken in your air fryer at 400F for 7-10 minutes, flipping half way through. The chicken is done when it has reached 165F internally. You do not want to overcook it.
  4. If you do not have an air fryer you can pan fry, grill, or bake the chicken.
  5. Cut the chicken into 1" pieces and set aside.

For the Vegetables

  1. If you are using frozen riced cauliflower, thaw it out in the microwave and drain the water out of the bag.
  2. Cut the onion and matchstick carrots into a small dice and roughly chop the spinach.
  3. Heat a large skillet over medium high heat and add some oil. Add in the onions and carrots and cook for 3-5 minutes or until they have begun to brown and soften. Salt lightly.
  4. Add in the riced cauliflower and spinach, salt lightly, and cook until the spinach has wilted.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide the pasta evenly between your 5 containers.

Spicy Chicken Sandwich

An air fried Spicy Chicken Sandwich made with chicken breast, mayo, tomatoes and pickles. Serve it on a bun, eat it without, or on a lettuce wrap, all are awesome choices.

CourseCuisineTime - 1 hour
Main Dish, SnackAmericanPrep - 30 minutes
Cook - 30 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
492kcal8 pieces
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates41.5g41%
Fat16.8g16%
Protein43.7g43%

Ingredients:

For the Chicken

  • 3 lbs (1362 g) boneless skinless chicken breast
  • 1 cups (125 g) ground corn chex
  • 1 tsp (4 g) onion powder
  • 1 tsp (4 g) garlic powder
  • 1 tsp (4 g) paprika
  • 1 tsp (6 g) cayenne pepper
  • salt and pepper to taste
  • 2 eggs
  • 3 tbsp (45 g) hot sauce
  • (8 g) oil spray

For the Toppings

  • 8 (408 g) hamburger buns
  • 2 tbsp (28 g) butter
  • 8 tbsp (104 g) mayo
  • 2 large (454 g) tomatoes
  • cup (227 g) hamburger pickle chips
  • 1 head (300 g) romaine lettuce

Instructions:

FYI

  1. These chicken cutlets can be prepped ahead of time and frozen if you wish. If you do that you will only be minutes away from a nice sandwich whenever you please. I would recommend doing this.

For the Chicken

  1. When I made this recipe, I had 4 chicken breasts to total 3lbs. That made for an easy division into 8 pieces. If you have bigger or smaller breasts you may need to get creative with your cutting. You want 8 pieces of equal weight.
  2. Cut your chicken breasts into 8 equally weighted pieces.
  3. Lay some plastic wrap over the chicken and pound each piece until they are around " in thickness and shaped like a piece of chicken that would go on a sandwich. Season each side with salt and pepper.
  4. Crack two eggs into bowl with 3 tbsp of hot sauce and beat to combine.
  5. For the breading I use ground corn chex. To make this I put corn chex cereal into the blender until it is a powder. You can use whatever you like, within reason, as a breading. I just prefer the corn chex.
  6. Mix the ground corn chex with onion powder, garlic powder, paprika, and cayenne pepper. If you like your food spicy, add more cayenne to taste.
  7. To bread each piece of chicken, dunk the chicken pieces into the egg wash and then into the breading mixture.
  8. Preheat your air fryer to 400F and cook the chicken for 4-5 minutes on each side. Spray with top side with oil when you put the chicken in and after you flip each piece.

For the Bread and Toppings

  1. Toast your buns by spreading a light layer of butter over the top and placing down in a hot skillet for a couple of minutes.
  2. Wash and cut your tomatoes into thin slices.
  3. Wash and dry your romaine lettuce leaves.

Construction

  1. Each sandwich gets 1 piece of chicken, 1-2 tomato slices, a piece of lettuce, pickles, and mayo spread on the bun.

Storage

  1. You can either store extra chicken in the fridge for up to 5 days or you can place the extra chicken in a ziplock bag, remove the air, and freeze. They will be good in the freezer as long as they don't develop freezer burn. Reheat in the air fryer until they are hot and ready to eat.

Nutrition Information

  1. The recipe calls for 125 grams of ground corn chex so it is easier to bread the meat. You will likely have some left over if you made 8 pieces of chicken. I have included 100 grams of corn chex in the nutrition estimates to account for the excess that wasn't included.
  2. The nutritional estimates for just the chicken, not the sandwich are 232 Calories, 11.5g C | 38.6g P | 4g F.

Apple and Greek Yogurt

This is one of my go to snacks. It is quick, easy, and has a decent amount of protein for a snack from the Greek yogurt. I use splenda for my sweetener, you can use whatever you like.

CourseCuisineTime - 5 minutes
SnackAmericanPrep - 5 minutes
Cook - 0 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
250kcal1
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates34.7g65%
Fat5.9g11%
Protein14.4g27%

Ingredients:

  • 1 medium (120 g) apple
  • cup (150 g) plain non fat Greek yogurt
  • tsp (2 g) splenda
  • 1 tbsp (20 g) mini chocolate chips

Instructions:

For the Apple

  1. Wash and cut the apple into slices.
  2. Mix the splenda into the Greek yogurt and plate with the apple.
  3. Add the chocolate chips to the bowl.

Air Fryer Buffalo Boneless Chicken Wings

Air Fryer Buffalo Boneless Wings made using the popcorn chicken recipe. If you keep the popcorn chicken in Snack City in your freezer, these boneless wings are only a quick air fry away.

CourseCuisineTime - 10 minutes
Appetizer, SnackAmericanPrep - 5 minutes
Cook - 8 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
294kcal1 serving
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates24g34%
Fat41g59%
Protein4g5%

Ingredients:

For the Chicken

  • 15-20 pieces (227 g) popcorn chicken

For the Sauce

  • 2 tbsp (37 g) buffalo sauce

Instructions:

For the Wings

  1. This recipe uses the Popcorn Chicken recipe that you should have in Snack City in your freezer at all times. If you do, all you need to do for cooking is to pull them from the freezer and reheat in your airfryer. I put them in at 400F for a few minutes until they are hot.
  2. If you don't have the popcorn chicken made, here is the recipe: Popcorn Chicken
  3. Add the sauce and chicken to a large bowl and toss to coat.

Serving

  1. This recipe makes 1 serving. If you wanted to use it for a meal, serve it with a side of rice and a vegetable.

Maple Sriracha Boneless Chicken Wings

Maple Sriracha Boneless Wings made using the popcorn chicken recipe. If you keep the popcorn chicken in Snack City in your freezer, these boneless wings are only a quick air fry away. Pair with some rice and a vegetable and you've got a nice meal.

CourseCuisineTime - 10 minutes
Appetizer, SnackAmericanPrep - 5 minutes
Cook - 8 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
378kcal1 serving
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates45.1g50%
Fat3.6g4%
Protein41.3g46%

Ingredients:

For the Chicken

  • 15-20 pieces (227 g) popcorn chicken

For the Sauce

  • 2 tbsp (30 g) maple syrup
  • 2 tsp (10 g) sriracha

Instructions:

For the Wings

  1. This recipe uses the Popcorn Chicken recipe that you should have in Snack City in your freezer at all times. If you do, all you need to do for cooking is to pull them from the freezer and reheat in your airfryer. I put them in at 400F for a few minutes until they are hot.
  2. If you don't have the popcorn chicken made, here is the recipe: Popcorn Chicken
  3. To make the sauce, mix the syrup and sriracha together in a large bowl. Add in the chicken and toss to coat.

Serving

  1. This recipe makes 1 serving. If you wanted to use it for a meal, serve it with a side of rice and a vegetable.

Stewed Pork and Beans

Stewed Pork and Beans made using ham, pork, sausage, and black beans. This recipe was inspired by the Brazilian dish Feijoada but I adapted it to make it a bit more meal prep friendly. The traditional dish is made using many parts of the pig and calabresa sausage which is not easy to find in the States.

CourseCuisineTime - 1 hour
Main DishAmerican, Brazilian, meal prepPrep - 15 minutes
Cook - 45 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
548kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates46g41%
Fat21g18%
Protein44g39%

Ingredients:

For the Stew

  • 14 oz (397 g) smoked turkey sausage
  • lb (227 g) ham steak
  • lb (227 g) pork ribeye
  • 1 can (425 g) black beans 15oz
  • 1 medium (200 g) sweet onion
  • 1 cup (240 g) chicken broth
  • 1 cup (240 g) water
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) oil
  • 1 tbsp (8 g) cornstarch if needed for thickening
  • Salt and pepper to taste

For the Rice

  • 2 cups (375 g) cooked rice

For the Collard Greens

  • 14 oz (397 g) frozen collard greens fresh is fine, frozen is just easier to find
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) oil
  • 1 tsp (3 g) garlic powder
  • salt and pepper to taste

Instructions:

For the Rice

  1. Cook enough rice to have 2 cups of cooked rice. 1 cup of dry rice will yield about 2-3 cups of cooked rice depending on what kind you use.

For the Stew

  1. Cut your onion into a small dice and saut in oil over medium high heat until it has begun to develop color and soften.
  2. While the onion is cooking you can cut your pork and ham into a large dice. Cut the sausage into rings on a bias.
  3. Once the onions have developed color, add in the pork ribeye and allow to develop color on all sides, then add in the ham and sausage and do the same.
  4. Pour in the chicken broth, water, and black beans. Reduce the heat to low, cover with a lid and allow to cook for 15-20 minutes.
  5. After the 20 minutes if your mixture is still quite liquidy, you can remove the lid and boil off some of the water to thicken it or you can make a cornstarch slurry by mixing equal parts of cornstarch and cold water. Stir that into the mixture to thicken.
  6. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

For the Collard Greens

  1. The Brazilian dish Feijoada is traditionally served with a collard green like vegetable. Many of you know that I despise leafy greens. Collard greens are no different. I put them in this recipe for variation from my normal vegetables I use and for tradition. If you don't like collard greens, swap them out for anything else.
  2. If you're using frozen collard greens, thaw them out in the microwave according to the packaging. Drain as much of the water away as possible.
