  3. In a pan over medium heat, add some oil and saut the collard greens. Cook for a few minutes and season with salt, pepper, and garlic powder.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide your ingredients evenly between the 5 containers. Each dish gets cup of rice.

Sweets and Sausage Skillet

Chicken sausage, sweet potatoes, onions, peppers, and green beans roasted together for a quick and easy meal prep dish. This meal is packed with flavor from the sausage and is an easy way to get a big serving of vegetables.

CourseCuisineTime - 45 minutes
Main DishAmerican, meal prepPrep - 20 minutes
Cook - 25 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
467kcal6
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates51g54%
Fat19g20%
Protein23g24%

Ingredients:

  • 28 oz (794 g) chicken sausage
  • 4 medium (1000 g) sweet potatoes
  • 1 medium (200 g) sweet onion
  • 2 medium (300 g) red peppers
  • 12 oz (340 g) frozen cut green beans
  • 2 tbsp (30 g) oil
  • salt and pepper to taste

Instructions:

For the Skillet

  1. Preheat your oven to 425F.
  2. Wash and cut your onion, sweet potatoes, and peppers into a medium dice. Cut your sausage into thin slices on a bias.
  3. In a large bowl, add the onion and sweet potatoes. Toss in 2 tbsp of oil.
  4. Spread the onions and potatoes out on a large sheet pan. Bake for 12-14 minutes, remove from the oven and turn. Cook an additional 12-14 minutes or until you are happy with the browning on the potatoes.
  5. Place the sausage and peppers on another sheet pan. Try to get the sausage to lay flat on the pan as this will allow it to brown. Add to the oven and cook for 8-10 minutes then flip and cook an additional 5-8 or until the sausage has browned.
  6. Cook the green beans in the microwave according to the packaging. Drain as much water from them as possible after cooking.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 6 servings. Divide your ingredients evenly into your 6 containers.

Huli Huli Chicken

Chicken thighs marinated in a sweet, tangy sauce and broiled in the oven. Served with the chicken is a side of rice as well as a zucchini and pineapple mixture.

CourseCuisineTime - 1 hour 15 minutes 1 hour 15 minutes 1 hour 15 minutes
Main DishAmerican, meal prepPrep - 15 minutes 15 minutes 15 minutes
Cook - 30 minutes 30 minutes 30 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
602kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates64g49%
Fat16g12%
Protein50g38%

Ingredients:

For the Chicken

  • 2 lbs (1135 g) boneless skinless chicken thighs
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) oil
  • cup (48 g) brown sugar
  • 3 tbsp (45 g) soy sauce
  • 2 tbsp (30 g) rice vinegar
  • 2 tsp (10 g) Worcestershire sauce
  • 2 tsp (10 g) minced garlic
  • 2 tsp (10 g) minced ginger
  • 2 tbsp (30 g) ketchup
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) water
  • salt and pepper to taste
  • sesame seeds optional

For the Rice

  • 5 cups (750 g) cooked rice

For the Vegetables

  • 2 medium (400 g) zucchini
  • 1 cups (283 g) pineapple frozen is fine
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) oil

Instructions:

For the Rice

  1. Cook enough rice to have 5 cups of cooked rice. 1 cup of dry rice will make around 2-3 cups of cooked rice depending on what kind of rice you use.

For the Chicken

  1. In a large bowl, mix together the brown sugar, oil, soy sauce, vinegar, ketchup, water, Worcestershire, garlic and ginger. Stir to combine and reserve about cup of the sauce for later.
  2. Place the chicken into the bowl and mix it around to coat. Allow it to marinate in the fridge for at least 30 minutes.
  3. Preheat your oven to 425F. Once the chicken has had time to marinate, place it on a sheet pan and bake for 10 minutes.
  4. After 10 minutes, remove from the oven and turn the oven to broil. Cut the chicken into 1 inch pieces and coat with the sauce that you reserved earlier. Mix to cover.
  5. Place the chicken back into the oven on the top rack and watch carefully to ensure it doesn't burn sometimes leaving a little crack in the oven door can help. Broiling the meat will help to promote better browning and flavor.

For the Vegetables

  1. Thaw your pineapple in the microwave if you use frozen.
  2. Wash and cut your zucchini into a medium dice.
  3. In a large skillet over medium high heat, add some oil and saut the zucchini until browned. Salting it early can help it cook faster.
  4. Once browned, add in the pineapple and salt to taste.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide your ingredients evenly into your 5 containers. Each dish gets 1 cup of rice.

Air Fryer Crinkle Cut Fries

Crinkle Cut Fries to add to Snack City. These fries are cooked in the air fryer and require no oil to prepare making them the perfect macro friendly addition to Snack City.

CourseCuisineTime - 40 minutes
SnackAmerican, meal prepPrep - 30 minutes
Cook - 10 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
120kcal15
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates27g90%
Fat0g0%
Protein3g10%

Ingredients:

  • 5 lbs russet potatoes
  • salt to taste

Instructions:

For Snack City

  1. Wash and cut all of your potatoes into fry shape using your crinkle cutter. Obviously you can use a knife if you want but the crinkle cutter makes for a better result in the fryer because there is more surface area to get crispy. I've linked the crinkle cutter I use above, it's only $8.
  2. Add your potatoes to a bowl of salted water. You don't need to go crazy with the salt here, just throw some in. Allow the potatoes to soak at least 20 minutes.
  3. Drain the water from the potatoes and spread out onto a couple of paper towel lined sheet pans. Pat the potatoes dry and salt lightly. Remove the paper towels and make sure the potatoes are in a single layer. Add to the freezer on the pans and allow to flash freeze until frozen solid. This is important for proper storage so the potatoes don't stick together when you put them in the bag.
  4. Once frozen, transfer the potatoes into a ziplock bag and you can store them inside of Snack City in your freezer.

Cooking the Fries

  1. To cook the fries I preheat the air fryer to 400F and add the frozen fries for 10-12 minutes depending on how many I am making.
  2. Shake the basket around once or twice during the cooking process and pull them out when they have reached your preferred doneness level. I find I don't need to use any oil but if you wanted to spray the top with oil during the cooking, have away.

Serving Size

  1. If you don't use any oil these are just plain potatoes so for tracking purposes you would just need to weigh out your portion and track as a russet potato. For this recipe I decided to use a 150g serving for the nutrition information. That's roughly a large handful of the frozen fries.

Air Fryer Chicken Fingers

Chicken Fingers breaded, air fried, and frozen to add to Snack City in your freezer. Use these for a late night snack or for a meal when you're in a pinch. Kid tested and approved When I make this for Snack City I do 8-10lbs of chicken at a time. If you have only one small air fryer like myself, it will take a few batches to cook.

CourseCuisineTime - 1 hour 30 minutes
SnackAmerican, meal prepPrep - 30 minutes
Cook - 1 hour

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
179kcal20 servings
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates13.1g33%
Fat3.7g9%
Protein23.4g60%

Ingredients:

  • 5 lbs (2270 g) boneless skinless chicken breast
  • 2 cups (250 g) corn chex ground
  • cups (60 g) tapioca flour or cornstarch
  • 2 eggs
  • 3 tbsp (45 g) water
  • salt and pepper to taste
  • 2 tbsp (30 g) oil spray

Instructions:

For the Chicken Fingers

  1. Cut your chicken breasts into chicken finger sized pieces. I shoot for between 1"-1.5" in diameter and 4-5" long. Season with salt and pepper.
  2. Prep your breading by placing the corn chex into a blender or food processor and blending into a flour. Lightly season the breading with salt and pepper.
  3. Set up three bowls, one with the eggs and water beaten together, one with the cornstarch, and one with the breading. You can also use large ziplock bags for the breading steps if you wish.
  4. Coat the chicken in cornstarch, then dunk in the egg wash, and then transfer to the corn chex and coat evenly. Shake off any excess and place on a sheet pan to prepare to be air fried.
  5. Keep one of your hands as the wet hand for the eggs and one as the dry hand for the breading, this will keep it from gunking up on your fingers.
  6. Once all of your chicken is breaded, preheat your air fryer to 400F. Place the chicken in a single layer in the basket and spray lightly with oil. Cook for 7-8 minutes then flip and lightly spray the other side. Cook for an additional 5-6 minutes or until golden brown.
  7. Place the cooked pieces on a wire rack to cool and repeat this process until you have cooked all of the chicken.

Storage

  1. Once all of the chicken has cooled, transfer it into a ziplock bag and remove all of the air. Store inside of Snack City in your freezer.
  2. To reheat, add to your air fryer at 400F for 7-10 minutes.
  3. The nutrition values are an estimate for if you split the 5 lbs of chicken into 20 servings. If you need exact calorie information, you may want to calculate the exact values for your specific batch.

Lemon Blueberry Baked Oatmeal

Frozen blueberries layered and swirled cream cheese inside of a lemon flavored oatmeal and egg bake. This is a great meal for those weeks you prefer something sweet to have in the morning.

CourseCuisineTime - 50 minutes
BreakfastAmerican, meal prepPrep - 10 minutes
Cook - 40 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
366kcal6
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates50.8g65%
Fat9.3g11%
Protein19.8g25%

Ingredients:

  • 3 cups (240 g) old fashioned oats
  • 2 scoops (60 g) vanilla protein powder
  • 1 tsp (4 g) baking powder
  • 3 cups (450 g) blueberries frozen is fine
  • 2 tbsp (42 g) maple syrup
  • 1 tbsp (14 g) butter
  • 10 tbsp (150 g) liquid egg whites or 3 eggs
  • 2 cups (480 g) skim milk
  • 3 tbsp (45 g) lemon juice
  • 4 oz (113 g) plain cream cheese i used whipped, regular is fine you'll just need to melt it down
  • 2 tbsp (20 g) sugar
  • 1 tsp (4 g) splenda optional
  • 1 tbsp (5 g) lemon zest

Instructions:

For the Baked Oatmeal

  1. Preheat your oven to 350F.
  2. Measure out your berries. If you would like a sweeter end product, sprinkle a teaspoon of splenda or sugar over the top of the strawberries and allow them to macerate. It may help speed up the process if you thaw them in the microwave first.
  3. In a large bowl, mix together the oats, protein powder, and baking powder.
  4. Add in the egg whites, milk, syrup, 1 tbsp of melted butter, lemon juice, and the berries.
  5. Spray a 13"x9" pan with oil and add the oat mixture.
  6. Mix together the cream cheese and sugar. You can microwave it for a bit to help it soften. Put a few spoonfuls of the cream cheese around your pan and swirl it around as best as you can.
  7. Bake for 35-40 minutes.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 6 servings. Top with lemon zest. Cut the oatmeal into 6 equal pieces.

Stuffed Hash Browns

Stuffed Hash Browns made in the air fryer. These hash browns are perfect to add to Snack City in your freezer for an easy morning breakfast.

CourseCuisineTime - 35 minutes
Breakfast, SnackAmerican, meal prepPrep - 35 minutes
Cook - 0 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
62kcal36 hash browns
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates10.2g78%
Fat1.3g10%
Protein2.5g19%

Ingredients:

  • 3 lbs (1362 g) frozen shredded hash browns country style
  • cup (85 g) tapioca flour corn starch works too
  • 1 tbsp (14 g) seasoned salt or regular salt
  • 1 medium (150 g) green pepper
  • 1 medium (150 g) red pepper
  • medium (100 g) sweet onion
  • lb (227 g) diced ham
  • cup (84 g) shredded cheese
  • (10 g) oil spray

Instructions:

For the Hash Browns

  1. Place all of your frozen hash browns into a microwave safe bowl. Microwave for 5-6 minutes or until they have thawed and are easier to work with and mold. You can use regular potatoes and shred them on your own if you wish. If you do this you will need to squeeze out as much water from them as possible using a clean towel.
  2. Wash and cut your peppers and onion into a small dice. Dry the ham with a paper towel to get as much moisture off of it as possible.
  3. Once the hash browns have thawed, stir in the tapioca flour (or corn starch), seasoned salt, peppers, onions, ham, and cheese.
  4. Spray a small ramekin or dish with a bit of oil and pack the potatoes into shape. You will want to pack them densely. I used about 60g ( cup) worth for each hash brown. Hit the ramekin upside down against the counter top or your hand lightly to release the hash brown. If you find that they aren't staying together you can add more starch. Some brands of hash browns are less starchy than others.
  5. You can cook these in advanced or freeze them as they are now. If you are going to freeze (this is what I do) place them on a sheet pan and flash freeze them to solidify. Once they have frozen solid, transfer to a ziplock bag and store in the freezer.
  6. If you choose to cook them in advance, preheat your air fryer to 400F. Place the hash browns in the air fryer in a single layer, cooking in batches if necessary. Spray the tops with a bit of oil to help with browning. Cook for 12-15 minutes, flipping half way and spraying the underside with a bit of oil.
  7. You can probably use an oven to cook these but they likely won't get as crispy and will take longer to cook. I have not attempted it, FYI.

Storage

  1. Once the hash browns have frozen solid if not precooking or have cooled if you did precook, add them to a ziplock bag, remove the air and freeze. To reheat, use the air fryer if you want to keep them crispy.
  2. Reheating the uncooked hash browns in the air fryer at 400F for 12-15 minutes. Spray the tops with oil and turn half way.
  3. This recipe makes 36 hash browns. The nutrition information is for each one.

Double Chocolate Chip Pancake Bites

Pancake batter poured into a mini muffin tin and baked to create a similar flavor and texture to pancakes. Bake these, throw them in the freezer, and reheat them whenever you need in the microwave. Serve with a side of maple syrup.

CourseCuisineTime - 20 minutes
Breakfast, SnackAmericanPrep - 10 minutes
Cook - 10 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
36kcal48 bites
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates5.1g72%
Fat0.7g10%
Protein2.2g31%

Ingredients:

  • 2 cup (200 g) oat flour
  • cup (50 g) tapioca flour corn starch would probably work
  • 2 scoop (60 g) vanilla casein protein powder I use the brand Optimum Nutrition but micellar casein will work
  • 1 cup (260 g) liquid egg whites
  • cup (60 g) mini chocolate chips
  • 2 tsp (8 g) baking powder
  • 7 tbsp (35 g) cocoa powder
  • 1 cup (360 ml) water

Instructions:

For the Pancake Bites

  1. Preheat your oven to 325F.
  2. In a large bowl, mix together all of the dry ingredients until no clumps remain. It is easiest for later if your bowl has a spout on it, not required however. Sift the cocoa powder if needed.
  3. NOTE: I'm sure many of you will ask me if you can swap the casein with whey or leave it out all together. No, do not omit the casein and absolutely do not substitute with whey. Your pancake bites will become hockey pucks. A lot of the sweetness comes from the protein powder, do not leave it out. I have attempted this recipe by adding sugar in place of the protein powder and it does not work. The casein adds an airy quality that is not present when only oat flour is used. You can probably use wheat flour and omit the casein but add in some kind of sweetener.
  4. Add in the water, egg whites, and 3 tbsp of chocolate chips. Mix until incorporated and your batter is pourable.
  5. Spray a mini muffin tin with cooking spray. Make sure to coat all sides of the well.
  6. If your bowl doesn't have a spout you may find it easiest to transfer the batter into a large ziplock bag to use as a piping bag. Cut off the corner to fill each well of your mini muffin tin.
  7. Fill each well about half way with batter. This recipe makes 48 bites. Top each bite with the remaining chocolate chips.
  8. Bake for 9-10 minutes.

Storage

  1. Once the bites have completely cooled, place them in a ziplock bag and remove as much air as possible. Store in the freezer.
  2. Reheat the bites in the microwave and serve with maple syrup.

Carrot Cake Baked Oatmeal

Carrot Cake Baked Oatmeal made from grated carrots, spices, a "frosting", and oats. This is a great meal for those weeks you prefer something sweet to have in the morning.

CourseCuisineTime - 45 minutes
BreakfastAmerican, meal prepPrep - 15 minutes
Cook - 30 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
423kcal6
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates53g58%
Fat14g15%
Protein23g25%

Ingredients:

  • 3 cups (240 g) old fashioned oats
  • 2 scoops (60 g) vanilla protein powder
  • 1 tsp (4 g) baking powder
  • 4 large (340 g) carrots grated
  • 2 tbsp (42 g) syrup
  • 1 tbsp (14 g) butter
  • 10 tbsp (150 g) liquid egg whites or 2 whole eggs
  • 2 cups (600 g) 2% milk
  • 1 tsp (3 g) ground ginger
  • 2 tsp (6 g) cinnamon
  • 1 tsp (3 g) nutmeg
  • cup (48 g) brown sugar

For the Frosting

  • 4 oz (100 g) cream cheese
  • cup (100 g) plain nonfat Greek yogurt
  • 1 tbsp (12 g) splenda

Instructions:

For the Oatmeal Bake

  1. Preheat your oven to 350F.
  2. In a large bowl, mix together the oats, protein powder, spices and baking powder.
  3. Wash and shred/grate your carrots into small pieces. I use the small shredding side of my cheese grater for this. Sprinkle the brown sugar over the carrots and mix.
  4. In the bowl with the carrots, add the butter, egg whites, syrup, milk. Pour in the dry ingredients and mix to combine.
  5. Spray a 13"x9" pan with oil and add the oat mixture. Spread evenly.
  6. Bake for 30-35 minutes.

For the Frosting

  1. Melt the cream cheese and mix in the yogurt and splenda.
  2. Place into a ziplock bag (or piping bag) and set aside.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 6 servings. Cut the oatmeal into 6 equal pieces. Once the oatmeal bake has cooled a bit, top with the frosting. I frost my oatmeal the day I cook it, it is probably better to keep your frosting in the fridge and frost the day of eating but it doesn't make a huge difference.

Notes

  1. I think adding some raisins and walnuts would be a nice addition, however I left them out of the recipe because it seems like I am in the minority for adding raisins specifically. Add them if you want.

Air Fryer Hash Browns

Hash Browns made in the air fryer using only 3 ingredients. These hash browns are perfect to add to Snack City in your freezer for a quick morning treat.

CourseCuisineTime - 40 minutes
Breakfast, SnackAmerican, meal prepPrep - 15 minutes
Cook - 25 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
61kcal15 hash browns
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates13.8g106%
Fat0.3g2%
Protein0.7g5%

Ingredients:

  • 30 oz (850 g) frozen shredded hash browns country style
  • cup (30 g) tapioca flour corn starch works too
  • 3 tsp (12 g) seasoned salt or regular salt
  • (5 g) oil spray

Instructions:

For the Hash Browns

  1. Place all of your frozen hash browns into a microwave safe bowl. Microwave for 5-6 minutes or until they have thawed and are easier to work with and mold. You can use regular potatoes and shred them on your own if you wish. If you do this you will need to squeeze out as much water from them as possible using a clean towel.
  2. Once the hash browns have thawed, stir in the tapioca flour (or corn starch) and salt.
  3. Spray a small ramekin or dish with a bit of oil and pack the potatoes into shape. You will want to pack them densely. I used about 60g ( cup) worth for each hash brown. Hit the ramekin upside down against the counter top or your hand to release the hash brown. I yielded 15 hash browns in total.
  4. You can cook these in advanced or freeze them as they are now. If you are going to freeze (this is what I do) place them on a sheet pan and flash freeze them to solidify. Once they have frozen solid, transfer to a ziplock bag and store in the freezer.
  5. Preheat your air fryer to 400F. Place the hash browns in the air fryer in a single layer, cooking in batches if necessary. Spray the tops with a bit of oil to help with browning. Cook for 12-15 minutes, flipping half way and spraying the underside with a bit of oil.
  6. You can probably use an oven to cook these but they likely won't get as crispy and will take longer to cook. I have not attempted it, FYI.

Storage

  1. Once the hash browns have cooled, add them to a ziplock bag, remove the air and freeze. To reheat, use the air fryer if you want to keep them crispy.
  2. This recipe makes 15 hash browns. The nutrition information is for each one.

Cheeseburger Chowder

Cheeseburger Chowder, a cheeseburger in soup form made from ground beef, potatoes, carrots, celery, and onion in a cheesy, creamy broth.

CourseCuisineTime - 1 hour 10 minutes
Main DishAmerican, meal prepPrep - 10 minutes
Cook - 1 hour

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
568kcal6 servings
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates31g28%
Fat29g27%
Protein47g43%

Ingredients:

  • 2 lbs (908 g) ground beef 93/7
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) oil
  • 3 medium (200 g) carrots
  • 5-6 medium (200 g) celery stalks
  • 1 medium (200 g) sweet onion
  • 3 medium (550 g) russet potatoes
  • 1 bunch (30 g) curly parsley optional
  • 32 oz (946 g) bone broth chicken stock is a fine alternative
  • 2 cups (480 g) water
  • 1 tbsp (21 g) butter
  • 2 tbsp (21 g) flour use gluten free if needed. I used an oat/tapioca flour mixture when I made this.
  • 1 cups (360 g) 2% milk
  • 1 cup (112 g) shredded cheddar cheese
  • 1 tbsp (12 g) granulated chicken bouillon
  • 2 tbsp (15 g) cornstarch
  • 2 tbsp (30 g) cold water
  • salt and pepper to taste

Instructions:

For the Chowder

  1. Wash and cut your carrots, celery, onion, potatoes and parsley. Cut the carrots into half circles, celery and onion into a small dice, and the potatoes into a medium to large dice. Roughly chop the parsley leaves into small pieces.
  2. In a large pot, add some oil over medium high heat. Add in the onion, celery, and carrots and cook to develop some color, around 5-8 minutes.
  3. Once the vegetables have developed some color, make some room in the middle of the pot and add the beef. Brown the meat as best as you can.
  4. Once the beef has cooked, add in the potatoes, broth, and enough water to just cover the contents of the pot. I used 2 cups, you may need more or less. Reduce the heat to medium, cover the pot and allow it to boil until the potatoes have softened, around 10 minutes.
  5. When the potatoes have about 5 minutes left, start making your bechamel sauce. If you have never done this before, I recommend watching a quick tutorial on how to do it. Here is Papa Gordon making one, https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9aeCJGmEXqE
  6. In a skillet over medium heat, make a roux by melting the butter and stirring in the flour. Add in the milk in batches, stirring constantly until a smooth sauce forms and it begins to thicken. Once smooth, add in the cheese and melt.
  7. Pour in the cheese sauce to the pot with the soup and mix.
  8. To thicken the soup you will want to add a cornstarch slurry, mix 1 tbsp of cornstarch with 1 tbsp of cold water together at a and stir it into the mixture until you have achieved your desired thickness. I used 2 tbsp when I made it but depending on how much liquid you have, you may need more or less.
  9. Stir in 1 tbsp of granulated chicken bouillon and salt and pepper to taste. Add in cup of chopped fresh parsley if you wish.

Plating

  1. Soup is actually very meal prep friendly. You can use this recipe as a meal prepped dish or as a regular meal. This recipe makes 6 servings. Divide the soup evenly between your dishes. Top with fresh parsley for garnish.

Peanut Butter Chocolate Chip Baked Oatmeal

Peanut Butter Chocolate Chip Baked Oatmeal made from powdered peanut butter, chocolate chips, bananas, and oats. This is a great meal for those weeks you prefer something sweet to have in the morning.

CourseCuisineTime - 50 minutes 50 minutes
BreakfastAmerican, meal prepPrep - 10 minutes 10 minutes
Cook - 40 minutes 40 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
432kcal6
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates54g60%
Fat14g15%
Protein22g24%

Ingredients:

  • 3 cups (240 g) old fashioned oats
  • 2 scoops (60 g) vanilla protein powder
  • 1 tsp (4 g) baking powder
  • 2 medium (250 g) bananas ripe
  • 2 tbsp (42 g) honey
  • 1 tbsp (14 g) butter
  • 10 tbsp (150 g) liquid egg whites or 2 whole eggs
  • 2 cups (480 g) skim milk
  • 3 tbsp (45 g) mini chocolate chips
  • 4 tbsp (64 g) peanut butter

For the Peanut Butter Drizzle

  • 1 tbsp (16 g) peanut butter
  • Water to thin if necessary

Instructions:

For the Oatmeal Bake

  1. Preheat your oven to 350F.
  2. In a large bowl, mix together the oats, protein powder, and baking powder.
  3. In a separate bowl, add the bananas, peanut butter, and butter. Microwave them for a bit to soften and mash until they are smooth.
  4. Whisk together the mashed banana, peanut butter, butter, egg whites, honey, and milk. Pour in the dry ingredients and 2 tbsp of the chocolate chips. Mix to combine.
  5. Spray a 13"x9" pan with oil and add the oat mixture. Top with the remaining chocolate chips.
  6. Bake for 30-35 minutes.
  7. Melt the remaining peanut butter and drizzle it over the top of the baked oatmeal. Thin it with a bit of water if needed.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 6 servings. Cut the oatmeal into 6 equal pieces.

Giant Protein Pancake

A gluten free, high protein pancake made from oat flour and a blend of whey and casein protein.

CourseCuisineTime - 10 minutes
Breakfast, Dessert, SnackAmericanPrep - 5 minutes
Cook - 5 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
283kcal1 Pancake
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates29.2g43%
Fat2.2g3%
Protein36.5g54%

Ingredients:

  • scoop (25 g) vanilla whey/casein blend 50/50 blend. I mix 12.5g of whey and 12.5g of casein together
  • cup (20 g) oat flour
  • 1 tbsp (10 g) tapioca flour or cornstarch
  • 1/4 tsp (1 g) baking powder
  • cup (60 g) liquid egg whites
  • cup (75 g) plain nonfat Greek yogurt
  • 1-2 tbsp (25 g) water

For the Toppings

  • cup (100 g) mixed berries frozen is fine
  • tsp (2 g) splenda optional
  • 1 tbsp (5 g) fat free whipped cream

Instructions:

  1. Mix all the dry ingredients together so no clumps are present. NOTE: I have tested this with only whey protein and it doesn't turn out as well. Only casein will work but you may need more water in the batter. The 50/50 blend is best.
  2. Add in the wet ingredients and mix thoroughly.
  3. Heat a griddle/skillet on medium heat and spray with oil. Add the batter and cook for a couple minutes, then flip.

For the Toppings

  1. If your fruit is frozen, defrost it in the microwave. Sprinkle the splenda over the top and allow it to macerate for a few minutes. This will pull out some of the juices and allow you to use less syrup.
  2. Top your pancake with the fruit and whipped cream.

Berries and Cream Baked Oatmeal

Frozen berries layered and swirled cream cheese inside of an oatmeal and egg bake. This is a great meal for those weeks you prefer something sweet to have in the morning.

CourseCuisineTime - 50 minutes
BreakfastAmerican, meal prepPrep - 10 minutes
Cook - 40 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
369kcal6
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates52g65%
Fat9.3g11%
Protein19.3g24%

Ingredients:

  • 3 cups (240 g) old fashioned oats
  • 2 scoops (60 g) vanilla protein powder
  • 1 tsp (4 g) baking powder
  • 4 cups (450 g) mixed berries frozen is fine
  • 2 tbsp (42 g) maple syrup
  • 1 tbsp (14 g) butter
  • 10 tbsp (150 g) liquid egg whites or 2 eggs
  • 2 cups (480 g) skim milk
  • 4 oz (113 g) plain cream cheese i used whipped, regular is fine you'll just need to melt it down
  • 2 tbsp (20 g) sugar
  • 1 tsp (4 g) splenda optional

Instructions:

For the Baked Oatmeal

  1. Preheat your oven to 375F.
  2. Measure out your berries. If you would like a sweeter end product, sprinkle a teaspoon of splenda or sugar over the top of the strawberries and allow them to macerate. It may help speed up the process if you thaw them in the microwave first.
  3. In a large bowl, mix together the oats, protein powder, and baking powder.
  4. Add in the egg whites, milk, syrup, 1 tbsp of melted butter, and most of the berries. Reserve a few to put on top.
  5. Spray a 13"x9" pan with oil and add the oat mixture.
  6. Mix together the cream cheese and sugar. You can microwave it for a bit to help it soften. Put a few spoonfuls of the cream cheese around your pan and swirl it around as best as you can.
  7. Bake for 35-40 minutes.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 6 servings. Cut the oatmeal into 6 equal pieces.

5 Minute Hash Brown Breakfast Bowl

A quick breakfast bowl made in the microwave from frozen hash browns, egg whites, greek yogurt and cheese. Add peppers and onions for extra flavor.

CourseCuisineTime - 5 minutes
BreakfastAmericanPrep - 2 minutes
Cook - 3 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
188kcal1 serving
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates18g41%
Fat3g6%
Protein22g51%

Ingredients:

  • 1/2 cup (120 g) 120g egg whites
  • (100 g) ~1.5 cups 100g frozen shredded hash browns
  • (50 g) ~1/4 cup 50g plain non fat Greek yogurt
  • 1 tbsp (10 g) 10g cheese
  • 1 tsp (2 g) 2g Green onions
  • Salt and pepper to taste

Instructions:

  1. Add the frozen hash browns and eggs to a bowl. Microwave in 1 minute intervals and stir until eggs have cooked.
  2. Add in the yogurt, salt, pepper and stir. Add the cheese and microwave an additional 30 seconds or until the cheese has melted.
  3. Top with green onions and enjoy.

Irish Nachos

Irish Nachos made from air fried potatoes topped with cheese, salsa, green onions, and Greek yogurt. This is a quick, easy, and flavorful snack you can use to curb your midnight cravings.

CourseCuisineTime - 13 minutes
Appetizer, SnackAmericanPrep - 5 minutes
Cook - 8 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
291kcal1 serving
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates45g71%
Fat8g12%
Protein10g15%

Ingredients:

  • 1 medium (200 g) russet potato
  • 2 tbsp (30 g) salsa
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) plain non fat Greek yogurt
  • 1 tsp (2 g) green onion
  • 1 tbsp (14 g) cheese
  • (1 g) oil spray

Instructions:

For the Potatoes

  1. Preheat your air fryer to 400F on the air fryer setting.
  2. Wash and slice your potato into chip sized slices.
  3. Add the potatoes to the air fryer and spray lightly with oil. Fry for a few minutes then shake/turn. It will probably take 5-6 minutes depending on the thickness of your potato.
  4. Remove from the fryer and salt. Sprinkle the cheese over the top and then microwave to melt.

Serving

  1. This recipe makes 1 serving. Top with salsa, yogurt and green onions.

Strawberries and Cream Baked Oatmeal

Sliced strawberries layered and swirled cream cheese inside of an oatmeal and egg bake. This is a great meal for those weeks you prefer something sweet to have in the morning.

CourseCuisineTime - 50 minutes
BreakfastAmerican, meal prepPrep - 10 minutes
Cook - 40 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
345kcal6
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates47g62%
Fat9g12%
Protein19g25%

Ingredients:

  • 3 cups (240 g) old fashioned oats
  • 2 scoops (60 g) vanilla protein powder
  • 1 tsp (4 g) baking powder
  • 4 cups (450 g) strawberries frozen is fine
  • 2 tsp (8 g) sugar or sub 1/2 sugar alternative
  • 2 tbsp (42 g) maple syrup
  • 1 tbsp (14 g) butter
  • 10 tbsp (150 g) liquid egg whites or 2 eggs
  • 2 cups (480 g) skim milk
  • 4 oz (113 g) plain cream cheese i used whipped, regular is fine you'll just need to melt it down
  • 2 tbsp (20 g) sugar

Instructions:

For the Baked Oatmeal

  1. Preheat your oven to 375F.
  2. If your strawberries are whole, cut them into thin slices. If you would like a sweeter end product, sprinkle 2 tsp sugar or 1 tsp splenda the top of the strawberries and allow them to macerate.
  3. In a large bowl, mix together the oats, protein powder, and baking powder.
  4. Add in the egg whites, milk, syrup, 1 tbsp of melted butter, and most of the strawberries. Reserve a few to put on top.
  5. Spray a 13"x9" pan with oil and add the oat mixture.
  6. Mix together the cream cheese and sugar. You can microwave it for a bit to help it soften. Put a few spoonfuls of the cream cheese around your pan and swirl it around as best as you can.
  7. Bake for 35-40 minutes.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 6 servings. Cut the oatmeal into 6 equal pieces.

Creamy Chicken and Noodles

Shredded chicken breasts with carrots, celery, and broccoli in a creamy, savory sauce and mixed with noodles. A one pot meal that takes little effort.

CourseCuisineTime - 45 minutes 45 minutes 45 minutes
Main DishAmerican, meal prepPrep - 15 minutes 15 minutes 15 minutes
Cook - 30 minutes 30 minutes 30 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
712kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates91g57%
Fat17g10%
Protein49g31%

Ingredients:

  • 2 lbs (908 g) boneless skinless chicken breast
  • 1 lb (454 g) fusilli pasta noodles gluten free if needed
  • medium (100 g) onion
  • lb (227 g) carrots
  • lb (227 g) celery
  • lb (227 g) frozen broccoli
  • 2 tbsp (30 g) olive oil
  • 4 cups (960 g) chicken broth
  • 2 cups (600 g) milk
  • salt and pepper to taste

Instructions:

For the Chicken and Vegetables

  1. Wash and cut your celery, carrots, and onion into a small dice.
  2. In a large stock pot, add some oil over medium high heat. Add the vegetables and cook for about 5 minutes or until they have begun to develop color and soften.
  3. Add the chicken to the bottom of the pot and pour the chicken broth over the top. If you don't have enough liquid to cover the top of the chicken, add a bit of water. Bring to a boil then reduce the heat to medium low and cover. Cook covered for 15-20 minutes.
  4. Remove the chicken from the pot and set aside.
  5. Add the noodles and milk to the pot, bring to a boil and cook for the time the package of noodles specifies, likely 10-12 minutes. Be sure to stir frequently.
  6. While the noodles are cooking, shred the chicken. Place the broccoli in the microwave and cook it according to its packaging.
  7. Chop the broccoli into small pieces.
  8. Once the noodles have finished cooking, add the chicken and broccoli to the pot and stir. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide your ingredients evenly between your 5 containers.

Pepper Jack Cheeseburger Bowls

A meal prep version of a cheeseburger. Ground beef with pepper jack cheese, spicy potatoes, and burger toppings come together in a bowl and served with ketchup.

CourseCuisineTime - 45 minutes
Main DishAmerican, meal prepPrep - 15 minutes
Cook - 30 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
532kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates45g42%
Fat22g20%
Protein38g36%

Ingredients:

For the Hamburger and Broccoli

  • 1 lbs (908 g) ground beef (93/7) or turkey
  • 1 lb (454 g) mushrooms
  • 5 Tbsp (70 g) shredded pepper jack cheese
  • 1 lb (454 g) frozen broccoli
  • 1 Tbsp (23 g) olive oil
  • 10 Tbsp (150 g) ketchup
  • 5 (150 g) dill pickle spears
  • 2 (120 g) Roma tomatoes
  • Salt and pepper to taste

For the Potatoes

  • 5 small (750 g) russet potatoes
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) olive oil
  • 1 tsp (3 g) cayenne pepper
  • 1 tsp (3 g) garlic powder
  • 1 tbsp (6 g) chili powder
  • salt and pepper to taste

Instructions:

For the Potatoes

  1. Preheat your oven to 450F.
  2. Wash each of your potatoes thoroughly. Cut them into a medium dice.
  3. In a large bowl, drizzle 1 Tbsp of olive oil over the potatoes. Sprinkle with salt, pepper, 1 tsp of cayenne pepper, garlic powder and 1 tbsp chili powder. Toss the potatoes to coat and spread onto a sheet pan.
  4. Bake for 10-15 minutes and then flip them to the other side and cook an additional 10-12 minutes or until desired doneness is achieved.

For the Broccoli

  1. Add a sheet pan to the oven while it is preheating to 450F. Add 1 Tbsp of olive oil to a large bowl with the broccoli and salt and pepper. Lay the broccoli out on the hot sheet pan and roast for 10 minutes. Remove from the oven, turn, and cook an additional 5-8 minutes.

For the Hamburger and Mushrooms

  1. Heat a skillet over medium high heat. Add the ground beef and cook. Once it has browned, season with salt and pepper to taste.
  2. Wash and cut your mushrooms into thin slices. If you want these to develop color, cook them in a dry skillet over medium heat and salt them to pull out the water. They will cook down and brown in about 5-8 minutes. You could also just throw them in with the beef if you don't care to cook them separately.
  3. Mix the mushrooms and beef together and stir to incorporate.

For the Bowls

  1. Cut 2 Roma tomatoes into slices.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide your hamburger, potatoes, and broccoli evenly between your 5 containers. Top the hamburger with 1 Tbsp of shredded pepper jack cheese. Add 1 pickle spear and 2 slices of Roma tomatoes. Store 2 Tbsp of ketchup sauce in a smaller, separate container.

Nashville Hot Chicken Stuffed Potato Skins

Crispy, flavorful and filling. The perfect between meals meal. These Hot Chicken Stuffed Potato Skins are cooked sans oil using the air fryer to keep the calorie load low.

CourseCuisineTime - 1 hour 10 minutes
Appetizer, SnackAmericanPrep - 10 minutes
Cook - 1 hour

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
90kcal5 potato skins
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates7.5g39%
Fat2g10%
Protein10.7g56%

Ingredients:

  • 5 (50 g) potato skins
  • lb (227 g) chicken breast tenders
  • cup (40 g) baked potato crumbles
  • 2 tbsp (14 g) shredded cheddar
  • 2 tsp (7 g) brown sugar
  • tsp (.7 g) chili powder
  • tsp (.7 g) onion powder
  • tsp (.7 g) cayenne
  • tsp (2 g) garlic powder
  • 2 tsp (8 g) hot sauce
  • tsp (3.5 g) water
  • 1 (10 g) green onion

For the Spicy Ketchup

  • 2 tbsp (25 g) ketchup
  • 2 tsp (10 g) hot sauce

Instructions:

  1. Bake some potatoes. I used the air fryer at 400F for 40 minutes. Doesnt matter how you do this. You can use the oven too.
  2. Halve the baked potato and scoop out the insides.
  3. Preheat your air fryer to 400F on the air fry setting for 8 minutes.
  4. Lightly spray the tenders with oil and season with salt and pepper. Cook for 4 minutes then flip.
  5. When the chicken has almost completed cooking, mix the seasonings together and stir in the water and hot sauce.
  6. Chop the chicken and add to the sauce. Coat evenly.
  7. Stuff 5 skins with chicken, top with some of the scooped out potato and cheese.
  8. Air fry at 400F for 3-4 minutes. Watch it closely to make sure it doesnt burn.

Serving

  1. Top the potato skins with with green onions. Mix the ketchup and hot sauce together for the spicy ketchup

Buffalo Chicken Tenders

A quick snack you can make in the air fryer. These Buffalo Chicken Tenders are the perfect meal for when you need a big dose of protein.

CourseCuisineTime - 11 minutes
Appetizer, SnackAmericanPrep - 3 minutes
Cook - 8 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
221kcal2 servings
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates0.3g0%
Fat1.2g2%
Protein52g98%

Ingredients:

  • 1 lb boneless skinless chicken breast tenders
  • 2 tbsp buffalo sauce
  • salt and pepper to taste

Instructions:

  1. Preheat your air fryer to 400F.
  2. Season the chicken with salt and pepper and add to the air fryer. Cook the tenders for around 4 minutes and then flip and cook an additional 4 minutes.
  3. Toss the chicken in the buffalo sauce.

Serving

  1. This recipe makes 2 servings.

Chocolate Chip Banana Bread Baked Oatmeal

Ripe bananas baked into an oatmeal and egg mixture and topped with chocolate chips for a Chocolate Chip Banana Bread Baked Oatmeal. This is a great meal for those weeks you prefer something sweet to have in the morning.

CourseCuisineTime - 50 minutes
BreakfastAmerican, meal prepPrep - 10 minutes
Cook - 40 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
389kcal6
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates59g67%
Fat9g10%
Protein19g21%

Ingredients:

  • 3 cups (240 g) old fashioned oats
  • 2 scoops (60 g) vanilla protein powder
  • 1 tsp (4 g) baking powder
  • 4 medium (500 g) bananas ripe
  • 2 tbsp (42 g) honey
  • 1 tbsp (14 g) butter
  • 10 tbsp (150 g) liquid egg whites or 2 whole eggs
  • 2 cups (480 g) 2% milk
  • 2 tbsp (28 g) mini chocolate chips

Instructions:

For the Oatmeal Bake

  1. Preheat your oven to 375F.
  2. In a large bowl, mix together the oats, protein powder, and baking powder.
  3. In a separate bowl, add 3 of the ripe bananas and mash. It may help to microwave them for a bit to soften. Cut the other banana into slices to go on top of the oatmeal.
  4. Whisk together the mashed banana, egg whites, honey, milk, and 1 tbsp of melted butter. Pour in the dry ingredients and 1 tbsp of the chocolate chips. Mix to combine.
  5. Spray a 13"x9" pan with oil and add the oat mixture. Top with the sliced banana and chocolate chips.
  6. Bake for 35-40 minutes.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 6 servings. Cut the oatmeal into 6 equal pieces.

Faux Cheddar Bay Biscuits

A copycat version of the Cheddar Bay Biscuits from Red Lobster. I like to use these in soups or as croutons.

CourseCuisineTime - 25 minutes
Appetizer, SnackAmericanPrep - 10 minutes
Cook - 15 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
53kcal13 biscuits
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates5.1g51%
Fat2.1g21%
Protein3.4g34%

Ingredients:

**Dry Ingredients **

  • cup (80 g) oat flour
  • tsp (2 g) onion powder
  • 1 tbsp (1 g) dried parsley
  • 1 tsp (4 g) salt
  • 1 tsp (3 g) garlic powder
  • tsp (2 g) baking soda

Wet Ingredients

  • 1 small egg or 1/2 large egg
  • cup (56 g) cheddar cheese
  • cup (150 g) plain Greek yogurt non fat

Instructions:

For the Biscuits

  1. Preheat your oven to 375F.
  2. Mix the dry ingredients and wet ingredients independently then combine.
  3. Use a cookie scoop to put on a sprayed sheet pan and bake at 375 Fahrenheit for 15-17 minutes. Makes 13.

Macro Friendly Protein Cheesecake

Macro Friendly Protein Cheesecake made from plain nonfat Greek yogurt to yield a higher protein, lower calorie alternative to the classic favorite.

CourseCuisineTime - 3 hours 38 minutes
DessertAmericanPrep - 8 minutes
Cook - 30 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
136kcal8 slices
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates18g54%
Fat0.4g1%
Protein15.6g47%

Ingredients:

For the Filling

  • 3 cups (681 g) plain nonfat Greek yogurt
  • 1 oz (30 g) sugar free vanilla pudding mix
  • 2 tsp (8 g) splenda
  • 13 tbsp (200 g) liquid egg whites cup + 1 tbsp

For the Crust

  • cup (75 g) protein pancake mix (you can probably use cup of any flour with a few grams of splenda and it will be fine)
  • cup (113 g) unsweetened applesauce

For the Topping

  • 1 cups (200 g) frozen fruit
  • 1 cup (64 g) fat free whipped cream
  • tsp (2 g) splenda

Instructions:

For the Crust

  1. Preheat your oven to 350F.
  2. Mix the protein pancake mix and applesauce together until it has combined.
  3. Spray an 8 inch pie pan or springform pan with oil and add the crust mixture to the dish. Using a spoon, spread the mixture around the bottom of the pan (and up the sides of the dish if using pie pan) in an even layer as best as you can.
  4. Parbake for 5-10 minutes or until it is no longer wet to the touch while you prepare the filling. The pie pan will likely be ready quicker as it isn't as thick.

For the Filling

  1. In a large bowl, mix together the yogurt, splenda, pudding mix, and egg whites until incorporated.
  2. Once the crust has parbaked, pour in the filling and smooth out in an even layer.
  3. Bake for 30 minutes. Use a waterbath if you don't want it to crack.
  4. Allow the cheesecake to cool to room temperature and then place it in the fridge to set for at least 3 hours, preferably overnight.

Serving

  1. Thaw out the frozen fruit in the microwave and sprinkle splenda over the top. Mix and allow to macerate for a couple of minutes.
  2. This recipe makes 8 servings. Cut the cheesecake into 8 equal slices and top with frozen fruit and 2 tbsp of whipped cream each.

Nashville Hot Chicken Tenders

Nashville Hot Chicken Tenders made from chicken breast tenderloins and coated in a spicy, sweet sauce from brown sugar, hot sauce, and spices.

CourseCuisineTime - 20 minutes
Appetizer, SnackAmericanPrep - 5 minutes
Cook - 15 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
263kcal2
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates9.4g15%
Fat2.6g4%
Protein50.5g82%

Ingredients:

  • 1 lb (454 g) chicken breast tenders
  • 1/2 tsp (1.5 g) chili powder
  • 1/2 tsp (1.5 g) onion powder
  • 1/2 tsp (1.5 g) cayenne pepper
  • 1 tbsp (14 g) brown sugar
  • 1 tsp (3 g) garlic powder
  • 1 tbsp (18 ml) hot sauce
  • 1.5 tsp (7 ml) water
  • Oil spray
  • Salt and pepper to taste

Instructions:

  1. Preheat your air fryer to 400F on the air fry setting for 8 minutes.
  2. Lightly spray the tenders with oil and season with salt and pepper. Cook for 4 minutes then flip.
  3. When the chicken has almost completed cooking, mix the seasonings together and stir in the water and hot sauce.
  4. Add to a pan over medium heat. Bring to a light bubble, we are just trying to caramelize the sugar a bit to thicken the sauce.
  5. Add in the chicken and coat evenly.
  6. This recipe makes 2 servings.

Chicken and Vegetable Rice Bowls with Orange Dijon Vinaigrette

Chicken breasts, mushrooms, zucchini, carrots, and onions mixed with a serving of rice and a side of an Orange Dijon Vinaigrette to pour over the top.

CourseCuisineTime - 45 minutes
Main DishAmerican, meal prepPrep - 10 minutes
Cook - 35 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
476kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates36g37%
Fat18g18%
Protein43g44%

Ingredients:

For the Rice Bowl

  • 2 lbs (908 g) boneless skinless chicken breast
  • medium (100 g ) onion
  • 2 medium (400 g) zucchini
  • 1 cups (150 g) shredded carrots
  • 8 oz (227 g) mushrooms
  • 2 tbsp (30 ml) olive oil
  • 3 cups (450 g) cooked rice

For the Vinaigrette

  • 2 tbsp (30 ml) orange juice freshly squeezed
  • 2 tbsp (30 ml) olive oil
  • cup (60 g) white wine vinegar
  • 1 tbsp (15 ml) Dijon mustard
  • tsp (2 g) garlic powder
  • tsp (2 g) oregano

Instructions:

For the Rice Bowls

  1. Cook enough rice to yield 3 cups of cooked rice. 1 cup of dry rice will make between 2-3 cups of cooked rice depending on what type you use.
  2. Wash and cut all of your vegetables. Cut the onion into a small dice and the mushrooms, zucchini into a medium dice. You can cut your shredded carrots if you wish so they aren't so long, but you don't need to if you don't want to.
  3. Cut the chicken into a medium dice of similar size to your mushrooms and zucchini.
  4. Heat a large skillet over medium high heat and add some olive oil. Saut the onions for 2-3 minutes or until they begin to brown, then make some space in the center and add the carrots and zucchini. Add oil as necessary. Cook until the zucchini begins to develop some color, 2-3 minutes.
  5. Make some room in the center of the pan again and add the mushrooms. Cook until they have softened. Season with salt to taste and add the vegetable mixture to a large bowl.
  6. Heat some more oil in the pan over medium high to high heat and saut the chicken in batches until it is all cooked through. Season lightly with salt. It will cook quickly because it is in small pieces. Be careful not to overcook it but also try to get proper browning (don't stir too frequently).
  7. Measure out 3 cups of rice and add to the bowl with the vegetables. Add the chicken as well. Stir to incorporate and season with salt and pepper as needed.

**For the Vinaigrette **

  1. Add all of the ingredients to a bowl and whisk to emulsify.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide your ingredients evenly 5 ways. Store your vinaigrette in smaller, separate containers as you do not want to heat this up with your meal. Each dish gets 1 container of the vinaigrette.

Pumpkin Cinnamon Rolls

A fall inspired pumpkin cinnamon roll. These are sweet, breadlike, and satisfying while using a combination of rice flour, cornstarch, and vanilla casein protein.

CourseCuisineTime - 32 minutes
Breakfast, DessertAmericanPrep - 20 minutes
Cook - 12 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
77kcal8 small rolls
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates13.3g83%
Fat1.5g9%
Protein2.8g17%

Ingredients:

For the Dough

  • cup (50 g) rice flour
  • 3 tbsp (25 g) tapioca flour
  • scoop (20 g) vanilla casein protein
  • tsp (2 g) baking powder
  • cup (80 g) canned pumpkin
  • 2 tbsp (30 g) liquid egg whites

For the Filling

  • 1 tsp (7 g) butter melted
  • 1 tbsp (20 g) sugar
  • 1 tsp (2 g) cinnamon

For the Frosting

  • 2 tbsp (24 g) whipped cream cheese frosting buy premade, its easier and better

Instructions:

For the Cinnamon Rolls

  1. Preheat your oven to 400F.
  2. Mix the flours, baking powder, and protein powder together until incorporated. Add in the pumpkin and egg whites. Stir until a dough forms.
  3. Spread out two large pieces of wax paper. Spray each side with oil.
  4. Place the dough on the wax paper and cover with the other wax paper. Roll the dough out until it is between " and " thick and in a rectangle. You don't want it so thin that it tears and so thick that it can't roll.
  5. Mix the sugar and cinnamon together and melt the butter.
  6. Spread the butter out over the dough and sprinkle in the cinnamon sugar.
  7. Lift up the bottom layer of wax paper to help roll the dough. The tighter you can get the roll the better.
  8. Once you have rolled the dough, cut it into 8 pieces.
  9. Spray a sheet pan, baking dish, or cast iron skillet with oil. Add the rolls to the pan. In the picture, I used a small cast iron skillet and placed them all together so they were touching. This is a fine way to do it but you will have to cook it longer and I think it prevents the rolls from being as soft as they could be. If you were to place them separately on the sheet pan, it will cook a bit more evenly but if you aren't able to achieve a tight roll, they will tip over. Not a huge issue but something to consider.
  10. Bake for 10-12 minutes if you put them on the pan apart from eachother. Bake for 17-18 minutes if you place them next to eachother.
  11. Spread the frosting over the top of the rolls. Makes 8 small cinnamon rolls.

Apple Fritters

Air fried Apple Fritters made from the pancake mix from the protein pancake recipe. The mix is combined with butter, sugar, apples, and Greek yogurt to form a dough.

CourseCuisineTime - 25 minutes
DessertAmericanPrep - 10 minutes
Cook - 15 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
261kcal2 fritters
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates38g67%
Fat6.6g11%
Protein12.4g22%

Ingredients:

For the Fritter

  • 2 tbsp (11 g) whey protein powder vanilla
  • 2 tbsp (11 g) casein protein powder vanilla
  • 3 tbsp (18 g) oat flour
  • 1 tbsp (9 g) tapioca flour or cornstarch
  • tsp (1 g) baking powder
  • medium (60 g) apple
  • 1 tbsp (14 g) butter
  • cup (50 g) plain nonfat Greek yogurt
  • 1 tsp (4 g) cinnamon
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) brown sugar

For the Frosting

  • 3 tbsp (25 g) powdered sugar
  • 1 tsp (5 ml) milk

Instructions:

For the Fritter

  1. NOTE: If you have the pancake mix from the protein pancakes premade (which you should ) you can measure out 50g of it and use it here.
  2. Mix all of the dry ingredients for the fritter together so no clumps remain.
  3. Cut the butter into small pieces and press it into the flour mixture with a fork until it is incorporated.
  4. Add in the apple and Greek yogurt and mix until completely hydrated.
  5. Cut out two rectangular pieces of parchment paper about 5 inches by 3 inches. Spray lightly with oil.
  6. Divide the dough into two halves and spread out on each piece of parchment.
  7. Preheat your air fryer to 325F on the air fry setting for 15 minutes.
  8. Spray the top of each fritter with oil and add to the air fryer. You could probably bake these but I would guess they will come out more bread like if you do. It may take longer in the oven.
  9. Keep an eye on the fritters and flip them over about half way through or when the top has browned evenly.

For the Frosting

  1. Mix the powdered sugar and milk together.
  2. Top each fritter with frosting.

California Burrito Bowls

California Burrito Bowls made with marinated chicken thighs, Mexican rice, potatoes, and vegetables. Served with a side of fresh Pico de Gallo for lots of low calorie flavor.

CourseCuisineTime - 1 hour 10 minutes
Main DishAmerican, meal prepPrep - 40 minutes
Cook - 30 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
521kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates39g37%
Fat21g20%
Protein44g42%

Ingredients:

For the Chicken

  • 2 lbs (1135 g) boneless skinless chicken thighs
  • 2 tsp (10 ml) soy sauce
  • 1 tbsp (15 ml) olive oil
  • 1 tbsp (22 ml) lime juice
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) adobo sauce canned chipotle peppers in adobo
  • 1 tsp (3 g) garlic powder
  • 1 tsp (3 g) onion powder
  • 1 tsp (3 g) paprika
  • tsp (2 g) salt
  • tsp (2 g) pepper

For the Rice

  • 2 cups (300 g) cooked rice
  • cup (120 g) tomato sauce
  • 1 tsp (3 g) cumin
  • 2 tbsp (10 g) cilantro chopped
  • salt to taste

For the Potatoes

  • 2 medium (350 g) russet potatoes
  • tbsp (8 g) olive oil
  • salt to taste

For the Vegetables

  • 1 medium (200 g) zucchini
  • 1 medium (150 g) bell pepper
  • tbsp (8 g) olive oil

For the Chipotle Mayo

  • 3 tbsp (45 g) mayo
  • 3 tbsp (45 g) plain nonfat Greek yogurt
  • 1 tsp (5 g) adobo sauce
  • 1 tsp (5 ml) lime juice
  • salt to taste

For the Pico de Gallo

  • 4 (160 g) Roma tomatoes
  • small (100 g) red onion
  • 1 tbsp (15 ml) lime juice
  • 1 small (15 g) jalapeno
  • 2 tbsp (10 g) cilantro
  • salt to taste

Instructions:

  1. Make sure you read through all of the instructions before you start. You want to multitask on your cooking to make things go smoothly.

For the Rice

  1. Cook enough rice to yield 2 cups of cooked rice. 1 cup of dry rice will yield between 2-3 cups of cooked rice depending on the kind you use.
  2. Heat a skillet over medium heat and add the tomato sauce. Cook for 2-3 minutes stirring occasionally.
  3. Add in the rice, cumin, cilantro, and salt to taste. Mix to combine.

For the Chicken

  1. In a bowl ziplock mix together the oil, soy sauce, lime juice, adobo sauce, garlic powder, onion powder, paprika, salt and pepper.
  2. In a large ziplock bag, add the chicken and pour over the sauce. Mix to coat the chicken and remove as much air as possible. Marinate for 30 minutes.
  3. Preheat your oven to 400F. (You can also cook this on the stovetop as well). Add your chicken to a wire rimmed baking sheet and roast for 20 minutes.
  4. Allow the chicken to rest and then cut into small pieces.
  5. If you'd like to add even more flavor to your chicken you can heat a skillet over medium high heat and cook the chicken for a few minutes to develop color on all sides. This is optional.

For the Vegetables

  1. Wash and cut your peppers and zucchini into a medium to large dice.
  2. Heat some oil in a large skillet over medium high heat. Cook the peppers and zucchini until they have begun to soften. Add salt and pepper to taste.

For the Pico de Gallo

  1. Wash all of your vegetables. Cut the tomatoes in half and remove the seeds. Cut them into a small dice.
  2. Place the tomatoes into a strainer and add salt. This will encourage excess water to come out of the tomatoes.
  3. Cut the onion, jalapeo, and cilantro into a small dice.
  4. Once the excess water has been drained, add the tomatoes, onion, jalapeo, and cilantro to a large bowl. Pour the lime juice over and salt to taste. Mix thoroughly.

For the Potatoes

  1. Wash and cut your potatoes into a medium dice.
  2. Preheat your oven or air fryer to 400F. Toss the potatoes in the oil and salt and roast for 15-20 minutes or until they have achieved proper browning, turning half way through. I used the air fryer at 400F for 15 minutes.

For the Chipotle Mayo

  1. Mix all of the ingredients together.

For the Bowl

  1. In a large bowl, add the chicken, rice, vegetables, and potatoes. Mix to combine and season as needed.
  2. In smaller separate containers, divide the pico evenly.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide all of your ingredients evenly between your 5 containers. Each container gets a side of pico and a side of mayo. I personally keep the mayo in a container in the fridge and add it to the top after reheating.

Chicken Fries

These Chicken Fries are made from ground chicken, coated in a corn Chex crust and air fried to create a gluten free, lower calorie chicken fry.

CourseCuisineTime - 2 hours 30 minutes
SnackAmericanPrep - 15 minutes
Cook - 15 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
51kcal36 chicken fries
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates3g30%
Fat2g20%
Protein5g50%

Ingredients:

  • 2 lbs (908 g) ground chicken
  • 1 cup (100 g) ground corn chex
  • tsp (1.5 g) garlic powder
  • tsp (1.5 g) onion powder
  • 1 tsp (4 g) salt
  • tsp (1 g) pepper
  • 1 (1 ) egg
  • 2 tbsp (15 g) cornstarch

Instructions:

For the Shaping of the Chicken Fries

  1. Add all of the seasonings to the ground chicken and mix.
  2. Spread your ground chicken out on a sheet pan in a layer that is roughly - inches in thickness.
  3. Place it in the freezer for 1-2 hours or until it is solid enough to cut through easily while still maintaining shape.
  4. Cut the chicken into - inch wide strips and 3-4 inches in length. I got 36 chicken fries out of 2 pounds of meat but if you make yours a bit bigger or smaller you may have a different amount, no worries though. There is a table at the bottom of this page to help you figure out the nutrition information if this is the case.
  5. Place the cut chicken fries back into the freezer until they are frozen solid. It will be much easier to work with when they are frozen. You can do these steps the night before if you wish.
  6. Measure out the corn chex and place them into a food processor or a blender to form into a powder. Season lightly with salt.
  7. In a ziplock bag, add some cornstarch and about half of the frozen chicken fries. Shake to coat. Do the same with the remaining chicken fries.
  8. Beat the egg in a shallow dish and mix in a couple of tablespoons of water to thin it out a bit. Set up a breading station with your egg wash, corn chex, and a plate for the breaded fries.
  9. Using one hand as your "wet" hand and one hand as your "dry" hand, dunk the cornstarch coated fries into the egg wash and then coat in corn chex. Knock off any excess breading.
  10. Preheat your air fryer to 400F on the air fry setting for 15 minutes. Place the chicken fries in the air fryer in a single layer spaced about 1-2cm apart. Spray lightly with oil.
  11. Cook the chicken fries for 6-7 minutes, then flip and cook for an additional 6-7 minutes or until they have crisped up properly. It may take more, it make take less depending on your air fryer.
  12. Once you have cooked all of your fries, allow them to cool and store in a ziplock bag in the freezer.
  13. To reheat, turn your air fryer to the reheat setting at 300F and heat for 4-5 minutes or until warm.
  14. NOTE: You can use turkey for this but it doesn't work as well as chicken. The goo stuff (just coagulated proteins) that comes out of turkey when you cook it seep through the breading and make it a bit uglier. It will still work, just knock it off the fries when you flip them and keep cooking. I would try to look for turkey with as little water added as possible to help prevent this

Spicy Chicken Fries

These Chicken Fries are made from ground chicken, coated in a corn chex crust and air fried to create a gluten free, lower calorie chicken fry.

CourseCuisineTime - 2 hours 30 minutes
SnackAmericanPrep - 15 minutes
Cook - 15 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
51kcal36 chicken fries
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates3g30%
Fat2g20%
Protein5g50%

Ingredients:

  • 2 lbs (908 g) ground chicken
  • 1 cup (100 g) ground corn chex
  • 2 tbsp hot sauce
  • tsp (1.5 g) garlic powder
  • tsp (1.5 g) onion powder
  • 1 tsp paprika
  • tsp cayenne pepper
  • 1 tsp (4 g) salt
  • tsp (1 g) pepper
  • 1 (1 ) egg
  • 2 tbsp (15 g) cornstarch

Instructions:

For the Shaping of the Chicken Fries

  1. Add all of the seasonings except the paprika and cayenne to the ground chicken and mix.
  2. Spread your ground chicken out on a sheet pan in a layer that is roughly - inches in thickness.
  3. Place it in the freezer for 1-2 hours or until it is solid enough to cut through easily while still maintaining shape.
  4. Cut the chicken into - inch wide strips and 3-4 inches in length. I got 36 chicken fries out of 2 pounds of meat but if you make yours a bit bigger or smaller you may have a different amount, no worries though. There is a table at the bottom of this page to help you figure out the nutrition information if this is the case. NOTE: the video is just showing you the process, ignore how many it made.
  5. Place the cut chicken fries back into the freezer until they are frozen solid. It will be much easier to work with when they are frozen. You can do these steps the night before if you wish.
  6. Measure out the corn chex and place them into a food processor or a blender to form into a powder. Season lightly with salt and add the cayenne and paprika.
  7. In a ziplock bag, add some cornstarch and about half of the frozen chicken fries. Shake to coat. Do the same with the remaining chicken fries.
  8. Beat the egg in a shallow dish and mix in the hot sauce. Set up a breading station with your egg wash, corn chex, and a plate for the breaded fries.
  9. Using one hand as your "wet" hand and one hand as your "dry" hand, dunk the cornstarch coated fries into the egg wash and then coat in corn chex. Knock off any excess breading.
  10. Preheat your air fryer to 400F on the air fry setting for 15 minutes. Place the chicken fries in the air fryer in a single layer spaced about 1-2cm apart. Spray lightly with oil.
  11. Cook the chicken fries for 6-7 minutes, then flip and cook for an additional 6-7 minutes or until they have crisped up properly. It may take more, it make take less depending on your air fryer.
  12. Once you have cooked all of your fries, allow them to cool and store in a ziplock bag in the freezer.
  13. To reheat, turn your air fryer to the reheat setting at 300F and heat for 4-5 minutes or until warm.
  14. NOTE: You can use turkey for this but it doesn't work as well as chicken. The goo stuff (just coagulated proteins) that comes out of turkey when you cook it seep through the breading and make it a bit uglier. It will still work, just knock it off the fries when you flip them and keep cooking. I would try to look for turkey with as little water added as possible to help prevent this

Maple Sriracha Chicken Wings

Air fried chicken wings coated in a sweet and spicy sauce made from maple syrup and sriracha. These are crispy and flavorful and actually super easy to make.

CourseCuisineTime - 17 minutes
AppetizerAmericanPrep - 5 minutes
Cook - 12 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
85kcal22 wings
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates3.9g32%
Fat5.5g45%
Protein4.9g40%

Ingredients:

  • 2 lbs (908 g) chicken wings
  • 2 tbsp (20 g) cornstarch
  • 5 tbsp (80 g) maple syrup
  • 2 tbsp (30 g) sriracha
  • cooking spray
  • 1 tsp (2 g) ground ginger optional
  • green onions chopped, optional
  • sesame seeds optional
  • salt and pepper to taste

Instructions:

  1. Dry the wings with a paper towel and coat with cornstarch, salt and pepper.
  2. Preheat the air fryer to 400F on the air fryer settings for 12 minutes. Place the wings in and spray with oil. Shake every couple of minutes during the cooking process. If you dont have an air fryer you can try the oven but it wont be as good.
  3. Mix together the syrup, sriracha, and ground ginger in a bowl.
  4. Once the wings have crisped up, add the wings into the sauce bowl and toss. Garnish with green onion and sesame seeds if you want to be fancy.
  5. NOTE: Counting calories in things with bones is not the easiest. The way I did it here was to weigh the wings raw with the bones and then weighed the bones after eating and finding the difference. The estimate is per wing for what I had and I had 20 wings. If you have bigger or smaller wings your mileage may vary.

Cilantro Lime Rice Bowls

These Cilantro Lime Rice Bowls have chicken breasts, zucchini, yellow, squash, tomatoes and rice. They are flavored with cilantro and lime to give a flavorful freshness with every bite.

CourseCuisineTime - 30 minutes 30 minutes 30 minutes
Main DishAmericanPrep - 10 minutes 10 minutes 10 minutes
Cook - 25 minutes 25 minutes 25 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
635kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates63g45%
Fat17g12%
Protein57g41%

Ingredients:

  • 2 lbs (1135 g) boneless skinless chicken breast
  • 1 medium (200 g) onion
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) garlic minced
  • 1 large (250 g) zucchini
  • 1 large (250 g) yellow squash
  • 2 medium (300 g) tomatoes
  • bunch (10 g) cilantro chopped
  • cup (60 g) lime juice
  • 3 tbsp (55 g) olive oil
  • 5 cups (750 g) cooked rice
  • 2 tsp hot sauce optional
  • 15 oz black beans canned
  • salt and pepper to taste

Instructions:

For the Rice

  1. Cook enough rice to yield5cups of cooked rice. 1 cup of dry rice will make around 2-3 cups of cooked rice depending on which type you use.

For the Chicken

  1. Preheat your oven to 400F.
  2. Pound or cut the chicken breast so it is even in thickness throughout. Drizzle lightly with olive oil and season with salt and pepper.
  3. Roast for 20-25 minutes. Don't cook the chicken past 165F. If your chicken is on the thicker side it may take a bit longer.

For the Vegetables

  1. While the chicken and rice are cooking, wash and cut your zucchini, squash, tomatoes, and onion. Cut the zucchini and squash into small, thin slices. Cut the tomatoes into a small dice and cut the onion into slices.
  2. Place the tomatoes in a strainer over a bowl and salt lightly to help pull out the excess water.
  3. Heat a skillet over medium high heat. Add some olive oil. Once hot, add in the onions and allow to brown and develop color.
  4. Add in the garlic, zucchini, and squash, adding more oil if necessary. Cook until the squash has developed color. Add salt and pepper to taste and place into a large mixing bowl.

For the Rice Bowls

  1. Once the chicken has finished cooking, cut it into a small dice. I find smaller pieces work best as they reheat better in the microwave.
  2. Cover the chicken in the hot sauce of your choice and mix. I used about 2 tsp but feel free to use more or less to your taste preferences. Salt lightly. Add to the bowl with the vegetables.
  3. Drain and rinse the black beans. Add to the bowl.
  4. Measure out the rice and mix in 2 tbsp of olive oil, cup of chopped cilantro, and salt to taste. Add to the bowl with the chicken and vegetables.
  5. Add the tomatoes to the bowl.
  6. Pour cup of fresh squeezed lime juice into the bowl and mix thoroughly. Add salt and pepper to taste.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide your ingredients evenly 5 ways.

Protein Pancakes

A gluten free, high protein pancake recipe made from oat flour and a blend of whey and casein protein.

CourseCuisineTime - 10 minutes
Breakfast, Dessert, SnackAmericanPrep - 5 minutes
Cook - 5 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
266kcal4 Pancakes
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates26.7g43%
Fat1.9g3%
Protein35.4g57%

Ingredients:

  • scoop (25 g) vanilla whey/casein blend 50/50 blend. I mix 12.5g of whey and 12.5g of casein together
  • cup (20 g) oat flour
  • 1 tbsp (10 g) tapioca flour or cornstarch
  • 1/4 tsp (1 g) baking powder
  • cup (60 g) liquid egg whites
  • cup (75 g) plain nonfat Greek yogurt
  • 1-2 tbsp (25 g) water

Instructions:

  1. Mix all the dry ingredients together so no clumps are present. NOTE: I have tested this with only whey protein and it doesn't turn out as well. Only casein will work but you may need more water in the batter. The 50/50 blend is best.
  2. Add in the wet ingredients and mix thoroughly.
  3. Heat a griddle/skillet on medium heat and spray with oil. Add the batter and cook for a couple minutes, then flip.

Protein Waffle

A gluten free, high protein waffle made from oat flour and a blend of whey and casein protein.

CourseCuisineTime - 10 minutes
Breakfast, Dessert, SnackAmericanPrep - 5 minutes
Cook - 5 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
183kcal1 Waffle
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates17.9g41%
Fat1.4g3%
Protein25.1g58%

Ingredients:

  • (20 g) scoop vanilla whey/casein blend 50/50 blend
  • 3 tbsp (14 g) oat flour
  • 1 tbsp (6.5 g) tapioca flour
  • tsp (1 g) baking powder
  • 3 tbsp (40 g) liquid egg whites
  • 3 tbsp (50 g) plain nonfat Greek yogurt
  • 1 tbsp (20 g) water

Instructions:

  1. Mix all the dry ingredients together so no clumps are present. NOTE: I have tested this with only whey protein and it doesn't turn out. Only casein will work but you may need more water in the batter. The 50/50 blend is best.
  2. Add in the wet ingredients and mix thoroughly.
  3. Heat an 8 waffle iron on medium heat and spray with oil. Add the batter and cook for a couple minutes.

Sweet Chili Chicken Rice Bowls

These Sweet Chili Chicken Rice Bowls are packed with vegetables including carrots, bell peppers, and green beans. The sweet chili sauce and pineapple chunks make for a spicy and sweet flavor in every bite.

CourseCuisineTime - 40 minutes 40 minutes 40 minutes
Main DishAmerican, meal prepPrep - 10 minutes 10 minutes 10 minutes
Cook - 30 minutes 30 minutes 30 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
624kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates73g54%
Fat16g11%
Protein46g34%

Ingredients:

For the Rice

  • 5 cups (750 g) cooked rice

For the Sweet Chili Sauce

  • cup (45 g) sugar
  • 5 tbsp (75 ml) water
  • 1 tbsp (18 ml) rice vinegar regular vinegar is fine
  • 1 tbsp (18 g) sambal oelek any hot sauce will do, sambal is best
  • 2 tbsp (38 g) ketchup
  • 1 tsp (7 g) cornstarch
  • salt to taste

For the Bowls

  • 2 lbs (1135 g) boneless skinless chicken thighs
  • 1 medium (150 g) red pepper
  • 1 medium (150 g) yellow pepper
  • 12 oz (340 g) green beans fresh
  • 1 cup (375 g) pineapple I used canned chunks, frozen or fresh are great as well
  • 1 cup (100 g) carrots shredded. I buy these pre-shredded.
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) garlic minced
  • salt and pepper to taste
  • 3 tbsp (45 ml) olive oil

Instructions:

For the Rice

  1. Cook enough rice to yield 5 cups of cooked rice. 1 cup of dry rice will make around 2-3 cups of cooked rice depending on which type you use.

For the Chicken

  1. Preheat your oven to 400F.
  2. Drizzle the chicken lightly with olive oil and season with salt and pepper.
  3. Roast for 20-25 minutes. Don't cook the chicken past 165F. If your chicken is on the thicker side it may take a bit longer.

For the Vegetables

  1. Wash and cut your peppers and green beans. Cut the peppers into a large dice and the green beans into " pieces.
  2. You may want to steam your green beans in the microwave for a bit so they can cook through and not be so crisp.
  3. In a large skillet, heat a bit of oil over medium high heat. Add in the carrots and green beans. Cook for 2-3 minutes.
  4. Add in the garlic and stir. Make some room in the pan for the peppers and add a bit more oil. Add in the peppers to the center of the pan and cook until they have begun to soften, around 3-4 minutes.
  5. Place all of the vegetables into a large bowl.

For the Sauce

  1. Add the ketchup, water, vinegar, sugar, and sambal into a small sauce pot and bring to a boil over medium high heat. Stir to dissolve the sugar.
  2. Mix the cornstarch with 1 tsp of water to create a slurry.
  3. Once the sauce has reached a light boil, reduce to a simmer and stir in the cornstarch mixing constantly.
  4. Season with salt to taste.

For the Bowls

  1. Cut the chicken into a small dice.
  2. Pour the sauce over the chicken and coat it evenly.
  3. Add the chicken, rice, and pineapple to the bowl with the vegetables. Mix thoroughly and taste. Season with salt and pepper to your liking. Drizzle in 1 tbsp of olive oil.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide your mixture evenly between 5 containers.

Raspberry Poptarts

A fun, homemade version of a Raspberry Poptarts made from gluten free flours and homemade raspberry jam. I use the air fryer to cook these but an oven works just as well.

CourseCuisineTime - 38 minutes
Breakfast, DessertAmericanPrep - 30 minutes
Cook - 8 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
196kcal2 poptarts
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates34.5g76%
Fat1.9g4%
Protein10.3g22%

Ingredients:

For the Pastry and Filling

  • cup (30 g) brown rice flour oat flour works as well, just not as pretty
  • cup (30 g) tapioca flour
  • 2 tbsp (16 g) vanilla casein
  • tsp (3 g) butter
  • cup (60 ml) water
  • 2 tbsp (30 g) raspberry jam homemade or jarred

For the Frosting

  • 2 tbsp (30 g) plain nonfat Greek yogurt
  • 1 tsp (5 g) vanilla casein
  • 1 tsp (5 g) powdered sugar
  • 1 tsp (4 g) sprinkles

Instructions:

For the Jam

  1. Make the jam or use pre-made. Its just 280g frozen raspberries, 120ml water, 20g of sugar reduced and a bit of cornstarch to thicken. Bring to a boil and mash then thicken with the cornstarch.

For the Pastry

  1. Mix the flours and casein together. Add in the water and butter. Stir to form dough. Place in the freezer for 10 minutes. Gluten free dough is often sticky so the freezer will help it dry out a bit.
  2. Lay out two sheets of wax paper. Spray lightly with oil. Roll out the dough between the paper to 1/8 thick. Trim the edges to form a rectangle. Cut into 4s.
  3. Place a spoonful or so of jam at the center of two of the squares. Place the empty squares on top and press down the edges with your finger and crimp with a fork. It's easiest to use the wax paper to assist you in the folding and then peel the paper away.
  4. Make a ball with your scraps and cook that as well, it's included in the nutrition information so you might as well cook it.
  5. Preheat an air fryer or oven to 325F. Air fry for 8 minutes. Baking might take a bit longer.

For the Frosting

  1. For the frosting just mix everything together. Place in the fridge for a bit to chill.
  2. Top with frosting and sprinkles.

Chimichurri Rice Bowls

Ground turkey, rice, sweet potatoes, and broccoli mixed together and served with a side of chimichurri sauce to go over the top. This meal is incredibly flavorful and a breeze to prep.

CourseCuisineTime - 40 minutes
Main DishAmerican, Argentinian, meal prepPrep - 15 minutes
Cook - 25 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
542kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates43g40%
Fat24g22%
Protein38g36%

Ingredients:

For the Main Dish

  • 2 lbs (908 g) ground turkey 93/7
  • 1 lb (454 g) frozen broccoli
  • 2 cups (300 g) cooked rice
  • 2 medium (500 g) sweet potatoes
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) olive oil
  • salt and pepper to taste

For the Chimichurri

  • cup (25 g) parsley chopped
  • cup (25 g) cilantro chopped
  • cup (60 ml) red wine vinegar
  • 3 tbsp (45 g) olive oil
  • 3 cloves (15 g) garlic
  • 2 tbsp (15 g) shallot minced
  • 1 tbsp (3 g) oregano

Instructions:

For the Rice

  1. Cook enough rice to yield 2 cups of cooked rice. 1 cup of dry rice will make between 2-3 cups of cooked rice depending on what kind you use.

For the Potatoes and Broccoli

  1. Wash and cut your potatoes into a large dice. If your broccoli is in large florets, cut it as well.
  2. I used an air fryer to cook these. Set your air fryer to the air fry setting at 400F. Add the potatoes and spray lightly with oil. Shake every few minutes. Once the potatoes have finished, remove and add the broccoli and cook for 8 minutes.
  3. If you don't have an air fryer, preheat your oven to 425F.
  4. Toss the potatoes in a bit of oil and spread on a sheet pan. Season lightly with salt and pepper. Roast for 10 minutes and then flip.
  5. When you remove the tray to flip the potatoes, add the broccoli and cook an additional 8-10 minutes. If your broccoli has lots of ice on the outside, you may want to use a separate sheet pan so the water that melts off doesn't soak the potatoes.

For the Turkey

  1. Heat a bit of oil in a large skillet over medium high heat. Add the turkey and brown. Cook off any water that remains in the pan. Season lightly with salt and pepper.
  2. Once the rice, broccoli, potatoes, and turkey have all cooked. Mix them all together in a giant bowl/pan. Season to taste.

For the Chimichurri

  1. Wash your parsley and cilantro. Dry with paper towels and cut of the stems. You don't need to pick off all of the leaves, just cut off the stem under the leaves.
  2. Roughly chop the leaves until you have 25 grams ( cup) worth of each.
  3. Peel the garlic and mince the onion until you have 15 grams (2 tbsp) worth.
  4. Place all of the ingredients into a blender or food processor and blend until it is homogenous and all of the ingredients are broken down.

Plating

  1. Divide the chimichurri evenly 5 ways. Store in a smaller separate container to place within your meal prep container. You could just mix in the chimichurri with the food but I find it better to keep on the side.
  2. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide the meat mixture evenly 5 ways between all of your containers.

Garlic Parm Fries

Air fried french fries tossed with fresh garlic and parmesan cheese. These are super flavorful and beautifully crisp. The air fryer makes a wonderful french fry that you'd never know wasn't deep fried.

CourseCuisineTime - 26 minutes
AppetizerAmericanPrep - 10 minutes
Cook - 16 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
224kcal2 servings
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates43.3g83%
Fat2.5g4%
Protein7.2g13%

Ingredients:

  • 2 medium (450 g) potatoes
  • 1 tsp (3 g) salt
  • 1 tsp (2 g) pepper
  • 1 tsp (2 g) paprika
  • 4 cloves (20 g) garlic
  • 1 tbsp (10 g) grated parmesan cheese
  • (2 g) cooking spray
  • 1 tbsp (5 g) chopped parsley optional, for garnish

Instructions:

  1. Wash and cut your potatoes into a thin fry shaped. Around inch wide.
  2. Peel your garlic and mince using a garlic press.
  3. Finely chop the parsley.
  4. Preheat your air fryer on the air fry setting to 385F and the timer for 16 minutes.
  5. In a large bowl, toss the potatoes in the salt, pepper, paprika, and spray lightly with oil.
  6. Once the air fryer has heated, add the potatoes and begin the cooking.
  7. After 5-6 minutes of cooking, add the garlic and parmesan and shake the basket. Shake the basket every 2-3 minutes for the remainder of the cooking time until you get your desired consistency.
  8. Garnish with parsley.

Nutrition Information Notes

  1. I included 2 grams of oil in the nutrition information as that is what I weighed the amount oil spray I used. If you need exact nutrition information, you should calculate it yourself.

Mozzarella Sticks

Mozzarella string cheese breaded with corn chex and air fried to make a gluten free decadent snack. You can freeze these and have them ready to go for whenever you need a quick bite to eat.

CourseCuisineTime - 1 hour
SnackAmericanPrep - 1 hour
Cook - 5 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
64kcal24 sticks
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates4.3g39%
Fat3.4g30%
Protein4g36%

Ingredients:

  • 12 (340 g) mozzarella cheese sticks
  • 1 tbsp (8 g) tapioca flour regular flour or cornstarch is fine
