  • 1 cup (100 g) corn chex ground (or breadcrumbs)
  • tsp (1 g) salt
  • tsp (1 g) pepper
  • tsp (1 g) garlic powder
  • 1 egg

Instructions:

For the Cheese Sticks

  1. Remove the plastic from all of the cheese sticks and cut in half. Place in the freezer until they have frozen solid.

For the Breading

  1. Place the corn chex into a food processor or blender and blend until they resemble the size of breadcrumbs. Mix in the salt, pepper, and garlic powder. Place just over half into a shallow dish.
  2. Place the cornstarch into a ziplock bag.
  3. Crack the egg into a bowl, add a bit of water to thin, and scramble.
  4. Coat the frozen cheese stick in cornstarch and shake off any excess.
  5. Dunk the starch coated cheese stick into the egg wash and then place into the dish with the corn chex. Make sure you allow the excess egg wash to drain off of the cheese before you put it into the dish. Coat with corn chex and place on a plate. Keep one hand for the egg dunk and one hand for the breading, that will keep the corn chex from gunking up on your fingers.
  6. Once all of the cheese sticks have been breaded, give them a second pass through the egg wash and remaining breading. Make sure you get the ends as well to prevent cheese from seeping out.
  7. After breading, place them into the freezer until they have frozen solid. If they aren't frozen throughout the cheese melts too fast when cooking.
  8. Preheat your air fryer to 400F on the air fry setting and set the timer for 6 minutes.
  9. Add the frozen mozzarella sticks to the air fryer and spray lightly with oil. Turn them every 1-2 minutes. This will help you monitor them to ensure they aren't leaking cheese. Pull them out when the outside is golden but before the cheese is leaking out everywhere.

Storage

  1. Allow the mozzarella sticks to cool and then place in a ziplock bag. Remove as much air as possible and seal. Place into the freezer.
  2. To reheat, you can use the microwave or your air fryer. Using the reheat setting on 400 it will take 3-5 minutes to reheat. Again, make sure you check it often to ensure the cheese doesn't seep out.

20 Minute Chicken Bowl

A quick option for dinner if you have the popcorn chicken recipe prepped and in your freezer. This is a copycat version of a meal I used to eat in my college dining hall that was everyone's favorite and similar to the KFC Famous Bowl. If you prep potatoes at the beginning of the week you can have this one ready in the time it takes to reheat the chicken.

CourseCuisineTime - 20 minutes
Main DishAmericanPrep - 5 minutes
Cook - 15 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
539kcal1
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates64g52%
Fat11g9%
Protein46g38%

Ingredients:

For the Bowl

  • 10 pieces popcorn chicken prep ahead of time and freeze
  • cup (40 g) frozen peas
  • 2 tbsp (14 g) shredded cheddar cheese

For the Mashed Potatoes

  • 1 medium (150 g) russet potato
  • cup (40 g) frozen kale optional, fresh is fine
  • 1 tsp (5 g) butter
  • 1 tbsp (20 ml) milk
  • salt and pepper to taste

For the Gravy

  • cup (120 ml) beef broth
  • 1 tbsp (8 g) cornstarch

Instructions:

For the Mashed Potaotes

  1. Fill a small sauce pan with water and bring to a boil.
  2. Wash and cut your potato into a large dice. Add to the boiling water and cook until soft.
  3. Microwave the kale until it has thawed.
  4. Drain the water and add in the butter, milk, kale, and salt and peppper to taste. Mash until smooth.

For the Gravy

  1. In a separate sauce pot, bring the beef broth to a boil.
  2. In a small dish add the cornstarch and stir in an equal amount of water to form a slurry.
  3. Once the broth has boiled, reduce the heat to a simmer and stir in the cornstarch until it has thickened.

For the Bowls

  1. Add 10 pieces of the popcorn chicken to your air fryer. Heat them using the reheat setting at 300F for 8-10 minutes. You can obviously use a microwave as well but they won't stay crispy.
  2. Heat the peas in the microwave.
  3. To construct the bowl put the potatoes on the bottom, layer the peas on top, and then place the chicken on top. Sprinkle the cheese and drizzle the gravy over everything.

P-Corn Chicken

Boneless skinless chicken breasts cut into pieces and coated in flour and corn chex then air fried to make a copycat version of the classic popcorn chicken with only a fraction of the oil.

CourseCuisineTime - 45 minutes
SnackAmericanPrep - 15 minutes
Cook - 30 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
234kcal6 servings
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates19.1g35%
Fat2.9g5%
Protein33g61%

Ingredients:

  • 2 lbs (908 g) boneless skinless chicken breast
  • 1 cups (125 g) corn chex ground (or use breadcrumbs)
  • cup (30 g) tapioca flour cornstarch works as well
  • 2 tsp (6 g) garlic powder
  • 1 tsp (5 g) salt
  • 1 tsp (2 g) pepper
  • 2 eggs
  • cooking spray

Instructions:

For the Chicken

  1. Cut the chicken into 1" cubes.
  2. Place the corn chex into a food processor or blender and blend until they resemble the size of breadcrumbs. Mix in the salt, pepper, and garlic powder. Place just over half into a shallow dish or a ziplock bag. I prefer to use the ziplock bag for ease.
  3. Crack 2 eggs into a bowl, add a bit of water to thin, and scramble.
  4. Coat the chicken with the tapoica flour. You can use a ziplock bag and shake it all together or just sprinkle it over and toss it around.
  5. Dunk the tapioca flour coated chicken into the egg wash and then place into the bag/dish with the corn chex. If you're using the bag method, do half of the chicken each time. Shake to coat adding more corn chex if needed. Make sure you allow the excess egg wash to drain off of the chicken before you put it into the bag. If there is too much egg on the chicken it can cause the breading to clump together. If this happens, you will probably want to dump it out and start over between rounds of coating. With the dish method you can just do them as you go. Keep one hand for the egg dunk and one hand for the breading, that will keep the corn chex from gunking up on your fingers.
  6. I like to set a sheet pan nearby so that I can place the completed pieces on the pan and ready to air fry.
  7. Preheat your air fryer to 400F on the air fry setting and set the timer for 12 minutes.
  8. Spray your fryer basket with a bit of oil and add the chicken in a single layer. Spray the top lightly with oil. Shake the basket every 3-4 minutes, checking to ensure they aren't burning. It will take a couple of rounds to complete. It will take 10-12 minutes to cook.

Storage

  1. Allow your chicken to cool to room temperature and place into a large ziplock bag. Remove as much air as possible and seal. Place into the freezer.
  2. To reheat, you can use the microwave or your airfryer. Using the reheat setting on 400 it will take around 7-8 minutes. Smaller pieces will heat faster and dry out so be cautious.

Nutrition Information Notes

  1. This recipe calls for 125g of corn chex, 2 eggs, and cooking oil spray. I only included 100g of corn chex, 1 egg, and 3g of oil in the nutrition information for the calorie estimate. I wrote the recipe to have 125g of corn chex and 2 eggs so that you are surely going to have enough to coat each piece. If you need exact nutrition information, you should calculate it yourself.
  2. The serving size for these is of the total recipe, for me that was 12 pieces. Depending on how big or small you cut your chicken, you may have more or less pieces.

Buffalo Chicken Rice Bowls

Chicken thighs, rice, mushrooms, zucchini, and onion cooked together and mixed with buffalo sauce. This is a highly palatable meal that is low on the calorie end and fairly satiating making it perfect for meal prep.

CourseCuisineTime - 40 minutes 40 minutes 40 minutes
Main DishAmerican, meal prepPrep - 10 minutes 10 minutes 10 minutes
Cook - 30 minutes 30 minutes 30 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
602kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates46g39%
Fat26g22%
Protein45g38%

Ingredients:

  • 2 lbs (1135 g) boneless skinless chicken thighs
  • 1 tbsp (8 g) chili powder
  • 2 tsp (6 g) salt
  • 1 tsp (2 g) pepper
  • 5 cups (750 g) cooked rice
  • 2 medium (400 g) zucchini
  • 8 oz (227 g) mushrooms
  • medium (100 g) onion
  • cup (56 g) cheddar cheese shredded
  • 3 tbsp (45 g) olive oil
  • 6 tbsp (90 g) buffalo sauce

Instructions:

For the Rice

  1. Cook enough rice to yield 5 cups of cooked rice. 1 cup of dry rice will make around 2-3 cups of cooked rice depending on what kind you use.

For the Chicken

  1. In a large bowl add the chicken, a bit of oil, chili powder, salt, and pepper. Toss to coat.
  2. You can cook your chicken however you like. I baked mine at 425F for 10 minutes and then broiled it on the top rack for 5 minutes to develop color. Cut into 1 inch pieces. If you would rather pan fry it follow the instructions in the next step.
  3. Heat a grill pan or a skillet over medium high heat and add some oil. Cook the chicken thighs for 4-5 minutes on each side. Cut them into a large dice and return to the pan to develop color.

For the Vegetables

  1. Wash and cut your zucchini into a small dice and mushrooms into a large dice. Cut the onion into a small dice.
  2. Heat a large skillet over medium high heat. Add oil and saute the onions for a couple of minutes.
  3. Add a bit more oil and add in the mushrooms, season with salt to help bring out the water. Allow them to cook and develop color.
  4. Add in the zuchinni and cook until soft.
  5. Measure out 3 cups of cooked rice and add to a large bowl. Mix in the chicken, vegetables, cheese, and buffalo sauce. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide your ingredients evenly 5 ways.

Chewy Chocolate Chip Cookies

A gluten free, chewy, chocolate chip cookie made from oat flour, a bit of casein protein powder, and pureed sweet potatoes. These cookies are low calorie and have great flavor for a cookie that has no butter or sugar.

CourseCuisineTime - 16 minutes
DessertAmericanPrep - 10 minutes
Cook - 6 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
55kcal12 cookies
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates8.5g77%
Fat1.3g11%
Protein2.4g21%

Ingredients:

  • cup (50 g) oat flour
  • 2 tbsp (20 g) tapioca flour or cornstarch
  • 3 tbsp (16 g) vanilla casein protein powder
  • cup (140 g) mashed sweet potatoes
  • 3 tbsp (50 g) liquid egg whites
  • 2 tbsp (40 g) mini chocolate chips
  • tsp (2 ml) vanilla
  • tsp splenda optional

Instructions:

For the Cookies

  1. Note: I use metric measurements for any baking recipe I develop. I reccomend you buy a scale and do the same.
  2. Preheat your oven to 350F.
  3. Mix the oat flour, tapioca flour, protein powder (and splenda if you're using it) together until it is fully incorporated.
  4. Add in the remaining ingredients and mix until it forms a dough.
  5. Spray a sheet pan with oil and use a cookie scoop to form each cookie. It will make 12.
  6. Wet your fingers and press each cookie into shape, they will not spread in the oven.
  7. Bake for 6-7 minutes. Let the cookies cool before serving.

Honey Mustard Turkey

Ground turkey flavored with a honey mustard sauce made from Greek yogurt instead of mayo. The turkey is served with a side of roasted broccoli and sweet potatoes.

CourseCuisineTime - 50 minutes 50 minutes 50 minutes
Main DishAmerican, meal prepPrep - 20 minutes 20 minutes 20 minutes
Cook - 30 minutes 30 minutes 30 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
670kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates65g50%
Fat31g24%
Protein33g25%

Ingredients:

For the Turkey

  • 1 lbs (681 g) ground beef 85/15
  • 8 oz (227 g) fresh green beans
  • 3 (20 g) green onions
  • 1 tbsp (22 g) olive oil
  • salt and pepper to taste

For the Honey Mustard

  • cup (60 g) mayo
  • 2 tbsp (42 g) honey
  • 2 tbsp (30 g) mustard I think it's best to use half dijon and half yellow
  • salt to taste

For the Broccoli

  • 1 lb (454 g) broccoli
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) olive oil
  • salt and pepper to taste

For the Sweet Potatoes

  • 3 large (1200 g) sweet potatoes
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) olive oil
  • salt and pepper to taste

Instructions:

For the Sweet Potatoes

  1. Preheat your oven to 425F.
  2. Wash and cut your sweet potatoes into a large dice. Toss in a large bowl with oil, salt, and pepper.
  3. Spread on a sheet pan and roast for 10 minutes, then turn. Cook an additional 10 minutes or until you have achieved your preferred level of browning.

For the Broccoli

  1. Wash and cut your broccoli into florets. Toss with oil, salt, and pepper.
  2. Spread on a sheet pan and roast for 5-7 minutes and turn. Cook an additional 4-5 minutes. If your florets are smaller they will take less time to cook.

For the Turkey

  1. Heat some oil in a large skillet over medium high heat. Add the turkey and brown. Cook off any water remaining.
  2. Season lightly with salt and pepper and remove from pan.
  3. Wash and roughly chop the green beans and onions into small pieces. You can cook these in a separate pan if you want this to go faster.
  4. Once the turkey has finished, add a bit more oil to the pan and cook the onion and green beans together. It may help to add a bit of water to steam the green beans so they cook faster. Cook for a few minutes.
  5. Add the turkey back to the pan and stir to incorporate. Lightly season to taste. Turn off the heat.
  6. In a bowl, mix the yogurt, mustard, and honey together. Stir into the turkey.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide the ingredients evenly between your 5 containers.

Homemade Cinnamon Rolls

I have spent 3 years trying to make a gluten free, yeast free, cinnamon roll that had a similar texture and taste to the real thing. These are sweet, breadlike, and satisfying while using a combination of oat flour, corn starch, and vanilla casein protein.

CourseCuisineTime - 40 minutes
Breakfast, DessertAmericanPrep - 30 minutes
Cook - 10 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
324kcal2 rolls
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates49.2g70%
Fat7.9g11%
Protein14.1g20%

Ingredients:

For the Dough

  • cup (40 g) oat flour
  • 5 tbsp (35 g) cornstarch
  • scoop (23 g) vanilla casein protein
  • tsp (2 g) baking powder
  • cup (80 g) milk
  • 2 tbsp (30 g) liquid egg whites

For the Filling

  • 1 tsp (6 g) butter melted
  • 1 tbsp (18 g) sugar
  • 1 tsp (2 g) cinnamon

For the Frosting

  • 2 tbsp (24 g) whipped cream cheese frosting buy premade, its easier and better

Instructions:

Note

  1. This recipe was developed using a digital scale for measurements. They are far more accurate than volumetric measures and I recommend using a scale for this recipe as the hydration of the dough is crucial. If you use volumetric, and find your dough wet or dry you will have to add more liquid or casein as necessary.

For the Cinnamon Rolls

  1. Preheat your oven to 400F. You can also use the air fryer.
  2. Mix the flours, baking powder, and protein powder together until incorporated. Add in the milk and egg whites. Stir until a dough forms. Place in the fridge for 10-15 minutes to help it set up and become less sticky.
  3. Spread out two large pieces of wax paper. Spray each side with oil.
  4. Place the dough on the wax paper and cover with the other wax paper. Roll the dough out until it is " thick and in a rectangle. You don't want it so thin that it tears and so thick that it can't roll.
  5. Mix the sugar and cinnamon together and melt the butter.
  6. Spread the butter out over the dough and sprinkle in the cinnamon sugar.
  7. Cut the dough in half down the center of the rectangle, long ways.
  8. Lift up the bottom layer of wax paper to help roll the dough into a cylinder. Roll one strip first, then place that at the start of the second strip and continue rolling to create one super roll.
  9. Once you have rolled the dough, cut it in half to make 2 rolls.
  10. Spray a sheet pan, baking dish, or cast iron skillet with oil. Add the rolls to the pan.
  11. Bake for 8-12 minutes in the oven. Watch closely and pull them out when they have just begun to brown on top. If you use the air fryer (how I cook them) it only takes 6 minutes.
  12. Spread the frosting over the top of the rolls. Makes 2 large rolls.

Peanut Butter Cookie Dough Frozen Yogurt

Frozen bananas, Greek yogurt, cookie dough, peanut butter, and maple syrup blended together and frozen to create a refreshing treat that is perfect for summer.

CourseCuisineTime - 1 hour 15 minutes
DessertAmericanPrep - 15 minutes
Cook - null

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
208kcal3 servings
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates35.7g79%
Fat4.2g9%
Protein6.9g15%

Ingredients:

  • 1 medium (125 g) banana frozen, ripe
  • cup (60 g) plain nonfat Greek yogurt
  • 3 tbsp (20 g) powdered peanut butter PB Fit
  • 2 tbsp (28 ml) water
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) sugar free maple syrup

For the Cookie Dough

  • 1 tbsp (12 g) brown sugar
  • 1 tbsp (12 g) sugar
  • 1 tsp (8 g) butter softened
  • 2 tsp (10 ml) water
  • 5 tbsp (35 g) oat flour
  • 1 tbsp (10 g) tapioca flour
  • 1 tsp (6 g) mini chocolate chips
  • 2 drops vanilla

Instructions:

For the Cookie Dough

  1. Cream together the brown sugar, sugar, and butter.
  2. Mix in the water and vanilla then the flours and chips. Stir together until a dough forms.

For the Frozen Yogurt

  1. Place the frozen bananas, PB2 mixture, yogurt, and syrup into a food processor. Blend until smooth.
  2. Place the mixture in to a shallow baking dish. Break up the cookie dough and mix in. Spread evenly. Place in the freezer for an hour or so until it has set.

Serving

  1. This recipe makes 3 servings. It is best to eat it fresh although it can be kept, covered, in the freezer.

Blueberry Frozen Yogurt

Frozen bananas, Greek yogurt, blueberries, and maple syrup blended together and frozen into a low calorie refreshing treat that is perfect for summer.

CourseCuisineTime - 1 hour 10 minutes
DessertAmericanPrep - 10 minutes
Cook - null

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
92kcal3 servings
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates19.7g93%
Fat0.3g1%
Protein2.6g12%

Ingredients:

  • 1 medium (125 g) banana frozen
  • 1 cup (125 g) blueberries frozen
  • cup (60 g) plain nonfat Greek yogurt
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) maple syrup

Instructions:

For the Frozen Yogurt

  1. Place the frozen bananas, blueberries, yogurt, and syrup into a food processor. Blend until smooth.
  2. Place the mixture in to a shallow baking dish and spread evenly. Place in the freezer for an hour or so until it has set.

Serving

  1. This recipe makes 3 servings. It is best to eat it fresh although it can be kept, covered, in the freezer.

Ham & Apple Breakfast Scramble

A hearty breakfast loaded with sweet potatoes, ham, green pepper, golden delicious apples and scrambled eggs. It packs a ton of flavor into every bite to start your day off right.

CourseCuisineTime - 30 minutes 30 minutes 30 minutes
BreakfastAmerican, meal prepPrep - 10 minutes 10 minutes 10 minutes
Cook - 20 minutes 20 minutes 20 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
568kcal4
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates44g41%
Fat28g26%
Protein34g32%

Ingredients:

  • lb (340 g) ham steak
  • 10 eggs
  • cup (60 ml) milk
  • 2 (600 g) large sweet potato
  • (75 g) small onion
  • 1 (125 g) small green pepper
  • 1 (125 g) golden delicious apple
  • 1 (125 g) avocado
  • 2 Tbsp (30 ml) olive oil

Instructions:

  1. Preheat your oven to 400F.
  2. Wash and peel your sweet potato. Cut it into a small/medium dice. Drizzle 1 Tbsp olive oil over the top and roast at 400F for 10 minutes and flip. Cook an additional 5-10 minutes. or until proper browning has been achieved.
  3. Cut the onion and pepper in a small dice. Add some oil to a skillet over medium high heat. Cook until the onions are soft and translucent. Remove from pan.
  4. Scramble 6 eggs with the milk and cook over medium heat until cooked. Set aside.
  5. Cut the ham into a large dice and saut in skillet until browned.
  6. Cut the apple into a large dice. Dont cook this as it will cook in the microwave and you want it to maintain texture.
  7. Add all of you ingredients (minus the avocado) into the pan and stir to incorporate.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 4 servings. Divide your ingredients evenly between your 4 containers. Top with a few slices of avocado if desired.

Lil Blueberry Pancake Bites

Pancake batter poured into a mini muffin tin and baked to create a similar flavor and texture to pancakes. Bake these, throw them in the freezer, and reheat them whenever you need in the microwave. Serve with a side of maple syrup.

CourseCuisineTime - 20 minutes
Breakfast, SnackAmericanPrep - 10 minutes
Cook - 9 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
28kcal24 bites
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates4.4g73%
Fat0.3g5%
Protein2g33%

Ingredients:

  • 1 cup (100 g) oat flour
  • cup (25 g) tapioca flour corn starch would probably work
  • 1 scoop (30 g) vanilla casein protein powder I use the brand Optimum Nutrition but micellar casein will work
  • cup (130 g) liquid egg whites
  • cup (45 g) frozen blueberries small ones work best
  • 1 tsp (4 g) baking powder
  • 10 tbsp (150 ml) water cup + 2 tbsp

Instructions:

For the Pancake Bites

  1. Preheat your oven to 325F.
  2. In a large bowl, mix together all of the dry ingredients until no clumps remain. It is easiest for later if your bowl has a spout on it, not required however.
  3. NOTE: I'm sure many of you will ask me if you can swap the casein with whey or leave it out all together. No, do not omit the casein and absolutely do not substitute with whey. Your pancake bites will become hockey pucks. A lot of the sweetness comes from the protein powder, do not leave it out. I have attempted this recipe by adding sugar in place of the protein powder and it does not work. The casein adds an airy quality that is not present when only oat flour is used. You can probably use wheat flour and omit the casein but add in some kind of sweetener.
  4. Add in the water, egg whites, and 1 tbsp of blueberries. Mix until incorporated and your batter is pourable.
  5. Spray a mini muffin tin with cooking spray. Make sure to coat all sides of the well.
  6. If your bowl doesn't have a spout you may find it easiest to transfer the batter into a large ziplock bag to use as a piping bag. Cut off the corner to fill each well of your mini muffin tin.
  7. Fill each well about half way with batter. This recipe makes 24 bites. Top each bite with the remaining blueberries.
  8. Bake for 9-10 minutes.

Storage

  1. Once the bites have completely cooled, place them in a ziplock bag and remove as much air as possible. Store in the freezer.
  2. Reheat the bites in the microwave and serve with maple syrup.

Sriracha Ranch Turkey Bowls

Ground turkey flavored with ranch dressing mix, sriracha, and rice vinegar and served with a side of sauteed onions and zucchini. This is a quick dish for those weeks you don't want to spend time in the kitchen.

CourseCuisineTime - 30 minutes 30 minutes 30 minutes
Main DishAmerican, Asian, meal prepPrep - 5 minutes 5 minutes 5 minutes
Cook - 25 minutes 25 minutes 25 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
659kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates54g42%
Fat32g25%
Protein40g31%

Ingredients:

For the Turkey

  • 2 lbs (908 g) ground beef 85/15
  • 2 tbsp (24 g) ranch dressing mix
  • 2 tbsp (30 ml) rice vinegar
  • 2 tbsp (30 ml) sriracha
  • 1 tsp (5 ml) olive oil
  • Salt and pepper to taste

For the Rice

  • 5 cups (750 g) cooked rice

For the Zucchini and Onions

  • 2 small (300 g) sweet onions
  • 2 medium (500 g) zucchinis
  • 1 tbsp (15 ml) olive oil
  • 1 tsp (3 g) garlic powder
  • salt and pepper to taste

Instructions:

For the Rice

  1. Cook enough rice to yield 5 cups of cooked rice. 1 cup of dry rice will yield around 2-3 cups of cooked rice depending on what kind of rice you use.

For the Turkey

  1. Heat a bit of olive oil in a large skillet over medium high heat. Add the turkey and cook until it has browned. Boil off any water that remains in the skillet from the turkey.
  2. Mix the vinegar, ranch mix, and sriracha together. Pour over the turkey and stir to incorporate. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

For the Zucchini and Onions

  1. Peel your oniona and cut into thin slices. Heat some oil over medium high heat in a skillet and add the onions. Cook them until they have begun to caramelize. Season with salt and pepper.
  2. Wash and cut the zucchini into a large dice. Add some oil to the pan and cook for a few minutes until they have begun to soften and develop color. Season with salt, pepper, and garlic powder to taste.
  3. You can cook the onions and zucchini together if you wish, they are separated in the image to show detail.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide your ingredients evenly 5 ways. Add 1 cup of rice to each dish.

For the Beef

  1. Heat a bit of olive oil in a large skillet over medium high heat. Add the beef and cook until it has browned. Boil off any water that remains in the skillet from the beef.
  2. Mix the vinegar, ranch mix, and sriracha together. Pour over the beef and stir to incorporate. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

Pepper Jack Turkey Breakfast Bowls

Ground turkey topped with a slice of melty pepper jack cheese and served with a side of potatoes o'brien and 2 hardboiled eggs.

CourseCuisineTime - 40 minutes 40 minutes 40 minutes
BreakfastAmerican, meal prepPrep - 10 minutes 10 minutes 10 minutes
Cook - 30 minutes 30 minutes 30 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
607kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates39g33%
Fat30g26%
Protein46g40%

Ingredients:

For the Turkey

  • 2 lbs (908 g) ground turkey 93/7
  • 6 tbsp (100 g) tomato paste
  • cup (60 g) ketchup
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) dijon mustard
  • 1 tbsp (15 ml) olive oil
  • cup (120 ml) water
  • Salt and pepper to taste
  • 3 slices (75 g) pepper jack cheese

For the Potatoes O'Brien

  • 5 small (750 g) potatoes
  • 2 medium (300 g) bell peppers
  • medium (100 g) onion
  • 1 tbsp (23 ml) olive oil
  • Salt and pepper to taste

For the Eggs

  • 10 eggs

Instructions:

For the Hard Boiled Eggs

  1. Place 10 eggs in to a sauce pot and cover with water and a splash or two of vinegar.
  2. Bring to a boil and cover with a tight fitting lid. Remove from the heat and set a timer for 12 minutes.
  3. Drain the water and rinse with cold water to stop the cooking. Peel the eggs and cut them in half.

For the Potatoes

  1. Preheat your oven to 425F.
  2. Wash and cut your potatoes, peppers, and onion into a small dice. Toss in a bowl with olive oil, salt, and pepper until everything has been coated evenly.
  3. Spread out on a sheet pan or two and bake for 10-12 minutes, remove from the oven and flip. Return to the oven for another 8-10 minutes or until proper browning is achieved.

For the Turkey

  1. Heat some olive oil over medium high heat. Add in the turkey and cook until it has browned and any remaining water has been boiled off.
  2. Add in the tomato paste, ketchup, mustard, and water. Stir to incorporate. Allow it to cook for a few minutes so that the flavors can come together.
  3. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide your ingredients evenly between your 5 containers. Add a slices of pepper jack cheese to the top of the turkey mixture.

Sloppy Joe Breakfast Bowls

Sloppy Joes in breakfast form. This recipe uses ground turkey coated in a sweet tomato based sauce and paired with roasted sweet potatoes and hard boiled eggs.

CourseCuisineTime - 40 minutes 40 minutes 40 minutes
BreakfastAmerican, meal prepPrep - 10 minutes 10 minutes 10 minutes
Cook - 30 minutes 30 minutes 30 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
688kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates49g38%
Fat35g27%
Protein44g34%

Ingredients:

  • 1 lbs (681 g) Ground beef 85/15
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) Olive Oil
  • 1 medium (150 g) Green Bell Pepper
  • medium (100 g) Sweet Onion
  • cup (74 g) Tomato Paste
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) Worcestershire Sauce
  • 1 Tbsp (15 g) Dijon Mustard
  • 3 Tbsp (45 g) Ketchup
  • 1 Tbsp (5 g) Onion Powder
  • 1 tsp (3 g) Red Pepper Flakes
  • 12 Hardboiled Eggs
  • 4 medium (1000 g) Sweet Potato
  • Salt and pepper to taste

Instructions:

For the Potatoes

  1. Preheat your oven to 425F. Cut potatoes into a small/medium dice. Roast with tbsp oil for 20 minutes. Flip half way. Cook until you get optimal browning.

For the Turkey

  1. Cut the pepper and onion into a small dice. Add Tbsp of olive oil in a skillet and add the pepper and onion. Cook until translucent and add the ground turkey. Cook until browned.
  2. Once the turkey has cooked, stir in tomato paste, Worcestershire sauce, Dijon mustard, ketchup, onion powder, red pepper flakes, and salt and pepper.

For the Hard Boiled Eggs

  1. Place 10 eggs in a pot of water and bring to a boil. Once boiling, turn off the heat and cover for 12 minutes. Rinse with cold water and peel.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide your ingredients eveny 5 ways. 1 dish will only get 4 egg halves.

5 Minute Carrot Cake

A gluten free, lower calorie Carrot Cake made in the microwave. This cake uses applesauce instead of oil and oat flour instead of wheat flour. I use whipped cream cheese frosting but you can also make a lower calorie version from fat free cream cheese and Greek yogurt.

CourseCuisineTime - 5 minutes
DessertAmericanPrep - 3 minutes
Cook - 2 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
242kcal1 cake
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates36g67%
Fat6g11%
Protein11g20%

Ingredients:

Dry Ingredients

  • 2 tbsp (10 g) oat flour
  • 1 tbsp (8 g) vanilla protein powder
  • tsp (1 g) cinnamon
  • tsp (.5 g) ginger
  • tsp (.5 g) nutmeg
  • 1 tsp (1 g) baking powder
  • 2 tbsp (30 g) egg whites
  • tsp (2 ml) vanilla
  • 2 tbsp (25 g) grated carrots
  • 2 tbsp (35 g) unsweetened applesauce
  • 2 tsp (8 g) brown sugar

For the Frosting

  • 2 tbsp (24 g) whipped Cream Cheese Frosting

Instructions:

  1. Wash a carrot and shred or grate using a box grater or microplane.
  2. Squeeze the carrots with a paper towel to get some of the water out.
  3. In a mug, mix the applesauce, egg whites, and vanilla together. Then mix in the whey, baking powder and spices individually and stir vigorously. You want to make sure these are well dissolved.
  4. Mix in the flour and sugar and stir. Add in the carrots last.
  5. Microwave for 2-2.5 minutes and remove from mug onto a plate.
  6. Let it cool to room temperature before eating or frosting.

Naked Nashville Hot Chicken

Grilled chicken breasts coated in a classic Nashville Hot Chicken sauce made. It is spicy with a touch of sweetness and loads of flavor. This meal is served with a side of roasted potatoes and vegetables.

CourseCuisineTime - 45 minutes 45 minutes 45 minutes
Main DishAmerican, meal prepPrep - 15 minutes 15 minutes 15 minutes
Cook - 30 minutes 30 minutes 30 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
664kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates71g47%
Fat13g8%
Protein65g43%

Ingredients:

For the Chicken and Sauce

  • 3 lbs (1362 g) boneless skinless chicken breast
  • 1 tbsp (15 ml) olive oil
  • 3 tbsp (45 g) vinegar based hot sauce I use Franks Red Hot
  • 1 tsp (3 g) cayenne pepper
  • 1 tsp (3 g) chili powder
  • 2 tsp (8 g) garlic powder
  • 3 tbsp (36 g) brown sugar
  • 1 tbsp (15 ml) water
  • Salt and pepper to taste

For the Potatoes

  • 10 small (1500 g) russet potatoes
  • 5 tbsp (30 ml) olive oil
  • Salt and pepper to taste

For the Vegetables

  • 1 lb (454 g) frozen peas and carrots
  • 1 tbsp (14 g) butter
  • Salt and pepper to taste

Instructions:

For the Potatoes

  1. Preheat your oven to 425F.
  2. Wash and cut your potatoes into a large dice.
  3. Toss the potatoes with 1 tbsp of oil and salt and pepper. Spread on a sheet pan and bake for 12 mintues and then remove from oven and flip. Cook an additional 10-15 minutes or until you have achieved proper browning.

For the Chicken

  1. Cut your chicken breast into thin pieces. I prefer to cut mine into pieces about " thick and 1-2 inches in length and width.
  2. Toss the chicken in oil to evenly coat each side and lightly season with salt and pepper.
  3. Heat a grill pan or skillet over medium high heat. Cook the chicken for a couple of minutes on each side until it has cooked throughout.

For the Sauce

  1. Mix the hot sauce, cayenne pepper, chili powder, garlic powder, brown sugar, and water together.
  2. Heat a skillet over medium heat. Add the sauce and bring to a light boil. We are just trying to caramalize the sugars a bit so it thickens, we don't want to reduce the sauce too much.
  3. Add in the chicken and stir to coat.

For the Vegetables

  1. Microwave the frozen peas and carrots and add 1 tbsp of butter and salt and pepper to taste.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide your ingredients evenly 5 ways.

Sweet Potato Tortillas

A chewy, stretchy tortilla made from pureed sweet potatoes, tapioca flour, and oat flour. This is a wonderful alternative to flour tortillas if you can't consume any gluten.

CourseCuisineTime - 30 minutes
SnackAmericanPrep - 20 minutes
Cook - 10 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
73kcal10 tortillas
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates16.8g105%
Fat0.3g1%
Protein0.9g5%

Ingredients:

  • cup (175 g) pureed sweet potato
  • cup (100 g) tapioca flour
  • cup (45 g) oat flour
  • 1 tsp (4 g) salt

Instructions:

For the Potato

  1. You need to cook your sweet potato first. Poke holes in the potato with a fork and either roast it or microwave it until it has cooked through and is soft.
  2. Remove the skin and place into a food processor or blender until it is completely smooth.

For the Tortillas

  1. This recipe was developed using metric measurements. I reccomend you do the same if you want the dough to come out correctly. If you use cup measures, you'll likely have to go by feel. Add flour or potatoes until you have a playdo like consistency.
  2. Mix the sweet potato puree, flours, and salt until the dough comes together.
  3. Portion out the dough into 1 oz (ping pong ball size) balls and press into shape with a tortilla press or the bottom of a skillet. It will make 10.
  4. Cook in a dry skillet until it has browned lightly on each side.

Monster Cookie Skillet

A combination of sweet potato puree, a combination of flours, and M&Ms mixed together and baked in a cast iron skillet to make a lower calorie, satisfying cookie alternative.

CourseCuisineTime - 19 minutes
DessertAmericanPrep - 5 minutes
Cook - 14 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
411kcal1
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates72.3g79%
Fat8.3g9%
Protein11.8g12%

Ingredients:

Wet Ingredients

  • cup (55 g) unsweetened applesauce
  • 3 tbsp (50 g) sweet potato puree
  • 3 tbsp (50 g) egg whites
  • tsp (2 ml) vanilla

Dry Ingredients

  • cup (37 g) oat flour
  • 1 heaping tbsp (10 g) tapioca flour any starch works
  • 1 tbsp (7.5 g) coconut flour
  • tsp (.5 g) baking soda
  • 1 tsp (3 g) stevia
  • 2 tbsp (25 g) M&M's

Instructions:

  1. You first need to cook your sweet potato. You can either roast this in the oven or poke a few holes in it with a fork and microwave it. After it has cooked, peel it and and puree it in a blender or food processor until it is smooth.
  2. Preheat your oven to 375. Note that when I develop these recipes I use metric measurements. I reccomend you do the same for accuracy.
  3. Mix all of the wet ingredients together in a bowl. Mix all of the dry ingredeints, except for the M&M's in a separate bowl.
  4. Combine the wet and dry ingredients and mix in the M&M's.
  5. Spray a 6-inch cast iron skillet (any baking dish works but cast iron is cooler ) with oil and add in the mixture. Spread it evenly in the skillet.
  6. Bake for 12-14 minutes or until it has cooked through in the center. You can use a thermometer if you wish. You know it's done when it is at least 170F.

Apple Pie Baked Oatmeal

Sliced Apples cooked in reduced brown sugar and cinnamon and layered inside of an oatmeal and egg mixture. This is a great meal for those weeks you prefer something sweet to have in the morning.

CourseCuisineTime - 50 minutes
BreakfastAmerican, meal prepPrep - 10 minutes
Cook - 40 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
361kcal6
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates52g65%
Fat9g11%
Protein18g22%

Ingredients:

  • 3 cups (240 g) old fashioned oats
  • 2 scoops (60 g) vanilla protein powder
  • 1 tsp (4 g) baking powder
  • 4 medium (600 g) apples peeled
  • cup (48 g) brown sugar
  • 1 tbsp (8 g) cinnamon
  • 2 tbsp (28 g) butter
  • 2 eggs
  • 2 cups (480 g) skim milk
  • 5 tbsp (60 g) vanilla Greek yogurt optional for frosting

Instructions:

For the Apples

  1. Wash and peel the apples. Cut them in half and remove the cores. Cut them into thin slices.
  2. Heat a large skillet over medium heat. Add 1 tbsp of butter and then add the apples.
  3. Sprinkle the cinnamon and brown sugar over the top. Cook until the sugar has reduced and the apples have become soft.

For the Oatmeal Bake

  1. Preheat your oven to 375F.
  2. In a large bowl, mix together the oats, protein powder, and baking powder.
  3. In a separate bowl, whisk together the eggs, milk, and 1 tbsp of melted butter. Pour over the top of the apples and oats and mix.
  4. Spray a 13"x9" pan with oil and add the oat mixture and apples.
  5. Bake for 30-35 minutes.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 6 servings. Cut the oatmeal into 6 equal pieces. You can use vanilla greek yogurt as a frosting if you wish.

Carrot Cake Cupcakes

A gluten free, lower calorie Carrot Cake Cupcake. These cupcakes use applesauce instead of oil and oat flour instead of wheat flour. I use regular cream cheese frosting but you can also make a lower calorie version from fat free cream cheese and Greek yogurt.

CourseCuisineTime - 40 minutes
DessertAmericanPrep - 20 minutes
Cook - 20 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
202kcal14 muffins
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates30.9g73%
Fat6g14%
Protein6.2g14%

Ingredients:

Dry Ingredients

  • 1 cups (150 g) oat flour
  • 1/3 cup (50 g) tapioca flour or corn starch
  • 2 small scoops (50 g) vanilla whey protein powder
  • 2 tsp (6 g) cinnamon
  • 1 tsp (3 g) ginger
  • 1 tsp (3 g) nutmeg
  • 3 tsp (12 g) baking powder

Wet Ingredients

  • 4 eggs
  • 2 tsp (8 ml) vanilla
  • 1/2 lb (227 g) grated carrots
  • 1 cup (226 g) unsweetened applesauce
  • 1/4 cup (48 g) brown sugar

For the Frosting

  • 1 cup (280 g) Cream Cheese Frosting

Instructions:

  1. Preheat your oven to 350F.
  2. Wash 3-4 large carrots and shred using a grater. The smallest shredding option you have is best, not grated though. Squeeze the carrots with a paper towel to get some of the water out.
  3. In a large bowl, mix (sift if you can) together the dry ingredients.
  4. NOTE: You can probably sub the oat and tapioca flour for an equal amount of wheat flour but I have never tested it. Any protein powder should also work.
  5. In a separate bowl mix together the wet ingredients. Make sure all of the egg whites have incorporated.
  6. Combine the wet ingredients and the dry ingredients until incorporated.
  7. Prepare a muffin tin. Use muffin liners or don't, it doesnt matter. Spray before you fill though regardless of if you use the liners or not. Fill each well - full. Makes 14 cupcakes.
  8. NOTE: I know 14 is an awkward number as most muffin tins have 12 but that is just the way the recipe came out. You could probably distribute between the wells and make the cupcakes bigger. You could also microwave the remaining batter to eat while you wait for the others to bake.
  9. Bake for 20 minutes at 350F or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.
  10. Allow to cool and then top each with 20g of frosting.

Chicken Nuggets

Ground chicken breaded in cornflakes and baked to make the perfect high protein, freezer friendly, and tasty snack.

CourseCuisineTime - 35 minutes
SnackAmericanPrep - 15 minutes
Cook - 20 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
40kcal48 nuggets
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates2.5g41%
Fat1.5g25%
Protein3.9g65%

Ingredients:

  • 2 lb (908 g) ground chicken 92/8
  • 2 tsp (6 g) salt
  • 4 tsp (12 g) garlic powder
  • 2 tsp (4 g) pepper
  • cup (20 g) oat flour any flour works
  • 2 cup (120 g) ground cornflakes ground into breadcrumb like consistency, about 2 cups of whole cornflakes

Instructions:

For the Cornflake Breading

  1. Measure out the cornflakes and place them into a food processor or blender. Blend until you reach a consistency similar to panko breadcrumbs. It may be nice to make a bit extra just in case.

For the Nuggets

  1. Preheat your oven to 400F.
  2. Mix the seasonings and flour into the ground chicken until incorporated.
  3. Pour the cornflake breading into a shallow dish that will allow you to coat the chicken.
  4. Using a small cookie scoop, or about half of a regular sized one, scoop the chicken into balls and place into the cornflakes. I find the easiest way to bread them is to scoop a bit of cornflakes over the top, press the ball down and then cover the remaining edges with cornflakes. Then you can place the nugget into your palm and shape it so that it is symmetrical.
  5. Place the nuggets on a wire rack on top of a sheet pan. If you don't have a wire rack, place them directly on a sheet pan sprayed with oil. The rack will allow for air circulation and lead to a crispier nugget. No worries if you don't have one though, it will still work.
  6. Bake the nuggets for 10 minutes, remove from oven and flip. Bake an additional 10 minutes.

Storage

  1. Once the nuggets have cooled, place them into a large ziplock bag and remove as much air as possible. Label and date the bag and place into the freezer. Reheat in the microwave as desired.

Maple Buffalo Chicken with Roasted Potatoes

Pan fried chicken thighs tossed with a mixture of buffalo sauce and maple syrup. This dish is served with a side of green beans and roasted potatoes. The sweetness of the maple syrup and the tangyness of the buffalo sauce makes an unconventional pairing that creates a perfect savory and sweet flavor profile.

CourseCuisineTime - 50 minutes 50 minutes 50 minutes
Main DishAmerican, meal prepPrep - 10 minutes 10 minutes 10 minutes
Cook - 40 minutes 40 minutes 40 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
661kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates70g51%
Fat22g16%
Protein45g32%

Ingredients:

For the Chicken and Sauce

  • 2 lbs (1135 g) boneless skinless chicken thighs
  • 1 tbsp (15 ml) olive oil
  • cup (60 g) buffalo sauce
  • 3 tbsp (60 g) maple syrup
  • salt and pepper to taste

For the Potatoes

  • 5 large (1500 g) russet potatoes
  • 2 tbsp (30 ml) olive oil
  • 8 oz (227 g) mushrooms
  • salt and pepper to taste

For the Green Beans

  • 1 lb (454 g) green beans fresh or frozen

Instructions:

For the Potatoes

  1. Preheat the oven to 450F.
  2. Wash and cut your potatoes and mushrooms into a medium dice. The smaller you cut the faster they will roast.
  3. In a large bowl, add the potatoes, olive oil, and a bit of salt and pepper. Toss to coat and place on a large sheet pan.
  4. Roast for 10-15 minutes and remove from the oven. Flip the potatoes and add the mushrooms. Cook an additional 10 minutes or until you have achieved the crispiness you desire.

For the Chicken

  1. Heat some oil in a large grill pan or skillet over medium high heat.
  2. Add the chicken thighs and cook for 3-4 minutes on each side. You know they are ready to turn when the white starts to creep up around the side of the thigh. Cook in batches to not overcrowd the pan.
  3. While the chicken is cooking, stir together the buffalo sauce and syrup in a bowl.
  4. Chop the chicken into 1 inch pieces and return to the pan to develop color on all sides of the meat.
  5. Pour the sauce over and mix to incorporate.

For the Green Beans

  1. If you use frozen green beans, cook them in the microwave until they are thawed. If you use fresh, steam them until they are soft.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide your ingredients evenly 5 ways.

Cheeseburger Mac & Roasted Brocc

This dish is a play on the classic boxed hamburger helper. This specific version uses brown rice penne, ground beef, spinach, and carrots to increase the nutrient density of the meal.

CourseCuisineTime - 45 minutes 45 minutes 45 minutes
Main DishAmerican, meal prepPrep - 10 minutes 10 minutes 10 minutes
Cook - 35 minutes 35 minutes 35 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
743kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates74g50%
Fat31g21%
Protein42g28%

Ingredients:

For the Pasta

  • 1 lbs (681 g) ground beef 85/15
  • medium (100 g) onion
  • 1 cup (100 g) shredded carrots
  • 5 tbsp (75 g) tomato paste
  • tsp (2 g) garlic powder
  • tsp (2 g) chili powder
  • 1 tbsp (5 g) oat flour wheat flour is fine
  • 2 cups (480 ml) vegetable broth
  • 2 cups (480 ml) milk 2%
  • 12 oz (340 g) brown rice penne Any pasta will work. I use Trader Joes Brown Rice Penne
  • cup (56 g) cheddar cheese shredded
  • 3 cups (90 g) spinach
  • Salt and pepper to taste

For the Broccoli

  • 3 cups (510 g) broccoli 1-2 bunches
  • 1 tbsp (22 g) olive oil
  • Salt and pepper to taste

Instructions:

For the Pasta

  1. Heat a large pot over medium high heat and add in the ground beef to brown.
  2. Cut the onion and carrots into a small dice. Cut the spinach into smaller pieces to break up the leaves. I use shredded carrots to make the chopping easier but regular carrots also work.
  3. Once the beef has browned, add in the onion and carrots and cook for 4-5 minutes.
  4. Add in the tomato paste, vegetable broth, milk, oat flour, chili powder, and garlic powder. Stir to incorporate and raise the heat to bring to a boil.
  5. Once the pot has begun to boil, add in the pasta, reduce the heat to low and cover. Cook for 7-10 minutes or until the noodles have softened. Cook times will vary depending on the type of pasta you use.
  6. If you find that there is still a lot of liquid remaining in the pot, remove the lid and allow some of the liquid to boil off.
  7. Add the cheese and spinach to the pot. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

For the Broccoli

  1. Preheat your oven to 450F.
  2. Wash and cut your broccoli into florets. Toss in 1 tbsp of olive oil. Spread the broccoli on to a couple of sheet pans.
  3. Cook the broccoli for 10 minutes then remove from the oven and turn. Cook for an additional 5-7 minutes.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide your ingredients evenly between 5 containers.

Lil Chocolate Chip Pancake Bites

Pancake batter poured into a mini muffin tin and baked to create a similar flavor and texture to pancakes. Bake these, throw them in the freezer, and reheat them whenever you need in the microwave. Serve with a side of maple syrup.

CourseCuisineTime - 20 minutes
Breakfast, SnackAmericanPrep - 10 minutes
Cook - 9 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
34kcal24 bites
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates4.9g81%
Fat0.7g11%
Protein2g33%

Ingredients:

  • 1 cup (100 g) oat flour
  • cup (25 g) tapioca flour or corn starch
  • 1 scoop (30 g) vanilla casein protein powder I use the brand Optimum Nutrition but micellar casein will work
  • cup (130 g) liquid egg whites
  • 2 tbsp (30 g) mini chocolate chips
  • 1 tsp (4 g) baking powder
  • cups (150 ml) water

Instructions:

For the Pancake Bites

  1. Preheat your oven to 325F.
  2. In a large bowl, mix together all of the dry ingredients until no clumps remain. It is easiest for later if your bowl has a spout on it, not required however.
  3. NOTE: I'm sure many of you will ask me if you can swap the casein with whey or leave it out all together. No, do not omit the casein and absolutely do not substitute with whey. Your pancake bites will become hockey pucks. A lot of the sweetness comes from the protein powder, do not leave it out. I have attempted this recipe by adding sugar in place of the protein powder and it does not work. The casein adds an airy quality that is not present when only oat flour is used. You can probably use wheat flour and omit the casein but add in some kind of sweetener.
  4. Add in the water, egg whites, and 1 tbsp of chocolate chips. Mix until incorporated and your batter is pourable.
  5. Spray a mini muffin tin with cooking spray. Make sure to coat all sides of the well.
  6. If your bowl doesn't have a spout you may find it easiest to transfer the batter into a large ziplock bag to use as a piping bag. Cut off the corner to fill each well of your mini muffin tin.
  7. Fill each well about half way with batter. This recipe makes 24 bites. Top each bite with the remaining chocolate chips.
  8. Bake for 9-10 minutes.

Storage

  1. Once the bites have completely cooled, place them in a ziplock bag and remove as much air as possible. Store in the freezer.
  2. Reheat the bites in the microwave and serve with maple syrup.

Shrimp and Sausage Skillet

Kielbasa sausage and shrimp paired with a mixture of peppers, onions, and zucchini. This dish is lighter, graviless jambalaya to help keep the caloric load down but the creole flavors still present.

CourseCuisineTime - 40 minutes 40 minutes 40 minutes
Main DishAmericanPrep - 10 minutes 10 minutes 10 minutes
Cook - 30 minutes 30 minutes 30 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
705kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates54g39%
Fat30g21%
Protein54g39%

Ingredients:

  • 2 lb (908 g) shrimp buy peeled and deveined, it's worth it
  • 14 oz (397 g) Kielbasa sausage
  • medium (100 g) sweet onion
  • 2 medium (500 g) zucchinis
  • 2 medium (300 g) red bell peppers
  • 2 Tbsp (30 ml) olive oil
  • 4 tsp (12 g) Cajun seasioning
  • Salt and pepper to taste
  • 5 cups (750 g) cooked rice

Instructions:

For the Rice

  1. Cook enough rice to yield 5 cups of cooked rice. 1 cup dry will yield around 3 cups of cooked depending on the type of rice you use.

For the Skillet

  1. Peel and devein all of your shrimp if needed. Pat them dry with a paper towel and season with around 2 tsp of cajun seasoning.
  2. Heat a skillet over medium high heat and add 1 Tbsp of olive oil. Add the shrimp and cook until both sides are pink. Remove from pan.
  3. Cut the onion and pepper into a large dice. Add 1 Tbsp of olive oil to the skillet and cook the onion and pepper become soft. Remove from pan and set aside.
  4. Cut the zucchini into a large dice and the kielbasa into discs. Add to the skillet and cook until the kielbasa begins to brown.
  5. Combine all of your ingredients into one skillet. Season with cajun seasoning, salt, and pepper to taste. The kielbasa sausage will provide a lot of flavor to this dish on its own.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide your ingredients evenly 5 ways into each of your containers and add 1 cup of rice to each.

Chicken Nourish Bowls

Grilled chicken thighs with shaved Brussels sprouts, bell peppers, and sweet potatoes. This is a simple recipe with only a handful of ingredients but provides a lot of variety of flavors.

CourseCuisineTime - 40 minutes 40 minutes 40 minutes
Main DishAmerican, meal prepPrep - 10 minutes 10 minutes 10 minutes
Cook - 30 minutes 30 minutes 30 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
569kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates44g37%
Fat20g17%
Protein52g44%

Ingredients:

  • 2 lbs (1135 g) boneless skinless chicken thighs
  • 3 large (900 g) sweet potatoes
  • 12 oz (340 g) Brussels sprouts shaved
  • 1 medium (200 g) sweet onion
  • 1 medium (300 g) bell peppers
  • 2 tsp (4 g) cumin
  • 1 tbsp (8 g) chili powder
  • 4 tbsp (45 g) olive oil
  • 10 tbsp (300 g) salsa buy your favorite jarred salsa

Instructions:

For the Sweet Potatoes

  1. Preheat your oven to 400F.
  2. Wash and cut your potatoes into a large dice. I leave the skin on, feel free to remove it if you wish.
  3. Toss the potatoes in 2 tbsp of olive oil and lightly season with salt and pepper.
  4. Bake for 10 minutes, remove from the oven and stir. Bake for an additional 8-10 minutes or until you have reached your desired level of doneness. If you want your potatoes to develop color, don't over crowd the pan and give them time to brown before turning.

For the Chicken

  1. Heat a large skillet or grill pan over medium high heat. Add in tbsp of olive oil.
  2. Season the chicken lightly with salt and pepper. Add it into the pan and cook for about 4 minutes on each side. You know the chicken is ready to turn when the white has started to creep up around the edges of the thigh. Cook the chicken in batches if necessary, you don't want to overcrowd the pan.
  3. Remove the chicken from the pan and cut into a large dice. Return to the pan to develop color on all sides of the meat. Add in the cumin and chili powder and mix.

For the Brussels Sprouts

  1. Heat another skillet over medium heat and add a splash of olive oil. Add in the shaved Brussels sprouts. Allow them to saut for a couple of minutes then add 2-3 tbsp of water to help them cook. The water will create steam.
  2. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

For the Peppers and Onions

  1. Wash and cut your peppers into thin strips. Cut the onion into similar sized strips.
  2. Heat some olive oil over medium high heat in a large skillet. Add in the onions first and allow them to cook for 2-3 minutes.
  3. Add in the peppers and cook until soft.
  4. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide all of your ingredients into 5 containers. In each containter, add a 2 tbsp serving of salsa.

Chocolate Fudge Brownies

A soft and fudgey brownie made without any butter or oil and sweetened by maple syrup. Chocolate chips are mixed into the batter and sprinkled on top to add an even more chocolatey layer.

CourseCuisineTime - 17 minutes
DessertAmericanPrep - 7 minutes
Cook - 10 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
270kcal4
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates47.9g82%
Fat6.2g10%
Protein5.6g9%

Ingredients:

  • cup (67 g) oat flour Just put oats in a food processor or blender
  • 2 tbsp (16 g) tapioca flour any starch should do the job
  • cup (20 g) cocoa powder
  • tsp (1 g) baking soda
  • cup (113 g) unsweetened applesauce
  • 1 egg yolk
  • cup (60 g) maple syrup
  • 1 tsp (4 ml) vanilla
  • 3 tbsp (45 g) chocolate chips
  • 1 tsp (4 g) splenda

Instructions:

  1. Preheat your oven to 325F.
  2. Mix the oat flour, tapioca flour, cocoa powder, and baking soda together until no clumps remain.
  3. In a separate bowl, mix the vanilla, egg yolk, syrup, and apple sauce.
  4. Combine the wet and dry ingredients and add in of the chocolate chips.
  5. Spray an 8x8 baking pan with oil and add the mixture. Top with the remaining chocolate chips and bake for 10 minutes.
  6. This recipe makes 4 servings.

Chipotle BBQ Chicken with Cilantro Lime Rice

Chicken thighs tossed in BBQ sauce, adobo sauce, and a touch of lime juice to give a slightly smoky, spicy flavor. The chicken is served with a side of cilantro lime rice and vegetables.

CourseCuisineTime - 55 minutes 55 minutes 55 minutes
Main DishAmerican, meal prepPrep - 15 minutes 15 minutes 15 minutes
Cook - 40 minutes 40 minutes 40 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
627kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates57g43%
Fat21g16%
Protein52g40%

Ingredients:

For the Chicken

  • 3 lbs (1362 g) boneless skinless chicken thighs
  • 2 tbsp (30 g) olive oil
  • cup (75 g) BBQ sauce vinegar based (I like the brand Gates BBQ)
  • 1 tsp (5 g) adobo sauce Buy a can of chipotle peppers in adobo sauce and use only the sauce
  • 1 tsp (5 g) lime juice
  • 3 (10 g) green onions

For the Cilantro Lime Rice

  • 5 cups (750 g) cooked riced
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) olive oil
  • cup (10 g) cilantro chopped
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) lime juice
  • Salt to taste

For the Calabacitas

  • 1 large (300 g) zucchini
  • medium (100 g) onion
  • lb (227 g) mushrooms
  • 2 medium (300 g) bell peppers
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) olive oil

Instructions:

For the Rice

  1. Cook enough rice to yield 5 cups of cooked rice. 1 cup of dry rice yields about 3 cups of cooked rice.
  2. Once the riced has cooked, measure out 5cups of cooked rice and place in a large bowl.
  3. Mix in the oil, lime juice, cilantro, and salt to taste.

For the Sauce

  1. Mix together the BBQ sauce, adobo sauce, and lime juice.

For the Chicken

  1. You can cook the chicken however you prefer. I find it best to grill it or use a cast iron skillet but you can make whatever you have work.
  2. Heat a cast iron grill pan or skillet over medium high heat. Add oil and cook the chicken for 3-5 minutes on each side or until the chicken has cooked through. You know the chicken is ready to turn when you see the white start to creep up around the sides of the chicken.
  3. Remove the chicken from the pan and cut into 1 inch, bite sized pieces. Return to the pan to develop color on all sides of the chicken.
  4. Once the chicken has browned, pour the BBQ sauce over the top and stir the chicken to coat.

For the Calabacitas

  1. Wash and cut your vegetables into a large dice.
  2. Heat some oil over medium heat in a large skillet. Add the onions and peppers first and cook for 3-4 minutes.
  3. Add in the zucchini and mushrooms next, adding more oil if needed. It also may be helpful to use a separate pan or to remove the onions and peppers before adding the zucchini and mushrooms. You don't want to overcrowd the pan.
  4. Mix all of the vegetables together. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide your ingredients evenly between your 5 containers.

Chocolate Chip Cookie Skillet

A whole grain, gluten free, chocolate chip cookie skillet that takes less than 15 minutes to make. You can make this recipe to create a dense, chewy cookie ore a fluffier one to fit your preferences simply by omitting or adding a touch of baking soda.

CourseCuisineTime - 15 minutes 15 minutes
DessertAmericanPrep - 7 minutes 7 minutes
Cook - 8 minutes 12 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
238kcal4 servings
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates39g75%
Fat6g11%
Protein7g13%

Ingredients:

Dry Ingredients

  • cup (75 g) oat flour I just put rolled oats in the blender
  • 2 tbsp (20 g) tapioca flour 2 tbsp + 2 tsp
  • 2 tbsp (20 g) powdered peanut butter optional
  • tsp (2 g) baking soda

Wet Ingredients

  • cup (113 g) unsweetened applesauce
  • 1 tsp (4 ml) vanilla extract
  • 1 egg yolk
  • cup (60 g) maple syrup
  • 3 tbsp (45 g) chocolate chips

Instructions:

  1. Preheat your oven to 325F.
  2. Mix your dry ingredients in a bowl and stir until no clumps remain.
  3. Mix your wet ingredients separately. Combine the wet and dry ingredients together and stir to incorporate.
  4. Add in 2 tbsp of chocolate chips to the batter
  5. Spray an 8x8 pan or an 8" cast iron skillet with oil. Add the batter and spread to fill the container. Top with the remaining chocolate chips.
  6. Bake for 12-13 minutes or unitl it has set in the center.
  7. This recipe makes 4 servings. The nutrition information is for of the entire pan.

BBQ Turkey Skillet

Ground turkey tossed in BBQ sauce and mixed with sweet potatoes, red pepper, and kale. This is a super quick and tasty dish for those weeks you don't want to spend a lot of time in the kitchen.

CourseCuisineTime - 30 minutes
Main DishAmerican, meal prepPrep - 10 minutes
Cook - 20 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
463kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates34g37%
Fat20g21%
Protein37g40%

Ingredients:

  • 2 lbs (908 g) ground turkey 93/7
  • 2 large (600 g) sweet potatoes
  • 1 medium (150 g) red pepper
  • medium (100 g) sweet onion
  • 2 tbsp (37 g) olive oil
  • 1 bunch (100 g) lacinato kale
  • 2 tsp (10 ml) lemon juice
  • cup (75 g) BBQ sauce vinegar based (anything will work though)
  • Salt and pepper to taste

Instructions:

For the Sweet Potatoes

  1. Preheat your oven to 425.
  2. Wash and cut your sweet potatoes into a large dice. Toss in 1 tbsp of olive oil and season with salt and pepper. Bake for 10 minutes, then flip and cook an additional 8-10 minutes or until soft.

For the Vegetables

  1. While the potatoes are cooking, cut your onion and red pepper into a small dice.
  2. Wash and remove the kale leaves from the stems. Rougly chop the leaves and place into a bowl.
  3. Drizzle 2 tsp of lemon juice and a few pinches of salt over the kale. Massage the kale by squeezing it in your hands 5-8 times. This will help to break down the fibers and keep it from being so tough.
  4. In a skillet, heat tbsp of oil. Add in the onion and red pepper and cook until soft.
  5. Once they have softened, add the kale and turn off the heat. Allow the residual heat to wilt the kale.

For the Turkey

  1. Heat 1 tbsp of oil over medium high heat in a separate large skillet. Brown the turkey and then mix in the BBQ sauce.
  2. Once everything has finished cooking, combine all of the ingredients in a large pot/bowl and mix to incorporate. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide your ingredients evenly 5 ways.

Cajun Chicken with Lentils and Potatoes

Shredded chicken breasts and red lentils served with a side of roasted potatoes and zucchini. This is a meal made using cheap ingredients making it perfect for those of you who need something that is budget friendly.

CourseCuisineTime - 1 hour 1 hour 1 hour
Main DishAmerican, meal prepPrep - 15 minutes 15 minutes 15 minutes
Cook - 45 minutes 45 minutes 45 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
737kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates89g55%
Fat19g11%
Protein51g32%

Ingredients:

  • 2 lbs (981 g) chicken thighs
  • lb (227 g) red lentils dry
  • 2 large (227 g) carrots
  • 2 stalks (114 g) celery
  • medium (100 g) onion
  • tbsp (8 g) minced garlic
  • 3 tbsp (53 g) olive oil
  • cup (120 ml) tomato sauce
  • 2 cups (480 ml) chicken broth
  • 2 tbsp (18 g) Cajun seasoning
  • 3 lbs (1362 g) russet potatoes
  • 2 large (500 g) zucchini
  • Salt and pepper
  • 5 tbsp (10 g) Parsley optional

Instructions:

  1. Preheat your oven to 425F.
  2. Cut your onion, celery, and carrots into a small dice. Cut your potatoes and zucchini into a medium dice.
  3. Rinse your lentils and sift through them to pick out any debris.
  4. Add 1 tbsp of oil to a large pot and saut the carrots, onion, celery, and garlic until they have become fragrant and softened.
  5. Add the lentils, chicken broth, tomato sauce and chicken breast. Bring to a boil and reduce the heat to low. Cover and simmer for 25 minutes.
  6. While the chicken is cooking, toss the potatoes in 2 tbsp of oil and 2 tbsp of Cajun seasoning. Bake for 12 minutes then turn and bake an additional 12-15 minutes or until you achieve optimal browning. Season to taste.
  7. Heat the remaining oil in a large skillet and saut the zucchini until soft. Season to taste.
  8. Once the chicken is done, remove it from the pot and shred with two forks. Return to the pot and stir. Add tbsp cajun season and stir. Adjust seasonings as needed.
  9. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide your ingredients evenly 5 ways.

Chicken and Lentil Soup

Chicken, carrots, peas, potatoes, and lentils stewed together and flavored with soy sauce, lemon juice, and sriracha. This is a one pot meal that can be cooked in under an hour and makes for the perfect warm dish on a cold day.

CourseCuisineTime - 1 hour
Main DishAmericanPrep - 15 minutes
Cook - 45 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
417kcal6
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates38g41%
Fat11g12%
Protein42g46%

Ingredients:

  • 2 lbs (908 g) boneless skinless chicken thighs
  • cup (180 g) dry lentils
  • 3 (230 g) carrots
  • 1 (200 g) onion
  • 3 cloves (15 g) garlic
  • 3 stalks (100 g) celery
  • 2 (400 g) potatoes
  • 3 tbsp (45 ml) lemon juice
  • 4 tbsp (60 ml) soy sauce
  • 1 cup (100 g) frozen peas
  • 1 tsp (5 g) sriracha
  • 8 cups (1920 ml) water
  • Salt and pepper
  • 2 tbsp (30 g) olive oil

Instructions:

  1. Cut the carrots, celery, onion and garlic into a small dice.
  2. Heat oil over medium heat in large pot. Add onions and saut until they have begun to soften. Add the carrots, celery and garlic. Cook for 5-10 minutes.
  3. Add the chicken to the pot with the 8 cups of water. Bring to a boil and then reduce the heat to medium low and simmer for 10-15 minutes.
  4. Add in the potatoes and lentils and continue boiling until they have both softened, probably around 10 minutes.
  5. Remove the chicken and shred. Return to the pot and add lemon juice, soy sauce, sriracha and peas. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Top with parsley/cilantro if you wish.

Chocolate Frosted Mini Brownies

These brownie bites are made using Greek yogurt instead of butter so they have a denser, more cakey texture than traditional brownies. These bites work awesome as a remedy to cure your sweet tooth.

CourseCuisineTime - 22 minutes
DessertAmericanPrep - 10 minutes
Cook - 12 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
76kcal16 bites
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates12.7g84%
Fat1.8g12%
Protein2.4g16%

Ingredients:

  • cup (115 g) plain non fat Greek yogurt
  • cup (100 g) sugar
  • cup (60 g) cocoa powder
  • 2 eggs
  • cup (50 g) oat flour
  • 1 tbsp (10 g) cornstarch
  • 1 tsp (4 ml) vanilla
  • 2 tbsp (30 ml) milk
  • 2 tbsp (28 g) chocolate chips

Instructions:

  1. Preheat your oven to 350F.
  2. Mix the eggs, yogurt, vanilla, and sugar together.
  3. Stir in the oat flour, cornstarch, and cocoa powder. Add approximately 1 tbsp of milk to thin out the batter.
  4. Spray a mini muffin tin with oil. Fill 16 wells with the batter. Bake for 12 minutes.
  5. Melt the chocolate chips in the microwave. Slowly add in milk to decrease the viscosity. It may be nice to add in more Chocolate than youll need just so frosting is easier.
  6. Top each brownie with frosting once they have cooled to room temperature.

Turkey Sausage Breakfast Skillet

Turkey sausage cooked with green peppers and carrots to add in some vegetables in your breakfast. Served with a side of eggs and home fries.

CourseCuisineTime - 35 minutes 35 minutes 35 minutes
BreakfastAmerican, meal prepPrep - 10 minutes 10 minutes 10 minutes
Cook - 25 minutes 25 minutes 25 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
745kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates61g44%
Fat39g28%
Protein36g26%

Ingredients:

  • 10 (10 ) eggs
  • cup (60 ml) skim milk
  • 1 lb (454 g) ground pork breakfast sausage
  • 7 (1000 g) russet potatoes
  • (100 g) sweet onion
  • 2 (300 g) green peppers
  • 1 cup (100 g) shredded carrots
  • 2 Tbsp (30 ml) olive oil
  • Cooking spray
  • Salt and pepper to taste

Instructions:

For the Home Fries

  1. Preheat your oven to 425F.
  2. Wash and cut your potatoes into a small dice (around - cubes). You want these small so they cook faster.
  3. Toss the potatoes in 1 Tbsp of olive oil and season with salt and pepper. Bake for 10 minutes, then remove from the oven and turn. Bake an additional 5-8 minutes or until they have crisped up.

For the Sausage

  1. Wash your peppers. Cut the onion and peppers into a small dice. Chop the shredded carrots into smaller pieces.
  2. Heat 1 Tbsp of olive oil over medium high heat in a large skillet. Add the onion, peppers, and carrots to the skillet and cook for 3 minutes.
  3. Add the sausage to the pan and brown.

For the Eggs

  1. Crack 10 eggs into a bowl, add in cup milk and beat. The secret to perfect scrambled eggs is to beat them until frothy and no egg whites remain unincorporated.
  2. Heat a skillet over medium heat, spray with cooking spray, and cook your eggs until finished. Make sure not to over cook them as you will be reheating them in the microwave.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide all of your ingredients evenly between your containers.

Honey Mustard Quinoa Bites

A freezer friendly snack that you can make ahead and have available in your freezer for whenever you may need a quick snack. Made from quinoa and egg whites, these are a filling, low calorie option.

CourseCuisineTime - 45 minutes
SnackAmericanPrep - 10 minutes
Cook - 35 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
38kcal24 bites
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates4.6g65%
Fat1g14%
Protein2.7g38%

Ingredients:

  • lb (227 g) ground turkey (93/7)
  • 1 tsp (5 tsp) olive oil
  • 9 tbsp (150 g) egg whites cup + 1 tbsp. I use the liquid egg whites in the carton for ease.
  • 3 tbsp (20 g) oat flour any flour works
  • 1 tbsp (30 g) honey
  • 2 tbsp (40 g) dijon mustard 2 tbsp + 2 tsp
  • 1 tbsp (20 g) plain non fat Greek yogurt 1 tbsp + 1 tsp
  • 1 tsp (5 g) pickle juice vinegar will work too
  • 1 tsp (3 g) salt
  • tsp (2 g) pepper
  • 1 cup (320 g) cooked quinoa

Instructions:

For the Quinoa

  1. Measure out 1 cup of quinoa, you will have a bit extra. (When I make quinoa, I prefer to make a large batch and freeze any extra so that I don't need to cook more every time I want to make this recipe.)
  2. Rinse the quinoa under water until the water runs clear. Do not skip this step as quinoa has a coating called saponin which will result in a bitter, unpleasant flavor if not rinsed off.
  3. Add 1 cup of quinoa and 1 cups of water to a pot. Bring to a boil, then lower the heat to simmer and cover. Cook for 15 minutes, remove from heat to rest for 5 minutes. Uncover and fluff with a fork.

For the Turkey

  1. Heat the olive oil in a skillet over medium high heat. Cook the turkey until it has browned. Cook off any water remaining in the skillet.

For the Quinoa Bite

  1. Preheat your oven to 350F.
  2. Mix the yogurt, honey, mustard, and pickle juice in a large bowl and stir.
  3. Measure out the cooked quinoa and mix all of the ingredients into the bowl until incorporated.
  4. Spray a mini muffin tin with oil and fill each well with the mixture. Bake in the oven for 15-17 minutes. I highly suggest buying a large mini muffin tin. It will help take your snack game to the next level. I use this 48 well Mini Muffin Tin.

Storage

  1. Allow the bites to cool to room temperature and place them into a large ziplock bag. Remove as much air as possible and place in the freezer. You must make sure they have cooled completely as if they are still warm when placed into the bag, steam will be trapped and lead to the formation of ice crystals.

Snickerdoodle Quinoa Bites

A freezer friendly snack that you can make ahead and have available in your freezer for whenever you may need a quick snack. Made from quinoa and egg whites, these are a filling, low calorie option.

CourseCuisineTime - 45 minutes
SnackAmericanPrep - 10 minutes
Cook - 35 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
30kcal24 bites
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates5.2g86%
Fat0.4g6%
Protein1.5g25%

Ingredients:

  • 9 tbsp (150 g) egg whites cup + 1 tbsp. I use the liquid egg whites in the carton for ease.
  • 6 tbsp (40 g) oat flour any flour works
  • 1 cup (320 g) cooked quinoa
  • 1 tsp (4 g) stevia
  • 3 tbsp (20 g) sugar
  • 2 tsp (6 g) cinnamon

Instructions:

For the Quinoa

  1. Measure out 1 cup of quinoa, you will have a bit extra. (When I make quinoa, I prefer to make a large batch and freeze any extra so that I don't need to cook more every time I want to make this recipe.)
  2. Rinse the quinoa under water until the water runs clear. Do not skip this step as quinoa has a coating called saponin which will result in a bitter, unpleasant flavor if not rinsed off.
  3. Add 1 cup of quinoa and 1 cups of water to a pot. Bring to a boil, then lower the heat to simmer and cover. Cook for 15 minutes, remove from heat to rest for 5 minutes. Uncover and fluff with a fork.

For the Quinoa Bite

  1. Preheat your oven to 350F.
  2. Measure out the cooked quinoa and mix all of the ingredients into a large bowl except for the sugar and 1 tsp of the cinnamon until incorporated. Mix the sugar and remaining cinnamon together.
  3. Spray a mini muffin tin with oil and fill each well with the mixture. Top with the cinnamon sugar mixture. Bake in the oven for 15-17 minutes. I highly suggest buying a large mini muffin tin. It will help take your snack game to the next level. I use this 48 well Mini Muffin Tin.

Storage

  1. Allow the bites to cool to room temperature and place them into a large ziplock bag. Remove as much air as possible and place in the freezer. You must make sure they have cooled completely as if they are still warm when placed into the bag, steam will be trapped and lead to the formation of ice crystals.

Peanut Butter Chocolate Chip Quinoa Bites

A freezer friendly snack that you can make ahead and have available in your freezer for whenever you may need a quick snack. Made from quinoa and egg whites, these are a filling, low calorie option.

CourseCuisineTime - 45 minutes
SnackAmericanPrep - 10 minutes
Cook - 35 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
47kcal22 bites
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates5.7g71%
Fat1.9g23%
Protein2.1g26%

Ingredients:

  • 9 tbsp (150 g) egg whites cup + 1 tbsp. I use the liquid egg whites in the carton for ease.
  • 4 tbsp (30 g) oat flour any flour works
  • 1 cup (320 g) cooked quinoa
  • 2 tbsp (30 g) miniature chocolate chips
  • 3 tbsp (48 g) peanut butter
  • 1 tsp (4 g) stevia

Instructions:

For the Quinoa

  1. Measure out 1 cup of quinoa, you will have a bit extra. (When I make quinoa, I prefer to make a large batch and freeze any extra so that I don't need to cook more every time I want to make this recipe.)
  2. Rinse the quinoa under water until the water runs clear. Do not skip this step as quinoa has a coating called saponin which will result in a bitter, unpleasant flavor if not rinsed off.
  3. Add 1 cup of quinoa and 1 cups of water to a pot. Bring to a boil, then lower the heat to simmer and cover. Cook for 15 minutes, remove from heat to rest for 5 minutes. Uncover and fluff with a fork.

For the Quinoa Bite

  1. Preheat your oven to 350F.
  2. Measure out the cooked quinoa and mix all of the ingredients into a large bowl until incorporated. If you'd like to save some of the chocolate chips to go on top, do so.
  3. Spray a mini muffin tin with oil and fill each well with the mixture. Top with chocolate chips if you decided to reserve some of them. Bake in the oven for 15-17 minutes. I highly suggest buying a large mini muffin tin. It will help take your snack game to the next level. I use this 48 well Mini Muffin Tin.

Storage

  1. Allow the bites to cool to room temperature and place them into a large ziplock bag. Remove as much air as possible and place in the freezer. You must make sure they have cooled completely as if they are still warm when placed into the bag, steam will be trapped and lead to the formation of ice crystals.

Sriracha Ranch Quinoa Bites

A freezer friendly snack that you can make ahead and have available in your freezer for whenever you may need a quick snack. Made from quinoa and egg whites, these are a filling, low calorie option.

CourseCuisineTime - 45 minutes
SnackAmericanPrep - 10 minutes
Cook - 35 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
37kcal24 bites
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates3.8g54%
Fat1g14%
Protein3.3g47%

Ingredients:

  • lb (227 g) ground turkey (93/7)
  • 1 tsp (5 tsp) olive oil
  • 9 tbsp (150 g) egg whites cup + 1 tbsp. I use the liquid egg whites in the carton for ease.
  • 2 tbsp (14 g) oat flour any flour works
  • 3 tsp (9 g) ranch dressing seasoning mix
  • 2 tsp (10 g) sriracha
  • 1 tsp (3 g) salt
  • tsp (2 g) pepper
  • 1 cup (320 g) cooked quinoa

Instructions:

For the Quinoa

  1. Measure out 1 cup of quinoa, you will have a bit extra. (When I make quinoa, I prefer to make a large batch and freeze any extra so that I don't need to cook more every time I want to make this recipe.)
  2. Rinse the quinoa under water until the water runs clear. Do not skip this step as quinoa has a coating called saponin which will result in a bitter, unpleasant flavor if not rinsed off.
  3. Add 1 cup of quinoa and 1 cups of water to a pot. Bring to a boil, then lower the heat to simmer and cover. Cook for 15 minutes, remove from heat to rest for 5 minutes. Uncover and fluff with a fork.

For the Turkey

  1. Heat the olive oil in a skillet over medium high heat. Cook the turkey until it has browned. Cook off any water remaining in the skillet.

For the Quinoa Bite

  1. Preheat your oven to 350F.
  2. Measure out the cooked quinoa and mix all of the ingredients into a large bowl until incorporated.
  3. Spray a mini muffin tin with oil and fill each well with the mixture. Bake in the oven for 15-17 minutes. I highly suggest buying a large mini muffin tin. It will help take your snack game to the next level. I use this 48 well Mini Muffin Tin.

Storage

  1. Allow the bites to cool to room temperature and place them into a large ziplock bag. Remove as much air as possible and place in the freezer. You must make sure they have cooled completely as if they are still warm when placed into the bag, steam will be trapped and lead to the formation of ice crystals.

Chili Cheese Quinoa Bites

A freezer friendly snack that you can make ahead and have available in your freezer for whenever you may need a quick snack. Made from quinoa and egg whites, these are a filling, low calorie option.

CourseCuisineTime - 45 minutes
SnackAmericanPrep - 10 minutes
Cook - 35 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
54kcal24 bites
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates5.3g53%
Fat1.8g18%
Protein4.1g41%

Ingredients:

  • lb (227 g) ground turkey (93/7)
  • 2 tsp (5 g) olive oil
  • 1 small (75 g) green pepper
  • small (50 g) onion
  • cup (60 g) tomato paste
  • cup (60 g) tomato sauce
  • 2 tsp (6 g) chili powder
  • tsp (2 g) mustard powder
  • 1 tbsp (15 ml) worcestershire sauce
  • 1 cup (320 g) cooked quinoa
  • 9 tbsp (150 g) egg whites cup + 1 tbsp. I use the liquid egg whites in the carton for ease.
  • cup (56 g) shredded cheddar cheese
  • 4 tbsp (30 g) oat flour any flour works
  • 1 tsp (3 g) salt
  • tsp (2 g) pepper

Instructions:

For the Quinoa

  1. Measure out 1 cup of quinoa, you will have a bit extra. (When I make quinoa, I prefer to make a large batch and freeze any extra so that I don't need to cook more every time I want to make this recipe.)
  2. Rinse the quinoa under water until the water runs clear. Do not skip this step as quinoa has a coating called saponin which will result in a bitter, unpleasant flavor if not rinsed off.
  3. Add 1 cup of quinoa and 1 cups of water to a pot. Bring to a boil, then lower the heat to simmer and cover. Cook for 15 minutes, remove from heat to rest for 5 minutes. Uncover and fluff with a fork.

For the Turkey

  1. Cut the green pepper and onion into a small dice.
  2. Heat 1 tsp of oil in a skillet over medium high heat. Add the green pepper and onion and cook for 3-5 minutes.
  3. Add another tsp of oil and the turkey to the pan and brown. Cook off any water remaining in the skillet.
  4. Add in the tomato sauce, tomato paste, mustard powder, chili powder, and worcestershire sauce. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Stir to incorporate. Cook for 5-7 minutes.

For the Quinoa Bite

  1. Preheat your oven to 350F.
  2. Measure out the cooked quinoa and mix all of the ingredients except for cup of the shredded cheese into a large bowl until incorporated.
  3. Spray a mini muffin tin with oil and fill each well with the mixture. Top with the remaining shredded cheese. Bake in the oven for 15-17 minutes. I highly suggest buying a large mini muffin tin. It will help take your snack game to the next level. I use this 48 well Mini Muffin Tin.

Storage

  1. Allow the bites to cool to room temperature and place them into a large ziplock bag. Remove as much air as possible and place in the freezer.
