You must make sure they have cooled completely as if they are still warm when placed into the bag, steam will be trapped and lead to the formation of ice crystals.

Taco Quinoa Bites

A freezer friendly snack that you can make ahead and have available in your freezer for whenever you may need a quick snack. Made from quinoa and egg whites, these are a filling, low calorie option.

CourseCuisineTime - 45 minutes
SnackAmericanPrep - 10 minutes
Cook - 35 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
47kcal24 bites
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates4g50%
Fat1.8g22%
Protein3.8g47%

Ingredients:

  • lb (227 g) ground turkey (93/7)
  • 1 tsp (5 g) olive oil
  • cup (60 ml) tomato sauce
  • tsp (2 g) chili powder
  • tsp (2 g) cumin
  • tsp (2 g) garlic powder
  • 1 cup (320 g) cooked quinoa
  • 9 tbsp (150 g) egg whites cup + 1 tbsp. I use the liquid egg whites in the carton for ease.
  • cup (56 g) shredded cheddar cheese
  • 3 tbsp (20 g) oat flour any flour works
  • 1 tsp (3 g) salt
  • tsp (2 g) pepper

Instructions:

For the Quinoa

  1. Measure out 1 cup of quinoa, you will have a bit extra. (When I make quinoa, I prefer to make a large batch and freeze any extra so that I don't need to cook more every time I want to make this recipe.)
  2. Rinse the quinoa under water until the water runs clear. Do not skip this step as quinoa has a coating called saponin which will result in a bitter, unpleasant flavor if not rinsed off.
  3. Add 1 cup of quinoa and 1 cups of water to a pot. Bring to a boil, then lower the heat to simmer and cover. Cook for 15 minutes, remove from heat to rest for 5 minutes. Uncover and fluff with a fork.

For the Turkey

  1. Heat 1 tsp of oil in a skillet over medium high heat. Add the turkey and brown. Cook off any water remaining in the skillet.
  2. Add in the tomato sauce, garlic powder, chili powder, cumin, and season with salt and pepper to taste. Stir to incorporate.

For the Quinoa Bite

  1. Preheat your oven to 350F.
  2. Measure out the cooked quinoa and mix all of the ingredients except for cup of the shredded cheese into a large bowl until incorporated.
  3. Spray a mini muffin tin with oil and fill each well with the mixture. Top with the remaining shredded cheese. Bake in the oven for 15-17 minutes. I highly suggest buying a large mini muffin tin. It will help take your snack game to the next level. I use this 48 well Mini Muffin Tin.

Storage

  1. Allow the bites to cool to room temperature and place them into a large ziplock bag. Remove as much air as possible and place in the freezer. You must make sure they have cooled completely as if they are still warm when placed into the bag, steam will be trapped and lead to the formation of ice crystals.

Buffalo Chicken Quinoa Bites

A freezer friendly snack that you can make ahead and have available in your freezer for whenever you may need a quick snack. Made from quinoa and egg whites, these are a filling, low calorie option.

CourseCuisineTime - 45 minutes
SnackAmericanPrep - 10 minutes
Cook - 35 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
34kcal24 bites
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates3.8g63%
Fat0.6g10%
Protein3.3g54%

Ingredients:

  • lb (227 g) boneless skinless chicken breast use ground chicken or turkey if you do not want to mess with cooking chicken breasts
  • 9 tbsp (150 g) egg whites cup + 1 tbsp. I use the liquid egg whites in the carton for ease.
  • 4 tbsp (30 g) oat flour any flour works
  • cup (60 ml) buffalo sauce
  • 1 tsp (3 g) salt
  • tsp (2 g) pepper
  • 1 cup (320 g) cooked quinoa

Instructions:

For the Quinoa

  1. Measure out 1 cup of quinoa, you will have a bit extra. (When I make quinoa, I prefer to make a large batch and freeze any extra so that I don't need to cook more every time I want to make this recipe.)
  2. Rinse the quinoa under water until the water runs clear. Do not skip this step as quinoa has a coating called saponin which will result in a bitter, unpleasant flavor if not rinsed off.
  3. Add 1 cup of quinoa and 1 cups of water to a pot. Bring to a boil, then lower the heat to simmer and cover. Cook for 15 minutes, remove from heat to rest for 5 minutes. Uncover and fluff with a fork.

For the Chicken

  1. Cook the chicken using your preferred method. It doesn't really matter how this is achieved as it will eventually be chopped into small pieces to fit into the bite sized snack.
  2. Note that ground meats will work just as well if you would prefer to use ground chicken or turkey.

For the Quinoa Bite

  1. Preheat your oven to 350F.
  2. Cut the chicken breast into small pieces (less than " ideally).
  3. Measure out the cooked quinoa and mix all of the ingredients into a large bowl until incorporated.
  4. Spray a mini muffin tin with oil and fill each well with the mixture. Bake in the oven for 15-17 minutes. I highly suggest buying a large mini muffin tin. It will help take your snack game to the next level. I use this 48 well Mini Muffin Tin.

Storage

  1. Allow the bites to cool to room temperature and place them into a large ziplock bag. Remove as much air as possible and place in the freezer. You must make sure they have cooled completely as if they are still warm when placed into the bag, steam will be trapped and lead to the formation of ice crystals.

Cheeseburger Quinoa Bites

A freezer friendly snack that you can make ahead and have available in your freezer for whenever you may need a quick snack. Made from quinoa and egg whites, these are a filling, low calorie option.

CourseCuisineTime - 45 minutes
SnackAmericanPrep - 10 minutes
Cook - 35 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
50kcal24 bites
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates4.1g45%
Fat2g22%
Protein3.8g42%

Ingredients:

  • lb (227 g) ground turkey (93/7)
  • 1 cup (320 g) cooked quinoa
  • 9 tbsp (150 g) egg whites cup + 1 tbsp. I use the liquid egg whites in the carton for ease.
  • 2 tbsp (20 g) oat flour any flour works
  • cup (28 g) shredded cheddar cheese
  • 2 (56 g) pickle spears
  • 2 slices (32 g) cheddar cheese
  • 3 tbsp (50 g) ketchup
  • 1 tsp (3 g) salt
  • tsp (2 g) pepper
  • 1 tsp (5 ml) olive oil

Instructions:

For the Quinoa

  1. Measure out 1 cup of quinoa, you will have a bit extra. (When I make quinoa, I prefer to make a large batch and freeze any extra so that I don't need to cook more every time I want to make this recipe.)
  2. Rinse the quinoa under water until the water runs clear. Do not skip this step as quinoa has a coating called saponin which will result in a bitter, unpleasant flavor if not rinsed off.
  3. Add 1 cup of quinoa and 1 cups of water to a pot. Bring to a boil, then lower the heat to simmer and cover. Cook for 15 minutes, remove from heat to rest for 5 minutes. Uncover and fluff with a fork.

For the Turkey

  1. Heat 1 tsp of olive oil over medium high heat in a skillet. Cook the turkey until it has browned and any water has evaporated.

For the Quinoa Bite

  1. Preheat your oven to 350F.
  2. Cut the pickles into a small dice.
  3. Stack the two cheese slices on top of each other and cut in half until you have small squares to fit on top of each bite. You should end up with 32 pieces.
  4. Measure out the cooked quinoa and mix all of the ingredients except the sliced cheese and ketchup into a large bowl until incorporated.
  5. Spray a mini muffin tin with oil and fill each well with the mixture.
  6. Top each quinoa bite with a squirt of ketchup and place a small cheese square over the top. If you need to be precise with measurements, weigh out the ketchup. If not, just squirt a tiny dollop onto each one, it will be much easier than measuring it out and the difference in calories will be minimal.
  7. Bake in the oven for 15-17 minutes. I highly suggest buying a large mini muffin tin. It will help take your snack game to the next level. I use this 48 well Mini Muffin Tin.

Storage

  1. Allow the bites to cool to room temperature and place them into a large ziplock bag. Remove as much air as possible and place in the freezer. You must make sure they have cooled completely as if they are still warm when placed into the bag, steam will be trapped and lead to the formation of ice crystals.

Teriyaki Quinoa Bites

A freezer friendly snack that you can make ahead and have available in your freezer for whenever you may need a quick snack. Made from quinoa and egg whites, these are a filling, low calorie option.

CourseCuisineTime - 45 minutes
SnackAmericanPrep - 10 minutes
Cook - 35 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
36kcal24 bites
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates4.2g60%
Fat0.6g8%
Protein3.4g48%

Ingredients:

  • lb (227 g) boneless skinless chicken breast use ground chicken or turkey if you don't want to mess with cooking chicken breasts
  • 9 tbsp (150 g) egg whites cup + 1 tbsp. I use the liquid egg whites in the carton for ease.
  • 4 tbsp (30 g) oat flour any flour works
  • cup (60 ml) teriyaki sauce I use the Kikkoman Ginger Teriyaki sauce
  • 1 tsp (3 g) salt
  • tsp (2 g) pepper
  • 1 cup (320 g) cooked quinoa

Instructions:

For the Quinoa

  1. Measure out 1 cup of quinoa, you will have a bit extra. (When I make quinoa, I prefer to make a large batch and freeze any extra so that I don't need to cook more every time I want to make this recipe.)
  2. Rinse the quinoa under water until the water runs clear. Do not skip this step as quinoa has a coating called saponin which will result in a bitter, unpleasant flavor if not rinsed off.
  3. Add 1 cup of quinoa and 1 cups of water to a pot. Bring to a boil, then lower the heat to simmer and cover. Cook for 15 minutes, remove from heat to rest for 5 minutes. Uncover and fluff with a fork.

For the Chicken

  1. Cook the chicken using your preferred method. It doesn't really matter how this is achieved as it will eventually be chopped into small pieces to fit into the bite sized snack.
  2. Note that ground meats will work just as well if you would prefer to use ground chicken or turkey.

For the Quinoa Bite

  1. Preheat your oven to 350F.
  2. Cut the chicken breast into small pieces (less than " ideally).
  3. Measure out the cooked quinoa and mix all of the ingredients into a large bowl until incorporated.
  4. Spray a mini muffin tin with oil and fill each well with the mixture. Bake in the oven for 15-17 minutes. I highly suggest buying a large mini muffin tin. It will help take your snack game to the next level. I use this 48 well Mini Muffin Tin.

Storage

  1. Allow the bites to cool to room temperature and place them into a large ziplock bag. Remove as much air as possible and place in the freezer. You must make sure they have cooled completely as if they are still warm when placed into the bag, steam will be trapped and lead to the formation of ice crystals.

Tomato Soup

Homemade tomato soup made from canned, whole tomatoes, carrots, onion, and celery. This soup can be topped with a gluten free cheddar crouton for a fancy alternative to grilled cheese and tomato soup.

CourseCuisineTime - null
Appetizer, Snack, SoupAmericanPrep - 5 minutes
Cook - 40 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
203kcal3
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates24.7g60%
Fat7.1g17%
Protein10.2g24%

Ingredients:

  • 28 oz (794 g) whole canned San Marzano tomatoes
  • 2 cups (480 ml) chicken stock
  • 2 stalks (100 g) celery
  • 1 (75 g) carrots
  • 1 (200 g) yellow onion
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) garlic
  • 1 tbsp (15 ml) olive oil
  • 3 tbsp (21 g) Parmesan cheese
  • cup (60 g) plain non fat Greek yogurt

Instructions:

  1. Cut the vegetables into a rough chop. Precision doesn't matter here as everything will be blended.
  2. Add the vegetabels to a large pot with garlic and olive oil. Saut for a couple of minutes.
  3. Add in the stock and the canned tomatoes with their juice. Bring to a boil and reduce heat to low. Cook for 30-35 minutes.
  4. Pour the soup and yogurt in a blender and blend until smooth. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
  5. Makes 3 servings. Top with parmesan cheese. Nutrition is per bowl for the soup only. The nutrition information will change depending on if you decide to make the croutons to go on top. The nutrition information for those should be added if you need precision.

For the Crouton

  1. While soup is simmering, you can make the biscuits shown in the picture if you wish. That recipe is called Faux Cheddar Bay Biscuits found at this link -> Faux Cheddar Bay Biscuits. Follow the recpie for the biscuts. To make the crouton, cut the cooked biscuits into 4ths. Bake in a 425F oven for 8-10 minutes until crispy. Shake the pan every few minutes to stir.

Pineapple BBQ Chicken

A simple recipe with only a small handful of ingredients, this dish comes together fairly quickly. The sweetness of the pineapple and BBQ sauce make a wonderful pair.

CourseCuisineTime - 35 minutes 35 minutes 35 minutes
Main DishAmericanPrep - 10 minutes 10 minutes 10 minutes
Cook - 25 minutes 25 minutes 25 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
656kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates63g45%
Fat19g13%
Protein58g41%

Ingredients:

  • 3 lbs (1362 g) boneless skinless chicken thighs
  • 5 tbsp (75 g) Vinegar based BBQ sauce I use the brand Gates
  • 3 large (1125 g) sweet potatoes
  • 2 cups (280 g) frozen broccoli I use the chopped broccoli for ease.
  • 3 cups (420 g) pineapple fresh or frozen
  • 3 tbsp (45 ml) olive oil

Instructions:

For the Potatoes

  1. Preheat the oven to 425F.
  2. Chop the potatoes into a medium dice. Coat in olive oil and roast for 20 minutes, flipping halfway through. Cook until youve reached youre desired doneness.

For the Chicken

  1. Heat a grill pan or skillet over medium high heat. Lightly coat the chicken thighs in a bit of olive oil and cook for a few minutes on each side.
  2. Cut it into one inch pieces and put it back in the pan. Add cup of BBQ sauce and stir.
  3. Cook the broccoli in the microwave until it is no longer frozen, drain any excess water.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide your ingredients evenly 5 ways. The pineapple doesn't need to be cooked.

Banana Chocolate Chip Muffins

If you have ripe bananas that need to be used up this is a great recipe to reach for. They are high in calories because they contain a lot of peanut butter so you should be aware of your intake but they taste great. If the caloric load isn't something that you are worried about, give them a shot.

CourseCuisineTime - 18 minutes
Dessert, SnackAmericanPrep - 10 minutes
Cook - 8 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
100kcal24 muffins
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates7.5g50%
Fat6.5g43%
Protein2.9g19%

Ingredients:

  • 2 (250 g) ripe, frozen and thawed bananas Non-frozen is fine, frozen bananas are just a bit sweeter
  • 1 cup (256 g) peanut butter
  • 2 eggs
  • 2 Tbsp (42 g) honey
  • 2 tsp (8 ml) vanilla
  • 1/2 tsp (2 g) baking powder
  • 1/4 cup (56 g) chocolate chips

Instructions:

  1. Mix all the ingredients except the chocolate chips in a blender until smooth.
  2. Pour into a mini muffin tin and top with 4 or 5 chocolate chips.
  3. Bake at 400F for 7-8 minutes

Raspberry Dutch Baby

Frozen raspberries and chocolate chips make up the filling of this oven baked pastry. The dough is made from a combination of oat and tapioca flour to provide a gluten free alternative to wheat flour.

CourseCuisineTime - 25 minutes
Dessert, SnackAmericanPrep - 10 minutes
Cook - 15 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
248kcal1
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates32.5g63%
Fat8g15%
Protein11.5g22%

Ingredients:

  • 4 tbsp (20 g) oat flour
  • 2 tsp (4 g) tapioca flour
  • tsp (2 g) baking powder
  • 1 egg
  • tsp (2 g) stevia
  • tsp (2 ml) vanilla
  • cup (60 ml) skim milk
  • cup (35 g) frozen raspberries
  • tbsp (8 g) mini chocolate chips
  • 1 tsp (2 g) powdered sugar

Instructions:

  1. Preheat oven to 425F.
  2. Mix everything except raspberries, chocolate chips, and powdered sugar in a blender.
  3. Spray a 6 cast iron pan with oil and pour in batter. You can add the raspberries and chocolate chips before or after baking. Your call.
  4. Bake for 12-15 minutes or until it has set.

Apple Cinnamon Turnover Bites

An oat base filled with cinnamon apples and baked to form a bite sized apple turnover. These bites are topped with a whey protein and Greek yogurt icing for added sweetness.

CourseCuisineTime - 33 minutes
Dessert, SnackAmericanPrep - 20 minutes
Cook - 13 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
41kcal12 bites
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates6.5g81%
Fat0.4g5%
Protein2.8g35%

Ingredients:

For the Base

  • cup (60 g) oat flour
  • cup (120 g) plain non fat Greek yogurt
  • 3 tbsp (50 g) liquid egg whites
  • 1 (100 g) apple
  • 1 tsp (4 ml) vanilla
  • tsp (2 g) baking soda
  • tsp (2 g) stevia
  • 1 tsp (3 g) cinnamon
  • 2 tsp (10 g) coconut sugar

For the Icing

  • 3 Tbsp (50 g) vanilla Greek yogurt
  • 2 tsp (5 g) vanilla whey protein powder
  • tsp (1 g) stevia
  • 2 tsp (8 ml) water

Instructions:

  1. Preheat oven to 350F.
  2. Cut apple into small dice. Heat a skillet over medium heat & spray with oil. Add apples and sprinkle sugar over top. Saut for a few minutes until soft. Toss in cinnamon.
  3. Mix the dry dough ingredients together then add in yogurt, vanilla, and eggs.
  4. Spray a mini muffin tin with oil. Divide the dough in half. Fill 12 wells using half of the total mixture. Use a spoon to form the dough into the well shape as best you can.
  5. Divide the apple mix between the wells. Add the remaining dough over the top.
  6. Bake for 12-13 minutes.
  7. Mix the icing ingredients and drizzle over the top. Its best to ice them when you eat them and not in advance.

Cinnamon Sugar Bagels

A gluten free alternative to regular wheat containing bagels. These aren't a perfect 1:1 swap but they taste great and have a wonderful texture and chewiness.

CourseCuisineTime - 25 minutes
Dessert, SnackAmericanPrep - 10 minutes
Cook - 15 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
77kcal5 bagels
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates12.9g80%
Fat0.7g4%
Protein4.9g30%

Ingredients:

  • cup (50 g) oat flour
  • 2 tbsp (15 g) tapioca flour
  • 6 tbsp (80 g) liquid egg whites
  • cup (120 g) plain non fat Greek yogurt
  • tsp (2 g) baking soda
  • 2 packets (4 g) stevia
  • 1 tsp (3 g) cinnamon
  • 2 tsp (10 g) sugar

Instructions:

  1. Preheat oven to 350F.
  2. Mix all ingredients in a bowl except cinnamon and sugar.
  3. Fill a donut tin with mixture. Makes 5. Mix half of the sugar and cinnamon together and sprinkle over the top.
  4. Bake 13-15 minutes.
  5. Sprinkle the remaining sugar over the top.
  6. Makes 5. Nutrition is for each bagel. Wait for it to cool before eating. It will be better.

Lower Calorie Apple Crisp

Puffed millet, oats, and apples sweetened with maple syrup and baked to form a perfect after dinner sweet treat.

CourseCuisineTime - 1 hour 5 minutes
Dessert, SnackAmericanPrep - 10 minutes
Cook - 55 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
236kcal4
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates55.6g95%
Fat1.1g1%
Protein2.1g3%

Ingredients:

  • 4 (400 g) apples
  • cup (30 g) tapioca flour (I used tapioca, anything should work)
  • 2 tsp (8 g) cinnamon
  • 5 tbsp (75 g) maple syrup
  • 1 cup (15 g) puffed millet
  • cup (40 g) oats

Instructions:

  1. Preheat oven to 350F
  2. Cut apples into slices or chunks. Cut the skin off if you wish, it doesnt make a difference.
  3. In a large bowl, add the apples, 1 tsp cinnamon, 1 tbsp maple syrup, and 3 tbsp of the flour. Mix thoroughly.
  4. Pour apples into a greased 8x8 pan.
  5. In the bowl, mix the oats, millet, remaining 1 tbsp of flour, and 4 tbsp of maple syrup. Mix and pour over apples.
  6. Bake for 55 minutes or until you can easily insert a knife into the apples.

Superdeluxo Chocolate Spacecake

This recipe is called Superdeluxo Chocolate Spacecake because I don't quite know what to compare it to. It's like nothing else I've had. The best way I can explain the texture and flavor of this loaf is a cheesecake crossbred with a donut.

CourseCuisineTime - 45 minutes
Dessert, SnackAmericanPrep - 10 minutes
Cook - 35 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
138kcal10 slices
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates15g53%
Fat3.9g13%
Protein10.6g37%

Ingredients:

  • 1 cups (340 g) plain non fat Greek yogurt
  • 7/8 cup (80 g) oat flour cup + 2 tbsp
  • cup (30 g) tapioca flour cornstarch works too
  • cup (113 g) unsweetened applesauce
  • 2 scoop (60 g) vanilla casein protein powder
  • 1 tsp (4 ml) vanilla
  • 1 tbsp (10 g) splenda
  • 2 eggs
  • cup (60 g) chocolate chips
  • 2 tsp (8 g) melted butter

Instructions:

  1. Preheat oven to 350F
  2. Sift flours so no clumps remain. Mix the flours together with casein until incorporated.
  3. In a separate bowl mix the vanilla, splenda, applesauce, yogurt, and eggs.
  4. Stir the wet ingredients and dry ingredients together in a large bowl.
  5. Spray an 8x8 or loaf pan with oil. Pour mixture in. Spread it evenly. Bang it against the counter to get as much air out as possible. If you use an 8x8 you may need more chocolate for the topping because of the extra surface area.
  6. Bake for 24 minutes if using an 8x8 or 30-35 minutes if using a loaf pan. Check doneness using when a toothpick inserted comes out clean.
  7. Allow to cool. Once cooled melt the chocolate chips and butter together. Pour over top and allow to harden.
  8. This recipe makes 10 slices.

Funfetti Protein Cake Bites

A low calorie cake bite made from coconut flour, casein protien powder, and egg whites. Sprinkled into the batter is rainbow sprinkles for color and sweetness.

CourseCuisineTime - 33 minutes
Dessert, SnackAmericanPrep - 15 minutes
Cook - 18 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
34kcal7 bites
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates2.8g40%
Fat0.4g5%
Protein5g71%

Ingredients:

  • 3 tbsp (48 g) liquid egg whites (1 egg white)
  • 2 tbsp (15 g) coconut flour
  • 1 scoop (30 g) vanilla casein protein powder
  • tsp (2 g) stevia
  • 3.5 tbsp (50 g) plain non fat Greek yogurt
  • 1 tsp (5 g) rainbow sprinkles
  • 2 tbsp (35 ml) water

Instructions:

  1. Preheat oven to 350F.
  2. Mix the dry ingredients together until incorporated making sure there is no clumping.
  3. Add in the Greek yogurt, egg whites and water. Stir to form dough. Add in sprinkles.
  4. Use a cookie scoop to create balls and place on a greased cookie sheet. If you dont have a scoop make ~1 balls. Makes 7.
  5. Bake for 18-20 minutes.

Crunchy Granola Bars

A crunchy, sweet granola bar made from oats, puffed rice, chocolate chips, and dried cranberries. These bars have protein powder mixed in as well to increase the protein load.

CourseCuisineTime - 40 minutes
Dessert, SnackAmericanPrep - 10 minutes
Cook - 30 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
180kcal24 bars
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates25.7g73%
Fat6.7g19%
Protein4.2g12%

Ingredients:

  • 5 cups (400 g) oats
  • 3 cups (51 g) puffed rice cereal
  • cup (112 g) melted coconut oil
  • 2 scoops (64 g) vanilla whey protein powder
  • 1 cup (240 ml) maple syrup
  • 3 tsp (12 ml) vanilla
  • 1 tsp (3 g) salt
  • cup (60 g) dried cranberries
  • cup (56 g) mini chocolate chips

Instructions:

  1. Preheat oven to 350F
  2. In a large bowl mix the salt, oats, and oil. Pour onto a baking sheet and bake until toasted, about 15 minutes stirring every couple of minutes.
  3. While the oats are baking, stir together the syrup, whey, and vanilla until the whey is dissolved.
  4. Mix the oats, puffed rice, cranberries, and syrup mixture together.
  5. Line a sheet pan with foil and spray with oil. Pour the mixture into the pan and press firmly. Add a layer of wax paper over the top before you press to keep your hands clean. The sheet pan should be a standard size ideally with a lip. If you have a smaller sheet pan youll probably end up with chewy bars.
  6. Bake for 10-15 minutes and remove from oven. Cut into 24 bars while still warm.

Dark Chocolate Drizzled Protein Rice Crispy Treats

Rice crispy treats made from cornstarch and protein powder instead of marshmallows to make these into a high protein treat.

CourseCuisineTime - 10 minutes
Dessert, SnackAmericanPrep - 10 minutes
Cook - null

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
161kcal4 servings
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates20.9g59%
Fat2.8g8%
Protein13.1g37%

Ingredients:

  • 2 cups (66 g) crispy rice cereal
  • 2 scoops (60 g) vanilla whey protein powder
  • 2 tsp (8 g) cornstarch
  • cup (60 ml) water
  • 2 tbsp (30 g) dark chocolate chips

Instructions:

  1. Mix the cornstarch and protein powder together.
  2. Stir in cup of water and vigorously stir until it is completely smooth.
  3. Pour in cereal and stir to coat.
  4. Press into an 8x8 pan.
  5. Melt chocolate and drizzle over the top. I added a bit of liquid to make it a bit less viscous. Allow it to come together and set up.

Blueberry Scones

A gluten free alternative to scones. These scones don't use as much fat as normal ones in order to be more calorie friendly so the texture isn't like a traditional scone but they still taste great.

CourseCuisineTime - 32 minutes
Dessert, SnackAmericanPrep - 10 minutes
Cook - 22 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
92kcal8 scones
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates14.5g76%
Fat2.4g12%
Protein3.1g16%

Ingredients:

  • 1 cup (100 g) oat flour
  • cup (150 g) plain non fat Greek yogurt
  • cup (140 g) frozen blueberries
  • 2 tbsp (42 g) honey
  • 1 tbsp (14 g) butter
  • 1 tsp (4 g) stevia
  • 1 tsp (4 g) baking powder
  • tsp (2 g) baking soda

Instructions:

  1. Preheat oven to 375F.
  2. Mix the oat flour, baking powder, and baking soda together in a small bowl.
  3. In a different bowl mix the Greek yogurt, honey, butter, and stevia together.
  4. Slowly stir in the flour and then fold in the blueberries.
  5. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper and spray with oil. Plop the batter down and form it into a circle with a thickness of about 1 inch.
  6. Cut into 8 pieces and spread apart.
  7. Bake for 20-22 minutes or longer if you want it crispier. Top with more honey if desired

Double Chocolate Chewy Cookies

Double chocolate chip cookies made from a base of white kidney beans, flour, and applesauce. These are miniature cookies and have only roughly 27 calories per cookie.

CourseCuisineTime - 24 minutes
Dessert, SnackAmericanPrep - 15 minutes
Cook - 9 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
27kcal24 mini cookies
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates4.7g117%
Fat0.6g15%
Protein0.8g20%

Ingredients:

Wet Ingredients

  • 1 cup (150 g) drained white kidney beans
  • 3 tbsp (45 g) unsweetened applesauce
  • 2 tsp (10 g) stevia
  • 1 tsp (4 ml) vanilla
  • 1 egg

Dry Ingredients

  • cup (75 g) gluten free baking flour
  • 2 tbsp (10 g) cocoa powder
  • tsp (2 g) baking soda
  • Pinch (0.5 g) salt
  • 2 tbsp (28 g) mini chocolate chips

Instructions:

  1. Preheat oven to 350F
  2. Drain the beans and rinse. Dry as well as possible. Use a food processor or a tool to mash the beans into a paste.
  3. In a large bowl, mix the beans, apple sauce, egg, stevia, vanilla, and egg.
  4. In a different bowl mix the dry ingredients.
  5. Slowly add the dry ingredients and half the chocolate chips to the wet ingredients and mix to incorporate.
  6. Spray a baking sheet with oil. Use a small sized cookie scoop to create little balls of dough. Press into cookie shape and top with remaining chips.
  7. Bake at 350F for 8-9 minutes.
  8. Makes 24 cookies.

Chocolate Chip Banana Bread Muffins

Muffins made from oats, Greek yogurt, bananas, and protein powder. These muffins are topped with chocolate chips but you could also do blueberries if you wanted something lower in calories.

CourseCuisineTime - 32 minutes
Dessert, SnackAmericanPrep - 10 minutes
Cook - 22 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
103kcal10 muffins
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates14.3g68%
Fat2.6g12%
Protein5.6g26%

Ingredients:

  • 1 cup (80 g) oats
  • cup (150 g) plain non fat Greek yogurt
  • 2 medium (250 g) total ripe bananas
  • 1 scoop (32 g) whey
  • 1 egg
  • 1 tsp (4 ml) vanilla
  • 1 tsp (4 g) baking powder
  • 1 tsp (4 g) stevia
  • 3 tbsp (45 g) dark chocolate chips

Instructions:

  1. Preheat your oven to 350F.
  2. In a blender, add the oats and pulverize into a flour. Add in the remainder of the ingredients minus the chocolate chips and blend until smooth.
  3. Spray a muffin tin with cooking spray and fill the wells half way with the batter. It will make 10 Muffins.
  4. Top each with some dark chocolate chips
  5. Bake for 20-22 minutes. I think the muffins are better when they sit overnight

Post Workout Weight Gain Chocolate Milkshake

A high protein, high calorie milkshake that would work well for gaining weight. Being in liquid form, this shake is an easy way to get in lots of calories.

CourseCuisineTime - 5 minutes
Dessert, SnackAmericanPrep - 5 minutes
Cook - null

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
614kcal1
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates52g43%
Fat26.3g21%
Protein42.4g35%

Ingredients:

  • 1 scoop (30 g) whey protein
  • 1 cup (240 ml) whole milk
  • 1 medium (125 g) frozen banana
  • 2 tbsp (32 g) peanut butter
  • 2 tbsp (10 g) cocoa powder
  • 6-8 ice cubes

Instructions:

  1. Place all ingredients into a high powered blender and blend until smooth. Adjust the ice as preferred to get a thicker or thinner shake.

Banana Cream Pie Milkshake

A banana cream pie flavored milkshake made from frozen greek yogurt, a banana, and honey nut cheerios to act as the crust.

CourseCuisineTime - 5 minutes
Dessert, SnackAmericanPrep - 5 minutes
Cook - null

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
408kcal1
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates45.7g46%
Fat1.7g1%
Protein52.5g53%

Ingredients:

  • 1 scoop (32 g) whey protein
  • 1 cup (227 g) plain non fat Greek yogurt frozen
  • 1 packet (2 g) stevia powder
  • 1 medium (100 g) banana
  • cup (9 g) honey nut cheerios
  • cup (120 ml) skim milk

Instructions:

  1. Place 1 cup of Greek yogurt into the freezer.
  2. Mix all of your ingredients except a small handful of the cheerios in a blender and blend until smooth.
  3. Crush the remaining cherrios and top with the crushed cheerios.

Peanut Butter Chocolate Mug Cake

A cake made from protein powder, cocoa powder, and applesauce that is cooked inside of mug and microwaved. If you're in need of a quick sweet treat, this is your recipe.

CourseCuisineTime - 7 minutes
Dessert, SnackAmericanPrep - 5 minutes
Cook - 2 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
351kcal1
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates29.4g39%
Fat9.3g12%
Protein37.3g49%

Ingredients:

  • cup (113 g) unsweetened applesauce
  • 1 scoop (32 g) whey protein
  • 2 tbsp (10 g) cocoa powder
  • 2 tbsp (10 g) powdered peanut butter
  • tsp (1 ml) vanilla
  • 1 egg
  • tsp (2 g) stevia
  • 1 tsp (5 g) rainbow sprinkles

Instructions:

  1. Mix everything in a mug and stir until incorporated.
  2. Microwave 2-2 minutes.

Chocolate Mug Cake

A cake made from protein powder, cocoa powder, and applesauce that is cooked inside of mug and microwaved. If you're in need of a quick sweet treat, this is your recipe.

CourseCuisineTime - 7 minutes
Dessert, SnackAmericanPrep - 5 minutes
Cook - 2 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
268kcal1
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates21.2g37%
Fat6.7g11%
Protein30.8g54%

Ingredients:

  • 1 scoop (30 g) whey protein
  • 2 tbsp (10 g) cocoa powder
  • tsp (2 g) stevia powder
  • 1 egg
  • 1 pinch (0.5 g) salt
  • tsp (1 ml) vanilla
  • cup (113 g) unsweetened applesauce

Instructions:

  1. Mix all of your ingredients in a mug.
  2. Microwave for 2 minutes or until it has set.

Chocolate Chip Cookie Bread

A gluten free, sweet bread recipe made from oat flour and plain greek yogurt. These bites taste similar to a chocolate chip cookie but have texture more similar to bread.

CourseCuisineTime - 27 minutes
Dessert, SnackAmericanPrep - 10 minutes
Cook - 17 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
67kcal11 bites
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates8.7g72%
Fat2.4g20%
Protein2.6g21%

Ingredients:

Dry Ingredients

  • 14 tbsp (80 g) oat flour cup + 2 tbsp
  • tsp (2 g) baking soda
  • tsp (1 g) salt

Wet Ingredients

  • 1 small egg
  • cup (150 g) plain non fat Greek yogurt
  • 1 tsp (5 g) splenda
  • 1 tsp (4 ml) vanilla
  • cup (60 g) chocolate chips

Instructions:

  1. Preheat oven to 375F.
  2. Stir together the dry ingredients and the wet ingredients separately.
  3. Mix the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients.
  4. Use a cookie scoop to make balls. Place on a greased cookie sheet and bake for 15-17 minutes. Makes 11.

Peanut Butter Marshmallow Bites

A quick dessert/snack to make from puffed rice cereal, marshmallows, and honey. Powdered peanut butter is used in place of regular peanut butter to lessen the caloric load.

CourseCuisineTime - 15 minutes
Dessert, SnackAmericanPrep - 10 minutes
Cook - 5 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
41kcal19 bites
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates8.2g91%
Fat0.3g3%
Protein1.3g14%

Ingredients:

  • 3 cups (51 g) puffed rice cereal
  • cup (54 g) powdered peanut butter
  • 3 Tbsp (63 g) honey
  • cup (30 g) mini marshmallows
  • 2 Tbsp (24 g) rainbow sprinkles

Instructions:

  1. In a small sauce pan, melt the honey, marshmallows, and peanut butter together. Mix the powdered peanut butter with the necessary amount of water as instructed on the packaging first.
  2. Pour over the cereal and mix in sprinkles.
  3. Form into balls with a cookie scoop and store in the refrigerator so they firm up. Makes 19.

Chocolate Chip Puffed Rice Cookies

Chocolate chip cookies made from puffed rice instead of flour for volume and applesauce instead of butter to add moisture.

CourseCuisineTime - 20 minutes
Dessert, SnackAmericanPrep - 10 minutes
Cook - 10 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
49kcal11 cookies
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates7.8g86%
Fat1.4g15%
Protein1.2g13%

Ingredients:

Dry Ingredients

  • 2 cups (34 g) puffed rice cereal
  • 6 tbsp (40 g) oat flour
  • 1 tsp (4 g) baking soda
  • tsp (1 g) salt

Wet Ingredients

  • 1 egg
  • cup (113 g) unsweetened applesauce
  • 1 tsp (4 ml) vanilla
  • 2 tsp (10 g) stevia
  • 2 tbsp (28 g) mini chocolate chips

Instructions:

  1. Preheat oven to 325F. Mix dry ingredients and wet ingredients separately. Combine into one bowl with half the chocolate chips.
  2. Allow the dough to rest and hydrate for a few minutes before scooping.
  3. Grease a sheet pan. Using a cookie scoop place the dough onto the pan. Form into cookie shape, top with remaining chocolate chips. I yielded 11 cookies.
  4. Bake 10 minutes.

Mint Chocolate Chip Banana "Ice Cream"

Frozen bananas blended with a bit of milk, protein powder, chocolate chips and mint extract to replicate Mint Chocolate Chip Ice Cream.

CourseCuisineTime - 10 minutes
Dessert, SnackAmericanPrep - 10 minutes
Cook - null

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
209kcal3 servings
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates26g55%
Fat3.6g7%
Protein18.2g38%

Ingredients:

  • 2 medium (250 g) frozen bananas
  • 2 scoops (60 g) whey protein
  • cup (120 ml) whole milk
  • 1 tsp (4 ml) vanilla extract
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) mini chocolate chips
  • 1-2 drops green food coloring
  • 1-2 drops peppermint extract

Instructions:

  1. Add the frozen bananas to a high powered blender in small pieces.
  2. Slowly pour in the milk and start to churn.
  3. Add in the whey, mint, and coloring.
  4. Fold in chocolate chips.
  5. Makes 3 servings.

Chocolate Chip Cookie Bars

These cookie bars are made from beans, casein protein, and oat flour. If you didnt know that there were beans in this recipe I have a hard time believing you could guess what they are made of.

CourseCuisineTime - 35 minutes
Dessert, SnackAmericanPrep - 10 minutes
Cook - 25 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
101kcal10 bars
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates16.2g73%
Fat1.5g6%
Protein5.7g25%

Ingredients:

Wet Ingredients

  • 1 can (425 g) cannellini beans
  • cup (60 ml) maple syrup
  • 1 scoop (32 g) vanilla casein protein powder
  • cup (58 g) unsweetened applesauce

Dry Ingredients

  • cup (20 g) oat flour
  • tsp (2 g) baking soda
  • 1 tsp (4 ml) vanilla
  • 1 (1 ) egg
  • 2 tbsp (30 ml) water
  • 2 tbsp (30 g) mini chocolate chips

Instructions:

  1. Preheat oven to 350F.
  2. Drain and rinse beans.
  3. In a food processor or a blender mix everything but the chocolate chips until smooth.
  4. Spray an 8x8 with oil and pour in the batter. Top with or stir in the chocolate chips.
  5. Bake for 23-25 minutes.
  6. Let it cool completely and cut into 10 bars.

Perfect Chocolate Cream Dream Angel Bake

This version of the Perfect Chocolate Dream Angel Bake incorporates some cream cheese to make a brownie/cheesecake hybrid. It is made by whipping egg whites to create lots of volume.

CourseCuisineTime - 38 minutes
Dessert, SnackAmericanPrep - 15 minutes
Cook - 23 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
172kcal4 servings
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates15.4g40%
Fat3g7%
Protein20.8g54%

Ingredients:

  • 9 tbsp (138 g) liquid egg whites cup + 1 tbsp
  • cup (113 g) unsweetened applesauce
  • 1 scoops (45 g) vanilla casein protein powder
  • 1 tsp (4 ml) vanilla
  • 2 tsp (8 g) stevia
  • tsp (1 g) baking powder
  • 2 tbsp (30 g) mini chocolate chips
  • 3 tbsp (15 g) cocoa powder
  • cup (113 g) plain non fat Greek yogurt
  • cup (113 g) fat free cream cheese
  • 1 tsp (5 g) oat flour

Instructions:

  1. Preheat oven to 300F
  2. Beat the egg whites, vanilla, & baking powder until stiff peaks form.
  3. Add tsp stevia & cocoa powder.
  4. Add in applesauce & casein. Youll lose a lot of the volume here.
  5. Pour of it into a greased 8x8. top with chocolate chips.
  6. Melt cream cheese in microwave. Stir in 1 stevia, yogurt, and oat flour.
  7. Spread a layer of the cream cheese over the brownie. Add the remaining brownie to the top by the spoonful and marble with a knife.
  8. Bake for 20-23 minutes. Let cool before eating if you want it to be solid.

Perfect Chocolate Pudding Dream Angel Bake

This is my favorite dessert recipe I have ever developed. This entire 8x8 pan is only 511 calories. It is made by whipping egg whites to create lots of volume. This is more souffl-like than brownie like but the longer it sits, the more dense it becomes.

CourseCuisineTime - 32 minutes
Dessert, SnackAmericanPrep - 10 minutes
Cook - 22 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
511kcal1
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates60g54%
Fat11.9g10%
Protein40.9g36%

Ingredients:

  • 9 tbsp (138 g) liquid egg whites cup + 1 tbsp
  • cup (113 g) unsweetened applesauce
  • 1 scoop (30 g) casein protein
  • 1 tsp (4 ml) vanilla
  • tsp (2 g) stevia
  • tsp (2 g) baking powder
  • 2 tbsp (30 g) mini chocolate chips
  • 2 tbsp (10 g) cocoa powder
  • 1 pack (92 g) chocolate pudding the snack packs

Instructions:

  1. Preheat oven to 325F.
  2. Beat the egg whites, vanilla, & baking powder until stiff peaks form.
  3. Add stevia & cocoa powder.
  4. Add in applesauce & casein. Youll lose a lot of the volume here, thats okay.
  5. Pour into a greased 8x8. Top with chocolate chips. Swirl in the pudding.
  6. Bake 20-22 minutes.

Perfect Chocolate Dream Angel Bake

This is my favorite dessert recipe I have ever developed. This entire 8x8 pan is only 420 calories. It is made by whipping egg whites to create lots of volume. This is more souffl-like than brownie like but the longer it sits, the more dense it becomes.

CourseCuisineTime - 32 minutes
Dessert, SnackAmericanPrep - 10 minutes
Cook - 22 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
420kcal1
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates42g45%
Fat9.4g10%
Protein41.9g45%

Ingredients:

  • 9 tbsp (138 g) liquid egg whites cup + 1 tbsp
  • cup (113 g) unsweetened applesauce
  • 1 scoop (30 g) casein protein
  • 1 tsp (4 ml) vanilla
  • tsp (2 g) stevia
  • tsp (2 g) cream of tartar use tsp baking powder if you don't have any
  • 2 tbsp (30 g) mini chocolate chips
  • 2 tbsp (10 g) cocoa powder

Instructions:

  1. Preheat oven to 325F.
  2. Beat the egg whites, vanilla, & cream of tartar until stiff peaks form. This is important.
  3. Add stevia & cocoa powder.
  4. Add in applesauce & casein. Youll lose a lot of the volume here, thats okay.
  5. Pour into a greased 8x8. Top with chocolate chips.
  6. Bake 20-22 minutes.

Strawberry Shortcake Cookies

A cookie/shortbread made from casein protein powder and coconut flour and topped with fresh strawberries and a Greek yogurt whipped cream mixture.

CourseCuisineTime - 28 minutes
Dessert, SnackAmericanPrep - 20 minutes
Cook - 8 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
68kcal12 cookies
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates4.9g44%
Fat3.4g30%
Protein4.3g39%

Ingredients:

For the Cookie

  • cup (28 g) coconut flour
  • 2 Tbsp (30 g) coconut oil
  • 1 scoop (30 g) vanilla casein protein powder
  • tsp (2 ml) vanilla
  • tsp (2 g) baking soda
  • 1 tsp (6 g) stevia
  • 1 (1 ) egg

For the Filling

  • 7 tbsp (100 g) plain non fat Greek yogurt cup + 3 tbsp
  • 1/3 scoop (10 g) vanilla whey protein powder
  • tsp (2 g) stevia powder
  • tsp (2 ml) vanilla
  • 14 tbsp (35 g) fat free whipped cream cup + 2 tbsp
  • 5 (200 g) strawberries

Instructions:

  1. Preheat oven to 350F.
  2. Mix the dry cookie ingredients together until incorporated. Mix the wet ingredients separately (melt the oil first).
  3. Combine dry and wet and mix thoroughly.
  4. Split the dough into 12 balls and place on a oiled baking sheet. Press into cookie form. (Note: Youll see in the picture the cookies are in mini muffin shape. I pressed the dough into a mini muffin tin to create wells to hold the filling. It was way too much work do to this so just make regular cookies.)
  5. Bake 7-8 minutes.

For the Filling

  1. For the filling mix everything but the whipped cream in a bowl and mix vigorously. When all of the protein has incorporated, add the whipped cream and fold in gently.
  2. Cut the strawberries into small pieces.
  3. Top each cookie with the filling and strawberries once cooled.

Double Chocolate Chip Muffins

A gluten free, chocolate muffin topped with chocolate chips. These muffins can be made regular sized or as mini muffins if you prefer. They are made from a combination of oat and coconut flour and use Greek yogurt instead of oil.

CourseCuisineTime - 30 minutes
Dessert, SnackAmericanPrep - 10 minutes
Cook - 20 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
106kcal11 muffins
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates15.7g74%
Fat2.7g12%
Protein4.8g22%

Ingredients:

  • cup (50 g) oat flour
  • cup (37 g) coconut flour
  • cup (20 g) cocoa powder
  • 2 eggs
  • 6 Tbsp (92 g) liquid egg whites
  • cup (113 g) plain non fat Greek yogurt
  • 1 medium (125 g) banana
  • 2 Tbsp (42 g) honey
  • 1 tsp (4 g) baking soda
  • 2 tsp (8 g) stevia
  • 3 tbsp (45 g) mini chocolate chips

Instructions:

  1. Preheat oven to 350F.
  2. Mix all of the dry ingredients together to prevent clumping.
  3. In a food processor (by hand is fine) mix the dry ingredients (except chocolate chips) with the wet ingredients until incorporated.
  4. Stir in 2 tbsp of the chocolate chips.
  5. Spray a muffin tin with oil and fill the wells about of the way. Dont use liners, they will stick. Top with remaining chocolate chips. I got 11 regular sized muffins or 24 mini muffins.
  6. Bake for 20 minutes for regular sized or 15 minutes for mini.

Banana Chocolate Protein Frosty

Frozen bananas blended with a bit of milk, protein powder, and cocoa powder to replicate a Chocolate frosty.

CourseCuisineTime - 10 minutes
Dessert, SnackAmericanPrep - 10 minutes
Cook - null

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
195kcal3 servings
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates23.8g55%
Fat2.7g6%
Protein18.9g43%

Ingredients:

  • 2 medium (250 g) frozen bananas
  • 2 scoops (60 g) whey protein
  • 1/2 cup (120 ml) whole milk
  • 2 tbsp (10 g) cocoa powder

Instructions:

  1. Put the frozen bananas in the blender and start churning.
  2. Add the milk slowly until you reach your desired consistency. If your bananas are bigger or smaller you may need more or less liquid.
  3. Add the protein and cocoa powders and mix until incorporated.
  4. Makes 3 servings.

Vegetable Shake

This is my daily vegetable shake. As many of you know, I despise and hate vegetables with the fire of 10,000 dragons. This is not something to drink for enjoyment. It doesn't taste good and if you have a crappy blender I wouldn't even try to make it. I drink this purely to get in a large serving of vegetables. The blender I use is a Vitamix 5200.

CourseCuisineTime - 10 minutes
DrinksAmerican, ArgentinianPrep - 10 minutes
Cook - null

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
167kcal4 servings
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates35.9g94%
Fat0.9g2%
Protein3.9g10%

Ingredients:

  • 1 pint (473 ml) water
  • 2 tbsp (30 ml) lemon juice
  • 1 cup (85 g) carrots
  • 4 cups (125 g) kale
  • 2 (365 g) pears
  • 1 medium (300 g) cucumber
  • 1 medium (200 g) zucchini
  • 1 inch (15 g) ginger

Instructions:

  1. Add all of the ingredients to a blender. Blend until smooth.
  2. Store in mason jars and refrigerate or freeze if youre prepping more than a days worth.

NOTE

  1. I've started to cut all of the vegetables in advance and store them in meal prep containers instead of blending them and storing in the mason jars. This is better for preserving nutrient quality.

Smores Pizza Bites

A gluten free pizza bite that is freezer friendly for you to have available to you whenever you need a quick snack.

CourseCuisineTime - 35 minutes
SnackAmerican, meal prepPrep - 25 minutes
Cook - 9 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
29kcal24 bites
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates4.5g90%
Fat0.6g12%
Protein1.4g27%

Ingredients:

  • cup (90 g) oat flour
  • 3 tbsp (45 g) liquid egg whites
  • cup (165 g) plain non fat Greek yogurt
  • 1 tsp (4 g) baking powder
  • tsp (2 g) stevia
  • 2 tbsp (28 g) chocolate chips
  • cup (28 g) mini marshmallows

Instructions:

For the Crust

  1. Preheat your oven to 425F.
  2. In a large bowl, mix the oat flour, egg whites, Greek yogurt, baking powder, and stevia until combined.
  3. Spray a mini muffin tin with oil. Put a spoonful of dough into 24 wells. Do your best to get the wells filled evenly. I find that a small cookie scoop is easiest but a spoon works as well. With some practice you'll get better at eyeballing the size.
  4. Form the dough into the shape of the well. I find this step easiest if you use a pointy spoon, put the spoon in the center of the dough, and drag the back of the spoon up the sides while applying a little pressure on the well of the muffin tin on all sides. I like to fill all of the wells first, then go through and form the wells, then redistribute any dough as needed to make them more even.
  5. Parbake the dough for 3 minutes.

For the Topping

  1. Measure out the marshmallows and chocolate chips. (If you're not worried about exact calories, just eyeball it. Your life will be easier.
  2. Top each pizza bite with the toppings. Bake for an additional 3-5 minutes. Watch them carefully to make sure the marshmallows don't melt and they brown like you want them to.
  3. Remove from oven and allow to cool.

Storage

  1. Once the bites are at room temperature, add them to a gallon ziplock bag. Label the bag with the name and date and freeze.
  2. To the reheat the pizza bites, microwave them for 1-2 minutes or until thawed based on the power of your microwave.

Shredded BBQ Chicken

A simple recipe comprised of only 7 ingredients, this meal is perfect for days you don't want to spend a lot of time in the kitchen as you will use the crockpot to cook the chicken and can buy frozen green beans to save time.

CourseCuisineTime - 6 hours 6 hours 6 hours
Main DishAmerican, meal prepPrep - 10 minutes 10 minutes 10 minutes
Cook - 6 hours 6 hours 6 hours

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
664kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates81g54%
Fat15g10%
Protein52g35%

Ingredients:

  • 2 lbs (1135 g) boneless skinless chicken breast
  • cup (180 ml) vinegar based BBQ sauce I use the brand Gates
  • 9-10 medium (1135 g) russet potatoes
  • 3 tbsp (45 ml) olive oil
  • 20 oz (567 g) frozen green beans fresh is fine
  • Salt and pepper

Instructions:

  1. Cook the chicken with 1 cup of water or broth in a crockpot on low for 6 hours or high for 2-3.
  2. Once cooked remove from liquid and shred. Mix in the BBQ sauce.
  3. Preheat oven to 425F
  4. Cut potatoes into wedges and toss in olive oil. Season with salt and pepper.
  5. Bake for 10 minutes and then flip. Cook an additional 10 minutes or until desired crispiness is achieved
  6. Cook green beans as instructed on package. Season with salt and pepper.
  7. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide evenly 5 ways.

Jalapeo Apple Sweet Potato Hash with Ham and Eggs

Sweet potatoes mixed with jalapeos, bell pepper, onion, and apple for a crisp and flavorful breakfast hash. This hash is served with a side of ham and eggs for protein.

CourseCuisineTime - 40 minutes 40 minutes 40 minutes
BreakfastAmerican, meal prepPrep - 10 minutes 10 minutes 10 minutes
Cook - 30 minutes 30 minutes 30 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
613kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates57g48%
Fat28g23%
Protein33g27%

Ingredients:

  • 12 eggs
  • 1 lb (454 g) ham steak
  • 4 medium (900 g) sweet potatoes
  • 2 (20 g) jalapeo pepper
  • 2 medium (300 g) red pepper
  • 1 medium (200 g) sweet onion
  • 2 (200 g) golden delicious apple
  • 2 tbsp (38 ml) olive oil
  • Salt and pepper to taste

Instructions:

  1. Preheat oven to 425F.
  2. Hard boil 12 eggs.
  3. Wash and cut potatoes into a medium dice. Toss in 2 tbsp of olive oil and bake for 10 minutes. Flip and cook an additional 10 minutes.
  4. Cut the onion and red pepper into a small dice. Cut the jalapeo into slices. Cut out the seeds if you dont like heat.
  5. Heat tbsp of oil in a pan over medium heat. Saut the onions for a few minutes and then add in the pepper and jalapeo. Cook until soft.
  6. Cut the apple into a medium dice.
  7. Remove from heat. Add the potatoes and apple to the pan with the peppers. Season with salt and pepper.
  8. Cook the ham however you please. You dont even need to if you dont want to.
  9. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide into 5 servings.

Buffalo Chicken Breakfast Bowls

A change from the traditional style breakfasts, this meal has buffalo chicken with potatoes, mushrooms, peppers and eggs that you can mix together in one big scramble.

CourseCuisineTime - 40 minutes 40 minutes 40 minutes
BreakfastAmerican, meal prepPrep - 10 minutes 10 minutes 10 minutes
Cook - 30 minutes 30 minutes 30 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
497kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates38g39%
Fat23g23%
Protein35g36%

Ingredients:

  • 1 lb (454 g) boneless skinless chicken breast
  • 10 (10 ) eggs
  • 1 medium (150 g) green pepper
  • 4 oz (113 g) mushrooms sliced
  • 4 medium (1000 g) russet potatoes
  • 2-3 Tbsp (30 ml) buffalo sauce
  • 4 Tbsp (60 ml) olive oil
  • Salt and pepper to taste

Instructions:

For the Potatoes

  1. Preheat your oven to 400F.
  2. Wash and cut your potatoes into a medium dice.
  3. Spread on a sheet pan and drizzle with 2 Tbsp of olive oil. Season with salt and pepper.
  4. Bake for 10 minutes then remove and flip. Cook an additional 5-7 minutes or until crispy

For the Chicken

  1. Butterfly the chicken breast so it will cook quicker and more evenly. Season with salt and pepper.
  2. Add 1 Tbsp of olive oil in a grill pan or skillet over medium heat. Cook the chicken until it has reached an internal temperature of at least 165F.
  3. Cut into a small dice of about " cubes. Mix in buffalo sauce.

For the Peppers and Mushrooms

  1. Wash and cut the pepper into a large dice. Add 1 Tbsp of olive oil to a skillet over medium heat.
  2. Cook the peppers for 3-4 minutes and then add in the mushrooms. Cook until soft.

For the Eggs

  1. Scramble and cook 10 eggs.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide your ingredients evenly between 5 containers.

Deconstructed Chicken Pot Pie

Shredded chicken with peas, celery, carrots, and onions served over top of a bed of mashed potatoes. This is a deconstructed version of the traditional Chicken Pot Pie where the potatoes replace the pie crust.

CourseCuisineTime - 50 minutes 50 minutes 50 minutes
Main DishAmerican, meal prepPrep - 10 minutes 10 minutes 10 minutes
Cook - 40 minutes 40 minutes 40 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
642kcal4
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates76g55%
Fat20g14%
Protein40g29%

Ingredients:

  • 1 lb (681 g) boneless skinless chicken thighs
  • 2 lbs (908 g) carrots
  • 3 stalks (300 g) celery
  • (100 g) onion
  • 2 lb (908 g) potatoes
  • 6 oz (170 g) frozen peas
  • 14 oz (397 g) chicken broth
  • cup (120 ml) milk
  • 2 tbsp (28 g) butter
  • 2 tbsp (30 ml) cornstarch
  • 2 tbsp (30 ml) water
  • 2 tbsp (30 ml) olive oil
  • Salt and pepper to taste

Instructions:

For the Chicken

  1. Wash 3 stalks of celery and peel 3 carrots. Cut the vegetables and of an onion into a small dice.
  2. Heat 1 Tbsp of olive oil in a large pot over medium high heat. Add the vegetables and cook until the onions are translucent.
  3. Add the chicken breast and 14.5 oz can of chicken broth. Cover the pot and reduce the heat to medium low. Cook for 25-30 minutes or until the chicken has cooked through.
  4. Once the chicken has cooked remove it from the pot and shred with two forks.
  5. Mix 2 Tbsp of cornstarch with 2 Tbsp of cold water and add to the pot to create a gravy. Stir to incorporate and bring to a boil to thicken.
  6. Once the sauce has thickened, add the shredded chicken and peas.

For the Roasted Carrots

  1. Preheat your oven to 400F.
  2. Wash and peel 7-9 carrots and cut on a bias to pieces about 1" thick and 2-3" long.
  3. Transfer the carrots to a sheet pan, oil and bake for 20 minutes, flipping halfway through.

For the Potatoes

  1. Wash and cut the potatoes into a large dice. Boil in a large pot of water until soft.
  2. Drain the water and add cup of milk and butter. Mash until smooth

Plating

  1. Divide your ingredients evenly between 4 containers.

Grilled Chicken Breast Sandwiches

Grilled chicken breasts marinated in a number of different ingredients to develop flavor. Sometimes I like to use waffles as buns, other times i'll use regular buns. A remoulade is spread on the bun and each thigh is topped with an arugula salad.

CourseCuisineTime - 50 minutes 50 minutes
Main DishAmericanPrep - 35 minutes 35 minutes
Cook - 15 minutes 15 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
493kcal5 Sandwiches
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates42g45%
Fat25g27%
Protein25g27%

Ingredients:

  • 20 oz (568 g) boneless skinless chicken thighs 5 thighs of roughly 4oz each
  • 4 tsp (20 g) Dijon mustard
  • 2 tsp (10 ml) soy sauce
  • 1 tsp (3 ml) garlic powder
  • 2-3 tbsp (30 ml) lemon juice
  • 1 tbsp (15 ml) olive oil

For the Salad

  • 3 oz (85 g) arugula
  • 1 tbsp (15 ml) olive oil
  • 1 tbsp (21 g) honey
  • Lemon juice to taste
  • 1/4 cup (40 g) feta cheese
  • Salt

For the Remoulade

  • 3 tbsp (45 g) mayonnaise
  • 2 tbsp (30 g) dill relish
  • Lemon juice to taste
  • 5 buns
  • 1 large (125 g) tomato

Instructions:

For the Chicken

  1. In a bowl mix together the chicken marinade. Stir and adjust flavor as preferred. Add chicken & marinade at room temp for 30 minutes. Start your grill.
  2. Grill the chicken for 3-4 minutes on each side or until cooked through.

For the Salad

  1. Mix together the arugula, oil, lemon, honey and feta. Adjust flavor as needed.

For the Remoulade

  1. Mix together the mayo, relish, and lemon juice. Pepper to taste.

Plating

  1. Cut the tomato.
  2. Toast the waffles/buns.
  3. Spread a layer of the mayo on each bun. Top with chicken, tomato, and salad mix.
  4. Makes 5 sandwiches, nutritional info is for each one.

Italian Turkey Bowls

Ground turkey cooked in a homemade Italian dressing and served with green beans and roasted sweet potatoes. This meal can be made in only 30 minutes.

CourseCuisineTime - 30 minutes 30 minutes 30 minutes
Main DishAmerican, meal prepPrep - 10 minutes 10 minutes 10 minutes
Cook - 25 minutes 25 minutes 25 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
642kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates43g37%
Fat35g30%
Protein38g32%

Ingredients:

  • 2 lbs (908 g) ground beef (85/15)
  • 1 lb (454 g) green beans fresh or frozen
  • 3 medium (900 g) sweet potatoes
  • Basil optional
  • 2 tbsp (30 ml) olive oil

For the Dressing

  • 1/4 cup (60 ml) red wine vinegar
  • 1 tbsp (15 ml) olive oil
  • 1 tsp (5 ml) lemon juice
  • 1 tsp (4 g) garlic powder
  • 1/2 tsp (2 g) onion powder
  • 1 tsp (1 g) dried basil
  • Pinch (Pinch) salt and pepper

Instructions:

  1. Preheat your oven to 450F.
  2. Cut your potatoes into thin ( or less) half moon shaped pieces. Toss in tbsp olive oil and spread on a sheet pan.
  3. Bake for 10 minutes and flip. Cook an additional 8-10 minutes.
  4. While the potatoes are cooking, heat a skillet over medium high heat. Add in the turkey and brown.
  5. Mix all of the ingredients for the dressing together. Mix into the meat.
  6. Microwave the green beans until they are no longer frozen.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide your ingredients evenly between 5 containers.

Dijon Balsamic Turkey with Garlic Parmesan Red Potatoes

Ground turkey flavored with dijon mustard, balsamic vinegar, and honey and served with a side of zucchini, red peppers, and garlic parmesan red potatoes.

CourseCuisineTime - 55 minutes 55 minutes 55 minutes
Main DishAmerican, meal prepPrep - 20 minutes 20 minutes 20 minutes
Cook - 35 minutes 35 minutes 35 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
664kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates60g44%
Fat26g19%
Protein48g35%

Ingredients:

  • 2 lbs (908 g) ground turkey (93/7)
  • 2.5 lbs (1135 g) red potatoes
  • 2 small (300 g) zucchini
  • 2 small (200 g) red peppers
  • 1/4 cup (60 ml) balsamic vinegar
  • 1.5 tbsp (32 g) honey
  • 1.5 tbsp (22.5 g) Dijon mustard
  • 3 tbsp (45 ml) olive oil
  • cup (78 g) grated Parmesan cheese
  • 2.5 tbsp (38 g) garlic minced
  • 1/2 (100 g) sweet onion
  • Salt and pepper

Instructions:

  1. Preheat oven to 425F.
  2. Wash and cut potatoes into 1 pieces. Add to a large bowl with 2 tbsp oil, salt and pepper, 1 tbsp garlic and cup grated Parmesan. Toss to coat.
  3. Add potatoes to a greased sheet pan and bake for 15 minutes, flip and cook an additional 10.
  4. While the potatoes are cooking, dice the onion and saut with the garlic a few minutes.
  5. Add the turkey and brown.
  6. Mix together the honey, balsamic, and mustard. Add to the turkey once all the water from the meat has boiled off. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
  7. Cut the zucchini and peppers into 1 inch chunks. Saut in oil until soft. Season to taste.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide your ingredients evenly 5 ways. Top with balsamic glaze if you wish.

Cherry Peach Crisp

Cherries and peaches baked underneath a oat crumble sweetened with honey.

CourseCuisineTime - 50 minutes
Dessert, SnackAmericanPrep - 10 minutes
Cook - 40 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
249kcal4 servings
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates40.2g78%
Fat8.2g16%
Protein3.5g6%

Ingredients:

  • 2 (200 g) peaches
  • 1/4 lb (115 g) sweet cherries
  • 3 tbsp (63 g) honey
  • 1 tsp (5 ml) lemon juice
  • 1 tbsp (7.5 g) tapioca flour or cornstarch
  • 11 tbsp (55 g) oats cup + 3 tbsp
  • 1/4 cup (25 g) oat flour
  • 2 tbsp (30 g) coconut oil
  • 1 tsp (4 ml) vanilla
  • 2 tbsp (10 g) fat free whipped cream

Instructions:

  1. Preheat oven to 350F.
  2. Wash and cut your peaches into slices. No need to peel. Pit the cherries and cut in half.
  3. In a large bowl add the peaches, cherries, tapioca flour, 1 tbsp honey, and lemon juice. Mix and allow to macerate while you make the topping.
  4. In a separate bowl mix the oats, oat flour, melted coconut oil, 2 tbsp of honey, and vanilla.
  5. Add the fruit to an 8" cast iron skillet. Top with the oat mixture.
  6. Bake for 35-40 minutes or until the top has browned.
  7. Top with whipped cream if you wish.

PB&J Donuts

A baked, gluten free donut topped with peanut butter and filled with a quick homemade jelly.

CourseCuisineTime - 40 minutes
Dessert, SnackAmericanPrep - 20 minutes
Cook - 20 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
151kcal5 donuts
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates22.4g70%
Fat3.4g10%
Protein7.7g24%

Ingredients:

  • 4/5 cup (80 g) oat flour
  • 1/4 cup (57 g) plain non fat Greek yogurt
  • 1 tsp (4 g) baking powder
  • 1 tsp (4 ml) vanilla
  • 1 tsp (4 g) stevia
  • 2 eggs
  • 2.5 tbsp (20 g) powdered peanut butter
  • 2 tsp (10 g) honey
  • 1.5 tbsp (25 ml) water
  • 1 cup (140 g) sliced frozen strawberries
  • 2 tbsp (30 g) maple syrup

Instructions:

  1. Add the strawberries and syrup to a saucepan and bring to a light boil. Break up the strawberries as it heats.
  2. Allow it to boil and thicken then use an immersion blender/blender to get a smooth texture.
  3. Add it back to the pot and boil to thicken again. Place in the fridge to cool.
  4. Preheat oven to 375F
  5. Mix the oat flour, baking powder, and stevia together until no clumps remain.
  6. Add in the eggs, vanilla, and yogurt. Mix thoroughly.
  7. Add the batter to a plastic bag to pipe into the donut tin.
  8. Divide half the the mixture between 5 wells.
  9. Evenly divide the strawberries between each well.
  10. Top with the remaining donut batter.
  11. Bake for 9-10 minutes.
  12. Allow the donuts to cool completely.
  13. Mix the powdered peanut butter, honey, and water. Top each donut with the frosting.

Maple Peanut Butter Donuts

A baked, gluten free donut recipe topped with a peanut butter and maple syrup glaze for sweetness and flavor.

CourseCuisineTime - null
Dessert, SnackAmericanPrep - 10 minutes
Cook - 9 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
137kcal5 donuts
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates17.8g65%
Fat4.5g16%
Protein6.4g23%

Ingredients:

  • 4/5 cup (80 g) oat flour
  • 1/4 cup (57 g) plain non fat Greek yogurt
  • 1 tsp (4 g) baking powder
  • 1 tsp (4 ml) vanilla
  • 1 tsp (4 g) stevia
  • 2 (2 ) eggs
  • 2 tbsp (30 g) maple syrup
  • 1 tbsp (16 g) peanut butter

Instructions:

  1. Preheat your oven to 375F.
  2. Mix the oat flour, baking powder, and stevia together to remove any clumps.
  3. Add in the eggs, yogurt, and vanilla. Mix thoroughly
  4. Filled a greased donut tin with the batter. It will make 5.
  5. Bake 9 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes away clear.
  6. Mix together the peanut butter and syrup until smooth.
  7. Once the donuts have cooled, top each with the icing.

Mini Pumpkin Muffins

Mini muffins made from pumpkin and oat flour and topped with a cream cheese frosting. The frosting here is made from Greek yogurt and fat free cream cheese but if you wanted them to taste even better you could use the real thing.

CourseCuisineTime - 24 minutes
Dessert, SnackAmerican, meal prepPrep - 15 minutes
Cook - 9 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
45kcal12 muffins
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates6.9g86%
Fat0.9g11%
Protein2.3g28%

Ingredients:

For the Muffins

  • 4/5 cup (80 g) oat flour
  • 1 tsp (4 g) baking powder
  • 1.5 tsp (6 g) stevia
  • 1 egg
  • 3 tbsp (45 g) liquid egg whites
  • 1/3 cup (75 g) canned pumpkin
  • 1.5 tsp (5.5 g) cinnamon
  • 1 tsp (3 g) Pumpkin pie spice

**For the Frosting **

  • 1.5 tbsp (20 g) fat free cream cheese
  • 1.5 tbsp (20 g) plain non fat Greek yogurt
  • 1.5 tbsp (10 g) powdered sugar
  • 8 tbsp (20 g) fat free whipped cream

Instructions:

  1. Preheat your oven to 375F.
  2. Mix the baking powder, cinnamon, pumpkin pie spice, oat flour, and stevia together until combined. Then add the eggs and pumpkin
  3. Fill 12 wells of a mini muffin tin and bake for 8-9 minutes.
  4. Mix the sugar, yogurt, and cream cheese together until smooth. Gently mix in the whipped cream.
  5. Top each muffin with frosting.
  6. Makes 12. Nutrition info is for each muffin.

Pumpkin Donuts

A gluten free, baked donut made from canned pumpkin and oats. These donuts are topped with cinnamon sugar and make for the perfect fall treat.

CourseCuisineTime - 19 minutes
Dessert, SnackAmericanPrep - 10 minutes
Cook - 9 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
132kcal5 donuts
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates19g70%
Fat4.1g15%
Protein4.7g17%

Ingredients:

For the Donut

  • 4/5 cup (80 g) oat flour
  • 1 tsp (4 g) baking powder
  • 1 tsp (4 g) stevia
  • 2 (2 ) eggs
  • 1/4 cup (60 g) canned pumpkin
  • 1/2 tsp (2 ml) vanilla
  • 1 tsp (4 g) cinnamon
  • 1/4 tsp (1 g) Pumpkin pie spice

For the Topping

  • 2 tbsp (25 g) sugar
  • tsp (2 g) cinnamon
  • 2 tsp (7 g) melted butter

Instructions:

  1. Preheat your oven to 375F.
  2. Mix the baking powder, cinnamon, pumpkin pie spice, oat flour, and stevia together until combined. Then add the eggs, vanilla, and pumpkin
  3. Fill 5 wells of a donut tin and bake for 8-9 minutes.
  4. Mix together the sugar and cinnamon in a bowl. Melt the butter in a different bowl.
  5. Dip the donuts in the butter then the sugar mixture to coat. Dont coat them until you eat them FYI. The sugar will dissolve if it sits long enough.

5 Minute Cinnamon Roll Center

A quick dessert that takes about 5 minutes from start to finish and has similar texture and flavor to the center of a cinnamon roll. All it takes is a bit of measuring, mixing, and microwaving.

CourseCuisineTime - null
Dessert, SnackAmericanPrep - 3 minutes
Cook - 2 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
221kcal1
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates26g54%
Fat4.8g10%
Protein18.5g38%

Ingredients:

  • 2 tbsp (12 g) oat flour
  • 2 tbsp (10 g) powdered peanut butter
  • 2 tbsp (10 g) tapioca flour
  • 2 tbsp (35 ml) water
  • 2 tbsp (25 g) liquid egg whites
  • 2 tbsp (12 g) vanilla casein protein powder
  • 1 tsp (4 g) sugar
  • 1 tsp (2 g) cinnamon
  • 1 tsp (3 g) butter

Instructions:

  1. Mix the oat flour, tapioca, PB, 1g cinnamon and casein together. Add in egg whites and water. It will make a dough like consistency.
  2. Spread out the dough in your bowl to even thickness.
  3. Melt butter, stir in 1g cinnamon, and sugar. Stir. If its too thick, add water to thin it out but no more than a few drops at a time.
  4. Pour the cinnamon sugar over the top. Microwave for 90-120 seconds

Chocolate Sprinkle Doughnuts

A homemade, baked, gluten free chocolate doughnut. These take under 20 minutes to cook so they are a perfect option for a weekend breakfast.

CourseCuisineTime - 19 minutes
Dessert, SnackAmericanPrep - 10 minutes
Cook - 9 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
143kcal5 donuts
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates16.2g60%
Fat6.1g22%
Protein5.7g21%

Ingredients:

  • 4/5 cup (80 g) oat flour
  • 1 tsp (4 g) stevia
  • 1 tsp (4 g) baking powder
  • 2 (2 ) eggs
  • 1/4 cup (57 g) plain non fat Greek yogurt
  • 1 tsp (4 ml) vanilla
  • 2 tbsp (30 g) Chocolate chips
  • 1 tsp (5 ml) coconut oil
  • 2 tsp (10 g) rainbow sprinkles

Instructions:

  1. Preheat your oven to 375F.
  2. Mix the oat flour, baking powder, and stevia together to remove any clumps.
  3. Add in the eggs, yogurt, and vanilla. Mix thoroughly
  4. Filled a greased doughnut tin with the batter. It will make 5.
  5. Bake 9 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes away clear.
  6. Melt the chocolate chips and coconut oil together in the microwave. Stir to combine.
  7. Once the doughnuts have cooled, top each with chocolate and sprinkles. Allow the chocolate to harden. I put mine in the freezer to expedite the process.

Microwave Chocolate Chip Cookies

A gluten free cookie recipe made from oat flower and casein protein powder that can be made in the microwave or the oven. It makes 4 cookies, the nutrition information is for all of them.

CourseCuisineTime - 12 minutes
Dessert, SnackAmericanPrep - 10 minutes
Cook - 2 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
288kcal1 servings
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates24.4g46%
Fat14.1g26%
Protein15.9g30%

Ingredients:

  • 2 tbsp (10 g) oat flour
  • 1 tbsp (5 g) coconut flour
  • 2 tbsp (10 g) vanilla casein protein powder
  • 1/4 cup (60 ml) whole milk
  • 2 tbsp (10 g) powdered peanut butter
  • 1.5 tsp (8 g) butter softened. Coconut oil works too
  • 2 tsp (10 g) mini chocolate chips

Instructions:

  1. Mix all of the ingredients together. Save some of the chocolate chips for the top if you want it to look cool.
  2. Microwave for 1-2 minutes or until the center has set. Thats it. Cool. Very easy. It makes 1 Cookie bowl/skillet or 4 cookies. The nutrition information is for the whole recipe.
  3. You can also bake them at 350F for 7-8 minutes if you want them in cookie form as seen above. I think they taste the same whether they have been cooked in the microwave or the oven. If youre going for aesthetics, use the oven. If youre going for time saving, use the microwave.

Jalapeo Apple Turkey Bowls

Ground turkey with jalapeos and apple for a spicy and sweet flavor, served with a roasted potato medley and broccoli.

CourseCuisineTime - 40 minutes 40 minutes 40 minutes
Main DishAmerican, meal prepPrep - 10 minutes 10 minutes 10 minutes
Cook - 30 minutes 30 minutes 30 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
743kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates64g45%
Fat31g21%
Protein46g32%

Ingredients:

  • 2 lbs (908 g) ground beef (85/15)
  • 1 medium (120 g) apples
  • 2 (60 g) jalapeo pepper
  • 2 medium (450 g) sweet potato
  • 7-8 small (337 g) red potatoes
  • 7-8 small (337 g) yellow potatoes
  • 20 oz (568 g) chopped frozen broccoli
  • 1/4 cup (60 ml) soy sauce
  • 2 tbsp (42 g) honey
  • 1 tbsp (15 ml) Worcestershire sauce
  • 2 tsp (10 g) garlic minced
  • 3 tbsp (45 ml) olive oil
  • 1 tsp (1 ml) oregano

Instructions:

  1. Preheat your oven to 450F
  2. Cut the potatoes into a large dice.
  3. Coat potatoes in 2 tbsp oil and toss with oregano and salt and pepper. Bake for 10 minutes and turn. Cook 10 more minutes or until desired doneness
  4. Heat oil in a pan over medium high heat. Brown the turkey and remove/boil off any water in the pan.
  5. Cut the jalapeo and Apple. Make room in the pan to saut the jalapeo. Cook for 3-4 minutes.
  6. In a bowl, mix together the soy sauce, honey, Worcestershire, and garlic. Add to the turkey.
  7. Remove from heat and stir in the apples.
  8. You can cook the broccoli if you wish. Not necessary though. Divide all of your ingredients evenly 5 ways.

Single Serve Chocolate Chips Banana Bread

These individual Chocolate Chip Banana Breads are a great way to use up any overripe or frozen bananas. They are gluten free and can be refined sugar free if you use sugar free chocolate chips.

CourseCuisineTime - 33 minutes
Dessert, SnackAmericanPrep - 15 minutes
Cook - 18 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
135kcal9 muffins
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates22.3g76%
Fat3g10%
Protein4.6g15%

Ingredients:

  • 1/2 cup (40 g) old fashioned oats
  • 1/2 cup (120 ml) water
  • 7/8 cup (80 g) oat flour
  • 1 tsp (4 g) baking powder
  • 1/2 tsp (2 g) baking soda
  • 2 (2 ) eggs
  • 2 medium (200 g) frozen and thawed bananas
  • 2 tbsp (42 g) honey
  • 1 scoop (30 g) vanilla casein protein powder
  • 1 tsp (4 ml) vanilla
  • 1/4 cup (60 g) mini chocolate chips

Instructions:

  1. Preheat oven to 350F.
  2. Microwave the ripe frozen bananas to thaw. Frozen bananas are sweeter and more liquidy. Non frozen will work but not as well.
  3. Mix the oats and water and microwave for one minute in a large bowl.
  4. Mix in the banana and stir until it is well incorporated. Allow to cool a bit.
  5. Add in the eggs and stir
  6. In a different bowl mix the oat flour, casein, baking soda, and baking powder until no clumps remain.
  7. Pour into wet ingredients and mix.
  8. Spray a regular sized muffin tin with oil and fill 9 wells.
  9. Bake for 16-18 minutes.

Honey Nut Bars

Almonds, cashews, sunflower, pumpkin, and chia seeds held together with a honey mixture and topped with dark chocolate. A cheaper alternative to store bought counterparts.

CourseCuisineTime - 1 hour 20 minutes
SnackAmerican, meal prepPrep - 1 hour
Cook - 20 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
278kcal14
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates24.6g52%
Fat17.2g36%
Protein6.2g13%

Ingredients:

  • 1 cup (140 g) cashews
  • 1 cup (140 g) almonds
  • cup (90 g) pumpkin seeds
  • cup (33 g) sunflower seeds
  • cup (43 g) chia seeds
  • cup (60 g) dried cranberries
  • 1 Tbsp (16 g) peanut butter
  • cup (168 g) honey
  • 2 Tbsp (32 g) coconut oil
  • 1 Tbsp (20 g) maple syrup
  • 1 tsp (4 ml) vanilla extract
  • 5 Tbsp (75 g) melted dark chocolate
  • Cooking spray

Instructions:

  1. Preheat your oven to 350F.
  2. Add all of the nuts, seeds, and dried fruit to a large bowl. Chop the almonds and cashews before adding if you would prefer smaller pieces.
  3. In a smaller bowl, mix together cup of honey, 2 Tbsp of coconut oil, 1 Tbsp of peanut butter, 1 Tbsp of maple syrup, and 1 tsp of vanilla.
  4. Pour the mixture over the nuts and mix until evenly coated.
  5. In a 13x9 pan or cookie sheet add a lining of parchment paper and spray with oil.
  6. Press the nut mixture into the pan and distribute evenly. Bake for 20 minutes.
  7. Remove from oven and allow to cool for 15 minutes. Then lift out of the pan using the parchment paper and spread 5 Tbsp of melted dark chocolate over the top. Allow to cool in the refrigerator completely.
  8. Once the slab has hardened cut it into 14 bars.
  9. Store the bars in the refrigerator to ensure they stay together.

Buffalo Chicken Dip

This buffalo chicken dip is best utilized as a snack. You can eat it with carrots/celery/bell peppers or heat it up and eat it by itself.

CourseCuisineTime - 3 hours 20 minutes
SnackAmerican, meal prepPrep - 20 minutes
Cook - 3 hours

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
178kcal10
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates3.7g10%
Fat6.1g16%
Protein27g75%

Ingredients:

  • 2 lbs (908 g) boneless skinless chicken breast
  • 1 cups (339 g) 4% fat cottage cheese
  • 1 cups (341 g) nonfat plain Greek yogurt
  • 6 slices (60 g) bacon cooked
  • 1 cup (118 g) kale chopped
  • 5 Tbsp (75 ml) buffalo sauce
  • Salt and pepper to taste

Instructions:

  1. Add the chicken and 1 cup of water to a crock pot and cook on high for 3 hours or until cooked.
  2. While the chicken is cooking, chop up some kale leaves until you have 1 cups worth. Use a food processor if you have one, you want it small.
  3. Heat a skillet over medium high heat and cook 6 slices of bacon. When the bacon is cooked, remove it from the pan and pat with paper towels. Keep the bacon fat in the pan.
  4. Add the kale to the bacon fat and cook until it has shrunken and is crisp, around 3-5 minutes. CAUTION: Use a lid to shield yourself from splatters when you add the kale. The wet kale can mix with the hot oil and splatter easily.
  5. Drain all the excess fat from the kale. Using the back of a spoon or spatula, try and squeeze out as much grease as possible.
  6. Chop the bacon up into small pieces and set aside with the kale.
  7. Once the chicken has cooked, transfer it into a large bowl and shred thoroughly with two forks. Allow the chicken to cool before mixing in the remaining ingredients. Once it has cooled, mix all of the ingredients together until incorporated.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 10 servings. Divide it evenly 10 ways.

Chicken Salad

This dish is meant to serve as a snack, not a meal. You can keep this in your refrigerator and always have a snack that is quick, easy, and high in protein.

CourseCuisineTime - null
SnackAmerican, meal prepPrep - 10 minutes
Cook - 4 hours

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
249kcal10
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates6.5g15%
Fat13.7g31%
Protein24.8g57%

Ingredients:

  • 2 lbs (1135 g) boneless skinless chicken breast
  • 1 cup (240 ml) chicken broth
  • 1 cup (150 g) red grapes
  • cup (110 g) mayonnaise
  • cup (113 g) plain non fat Greek yogurt
  • 2 Tbsp (30 g) Dijon mustard
  • 1 Tbsp (21 g) honey
  • 2 Tbsp (30 ml) lemon juice
  • cup (50 g) slivered almonds
  • Salt and pepper to taste
  • 3 Tbsp (6 g) parsley chopped (optional)

Instructions:

  1. Place chicken breast in a crockpot with 1 cup of chicken broth and cook on high for 3-4 hours or until cooked through.
  2. Remove the chicken from the crockpot and shred with two forks, allow to cool.
  3. Cut grapes into 4s until you have accumulated 1 cup
  4. In a bowl mix together the cup yogurt, cup mayonnaise, 2 Tbsp lemon juice, and 1 Tbsp honey. Pour over chicken with almonds and grapes and mix thoroughly. Add salt and pepper to taste.

Plating

  1. Divide evenly into 10 snack size portions.

Turkey & Hash Brown Egg Bake

Ground turkey and hash browns with an onion, poblano pepper, and red pepper mixture baked into an egg casserole. Serve over a bed of spinach if you prefer some extra vegetables.

CourseCuisineTime - 43 minutes 43 minutes
BreakfastAmerican, meal prepPrep - 8 minutes 8 minutes
Cook - 35 minutes 35 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
548kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates20g21%
Fat37g40%
Protein34g37%

Ingredients:

  • 1 lb (454 g) pork sausage
  • 10 (10 ) eggs
  • cup (60 ml) skim milk
  • 3 cups (252 g) shredded hash browns
  • (100 g) sweet onion
  • 1 (150 g) poblano pepper
  • 1 (150 g) red pepper
  • cup (56 g) shredded cheese
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) olive oil
  • Salt and pepper to taste
  • 2 cups (75 g) spinach (optional)
  • Cooking spray

Instructions:

  1. Preheat your oven to 375F.
  2. Wash your peppers and chop the peppers and onion into a small dice.
  3. Heat 1 Tbsp of olive oil over medium high heat in a large skillet. Add in the peppers and onions and cook for 2-3 minutes. If you wish, add 2 cup of raw spinach to the pan and wilt.
  4. Add in the ground sausage and brown.
  5. While the sausage is cooking, beat 10 eggs and cup of milk together. Stir in 2 cups of shredded hash browns, 1 tsp salt, 1 tsp pepper, and cup of shredded cheese.
  6. Once the sausage has finished cooking, mix it into the egg/hash brown mixture.
  7. Lightly spray a 13x9 baking dish with cooking spray and pour in the egg mixture. Bake for 20-22 minutes or until the center has set.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Cut the Egg Bake into 5 equal servings.

Buffalo Chicken and Garlic Parmesan Potatoes

A highly palatable meal containing chicken coated in buffalo sauce as well as oven baked garlic parmesan potato wedges and broccoli.

CourseCuisineTime - 40 minutes 40 minutes 40 minutes
Main DishAmerican, meal prepPrep - 10 minutes 10 minutes 10 minutes
Cook - 30 minutes 30 minutes 30 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
693kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates63g44%
Fat24g16%
Protein55g38%

Ingredients:

For the Chicken

  • 2 lbs (1135 g) boneless skinless chicken breast
  • 2-3 Tbsp (30 ml) buffalo sauce
  • 1 tsp (2 g) cornstarch
  • 1 Tbsp (15 g) olive oil
  • 4 Tbsp (56 g) butter

For the Broccoli

  • 1 large bunch (500 g) broccoli

For the Potato Wedges

  • 10 small (1500 g) russet potatoes
  • 2 Tbsp (30 ml) olive oil
  • 4 Tbsp (60 g) garlic minced
  • 2 tsp (6 g) salt
  • 2 tsp (4 g) pepper
  • 2 tsp (4 g) paprika
  • 2 tsp (4 g) cayenne pepper
  • 2 Tbsp (6 g) dried parsley
  • 6 Tbsp (34 g) parmesan cheese grated

Instructions:

For the Potatoes

  1. Preheat your oven to 400F.
  2. Wash each of your potatoes thoroughly. Cut each of them in half long ways 3 times so you have 8 wedges for each potato.
