  3. In a large bowl, drizzle 2 Tbsp of olive oil over the potatoes. Sprinkle 2 tsp of salt, pepper, paprika, cayenne, and 2 Tbsp parsley over the potatoes. Add 4 Tbsp of minced garlic and 6 Tbsp of grated parmesan cheese. Toss the potatoes to coat and spread onto a sheet pan.
  4. Bake for 15 minutes and then flip them to the other side and cook an additional 10-12 minutes.

For the Chicken

  1. While the potatoes are cooking cut the chicken breast into one inch cubes.
  2. Heat a large skillet over medium high heat and add in 1 Tbsp of olive oil. Add the chicken and cook until it is white in the center, around 7-8 minutes.
  3. When the chicken is just about cooked through, melt 4 Tbsp of butter and mix in 1 tsp of cornstarch and 2-3 Tbsp of buffalo sauce.

For the Broccoli

  1. Steam the broccoli while your chicken is cooking. Season with salt and pepper.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide all of your ingredients evenly between your containers.

Pork Tenderloin & Roasted Brussels Sprouts

Pork tenderloin served with roasted Brussels sprouts cooked with bacon and green apples. A classic meat and vegetables dish.

CourseCuisineTime - null
Main DishAmerican, meal prepPrep - 10 minutes 10 minutes 10 minutes
Cook - 1 hour 1 hour 1 hour

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
734kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates59g41%
Fat32g22%
Protein52g36%

Ingredients:

  • 2 lbs (908 g) pork tenderloin
  • 2 lbs (908 g) Brussels sprouts
  • 1 (200 g) green apple
  • 1 medium (200 g) sweet onion
  • 2 Tbsp (30 ml) olive oil
  • 8 pieces (80 g) bacon
  • 2 tsp (6 g) garlic powder
  • Salt and pepper

For the Potato

  • 5 small (750 g) potatoes
  • 5 tbsp (70 g) butter
  • 5 tbsp (80 g) sour cream

Instructions:

  1. Preheat your oven to 425F. Sprinkle the pork with salt, pepper, and 2 tsp of garlic powder. Cook in the oven for 45 minutes or until it has reached an internal temperature of 160F.
  2. Cut the apple and onion into a large dice. Remove the stems off of the Brussels sprouts and cut them in half. In a large roasting pan combine the onions and Brussels sprouts and drizzle with 2 Tbsp of olive oil. Season with salt and pepper.
  3. Put the Brussels sprouts and onion in the oven for 30 minutes or until the Brussels sprouts are soft. Add in the apples after they have finished cooking. The apples will cook in the microwave when you reheat the meal. You dont want them to become mushy.
  4. Cook the bacon either on the stove or in the oven until crispy and add to the vegetables with the apples once they have fully cooked.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide your meat and vegetables evenly between your 5 containers. Add 1 potato to each and top with 1 Tbsp of butter and 1 Tbsp sour cream

For the Pork

  1. Preheat your oven to 425F. Sprinkle the pork with salt, pepper, and 2 tsp of garlic powder. Cook in the oven for 45 minutes or until it has reached an internal temperature of 160F.

For the Brussels Sprouts

  1. Cut the apple and onion into a large dice. Remove the stems off of the Brussels sprouts and cut them in half. In a large roasting pan combine the onions and Brussels sprouts and drizzle with 2 Tbsp of olive oil. Season with salt and pepper.
  2. Put the Brussels sprouts and onion in the oven for 30 minutes or until the Brussels sprouts are soft. Add in the apples after they have finished cooking. The apples will cook in the microwave when you reheat the meal. You dont want them to become mushy.
  3. Cook the bacon either on the stove or in the oven until crispy and add to the vegetables with the apples once they have fully cooked.

For the Potatoes

  1. Wash and clear any dirt away from your potaotes. Poke holes in them with a fork and place on a sheet pan.
  2. Bake for 40-50 minutes or unitl soft.

Beef & Potato Stew

Boneless chuck roast cooked with carrots, potatoes, and celery. A heart warming meal that can be served over rice for additional calories.

CourseCuisineTime - null
Main DishAmerican, meal prepPrep - 15 minutes 15 minutes 15 minutes
Cook - 2 hours 25 minutes 2 hours 25 minutes 2 hours 25 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
773kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates83g54%
Fat34g22%
Protein34g22%

Ingredients:

  • 1 lb (681 g) boneless beef chuck roast
  • 1 lb (681 g) baby yellow potatoes
  • 5 medium (500 g) carrots
  • 5 (500 g) celery stalks
  • 1 large (250 g) onion
  • 1 Tbsp (15 g) garlic
  • 2 Tbsp (30 ml) olive oil
  • 4 (15 g) beef bullion cubes
  • 4 cups (960 ml) water
  • 2 tsp (4 g) cornstarch
  • 2 tsp (10 ml) cold water
  • 2 Tbsp (16 g) flour use oat flour for gluten free alternative
  • 2 Tbsp (28 g) butter
  • 5 cups (675 g) cooked rice

Instructions:

  1. Heat a large pot over medium high heat and add 1 Tbsp olive oil. Dice the onion and add to the pot with the garlic.
  2. Cut the steak into 1 inch cubes and add to the pot with an additional Tbsp of olive oil once the onions have become translucent. Season with salt and pepper.
  3. Dissolve the bullion cubes into 4 cups of water and add to the pot once the beef has browned. Bring to a boil and then reduce heat to low, cover the pot and simmer for 1 hour.
  4. Cut the potatoes, celery, and carrots into a large dice and set aside.
  5. After 1 hour, add in the potatoes, celery, carrots, and 2 tsp of cornstarch mixed with 2 tsp of cold water to the pot and stir. Cover and simmer for 1 more hour.
  6. Make a roux by melting 2 Tbsp of butter and mixing in 2 Tbsp of flour in a pan over medium heat. Add to the stew and stir to thicken. You can omit this if you need a gluten free option.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide the stew evenly into your containers and add 1 cup of rice to each.

For the Rice

  1. Cook enough rice to have 5 cups of cooked rice. 1 cup of dry rice will yield about 3 cups of cooked rice.

For the Stew

  1. Heat a large pot over medium high heat and add 1 Tbsp olive oil. Dice the onion and add to the pot with the garlic.
  2. Cut the roast into 1 inch cubes and add to the pot with an additional Tbsp of olive oil once the onions have become translucent. Season with salt and pepper.
  3. Dissolve the bullion cubes into 4 cups of water and add to the pot once the beef has browned. Bring to a boil and then reduce heat to low, cover the pot and simmer for 1 hour.
  4. Cut the potatoes, celery, and carrots into a large dice and set aside.
  5. After 1 hour, add in the potatoes, celery, carrots, and 2 tsp of cornstarch mixed with 2 tsp of cold water to the pot and stir. Cover and simmer for 1 more hour.
  6. Make a roux by melting 2 Tbsp of butter and mixing in 2 Tbsp of flour in a pan over medium heat. Add to the stew and stir to thicken. You can omit this if you need a gluten free option.

Crockpot Jambalaya

A take on the cajun dish that requires little effort. This particular recipe doesnt include shrimp but it can be easily added for a classical version of jambalaya.

CourseCuisineTime - 2 hours 40 minutes 2 hours 40 minutes 2 hours 40 minutes
Main DishAmerican, meal prepPrep - 10 minutes 10 minutes 10 minutes
Cook - 2 hours 30 minutes 2 hours 30 minutes 2 hours 30 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
650kcal6
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates66g50%
Fat26g20%
Protein38g29%

Ingredients:

  • 1 lbs (681 g) boneless skinless chicken breast
  • 14 oz (397 g) Andouille sausage
  • 28 oz (794 g) can of diced tomatoes
  • 1 cup (240 ml) chicken broth
  • medium (100 g) onion
  • 4 (400 g) carrots
  • 4 stalks (400 g) celery
  • 1 Tbsp (15 g) garlic
  • 1 medium (150 g) green pepper
  • 1 medium (150 g) red pepper
  • 1 (20 g) jalapeo pepper optional
  • 2 Tbsp (30 ml) olive oil
  • 1 Tbsp (8 g) cajun seasoning
  • Salt and pepper to taste
  • 1 Tbsp (8 g) cornstarch
  • 2 Tbsp (30 ml) cold water
  • 7 cups (945 g) cooked rice

Instructions:

  1. Cook the rice using your preferred method. 1 cup of uncooked rice will yield around 3 cups of cooked rice.
  2. Wash your carrots, celery, and peppers. Peel the carrots to prepare for cutting.
  3. Cut your carrots, celery, green pepper, and onion into a small dice.
  4. In a large pot, heat 2 Tbsp of olive oil over medium heat. Add in the carrots, celery, green pepper, onion, and 1 Tbsp of garlic. Cook for 8-10 minutes stirring occasionally.
  5. After the vegetables have cooked add them to a crockpot and lay the chicken breasts on top. Add in the can of diced tomatoes and 1 cup of chicken broth. Stir in 1 Tbsp of cajun seasoning.
  6. Turn the crockpot to high and cook for 2-3 hours
  7. After the jambalaya has cooked for 2 hours, remove the chicken and shred with two forks in a large bowl.
  8. Next you will need to thicken the jambalaya. Mix together 1 Tbsp cornstarch with 2 Tbsp cold water into a slurry and add to the broth and stir. The sauce will thicken as you stir. If you find your sauce isnt getting thick, try adding more of the cornstarch slurry.
  9. Cut the sausage into inch slices and fry in a pan then add to the jambalaya.
  10. Continue to cook for an additional 10 minutes. Stir often. Return the chicken to the jambalaya, add 2 cups of cooked rice and salt and pepper to taste.

Plating

  1. This recipe will make 6 servings. Divide the mixture evenly between your containers.

Sweet Potato Chili

Beef chili loaded with bell peppers and sweet potatoes. This meal is is quick and easy to prepare making it perfect for when your pressed for time.

CourseCuisineTime - 50 minutes 50 minutes 50 minutes
Main DishAmerican, meal prepPrep - 10 minutes 10 minutes 10 minutes
Cook - 40 minutes 40 minutes 40 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
769kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates79g51%
Fat31g20%
Protein43g28%

Ingredients:

  • 2 lbs (908 g) ground beef (85/15)
  • 1 medium (200 g) yellow onion
  • 2 Tbsp (30 g) garlic
  • 3 (450 g) bell peppers if you want it to be colorful, get one of each color
  • 2 medium (500 g) sweet potatoes
  • 28 oz (794 g) can petite diced tomatoes
  • 14.5 oz (411 g) can crushed tomatoes in puree
  • 1 (10 g) chipotle pepper in adobo sauce chopped
  • 3 Tbsp (24 g) chili powder or to taste
  • 2 tsp (6 g) cumin
  • Salt and pepper to taste
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) olive oil
  • 1 (20 g) jalapeo pepper optional
  • 1 lime optional
  • 5 cups (675 g) cooked rice

Instructions:

  1. In a large pot, heat 1 Tbsp of oil over medium high heat.
  2. Once the oil is hot, add 3 Tbsp of chili powder and 2 tsp cumin to toast for a few seconds. Then add the diced onion and garlic and stir. Cook for 2-3 minutes.
  3. Allow the onion and garlic to cook on their own for a couple of minutes then add the turkey and season it with salt and pepper. Cook until brown and drain the of the fat.
  4. While the turkey is cooking, peel and cut the sweet potatoes into 1 inch chunks. Add them to a pot of boiling water and cook for around 5 minutes until they are just soft enough to be pierced by a fork.
  5. Wash and cut the peppers into a large dice. After the beef has browned, add the peppers to the pot.
  6. Add the can of crushed tomatoes and the can of diced tomatoes. Stir to incorporate. Add in the sweet potatoes, chopped chipotle pepper in adobo, and salt and pepper to taste.
  7. Reduce the heat to low and allow to simmer for 20-30 minutes. Taste after it has simmered and adjust the spice levels to your liking.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide the Chili evenly between your containers and topped with a lime wedge and jalapeo slices if desired. Add 1 cup of rice to each dish.

For the Rice

  1. Cook enough rice to have 5 cups of cooked rice. 1 cup of dry rice will yield 3 cups of cooked rice.
  2. In a large pot, heat 1 Tbsp of oil over medium high heat.
  3. Once the oil is hot, add 3 Tbsp of chili powder and 2 tsp cumin to toast for a few seconds. Then add the diced onion and garlic and stir. Cook for 2-3 minutes.
  4. Allow the onion and garlic to cook on their own for a couple of minutes then add the beef and season it with salt and pepper. Cook until brown and drain the of the fat.
  5. While the beef is cooking, peel and cut the sweet potatoes into 1 inch chunks. Add them to a pot of boiling water and cook for around 5 minutes until they are just soft enough to be pierced by a fork.
  6. Wash and cut the peppers into a large dice. After the beef has browned, add the peppers to the pot.
  7. Add the can of crushed tomatoes and the can of diced tomatoes. Stir to incorporate. Add in the sweet potatoes, chopped chipotle pepper in adobo, and salt and pepper to taste.
  8. Reduce the heat to low and allow to simmer for 20-30 minutes. Taste after it has simmered and adjust the spice levels to your liking.

Roasted Turkey with Cauliflower Pure

Roasted turkey served with a cauliflower pure and roasted carrots. A play on the classic Thanksgiving dinner where the cauliflower pure replaces the mashed potatoes and gravy.

CourseCuisineTime - null
Main DishAmerican, meal prepPrep - 20 minutes 20 minutes 20 minutes
Cook - 1 hour 1 hour 1 hour

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
620kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates57g41%
Fat16g11%
Protein63g46%

Ingredients:

For the Turkey

  • 2 lbs (908 g) turkey breast tenderloin
  • Salt and pepper to taste
  • 1 tsp (3 g) garlic powder
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) olive oil

For the Vegetables

  • 1 lb (454 g) bag frozen cauliflower
  • 4 (800 g) russet potatoes
  • 3 Tbsp (42 ) butter
  • cup (28 g) parmesan cheese
  • Salt and pepper to taste
  • 2 Tbsp (32 g) plain Greek yogurt
  • 1 Tbsp (15 g) garlic
  • green onions optional
  • 1 lbs (681 g) carrots
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) olive oil

Instructions:

For the Turkey

  1. Preheat your oven to 350F.
  2. Place your turkey breasts in a baking dish, sprinkle with salt, pepper, and 1 tsp garlic powder. Cook for 45 minutes or until the internal temperature reaches 165F.
  3. When the turkey is finished cooking, let it rest for 10 minutes and slice it into pieces.

For the Cauliflower/Potato Pure

  1. Cut your potatoes into a large dice and place in a pot of boiling water. Boil for 8-10 minutes or until soft.
  2. Microwave the cauliflower until it is thawed.
  3. While the cauliflower is still hot add it to a food processor or blender with the potatoes, garlic, butter, Greek yogurt, parmesan cheese, and 1 tsp each of salt and pepper. Blend until smooth.

For the Carrots

  1. Peel your carrots and cut off the stems. Cut the carrots on a bias into 2 inch pieces.
  2. Add the carrots to a sheet pan and drizzle with 1 Tbsp olive oil.
  3. Using the same 350F oven, bake for 10 minutes then flip. Bake for an additional 8-10 minutes. They have finished cooking when they are soft and have begun to brown.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide all of your ingredients evenly between your 5 containers. Top with green onions if you wish.

Sweet Chili Chicken & Shrimp

Chicken and shrimp with ginger rice drizzled with Thai sweet chili sauce. Serve this dish with a side of zucchini and yellow squash.

CourseCuisineTime - 55 minutes 55 minutes 55 minutes
Main DishAmerican, meal prepPrep - 20 minutes 20 minutes 20 minutes
Cook - 35 minutes 35 minutes 35 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
657kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates56g40%
Fat22g16%
Protein59g43%

Ingredients:

For the Chicken

  • 2 lbs (908 g) boneless skinless chicken breast
  • 2 tsp (6 g) chili powder
  • 2 tsp (6 g) garlic powder
  • Salt and pepper to taste
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) olive oil
  • 5 Tbsp (75 g) Thai sweet chili sauce buy premade

For the Rice

  • 5 cups (675 g) cooked rice
  • 1 Tbsp (5 g) ginger minced
  • 5.333 tsp (80 ml) olive oil
  • Salt to taste

For the Shrimp

  • 1 lb (454 g) shrimp
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) olive oil
  • 1 tsp (5 g) garlic minced
  • tsp (2 g) cumin
  • tsp (2 g) chili powder
  • tsp (2 g) onion powder
  • tsp (1 g) salt
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) lime juice

For the Squash

  • 2 (400 g) zucchini
  • 2 (400 g) yellow squash
  • 1 Tbsp (15 g) garlic minced
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) olive oil

Instructions:

For the Chicken

  1. Pound or butterfly your chicken breast so it has an even thickness throughout. Season both sides of the chicken with salt, pepper, 2 tsp chili powder, and 2 tsp garlic powder.
  2. Heat a grill pan or a large skillet over medium high heat and add 1 Tbsp of olive oil.
  3. Cook the chicken until it is no longer pink in the center and the internal temperature reaches 165. Allow to rest for 8-10 minutes before slicing. Slice your chicken into strips about thick.

For the Shrimp

  1. Mix together the ingredients for the shrimp marinade and stir in the shrimp, set in the fridge to marinate for at least 15 minutes.
  2. Heat a cast iron pan or a grill pan over high heat.
  3. Cook your shrimp for 2 minutes on each side or until fully pink and cooked through.

For the Zucchini

  1. While the chicken is cooking, slice the zucchini and yellow squash into thin (around 1/8). Use a mandolin if you have one.
  2. Heat a skillet over medium high heat and add 1 Tbsp of olive oil. Saut the vegetables and minced garlic until soft. Season with seasoned salt and pepper to taste.

For the Rice

  1. Cook the rice using your preferred method (rice cooker or saucepan). Be sure you make enough to have 2 cups worth of cooked rice.
  2. In a large bowl, take 2 cups of cooked rice and add the minced ginger, olive oil, and salt to taste.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. To each of your containers add cup of the ginger rice and divide the chicken, shrimp, and vegetables evenly. Top each piece of chicken with 1 Tbsp of sweet chili sauce.

Stuffed Peppers

Bell peppers stuffed with hamburger, zucchini, mushrooms, and rice. This meal provides a great way to hide vegetables to where they are nearly unnoticeable.

CourseCuisineTime - 40 minutes 40 minutes 40 minutes
Main DishAmerican, meal prepPrep - 10 minutes 10 minutes 10 minutes
Cook - 30 minutes 30 minutes 30 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
749kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates69g47%
Fat33g22%
Protein43g29%

Ingredients:

  • 5 (750 g) bell peppers
  • 2 lbs (908 g) ground beef (85/15)
  • 1 large (300 g) zucchini
  • 1 medium (200 g) yellow onion
  • 2 Tbsp (30 g) garlic minced
  • 4 oz (114 g) white mushrooms
  • 14.5 oz (411 g) can petite diced tomatoes
  • 7 cups (945 g) cooked rice
  • Salt and pepper to taste
  • 2 Tbsp (30 ml) olive oil

Instructions:

  1. Cook the rice using your preferred method (rice cooker or saucepan). Be sure you make enough to have 7 cups worth of cooked rice.
  2. Heat a large pot of salted water to cook the peppers in. Make sure you have enough water to fully cover the peppers.
  3. Wash and cut the peppers in half lengthwise, through the stem. Cut out the seeds and stem. Boil the pepper halves in the water until soft, around 5-7 minutes.
  4. While the peppers are cooking, heat a skillet over medium high heat and add 1 Tbsp of olive oil.
  5. Cut the onion into a small dice.
  6. Add the onion and garlic to the skillet and saut for 2 minutes then add the ground beef. Season with salt and pepper.
  7. When the beef is cooked through, drain the fat and transfer the meat to a large bowl.
  8. Cut the zucchini into small inch sized pieces and dice the mushrooms.
  9. Add 1 Tbsp of olive oil to the pan and saut the zucchini and mushrooms.
  10. Add the can of tomatoes and 7 cups of cooked rice to the pan and cook for 5 minutes over medium heat.
  11. Season the tomato mixture with salt and pepper to taste and add the beef back to the pan. Mix thoroughly.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Place two pepper halves in each of your containers and divide the meat mixture evenly between them. You wont be able to fit it all inside the pepper.

Shredded Pork & Sweet Potatoes

This dish is one of the easiest you will make. The sweet potatoes & green beans take no more than 25 minutes and the pork cooks in the crock pot so you dont have to spend much time in the kitchen.

CourseCuisineTime - null
Main DishAmerican, meal prepPrep - 15 minutes 15 minutes 15 minutes
Cook - 4 hours 30 minutes 4 hours 30 minutes 4 hours 30 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
704kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates55g40%
Fat32g23%
Protein49g36%

Ingredients:

For the Pork

  • 3 lb (1362 g) pork butt roast
  • 2 tsp (6 g) garlic powder
  • 2 tsp (5 g) onion powder
  • 2 tsp (6 g) chili powder
  • 2 tsp (6 g) paprika
  • 2 tsp (6 g) salt
  • 2 tsp (4 g) pepper
  • tsp (2 g) cayenne pepper
  • 1 cup (240 g) apple cider vinegar
  • cup (120 g) BBQ sauce look for low sugar option. Most vinegar based sauces are lower in sugar

For the Green Beans

  • 1 lb (454 g) cut and washed fresh green beans

For the Sweet Potatoes

  • 5 (875 g) sweet potatoes
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) olive oil
  • salt and pepper to taste

Instructions:

For the Pork

  1. Mix together all of the spices and rub over the pork.
  2. Place in a crockpot on high with 1 cup of apple cider vinegar for 4 hours.
  3. Once cooked, remove from crockpot and shred with two forks.
  4. Turn on your oven to broil.
  5. Line a baking sheet with tin foil. Spread the pork over the baking sheet and place in the oven for 3 minutes. Remove and flip. Cook an additional 3 minutes. Watch carefully so the pork doesn't burn. Placing the pork in the oven will add color and texture to the meat.
  6. Cover the pork with the BBQ sauce.

For the Green Beans

  1. If you buy the pre-cut green beans in the bag, follow the instructions on the bag.
  2. If you buy regular green beans, cut off the ends and boil them for 10 minutes or until they are soft.

For the Sweet Potatoes

  1. Preheat your oven to 400F
  2. Wash and cut the sweet potatoes into a medium dice.
  3. Spread them onto a sheet pan and drizzle with 1 Tbsp of olive oil. Season with salt and pepper.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide the ingredients evenly between your 5 containers.

Loaded Meatloaf with Green Beans

Meatloaf made with 93/7 ground turkey, stuffed with onions and carrots, served with a side of green beans and garlic parmesan potato wedges.

CourseCuisineTime - 1 hour 20 minutes 1 hour 20 minutes 1 hour 20 minutes
Main DishAmerican, meal prepPrep - 20 minutes 20 minutes 20 minutes
Cook - 1 hour 1 hour 1 hour

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
692kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates47g36%
Fat35g27%
Protein47g36%

Ingredients:

For the Meat Mixture

  • 2 lbs (908 g) ground beef (85/15)
  • cup (60 g) instant oats
  • 2 (2 ) eggs
  • 1 cup (240 ml) skim milk
  • medium (100 g) sweet onion
  • 1 cup (100 g) shredded carrots
  • cup (23 g) parmesan cheese grated
  • 1 tsp (2 g) pepper
  • 1 tsp (3 g) salt
  • 1 tsp (3 g) Lawrys seasoned salt

For the Potato Wedges

  • 5 small (750 g) russet potatoes
  • 2 Tbsp (30 ml) garlic minced
  • 1 tsp (3 g) salt
  • 1 tsp (2 g) pepper
  • 1 tsp (2 g) paprika
  • 1 tsp (2 g) cayenne pepper
  • 1 Tbsp (1 g) dried parsley
  • 2 Tbsp (11 g) parmesan cheese grated
  • 1 tbsp (15 ml) olive oil

For the Green Beans

  • 1 lb (454 g) green beans fresh

Instructions:

For the Meatloaf

  1. Preheat oven to 350F
  2. Finely chop the onion (and the carrots if desired).
  3. In a large bowl combine the beef, cup oatmeal, 2 lightly beaten eggs, 1 cup of milk, 1 tsp salt, 1 tsp pepper, 1 tsp seasoned salt, cup grated parmesan cheese, and the chopped onion and carrots. Try not to handle too much as the meat will become tough.
  4. Press the mixture into a large loaf pan and bake for 1 hour or until the center registers a temperature of 160F.

For the Potatoes

  1. Wash each of your potatoes thoroughly. Cut each of them in half long ways 3 times so you have 8 wedges for each potato.
  2. You can use the oven at the same time you are cooking the meatloaf. On a cookie sheet, drizzle 1 Tbsp of olive oil over the potatoes.
  3. Sprinkle 1 tsp each of salt, pepper, paprika, cayenne, and 1 Tbsp parsley over the potatoes. Add 2 Tbsp minced garlic and 2 Tbsp of grated parmesan and toss the potatoes to coat.
  4. Bake them for 15 minutes and then flip them to the other side and cook an additional 10-15 minutes. Watch them carefully to ensure they dont burn.

For the Green Beans

  1. If you buy the pre-cut green beans in the bag, follow the instructions on the bag.
  2. If you buy regular green beans, cut off the ends and boil them for 10 minutes or until they are soft.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Cut the meatloaf into 5 equal portions and divide the green beans and potatoes evenly.

Balsamic Chicken & Roasted Vegetables

Balsamic marinated chicken served with red potatoes and cherry tomatoes as well as balsamic roasted vegetables. A flavorful, low calorie meal option which provides more than a serving of vegetables.

CourseCuisineTime - 1 hour 20 minutes
Main DishAmerican, meal prepPrep - 40 minutes
Cook - 40 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
461kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates44g44%
Fat13g13%
Protein41g41%

Ingredients:

For the Chicken

  • 2 lbs (908 g) boneless skinless chicken breast
  • 1 cup (200 g) grape tomatoes
  • 1 lb (454 g) red potatoes
  • medium (100 g) red onion
  • 2 Tbsp (30 ml) olive oil
  • cup (60 ml) balsamic vinegar
  • 1 Tbsp (15 g) Dijon mustard
  • 1 Tbsp (15 g) garlic minced
  • 2 Tbsp (42 g) honey
  • Salt and pepper to taste

For the Roasted Vegetables

  • 1 medium (125 g) red pepper
  • 1 bunch (500 g) broccoli
  • lb (227 g) carrots
  • 2 Tbsp (30 ml) balsamic vinegar
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) olive oil
  • Salt and pepper to taste

Instructions:

For the Chicken

  1. Preheat your oven to 400F
  2. In a bowl mix together cup balsamic vinegar, 2 Tbsp honey, 1 Tbsp dijon mustard, 1 Tbsp minced garlic, and salt & pepper.
  3. Place the chicken in a gallon plastic bag and pour your sauce mixture over the chicken. Remove as much air from the bag as possible. Marinate for at least 30 minutes.
  4. Cut the potatoes and onion into 1-2 inch pieces and put in a 13x9 pan or on a foil lined sheet pan. Drizzle with olive oil and season with salt and pepper and bake for 15 minutes.
  5. After 15 minutes of baking, remove from the oven and add the grape tomatoes and the chicken along with the marinade.
  6. Cook the chicken for 25 minutes or until the internal temperature is at least 165F.

For the Vegetables

  1. Cut the vegetables into 1 pieces.
  2. Cover a sheet pan with aluminum foil and spread out the vegetables evenly. Drizzle with 1 Tbsp olive oil, 2 Tbsp balsamic vinegar and salt and pepper over the top.
  3. Bake for 15 minutes.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Cut the chicken into strips and divide everything evenly into 5 portions.

Hamburger and Sweet Potato Fries

Hamburger patties made from 85/15 ground beef served with fresh tomato slices, romaine lettuce, and a side of sweet potato fries.

CourseCuisineTime - 1 hour 5 minutes 1 hour 5 minutes 1 hour 5 minutes
Main DishAmerican, meal prepPrep - 30 minutes 30 minutes 30 minutes
Cook - 35 minutes 35 minutes 35 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
789kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates68g44%
Fat35g22%
Protein51g33%

Ingredients:

  • 2 lbs (908 g) ground beef (85/15)
  • 2 (2 ) eggs
  • small (100 g) yellow onion
  • 2 tsp (10 g) dijon mustard
  • 2 tsp (10 ml) Worcestershire sauce
  • 1 tsp (5 g) garlic minced
  • 1 tsp (3 g) salt
  • 1 tsp (2 g) pepper
  • 1 tsp (15 ml) olive oil
  • Cooking spray
  • 2 (120 g) Roma tomatoes
  • Romaine lettuce optional
  • 4 large (1100 g) sweet potatoes
  • 1 (20 g) jalapeo pepper
  • 5 slices (100 g) cheese of your choice

Instructions:

  1. In a large bowl whisk two eggs and add in 2 tsp Worcestershire sauce, 2 tsp dijon mustard, 1 tsp minced garlic, finely chopped onion, and 1 tsp salt and pepper
  2. Add in beef and mix together. Try and handle the meat as little as possible as it will get tough
  3. Use a scale if you have one to portion out 4oz balls and shape into a patty. Aim for 10 patties.
  4. Making a shallow imprint with your thumb into the patty will prevent it from puffing up during cooking.
  5. To cook your burgers, use a grill for best results. If you dont have access to a grill heat a skillet over medium to medium high heat and cook with a small amount of oil. The burgers are done when they have reached in internal temperature of 160F.
  6. While your burgers are cooking, wash and peel your sweet potatoes. Preheat your oven to 425. Cut potatoes into x matchstick shapes. Placing the potatoes in ice cold water for at least 30 minutes prior to cooking may help with crispiness. This step is optional.
  7. Line a cookie sheet with foil and spray with oil. Spread the potatoes out over the foil but be sure you dont overcrowd the sheet. Spray the top of the potatoes with oil and season with salt and pepper or your favorite seasoning.
  8. Cook for 10 minutes and then flip the potatoes and cook for 5-10 additional minutes. Watch the potatoes closely as they are prone to burn.
  9. Plating
  10. This recipe makes 5 servings. In each of your containers put two hamburger patties, two pieces of lettuce, tomato slices, one piece of cheese, and split the sweet potato fries evenly 5 ways.

Sweet Potato Breakfast Hash

Sausage and sweet potatoes cooked with onions and garlic and served with a side of eggs. A calorie dense breakfast option to help you start off your day.

CourseCuisineTime - 30 minutes 30 minutes 30 minutes
BreakfastAmerican, meal prepPrep - 10 minutes 10 minutes 10 minutes
Cook - 20 minutes 20 minutes 20 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
636kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates39g35%
Fat40g36%
Protein31g28%

Ingredients:

  • 3 large (825 g) sweet potatoes
  • medium (100 g) yellow onion
  • 1 tsp (5 g) garlic minced
  • 1 lb (454 g) breakfast sausage I prefer Jimmy Dean Original
  • 12 (10 ) eggs
  • 1 tsp (5 ml) olive oil
  • Salt and pepper to taste

Instructions:

For the Hash

  1. Heat a large skillet over medium high heat. Dice the onion and add to the pan with olive oil and garlic. Allow to cook for 2-3 minutes. Add the sausage to the onion and garlic mixture and stir occasionally until browned.
  2. While the sausage is cooking, fill a saucepan with enough water to cover sweet potatoes and begin to boil water.
  3. Peel the sweet potatoes and cut into inch cubes. Add the potatoes to the water once it is boiling. Cook until sweet potatoes are soft and easily pierced with fork.
  4. Drain the potatoes and add to the sausage mixture. Make sure you drain the fat first.

For the Eggs

  1. You can cook the eggs any way that you like. I prefer boiled or scrambled. If you prefer fried, I would make them fresh the day you plan on eating each meal.
  2. Fill a medium pot with enough water to cover 12 eggs. Bring the pot to a boil and then remove from the heat and cover. Set a timer for 12 minutes.
  3. After 12 minutes drain the water and shower the eggs in cold water to cool. Peel the eggs and cut in half.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide your hash evenly into each of your 5 containers and add 2 eggs to each.

Sausage and Eggs with Sweet Potato Chips

Ground sausage and eggs over a bed of sweet potato chips with grape tomatoes. A breakfast full of flavor that can provide you will energy to start your day.

CourseCuisineTime - 35 minutes 35 minutes 35 minutes
BreakfastAmerican, meal prepPrep - 10 minutes 10 minutes 10 minutes
Cook - 25 minutes 25 minutes 25 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
575kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates52g47%
Fat28g25%
Protein29g26%

Ingredients:

  • 12 oz (341 g) ground sausage
  • 10 (10 ) eggs
  • 6 (1200 g) sweet potatoes
  • 1 cup (150 g) grape tomatoes
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) olive oil
  • Salt and pepper to taste

Instructions:

  1. Preheat your oven to 425F.
  2. Wash and cut your sweet potatoes into 1/4 thick chips. Place them on a sheet pan and drizzle with olive oil, salt, and pepper. Bake for 10-15 minutes or until soft. Flip half way.
  3. Heat a skillet over medium high heat and brown your sausage.
  4. While the sausage is cooking, cut the grape tomatoes into halves.
  5. Once the sausage is done browning, cook the grape tomatoes for 5 minutes in the same skillet.
  6. Cook your eggs however you prefer. In the picture on the previous page they are hard boiled. If you prefer any other form, I would recommend cooking your eggs the day you plan to eat each meal.
  7. Fill a medium pot with enough water to cover 10 eggs. Bring the pot to a boil and then remove from the heat and cover. Set a timer for 12 minutes.
  8. After 12 minutes drain the water and shower the eggs in cold water to cool. Peel the eggs and cut in half.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide your ingredients 5 ways and add to each container.

Almond Butter Breakfast Sandwiches

Waffles made from eggs and almond butter to provide a gluten free, lower carb bread for a breakfast sandwich. These are completely customizable and you can add whatever you like!

CourseCuisineTime - 30 minutes
BreakfastAmerican, meal prepPrep - 10 minutes
Cook - 20 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
397kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates6g9%
Fat29g45%
Protein29g45%

Ingredients:

For the Waffles

  • 4 (4 ) eggs
  • cup (128 g) almond butter peanut butter works too
  • tsp (2 g) baking powder
  • NOTE: Add whatever you would like to the batter to customize my favorite is jalapeos and cheddar cheese.

For the Sandwich Components

  • lb (227 g) sliced ham
  • 5 (5 ) eggs
  • 5 slices (50 g) cheddar cheese thinly sliced

Instructions:

For the Waffles

  1. In a blender, add 4 eggs, cup of almond butter and tsp of baking powder. Blend until smooth. (It seems strange but almond butter is the correct ingredient, NOT almond flour).
  2. For waffles, heat a waffle iron to medium heat. For pancakes, heat a skillet. You will have enough batter for 34, 8-inch waffles or 810, 3-inch pancakes. Spray the waffle iron or skillet with cooking spray before cooking.
  3. Cook the waffles for 5-6 minutes. You know its done when it easily comes out of the waffle iron. The pancakes will take 2-3 minutes each side.
  4. Cut the waffles into 4 pieces to serve as your bread for the sandwich.

For the Sandwich Components

  1. Cut your sliced ham into pieces to fit on the waffle or pancake.
  2. The next step is to cook the eggs. If you want nicely shaped eggs like in the picture, crack them into a ramekin and bake at 350F until they are set. Some people dont like the idea of meal prepped eggs. If this is you, prep the eggs the morning you plan to eat the meal. It will only take a few minutes.

Plating

  1. Divide your ingredients evenly between 5 containers.

Oven Baked Omelette with Home Fries

Ham, eggs, cheese, and peppers baked in the oven for ease of cooking and served with a side of baked home fries. This is a super easy breakfast to make for the work week!

CourseCuisineTime - 35 minutes 35 minutes 35 minutes
BreakfastAmerican, meal prepPrep - 10 minutes 10 minutes 10 minutes
Cook - 25 minutes 25 minutes 25 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
571kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates29g30%
Fat38g39%
Protein29g30%

Ingredients:

For the Omelette

  • 8 eggs
  • 1 cup (114 g) diced ham
  • 1 small (100 g) green pepper
  • 1 small (100 g) red pepper
  • (100 g) yellow onion
  • cup (84 g) shredded cheddar cheese
  • cup (60 ml) skim milk
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) olive oil
  • Salt and pepper to taste

For the Home Fries

  • 2 large (550 g) russet potatoes
  • 2 Tbsp (30 ml) olive oil
  • 1 tsp (3 g) seasoned salt
  • tsp (1 g) pepper
  • 1 (60 g) Roma tomato optional
  • 1 (150 g) avocado optional

For the Bacon

  • 15 strips bacon

Instructions:

For the Omelette

  1. Preheat your oven to 400F.
  2. Wash your peppers and cut them into a small dice. Dice the onion to a similar size.
  3. Heat a skillet over medium high heat and add 1 Tbsp of olive oil. Add in onion and peppers. Saut until onions are translucent.
  4. Scramble 8 eggs and cup of milk together. Add in 1 tsp salt and tsp pepper and mix.
  5. Add in the 1 cup of diced ham, the peppers, onions, and cup of cheese to the eggs. Top the mixture with the remaining cup of cheese.
  6. Pour the egg mixture into a greased 8x8 or 13x9 inch baking pan.
  7. Bake for 20-25 minutes until the eggs have set.

For the Home Fries

  1. Wash and cut your potatoes into a medium dice, about inch pieces.
  2. Spread them out on a sheet pan and drizzle with 1 Tbsp of olive oil. Season with 1 tsp seasoned salt and tsp of pepper.
  3. Bake for 10 minutes and then flip the potatoes. Bake an additional 10 minutes or until they are crispy.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Cut your omelette into 5 sections, split the potatoes evenly 5 ways, and add to each of your 5 containers. Add avocado or tomato the day you eat each meal if you desire.

For the Bacon

  1. Line a sheet pan with foil and spread out the bacon on the pan. Bake for about 20 minutes. If you like it crispy, elevate the bacon onto a cooling rack so it is raised from the pan.

Kielbasa Breakfast Bowls

A fantastic way to get more more vegetables in your breakfasts. Roasted sweet potatoes and zucchini paired with kielbasa sausage cooked with spinach and onions.

CourseCuisineTime - 50 minutes 50 minutes 50 minutes
BreakfastAmerican, meal prepPrep - 20 minutes 20 minutes 20 minutes
Cook - 30 minutes 30 minutes 30 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
746kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates54g41%
Fat44g33%
Protein33g25%

Ingredients:

  • 10 (10 ) eggs
  • (100 g) yellow onion
  • 4 (1100 g) sweet potatoes
  • 2 (500 g) zucchinis
  • 21 oz (397 g) kielbasa sausage
  • 3 cups (90 g) uncooked spinach
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) olive oil
  • Salt and pepper to taste

Instructions:

  1. Fill a medium pot with enough water to cover 10 eggs. Bring the pot to a boil and then remove from the heat and cover. Set a timer for 12 minutes.
  2. After 12 minutes drain the water and shower the eggs in cold water to cool. Peel the eggs and cut in half.
  3. Preheat your oven to 400F.
  4. While the eggs are cooking, wash the zucchini and sweet potatoes. Peel the potatoes. Cut the zucchini and sweet potatoes into a small dice.
  5. Spread the sweet potatoes out on a sheet pan and drizzle with olive oil. Cook for 10 minutes then remove from the oven and flip.
  6. Add the zucchini to the same pan and return to the oven for an additional 10 minutes.
  7. Cut your sausage into slices and fry in a skillet over medium high heat.
  8. Save the grease in the pan that occurs from cooking the sausage to cook the onion in.
  9. Cut the onion into a small dice and do a rough chop on your spinach.
  10. Add the onion and spinach to the skillet and cook for 5-7 minutes or until the onions are soft. Add the sausage back in and mix.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Put two eggs into each container and split the sausage and vegetables evenly 5 ways.

Cauliflower Cheese Sticks

Riced cauliflower baked with eggs and cheese to form a crust, then topped with more cheese. Serve with a side of marinara sauce for dipping.

CourseCuisineTime - 35 minutes
SnackAmericanPrep - 10 minutes
Cook - 25 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
72kcal16 cheese sticks
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates2.4g21%
Fat4.4g40%
Protein5.6g50%

Ingredients:

For the Crust

  • 20 oz (568 g) frozen cauliflower rice I use the brand Birds Eye
  • 2 (2 ) eggs
  • cup (28 g) shredded parmesan cheese
  • cup (28 g) shredded mozzarella and provolone cheese mix
  • 1 Tbsp (6 g) Italian seasoning

For the Topping

  • 1 cup (112 g) shredded mozzarella and provolone cheese mix
  • cup (56 g) shredded parmesan cheese
  • 8 oz (120 ml) can of marinara sauce

Instructions:

  1. Preheat your oven to 400F.
  2. If you use frozen, riced cauliflower, thaw it in the microwave until it is no longer frozen. It doesnt need to be cooked, just thawed.
  3. Using a cheesecloth, squeeze as much water out of the cauliflower as possible. If you dont have a cheesecloth use a thin kitchen towel or paper towels. This step is crucial, get as much water out as you can.
  4. In a large bowl, mix together the cauliflower, 2 beaten eggs, cup parmesan cheese, cup mozzarella and provolone cheese mix, and 1 Tbsp Italian seasoning.
  5. Line a sheet pan with parchment paper and spray with oil. Press the cauliflower mix onto the pan with your hands until it is about of an inch thick. Bake for 15 minutes.
  6. Remove from the oven and add 1 cup of mozzarella and provolone cheese mix and cup shredded parmesan cheese to the top.
  7. Bake for an additional 5-10 minutes until the cheese has browned.
  8. Cut into 1 inch thick slices. It will make around 16 cheese sticks.
  9. Serve with a side of marinara sauce. You can make this fresh if you please, but canned is just fine.

Storage

  1. Keep in the refrigerator for up to 3-4 days. I wouldn't reccommend freezing these.

Chipotle Stuffed Mushrooms

Baby bella mushrooms stuffed with ground beef and red peppers mixed in chipotle flavored Greek yogurt. A perfect healthy snack for between meals.

CourseCuisineTime - 45 minutes
SnackAmericanPrep - 10 minutes
Cook - 35 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
87kcal15
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates2.2g15%
Fat5.5g39%
Protein7g50%

Ingredients:

  • 1 lb (454 g) ground beef (85/15)
  • 1 lb (454 g) baby bella mushrooms
  • cup (76 g) plain non fat Greek yogurt
  • 1 tsp (5 ml) lime juice
  • 1 (20 g) chipotle pepper in adobo sauce + 2 tsp of the adobo sauce
  • (100 g) sweet onion
  • 1 (100 g) red bell pepper small
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) olive oil
  • 2 Tbsp (14 g) shredded cheese
  • Salt and pepper to taste

For the Sauce Topping

  • 2 Tbsp (28 g) Greek yogurt
  • tsp (2 ml) lime juice
  • Salt and pepper to taste

Instructions:

  1. Preheat oven to 375F
  2. Dice the onion and red pepper.
  3. Heat a skillet over medium high heat and add 1 Tbsp of olive oil. Saut the onion and red pepper for 5 minutes. Add the beef to the skillet and brown.
  4. While the beef is cooking, clean the mushrooms and remove the stems. Use your fingers to remove some of the underside of the cap to create more room for you to stuff the mushroom. You can save the stems to use in other recipes or discard them.
  5. Lightly salt and pepper the inside of the mushrooms.
  6. In a blender, blend cup of Greek yogurt, 1 chipotle pepper + 2 tsp of adobo sauce, 1 tsp lime juice, and a pinch of salt and pepper. Add to the meat mixture once it has browned and mix.
  7. Stuff each mushroom with as much of the beef mixture you can fit on each one. Top with a small pinch of shredded cheese.
  8. Bake for 25 minutes.
  9. While the mushrooms are baking, mix together the ingredients for the sauce. Add the sauce to a ziplock bag and cut a small opening in the corner to pipe the sauce over the mushrooms.

Note

  1. How many mushrooms you make depends entirely on how big or small the ones you buy are. For reference, I made 15 mushrooms but you dont need to be exact. Store any extra meat on the side.

Storage

  1. Store the mushrooms in the refrigerator for no longer than 5 days. If you wish to freeze them, put the mushrooms into a ziplock bag, remove as much air as possible, and label with the date.

Turkey Nuggets

The greatest snack you will ever make, a healthy version of a chicken nugget without any breading. This recipe uses ground turkey but you could just as easily use chicken.

CourseCuisineTime - 35 minutes
SnackAmericanPrep - 15 minutes
Cook - 20 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
42kcal26
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates2.5g35%
Fat2g28%
Protein3.6g51%

Ingredients:

  • 1 lb (454 g) ground turkey or chicken
  • 1 (240 g) sweet potato youll need about 2 cups worth
  • 1 (1 ) egg beaten
  • 3 Tbsp (10 g) green onion
  • 1 (20 g) jalapeo pepper optional
  • 2 tsp (4 g) garlic powder
  • 2 tsp (4 g) seasoned salt
  • 1 tsp (2 g) pepper
  • 3 Tbsp (18 g) almond flour oat or wheat flour will also work
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) olive oil

Instructions:

  1. Preheat your oven to 400F
  2. Wash and peel your potato. Using a food processor or grater, cut your potato into a mince. The food processor works the best here. You want the potato to be in riced form.
  3. Cut your jalapeo into a small dice and saut over medium heat.
  4. While the jalapeo is cooking, wash and cut your green onions into a small dice. Use the whites and greens to until you have 3 Tbsp worth.
  5. In a large bowl, mix all of the ingredients together.
  6. Spray 2 sheet pans with cooking oil.
  7. Divide your meat mixture into nuggets using a cookie scoop. Start with a ball around 1-1 inches in diameter and press into a disc with your fingers.
  8. You want your nuggets to be about 2 inches in diameter and - inch in thickness. They will shrink. I made 24. Depending on how big your cookie scoop is you may have a different yield.
  9. Bake for 10 minutes and then flip and bake an additional 10 minutes.

Storing

  1. Keep the nuggets in the refrigerator for up to 5 days. They will also keep well in the freezer. Put them into a ziplock bag, remove as much air as possible, and label with the date.

Chicken and Sausage Gumbo

A meal prep version of the Louisiana classic. Shredded chicken and andouille sausage cooked low and slow in tomatoes and chicken broth.

CourseCuisineTime - 3 hours 3 hours 3 hours
Main DishAmerican, meal prepPrep - 20 minutes 20 minutes 20 minutes
Cook - 3 hours 3 hours 3 hours

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
649kcal6
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates49g39%
Fat31g25%
Protein44g35%

Ingredients:

  • 2 lbs (908 g) boneless skinless chicken breast
  • 14 oz (397 g) Andouille sausage
  • 14 oz (397 g) can diced tomatoes
  • 2 cups (480 g) chicken broth
  • medium (100 g) onion
  • 4 (400 g) carrots
  • 4 stalks (400 g) celery
  • 1 Tbsp (15 g) garlic
  • 1 medium (150 g) green pepper
  • 2 Tbsp (30 ml) olive oil
  • 1 Tbsp (8 g) cajun seasoning
  • Salt and pepper to taste
  • 2 Tbsp (28 g) butter
  • 1 Tbsp (8 g) cornstarch
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) cold water
  • 5 cups (675 g) cooked rice

Instructions:

  1. Cook the rice using your preferred method. 1 cup of uncooked rice will yield around 3 cups of cooked rice.
  2. Wash your carrots, celery, and green pepper. Peel the carrots to prepare for cutting.
  3. Cut your carrots, celery, green pepper, and onion into a small dice.
  4. In a large pot, heat 2 Tbsp of olive oil over medium heat. Add in the carrots, celery, green pepper, onion, and 1 Tbsp of garlic. Cook for 8-10 minutes stirring occasionally.
  5. After the vegetables have cooked, lay the chicken breasts on top of the vegetables and add in a 14oz can of diced tomatoes and 2 cups of chicken broth. Stir in 1 Tbsp of cajun seasoning.
  6. Bring to a boil and then lower the heat to low and simmer for 2 hours.
  7. After the gumbo has cooked for 2 hours, remove the chicken and shred with two forks in a large bowl.
  8. Next you will need to make a roux to thicken the gumbo. Melt 2 Tbsp of butter in a skillet and stir in cup of almond flour (regular flour is fine, I just use almond flour because it is gluten free. Oat flour works as well.)
  9. Cook the roux for 3-4 minutes or until it has started to brown. Add to the gumbo and stir. Raise the heat to medium.
  10. If your sauce hasnt thickened enough, stir together 1 tsp cornstarch and 1 tsp cold water together. Add to the pot and stir to thicken.
  11. Cut the sausage into inch slices and add to the gumbo.
  12. Continue to cook for an additional 10 minutes. Stir often. Return the chicken to the gumbo and add salt and pepper to taste.

Plating

  1. This recipe will make 6 servings. Divide the ingredients evenly between your 6 containers.

Sausage & Chili Covered Sweet Potato

A play on the classic chili dog with the bun replaced by a sweet potato and the hot dog by kielbasa sausage. This meal packs a lot of flavor into every bite.

CourseCuisineTime - 55 minutes 55 minutes 55 minutes
Main DishAmerican, meal prepPrep - 15 minutes 15 minutes 15 minutes
Cook - 40 minutes 40 minutes 40 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
766kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates59g42%
Fat44g31%
Protein35g25%

Ingredients:

For the Chili

  • 1 lb (454 g) ground beef (85/15)
  • cup (132 g) tomato paste
  • 1 cup (240 g) tomato sauce
  • 8 oz (227 g) mushrooms
  • medium (100 g) sweet onion
  • 1 medium (150 g) green pepper
  • 1 medium (150 g) red pepper
  • 2 Tbsp (30 ml) Worcestershire sauce
  • 1 Tbsp (8 g) chili powder
  • 1 tsp (2 g) mustard powder
  • 1 Tbsp (15 g) garlic minced
  • Salt and pepper to taste
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) olive oil

For the Sweet Potatoes

  • 5 large (1000 g) sweet potatoes
  • 14 oz (397 g) kielbasa sausage
  • 5 Tbsp (71 g) Greek yogurt or sour cream
  • (100 g) avocado

Instructions:

For the Chili

  1. Cut of a sweet onion, 1 red bell pepper, 1 green pepper, and 8 oz of mushrooms into a small dice.
  2. Add 1 Tbsp of olive oil into a large pot over medium high heat. Add in the vegetables and 1 Tbsp of minced garlic. Cook until soft. (Add spinach here if you wish for more vegetables)
  3. Once the vegetables have softened, make some space to add the ground beef. Add the ground beef to the pot and season with salt and pepper. Cook until browned and drain the fat.
  4. Add 1 cup of tomato sauce, cup of tomato paste, and 2 Tbsp of Worcestershire sauce to the pot. Bring to a boil then reduce the heat to low and simmer for 12-15 minutes.
  5. Add 1 Tbsp of chili powder and 1 tsp mustard powder. Taste and adjust any seasonings as needed.

For the Sweet Potatoes

  1. Heat your oven to 400F. Carefully poke holes in each sweet potato with a fork and bake for 30 minutes or until soft. Remove the skin once cooked.

For the Sausage

  1. Cut the sausage into 1-2 inch pieces on a bias. Brown the sausage in a large skillet for 5-7 minutes. Add to the chili and mix.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. In each of your containers add 1 sweet potato and cover with the chili. Top each with 1 Tbsp of Greek yogurt and diced avocado.

Boneless Ribs with Cauliflower Mac & Cheese

Country style pork ribs seasoned with a spice rub and topped with BBQ sauce. They are served with a side of cauliflower mac and cheese and coleslaw.

CourseCuisineTime - 50 minutes 50 minutes 50 minutes
Main DishAmerican, meal prepPrep - 15 minutes 15 minutes 15 minutes
Cook - 35 minutes 35 minutes 35 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
953kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates63g38%
Fat58g35%
Protein44g26%

Ingredients:

For the Ribs

  • 2 lbs (908 g) country style pork ribs
  • cup (72 g) BBQ sauce find a vinegar or tomato based sauce
  • 1 tsp (3 ml) salt
  • 1 tsp (2 ml) pepper
  • 1 Tbsp (7 g) cumin
  • 1 Tbsp (7 g) garlic powder
  • 1 Tbsp (7 g) onion powder
  • 1 tsp (3 g) paprika
  • 1 tsp (3 g) chili powder

For the Cauliflower Mac and Cheese

  • 5 cups (250 g) raw macaroni noodles
  • 3 Tbsp (42 g) butter
  • 6 Tbsp (36 g) almond flour regular flour is fine
  • 1 cups (360 ml) whole milk
  • 1 cup (168 g) cheddar jack cheese
  • Salt and pepper to taste

For the Coleslaw

  • 2 cups (142 g) coleslaw mix
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) olive oil
  • cup (56 g) mayonnaise
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) lemon juice
  • 1 Tbsp (21 g) honey

Instructions:

For the Ribs

  1. Preheat your oven to 375F.
  2. In a bowl mix together the seasonings. 1 tsp salt, 1 tsp pepper, 1 Tbsp cumin, 1 Tbsp garlic powder, 1 Tbsp onion powder, 1 tsp paprika, 1 tsp chili powder.
  3. Rub the seasonings into all sides of the meat. Bake for 30 minutes and check temperature. Bake until it has reached an internal temperature of at least 155F.

For the Cauliflower Mac and Cheese

  1. Cook the cauliflower in a microwave until it is no longer frozen. Cut into macaroni noodle sized pieces.
  2. Add in 1 cup of cheese and the Greek yogurt and stir.
  3. Stir in the cauliflower. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Add the remaining cup of cheese to the top after plating each serving!

For the Coleslaw

  1. In a bowl, mix together cup mayonnaise, 1 Tbsp olive oil, 1 Tbsp lemon juice, and 1 Tbsp honey.
  2. Pour over 2 cups of coleslaw mix.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide your ribs and mac and cheese evenly 5 ways into each of your containers. Store the coleslaw in a separate, smaller container because you wont want to microwave it.

For the Mac and Cheese

  1. Cook the macaroni noodles until soft.
  2. In a sauce pan over medium heat, melt the butter and add in the flour to make a roux. Mix thoroughly and cook for 2-3 minutes to brown.
  3. Add in the milk and stir continuously until it is smooth. Bring to a boil and stir until thick.
  4. Add in 1 cup of cheese and stir.
  5. Stir in the noodles. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Add the remaining cup of cheese to the top after plating each serving!

Philly Cheesesteak Bowls

A breadless, meal prep version of the Philadelphia classic. Zucchini and mushrooms are added to provide some volume and compensate for the lack of bread.

CourseCuisineTime - 40 minutes 40 minutes 40 minutes
Main CourseAmerican, meal prepPrep - 10 minutes 10 minutes 10 minutes
Cook - 30 minutes 30 minutes 30 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
742kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates46g34%
Fat42g31%
Protein46g34%

Ingredients:

  • 2 lbs (908 g) chuck roast
  • 2 (400 g) zucchinis
  • 8 oz (227 g) mushrooms sliced
  • 2 (300 g) green peppers
  • 1 (200 g) white onion
  • 2 Tbsp (30 ml) Worcestershire sauce
  • Salt and pepper to taste
  • 2 Tbsp (30 ml) olive oil
  • 5 slices (105 g) provolone cheese

For the Steak Seasoning

  • 1 tsp (3 g) salt
  • 1 tsp (2 g) pepper
  • 1 tsp (3 g) paprika
  • tsp (1 g) cayenne pepper
  • 1 tsp (2.5 g) onion powder
  • tsp (1.5 g) garlic powder
  • 1 Tbsp (3 g) Italian seasoning

For the Rice

  • 5 cups (675 g) cooked rice

Instructions:

  1. Trim away any large pieces of fat from your steak. Slice it into thin pieces about of an inch thick. You want the pieces of meat to be 1x1x in size.
  2. Heat a large skillet over medium high heat and add 1 Tbsp of olive oil.
  3. Mix all of the seasonings and season one side of the meat with half of it. Place the meat seasoned side down in the skillet and season the other side. Cook for about a minute and flip. The meat will cook very quickly because it is so thin.
  4. Add 2 Tbsp of Worcestershire sauce and mix. Keep the juice left over in the pan.
  5. Cut the onion and peppers into strips. Cut your mushrooms into a small dice and the zucchini into a large dice.
  6. Heat another skillet over medium heat. Add a drizzle of olive oil to each. In one add the onions and peppers and in the other add the diced mushrooms. Once the mushrooms have shrunk and are soft, add in the zucchini. Cook until soft.
  7. Season each of the skillets with salt and peppers to taste.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide the ingredients evenly between your 5 containers. Layer the mushroom and zucchini mixture, then the onions and peppers, followed by the steak. Add any remaining sauce to the top for flavor. Add a slice of provolone cheese to the top of each dish.

For the Rice

  1. Cook enough rice to have 5 cups of cooked rice. One cup of dry rice will yield about 3 cups of cooked rice.

Thai Turkey Burgers with Sweet Potato Fries

Asian flavors melded into a classical American dish. The turkey burgers are meant to be topped with the peanut slaw and eaten together. The slaw provides a great fresh aspect to the dish.

CourseCuisineTime - 1 hour 1 hour 1 hour
Main DishAmerican, Asian, meal prepPrep - 30 minutes 30 minutes 30 minutes
Cook - 30 minutes 30 minutes 30 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
707kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates63g44%
Fat28g19%
Protein52g36%

Ingredients:

For the Burgers

  • 2 lbs (1135 g) ground turkey (93/7)
  • cup (12 g) cilantro finely chopped
  • 2 Tbsp (10 g) ginger minced
  • 5 cloves (20 g) garlic minced
  • 1 (20 g) jalapeo pepper diced
  • 3 small (100 g) shallots minced
  • 1.333 Tbsp (20 ml) fish sauce
  • 2 Tbsp (30 ml) soy sauce
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) olive oil

For the Peanut Slaw

  • 2 cups (140 g) red cabbage
  • 1 cup (100 g) shredded carrots
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) soy sauce
  • 2 Tbsp (32 g) natural peanut butter
  • 2 Tbsp (30 ml) rice wine vinegar
  • 1 inch (10 g) chunk of ginger
  • 1 clove (5 g) garlic
  • 2 Tbsp (42 g) honey
  • 3 Tbsp (45 ml) water
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) lime juice

For the Sweet Potato Fries

  • 4 large (1100 g) sweet potatoes cut into strips
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) olive oil
  • 2 tsp (10 ml) garlic powder
  • Salt and pepper to taste

Instructions:

For the Sweet Potato Fries

  1. Preheat your oven to 400F.
  2. Cut your sweet potatoes into strips about inch thick. Use a mandolin if you have one, it will be much faster and you will get uniform cuts.
  3. Spread the potatoes out on sheet pan and drizzle with olive oil. Season with 2 tsp of garlic powder.
  4. Bake for 10 minutes and then turn the fries and bake an addition 5-8 minutes. Watch them carefully to make sure they dont burn.
  5. Season with salt and pepper to taste once they have finished cooking.

For the Turkey Burgers

  1. Mince the 3 shallots, 5 cloves of garlic, and 2 Tbsp worth of ginger. Cut the jalapeo into a small dice.
  2. Heat 1 tsp of olive oil in a skillet and saut the shallots, garlic, ginger, and jalapeo until the onions have browned. Stir often to prevent burning.
  3. In a large bowl, mix together the 2 lbs of ground turkey, shallot/ginger/garlic/jalapeo mixture, 1 Tbsp + 1 tsp of fish sauce, cilantro, 2 Tbsp of soy sauce, 1 Tbsp olive oil. Using your hands, fold the mixture until everything has been incorporated thoroughly.
  4. Form 10 patties about an inch thick.
  5. Heat a grill pan or a skillet over medium high heat. Cook the burgers for 5-7 minutes on each side. They are finished when they have reached an internal temperature of 165F.

For the Peanut Slaw

  1. While the burgers are cooking you can begin to prep the slaw. In a large bowl, mix together 2 cups of red cabbage and 1 cup of shredded carrots.
  2. Make the dressing in a blender by combining 2 Tbsp of peanut butter, 2 Tbsp rice wine vinegar, a 1 inch chunk of ginger, 1 clove of garlic, 2 Tbsp of honey, 3 Tbsp of water, and 1 Tbsp of lime juice. Blend until smooth. Taste and adjust flavors as necessary. Pour the sauce over the cabbage mix and toss.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide your turkey burgers and sweet potato fries evenly between your 5 containers. Keep the peanut slaw in a separate container as you do not want to microwave it.

Shepherd's Pie with Sweet Potato Chips

A healthy play on the classic version of Shepherds Pie. Instead of mashed potatoes on top of the meat mixture, this recipe uses a combination of cauliflower and potatoes.

CourseCuisineTime - 50 minutes 50 minutes 50 minutes
Main DishAmerican, meal prepPrep - 10 minutes 10 minutes 10 minutes
Cook - 40 minutes 40 minutes 40 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
805kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates72g46%
Fat37g23%
Protein47g30%

Ingredients:

For the Meat Mixture

  • 1 lbs (681 g) ground beef (85/15)
  • 8 (8 ) eggs
  • 28 oz (794 g) can crushed tomatoes
  • 12 oz (340 g) mixed frozen vegetables
  • 1 medium (200 g) onion
  • 1 Tbsp (15 g) garlic minced
  • 1 Tbsp (2 g) olive oil
  • 1 Tbsp (2 g) dried basil
  • 1 Tbsp (2 g) dried oregano
  • Salt and Pepper to taste

For the Sweet Potato Chips

  • 2 large (550 g) sweet potatoes
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) olive oil
  • 1 tsp (3 g) garlic powder
  • Salt and pepper to taste

For the Cauliflower/Potato Combo

  • 14 oz (397 g) frozen cauliflower
  • 1 (150 g) russet potato
  • cup (60 g) skim milk
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) butter
  • Salt and pepper to taste

For the Cauliflower

  • 14 oz (397 g) frozen cauliflower
  • cup (60 g) skim milk
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) butter
  • Salt and pepper to taste

For the Potatoes

  • 4 (600 g) russet potato
  • cup (60 g) skim milk
  • 4 Tbsp (60 g) butter
  • Salt and pepper to taste

Instructions:

For the Meat Mixture

  1. Start a pot of water large enough to boil the eggs.
  2. Hard boil 8 eggs in a pot of water. Put the eggs in the water and once you reach a rolling boil, remove from the heat and cover for 12 minutes. After 12 minutes, run cool water over the eggs and remove the shell.
  3. In a large pot/pan, add 1 Tbsp of olive oil over medium high heat.
  4. Dice the onion and add to the pan with 1 Tbsp of garlic. Cook until onion is translucent.
  5. Add in 1 lbs of ground beef and brown. Once browned remove the fat.
  6. Add in the canned tomatoes, mixed vegetables, 1 Tbsp oregano, and 1 Tbsp basil
  7. Reduce the heat to low and simmer for 15-20 minutes. Add salt and pepper to taste.
  8. Cut the hardboiled eggs into a large dice and gently fold into the mixture.

For the Cauliflower/Potato topping

  1. Wash and peel your potato and cut it into a large dice.
  2. Bring a large pot of water to a boil and add the cauliflower and potato. Cook until soft. Drain the water from the pot and add in cup of milk and 1 Tbsp butter. Mash the cauliflower and potato until smooth. Season with salt and pepper

For the Sweet Potato Chips

  1. Preheat your oven to 400F.
  2. Wash your sweet potatoes thoroughly. Using a mandolin or knife, cut your potatoes into discs of an inch thick.
  3. Spread the potatoes out on a sheet pan and drizzle with olive oil. Season with salt, pepper, and 1 tsp of garlic powder.
  4. Bake the potatoes for 8-10 minutes then flip them and cook an additional 5-8 minutes.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide your ingredients evenly 5 ways into each of your containers.

For the Cauliflower topping

  1. Bring a large pot of water to a boil and add the cauliflower. Cook until soft. Drain the water from the pot and add in cup of milk and 1 Tbsp butter. Mash the cauliflower until smooth. Season with salt and pepper

For the Potato topping

  1. Wash and peel your potato and cut it into a large dice.
  2. Bring a large pot of water to a boil, add the potato potato. Cook until soft. Drain the water from the pot and add in cup of milk and 1 Tbsp butter. Mash potato until smooth. Season with salt and pepper

Pot Roast over Green Beans & Mashed Cauliflower

An easy recipe with great flavor. Put it in the crockpot and youre almost done. The mashed cauliflower can be mixed with mashed potatoes to mask the taste of the cauliflower.

CourseCuisineTime - 8 hours 20 minutes 8 hours 20 minutes
Main DishAmerican, meal prepPrep - 20 minutes 20 minutes
Cook - 8 hours 8 hours

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
474kcal8
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates27g31%
Fat26g30%
Protein32g37%

Ingredients:

For the Roast

  • 2 lb (1135 g) Chuck Roast
  • 1 (28 g) packet au jus
  • 1 (28 g) packet ranch dressing mix
  • 10 (75 g) pepperoncini peppers

For the Cauliflower Mash

  • 24 oz (681 g) frozen cauliflower
  • 1 lb (454 g) red potatoes
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) butter
  • cup (60 ml) milk
  • Salt and Pepper

For the Green Beans

  • 2 lbs (908 g) green beans

Instructions:

  1. In a crock pot mix together the roast, au jus, ranch dressing mix, and 10 pepperoncinis. Cook on low for 8 hours and then shred the meat.
  2. When the roast is almost finished, cut the potatoes and cauliflower into a large dice and boil until soft.
  3. Once soft, drain the water and use a blender or a potato masher to smoothen out the potatoes and cauliflower. Add in 1 Tbsp of butter, cup of milk, and salt and pepper to taste. Blend until smooth.
  4. Boil the green beans until soft. Season with salt and pepper.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 8 servings. Divide the ingredients 8 ways between your containers. Layer the potato mixture on the bottom, add green beans, and then top it with the beef. Add a couple of spoonfuls of the leftover gravy mixture from the crockpot to the top of each meal.

Garlic Parmesan Roasted Chickpeas & Edamame

Chickpeas and edamame coated in garlic and parmesan cheese, roasted in the oven to achieve a crispy texture. This snack can help to curb your cravings for a salty treat.

CourseCuisineTime - 25 minutes
SnackAmericanPrep - 5 minutes
Cook - 20 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
113kcal10
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates13g56%
Fat3.3g14%
Protein7.7g33%

Ingredients:

  • 2 cups (300 g) shelled edamame
  • 15 oz (425 g) can of chickpeas
  • 1 tsp (2 g) garlic powder
  • cup (28 g) grated parmesan cheese
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) olive oil
  • Salt and pepper to taste

Instructions:

  1. Preheat your oven to 400F.
  2. Thaw the edamame and drain the liquid from your chickpeas. Pat dry with a few paper towels.
  3. In a large bowl, mix together the edamame, chickpeas, 1 Tbsp olive oil, 1 tsp garlic powder, and cup grated parmesan cheese. Toss to coat.
  4. Bake for 10 minutes and remove from oven to stir. Bake an additional 10 minutes, removing it again to stir after 5 minutes.
  5. This recipe makes 10 servings. Divide the mixture evenly 10 ways.

Sweet Potato Turkey Sliders

Thinly sliced sweet potatoes topped with turkey, cheese, and green onions. This dish works great as a healthy game time snack or a post work/school treat.

CourseCuisineTime - 28 minutes
SnackAmericanPrep - 8 minutes
Cook - 20 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
87kcal15
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates8.8g48%
Fat2.2g12%
Protein8.1g44%

Ingredients:

  • 2 (400 g) sweet potatoes
  • 1 lb (454 g) turkey breast lunchmeat
  • 8 slices (88 g) thinly sliced provolone cheese
  • 2 tsp (5 g) garlic powder
  • cup (15 g) green onions
  • Cooking spray

Instructions:

  1. Preheat your oven to 400F.
  2. Wash and cut your sweet potato into slices, longways.
  3. Spray a sheet pan with cooking spray and spread out the potatoes. Lightly spray the tops of the potatoes with cooking spray as well.
  4. Lightly season with garlic powder.
  5. Bake the potatoes for 10-12 minutes or until the potatoes have softened and have started to brown.
  6. Remove from the oven and top each potato with turkey and a half slice of cheese. Put the pan back in the oven until the cheese has melted and browned.
  7. Remove from oven and top with green onions.
  8. This recipe makes anywhere between 12-18 sliders. For reference, I yielded 15 but it will depend on how big your potatoes/slices are. Divide the total nutrition information for the recipe by the number of sliders you make to get the most accurate nutritional data.

Turkey Sloppy Joe Bowls & Jalapeo Cheddar Potatoes

Ground turkey mixed with tomato sauce and seasonings and served with jalapeo cheddar potatoes and broccoli. This meal has a wide array of flavors and reheats well in the microwave.

CourseCuisineTime - 35 minutes 35 minutes 35 minutes
Main CourseAmerican, meal prepPrep - 10 minutes 10 minutes 10 minutes
Cook - 25 minutes 25 minutes 25 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
823kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates65g42%
Fat42g27%
Protein47g30%

Ingredients:

For the Sloppy Joes

  • 2 lbs (908 g) ground beef (85/15)
  • cup (132 g) tomato paste
  • (100 g) sweet onion
  • 1 (150 g) green pepper
  • 2 Tbsp (30 ml) dijon mustard
  • 1 Tbsp (23 ml) Worcestershire sauce
  • cup (60 g) ketchup
  • 1 tsp (3 g) red pepper flakes
  • 1 Tbsp (8 g) onion powder
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) olive oil
  • Salt and pepper to taste

For the Jalapeo Cheddar Potatoes

  • 8 small (1000 g) potatoes
  • 1 (30 g) jalapeo pepper
  • cup (74 g) shredded cheddar cheese
  • 1 Tbsp (23 ml) olive oil
  • Salt and pepper to taste
  • 1 large bunch (500 g) broccoli

For the Potatoes

  • 2 medium (275 g) potatoes
  • (15 g) jalapeo
  • cup (28 g) cheddar cheese shredded
  • Cooking spray oil

Instructions:

For the Potatoes

  1. Preheat your oven to 425F.
  2. Wash and cut your potatoes into a small to medium dice. You want these small so they cook faster. Aim for about inch cubes. Toss the potatoes in 1 Tbsp of olive oil and spread on a sheet pan.
  3. Bake for 10 minutes then remove from the oven and stir/flip. Bake for an additional 5-8 minutes or until they have developed some color.
  4. Remove the potatoes from the oven and segment them out into 5 even portions on the pan. Top each portion with cheddar cheese and sliced jalapeos, bake until the cheese has melted.

For the Sloppy Joes

  1. Cut your pepper and onion into a small dice. Add 1 Tbsp of olive oil in a skillet and add the pepper and onion. Cook until the onion is translucent and add the ground beef and cook until browned.
  2. Once the beef has cooked, stir in cup tomato paste, 1 Tbsp Worcestershire sauce, 2 Tbsp Dijon mustard, cup ketchup, 1 Tbsp onion powder, 1 tsp red pepper flakes, and salt and pepper to taste.

For the Broccoli

  1. Wash and cut your broccoli into florets and cook using your preferred method.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide all of your ingredients evenly between your containers.

Buffalo Chicken Quinoa Bowls

These Chicken Quinoa Bowls are incredibly versatile. Pictured here is a Buffalo Chicken Bowl with Greek yogurt ranch. You could also make a Salsa Chicken Bowl or BBQ Chicken.

CourseCuisineTime - 30 minutes
Main DishAmerican, meal prepPrep - 10 minutes
Cook - 20 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
442kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates27g28%
Fat13g13%
Protein54g57%

Ingredients:

  • 2 lbs (1135 g) boneless skinless chicken breast
  • 1 cup (175 g) celery diced
  • 1 cup (125 g) shredded carrots
  • 1 cup (175 g) green peppers diced
  • 1 cup (227 g) plain non fat Greek yogurt
  • 1 tsp (3 g) ranch dressing seasoning mix
    • cup (60 mL) buffalo sauce
  • 2 cups (438 g) cooked quinoa
  • 2 Tbsp (30 ml) olive oil
  • Salt and pepper

Instructions:

For the Quinoa

  1. Cook enough quinoa to have 2 cups of cooked quinoa. 1 cup of uncooked quinoa will yield around 3 cups of cooked quinoa. Rinse the quinoa prior to cooking until the water runs clear. Cook using the same method you would use for rice.

For the Chicken

  1. Butterfly (or pound with a meat tenderizeyour chicken so that it is not so thick and it will cook faster. Cut all the way through so you have 2 pieces. If it is still fairly thick, you may want to pound it until it is inch thin or less. (Butterfly means to cut down the middle so you can open it like a book).
  2. Lightly season the chicken with salt and pepper.
  3. Add 12 Tbsp of of olive oil to a grill pan or skillet over medium high heat and cook the chicken in batches if necessary to prevent overcrowding. It has finished cooking when the inside is no longer pink and reaches an internal temperature of at least 165F.
  4. Let it rest for a few minutes after cooking and cut into a medium dice.
  5. Add to a bowl and mix with cup buffalo sauce to coat evenly.

For the Vegetables

  1. Wash and cut your pepper and celery into a small dice. You need to have a total of 1 cups each.
  2. Measure out 1 cups of shredded carrots.
  3. You dont need to cook any of these as they will cook in the microwave.

For the Ranch Dressing

  1. Mix together 1 cup of Greek yogurt and 1 tsp of ranch dressing mix. Store in separate, smaller containers.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Add cup of quinoa and carrots, celery, and peppers to each container. Divide the chicken equally and add 1 of your ranch dressing cups to each container.

Deconstructed Cheeseburger Bowls

A meal prep version of the American classic. Ground beef, potato wedges, and burger toppings come together in a bowl that reheats well in the microwave.

CourseCuisineTime - 33 minutes
Main DishAmerican, meal prepPrep - 8 minutes
Cook - 25 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
662kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates47g38%
Fat35g28%
Protein41g33%

Ingredients:

For the Hamburger and Toppings

  • 2 lbs (908 g) ground beef (85/15)
  • 5 Tbsp (35 g) shredded cheese
  • 9 oz (255 g) shredded Brussels sprouts
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) olive oil
  • 1 tsp (2 g) garlic powder
  • 10 Tbsp (150 ml) BBQ sauce Vinegar based
  • 5 (150 g) dill pickle spears
  • 2 (120 g) Roma tomatoes
  • Salt and pepper to taste

For the Potato Wedges

  • 5 small (750 g) russet potatoes
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) olive oil
  • Salt and pepper

Instructions:

For the Potato Wedges

  1. Preheat your oven to 400F.
  2. Wash each of your potatoes thoroughly. Cut each of them in half long ways 3 times so you have 8 wedges for each potato.
  3. In a large bowl, drizzle 1 Tbsp of olive oil over the potatoes. Sprinkle with 1 tsp of salt and pepper. Toss the potatoes to coat and spread onto a sheet pan.
  4. Bake for 10 minutes and then flip them to the other side and cook an additional 10-12 minutes or until desired doneness is achieved.

For the Hamburger

  1. Heat a skillet over medium high heat. Add the ground beef and cook. Once it has browned, season with salt and pepper to taste.

For the Brussels Sprouts

  1. Heat 1 Tbsp of olive oil over medium high heat. Add in the shaved Brussels sprouts and cook for 2-3 minutes. They will cook fast. Season with 1 tsp garlic powder and salt and pepper to taste.

For the Bowls

  1. Cut 2 Roma tomatoes into slices.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide your hamburger, potatoes, and Brussels sprouts evenly between your 5 containers. Top the hamburger with 1 Tbsp of shredded cheese. Add 1 pickle spear and slices of Roma tomatoes. Store 2 Tbsp of BBQ sauce in a separate container.

Sweet Potato Turkey Chili

A hearty chili packed with sweet potatoes, pinto beans, peppers, and ground turkey. This meal can be made in one pot to help speed up the cleaning process!

CourseCuisineTime - 30 minutes 30 minutes 30 minutes
Main DishAmerican, meal prepPrep - 10 minutes 10 minutes 10 minutes
Cook - 20 minutes 20 minutes 20 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
669kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates72g53%
Fat27g20%
Protein35g26%

Ingredients:

For the Chili

  • 1 lbs (681 g) ground beef (85/15)
  • 14.5 oz (411 g) pinto beans
  • 14.5 oz (411 g) can petite diced tomatoes
  • 14.5 oz (411 g) can crushed tomatoes
  • 1 large (300 g) sweet potato
  • medium (100 g) sweet onion
  • 1 medium (150 g) green pepper
  • 1 medium (150 g) red pepper
  • 2 Tbsp (15 g) chili powder
  • 1 tsp (3 g) cayenne pepper
  • 2 Tbsp (30 ml) olive oil
  • 5 cups (750 g) cooked rice
  • Salt and pepper to taste

For the Topping

  • 5 Tbsp (71 g) Greek yogurt
  • green onions

Instructions:

  1. Before you start cooking youll want to chop all of your vegetables first and start cooking the rice. This will save time. Youll also want to start a pot of water to boil for the sweet potatoes. Cut the onion and bell peppers into a small dice. Cut the sweet potatoes into a medium dice.
  2. Add the sweet potatoes to the boiling water and cook until soft. Drain the water and set aside.
  3. Heat 1 Tbsp of olive oil over medium high heat in a large pot. Add in the peppers and onions and cook for 3-5 minutes or until soft.
  4. Push the pepper and onion mixture to the side and add an additional 1 Tbsp of olive oil to the pot. Lightly season the turkey with salt and pepper and add to the pot. Cook until browned.
  5. Add the crushed tomatoes, petite diced tomatoes, sweet potatoes, 2 Tbsp chili powder, and 1 tsp cayenne pepper, and beans to the pot. Bring to a boil and taste test. Season with salt and pepper and adjust seasonings as needed.
  6. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide all of your ingredients evenly between 5 containers. Add 1 cup of cooked rice to each dish. Top each dish with Greek yogurt and green onions.

Easy Breakfast Tacos

These Breakfast Tacos are my go to breakfast or late night meal when I don't have anything prepped. They only take 10-15 minutes and are made from eggs, cheese, and potatoes.

CourseCuisineTime - 15 minutes
Breakfast, Main DishAmerican, MexicanPrep - 5 minutes
Cook - 10 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
152kcal4 Tacos
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates16.3g56%
Fat6.5g22%
Protein7g24%

Ingredients:

For the Tacos

  • 4 (94 g) corn tortillas
  • 1 small (100 g) russet potato
  • 2 large (140 g) eggs
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) milk
  • 2 slices (46 g) cheese
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) hot sauce
  • 1 tbsp (5 g) cilantro chopped
  • tsp (2 g) oil
  • salt to taste

For the Pickled Red Onions

  • 1 medium (200 g) red onion
  • 1 tbsp (12 g) sugar
  • 1 tsp (6 g) salt
  • 1 cups (360 g) white vinegar
  • 1 cups (360 g) water

Instructions:

For the Tacos

  1. Wash and cut your potato into small shoestring french fry shapes.
  2. Place the fries into your air fryer basket and spray with 2g of oil and sprinkle with salt to taste.
  3. Air fry at 400 F for 8-10 minutes shaking the basket half way through.
  4. While the potatoes are cooking, crack 2 eggs into a dish and add a splash of milk and salt. Beat until they are smooth. Cook the eggs in either a pan or in the microwave until they are finished.
  5. In a dry skillet over medium high heat, add 4 corn tortillas to warm and lightly brown. Flip over and add a half slice of cheese to each to begin to melt.
  6. To each tortilla, evenly divide the potatoes and eggs. Top each with hot sauce, pickled onions, and chopped cilantro.
  7. The nutritional estimates are per taco.

For the Pickled Red Onions

  1. These are best made in advance. I always keep these in my fridge. They will last for weeks.
  2. Cut your red onion into thin slices from root to shoot.
  3. In large mason jar, add1tsp of salt,1tbsp of sugar,1cups water, and1cups distilled vinegar. Stir to dissolve the solids.
  4. Add the onions into the mason jar and top with more water and vinegar if necessary to cover the onions. Cap the jar and move it into the fridge to allow the onions to pickle.

Salsa Verde Beef Bowls

These Salsa Verde Beef Bowls are made up of ground beef, red onions, poblano peppers, cabbage, cilantro lime rice and salsa verde to pour over the top. This is a quick and easy recipe that can be finished in under an hour.

CourseCuisineTime - 45 minutes
Main Coursemeal prep, MexicanPrep - 10 minutes
Cook - 35 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
540kcal5 servings
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates39g37%
Fat24g22%
Protein42g40%

Ingredients:

For the Rice

  • 3 cups (450 g) cooked rice
  • 2 tbsp (30 g) lime juice
  • cup (20 g) chopped cilantro
  • salt to taste

For the Beef and Vegetables

  • 2 lbs (908 g) ground beef (90/10)
  • 2 (150 g) poblano peppers green bell pepper is fine too
  • 1 medium (200 g) red onion
  • 1 small (227 g) green cabbage alternatively you can buy 8oz of preshredded cabbage in a bag
  • 2 tbsp (30 g) oil
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) minced garlic
  • 1 tsp (3 g) cumin
  • 1 tsp (3 g) chili powder
  • 1 tsp (3 g) smoked paprika
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) lime juice
  • salt and pepper to taste
  • 1 cups (300 g) salsa verde pick out your favorite jar from the store
  • 1 jalapeo optional for garnish

Instructions:

For the Rice

  1. Make enough rice to yield3cups of cooked rice. 1 cup of dry rice will make between 2-3 cups of cooked rice depending on what type of rice you use.
  2. Once the rice has finished, add 3 cups of rice to a bowl and mix in 2 tbsp of lime juice and cup chopped cilantro.

For the Beef and Vegetables

  1. While the rice is cooking, prepare your beef and vegetables. For the nutritional estimates provided, I have included 2 tbsp of oil to use in the cooking process. Use that amount as needed in the cooking of the beef and vegetables.
  2. In a large skillet over medium high heat, add about a tsp of the oil and cook the beef until it has browned. The beef should have enough fat that you won't need to use a ton of oil.
  3. While the beef is browning, wash and cut all of your vegetables.
