  4. Cut the red onion into thin slices, the peppers into a medium dice, and shred the cabbage by cutting into thin slices. Mince up 1 tbsp worth of garlic. Chop the cilantro into small pieces for the cilantro lime rice once the rice has finished.
  5. Once the beef is finished browning, remove it from the skillet (or use a separate skillet) and add 1 tbsp of oil over medium heat. Toast the cumin, chili powder, and smoked paprika in the oil for about 30 seconds and then raise the temperature to medium high and add in the onions and peppers to cook. Add more oil if needed.
  6. Allow the onions and peppers to cook and brown for 4-5 minutes then add it the shredded cabbage and continue cooking until it has softened, around 3-5 minutes. Season lightly with salt and pepper.
  7. Once the vegetables have softened, add back the beef to the pan as well as the cilantro lime rice and squeeze about 1 tbsp of lime juice over the top. Mix everything until well incorporated.
  8. Taste test and adjust flavors with salt, pepper, and extra lime juice as necessary.

For the Salsa Verde

  1. Shake up your jar of salsa and divide it into 5 smaller containers of cup each.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide the contents of the pan evenly between your 5 containers and add a small container of salsa to each.

Ground Chicken Taco Bowls

Ground Chicken Taco Bowls paired with shredded cabbage, rice, and a side of salsa roja. This is a flavorful and filling dish for under 500 calories.

CourseCuisineTime - 35 minutes
Main Dishmeal prep, MexicanPrep - 10 minutes
Cook - 25 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
481kcal5 servings
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates47g46%
Fat14g13%
Protein41g40%

Ingredients:

For the Meat

  • 2 lbs (908 g) ground chicken (95/5) I put boneless skinless chicken thighs in the food processor
  • cup (180 g) tomato sauce
  • 1 tsp (3 g) paprika
  • 1 tsp (3 g) garlic powder
  • 1 tsp (3 g) chili powder
  • 1 tsp (3 g) cumin
  • tbsp (8 g) oil
  • Salt and pepper to taste

For the Cabbage

  • 12 oz (563 g) shredded cabbage You can buy these pre shredded as coleslaw or salad mix
  • tbsp (7 g) oil
  • 1 tsp (3 g) garlic powder
  • Salt and pepper to taste

For the Rice

  • 3 cups (563 g) cooked rice
  • tbsp (8 g) oil
  • 1 tbsp (8 g) chili powder
  • 1 tsp (3 g) paprika
  • 1 (60 g) Roma tomato diced

For the Salsa Roja

  • 4 (240 g) Roma tomatoes
  • 1 small (100 g) white onion
  • 2 (60 g) jalapeos
  • 5 cloves (25 g) garlic
  • tbsp (7 g) oil
  • bunch (20 g) cilantro
  • 2 Tbsp (30 g) lime juice
  • Salt to taste

Instructions:

For the Rice

  1. Prepare enough rice to have 3 cups of cooked rice. 1 cup of dry rice will yield between 2-3 cups of cooked rice depending on what kind you use.
  2. Dice 1 Roma tomato and remove the seeds.
  3. Once the rice has finished, measure out 3 cups and add in the oil, chili powder, paprika, diced Roma tomato, and salt to taste.

For the Salsa Roja

  1. You can either boil, roast, or air fry this. I use the air fryer. Preheat the air fryer to 400F.
  2. Wash your tomatoes, jalapeos, and cilantro. Cut the stems off the jalapeos and cut your onion in half. Peel your garlic cloves.
  3. Add the halved onion, jalapeo peppers, tomatoes, and garlic to a large bowl and drizzle over tbsp of oil and salt to your liking. Toss to coat. The tomatoes have finished cooking when they begin to change color and the skin starts to break.
  4. Air fry for 8-10 minutes, turning every few minutes until the tomatoes and onions have softened and developed color.
  5. Add the tomatoes, onions, garlic, jalapeos, bunch of cilantro, and the juice of 1 lime to a blender or food processor Blend until smooth.
  6. Add salt to taste. Adjust flavor with salt and lime juice as needed.
  7. Portion out into smaller, separate cups for the meals. You will probably have extra.

For the Shredded Cabbage

  1. Heat tbsp of olive oil over medium high heat. Add in the shredded cabbage and cook for 4-5 minutes. Season with 1 tsp garlic powder and salt and pepper to taste.
  2. You can drizzle in a bit of water to create steam and help them cook faster. Once finished, set aside until you are ready to plate.

For the Taco Meat

  1. Heat tbsp of oil over medium high heat and add in your ground chicken. Allow it to brown and cook.
  2. Once the chicken is about 90% of the way cooked, add cup of tomato sauce, 1 tsp paprika, 1 tsp chili powder, 1 tsp cumin, 1 tsp garlic powder, and salt and pepper to taste. Stir to combine and cook for an additional few minutes to cook out the tomato sauce. Taste test and adjust flavors as needed.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide your chicken, cabbage, and rice evenly between the containers. Each meal gets 1 of your salsa cups as well.

Mexican Beef and Potatoes

Mexican Beef and Potatoes made from ground beef, tomaotes, potatoes, rice and topped with cotija cheese. Serve with a lime wedge to spritz over the top for added freshness.

CourseCuisineTime - 30 minutes 30 minutes 30 minutes
Main Dishmeal prep, MexicanPrep - 10 minutes 10 minutes 10 minutes
Cook - 20 minutes 20 minutes 20 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
694kcal5 servings
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates56g43%
Fat34g26%
Protein40g30%

Ingredients:

For the Rice

  • 4 cups (600 g) cooked rice

For the Beef & Potatoes

  • 2 lbs (908 g) ground beef (85/15)
  • 1 can (425 g) petite diced tomatoes
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) oil
  • 1 bunch (100 g) green onions
  • 2 medium (300 g) russet potatoes
  • 8 oz (227 g) shredded cabbage or coleslaw mix
  • 1 lime
  • 1 medium (20 g) jalapeo pepper optional
  • 2 tsp (8 g) cumin
  • 1 tbsp (12 g) chili powder
  • 2 tsp (8 g) garlic powder
  • 5 tbsp (40 g) cotija cheese

For the Turkey & Potatoes

  • 2 lbs (908 g) ground turkey (93/7)
  • 1 can (425 g) petite diced tomatoes
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) oil
  • 1 bunch (100 g) green onions
  • 2 medium (300 g) russet potatoes
  • 8 oz (227 g) shredded cabbage or coleslaw mix
  • 1 lime
  • 1 medium (20 g) jalapeo pepper optional
  • 2 tsp (8 g) cumin
  • 1 tbsp (12 g) chili powder
  • 2 tsp (8 g) garlic powder
  • 5 tbsp (40 g) cotija cheese

Instructions:

For the Rice

  1. Cook enough rice to have 4 cups of cooked rice. 1 cup of dry rice will yield about 2-3 cups of cooked rice depending on what kind you use.

For the Beef & Potatoes

  1. Wash and cut your potatoes, green onions, lime, and jalapeo.
  2. Cut the potatoes into a large dice, the green onions into slices separating the whites from the greens. Cut the lime into wedges and jalapeo into thin slices.
  3. I used the air fryer to cook the potatoes for speed purposes. You can use your oven if needed. Preheat the air fryer to 400F or your oven to 425F. Add the potatoes to the air fryer basket and cook for 8-12 minutes or until they have properly browned.
  4. If you use the oven, you'll need to toss the potatoes in a bit of oil and spread on a sheet pan. Roast for 8-10 minutes, then flip and return to the oven for an additional 5-7 minutes.
  5. In a large skillet over medium high heat, add a bit of oil and begin to brown the ground beef.
  6. Once the beef is about 90% of the way cooked, make room in the center of the skillet and add in the whites of the green onions and the shredded cabbage. Season lightly with salt.
  7. After the cabbage has cooked down a bit, add in the canned petite diced tomatoes. Stir to incorporate. Once the potatoes have finished cooking you can add them to the pan as well.
  8. Add two cups of rice as well as the garlic powder, cumin, and chili powder. Stir everything together to incorporate and adjust seasonings to taste.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide your ingredients evenly into your 5 containers and top with cotija cheese, jalapeo slices, and a lime wedge.

For the Turkey & Potatoes

  1. Wash and cut your potatoes, green onions, lime, and jalapeo.
  2. Cut the potatoes into a large dice, the green onions into slices separating the whites from the greens. Cut the lime into wedges and jalapeo into thin slices.
  3. I used the air fryer to cook the potatoes for speed purposes. You can use your oven if needed. Preheat the air fryer to 400F or your oven to 425F. Add the potatoes to the air fryer basket and cook for 8-12 minutes or until they have properly browned.
  4. If you use the oven, you'll need to toss the potatoes in a bit of oil and spread on a sheet pan. Roast for 8-10 minutes, then flip and return to the oven for an additional 5-7 minutes.
  5. In a large skillet over medium high heat, add a bit of oil and begin to brown the ground turkey.
  6. Once the turkey is about 90% of the way cooked, make room in the center of the skillet and add in the whites of the green onions and the shredded cabbage. Season lightly with salt.
  7. After the cabbage has cooked down a bit, add in the canned petite diced tomatoes. Stir to incorporate. Once the potatoes have finished cooking you can add them to the pan as well.
  8. Add two cups of rice as well as the garlic powder, cumin, and chili powder. Stir everything together to incorporate and adjust seasonings to taste.

Fire Roasted Tomato Beef with Rice and Refried Beans

Ground beef coated with a homemade enchilada sauce and mixed with a variety of vegetables. This meat is served with a side of rice and refried beans.

CourseCuisineTime - 45 minutes 45 minutes 45 minutes
Main Dishmeal prep, MexicanPrep - 15 minutes 15 minutes 15 minutes
Cook - 30 minutes 30 minutes 30 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
687kcal6
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates79g53%
Fat21g14%
Protein47g31%

Ingredients:

For the Beef and Sauce

  • 2 lbs (908 g) ground beef (90/10)
  • 14.5 oz (411 g) can fire roasted tomatoes
  • 2 Tbsp (20 g) red onion diced
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) white vinegar
  • 1 Tbsp (8 g) chili powder
  • 1 tsp (1 g) oregano
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) olive oil

For the Vegetables

  • 1 medium (200 g) zucchini
  • 8 oz (227 g) mushrooms
  • 1 medium (150 g) red pepper
  • 1 medium (200 g) red onion
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) olive oil

For the Rice & Beans

  • 6 cups (900 g) cooked rice
  • 2 can (908 g) refried beans

For the Turkey and Sauce

  • 2 lbs (908 g) ground turkey (93/7)
  • 14.5 oz (411 g) can fire roasted tomatoes
  • 2 Tbsp (20 g) red onion diced
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) white vinegar
  • 1 Tbsp (8 g) chili powder
  • 1 tsp (1 g) oregano
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) olive oil

For the Rice

  • 3 cups (450 g) cooked rice

Instructions:

For the Rice

  1. Cook enough rice to have 6 cups of cooked rice. 1 cup of uncooked rice will yield around 2-3 cups of cooked rice.

For the Enchilada Sauce

  1. Add 2 Tbsp of diced red onion, 1 can of fire roasted tomatoes, 1 Tbsp vinegar, 1 Tbsp chili powder, 1 tsp oregano, and 1 tsp salt to a blender. Blend until smooth.

For the Beef

  1. In a large skillet over medium high heat, begin to brown the beef.
  2. When the beef is about 85% of the way cooked, add in the enchilada sauce and reduce the heat to medium low. Allow it to simmer to cook out the tomatoes.

For the Vegetables

  1. Wash and cut your vegetables into a large dice.
  2. Heat another large skillet over medium high heat and add 1 Tbsp of olive oil. Saut the vegetables in order of how long it will take them to cook. Onions and peppers, then zucchini, then mushrooms.
  3. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

For the Beef and Vegetable Mix

  1. Once the vegetables have cooked down and finished cooking, add them to the skillet with the beef and sauce and toss to mix. Season with salt to taste.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 6 servings. Add 1 cup of the rice and about 1 cup of the beans to each container. The beans don't need to be cooked, you can just open the cans and divide the entirety of them between your containers. Split the beef mixture evenly into each container. Top with cilantro if you wish.

For the Turkey

  1. In a large skillet over medium high heat, begin to brown the turkey.
  2. When the turkey is about 85% of the way cooked, add in the enchilada sauce and reduce the heat to medium low. Allow it to simmer to cook out the tomatoes.

For the Turkey and Vegetable Mix

  1. Once the vegetables have cooked down and finished cooking, add them to the skillet with the turkey and sauce and toss to mix. Season with salt to taste.

Steak Fajita Bowls

Steak Fajita Bowls comprised of sirloin steak soaked in a spiced lime juice marinade and combined with a mixture of peppers, onions, and grape tomatoes.

CourseCuisineTime - 35 minutes 35 minutes 35 minutes
Main Dishmeal prep, MexicanPrep - 20 minutes 20 minutes 20 minutes
Cook - 15 minutes 15 minutes 20 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
765kcal5 servings
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates57g39%
Fat37g25%
Protein51g35%

Ingredients:

For the Steak

  • 2 lbs (1135 g) center cut sirloin steak
  • 2 tsp (6 g) onion powder
  • 2 tsp (6 g) garlic powder
  • 1 tbsp (8 g) chili powder
  • 1 tsp (4 g) cayenne pepper
  • 2 tsp (6 g) salt
  • 1 tsp (2 g) pepper
  • 1 tsp (5 g) oil
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) lime juice

For the Rice

  • 5 cups (750 g) cooked rice

For the Vegetables

  • 2 medium (300 g) red peppers
  • 2 medium (300 g) green peppers
  • 1 medium (200 g) sweet onion
  • 10 oz (283 g) grape tomatoes
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) oil
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) lime juice
  • salt and pepper to taste

Instructions:

**For the Rice **

  1. Cook enough rice to yield 5 cups of cooked rice. 1 cup of dry rice will make around 2-3 cups of cooked rice depending on what kind of rice you use.

For the Steak

  1. Cut the steak, against the grain and on a slight bias, into thin strips of about inch thick. You are looking for bite sized pieces.
  2. Place the steak into a large bowl and add the onion powder, garlic powder, chili powder, cayenne pepper, salt, pepper, lime juice, and oil. Toss everything together so it is evenly coated. Allow it to marinade for a few minutes while you cut the vegetables.
  3. Preheat your air fryer to 400F. Once at temperature add in a portion of the steak and cook for 2-3 minutes. It won't take long at all since it is cut thin and you don't want to over cook it. Cook it in batches to ensure proper cooking.
  4. You can also cook the steak on a skillet over high heat if you don't have an air fryer.

For the Vegetables

  1. Cut the onion and peppers into thin slices and the tomatoes in halves.
  2. In a large skillet over medium high heat, add some oil and the sweet onions. Sal early to encourage water release and browning.
  3. Allow the onions to develop some color then add in the peppers and lightly salt again to pull out the water. Once they have begun to soften, add in the tomatoes and cook until the tomatoes have softened and cooked out.
  4. Add some lime juice over the top of the vegetables and season with salt and pepper to taste.
  5. Mix in the steak and stir to incorporate.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide your ingredients evenly into your 5 containers. Each dish gets 1 cup of cooked rice.

For the Chicken

  1. Cut the chicken into thin strips of about inch thick. You are looking for bite sized pieces.
  2. Place the chicken into a large bowl and add the onion powder, garlic powder, chili powder, cayenne pepper, salt, pepper, lime juice, and oil. Toss everything together so it is evenly coated. Allow it to marinade for a few minutes while you cut the vegetables.
  3. Preheat your air fryer to 400F. Once at temperature add in a portion of the chicken and cook for 4-5 minutes. It won't take long at all since it is cut thin and you don't want to over cook it. Cook it in batches to ensure proper cooking.
  4. You can also cook the chicken on a skillet over high heat if you don't have an air fryer.

Chili Garlic Chicken with Rice and Beans

Chili Garlic Chicken made by broiling marinated chicken thighs and served with a side of vegetables, rice, and beans.

CourseCuisineTime - 40 minutes
Main Coursemeal prep, MexicanPrep - 10 minutes
Cook - 30 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
496kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates44g41%
Fat15g14%
Protein46g43%

Ingredients:

For the Chicken

  • 2 lbs (1135 g) boneless skinless chicken thighs
  • tbsp (8 g) oil
  • 1 tbsp (8 g) chili powder
  • 1 tsp (3 g) garlic powder
  • 1 tsp (3 g) onion powder
  • 2 tsp (10 ml) lemon juice
  • 2 tsp (8 g) salt
  • 5 tsp cilantro chopped, optional

For the Vegetables

  • 2 medium (400 g) zucchini
  • 1 medium (150 g) red pepper
  • medium (100 g) onion
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) oil

For the Rice and Beans

  • 2 cups (375 g) cooked rice
  • 1 can (438 g) pinto beans 15.5oz
  • tbsp (8 g) oil
  • 1 tbsp (9 g) ranch dressing mix
  • 1 tsp (3 g) garlic powder
  • 1 tsp (3 g) onion powder
  • salt to taste

Instructions:

For the Rice and Beans

  1. Cook enough rice to make 2 cups of cooked rice. 1 cup of dry rice will make about 2-3 cups of cooked rice depending on what kind you use.
  2. Drain and rinse the pinto beans.
  3. Once the rice has cooked, measure out 2 cups and add in the beans, seasonings, and oil. Mix to combine.

For the Chicken

  1. Preheat your oven to 400F and put the sheet pan inside while it is coming to temperature.
  2. In a large bowl, add the chicken thighs, chili powder, onion powder, garlic powder, lemon juice, salt and oil. Mix thoroughly to combine.
  3. When the oven has heated, add the chicken to the hot sheet pan in a single layer and bake for 15 minutes.
  4. After 15 minutes, turn the oven to broil, move the chicken to a top shelf and broil for 3-5 minutes or until color starts to develop. Watch it carefully as you don't want it to burn.

For the Vegetables

  1. Wash and cut all of your vegetables into a large dice.
  2. Preheat a skillet over medium high heat and add oil. Cook the onions until they have begun to develop color, then add the zucchini and peppers. Season with salt to taste.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide your ingredients evenly between your 5 containers. Garnish with cilantro if you wish.

Chicken Tinga Taco Bowls

Chicken Tinga Taco Bowls made from shredded chicken breasts in a seasoned tomato sauce and served with a side of Mexican rice and sauted garlic cabbage.

CourseCuisineTime - 50 minutes 50 minutes
Main Dishmeal prep, MexicanPrep - 20 minutes 20 minutes
Cook - 30 minutes 30 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
569kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates58g48%
Fat17g14%
Protein45g37%

Ingredients:

For the Chicken

  • 2 lbs (1135 g) boneless skinless chicken thighs
  • medium (100 g) sweet onion
  • 14 oz (397 g) crushed tomatoes canned
  • 2 (25 g) chipotle peppers in adobo sauce chopped
  • 2 tsp (12 g) chili powder
  • 1 tsp (4 g) cumin
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) olive oil
  • salt and pepper to taste
  • 5 tsp (5 g) cilantro chopped, optional

For the Rice

  • 5 cups (750 g) cooked rice
  • 2 medium (200 g) tomato
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) olive oil
  • 1 tbsp (12 g) chili powder
  • 2 tsp (6 g) paprika
  • salt to taste

For the Coleslaw Mix

  • 12 oz (340 g) coleslaw mix
  • tbsp (8 g) olive oil
  • 1 tsp (3 g) garlic powder
  • salt to taste

For the Salsa

  • 8 oz (227 g) salsa use your favorite kind

Instructions:

For the Rice

  1. Cook enough rice to yield 5 cups of cooked rice. 1 cup of dry rice will make between 2-3 cups of cooked rice depending on what kind you use.
  2. Wash and chop your tomato into a small dice. Remove the seeds and watery inside.
  3. After the rice has finished cooking, mix in 1 tbsp of olive oil, 1 tbsp of chili powder, 2 tsp paprika, and salt to taste.

For the Chicken

  1. Add the chicken thighs to a large pot and cover with water. Bring the pot to a boil over medium high heat and cover the pot with a lid. Allow to boil for 15-20 minutes or until the chicken has cooked through.
  2. Once the chicken has finished cooking, remove the breasts from the pot and place them into a large bowl. Shred the chicken with two forks or using a hand mixer.
  3. Drain the water from the pot, rinse out any of the proteins left behind and return to the stove to cook the tomato sauce in.

For the Sauce

  1. While the chicken is cooking prepare the remaining ingredients. Cut your onion and chipotle peppers into a small dice. Measure out your seasonings.
  2. Add some oil to your pot over medium high heat. Add in the onion and cook for 1-2 minutes, then add in the seasonings and allow them to toast for a minute. Then add the chopped chipotle peppers and crushed tomatoes.
  3. Reduce the heat to low and allow the tomatoes to simmer for 5-10 minutes. Stir in the chicken and season with salt and pepper to taste.

For the Coleslaw

  1. In a skillet over medium heat, add a bit of oil and saut the coleslaw mix. Season with salt early to help draw out some of the water. If you cover it with a lid it may help speed up the process.
  2. Season with garlic powder, salt, and pepper to taste.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide your ingredients evenly between your 5 containers. Store your salsa in a smaller, separate container as you don't want to heat this with your meal.

Pollo and Pinto Mini Tacos

A freezer friendly mini taco made from pinto beans, chicken, cheddar cheese, and spinach. Adding chopped spinach to the bean mixture makes for an easy way to get in more leafy greens, even if its only a little bit.

CourseCuisineTime - 45 minutes
SnackMexicanPrep - 15 minutes
Cook - 30 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
84kcal32 tacos
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates10.7g62%
Fat2g11%
Protein5.7g33%

Ingredients:

  • 2 cans (850 g) pinto beans
  • 2 cups (120 g) spinach chopped
  • cup (120 g) water
  • 2 tsp (4 g) cumin
  • 2 tsp (4 g) chili powder
  • 1 tsp (5 g) olive oil
  • 32 mini (469 g) corn tortillas I use the brand Mission street taco tortillas. They are 3" in diameter
  • 1 cup (112 g) cheddar cheese
  • 1 lb (454 g) boneless skinless chicken breast
  • salt and pepper to taste

Instructions:

  1. Preheat your oven to 400F.

For the Chicken

  1. You can cook this anyway you please. It doesn't make a huge difference because we are cutting it up small and putting in the filling. Bake it, boil it, buy it precooked if you want. If you bake it, cut or pound it so it has even thickness throughout and cook for 15-20 minutes or until it has reached an internal temperature of 165F.

For the Beans

  1. Heat 1 tsp of oil in a skillet over medium heat. Add in the beans and chopped spinach. Allow to cook for 2 minutes until the spinach has wilted.
  2. Add in cup of water and cover. Cook for 5 minutes.
  3. Remove the cover and mash the beans with a fork or potato masher. Add in the cumin, chili powder and season with salt and pepper to taste.
  4. Mix in the cheese and chicken.

For the Tacos

  1. Heat the tortilla shells in the microwave so they are pliable. I like to wrap a small amount of them in a damp paper towel.
  2. Spoon the bean and cheese mixture onto each tortilla and fold to close. I like to use a cookie scoop for this step.
  3. Place the tacos on a sheet pan and bake for 5-8 minutes. Place an empty sheet pan on the top so they are weighed down and won't open when baked.

Storage

  1. Once the tacos have cooled, add to a large ziplock bag. Remove as much air as possible and keep in the freezer. Reheat the tacos in the microwave. For the best result, use an air fryer or wrap the tacos in a wet paper towel and then microwave for 10-15 seconds. I don't recommend going straight from the freezer to microwave as the tortilla will be too dry.

Spicy Adobo Chicken and Peppers

This is a quick and simple meal that requires very little effort. Chicken thighs, rice, peppers, and onions mixed in diced chipotle peppers in adobo sauce to give the heat.

CourseCuisineTime - 35 minutes
Main Dishmeal prep, MexicanPrep - 10 minutes
Cook - 25 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
504kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates39g37%
Fat18g17%
Protein47g45%

Ingredients:

  • 2 lbs (908 g) boneless skinless chicken thighs
  • 1 tbsp (23 g) olive oil
  • 1 medium (150 g) red bell pepper
  • 1 medium (150 g) green bell pepper
  • 1 medium (200 g) onion
  • 3 cups (525 g) cooked rice
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) lime juice
  • 4 tbsp (60 g) chipotle peppers in adobo sauce
  • 1 tsp (3 g) garlic powder
  • salt and pepper to taste

Instructions:

For the Rice

  1. Cook enough rice to yield 3 cups of cooked rice. 1 cup of dry rice will yield between 2-3 cups of cooked rice.

For the Chicken

  1. I prefer to cook this in the air fryer. If you don't have one you can use the bake and broil method in the oven. Preheat your air fryer to 400F or your oven to 425F.
  2. Cut the chipotle peppers into a mince with some of the adobo sauce until you have about cup worth.
  3. Season the chicken with salt and pepper and add about 2 tbsp of the chipotle peppers and adobo sauce. Toss the chicken to coat with the sauce.
  4. Place the chicken into your air fryer basket and air fry for 8-12 minutes, flipping halfway.
  5. If you bake it, place it on a sheet pan in the oven on the top rack for 10 minutes, then turn the oven to broil and broil for about 3 minutes each side or until it has developed color. The thickness of your chicken will impact cooking time. If it needs more or less time, pull it out when it is done.

For the Peppers and Onion

  1. Wash and cut your peppers into a large dice. Cut the onion into slices.
  2. In a large skillet, heat some oil over medium high heat. Add the onions and cook for 4-5 minutes until they have begun to caramelize.
  3. Add more oil if needed and add in the peppers. Season with salt to help bring out some of the moisture. Cook for 3-4 minutes and remove from the pan.

For the Finished Dish

  1. Cut the chicken into a medium dice.
  2. Into a large skillet, add the chicken and allow it to develop a bit more color on all sides. Add in the peppers and onions, 3 cups of cooked rice and the remaining chipotle peppers. Toss to coat evenly.
  3. Add the garlic powder and lime juice. Stir to incorporate and season with salt and pepper to taste.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide the ingredients evenly 5 ways.

Tex Mex Rice Bowls

Chicken breasts with rice, black beans, and vegetables mixed with a Mexican style red sauce. This dish is served with a side of pico de gallo for added freshness.

CourseCuisineTime - 50 minutes 50 minutes 50 minutes
Main Dishmeal prep, MexicanPrep - 15 minutes 15 minutes 15 minutes
Cook - 35 minutes 35 minutes 35 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
626kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates58g44%
Fat22g17%
Protein49g37%

Ingredients:

For the Pico de Gallo

  • 4 (240 g) Roma tomatoes
  • (100 g) red onion
  • 1 (15 g) jalapeo
  • bunch (15 g) cilantro
  • lime juice to taste
  • salt to taste

For the Red Sauce

  • 14 oz (411 g) fire roasted tomatoes canned
  • 1 tbsp (15 ml) vinegar
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) olive oil
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) garlic
  • 2 tbsp (20 g) red onion minced
  • 1 tbsp (8 g) chili powder
  • 1 tsp (2 g) oregano

For the Bowls

  • 2 lbs (1135 g) boneless skinless chicken thighs
  • 1 medium (200 g) zucchini
  • 1 medium (150 g) red pepper
  • 8 oz (227 g) mushrooms
  • 4 cups (600 g) cooked rice
  • 14 oz (411 g) black beans canned
  • 3 tbsp (52 ml) olive oil
  • salt and pepper to taste

Instructions:

For the Rice

  1. Cook enough rice to yield3cups of cooked rice. 1 cup of dry rice will make between 2-3 cups of cooked rice depending on what kind you use.

For the Chicken

  1. Preheat your oven to 400F.
  2. Pound or cut your chicken breast so it is even in thickness throughout. Drizzle with a bit of olive oil, salt, and pepper and place into a baking dish. Roast for 20-25 minutes or until the thickest part of the chicken reaches 165F.
  3. Cut into small pieces after it has finished cooking and rested for a couple of minutes.

For the Pico de Gallo

  1. Cut the tomatoes in half the long way and scoop out the seeds. Dice the tomatoes so they are about inch cubes and place in a large bowl.
  2. Diceof a red onion and add to the the tomatoes.
  3. Cut the stems off of the jalapeo pepper. Cut the pepper into a small dice and add to the mixture.
  4. NOTE: If you arent a fan of heat, then take out the ribs and seeds before chopping up the peppers.
  5. Cut the stems off of a small bunch of cilantro and finely chop the leaves until you have cup, add to the bowl.
  6. Cut a lime in half and squeeze its juice into the mixing bowl. Stir all of the ingredients together and add salt and pepper to taste.

For the Vegetables

  1. Wash and cut all of the vegetables into a medium dice.
  2. In a large skillet over medium high heat, add some oil and cook the zucchini and peppers for 2-3 minutes. Then add the mushrooms and salt lightly. Cook until the mushrooms have started to develop some color. Dump into a large bowl.

For the Red Sauce

  1. Add all of the sauce ingredients to a blender and blend until smooth.
  2. In a large skillet over medium high heat, add the sauce and cook for 1-2 minutes, stirring constantly.
  3. Add in the chicken and toss to coat. Dump the chicken into the bowl with the vegetables.

For the Bowls

  1. Measure out the rice and rinse the canned beans. Add to the bowl and mix. Drizzle in 2 tbsp of olive oil. Season with salt and pepper to taste. A touch of lime juice is nice as well.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide your ingredients 5 ways. Store the pico in a smaller, separate container.

Chorizo Breakfast Bowls

Chorizo, scrambled eggs, and a pepper, onion, and potato mixture. There is only a bit of chorizo in this dish but it provides so much flavor that any more may be too rich.

CourseCuisineTime - 35 minutes 35 minutes 35 minutes
Breakfastmeal prep, MexicanPrep - 10 minutes 10 minutes 10 minutes
Cook - 25 minutes 25 minutes 25 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
591kcal4
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates36g34%
Fat36g34%
Protein32g30%

Ingredients:

  • 8 (8 ) eggs
  • 1 lb (680 g) Yukon gold potatoes
  • medium (100 g) onion
  • 2 medium (300 g) bell peppers
  • 12 oz (340 g) chorizo
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) olive oil
  • salt and pepper to taste

Instructions:

For the Potatoes

  1. Preheat your oven to 425F
  2. Wash and cut your potatoes into a medium dice.
  3. Add to a sheet pan with some olive oil and sprinkle with salt and pepper. Roast for 10 minutes and then flip. Cook an additional 8-10 minutes or until you achieve proper browning.

For the Pepper and Onion Mix

  1. Wash and chop your onion and peppers into a medium dice. Saut in olive oil until softened. Stir in the potatoes.

For the Chorizo and Scrambled Eggs

  1. Cook the chorizo and scrambled eggs, together is fine, separate if you'd prefer the separation. Be careful not to overcook your eggs as you will be reheating them again in the microwave if you are meal prepping this dish.

Plating

  1. Divide ingredients evenly 4 ways. This recipe makes 4 servings.

Shrimp Tacos

Pan fried shrimp tossed in a spicy mayo and served inside of a corn tortilla with rice, slaw, and pickled onions.

CourseCuisineTime - 35 minutes
Main DishMexicanPrep - 25 minutes
Cook - 10 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
197kcal6 tacos
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates21.3g53%
Fat7g17%
Protein12.1g30%

Ingredients:

For the Shrimp

  • 1 lb (454 g) shrimp
  • 1 tsp (5 ml) olive oil
  • 5 tsp (25 g) mayo
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) sambal oelek
  • 1 tsp (5 g) sriracha
  • 1 tsp (5 g) honey
  • salt and pepper to taste

For the Slaw and Toppings

  • 2 cups (140 g) coleslaw mix
  • 1 tsp (5 ml) olive oil
  • 2 tsp (10 ml) lime juice
  • cilantro chopped

For the Rice

  • 1 cup (150 g) cooked rice
  • 1/2 tsp (2 g) paprika
  • 1/2 tsp (2 g) chili powder
  • 1 tsp (5 ml) olive oil
  • Salt and pepper
  • 6 corn tortillas

For the Pickled Onions

  • 1 medium (200 g) red onion
  • 1 tbsp (12 g) sugar
  • 1 tsp (3 g) salt
  • 1 cup (240 g) vinegar
  • 1 cup (240 g) water
  • cup (60 g) lime juice

Instructions:

For the Pickled Onions

  1. Cut the onion into thin slices. In a mason jar, add the sugar, salt, water, and vinegar. Shake to dissolve the solids.
  2. Add in the onions and top off the jar with lime juice.Place into the fridge overnight.
  3. The night before, cut the onion into thin slices. In a mason jar, add the sugar, salt, water, and vinegar. Shake to dissolve the solids.

For the Rice

  1. Cook enough rice to yield 1 cup of cooked rice. Measure out a cup and mix in some oil, chili powder, paprika, salt and pepper.

For the Shrimp

  1. Pat the shrimp dry and coat each side in oil and season with salt and pepper. Add to a grill or pan over medium high heat and cook for a couple of minutes on each side. Cut the shrimp into bite sized pieces.
  2. Mix the sambal, sriracha, honey, and mayo in a bowl. Stir. Adjust flavors as necessary. Mix in shrimp.

For the Slaw

  1. Toss oil and lime juice in coleslaw. Season with salt and pepper. Adjust flavors as necessary.

For the Taco

  1. Heat your tortillas on a dry skillet.
  2. Construct your taco. Rice first, then shrimp, then slaw, then pickled onions and cilantro.

Creamy Salsa Verde Grain Bowls

Shelled edamame, corn, black beans and red bell peppers cooked together and served over the top of a bed of rice. This dish is served with a side of creamy salsa verde to pour over the top for added flavor.

CourseCuisineTime - 35 minutes 35 minutes 35 minutes
Main Dishmeal prep, MexicanPrep - 10 minutes 10 minutes 10 minutes
Cook - 25 minutes 25 minutes 25 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
683kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates102g68%
Fat16g10%
Protein32g21%

Ingredients:

For the Plant Mix

  • 1 lb (454 g) shelled edamame frozen
  • 1 medium (150 g) red pepper
  • 14.5 oz (411 g) black beans 1 can
  • 1 cup (170 g) corn frozen or canned
  • 1 tbsp (6 g) cumin
  • 2 tsp (4 g) chili powder
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) olive oil
  • 1-2 tbsp (30 ml) water
  • 1 cup dry lentils
  • salt and pepper to taste

For The Salsa Verde

  • 5 small (300 g) tomatillos
  • 1 (15 g) jalapeo pepper
  • 1 (10 g) serrano pepper
  • 1 small (150 g) white onion
  • 3 cloves (15 g) garlic
  • bunch (12 g) cilantro
  • 1 (15 ml) lime, juiced
  • 1 small (125 g) avocado
  • 1 tbsp (5 g) olive oil
  • salt to taste

For the Rice

  • 3 cups (562.5 g) cooked rice
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) olive oil
  • salt and pepper to taste

Instructions:

For the Salsa Verde

  1. Preheat your oven to 400F.
  2. Wash all of your vegetables. Cut the tops off of the peppers and cut the onion in half.
  3. Place the tomatoes, peppers, peeled garlic, and the onion to a sheet pan. Cover with oil and salt. Roast for 10-15 minutes or until all of the vegetables have softened.
  4. Place the roasted vegetables to a blender, add in bunch of cilantro, 1 tbsp of lime juice, and salt. Add lime juice and salt to taste. Adjust as needed.
  5. Allow the salsa to cool to room temperature and blend in the avocado until it is creamy and smooth.

For the Rice

  1. Cook enough rice to yield 4 cups of cooked rice. 1 cup of dry rice will yield between 2-3 cups of cooked rice depending on the type of rice you use.
  2. Measure out 3 cups of rice. Add in the olive oil and salt and pepper to taste.

For the Plant Mix

  1. Rinse the lentils and clean out any debris. Start a pot of water over high heat and bring to a boil. Boil the lentils until they have softened and drain.
  2. Place the frozen corn and shelled edamame into the microwave and cook until it has thawed. Drain off any water.
  3. Wash and cut the pepper into slices.
  4. Heat a large skillet over medium high heat and add a bit of oil. Add in the red peppers and cook until soft. Remove from the pan and heat a bit more oil.
  5. Drain and rinse your black beans.
  6. Add in the corn, edamame, lentils and black beans. Cook for a few minutes, stirring every so often do develop some color on the pieces. Add oil as necessary.
  7. After they have cooked for a few minutes, add back the peppers and stir in the cumin, chili powder, and salt and pepper. Add in 1-2 tbsp of water to help the seasonings incorporate.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Add cup of rice to each dish, divide the plant mixture evenly 5 ways, and store the salsa verde in a separate smaller container. It is likely you will have extra salsa.

Pollo Asado Tacos

Chicken tacos marinated in orange juice, lime juice, and spices. These tacos are layered with a chipotle mayo rice, chicken, creamy salsa verde, and pickled onions.

CourseCuisineTime - 1 hour 20 minutes
Main CourseMexicanPrep - 30 minutes
Cook - 30 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
274kcal12 tacos
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates28.3g53%
Fat10.8g20%
Protein15.9g30%

Ingredients:

For the Chicken

  • 2 lbs (908 g) boneless skinless chicken thighs
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) minced garlic
  • 1 large (60 ml) orange, juiced
  • 1 (30 ml) lime, juiced
  • 2 tbsp (30 ml) olive oil
  • 1 tbsp (12 g) cumin
  • 3 tsp (9 g) chili powder
  • 1 tsp (3 g) salt
  • 1 tsp (3 g) pepper

For the Chipotle Rice

  • 2 cups (300 g) cooked rice
  • 3 tbsp (44 g) mayonnaise
  • 2 tsp (6 g) chili powder
  • 2 tsp (6 g) paprika
  • 1 tsp (3 g) cumin
  • Salt to taste

For the Creamy Salsa Verde

  • 5 small (250 g) tomatillos
  • 1 (20 g) jalapeo pepper
  • 1 (15 g) serrano pepper
  • 1 small (150 g) white onion
  • 3 cloves (15 g) garlic
  • bunch (12 g) cilantro
  • 1 (15 ml) lime, juiced
  • 1 small (125 g) avocado
  • salt to taste

For the PIckled Onions

  • 1 medium (200 g) red onion
  • 1 tbsp (12 g) sugar
  • 1 tsp (3 g) salt
  • 1 cup (240 ml) water
  • 1 cup (240 ml) vinegar
  • cup (60 ml) lime juice
  • 12 corn tortillas

Instructions:

For the Chicken

  1. In a large ziplock bag, add the chicken, garlic, lime juice, orange juice, olive oil, cumin, chili powder, salt, and pepper. Shake to mix. Remove as much air as possible from the bag and marinate at least 1 hour.
  2. Once the chicken has finished marinating, remove it from the marinade and heat a grill pan or skillet over medium high heat. Cook the chicken in batches for 3-4 minutes on each side.
  3. Once the chicken has finished cooking, cut it into small pieces (" or so) and return to the pan to develop color on all sides.

**For the Rice **

  1. Cook enough rice to yield 2 cups of cooked rice. 1 cup of dry rice will make around 2-3 cups of cooked rice depending on the type of rice you use. You can cook this rice in advanced if you wish. Leftover rice works fine.
  2. Measure out 2cups of rice and mix the mayo and seasonings into the rice.

For the Creamy Salsa Verde

  1. Preheat your oven to 400F.
  2. Wash all of your vegetables. Cut the tops off of the peppers and cut the onion in half.
  3. Place the tomatoes, peppers, peeled garlic, and the onion to a sheet pan. Cover with oil and salt. Roast for 10-15 minutes or until all of the vegetables have softened.
  4. Place the roasted vegetables to a blender, add inbunch of cilantro,1tbsp of lime juice, and salt. Add lime juice and salt to taste. Adjust as needed.
  5. Allow the salsa to cool to room temperature and blend in the avocado until it is creamy and smooth.

For the Pickled Onions

  1. Cut the onion into thin slices
  2. In a mason jar, add the sugar, salt, water, and vinegar. Shake to dissolve the solids.
  3. Add in the onions and top off the jar with lime juice.
  4. Place in the fridge over night. They will last a few weeks.

For the Tacos

  1. Heat the tortillas in a dry skillet until they have heated and are pliable.
  2. Top with rice first, then chicken, salsa, and pickled onions.
  3. How many tacos this makes will obviously depend on how much you fill each one. For nutrition information purposes I am going to go with 12 tacos. It is difficult to estimate nutritional information for these because you will have extras of the toppings leftover.

Chicken Street Tacos

*Chipotle marinated chicken with a cabbage slaw, cilantro lime rice, salsa roja, and pickled onions. One of the most flavor packed bites you will ever encounter *

CourseCuisineTime - 1 hour 30 minutes
Main DishMexicanPrep - 1 hour
Cook - 30 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
287kcal12 tacos
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates26.6g48%
Fat11.8g21%
Protein18.8g34%

Ingredients:

For the Chicken

  • 2 lbs (1135 g) chicken thighs
  • cup (60 ml) lime juice
  • 2 (15 g) chipotle peppers in adobo sauce
  • 2 tbsp (30 g) adobo sauce
  • 1 tbsp (8 g) cumin
  • 2 tsp (6 g) paprika
  • 2 tsp (6 g) salt
  • 1 tsp (3 g) pepper
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) olive oil

For the Rice

  • 2 cups (300 g) cooked rice
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) olive oil
  • cup (12 g) chopped cilantro
  • 2 tbsp (30 ml) lime juice
  • Salt to taste

For the Salsa Roja

  • 6 (360 g) roma tomatoes
  • 5 cloves (20 g) garlic
  • 1 medium (200 g) white onion
  • 1 (20 g) jalapeno pepper
  • 1 (10 g) serrano pepper
  • bunch (20 g) cilantro
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) olive
  • 2 tbsp (30 ml) lime juice
  • Salt to taste

For the Pickled Onions

  • 1 medium (200 g) red onion
  • 1 tbsp (8 g) sugar
  • 1 tsp (3 g) salt
  • 1 cup (240 ml) water
  • 1 cup (240 ml) vinegar
  • cup (60 ml) lime juice

For the Slaw

  • 12 oz (340 g) coleslaw mix
  • cup (60 g) mayonnaise
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) adobo sauce
  • 1 tbsp (15 ml) lime juice
  • Salt and pepper to taste

For the Tortillas

  • 12 (300 g) corn tortillas

Instructions:

  1. Most of this stuff can/should be done the night before. The pickeled onions absolutely should be made at least a day in advance so they have time to pickle. The salsa can be prepared well ahead of time. Using leftover rice is also works.

For the Chicken

  1. In a large ziplock bag, add the chicken, lime juice, minced chipotle peppers, the adobo sauce from the can, spices, and oil. Mix everything together in the bag until the chicken is coated. Remove as much air as possible and allow to marinate in the fridge at least an hour.
  2. For the most authentic flavor using a flat top is best. It just makes food taste better. Cast iron is second best, any skillet will work though. Heat the skillet over medium high heat.
  3. Add a little bit of oil and cook the chicken for 3-4 minutes each side.
  4. Remove the chicken and cut into a small dice. Return to the skillet to obtain color on all sides.

For the Rice

  1. Cook the rice using your preferred method. 1 cup of dry rice will yield between 2-3 cups of cooked rice depending on the kind.
  2. Measure out 2 cups of rice and add to a bowl. Add in the chopped cilantro, oil, and lime juice and salt to taste.

For the Salsa Roja

  1. Preheat your oven to 400F.
  2. Wash all of your vegetables. Cut the tops off of the peppers and cut the onion in half.
  3. Place the tomatoes, peppers, peeled garlic, and the onion to a sheet pan. Cover with oil and salt. Roast for 10-15 minutes or until all of the vegetables have softened. You may want to remove the skins from the tomatoes to avoid any stringy bits.
  4. Place the roasted vegetables to a blender, add in bunch of cilantro, 2 tbsp of lime juice, and salt. Add lime juice and salt to taste. Adjust as needed.

For the Pickled Onions

  1. Cut the onion into thin slices.
  2. In a mason jar, add the sugar, salt, water, and vinegar. Shake to dissolve the solids.
  3. Add in the onions and top off the jar with lime juice.
  4. Place in the fridge over night. They will last a few weeks.

For the Slaw

  1. In a large bowl, mix all of the ingredients together.

For the Tacos

  1. Heat the tortillas in a dry skillet until they have heated and are pliable.
  2. Top with rice first, then chicken, slaw, salsa, and pickled onions.
  3. How many tacos this makes will obviously depend on how much you fill each one. For nutrition information purposes I am going to go with 12 tacos. It is difficult to estimate nutritional information for these because you will have extras of the toppings leftover.

Mini Bean and Cheese Tacos

A freezer friendly mini taco made from refried beans, cheddar cheese, and spinach. Adding chopped spinach to the bean mixture makes for an easy way to get in more leafy greens, even if its only a little bit.

CourseCuisineTime - 1 hour 5 minutes
SnackMexicanPrep - 5 minutes
Cook - 1 hour

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
71kcal38 tacos
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates11.1g74%
Fat1.5g10%
Protein3.3g22%

Ingredients:

  • 2 cans (908 g) refried beans
  • 6 oz (170 g) spinach chopped
  • 1 tbsp water
  • 1 tsp (2 g) cumin
  • 1 tsp (5 g) olive oil
  • 38 mini (279 g) corn tortillas I use the brand Mission street taco tortillas. They are 3" in diameter
  • 1 cups (160 g) shredded cheese

Instructions:

For the Filling

  1. Roughly chop the spinach into smaller pieces.
  2. Heat 1 tsp of oil in a skillet over medium heat. Add in the spinach stir for a bit in the oil then drizzle over 1 tbsp of water and cover with a lid for 1 minute to allow the spinach to wilt.
  3. Remove the lid and boil off any excess water then add 1 of cumin and stir.
  4. Add in the canned refried beans, of the cheese, and salt and pepper for flavor. Mix until well combined then remove from the heat.

For the Tacos

  1. Heat a dry skillet over medium to medium high heat. Lay down the tortillas in the skillet and heat until they have softened and are pliable. Flip halfway through.
  2. Spoon the bean and cheese mixture onto each tortilla and top with a bit more cheese, fold to close.
  3. Place the finished tacos on a sheet pan to cool and repeat until all the filling has been used.
  4. If you plan to vacuum seal the tacos, flash freeze the sheet pan of tacos, uncovered in the freezer until solid.

Storage

  1. Place the frozen tacos into your freezer bag, remove all of the air and return to the freezer for storage.
  2. To reheat the tacos, place into a 400F for 3-5 minutes or in the oven if you don't have an air fryer. Microwaving is fine as well.

Flank Steak Fajitas

Grilled flank steak marinated in lime juice and seasonings served with pan fried peppers and onions. This is a great low carb meal option.

CourseCuisineTime - 30 minutes 30 minutes
Main Dishmeal prep, MexicanPrep - 10 minutes 10 minutes
Cook - 20 minutes 20 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
671kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates53g39%
Fat27g20%
Protein54g40%

Ingredients:

For the Steak

  • 2 lbs (1135 g) flank steak
  • 2 Tbsp (30 g) olive oil
  • 1 Tbsp (8 g) chili powder
  • 2 Tbsp (30 g) garlic minced
  • 2 tsp (5 g) ground coriander
  • Salt and pepper to taste
  • 1 Tbsp (15 g) lime juice

For the Peppers and Onions

  • 4 medium (600 g) bell peppers any color
  • 1 medium (200 g) sweet onion
  • 1 Tbsp (15 g) olive oil
  • Cilantro optional
  • Salt and pepper to taste
  • 1 lime for garnish

For the Rice

  • 5 cups (750 g) cooked rice

Instructions:

  1. Lightly season the steak with salt and pepper. Place it in a large ziplock bag and add 2 Tbsp olive oil, 1 Tbsp chili powder, 2 Tbsp minced garlic, 2 tsp ground coriander, and the juice of 1 lime.
  2. Remove as much air as possible and allow to marinate for at least 10 minutes.
  3. While the steak is marinating, wash and cut your peppers into strips. Cut your onion into similar sized slices.
  4. Heat a large skillet over medium high heat (cast iron is best here). Add in 1 Tbsp of olive oil and cook the peppers and onions until they become soft.
  5. Season with salt and pepper and drizzle a bit of lime juice over the top.
  6. To cook the steak, heat a grill pan over medium high heat, add a bit of olive oil and grill the meat for 3-4 minutes each side for a medium steak.
  7. Remove from the pan and allow to rest for a few minutes. This will make sure the meat retains its moisture.
  8. Cut the meat into thin slices against the grain to prevent chewiness.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide your ingredients evenly 5 ways and add to your containers.

For the Rice

  1. Cook enough rice to have 5 cups worth of cooked rice. 1 cup of dry rice yields about 3 cups of cooked rice. NOTE: You can blend some cilantro and spinach with water and use that water to cook your rice in. It's a super sneaky way to add in a serving of leafy greens.

For the Steak and Peppers

  1. Lightly season the steak with salt and pepper. Place it in a large ziplock bag and add 2 Tbsp olive oil, 1 Tbsp chili powder, 2 Tbsp minced garlic, 2 tsp ground coriander, and the juice of 1 lime.
  2. Remove as much air as possible and allow to marinate for at least 10 minutes.
  3. While the steak is marinating, wash and cut your peppers into strips. Cut your onion into similar sized slices.
  4. Heat a large skillet over medium high heat (cast iron is best here). Add in 1 Tbsp of olive oil and cook the peppers and onions until they become soft.
  5. Season with salt and pepper and drizzle a bit of lime juice over the top.
  6. To cook the steak, heat a grill pan over medium high heat, add a bit of olive oil and grill the meat for 3-4 minutes each side for a medium steak.
  7. Remove from the pan and allow to rest for a few minutes. This will make sure the meat retains its moisture.
  8. Cut the meat into thin slices against the grain to prevent chewiness.

Chicken Fajitas

Chicken breast marinated in olive oil, chili powder, and lime juice cooked with a mixture of red /green peppers and onions and serve over sweet potato rice.

CourseCuisineTime - null
Main Dishmeal prep, MexicanPrep - 40 minutes 40 minutes 40 minutes
Cook - 25 minutes 25 minutes 25 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
643kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates49g39%
Fat29g23%
Protein46g37%

Ingredients:

For the Chicken

  • 2 lbs (908 g) boneless skinless chicken breast
  • 2 Tbsp (30 g) garlic
  • 2 tsp (2 g) oregano
  • 1 tsp (2 g) coriander
  • 1 tsp (2 g) cumin
  • 1 Tbsp (8 g) chili powder
  • 2 Tbsp (30 ml) olive oil
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) lime juice
  • Salt and pepper

For the Peppers

  • 1 medium (150 g) red pepper
  • 2 medium (300 g) green peppers
  • 1 (200 g) sweet onion
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) olive oil

For the Potatoes

  • 2 (500 g) sweet potatoes
  • 1 Tbsp (8 g) chili powder
  • Salt and pepper
  • (30 g) queso fresco

For the Cauliflower Rice

  • 5 cups (500 g) cauliflower rice frozen is easiest
  • 1 tbsp (8 g) chili powder
  • salt and pepper to taste

For the Rice

  • 5 cups (675 g) cooked rice
  • 10 tbsp (150 g) melted queso

Instructions:

  1. Cut the chicken into thin strips - thick.
  2. In a large bowl add the chicken, 2 Tbsp garlic, 2 tsp oregano, 1 tsp coriander, 1 tsp cumin, 1 Tbsp chili powder, 2 Tbsp of oil and around 1 tsp of salt. Mix thoroughly and refrigerate for 30 minutes.
  3. If you have a cast iron pan, use it to cook the peppers and chicken. Heat it over medium high heat.
  4. Add 1 Tbsp of oil to the pan and cook the peppers and onions until they are soft. Cook in batches if necessary. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
  5. After the peppers and onions have cooked, cook the chicken (in batches if necessary).
  6. Once all the chicken has finished cooking, add all the peppers, onions, and chicken back to the pan and add lime juice.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide your rice, chicken, and peppers evenly between each of your containers. Top each dish with queso fresco.

For the Cauliflower Rice

  1. Microwave/boil the cauliflower rice to cook it. Mix in the chili powder and salt and pepper to taste.

For the Rice

  1. Cook enough rice to make 5 cups of cooked rice. 1 cup of dry rice will yield about 3 cups of cooked rice.

Salsa Chicken

Shredded chicken breasts cooked in the crockpot paired with sauted peppers and onions with refried black beans.

CourseCuisineTime - 6 hours 6 hours 6 hours
Main Dishmeal prep, MexicanPrep - 10 minutes 10 minutes 10 minutes
Cook - 6 hours 6 hours 6 hours

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
652kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates57g41%
Fat20g14%
Protein61g44%

Ingredients:

  • 2 lbs (908 g) boneless skinless chicken breast
  • 14 oz (397 g) can chicken broth
  • 2 cups (448 g) salsa
  • 3 cans (1275 g) black beans 45oz
  • 1 tbsp (8 g) cumin
  • 1 cup (112 g) jack cheese
  • 3 medium (450 g) bell peppers
  • 1 medium (200 g) onion
  • 2 tbsp (30 ml) olive oil
  • (2 g) Cilantro

Instructions:

  1. Put the chicken and broth in a crockpot. Cook on low for 5-7 hours or high for 4 hours.
  2. Remove the chicken from crockpot when finished cooking and shred. Add salsa and mix. Season to taste.
  3. Cut onion and peppers into strips. Saut in oil until soft.
  4. Add black beans to a pot. Bring to a light boil and mash the beans into a paste. Add oil if necessary. Cook until the liquid has reduced (probably 8-10 minutes). Add cumin, salt and pepper to taste.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide your ingredients 5 ways. Top the beans with jack cheese.

Chipotle Citrus Chicken

Chicken thighs marinated in adobo sauce and citrus to give outstanding flavor to the meat. This chicken is served with a side of zucchini and a Mexican inspired fried rice.

CourseCuisineTime - 1 hour 1 hour 1 hour
Main Dishmeal prep, MexicanPrep - 40 minutes 40 minutes 40 minutes
Cook - 30 minutes 30 minutes 30 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
607kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates57g44%
Fat18g13%
Protein54g41%

Ingredients:

For the Chicken

  • 2.5 lbs (1135 g) boneless skinless chicken thighs
  • 1 (85 g) orange juiced
  • 1 (30 g) lime juiced
  • 1 (10 g) chipotle pepper in adobo sauce
  • 3 tbsp (45 g) adobo sauce
  • 1 tbsp (8 g) Cumin
  • 1 tsp (3 g) Salt
  • 1 tsp (2 g) Pepper
  • 1 tbsp (8 g) Chili powder
  • 1 tbsp (15 ml) Olive oil

For the Rice

  • 4 cups (600 g) cooked rice
  • 2 tbsp (30 ml) olive oil
  • 1 cup (366 g) canned black beans
  • 1 (150 g) green pepper
  • 1 (150 g) red pepper
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) garlic
  • 1/2 medium (100 g) onion
  • 2 medium (500 g) zucchini

Instructions:

**For the Chicken **

  1. In a large ziplock bag, add the chicken, juice from the lime, juice from the orange, chipotle pepper and adobo sauce, cumin, chili powder, salt and pepper. Mix together and allow to marinate for 30 minutes.
  2. Once the chicken has marinated, heat a grill pan over medium heat add oil and cook the chicken.
  3. Cut the chicken into one inch pieces and return to the pan to get even color.

For the Rice

  1. While the chicken is marinating, chop your peppers and onion into a small dice. Cut the zucchini into a large dice.
  2. Cook enough rice to yield 4 cups of cooked rice. 1 cup of dry rice will yield about 3 cups of cooked rice.
  3. In a skillet, heat some oil over medium heat. Saut the onion and garlic until the onion has softened. Add the peppers and cook until soft.
  4. Add in 4 cups of cooked rice, 1 cup of rinsed black beans and season with salt, pepper, and lime juice to taste.

For the Zucchini

  1. Heat some oil in another pan and saut the zucchini until soft.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide the ingredients evenly between 5 containers.

Pollo Verde

Pollo Verde from shredded chicken mixed with a homemade salsa verde and served with a side of peppers, onions, and pinto beans.

CourseCuisineTime - 4 hours 4 hours 4 hours
Main Dishmeal prep, MexicanPrep - 10 minutes 10 minutes 10 minutes
Cook - 4 hours 4 hours 4 hours

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
683kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates70g50%
Fat26g18%
Protein42g30%

Ingredients:

  • 2 lbs (908 g) boneless skinless chicken thighs
  • 1 large (300 g) zucchini
  • 1 large (200 g) red pepper
  • 1 medium (200 g) sweet onion
  • 5 Tbsp (75 ml) olive oil
  • 5 (250 g) tomatillos
  • 2 (40 g) jalapeos use serranos if you like it spicy
  • 1/4 bunch (15 g) cilantro
  • 1 (30 ml) lime
  • 4 cloves (20 g) garlic
  • 1 small (100 g) white onion
  • 2 cups (438 g) pinto beans
  • 2 Tbsp (16 g) cotija cheese
  • 5 cups (750 g) cooked rice

Instructions:

For the Chicken

  1. In a crockpot or instant pot, add 1-2 cups of water. Salt it and then add the chicken. Cook until it is shreddable. Empty most of the liquid and shred the meat.

For the Salsa

  1. In a pot of boiling water, add the tomatillos, garlic, white onion (halved) and the jalapeos. Boil until the tomatillos have turned army green. Add to a blender with cilantro, lime juice and salt to taste. Blend to desired consistency.
  2. Mix The Salsa into the chicken and stir.

For the Vegetables

  1. Cut your red pepper, onion, and zucchini into a large dice. Saut with olive oil until soft. .

For the Beans

  1. Rinse and drain the beans.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide your ingredients evenly between 5 dishes. Divide the Cotija beans evenly and sprinkle over the beans.

For the Rice

  1. Cook enough rice to have 5 cups of cooked rice. 1 cup of cooked rice will yield about 3 cups of cooked rice. Stir in 3 Tbsp of olive oil to the cooked rice.

Chicken Enchiladas

Two chicken enchiladas topped with pico de gallo.. The homemade red sauce gives these enchiladas an authentic, robust flavor.

CourseCuisineTime - 4 hours 50 minutes 4 hours 50 minutes
Main Dishmeal prep, MexicanPrep - 20 minutes 20 minutes
Cook - 4 hours 30 minutes 4 hours 30 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
787kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates82g49%
Fat24g14%
Protein60g36%

Ingredients:

For the Enchiladas

  • 2 lbs (1135 g) boneless skinless chicken breast
  • 28 oz (794 g) can fire roasted tomatoes
  • 1.33 tbsp (20 ml) white vinegar
  • cup (40 g) red onion diced
  • 2 Tbsp (30 g) garlic minced
  • 1.33 Tbsp (20 ml) ancho chili powder
  • 2 tsp (10 g) sugar
  • 1 tsp (1 g) oregano
  • 1 tsp (3 g) salt
  • 2 tsp (10 ml) olive oil
  • 15 (600 g) flour tortillas
  • 5 Tbsp (37 g) queso fresco
  • 1 cup (112 g) Mexican shredded cheese

For the Pico de Gallo

  • 5 (300 g) Roma tomatoes
  • medium (100 g) red onion
  • cup (1 g) cilantro chopped
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) lime juice
  • 1 (20 g) jalapeo pepper
  • Salt and pepper to taste

Instructions:

For the Chicken

  1. Add the chicken and 1 cup of water to a crock pot and cook on high for 3 hours or until cooked.
  2. After the chicken has completed cooking, shred it using two forks or a hand mixer.

For the Enchiladas

  1. Dice a red onion until you have of a cup. Heat 2 tsp of olive oil in a skillet over medium high heat and cook the onion and 2 Tbsp minced garlic until the onion is soft. Be sure to stir frequently to ensure the garlic doesnt burn.
  2. Add the onion, garlic, 2 cans of tomatoes, 1 Tbsp vinegar, 2 tsp sugar, 1 Tbsp chili powder, 1 tsp oregano, and 1 tsp salt to a blender. Blend until smooth.
  3. Pour half of the mixture into the skillet over medium low heat and cook for 10-12 minutes.
  4. Once all the chicken is shredded, add it to the pan with the sauce and mix to incorporate.
  5. Divide the meat mixture into 15 equal parts and put one portion into each tortilla along with a sprinkling of shredded Mexican cheese.
  6. Roll the tortilla up and place it seam side down in a 13x9 pan. Sprinkle the remaining cheese over the top of the enchiladas as well as the last half of the red sauce.
  7. Bake the enchiladas for 10 minutes at 350F.

For the Pico de Gallo

  1. Cut the tomatoes in half the long way and scoop out the seeds. Dice the tomatoes and place in a large bowl.
  2. Dice of a red onion and add to the the tomatoes.
  3. Cut the stem off of the jalapeo pepper. Cut the pepper into small pieces and add to the mixture.
  4. NOTE: If you arent a fan of heat, then take out the ribs before chopping up the peppers.
  5. Cut the stems off of a small bunch of cilantro and finely chop the leaves until you have cup, add to the bowl.
  6. Cut a lime in half and squeeze its juice into the mixing bowl. Stir all of the ingredients together and add salt and pepper to taste.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. To each of your containers add 3 enchiladas and divide the Pico de Gallo evenly 5 ways. You may want to store this in a smaller separate container so you dont have to reheat it in the microwave.

Chicken Burrito Bowls

Adobo marinated chicken with peppers, cilantro lime rice, and pico de gallo. A dish full of flavor and one that reheats extremely well. A great post-workout meal.

CourseCuisineTime - 1 hour 1 hour 1 hour
Main Dishmeal prep, MexicanPrep - 1 hour 1 hour 1 hour
Cook - 35 minutes 35 minutes 35 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
705kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates59g42%
Fat29g20%
Protein51g36%

Ingredients:

For the Chicken

  • 2 lbs (1335 g) boneless skinless chicken thighs
  • (170 g) can chipotle peppers in adobo sauce
  • medium (100 g) red onion
  • Tbsp (7 ml) olive oil
  • 1 Tbsp (15 g) garlic minced
  • 1 tsp (3 g) salt
  • 1 tsp (2 g) pepper
  • 1 tsp (3 g) cumin

For the Rice

  • 5 cups (875 g) cooked rice
  • 2 Tbsp (2 g) cilantro chopped
  • 3 tbsp (45 ml) olive oil
  • 2 Tbsp (30 ml) lime juice

For the Pico de Gallo

  • 5 (300 g) Roma tomatoes
  • medium (100 g) red onion
  • cup (5 g) cilantro chopped
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) lime juice
  • 1 (20 g) jalapeo pepper
  • Salt and pepper to taste

For the Guacamole

  • 2 (250 g) avocados
  • cup pico de gallo
  • Lime juice
  • Salt and pepper to taste

For the Peppers

  • 2 medium (300 g) red peppers
  • 2 medium (300 g) green peppers
  • medium (100 g) red onion
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) olive oil

Instructions:

For the Chicken

  1. Dice the red onion
  2. In a large zip lock bag, add the chicken, chipotle peppers, red onion, olive oil, garlic, salt, pepper, and cumin. Shake it around to coat the chicken evenly. Try to remove all of the air from the bag and marinate for at least 30 minutes.
  3. Once marinated, preheat a large skillet over medium high heat. Add 1 Tbsp of olive oil to the pan and cook the chicken in batches to prevent overcrowding and proper cooking. The chicken is done when it has an internal temperature of 165F.
  4. Cut the chicken into 1 inch cubes.

For the Peppers

  1. While the chicken is cooking, cut the peppers and onions into strips. Cook them together in a skillet with 1 Tbsp olive oil until onions are translucent.

For the Rice

  1. Cook enough rice to have 2 cups of cooked rice. 1 cup of uncooked rice will yield around 3 cups of cooked rice.
  2. Drizzle 3 tbsp of olive oil over the rice and mix in the cilantro, lime juice, and add salt and pepper to taste.

For the Pico de Gallo

  1. Cut the tomatoes in half the long way and scoop out the seeds. Dice the tomatoes so they are about inch cubes and place in a large bowl.
  2. Dice of a red onion and add to the the tomatoes.
  3. Cut the stems off of the jalapeo pepper. Cut the pepper into a small dice and add to the mixture.
  4. NOTE: If you arent a fan of heat, then take out the ribs and seeds before chopping up the peppers.
  5. Cut the stems off of a small bunch of cilantro and finely chop the leaves until you have cup, add to the bowl.
  6. Cut a lime in half and squeeze its juice into the mixing bowl. Stir all of the ingredients together and add salt and pepper to taste.

For the Guacamole

  1. It is best to make the guacamole on an as needed basis as the avocado will oxidize quickly and turn brown. Luckily it can be made in the time it takes to heat up your meal.
  2. Cut 1 avocado in half and remove the pit. Score the inside of the avocado and extract with a spoon. In a bowl, mash the avocado with a fork until it is smooth.
  3. Add 3 Tbsp of the pico de gallo to the avocado and mix. Add salt, pepper and lime juice to taste.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. In each of your containers put cup of the cilantro lime rice. Divide the remaining ingredients evenly into each of your 5 containers. Store the pico and guacamole in a separate, smaller container.

Taco Breakfast Bowls with Salsa Roja

A flavorful breakfast option with hash browns, scrambled eggs, and taco meat. Serve this dish with a side of salsa roja. This meal will become a staple for your breakfasts!

CourseCuisineTime - 40 minutes 40 minutes 40 minutes
Breakfastmeal prep, MexicanPrep - 10 minutes 10 minutes 10 minutes
Cook - 30 minutes 30 minutes 30 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
735kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates32g25%
Fat46g36%
Protein48g38%

Ingredients:

For the Taco Meat

  • 2 lb (908 g) ground beef (85/15)
  • 1 cup (240 ml) tomato sauce
  • 2 tsp (4 g) paprika
  • 2 tsp (4 g) chili powder
  • 2 tsp (4 g) cumin
  • 2 tsp (4 g) garlic powder
  • Salt and pepper to taste

For the Eggs

  • 8 (8 ) eggs
  • cup (60 ml) skim milk
  • Cooking spray
  • Salt and pepper to taste

For the Hash browns

  • 6 cups (454 g) hash browns
  • 4 Tbsp (60 ml) olive oil
  • 4 (240 g) Roma tomatoes

For the Salsa Roja

  • 4 (240 g) Roma tomatoes
  • 1 small (100 g) white onion
  • 1 (20 g) jalapeo pepper
  • 1 (10 g) serrano pepper
  • 3 cloves (15 g) garlic
  • bunch (15 g) cilantro
  • Salt and lime juice to taste

Instructions:

For the Taco Meat

  1. Heat a large skillet over medium high heat and brown the ground beef.
  2. Once cooked, drain the fat and add in cup of tomato sauce, 1 tsp paprika, 1 tsp chili powder, 1 tsp cumin, 1 tsp garlic powder, and salt and pepper to taste. Stir to combine and cook for an additional 5 minutes then remove from heat.

For the Salsa Roja

  1. Start a medium pot of water over high heat to boil.
  2. Wash your tomatoes, peppers, and cilantro. Cut the stems off of the tomatoes and peppers.
  3. Add the small white onion (halved), the peppers, tomatoes, and 3 cloves of garlic to the boiling water. Cook for 6-8 minutes. The tomatoes have finished cooking when they begin to change color and the skin starts to break.
  4. Drain the water from the pot. You may want to remove the skins from the tomatoes to avoid any stringy bits. Add the tomatoes, garlic, jalapeos, bunch of cilantro, juice of of a lime and 1 Tbsp apple cider vinegar to a blender. Blend until smooth.
  5. Add salt to taste. Adjust flavor with salt and lime juice as needed.

For the Hash Browns

  1. Heat a large skillet over medium high heat and add in 2 Tbsp of olive oil. Once the oil has heated, add in 6 cups of hash browns. Cook for 5 minutes and flip. Add in more oil as needed.
  2. Cook for an additional 5-7 minutes. If you like your hash browns crispy, you will want to cook them a bit longer.
  3. Dice 2 tomatoes and mix them into the hash browns.

For the Scrambled Eggs

  1. Crack 8 eggs into a large bowl.
  2. Add in cup milk and beat. The secret to perfect scrambled eggs is to beat them until frothy and no egg whites remain unincorporated.
  3. Heat a skillet over medium heat, spray with cooking spray, and cook your eggs until finished. Make sure not to over cook them as you will be reheating them in the microwave.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide your ingredients evenly 5 ways into each of your containers. Store your salsa in a separate, smaller container as you dont want to heat this in the microwave.

Chicken Taquitos

A healthier version of one of my childhood favorite snacks. These taquitos are corn tortillas filled with minced chicken. These are great to make a large batch and freeze them for a future snack.

CourseCuisineTime - null
SnackMexicanPrep - 10 minutes
Cook - 35 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
119kcal15
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates11.8g51%
Fat4.1g17%
Protein8.7g37%

Ingredients:

  • 1 lb (454 g) boneless skinless chicken breast
  • 1 cup (240 ml) chicken broth
  • cup (180 ml) tomato sauce
  • 1 tsp (2 g) paprika
  • 1 tsp (2 g) chili powder
  • 1 tsp (2 g) cumin
  • 1 tsp (2 g) garlic powder
  • 1 cup (112 g) shredded cheese
  • Salt and pepper to taste
  • 15 (345 g) corn tortillas
  • Cooking spray

Instructions:

  1. In a crockpot add 1 cup of chicken broth and 1 lb of chicken breast and turn it to high heat.
  2. Cook for 2 hours or until it is easily shreddable and completely cooked.
  3. Preheat your oven to 400F.
  4. Shred the chicken using two forks. Place the shredded chicken into a blender with cup tomato sauce, 1 tsp paprika, 1 tsp chili powder, 1 tsp cumin, 1 tsp garlic powder, and salt and pepper to taste and blend until the meat is a paste like consistency.
  5. Heat your tortillas in the microwave for 20-30 seconds so they are pliable for folding. The fresher the tortillas the better. If you have dry tortillas they will be more likely to crack in the oven.
  6. Add a few spoonfuls of meat to each of your tortillas, sprinkle with cheese and roll. Aim for taquitos with a diameter of about of an inch. Place on a sheet pan seam side down.
  7. You should have enough meat to make around 15-20 taquitos.
  8. Spray the top of the taquitos with cooking spray and bake for 10-12 minutes.

Storage

  1. Keep in the refrigerator for up to 5 days. They will also keep well in the freezer. Put them into a ziplock bag, remove as much air as possible, and label with the date.

Steak Burrito Bowls

Adobo marinated steak with peppers, cilantro lime rice, and pico de gallo. You wont get tired of eating this one. The pico and guac add a great fresh aspect to this dish.

CourseCuisineTime - 1 hour 1 hour 1 hour
Main Dishmeal prep, MexicanPrep - 45 minutes 45 minutes 45 minutes
Cook - 30 minutes 30 minutes 30 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
837kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates55g35%
Fat44g28%
Protein55g35%

Ingredients:

For the Steak

  • 2 lbs (1135 g) steak any cut should work, sirloin or top round are probably best
  • 3 oz (100 g) chipotle peppers in adobo sauce
  • medium (100 g) red onion
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) olive oil
  • 1 Tbsp (15 g) garlic minced
  • 1 tsp (3 g) salt
  • 1 tsp (2 g) pepper
  • 1 tsp (2 g) cumin

For the Rice

  • 5 cups (675 g) cooked rice
  • 4 Tbsp (4 g) cilantro chopped
  • 2 tsp (10 ml) olive oil
  • 2 Tbsp (30 ml) lime juice

For the Pico de Gallo

  • 5 (300 g) Roma tomatoes
  • medium (100 g) red onion
  • cup (4 g) cilantro chopped
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) lime juice
  • 1 (20 g) jalapeo pepper
  • Salt and pepper to taste

For the Guacamole

  • 2 (250 g) avocados
  • cup pico de gallo
  • Lime juice salt, and pepper to taste

For the Peppers

  • 2 medium (300 g) red peppers
  • 2 medium (300 g) green peppers
  • medium (100 g) red onion
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) olive oil

Instructions:

For the Steak

  1. Dice the red onion
  2. In a large zip lock bag, add the steak, can of chipotle peppers, of a red onion, 1 Tbsp olive oil, 1 Tbsp garlic, 1 tsp salt, 1 tsp pepper, and 1 tsp cumin. Shake it around to coat the steak evenly. Try to remove all of the air from the bag and marinate for at least 30 minutes.
  3. Once marinated, preheat a large grill pan or skillet over medium high heat. Add 1 Tbsp of olive oil to the pan and cook the steak in batches to prevent overcrowding and proper cooking. Cook the steak to medium rare, around 3 minutes each side. Remember that you will be reheating it again in the microwave which is additional cooking time.
  4. Cut the steak into 1 inch cubes.

For the Peppers

  1. While the steak is cooking, cut the peppers and onions into strips. Cook them together in a skillet with 1 Tbsp olive oil until onions are translucent.

For the Rice

  1. Cook enough rice to have 5 cups of cooked rice. 1 cup of uncooked rice will yield around 3 cups of cooked rice.
  2. Drizzle the olive oil over the rice and mix in the cilantro, lime juice, and add salt and pepper to taste.

For the Pico de Gallo

  1. Cut the tomatoes in half the long way and scoop out the seeds. Dice the tomatoes so they are about inch cubes and place in a large bowl.
  2. Dice of a red onion and add to the the tomatoes.
  3. Cut the stems off of the jalapeo pepper. Cut the pepper into a small dice and add to the mixture.
  4. NOTE: If you arent a fan of heat, then take out the seeds before chopping up the peppers.
  5. Cut the stems off of a small bunch of cilantro and finely chop the leaves until you have cup, add to the bowl.
  6. Cut a lime in half and squeeze its juice into the mixing bowl. Stir all of the ingredients together and add salt and pepper to taste

For the Guacamole

  1. It is best to make the guacamole on an as needed basis as the avocado will oxidize quickly and turn brown. Luckily it can be made in the time it takes to heat up your meal.
  2. Cut 1 avocado in half and remove the pit. Score the inside of the avocado and extract with a spoon. In a bowl, mash the avocado with a fork until it is smooth.
  3. Add 3 Tbsp of the pico de gallo to the avocado and mix. Add salt, pepper and lime juice to taste.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. In each of your containers put 1 cup of the cilantro lime rice. Divide the remaining ingredients evenly into each of your 5 containers.

Pork Carnitas with Salsa Verde & Calabacitas

Carnitas translates to little meats. The pork is cooked slowly in orange and lime juice and then broiled to create crispy, flavorful bites. The pork is a perfect pairing with homemade salsa verde.

CourseCuisineTime - 3 hours 3 hours 3 hours
Main Dishmeal prep, MexicanPrep - 10 minutes 10 minutes 10 minutes
Cook - 3 hours 3 hours 3 hours

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
774kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates59g39%
Fat35g23%
Protein55g36%

Ingredients:

For the Pork

  • 3 lb (1362 g) pork butt roast
  • 1 medium (200 g) yellow onion
  • 2 Tbsp (30 ml) lime juice
  • cup (60 ml) orange juice
  • 1 tsp (2 g) cumin
  • 1 tsp (1 g) oregano
  • 2 tsp (6 g) salt
  • 1 tsp (2 g) pepper
  • 2 cups (480 ml) water

For the Calabacitas

  • 1 medium (250 g) zucchini
  • 1 small (100 g) green pepper
  • 1 small (100 g) yellow pepper
  • 1 small (100 g) red pepper
  • medium (100 g) sweet onion
  • 8 oz (227 g) mushrooms
  • 3 (180 g) Roma tomatoes seeded
  • 1 tbsp (15 ml) olive oil

For the Salsa Verde

  • 4 (240 g) tomatillos
  • 2 (40 g) jalapeos
  • 4 cloves (20 g) garlic
  • small (75 g) white onion
  • bunch (15 g) cilantro
  • 3-4 Tbsp (45 ml) lime juice
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) apple cider vinegar
  • Salt to taste

For the Rice

  • 5 cups (675 g) cooked rice

Instructions:

For the roast

  1. Trim your roast of large pieces of fat and cut into 2 inch chunks.
  2. Turn on your oven to 300F.
  3. Heat a large, oven safe pot (cast iron or dutch oveon the stove over medium high heat.
  4. Add in the pork, the yellow onion (cut in half), 1 lime (juic eand its rind, 1 orange (juice and its rind, 1 tsp cumin, 1 tsp oregano, 2 tsp salt, 1 tsp pepper, and 2 cups of water. Bring the mixture to a light boil.
  5. Once boiling, cover the pot and place in the oven for 2 hours. If your pot doesnt have a lid, use foil to create a seal.
  6. The meat is done when it is easily broken apart with a fork.
  7. Line a sheet pan with foil and transfer the chunks of meat from your pot to the sheet pan. Break each chunk into 3 or 4 smaller pieces but do not shred the meat.
  8. Remove all of the solid ingredients from the liquid remaining in your pot. They can be thrown away.
  9. Over high heat, reduce the liquid in the pot to create a syrup like sauce. This should take between 15 and 20 minutes. Stir the sauce frequently.
  10. Once the sauce has thickened, add your meat back to the pot and gently cover the meat with the sauce. Be careful not to break up the meat any more than you already have.
  11. Turn your oven to broil. Place the meat back onto the sheet pan and spread out. Broil the pork for 2-3 minutes or until it begins to crisp. Remove from the oven and flip the meat. Broil the other side for an additional 2-3 minutes. Be sure to watch the meat carefully as it can burn quickly.

For the Salsa Verde

  1. Remove the husks from your tomatillos and wash all of your vegetables. Cut the stems off of the jalapeos, peel your garlic, and halve your onion.
  2. Fill a medium pot with water and bring to a boil. Add in the tomatillos, garlic, onion, and jalapeos.
  3. Boil for about 10 minutes or until the tomatillos turn army green.
  4. While the vegetables are boiling, wash the cilantro and cut off the bottom of the stems. Add to your blender.
  5. Cut your limes in half and juice the halves into the blender along with 1 Tbsp of apple cider vinegar and salt.
  6. Add the boiled vegetables into the blender. Blend until the ingredients until there are no large chunks remaining. Add salt to taste.

For the Calabacitas

  1. Wash all of your vegetables and cut them into a large dice, each around the same size. Seed your tomatoes.
  2. Heat a large skillet over medium high heat and add 1 Tbsp of olive oil. Cook the vegetables in batches. Start with the onions and peppers. Once they peppers are soft, remove from the pan and cook the remaining vegetables.
  3. When the mushrooms, zucchini, and tomatoes have cooked, add the onions and peppers back to the pan and season with salt and pepper to taste.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide your meat and vegetables 5 ways and add to each of your containers. Add 1 cup of rice to each Store the salsa verde in a separate, smaller container as you dont want to heat it in the microwave.

For the Chicken

  1. Trim your chicken of large pieces of fat and cut into 2-3 inch chunks.
  2. Turn on your oven to 300F.
  3. Heat a large, oven safe pot (cast iron or dutch oven) on the stove over medium high heat.
  4. Add in the chicken, the yellow onion (cut in half), 1 lime (juic eand its rind, 1 orange (juice and its rind, 1 tsp cumin, 1 tsp oregano, 2 tsp salt, 1 tsp pepper, and 2 cups of water. Bring the mixture to a light boil.
  5. Once boiling, cover the pot and place in the oven for 2 hours. If your pot doesnt have a lid, use foil to create a seal.
  6. The meat is done when it is easily broken apart with a fork.
  7. Line a sheet pan with foil and transfer the chunks of meat from your pot to the sheet pan. Break each chunk into 3 or 4 smaller pieces but do not shred the meat.
  8. Remove all of the solid ingredients from the liquid remaining in your pot. They can be thrown away.
  9. Over high heat, reduce the liquid in the pot to create a syrup like sauce. This should take between 15 and 20 minutes. Stir the sauce frequently.
  10. Once the sauce has thickened, add your meat back to the pot and gently cover the meat with the sauce. Be careful not to break up the meat any more than you already have.
  11. Turn your oven to broil. Place the meat back onto the sheet pan and spread out. Broil the pork for 2-3 minutes or until it begins to crisp. Remove from the oven and flip the meat. Broil the other side for an additional 2-3 minutes. Be sure to watch the meat carefully as it can burn quickly.

For the Rice

  1. Cook enough rice to have 5 cups of cooked rice. 1 cup of dry rice wil yield about 3 cups.

Enchilada Chicken with Calabacitas

Grilled chicken thighs coated with a homemade enchilada sauce and served with a side of cilantro lime rice, pico de gallo, and calabacitas.

CourseCuisineTime - null
Main Dishmeal prep, MexicanPrep - 10 minutes 10 minutes 10 minutes
Cook - 35 minutes 35 minutes 35 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
665kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates67g47%
Fat19g13%
Protein56g39%

Ingredients:

For the Chicken and Sauce

  • 2 lbs (1135 g) boneless skinless chicken thighs
  • 14.5 oz (411 g) can fire roasted tomatoes
  • 2 Tbsp (20 g) red onion diced
  • 1 Tbsp (15 g) garlic
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) white vinegar
  • 1 Tbsp (8 g) chili powder
  • 1 tsp (1 g) oregano
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) olive oil

For the Vegetables

  • 2 medium (500 g) zucchini
  • 8 oz (227 g) mushrooms
  • 1 large (200 g) red pepper
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) olive oil

For the Cilantro Lime Rice

  • 5 cups (675 g) cooked rice
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) lime juice
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) olive oil
  • cup (10 g) cilantro chopped
  • Salt to taste
  • 2 cups (438 g) black beans

For the Pico de Gallo

  • 4 (240 g) Roma tomatoes
  • medium (100 g) red onion
  • cup (10 g) cilantro chopped
  • 1-2 Tbsp (15 ml) lime juice
  • 1 (20 g) jalapeo pepper
