  • Salt and pepper to taste

Instructions:

For the Rice

  1. Cook enough rice to have 2 cups of cooked rice. 1 cup of uncooked rice will yield around 3 cups of cooked rice.
  2. Drizzle 1 Tbsp of olive oil over the rice and mix in cup of cilantro, juice of lime, and add salt to taste. Mix thoroughly.

For the Enchilada Sauce

  1. Add 1 Tbsp garlic, 2 Tbsp of diced red onion, 1 can of fire roasted tomatoes, 1 Tbsp vinegar, 1 Tbsp chili powder, 1 tsp oregano, and 1 tsp salt to a blender. Blend until smooth.

For the Chicken

  1. Poke holes in the chicken to allow the marinade to enter the meat.
  2. Put the chicken in a ziplock bag and add of the enchilada sauce to the bag. Toss the chicken around in the bag to evenly distribute the sauce.
  3. Remove all of the air from the bag and allow to marinate for at least a few minutes.
  4. Add the remainder of the sauce to a pan and bring to a light boil for 15 minutes.
  5. Heat a grill pan or a skillet over medium high heat and cook the chicken in batches if necessary to prevent overcrowding. It has finished cooking when the inside is no longer pink and reaches an internal temperature of at least 165F.
  6. Remove the chicken from the pan and allow it to rest for at least a couple of minutes. Once it has rested, add it back to the skillet with the simmering enchilada sauce and toss to coat.

For the Vegetables

  1. Wash and cut your vegetables into a large dice.
  2. Heat a large skillet over medium high heat and add 1 Tbsp of olive oil. Saut the vegetables until the zucchini has softened.
  3. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

For the Pico de Gallo

  1. Cut the tomatoes in half the long way and scoop out the seeds. Dice the tomatoes so they are about inch cubes and place in a large bowl.
  2. Diceof a red onion and add to the the tomatoes.
  3. Cut the stems off of the jalapeo pepper. Cut the pepper into a small dice and add to the mixture. NOTE: If you arent a fan of heat, then take out the ribs and seeds before chopping up the peppers.
  4. Cut the stems off of a small bunch of cilantro and finely chop the leaves until you have cup, add to the bowl.
  5. Cut a lime in half and squeeze its juice into the mixing bowl. Stir all of the ingredients together and add salt and pepper to taste.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Add 1 cup of the cilantro lime rice to each container, cup of beans and divide the remainder of the ingredients evenly. Store the pico de gallo in a separate, smaller container.

For the Rice and Beans

  1. Cook enough rice to have 5 cups of cooked rice. 1 cup of uncooked rice will yield around 3 cups of cooked rice.
  2. Drizzle 1 Tbsp of olive oil over the rice and mix in cup of cilantro, juice of lime, and add salt to taste. Mix thoroughly.
  3. Drain and rinse 2 cups worth of beans.

Taco Bowls with Cauliflower Rice

Ground beef, shredded Brussels sprouts, and cauliflower rice served with a side of salsa roja. A flavorful dish that can be customized to add your favorite toppings.

CourseCuisineTime - 35 minutes 35 minutes 35 minutes
Main Dishmeal prep, MexicanPrep - 10 minutes 10 minutes 10 minutes
Cook - 25 minutes 25 minutes 25 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
718kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates55g41%
Fat36g26%
Protein43g32%

Ingredients:

For the Meat

  • 2 lbs (908 g) ground beef (85/15)
  • cup (120 ml) tomato sauce
  • 1 tsp (3 g) paprika
  • 1 tsp (3 g) garlic powder
  • 1 tsp (3 g) chili powder
  • 1 tsp (3 g) cumin
  • Salt and pepper to taste

For the Brussels Sprouts

  • 9 oz (255 g) shredded Brussels sprouts You can buy these pre shredded
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) olive oil
  • 1 tsp (3 g) garlic powder
  • Salt and pepper to taste

For the Cauliflower Rice

  • 20 oz (567 g) frozen cauliflower rice
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) olive oil
  • 1 Tbsp (8 g) chili powder
  • 1 tsp (3 g) paprika
  • 1 (60 g) Roma tomato diced

For the Salsa Roja

  • 4 (240 g) Roma tomatoes
  • 1 small (100 g) white onion
  • 2 (60 g) jalapeos
  • 4 cloves (20 g) garlic
  • bunch (10 g) cilantro
  • 2 Tbsp (30 ml) lime juice
  • Salt to taste

For the Rice

  • 5 cups (675 g) rice cooked
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) olive oil
  • 1 Tbsp (8 g) chili powder
  • 1 tsp (3 g) paprika
  • 1 (60 g) Roma tomato diced

Instructions:

For the Taco Meat

  1. Heat a large skillet over medium high heat and brown the ground beef.
  2. Once cooked, drain the fat and add in cup of tomato sauce, 1 tsp paprika, 1 tsp chili powder, 1 tsp cumin, 1 tsp garlic powder, and salt and pepper to taste. Stir to combine and cook for an additional 5 minutes then remove from heat.

For the Salsa Roja

  1. Start a medium pot of water over high heat to boil.
  2. Wash your tomatoes, jalapeos, and cilantro. Cut the stems off of the tomatoes and jalapeos and cut the onion in half
  3. Add the small white onion, the peppers, tomatoes, and 4 cloves of garlic to the boiling water. Cook for 6-8 minutes. The tomatoes have finished cooking when they begin to change color and the skin starts to break.
  4. Drain the water from the pot. You may want to remove the skins from the tomatoes to avoid any stringy bits. Add the tomatoes, onions, garlic, jalapeos, bunch of cilantro, and the juice of 1 lime to a blender. Blend until smooth.
  5. Add salt to taste. Adjust flavor with salt and lime juice as needed.
  6. Portion out into smaller, separate cups once it has cooled.

For the Cauliflower Rice

  1. Microwave the cauliflower rice until it is no longer frozen.
  2. Dice 1 Roma tomato and remove the seeds.
  3. Heat a large skillet over medium heat and add 1 Tbsp of olive oil.
  4. Add the riced cauliflower, 1 Tbsp chili powder, and 1 tsp paprika.
  5. Cook for 3-4 minutes and remove from heat. Stir in the diced tomato. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

For the Brussels Sprouts

  1. Heat 1 Tbsp of olive oil over medium high heat. Add in the shaved Brussels sprouts and cook for 2-3 minutes. They will cook fast. Season with 1 tsp garlic powder and salt and pepper to taste.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Add 1 of your salsa cups to each container and divide the remaining ingredients evenly.

For the Rice

  1. Make enough rice to yield 5 cups, cooked. 1 cup of dry rice will make about 3 cups of cooked rice.
  2. Dice 1 Roma tomato and remove the seeds.
  3. Heat a large skillet over medium heat and add 1 Tbsp of olive oil.
  4. Add the rice, 1 Tbsp chili powder, and 1 tsp paprika.
  5. Cook for 3-4 minutes and remove from heat. Stir in the diced tomato. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

Salsa Chicken Quinoa Bowls

These Chicken Quinoa Bowls are incredibly versatile. Pictured here is a Salsa Chicken Bowl. You could also make a Buffalo Chicken Bowl or BBQ Chicken.

CourseCuisineTime - 30 minutes 30 minutes 30 minutes
Main Dishmeal prep, MexicanPrep - 10 minutes 10 minutes 10 minutes
Cook - 20 minutes 20 minutes 20 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
713kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates61g41%
Fat25g17%
Protein61g41%

Ingredients:

  • 2 lbs (1135 g) boneless skinless chicken breast
  • 1 large (300 g) zucchini
  • 15 oz (425 g) black beans
  • 1 large (200 g) green pepper
  • 16 oz (454 g) salsa
  • 5 cups (875 g) cooked quinoa
  • 5 Tbsp (82 ml) olive oil
  • Salt and pepper

Instructions:

For the Quinoa

  1. Cook enough quinoa to have 5 cups of cooked quinoa. 1 cup of uncooked quinoa will yield around 3 cups of cooked quinoa. Rinse the quinoa prior to cooking until the water runs clear. Cook using the same method you would use for rice. Mix in 3 Tbsp olive oil for extra calories.

For the Chicken

  1. Butterfly (or pound with a meat tenderizeyour chicken so that it is not so thick and it will cook faster. Cut all the way through so you have 2 pieces. If it is still fairly thick, you may want to pound it until it is inch thin or less. (Butterfly means to cut down the middle so you can open it like a book).
  2. Lightly season the chicken with salt and pepper.
  3. Add 1-2 Tbsp of of olive oil to a grill pan or skillet over medium high heat and cook the chicken in batches if necessary to prevent overcrowding. It has finished cooking when the inside is no longer pink and reaches an internal temperature of at least 165F.
  4. Let it rest for a few minutes after cooking and cut into a medium dice.
  5. Add to a bowl and mix with half the salsa to coat evenly.

For the Vegetables

  1. Wash and cut your pepper and zucchini into a small dice. Sauts until soft.
  2. Drain and rinse the black beans
  3. Plating
  4. This recipe makes 5 servings. Add 1 cup of quinoa and divide the remaining ingredients equally to each container.

Italian

  • Pasta e Fagioli
  • Lazy Lasagna
  • Baked Penne
  • Lemon Garlic Pasta
  • Gluten Free Bruschetta
  • Cheese Pizza Bites
  • Supreme Pizza Bites
  • Pepperoni Pizza Bites
  • Sausage Pizza Bites
  • Butternut Squash Lasagna
  • Meatballs in Bolognese
  • Chicken Parmesan

Pasta e Fagioli

Pasta e Fagioli (fagioli is Italian for beans) made using macaroni, white and red kidney beans, vegetables, and ground beef. This meal is freezer friendly, easy to make a huge batch, and it's a one pot meal.

CourseCuisineTime - 50 minutes
Main DishItalian, meal prepPrep - 10 minutes
Cook - 40 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
642kcal7 servings
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates72g53%
Fat21g15%
Protein42g31%

Ingredients:

For the Pasta

  • 2 lbs (908 g) ground beef (85/15)
  • 15 oz (425 g) canned white kidney beans
  • 15 oz (425 g) canned red kidney beans
  • 29 oz (822 g) canned tomato sauce
  • 14.5 oz (411 g) canned petite diced tomatoes
  • 32 oz (908 g) chicken broth
  • 2 cups (480 g) water
  • 12 oz (340 g) macaroni noodles gluten free if needed
  • 1 medium (200 g) onion
  • 3 cloves (15 g) garlic
  • 3 stalks (150 g) celery
  • 3 medium (200 g) carrots
  • 6 oz (170 g) spinach
  • 1 tbsp (8 g) crushed red pepper flakes
  • 2 tsp (4 g) oregano

Instructions:

For the Pasta

  1. In a large stock pot over medium high heat, brown your ground beef. You want to make sure you get good color on this meat as it will develop a ton of flavor for this dish.
  2. While the beef is cooking wash and cut all of your vegetables. Cut the onion, celery, carrots, and garlic into a small dice and roughly chop the spinach into smaller pieces.
  3. Once the beef has finished browning, remove it from the pot and set aside but leave all of the grease that was rendered off in the pan. If you have more than 2 or 3 tablespoons of grease, you can remove anything in excess of this if you wish.
  4. You should now have 2-3 tablespoons of the beef fat heating in the stock pot over medium high heat, add in the crushed red pepper to bloom the spices for a few seconds and then add in the carrots, onion, celery, and garlic. Season lightly with salt, add the oregano, and cook until the onions have become translucent and are beginning to take on color.
  5. After the vegetables have cooked for 5-10 minutes, add the beef back to the pot. Add the petite diced tomatoes, tomato sauce, both cans of beans, the chicken broth, water, and macaroni noodles. Stir to combine and bring to a light boil.
  6. Once boiling, cover the pot, reduce the heat to medium low and allow the noodles to soften. It should only take a few minutes.
  7. After the noodles have cooked, add in your chopped spinach, allow it to wilt into the mixture and season with salt and pepper to taste.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 7 servings. Divide the total amount evenly into your 7 containers.

Lazy Lasagna

Lazy Lasagna, instead of having to construct all of the layers and bake everything in the oven you'll cut out a few steps and make a pasta dish that tastes like lasagna but in half of the time.

CourseCuisineTime - 45 minutes 45 minutes 45 minutes
Main DishItalian, meal prepPrep - 10 minutes 10 minutes 10 minutes
Cook - 35 minutes 35 minutes 35 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
832kcal7 servings
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates72g42%
Fat31g18%
Protein66g39%

Ingredients:

For the Lasagna

  • 12 oz (340 g) fusili pasta any pasta should work, gluten free if necessary
  • 1 lb (454 g) italian sausage
  • 1.5 lb (651 g) ground turkey (93/7)
  • 6 oz (170 g) spinach
  • 12 oz (340 g) broccoli slaw
  • 6 oz (170 g) tomato paste
  • 14.5 oz (411 g) petite diced tomatoes
  • 2 tsp (4 g) dried basil
  • 2 tsp (4 g) dried oregano
  • 1 cup (112 g) shredded mozzarella cheese
  • 6 tbsp (90 g) parmesan cheese
  • 2 cups (454 g) cottage cheese
  • salt and pepper to taste

Instructions:

For the Fusili

  1. Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil and cook the noodles according to their packaging. Reserve aside until ready once they are finished.

For the Lasagna

  1. In a large skillet over medium high heat, add the sausage first to brown. Remove the casing first if you buy the kind in link form. The sausage should have lots of fat in it so we are cooking it first to help some of that fat render out to cook the other ingredients.
  2. Once the sausage is about half way finished, add in the ground turkey. Season lightly with salt and pepper. Cook until about 90% of the way finished.
  3. While the meat is browning, cut up the broccoli slaw and spinach. Cutting the broccoli slaw into a small dice will help it to almost dissolve into the sauce. Roughly chop the spinach.
  4. Once the turkey is about 90% of the way cooked, make room in the center of the pan and allow any of the fat to collect in the center. Add in the chopped broccoli slaw and season lightly with salt. Allow it to saut in the fat and soften. Adding a bit of water can help it to cook faster by steaming the broccoli.
  5. After the broccoli slaw has cooked for a couple of minutes, add in the tomato paste, petite diced tomatoes, oregano, basil, and chopped spinach. Let the spinach wilt and the tomatoes to cook down by bringing the mixture to light boil.
  6. If your noodles have not been drained yet, drain the water and put them back into the pot. Add in the cottage cheese and parmesan cheese.
  7. Once the tomato sauce has cooked for a few minutes, season with salt and pepper to taste and add to the pot with your noodles. Mix everything until incorporated. Taste test and adjust seasonings as necessary.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide your ingredients evenly into your 5 containers.
  2. Measure out the mozzarella cheese and divide it evenly over the top of each dish. You can also garnish with parsley if you wish.

Baked Penne

Baked penne pasta mixed with a ground beef tomato sauce, topped with ricotta, mozzarella, and parmesan cheeses.

CourseCuisineTime - 1 hour 10 minutes
Main DishItalian, meal prepPrep - 20 minutes
Cook - 50 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
566kcal8
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates48g41%
Fat21g17%
Protein48g41%

Ingredients:

  • 12 oz (340 g) penne pasta noodles uncooked, gluten free if needed
  • 2 lbs (1135 g) ground beef 90/10
  • 43.5 oz (1233 g) petite diced tomates 3 cans
  • 14.5 oz (411 g) crushed tomatoes 1 can
  • 1 medium (200 g) onion
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) minced garlic
  • 1 tbsp (2 g) oregano dried
  • 1 tbsp (2 g) basil dried
  • 15 oz (425 g) low fat ricotta cheese
  • 1 cup (112 g) mozzarella cheese shredded
  • cup (50 g) parmesan cheese shredded
  • 10 oz (283 g) spinach 1 bag
  • salt and pepper to taste

Instructions:

For the Beef and Tomato Sauce

  1. In a large pot over medium high heat, add the ground beef and brown.
  2. While the beef is cooking, dice the onion and add to the pot with the beef. Add the minced garlic as well. Season lightly with salt and pepper.
  3. Once the meat has browned, add in the cans of petite diced and crushed tomatoes. Stir in the oregano and basil. Allow the mixture to boil for 10-20 minutes to cook out the tomato flavor.
  4. Chop up the spinach and add to the pot. Stir to incorporate and wilt the leaves.

For the Casserole

  1. Preheat your oven to 400F.
  2. While the beef and sauce is cooking, bring a large pot of water to a boil and cook the noodles according to the packaging. Drain the water.
  3. Once the noodles and sauce have finished cooking, combine the two together and season with salt and pepper to taste.
  4. In a large casserole or baking dish, add about half of the noodle mixture in a single layer. Spread out the ricotta cheese over the top of this layer and pour the remaining noodle mixture over the top.
  5. Top the entire dish with the parmesan and mozzarella cheese.
  6. Place the dish on a sheet pan to protect from any leakage and place into the oven. Bake for 30 minutes. Watch it closely as you don't want to burn the cheese. If it gets too brown you can cover it with a piece of aluminum foil.
  7. Allow the casserole to rest and cool before cutting into it.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 8 servings. Divide the tray into 8 equal sized pieces and add to each of your dishes.

Lemon Garlic Pasta

Brown rice fusilli and ground turkey mixed in a lemon, garlic and butter sauce. A flavorful dish that includes frozen peas and chopped kale to provide some nutrients that heats up wonderfully in the microwave.

CourseCuisineTime - 40 minutes 40 minutes 40 minutes
Main DishItalian, meal prepPrep - 10 minutes 10 minutes 10 minutes
Cook - 30 minutes 30 minutes 30 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
794kcal6
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates76g49%
Fat35g22%
Protein43g27%

Ingredients:

  • 2 lb (908 g) ground beef 85/15
  • 1 lb (454 g) brown rice fusilli pasta any kind of pasta works
  • 1 lb (454 g) frozen peas
  • cup (60 ml) lemon juice
  • medium (100 g) onion
  • 1 tbsp (14 g) butter
  • 6 cloves (30 g) garlic
  • 14.5 oz (411 g) petite diced tomatos 1 can
  • 1 bunch (50 g) lacinato kale regular kale or spinach is fine
  • cup (80 g) parmesan cheese shredded
  • 2 tbsp (30 ml) olive oil
  • cup (120 ml) pasta water

Instructions:

For the Pasta

  1. Cook the noodles per the instructions on the package and reserve at least cup of the pasta water for the sauce.
  2. In a large skillet, heat some olive oil over medium high heat and brown the turkey.
  3. While the turkey is cooking, cut the onion and garlic into a small dice and squeeze the juice out of the lemons.
  4. In a large pot, saute the onions in a bit of olive oil over medium heat until they are soft. Add in the butter and garlic and cook until fragrant.
  5. Stir in 2 tbsp of lemon juice and, peas, and canned tomatoes. Allow the flavors to cook and come together for a couple of minutes.
  6. Add in the noodles, turkey, kale, parmesan cheese, and cup of pasta water. Stir and season with salt, pepper, and the remaining lemon juice to taste.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 6 servings. Divide your ingredients evenly 6 ways.

Gluten Free Bruschetta

A gluten free version of the classic bread based appetizer. Instead of a baguette, this recipe uses a bread made from oat flour as a vehicle for the tomato and balsamic mixture.

CourseCuisineTime - 40 minutes
Appetizer, SnackItalianPrep - 15 minutes
Cook - 25 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
77kcal8 slices
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates11.3g70%
Fat1.3g8%
Protein4.5g28%

Ingredients:

  • 7/8 cup (80 g) oat flour
  • 1 tsp (4 g) salt
  • 1 tsp (4 g) garlic powder
  • 1/2 tsp (2 g) onion powder
  • 1/2 tsp (2 g) baking soda
  • 1/2 cup (120 g) plain non fat Greek yogurt
  • 1 large (50 g) egg white
  • 2 (120 g) Roma tomatoes
  • 1 tbsp (15 ml) balsamic glaze
  • Basil
  • 2 (56 g) mozzarella string cheese sticks

Instructions:

  1. Preheat oven to 375F.
  2. Mix the dry ingredients together for the bread. Then add in yogurt and egg white. Stir to incorporate.
  3. Put the dough mixture onto an oiled baking sheet or on top of a silpat and form it into a baguette shape. Do your best to recreate the shape.
  4. Bake for 15-17 minutes.
  5. Allow to cool and cut into slices. If you were able to shape it correctly you may be able to cut into cross sections. Your loaf may be a little bit flat if you were unable to shape the raw dough correctly. If this is the case, cut the loaf logitudinally and then into slices.
  6. Turn the oven to 450F and bake the slices for 7-9 minutes or until crisp flipping halfway through. Watch them carefully to ensure they don't burn.
  7. Cut the tomatoes into a small dice removing any seeds and chop the basil and string cheese. Mix together.
  8. Top each piece of bread with tomato mixture and drizzle balsamic glaze.
  9. This will make 8 slices. Nutrition information is for 1 of 8 slices.

Cheese Pizza Bites

Gluten free Cheese Pizza Bites that are freezer friendly for you to have available to you whenever you need a quick snack.

CourseCuisineTime - 35 minutes
SnackItalian, meal prepPrep - 25 minutes
Cook - 9 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
29kcal24 bites
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates3.7g92%
Fat0.8g20%
Protein1.9g47%

Ingredients:

  • cup (90 g) oat flour
  • 3 tbsp (45 g) liquid egg whites
  • cup (165 g) plain non fat Greek yogurt
  • 1 tsp (4 g) baking powder
  • tsp (2 g) onion powder
  • tsp (2 g) garlic powder
  • tsp (1 g) salt
  • cup (100 g) marinara sauce
  • 5 tbsp (40 g) shredded mozzarella cheese

Instructions:

For the Crust

  1. Preheat your oven to 425F.
  2. In a large bowl, mix the oat flour, egg whites, Greek yogurt, baking powder, salt, onion powder, and garlic powder until combined.
  3. Spray a mini muffin tin with oil. Put a spoonful of dough into 24 wells. Do your best to get the wells filled evenly. I find that a small cookie scoop is easiest but a spoon works as well. With some practice you'll get better at eyeballing the size.
  4. Form the dough into the shape of the well. I find this step easiest if you use a pointy spoon, put the spoon in the center of the dough, and drag the back of the spoon up the sides while applying a little pressure on the well of the muffin tin on all sides. I like to fill all of the wells first, then go through and form the wells, then redistribute any dough as needed to make them more even.
  5. Parbake the dough for 3 minutes.

For the Topping

  1. Measure out the sauce and cheese. (If you're not worried about exact calories, just eyeball it. Your life will be easier.
  2. Top each pizza bite with sauce and cheese over the top. Bake for an additional 6-7 minutes.
  3. Remove from oven and allow to cool.

Storage

  1. Once the bites are at room temperature, add them to a gallon ziplock bag. Label the bag with the name and date and freeze.
  2. To the reheat the pizza bites, microwave them for 1-2 minutes or until thawed based on the power of your microwave.

Supreme Pizza Bites

A gluten free pizza bite that is freezer friendly for you to have available to you whenever you need a quick snack.

CourseCuisineTime - 45 minutes
SnackItalian, meal prepPrep - 25 minutes
Cook - 20 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
37kcal24 bites
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates4g57%
Fat1.3g18%
Protein2.4g34%

Ingredients:

  • cup (90 g) oat flour
  • 3 tbsp (45 g) liquid egg whites
  • cup (165 g) plain non fat Greek yogurt
  • 1 tsp (4 g) baking powder
  • tsp (2 g) onion powder
  • tsp (2 g) garlic powder
  • tsp (1 g) salt
  • cup (100 g) marinara sauce
  • 5 tbsp (40 g) shredded mozzarella cheese
  • 2 oz (57 g) turkey sausage Jimmy Dean sells a bag of frozen precooked sausage, I use it for ease.
  • 4 slices (8 g) pepperoni
  • cup (38 g) onion diced
  • cup (38 g) pepper diced

Instructions:

For the Crust

  1. Preheat your oven to 425F.
  2. In a large bowl, mix the oat flour, egg whites, Greek yogurt, baking powder, salt, onion powder, and garlic powder until combined.
  3. Spray a mini muffin tin with oil. Put a spoonful of dough into 24 wells. Do your best to get the wells filled evenly. I find that a small cookie scoop is easiest but a spoon works as well. With some practice you'll get better at eyeballing the size.
  4. Form the dough into the shape of the well. I find this step easiest if you use a pointy spoon, put the spoon in the center of the dough, and drag the back of the spoon up the sides while applying a little pressure on the well of the muffin tin on all sides. I like to fill all of the wells first, then go through and form the wells, then redistribute any dough as needed to make them more even.
  5. Parbake the dough for 3 minutes.

For the Topping

  1. Weigh out the sauce, cheese, onion, peppers, sausage, and pepperoni. Cut the pepperoni into small pieces to fit on top. (If you're not worried about exact calories, just eyeball it. Your life will be easier.)
  2. Top each pizza bite with sauce, then the toppings and cheese over the top. Bake for an additional 6-7 minutes.
  3. Remove from oven and allow to cool.

Storage

  1. Once the bites are at room temperature, add them to a gallon ziplock bag. Label the bag with the name and date and freeze.
  2. To the reheat the pizza bites, microwave them for 1-2 minutes or until thawed based on the power of your microwave.

Pepperoni Pizza Bites

A gluten free pizza bite that is freezer friendly for you to have available to you whenever you need a quick snack.

CourseCuisineTime - 45 minutes
SnackItalian, meal prepPrep - 35 minutes
Cook - 10 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
33kcal48 bites
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates3.5g58%
Fat1.1g18%
Protein2.2g36%

Ingredients:

  • 1 cup (180 g) oat flour
  • 6 tbsp (90 g) liquid egg whites
  • 1 cup (330 g) plain non fat Greek yogurt
  • 2 tsp (8 g) baking powder
  • 1 tsp (4 g) onion powder
  • 1 tsp (4 g) garlic powder
  • tsp (3 g) salt
  • 1 cup (240 g) marinara sauce
  • tbsp (84 g) shredded mozzarella cheese
  • 15 slices (30 g) pepperoni

Instructions:

For the Crust

  1. Preheat your oven to 425F.
  2. In a large bowl, mix the oat flour, egg whites, Greek yogurt, baking powder, salt, onion powder, and garlic powder until combined.
  3. Spray a mini muffin tin with oil. Put a spoonful of dough into 48 wells. Do your best to get the wells filled evenly. I find that a small cookie scoop is easiest but a spoon works as well. With some practice you'll get better at eyeballing the size.
  4. Form the dough into the shape of the well. I find this step easiest if you use a pointy spoon, put the spoon in the center of the dough, and drag the back of the spoon up the sides while applying a little pressure on the well of the muffin tin on all sides. I like to fill all of the wells first, then go through and form the wells, then redistribute any dough as needed to make them more even.
  5. Parbake the dough for 4-6 minutes.

For the Topping

  1. Measure out the sauce and cheese and pepperoni. Cut the pepperoni into small pieces to fit on top. (If you're not worried about exact calories, just eyeball it. Your life will be easier.)
  2. Top each pizza bite with sauce, cheese, then pepperoni over the top. Bake for an additional 6-10 minutes.
  3. Remove from oven and allow to cool.

Storage

  1. Once the bites are at room temperature, add them to a Fresh & Save Bag, label the bag with the name and date and freeze.
  2. To the reheat the pizza bites, air fry or microwave them. I air fry at 400F until they are hot or microwave them for 1-2 minutes or until thawed based on the power of your microwave. Air frying to reheat is my preferred method.

Sausage Pizza Bites

A gluten free pizza bite that is freezer friendly for you to have available to you whenever you need a quick snack.

CourseCuisineTime - 35 minutes
SnackItalian, meal prepPrep - 25 minutes
Cook - 9 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
42kcal24 bites
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates3.3g47%
Fat2g28%
Protein2.7g38%

Ingredients:

  • cup (90 g) oat flour
  • 3 tbsp (45 g) liquid egg whites
  • cup (165 g) plain non fat Greek yogurt
  • 1 tsp (4 g) baking powder
  • tsp (2 g) onion powder
  • tsp (2 g) garlic powder
  • tsp (1 g) salt
  • cup (100 g) marinara sauce
  • 5 tbsp (40 g) shredded mozzarella cheese
  • 4 oz (114 g) sausage

Instructions:

For the Crust

  1. Preheat your oven to 425F.
  2. In a large bowl, mix the oat flour, egg whites, Greek yogurt, baking powder, salt, onion powder, and garlic powder until combined.
  3. Spray a mini muffin tin with oil. Put a spoonful of dough into 24 wells. Do your best to get the wells filled evenly. I find that a small cookie scoop is easiest but a spoon works as well. With some practice you'll get better at eyeballing the size.
  4. Form the dough into the shape of the well. I find this step easiest if you use a pointy spoon, put the spoon in the center of the dough, and drag the back of the spoon up the sides while applying a little pressure on the well of the muffin tin on all sides. I like to fill all of the wells first, then go through and form the wells, then redistribute any dough as needed to make them more even.
  5. Parbake the dough for 3 minutes.

For the Topping

  1. Brown the sausage and break into small pieces.
  2. Measure out the sauce and cheese. (If you're not worried about exact calories, just eyeball it. Your life will be easier.)
  3. Top each pizza bite with sauce, sausage, then cheese over the top. Bake for an additional 6-7 minutes.
  4. Remove from oven and allow to cool.

Storage

  1. Once the bites are at room temperature, add them to a gallon ziplock bag. Label the bag with the name and date and freeze.
  2. To the reheat the pizza bites, microwave them for 1-2 minutes or until thawed based on the power of your microwave. Air frying to reheat is my preferred method.

Butternut Squash Lasagna

Butternut squash acts as a lower carb replacement to noodles in this dish that is rich in flavor and highly palatable. This recipe works great outside of meal prep as well!

CourseCuisineTime - null
Main DishItalian, meal prepPrep - 30 minutes 30 minutes 30 minutes
Cook - 2 hours 2 hours 2 hours

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
856kcal6
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates32g21%
Fat54g36%
Protein62g41%

Ingredients:

  • 1 large (1135 g) butternut squash
  • 1 lb (681 g) ground beef (85/15)
  • 1 lb (454 g) Italian pork sausage
  • 14 oz (397 g) can petite diced tomatoes
  • 6 oz (170 g) can of tomato paste
  • lb (227 g) sliced mozzarella cheese
  • cup (84 g) shredded parmesan cheese
  • Salt and pepper
  • 1 cup (248 g) part skim ricotta cheese
  • 8 oz (227 g) spinach
  • 2 (2 ) eggs
  • 2 Tbsp (6 g) dried parsley
  • 2 Tbsp (6 g) dried basil
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) olive oil
  • 1 Tbsp (15 g) garlic

Instructions:

  1. Heat a large skillet over medium high heat and brown the sausage and ground beef with 1 Tbsp of garlic.
  2. While cooking the meat, peel the squash and cut into sheets thick. I like to cut off the bulbous portion and cut the top first as it makes for better noodles.
  3. Once the meat has browned, drain half of the fat and add the diced tomatoes, tomato paste, 2 Tbsp parsley, 2 Tbsp basil, and 1 tsp of salt. Stir to incorporate and reduce heat to low. Allow it to simmer for 30 minutes.
  4. Preheat your oven to 350F.
  5. If your bag of spinach is microwave safe, pierce it with a fork and microwave for 3 minutes. Once cooked, chop it into small pieces and allow to cool.
  6. In a large bowl mix together the spinach, 1 cup ricotta cheese, cup parmesan cheese, 2 beaten eggs, and salt and pepper.
  7. Coat a 13x9 baking dish with olive oil and add one third of the meat mixture to the bottom.
  8. Add a layer of squash sheets on top of the meat and season the squash lightly with salt and pepper.
  9. Spread of the ricotta and spinach mixture over the top of the squash.
  10. Place half of the sliced mozzarella cheese over the ricotta.
  11. Start the process again, spreading of the remaining meat over the cheese, followed by the squash, ricotta mixture, and mozzarella cheese.
  12. Top the pan with the remaining meat and cup of parmesan cheese.
  13. Bake for 45-60 minutes. The lasagna is finished cooking once you can easily insert a butter knife anywhere in the pan.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 6 servings. Cut the lasagna into 6 pieces and put 1 piece in each of your containers.

Meatballs in Bolognese

Meatballs made from 85/15 ground beef served with homemade bolognese sauce made with fresh basil, parsley, carrots, and celery.

CourseCuisineTime - 1 hour 15 minutes 1 hour 15 minutes 1 hour 15 minutes
Main DishItalian, meal prepPrep - 25 minutes 25 minutes 25 minutes
Cook - 50 minutes 50 minutes 50 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
893kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates79g45%
Fat39g22%
Protein57g32%

Ingredients:

For the Meatballs

  • 2 lbs (908 g) ground beef (85/15)
  • 4 (4 ) eggs
  • cup (120 ml) skim milk
  • 1 cup (60 g) ground Cheerios between 1 -2 cups of whole Cheerios, blended, you can use breadcrumbs as well
  • 1 tsp (3 g) salt
  • 1 tsp (2 g) pepper
  • 2 Tbsp (3 g) fresh parsley
  • 2 tsp (6 g) garlic powder
  • cup (69 g) parmesan cheese grated
  • medium (100 g) sweet onion

For the Bolognese

  • 1 medium (200 g) sweet onion
  • 1 Tbsp (15 g) garlic minced
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) olive oil
  • 28 oz (794 g) can of crushed tomatoes
  • 3 medium (300 g) carrots
  • 3 medium (300 g) celery stalks
  • cup (5 g) fresh parsley
  • 8 fresh basil leaves
  • Salt and pepper to taste

For the Zoodles

  • 3 medium (600 g) zucchini spiralized

For the Rice

  • 5 cups (875 g) cooked rice

Instructions:

For the Meatballs

  1. Preheat your oven to 375F
  2. In a large bowl mix all of the ingredients together using your hands. Be careful not to handle too much or the meatballs will become tough.
  3. Roll the meat into balls about 1.5-2 in diameter and place onto a greased sheet pan.
  4. Bake the meatballs for 15 minutes. Remove them from the oven to turn and then cook for an additional 5 minutes.

For the Bolognese

  1. Chop the onion, celery, and carrots into a small dice.
  2. In a large skillet heat the olive oil over medium high heat and saut 1 Tbsp minced garlic and onion together for a few minutes. Then add the celery and carrot and cook until soft.
  3. Chop the parsley and basil while the vegetables cook.
  4. Add the canned tomatoes, basil, and parsley and reduce the heat to medium low. Cook for 15-20 minutes or until thickened. Add salt and pepper to taste.
  5. If you prefer a smooth sauce, put the mixture into a blender. If you dont mind the carrot and celery chunks, leave it as is.
  6. When the meatballs are finished, add them to the sauce and allow them to cook together

For the Zoodles

  1. Spiralize all of your zucchini. We arent going to cook this because it will cook in the microwave when you reheat your meal. Do not salt this either as it will encourage moisture to release from the squash.
  2. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide the meatballs, sauce, and zucchini evenly into 5 portions

For the Rice

  1. Cook enough rice to have 5 cups of cooked rice. 1 cup of dry rice will yield about 3 cups of cooked rice.

Chicken Parmesan

Baked chicken breast tenders coated in ground corn flakes to make a gluten free breading and topped with a red sauce and cheese. The chicken is served with a side of zucchini noodles.

CourseCuisineTime - 45 minutes 45 minutes
Main CourseItalian, meal prepPrep - 20 minutes 20 minutes
Cook - 25 minutes 25 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
670kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates78g51%
Fat13g8%
Protein60g39%

Ingredients:

  • 2 lbs (908 g) chicken breast tenders
  • 2 cups (75 g) cornflakes you can use breadcrumbs, I use cornflakes because they are gluten free
  • cup (28 g) shredded parmesan cheese
  • 2 (2 ) eggs
  • cup (60 g) tapioca flour cornstarch works as well
  • 10 slices (110 g) thinly sliced provolone cheese
  • 2 (120 g) Roma tomatoes sliced
  • 1 tsp (1 g) oregano
  • 5 Tbsp (5 g) fresh parsley chopped
  • 1 cups (300 g) red pasta sauce
  • 3 (750 g) zucchinis
  • 5 cups (750 g) cooked rice or noodles
  • Cooking spray

Instructions:

For the Chicken

  1. Preheat your oven to 400F
  2. In a blender, add cup shredded parmesan cheese, 1 tsp oregano, and 2 cups of cornflakes. Blend until the cornflakes are reduced to a powder.
  3. Set up 3 bowls. One with cup of tapioca flour (cornstarch works as well), one with 2 beaten eggs, and one with the ground cornflakes.
  4. Dip the chicken breast tenders in the tapioca flour, then the egg wash, and then coat with the ground cornflakes.
  5. Spray a sheet pan with cooking spray and place the chicken on the pan. Lightly spray the tops with more cooking spray.
  6. Cook the chicken for 10 minutes and remove from the oven. Flip the chicken and cook an additional 5 minutes.
  7. Remove from the oven again and top the chicken with 1 cups of pasta sauce. Evenly spread the sauce across the chicken evenly. Place two thinly sliced pieces of provolone cheese over the top of the chicken.
  8. Bake an additional 5 minutes or until the cheese starts to brown and remove from oven.
  9. Top the chicken with chopped parsley.

For the Zoodles and Tomatoes

  1. While the chicken is cooking, wash your zucchini and form them into noodles using a vegetable spiralizer.
  2. There is no need to cook these as they will cook upon reheating in the microwave.
  3. Cut the tomatoes into slices.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide your chicken, zoodles, and sliced tomatoes evenly between your containers.

For the Rice

  1. Cook enough rice to have 5 cups worth. 1 cup of dry rice makes around 3 cups of cooked rice.

Argentinian

  • Chimichurri Chicken Fried Rice
  • Chimichurri Rice Bowls
  • Vegetable Shake
  • Chimichurri Chicken with Sweet Potato Fries
  • Skirt Steak & Chimichurri with Green Beans & Murshrooms

Chimichurri Chicken Fried Rice

Chimichurri Chicken Fried Rice made using day old rice, chicken thighs, and a variety of vegetables. Instead of flavoring with soy sauce like in traditional fried rice, this one is flavored with a tangy chimichurri sauce that goes awesome with any meats and rice.

CourseCuisineTime - 45 minutes 45 minutes 45 minutes
Main DishArgentinian, meal prepPrep - 15 minutes 15 minutes 15 minutes
Cook - 30 minutes 30 minutes 30 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
703kcal5 servings
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates61g44%
Fat31g22%
Protein44g32%

Ingredients:

For the Rice

  • 6 cups (900 g) cooked rice

For the Chicken

  • 2 lbs (1135 g) boneless skinless chicken thighs
  • 2 tbsp (28 g) mayo
  • 3 tsp (9 g) chili powder
  • 1 tsp (5 g) garlic powder
  • 2 tsp (8 g) salt
  • 2 tsp (3 g) pepper

For the Fried Rice

  • lb (227 g) mushrooms
  • medium (100 g) onion
  • 1 cup (100 g) carrots shredded
  • 1 medium (150 g) red pepper
  • 2 (120 g) Roma tomatoes
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) oil

For the Chimichurri

  • bunch (20 g) parsley
  • bunch (20 g) cilantro
  • 1 tbsp (10 g) minced onion
  • 1 tsp (1 g) dried oregano
  • cup (60 g) red wine vinegar
  • 3 cloves (15 g) garlic
  • 3 tbsp (45 g) oil
  • salt to taste

Instructions:

For the Rice

  1. Fried Rice is always better when you use day old rice so ideally you would cook the rice for this recipe the day before you plan to make it. You can use fresh rice when you make it and it will still turn out well, but the day old rice really does make a difference.
  2. Make enough rice to yield 6 cups of cooked rice. 1 cup of dry rice will make between 2-3 cups of cooked rice depending on what type of rice you use.

For the Chicken

  1. Mix together the mayo, garlic powder, chili powder, salt, and pepper. Add the chicken and ensure that all surfaces are covered.
  2. I use the air fryer to cook the chicken. I think it works better for browning and is easier. Preheat your air fryer to 400F. Air fry for 10-12 minutes flipping around the 8 minute mark.
  3. If you don't have an air fryer you can cook in the oven. Preheat your oven to 425F. Bake for 10 minutes, turn the chicken and remove any liquid on the pan. Turn the oven to broil and return the pan to the oven on the top rack. Watch the chicken carefully as it is prone to burn. Cook it for 5 more minutes or until it has browned.

For the Chimichurri

  1. Wash your parsley and cilantro. Dry with paper towels and cut off the stems. You don't need to pick off all of the leaves, just cut off the stem under the leaves.
  2. Roughly chop the leaves of the parsley and cilantro, dice the onion, and chop the garlic into smaller pieces.
  3. Place the parsley, cilantro, onion, garlic, oregano, and red wine vinegar into a blender or food processor. Slowly add in the oil to emulsify with the vinegar and blend up all of the components. If you are using a large blender, it may be a struggle to get everything moving. You'll likely have to either a) use a smaller container for your blender or b) scrape down the sides often until it all comes together.
  4. Season with salt to taste.

For the Fried Rice

  1. Wash and cut all of your vegetables before you start. Cut the onion, mushrooms, carrots, and red pepper into a small dice. Cut the tomatoes into a small dice, scoop out the seeds from the center.
  2. In a large skillet, add 1 tbsp of oil over medium high heat. Add in the onions, red peppers and carrots and cook for a few minutes until soft.
  3. Add in the mushrooms and season lightly with salt. Allow them to cook down.
  4. Add in 5 cups of cooked, day old rice and break apart to incorporate.
  5. Your chicken should be finished around this time. While the vegetables are cooking, chop it into bite sized pieces.
  6. Add the chicken and all of the chimichurri to the pan and mix to combine. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide your ingredients evenly between your 5 containers. Sprinkle the diced tomatoes over the top of each dish.

Chimichurri Rice Bowls

Ground turkey, rice, sweet potatoes, and broccoli mixed together and served with a side of chimichurri sauce to go over the top. This meal is incredibly flavorful and a breeze to prep.

CourseCuisineTime - 40 minutes
Main DishAmerican, Argentinian, meal prepPrep - 15 minutes
Cook - 25 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
542kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates43g40%
Fat24g22%
Protein38g36%

Ingredients:

For the Main Dish

  • 2 lbs (908 g) ground turkey 93/7
  • 1 lb (454 g) frozen broccoli
  • 2 cups (300 g) cooked rice
  • 2 medium (500 g) sweet potatoes
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) olive oil
  • salt and pepper to taste

For the Chimichurri

  • cup (25 g) parsley chopped
  • cup (25 g) cilantro chopped
  • cup (60 ml) red wine vinegar
  • 3 tbsp (45 g) olive oil
  • 3 cloves (15 g) garlic
  • 2 tbsp (15 g) shallot minced
  • 1 tbsp (3 g) oregano

Instructions:

For the Rice

  1. Cook enough rice to yield 2 cups of cooked rice. 1 cup of dry rice will make between 2-3 cups of cooked rice depending on what kind you use.

For the Potatoes and Broccoli

  1. Wash and cut your potatoes into a large dice. If your broccoli is in large florets, cut it as well.
  2. I used an air fryer to cook these. Set your air fryer to the air fry setting at 400F. Add the potatoes and spray lightly with oil. Shake every few minutes. Once the potatoes have finished, remove and add the broccoli and cook for 8 minutes.
  3. If you don't have an air fryer, preheat your oven to 425F.
  4. Toss the potatoes in a bit of oil and spread on a sheet pan. Season lightly with salt and pepper. Roast for 10 minutes and then flip.
  5. When you remove the tray to flip the potatoes, add the broccoli and cook an additional 8-10 minutes. If your broccoli has lots of ice on the outside, you may want to use a separate sheet pan so the water that melts off doesn't soak the potatoes.

For the Turkey

  1. Heat a bit of oil in a large skillet over medium high heat. Add the turkey and brown. Cook off any water that remains in the pan. Season lightly with salt and pepper.
  2. Once the rice, broccoli, potatoes, and turkey have all cooked. Mix them all together in a giant bowl/pan. Season to taste.

For the Chimichurri

  1. Wash your parsley and cilantro. Dry with paper towels and cut of the stems. You don't need to pick off all of the leaves, just cut off the stem under the leaves.
  2. Roughly chop the leaves until you have 25 grams ( cup) worth of each.
  3. Peel the garlic and mince the onion until you have 15 grams (2 tbsp) worth.
  4. Place all of the ingredients into a blender or food processor and blend until it is homogenous and all of the ingredients are broken down.

Plating

  1. Divide the chimichurri evenly 5 ways. Store in a smaller separate container to place within your meal prep container. You could just mix in the chimichurri with the food but I find it better to keep on the side.
  2. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide the meat mixture evenly 5 ways between all of your containers.

Vegetable Shake

This is my daily vegetable shake. As many of you know, I despise and hate vegetables with the fire of 10,000 dragons. This is not something to drink for enjoyment. It doesn't taste good and if you have a crappy blender I wouldn't even try to make it. I drink this purely to get in a large serving of vegetables. The blender I use is a Vitamix 5200.

CourseCuisineTime - 10 minutes
DrinksAmerican, ArgentinianPrep - 10 minutes
Cook - null

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
167kcal4 servings
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates35.9g94%
Fat0.9g2%
Protein3.9g10%

Ingredients:

  • 1 pint (473 ml) water
  • 2 tbsp (30 ml) lemon juice
  • 1 cup (85 g) carrots
  • 4 cups (125 g) kale
  • 2 (365 g) pears
  • 1 medium (300 g) cucumber
  • 1 medium (200 g) zucchini
  • 1 inch (15 g) ginger

Instructions:

  1. Add all of the ingredients to a blender. Blend until smooth.
  2. Store in mason jars and refrigerate or freeze if youre prepping more than a days worth.

NOTE

  1. I've started to cut all of the vegetables in advance and store them in meal prep containers instead of blending them and storing in the mason jars. This is better for preserving nutrient quality.

Chimichurri Chicken with Sweet Potato Fries

Grilled chicken thighs served with a side of chimichurri sauce, sweet potato fries, and zucchini. Grilled meat and chimichurri are a match made in heaven.

CourseCuisineTime - 1 hour 20 minutes 1 hour 20 minutes 1 hour 20 minutes
Main DishArgentinian, meal prepPrep - 40 minutes 40 minutes 40 minutes
Cook - 40 minutes 40 minutes 40 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
816kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates66g42%
Fat38g24%
Protein51g32%

Ingredients:

For the Chicken

  • 2 lbs (1135 g) boneless skinless chicken thighs
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) olive oil
  • tsp (1.5 ml) salt
  • 1 Tbsp (8 g) paprika
  • 1 Tbsp (15 g) garlic minced

For the Sweet Potato Fries and Zucchini

  • 2 medium (550 g) sweet potatoes
  • 2 medium (500 g) zucchini
  • 1 Tbsp (20 ml) olive oil
  • Salt and pepper

For the Chimichurri

  • 1 bunch (55 g) flat leaf parsley 2-2.5 cups
  • 4 cloves (20 g) garlic
  • 2 Tbsp (30 ml) red wine vinegar
  • cup (120 ml) olive oil
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) lemon juice
  • 2 Tbsp (10 g) red onion diced
  • 1 tsp (1 g) oregano
  • 5 cups (675 g) cooked rice

For the Zucchini

  • 2 medium (500 g) zucchini
  • 1 tsp (20 ml) olive oil
  • Salt and pepper

Instructions:

  1. Add the chicken thighs to a ziplock bag with 1 Tbsp of olive oil, tsp salt, 1 Tbsp paprika, and 1 Tbsp minced garlic. Shake the chicken around in the bag to coat. Remove as much air as possible and marinate in the refrigerator for at least 30 minutes.
  2. Heat a grill pan over medium high heat and add 1 Tbsp of olive oil.
  3. Cook the chicken in batches if necessary to prevent overcrowding. Cook it for roughly 4 minutes on each side but be careful not to mess with it too much as you want the outside to develop some color.
  4. After the chicken has cooked, remove it from the pan and cut it into a large dice. Add it back to the pan to allow for it to finish cooking and develop more color.

For the Sweet Potato Fries and Zucchini

  1. Preheat your oven to 400F.
  2. Wash and cut your sweet potatoes and zucchini into fry shaped sticks.
  3. Add the zucchini to a bowl with 1 tsp of olive oil and lightly season with salt.
  4. Add the sweet potatoes to a large bowl and add 1 Tbsp of olive oil. Lightly season with salt and pepper. Spread on a sheet pan and bake for 10 minutes, remove from the oven and flip.
  5. While the pan is out of the oven, add the zucchini and bake an additional 8-10 minutes.
  6. Watch the pan carefully to make sure the sweet potatoes dont burn.

For the Chimichurri

  1. In a food processor or a blender, add all of the ingredients and blend until smooth. The sauce should be a vibrant green color, if yours is brown you probably need to add more parsley and blend longer.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide all of your ingredients evenly between 5 containers. Store the chimichurri in a separate, smaller container as you dont want to heat it in the microwave.

For the Zucchini

  1. Preheat your oven to 400F.
  2. Wash and cut the zucchini into matchsticks. Coat with 1 tsp oil.
  3. Add the zucchini to a sheet pan and bake 8-10 minutes.

For the Rice

  1. Cook enough rice to yield 5 cups of cooked rice. 1 cup of dry rice will make about 3 cups of cooked rice.

Skirt Steak & Chimichurri with Green Beans & Murshrooms

Grilled skirt steak served with chimichurri sauce, green beans and mushrooms. The chimichurri sauce is the highlight in this meal, bringing strong flavors to the meat.

CourseCuisineTime - 50 minutes 50 minutes 50 minutes
Main DishArgentinian, meal prepPrep - 20 minutes 20 minutes 20 minutes
Cook - 30 minutes 30 minutes 30 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
807kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates49g33%
Fat43g29%
Protein56g37%

Ingredients:

  • 2 lbs (1135 g) skirt steak you may need to buy 2 smaller steaks
  • 8 oz (227 g) mushrooms
  • 2 Tbsp (30 ml) garlic
  • 1 lb (454 g) green beans
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) olive oil
  • Salt and Pepper to taste

For the Chimichurri

  • 1 bunch (55 g) flat leaf parsley 2-2.5 cups
  • 4 cloves (20 g) garlic
  • 2 Tbsp (30 ml) red wine vinegar
  • cup (120 g) olive oil
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) lemon juice
  • 2 Tbsp (26 g) red onion diced
  • 1 tsp (1 g) dried oregano

For the Rice

  • 5 cups (675 g) cooked rice

Instructions:

  1. Bring a large pot of water to a boil and add the green beans. Cook for about 7-8 minutes or until almost cooked through.
  2. In a skillet, heat 1 Tbsp of olive oil over medium high heat. Add the mushrooms and cook for 4-5 minutes then add the green beans and season with salt and pepper to taste.
  3. While the vegetables are cooking heat a grill pan or another skillet over medium high heat. Cast iron is preferred.
  4. Drizzle the steak with olive oil and season with salt and pepper. Make sure you cook your steak one stage below where you prefer your meat because you will be reheating it in the microwave again.

For the Chimichurri

  1. In a food processor or a blender, add all of the ingredients and blend until smooth. The sauce should be a vibrant green color, if yours is brown you probably need to add more parsley and blend longer.
  2. Once your steak has rested for 10 minutes, cut it into slices against the grain, this will prevent the meat from being chewy.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide all of your ingredients evenly between 5 containers. Store the chimichurri in a separate, smaller container as you dont want to heat it in the microwave.

For the Rice

  1. Cook enough rice to have 5 cups of cooked rice. 1 cup of dry rice will yield about 3 cups of cooked rice.
  2. Bring a large pot of water to a boil and add the green beans. Cook for about 7-8 minutes or until almost cooked through.
  3. In a skillet, heat 1 Tbsp of olive oil over medium high heat. Add the mushrooms and cook for 4-5 minutes then add the green beans and season with salt and pepper to taste.
  4. While the vegetables are cooking heat a grill pan or another skillet over medium high heat. Cast iron is preferred.
  5. Drizzle the steak with olive oil and season with salt and pepper. Make sure you cook your steak one stage below where you prefer your meat because you will be reheating it in the microwave again.

Filipino

  • Ground Pork Pancit
  • Chicken Pancit

Ground Pork Pancit

Filipino Pancit made with ground pork, rice sticks and a variety of vegetables. This dish is flavored with chicken stock, lime juice, soy sauce, and oyster sauce.

CourseCuisineTime - 45 minutes 45 minutes 45 minutes
Main DishAsian, Filipino, meal prepPrep - 10 minutes 10 minutes 10 minutes
Cook - 35 minutes 35 minutes 35 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
682kcal5 servings
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates45g36%
Fat37g29%
Protein43g34%

Ingredients:

For the Pancit

  • 3 lbs (1362 g) ground pork (85/15) beef or turkey works as well
  • 8 oz (227 g) shredded cabbage or coleslaw mix
  • 1 medium (200 g) sweet onion
  • lb (227 g) carrots
  • lb (227 g) celery
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) minced garlic
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) minced ginger
  • 8 oz (227 g) rice sticks
  • 5 (25 g) green onions
  • 1 (15 g) jalapeo optional

For the Sauce

  • 3 tbsp (45 g) lime juice
  • cup (60 g) chicken stock
  • 2 tbsp (30 g) oyster sauce
  • 2 tbsp (35 g) soy sauce

Instructions:

For the Rice Sticks

  1. Add the rice sticks to a bowl of hot water and allow them to soak to soften while you cook the other ingredients.

For the Pork and Vegetables

  1. In a large skillet or wok, add in the pork and brown.
  2. While the pork is cooking, cut all of your vegetables. Cut the onion into thin slices, celery into a small dice, and the carrots into ribbons using a vegetable peeler. If you wanted to buy matchstick carrots, you could use those as well. Chop the tops off of some green onions and thinly slice a jalapeo for garnishing.
  3. Once the pork has finished cooking, remove it from the pan and place into a large bowl, reserving all of the grease in the pan. You will use this to cook the vegetables. If there is more than 2 tbsp of grease in the pan, remove the excess.
  4. Add the onions and celery to the pan with the rendered fat. Allow them to cook for about 5 minutes. Then add in the garlic and ginger and cook for a minute or two until they become fragrant.
  5. Next add in the carrots and cabbage. Season lightly with salt and cook for 3-5 more minutes until the cabbage has wilted slightly and softened.

For the Sauce

  1. In a bowl, mix together the chicken stock, soy sauce, lime juice, and oyster sauce. Stir to combine.

For the Pancit

  1. Drain the water away from your rice sticks and pass a knife through them a few times to break them into smaller pieces.
  2. In the large bowl that is holding your pork, add the rice sticks, vegetables, and sauce. Mix to combine and season with salt and pepper to taste. Additionally, if you feel you should add more lime or soy sauce, do so.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 6 servings. Divide the Pancit into 6 containers. Top with green onions, jalapeo, and a lime wedge.

Reheating

  1. Some brands of rice sticks tend to dry out more than others in the fridge over the course of the week. If you find that happens to you, add a splash of chicken stock over the top of your meal before reheating and it will help.

Chicken Pancit

Pancit is a Filipino dish made using meat (traditionally pork), vegetables, and thin rice noodles. It is full of flavor, high volume, and fairly low in calories. It also happens to work wonderfully for meal prep.

CourseCuisineTime - 50 minutes 50 minutes
Main DishFilipino, meal prepPrep - 25 minutes 25 minutes
Cook - 25 minutes 25 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
664kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates83g60%
Fat23g16%
Protein31g22%

Ingredients:

  • 2 lbs (908 g) boneless skinless chicken thighs
  • 3 cups (210 g) shredded cabbage or coleslaw mix for ease
  • 2 cup (200 g) shredded carrots
  • 2 stalks (200 g) celery
  • 1 medium (200 g) sweet onion
  • 2 Tbsp (30 ml) garlic minced
  • 2 Tbsp (10 ml) ginger minced
  • 4 Tbsp (60 ml) olive oil
  • 1 (20 g) jalapeo
  • 2 (60 ml) lemon juiced
  • 4-5 Tbsp (60 ml) soy sauce
  • 4 Tbsp (60 ml) oyster sauce
  • 1 cup chicken stock optional
  • 10 (30 g) green onions
  • 13 oz (368 g) rice noodles I use the brand Dynasty Maifun Rice sticks.

Instructions:

  1. Cut up all of the vegetables. Cut the onion into slices. Mince the garlic and ginger. Cut the celery. Shred the cabbage.
  2. Bring a pot of water to a boil and boil the chicken until cooked then cut into small chunks. If you want your chicken to have more flavor you could grill it or pan fry it. In traditional pancit the meat is often poached.
  3. Cook the noodles in the chicken water until soft. Regular water or broth is fine if you choose to cook the chicken another way.
  4. Heat 2 Tbsp of olive oil over medium high heat. Add in the garlic, ginger, and onions. Once they have developed some color add the celery and carrots. After a couple minutes add in the chicken, noodles, and cabbage. Add oil as needed.
  5. Mix in the oyster sauce and soy sauce. Taste and adjust flavors as needed. Season with black pepper.
  6. This recipes makes 5 servings. Serve each dish with lemon, green onion and jalapeo if you wish. The lemon shouldnt be omitted. Im also serving mine with a side of sambal. If you find that your noodles dry out over the course of the week, pouring a bit of chicken stock over the top before reheating can help.

moroccan

  • Moroccan Tomato Chicken

Moroccan Tomato Chicken

Moroccan Tomato Chicken made from marinated chicken thighs, roasted vegetables, rice, and a yogurt sauce to go over the top. The chicken is broiled in the oven to develop lots of color and flavor.

CourseCuisineTime - 55 minutes 55 minutes 55 minutes
Main Dishmeal prep, moroccanPrep - 15 minutes 15 minutes 15 minutes
Cook - 40 minutes 40 minutes 40 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
671kcal5 servings
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates57g42%
Fat26g19%
Protein52g38%

Ingredients:

For the Chicken

  • 3 lbs (1362 g) boneless skinless chicken thighs
  • cup (60 g) plain nonfat Greek yogurt
  • 2 tbsp (30 g) tomato paste
  • 2 tsp (8 g) salt
  • 2 tsp (6 g) cumin
  • 1 tsp (3 g) turmeric
  • 2 tsp (6 g) chili powder
  • 2 tbsp (30 g) lemon juice
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) minced garlic
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) minced ginger

For the Vegetables

  • 1 large (250 g) zucchini
  • 1 medium (200 g) red onion
  • lb (227 g) carrots
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) oil
  • salt and pepper to taste

For the Rice

  • 5 cups (750 g) cooked rice

For the Mayo Sauce

  • cup (60 g) plain nonfat Greek yogurt
  • 3 tbsp (39 g) mayo
  • 1 tsp (5 g) lemon juice
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) water

Instructions:

For the Rice

  1. Cook enough rice to have5cups of cooked rice. 1 cup of dry rice will yield about 2-3 cups of cooked rice depending on what kind you use.

For the Vegetables

  1. Preheat your oven to 425F.
  2. Wash and cut all of your vegetables. You can really cut them into any shape you wish. I cut the carrots into sticks and the zucchini and onion into a large dice.
  3. Add the vegetables to a large bowl and toss with 1 tbsp of oil and season lightly with salt and pepper.
  4. Spread out on a large sheet pan and roast for 15-18 minutes, flipping around the 10 minute mark.

For the Chicken

  1. While the vegetables are cooking, cut your chicken thighs into small, bite sized pieces, around 1 inch cubes.
  2. In a large bowl mix together the greek yogurt, tomato paste, lemon juice, salt, cumin, turmeric, chili powder, salt, minced garlic, and minced ginger.
  3. Add in the chicken and mix until all of the pieces are evenly coated.
  4. Spread out the chicken on a large sheet pan, make sure you have space between the pieces so they will brown evenly.
  5. Turn your oven to broil and place the pan on the top rack. Make sure you watch this closely, if your rack is too close the broiler it will be prone to burning.
  6. After 6-8 minutes, remove from the oven and toss the chicken. Spoon away any water that has been released onto the pan as this will prevent further browning.
  7. Put the chicken back under the broiler for an additional 4-5 minutes or until adequate browning is achieved. Again, watch it closely so it doesn't burn, stirring if necessary.

For the Mayo Sauce

  1. Mix the yogurt, mayo, lemon juice, and water together in a bowl. Season lightly with salt.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide your ingredients evenly between the 5 containers. Each dish gets 1 cup of rice. Store the yogurt sauce in smaller separate containers as you don't want to reheat this.

Korean

  • Korean Chicken Stew – Dakdoritang

Korean Chicken Stew Dakdoritang

Dakdoritang is a Spicy Korean Chicken Stew dish. It is full of intense flavors from gochujang and gochugaru and its stewy qualities make it a wonderful dish for meal prepping. Filled with potatoes, carrots, celery, and chicken and served with rice this stew is something you'll find yourself wanting to make often

CourseCuisineTime - 1 hour
Main DishAsian, Korean, meal prepPrep - 15 minutes
Cook - 45 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
520kcal6 servings
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates63g56%
Fat15g13%
Protein33g29%

Ingredients:

For the Rice

  • 4 cups (675 g) cooked rice

For the Stew

  • 2 lbs (908 g) boneless skinless chicken thighs
  • lb (227 g) celery
  • lb (227 g) carrots
  • 1 lbs (454 g) russet potatoes
  • 2 tbsp (30 g) minced ginger
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) minced garlic
  • 1 bunch (50 g) green onions
  • 1 cups (360 g) chicken stock
  • 2 tbsp (30 g) oil

For the Sauce

  • 3 tbsp (45 g) gochujang
  • 1 tbsp (12 g) gochugaru
  • 1 tbsp (36 g) honey
  • cup (60 g) soy sauce
  • 1 tbsp (8 g) cornstarch slurry

Instructions:

For the Rice

  1. Cook enough rice to have 4 cups of cooked rice. 1 cup of dry rice will yield about 2-3 cups of cooked rice depending on what kind you use.

For the Stew

  1. Start by washing cutting all of your vegetables.
  2. Slice the green onions and separate out the whites and green tops. You will use the tops for garnishing the final dish.
  3. Cut the carrots, celery, and potatoes into a large dice. I cut the celery and the carrots down the center to halve it then cut it on a bias into smaller pieces. The potatoes get cut into cubes of about inch in size. You can peel them or leave them as they are.
  4. Season your chicken lightly with salt and pepper.
  5. In a large stock pot over medium high heat, add some oil and the scallions, carrots, potatoes, celery, and ginger. Season lightly with salt and cook for 5-7 minutes to allow the flavors to develop. Add in the garlic and stir.
  6. Make some room in the bottom of the pot (there won't be much room, do your best) and add in the chicken to get some browning. Cook it for 3-4 minutes. Flipping over when ready.
  7. While the vegetables and chicken are cooking you can prepare your sauce. Mix together the soy sauce, honey, gochujang, and gochugaru. These are Korean ingredients. I get them at Whole Foods, you may be able to find them at your regular store and certainly at your local asian grocer. If you don't love spicy food, add less gochugaru. If you can't find gochugaru you can substitute ground chili powder (the one that is just ground chili, not the chili powder mixture with cumin etc.)
  8. Pour the sauce over the meat and vegetables and stir. Pour the chicken stock over the top and mix.
  9. Cover the pot and reduce the heat to medium low. Simmer with the lid on for 20 minutes.
  10. While stewing, you can plate up your rice into your containers. Each container gets cup of rice.
  11. After 20 minutes, remove the lid, stir the contents of the pot and taste. Season with salt and pepper to taste. When I made this recipe I used chicken bone broth which is a tad bit thicker than regular stock. The starch from the potatoes should help to thicken the sauce. If you still have a very watery consistency, you can either add a small amount of a cornstarch slurry or allow the pot to boil with the lid off to boil off some of the water.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 6 servings. Each dish gets cup of rice and you can divide the stew evenly between the 6 containers. Top each dish with the chopped green onions.

Brazilian

  • Stewed Pork and Beans
  • Frango Assado
  • Pão de Queijo - Traditional
  • Brazilian Chicken Stroganoff

Stewed Pork and Beans

Stewed Pork and Beans made using ham, pork, sausage, and black beans. This recipe was inspired by the Brazilian dish Feijoada but I adapted it to make it a bit more meal prep friendly. The traditional dish is made using many parts of the pig and calabresa sausage which is not easy to find in the States.

CourseCuisineTime - 1 hour
Main DishAmerican, Brazilian, meal prepPrep - 15 minutes
Cook - 45 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
548kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates46g41%
Fat21g18%
Protein44g39%

Ingredients:

For the Stew

  • 14 oz (397 g) smoked turkey sausage
  • lb (227 g) ham steak
  • lb (227 g) pork ribeye
  • 1 can (425 g) black beans 15oz
  • 1 medium (200 g) sweet onion
  • 1 cup (240 g) chicken broth
  • 1 cup (240 g) water
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) oil
  • 1 tbsp (8 g) cornstarch if needed for thickening
  • Salt and pepper to taste

For the Rice

  • 2 cups (375 g) cooked rice

For the Collard Greens

  • 14 oz (397 g) frozen collard greens fresh is fine, frozen is just easier to find
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) oil
  • 1 tsp (3 g) garlic powder
  • salt and pepper to taste

Instructions:

For the Rice

  1. Cook enough rice to have 2 cups of cooked rice. 1 cup of dry rice will yield about 2-3 cups of cooked rice depending on what kind you use.

For the Stew

  1. Cut your onion into a small dice and saut in oil over medium high heat until it has begun to develop color and soften.
  2. While the onion is cooking you can cut your pork and ham into a large dice. Cut the sausage into rings on a bias.
  3. Once the onions have developed color, add in the pork ribeye and allow to develop color on all sides, then add in the ham and sausage and do the same.
  4. Pour in the chicken broth, water, and black beans. Reduce the heat to low, cover with a lid and allow to cook for 15-20 minutes.
  5. After the 20 minutes if your mixture is still quite liquidy, you can remove the lid and boil off some of the water to thicken it or you can make a cornstarch slurry by mixing equal parts of cornstarch and cold water. Stir that into the mixture to thicken.
  6. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

For the Collard Greens

  1. The Brazilian dish Feijoada is traditionally served with a collard green like vegetable. Many of you know that I despise leafy greens. Collard greens are no different. I put them in this recipe for variation from my normal vegetables I use and for tradition. If you don't like collard greens, swap them out for anything else.
  2. If you're using frozen collard greens, thaw them out in the microwave according to the packaging. Drain as much of the water away as possible.
  3. In a pan over medium heat, add some oil and saut the collard greens. Cook for a few minutes and season with salt, pepper, and garlic powder.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide your ingredients evenly between the 5 containers. Each dish gets cup of rice.

Frango Assado

Frango Assado is a Brazilian dish comprised of chicken and traditionally served with rice, beans, and farofa. Farofa is used for flavor and texture and is usually made from cassava flour but it can be hard to find in the US. When I lived in So Paulo I would eat this meal multiple times per week. It's one of those nostalgic foods for me.

CourseCuisineTime - 1 hour 35 minutes 1 hour 35 minutes
Main DishBrazilian, meal prepPrep - 1 hour 1 hour
Cook - 35 minutes 35 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
442kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates38g40%
Fat13g13%
Protein42g45%

Ingredients:

For the Chicken

  • 2.5 lbs (1135 g) boneless skinless chicken thighs
  • 1 (1 ) lime
  • 2 tsp (6 g) chili powder
  • 2 tsp (2 g) oregano
  • 2 tsp (6 g) cumin
  • 1 tsp (3 g) paprika
  • 1 tsp (3 g) salt

For the Beans

  • 2 cans (795 g) pinto beans
  • medium (100 g) onion
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) garlic
  • tbsp (7 ml) olive oil
  • cup (160 ml) chicken broth
  • 2 tsp (2 g) basil
  • 2 tsp (6 g) paprika
  • Salt and pepper to taste

For the Rice

  • 1 cup (180 g) dry rice
  • (100 g) onion
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) garlic
  • tbsp (7 ml) olive oil
  • 2 cups (240 ml) water
  • Salt and pepper to taste

For the Farofa

  • 3 tbsp (30 g) cornmeal
  • tbsp (7 ml) olive oil
  • Salt and pepper to taste
  • 2 (120 g) tomatoes

Instructions:

For the Chicken

  1. Mix all of the chicken spices and juice from the lime in a ziplock bag. Add the chicken. Marinate at least 1 hour.
  2. Bake at 400F for 20-22 min.

For the Rice

  1. Dice onion and mince garlic.
  2. Add oil to a pan and add onion and 1 tbsp of garlic. Cook until onion is translucent.
  3. Add dry rice and allow to brown a bit. Add water, bring to a boil and reduce to simmer. Cover for 20 minutes. Salt and pepper to taste.

For the Beans

  1. In another pan add oil and saut other half of onion and 1 tbsp of garlic until translucent. Add in of beans and mash.
  2. Pour in broth and remaining beans. Allow them to thicken and add the seasonings.

For the Farofa

  1. Add oil to a skillet and mix in cornmeal. Cook until it has toasted. Season with salt and pepper.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide ingredients evenly 5 ways.

Po de Queijo - Traditional

Po de queijo is a popular Brazilian treat that is Portuguese for cheese bread. Whats great about these is that they are gluten free so even those who are gluten sensitive can enjoy them!

CourseCuisineTime - 40 minutes 25 minutes
SnackBrazilian, meal prepPrep - 20 minutes 5 minutes
Cook - 20 minutes 20 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
63kcal13
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates7.3g66%
Fat3.2g29%
Protein1.2g10%

Ingredients:

  • 1 cups (180 g) tapioca flour check the health aisles at your store or on Amazon
  • cup (28 g) shredded parmesan cheese
  • 2 tbsp (20 g) shredded mozzarella cheese
  • tsp (2 g) salt
  • cup (60 ml) olive oil
  • cup (144 g) skim milk
  • 1 egg

Instructions:

  1. Preheat your oven to 400F.
  2. Mix all of your ingredients in a blender until the ingredients are homogenized.
  3. Spray two mini muffin tins with oil and fill each well about half way with the batter. It will make about 24 pieces.
  4. Bake for 20 minutes or until golden brown.
  5. These are best after they have rested for a while. The day after is when I prefer to eat them because they become much softer.

Brazilian Chicken Stroganoff

This is the Brazilian version of of the classic stroganoff dish. It contains chicken and mushrooms in a wine and cream sauce and served over rice instead of noodles.

CourseCuisineTime - 1 hour 20 minutes 1 hour 20 minutes 1 hour 20 minutes
Main DishBrazilian, meal prepPrep - 20 minutes 20 minutes 20 minutes
Cook - 1 hour 1 hour 1 hour

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
692kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates77g51%
Fat19g12%
Protein54g36%

Ingredients:

For the Stroganoff

  • 2 lbs (1135 g) boneless skinless chicken breast
  • medium (100 g) sweet onion
  • 2 Tbsp (30 g) garlic minced
  • 3 Tbsp (45 ml) olive oil
  • cup (120 ml) dry white wine
  • 1 cups (360 ml) chicken stock
  • cup (180 ml) tomato sauce
  • 1 Tbsp (14 g) butter
  • 8 oz (227 g) white mushrooms
  • 1 cup (227 g) nonfat plain greek yogurt
  • 1 Tbsp (15 g) Dijon mustard
  • cup (5 g) cilantro chopped
  • 1 large bunch (500 g) broccoli
  • 7 cups (1125 g) cooked rice

Instructions:

For the Chicken

  1. Heat a skillet over medium high heat and add 1 Tbsp of olive oil.
  2. Pat the chicken dry with a paper towel and cut into strips around inch thick, season the chicken with salt and pepper.
  3. Fry the chicken in the pan in batches to ensure the pan isnt overcrowded and you achieve proper browning on the meat. Add oil as necessary. You dont need to cook it all of the way through, just achieve proper browning on the meat.
  4. Dice of a sweet onion while the chicken is cooking.
  5. After all of the chicken has cooked, set it aside and add another tablespoon of olive oil to the pan. Add the onion and garlic and cook for 5 minutes.
  6. Add the chicken back to the pan and pour in cup of white wine. Cook until the wine is almost dissolved and turn the heat to low.
  7. Add the tomato sauce and chicken broth to the pan. Partially cover the pan, turn the heat to low, and cook for 35-40 minutes.
  8. Heat a new skillet over medium-medium high heat. Add 1 Tbsp of butter to the skillet and saut the mushrooms until brown and soft.
  9. Once your chicken mixture has cooked for 45 minutes, remove the pan from the heat and add the mushrooms, 1 cup of greek yogurt, cup chopped cilantro, and 1 Tbsp of dijon mustard. Stir to incorporate.

For the Broccoli

  1. In a large pot, add 1 inch of water and steam the broccoli using a steamer basket. Cook on high heat, covered for 5-7 minutes or until the broccoli is soft.
  2. This recipe makes 5 servings. Add cup of rice to each container and split the chicken and broccoli evenly. If you have extra sauce remaining, pour it over the broccoli.

For the Rice

  1. Cook enough rice to have 7 cups of cooked rice using your preferred method. 1 cup of uncooked rice will yield around 3 cups of cooked rice.

**For the Rice **

  1. Cook enough rice to yield 1 cups of cooked rice. 1 cup of dry rice will make around 2-3 cups of cooked rice.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Split the chicken and broccoli evenly. Each dish gets cup of rice. If you have extra sauce remaining, pour it over the broccoli.

Mediterranean

  • Mediterranean Chicken Wraps
  • Mediterranean Chicken Rice Bowls
  • Mediterranean Quinoa Bowls

Mediterranean Chicken Wraps

Mediterranean Chicken Wraps made with marinated chicken thighs, lettuce, cucumbers, tomatoes, and red onion dressed in a vinaigrette. A layer of hummus is spread over a tortilla and filled with the chicken and vegetables.

CourseCuisineTime - 1 hour
Main DishMediterraneanPrep - 45 minutes
Cook - 20 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
494kcal6 wraps
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates47g47%
Fat19g19%
Protein34g34%

Ingredients:

For the Chicken

  • 2 lbs (908 g) boneless skinless chicken thighs
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) oil
  • 1 tsp (3 g) onion powder
  • 1 tsp (3 g) garlic powder
  • 1 tsp (3 g) ginger
  • 1 tsp (3 g) cumin
  • 1 tsp (4 g) salt
  • 1 tsp (2 g) pepper
  • 1 tsp (1 g) oregano
  • tsp (1 g) cayenne pepper
  • 2 tbsp (30 ml) lemon juice

For the Vegetables

  • 1 medium (200 g) cucumber
  • 4 (240 g) Roma tomatoes
  • 1 medium (200 g) red onion
  • 1 tbsp (15 ml) vinegar
  • tbsp (7 ml) olive oil
  • salt to taste

For the Lettuce

  • 2 heads (340 g) romaine lettuce
  • tbsp (7 g) olive oil
  • 1 tbsp (15 ml) vinegar
  • salt to taste

For the Wraps

  • 6 12" (420 g) tortillas gluten free if needed
  • 6 tbsp (96 g) hummus store bought is fine
  • 6 tbsp (42 g) feta cheese

Instructions:

For the Chicken

  1. Preheat your oven to 425F.
  2. Mix together all of the seasonings, oil and lemon juice. Add the chicken and mix thoroughly. Allow to marinate for at least 30 minutes.
  3. Add the chicken to a sheet pan and cook for 10 minutes.
  4. Turn the oven to broil and move the chicken to the top rack. Cook for an additional 5-8 minutes to brown the tops of the chicken. Be sure to watch it closely and check on it often to make sure it is not burning.
  5. Remove from the oven when the chicken has browned properly and allow to rest.
  6. Cut the chicken into thin slices.

For the Vegetables and Lettuce

  1. Wash and cut the cucumber and tomatoes into a small dice. Deseed each of them before cutting.
  2. Cut the red onion into thin slices.
  3. Add all of the vegetables to a bowl and add the vinegar, oil, and salt. Stir and allow to incorporate.
  4. Wash and cut the lettuce into thin strips. Add oil, vinegar and salt to taste.

For the Wrap

  1. Spread some hummus onto each tortilla and add chicken, lettuce, the vegetable mix, and feta to each wrap.

Notes

  1. The nutrition information listed is an estimate for if you make 6 wraps from the ingredients listed. It is very difficult to get accurate values for nutritional values on recipes like this. Some of you may stuff your wrap differently than I do and it's possible you get 8 wraps out of the ingredients. It is my recommendation that you just enjoy this recipe without worrying about the nutritional information. If you do need it, i would calculate it for yourself depending on all of your ingredients. The info listed here will be close, but it will be better to do it on your own.
  2. If you are going to meal prep these, don't make the burritos until you are ready to eat them. The tomato and cucumber mix can be prepped ahead of time and kept in the fridge but I wouldn't dress the lettuce in advance as it will get soggy.

Mediterranean Chicken Rice Bowls

Chicken thighs, zucchini, mushrooms and rice mixed together in a Greek dressing and served with a side of hummus and marinated vegetables.

CourseCuisineTime - 1 hour 10 minutes 1 hour 10 minutes 1 hour 10 minutes
Main Dishmeal prep, MediterraneanPrep - 30 minutes 30 minutes 30 minutes
Cook - 40 minutes 40 minutes 40 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
676kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates56g41%
Fat28g20%
Protein50g37%

Ingredients:

For the Dressing

  • 3 tbsp (45 g) olive oil
  • 3 tbsp (45 ml) red wine vinegar
  • 2 tbsp (30 ml) lemon juice
  • 2 cloves (10 g) garlic
  • 1 tsp (2 g) oregano
  • tsp (1 g) salt
  • tsp (1 g) pepper
  • 1 tsp (5 g) dijon

For the Bowls

  • 2 lbs (1135 g) boneless skinless chicken thighs
  • 5 cups (750 g) cooked rice
  • cup (68 g) black olives sliced
  • 1 medium (200 g ) tomato
  • medium (100 g) cucumber
  • small (35 g) red onion
  • 2 small (400 g) zucchini
  • 8 oz (227 g) mushrooms
  • 10 tbsp (140 g) hummus store bought is easiest
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) olive oil
  • 5 tbsp (50 g) crumbled feta cheese

Instructions:

For the Rice

  1. Cook enough rice to yield 5 cups of cooked rice. 1 cup of dry rice will yield around 2-3 cups of cooked rice depending on the type of rice you use.

For the Dressing

  1. In a jar or a bowl, add all of the ingredients and shake/whisk until the oil has emulsified.

For the Chicken

  1. Place your chicken thighs into a large ziplock bag and pour half of the dressing over the top. Shake to mix and remove as much air from the bag as possible. Marinate for at least 20 minutes.
  2. Heat a grill pan or a skillet over medium high heat. Cook the chicken for 3-4 minutes each side. Cook it in batches if necessary.
  3. Cut the chicken into bite sized pieces and return to the hot pan to develop color on all sides, about 2-3 minutes.

For the Vegetables

  1. While the chicken is cooking, wash all of your vegetables.
  2. Cut the cucumber in half longways and remove the seeds. Cut into a small dice.
  3. Cut the red onion and tomato into a small dice.
  4. Cut the zucchini and mushrooms into a large dice.
  5. In a large skillet, add some olive oil over medium high heat. Add the zucchini and cook for 3-4 minutes or until they start to develop some color. Add the mushrooms and salt. Cook until the mushrooms have developed color and place into a large bowl.

For the Vegetable Dressing

  1. Mix together the cucumber, of the tomatoes, and red onion and place into a strainer and add salt. This will pull some of the excess water out.
  2. Drain the water and pour the vegetables into a bowl. Pour of the remaining dressing from your jar over the top and mix.

For the Bowls

  1. Measure out 3 cups of cooked rice and add to the large bowl with the zucchini and mushrooms.
