  2. Add in the chicken, remaining tomatoes, drained olives, and the remaining dressing to the bowl. Mix and season with salt and pepper to taste.
  3. In smaller separate containers, add 2 tbsp of hummus and some of the vegetables that have been marinating in the dressing. You may have extra.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide your ingredients evenly 5 ways. Each dish gets a hummus/vegetable side. Top with feta cheese.

Mediterranean Quinoa Bowls

This dish packs a ton of flavor into every bite. The tangy vinegar flavor in the beef, the feta cheese topping, and the hummus make for a number of flavors layered into every bite. The paring of beef and quinoa is a satiating combination that will leave you full, longer.

CourseCuisineTime - 40 minutes 40 minutes 40 minutes
Main DishMediterraneanPrep - 10 minutes 10 minutes 10 minutes
Cook - 30 minutes 30 minutes 30 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
726kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates46g35%
Fat40g30%
Protein45g34%

Ingredients:

For the Beef Mixture

  • 2 lbs (908 g) ground beef 85/15
  • 2 (120 g) Roma tomatoes
  • 2 tbsp (28 g) red wine vinegar
  • 5 tsp (10 g) feta cheese

For the Quinoa

  • 5 cups (875 g) cooked quinoa

For the Roasted Vegetables

  • 1 medium (250 g) zucchini
  • 1 medium (250 g) yellow squash
  • 1 medium (150 g) red bell pepper
  • 2 tsp (4 g) oregano dried
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) olive oil
  • 10 tbsp (150 g) hummus I use storebought, you can make it if you wish

Instructions:

For the Quinoa

  1. Measure out enough quinoa to yield 5 cups of cooked quinoa. 1 cup of dried quinoa will make 2-3 cups of cooked quinoa.
  2. Rinse the quinoa under water until the water runs clear. Do not skip this step as quinoa has a coating called saponin which will result in a bitter, unpleasant flavor if not rinsed off.
  3. Add2cup of quinoa and3cups of water to a pot. Bring to a boil, then lower the heat to simmer and cover. Cook for 15 minutes, remove from heat to rest for 5 minutes. Uncover and fluff with a fork.

For the Roasted Vegetables

  1. Preheat your oven to 425F.
  2. Wash and cut the vegetables into a large dice. Toss the vegetables with 1 of oil, 2 tsp of oregano, and salt and pepper.
  3. Bake for 10 minutes, flip, and bake an additional 6-8 minutes.

For the Beef

  1. Heat a large skillet over medium high heat. Add the beef and cook until it has browned. Drain the fat from the pan.
  2. Wash and cut the tomatoes into a small dice. Remove the seeds.
  3. Season the beef with salt and pepper, add in 2 tbsp of red wine vinegar, and the diced tomatoes. Mix and adjust flavors as needed.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Add 1 cup of quinoa to each dish. Divide your ingredients evenly 5 ways. Add a 2 tbsp serving of hummus in a smaller separate container to each dish and sprinkle a light dusting of feta cheese over the top.

Japanese

  • Chicken Katsu Ramen
  • Chicken Katsu
  • Japanese Curry
  • Katsudon

Chicken Katsu Ramen

Chicken Katsu served over ramen noodles and broth for a quick 15 minute snack if you have the chicken katsu prepped in your freezer.

CourseCuisineTime - 15 minutes
Main Dish, SnackJapanesePrep - 5 minutes
Cook - 10 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
513kcal1 serving
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates61.8g55%
Fat11.6g10%
Protein40.4g36%

Ingredients:

  • 2 oz (70 g) ramen noodles gluten free if needed
  • 3 oz (85 g) chicken katsu
  • 1 egg
  • cup (30 g) shredded carrots
  • 1 tbsp (10 g) green onions sliced
  • 1 tsp (5 g) soy sauce
  • tsp (2 g) chicken bouillon
  • 1 cup (240 ml) chicken stock or bone broth

Instructions:

For the Egg

  1. Start a pot of water over high heat and bring to a boil. Add in the egg and boil for 1 minute.
  2. Add a lid and remove from the heat. Let rest for 6-8 minutes then rinse with cold water to stop the cooking. Remove from shell.

For the Ramen

  1. In a pot bring the chicken stock, soy sauce, and chicken bouillon to a light boil.
  2. Once boiling add in the noodles and cook until soft.
  3. Cut your green onions on a bias and shred the carrots into ribbons
  4. Reheat your katsu in the air fryer on 400F until it is heated through. Cut into slices. The recipe for the Katsu is linked in the ingredient list above. I have this in my freezer as part of Snack City at all times to make it easy for uses like this.
  5. Once the noodles have finished, add the broth and noodles to a bowl. Top with the carrots, egg, chicken and green onions.

Chicken Katsu

Use this recipe to prep your Katsu ahead of time. You can store it in the freezer and be minutes away from Katsudon any time youd like to make it.

CourseCuisineTime - 1 hour
Main DishJapanesePrep - 30 minutes
Cook - 30 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
134kcal12 pieces
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates9.8g35%
Fat3.3g11%
Protein16.2g57%

Ingredients:

For the Chicken Katsu

  • 2 lbs (908 g) boneless skinless chicken breast
  • cup (60 g) cornstarch
  • cup (100 g) ground cornflakes or panko
  • salt and pepper
  • 2 eggs
  • 2 tbsp (30 ml) water
  • (5 g) Oil spray

Instructions:

For the Katsu

  1. Take your chicken breasts and slice them into thin pieces so they are about " thick. You can take the back of your knife and use it as a tenderizer to help pound the pieces thinner and to even them out.
  2. Season lightly with salt and pepper.
  3. Prepare your breading station for the chicken. Place the corn chex into a food processor or blender to create a flour and put into a bowl. Crack the eggs into a bowl and mix in the water to thin it out. Scramble. Prepare a bowl of the corn starch.
  4. Dunk the chicken into the corn starch, shake off excess. Then dunk into the eggs, drain the excess. Then place into the corn chex and cover all portions of the meat. Shake off the excess. Place on a sheet pan when finished. Repeat for all pieces of chicken.
  5. Preheat your air fryer to 400F on the air fry setting. Add the chicken and spray the top lightly with oil. Fry for 10 minutes, flipping halfway and checking on it occasionally.

Storage

  1. Allow the cutlets to cool and place in a ziplock bag, removing as much air as possible. Keep in the freezer.
  2. Reheat in the air fryer when you are ready to eat them again.

Nutrition Note

  1. I got 12 pieces from 2 pounds of chicken. You may find that you have more or less so keep that in mind for the nutrition estimates. The recipe also calls for 60g of corn starch and 100g of corn chex. I used 50g of corn starch and 85g of corn chex and that is reflected in the nutrition information. I wrote the recipe to have extra because there is nothing worse than running out of breading materials.

Japanese Curry

*Chicken thighs, potatoes and carrots make up this Japanese Curry. The "stewy" quality of Japanese Curry makes for a perfect meal prep meal that reheats like a dream in the microwave. Japanese Curry has a bit more umami flavor than Indian Curry and is more mild in flavor profile, making it the superior curry in my opinion *

CourseCuisineTime - 1 hour 1 hour 1 hour
Main DishAsian, Japanese, meal prepPrep - 20 minutes 20 minutes 20 minutes
Cook - 40 minutes 40 minutes 40 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
601kcal5 servings
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates70g53%
Fat15g11%
Protein46g35%

Ingredients:

  • 2 lbs (908 g) boneless skinless chicken thighs
  • medium (100 g) onion
  • tbsp (8 g) garlic minced
  • lb (227 g) carrots
  • lb (341 g) potatoes
  • 5 cups (750 g) cooked rice
  • 1 lb (454 g) frozen broccoli
  • 2 tbsp (12 g) curry powder
  • 1 tbsp (12 g) cornstarch
  • 1 tbsp (22 g) cold water
  • 2 tbsp (30 g) olive oil
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) soy sauce

Instructions:

For the Rice

  1. Cook enough rice to yield 5 cups of cooked rice. 1 cup of dry rice will make around 2-3 cups of cooked rice depending on what type of rice you use.

For the Curry

  1. Wash and cut your potatoes, carrots, and onion. Peel the carrots and potatoes. Cut the potatoes into a large dice (around inch cubes), your carrots into thin rounds, and the onion into a small dice.
  2. In a large pot over medium high heat, add 1 tbsp of oil and add the onions. Season lightly with salt and allow them to cook for 1-2 minutes then add in the curry powder and stir, add the remaining oil as needed.
  3. Make room in the bottom of your pot and add the chicken and garlic, use more of the remaining oil as needed. Allow the chicken to cook for around 3 minutes on each side to develop color.
  4. Add 1 cup of water to the pot and reduce the heat to medium. Allow the chicken to cook in the water for around 10 minutes to finish the cooking process. Flip half way through.
  5. Remove the chicken from the pot and set aside. Add in the carrots and potatoes with an extra 1 cups of water, cover the pot and cook for 10-15 minutes or until the carrots and potatoes have softened.
  6. While the curry is stewing, cut the chicken into bite size pieces. If you find that the chicken isn't cooked all of the way through, that's okay, we are going to be adding it back to the pot.
  7. In a bowl, mix together the cornstarch and cold water to form a slurry. Once the carrots and potatoes have softened, slowly drizzle in the cornstarch slurry to the mix while constantly stirring. This will thicken the sauce.
  8. Add the chopped chicken back to the pot and stir in the soy sauce. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

For the Broccoli

  1. Cook your frozen broccoli according to the packaging. I use the microwave for ease but feel free to use fresh broccoli if you wish. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide your ingredients evenly between your 5 and add cup of rice to each.

Katsudon

Katsudon is a traditional Japanese dish made from a fried meat cutlet, scrambled egg, onions, sauce and served over rice. If you prep the rice and fried chicken ahead of times this dish can be prepped in minutes.

CourseCuisineTime - 30 minutes 1 hour
Main DishJapanesePrep - 10 minutes 30 minutes
Cook - 30 minutes 30 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
134kcal2 pieces
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates9.8g35%
Fat3.3g11%
Protein16.2g57%

Ingredients:

For the Rice

  • 1 cups (225 g) cooked rice

For the Chicken

  • lb (150 g) chicken breast
  • 2 tbsp (12 g) cornstarch
  • cup (50 g) ground corn chex or panko
  • salt to taste
  • egg

For the Sauce

  • 1 cup (240 ml) chicken stock
  • 2 tbsp (30 ml) rice vinegar
  • 2 tbsp (30 ml) soy sauce
  • 2 tsp (8 g) sugar
  • medium (50 g) sweet onion
  • 2 eggs

For the Chicken Katsu

  • 2 lbs (908 g) boneless skinless chicken breast
  • cup (60 g) cornstarch
  • cup (100 g) ground cornflakes or panko
  • salt and pepper
  • 2 eggs
  • 2 tbsp (30 ml) water
  • (5 g) Oil spray

Instructions:

For the Rice

  1. Cook enough rice to have1cups of cooked rice. 1 cup of dry rice will yield about 3 cups of cooked rice.

For the Chicken

  1. Pound/cut the chicken out until it is about " thick.
  2. Season lightly with salt.
  3. Prepare your breading station for the chicken. You can prep these ahead of time and keep them in the freezer, it will make for an easy dinner when you need it. Place the corn chex into a food processor or blender to create a flour and put into a bowl. Crack an egg into a bowl and reserve half of it for later. Add a bit of water to thin it out. Scramble.
  4. Sprinkle the cornstarch over the chicken and rub to cover the meat on all sides.
  5. Dunk the chicken into the egg wash and then coat with the cornflakes.
  6. Preheat your air fryer to 400F on the air fry setting. Fry for 14-15 minutes, flipping halfway and checking on it occasionally.
  7. If you decide to prep extra, allow them to cool and store in a ziplock bag in the freezer. Reheat in the air fryer when you are ready to eat them again.

For the Sauce

  1. While the meat is cooking, cut your onion into slices.
  2. Measure out cup of rice and place into two bowls.
  3. You can make more than one serving at a time but its easiest to do one because you are going to pour the contents of the pan right over your bowl of rice, so you won't have to mess with dividing it if you cook one at a time.
  4. Heat the oil over medium high heat in a small skillet. Add half of the onions and cook for 3-5 minutes, stirring occasionally until they have browned. (If you're doing both servings at once, use all of the onions.)
  5. While the onions are cooking, measure out the the chicken stock, soy sauce, rice vinegar, and sugar in a bowl. Mix to combine.
  6. In the bowl with the of an egg, crack another egg and scramble.
  7. Once the onion has browned, pour in half of the sauce and bring to a light boil. (If you're doing both servings at once, pour in all of the sauce.)
  8. Cut the chicken into thin slices and place one cutlet into the pan over the sauce. Pour half of the eggs around the chicken and cover with a lid. (If you're doing both servings at once, pour in all of the eggs and use both chicken cutlets.)
  9. Cook for 1-2 minutes or until the egg has set.
  10. Pour the contents of the pan over the rice and top with green onions. (Divide the ingredients of the pan over both rice bowls if you make it all at once)

For the Katsu

  1. Take your chicken breasts and slice them into thin pieces so they are about " thick. You can take the back of your knife and use it as a tenderizer to help pound the pieces thinner and to even them out.
  2. Season lightly with salt and pepper.
  3. Prepare your breading station for the chicken. Place the corn chex into a food processor or blender to create a flour and put into a bowl. Crack the eggs into a bowl and mix in the water to thin it out. Scramble. Prepare a bowl of the corn starch.
  4. Dunk the chicken into the corn starch, shake off excess. Then dunk into the eggs, drain the excess. Then place into the corn chex and cover all portions of the meat. Shake off the excess. Place on a sheet pan when finished. Repeat for all pieces of chicken.
  5. Preheat your air fryer to 400F on the air fry setting. Add the chicken and spray the top lightly with oil. Fry for 10 minutes, flipping halfway and checking on it occasionally.

Storage

  1. Allow the cutlets to cool and place in a ziplock bag, removing as much air as possible. Keep in the freezer.
  2. Reheat in the air fryer when you are ready to eat them again.

Nutrition Note

  1. I got 12 pieces from 2 pounds of chicken. You may find that you have more or less so keep that in mind for the nutrition estimates. The recipe also calls for 60g of corn starch and 100g of corn chex. I used 50g of corn starch and 85g of corn chex and that is reflected in the nutrition information. I wrote the recipe to have extra because there is nothing worse than running out of breading materials.

Hungarian

  • Chicken Paprikash

Chicken Paprikash

Chicken Paprikash is a popular, paprika heavy Hungarian dish that is traditionally served with noodles or rice. Often times it is served with the chicken on the bone but for meal prep purposes we use boneless skinless chicken thighs to make eating as easy as possible.

CourseCuisineTime - 50 minutes 50 minutes 50 minutes
Main DishHungarian, meal prepPrep - 10 minutes 10 minutes 10 minutes
Cook - 40 minutes 40 minutes 40 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
612kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates58g45%
Fat20g15%
Protein50g39%

Ingredients:

For the Rice

  • 5 cups (750 g) cooked rice
  • 3 tbsp olive oil

For the Chicken

  • 2 lbs (1135 g) boneless skinless chicken thighs
  • 1 tbsp (15 ml) olive oil
  • medium (100 g) onion
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) minced garlic
  • 3 tbsp (24 g) paprika
  • 1 tsp (3 g) chili powder
  • 15 oz (425 g) crushed tomatoes
  • 1 cup (240 ml) chicken broth
  • cup (113 g) plain nonfat Greek yogurt
  • Salt and pepper to taste

For the Broccoli

  • 1 lb (454 g) broccoli florets

Instructions:

For the Rice

  1. Cook enough rice to yield 5 cups of cooked rice. 1 cup of dry rice will yield around 3 cups of cooked rice depending on what kind of rice you use. Mix in the olive oil and season lightly with salt.

For the Chicken

  1. Measure out your yogurt and place it on the counter while you cook everything else so that it can come up to room temperature.
  2. Heat some olive oil in a large skillet over medium high heat. Add in the chicken thighs and cook for 3-4 minutes on each side.
  3. After the chicken has cooked, cut it into a large dice and return back to the pan to develop color on all sides.
  4. While the chicken is cooking cut your onion into a small dice and mince your garlic.
  5. After the chicken has finished cooking, remove it from the pan. You should have plenty of oil remaining in the skillet to cook the onions and garlic.
  6. Add the onions and garlic and sautee for a couple of minutes. Sprinkle the paprika and chili powder over the onions and toast the spices for a bit. Make sure you are constantly stirring as the spices can burn rather quickly.
  7. Pour in the tomatoes and chicken broth and bring to a light boil. Lower the heat to low and allow the sauce to reduce and thicken. It will probably take 10-15 minutes.
  8. After the sauce has thickened, stir one spoonful of the hot tomato mixture into the yogurt to bring it up to temperature. If you pour the yogurt directly into the sauce it will curdle the milk and become grainy.
  9. Add spoonfuls of the yogurt to the skillet slowly and stir to incorporate. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

For the Broccoli

  1. Steam the broccoli for 4-5 minutes until it has softened a bit but is not mushy. (I reccommend cutting the broccoli into small pieces and just throwing the broccoli in with the tomato sauce while it reduces, but this won't be as pretty to look at)

Greek

  • Mediterranean Turkey Bowls
  • Greek Salad
  • Chicken Souvlaki & Roasted Vegetables

Mediterranean Turkey Bowls

Ground turkey, tomatoes, olives, and spinach mixed in a red wine sauce to give a tangy flavor that works great for meal prep. This dish is served with a side of lemon rice and tzatziki sauce.

CourseCuisineTime - 35 minutes 35 minutes 35 minutes
Main DishGreek, meal prepPrep - 10 minutes 10 minutes 10 minutes
Cook - 25 minutes 25 minutes 25 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
695kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates51g39%
Fat35g26%
Protein44g33%

Ingredients:

For the Turkey

  • 2 lbs (908 g) ground beef 85/15
  • 1 tbsp (22 ml) olive oil
  • 3 tbsp (45 ml) red wine vinegar
  • cup (100 g) black olives canned
  • 4 (240 g) Roma tomatoes seeded
  • 1 cups (100 g) spinach chopped, frozen
  • 1 tsp (3 g) onion powder
  • 1 tsp (3 g) garlic powder

For the Rice

  • 5 cups (750 g) cooked rice
  • 2 tbsp (30 ml) olive oil
  • 4 tbsp (60 ml) lemon juice

For the Tzatziki Sauce

  • 10 tbsp (300 g) Tzatziki sauce I use storebought, you can make it if needed

Instructions:

For the Turkey

  1. Heat 1 tbsp of oil in a skillet over medium high heat. Add in the beef and brown.
  2. While the beef is cooking, cut the tomatoes into a medium dice. Cut out the seeds. Cut the olives as well if you bought whole ones.
  3. Once the beef has browned, add in the tomatoes, olives, tbsp of olive oil, red wine vinegar, chopped spinach, onion powder, and garlic powder. I use frozen, chopped spinach because it's easier but fresh spinach is fine. Just make sure you allow it to wilt a bit in the pan so you aren't left with huge leaves.
  4. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

For the Rice

  1. Cook enough rice to have 5 cups of cooked rice. 1 cup of dry rice will make between 2-3 cups depending on which kind you choose.
  2. Once the rice has finished cooking, measure out 5 cups of cooked rice and add in 2 tbsp of olive oil and 4 tbsp of lemon juice. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

For the Tzatziki Sauce

  1. I use a storebought Tzatziki sauce for ease but you can make it if you need to. There is a recipe included with the Chicken Souvlaki recipe linked here https://mealprepmanual.com/chicken-souvlaki-with-roasted-vegetables/

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide your ingredients evenly 5 ways and add 2 tbsp of Tzatziki sauce to each.

Greek Salad

Cucumber, red onion, red pepper, green olives, and feta cheese dressed in an garlic and olive oil dressing. A nice dish to keep in your fridge as a healthy snack.

CourseCuisineTime - 15 minutes
SnackGreek, meal prepPrep - 15 minutes
Cook - null

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
172kcal10
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates6.8g30%
Fat14.9g67%
Protein2.9g13%

Ingredients:

  • 1 large (300 g) cucumber
  • 1 large (200 g) red pepper
  • medium (100 g) red onion
  • 3 (180 g) Roma tomatoes
  • cup (100 g) green olives
  • 4 oz (113 g) feta cheese
  • 2 tsp (10 g) garlic
  • 1 tsp (2 g) oregano
  • cup (60 ml) red wine vinegar
  • cup (120 ml) olive oil
  • tsp (2.5 g) dijon mustard
  • 1 tsp (3 g) salt
  • tsp (1 g) pepper

Instructions:

  1. Cut the cucumber, red pepper, and tomatoes in half and remove all of the seeds. Cut the cucumber, red pepper, and tomatoes into a large dice. Add the cucumber and red pepper to a large bowl.
  2. In a strainer, add the tomatoes and sprinkle with salt. This will encourage the tomatoes to release some of their water.
  3. Cut the red onion into small slices around thick and add to the bowl.
  4. Add the olives to the bowl.
  5. In a smaller bowl, whisk together cup olive oil, red wine vinegar, tsp dijon mustard, 1 tsp oregano, 2 tsp minced garlic and salt and pepper to taste. Pour over the vegetables in the large bowl and add the feta cheese. Toss lightly and allow everything to blend together for 20-30 minutes before eating.
  6. Plating
  7. This recipe makes 10 servings. Divide it evenly 10 ways.

Chicken Souvlaki & Roasted Vegetables

Grilled chicken marinated in lemon juice and seasonings served with roasted vegetables and tzatziki sauce. This is a great low carb meal with lots of fresh flavors.

CourseCuisineTime - 1 hour 1 hour
Main DishGreek, meal prepPrep - 30 minutes 30 minutes
Cook - 30 minutes 30 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
616kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates53g39%
Fat16g11%
Protein65g48%

Ingredients:

For the Chicken

  • 3 lbs (1362 g) boneless skinless chicken breast
  • 4 Tbsp (60 g) garlic minced
  • (100 g) red onion
  • 1 Tbsp (2 g) oregano
  • 2 Tbsp (30 ml) lemon juice
  • 2 Tbsp (30 ml) olive oil
  • 2 tsp (6 g) salt
  • 1 tsp (2 g) pepper

For the Roasted Vegetables

  • 2 (300 g) red peppers
  • 8 oz (227 g) mushrooms
  • 2 (400 g) zucchinis
  • 2 Tbsp (30 g) garlic minced
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) Balsamic vinegar
  • Salt and pepper to taste

For the Tzatziki Sauce

  • 1 cup (227 g) plain non fat Greek yogurt
  • 1 tsp (5 g) garlic minced
  • 1 small (100 g) cucumber
  • 1 Tbsp (2 g) dried dill
  • Lemon juice to taste
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) olive oil
  • Salt and pepper to taste

For the Rice

  • 5 cups (675 g) cooked rice

Instructions:

  1. Cut the chicken into a large dice, around 1-2 inches
  2. In a large ziplock bag combine the chicken, 4 Tbsp of minced garlic, of a diced red onion, 1 Tbsp oregano, the juice of 1 lemon, 2 Tbsp olive oil, 2 tsp of salt and 1 tsp of pepper. Let it marinate in the refrigerator for at least 20 minutes.
  3. While the chicken is marinating, preheat your oven to 400F and cut the vegetables into a large dice. Try to make them all the same size.
  4. Spread out the vegetables on a sheet pan and sprinkle with salt and pepper, add 2 Tbsp of minced garlic and 1 Tbsp of balsamic vinegar. Roast for 10-12 minutes.
  5. Prepare the tzatziki sauce by combining all of the ingredients together and mix thoroughly. Store this in a separate container as you dont want to reheat it in the microwave.
  6. After the chicken is done marinating, heat a grill pan or skillet over medium high heat. If you prefer, the chicken can be put on a skewer but this is not necessary and you can just cook it without the skewer.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide all of the ingredients 5 ways and add to your containers.

For the Rice

  1. Cook enough riced to have 5 cups of cooked rice. 1 cup of dry rice yields about 3 cups of cooked rice.
  2. Cut the chicken into a large dice, around 1-2 inches
  3. In a large ziplock bag combine the chicken, 4 Tbsp of minced garlic, of a diced red onion, 1 Tbsp oregano, the juice of 1 lemon, 2 Tbsp olive oil, 2 tsp of salt and 1 tsp of pepper. Let it marinate in the refrigerator for at least 20 minutes.
  4. While the chicken is marinating, preheat your oven to 400F and cut the vegetables into a large dice. Try to make them all the same size.
  5. Spread out the vegetables on a sheet pan and sprinkle with salt and pepper, add 2 Tbsp of minced garlic and 1 Tbsp of balsamic vinegar. Roast for 10-12 minutes.
  6. Prepare the tzatziki sauce by combining all of the ingredients together and mix thoroughly. Store this in a separate container as you dont want to reheat it in the microwave.
  7. After the chicken is done marinating, heat a grill pan or skillet over medium high heat. If you prefer, the chicken can be put on a skewer but this is not necessary and you can just cook it without the skewer.

Middle Eastern

  • Middle Eastern Lentil Soup
  • Chicken Shawarma with Roasted Butternut Squash
  • Baked Falafel
  • Middle Eastern Chicken with Turmeric Rice

Middle Eastern Lentil Soup

Red lentils, onions, and carrots make up the bulk of this soup that is flavored by lemon juice, turmeric, and cumin. You can top this soup with a lemon garlic yogurt sauce for even more flavor.

CourseCuisineTime - 30 minutes
Main DishMiddle EasternPrep - 10 minutes
Cook - 20 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
427kcal4
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates69g69%
Fat4.8g4%
Protein27g27%

Ingredients:

For the Soup

  • 1 medium (200 g) onion
  • 1 cup (150 g) carrots chopped
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) olive oil
  • 2 tsp (6 g) cumin
  • tsp (2 g) turmeric
  • 1 cups (350 g) red lentils
  • 2 cups (480 ml) water
  • 4 cups (960 ml) vegetable broth
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) garlic
  • 3 tbsp (45 ml) lemon juice

For the Yogurt

  • cup (100 g) plain non fat Greek yogurt
  • 1 tsp (5 g) garlic minced
  • (1 ml) Splash of lemon juice
  • Water to thin
  • 1 (60 g) Roma tomato

Instructions:

For the Soup

  1. Cut the onion and carrot into a small dice. Mince the garlic.
  2. Add 1 tbsp of oil to a large stock pot and saut onion, carrot, and garlic for 3-5 minutes.
  3. Add in the turmeric and cumin. Stir.
  4. Add in the lentils, water, and broth. Bring to a boil, cover, and reduce heat to low to simmer for 15 minutes.
  5. Stir in lemon juice and season with salt and pepper to taste.

For the Yogurt

  1. Mix a splash of lemon and garlic into the yogurt. Top the soup with yogurt and tomato.

Chicken Shawarma with Roasted Butternut Squash

A classic middle eastern dish paired with tahini sauce and roasted butternut squash. Tahini is made from ground sesame seeds and for this dish it is mixed with Greek yogurt.

CourseCuisineTime - 1 hour 20 minutes 1 hour 20 minutes 1 hour 20 minutes
Main DishMiddle EasternPrep - 40 minutes 40 minutes 40 minutes
Cook - 40 minutes 40 minutes 40 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
740kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates72g46%
Fat26g16%
Protein56g36%

Ingredients:

For the Chicken

  • 2 lbs (1135 g) boneless skinless chicken thighs
  • 3 Tbsp (45 g) garlic minced
  • cup (60 ml) olive oil
  • 2 Tbsp (30 ml) red wine vinegar
  • 1 Tbsp (8 g) cumin
  • 1 Tbsp (8 g) coriander
  • 1 tsp (3 g) turmeric
  • 1 tsp (2 g) all spice
  • 2 tsp (6 g) salt
  • 1 tsp (2 g) pepper
  • tsp (2 ml) cayenne pepper

For the Tahini Sauce

  • 1 cup (227 g) plain non fat Greek yogurt
  • 3 Tbsp (45 ml) tahini
  • 2 Tbsp (30 ml) lemon juice
  • tsp (1.5 g) salt

For the Squash

  • 1 large (1135 g) butternut squash
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) olive oil
  • 2 tsp (5 g) garlic powder
  • Salt and pepper to taste

For the Rice

  • 5 cups (675 g) cooked rice

Instructions:

For the Chicken

  1. Marinate your chicken in a ziplock bag. Using a knife, poke holes into the chicken to allow the marinade to enter the chicken.
  2. To the ziplock bag add the chicken, 3 Tbsp of garlic, cup olive oil, 2 Tbsp red wine vinegar, 1 Tbsp cumin, 1 Tbsp coriander, 1 tsp turmeric, 1 tsp all spice, 2 tsp salt, 1 tsp pepper, and tsp cayenne pepper. Place in the refrigerator for at least 30 minutes.
  3. Once the chicken has marinated, heat a grill pan or a skillet over medium high heat. Cook the chicken in batches to prevent crowding the pan. Cook until it reaches an internal temperature of 165F or is no longer pink in the center.
  4. Once the chicken has finished cooking, cut it into strips about inch thick.

For the Tahini Sauce

  1. Mix all of the ingredients together. Season with salt to taste.

For the Butternut Squash

  1. Preheat your oven to 400F.
  2. Wash and peel the squash. Cut off the stems and cut the squash in half. Remove the seeds with a spoon. Cut the squash into a large dice, about inch-1 inch pieces.
  3. Spread out the squash on a sheet pan and drizzle with 1 Tbsp of olive oil. Season with 2 tsp of garlic powder, and salt and pepper to taste.
  4. Bake for 10 minutes, then flip and bake another 10 minutes.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide your ingredients evenly 5 ways into each of your containers. Store the tahini sauce in a separate container as you do not want to heat this up.

For the Rice

  1. Cook enough rice to have 5 cups of cooked rice. 1 cup of dry rice will yield about 3 cups of cooked rice.

Baked Falafel

A baked version of the Middle Eastern treat. Falafel is a combination of chickpeas, onion, garlic, parsley, and spices. It is easy to make and dangerously tasty.

CourseCuisineTime - 28 minutes
SnackMiddle EasternPrep - 8 minutes
Cook - 20 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
52kcal14
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates6.1g61%
Fat2.1g21%
Protein2.2g22%

Ingredients:

  • 15 oz (425 g) can of chickpeas
  • cup (20 g) red onion diced
  • 3 cloves (15 g) garlic
  • 1 Tbsp (8 g) cumin
  • 1 tsp (2 g) paprika
  • 2 Tbsp (30 ml) lemon juice
  • cup (30 g) parsley chopped
  • cup (10 g) cilantro
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) olive oil
  • tsp (1 g) salt
  • 1 (1 ) egg
  • Cooking spray

Instructions:

  1. Preheat your oven to 375F.
  2. In a food processor or a blender, add all of the ingredients except the cooking spray and pulse until the ingredients have been thoroughly mixed. You dont want this to become a paste, so be careful with how long you blend.
  3. Spray a sheet pan with cooking spray and use a cookie scoop to create 1-2 inch balls from the falafel mix.
  4. Place on the sheet pan and lightly press down on the center to flatten each ball slightly.
  5. Bake for 20 minutes or until the falafel has set and browned.
  6. This recipe makes anywhere between 1015 falafels depending on the size of your scoop. For reference, I made 14.

Middle Eastern Chicken with Turmeric Rice

Chicken thighs seasoned with middle eastern spices and grilled to perfection. Paired with the chicken is rice, spiced with turmeric and mixed with carrots, peas, and tomatoes.

CourseCuisineTime - 35 minutes 35 minutes 35 minutes
Main Dishmeal prep, Middle EasternPrep - 10 minutes 10 minutes 10 minutes
Cook - 25 minutes 25 minutes 25 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
659kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates60g43%
Fat21g15%
Protein57g41%

Ingredients:

For the Chicken

  • 2 lbs (1135 g) boneless skinless chicken thighs
  • 1 cup (227 g) plain non fat Greek yogurt
  • (100 g) red onion minced
  • tsp (1 g) salt
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) lemon juice
  • 1 tsp (3 g) cumin
  • 1 tsp (1 g) oregano
  • tsp (2 g) paprika
  • 2 Tbsp (30 ml) olive oil

For the Rice

  • 5 cups (750 g) cooked rice
  • 2 tsp (8 g) turmeric
  • 2 cup (200 g) shredded carrots
  • 2 cup (300 g) frozen peas
  • 2 (120 g) Roma tomatoes
  • 3 tsp (8 g) garlic powder
  • 2 Tbsp (30 ml) olive oil
  • Salt and pepper to taste

Instructions:

For the Rice

  1. Cook enough rice to have 5 cups of cooked rice. 1 cup of uncooked rice will yield around 3 cups of cooked rice.
  2. Once the rice has finished cooking, measure out 5 cups and place in a large bowl.
  3. Cut your Roma tomato into a small dice, remove the seeds. Chop the shredded carrots into smaller pieces.
  4. Mix in 2 tsp turmeric, 2 cup shredded carrots, 2 cup frozen peas, the diced tomato, 3 tsp garlic powder, 2 Tbsp olive oil, and salt and pepper to taste.

For the Chicken

  1. While the rice is cooking add the chicken thighs to a ziplock back with 1 cup of Greek yogurt, of minced red onion, tsp salt, 1 Tbsp lemon juice, 1 tsp cumin, 1 tsp oregano, tsp paprika, and 1 Tbsp olive oil.
  2. Toss the chicken around in the bag to make sure it is evenly coated and then remove the air and allow to marinate for at least 5 minutes. 30 minutes is preferred but in the interest of time, it is not required.
  3. Heat a grill pan over medium high heat and add 1 Tbsp of olive oil.
  4. Cook the chicken in batches if necessary to prevent overcrowding. Cook it for roughly 3 minutes on each side but be careful not to mess with it too much as you want the outside to develop some color.
  5. After the chicken has cooked, remove it from the pan and cut it into a large dice. Add it back to the pan to allow for it to finish cooking and develop more color.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide the chicken and rice evenly between each of your containers.

French

  • Strawberries and Cream Crepes

Strawberries and Cream Crepes

Crepes made using a gluten free flour blend and filled with strawberries and a Greek yogurt cream sauce.

CourseCuisineTime - 30 minutes
Dessert, SnackFrenchPrep - 10 minutes
Cook - 20 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
126kcal4 crepes
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates17.9g68%
Fat2.8g10%
Protein7.4g28%

Ingredients:

For the Crepe

  • cup (74 g) gluten free baking flour
  • cup (60 ml) skim milk
  • cup (60 ml) water
  • tbsp (7 g) butter
  • 1 egg

For the Filling

  • 4-5 (60 g) strawberries
  • cup (57 g) plain non fat Greek yogurt
  • scoop (15 g) vanilla whey protein powder
  • Stevia to taste
  • dusting (1 g) powdered sugar

Instructions:

  1. Mix crepe ingredients in a large bowl. Whisk until smooth. Add more water if its too thick. It should be fairly runny, not like pancake batter.
  2. Heat an 8-inch skillet over medium heat. To form the crepe takes a bit of finesse. Its not hard but if youve never done it before it will take some practice. Pour about cup worth of batter in the center of the pan and tilt the pan in a circular motion to evenly cover the bottom.
  3. Flip when ready and cook the other side. It will take a few minutes on each side.
  4. Mix the protein and stevia to taste into the yogurt and stir vigorously.
  5. Spread a spoonful out on the crepe, fill with strawberries and roll or fold. Top with powdered sugar. Makes 4.

Indian

  • Chicken Vindaloo
  • Chicken Tikka Masala
  • Coconut Chicken Curry

Chicken Vindaloo

Chicken Vindaloo is an Indian curry dish usually make with pork. This recipe uses chicken, potatoes and peppers and is served with a side of rice.

CourseCuisineTime - 45 minutes 45 minutes 45 minutes
Main DishIndian, meal prepPrep - 10 minutes 10 minutes 10 minutes
Cook - 35 minutes 35 minutes 35 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
678kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates72g49%
Fat20g13%
Protein53g36%

Ingredients:

  • 2.5 lbs (1135 g) boneless skinless chicken thighs
  • 1 cup (240 ml) coconut milk full fat, canned
  • 14 oz (397 g) crushed tomatoes
  • 2 tbsp (30 g) garlic
  • 2 medium (300 g) bell peppers You can use the frozen blend of onions and peppers if you're feeling lazy
  • medium (100 g) onion
  • 2 Tbsp (16 g) cumin
  • 1 Tbsp (8 g) curry powder
  • 2 tsp (5 g) turmeric
  • 5 cups (750 g) cooked rice
  • 1 lb (454 g) russet potatoes
  • 1 tbsp (15 ml) olive oil

Instructions:

For the Rice

  1. Cook enough rice to yield 5 cups of cooked rice. 1 cup of dry rice will make around 3 cups of cooked rice.

For the Chicken

  1. Heat a grill pan or skillet over medium high heat. Add oil and cook the chicken for 3-5 minutes on each side or until cooked through. Cut it into slices.
  2. Wash and cut your potatoes into a large dice. Heat a pot of water over high heat and boil the potatoes until they are soft.
  3. Cut the onion and pepper into strips.
  4. In a skillet heat some olive oil over medium heat. Add the garlic, onion, and peppers. Cook for 2-3 mintues.
  5. Add tomatoes and coconut milk to the skillet. Add the cumin, curry powder, and turmeric. Simmer for 10 min uncovered and allow the sauce to thicken.
  6. Add potatoes and chicken to the pan and mix. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide your ingredients evenly 5 ways. Add cup of rice to each dish.

Chicken Tikka Masala

Chicken thighs coated in tikka masala sauce with rice and broccoli. Using a store bought tikka masala sauce can speed up the time it takes to cook this meal. Using premade sauces for ease isnt something I do often but it greatly speeds up the process.

CourseCuisineTime - 30 minutes 30 minutes 30 minutes
Main DishIndian, meal prepPrep - 5 minutes 5 minutes 5 minutes
Cook - 25 minutes 25 minutes 25 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
715kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates67g44%
Fat25g16%
Protein57g38%

Ingredients:

  • 2 lbs (1135 g) boneless skinless chicken thighs
  • 16 oz (454 g) frozen broccoli
  • 6 oz (170 g) frozen peas
  • 8 oz (227 g) shredded carrots
  • 1.25 cups (313 g) tikka masala sauce Use jarred. Its just way easier. I use Hy-Vee Brand.
  • 5 cups (750 g) cooked rice
  • 4 tbsp (60 ml) olive oil
  • Parsley

Instructions:

  1. Cook enough rice to have 5 cups worth. Once cooked, mix in 3 tbsp of olive oil for the extra calories.
  2. Heat tbsp of oil in a cast iron grill or skillet over medium heat. Cook the chicken. Cut into 1 inch pieces.
  3. In a skillet, heat tbsp of oil over medium heat and add the peas and carrots. Cook for a few minutes.
  4. Add the chicken and sauce. Stir to incorporate.
  5. Cook the broccoli in the microwave.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide your ingredients evenly between 5 containers. Put 1 cup of rice in each dish.

Coconut Chicken Curry

Chicken and red bell peppers in a coconut curry sauce served over roasted spaghetti squash. A low calorie, cheap meal option that packs a lot of flavor and variety.

CourseCuisineTime - 1 hour 10 minutes 1 hour 10 minutes
Main CourseIndian, meal prepPrep - 10 minutes 10 minutes
Cook - 1 hour 1 hour

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
552kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates48g43%
Fat22g19%
Protein41g36%

Ingredients:

For the Curry

  • 2 lbs (908 g) boneless skinless chicken thighs
  • 1 cup (240 g) canned coconut milk
  • 1 (100 g) red onion small
  • 2 (250 g) red peppers
  • 1 Tbsp (15 g) garlic
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) olive oil
  • 1 Tbsp (6 g) curry powder
  • Tbsp (3 g) turmeric
  • Tbsp (3 g) paprika
  • Tbsp (3 g) cayenne pepper
  • Salt and pepper to taste

For the Spaghetti Squash

  • 1 (750 g) spaghetti squash
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) olive oil
  • Salt and pepper to taste

For the Rice

  • 5 cups (875 g) cooked rice
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) olive oil
  • Salt and pepper to taste

Instructions:

For the Squash

  1. Preheat your oven to 425. Cut the spaghetti squash in half the long way. It may help to pierce the squash with a fork and microwave for a few minutes to make it easier to slice. Scoop out any seeds and sprinkle with olive oil, salt, and pepper. Place on a cookie sheet face up and cook for around 40 minutes or until you can easily peel away the flesh.

For the Curry

  1. Heat a skillet over medium high heat and add a bit of olive oil.
  2. Season one side of the chicken with salt and pepper and place season side down in pan and then season the other side. Cook until the center is no longer pink or a has an internal temperature of 165F.
  3. While the chicken is cooking, cut the red onion and peppers into thin strips
  4. When the chicken is finished, add a bit of olive oil to the same pan and saut the onion, peppers, and garlic until soft.
  5. Add coconut milk and all spices. Shake the can of coconut milk before opening until you hear it is in liquid form. Running the can under hot water will help the process. Stir to incorporate.
  6. Reduce the heat to low and cover. Simmer the sauce and allow to thicken until desired consistency. If the sauce is still runny after ~10 minutes, mix 1 Tbsp of cornstarch with Tbsp of cold water and add to the sauce to thicken.
  7. While the sauce is simmering, cut your chicken into 1-2 inch pieces. Add the sliced chicken to sauce once it has thickened.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Add 1 cup of rice to each of your containers and divide the curry mixture evenly between the 5 containers.

For the Rice

  1. Cook enough rice to have 5 cups of cooked rice. 1 cup of dry rice will yield about 3 cups of cooked rice. Mix in 1 tbsp of oil and season to taste.

Cuban

  • Ropa Vieja

Ropa Vieja

Ropa Vieja is the national dish of Cuba and translates to Old Clothes. This recipe is slightly modified from the traditional version to add more vegetables.

CourseCuisineTime - 4 hours 4 hours
Main DishCuban, meal prepPrep - 10 minutes 10 minutes
Cook - 4 hours 30 minutes 4 hours 30 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
528kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates50g44%
Fat16g14%
Protein47g41%

Ingredients:

  • 2 lbs (908 g) boneless skinless chicken breast
  • 2 medium (300 g) green peppers
  • 1 medium (150 g) red pepper
  • 1 medium (200 g) sweet onion
  • 2 Tbsp (30 g) garlic minced
  • 3 stalks (300 g) celery
  • 3 (300 g) carrots
  • 6 oz (170 g) can tomato paste
  • 15 oz (425 g) can crushed tomatoes
  • 1 cup (240 ml) chicken broth
  • cup (120 ml) white wine
  • 1 cup (180 g) green olives
  • 2 (20 g) chipotle peppers in adobo sauce
  • 1 Tbsp (8 g) cumin
  • 1 Tbsp (8 g) paprika
  • 1 Tbsp (5 g) oregano
  • 2 bay leaves
  • 2 Tbsp (30 ml) olive oil
  • Salt and pepper to taste
  • 1 cups (169 g) cooked rice
  • 1 cups (217 g) black beans

Instructions:

  1. Wash and cut your peppers and onion into strips. Peel and cut the carrots into small discs about of an inch thick. Cut the celery into a small dice.
  2. Heat a dutch oven or pot to medium high and add 1 Tbsp of olive oil. Add the the peppers, onions, carrots, celery, and 2 Tbsp of minced garlic to the pot. Cook for around 10 minutes until the onions have browned.
  3. Pour in cup of white wine and stir to deglaze the pot.
  4. Add in the chicken, 1 cup of chicken broth, 6 oz of tomato paste, 15 oz of crushed tomatoes, 2 chipotle peppers in adobo, 1 Tbsp cumin, 1 Tbsp paprika, 1 Tbsp oregano, and 2 bay leaves and bring to a boil for 5 minutes.
  5. Reduce the heat to low and cover. Cook for 4 hours.
  6. Remove the chicken from the pot and shred with two forks. Return to the pot with 1 cup of green olives. Simmer uncovered for 25-30 minutes to thicken the sauce. Add salt and pepper to taste.
  7. If you have a lot of juice left in the pot it may be helpful to strain out the excess liquid using a colander. Some liquid is good but you dont want too much in the bottom of your containers when you store your meals.
  8. Cook the rice using your preferred method. 1 cup of uncooked rice will yield around 3 cups of cooked rice.
  9. Heat the beans in a small sauce pot.
  10. Plating
  11. This recipe makes 5 servings. In each of your containers, add cup of black beans and cup of rice. Divide the meat mixture evenly 5 ways, straining out any juice if necessary.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. In each of your containers, add cup of black beans and cup of rice. Divide the meat mixture evenly 5 ways, straining out any juice if necessary.

Honey Garlic Chicken Noodle Bowls

These Honey Garlic Chicken Noodle Bowls can be prepped in about 45 minutes. They are made up of sweet potato glass noodles, ground chicken, a variety of vegetables, and a sauce to bring it all together.

CourseCuisineTime - 45 minutes
Main DishAsian, meal prepPrep - 15 minutes
Cook - 30 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
597kcal5 servings
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates66g53%
Fat21g17%
Protein36g29%

Ingredients:

For the Meat and Vegetables

  • 2 lbs (908 g) ground chicken (93/7)
  • 8 oz (227 g) sweet potato glass noodles
  • 1 small (125 g) onion
  • 1 medium (150 g) red pepper
  • 8 oz (227 g) mushrooms
  • 8 oz (227 g) shredded cabbage i buy this pre shredded
  • 4 cloves (15 g) garlic
  • 5 stalks (25 g) green onions
  • 2 tbsp (30 g) oil
  • salt and pepper

For the Sauce

  • 2 tbsp (30 g) soy sauce
  • cup (84 g) honey
  • cup (80 g) oyster sauce
  • 2 tsp (10 g) sesame oil
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) sriracha

Instructions:

For the Noodles

  1. Place the noodles into a bowl and pour over enough hot water to submerge them. Allow them to soften while you prepare the rest of your ingredients.

For the Stir Fry

  1. Heat a large skillet over medium high heat and add 1 tbsp of oil and throw in the ground chicken. Season lightly with salt and pepper.
  2. Keep an eye on the chicken while you cut up your vegetables and tend to it as needed. Cook the chicken until it has browned and no pink remains. When finished, remove it from the skillet and set aside.
  3. While the chicken is cooking, wash and cut all of your vegetables. Cut the onion into thin slices, the red pepper into a large dice, the mushrooms into thin slices, shred the cabbage (if necessary), mince the garlic, and cut the tops off the green onions on a bias.
  4. Once the chicken has finished and you have removed it from the pan, add tbsp of oil and add in the onions and peppers first. Allow these to cook and brown for a couple of minutes before adding the other vegetables.
  5. Make some room in the center of the pan and add another tbsp of oil and the mushrooms. Allow the mushrooms to brown and release their water before you stir them around too much.
  6. Once the mushrooms have browned, add the cabbage and garlic. Stir to distribute everything in the pan.

For the Sauce

  1. In a bowl, stir together the soy sauce, honey, oyster sauce, sesame oil, and sriracha. Mix vigorously to make sure that the honey gets evenly stirred in.

Construction

  1. Place the skillet over medium heat. Add in the chicken and pour about half of the sauce over the top. Stir to combine so that the chicken and vegetables are coated.
  2. Drain the water away from the noodles and add them into the pan. Pour the remaining sauce over the top and stir. Taste test and add salt and pepper as needed.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide the contents of the pan evenly between 5 containers. This meal will last up to 5 days in the fridge.

Teriyaki Rotisserie Chicken Bowls

These Teriyaki Rotisserie Chicken Bowls can be prepped with no cooking other than using a microwave by utilizing a rotisserie chicken bought from the store. This meal can be tossed together in 20 minutes and provide you with your lunches for the week.

CourseCuisineTime - 20 minutes
Main DishAsian, meal prepPrep - 20 minutes
Cook - 5 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
557kcal5 servings
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates63g53%
Fat17g14%
Protein38g32%

Ingredients:

  • 1.5 lbs (681 g) pulled rotisserie chicken
  • 9 tbsp (135 g) teriyaki sauce
  • 2 tsp (10 g) sesame seeds
  • 2 (10 g) green onions

For the Rice

  • 4 cups (568 g) cooked rice
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) soy sauce
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) rice vinegar
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) crunchy chili garlic oil

For the Slaw

  • 12 oz (340 g) shredded cabbage
  • 1 cup (100 g) matchstick carrots
  • 2 tbsp (30 g) rice vinegar
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) crunchy chili garlic oil
  • 1 tbsp (21 g) honey

Instructions:

  1. Cook the frozen rice in the microwave according to the packaging.
  2. In a large bowl, add the carrots, cabbage, vinegar, chili garlic oil, and honey.
  3. Mix to combine, season with salt to taste and adjust flavor as needed.
  4. Butcher your rotisserie chicken and pull away the meat. Measure out 1.5lbs or 681g of the chicken into a bowl.
  5. Add 4 tbsp or 60g of teriyaki sauce and mix.
  6. Add the rice to the bowl and mix in the soy sauce, vinegar, and chili oil.
  7. Divide the ingredients evenly between 5 containers. Top with sesame seeds and green onions if you wish.
  8. After reheating, top each dish with 1 tbsp of teriyaki sauce.

Easy Breakfast Tacos

These Breakfast Tacos are my go to breakfast or late night meal when I don't have anything prepped. They only take 10-15 minutes and are made from eggs, cheese, and potatoes.

CourseCuisineTime - 15 minutes
Breakfast, Main DishAmerican, MexicanPrep - 5 minutes
Cook - 10 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
152kcal4 Tacos
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates16.3g56%
Fat6.5g22%
Protein7g24%

Ingredients:

For the Tacos

  • 4 (94 g) corn tortillas
  • 1 small (100 g) russet potato
  • 2 large (140 g) eggs
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) milk
  • 2 slices (46 g) cheese
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) hot sauce
  • 1 tbsp (5 g) cilantro chopped
  • tsp (2 g) oil
  • salt to taste

For the Pickled Red Onions

  • 1 medium (200 g) red onion
  • 1 tbsp (12 g) sugar
  • 1 tsp (6 g) salt
  • 1 cups (360 g) white vinegar
  • 1 cups (360 g) water

Instructions:

For the Tacos

  1. Wash and cut your potato into small shoestring french fry shapes.
  2. Place the fries into your air fryer basket and spray with 2g of oil and sprinkle with salt to taste.
  3. Air fry at 400 F for 8-10 minutes shaking the basket half way through.
  4. While the potatoes are cooking, crack 2 eggs into a dish and add a splash of milk and salt. Beat until they are smooth. Cook the eggs in either a pan or in the microwave until they are finished.
  5. In a dry skillet over medium high heat, add 4 corn tortillas to warm and lightly brown. Flip over and add a half slice of cheese to each to begin to melt.
  6. To each tortilla, evenly divide the potatoes and eggs. Top each with hot sauce, pickled onions, and chopped cilantro.
  7. The nutritional estimates are per taco.

For the Pickled Red Onions

  1. These are best made in advance. I always keep these in my fridge. They will last for weeks.
  2. Cut your red onion into thin slices from root to shoot.
  3. In large mason jar, add1tsp of salt,1tbsp of sugar,1cups water, and1cups distilled vinegar. Stir to dissolve the solids.
  4. Add the onions into the mason jar and top with more water and vinegar if necessary to cover the onions. Cap the jar and move it into the fridge to allow the onions to pickle.

Double Chocolate Brownie Baked Oatmeal

Double Chocolate Brownie Baked Oatmeal. Great for either a meal prepped breakfast or as a pre-bedtime snack. I like to eat mine by dumping some milk over the top after reheating.

CourseCuisineTime - 55 minutes
Main DishAmerican, meal prepPrep - 15 minutes
Cook - 40 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
360kcal6 servings
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates49g61%
Fat8g10%
Protein23g28%

Ingredients:

  • 3 cups (240 g) old fashioned oats
  • 3 scoops (90 g) vanilla protein powder i use whey
  • 1 tsp (4 g) baking powder
  • 1/4 cup (20 g) cocoa powder
  • 2 tbsp (42 g) maple syrup
  • 1 tbsp (14 g) butter
  • 10 tbsp (150 g) liquid egg whites or 2 whole eggs
  • 2 cups (480 g) milk
  • 1 cup (226 g) unsweetened apple sauce
  • 4 tbsp (56 g) mini chocolate chips
  • 1 tsp (5 g) milk

Instructions:

FOR THE BAKED OATMEAL

  1. Preheat your oven to 350F (177C).
  2. In a large bowl, mix together the oats, protein powder, cocoa powder, and baking powder.
  3. Add in the egg whites, milk, syrup, 1 tbsp of melted butter, apple sauce, and 2 tbsp of chocolate chips.
  4. Spray a 13x9 pan with oil and add the oat mixture.
  5. Top with 1 tbsp of chocolate chips.
  6. Bake for 35-40 minutes.
  7. Melt the last tbsp of chocolate chips in the microwave with 1 tsp of milk.
  8. Place the melted chocolate into a piping bag and drizzle over the top.

PLATING

  1. This recipe makes 6 servings. Cut the oatmeal into 6 equal pieces.

Turkey and Kale Power Bowl

This Turkey and Kale Power Bowl is served with a side of Sriracha Lime Mayo and Pickled Red Onions. Made up of 93/7 ground turkey, onions, peppers, kale and quinoa this meal is high in volume and flavor.

CourseCuisineTime - 45 minutes
Main DishAmerican, meal prepPrep - 20 minutes
Cook - 25 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
574kcal5 servings
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates36g33%
Fat30g28%
Protein40g37%

Ingredients:

For the Pickled Onions

  • 1 medium (200 g) red onion
  • 1 tbsp (12 g) sugar
  • 1 tsp (6 g) salt
  • 1 cups (360 g) white vinegar
  • 1 cups (360 g) water

For the Quinoa

  • 1 cup (180 g) dry quinoa
  • 2 cups (480 g) water

For the Turkey

  • 2 lbs (908 g) ground turkey (93/7)
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) oil
  • 2 tsp (6 g) paprika
  • 1 tsp (3 g) ground coriander
  • salt and pepper to taste

For the Vegetables

  • 1 small (125 g) sweet onion
  • 2 medium (300 g) red peppers
  • 1 bunch (150 g) kale
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) minced garlic
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) oil
  • salt and pepper to taste

For the Sriracha Lime Mayo

  • cup (56 g) mayonnaise
  • cup (56 g) plain nonfat Greek yogurt
  • 4 tsp (20 g) lime juice
  • 4 tsp (20 g) sriracha
  • salt to taste

Instructions:

For the Quinoa

  1. Rinse your quinoa under some water to clean off any impurities.
  2. Cook your quinoa according to the packaging. I use a rice cooker with a 1 cup quinoa to 2 cups water ratio.

For the Pickled Onions

  1. Cut your red onion into thin slices from root to shoot.
  2. In large mason jar, add 1 tsp of salt, 1 tbsp of sugar, 1 cups water, and 1 cups distilled vinegar. Stir to dissolve the solids.
  3. Add the onions into the mason jar and top with more water and vinegar if necessary to cover the onions. Cap the jar and move it into the fridge to allow the onions to pickle.

For the Vegetables

  1. Wash your red peppers and kale first.
  2. Cut the peppers into a small to medium dice and the onion into a small dice.
  3. Remove the leaves from the stems of the kale and roughly chop them into smaller pieces. Massage the kale leaves by squeezing them in your hands for 20-30 seconds. This will help soften the leaves and take away some bitterness.
  4. In a large skillet over medium high heat, add 1 tbsp of oil and dump in your onions and peppers. Salt lightly.
  5. Once the onions have started to develop some color, add in your kale and cover for 1 minute to help it wilt down.
  6. Stir the contents of the skillet and then add 1 tbsp of minced garlic and season the vegetables to taste. Reserve to the side until the remainder of your components are ready.

For the Turkey

  1. In a large skillet over medium high heat, drizzle in 1 tbsp of oil and add the turkey to brown. Season with salt and pepper to your liking.
  2. Flip the turkey over after a few minutes to brown the other side. When it is about 85% of the way finished, add in 2 tsp of paprika and 1 tsp ground coriander.
  3. Mix in the seasonings until they are well distributed. Once the turkey is finished cooking, set it aside until everything else is ready.

For the Sriracha Lime Mayo

  1. In a small bowl, mix the mayo, yogurt, lime juice, and sriracha together. Season with salt to taste.
  2. Divide the mayo out into 5 small ramekins to be placed into the final dish.

For the Final Dish + Plating

  1. In a large skillet with the vegetables, add in the turkey and quinoa. Mix thoroughly to incorporate. Taste test and adjust flavors as needed.
  2. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide the contents of the skillet evenly between 5 servings. Each dish gets one ramekin of the sriracha lime mayo.
  3. If you are taking the meals away from your home, I would also add in some of the pickled red onions to each dish. If you eat the meals at home, you can take the onions from the jar after you reheat.

Hidden Vegetable Mac and Cheese

This Mac and Cheese is macro friendly with 50 grams of protein and is full of nutrients from vegetables hidden in the cheese sauce. The sauce is made up of carrots, cauliflower, milk, and cheese.

CourseCuisineTime - 1 hour
Main DishAmerican, meal prepPrep - 30 minutes
Cook - 30 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
596kcal6 servings
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates54g43%
Fat20g16%
Protein50g40%

Ingredients:

  • 2 lbs (908 g) boneless skinless chicken breast
  • 12 oz (340 g) macaroni noodles gluten free if needed
  • 1 lb (454 g) frozen cauliflower
  • 3 medium (300 g) carrots
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) oil
  • 8 oz (227 g) cheddar cheese block is best
  • 2 cups (480 g) pasta water
  • 1 cups (360 g) 2% milk
  • salt and pepper to taste
  • any other seasoning you like is optional

Instructions:

For the Vegetables

  1. Wash and cut your carrots into smaller pieces so that they roast quicker.
  2. On a lightly oiled sheet pan, place the carrots and frozen cauliflower. Drizzle over 1 tbsp of oil and lightly season with salt and pepper. Toss to coat.
  3. Roast at 425F (218C) for 20-25 minutes, flipping half way through.

For the Chicken

  1. Trim the excess fat and skin from the chicken and either cut or pound the chicken so that is even in thickness throughout. I shoot for about " in thickness.
  2. Season both sides lightly with salt and pepper and place onto a sheet pan. Place into the oven at 425F for 15 minutes or until the chicken reaches 165F.
  3. Once the chicken has finished, allow it to rest for 10 minutes before cutting it into a very small dice.

For the Macaroni

  1. Cook the macaroni according to the packaging. Shoot for just past al dente on the doneness. Reserve 2 cups of the pasta water for your cheese sauce. Be sure not to use too much water in your pot. Too much water will dilute the starchy pasta water that we will use to thicken the sauce later.
  2. Once cooked, rinse and store in cold water to stop the cooking process until you are ready to use later.

For the Cheese Sauce

  1. NOTE: If you wanted to add a bit of mustard powder, paprika, or another spice you could certainly do that. I like to personally keep it to salt and pepper but you should make it how you like it. Using a blend of different cheese can also add layers of flavor if you don't mind buying a few blocks of cheese.
  2. Shred your block of cheese using a box grater or food processor.
  3. Once the vegetables have finished roasting, place them into a blender with 2 cups of pasta water, 1 cups of milk, and about of all of the cheese you just shredded. Blend on high speed for 30-60s or until smooth.

For the Mac & Cheese

  1. In a 13"x9" baking dish, pour about half of the cheese sauce into the bottom.
  2. Drain the water away from your macaroni and dump the noodles into the pan.
  3. Add in the chopped chicken and pour the remaining cheese sauce over the top.
  4. Stir to evenly distribute the cheese sauce and give it a taste test. Adjust with salt and pepper to taste. Mix again if necessary.
  5. Top the dish with the remaining shredded cheese and place back into the oven at 425F for 10 minutes to brown the cheese and thicken the sauce. For the last two minutes, I like to turn the oven to broil to help the cheese brown.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 6 servings. Cut the dish into 6 equal portions and place into each meal prep container. Top with chopped parsley for a garnish if you wish.

Sweet Chili Noodle Bowls

These Sweet Chili Noodle Bowls are a combination of noodles, chicken, lettuce, cabbage, cucumbers, pickled carrots and a sweet chili vinaigrette. They are meant to be eaten cold and are a wonderful lunch option for a hot summer day.

CourseCuisineTime - 45 minutes
Main DishAsian, meal prepPrep - 20 minutes
Cook - 25 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
569kcal5 servings
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates64g53%
Fat18g15%
Protein37g31%

Ingredients:

For the Chicken

  • 2 lbs (908 g) boneless skinless chicken breasts
  • 2 tbsp (24 g) gochujang
  • 1 tsp (5 g) oil
  • salt and pepper to taste

For the Noodles and Vegetables

  • 10 oz (275 g) sweet potato glass noodles
  • 1 medium head (125 g) romaine lettuce
  • 4.5 oz (125 g) red cabbage
  • 1 medium (150 g) seedless cucumber
  • 2 medium (125 g) pickled carrots

For the Sweet Chili Vinaigrette

  • cup (60 g) light oil avocado, vegetable, or light olive will work
  • 1 tbsp (23.5 g) sriracha
  • 1 tbsp (23.5 g) vinegar
  • 3 tbsp (45 g) lime juice
  • 3 tbsp (36 g) sugar
  • 1 tsp (3 g) sesame seeds

For the Pickled Carrots

  • 4 medium (200 g) carrots
  • 1 cups (360 g) vinegar
  • 1 cups (360 g) water
  • 1 tbsp (12 g) sugar
  • 1 tsp (3 g) salt

Instructions:

For the Pickled Carrots

  1. I would recommend making a big batch of these carrots as they last for weeks in the fridge and they rock. They go on everything. For this particular recipe you'll only need about 2 carrots worth but making a bigger batch is nice to do. It also helps to prepare these the night before you make the meal so they have time to pickle but this is not absolutely necessary. 30 minutes to brine will work.
  2. Wash and peel the outer layer of your carrots. Using a vegetable peeler, go down the length of the carrot to create ribbons.
  3. For the brine, mix together the water, vinegar, salt, and sugar. Stir to combine and pour over top of the carrots in a glass jar. If you don't have enough to cover the carrots, you can just add more water and vinegar in equal parts.

For the Noodles

  1. I have found that the sweet potato glass noodles linked above work the best for this application. They don't dry out in the fridge over the week and have a soft bite. They are my favorite noodle to use right now. Can't speak highly enough about them. I bought mine at a local Asian grocery but I have also seen them at Central Market and on Amazon.
  2. To soften the noodles, I place them into a large bowl and pour boiling water over the top to soak while I prepare the rest of the ingredients. Get them started first so they will be ready when needed.

For the Chicken

  1. This meal is meant to be eaten cold and because of this, chicken breast is a fine choice. I usually stick to chicken thighs when I meal prep because they reheat better in the microwave and retain moisture. Since we don't have to worry about that, chicken breast is perfect.
  2. Cut or pound your chicken breasts until they are of even thickness throughout. This will help them cook faster and more evenly. Shoot for about 1/2" in thickness.
  3. Season the chicken breast with salt and pepper and coat the chicken with 2 tbsp of gochujang.
  4. I cook the chicken in the air fryer as it is easy and you get awesome color and flavor. You can cook the chicken however you prefer.
  5. Preheat your air fryer to 400F (204C) and cook the chicken for 4-5 minutes on each side. Cook in batches to not overcrowd the air fryer. Adjust the cooking time if you have thicker or thinner pieces of chicken.
  6. Once the chicken has finished cooking, set it aside to rest for a few minutes before cutting it into thin slices.

For the Vegetables

  1. While the chicken is cooking, chop up all of your vegetables.
  2. Cut up the romaine lettuce into thin pieces until you have about 2 cups worth.
  3. For the red cabbage you can use the preshredded stuff in the bag or buy the smallest head of cabbage you can find. Cut the cabbage into thin slices.
  4. Cut the cucumber in half length-wise and scoop out the seeds with a spoon. Cut the halves on a bias into thin slices.

For the Dressing

  1. Mix all of the ingredients in a bowl or jar with a lid and shake to emulsify the fat with the vinegar and lime juice.
  2. Divide evenly into 5 smaller ramekins.

Plating

  1. Drain all of the water away from the noodles and cut the chicken into thin slices if you have not yet.
  2. This recipe makes 5 servings so lay out 5 of your meal prep containers.
  3. Divide the noodles, chicken, cucumbers, cabbage, and lettuce evenly between the containers. Each container gets a healthy pinch of the carrots and 1 of the ramekins of the vinaigrette.
  4. To eat, pour the vinaigrette over the top of the dish, season lightly with salt and pepper, replace the lid on the container and shake up the ingredients to coat with the vinaigrette.

Salsa Verde Beef Bowls

These Salsa Verde Beef Bowls are made up of ground beef, red onions, poblano peppers, cabbage, cilantro lime rice and salsa verde to pour over the top. This is a quick and easy recipe that can be finished in under an hour.

CourseCuisineTime - 45 minutes
Main Coursemeal prep, MexicanPrep - 10 minutes
Cook - 35 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
540kcal5 servings
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates39g37%
Fat24g22%
Protein42g40%

Ingredients:

For the Rice

  • 3 cups (450 g) cooked rice
  • 2 tbsp (30 g) lime juice
  • cup (20 g) chopped cilantro
  • salt to taste

For the Beef and Vegetables

  • 2 lbs (908 g) ground beef (90/10)
  • 2 (150 g) poblano peppers green bell pepper is fine too
  • 1 medium (200 g) red onion
  • 1 small (227 g) green cabbage alternatively you can buy 8oz of preshredded cabbage in a bag
  • 2 tbsp (30 g) oil
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) minced garlic
  • 1 tsp (3 g) cumin
  • 1 tsp (3 g) chili powder
  • 1 tsp (3 g) smoked paprika
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) lime juice
  • salt and pepper to taste
  • 1 cups (300 g) salsa verde pick out your favorite jar from the store
  • 1 jalapeo optional for garnish

Instructions:

For the Rice

  1. Make enough rice to yield3cups of cooked rice. 1 cup of dry rice will make between 2-3 cups of cooked rice depending on what type of rice you use.
  2. Once the rice has finished, add 3 cups of rice to a bowl and mix in 2 tbsp of lime juice and cup chopped cilantro.

For the Beef and Vegetables

  1. While the rice is cooking, prepare your beef and vegetables. For the nutritional estimates provided, I have included 2 tbsp of oil to use in the cooking process. Use that amount as needed in the cooking of the beef and vegetables.
  2. In a large skillet over medium high heat, add about a tsp of the oil and cook the beef until it has browned. The beef should have enough fat that you won't need to use a ton of oil.
  3. While the beef is browning, wash and cut all of your vegetables.
  4. Cut the red onion into thin slices, the peppers into a medium dice, and shred the cabbage by cutting into thin slices. Mince up 1 tbsp worth of garlic. Chop the cilantro into small pieces for the cilantro lime rice once the rice has finished.
  5. Once the beef is finished browning, remove it from the skillet (or use a separate skillet) and add 1 tbsp of oil over medium heat. Toast the cumin, chili powder, and smoked paprika in the oil for about 30 seconds and then raise the temperature to medium high and add in the onions and peppers to cook. Add more oil if needed.
  6. Allow the onions and peppers to cook and brown for 4-5 minutes then add it the shredded cabbage and continue cooking until it has softened, around 3-5 minutes. Season lightly with salt and pepper.
  7. Once the vegetables have softened, add back the beef to the pan as well as the cilantro lime rice and squeeze about 1 tbsp of lime juice over the top. Mix everything until well incorporated.
  8. Taste test and adjust flavors with salt, pepper, and extra lime juice as necessary.

For the Salsa Verde

  1. Shake up your jar of salsa and divide it into 5 smaller containers of cup each.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide the contents of the pan evenly between your 5 containers and add a small container of salsa to each.

HamBULKer Helper

This HamBULKer Helper is a weight gain friendly meal prep with over 1,000 calories per dish to help you easily get in the energy you need to grow muscle. A combination of pasta, beef, potatoes and cheese make up the bulk of the calories but this meal still includes a decent serving of vegetables too.

CourseCuisineTime - 1 hour
Main DishAmerican, meal prepPrep - 30 minutes
Cook - 30 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
1000kcal5 servings
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates94g47%
Fat42g21%
Protein62g31%

Ingredients:

  • 2 lbs (908 g) ground beef 85/15
  • 1 medium (200 g) onion
  • 4 medium (227 g) carrots
  • 4 stalks (112 g) celery
  • 3 medium (500 g) potatoes
  • 12 oz (340 g) elbow pasta gluten free if needed
  • 14.5 oz (411 g) petite diced tomatoes canned
  • 6 oz (170 g) spinach
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) minced garlic
  • 2 cups (480 g) 2% milk
  • 3 cups (720 g) chicken broth
  • 1 cup (112 g) shredded cheddar cheese
  • cup (60 g) grated parmesan cheese
  • cup (68 g) ketchup
  • 1 tbsp (3 g) dried basil
  • 1 tsbp (6 g) paprika
  • salt and pepper to taste

Instructions:

For the Beef

  1. In a large stock pot over medium high heat, add the beef and allow it to brown and the fat to render off.
  2. Once browned, remove it from the pot, keeping all of the fat that was rendered off inside the pot. This will be used to cook the vegetables.

For the Vegetables

  1. While the beef is cooking, wash and cut the onion, carrots, and celery into a small dice of roughly the same size. Grate the garlic. Cut the potatoes into a medium dice of about " cubes. Roughly chop the spinach into smaller pieces.
  2. Once the beef has finished and only the fat remains left in the pot, add in the onions, carrots, celery, and garlic. Season lightly with salt to encourage the water to come out quicker. Allow this to brown and soften for 8-10 minutes.
  3. Once the vegetables have softened, season with 1 each of dried basil and paprika.
  4. Add in the potatoes, 2 cups of milk, 3 cups of chicken broth, 1 can of petite diced tomatoes, the beef and 12oz of elbow pasta.
  5. Bring this mixture to a light boil, stirring occasionally then reduce the heat to low, cover, and cook for 10-15 minutes or until the potatoes have softened and the noodles have finished.
  6. Test the potatoes for doneness by sticking a fork into them. Once they have softened, add in 1 cup of shredded cheddar cheese, cup of grated parmesan cheese, cup of ketchup, and all of the spinach you chopped earlier.
  7. Mix well to incorporate the cheeses and wilt the spinach. Taste test, season with salt and pepper to adjust flavor as needed.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide the mixture of the pot evenly 5 ways.

Velveted Chicken for Stir Fry

This is how I batch prep chicken to store in Snack City in my freezer to use in stir fry's. It drastically cuts down on the time it takes to prep dinner each night and is super easy to pull out of the freezer and throw into a wok.

CourseCuisineTime - 55 minutes 10 minutes 5 minutes 10 minutes
Main Dishmeal prepPrep - 45 minutes 10 minutes 5 minutes 2 minutes
Cook - 10 minutes 0 minutes 8 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
495kcal14 servings
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates62g54%
Fat8g7%
Protein43g38%

Ingredients:

  • 1 cups (360 g) chicken stock
  • cup (120 g) soy sauce I use low sodium
  • 3 tbsp (48 g) oyster sauce
  • 2 tbsp (35 g) mirin
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) water
  • 2 tbsp (16 g) cornstarch

For the Stir Fry

  • 120 g velveted chicken
  • 35 g sweet onion
  • 10 g ginger
  • 15 g garlic
  • 35 g red pepper
  • 35 g green pepper
  • 100 g cabbage
  • 75 g zucchini
  • 5 g oil
  • 10 g gochujang
  • 4 g gochugaru
  • 50 g brown stir fry sauce
  • 100 g cooked rice
  • 30 g pickled carrots
  • 30 g cucumber
  • 5 g green onion

Instructions:

For the Chicken

  1. Place your chicken into the freezer for about an hour before you start to prep. This will make it easier to cut and handle.
  2. Cut the chicken into thin slices of about "-" in thickness. Place into a large bowl.
  3. Into the bowl, add the egg whites, soy sauce, and cornstarch. Mix well until everything has been well incorprated. Store in the fridge for 30 minutes to give it time to marinate.
  4. Heat a large pot of water on the stove and bring it to a light boil. If you are doing the full 5 pounds of chicken you will likely want to cook this in batches so it doesn't cool down the water too much when you drop it in.
  5. Add the chicken to the boiling water and cook it for about 2-3 minutes or just until it is cooked all of the way through and no longer pink in the center. It won't take long since it has been cut so thin.
  6. Remove from the water using a spider or a colander and place on a large sheet pan to dry.
  7. Repeat this process until all of your chicken has been cooked.
  8. You can use a paper towel to help soak up any excess liquid on the sheet pan or on the chicken to help dry it out.
  9. Once the chicken has cooled a bit, place the sheet pan uncovered into your freezer for a couple of hours until the chicken has frozen solid.
  10. Freezing uncovered, in a singler layer is how we flash freeze in a home kitchen. This helps ensure that the food has a chance to freeze as individual pieces instead of in one big clump. It is a requirement for if you are going to vacuum seal this, which you should.
  11. Once the chicken has frozen solid, remove it from the freezer, break up the pieces, and transfer to a zip top bag. I use the Zwilling Fresh & Save Vacuum Bags.
  12. Take out all of the air, and store them in your freezer for later use.

For the Carrots

  1. Wash and peel the outer layer of your carrots.
  2. Using a vegetable peeler, go down the length of the carrot to create ribbons.
  3. For the brine, mix together the water, vinegar, salt, and sugar. Stir to combine and pour over top of the carrots in a glass jar. If you don't have enough to cover the carrots, you can just add more water and vinegar in equal parts.

For the Sauce

  1. Mix all of the ingredients together and store in a glass jar in the fridge. It will last for a couple of weeks. Shake it up prior to use.

For the Stir Fry

  1. Heat a large wok over high heat. Add in some oil.
  2. Add the vegetables to the wok, with the aromatics on the bottom so they can develop color first.
  3. Once the vegetables are about 50% of the way cooked, add in the frozen chicken and allow it to cook for a 1-2 minutes.
  4. Add in the gochujang and gochugaru, stir until everything has a been coated.
  5. Make a well in the center of the wok and pour in the brown sauce. Once it starts to bubble and thicken, add in the rice. Stir to mix and allow it to heat up.
  6. Transfer the contents of the wok to a bowl, top with pickled carrots, cucumber, and green onions.

Ground Chicken Taco Bowls

Ground Chicken Taco Bowls paired with shredded cabbage, rice, and a side of salsa roja. This is a flavorful and filling dish for under 500 calories.

CourseCuisineTime - 35 minutes
Main Dishmeal prep, MexicanPrep - 10 minutes
Cook - 25 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
481kcal5 servings
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates47g46%
Fat14g13%
Protein41g40%

Ingredients:

For the Meat

  • 2 lbs (908 g) ground chicken (95/5) I put boneless skinless chicken thighs in the food processor
  • cup (180 g) tomato sauce
  • 1 tsp (3 g) paprika
  • 1 tsp (3 g) garlic powder
  • 1 tsp (3 g) chili powder
  • 1 tsp (3 g) cumin
  • tbsp (8 g) oil
  • Salt and pepper to taste

For the Cabbage

  • 12 oz (563 g) shredded cabbage You can buy these pre shredded as coleslaw or salad mix
  • tbsp (7 g) oil
  • 1 tsp (3 g) garlic powder
  • Salt and pepper to taste

For the Rice

  • 3 cups (563 g) cooked rice
  • tbsp (8 g) oil
  • 1 tbsp (8 g) chili powder
  • 1 tsp (3 g) paprika
  • 1 (60 g) Roma tomato diced

For the Salsa Roja

  • 4 (240 g) Roma tomatoes
  • 1 small (100 g) white onion
  • 2 (60 g) jalapeos
  • 5 cloves (25 g) garlic
  • tbsp (7 g) oil
  • bunch (20 g) cilantro
  • 2 Tbsp (30 g) lime juice
  • Salt to taste

Instructions:

For the Rice

  1. Prepare enough rice to have 3 cups of cooked rice. 1 cup of dry rice will yield between 2-3 cups of cooked rice depending on what kind you use.
  2. Dice 1 Roma tomato and remove the seeds.
  3. Once the rice has finished, measure out 3 cups and add in the oil, chili powder, paprika, diced Roma tomato, and salt to taste.

For the Salsa Roja

  1. You can either boil, roast, or air fry this. I use the air fryer. Preheat the air fryer to 400F.
  2. Wash your tomatoes, jalapeos, and cilantro. Cut the stems off the jalapeos and cut your onion in half. Peel your garlic cloves.
  3. Add the halved onion, jalapeo peppers, tomatoes, and garlic to a large bowl and drizzle over tbsp of oil and salt to your liking. Toss to coat. The tomatoes have finished cooking when they begin to change color and the skin starts to break.
  4. Air fry for 8-10 minutes, turning every few minutes until the tomatoes and onions have softened and developed color.
  5. Add the tomatoes, onions, garlic, jalapeos, bunch of cilantro, and the juice of 1 lime to a blender or food processor Blend until smooth.
  6. Add salt to taste. Adjust flavor with salt and lime juice as needed.
  7. Portion out into smaller, separate cups for the meals. You will probably have extra.

For the Shredded Cabbage

  1. Heat tbsp of olive oil over medium high heat. Add in the shredded cabbage and cook for 4-5 minutes. Season with 1 tsp garlic powder and salt and pepper to taste.
  2. You can drizzle in a bit of water to create steam and help them cook faster. Once finished, set aside until you are ready to plate.

For the Taco Meat

  1. Heat tbsp of oil over medium high heat and add in your ground chicken. Allow it to brown and cook.
  2. Once the chicken is about 90% of the way cooked, add cup of tomato sauce, 1 tsp paprika, 1 tsp chili powder, 1 tsp cumin, 1 tsp garlic powder, and salt and pepper to taste. Stir to combine and cook for an additional few minutes to cook out the tomato sauce. Taste test and adjust flavors as needed.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide your chicken, cabbage, and rice evenly between the containers. Each meal gets 1 of your salsa cups as well.

Firecracker Beef & Brussels

Firecracker Beef & Brussels sprouts served with a side of rice. The firecracker sauce is made using combination of red pepper flakes, hot sauce and honey for a spicy, sweet, and flavor packed bite.

CourseCuisineTime - 40 minutes
Main DishAmerican, meal prepPrep - 15 minutes
Cook - 25 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
620kcal5 servings
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates63g49%
Fat21g16%
Protein44g34%

Ingredients:

For the Rice

  • 3 cups (563 g) cooked rice

For the Beef and Brussels

  • 2 lbs (908 g) ground beef 90/10
  • 1 lb (454 g) Brussels sprouts
  • medium (100 g) onion
  • 2 medium (200 g) poblano peppers
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) minced garlic
  • 1 tbsp (6 g) red pepper flakes
  • 4 stalks (20 g) green onions optional for garnish
  • 1 lime optional for garnish
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) oil

For the Sauce

  • cup (60 g) hot sauce I use Frank's Red Hot
  • 1 tbsp (20 g) apple cider vinegar
  • 5 tbsp (84 g) honey
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) cornstarch
  • water to thin if necessary

Instructions:

For the Rice

  1. Make enough rice to yield3 cups of cooked rice. 1 cup of dry rice will make between 2-3 cups of cooked rice depending on what type of rice you use.

For the Beef & Brussels

  1. Wash and cut all of your vegetables first.
  2. Cut the stems off of your Brussels sprouts and remove any of the damaged outer layers. Cut them in half.
  3. Cut the onion, green onions, and peppers into a small dice. Mince your garlic if you're using fresh.
  4. Place the Brussels sprout halves into a large bowl and drizzle over tbsp of oil. Season with salt and pepper to your liking.
  5. Preheat your air fryer to 400F.
