  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Add 1 cup of rice to each dish and divide the chicken and broccoli evenly. Top each dish with 1 Tbsp of chopped green onions.

Orange Chicken & Vegetables

A meal prepped version of the Chinese takeout dish. This version is not breaded or deep fried making it a healthier option than the one you would get from the Chinese restaurant.

CourseCuisineTime - 35 minutes 35 minutes 35 minutes
Main DishAsian, meal prepPrep - 10 minutes 10 minutes 10 minutes
Cook - 25 minutes 25 minutes 25 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
627kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates68g50%
Fat17g12%
Protein51g37%

Ingredients:

For the Chicken

  • 2 lbs (1135 g) boneless skinless chicken thighs
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) olive oil
  • 1 Tbsp (6 g) sesame seeds

For the Vegetables

  • 1 (250 g) zucchini
  • 1 (250 g) yellow squash
  • 2 (200 g) carrots
  • 1 (150 g) green pepper
  • 1 (150 g) red pepper
  • (100 g) sweet onion
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) olive oil

For the Sauce

  • cup (84 g) honey
  • cup (60 ml) white vinegar
  • cup (120 ml) orange juice
  • 2 Tbsp (30 ml) soy sauce
  • 2 tsp (6 g) cornstarch
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) cold water

For the Rice

  • 5 cups (675 g) cooked rice

Instructions:

For the Rice

  1. Cook enough rice to have 5 cups of rice. 1 cup of dry rice will yield 3 cups of cooked rice.

For the Chicken

  1. Drizzle 1 Tbsp of olive oil over the chicken and ensure it is distributed across each of the thighs.
  2. Lightly season the chicken with salt and pepper.
  3. Heat a grill pan or a skillet over medium high heat and cook the chicken in batches if necessary to prevent overcrowding. It has finished cooking when the inside is no longer pink and reaches an internal temperature of at least 165F.
  4. Let the chicken rest for at least 5 minutes and then cut it into a large dice.

For the Vegetables

  1. Wash and cut all of the vegetables into a large dice.
  2. Heat 1 Tbsp of olive oil in a large skillet. Add in the onions and carrots first and cook for 1-2 minutes.
  3. Add the peppers and squash next and cook until soft.

For the Sauce

  1. In a small sauce pot add cup honey, cup white vinegar, cup orange juice, and 2 Tbsp soy sauce. Bring to a light boil.
  2. Mix together 2 tsp cornstarch and 1 Tbsp cold water into a slurry. Pour into the sauce and stir to thicken.
  3. Pour the sauce over the chicken and vegetables and top the chicken with 2 Tbsp of sesame seeds.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide the chicken and vegetables evenly between your containers.

Turkey Sloppy Joe Bowls & Jalapeo Cheddar Potatoes

Ground turkey mixed with tomato sauce and seasonings and served with jalapeo cheddar potatoes and broccoli. This meal has a wide array of flavors and reheats well in the microwave.

CourseCuisineTime - 35 minutes 35 minutes 35 minutes
Main CourseAmerican, meal prepPrep - 10 minutes 10 minutes 10 minutes
Cook - 25 minutes 25 minutes 25 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
823kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates65g42%
Fat42g27%
Protein47g30%

Ingredients:

For the Sloppy Joes

  • 2 lbs (908 g) ground beef (85/15)
  • cup (132 g) tomato paste
  • (100 g) sweet onion
  • 1 (150 g) green pepper
  • 2 Tbsp (30 ml) dijon mustard
  • 1 Tbsp (23 ml) Worcestershire sauce
  • cup (60 g) ketchup
  • 1 tsp (3 g) red pepper flakes
  • 1 Tbsp (8 g) onion powder
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) olive oil
  • Salt and pepper to taste

For the Jalapeo Cheddar Potatoes

  • 8 small (1000 g) potatoes
  • 1 (30 g) jalapeo pepper
  • cup (74 g) shredded cheddar cheese
  • 1 Tbsp (23 ml) olive oil
  • Salt and pepper to taste
  • 1 large bunch (500 g) broccoli

For the Potatoes

  • 2 medium (275 g) potatoes
  • (15 g) jalapeo
  • cup (28 g) cheddar cheese shredded
  • Cooking spray oil

Instructions:

For the Potatoes

  1. Preheat your oven to 425F.
  2. Wash and cut your potatoes into a small to medium dice. You want these small so they cook faster. Aim for about inch cubes. Toss the potatoes in 1 Tbsp of olive oil and spread on a sheet pan.
  3. Bake for 10 minutes then remove from the oven and stir/flip. Bake for an additional 5-8 minutes or until they have developed some color.
  4. Remove the potatoes from the oven and segment them out into 5 even portions on the pan. Top each portion with cheddar cheese and sliced jalapeos, bake until the cheese has melted.

For the Sloppy Joes

  1. Cut your pepper and onion into a small dice. Add 1 Tbsp of olive oil in a skillet and add the pepper and onion. Cook until the onion is translucent and add the ground beef and cook until browned.
  2. Once the beef has cooked, stir in cup tomato paste, 1 Tbsp Worcestershire sauce, 2 Tbsp Dijon mustard, cup ketchup, 1 Tbsp onion powder, 1 tsp red pepper flakes, and salt and pepper to taste.

For the Broccoli

  1. Wash and cut your broccoli into florets and cook using your preferred method.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide all of your ingredients evenly between your containers.

Chicken Parmesan

Baked chicken breast tenders coated in ground corn flakes to make a gluten free breading and topped with a red sauce and cheese. The chicken is served with a side of zucchini noodles.

CourseCuisineTime - 45 minutes 45 minutes
Main CourseItalian, meal prepPrep - 20 minutes 20 minutes
Cook - 25 minutes 25 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
670kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates78g51%
Fat13g8%
Protein60g39%

Ingredients:

  • 2 lbs (908 g) chicken breast tenders
  • 2 cups (75 g) cornflakes you can use breadcrumbs, I use cornflakes because they are gluten free
  • cup (28 g) shredded parmesan cheese
  • 2 (2 ) eggs
  • cup (60 g) tapioca flour cornstarch works as well
  • 10 slices (110 g) thinly sliced provolone cheese
  • 2 (120 g) Roma tomatoes sliced
  • 1 tsp (1 g) oregano
  • 5 Tbsp (5 g) fresh parsley chopped
  • 1 cups (300 g) red pasta sauce
  • 3 (750 g) zucchinis
  • 5 cups (750 g) cooked rice or noodles
  • Cooking spray

Instructions:

For the Chicken

  1. Preheat your oven to 400F
  2. In a blender, add cup shredded parmesan cheese, 1 tsp oregano, and 2 cups of cornflakes. Blend until the cornflakes are reduced to a powder.
  3. Set up 3 bowls. One with cup of tapioca flour (cornstarch works as well), one with 2 beaten eggs, and one with the ground cornflakes.
  4. Dip the chicken breast tenders in the tapioca flour, then the egg wash, and then coat with the ground cornflakes.
  5. Spray a sheet pan with cooking spray and place the chicken on the pan. Lightly spray the tops with more cooking spray.
  6. Cook the chicken for 10 minutes and remove from the oven. Flip the chicken and cook an additional 5 minutes.
  7. Remove from the oven again and top the chicken with 1 cups of pasta sauce. Evenly spread the sauce across the chicken evenly. Place two thinly sliced pieces of provolone cheese over the top of the chicken.
  8. Bake an additional 5 minutes or until the cheese starts to brown and remove from oven.
  9. Top the chicken with chopped parsley.

For the Zoodles and Tomatoes

  1. While the chicken is cooking, wash your zucchini and form them into noodles using a vegetable spiralizer.
  2. There is no need to cook these as they will cook upon reheating in the microwave.
  3. Cut the tomatoes into slices.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide your chicken, zoodles, and sliced tomatoes evenly between your containers.

For the Rice

  1. Cook enough rice to have 5 cups worth. 1 cup of dry rice makes around 3 cups of cooked rice.

Taco Bowls with Cauliflower Rice

Ground beef, shredded Brussels sprouts, and cauliflower rice served with a side of salsa roja. A flavorful dish that can be customized to add your favorite toppings.

CourseCuisineTime - 35 minutes 35 minutes 35 minutes
Main Dishmeal prep, MexicanPrep - 10 minutes 10 minutes 10 minutes
Cook - 25 minutes 25 minutes 25 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
718kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates55g41%
Fat36g26%
Protein43g32%

Ingredients:

For the Meat

  • 2 lbs (908 g) ground beef (85/15)
  • cup (120 ml) tomato sauce
  • 1 tsp (3 g) paprika
  • 1 tsp (3 g) garlic powder
  • 1 tsp (3 g) chili powder
  • 1 tsp (3 g) cumin
  • Salt and pepper to taste

For the Brussels Sprouts

  • 9 oz (255 g) shredded Brussels sprouts You can buy these pre shredded
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) olive oil
  • 1 tsp (3 g) garlic powder
  • Salt and pepper to taste

For the Cauliflower Rice

  • 20 oz (567 g) frozen cauliflower rice
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) olive oil
  • 1 Tbsp (8 g) chili powder
  • 1 tsp (3 g) paprika
  • 1 (60 g) Roma tomato diced

For the Salsa Roja

  • 4 (240 g) Roma tomatoes
  • 1 small (100 g) white onion
  • 2 (60 g) jalapeos
  • 4 cloves (20 g) garlic
  • bunch (10 g) cilantro
  • 2 Tbsp (30 ml) lime juice
  • Salt to taste

For the Rice

  • 5 cups (675 g) rice cooked
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) olive oil
  • 1 Tbsp (8 g) chili powder
  • 1 tsp (3 g) paprika
  • 1 (60 g) Roma tomato diced

Instructions:

For the Taco Meat

  1. Heat a large skillet over medium high heat and brown the ground beef.
  2. Once cooked, drain the fat and add in cup of tomato sauce, 1 tsp paprika, 1 tsp chili powder, 1 tsp cumin, 1 tsp garlic powder, and salt and pepper to taste. Stir to combine and cook for an additional 5 minutes then remove from heat.

For the Salsa Roja

  1. Start a medium pot of water over high heat to boil.
  2. Wash your tomatoes, jalapeos, and cilantro. Cut the stems off of the tomatoes and jalapeos and cut the onion in half
  3. Add the small white onion, the peppers, tomatoes, and 4 cloves of garlic to the boiling water. Cook for 6-8 minutes. The tomatoes have finished cooking when they begin to change color and the skin starts to break.
  4. Drain the water from the pot. You may want to remove the skins from the tomatoes to avoid any stringy bits. Add the tomatoes, onions, garlic, jalapeos, bunch of cilantro, and the juice of 1 lime to a blender. Blend until smooth.
  5. Add salt to taste. Adjust flavor with salt and lime juice as needed.
  6. Portion out into smaller, separate cups once it has cooled.

For the Cauliflower Rice

  1. Microwave the cauliflower rice until it is no longer frozen.
  2. Dice 1 Roma tomato and remove the seeds.
  3. Heat a large skillet over medium heat and add 1 Tbsp of olive oil.
  4. Add the riced cauliflower, 1 Tbsp chili powder, and 1 tsp paprika.
  5. Cook for 3-4 minutes and remove from heat. Stir in the diced tomato. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

For the Brussels Sprouts

  1. Heat 1 Tbsp of olive oil over medium high heat. Add in the shaved Brussels sprouts and cook for 2-3 minutes. They will cook fast. Season with 1 tsp garlic powder and salt and pepper to taste.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Add 1 of your salsa cups to each container and divide the remaining ingredients evenly.

For the Rice

  1. Make enough rice to yield 5 cups, cooked. 1 cup of dry rice will make about 3 cups of cooked rice.
  2. Dice 1 Roma tomato and remove the seeds.
  3. Heat a large skillet over medium heat and add 1 Tbsp of olive oil.
  4. Add the rice, 1 Tbsp chili powder, and 1 tsp paprika.
  5. Cook for 3-4 minutes and remove from heat. Stir in the diced tomato. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

Ground Beef Stroganoff

Ground beef cooked with Greek yogurt and tomato sauce. Served with a side of rice and vegetables. This is a healthier version of the classic Beef Stroganoff.

CourseCuisineTime - 35 minutes 35 minutes 35 minutes
Main Dishmeal prepPrep - 10 minutes 10 minutes 10 minutes
Cook - 25 minutes 25 minutes 25 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
703kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates55g41%
Fat34g25%
Protein45g33%

Ingredients:

For the Stroganoff

  • 2 lbs (908 g) ground beef (85/15)
  • (100 g) sweet onion
  • cup (170 g) plain non fat Greek yogurt
  • cup (120 ml) tomato sauce
  • 2 Tbsp (30 ml) dijon mustard
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) olive oil
  • Salt and pepper to taste

For the Rice

  • 5 cups (750 g) cooked rice

For the Vegetables

  • 1 lb (454 g) whole mushrooms
  • 2 (500 g) zucchinis
  • 1 Tbsp (14 ml) butter
  • Salt and pepper to taste

Instructions:

For the Rice

  1. Cook enough rice to have 5 cups of cooked rice. 1 cup of uncooked rice will yield around 3 cups of cooked rice.

For the Stroganoff

  1. Cut of a sweet onion into a small dice.
  2. Heat 1 Tbsp of olive oil over medium high heat and add in the onion. Cook for 3 minutes then add the ground beef. Cook until it has browned and drain the fat.
  3. Once the beef has browned stir in cup plain Greek yogurt, cup tomato sauce, 2 Tbsp dijon mustard. Reduce the heat to medium low and cook for 5-7 minutes to allow the flavors to come together.
  4. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

For the Vegetables

  1. Wash and cut your zucchini and mushrooms into a large dice.
  2. Heat 1 Tbsp of butter in another skillet. Add in the mushrooms and cook for 3-4 minutes then add in the zucchini and cook until soft.
  3. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Add 1 cup of rice to each dish and divide the beef and vegetables evenly.

Teriyaki Ginger Chicken Stir Fry

It doesnt get quicker than a stir fry meal. If you buy frozen, precooked chicken this meal can be made in minutes. Using a bottled teriyaki sauce also makes it super quick and easy.

CourseCuisineTime - 25 minutes 25 minutes 25 minutes
Main DishAsian, meal prepPrep - 5 minutes 5 minutes 5 minutes
Cook - 20 minutes 20 minutes 20 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
573kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates61g49%
Fat15g12%
Protein48g38%

Ingredients:

  • 2 lbs (1135 g) boneless skinless chicken thighs
  • 20 oz (567 g) broccoli fresh or frozen
  • 1 lb (454 g) green beans
  • 2 Tbsp (30 ml) olive oil
  • cup (120 g) teriyaki ginger sauce I use the Kikkoman Teriyaki Triple Ginger sauce
  • 1 Tbsp (6 ml) sesame seeds
  • 5 cups (750 g) cooked rice
  • Salt and pepper to taste

Instructions:

For the Rice

  1. Cook enough rice to have 5 cups of cooked rice. 1 cup of uncooked rice will yield around 3 cups of cooked rice.

For the Chicken

  1. Lightly season the chicken with salt and pepper.
  2. Add 1-2 Tbsp of of olive oil to a grill pan or skillet over medium high heat and cook the chicken in batches if necessary to prevent overcrowding. It has finished cooking when the inside is no longer pink and reaches an internal temperature of at least 165F.
  3. Let it rest for a few minutes after cooking and cut into a large dice.

For the Vegetables

  1. Cook the broccoli in the microwave until it is no longer frozen. It doesnt have to be hot as you will be cooking more in the skillet.
  2. Start a large pot of water over high heat. Add the green beans and bring to a boil. Boil for 5-7 minutes or until the beans have softened but still slightly crisp.
  3. Add the chicken back to the skillet and pour cup of the teriyaki sauce over the top. Stir to coat and then add the green beans and broccoli. Stir everything so that the vegetables can pick up the residual sauce. Sprinkle 1 Tbsp of sesame seeds over the top.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. To each of your containers add 1 cup of rice and divide the stir fry evenly.

Middle Eastern Chicken with Turmeric Rice

Chicken thighs seasoned with middle eastern spices and grilled to perfection. Paired with the chicken is rice, spiced with turmeric and mixed with carrots, peas, and tomatoes.

CourseCuisineTime - 35 minutes 35 minutes 35 minutes
Main Dishmeal prep, Middle EasternPrep - 10 minutes 10 minutes 10 minutes
Cook - 25 minutes 25 minutes 25 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
659kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates60g43%
Fat21g15%
Protein57g41%

Ingredients:

For the Chicken

  • 2 lbs (1135 g) boneless skinless chicken thighs
  • 1 cup (227 g) plain non fat Greek yogurt
  • (100 g) red onion minced
  • tsp (1 g) salt
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) lemon juice
  • 1 tsp (3 g) cumin
  • 1 tsp (1 g) oregano
  • tsp (2 g) paprika
  • 2 Tbsp (30 ml) olive oil

For the Rice

  • 5 cups (750 g) cooked rice
  • 2 tsp (8 g) turmeric
  • 2 cup (200 g) shredded carrots
  • 2 cup (300 g) frozen peas
  • 2 (120 g) Roma tomatoes
  • 3 tsp (8 g) garlic powder
  • 2 Tbsp (30 ml) olive oil
  • Salt and pepper to taste

Instructions:

For the Rice

  1. Cook enough rice to have 5 cups of cooked rice. 1 cup of uncooked rice will yield around 3 cups of cooked rice.
  2. Once the rice has finished cooking, measure out 5 cups and place in a large bowl.
  3. Cut your Roma tomato into a small dice, remove the seeds. Chop the shredded carrots into smaller pieces.
  4. Mix in 2 tsp turmeric, 2 cup shredded carrots, 2 cup frozen peas, the diced tomato, 3 tsp garlic powder, 2 Tbsp olive oil, and salt and pepper to taste.

For the Chicken

  1. While the rice is cooking add the chicken thighs to a ziplock back with 1 cup of Greek yogurt, of minced red onion, tsp salt, 1 Tbsp lemon juice, 1 tsp cumin, 1 tsp oregano, tsp paprika, and 1 Tbsp olive oil.
  2. Toss the chicken around in the bag to make sure it is evenly coated and then remove the air and allow to marinate for at least 5 minutes. 30 minutes is preferred but in the interest of time, it is not required.
  3. Heat a grill pan over medium high heat and add 1 Tbsp of olive oil.
  4. Cook the chicken in batches if necessary to prevent overcrowding. Cook it for roughly 3 minutes on each side but be careful not to mess with it too much as you want the outside to develop some color.
  5. After the chicken has cooked, remove it from the pan and cut it into a large dice. Add it back to the pan to allow for it to finish cooking and develop more color.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide the chicken and rice evenly between each of your containers.

Salsa Chicken Quinoa Bowls

These Chicken Quinoa Bowls are incredibly versatile. Pictured here is a Salsa Chicken Bowl. You could also make a Buffalo Chicken Bowl or BBQ Chicken.

CourseCuisineTime - 30 minutes 30 minutes 30 minutes
Main Dishmeal prep, MexicanPrep - 10 minutes 10 minutes 10 minutes
Cook - 20 minutes 20 minutes 20 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
713kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates61g41%
Fat25g17%
Protein61g41%

Ingredients:

  • 2 lbs (1135 g) boneless skinless chicken breast
  • 1 large (300 g) zucchini
  • 15 oz (425 g) black beans
  • 1 large (200 g) green pepper
  • 16 oz (454 g) salsa
  • 5 cups (875 g) cooked quinoa
  • 5 Tbsp (82 ml) olive oil
  • Salt and pepper

Instructions:

For the Quinoa

  1. Cook enough quinoa to have 5 cups of cooked quinoa. 1 cup of uncooked quinoa will yield around 3 cups of cooked quinoa. Rinse the quinoa prior to cooking until the water runs clear. Cook using the same method you would use for rice. Mix in 3 Tbsp olive oil for extra calories.

For the Chicken

  1. Butterfly (or pound with a meat tenderizeyour chicken so that it is not so thick and it will cook faster. Cut all the way through so you have 2 pieces. If it is still fairly thick, you may want to pound it until it is inch thin or less. (Butterfly means to cut down the middle so you can open it like a book).
  2. Lightly season the chicken with salt and pepper.
  3. Add 1-2 Tbsp of of olive oil to a grill pan or skillet over medium high heat and cook the chicken in batches if necessary to prevent overcrowding. It has finished cooking when the inside is no longer pink and reaches an internal temperature of at least 165F.
  4. Let it rest for a few minutes after cooking and cut into a medium dice.
  5. Add to a bowl and mix with half the salsa to coat evenly.

For the Vegetables

  1. Wash and cut your pepper and zucchini into a small dice. Sauts until soft.
  2. Drain and rinse the black beans
  3. Plating
  4. This recipe makes 5 servings. Add 1 cup of quinoa and divide the remaining ingredients equally to each container.

Buffalo Chicken Quinoa Bowls

These Chicken Quinoa Bowls are incredibly versatile. Pictured here is a Buffalo Chicken Bowl with Greek yogurt ranch. You could also make a Salsa Chicken Bowl or BBQ Chicken.

CourseCuisineTime - 30 minutes
Main DishAmerican, meal prepPrep - 10 minutes
Cook - 20 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
442kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates27g28%
Fat13g13%
Protein54g57%

Ingredients:

  • 2 lbs (1135 g) boneless skinless chicken breast
  • 1 cup (175 g) celery diced
  • 1 cup (125 g) shredded carrots
  • 1 cup (175 g) green peppers diced
  • 1 cup (227 g) plain non fat Greek yogurt
  • 1 tsp (3 g) ranch dressing seasoning mix
    • cup (60 mL) buffalo sauce
  • 2 cups (438 g) cooked quinoa
  • 2 Tbsp (30 ml) olive oil
  • Salt and pepper

Instructions:

For the Quinoa

  1. Cook enough quinoa to have 2 cups of cooked quinoa. 1 cup of uncooked quinoa will yield around 3 cups of cooked quinoa. Rinse the quinoa prior to cooking until the water runs clear. Cook using the same method you would use for rice.

For the Chicken

  1. Butterfly (or pound with a meat tenderizeyour chicken so that it is not so thick and it will cook faster. Cut all the way through so you have 2 pieces. If it is still fairly thick, you may want to pound it until it is inch thin or less. (Butterfly means to cut down the middle so you can open it like a book).
  2. Lightly season the chicken with salt and pepper.
  3. Add 12 Tbsp of of olive oil to a grill pan or skillet over medium high heat and cook the chicken in batches if necessary to prevent overcrowding. It has finished cooking when the inside is no longer pink and reaches an internal temperature of at least 165F.
  4. Let it rest for a few minutes after cooking and cut into a medium dice.
  5. Add to a bowl and mix with cup buffalo sauce to coat evenly.

For the Vegetables

  1. Wash and cut your pepper and celery into a small dice. You need to have a total of 1 cups each.
  2. Measure out 1 cups of shredded carrots.
  3. You dont need to cook any of these as they will cook in the microwave.

For the Ranch Dressing

  1. Mix together 1 cup of Greek yogurt and 1 tsp of ranch dressing mix. Store in separate, smaller containers.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Add cup of quinoa and carrots, celery, and peppers to each container. Divide the chicken equally and add 1 of your ranch dressing cups to each container.

Deconstructed Cheeseburger Bowls

A meal prep version of the American classic. Ground beef, potato wedges, and burger toppings come together in a bowl that reheats well in the microwave.

CourseCuisineTime - 33 minutes
Main DishAmerican, meal prepPrep - 8 minutes
Cook - 25 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
662kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates47g38%
Fat35g28%
Protein41g33%

Ingredients:

For the Hamburger and Toppings

  • 2 lbs (908 g) ground beef (85/15)
  • 5 Tbsp (35 g) shredded cheese
  • 9 oz (255 g) shredded Brussels sprouts
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) olive oil
  • 1 tsp (2 g) garlic powder
  • 10 Tbsp (150 ml) BBQ sauce Vinegar based
  • 5 (150 g) dill pickle spears
  • 2 (120 g) Roma tomatoes
  • Salt and pepper to taste

For the Potato Wedges

  • 5 small (750 g) russet potatoes
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) olive oil
  • Salt and pepper

Instructions:

For the Potato Wedges

  1. Preheat your oven to 400F.
  2. Wash each of your potatoes thoroughly. Cut each of them in half long ways 3 times so you have 8 wedges for each potato.
  3. In a large bowl, drizzle 1 Tbsp of olive oil over the potatoes. Sprinkle with 1 tsp of salt and pepper. Toss the potatoes to coat and spread onto a sheet pan.
  4. Bake for 10 minutes and then flip them to the other side and cook an additional 10-12 minutes or until desired doneness is achieved.

For the Hamburger

  1. Heat a skillet over medium high heat. Add the ground beef and cook. Once it has browned, season with salt and pepper to taste.

For the Brussels Sprouts

  1. Heat 1 Tbsp of olive oil over medium high heat. Add in the shaved Brussels sprouts and cook for 2-3 minutes. They will cook fast. Season with 1 tsp garlic powder and salt and pepper to taste.

For the Bowls

  1. Cut 2 Roma tomatoes into slices.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide your hamburger, potatoes, and Brussels sprouts evenly between your 5 containers. Top the hamburger with 1 Tbsp of shredded cheese. Add 1 pickle spear and slices of Roma tomatoes. Store 2 Tbsp of BBQ sauce in a separate container.

Firecracker Chicken

Thinly sliced chicken breast coated in firecracker sauce and served with a side of rice and vegetables. If you are a fan of spicy food, this one is for you.

CourseCuisineTime - 35 minutes 35 minutes 35 minutes
Main Dishmeal prepPrep - 10 minutes 10 minutes 10 minutes
Cook - 25 minutes 25 minutes 25 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
624kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates65g50%
Fat22g17%
Protein41g32%

Ingredients:

For the Chicken

  • 2 lbs (908 g) boneless skinless chicken breast
  • 3 Tbsp (45 ml) Franks Red Hot Sauce any hot sauce should work
  • 1 tsp (2 g) red pepper flakes
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) apple cider vinegar
  • (84 g) cup honey
  • 1 Tbsp (8 g) cornstarch
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) cold water
  • 2 Tbsp (30 ml) olive oil
  • Salt and pepper to taste
  • (10 g) Green onions to garnish optional

For the Vegetables

  • 2 medium (500 g) zucchinis
  • 1 large (200 g) red pepper
  • medium (100 g) sweet onion
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) olive oil
  • Salt and pepper to taste

For the Rice

  • 5 cups (750 g) cooked rice
  • 3 Tbsp (45 g) olive oil

Instructions:

For the rice

  1. Cook enough rice to have 5 cups of cooked rice. 1 cup of uncooked rice will yield around 3 cups of cooked rice. Mix in 3 Tbsp of olive oil for extra calories.

For the Chicken

  1. Butterfly your chicken so that it is not so thick and it will cook faster. Cut all the way through so you have 2 pieces. If it is still fairly thick, you may want to pound it until it is inch thin or less. (Butterfly means to cut down the middle so you can open it like a book).
  2. Heat a grill pan over medium high heat and add 1 Tbsp of olive oil. Season the chicken with salt and pepper.
  3. Cook the chicken in batches if necessary to prevent overcrowding. It has finished cooking when the inside is no longer pink and reaches an internal temperature of at least 165F.

For the Vegetables

  1. Cut your vegetables into a large dice.
  2. Heat a large skillet over medium high heat and add 1 Tbsp of olive oil.
  3. Add the onions and peppers first. Cook them for 1-2 minutes and then add in the zucchini and cook until soft.

For the Sauce

  1. In a small sauce pot, add 3 Tbsp hot sauce, 1 tsp red pepper flakes, 1 Tbsp apple cider vinegar, and cup honey. Bring to a light boil.
  2. Mix together 1 Tbsp of cornstarch and 1 Tbsp of cold water to make a slurry. Pour into the pot and stir to thicken.
  3. Pour the sauce over the chicken and coat evenly.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Add 1 cup of rice and divide the remainder of your ingredients evenly between your containers. Top with green onions if you wish.

Beef & Broccoli Stir Fry

An easy recipe with great flavor. This meal is as good as any you would get from a Chinese takeout menu. Make sure you get your pan nice an hot to get a good sear on the beef!

CourseCuisineTime - 30 minutes 30 minutes 30 minutes
Main DishAsian, meal prepPrep - 10 minutes 10 minutes 10 minutes
Cook - 20 minutes 20 minutes 20 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
717kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates74g50%
Fat27g18%
Protein45g30%

Ingredients:

  • 2 lbs (908 g) sirloin steak
  • 1 bunch (500 g) broccoli
  • (100 g) sweet onion
  • 1 lb (454 g) carrots
  • 2 Tbsp (30 ml) olive oil
  • 1 Tbsp (5 g) ginger
  • 3 tsp (8 g) cornstarch
  • 5 cups (750 g) cooked rice
  • 5 Tbsp (10 g) green onions chopped
  • Salt and pepper to taste
  • 1 Tbsp (8 g) sesame seeds

For the Sauce

  • cup (120 ml) soy sauce
  • 1 Tbsp (15 g) sriracha
  • cup (60 ml) water
  • 1 Tbsp (5 g) ginger minced
  • 1 tsp (3 gl) cornstarch
  • 3 Tbsp (37 g) brown sugar

Instructions:

For the rice

  1. Cook enough rice to have 5 cups of cooked rice. 1 cup of uncooked rice will yield around 3 cups of cooked rice.

For the Beef and Broccoli

  1. Prepare all of your ingredients before you start cooking. Cut your onion and carrots into a large dice, cut your broccoli into florets. Mince the enough ginger to yield 2 Tbsp.
  2. Heat a large skillet over medium high heat and add ~1 Tbsp of olive oil.
  3. Cut the steak into thin slices (about inch thick, against the grain of the meat. It may help to cut if the meat is slightly frozen.
  4. Very lightly season the beef with salt and sprinkle 3 tsp of cornstarch over the top. Try and coat all sides of the meat.
  5. Cook the beef in the pan in batches. You want to get a sear on the meat so dont overcrowd the pan and make sure your pan is hot. After 1 minute, flip the pieces and cook an additional minute. Remove from pan.
  6. Add olive oil if necessary and cook the remaining beef.
  7. Once the beef has finished add ~1 Tbsp of olive oil to the pan. Add in the onions, carrots, and minced ginger. Cook for 3 minutes and then add in the broccoli. Continue cooking until the broccoli begins to soften. It may be helpful to parboil it first.

For the Sauce

  1. In a sauce pot, add cup soy sauce, 1 Tbsp sriracha, 1 Tbsp minced ginger, 2 Tbsp of water and 3 Tbsp brown sugar over medium heat. Allow the sugar to melt and stir frequently. Bring to a light boil.
  2. Mix 1 tsp cornstarch into the remaining 2 Tbsp of water. Add to the pot and stir to thicken.
  3. Combine the beef and vegetables back into the skillet and pour the sauce over the top. Stir to coat evenly. Top with sesame seeds.
  4. This recipe makes 5 servings. Add 1 cup of rice and 1 Tbsp green onions to each dish and divide the meat mixture evenly.

For the Chicken and Broccoli

  1. Prepare all of your ingredients before you start cooking. Cut your onion and carrots into a large dice, cut your broccoli into florets. Mince the enough ginger to yield 2 Tbsp.
  2. Heat a large skillet over medium high heat and add ~1 Tbsp of olive oil.
  3. Cut the chicken into thin slices (about inch thick, against the grain of the meat. It may help to cut if the meat is slightly frozen.
  4. Very lightly season the beef with salt and sprinkle 3 tsp of cornstarch over the top. Try and coat all sides of the meat.
  5. Cook the chicken in the pan in batches. You want to get a sear on the meat so dont overcrowd the pan and make sure your pan is hot. After 1 minute, flip the pieces and cook an additional minute. Remove from pan.
  6. Add olive oil if necessary and cook the remaining beef.
  7. Once the chicken has finished add ~1 Tbsp of olive oil to the pan. Add in the onions, carrots, and minced ginger. Cook for 3 minutes and then add in the broccoli. Continue cooking until the broccoli begins to soften. It may be helpful to parboil it first.

Sweet Potato Turkey Chili

A hearty chili packed with sweet potatoes, pinto beans, peppers, and ground turkey. This meal can be made in one pot to help speed up the cleaning process!

CourseCuisineTime - 30 minutes 30 minutes 30 minutes
Main DishAmerican, meal prepPrep - 10 minutes 10 minutes 10 minutes
Cook - 20 minutes 20 minutes 20 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
669kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates72g53%
Fat27g20%
Protein35g26%

Ingredients:

For the Chili

  • 1 lbs (681 g) ground beef (85/15)
  • 14.5 oz (411 g) pinto beans
  • 14.5 oz (411 g) can petite diced tomatoes
  • 14.5 oz (411 g) can crushed tomatoes
  • 1 large (300 g) sweet potato
  • medium (100 g) sweet onion
  • 1 medium (150 g) green pepper
  • 1 medium (150 g) red pepper
  • 2 Tbsp (15 g) chili powder
  • 1 tsp (3 g) cayenne pepper
  • 2 Tbsp (30 ml) olive oil
  • 5 cups (750 g) cooked rice
  • Salt and pepper to taste

For the Topping

  • 5 Tbsp (71 g) Greek yogurt
  • green onions

Instructions:

  1. Before you start cooking youll want to chop all of your vegetables first and start cooking the rice. This will save time. Youll also want to start a pot of water to boil for the sweet potatoes. Cut the onion and bell peppers into a small dice. Cut the sweet potatoes into a medium dice.
  2. Add the sweet potatoes to the boiling water and cook until soft. Drain the water and set aside.
  3. Heat 1 Tbsp of olive oil over medium high heat in a large pot. Add in the peppers and onions and cook for 3-5 minutes or until soft.
  4. Push the pepper and onion mixture to the side and add an additional 1 Tbsp of olive oil to the pot. Lightly season the turkey with salt and pepper and add to the pot. Cook until browned.
  5. Add the crushed tomatoes, petite diced tomatoes, sweet potatoes, 2 Tbsp chili powder, and 1 tsp cayenne pepper, and beans to the pot. Bring to a boil and taste test. Season with salt and pepper and adjust seasonings as needed.
  6. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide all of your ingredients evenly between 5 containers. Add 1 cup of cooked rice to each dish. Top each dish with Greek yogurt and green onions.

Smoked Sausage with Rice & Beans

Here is one of the easiest meals you will ever make. Sausage, rice, and beans is such a classic combination and the frozen broccoli and carrots add an easy source of nutrients.

CourseCuisineTime - 25 minutes
Main Dishmeal prepPrep - 5 minutes
Cook - 20 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
467kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates52g52%
Fat15g15%
Protein32g32%

Ingredients:

  • 28 oz (795 g) turkey kielbasa sausage
  • 2 cups (375 g) cooked rice
  • 2 cups (300 g) shredded carrots
  • 1 lb (454 g) frozen chopped broccoli
  • 1 can (425 g) black beans 15oz drained and rinsed
  • cup (10 g) cilantro optional
  • 1 lime optional
  • Salt and pepper to taste

Instructions:

  1. Cook enough rice to yield 3 cups of cooked rice. (1 cup of dry rice yields around 3 cups of cooked rice)
  2. Slice your kielbasa sausage into bite sized pieces and fry in a large skillet until browned.
  3. This is all of the cooking that is required for this meal. The carrots, broccoli, and beans will cook in the microwave when you reheat your meal. If you plan on eating the meal right away, microwave the broccoli and carrots and heat the beans in a small sauce pan.
  4. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide all of your ingredients evenly between 5 containers. Sprinkle chopped cilantro over the beans and rice. Serve with a lime wedge if youd like.

Asian Ground Turkey Bowls

Ground turkey mixed in an Asian inspired sauce and served with a side of rice, and vegetables. Topping this dish with a few peanuts after reheating would be a great addition.

CourseCuisineTime - 35 minutes
Main DishAsian, meal prepPrep - 10 minutes
Cook - 25 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
415kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates36g42%
Fat16g19%
Protein32g38%

Ingredients:

For the Rice

  • 2 cups (375 g) cooked rice

For the Vegetables

  • 1 medium (200 g) sweet onion
  • 1 medium (150 g) green pepper
  • 2 cups (250 g) shredded carrots
  • 1 tbsp (15 mL) olive oil
  • salt and pepper to taste

For the Turkey

  • 2 lbs (681 g) ground turkey 93/7
  • 8 oz (227 g) mushrooms
  • 1 tbsp (21 g) honey
  • 2 tsp (10 g) sriracha
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) garlic minced
  • tsp (1 g) ground ginger
  • 1 tsp (5 mL) sesame oil
  • 1 tbsp (15 mL) olive oil
  • 3 tbsp (45 mL) soy sauce
  • salt and pepper to taste

Instructions:

For the Vegetables

  1. Wash and cut your green pepper into a large dice. Cut your sweet onion into a large dice as well.
  2. Cut your mushrooms into quarters if they are small or more if they are larger mushrooms.
  3. In a large skillet, heat 1 Tbsp of olive oil over medium high heat.
  4. Add the onion first and cook for 1-2 minutes then add in the green peppers. Cook until soft and remove from the pan. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

For the Turkey

  1. Heat 1 Tbsp of olive oil over medium high heat. Add in the ground turkey and 1 Tbsp minced garlic to cook.
  2. When the turkey is half way browned, add in the chopped mushrooms and cook together until the turkey has fully browned.
  3. When the turkey has finished, add in 1 Tbsp of honey, 3 Tbsp soy sauce, 2 tsp sriracha, 1 tsp sesame oil, and tsp ground ginger. Stir to incorporate and season with salt and pepper to taste.

For the Rice

  1. Cook enough rice to have 2 cups of cooked rice. 1 cup of uncooked rice will yield around 3 cups of cooked rice.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. You do not need to cook the shredded carrots because they will cook when reheated in the microwave. Add cup of rice and carrots to each container and divide the remaining ingredients equally.

Peaches and Cream Baked Oatmeal

Peaches and Cream Baked Oatmeal made from frozen peaches layered and swirled cream cheese inside of an oatmeal and egg bake. This is a great meal for those weeks you prefer something sweet to have in the morning.

CourseCuisineTime - 55 minutes
BreakfastAmerican, meal prepPrep - 10 minutes
Cook - 45 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
392kcal6
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates49g59%
Fat13g15%
Protein20g24%

Ingredients:

  • 3 cups (240 g) old fashioned oats
  • 2 scoops (60 g) vanilla protein powder
  • 1 tsp (4 g) baking powder
  • 1 lb (454 g) peaches frozen, fresh, or canned
  • 2 tbsp (42 g) maple syrup
  • 1 tbsp (14 g) butter
  • 10 tbsp (150 g) liquid egg whites or 2 eggs
  • 2 cups (480 g) 2% milk
  • 4 oz (113 g) plain cream cheese i used whipped, regular is fine you'll just need to melt it down
  • 2 tbsp (25 g) sugar
  • tsp (2 g) salt

Instructions:

For the Baked Oatmeal

  1. Preheat your oven to 375F.
  2. Measure out your peaches. If you would like a sweeter end product, sprinkle 1 teaspoon (5g) of sugar over the top and allow them to macerate. It may help speed up the process if you thaw them in the microwave first.
  3. In a large bowl, mix together the oats, protein powder, salt, and baking powder.
  4. Add in the egg whites, milk, syrup, 1 tbsp of melted butter, and the peaches. Reserve a few to put on top.
  5. Spray a 13"x9" pan with oil and add the oat mixture.
  6. Mix together the cream cheese and sugar. You can microwave it for a bit to help it soften. Put a few spoonfuls of the cream cheese around your pan and swirl it around as best as you can.
  7. You can garnish the top with fresh peach slices if you wish.
  8. Bake for 40-45 minutes.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 6 servings. Cut the oatmeal into 6 equal pieces.

Easy Breakfast Tacos

These Breakfast Tacos are my go to breakfast or late night meal when I don't have anything prepped. They only take 10-15 minutes and are made from eggs, cheese, and potatoes.

CourseCuisineTime - 15 minutes
Breakfast, Main DishAmerican, MexicanPrep - 5 minutes
Cook - 10 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
152kcal4 Tacos
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates16.3g56%
Fat6.5g22%
Protein7g24%

Ingredients:

For the Tacos

  • 4 (94 g) corn tortillas
  • 1 small (100 g) russet potato
  • 2 large (140 g) eggs
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) milk
  • 2 slices (46 g) cheese
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) hot sauce
  • 1 tbsp (5 g) cilantro chopped
  • tsp (2 g) oil
  • salt to taste

For the Pickled Red Onions

  • 1 medium (200 g) red onion
  • 1 tbsp (12 g) sugar
  • 1 tsp (6 g) salt
  • 1 cups (360 g) white vinegar
  • 1 cups (360 g) water

Instructions:

For the Tacos

  1. Wash and cut your potato into small shoestring french fry shapes.
  2. Place the fries into your air fryer basket and spray with 2g of oil and sprinkle with salt to taste.
  3. Air fry at 400 F for 8-10 minutes shaking the basket half way through.
  4. While the potatoes are cooking, crack 2 eggs into a dish and add a splash of milk and salt. Beat until they are smooth. Cook the eggs in either a pan or in the microwave until they are finished.
  5. In a dry skillet over medium high heat, add 4 corn tortillas to warm and lightly brown. Flip over and add a half slice of cheese to each to begin to melt.
  6. To each tortilla, evenly divide the potatoes and eggs. Top each with hot sauce, pickled onions, and chopped cilantro.
  7. The nutritional estimates are per taco.

For the Pickled Red Onions

  1. These are best made in advance. I always keep these in my fridge. They will last for weeks.
  2. Cut your red onion into thin slices from root to shoot.
  3. In large mason jar, add1tsp of salt,1tbsp of sugar,1cups water, and1cups distilled vinegar. Stir to dissolve the solids.
  4. Add the onions into the mason jar and top with more water and vinegar if necessary to cover the onions. Cap the jar and move it into the fridge to allow the onions to pickle.

Breakfast Burritos

Freezer Friendly Breakfast Burritos made of turkey sausage, eggs, peppers, onion, spinach, and cheese. These can be prepped in advanced and stored into the freezer to give you breakfast each morning in about a minute.

CourseCuisineTime - 1 hour 10 minutes
BreakfastAmerican, meal prepPrep - 30 minutes
Cook - 40 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
349kcal17 burritos
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates39g56%
Fat14g20%
Protein16g23%

Ingredients:

For the Turkey Sausage

  • 1 lb (454 g) ground turkey 93/7
  • 1 tbsp (12 g) brown sugar
  • 1 tsp (6 g) salt
  • 1 tsp (3 g) pepper
  • 1 tsp (3 g) cayenne pepper
  • 1 tsp (3 g) smoked paprika
  • 1 tsp (3 g) onion powder
  • 1 tsp (3 g) garlic powder
  • 1 tsp (1 g) oregano
  • 1 tsp (2 g) rubbed sage
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) oil

For the Burrito Filling

  • 8 large (560 g) eggs
  • 2 tbsp (30 g) milk
  • 1 medium (150 g) green pepper
  • 1 medium (150 g) red pepper
  • 1 medium (200 g) sweet onion
  • 5 oz (140 g) spinach
  • 2 cups (170 g) frozen shredded hash browns
  • 2 tbsp (30 g) oil
  • 1 cup (120 g) shredded cheese
  • 17 9 inch flour tortillas

Instructions:

For the Turkey Sausage

  1. In a large bowl add the turkey and all of the seasonings and brown sugar. Mix thoroughly to incorporate into the meat.
  2. In a large skillet over medium high heat, add 1 tbsp of oil and add in the turkey. Brown it on both sides and cook it until no pink color remains.
  3. Break up the sausage into small pieces and set aside until you are ready for it later.

For the Burrito Filling

  1. While the turkey is cooking, wash and prep all of your vegetables.
  2. Cut the peppers and onion into a small dice and roughly chop the spinach into smaller pieces. Measure out 2 cups of frozen shredded hash browns.
  3. In a large skillet over medium high heat add 1 tbsp of oil and add in the peppers and onions. Allow them to cook down and soften. Season lightly with salt early to help encourage some of the water to be released faster.
  4. Once the onions have begun to turn translucent, add in the hash browns and spinach. Stir to combine and wilt the spinach.
  5. Crack 8 eggs into a bowl, add in 2 tbsp of milk and beat until they are smooth.
  6. You can cook the eggs in the same skillet or in a separate one at the same time as the vegetables cook. If you use the same skillet, create some room in the center to cook the eggs.
  7. Add in 1 tbsp of oil and pour the eggs into the center to make scrambled eggs. Cook them for a few minutes until they have finished.
  8. Once done, remove from the heat and stir in the sausage. Mix and give it a taste test. Adjust flavor with salt and pepper as necessary.
  9. Allow the mixture to cool before you construct the burritos, put it in the fridge for a few minutes if necessary.

Constructing the Burritos

  1. I made 17 burritos out of this recipe using 9 inch tortillas. You may yield more or less.
  2. Measure out 1 cup (120g) of shredded cheese.
  3. Lay out some tortillas on your work space and place a couple of large spoonfuls of the filling on top of each. I used about 70-80g of filling for each burrito.
  4. Add about 1 tbsp of shredded cheese to the top of the filling and roll the burrito up by folding in the sides first, then rolling the center over the top. Repeat until all of your filling is used up.
  5. If you are going to vacuum seal these, place the burritos onto a sheet pan or in a baking dish as you finish them. Flash freeze the burritos by placing them into your freezer, uncovered, for a few hours until they are frozen solid. If you don't plan on vacuum sealing you can just roll them in foil or place them in a zip top bag.
  6. Once the burritos have frozen solid, place them into your vacuum bags and remove the air. Store in your freezer.

Reheating

  1. To reheat, I recommend wrapping the burrito inside of a damp paper towel and microwaving for 60-75 seconds or until it is hot in the center.

Orange Creamsicle Baked Oatmeal

Orange Creamsicle Baked Oatmeal. Inspired by one of my favorite summer snacks, this baked oatmeal combines oranges and cream cheese inside a baked oatmeal. There are even some carrots snuck in for some hidden vegetables.

CourseCuisineTime - 55 minutes
BreakfastAmerican, meal prepPrep - 15 minutes
Cook - 40 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
382kcal6
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates49g61%
Fat12g15%
Protein19g23%

Ingredients:

  • 3 cups (240 g) old fashioned oats
  • 2 scoops (60 g) vanilla protein powder
  • 1 tsp (4 g) baking powder
  • 20 oz (300 g) canned mandarin oranges fresh can work as well
  • 1 tbsp (8 g) orange zest
  • 2 medium (150 g) carrots
  • 1 tbsp (14 g) butter
  • 10 tbsp (150 g) liquid egg whites or 2 eggs
  • 1 cups (240 g) 2% milk
  • 1 cup (240 g) orange juice
  • 4 oz (113 g) plain cream cheese
  • 2 tbsp (20 g) sugar
  • 1 tsp (4 g) vanilla

Instructions:

For the Baked Oatmeal

  1. Preheat your oven to 375F.
  2. Wash and grate your carrots into fine pieces using a box grater or a microplane.
  3. Wash one orange and zest it until you have 1 tbsp or 8g of orange zest.
  4. Canned Mandarin Oranges work best for this recipe because they are already peeled. Use two 10oz cans and drain away any of the syrup. I had 300g worth once I did this.
  5. You can also use regular mandarin oranges but they have a "skin" on the outside of each piece that makes them a bit tough. Peel all of your oranges and remove as much of the stringy bits as possbile. Separate the pieces. Removing the translucent "skin" on the outside of each orange piece will give you a softer bite as this can get chewy when baked. Cutting it off with the peel by using a knife is the fastest way to do it.
  6. In a large bowl, mix together the oats, protein powder, and baking powder.
  7. Add in the egg whites, milk, orange juice, 1 tbsp of melted butter, carrots, zest, and orange slices.
  8. Spray a 13"x9" pan with oil and add the oat mixture. You can also line this with parchment for easier clean up.
  9. Mix together the cream cheese, vanilla, and sugar. You can microwave it for a bit to help it soften. Put a few spoonfuls of the cream cheese around your pan and swirl it around as best as you can.
  10. Bake for 35-45 minutes.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 6 servings. Cut the oatmeal into 6 equal pieces.

PB and J Baked Oatmeal

PB and J Baked Oatmeal made from a homemade strawberry jelly and peanut butter combined inside of an oatmeal and egg bake. A great breakfast or bedtime snack with a decent dose of protein.

CourseCuisineTime - 1 hour 10 minutes
BreakfastAmerican, meal prepPrep - 10 minutes
Cook - 1 hour

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
376kcal6 servings
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates45g56%
Fat12g15%
Protein22g27%

Ingredients:

  • 3 cups (240 g) old fashioned oats
  • 2 scoops (60 g) vanilla protein powder
  • 1 tsp (4 g) baking powder
  • 3 tbsp (48 g) peanut butter
  • 2 tbsp (42 g) maple syrup
  • 10 tbsp (150 g) liquid egg whites or 2 eggs
  • 2 cups (480 g) milk

For the Strawberry Jelly

  • 1 lb (454 g) frozen strawberries
  • 1 tsp (6 g) splenda or 5-6x sugar/maple syrup
  • 2 tsp (8 g) pectin optional but recommended

For the Peanut Butter Drizzle

  • 2 tbsp (32 g) peanut butter

Instructions:

For the Strawberry Jelly

  1. I usually make a double or triple batch of this and keep it in the fridge for use in other things as well. If you want to give it time to set up a bit you should make it the night before but that isn't required if you are just using it for this baked oatmeal. If you have this prepped in your fridge you can prep this baked oatmeal in 5 minutes.
  2. In a large pot over medium heat, add in your frozen strawberries and allow them to cook down. As they begin to thaw, break them up with a spatula to help them cook faster.
  3. Sprinkle the splenda over the top and bring to a light boil. You can use real sugar or maple syrup if you wish, you will just need to use more of it. Allow it to lightly boil, stirring often so it doesn't stick to the bottom.
  4. After a few minutes, add in the pectin and continue mixing. The pectin is what helps to make it into a jelly. You don't need to add the pectin for use in the baked oatmeal but if you want to use it for a jelly with other things, you should add it.
  5. After it has been lightly boiling for 10-15 minutes you can pull it off the heat and transfer to a storage container. Place it in the fridge to cool as you prep the other ingredients.

For the Baked Oatmeal

  1. Preheat your oven to 350F.
  2. In a large bowl, mix together the oats, protein powder, and baking powder.
  3. Add in the egg whites, milk, syrup, and 3 tbsp of peanut butter. Stir to combine.
  4. Spray a 13"x9" pan with oil and add the oat mixture.
  5. Spoon the jelly over the top and swirl it into the oat mixture using a butter knife.
  6. Bake for 35-40 minutes.

For the Peanut Butter Drizzle

  1. Melt 2 tbsp of peanut butter in the microwave for few seconds until melted.
  2. Add to a small ziplock bag and cut a small hole in the corner. Pipe the peanut butter over the top of the finished baked oatmeal.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 6 servings. Cut the oatmeal into 6 equal pieces.

Dark Chocolate Cherry Baked Oatmeal

Dark Chocolate Cherry Baked Oatmeal made from frozen cherries and dark chocolate chips combined inside of an oatmeal and egg bake. This is a great meal for those weeks you prefer something sweet to have in the morning.

CourseCuisineTime - 50 minutes
BreakfastAmerican, meal prepPrep - 10 minutes
Cook - 40 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
384kcal6
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates56g65%
Fat10g11%
Protein19g22%

Ingredients:

  • 3 cups (240 g) old fashioned oats
  • 2 scoops (60 g) vanilla protein powder
  • 1 tsp (4 g) baking powder
  • 1 lb (450 g) frozen cherries
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) sugar
  • 2 tbsp (42 g) maple syrup
  • 1 tbsp (14 g) butter
  • 10 tbsp (150 g) liquid egg whites or 2 eggs
  • 2 cups (480 g) milk
  • 2 tbsp (28 g) dark chocolate chips

For the Chocolate Drizzle

  • 1 tbsp (14 g) dark chocolate chips
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) milk

Instructions:

For the Baked Oatmeal

  1. Preheat your oven to 375F.
  2. If your cherries are whole, cut them into halves or quarters. Sprinkle 1 tbsp of sugar over the top of the cherries and allow them to macerate.
  3. In a large bowl, mix together the oats, protein powder, and baking powder.
  4. Add in the egg whites, milk, syrup, 1 tbsp of melted butter, 2 tbsp of the chocolate chips, and the cherries. If you get the big dark chocolate chips you should cut them up a bit so you get more coverage.
  5. Spray a 13"x9" pan with oil and add the oat mixture.
  6. Bake for 35-40 minutes.

For the Chocolate Drizzle

  1. Melt 1 tbsp of the dark chocolate chips and 1 tsp or so of milk in the microwave for few seconds until they melt. Stir to combine and continue to thin with milk until you get a consistency that will allow you to pipe over the top.
  2. Add the chocolate to a small ziplock bag and cut a small hole in the corner. Pipe the chocolate over the top of the baked oatmeal.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 6 servings. Cut the oatmeal into 6 equal pieces.

Lemon Blueberry Baked Oatmeal

Frozen blueberries layered and swirled cream cheese inside of a lemon flavored oatmeal and egg bake. This is a great meal for those weeks you prefer something sweet to have in the morning.

CourseCuisineTime - 50 minutes
BreakfastAmerican, meal prepPrep - 10 minutes
Cook - 40 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
366kcal6
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates50.8g65%
Fat9.3g11%
Protein19.8g25%

Ingredients:

  • 3 cups (240 g) old fashioned oats
  • 2 scoops (60 g) vanilla protein powder
  • 1 tsp (4 g) baking powder
  • 3 cups (450 g) blueberries frozen is fine
  • 2 tbsp (42 g) maple syrup
  • 1 tbsp (14 g) butter
  • 10 tbsp (150 g) liquid egg whites or 3 eggs
  • 2 cups (480 g) skim milk
  • 3 tbsp (45 g) lemon juice
  • 4 oz (113 g) plain cream cheese i used whipped, regular is fine you'll just need to melt it down
  • 2 tbsp (20 g) sugar
  • 1 tsp (4 g) splenda optional
  • 1 tbsp (5 g) lemon zest

Instructions:

For the Baked Oatmeal

  1. Preheat your oven to 350F.
  2. Measure out your berries. If you would like a sweeter end product, sprinkle a teaspoon of splenda or sugar over the top of the strawberries and allow them to macerate. It may help speed up the process if you thaw them in the microwave first.
  3. In a large bowl, mix together the oats, protein powder, and baking powder.
  4. Add in the egg whites, milk, syrup, 1 tbsp of melted butter, lemon juice, and the berries.
  5. Spray a 13"x9" pan with oil and add the oat mixture.
  6. Mix together the cream cheese and sugar. You can microwave it for a bit to help it soften. Put a few spoonfuls of the cream cheese around your pan and swirl it around as best as you can.
  7. Bake for 35-40 minutes.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 6 servings. Top with lemon zest. Cut the oatmeal into 6 equal pieces.

Stuffed Hash Browns

Stuffed Hash Browns made in the air fryer. These hash browns are perfect to add to Snack City in your freezer for an easy morning breakfast.

CourseCuisineTime - 35 minutes
Breakfast, SnackAmerican, meal prepPrep - 35 minutes
Cook - 0 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
62kcal36 hash browns
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates10.2g78%
Fat1.3g10%
Protein2.5g19%

Ingredients:

  • 3 lbs (1362 g) frozen shredded hash browns country style
  • cup (85 g) tapioca flour corn starch works too
  • 1 tbsp (14 g) seasoned salt or regular salt
  • 1 medium (150 g) green pepper
  • 1 medium (150 g) red pepper
  • medium (100 g) sweet onion
  • lb (227 g) diced ham
  • cup (84 g) shredded cheese
  • (10 g) oil spray

Instructions:

For the Hash Browns

  1. Place all of your frozen hash browns into a microwave safe bowl. Microwave for 5-6 minutes or until they have thawed and are easier to work with and mold. You can use regular potatoes and shred them on your own if you wish. If you do this you will need to squeeze out as much water from them as possible using a clean towel.
  2. Wash and cut your peppers and onion into a small dice. Dry the ham with a paper towel to get as much moisture off of it as possible.
  3. Once the hash browns have thawed, stir in the tapioca flour (or corn starch), seasoned salt, peppers, onions, ham, and cheese.
  4. Spray a small ramekin or dish with a bit of oil and pack the potatoes into shape. You will want to pack them densely. I used about 60g ( cup) worth for each hash brown. Hit the ramekin upside down against the counter top or your hand lightly to release the hash brown. If you find that they aren't staying together you can add more starch. Some brands of hash browns are less starchy than others.
  5. You can cook these in advanced or freeze them as they are now. If you are going to freeze (this is what I do) place them on a sheet pan and flash freeze them to solidify. Once they have frozen solid, transfer to a ziplock bag and store in the freezer.
  6. If you choose to cook them in advance, preheat your air fryer to 400F. Place the hash browns in the air fryer in a single layer, cooking in batches if necessary. Spray the tops with a bit of oil to help with browning. Cook for 12-15 minutes, flipping half way and spraying the underside with a bit of oil.
  7. You can probably use an oven to cook these but they likely won't get as crispy and will take longer to cook. I have not attempted it, FYI.

Storage

  1. Once the hash browns have frozen solid if not precooking or have cooled if you did precook, add them to a ziplock bag, remove the air and freeze. To reheat, use the air fryer if you want to keep them crispy.
  2. Reheating the uncooked hash browns in the air fryer at 400F for 12-15 minutes. Spray the tops with oil and turn half way.
  3. This recipe makes 36 hash browns. The nutrition information is for each one.

Double Chocolate Chip Pancake Bites

Pancake batter poured into a mini muffin tin and baked to create a similar flavor and texture to pancakes. Bake these, throw them in the freezer, and reheat them whenever you need in the microwave. Serve with a side of maple syrup.

CourseCuisineTime - 20 minutes
Breakfast, SnackAmericanPrep - 10 minutes
Cook - 10 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
36kcal48 bites
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates5.1g72%
Fat0.7g10%
Protein2.2g31%

Ingredients:

  • 2 cup (200 g) oat flour
  • cup (50 g) tapioca flour corn starch would probably work
  • 2 scoop (60 g) vanilla casein protein powder I use the brand Optimum Nutrition but micellar casein will work
  • 1 cup (260 g) liquid egg whites
  • cup (60 g) mini chocolate chips
  • 2 tsp (8 g) baking powder
  • 7 tbsp (35 g) cocoa powder
  • 1 cup (360 ml) water

Instructions:

For the Pancake Bites

  1. Preheat your oven to 325F.
  2. In a large bowl, mix together all of the dry ingredients until no clumps remain. It is easiest for later if your bowl has a spout on it, not required however. Sift the cocoa powder if needed.
  3. NOTE: I'm sure many of you will ask me if you can swap the casein with whey or leave it out all together. No, do not omit the casein and absolutely do not substitute with whey. Your pancake bites will become hockey pucks. A lot of the sweetness comes from the protein powder, do not leave it out. I have attempted this recipe by adding sugar in place of the protein powder and it does not work. The casein adds an airy quality that is not present when only oat flour is used. You can probably use wheat flour and omit the casein but add in some kind of sweetener.
  4. Add in the water, egg whites, and 3 tbsp of chocolate chips. Mix until incorporated and your batter is pourable.
  5. Spray a mini muffin tin with cooking spray. Make sure to coat all sides of the well.
  6. If your bowl doesn't have a spout you may find it easiest to transfer the batter into a large ziplock bag to use as a piping bag. Cut off the corner to fill each well of your mini muffin tin.
  7. Fill each well about half way with batter. This recipe makes 48 bites. Top each bite with the remaining chocolate chips.
  8. Bake for 9-10 minutes.

Storage

  1. Once the bites have completely cooled, place them in a ziplock bag and remove as much air as possible. Store in the freezer.
  2. Reheat the bites in the microwave and serve with maple syrup.

Carrot Cake Baked Oatmeal

Carrot Cake Baked Oatmeal made from grated carrots, spices, a "frosting", and oats. This is a great meal for those weeks you prefer something sweet to have in the morning.

CourseCuisineTime - 45 minutes
BreakfastAmerican, meal prepPrep - 15 minutes
Cook - 30 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
423kcal6
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates53g58%
Fat14g15%
Protein23g25%

Ingredients:

  • 3 cups (240 g) old fashioned oats
  • 2 scoops (60 g) vanilla protein powder
  • 1 tsp (4 g) baking powder
  • 4 large (340 g) carrots grated
  • 2 tbsp (42 g) syrup
  • 1 tbsp (14 g) butter
  • 10 tbsp (150 g) liquid egg whites or 2 whole eggs
  • 2 cups (600 g) 2% milk
  • 1 tsp (3 g) ground ginger
  • 2 tsp (6 g) cinnamon
  • 1 tsp (3 g) nutmeg
  • cup (48 g) brown sugar

For the Frosting

  • 4 oz (100 g) cream cheese
  • cup (100 g) plain nonfat Greek yogurt
  • 1 tbsp (12 g) splenda

Instructions:

For the Oatmeal Bake

  1. Preheat your oven to 350F.
  2. In a large bowl, mix together the oats, protein powder, spices and baking powder.
  3. Wash and shred/grate your carrots into small pieces. I use the small shredding side of my cheese grater for this. Sprinkle the brown sugar over the carrots and mix.
  4. In the bowl with the carrots, add the butter, egg whites, syrup, milk. Pour in the dry ingredients and mix to combine.
  5. Spray a 13"x9" pan with oil and add the oat mixture. Spread evenly.
  6. Bake for 30-35 minutes.

For the Frosting

  1. Melt the cream cheese and mix in the yogurt and splenda.
  2. Place into a ziplock bag (or piping bag) and set aside.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 6 servings. Cut the oatmeal into 6 equal pieces. Once the oatmeal bake has cooled a bit, top with the frosting. I frost my oatmeal the day I cook it, it is probably better to keep your frosting in the fridge and frost the day of eating but it doesn't make a huge difference.

Notes

  1. I think adding some raisins and walnuts would be a nice addition, however I left them out of the recipe because it seems like I am in the minority for adding raisins specifically. Add them if you want.

Air Fryer Hash Browns

Hash Browns made in the air fryer using only 3 ingredients. These hash browns are perfect to add to Snack City in your freezer for a quick morning treat.

CourseCuisineTime - 40 minutes
Breakfast, SnackAmerican, meal prepPrep - 15 minutes
Cook - 25 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
61kcal15 hash browns
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates13.8g106%
Fat0.3g2%
Protein0.7g5%

Ingredients:

  • 30 oz (850 g) frozen shredded hash browns country style
  • cup (30 g) tapioca flour corn starch works too
  • 3 tsp (12 g) seasoned salt or regular salt
  • (5 g) oil spray

Instructions:

For the Hash Browns

  1. Place all of your frozen hash browns into a microwave safe bowl. Microwave for 5-6 minutes or until they have thawed and are easier to work with and mold. You can use regular potatoes and shred them on your own if you wish. If you do this you will need to squeeze out as much water from them as possible using a clean towel.
  2. Once the hash browns have thawed, stir in the tapioca flour (or corn starch) and salt.
  3. Spray a small ramekin or dish with a bit of oil and pack the potatoes into shape. You will want to pack them densely. I used about 60g ( cup) worth for each hash brown. Hit the ramekin upside down against the counter top or your hand to release the hash brown. I yielded 15 hash browns in total.
  4. You can cook these in advanced or freeze them as they are now. If you are going to freeze (this is what I do) place them on a sheet pan and flash freeze them to solidify. Once they have frozen solid, transfer to a ziplock bag and store in the freezer.
  5. Preheat your air fryer to 400F. Place the hash browns in the air fryer in a single layer, cooking in batches if necessary. Spray the tops with a bit of oil to help with browning. Cook for 12-15 minutes, flipping half way and spraying the underside with a bit of oil.
  6. You can probably use an oven to cook these but they likely won't get as crispy and will take longer to cook. I have not attempted it, FYI.

Storage

  1. Once the hash browns have cooled, add them to a ziplock bag, remove the air and freeze. To reheat, use the air fryer if you want to keep them crispy.
  2. This recipe makes 15 hash browns. The nutrition information is for each one.

Peanut Butter Chocolate Chip Baked Oatmeal

Peanut Butter Chocolate Chip Baked Oatmeal made from powdered peanut butter, chocolate chips, bananas, and oats. This is a great meal for those weeks you prefer something sweet to have in the morning.

CourseCuisineTime - 50 minutes 50 minutes
BreakfastAmerican, meal prepPrep - 10 minutes 10 minutes
Cook - 40 minutes 40 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
432kcal6
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates54g60%
Fat14g15%
Protein22g24%

Ingredients:

  • 3 cups (240 g) old fashioned oats
  • 2 scoops (60 g) vanilla protein powder
  • 1 tsp (4 g) baking powder
  • 2 medium (250 g) bananas ripe
  • 2 tbsp (42 g) honey
  • 1 tbsp (14 g) butter
  • 10 tbsp (150 g) liquid egg whites or 2 whole eggs
  • 2 cups (480 g) skim milk
  • 3 tbsp (45 g) mini chocolate chips
  • 4 tbsp (64 g) peanut butter

For the Peanut Butter Drizzle

  • 1 tbsp (16 g) peanut butter
  • Water to thin if necessary

Instructions:

For the Oatmeal Bake

  1. Preheat your oven to 350F.
  2. In a large bowl, mix together the oats, protein powder, and baking powder.
  3. In a separate bowl, add the bananas, peanut butter, and butter. Microwave them for a bit to soften and mash until they are smooth.
  4. Whisk together the mashed banana, peanut butter, butter, egg whites, honey, and milk. Pour in the dry ingredients and 2 tbsp of the chocolate chips. Mix to combine.
  5. Spray a 13"x9" pan with oil and add the oat mixture. Top with the remaining chocolate chips.
  6. Bake for 30-35 minutes.
  7. Melt the remaining peanut butter and drizzle it over the top of the baked oatmeal. Thin it with a bit of water if needed.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 6 servings. Cut the oatmeal into 6 equal pieces.

Giant Protein Pancake

A gluten free, high protein pancake made from oat flour and a blend of whey and casein protein.

CourseCuisineTime - 10 minutes
Breakfast, Dessert, SnackAmericanPrep - 5 minutes
Cook - 5 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
283kcal1 Pancake
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates29.2g43%
Fat2.2g3%
Protein36.5g54%

Ingredients:

  • scoop (25 g) vanilla whey/casein blend 50/50 blend. I mix 12.5g of whey and 12.5g of casein together
  • cup (20 g) oat flour
  • 1 tbsp (10 g) tapioca flour or cornstarch
  • 1/4 tsp (1 g) baking powder
  • cup (60 g) liquid egg whites
  • cup (75 g) plain nonfat Greek yogurt
  • 1-2 tbsp (25 g) water

For the Toppings

  • cup (100 g) mixed berries frozen is fine
  • tsp (2 g) splenda optional
  • 1 tbsp (5 g) fat free whipped cream

Instructions:

  1. Mix all the dry ingredients together so no clumps are present. NOTE: I have tested this with only whey protein and it doesn't turn out as well. Only casein will work but you may need more water in the batter. The 50/50 blend is best.
  2. Add in the wet ingredients and mix thoroughly.
  3. Heat a griddle/skillet on medium heat and spray with oil. Add the batter and cook for a couple minutes, then flip.

For the Toppings

  1. If your fruit is frozen, defrost it in the microwave. Sprinkle the splenda over the top and allow it to macerate for a few minutes. This will pull out some of the juices and allow you to use less syrup.
  2. Top your pancake with the fruit and whipped cream.

Berries and Cream Baked Oatmeal

Frozen berries layered and swirled cream cheese inside of an oatmeal and egg bake. This is a great meal for those weeks you prefer something sweet to have in the morning.

CourseCuisineTime - 50 minutes
BreakfastAmerican, meal prepPrep - 10 minutes
Cook - 40 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
369kcal6
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates52g65%
Fat9.3g11%
Protein19.3g24%

Ingredients:

  • 3 cups (240 g) old fashioned oats
  • 2 scoops (60 g) vanilla protein powder
  • 1 tsp (4 g) baking powder
  • 4 cups (450 g) mixed berries frozen is fine
  • 2 tbsp (42 g) maple syrup
  • 1 tbsp (14 g) butter
  • 10 tbsp (150 g) liquid egg whites or 2 eggs
  • 2 cups (480 g) skim milk
  • 4 oz (113 g) plain cream cheese i used whipped, regular is fine you'll just need to melt it down
  • 2 tbsp (20 g) sugar
  • 1 tsp (4 g) splenda optional

Instructions:

For the Baked Oatmeal

  1. Preheat your oven to 375F.
  2. Measure out your berries. If you would like a sweeter end product, sprinkle a teaspoon of splenda or sugar over the top of the strawberries and allow them to macerate. It may help speed up the process if you thaw them in the microwave first.
  3. In a large bowl, mix together the oats, protein powder, and baking powder.
  4. Add in the egg whites, milk, syrup, 1 tbsp of melted butter, and most of the berries. Reserve a few to put on top.
  5. Spray a 13"x9" pan with oil and add the oat mixture.
  6. Mix together the cream cheese and sugar. You can microwave it for a bit to help it soften. Put a few spoonfuls of the cream cheese around your pan and swirl it around as best as you can.
  7. Bake for 35-40 minutes.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 6 servings. Cut the oatmeal into 6 equal pieces.

5 Minute Hash Brown Breakfast Bowl

A quick breakfast bowl made in the microwave from frozen hash browns, egg whites, greek yogurt and cheese. Add peppers and onions for extra flavor.

CourseCuisineTime - 5 minutes
BreakfastAmericanPrep - 2 minutes
Cook - 3 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
188kcal1 serving
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates18g41%
Fat3g6%
Protein22g51%

Ingredients:

  • 1/2 cup (120 g) 120g egg whites
  • (100 g) ~1.5 cups 100g frozen shredded hash browns
  • (50 g) ~1/4 cup 50g plain non fat Greek yogurt
  • 1 tbsp (10 g) 10g cheese
  • 1 tsp (2 g) 2g Green onions
  • Salt and pepper to taste

Instructions:

  1. Add the frozen hash browns and eggs to a bowl. Microwave in 1 minute intervals and stir until eggs have cooked.
  2. Add in the yogurt, salt, pepper and stir. Add the cheese and microwave an additional 30 seconds or until the cheese has melted.
  3. Top with green onions and enjoy.

Strawberries and Cream Baked Oatmeal

Sliced strawberries layered and swirled cream cheese inside of an oatmeal and egg bake. This is a great meal for those weeks you prefer something sweet to have in the morning.

CourseCuisineTime - 50 minutes
BreakfastAmerican, meal prepPrep - 10 minutes
Cook - 40 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
345kcal6
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates47g62%
Fat9g12%
Protein19g25%

Ingredients:

  • 3 cups (240 g) old fashioned oats
  • 2 scoops (60 g) vanilla protein powder
  • 1 tsp (4 g) baking powder
  • 4 cups (450 g) strawberries frozen is fine
  • 2 tsp (8 g) sugar or sub 1/2 sugar alternative
  • 2 tbsp (42 g) maple syrup
  • 1 tbsp (14 g) butter
  • 10 tbsp (150 g) liquid egg whites or 2 eggs
  • 2 cups (480 g) skim milk
  • 4 oz (113 g) plain cream cheese i used whipped, regular is fine you'll just need to melt it down
  • 2 tbsp (20 g) sugar

Instructions:

For the Baked Oatmeal

  1. Preheat your oven to 375F.
  2. If your strawberries are whole, cut them into thin slices. If you would like a sweeter end product, sprinkle 2 tsp sugar or 1 tsp splenda the top of the strawberries and allow them to macerate.
  3. In a large bowl, mix together the oats, protein powder, and baking powder.
  4. Add in the egg whites, milk, syrup, 1 tbsp of melted butter, and most of the strawberries. Reserve a few to put on top.
  5. Spray a 13"x9" pan with oil and add the oat mixture.
  6. Mix together the cream cheese and sugar. You can microwave it for a bit to help it soften. Put a few spoonfuls of the cream cheese around your pan and swirl it around as best as you can.
  7. Bake for 35-40 minutes.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 6 servings. Cut the oatmeal into 6 equal pieces.

Chocolate Chip Banana Bread Baked Oatmeal

Ripe bananas baked into an oatmeal and egg mixture and topped with chocolate chips for a Chocolate Chip Banana Bread Baked Oatmeal. This is a great meal for those weeks you prefer something sweet to have in the morning.

CourseCuisineTime - 50 minutes
BreakfastAmerican, meal prepPrep - 10 minutes
Cook - 40 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
389kcal6
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates59g67%
Fat9g10%
Protein19g21%

Ingredients:

  • 3 cups (240 g) old fashioned oats
  • 2 scoops (60 g) vanilla protein powder
  • 1 tsp (4 g) baking powder
  • 4 medium (500 g) bananas ripe
  • 2 tbsp (42 g) honey
  • 1 tbsp (14 g) butter
  • 10 tbsp (150 g) liquid egg whites or 2 whole eggs
  • 2 cups (480 g) 2% milk
  • 2 tbsp (28 g) mini chocolate chips

Instructions:

For the Oatmeal Bake

  1. Preheat your oven to 375F.
  2. In a large bowl, mix together the oats, protein powder, and baking powder.
  3. In a separate bowl, add 3 of the ripe bananas and mash. It may help to microwave them for a bit to soften. Cut the other banana into slices to go on top of the oatmeal.
  4. Whisk together the mashed banana, egg whites, honey, milk, and 1 tbsp of melted butter. Pour in the dry ingredients and 1 tbsp of the chocolate chips. Mix to combine.
  5. Spray a 13"x9" pan with oil and add the oat mixture. Top with the sliced banana and chocolate chips.
  6. Bake for 35-40 minutes.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 6 servings. Cut the oatmeal into 6 equal pieces.

Pumpkin Cinnamon Rolls

A fall inspired pumpkin cinnamon roll. These are sweet, breadlike, and satisfying while using a combination of rice flour, cornstarch, and vanilla casein protein.

CourseCuisineTime - 32 minutes
Breakfast, DessertAmericanPrep - 20 minutes
Cook - 12 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
77kcal8 small rolls
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates13.3g83%
Fat1.5g9%
Protein2.8g17%

Ingredients:

For the Dough

  • cup (50 g) rice flour
  • 3 tbsp (25 g) tapioca flour
  • scoop (20 g) vanilla casein protein
  • tsp (2 g) baking powder
  • cup (80 g) canned pumpkin
  • 2 tbsp (30 g) liquid egg whites

For the Filling

  • 1 tsp (7 g) butter melted
  • 1 tbsp (20 g) sugar
  • 1 tsp (2 g) cinnamon

For the Frosting

  • 2 tbsp (24 g) whipped cream cheese frosting buy premade, its easier and better

Instructions:

For the Cinnamon Rolls

  1. Preheat your oven to 400F.
  2. Mix the flours, baking powder, and protein powder together until incorporated. Add in the pumpkin and egg whites. Stir until a dough forms.
  3. Spread out two large pieces of wax paper. Spray each side with oil.
  4. Place the dough on the wax paper and cover with the other wax paper. Roll the dough out until it is between " and " thick and in a rectangle. You don't want it so thin that it tears and so thick that it can't roll.
  5. Mix the sugar and cinnamon together and melt the butter.
  6. Spread the butter out over the dough and sprinkle in the cinnamon sugar.
  7. Lift up the bottom layer of wax paper to help roll the dough. The tighter you can get the roll the better.
  8. Once you have rolled the dough, cut it into 8 pieces.
  9. Spray a sheet pan, baking dish, or cast iron skillet with oil. Add the rolls to the pan. In the picture, I used a small cast iron skillet and placed them all together so they were touching. This is a fine way to do it but you will have to cook it longer and I think it prevents the rolls from being as soft as they could be. If you were to place them separately on the sheet pan, it will cook a bit more evenly but if you aren't able to achieve a tight roll, they will tip over. Not a huge issue but something to consider.
  10. Bake for 10-12 minutes if you put them on the pan apart from eachother. Bake for 17-18 minutes if you place them next to eachother.
  11. Spread the frosting over the top of the rolls. Makes 8 small cinnamon rolls.

Protein Pancakes

A gluten free, high protein pancake recipe made from oat flour and a blend of whey and casein protein.

CourseCuisineTime - 10 minutes
Breakfast, Dessert, SnackAmericanPrep - 5 minutes
Cook - 5 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
266kcal4 Pancakes
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates26.7g43%
Fat1.9g3%
Protein35.4g57%

Ingredients:

  • scoop (25 g) vanilla whey/casein blend 50/50 blend. I mix 12.5g of whey and 12.5g of casein together
  • cup (20 g) oat flour
  • 1 tbsp (10 g) tapioca flour or cornstarch
  • 1/4 tsp (1 g) baking powder
  • cup (60 g) liquid egg whites
  • cup (75 g) plain nonfat Greek yogurt
  • 1-2 tbsp (25 g) water

Instructions:

  1. Mix all the dry ingredients together so no clumps are present. NOTE: I have tested this with only whey protein and it doesn't turn out as well. Only casein will work but you may need more water in the batter. The 50/50 blend is best.
  2. Add in the wet ingredients and mix thoroughly.
  3. Heat a griddle/skillet on medium heat and spray with oil. Add the batter and cook for a couple minutes, then flip.

Protein Waffle

A gluten free, high protein waffle made from oat flour and a blend of whey and casein protein.

CourseCuisineTime - 10 minutes
Breakfast, Dessert, SnackAmericanPrep - 5 minutes
Cook - 5 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
183kcal1 Waffle
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates17.9g41%
Fat1.4g3%
Protein25.1g58%

Ingredients:

  • (20 g) scoop vanilla whey/casein blend 50/50 blend
  • 3 tbsp (14 g) oat flour
  • 1 tbsp (6.5 g) tapioca flour
  • tsp (1 g) baking powder
  • 3 tbsp (40 g) liquid egg whites
  • 3 tbsp (50 g) plain nonfat Greek yogurt
  • 1 tbsp (20 g) water

Instructions:

  1. Mix all the dry ingredients together so no clumps are present. NOTE: I have tested this with only whey protein and it doesn't turn out. Only casein will work but you may need more water in the batter. The 50/50 blend is best.
  2. Add in the wet ingredients and mix thoroughly.
  3. Heat an 8 waffle iron on medium heat and spray with oil. Add the batter and cook for a couple minutes.

Raspberry Poptarts

A fun, homemade version of a Raspberry Poptarts made from gluten free flours and homemade raspberry jam. I use the air fryer to cook these but an oven works just as well.

CourseCuisineTime - 38 minutes
Breakfast, DessertAmericanPrep - 30 minutes
Cook - 8 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
196kcal2 poptarts
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates34.5g76%
Fat1.9g4%
Protein10.3g22%

Ingredients:

For the Pastry and Filling

  • cup (30 g) brown rice flour oat flour works as well, just not as pretty
  • cup (30 g) tapioca flour
  • 2 tbsp (16 g) vanilla casein
  • tsp (3 g) butter
  • cup (60 ml) water
  • 2 tbsp (30 g) raspberry jam homemade or jarred

For the Frosting

  • 2 tbsp (30 g) plain nonfat Greek yogurt
  • 1 tsp (5 g) vanilla casein
  • 1 tsp (5 g) powdered sugar
  • 1 tsp (4 g) sprinkles

Instructions:

For the Jam

  1. Make the jam or use pre-made. Its just 280g frozen raspberries, 120ml water, 20g of sugar reduced and a bit of cornstarch to thicken. Bring to a boil and mash then thicken with the cornstarch.

For the Pastry

  1. Mix the flours and casein together. Add in the water and butter. Stir to form dough. Place in the freezer for 10 minutes. Gluten free dough is often sticky so the freezer will help it dry out a bit.
  2. Lay out two sheets of wax paper. Spray lightly with oil. Roll out the dough between the paper to 1/8 thick. Trim the edges to form a rectangle. Cut into 4s.
  3. Place a spoonful or so of jam at the center of two of the squares. Place the empty squares on top and press down the edges with your finger and crimp with a fork. It's easiest to use the wax paper to assist you in the folding and then peel the paper away.
  4. Make a ball with your scraps and cook that as well, it's included in the nutrition information so you might as well cook it.
  5. Preheat an air fryer or oven to 325F. Air fry for 8 minutes. Baking might take a bit longer.

For the Frosting

  1. For the frosting just mix everything together. Place in the fridge for a bit to chill.
  2. Top with frosting and sprinkles.

Homemade Cinnamon Rolls

I have spent 3 years trying to make a gluten free, yeast free, cinnamon roll that had a similar texture and taste to the real thing. These are sweet, breadlike, and satisfying while using a combination of oat flour, corn starch, and vanilla casein protein.

CourseCuisineTime - 40 minutes
Breakfast, DessertAmericanPrep - 30 minutes
Cook - 10 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
324kcal2 rolls
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates49.2g70%
Fat7.9g11%
Protein14.1g20%

Ingredients:

For the Dough

  • cup (40 g) oat flour
  • 5 tbsp (35 g) cornstarch
  • scoop (23 g) vanilla casein protein
  • tsp (2 g) baking powder
  • cup (80 g) milk
