  • 2 tbsp (30 g) liquid egg whites

For the Filling

  • 1 tsp (6 g) butter melted
  • 1 tbsp (18 g) sugar
  • 1 tsp (2 g) cinnamon

For the Frosting

  • 2 tbsp (24 g) whipped cream cheese frosting buy premade, its easier and better

Instructions:

Note

  1. This recipe was developed using a digital scale for measurements. They are far more accurate than volumetric measures and I recommend using a scale for this recipe as the hydration of the dough is crucial. If you use volumetric, and find your dough wet or dry you will have to add more liquid or casein as necessary.

For the Cinnamon Rolls

  1. Preheat your oven to 400F. You can also use the air fryer.
  2. Mix the flours, baking powder, and protein powder together until incorporated. Add in the milk and egg whites. Stir until a dough forms. Place in the fridge for 10-15 minutes to help it set up and become less sticky.
  3. Spread out two large pieces of wax paper. Spray each side with oil.
  4. Place the dough on the wax paper and cover with the other wax paper. Roll the dough out until it is " thick and in a rectangle. You don't want it so thin that it tears and so thick that it can't roll.
  5. Mix the sugar and cinnamon together and melt the butter.
  6. Spread the butter out over the dough and sprinkle in the cinnamon sugar.
  7. Cut the dough in half down the center of the rectangle, long ways.
  8. Lift up the bottom layer of wax paper to help roll the dough into a cylinder. Roll one strip first, then place that at the start of the second strip and continue rolling to create one super roll.
  9. Once you have rolled the dough, cut it in half to make 2 rolls.
  10. Spray a sheet pan, baking dish, or cast iron skillet with oil. Add the rolls to the pan.
  11. Bake for 8-12 minutes in the oven. Watch closely and pull them out when they have just begun to brown on top. If you use the air fryer (how I cook them) it only takes 6 minutes.
  12. Spread the frosting over the top of the rolls. Makes 2 large rolls.

Chorizo Breakfast Bowls

Chorizo, scrambled eggs, and a pepper, onion, and potato mixture. There is only a bit of chorizo in this dish but it provides so much flavor that any more may be too rich.

CourseCuisineTime - 35 minutes 35 minutes 35 minutes
Breakfastmeal prep, MexicanPrep - 10 minutes 10 minutes 10 minutes
Cook - 25 minutes 25 minutes 25 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
591kcal4
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates36g34%
Fat36g34%
Protein32g30%

Ingredients:

  • 8 (8 ) eggs
  • 1 lb (680 g) Yukon gold potatoes
  • medium (100 g) onion
  • 2 medium (300 g) bell peppers
  • 12 oz (340 g) chorizo
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) olive oil
  • salt and pepper to taste

Instructions:

For the Potatoes

  1. Preheat your oven to 425F
  2. Wash and cut your potatoes into a medium dice.
  3. Add to a sheet pan with some olive oil and sprinkle with salt and pepper. Roast for 10 minutes and then flip. Cook an additional 8-10 minutes or until you achieve proper browning.

For the Pepper and Onion Mix

  1. Wash and chop your onion and peppers into a medium dice. Saut in olive oil until softened. Stir in the potatoes.

For the Chorizo and Scrambled Eggs

  1. Cook the chorizo and scrambled eggs, together is fine, separate if you'd prefer the separation. Be careful not to overcook your eggs as you will be reheating them again in the microwave if you are meal prepping this dish.

Plating

  1. Divide ingredients evenly 4 ways. This recipe makes 4 servings.

Ham & Apple Breakfast Scramble

A hearty breakfast loaded with sweet potatoes, ham, green pepper, golden delicious apples and scrambled eggs. It packs a ton of flavor into every bite to start your day off right.

CourseCuisineTime - 30 minutes 30 minutes 30 minutes
BreakfastAmerican, meal prepPrep - 10 minutes 10 minutes 10 minutes
Cook - 20 minutes 20 minutes 20 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
568kcal4
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates44g41%
Fat28g26%
Protein34g32%

Ingredients:

  • lb (340 g) ham steak
  • 10 eggs
  • cup (60 ml) milk
  • 2 (600 g) large sweet potato
  • (75 g) small onion
  • 1 (125 g) small green pepper
  • 1 (125 g) golden delicious apple
  • 1 (125 g) avocado
  • 2 Tbsp (30 ml) olive oil

Instructions:

  1. Preheat your oven to 400F.
  2. Wash and peel your sweet potato. Cut it into a small/medium dice. Drizzle 1 Tbsp olive oil over the top and roast at 400F for 10 minutes and flip. Cook an additional 5-10 minutes. or until proper browning has been achieved.
  3. Cut the onion and pepper in a small dice. Add some oil to a skillet over medium high heat. Cook until the onions are soft and translucent. Remove from pan.
  4. Scramble 6 eggs with the milk and cook over medium heat until cooked. Set aside.
  5. Cut the ham into a large dice and saut in skillet until browned.
  6. Cut the apple into a large dice. Dont cook this as it will cook in the microwave and you want it to maintain texture.
  7. Add all of you ingredients (minus the avocado) into the pan and stir to incorporate.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 4 servings. Divide your ingredients evenly between your 4 containers. Top with a few slices of avocado if desired.

Lil Blueberry Pancake Bites

Pancake batter poured into a mini muffin tin and baked to create a similar flavor and texture to pancakes. Bake these, throw them in the freezer, and reheat them whenever you need in the microwave. Serve with a side of maple syrup.

CourseCuisineTime - 20 minutes
Breakfast, SnackAmericanPrep - 10 minutes
Cook - 9 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
28kcal24 bites
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates4.4g73%
Fat0.3g5%
Protein2g33%

Ingredients:

  • 1 cup (100 g) oat flour
  • cup (25 g) tapioca flour corn starch would probably work
  • 1 scoop (30 g) vanilla casein protein powder I use the brand Optimum Nutrition but micellar casein will work
  • cup (130 g) liquid egg whites
  • cup (45 g) frozen blueberries small ones work best
  • 1 tsp (4 g) baking powder
  • 10 tbsp (150 ml) water cup + 2 tbsp

Instructions:

For the Pancake Bites

  1. Preheat your oven to 325F.
  2. In a large bowl, mix together all of the dry ingredients until no clumps remain. It is easiest for later if your bowl has a spout on it, not required however.
  3. NOTE: I'm sure many of you will ask me if you can swap the casein with whey or leave it out all together. No, do not omit the casein and absolutely do not substitute with whey. Your pancake bites will become hockey pucks. A lot of the sweetness comes from the protein powder, do not leave it out. I have attempted this recipe by adding sugar in place of the protein powder and it does not work. The casein adds an airy quality that is not present when only oat flour is used. You can probably use wheat flour and omit the casein but add in some kind of sweetener.
  4. Add in the water, egg whites, and 1 tbsp of blueberries. Mix until incorporated and your batter is pourable.
  5. Spray a mini muffin tin with cooking spray. Make sure to coat all sides of the well.
  6. If your bowl doesn't have a spout you may find it easiest to transfer the batter into a large ziplock bag to use as a piping bag. Cut off the corner to fill each well of your mini muffin tin.
  7. Fill each well about half way with batter. This recipe makes 24 bites. Top each bite with the remaining blueberries.
  8. Bake for 9-10 minutes.

Storage

  1. Once the bites have completely cooled, place them in a ziplock bag and remove as much air as possible. Store in the freezer.
  2. Reheat the bites in the microwave and serve with maple syrup.

Pepper Jack Turkey Breakfast Bowls

Ground turkey topped with a slice of melty pepper jack cheese and served with a side of potatoes o'brien and 2 hardboiled eggs.

CourseCuisineTime - 40 minutes 40 minutes 40 minutes
BreakfastAmerican, meal prepPrep - 10 minutes 10 minutes 10 minutes
Cook - 30 minutes 30 minutes 30 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
607kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates39g33%
Fat30g26%
Protein46g40%

Ingredients:

For the Turkey

  • 2 lbs (908 g) ground turkey 93/7
  • 6 tbsp (100 g) tomato paste
  • cup (60 g) ketchup
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) dijon mustard
  • 1 tbsp (15 ml) olive oil
  • cup (120 ml) water
  • Salt and pepper to taste
  • 3 slices (75 g) pepper jack cheese

For the Potatoes O'Brien

  • 5 small (750 g) potatoes
  • 2 medium (300 g) bell peppers
  • medium (100 g) onion
  • 1 tbsp (23 ml) olive oil
  • Salt and pepper to taste

For the Eggs

  • 10 eggs

Instructions:

For the Hard Boiled Eggs

  1. Place 10 eggs in to a sauce pot and cover with water and a splash or two of vinegar.
  2. Bring to a boil and cover with a tight fitting lid. Remove from the heat and set a timer for 12 minutes.
  3. Drain the water and rinse with cold water to stop the cooking. Peel the eggs and cut them in half.

For the Potatoes

  1. Preheat your oven to 425F.
  2. Wash and cut your potatoes, peppers, and onion into a small dice. Toss in a bowl with olive oil, salt, and pepper until everything has been coated evenly.
  3. Spread out on a sheet pan or two and bake for 10-12 minutes, remove from the oven and flip. Return to the oven for another 8-10 minutes or until proper browning is achieved.

For the Turkey

  1. Heat some olive oil over medium high heat. Add in the turkey and cook until it has browned and any remaining water has been boiled off.
  2. Add in the tomato paste, ketchup, mustard, and water. Stir to incorporate. Allow it to cook for a few minutes so that the flavors can come together.
  3. Season with salt and pepper to taste.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide your ingredients evenly between your 5 containers. Add a slices of pepper jack cheese to the top of the turkey mixture.

Sloppy Joe Breakfast Bowls

Sloppy Joes in breakfast form. This recipe uses ground turkey coated in a sweet tomato based sauce and paired with roasted sweet potatoes and hard boiled eggs.

CourseCuisineTime - 40 minutes 40 minutes 40 minutes
BreakfastAmerican, meal prepPrep - 10 minutes 10 minutes 10 minutes
Cook - 30 minutes 30 minutes 30 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
688kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates49g38%
Fat35g27%
Protein44g34%

Ingredients:

  • 1 lbs (681 g) Ground beef 85/15
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) Olive Oil
  • 1 medium (150 g) Green Bell Pepper
  • medium (100 g) Sweet Onion
  • cup (74 g) Tomato Paste
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) Worcestershire Sauce
  • 1 Tbsp (15 g) Dijon Mustard
  • 3 Tbsp (45 g) Ketchup
  • 1 Tbsp (5 g) Onion Powder
  • 1 tsp (3 g) Red Pepper Flakes
  • 12 Hardboiled Eggs
  • 4 medium (1000 g) Sweet Potato
  • Salt and pepper to taste

Instructions:

For the Potatoes

  1. Preheat your oven to 425F. Cut potatoes into a small/medium dice. Roast with tbsp oil for 20 minutes. Flip half way. Cook until you get optimal browning.

For the Turkey

  1. Cut the pepper and onion into a small dice. Add Tbsp of olive oil in a skillet and add the pepper and onion. Cook until translucent and add the ground turkey. Cook until browned.
  2. Once the turkey has cooked, stir in tomato paste, Worcestershire sauce, Dijon mustard, ketchup, onion powder, red pepper flakes, and salt and pepper.

For the Hard Boiled Eggs

  1. Place 10 eggs in a pot of water and bring to a boil. Once boiling, turn off the heat and cover for 12 minutes. Rinse with cold water and peel.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide your ingredients eveny 5 ways. 1 dish will only get 4 egg halves.

Apple Pie Baked Oatmeal

Sliced Apples cooked in reduced brown sugar and cinnamon and layered inside of an oatmeal and egg mixture. This is a great meal for those weeks you prefer something sweet to have in the morning.

CourseCuisineTime - 50 minutes
BreakfastAmerican, meal prepPrep - 10 minutes
Cook - 40 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
361kcal6
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates52g65%
Fat9g11%
Protein18g22%

Ingredients:

  • 3 cups (240 g) old fashioned oats
  • 2 scoops (60 g) vanilla protein powder
  • 1 tsp (4 g) baking powder
  • 4 medium (600 g) apples peeled
  • cup (48 g) brown sugar
  • 1 tbsp (8 g) cinnamon
  • 2 tbsp (28 g) butter
  • 2 eggs
  • 2 cups (480 g) skim milk
  • 5 tbsp (60 g) vanilla Greek yogurt optional for frosting

Instructions:

For the Apples

  1. Wash and peel the apples. Cut them in half and remove the cores. Cut them into thin slices.
  2. Heat a large skillet over medium heat. Add 1 tbsp of butter and then add the apples.
  3. Sprinkle the cinnamon and brown sugar over the top. Cook until the sugar has reduced and the apples have become soft.

For the Oatmeal Bake

  1. Preheat your oven to 375F.
  2. In a large bowl, mix together the oats, protein powder, and baking powder.
  3. In a separate bowl, whisk together the eggs, milk, and 1 tbsp of melted butter. Pour over the top of the apples and oats and mix.
  4. Spray a 13"x9" pan with oil and add the oat mixture and apples.
  5. Bake for 30-35 minutes.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 6 servings. Cut the oatmeal into 6 equal pieces. You can use vanilla greek yogurt as a frosting if you wish.

Lil Chocolate Chip Pancake Bites

Pancake batter poured into a mini muffin tin and baked to create a similar flavor and texture to pancakes. Bake these, throw them in the freezer, and reheat them whenever you need in the microwave. Serve with a side of maple syrup.

CourseCuisineTime - 20 minutes
Breakfast, SnackAmericanPrep - 10 minutes
Cook - 9 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
34kcal24 bites
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates4.9g81%
Fat0.7g11%
Protein2g33%

Ingredients:

  • 1 cup (100 g) oat flour
  • cup (25 g) tapioca flour or corn starch
  • 1 scoop (30 g) vanilla casein protein powder I use the brand Optimum Nutrition but micellar casein will work
  • cup (130 g) liquid egg whites
  • 2 tbsp (30 g) mini chocolate chips
  • 1 tsp (4 g) baking powder
  • cups (150 ml) water

Instructions:

For the Pancake Bites

  1. Preheat your oven to 325F.
  2. In a large bowl, mix together all of the dry ingredients until no clumps remain. It is easiest for later if your bowl has a spout on it, not required however.
  3. NOTE: I'm sure many of you will ask me if you can swap the casein with whey or leave it out all together. No, do not omit the casein and absolutely do not substitute with whey. Your pancake bites will become hockey pucks. A lot of the sweetness comes from the protein powder, do not leave it out. I have attempted this recipe by adding sugar in place of the protein powder and it does not work. The casein adds an airy quality that is not present when only oat flour is used. You can probably use wheat flour and omit the casein but add in some kind of sweetener.
  4. Add in the water, egg whites, and 1 tbsp of chocolate chips. Mix until incorporated and your batter is pourable.
  5. Spray a mini muffin tin with cooking spray. Make sure to coat all sides of the well.
  6. If your bowl doesn't have a spout you may find it easiest to transfer the batter into a large ziplock bag to use as a piping bag. Cut off the corner to fill each well of your mini muffin tin.
  7. Fill each well about half way with batter. This recipe makes 24 bites. Top each bite with the remaining chocolate chips.
  8. Bake for 9-10 minutes.

Storage

  1. Once the bites have completely cooled, place them in a ziplock bag and remove as much air as possible. Store in the freezer.
  2. Reheat the bites in the microwave and serve with maple syrup.

Turkey Sausage Breakfast Skillet

Turkey sausage cooked with green peppers and carrots to add in some vegetables in your breakfast. Served with a side of eggs and home fries.

CourseCuisineTime - 35 minutes 35 minutes 35 minutes
BreakfastAmerican, meal prepPrep - 10 minutes 10 minutes 10 minutes
Cook - 25 minutes 25 minutes 25 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
745kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates61g44%
Fat39g28%
Protein36g26%

Ingredients:

  • 10 (10 ) eggs
  • cup (60 ml) skim milk
  • 1 lb (454 g) ground pork breakfast sausage
  • 7 (1000 g) russet potatoes
  • (100 g) sweet onion
  • 2 (300 g) green peppers
  • 1 cup (100 g) shredded carrots
  • 2 Tbsp (30 ml) olive oil
  • Cooking spray
  • Salt and pepper to taste

Instructions:

For the Home Fries

  1. Preheat your oven to 425F.
  2. Wash and cut your potatoes into a small dice (around - cubes). You want these small so they cook faster.
  3. Toss the potatoes in 1 Tbsp of olive oil and season with salt and pepper. Bake for 10 minutes, then remove from the oven and turn. Bake an additional 5-8 minutes or until they have crisped up.

For the Sausage

  1. Wash your peppers. Cut the onion and peppers into a small dice. Chop the shredded carrots into smaller pieces.
  2. Heat 1 Tbsp of olive oil over medium high heat in a large skillet. Add the onion, peppers, and carrots to the skillet and cook for 3 minutes.
  3. Add the sausage to the pan and brown.

For the Eggs

  1. Crack 10 eggs into a bowl, add in cup milk and beat. The secret to perfect scrambled eggs is to beat them until frothy and no egg whites remain unincorporated.
  2. Heat a skillet over medium heat, spray with cooking spray, and cook your eggs until finished. Make sure not to over cook them as you will be reheating them in the microwave.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide all of your ingredients evenly between your containers.

Jalapeo Apple Sweet Potato Hash with Ham and Eggs

Sweet potatoes mixed with jalapeos, bell pepper, onion, and apple for a crisp and flavorful breakfast hash. This hash is served with a side of ham and eggs for protein.

CourseCuisineTime - 40 minutes 40 minutes 40 minutes
BreakfastAmerican, meal prepPrep - 10 minutes 10 minutes 10 minutes
Cook - 30 minutes 30 minutes 30 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
613kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates57g48%
Fat28g23%
Protein33g27%

Ingredients:

  • 12 eggs
  • 1 lb (454 g) ham steak
  • 4 medium (900 g) sweet potatoes
  • 2 (20 g) jalapeo pepper
  • 2 medium (300 g) red pepper
  • 1 medium (200 g) sweet onion
  • 2 (200 g) golden delicious apple
  • 2 tbsp (38 ml) olive oil
  • Salt and pepper to taste

Instructions:

  1. Preheat oven to 425F.
  2. Hard boil 12 eggs.
  3. Wash and cut potatoes into a medium dice. Toss in 2 tbsp of olive oil and bake for 10 minutes. Flip and cook an additional 10 minutes.
  4. Cut the onion and red pepper into a small dice. Cut the jalapeo into slices. Cut out the seeds if you dont like heat.
  5. Heat tbsp of oil in a pan over medium heat. Saut the onions for a few minutes and then add in the pepper and jalapeo. Cook until soft.
  6. Cut the apple into a medium dice.
  7. Remove from heat. Add the potatoes and apple to the pan with the peppers. Season with salt and pepper.
  8. Cook the ham however you please. You dont even need to if you dont want to.
  9. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide into 5 servings.

Buffalo Chicken Breakfast Bowls

A change from the traditional style breakfasts, this meal has buffalo chicken with potatoes, mushrooms, peppers and eggs that you can mix together in one big scramble.

CourseCuisineTime - 40 minutes 40 minutes 40 minutes
BreakfastAmerican, meal prepPrep - 10 minutes 10 minutes 10 minutes
Cook - 30 minutes 30 minutes 30 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
497kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates38g39%
Fat23g23%
Protein35g36%

Ingredients:

  • 1 lb (454 g) boneless skinless chicken breast
  • 10 (10 ) eggs
  • 1 medium (150 g) green pepper
  • 4 oz (113 g) mushrooms sliced
  • 4 medium (1000 g) russet potatoes
  • 2-3 Tbsp (30 ml) buffalo sauce
  • 4 Tbsp (60 ml) olive oil
  • Salt and pepper to taste

Instructions:

For the Potatoes

  1. Preheat your oven to 400F.
  2. Wash and cut your potatoes into a medium dice.
  3. Spread on a sheet pan and drizzle with 2 Tbsp of olive oil. Season with salt and pepper.
  4. Bake for 10 minutes then remove and flip. Cook an additional 5-7 minutes or until crispy

For the Chicken

  1. Butterfly the chicken breast so it will cook quicker and more evenly. Season with salt and pepper.
  2. Add 1 Tbsp of olive oil in a grill pan or skillet over medium heat. Cook the chicken until it has reached an internal temperature of at least 165F.
  3. Cut into a small dice of about " cubes. Mix in buffalo sauce.

For the Peppers and Mushrooms

  1. Wash and cut the pepper into a large dice. Add 1 Tbsp of olive oil to a skillet over medium heat.
  2. Cook the peppers for 3-4 minutes and then add in the mushrooms. Cook until soft.

For the Eggs

  1. Scramble and cook 10 eggs.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide your ingredients evenly between 5 containers.

Turkey & Hash Brown Egg Bake

Ground turkey and hash browns with an onion, poblano pepper, and red pepper mixture baked into an egg casserole. Serve over a bed of spinach if you prefer some extra vegetables.

CourseCuisineTime - 43 minutes 43 minutes
BreakfastAmerican, meal prepPrep - 8 minutes 8 minutes
Cook - 35 minutes 35 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
548kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates20g21%
Fat37g40%
Protein34g37%

Ingredients:

  • 1 lb (454 g) pork sausage
  • 10 (10 ) eggs
  • cup (60 ml) skim milk
  • 3 cups (252 g) shredded hash browns
  • (100 g) sweet onion
  • 1 (150 g) poblano pepper
  • 1 (150 g) red pepper
  • cup (56 g) shredded cheese
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) olive oil
  • Salt and pepper to taste
  • 2 cups (75 g) spinach (optional)
  • Cooking spray

Instructions:

  1. Preheat your oven to 375F.
  2. Wash your peppers and chop the peppers and onion into a small dice.
  3. Heat 1 Tbsp of olive oil over medium high heat in a large skillet. Add in the peppers and onions and cook for 2-3 minutes. If you wish, add 2 cup of raw spinach to the pan and wilt.
  4. Add in the ground sausage and brown.
  5. While the sausage is cooking, beat 10 eggs and cup of milk together. Stir in 2 cups of shredded hash browns, 1 tsp salt, 1 tsp pepper, and cup of shredded cheese.
  6. Once the sausage has finished cooking, mix it into the egg/hash brown mixture.
  7. Lightly spray a 13x9 baking dish with cooking spray and pour in the egg mixture. Bake for 20-22 minutes or until the center has set.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Cut the Egg Bake into 5 equal servings.

Sweet Potato Breakfast Hash

Sausage and sweet potatoes cooked with onions and garlic and served with a side of eggs. A calorie dense breakfast option to help you start off your day.

CourseCuisineTime - 30 minutes 30 minutes 30 minutes
BreakfastAmerican, meal prepPrep - 10 minutes 10 minutes 10 minutes
Cook - 20 minutes 20 minutes 20 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
636kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates39g35%
Fat40g36%
Protein31g28%

Ingredients:

  • 3 large (825 g) sweet potatoes
  • medium (100 g) yellow onion
  • 1 tsp (5 g) garlic minced
  • 1 lb (454 g) breakfast sausage I prefer Jimmy Dean Original
  • 12 (10 ) eggs
  • 1 tsp (5 ml) olive oil
  • Salt and pepper to taste

Instructions:

For the Hash

  1. Heat a large skillet over medium high heat. Dice the onion and add to the pan with olive oil and garlic. Allow to cook for 2-3 minutes. Add the sausage to the onion and garlic mixture and stir occasionally until browned.
  2. While the sausage is cooking, fill a saucepan with enough water to cover sweet potatoes and begin to boil water.
  3. Peel the sweet potatoes and cut into inch cubes. Add the potatoes to the water once it is boiling. Cook until sweet potatoes are soft and easily pierced with fork.
  4. Drain the potatoes and add to the sausage mixture. Make sure you drain the fat first.

For the Eggs

  1. You can cook the eggs any way that you like. I prefer boiled or scrambled. If you prefer fried, I would make them fresh the day you plan on eating each meal.
  2. Fill a medium pot with enough water to cover 12 eggs. Bring the pot to a boil and then remove from the heat and cover. Set a timer for 12 minutes.
  3. After 12 minutes drain the water and shower the eggs in cold water to cool. Peel the eggs and cut in half.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide your hash evenly into each of your 5 containers and add 2 eggs to each.

Sausage and Eggs with Sweet Potato Chips

Ground sausage and eggs over a bed of sweet potato chips with grape tomatoes. A breakfast full of flavor that can provide you will energy to start your day.

CourseCuisineTime - 35 minutes 35 minutes 35 minutes
BreakfastAmerican, meal prepPrep - 10 minutes 10 minutes 10 minutes
Cook - 25 minutes 25 minutes 25 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
575kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates52g47%
Fat28g25%
Protein29g26%

Ingredients:

  • 12 oz (341 g) ground sausage
  • 10 (10 ) eggs
  • 6 (1200 g) sweet potatoes
  • 1 cup (150 g) grape tomatoes
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) olive oil
  • Salt and pepper to taste

Instructions:

  1. Preheat your oven to 425F.
  2. Wash and cut your sweet potatoes into 1/4 thick chips. Place them on a sheet pan and drizzle with olive oil, salt, and pepper. Bake for 10-15 minutes or until soft. Flip half way.
  3. Heat a skillet over medium high heat and brown your sausage.
  4. While the sausage is cooking, cut the grape tomatoes into halves.
  5. Once the sausage is done browning, cook the grape tomatoes for 5 minutes in the same skillet.
  6. Cook your eggs however you prefer. In the picture on the previous page they are hard boiled. If you prefer any other form, I would recommend cooking your eggs the day you plan to eat each meal.
  7. Fill a medium pot with enough water to cover 10 eggs. Bring the pot to a boil and then remove from the heat and cover. Set a timer for 12 minutes.
  8. After 12 minutes drain the water and shower the eggs in cold water to cool. Peel the eggs and cut in half.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide your ingredients 5 ways and add to each container.

Almond Butter Breakfast Sandwiches

Waffles made from eggs and almond butter to provide a gluten free, lower carb bread for a breakfast sandwich. These are completely customizable and you can add whatever you like!

CourseCuisineTime - 30 minutes
BreakfastAmerican, meal prepPrep - 10 minutes
Cook - 20 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
397kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates6g9%
Fat29g45%
Protein29g45%

Ingredients:

For the Waffles

  • 4 (4 ) eggs
  • cup (128 g) almond butter peanut butter works too
  • tsp (2 g) baking powder
  • NOTE: Add whatever you would like to the batter to customize my favorite is jalapeos and cheddar cheese.

For the Sandwich Components

  • lb (227 g) sliced ham
  • 5 (5 ) eggs
  • 5 slices (50 g) cheddar cheese thinly sliced

Instructions:

For the Waffles

  1. In a blender, add 4 eggs, cup of almond butter and tsp of baking powder. Blend until smooth. (It seems strange but almond butter is the correct ingredient, NOT almond flour).
  2. For waffles, heat a waffle iron to medium heat. For pancakes, heat a skillet. You will have enough batter for 34, 8-inch waffles or 810, 3-inch pancakes. Spray the waffle iron or skillet with cooking spray before cooking.
  3. Cook the waffles for 5-6 minutes. You know its done when it easily comes out of the waffle iron. The pancakes will take 2-3 minutes each side.
  4. Cut the waffles into 4 pieces to serve as your bread for the sandwich.

For the Sandwich Components

  1. Cut your sliced ham into pieces to fit on the waffle or pancake.
  2. The next step is to cook the eggs. If you want nicely shaped eggs like in the picture, crack them into a ramekin and bake at 350F until they are set. Some people dont like the idea of meal prepped eggs. If this is you, prep the eggs the morning you plan to eat the meal. It will only take a few minutes.

Plating

  1. Divide your ingredients evenly between 5 containers.

Oven Baked Omelette with Home Fries

Ham, eggs, cheese, and peppers baked in the oven for ease of cooking and served with a side of baked home fries. This is a super easy breakfast to make for the work week!

CourseCuisineTime - 35 minutes 35 minutes 35 minutes
BreakfastAmerican, meal prepPrep - 10 minutes 10 minutes 10 minutes
Cook - 25 minutes 25 minutes 25 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
571kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates29g30%
Fat38g39%
Protein29g30%

Ingredients:

For the Omelette

  • 8 eggs
  • 1 cup (114 g) diced ham
  • 1 small (100 g) green pepper
  • 1 small (100 g) red pepper
  • (100 g) yellow onion
  • cup (84 g) shredded cheddar cheese
  • cup (60 ml) skim milk
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) olive oil
  • Salt and pepper to taste

For the Home Fries

  • 2 large (550 g) russet potatoes
  • 2 Tbsp (30 ml) olive oil
  • 1 tsp (3 g) seasoned salt
  • tsp (1 g) pepper
  • 1 (60 g) Roma tomato optional
  • 1 (150 g) avocado optional

For the Bacon

  • 15 strips bacon

Instructions:

For the Omelette

  1. Preheat your oven to 400F.
  2. Wash your peppers and cut them into a small dice. Dice the onion to a similar size.
  3. Heat a skillet over medium high heat and add 1 Tbsp of olive oil. Add in onion and peppers. Saut until onions are translucent.
  4. Scramble 8 eggs and cup of milk together. Add in 1 tsp salt and tsp pepper and mix.
  5. Add in the 1 cup of diced ham, the peppers, onions, and cup of cheese to the eggs. Top the mixture with the remaining cup of cheese.
  6. Pour the egg mixture into a greased 8x8 or 13x9 inch baking pan.
  7. Bake for 20-25 minutes until the eggs have set.

For the Home Fries

  1. Wash and cut your potatoes into a medium dice, about inch pieces.
  2. Spread them out on a sheet pan and drizzle with 1 Tbsp of olive oil. Season with 1 tsp seasoned salt and tsp of pepper.
  3. Bake for 10 minutes and then flip the potatoes. Bake an additional 10 minutes or until they are crispy.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Cut your omelette into 5 sections, split the potatoes evenly 5 ways, and add to each of your 5 containers. Add avocado or tomato the day you eat each meal if you desire.

For the Bacon

  1. Line a sheet pan with foil and spread out the bacon on the pan. Bake for about 20 minutes. If you like it crispy, elevate the bacon onto a cooling rack so it is raised from the pan.

Taco Breakfast Bowls with Salsa Roja

A flavorful breakfast option with hash browns, scrambled eggs, and taco meat. Serve this dish with a side of salsa roja. This meal will become a staple for your breakfasts!

CourseCuisineTime - 40 minutes 40 minutes 40 minutes
Breakfastmeal prep, MexicanPrep - 10 minutes 10 minutes 10 minutes
Cook - 30 minutes 30 minutes 30 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
735kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates32g25%
Fat46g36%
Protein48g38%

Ingredients:

For the Taco Meat

  • 2 lb (908 g) ground beef (85/15)
  • 1 cup (240 ml) tomato sauce
  • 2 tsp (4 g) paprika
  • 2 tsp (4 g) chili powder
  • 2 tsp (4 g) cumin
  • 2 tsp (4 g) garlic powder
  • Salt and pepper to taste

For the Eggs

  • 8 (8 ) eggs
  • cup (60 ml) skim milk
  • Cooking spray
  • Salt and pepper to taste

For the Hash browns

  • 6 cups (454 g) hash browns
  • 4 Tbsp (60 ml) olive oil
  • 4 (240 g) Roma tomatoes

For the Salsa Roja

  • 4 (240 g) Roma tomatoes
  • 1 small (100 g) white onion
  • 1 (20 g) jalapeo pepper
  • 1 (10 g) serrano pepper
  • 3 cloves (15 g) garlic
  • bunch (15 g) cilantro
  • Salt and lime juice to taste

Instructions:

For the Taco Meat

  1. Heat a large skillet over medium high heat and brown the ground beef.
  2. Once cooked, drain the fat and add in cup of tomato sauce, 1 tsp paprika, 1 tsp chili powder, 1 tsp cumin, 1 tsp garlic powder, and salt and pepper to taste. Stir to combine and cook for an additional 5 minutes then remove from heat.

For the Salsa Roja

  1. Start a medium pot of water over high heat to boil.
  2. Wash your tomatoes, peppers, and cilantro. Cut the stems off of the tomatoes and peppers.
  3. Add the small white onion (halved), the peppers, tomatoes, and 3 cloves of garlic to the boiling water. Cook for 6-8 minutes. The tomatoes have finished cooking when they begin to change color and the skin starts to break.
  4. Drain the water from the pot. You may want to remove the skins from the tomatoes to avoid any stringy bits. Add the tomatoes, garlic, jalapeos, bunch of cilantro, juice of of a lime and 1 Tbsp apple cider vinegar to a blender. Blend until smooth.
  5. Add salt to taste. Adjust flavor with salt and lime juice as needed.

For the Hash Browns

  1. Heat a large skillet over medium high heat and add in 2 Tbsp of olive oil. Once the oil has heated, add in 6 cups of hash browns. Cook for 5 minutes and flip. Add in more oil as needed.
  2. Cook for an additional 5-7 minutes. If you like your hash browns crispy, you will want to cook them a bit longer.
  3. Dice 2 tomatoes and mix them into the hash browns.

For the Scrambled Eggs

  1. Crack 8 eggs into a large bowl.
  2. Add in cup milk and beat. The secret to perfect scrambled eggs is to beat them until frothy and no egg whites remain unincorporated.
  3. Heat a skillet over medium heat, spray with cooking spray, and cook your eggs until finished. Make sure not to over cook them as you will be reheating them in the microwave.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Divide your ingredients evenly 5 ways into each of your containers. Store your salsa in a separate, smaller container as you dont want to heat this in the microwave.

Kielbasa Breakfast Bowls

A fantastic way to get more more vegetables in your breakfasts. Roasted sweet potatoes and zucchini paired with kielbasa sausage cooked with spinach and onions.

CourseCuisineTime - 50 minutes 50 minutes 50 minutes
BreakfastAmerican, meal prepPrep - 20 minutes 20 minutes 20 minutes
Cook - 30 minutes 30 minutes 30 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
746kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates54g41%
Fat44g33%
Protein33g25%

Ingredients:

  • 10 (10 ) eggs
  • (100 g) yellow onion
  • 4 (1100 g) sweet potatoes
  • 2 (500 g) zucchinis
  • 21 oz (397 g) kielbasa sausage
  • 3 cups (90 g) uncooked spinach
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) olive oil
  • Salt and pepper to taste

Instructions:

  1. Fill a medium pot with enough water to cover 10 eggs. Bring the pot to a boil and then remove from the heat and cover. Set a timer for 12 minutes.
  2. After 12 minutes drain the water and shower the eggs in cold water to cool. Peel the eggs and cut in half.
  3. Preheat your oven to 400F.
  4. While the eggs are cooking, wash the zucchini and sweet potatoes. Peel the potatoes. Cut the zucchini and sweet potatoes into a small dice.
  5. Spread the sweet potatoes out on a sheet pan and drizzle with olive oil. Cook for 10 minutes then remove from the oven and flip.
  6. Add the zucchini to the same pan and return to the oven for an additional 10 minutes.
  7. Cut your sausage into slices and fry in a skillet over medium high heat.
  8. Save the grease in the pan that occurs from cooking the sausage to cook the onion in.
  9. Cut the onion into a small dice and do a rough chop on your spinach.
  10. Add the onion and spinach to the skillet and cook for 5-7 minutes or until the onions are soft. Add the sausage back in and mix.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Put two eggs into each container and split the sausage and vegetables evenly 5 ways.

Homemade Granola Yogurt Parfait

Rolled oats tossed with almonds, sunflower seeds, and dried cranberries in a maple syrup and peanut butter sauce. The granola is served with Greek yogurt and your favorite fruit.

CourseCuisineTime - 20 minutes
Breakfastmeal prepPrep - 10 minutes
Cook - 10 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
437kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates51g57%
Fat18g20%
Protein19g21%

Ingredients:

For the Granola

  • 2 cups (160 g) rolled oats
  • cup (67 g) sunflower seed kernels
  • cup (28 g) sliced almonds
  • cup (113 g) dried cranberries
  • cup (80 g) maple syrup
  • 1 Tbsp (15 g) coconut oil
  • 2 Tbsp (32 g) peanut butter

For the Yogurt and Fruit

  • 2 cups (568 g) plain non fat Greek yogurt
  • Stevia or another zero calorie sweetener to taste
  • 5 servings of your favorite fruit. I used 2 lbs of strawberries here. Strawberries will not always be in season so I want to leave this choice up to you.

Instructions:

  1. Preheat your oven to 325F.
  2. In a large mixing bowl, add cup maple syrup, 1 Tbsp coconut oil, and 2 Tbsp peanut butter. Melt in the microwave and stir.
  3. Add 2 cups of oats, cup sunflower seeds, cup sliced almonds, and cup of dried cranberries to the bowl and stir to evenly coat.
  4. Spread out the granola on a sheet pan and bake for 7-8 minutes. Pull it out and try a small piece. The granola should be lightly toasted. If it needs more time put it back in the oven and watch it carefully. You absolutely do not want to burn this.
  5. Measure out 2 cups of plain Greek yogurt. Use stevia or another zero calorie sweetener to sweeten the Greek yogurt to taste.
  6. Prepare your favorite fruit to add to the containers.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Put cup of Greek yogurt in each container as well as one serving of your fruit. Divide the granola evenly between the containers.

NOTE: The nutritional information on the following page does not include the fruit as it will depend on what you choose. Make sure you account for this in your tracking.

Baked Peach Oatmeal

Rolled oats mixed with frozen peaches and baked into a cake like breakfast food. This is a great meal for those weeks you prefer something sweet to have in the morning.

CourseCuisineTime - 43 minutes
Breakfastmeal prepPrep - 8 minutes
Cook - 35 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
347kcal4
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates42g56%
Fat10g13%
Protein22g29%

Ingredients:

  • 2 cups (160 g) oats
  • 1 cups (360 g) skim milk
  • 1 Tbsp (21 g) honey
  • 2 scoops (60 g) whey protein powder vanilla
  • 2 cups (280 g) frozen peaches
  • 2 Tbsp (28 g) butter or coconut oil
  • 1 tsp (4 ml) vanilla
  • 1 (1 ) egg
  • 1 tsp (4 g) baking powder
  • tsp (1 g) salt
  • Cooking spray

Instructions:

  1. Preheat your oven to 375F.
  2. In a large bowl, mix together 2 cups of oats, 2 scoops of whey protein powder, 1 tsp baking powder, and tsp of salt.
  3. In a separate bowl mix together 1 cups of milk, 1 Tbsp honey, 1 Tbsp melted butter, 1 Tbsp melted coconut oil, 1 egg, and 1 tsp vanilla.
  4. Spray an 8x8 baking dish with cooking spray and add the dry ingredients. Pour the wet ingredients over the top and mix to incorporate.
  5. Add in some of the peaches and hide them in the oatmeal. Place some of the peaches over the top for presentation purposes.
  6. Bake the oatmeal for 35 minutes or until it has set in the middle.
  7. This recipe makes 4 servings. Cut the oatmeal into 4 even pieces and place into each of your containers.

Banana Berry Muffins

A gluten free muffin for you to enjoy as either a breakfast option or a snack. These muffins are made with eggs, bananas, and coconut flour instead of wheat flour.

CourseCuisineTime - 28 minutes
Breakfast, Snackmeal prepPrep - 8 minutes
Cook - 20 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
93kcal9
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates10.8g63%
Fat3.7g21%
Protein4.2g24%

Ingredients:

  • 2 (250 g) ripe bananas frozen and thawed is best
  • 4 (4 ) eggs
  • 1 Tbsp (16 g) peanut butter
  • 1 tsp (4 ml) vanilla
  • 1 tsp (4 g) baking powder
  • cup (37 g) coconut flour
  • 1 cup (140 g) frozen berries

Instructions:

  1. Preheat your oven to 375F
  2. Add all of the ingredients to a blender except the frozen berries. Blend until smooth.
  3. Spray a muffin tin with cooking spray and pour the batter into the wells. It will make around 9 or 10 muffins depending on the size of your bananas.
  4. Top each muffin with the frozen berries.
  5. Bake for 18-20 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center of a muffin comes out clean.
  6. This recipe makes 9 muffins.

Tuscan Egg Bake

Pork sausage, spinach, tomatoes, and feta cheese cooked into an egg bake. This is a wonderful combination of flavors and a small serving of vegetables to start off your day with!

CourseCuisineTime - 40 minutes 40 minutes 40 minutes
Breakfastmeal prepPrep - 5 minutes 5 minutes 5 minutes
Cook - 35 minutes 35 minutes 35 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
494kcal5
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates12g15%
Fat35g43%
Protein33g41%

Ingredients:

  • 10 (10 ) eggs
  • 1 lb (454 g) pork breakfast sausage
  • 3 cups (90 g) spinach
  • 3 (180 g) Roma tomatoes
  • 1 tsp (1 g) oregano
  • cup (38 g) feta cheese
  • cup (60 ml) skim milk
  • Salt and pepper to taste
  • Cooking spray
  • 2 cups (300 g) shredded hash browns frozen

Instructions:

  1. Preheat your oven to 400F.
  2. Heat a large skillet over medium high heat and cook the sausage until it has browned.
  3. Once the sausage has browned, add in the spinach and wilt.
  4. In a large bowl, beat together 10 eggs, 1 tsp oregano and cup of milk. Stir in 2 cups of hash browns
  5. Wash and cut your tomatoes into a large dice and remove the seeds. (You can cut one of the tomatoes into slices for presentation purposes if you wish)
  6. Spray a 13x9 pan with cooking spray and add in the eggs, sausage and spinach mixture, cup feta cheese, diced tomatoes, and lightly season with salt and pepper.
  7. Bake for 20 minutes or until the center has set.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 5 servings. Cut the egg bake into 5 even pieces and place into each of your containers.

Nashville Hot Chicken Nuggets

Nashville Hot Chicken Nuggets made from ground chicken breasts and sweet potatoes with a jalapeo and spices to give them some heat. Batch prep these to put in Snack City in the freezer and you've got yourself a high protein snack in minutes.

CourseCuisineTime - 1 hour 30 minutes
SnackAmericanPrep - 30 minutes
Cook - 1 hour

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
32kcal90 nuggets
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates2.2g36%
Fat1g16%
Protein3.6g60%

Ingredients:

  • 3 lbs (1362 g) ground chicken I grind my own chicken breasts
  • 3 medium (720 g) sweet potatoes
  • 5 stalks (50 g) green onion
  • 1 (30 g) jalapeo pepper optional
  • 3 (210 g) eggs beaten
  • cup (60 g) flour I use oat, wheat flour will also work
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) minced garlic
  • 3 tbsp (45 g) hot sauce I use Louisiana Hot Sauce
  • 2 tsp (12 g) salt
  • 1.5 tbsp (9 g) paprika
  • 1 tbsp (6 g) chili powder
  • 1 tbsp (6 g) cayenne pepper
  • 1 tbsp (6 g) onion powder
  • 1.5 tbsp (18 g) brown sugar
  • 2 tbsp (30 g) oil
  • oil spray

Instructions:

For the Chicken

  1. I make my own ground chicken by placing chicken breasts into the food processor until they are processed down into a mince. To calculate the leanness I divide the amount of fat by the total weight. For the Kirkland brand chicken breast I use that is 4g/454g or 99% lean ground chicken. If you use a store bought that is fattier, you will want to place the ingredients into a tracker to determine the nutritional information.
  2. Here is a video of how I make the ground chicken in the food processor. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cEcQOVkQpOQ

For the Nuggets

  1. Preheat your oven to 400F
  2. Wash all of your vegetables. Peel and cut your potatoes into smaller chunks, cut the stem from the jalapeo, and cut the ends off of the green onions and chop into smaller pieces.
  3. Using a food processor, blender, or grater, process your sweet potatoes and jalapeo down into a mince. The food processor works the best here but i've also used a blender with success. You want the potato to be in riced form. I do this before I grind up the chicken in the food processor because it feels cleaner.
  4. After the potatoes and jalapeos have been minced, I add in the green onions and process them down a bit as well. I don't like to do this earlier because I prefer to have some larger pieces of the green onions. If they are added at the same time as the potatoes they get chopped down too small.
  5. In a large bowl, add your minced vegetables, ground chicken, 2 tbsp of oil, 3 tbsp of hot sauce, 1 tbsp of minced garlic, flour, 3 beaten eggs, as well as all of your spices and brown sugar. Mix thoroughly to combine and evenly distribute the ingredients.
  6. Spray a couple of large sheet pans with oil.
  7. Place your meat mixture onto the sheet pan using a cookie scoop, ensuring you have plenty of space between each nugget. Wet your fingers to prevent sticking and lightly press the balls into a disc with your fingers. You don't want to go too thin or else they will be prone to sticking.
  8. You want your nuggets to be about 2 inches in diameter and - inch in thickness. I made 90 total nuggets in this recipe. Depending on how big your cookie scoop is you may have a different yield.
  9. Bake for 8 minutes and then flip and bake an additional 4 minutes.
  10. Cool the nuggets on a wire rimmed baking sheet and repeat this process until all of your meat mixture has been used up. Doubling up on sheet pans in the oven will help you go faster but can lead to less optimal browning. I honestly don't care about this because I reheat in the air fryer and can get plenty of browning this way so I put one sheet pan on each rack of my oven.

Storing

  1. Once the nuggets have cooled, arrange them onto a sheet pan and place them into the freezer, uncovered until they have frozen solid. This will help them not stick together in the bags.
  2. Once they are frozen solid, transfer them to a zip top bag, remove all of the air and keep them in Snack City in your freezer. As long as you protect them from air and freezer burn, they will last for months.

Reheating

  1. I reheat using the air fryer at 400F for about 5 minutes. They just need to thaw and get hot. You can also use the microwave or oven.

Chicken Meatballs

Chicken meatballs made from ground chicken, seasonings, and oats instead of breadcrumbs. These meatballs are the perfect addition to Snack City in your freezer. They can be eaten plain, sauced, or used to add in meals. They have been my favorite resident of Snack City lately.

CourseCuisineTime - 1 hour 10 minutes
SnackAmerican, meal prepPrep - 30 minutes
Cook - 40 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
36kcal83 meatballs
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates0.6g10%
Fat1.2g20%
Protein5.6g93%

Ingredients:

  • 5 lbs (2270 g) ground chicken i used 96% lean. You can make this in a food processor if needed
  • 1 cup (80 g) rolled oats
  • 2 (100 g) eggs beaten
  • 1 tbsp (12 g) garlic powder
  • 1 tbsp (12 g) onion powder
  • 1 tsp (10 g) salt
  • 2 tsp (8 g) pepper
  • oil spray

Instructions:

**For the Meatballs **

  1. Preheat your oven to 400F.
  2. If you need grind your chicken, do so. I make ground chicken by placing boneless skinless chicken thighs into the food processor until it resembles ground meat. I do a bunch at once and freeze the excess.
  3. In a large bowl, add your ground chicken, rolled oats, eggs, onion powder, garlic powder, salt, and pepper. Mix it together until everything is fully incorporated.
  4. Line a few large baking sheets with foil in preparation for the meatballs. It may help to spray lightly with oil.
  5. Using a cookie scoop, create meatballs and spread out on to your sheet pans. Space them out evenly with some room between each so that they will brown more easily.
  6. Once you have all of the meatballs created, form them into a tighter ball by tossing each meatball between your hands a few times. It will help to spray your hands with a bit of oil to keep the chicken from sticking.
  7. Roast your meatballs in the oven for 17-20 minutes.
  8. Doing one sheet pan at a time will lead to better browning. If you try to place a pan onto each rack, the one on the top rack will struggle to get brown due to the steam being released from the bottom pan. They will still taste awesome and I do two at once for speed but just be aware that you will sacrifice some browning. When the meatballs are finished, remove from the oven and allow to cool.
  9. Once all of your meatballs have been cooled, transfer them to one single sheet pan and move to your freezer to flash freeze. This just means that you freeze them, uncovered in a single layer, so that they have a chance to freeze individually.
  10. Once they have frozen solid, transfer them over into a ziplock bag, remove all of the air and move them into Snack City in your freezer.
  11. I made 83 meatballs out of this recipe. The nutrition information you see here is for 83 meatballs. If you end up having more or less than that, your nutrition information will be slightly different. Use the table below this recipe to enter how many meatballs you made for the better nutritional estimate.

Serving

  1. To reheat these, I air fry them at 400F for about 5 minutes or until they are hot. You can also microwave them.
  2. I eat them with some ketchup, cover them in buffalo sauce, or incorporate them in a regular meal.

Spicy Popcorn Chicken

Boneless skinless chicken breasts cut into pieces and breaded in corn chex cereal, then air fried to make a copycat version of the classic popcorn chicken with only a fraction of the oil.

CourseCuisineTime - 1 hour 30 minutes
SnackAmericanPrep - 30 minutes
Cook - 1 hour

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
191kcal20 servings
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates17g37%
Fat3g6%
Protein25g55%

Ingredients:

  • 5 lbs (2270 g) boneless skinless chicken breast
  • 2 cups (300 g) corn chex ground (or use breadcrumbs)
  • cup (75 g) cornstarch tapioca works as well
  • 2 tsp (6 g) cayenne pepper
  • 2 tsp (6 g) paprika
  • 3 tsp (12 g) salt
  • 2 tsp (6 g) pepper
  • 3 (150 g) eggs
  • cup (60 g) hot sauce
  • (15 g) cooking spray

Instructions:

For the Chicken

  1. Cut the chicken into 1"-1.5" cubes. Season lightly with salt and pepper.
  2. Place the chicken into a large ziplock bag or bowl and sprinkle over the cornstarch. Shake/mix to evenly distribute the starch on all of the chicken.
  3. Place the corn chex into a food processor or blender and blend until they have formed a powder.
  4. Mix together the corn chex, salt, pepper, cayenne pepper and paprika in a shallow dish or a large bowl.
  5. Crack 3 eggs into a bowl and add your hot sauce. Beat the eggs.
  6. Dunk the cornstarch coated chicken into the egg wash and then place into the bag/dish with the corn chex. If you're using the bag method, don't overcrowd the bag. Shake to coat adding more corn chex if needed. Make sure you allow the excess egg wash to drain off of the chicken before you put it into the bag. If there is too much egg on the chicken it can cause the breading to clump together. If this happens, you will probably want to dump it out and start over between rounds of coating. With the dish method you can just do them as you go. Keep one hand for the egg dunk and one hand for the breading, that will keep the corn chex from gunking up on your fingers.
  7. I like to set a sheet pan nearby so that I can place the completed pieces on the pan and ready to air fry.
  8. Preheat your air fryer to 400F (204C) on the air fry setting and set the timer for 10 minutes.
  9. Add the chicken to your air fryer basket in a single layer. Spray the top lightly with oil and air fry at 400F (204C) for 8-10 minutes. Shake the basket half way through. Pull the chicken out when the breading has turned a golden brown color and the chicken is finished cooking. In my air fryer this takes right around 8 minutes.
  10. You will need to cook in batches as to not over crowd your air fryer. Store the finished chicken on a wire lined baking sheet to cool.

Storage

  1. If you are going to vacuum seal this, you need to flash freeze the chicken first. To do this, place the sheet pan into your freezer, uncovered, until all of the chicken has frozen solid. Then you can transfer it over to your vacuum sealed bags. If you don't flash freeze first, all of the chicken will freeze in a block when you take all of the air out.
  2. If you are freezing in a regular ziplock freezer bag, allow your chicken to cool to room temperature and place into a large ziplock bag. Remove as much air as possible and seal. Place into the freezer. You don't need to flash freeze, but it can still be helpful.
  3. To reheat, you can use the microwave or your airfryer. Air fry at 400 until they are hot. It will take around 3-8 minutes. Smaller pieces will heat faster and dry out so be cautious.

Nutrition Information Notes

  1. This recipe calls for 300g of corn chex, 3 eggs, and cooking oil spray. I included all of the chex, eggs, and 15 grams of oil for the cooking process in the nutrition information for the calorie estimate. It is highly likely you will have corn chex and eggs left over so this estimate is probably on the higher end. If you need exact nutrition information, you should measure and calculate it yourself but i wanted to err on the high side.
  2. This recipe makes 20 servings. For me, that was about 8 or 9 pieces of chicken. Depending on how big or small you cut your chicken, that could change. If you weighed the total amount of your cooked chicken, and divided by 20, that would give you the weight of 1 serving.

Broccoli Bites

These Broccoli Bites are the most highly palatable form of vegetables I have ever encountered. If you are looking for an easy way to get in more vegetables, this recipe is it. If you have a food processor these can probably be prepared in minutes.

CourseCuisineTime - 35 minutes
Appetizer, SnackAmerican, meal prepPrep - 15 minutes
Cook - 20 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
16kcal48 bites
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates3.2g106%
Fat0.1g3%
Protein0.5g16%

Ingredients:

  • 2 lbs (908 g) frozen broccoli
  • medium (100 g) onion
  • 1 cup (120 g) maseca
  • 3 tsp (12 g) garlic powder
  • 1 tsp (8 g) salt
  • 2 tsp (4 g) pepper
  • cup (60 g) water
  • (10 g) oil spray optional for reheating

Instructions:

For the Broccoli Bites

  1. Thaw out your broccoli in the microwave.
  2. NOTE: If you have a food processor you can probably just add all of the ingredients (minus the oil spray) and pulse it until it forms a "dough".
  3. If you don't have a food processor, pour out all of your broccoli onto a cutting board and chop it as fine as you reasonably can.
  4. Cut your onion into as small of a dice as you can.
  5. In a large bowl, add the broccoli, onion, salt, pepper, garlic powder, and maseca. Mix to combine.
  6. Add in the water and stir to hydrate. Keep moving everything around until the maseca becomes sticky and a dough like consistency starts to form.
  7. Line a large baking sheet (I used 17"x11") with foil or parchment and spread out the broccoli mix. Press it into all sides of the sheet pan to get a dense, thin product.
  8. The thinner you make these the crispier they will get in the air fryer. If your sheet pan is too small and you try to fit the entire mixture on to it, your final bites will probably be too thick. It may be necessary in this case to use two sheet pans. You want about "-" in thickness.
  9. Place the sheet pan into the freezer and allow it to freeze until solid. This will make it a breeze to form into pieces. You would have to do it by hand otherwise which would get messy and time consuming.
  10. You can just form them by hand and air fry immediately if you don't need them for Snack City.
  11. Once frozen solid, remove from the pan and cut into 48 pieces. I achieved this by cutting it into 8 rows and 6 columns.
  12. Transfer the bites to a ziplock bag and store them inside of Snack City in your freezer.

Cooking and Serving

  1. Preheat your air fryer to 400F. Place the frozen broccoli bites into the air fryer. (Spray with oil if you wish). Air fry for 16-20 minutes, flipping half way. Cooking times may vary depending on thickness, just keep an eye on them.
  2. Serve your broccoli bites with a bit of pasta sauce for dipping. Choose your favorited jarred sauce at the store.
  3. Note that the nutrition information doesn't include the pasta sauce, just the broccoli bites.

Tater Tots

Tater Tots made from frozen shredded hash browns and air fried for an awesome, crispy, addicting treat to add to Snack City inside of your freezer. These tots are formed using a cookie scoop to make formation of the tots a breeze.

CourseCuisineTime - 35 minutes
SnackAmerican, meal prepPrep - 20 minutes
Cook - 15 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
22kcal49 tots
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates4.7g117%
Fat0.2g5%
Protein0.3g7%

Ingredients:

  • 2 lbs (1135 g) frozen shredded hash browns
  • cup (40 g) cornstarch
  • 4 tsp (16 g) seasoned salt
  • (10 g) oil spray

Instructions:

For the Tater Tots

  1. Place all of your frozen, shredded hash browns in a microwave safe dish. Microwave them for a minute or two until they are thawed. They don't need to be hot here, we just want them to be malleable and easy to cut.
  2. Spread out all of your potatoes on a large cutting board. Cut the hash browns into a small dice by passing a knife through them a few times. We don't need perfect cuts, just shoot for a small dice.
  3. In a large bowl, add the potatoes, cornstarch, and seasoned salt. You can use regular salt if you don't have seasoned salt. I would only use 3 tsp if you do.
  4. Mix the potatoes until all of the ingredients have been incorporated.
  5. Using a standard sized cookie scoop, pack the scoop with potatoes and press them into the scoop using your thumb. Release the tots onto a sheet pan and continue this process until the potatoes are gone.

Cooking and Storing the Tater Tots

  1. Once you have formed all of the tater tots you can either cook them at this step or place them straight into the freezer. It makes no difference.
  2. If you choose to freeze at this step, place the sheet pan into the freezer and allow the tots to flash freeze until frozen solid then transfer into a ziplock bag, remove as much air as possible, and place into the freezer.
  3. To cook the tots, preheat your air fryer to 400F. Place the tater tots, straight from the freezer, into your air fryer and spray the tops lightly with oil. Cook for 12-15 minutes or until they have achieved your preferred level of browning.
  4. I got 49 tots out of this recipe with a standard sized cookie scoop that I packed level with the top. If your yield is greater or less, you will want to reference the table below to update the nutritional estimates.

Spicy Chicken Sandwich

An air fried Spicy Chicken Sandwich made with chicken breast, mayo, tomatoes and pickles. Serve it on a bun, eat it without, or on a lettuce wrap, all are awesome choices.

CourseCuisineTime - 1 hour
Main Dish, SnackAmericanPrep - 30 minutes
Cook - 30 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
492kcal8 pieces
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates41.5g41%
Fat16.8g16%
Protein43.7g43%

Ingredients:

For the Chicken

  • 3 lbs (1362 g) boneless skinless chicken breast
  • 1 cups (125 g) ground corn chex
  • 1 tsp (4 g) onion powder
  • 1 tsp (4 g) garlic powder
  • 1 tsp (4 g) paprika
  • 1 tsp (6 g) cayenne pepper
  • salt and pepper to taste
  • 2 eggs
  • 3 tbsp (45 g) hot sauce
  • (8 g) oil spray

For the Toppings

  • 8 (408 g) hamburger buns
  • 2 tbsp (28 g) butter
  • 8 tbsp (104 g) mayo
  • 2 large (454 g) tomatoes
  • cup (227 g) hamburger pickle chips
  • 1 head (300 g) romaine lettuce

Instructions:

FYI

  1. These chicken cutlets can be prepped ahead of time and frozen if you wish. If you do that you will only be minutes away from a nice sandwich whenever you please. I would recommend doing this.

For the Chicken

  1. When I made this recipe, I had 4 chicken breasts to total 3lbs. That made for an easy division into 8 pieces. If you have bigger or smaller breasts you may need to get creative with your cutting. You want 8 pieces of equal weight.
  2. Cut your chicken breasts into 8 equally weighted pieces.
  3. Lay some plastic wrap over the chicken and pound each piece until they are around " in thickness and shaped like a piece of chicken that would go on a sandwich. Season each side with salt and pepper.
  4. Crack two eggs into bowl with 3 tbsp of hot sauce and beat to combine.
  5. For the breading I use ground corn chex. To make this I put corn chex cereal into the blender until it is a powder. You can use whatever you like, within reason, as a breading. I just prefer the corn chex.
  6. Mix the ground corn chex with onion powder, garlic powder, paprika, and cayenne pepper. If you like your food spicy, add more cayenne to taste.
  7. To bread each piece of chicken, dunk the chicken pieces into the egg wash and then into the breading mixture.
  8. Preheat your air fryer to 400F and cook the chicken for 4-5 minutes on each side. Spray with top side with oil when you put the chicken in and after you flip each piece.

For the Bread and Toppings

  1. Toast your buns by spreading a light layer of butter over the top and placing down in a hot skillet for a couple of minutes.
  2. Wash and cut your tomatoes into thin slices.
  3. Wash and dry your romaine lettuce leaves.

Construction

  1. Each sandwich gets 1 piece of chicken, 1-2 tomato slices, a piece of lettuce, pickles, and mayo spread on the bun.

Storage

  1. You can either store extra chicken in the fridge for up to 5 days or you can place the extra chicken in a ziplock bag, remove the air, and freeze. They will be good in the freezer as long as they don't develop freezer burn. Reheat in the air fryer until they are hot and ready to eat.

Nutrition Information

  1. The recipe calls for 125 grams of ground corn chex so it is easier to bread the meat. You will likely have some left over if you made 8 pieces of chicken. I have included 100 grams of corn chex in the nutrition estimates to account for the excess that wasn't included.
  2. The nutritional estimates for just the chicken, not the sandwich are 232 Calories, 11.5g C | 38.6g P | 4g F.

Apple and Greek Yogurt

This is one of my go to snacks. It is quick, easy, and has a decent amount of protein for a snack from the Greek yogurt. I use splenda for my sweetener, you can use whatever you like.

CourseCuisineTime - 5 minutes
SnackAmericanPrep - 5 minutes
Cook - 0 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
250kcal1
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates34.7g65%
Fat5.9g11%
Protein14.4g27%

Ingredients:

  • 1 medium (120 g) apple
  • cup (150 g) plain non fat Greek yogurt
  • tsp (2 g) splenda
  • 1 tbsp (20 g) mini chocolate chips

Instructions:

For the Apple

  1. Wash and cut the apple into slices.
  2. Mix the splenda into the Greek yogurt and plate with the apple.
  3. Add the chocolate chips to the bowl.

Air Fryer Buffalo Boneless Chicken Wings

Air Fryer Buffalo Boneless Wings made using the popcorn chicken recipe. If you keep the popcorn chicken in Snack City in your freezer, these boneless wings are only a quick air fry away.

CourseCuisineTime - 10 minutes
Appetizer, SnackAmericanPrep - 5 minutes
Cook - 8 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
294kcal1 serving
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates24g34%
Fat41g59%
Protein4g5%

Ingredients:

For the Chicken

  • 15-20 pieces (227 g) popcorn chicken

For the Sauce

  • 2 tbsp (37 g) buffalo sauce

Instructions:

For the Wings

  1. This recipe uses the Popcorn Chicken recipe that you should have in Snack City in your freezer at all times. If you do, all you need to do for cooking is to pull them from the freezer and reheat in your airfryer. I put them in at 400F for a few minutes until they are hot.
  2. If you don't have the popcorn chicken made, here is the recipe: Popcorn Chicken
  3. Add the sauce and chicken to a large bowl and toss to coat.

Serving

  1. This recipe makes 1 serving. If you wanted to use it for a meal, serve it with a side of rice and a vegetable.

Maple Sriracha Boneless Chicken Wings

Maple Sriracha Boneless Wings made using the popcorn chicken recipe. If you keep the popcorn chicken in Snack City in your freezer, these boneless wings are only a quick air fry away. Pair with some rice and a vegetable and you've got a nice meal.

CourseCuisineTime - 10 minutes
Appetizer, SnackAmericanPrep - 5 minutes
Cook - 8 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
378kcal1 serving
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates45.1g50%
Fat3.6g4%
Protein41.3g46%

Ingredients:

For the Chicken

  • 15-20 pieces (227 g) popcorn chicken

For the Sauce

  • 2 tbsp (30 g) maple syrup
  • 2 tsp (10 g) sriracha

Instructions:

For the Wings

  1. This recipe uses the Popcorn Chicken recipe that you should have in Snack City in your freezer at all times. If you do, all you need to do for cooking is to pull them from the freezer and reheat in your airfryer. I put them in at 400F for a few minutes until they are hot.
  2. If you don't have the popcorn chicken made, here is the recipe: Popcorn Chicken
  3. To make the sauce, mix the syrup and sriracha together in a large bowl. Add in the chicken and toss to coat.

Serving

  1. This recipe makes 1 serving. If you wanted to use it for a meal, serve it with a side of rice and a vegetable.

Air Fryer Crinkle Cut Fries

Crinkle Cut Fries to add to Snack City. These fries are cooked in the air fryer and require no oil to prepare making them the perfect macro friendly addition to Snack City.

CourseCuisineTime - 40 minutes
SnackAmerican, meal prepPrep - 30 minutes
Cook - 10 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
120kcal15
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates27g90%
Fat0g0%
Protein3g10%

Ingredients:

  • 5 lbs russet potatoes
  • salt to taste

Instructions:

For Snack City

  1. Wash and cut all of your potatoes into fry shape using your crinkle cutter. Obviously you can use a knife if you want but the crinkle cutter makes for a better result in the fryer because there is more surface area to get crispy. I've linked the crinkle cutter I use above, it's only $8.
  2. Add your potatoes to a bowl of salted water. You don't need to go crazy with the salt here, just throw some in. Allow the potatoes to soak at least 20 minutes.
  3. Drain the water from the potatoes and spread out onto a couple of paper towel lined sheet pans. Pat the potatoes dry and salt lightly. Remove the paper towels and make sure the potatoes are in a single layer. Add to the freezer on the pans and allow to flash freeze until frozen solid. This is important for proper storage so the potatoes don't stick together when you put them in the bag.
  4. Once frozen, transfer the potatoes into a ziplock bag and you can store them inside of Snack City in your freezer.

Cooking the Fries

  1. To cook the fries I preheat the air fryer to 400F and add the frozen fries for 10-12 minutes depending on how many I am making.
  2. Shake the basket around once or twice during the cooking process and pull them out when they have reached your preferred doneness level. I find I don't need to use any oil but if you wanted to spray the top with oil during the cooking, have away.

Serving Size

  1. If you don't use any oil these are just plain potatoes so for tracking purposes you would just need to weigh out your portion and track as a russet potato. For this recipe I decided to use a 150g serving for the nutrition information. That's roughly a large handful of the frozen fries.

Air Fryer Chicken Fingers

Chicken Fingers breaded, air fried, and frozen to add to Snack City in your freezer. Use these for a late night snack or for a meal when you're in a pinch. Kid tested and approved When I make this for Snack City I do 8-10lbs of chicken at a time. If you have only one small air fryer like myself, it will take a few batches to cook.

CourseCuisineTime - 1 hour 30 minutes
SnackAmerican, meal prepPrep - 30 minutes
Cook - 1 hour

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
179kcal20 servings
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates13.1g33%
Fat3.7g9%
Protein23.4g60%

Ingredients:

  • 5 lbs (2270 g) boneless skinless chicken breast
  • 2 cups (250 g) corn chex ground
  • cups (60 g) tapioca flour or cornstarch
  • 2 eggs
  • 3 tbsp (45 g) water
  • salt and pepper to taste
  • 2 tbsp (30 g) oil spray

Instructions:

For the Chicken Fingers

  1. Cut your chicken breasts into chicken finger sized pieces. I shoot for between 1"-1.5" in diameter and 4-5" long. Season with salt and pepper.
  2. Prep your breading by placing the corn chex into a blender or food processor and blending into a flour. Lightly season the breading with salt and pepper.
  3. Set up three bowls, one with the eggs and water beaten together, one with the cornstarch, and one with the breading. You can also use large ziplock bags for the breading steps if you wish.
  4. Coat the chicken in cornstarch, then dunk in the egg wash, and then transfer to the corn chex and coat evenly. Shake off any excess and place on a sheet pan to prepare to be air fried.
  5. Keep one of your hands as the wet hand for the eggs and one as the dry hand for the breading, this will keep it from gunking up on your fingers.
  6. Once all of your chicken is breaded, preheat your air fryer to 400F. Place the chicken in a single layer in the basket and spray lightly with oil. Cook for 7-8 minutes then flip and lightly spray the other side. Cook for an additional 5-6 minutes or until golden brown.
  7. Place the cooked pieces on a wire rack to cool and repeat this process until you have cooked all of the chicken.

Storage

  1. Once all of the chicken has cooled, transfer it into a ziplock bag and remove all of the air. Store inside of Snack City in your freezer.
  2. To reheat, add to your air fryer at 400F for 7-10 minutes.
  3. The nutrition values are an estimate for if you split the 5 lbs of chicken into 20 servings. If you need exact calorie information, you may want to calculate the exact values for your specific batch.

Stuffed Hash Browns

Stuffed Hash Browns made in the air fryer. These hash browns are perfect to add to Snack City in your freezer for an easy morning breakfast.

CourseCuisineTime - 35 minutes
Breakfast, SnackAmerican, meal prepPrep - 35 minutes
Cook - 0 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
62kcal36 hash browns
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates10.2g78%
Fat1.3g10%
Protein2.5g19%

Ingredients:

  • 3 lbs (1362 g) frozen shredded hash browns country style
  • cup (85 g) tapioca flour corn starch works too
  • 1 tbsp (14 g) seasoned salt or regular salt
  • 1 medium (150 g) green pepper
  • 1 medium (150 g) red pepper
  • medium (100 g) sweet onion
  • lb (227 g) diced ham
  • cup (84 g) shredded cheese
  • (10 g) oil spray

Instructions:

For the Hash Browns

  1. Place all of your frozen hash browns into a microwave safe bowl. Microwave for 5-6 minutes or until they have thawed and are easier to work with and mold. You can use regular potatoes and shred them on your own if you wish. If you do this you will need to squeeze out as much water from them as possible using a clean towel.
  2. Wash and cut your peppers and onion into a small dice. Dry the ham with a paper towel to get as much moisture off of it as possible.
  3. Once the hash browns have thawed, stir in the tapioca flour (or corn starch), seasoned salt, peppers, onions, ham, and cheese.
  4. Spray a small ramekin or dish with a bit of oil and pack the potatoes into shape. You will want to pack them densely. I used about 60g ( cup) worth for each hash brown. Hit the ramekin upside down against the counter top or your hand lightly to release the hash brown. If you find that they aren't staying together you can add more starch. Some brands of hash browns are less starchy than others.
  5. You can cook these in advanced or freeze them as they are now. If you are going to freeze (this is what I do) place them on a sheet pan and flash freeze them to solidify. Once they have frozen solid, transfer to a ziplock bag and store in the freezer.
  6. If you choose to cook them in advance, preheat your air fryer to 400F. Place the hash browns in the air fryer in a single layer, cooking in batches if necessary. Spray the tops with a bit of oil to help with browning. Cook for 12-15 minutes, flipping half way and spraying the underside with a bit of oil.
  7. You can probably use an oven to cook these but they likely won't get as crispy and will take longer to cook. I have not attempted it, FYI.

Storage

  1. Once the hash browns have frozen solid if not precooking or have cooled if you did precook, add them to a ziplock bag, remove the air and freeze. To reheat, use the air fryer if you want to keep them crispy.
  2. Reheating the uncooked hash browns in the air fryer at 400F for 12-15 minutes. Spray the tops with oil and turn half way.
  3. This recipe makes 36 hash browns. The nutrition information is for each one.

Double Chocolate Chip Pancake Bites

Pancake batter poured into a mini muffin tin and baked to create a similar flavor and texture to pancakes. Bake these, throw them in the freezer, and reheat them whenever you need in the microwave. Serve with a side of maple syrup.

CourseCuisineTime - 20 minutes
Breakfast, SnackAmericanPrep - 10 minutes
Cook - 10 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
36kcal48 bites
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates5.1g72%
Fat0.7g10%
Protein2.2g31%

Ingredients:

  • 2 cup (200 g) oat flour
  • cup (50 g) tapioca flour corn starch would probably work
  • 2 scoop (60 g) vanilla casein protein powder I use the brand Optimum Nutrition but micellar casein will work
  • 1 cup (260 g) liquid egg whites
  • cup (60 g) mini chocolate chips
  • 2 tsp (8 g) baking powder
  • 7 tbsp (35 g) cocoa powder
  • 1 cup (360 ml) water

Instructions:

For the Pancake Bites

  1. Preheat your oven to 325F.
  2. In a large bowl, mix together all of the dry ingredients until no clumps remain. It is easiest for later if your bowl has a spout on it, not required however. Sift the cocoa powder if needed.
  3. NOTE: I'm sure many of you will ask me if you can swap the casein with whey or leave it out all together. No, do not omit the casein and absolutely do not substitute with whey. Your pancake bites will become hockey pucks. A lot of the sweetness comes from the protein powder, do not leave it out. I have attempted this recipe by adding sugar in place of the protein powder and it does not work. The casein adds an airy quality that is not present when only oat flour is used. You can probably use wheat flour and omit the casein but add in some kind of sweetener.
  4. Add in the water, egg whites, and 3 tbsp of chocolate chips. Mix until incorporated and your batter is pourable.
  5. Spray a mini muffin tin with cooking spray. Make sure to coat all sides of the well.
  6. If your bowl doesn't have a spout you may find it easiest to transfer the batter into a large ziplock bag to use as a piping bag. Cut off the corner to fill each well of your mini muffin tin.
  7. Fill each well about half way with batter. This recipe makes 48 bites. Top each bite with the remaining chocolate chips.
  8. Bake for 9-10 minutes.

Storage

  1. Once the bites have completely cooled, place them in a ziplock bag and remove as much air as possible. Store in the freezer.
  2. Reheat the bites in the microwave and serve with maple syrup.

Air Fryer Hash Browns

Hash Browns made in the air fryer using only 3 ingredients. These hash browns are perfect to add to Snack City in your freezer for a quick morning treat.

CourseCuisineTime - 40 minutes
Breakfast, SnackAmerican, meal prepPrep - 15 minutes
Cook - 25 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
61kcal15 hash browns
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates13.8g106%
Fat0.3g2%
Protein0.7g5%

Ingredients:

  • 30 oz (850 g) frozen shredded hash browns country style
  • cup (30 g) tapioca flour corn starch works too
  • 3 tsp (12 g) seasoned salt or regular salt
  • (5 g) oil spray

Instructions:

For the Hash Browns

  1. Place all of your frozen hash browns into a microwave safe bowl. Microwave for 5-6 minutes or until they have thawed and are easier to work with and mold. You can use regular potatoes and shred them on your own if you wish. If you do this you will need to squeeze out as much water from them as possible using a clean towel.
  2. Once the hash browns have thawed, stir in the tapioca flour (or corn starch) and salt.
  3. Spray a small ramekin or dish with a bit of oil and pack the potatoes into shape. You will want to pack them densely. I used about 60g ( cup) worth for each hash brown. Hit the ramekin upside down against the counter top or your hand to release the hash brown. I yielded 15 hash browns in total.
  4. You can cook these in advanced or freeze them as they are now. If you are going to freeze (this is what I do) place them on a sheet pan and flash freeze them to solidify. Once they have frozen solid, transfer to a ziplock bag and store in the freezer.
  5. Preheat your air fryer to 400F. Place the hash browns in the air fryer in a single layer, cooking in batches if necessary. Spray the tops with a bit of oil to help with browning. Cook for 12-15 minutes, flipping half way and spraying the underside with a bit of oil.
  6. You can probably use an oven to cook these but they likely won't get as crispy and will take longer to cook. I have not attempted it, FYI.

Storage

  1. Once the hash browns have cooled, add them to a ziplock bag, remove the air and freeze. To reheat, use the air fryer if you want to keep them crispy.
  2. This recipe makes 15 hash browns. The nutrition information is for each one.

Chicken Katsu Ramen

Chicken Katsu served over ramen noodles and broth for a quick 15 minute snack if you have the chicken katsu prepped in your freezer.

CourseCuisineTime - 15 minutes
Main Dish, SnackJapanesePrep - 5 minutes
Cook - 10 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
513kcal1 serving
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates61.8g55%
Fat11.6g10%
Protein40.4g36%

Ingredients:

  • 2 oz (70 g) ramen noodles gluten free if needed
  • 3 oz (85 g) chicken katsu
  • 1 egg
  • cup (30 g) shredded carrots
  • 1 tbsp (10 g) green onions sliced
  • 1 tsp (5 g) soy sauce
  • tsp (2 g) chicken bouillon
  • 1 cup (240 ml) chicken stock or bone broth

Instructions:

For the Egg

  1. Start a pot of water over high heat and bring to a boil. Add in the egg and boil for 1 minute.
  2. Add a lid and remove from the heat. Let rest for 6-8 minutes then rinse with cold water to stop the cooking. Remove from shell.

For the Ramen

  1. In a pot bring the chicken stock, soy sauce, and chicken bouillon to a light boil.
  2. Once boiling add in the noodles and cook until soft.
  3. Cut your green onions on a bias and shred the carrots into ribbons
  4. Reheat your katsu in the air fryer on 400F until it is heated through. Cut into slices. The recipe for the Katsu is linked in the ingredient list above. I have this in my freezer as part of Snack City at all times to make it easy for uses like this.
  5. Once the noodles have finished, add the broth and noodles to a bowl. Top with the carrots, egg, chicken and green onions.

Giant Protein Pancake

A gluten free, high protein pancake made from oat flour and a blend of whey and casein protein.

CourseCuisineTime - 10 minutes
Breakfast, Dessert, SnackAmericanPrep - 5 minutes
Cook - 5 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
283kcal1 Pancake
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates29.2g43%
Fat2.2g3%
Protein36.5g54%

Ingredients:

  • scoop (25 g) vanilla whey/casein blend 50/50 blend. I mix 12.5g of whey and 12.5g of casein together
  • cup (20 g) oat flour
  • 1 tbsp (10 g) tapioca flour or cornstarch
  • 1/4 tsp (1 g) baking powder
  • cup (60 g) liquid egg whites
  • cup (75 g) plain nonfat Greek yogurt
  • 1-2 tbsp (25 g) water

For the Toppings

  • cup (100 g) mixed berries frozen is fine
  • tsp (2 g) splenda optional
  • 1 tbsp (5 g) fat free whipped cream

Instructions:
