  1. Mix all the dry ingredients together so no clumps are present. NOTE: I have tested this with only whey protein and it doesn't turn out as well. Only casein will work but you may need more water in the batter. The 50/50 blend is best.
  2. Add in the wet ingredients and mix thoroughly.
  3. Heat a griddle/skillet on medium heat and spray with oil. Add the batter and cook for a couple minutes, then flip.

For the Toppings

  1. If your fruit is frozen, defrost it in the microwave. Sprinkle the splenda over the top and allow it to macerate for a few minutes. This will pull out some of the juices and allow you to use less syrup.
  2. Top your pancake with the fruit and whipped cream.

Irish Nachos

Irish Nachos made from air fried potatoes topped with cheese, salsa, green onions, and Greek yogurt. This is a quick, easy, and flavorful snack you can use to curb your midnight cravings.

CourseCuisineTime - 13 minutes
Appetizer, SnackAmericanPrep - 5 minutes
Cook - 8 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
291kcal1 serving
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates45g71%
Fat8g12%
Protein10g15%

Ingredients:

  • 1 medium (200 g) russet potato
  • 2 tbsp (30 g) salsa
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) plain non fat Greek yogurt
  • 1 tsp (2 g) green onion
  • 1 tbsp (14 g) cheese
  • (1 g) oil spray

Instructions:

For the Potatoes

  1. Preheat your air fryer to 400F on the air fryer setting.
  2. Wash and slice your potato into chip sized slices.
  3. Add the potatoes to the air fryer and spray lightly with oil. Fry for a few minutes then shake/turn. It will probably take 5-6 minutes depending on the thickness of your potato.
  4. Remove from the fryer and salt. Sprinkle the cheese over the top and then microwave to melt.

Serving

  1. This recipe makes 1 serving. Top with salsa, yogurt and green onions.

Pollo and Pinto Mini Tacos

A freezer friendly mini taco made from pinto beans, chicken, cheddar cheese, and spinach. Adding chopped spinach to the bean mixture makes for an easy way to get in more leafy greens, even if its only a little bit.

CourseCuisineTime - 45 minutes
SnackMexicanPrep - 15 minutes
Cook - 30 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
84kcal32 tacos
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates10.7g62%
Fat2g11%
Protein5.7g33%

Ingredients:

  • 2 cans (850 g) pinto beans
  • 2 cups (120 g) spinach chopped
  • cup (120 g) water
  • 2 tsp (4 g) cumin
  • 2 tsp (4 g) chili powder
  • 1 tsp (5 g) olive oil
  • 32 mini (469 g) corn tortillas I use the brand Mission street taco tortillas. They are 3" in diameter
  • 1 cup (112 g) cheddar cheese
  • 1 lb (454 g) boneless skinless chicken breast
  • salt and pepper to taste

Instructions:

  1. Preheat your oven to 400F.

For the Chicken

  1. You can cook this anyway you please. It doesn't make a huge difference because we are cutting it up small and putting in the filling. Bake it, boil it, buy it precooked if you want. If you bake it, cut or pound it so it has even thickness throughout and cook for 15-20 minutes or until it has reached an internal temperature of 165F.

For the Beans

  1. Heat 1 tsp of oil in a skillet over medium heat. Add in the beans and chopped spinach. Allow to cook for 2 minutes until the spinach has wilted.
  2. Add in cup of water and cover. Cook for 5 minutes.
  3. Remove the cover and mash the beans with a fork or potato masher. Add in the cumin, chili powder and season with salt and pepper to taste.
  4. Mix in the cheese and chicken.

For the Tacos

  1. Heat the tortilla shells in the microwave so they are pliable. I like to wrap a small amount of them in a damp paper towel.
  2. Spoon the bean and cheese mixture onto each tortilla and fold to close. I like to use a cookie scoop for this step.
  3. Place the tacos on a sheet pan and bake for 5-8 minutes. Place an empty sheet pan on the top so they are weighed down and won't open when baked.

Storage

  1. Once the tacos have cooled, add to a large ziplock bag. Remove as much air as possible and keep in the freezer. Reheat the tacos in the microwave. For the best result, use an air fryer or wrap the tacos in a wet paper towel and then microwave for 10-15 seconds. I don't recommend going straight from the freezer to microwave as the tortilla will be too dry.

Nashville Hot Chicken Stuffed Potato Skins

Crispy, flavorful and filling. The perfect between meals meal. These Hot Chicken Stuffed Potato Skins are cooked sans oil using the air fryer to keep the calorie load low.

CourseCuisineTime - 1 hour 10 minutes
Appetizer, SnackAmericanPrep - 10 minutes
Cook - 1 hour

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
90kcal5 potato skins
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates7.5g39%
Fat2g10%
Protein10.7g56%

Ingredients:

  • 5 (50 g) potato skins
  • lb (227 g) chicken breast tenders
  • cup (40 g) baked potato crumbles
  • 2 tbsp (14 g) shredded cheddar
  • 2 tsp (7 g) brown sugar
  • tsp (.7 g) chili powder
  • tsp (.7 g) onion powder
  • tsp (.7 g) cayenne
  • tsp (2 g) garlic powder
  • 2 tsp (8 g) hot sauce
  • tsp (3.5 g) water
  • 1 (10 g) green onion

For the Spicy Ketchup

  • 2 tbsp (25 g) ketchup
  • 2 tsp (10 g) hot sauce

Instructions:

  1. Bake some potatoes. I used the air fryer at 400F for 40 minutes. Doesnt matter how you do this. You can use the oven too.
  2. Halve the baked potato and scoop out the insides.
  3. Preheat your air fryer to 400F on the air fry setting for 8 minutes.
  4. Lightly spray the tenders with oil and season with salt and pepper. Cook for 4 minutes then flip.
  5. When the chicken has almost completed cooking, mix the seasonings together and stir in the water and hot sauce.
  6. Chop the chicken and add to the sauce. Coat evenly.
  7. Stuff 5 skins with chicken, top with some of the scooped out potato and cheese.
  8. Air fry at 400F for 3-4 minutes. Watch it closely to make sure it doesnt burn.

Serving

  1. Top the potato skins with with green onions. Mix the ketchup and hot sauce together for the spicy ketchup

Buffalo Chicken Tenders

A quick snack you can make in the air fryer. These Buffalo Chicken Tenders are the perfect meal for when you need a big dose of protein.

CourseCuisineTime - 11 minutes
Appetizer, SnackAmericanPrep - 3 minutes
Cook - 8 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
221kcal2 servings
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates0.3g0%
Fat1.2g2%
Protein52g98%

Ingredients:

  • 1 lb boneless skinless chicken breast tenders
  • 2 tbsp buffalo sauce
  • salt and pepper to taste

Instructions:

  1. Preheat your air fryer to 400F.
  2. Season the chicken with salt and pepper and add to the air fryer. Cook the tenders for around 4 minutes and then flip and cook an additional 4 minutes.
  3. Toss the chicken in the buffalo sauce.

Serving

  1. This recipe makes 2 servings.

Spring Rolls

These Spring Rolls are made using rice paper, rice noodles, chicken breasts, lettuce, carrots, and cilantro. They are served with a side of peanut sauce for lots of flavor.

CourseCuisineTime - 40 minutes
Appetizer, SnackAsianPrep - 25 minutes
Cook - 15 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
107kcal15 spring rolls
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates15.5g67%
Fat2.1g9%
Protein6.4g27%

Ingredients:

For the Spring Rolls

  • 15 sheets (135 g) rice paper
  • 1 lb (454 g) boneless skinless chicken breast
  • 1 tbsp (14 g) mayo
  • 2 tsp (5 g) sriracha
  • 2 oz (75 g) rice sticks
  • 3 cups (250 g) romaine lettuce
  • 1 large (200 g) cucumber
  • bunch (20 g) cilantro
  • 2 tbsp (30 g) rice vinegar
  • 1 medium (100 g) pickled carrots

For the Peanut Sauce

  • 3 tbsp (50 g) peanut butter
  • 4 tsp (20 g) soy sauce
  • 2 tsp (10 g) sriracha
  • 4 tsp (20 g) lime juice
  • 1 tbsp (30 g) honey
  • water to consistency

Instructions:

For the Spring Rolls

  1. Cut the chicken to even thickness and cover with the mayo and sriracha on all sides. Air Fry at 400F for 8-12 minutes, flipping it halfway. You could also do shrimp or pork if you wanted.
  2. You'll need to prep the pickled carrots in advance as well if you don't already have them in your fridge. You can either use a vegetable peeler to create ribbons or just buy pre-shredded carrots. To pickle them mix 1 part water and 1 part vinegar with 1 tbsp of sugar and 1 tsp of salt. Put them in a container and allow them to pickle overnight. Make a bunch. These are great and they will last in the fridge for weeks.
  3. To start your prep work, place the rice noodles in a bowl of hot water and allow them to soak for 10-15 minutes or until they have softened.
  4. Wash and cut your lettuce into thin slices and pick the leaves away from the cilantro stems.
  5. Using a vegetable peeler, create ribbons out of your cucumber.
  6. Once the chicken has finished cooking, cut it into thin slices.
  7. To prep the rice paper, submerge it in warm water or hold it under the faucet. Place it down on your work surface and flatten.
  8. Add a small amount of rice noodles, lettuce (dressed with rice vinegar), chicken, pickled carrots, cucumber, and cilantro. I like to include a drizzle of sriracha as well.
  9. Roll the ingredients in the wrap and fold in the sides. Repeat for the remaining rolls.

For the Peanut Sauce

  1. Melt the peanut butter and mix all of the ingredients together until smooth. Add water as needed to thin out.

Storage

  1. To store this for meal prep you should keep it in your fridge, deconstructed, and make the spring rolls whenever you plan to eat them. Store the lettuce and cilantro in a container, the chicken, the cucumbers, pickled carrots, and rice stick in their own containers. Store the rice sticks submerged in water to prevent them from drying out.

Serving

  1. When it comes time to prep the Spring Rolls, remove the containers from your fridge, set up a prep station, and make however many you want. This recipe will make 15 Spring Rolls.
  2. Serve the spring rolls with the peanut sauce. If your sauce thickens up in the fridge you can add water and stir until you reach the correct consistency.

Faux Cheddar Bay Biscuits

A copycat version of the Cheddar Bay Biscuits from Red Lobster. I like to use these in soups or as croutons.

CourseCuisineTime - 25 minutes
Appetizer, SnackAmericanPrep - 10 minutes
Cook - 15 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
53kcal13 biscuits
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates5.1g51%
Fat2.1g21%
Protein3.4g34%

Ingredients:

**Dry Ingredients **

  • cup (80 g) oat flour
  • tsp (2 g) onion powder
  • 1 tbsp (1 g) dried parsley
  • 1 tsp (4 g) salt
  • 1 tsp (3 g) garlic powder
  • tsp (2 g) baking soda

Wet Ingredients

  • 1 small egg or 1/2 large egg
  • cup (56 g) cheddar cheese
  • cup (150 g) plain Greek yogurt non fat

Instructions:

For the Biscuits

  1. Preheat your oven to 375F.
  2. Mix the dry ingredients and wet ingredients independently then combine.
  3. Use a cookie scoop to put on a sprayed sheet pan and bake at 375 Fahrenheit for 15-17 minutes. Makes 13.

Nashville Hot Chicken Tenders

Nashville Hot Chicken Tenders made from chicken breast tenderloins and coated in a spicy, sweet sauce from brown sugar, hot sauce, and spices.

CourseCuisineTime - 20 minutes
Appetizer, SnackAmericanPrep - 5 minutes
Cook - 15 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
263kcal2
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates9.4g15%
Fat2.6g4%
Protein50.5g82%

Ingredients:

  • 1 lb (454 g) chicken breast tenders
  • 1/2 tsp (1.5 g) chili powder
  • 1/2 tsp (1.5 g) onion powder
  • 1/2 tsp (1.5 g) cayenne pepper
  • 1 tbsp (14 g) brown sugar
  • 1 tsp (3 g) garlic powder
  • 1 tbsp (18 ml) hot sauce
  • 1.5 tsp (7 ml) water
  • Oil spray
  • Salt and pepper to taste

Instructions:

  1. Preheat your air fryer to 400F on the air fry setting for 8 minutes.
  2. Lightly spray the tenders with oil and season with salt and pepper. Cook for 4 minutes then flip.
  3. When the chicken has almost completed cooking, mix the seasonings together and stir in the water and hot sauce.
  4. Add to a pan over medium heat. Bring to a light bubble, we are just trying to caramelize the sugar a bit to thicken the sauce.
  5. Add in the chicken and coat evenly.
  6. This recipe makes 2 servings.

Chicken Fries

These Chicken Fries are made from ground chicken, coated in a corn Chex crust and air fried to create a gluten free, lower calorie chicken fry.

CourseCuisineTime - 2 hours 30 minutes
SnackAmericanPrep - 15 minutes
Cook - 15 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
51kcal36 chicken fries
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates3g30%
Fat2g20%
Protein5g50%

Ingredients:

  • 2 lbs (908 g) ground chicken
  • 1 cup (100 g) ground corn chex
  • tsp (1.5 g) garlic powder
  • tsp (1.5 g) onion powder
  • 1 tsp (4 g) salt
  • tsp (1 g) pepper
  • 1 (1 ) egg
  • 2 tbsp (15 g) cornstarch

Instructions:

For the Shaping of the Chicken Fries

  1. Add all of the seasonings to the ground chicken and mix.
  2. Spread your ground chicken out on a sheet pan in a layer that is roughly - inches in thickness.
  3. Place it in the freezer for 1-2 hours or until it is solid enough to cut through easily while still maintaining shape.
  4. Cut the chicken into - inch wide strips and 3-4 inches in length. I got 36 chicken fries out of 2 pounds of meat but if you make yours a bit bigger or smaller you may have a different amount, no worries though. There is a table at the bottom of this page to help you figure out the nutrition information if this is the case.
  5. Place the cut chicken fries back into the freezer until they are frozen solid. It will be much easier to work with when they are frozen. You can do these steps the night before if you wish.
  6. Measure out the corn chex and place them into a food processor or a blender to form into a powder. Season lightly with salt.
  7. In a ziplock bag, add some cornstarch and about half of the frozen chicken fries. Shake to coat. Do the same with the remaining chicken fries.
  8. Beat the egg in a shallow dish and mix in a couple of tablespoons of water to thin it out a bit. Set up a breading station with your egg wash, corn chex, and a plate for the breaded fries.
  9. Using one hand as your "wet" hand and one hand as your "dry" hand, dunk the cornstarch coated fries into the egg wash and then coat in corn chex. Knock off any excess breading.
  10. Preheat your air fryer to 400F on the air fry setting for 15 minutes. Place the chicken fries in the air fryer in a single layer spaced about 1-2cm apart. Spray lightly with oil.
  11. Cook the chicken fries for 6-7 minutes, then flip and cook for an additional 6-7 minutes or until they have crisped up properly. It may take more, it make take less depending on your air fryer.
  12. Once you have cooked all of your fries, allow them to cool and store in a ziplock bag in the freezer.
  13. To reheat, turn your air fryer to the reheat setting at 300F and heat for 4-5 minutes or until warm.
  14. NOTE: You can use turkey for this but it doesn't work as well as chicken. The goo stuff (just coagulated proteins) that comes out of turkey when you cook it seep through the breading and make it a bit uglier. It will still work, just knock it off the fries when you flip them and keep cooking. I would try to look for turkey with as little water added as possible to help prevent this

Spicy Chicken Fries

These Chicken Fries are made from ground chicken, coated in a corn chex crust and air fried to create a gluten free, lower calorie chicken fry.

CourseCuisineTime - 2 hours 30 minutes
SnackAmericanPrep - 15 minutes
Cook - 15 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
51kcal36 chicken fries
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates3g30%
Fat2g20%
Protein5g50%

Ingredients:

  • 2 lbs (908 g) ground chicken
  • 1 cup (100 g) ground corn chex
  • 2 tbsp hot sauce
  • tsp (1.5 g) garlic powder
  • tsp (1.5 g) onion powder
  • 1 tsp paprika
  • tsp cayenne pepper
  • 1 tsp (4 g) salt
  • tsp (1 g) pepper
  • 1 (1 ) egg
  • 2 tbsp (15 g) cornstarch

Instructions:

For the Shaping of the Chicken Fries

  1. Add all of the seasonings except the paprika and cayenne to the ground chicken and mix.
  2. Spread your ground chicken out on a sheet pan in a layer that is roughly - inches in thickness.
  3. Place it in the freezer for 1-2 hours or until it is solid enough to cut through easily while still maintaining shape.
  4. Cut the chicken into - inch wide strips and 3-4 inches in length. I got 36 chicken fries out of 2 pounds of meat but if you make yours a bit bigger or smaller you may have a different amount, no worries though. There is a table at the bottom of this page to help you figure out the nutrition information if this is the case. NOTE: the video is just showing you the process, ignore how many it made.
  5. Place the cut chicken fries back into the freezer until they are frozen solid. It will be much easier to work with when they are frozen. You can do these steps the night before if you wish.
  6. Measure out the corn chex and place them into a food processor or a blender to form into a powder. Season lightly with salt and add the cayenne and paprika.
  7. In a ziplock bag, add some cornstarch and about half of the frozen chicken fries. Shake to coat. Do the same with the remaining chicken fries.
  8. Beat the egg in a shallow dish and mix in the hot sauce. Set up a breading station with your egg wash, corn chex, and a plate for the breaded fries.
  9. Using one hand as your "wet" hand and one hand as your "dry" hand, dunk the cornstarch coated fries into the egg wash and then coat in corn chex. Knock off any excess breading.
  10. Preheat your air fryer to 400F on the air fry setting for 15 minutes. Place the chicken fries in the air fryer in a single layer spaced about 1-2cm apart. Spray lightly with oil.
  11. Cook the chicken fries for 6-7 minutes, then flip and cook for an additional 6-7 minutes or until they have crisped up properly. It may take more, it make take less depending on your air fryer.
  12. Once you have cooked all of your fries, allow them to cool and store in a ziplock bag in the freezer.
  13. To reheat, turn your air fryer to the reheat setting at 300F and heat for 4-5 minutes or until warm.
  14. NOTE: You can use turkey for this but it doesn't work as well as chicken. The goo stuff (just coagulated proteins) that comes out of turkey when you cook it seep through the breading and make it a bit uglier. It will still work, just knock it off the fries when you flip them and keep cooking. I would try to look for turkey with as little water added as possible to help prevent this

Protein Pancakes

A gluten free, high protein pancake recipe made from oat flour and a blend of whey and casein protein.

CourseCuisineTime - 10 minutes
Breakfast, Dessert, SnackAmericanPrep - 5 minutes
Cook - 5 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
266kcal4 Pancakes
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates26.7g43%
Fat1.9g3%
Protein35.4g57%

Ingredients:

  • scoop (25 g) vanilla whey/casein blend 50/50 blend. I mix 12.5g of whey and 12.5g of casein together
  • cup (20 g) oat flour
  • 1 tbsp (10 g) tapioca flour or cornstarch
  • 1/4 tsp (1 g) baking powder
  • cup (60 g) liquid egg whites
  • cup (75 g) plain nonfat Greek yogurt
  • 1-2 tbsp (25 g) water

Instructions:

  1. Mix all the dry ingredients together so no clumps are present. NOTE: I have tested this with only whey protein and it doesn't turn out as well. Only casein will work but you may need more water in the batter. The 50/50 blend is best.
  2. Add in the wet ingredients and mix thoroughly.
  3. Heat a griddle/skillet on medium heat and spray with oil. Add the batter and cook for a couple minutes, then flip.

Protein Waffle

A gluten free, high protein waffle made from oat flour and a blend of whey and casein protein.

CourseCuisineTime - 10 minutes
Breakfast, Dessert, SnackAmericanPrep - 5 minutes
Cook - 5 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
183kcal1 Waffle
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates17.9g41%
Fat1.4g3%
Protein25.1g58%

Ingredients:

  • (20 g) scoop vanilla whey/casein blend 50/50 blend
  • 3 tbsp (14 g) oat flour
  • 1 tbsp (6.5 g) tapioca flour
  • tsp (1 g) baking powder
  • 3 tbsp (40 g) liquid egg whites
  • 3 tbsp (50 g) plain nonfat Greek yogurt
  • 1 tbsp (20 g) water

Instructions:

  1. Mix all the dry ingredients together so no clumps are present. NOTE: I have tested this with only whey protein and it doesn't turn out. Only casein will work but you may need more water in the batter. The 50/50 blend is best.
  2. Add in the wet ingredients and mix thoroughly.
  3. Heat an 8 waffle iron on medium heat and spray with oil. Add the batter and cook for a couple minutes.

Mozzarella Sticks

Mozzarella string cheese breaded with corn chex and air fried to make a gluten free decadent snack. You can freeze these and have them ready to go for whenever you need a quick bite to eat.

CourseCuisineTime - 1 hour
SnackAmericanPrep - 1 hour
Cook - 5 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
64kcal24 sticks
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates4.3g39%
Fat3.4g30%
Protein4g36%

Ingredients:

  • 12 (340 g) mozzarella cheese sticks
  • 1 tbsp (8 g) tapioca flour regular flour or cornstarch is fine
  • 1 cup (100 g) corn chex ground (or breadcrumbs)
  • tsp (1 g) salt
  • tsp (1 g) pepper
  • tsp (1 g) garlic powder
  • 1 egg

Instructions:

For the Cheese Sticks

  1. Remove the plastic from all of the cheese sticks and cut in half. Place in the freezer until they have frozen solid.

For the Breading

  1. Place the corn chex into a food processor or blender and blend until they resemble the size of breadcrumbs. Mix in the salt, pepper, and garlic powder. Place just over half into a shallow dish.
  2. Place the cornstarch into a ziplock bag.
  3. Crack the egg into a bowl, add a bit of water to thin, and scramble.
  4. Coat the frozen cheese stick in cornstarch and shake off any excess.
  5. Dunk the starch coated cheese stick into the egg wash and then place into the dish with the corn chex. Make sure you allow the excess egg wash to drain off of the cheese before you put it into the dish. Coat with corn chex and place on a plate. Keep one hand for the egg dunk and one hand for the breading, that will keep the corn chex from gunking up on your fingers.
  6. Once all of the cheese sticks have been breaded, give them a second pass through the egg wash and remaining breading. Make sure you get the ends as well to prevent cheese from seeping out.
  7. After breading, place them into the freezer until they have frozen solid. If they aren't frozen throughout the cheese melts too fast when cooking.
  8. Preheat your air fryer to 400F on the air fry setting and set the timer for 6 minutes.
  9. Add the frozen mozzarella sticks to the air fryer and spray lightly with oil. Turn them every 1-2 minutes. This will help you monitor them to ensure they aren't leaking cheese. Pull them out when the outside is golden but before the cheese is leaking out everywhere.

Storage

  1. Allow the mozzarella sticks to cool and then place in a ziplock bag. Remove as much air as possible and seal. Place into the freezer.
  2. To reheat, you can use the microwave or your air fryer. Using the reheat setting on 400 it will take 3-5 minutes to reheat. Again, make sure you check it often to ensure the cheese doesn't seep out.

P-Corn Chicken

Boneless skinless chicken breasts cut into pieces and coated in flour and corn chex then air fried to make a copycat version of the classic popcorn chicken with only a fraction of the oil.

CourseCuisineTime - 45 minutes
SnackAmericanPrep - 15 minutes
Cook - 30 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
234kcal6 servings
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates19.1g35%
Fat2.9g5%
Protein33g61%

Ingredients:

  • 2 lbs (908 g) boneless skinless chicken breast
  • 1 cups (125 g) corn chex ground (or use breadcrumbs)
  • cup (30 g) tapioca flour cornstarch works as well
  • 2 tsp (6 g) garlic powder
  • 1 tsp (5 g) salt
  • 1 tsp (2 g) pepper
  • 2 eggs
  • cooking spray

Instructions:

For the Chicken

  1. Cut the chicken into 1" cubes.
  2. Place the corn chex into a food processor or blender and blend until they resemble the size of breadcrumbs. Mix in the salt, pepper, and garlic powder. Place just over half into a shallow dish or a ziplock bag. I prefer to use the ziplock bag for ease.
  3. Crack 2 eggs into a bowl, add a bit of water to thin, and scramble.
  4. Coat the chicken with the tapoica flour. You can use a ziplock bag and shake it all together or just sprinkle it over and toss it around.
  5. Dunk the tapioca flour coated chicken into the egg wash and then place into the bag/dish with the corn chex. If you're using the bag method, do half of the chicken each time. Shake to coat adding more corn chex if needed. Make sure you allow the excess egg wash to drain off of the chicken before you put it into the bag. If there is too much egg on the chicken it can cause the breading to clump together. If this happens, you will probably want to dump it out and start over between rounds of coating. With the dish method you can just do them as you go. Keep one hand for the egg dunk and one hand for the breading, that will keep the corn chex from gunking up on your fingers.
  6. I like to set a sheet pan nearby so that I can place the completed pieces on the pan and ready to air fry.
  7. Preheat your air fryer to 400F on the air fry setting and set the timer for 12 minutes.
  8. Spray your fryer basket with a bit of oil and add the chicken in a single layer. Spray the top lightly with oil. Shake the basket every 3-4 minutes, checking to ensure they aren't burning. It will take a couple of rounds to complete. It will take 10-12 minutes to cook.

Storage

  1. Allow your chicken to cool to room temperature and place into a large ziplock bag. Remove as much air as possible and seal. Place into the freezer.
  2. To reheat, you can use the microwave or your airfryer. Using the reheat setting on 400 it will take around 7-8 minutes. Smaller pieces will heat faster and dry out so be cautious.

Nutrition Information Notes

  1. This recipe calls for 125g of corn chex, 2 eggs, and cooking oil spray. I only included 100g of corn chex, 1 egg, and 3g of oil in the nutrition information for the calorie estimate. I wrote the recipe to have 125g of corn chex and 2 eggs so that you are surely going to have enough to coat each piece. If you need exact nutrition information, you should calculate it yourself.
  2. The serving size for these is of the total recipe, for me that was 12 pieces. Depending on how big or small you cut your chicken, you may have more or less pieces.

Lil Blueberry Pancake Bites

Pancake batter poured into a mini muffin tin and baked to create a similar flavor and texture to pancakes. Bake these, throw them in the freezer, and reheat them whenever you need in the microwave. Serve with a side of maple syrup.

CourseCuisineTime - 20 minutes
Breakfast, SnackAmericanPrep - 10 minutes
Cook - 9 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
28kcal24 bites
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates4.4g73%
Fat0.3g5%
Protein2g33%

Ingredients:

  • 1 cup (100 g) oat flour
  • cup (25 g) tapioca flour corn starch would probably work
  • 1 scoop (30 g) vanilla casein protein powder I use the brand Optimum Nutrition but micellar casein will work
  • cup (130 g) liquid egg whites
  • cup (45 g) frozen blueberries small ones work best
  • 1 tsp (4 g) baking powder
  • 10 tbsp (150 ml) water cup + 2 tbsp

Instructions:

For the Pancake Bites

  1. Preheat your oven to 325F.
  2. In a large bowl, mix together all of the dry ingredients until no clumps remain. It is easiest for later if your bowl has a spout on it, not required however.
  3. NOTE: I'm sure many of you will ask me if you can swap the casein with whey or leave it out all together. No, do not omit the casein and absolutely do not substitute with whey. Your pancake bites will become hockey pucks. A lot of the sweetness comes from the protein powder, do not leave it out. I have attempted this recipe by adding sugar in place of the protein powder and it does not work. The casein adds an airy quality that is not present when only oat flour is used. You can probably use wheat flour and omit the casein but add in some kind of sweetener.
  4. Add in the water, egg whites, and 1 tbsp of blueberries. Mix until incorporated and your batter is pourable.
  5. Spray a mini muffin tin with cooking spray. Make sure to coat all sides of the well.
  6. If your bowl doesn't have a spout you may find it easiest to transfer the batter into a large ziplock bag to use as a piping bag. Cut off the corner to fill each well of your mini muffin tin.
  7. Fill each well about half way with batter. This recipe makes 24 bites. Top each bite with the remaining blueberries.
  8. Bake for 9-10 minutes.

Storage

  1. Once the bites have completely cooled, place them in a ziplock bag and remove as much air as possible. Store in the freezer.
  2. Reheat the bites in the microwave and serve with maple syrup.

Sweet Potato Tortillas

A chewy, stretchy tortilla made from pureed sweet potatoes, tapioca flour, and oat flour. This is a wonderful alternative to flour tortillas if you can't consume any gluten.

CourseCuisineTime - 30 minutes
SnackAmericanPrep - 20 minutes
Cook - 10 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
73kcal10 tortillas
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates16.8g105%
Fat0.3g1%
Protein0.9g5%

Ingredients:

  • cup (175 g) pureed sweet potato
  • cup (100 g) tapioca flour
  • cup (45 g) oat flour
  • 1 tsp (4 g) salt

Instructions:

For the Potato

  1. You need to cook your sweet potato first. Poke holes in the potato with a fork and either roast it or microwave it until it has cooked through and is soft.
  2. Remove the skin and place into a food processor or blender until it is completely smooth.

For the Tortillas

  1. This recipe was developed using metric measurements. I reccomend you do the same if you want the dough to come out correctly. If you use cup measures, you'll likely have to go by feel. Add flour or potatoes until you have a playdo like consistency.
  2. Mix the sweet potato puree, flours, and salt until the dough comes together.
  3. Portion out the dough into 1 oz (ping pong ball size) balls and press into shape with a tortilla press or the bottom of a skillet. It will make 10.
  4. Cook in a dry skillet until it has browned lightly on each side.

Chicken Nuggets

Ground chicken breaded in cornflakes and baked to make the perfect high protein, freezer friendly, and tasty snack.

CourseCuisineTime - 35 minutes
SnackAmericanPrep - 15 minutes
Cook - 20 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
40kcal48 nuggets
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates2.5g41%
Fat1.5g25%
Protein3.9g65%

Ingredients:

  • 2 lb (908 g) ground chicken 92/8
  • 2 tsp (6 g) salt
  • 4 tsp (12 g) garlic powder
  • 2 tsp (4 g) pepper
  • cup (20 g) oat flour any flour works
  • 2 cup (120 g) ground cornflakes ground into breadcrumb like consistency, about 2 cups of whole cornflakes

Instructions:

For the Cornflake Breading

  1. Measure out the cornflakes and place them into a food processor or blender. Blend until you reach a consistency similar to panko breadcrumbs. It may be nice to make a bit extra just in case.

For the Nuggets

  1. Preheat your oven to 400F.
  2. Mix the seasonings and flour into the ground chicken until incorporated.
  3. Pour the cornflake breading into a shallow dish that will allow you to coat the chicken.
  4. Using a small cookie scoop, or about half of a regular sized one, scoop the chicken into balls and place into the cornflakes. I find the easiest way to bread them is to scoop a bit of cornflakes over the top, press the ball down and then cover the remaining edges with cornflakes. Then you can place the nugget into your palm and shape it so that it is symmetrical.
  5. Place the nuggets on a wire rack on top of a sheet pan. If you don't have a wire rack, place them directly on a sheet pan sprayed with oil. The rack will allow for air circulation and lead to a crispier nugget. No worries if you don't have one though, it will still work.
  6. Bake the nuggets for 10 minutes, remove from oven and flip. Bake an additional 10 minutes.

Storage

  1. Once the nuggets have cooled, place them into a large ziplock bag and remove as much air as possible. Label and date the bag and place into the freezer. Reheat in the microwave as desired.

Lil Chocolate Chip Pancake Bites

Pancake batter poured into a mini muffin tin and baked to create a similar flavor and texture to pancakes. Bake these, throw them in the freezer, and reheat them whenever you need in the microwave. Serve with a side of maple syrup.

CourseCuisineTime - 20 minutes
Breakfast, SnackAmericanPrep - 10 minutes
Cook - 9 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
34kcal24 bites
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates4.9g81%
Fat0.7g11%
Protein2g33%

Ingredients:

  • 1 cup (100 g) oat flour
  • cup (25 g) tapioca flour or corn starch
  • 1 scoop (30 g) vanilla casein protein powder I use the brand Optimum Nutrition but micellar casein will work
  • cup (130 g) liquid egg whites
  • 2 tbsp (30 g) mini chocolate chips
  • 1 tsp (4 g) baking powder
  • cups (150 ml) water

Instructions:

For the Pancake Bites

  1. Preheat your oven to 325F.
  2. In a large bowl, mix together all of the dry ingredients until no clumps remain. It is easiest for later if your bowl has a spout on it, not required however.
  3. NOTE: I'm sure many of you will ask me if you can swap the casein with whey or leave it out all together. No, do not omit the casein and absolutely do not substitute with whey. Your pancake bites will become hockey pucks. A lot of the sweetness comes from the protein powder, do not leave it out. I have attempted this recipe by adding sugar in place of the protein powder and it does not work. The casein adds an airy quality that is not present when only oat flour is used. You can probably use wheat flour and omit the casein but add in some kind of sweetener.
  4. Add in the water, egg whites, and 1 tbsp of chocolate chips. Mix until incorporated and your batter is pourable.
  5. Spray a mini muffin tin with cooking spray. Make sure to coat all sides of the well.
  6. If your bowl doesn't have a spout you may find it easiest to transfer the batter into a large ziplock bag to use as a piping bag. Cut off the corner to fill each well of your mini muffin tin.
  7. Fill each well about half way with batter. This recipe makes 24 bites. Top each bite with the remaining chocolate chips.
  8. Bake for 9-10 minutes.

Storage

  1. Once the bites have completely cooled, place them in a ziplock bag and remove as much air as possible. Store in the freezer.
  2. Reheat the bites in the microwave and serve with maple syrup.

Mini Bean and Cheese Tacos

A freezer friendly mini taco made from refried beans, cheddar cheese, and spinach. Adding chopped spinach to the bean mixture makes for an easy way to get in more leafy greens, even if its only a little bit.

CourseCuisineTime - 1 hour 5 minutes
SnackMexicanPrep - 5 minutes
Cook - 1 hour

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
71kcal38 tacos
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates11.1g74%
Fat1.5g10%
Protein3.3g22%

Ingredients:

  • 2 cans (908 g) refried beans
  • 6 oz (170 g) spinach chopped
  • 1 tbsp water
  • 1 tsp (2 g) cumin
  • 1 tsp (5 g) olive oil
  • 38 mini (279 g) corn tortillas I use the brand Mission street taco tortillas. They are 3" in diameter
  • 1 cups (160 g) shredded cheese

Instructions:

For the Filling

  1. Roughly chop the spinach into smaller pieces.
  2. Heat 1 tsp of oil in a skillet over medium heat. Add in the spinach stir for a bit in the oil then drizzle over 1 tbsp of water and cover with a lid for 1 minute to allow the spinach to wilt.
  3. Remove the lid and boil off any excess water then add 1 of cumin and stir.
  4. Add in the canned refried beans, of the cheese, and salt and pepper for flavor. Mix until well combined then remove from the heat.

For the Tacos

  1. Heat a dry skillet over medium to medium high heat. Lay down the tortillas in the skillet and heat until they have softened and are pliable. Flip halfway through.
  2. Spoon the bean and cheese mixture onto each tortilla and top with a bit more cheese, fold to close.
  3. Place the finished tacos on a sheet pan to cool and repeat until all the filling has been used.
  4. If you plan to vacuum seal the tacos, flash freeze the sheet pan of tacos, uncovered in the freezer until solid.

Storage

  1. Place the frozen tacos into your freezer bag, remove all of the air and return to the freezer for storage.
  2. To reheat the tacos, place into a 400F for 3-5 minutes or in the oven if you don't have an air fryer. Microwaving is fine as well.

Honey Mustard Quinoa Bites

A freezer friendly snack that you can make ahead and have available in your freezer for whenever you may need a quick snack. Made from quinoa and egg whites, these are a filling, low calorie option.

CourseCuisineTime - 45 minutes
SnackAmericanPrep - 10 minutes
Cook - 35 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
38kcal24 bites
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates4.6g65%
Fat1g14%
Protein2.7g38%

Ingredients:

  • lb (227 g) ground turkey (93/7)
  • 1 tsp (5 tsp) olive oil
  • 9 tbsp (150 g) egg whites cup + 1 tbsp. I use the liquid egg whites in the carton for ease.
  • 3 tbsp (20 g) oat flour any flour works
  • 1 tbsp (30 g) honey
  • 2 tbsp (40 g) dijon mustard 2 tbsp + 2 tsp
  • 1 tbsp (20 g) plain non fat Greek yogurt 1 tbsp + 1 tsp
  • 1 tsp (5 g) pickle juice vinegar will work too
  • 1 tsp (3 g) salt
  • tsp (2 g) pepper
  • 1 cup (320 g) cooked quinoa

Instructions:

For the Quinoa

  1. Measure out 1 cup of quinoa, you will have a bit extra. (When I make quinoa, I prefer to make a large batch and freeze any extra so that I don't need to cook more every time I want to make this recipe.)
  2. Rinse the quinoa under water until the water runs clear. Do not skip this step as quinoa has a coating called saponin which will result in a bitter, unpleasant flavor if not rinsed off.
  3. Add 1 cup of quinoa and 1 cups of water to a pot. Bring to a boil, then lower the heat to simmer and cover. Cook for 15 minutes, remove from heat to rest for 5 minutes. Uncover and fluff with a fork.

For the Turkey

  1. Heat the olive oil in a skillet over medium high heat. Cook the turkey until it has browned. Cook off any water remaining in the skillet.

For the Quinoa Bite

  1. Preheat your oven to 350F.
  2. Mix the yogurt, honey, mustard, and pickle juice in a large bowl and stir.
  3. Measure out the cooked quinoa and mix all of the ingredients into the bowl until incorporated.
  4. Spray a mini muffin tin with oil and fill each well with the mixture. Bake in the oven for 15-17 minutes. I highly suggest buying a large mini muffin tin. It will help take your snack game to the next level. I use this 48 well Mini Muffin Tin.

Storage

  1. Allow the bites to cool to room temperature and place them into a large ziplock bag. Remove as much air as possible and place in the freezer. You must make sure they have cooled completely as if they are still warm when placed into the bag, steam will be trapped and lead to the formation of ice crystals.

Snickerdoodle Quinoa Bites

A freezer friendly snack that you can make ahead and have available in your freezer for whenever you may need a quick snack. Made from quinoa and egg whites, these are a filling, low calorie option.

CourseCuisineTime - 45 minutes
SnackAmericanPrep - 10 minutes
Cook - 35 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
30kcal24 bites
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates5.2g86%
Fat0.4g6%
Protein1.5g25%

Ingredients:

  • 9 tbsp (150 g) egg whites cup + 1 tbsp. I use the liquid egg whites in the carton for ease.
  • 6 tbsp (40 g) oat flour any flour works
  • 1 cup (320 g) cooked quinoa
  • 1 tsp (4 g) stevia
  • 3 tbsp (20 g) sugar
  • 2 tsp (6 g) cinnamon

Instructions:

For the Quinoa

  1. Measure out 1 cup of quinoa, you will have a bit extra. (When I make quinoa, I prefer to make a large batch and freeze any extra so that I don't need to cook more every time I want to make this recipe.)
  2. Rinse the quinoa under water until the water runs clear. Do not skip this step as quinoa has a coating called saponin which will result in a bitter, unpleasant flavor if not rinsed off.
  3. Add 1 cup of quinoa and 1 cups of water to a pot. Bring to a boil, then lower the heat to simmer and cover. Cook for 15 minutes, remove from heat to rest for 5 minutes. Uncover and fluff with a fork.

For the Quinoa Bite

  1. Preheat your oven to 350F.
  2. Measure out the cooked quinoa and mix all of the ingredients into a large bowl except for the sugar and 1 tsp of the cinnamon until incorporated. Mix the sugar and remaining cinnamon together.
  3. Spray a mini muffin tin with oil and fill each well with the mixture. Top with the cinnamon sugar mixture. Bake in the oven for 15-17 minutes. I highly suggest buying a large mini muffin tin. It will help take your snack game to the next level. I use this 48 well Mini Muffin Tin.

Storage

  1. Allow the bites to cool to room temperature and place them into a large ziplock bag. Remove as much air as possible and place in the freezer. You must make sure they have cooled completely as if they are still warm when placed into the bag, steam will be trapped and lead to the formation of ice crystals.

Peanut Butter Chocolate Chip Quinoa Bites

A freezer friendly snack that you can make ahead and have available in your freezer for whenever you may need a quick snack. Made from quinoa and egg whites, these are a filling, low calorie option.

CourseCuisineTime - 45 minutes
SnackAmericanPrep - 10 minutes
Cook - 35 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
47kcal22 bites
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates5.7g71%
Fat1.9g23%
Protein2.1g26%

Ingredients:

  • 9 tbsp (150 g) egg whites cup + 1 tbsp. I use the liquid egg whites in the carton for ease.
  • 4 tbsp (30 g) oat flour any flour works
  • 1 cup (320 g) cooked quinoa
  • 2 tbsp (30 g) miniature chocolate chips
  • 3 tbsp (48 g) peanut butter
  • 1 tsp (4 g) stevia

Instructions:

For the Quinoa

  1. Measure out 1 cup of quinoa, you will have a bit extra. (When I make quinoa, I prefer to make a large batch and freeze any extra so that I don't need to cook more every time I want to make this recipe.)
  2. Rinse the quinoa under water until the water runs clear. Do not skip this step as quinoa has a coating called saponin which will result in a bitter, unpleasant flavor if not rinsed off.
  3. Add 1 cup of quinoa and 1 cups of water to a pot. Bring to a boil, then lower the heat to simmer and cover. Cook for 15 minutes, remove from heat to rest for 5 minutes. Uncover and fluff with a fork.

For the Quinoa Bite

  1. Preheat your oven to 350F.
  2. Measure out the cooked quinoa and mix all of the ingredients into a large bowl until incorporated. If you'd like to save some of the chocolate chips to go on top, do so.
  3. Spray a mini muffin tin with oil and fill each well with the mixture. Top with chocolate chips if you decided to reserve some of them. Bake in the oven for 15-17 minutes. I highly suggest buying a large mini muffin tin. It will help take your snack game to the next level. I use this 48 well Mini Muffin Tin.

Storage

  1. Allow the bites to cool to room temperature and place them into a large ziplock bag. Remove as much air as possible and place in the freezer. You must make sure they have cooled completely as if they are still warm when placed into the bag, steam will be trapped and lead to the formation of ice crystals.

Sriracha Ranch Quinoa Bites

A freezer friendly snack that you can make ahead and have available in your freezer for whenever you may need a quick snack. Made from quinoa and egg whites, these are a filling, low calorie option.

CourseCuisineTime - 45 minutes
SnackAmericanPrep - 10 minutes
Cook - 35 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
37kcal24 bites
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates3.8g54%
Fat1g14%
Protein3.3g47%

Ingredients:

  • lb (227 g) ground turkey (93/7)
  • 1 tsp (5 tsp) olive oil
  • 9 tbsp (150 g) egg whites cup + 1 tbsp. I use the liquid egg whites in the carton for ease.
  • 2 tbsp (14 g) oat flour any flour works
  • 3 tsp (9 g) ranch dressing seasoning mix
  • 2 tsp (10 g) sriracha
  • 1 tsp (3 g) salt
  • tsp (2 g) pepper
  • 1 cup (320 g) cooked quinoa

Instructions:

For the Quinoa

  1. Measure out 1 cup of quinoa, you will have a bit extra. (When I make quinoa, I prefer to make a large batch and freeze any extra so that I don't need to cook more every time I want to make this recipe.)
  2. Rinse the quinoa under water until the water runs clear. Do not skip this step as quinoa has a coating called saponin which will result in a bitter, unpleasant flavor if not rinsed off.
  3. Add 1 cup of quinoa and 1 cups of water to a pot. Bring to a boil, then lower the heat to simmer and cover. Cook for 15 minutes, remove from heat to rest for 5 minutes. Uncover and fluff with a fork.

For the Turkey

  1. Heat the olive oil in a skillet over medium high heat. Cook the turkey until it has browned. Cook off any water remaining in the skillet.

For the Quinoa Bite

  1. Preheat your oven to 350F.
  2. Measure out the cooked quinoa and mix all of the ingredients into a large bowl until incorporated.
  3. Spray a mini muffin tin with oil and fill each well with the mixture. Bake in the oven for 15-17 minutes. I highly suggest buying a large mini muffin tin. It will help take your snack game to the next level. I use this 48 well Mini Muffin Tin.

Storage

  1. Allow the bites to cool to room temperature and place them into a large ziplock bag. Remove as much air as possible and place in the freezer. You must make sure they have cooled completely as if they are still warm when placed into the bag, steam will be trapped and lead to the formation of ice crystals.

Chili Cheese Quinoa Bites

A freezer friendly snack that you can make ahead and have available in your freezer for whenever you may need a quick snack. Made from quinoa and egg whites, these are a filling, low calorie option.

CourseCuisineTime - 45 minutes
SnackAmericanPrep - 10 minutes
Cook - 35 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
54kcal24 bites
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates5.3g53%
Fat1.8g18%
Protein4.1g41%

Ingredients:

  • lb (227 g) ground turkey (93/7)
  • 2 tsp (5 g) olive oil
  • 1 small (75 g) green pepper
  • small (50 g) onion
  • cup (60 g) tomato paste
  • cup (60 g) tomato sauce
  • 2 tsp (6 g) chili powder
  • tsp (2 g) mustard powder
  • 1 tbsp (15 ml) worcestershire sauce
  • 1 cup (320 g) cooked quinoa
  • 9 tbsp (150 g) egg whites cup + 1 tbsp. I use the liquid egg whites in the carton for ease.
  • cup (56 g) shredded cheddar cheese
  • 4 tbsp (30 g) oat flour any flour works
  • 1 tsp (3 g) salt
  • tsp (2 g) pepper

Instructions:

For the Quinoa

  1. Measure out 1 cup of quinoa, you will have a bit extra. (When I make quinoa, I prefer to make a large batch and freeze any extra so that I don't need to cook more every time I want to make this recipe.)
  2. Rinse the quinoa under water until the water runs clear. Do not skip this step as quinoa has a coating called saponin which will result in a bitter, unpleasant flavor if not rinsed off.
  3. Add 1 cup of quinoa and 1 cups of water to a pot. Bring to a boil, then lower the heat to simmer and cover. Cook for 15 minutes, remove from heat to rest for 5 minutes. Uncover and fluff with a fork.

For the Turkey

  1. Cut the green pepper and onion into a small dice.
  2. Heat 1 tsp of oil in a skillet over medium high heat. Add the green pepper and onion and cook for 3-5 minutes.
  3. Add another tsp of oil and the turkey to the pan and brown. Cook off any water remaining in the skillet.
  4. Add in the tomato sauce, tomato paste, mustard powder, chili powder, and worcestershire sauce. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Stir to incorporate. Cook for 5-7 minutes.

For the Quinoa Bite

  1. Preheat your oven to 350F.
  2. Measure out the cooked quinoa and mix all of the ingredients except for cup of the shredded cheese into a large bowl until incorporated.
  3. Spray a mini muffin tin with oil and fill each well with the mixture. Top with the remaining shredded cheese. Bake in the oven for 15-17 minutes. I highly suggest buying a large mini muffin tin. It will help take your snack game to the next level. I use this 48 well Mini Muffin Tin.

Storage

  1. Allow the bites to cool to room temperature and place them into a large ziplock bag. Remove as much air as possible and place in the freezer. You must make sure they have cooled completely as if they are still warm when placed into the bag, steam will be trapped and lead to the formation of ice crystals.

Taco Quinoa Bites

A freezer friendly snack that you can make ahead and have available in your freezer for whenever you may need a quick snack. Made from quinoa and egg whites, these are a filling, low calorie option.

CourseCuisineTime - 45 minutes
SnackAmericanPrep - 10 minutes
Cook - 35 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
47kcal24 bites
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates4g50%
Fat1.8g22%
Protein3.8g47%

Ingredients:

  • lb (227 g) ground turkey (93/7)
  • 1 tsp (5 g) olive oil
  • cup (60 ml) tomato sauce
  • tsp (2 g) chili powder
  • tsp (2 g) cumin
  • tsp (2 g) garlic powder
  • 1 cup (320 g) cooked quinoa
  • 9 tbsp (150 g) egg whites cup + 1 tbsp. I use the liquid egg whites in the carton for ease.
  • cup (56 g) shredded cheddar cheese
  • 3 tbsp (20 g) oat flour any flour works
  • 1 tsp (3 g) salt
  • tsp (2 g) pepper

Instructions:

For the Quinoa

  1. Measure out 1 cup of quinoa, you will have a bit extra. (When I make quinoa, I prefer to make a large batch and freeze any extra so that I don't need to cook more every time I want to make this recipe.)
  2. Rinse the quinoa under water until the water runs clear. Do not skip this step as quinoa has a coating called saponin which will result in a bitter, unpleasant flavor if not rinsed off.
  3. Add 1 cup of quinoa and 1 cups of water to a pot. Bring to a boil, then lower the heat to simmer and cover. Cook for 15 minutes, remove from heat to rest for 5 minutes. Uncover and fluff with a fork.

For the Turkey

  1. Heat 1 tsp of oil in a skillet over medium high heat. Add the turkey and brown. Cook off any water remaining in the skillet.
  2. Add in the tomato sauce, garlic powder, chili powder, cumin, and season with salt and pepper to taste. Stir to incorporate.

For the Quinoa Bite

  1. Preheat your oven to 350F.
  2. Measure out the cooked quinoa and mix all of the ingredients except for cup of the shredded cheese into a large bowl until incorporated.
  3. Spray a mini muffin tin with oil and fill each well with the mixture. Top with the remaining shredded cheese. Bake in the oven for 15-17 minutes. I highly suggest buying a large mini muffin tin. It will help take your snack game to the next level. I use this 48 well Mini Muffin Tin.

Storage

  1. Allow the bites to cool to room temperature and place them into a large ziplock bag. Remove as much air as possible and place in the freezer. You must make sure they have cooled completely as if they are still warm when placed into the bag, steam will be trapped and lead to the formation of ice crystals.

Buffalo Chicken Quinoa Bites

A freezer friendly snack that you can make ahead and have available in your freezer for whenever you may need a quick snack. Made from quinoa and egg whites, these are a filling, low calorie option.

CourseCuisineTime - 45 minutes
SnackAmericanPrep - 10 minutes
Cook - 35 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
34kcal24 bites
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates3.8g63%
Fat0.6g10%
Protein3.3g54%

Ingredients:

  • lb (227 g) boneless skinless chicken breast use ground chicken or turkey if you do not want to mess with cooking chicken breasts
  • 9 tbsp (150 g) egg whites cup + 1 tbsp. I use the liquid egg whites in the carton for ease.
  • 4 tbsp (30 g) oat flour any flour works
  • cup (60 ml) buffalo sauce
  • 1 tsp (3 g) salt
  • tsp (2 g) pepper
  • 1 cup (320 g) cooked quinoa

Instructions:

For the Quinoa

  1. Measure out 1 cup of quinoa, you will have a bit extra. (When I make quinoa, I prefer to make a large batch and freeze any extra so that I don't need to cook more every time I want to make this recipe.)
  2. Rinse the quinoa under water until the water runs clear. Do not skip this step as quinoa has a coating called saponin which will result in a bitter, unpleasant flavor if not rinsed off.
  3. Add 1 cup of quinoa and 1 cups of water to a pot. Bring to a boil, then lower the heat to simmer and cover. Cook for 15 minutes, remove from heat to rest for 5 minutes. Uncover and fluff with a fork.

For the Chicken

  1. Cook the chicken using your preferred method. It doesn't really matter how this is achieved as it will eventually be chopped into small pieces to fit into the bite sized snack.
  2. Note that ground meats will work just as well if you would prefer to use ground chicken or turkey.

For the Quinoa Bite

  1. Preheat your oven to 350F.
  2. Cut the chicken breast into small pieces (less than " ideally).
  3. Measure out the cooked quinoa and mix all of the ingredients into a large bowl until incorporated.
  4. Spray a mini muffin tin with oil and fill each well with the mixture. Bake in the oven for 15-17 minutes. I highly suggest buying a large mini muffin tin. It will help take your snack game to the next level. I use this 48 well Mini Muffin Tin.

Storage

  1. Allow the bites to cool to room temperature and place them into a large ziplock bag. Remove as much air as possible and place in the freezer. You must make sure they have cooled completely as if they are still warm when placed into the bag, steam will be trapped and lead to the formation of ice crystals.

Cheeseburger Quinoa Bites

A freezer friendly snack that you can make ahead and have available in your freezer for whenever you may need a quick snack. Made from quinoa and egg whites, these are a filling, low calorie option.

CourseCuisineTime - 45 minutes
SnackAmericanPrep - 10 minutes
Cook - 35 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
50kcal24 bites
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates4.1g45%
Fat2g22%
Protein3.8g42%

Ingredients:

  • lb (227 g) ground turkey (93/7)
  • 1 cup (320 g) cooked quinoa
  • 9 tbsp (150 g) egg whites cup + 1 tbsp. I use the liquid egg whites in the carton for ease.
  • 2 tbsp (20 g) oat flour any flour works
  • cup (28 g) shredded cheddar cheese
  • 2 (56 g) pickle spears
  • 2 slices (32 g) cheddar cheese
  • 3 tbsp (50 g) ketchup
  • 1 tsp (3 g) salt
  • tsp (2 g) pepper
  • 1 tsp (5 ml) olive oil

Instructions:

For the Quinoa

  1. Measure out 1 cup of quinoa, you will have a bit extra. (When I make quinoa, I prefer to make a large batch and freeze any extra so that I don't need to cook more every time I want to make this recipe.)
  2. Rinse the quinoa under water until the water runs clear. Do not skip this step as quinoa has a coating called saponin which will result in a bitter, unpleasant flavor if not rinsed off.
  3. Add 1 cup of quinoa and 1 cups of water to a pot. Bring to a boil, then lower the heat to simmer and cover. Cook for 15 minutes, remove from heat to rest for 5 minutes. Uncover and fluff with a fork.

For the Turkey

  1. Heat 1 tsp of olive oil over medium high heat in a skillet. Cook the turkey until it has browned and any water has evaporated.

For the Quinoa Bite

  1. Preheat your oven to 350F.
  2. Cut the pickles into a small dice.
  3. Stack the two cheese slices on top of each other and cut in half until you have small squares to fit on top of each bite. You should end up with 32 pieces.
  4. Measure out the cooked quinoa and mix all of the ingredients except the sliced cheese and ketchup into a large bowl until incorporated.
  5. Spray a mini muffin tin with oil and fill each well with the mixture.
  6. Top each quinoa bite with a squirt of ketchup and place a small cheese square over the top. If you need to be precise with measurements, weigh out the ketchup. If not, just squirt a tiny dollop onto each one, it will be much easier than measuring it out and the difference in calories will be minimal.
  7. Bake in the oven for 15-17 minutes. I highly suggest buying a large mini muffin tin. It will help take your snack game to the next level. I use this 48 well Mini Muffin Tin.

Storage

  1. Allow the bites to cool to room temperature and place them into a large ziplock bag. Remove as much air as possible and place in the freezer. You must make sure they have cooled completely as if they are still warm when placed into the bag, steam will be trapped and lead to the formation of ice crystals.

Teriyaki Quinoa Bites

A freezer friendly snack that you can make ahead and have available in your freezer for whenever you may need a quick snack. Made from quinoa and egg whites, these are a filling, low calorie option.

CourseCuisineTime - 45 minutes
SnackAmericanPrep - 10 minutes
Cook - 35 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
36kcal24 bites
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates4.2g60%
Fat0.6g8%
Protein3.4g48%

Ingredients:

  • lb (227 g) boneless skinless chicken breast use ground chicken or turkey if you don't want to mess with cooking chicken breasts
  • 9 tbsp (150 g) egg whites cup + 1 tbsp. I use the liquid egg whites in the carton for ease.
  • 4 tbsp (30 g) oat flour any flour works
  • cup (60 ml) teriyaki sauce I use the Kikkoman Ginger Teriyaki sauce
  • 1 tsp (3 g) salt
  • tsp (2 g) pepper
  • 1 cup (320 g) cooked quinoa

Instructions:

For the Quinoa

  1. Measure out 1 cup of quinoa, you will have a bit extra. (When I make quinoa, I prefer to make a large batch and freeze any extra so that I don't need to cook more every time I want to make this recipe.)
  2. Rinse the quinoa under water until the water runs clear. Do not skip this step as quinoa has a coating called saponin which will result in a bitter, unpleasant flavor if not rinsed off.
  3. Add 1 cup of quinoa and 1 cups of water to a pot. Bring to a boil, then lower the heat to simmer and cover. Cook for 15 minutes, remove from heat to rest for 5 minutes. Uncover and fluff with a fork.

For the Chicken

  1. Cook the chicken using your preferred method. It doesn't really matter how this is achieved as it will eventually be chopped into small pieces to fit into the bite sized snack.
  2. Note that ground meats will work just as well if you would prefer to use ground chicken or turkey.

For the Quinoa Bite

  1. Preheat your oven to 350F.
  2. Cut the chicken breast into small pieces (less than " ideally).
  3. Measure out the cooked quinoa and mix all of the ingredients into a large bowl until incorporated.
  4. Spray a mini muffin tin with oil and fill each well with the mixture. Bake in the oven for 15-17 minutes. I highly suggest buying a large mini muffin tin. It will help take your snack game to the next level. I use this 48 well Mini Muffin Tin.

Storage

  1. Allow the bites to cool to room temperature and place them into a large ziplock bag. Remove as much air as possible and place in the freezer. You must make sure they have cooled completely as if they are still warm when placed into the bag, steam will be trapped and lead to the formation of ice crystals.

Tomato Soup

Homemade tomato soup made from canned, whole tomatoes, carrots, onion, and celery. This soup can be topped with a gluten free cheddar crouton for a fancy alternative to grilled cheese and tomato soup.

CourseCuisineTime - null
Appetizer, Snack, SoupAmericanPrep - 5 minutes
Cook - 40 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
203kcal3
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates24.7g60%
Fat7.1g17%
Protein10.2g24%

Ingredients:

  • 28 oz (794 g) whole canned San Marzano tomatoes
  • 2 cups (480 ml) chicken stock
  • 2 stalks (100 g) celery
  • 1 (75 g) carrots
  • 1 (200 g) yellow onion
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) garlic
  • 1 tbsp (15 ml) olive oil
  • 3 tbsp (21 g) Parmesan cheese
  • cup (60 g) plain non fat Greek yogurt

Instructions:

  1. Cut the vegetables into a rough chop. Precision doesn't matter here as everything will be blended.
  2. Add the vegetabels to a large pot with garlic and olive oil. Saut for a couple of minutes.
  3. Add in the stock and the canned tomatoes with their juice. Bring to a boil and reduce heat to low. Cook for 30-35 minutes.
  4. Pour the soup and yogurt in a blender and blend until smooth. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
  5. Makes 3 servings. Top with parmesan cheese. Nutrition is per bowl for the soup only. The nutrition information will change depending on if you decide to make the croutons to go on top. The nutrition information for those should be added if you need precision.

For the Crouton

  1. While soup is simmering, you can make the biscuits shown in the picture if you wish. That recipe is called Faux Cheddar Bay Biscuits found at this link -> Faux Cheddar Bay Biscuits. Follow the recpie for the biscuts. To make the crouton, cut the cooked biscuits into 4ths. Bake in a 425F oven for 8-10 minutes until crispy. Shake the pan every few minutes to stir.

Gluten Free Bruschetta

A gluten free version of the classic bread based appetizer. Instead of a baguette, this recipe uses a bread made from oat flour as a vehicle for the tomato and balsamic mixture.

CourseCuisineTime - 40 minutes
Appetizer, SnackItalianPrep - 15 minutes
Cook - 25 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
77kcal8 slices
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates11.3g70%
Fat1.3g8%
Protein4.5g28%

Ingredients:

  • 7/8 cup (80 g) oat flour
  • 1 tsp (4 g) salt
  • 1 tsp (4 g) garlic powder
  • 1/2 tsp (2 g) onion powder
  • 1/2 tsp (2 g) baking soda
  • 1/2 cup (120 g) plain non fat Greek yogurt
  • 1 large (50 g) egg white
  • 2 (120 g) Roma tomatoes
  • 1 tbsp (15 ml) balsamic glaze
  • Basil
  • 2 (56 g) mozzarella string cheese sticks

Instructions:

  1. Preheat oven to 375F.
  2. Mix the dry ingredients together for the bread. Then add in yogurt and egg white. Stir to incorporate.
  3. Put the dough mixture onto an oiled baking sheet or on top of a silpat and form it into a baguette shape. Do your best to recreate the shape.
  4. Bake for 15-17 minutes.
  5. Allow to cool and cut into slices. If you were able to shape it correctly you may be able to cut into cross sections. Your loaf may be a little bit flat if you were unable to shape the raw dough correctly. If this is the case, cut the loaf logitudinally and then into slices.
  6. Turn the oven to 450F and bake the slices for 7-9 minutes or until crisp flipping halfway through. Watch them carefully to ensure they don't burn.
  7. Cut the tomatoes into a small dice removing any seeds and chop the basil and string cheese. Mix together.
  8. Top each piece of bread with tomato mixture and drizzle balsamic glaze.
  9. This will make 8 slices. Nutrition information is for 1 of 8 slices.

Banana Chocolate Chip Muffins

If you have ripe bananas that need to be used up this is a great recipe to reach for. They are high in calories because they contain a lot of peanut butter so you should be aware of your intake but they taste great. If the caloric load isn't something that you are worried about, give them a shot.

CourseCuisineTime - 18 minutes
Dessert, SnackAmericanPrep - 10 minutes
Cook - 8 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
100kcal24 muffins
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates7.5g50%
Fat6.5g43%
Protein2.9g19%

Ingredients:

  • 2 (250 g) ripe, frozen and thawed bananas Non-frozen is fine, frozen bananas are just a bit sweeter
  • 1 cup (256 g) peanut butter
  • 2 eggs
  • 2 Tbsp (42 g) honey
  • 2 tsp (8 ml) vanilla
  • 1/2 tsp (2 g) baking powder
  • 1/4 cup (56 g) chocolate chips

Instructions:

  1. Mix all the ingredients except the chocolate chips in a blender until smooth.
  2. Pour into a mini muffin tin and top with 4 or 5 chocolate chips.
  3. Bake at 400F for 7-8 minutes

Raspberry Dutch Baby

Frozen raspberries and chocolate chips make up the filling of this oven baked pastry. The dough is made from a combination of oat and tapioca flour to provide a gluten free alternative to wheat flour.

CourseCuisineTime - 25 minutes
Dessert, SnackAmericanPrep - 10 minutes
Cook - 15 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
248kcal1
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates32.5g63%
Fat8g15%
Protein11.5g22%

Ingredients:

  • 4 tbsp (20 g) oat flour
  • 2 tsp (4 g) tapioca flour
  • tsp (2 g) baking powder
  • 1 egg
  • tsp (2 g) stevia
  • tsp (2 ml) vanilla
  • cup (60 ml) skim milk
  • cup (35 g) frozen raspberries
  • tbsp (8 g) mini chocolate chips
  • 1 tsp (2 g) powdered sugar

Instructions:

  1. Preheat oven to 425F.
  2. Mix everything except raspberries, chocolate chips, and powdered sugar in a blender.
  3. Spray a 6 cast iron pan with oil and pour in batter. You can add the raspberries and chocolate chips before or after baking. Your call.
  4. Bake for 12-15 minutes or until it has set.

Apple Cinnamon Turnover Bites

An oat base filled with cinnamon apples and baked to form a bite sized apple turnover. These bites are topped with a whey protein and Greek yogurt icing for added sweetness.

CourseCuisineTime - 33 minutes
Dessert, SnackAmericanPrep - 20 minutes
Cook - 13 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
41kcal12 bites
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates6.5g81%
Fat0.4g5%
Protein2.8g35%

Ingredients:

For the Base

  • cup (60 g) oat flour
  • cup (120 g) plain non fat Greek yogurt
  • 3 tbsp (50 g) liquid egg whites
  • 1 (100 g) apple
  • 1 tsp (4 ml) vanilla
  • tsp (2 g) baking soda
  • tsp (2 g) stevia
  • 1 tsp (3 g) cinnamon
  • 2 tsp (10 g) coconut sugar

For the Icing

  • 3 Tbsp (50 g) vanilla Greek yogurt
  • 2 tsp (5 g) vanilla whey protein powder
  • tsp (1 g) stevia
  • 2 tsp (8 ml) water

Instructions:

  1. Preheat oven to 350F.
  2. Cut apple into small dice. Heat a skillet over medium heat & spray with oil. Add apples and sprinkle sugar over top. Saut for a few minutes until soft. Toss in cinnamon.
  3. Mix the dry dough ingredients together then add in yogurt, vanilla, and eggs.
  4. Spray a mini muffin tin with oil. Divide the dough in half. Fill 12 wells using half of the total mixture. Use a spoon to form the dough into the well shape as best you can.
  5. Divide the apple mix between the wells. Add the remaining dough over the top.
  6. Bake for 12-13 minutes.
  7. Mix the icing ingredients and drizzle over the top. Its best to ice them when you eat them and not in advance.

Cinnamon Sugar Bagels

A gluten free alternative to regular wheat containing bagels. These aren't a perfect 1:1 swap but they taste great and have a wonderful texture and chewiness.

CourseCuisineTime - 25 minutes
Dessert, SnackAmericanPrep - 10 minutes
Cook - 15 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
77kcal5 bagels
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates12.9g80%
Fat0.7g4%
Protein4.9g30%

Ingredients:

  • cup (50 g) oat flour
  • 2 tbsp (15 g) tapioca flour
  • 6 tbsp (80 g) liquid egg whites
  • cup (120 g) plain non fat Greek yogurt
  • tsp (2 g) baking soda
  • 2 packets (4 g) stevia
  • 1 tsp (3 g) cinnamon
  • 2 tsp (10 g) sugar

Instructions:

  1. Preheat oven to 350F.
  2. Mix all ingredients in a bowl except cinnamon and sugar.
  3. Fill a donut tin with mixture. Makes 5. Mix half of the sugar and cinnamon together and sprinkle over the top.
  4. Bake 13-15 minutes.
  5. Sprinkle the remaining sugar over the top.
  6. Makes 5. Nutrition is for each bagel. Wait for it to cool before eating. It will be better.

Lower Calorie Apple Crisp

Puffed millet, oats, and apples sweetened with maple syrup and baked to form a perfect after dinner sweet treat.

CourseCuisineTime - 1 hour 5 minutes
Dessert, SnackAmericanPrep - 10 minutes
Cook - 55 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
236kcal4
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates55.6g95%
Fat1.1g1%
Protein2.1g3%

Ingredients:

  • 4 (400 g) apples
  • cup (30 g) tapioca flour (I used tapioca, anything should work)
  • 2 tsp (8 g) cinnamon
  • 5 tbsp (75 g) maple syrup
  • 1 cup (15 g) puffed millet
  • cup (40 g) oats

Instructions:

  1. Preheat oven to 350F
  2. Cut apples into slices or chunks. Cut the skin off if you wish, it doesnt make a difference.
  3. In a large bowl, add the apples, 1 tsp cinnamon, 1 tbsp maple syrup, and 3 tbsp of the flour. Mix thoroughly.
  4. Pour apples into a greased 8x8 pan.
  5. In the bowl, mix the oats, millet, remaining 1 tbsp of flour, and 4 tbsp of maple syrup. Mix and pour over apples.
  6. Bake for 55 minutes or until you can easily insert a knife into the apples.

Superdeluxo Chocolate Spacecake

This recipe is called Superdeluxo Chocolate Spacecake because I don't quite know what to compare it to. It's like nothing else I've had. The best way I can explain the texture and flavor of this loaf is a cheesecake crossbred with a donut.

CourseCuisineTime - 45 minutes
Dessert, SnackAmericanPrep - 10 minutes
Cook - 35 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
138kcal10 slices
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates15g53%
Fat3.9g13%
Protein10.6g37%

Ingredients:

  • 1 cups (340 g) plain non fat Greek yogurt
  • 7/8 cup (80 g) oat flour cup + 2 tbsp
  • cup (30 g) tapioca flour cornstarch works too
  • cup (113 g) unsweetened applesauce
  • 2 scoop (60 g) vanilla casein protein powder
  • 1 tsp (4 ml) vanilla
  • 1 tbsp (10 g) splenda
  • 2 eggs
  • cup (60 g) chocolate chips
  • 2 tsp (8 g) melted butter

Instructions:

  1. Preheat oven to 350F
  2. Sift flours so no clumps remain. Mix the flours together with casein until incorporated.
  3. In a separate bowl mix the vanilla, splenda, applesauce, yogurt, and eggs.
  4. Stir the wet ingredients and dry ingredients together in a large bowl.
  5. Spray an 8x8 or loaf pan with oil. Pour mixture in. Spread it evenly. Bang it against the counter to get as much air out as possible. If you use an 8x8 you may need more chocolate for the topping because of the extra surface area.
  6. Bake for 24 minutes if using an 8x8 or 30-35 minutes if using a loaf pan. Check doneness using when a toothpick inserted comes out clean.
  7. Allow to cool. Once cooled melt the chocolate chips and butter together. Pour over top and allow to harden.
  8. This recipe makes 10 slices.

Funfetti Protein Cake Bites

A low calorie cake bite made from coconut flour, casein protien powder, and egg whites. Sprinkled into the batter is rainbow sprinkles for color and sweetness.

CourseCuisineTime - 33 minutes
Dessert, SnackAmericanPrep - 15 minutes
Cook - 18 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
34kcal7 bites
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates2.8g40%
Fat0.4g5%
Protein5g71%

Ingredients:

  • 3 tbsp (48 g) liquid egg whites (1 egg white)
  • 2 tbsp (15 g) coconut flour
  • 1 scoop (30 g) vanilla casein protein powder
  • tsp (2 g) stevia
  • 3.5 tbsp (50 g) plain non fat Greek yogurt
  • 1 tsp (5 g) rainbow sprinkles
  • 2 tbsp (35 ml) water

Instructions:

  1. Preheat oven to 350F.
  2. Mix the dry ingredients together until incorporated making sure there is no clumping.
  3. Add in the Greek yogurt, egg whites and water. Stir to form dough. Add in sprinkles.
  4. Use a cookie scoop to create balls and place on a greased cookie sheet. If you dont have a scoop make ~1 balls. Makes 7.
  5. Bake for 18-20 minutes.

Crunchy Granola Bars

A crunchy, sweet granola bar made from oats, puffed rice, chocolate chips, and dried cranberries. These bars have protein powder mixed in as well to increase the protein load.

CourseCuisineTime - 40 minutes
Dessert, SnackAmericanPrep - 10 minutes
Cook - 30 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
180kcal24 bars
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates25.7g73%
Fat6.7g19%
Protein4.2g12%

Ingredients:

  • 5 cups (400 g) oats
  • 3 cups (51 g) puffed rice cereal
  • cup (112 g) melted coconut oil
  • 2 scoops (64 g) vanilla whey protein powder
  • 1 cup (240 ml) maple syrup
  • 3 tsp (12 ml) vanilla
  • 1 tsp (3 g) salt
  • cup (60 g) dried cranberries
  • cup (56 g) mini chocolate chips

Instructions:

  1. Preheat oven to 350F
  2. In a large bowl mix the salt, oats, and oil. Pour onto a baking sheet and bake until toasted, about 15 minutes stirring every couple of minutes.
  3. While the oats are baking, stir together the syrup, whey, and vanilla until the whey is dissolved.
  4. Mix the oats, puffed rice, cranberries, and syrup mixture together.
  5. Line a sheet pan with foil and spray with oil. Pour the mixture into the pan and press firmly. Add a layer of wax paper over the top before you press to keep your hands clean. The sheet pan should be a standard size ideally with a lip. If you have a smaller sheet pan youll probably end up with chewy bars.
  6. Bake for 10-15 minutes and remove from oven. Cut into 24 bars while still warm.

Dark Chocolate Drizzled Protein Rice Crispy Treats

Rice crispy treats made from cornstarch and protein powder instead of marshmallows to make these into a high protein treat.

CourseCuisineTime - 10 minutes
Dessert, SnackAmericanPrep - 10 minutes
Cook - null

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
161kcal4 servings
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates20.9g59%
Fat2.8g8%
Protein13.1g37%

Ingredients:

  • 2 cups (66 g) crispy rice cereal
  • 2 scoops (60 g) vanilla whey protein powder
  • 2 tsp (8 g) cornstarch
  • cup (60 ml) water
  • 2 tbsp (30 g) dark chocolate chips

Instructions:

  1. Mix the cornstarch and protein powder together.
  2. Stir in cup of water and vigorously stir until it is completely smooth.
  3. Pour in cereal and stir to coat.
  4. Press into an 8x8 pan.
  5. Melt chocolate and drizzle over the top. I added a bit of liquid to make it a bit less viscous. Allow it to come together and set up.

Strawberries and Cream Crepes

Crepes made using a gluten free flour blend and filled with strawberries and a Greek yogurt cream sauce.

CourseCuisineTime - 30 minutes
Dessert, SnackFrenchPrep - 10 minutes
Cook - 20 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
126kcal4 crepes
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates17.9g68%
Fat2.8g10%
Protein7.4g28%

Ingredients:

For the Crepe

  • cup (74 g) gluten free baking flour
  • cup (60 ml) skim milk
  • cup (60 ml) water
  • tbsp (7 g) butter
  • 1 egg

For the Filling

  • 4-5 (60 g) strawberries
  • cup (57 g) plain non fat Greek yogurt
  • scoop (15 g) vanilla whey protein powder
  • Stevia to taste
  • dusting (1 g) powdered sugar

Instructions:

  1. Mix crepe ingredients in a large bowl. Whisk until smooth. Add more water if its too thick. It should be fairly runny, not like pancake batter.
  2. Heat an 8-inch skillet over medium heat. To form the crepe takes a bit of finesse. Its not hard but if youve never done it before it will take some practice. Pour about cup worth of batter in the center of the pan and tilt the pan in a circular motion to evenly cover the bottom.
  3. Flip when ready and cook the other side. It will take a few minutes on each side.
  4. Mix the protein and stevia to taste into the yogurt and stir vigorously.
  5. Spread a spoonful out on the crepe, fill with strawberries and roll or fold. Top with powdered sugar. Makes 4.

Blueberry Scones

A gluten free alternative to scones. These scones don't use as much fat as normal ones in order to be more calorie friendly so the texture isn't like a traditional scone but they still taste great.

CourseCuisineTime - 32 minutes
Dessert, SnackAmericanPrep - 10 minutes
Cook - 22 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
92kcal8 scones
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates14.5g76%
Fat2.4g12%
Protein3.1g16%

Ingredients:

  • 1 cup (100 g) oat flour
  • cup (150 g) plain non fat Greek yogurt
  • cup (140 g) frozen blueberries
  • 2 tbsp (42 g) honey
  • 1 tbsp (14 g) butter
  • 1 tsp (4 g) stevia
  • 1 tsp (4 g) baking powder
  • tsp (2 g) baking soda

Instructions:

  1. Preheat oven to 375F.
  2. Mix the oat flour, baking powder, and baking soda together in a small bowl.
  3. In a different bowl mix the Greek yogurt, honey, butter, and stevia together.
  4. Slowly stir in the flour and then fold in the blueberries.
  5. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper and spray with oil. Plop the batter down and form it into a circle with a thickness of about 1 inch.
  6. Cut into 8 pieces and spread apart.
  7. Bake for 20-22 minutes or longer if you want it crispier. Top with more honey if desired

Double Chocolate Chewy Cookies

Double chocolate chip cookies made from a base of white kidney beans, flour, and applesauce. These are miniature cookies and have only roughly 27 calories per cookie.

CourseCuisineTime - 24 minutes
Dessert, SnackAmericanPrep - 15 minutes
Cook - 9 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
27kcal24 mini cookies
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates4.7g117%
Fat0.6g15%
Protein0.8g20%

Ingredients:

Wet Ingredients

  • 1 cup (150 g) drained white kidney beans
  • 3 tbsp (45 g) unsweetened applesauce
  • 2 tsp (10 g) stevia
  • 1 tsp (4 ml) vanilla
  • 1 egg

Dry Ingredients

  • cup (75 g) gluten free baking flour
  • 2 tbsp (10 g) cocoa powder
  • tsp (2 g) baking soda
  • Pinch (0.5 g) salt
  • 2 tbsp (28 g) mini chocolate chips

Instructions:

  1. Preheat oven to 350F
  2. Drain the beans and rinse. Dry as well as possible. Use a food processor or a tool to mash the beans into a paste.
  3. In a large bowl, mix the beans, apple sauce, egg, stevia, vanilla, and egg.
  4. In a different bowl mix the dry ingredients.
  5. Slowly add the dry ingredients and half the chocolate chips to the wet ingredients and mix to incorporate.
  6. Spray a baking sheet with oil. Use a small sized cookie scoop to create little balls of dough. Press into cookie shape and top with remaining chips.
  7. Bake at 350F for 8-9 minutes.
  8. Makes 24 cookies.

Chocolate Chip Banana Bread Muffins

Muffins made from oats, Greek yogurt, bananas, and protein powder. These muffins are topped with chocolate chips but you could also do blueberries if you wanted something lower in calories.

CourseCuisineTime - 32 minutes
Dessert, SnackAmericanPrep - 10 minutes
Cook - 22 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
103kcal10 muffins
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates14.3g68%
Fat2.6g12%
Protein5.6g26%

Ingredients:

  • 1 cup (80 g) oats
  • cup (150 g) plain non fat Greek yogurt
  • 2 medium (250 g) total ripe bananas
  • 1 scoop (32 g) whey
  • 1 egg
  • 1 tsp (4 ml) vanilla
  • 1 tsp (4 g) baking powder
  • 1 tsp (4 g) stevia
  • 3 tbsp (45 g) dark chocolate chips

Instructions:

  1. Preheat your oven to 350F.
  2. In a blender, add the oats and pulverize into a flour. Add in the remainder of the ingredients minus the chocolate chips and blend until smooth.
  3. Spray a muffin tin with cooking spray and fill the wells half way with the batter. It will make 10 Muffins.
  4. Top each with some dark chocolate chips
  5. Bake for 20-22 minutes. I think the muffins are better when they sit overnight

Post Workout Weight Gain Chocolate Milkshake

A high protein, high calorie milkshake that would work well for gaining weight. Being in liquid form, this shake is an easy way to get in lots of calories.

CourseCuisineTime - 5 minutes
Dessert, SnackAmericanPrep - 5 minutes
Cook - null

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
614kcal1
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates52g43%
Fat26.3g21%
Protein42.4g35%

Ingredients:

  • 1 scoop (30 g) whey protein
  • 1 cup (240 ml) whole milk
  • 1 medium (125 g) frozen banana
  • 2 tbsp (32 g) peanut butter
  • 2 tbsp (10 g) cocoa powder
  • 6-8 ice cubes

Instructions:

  1. Place all ingredients into a high powered blender and blend until smooth. Adjust the ice as preferred to get a thicker or thinner shake.

Banana Cream Pie Milkshake
