A banana cream pie flavored milkshake made from frozen greek yogurt, a banana, and honey nut cheerios to act as the crust.

CourseCuisineTime - 5 minutes
Dessert, SnackAmericanPrep - 5 minutes
Cook - null

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
408kcal1
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates45.7g46%
Fat1.7g1%
Protein52.5g53%

Ingredients:

  • 1 scoop (32 g) whey protein
  • 1 cup (227 g) plain non fat Greek yogurt frozen
  • 1 packet (2 g) stevia powder
  • 1 medium (100 g) banana
  • cup (9 g) honey nut cheerios
  • cup (120 ml) skim milk

Instructions:

  1. Place 1 cup of Greek yogurt into the freezer.
  2. Mix all of your ingredients except a small handful of the cheerios in a blender and blend until smooth.
  3. Crush the remaining cherrios and top with the crushed cheerios.

Peanut Butter Chocolate Mug Cake

A cake made from protein powder, cocoa powder, and applesauce that is cooked inside of mug and microwaved. If you're in need of a quick sweet treat, this is your recipe.

CourseCuisineTime - 7 minutes
Dessert, SnackAmericanPrep - 5 minutes
Cook - 2 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
351kcal1
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates29.4g39%
Fat9.3g12%
Protein37.3g49%

Ingredients:

  • cup (113 g) unsweetened applesauce
  • 1 scoop (32 g) whey protein
  • 2 tbsp (10 g) cocoa powder
  • 2 tbsp (10 g) powdered peanut butter
  • tsp (1 ml) vanilla
  • 1 egg
  • tsp (2 g) stevia
  • 1 tsp (5 g) rainbow sprinkles

Instructions:

  1. Mix everything in a mug and stir until incorporated.
  2. Microwave 2-2 minutes.

Chocolate Mug Cake

A cake made from protein powder, cocoa powder, and applesauce that is cooked inside of mug and microwaved. If you're in need of a quick sweet treat, this is your recipe.

CourseCuisineTime - 7 minutes
Dessert, SnackAmericanPrep - 5 minutes
Cook - 2 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
268kcal1
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates21.2g37%
Fat6.7g11%
Protein30.8g54%

Ingredients:

  • 1 scoop (30 g) whey protein
  • 2 tbsp (10 g) cocoa powder
  • tsp (2 g) stevia powder
  • 1 egg
  • 1 pinch (0.5 g) salt
  • tsp (1 ml) vanilla
  • cup (113 g) unsweetened applesauce

Instructions:

  1. Mix all of your ingredients in a mug.
  2. Microwave for 2 minutes or until it has set.

Chocolate Chip Cookie Bread

A gluten free, sweet bread recipe made from oat flour and plain greek yogurt. These bites taste similar to a chocolate chip cookie but have texture more similar to bread.

CourseCuisineTime - 27 minutes
Dessert, SnackAmericanPrep - 10 minutes
Cook - 17 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
67kcal11 bites
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates8.7g72%
Fat2.4g20%
Protein2.6g21%

Ingredients:

Dry Ingredients

  • 14 tbsp (80 g) oat flour cup + 2 tbsp
  • tsp (2 g) baking soda
  • tsp (1 g) salt

Wet Ingredients

  • 1 small egg
  • cup (150 g) plain non fat Greek yogurt
  • 1 tsp (5 g) splenda
  • 1 tsp (4 ml) vanilla
  • cup (60 g) chocolate chips

Instructions:

  1. Preheat oven to 375F.
  2. Stir together the dry ingredients and the wet ingredients separately.
  3. Mix the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients.
  4. Use a cookie scoop to make balls. Place on a greased cookie sheet and bake for 15-17 minutes. Makes 11.

Peanut Butter Marshmallow Bites

A quick dessert/snack to make from puffed rice cereal, marshmallows, and honey. Powdered peanut butter is used in place of regular peanut butter to lessen the caloric load.

CourseCuisineTime - 15 minutes
Dessert, SnackAmericanPrep - 10 minutes
Cook - 5 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
41kcal19 bites
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates8.2g91%
Fat0.3g3%
Protein1.3g14%

Ingredients:

  • 3 cups (51 g) puffed rice cereal
  • cup (54 g) powdered peanut butter
  • 3 Tbsp (63 g) honey
  • cup (30 g) mini marshmallows
  • 2 Tbsp (24 g) rainbow sprinkles

Instructions:

  1. In a small sauce pan, melt the honey, marshmallows, and peanut butter together. Mix the powdered peanut butter with the necessary amount of water as instructed on the packaging first.
  2. Pour over the cereal and mix in sprinkles.
  3. Form into balls with a cookie scoop and store in the refrigerator so they firm up. Makes 19.

Chocolate Chip Puffed Rice Cookies

Chocolate chip cookies made from puffed rice instead of flour for volume and applesauce instead of butter to add moisture.

CourseCuisineTime - 20 minutes
Dessert, SnackAmericanPrep - 10 minutes
Cook - 10 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
49kcal11 cookies
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates7.8g86%
Fat1.4g15%
Protein1.2g13%

Ingredients:

Dry Ingredients

  • 2 cups (34 g) puffed rice cereal
  • 6 tbsp (40 g) oat flour
  • 1 tsp (4 g) baking soda
  • tsp (1 g) salt

Wet Ingredients

  • 1 egg
  • cup (113 g) unsweetened applesauce
  • 1 tsp (4 ml) vanilla
  • 2 tsp (10 g) stevia
  • 2 tbsp (28 g) mini chocolate chips

Instructions:

  1. Preheat oven to 325F. Mix dry ingredients and wet ingredients separately. Combine into one bowl with half the chocolate chips.
  2. Allow the dough to rest and hydrate for a few minutes before scooping.
  3. Grease a sheet pan. Using a cookie scoop place the dough onto the pan. Form into cookie shape, top with remaining chocolate chips. I yielded 11 cookies.
  4. Bake 10 minutes.

Mint Chocolate Chip Banana "Ice Cream"

Frozen bananas blended with a bit of milk, protein powder, chocolate chips and mint extract to replicate Mint Chocolate Chip Ice Cream.

CourseCuisineTime - 10 minutes
Dessert, SnackAmericanPrep - 10 minutes
Cook - null

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
209kcal3 servings
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates26g55%
Fat3.6g7%
Protein18.2g38%

Ingredients:

  • 2 medium (250 g) frozen bananas
  • 2 scoops (60 g) whey protein
  • cup (120 ml) whole milk
  • 1 tsp (4 ml) vanilla extract
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) mini chocolate chips
  • 1-2 drops green food coloring
  • 1-2 drops peppermint extract

Instructions:

  1. Add the frozen bananas to a high powered blender in small pieces.
  2. Slowly pour in the milk and start to churn.
  3. Add in the whey, mint, and coloring.
  4. Fold in chocolate chips.
  5. Makes 3 servings.

Chocolate Chip Cookie Bars

These cookie bars are made from beans, casein protein, and oat flour. If you didnt know that there were beans in this recipe I have a hard time believing you could guess what they are made of.

CourseCuisineTime - 35 minutes
Dessert, SnackAmericanPrep - 10 minutes
Cook - 25 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
101kcal10 bars
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates16.2g73%
Fat1.5g6%
Protein5.7g25%

Ingredients:

Wet Ingredients

  • 1 can (425 g) cannellini beans
  • cup (60 ml) maple syrup
  • 1 scoop (32 g) vanilla casein protein powder
  • cup (58 g) unsweetened applesauce

Dry Ingredients

  • cup (20 g) oat flour
  • tsp (2 g) baking soda
  • 1 tsp (4 ml) vanilla
  • 1 (1 ) egg
  • 2 tbsp (30 ml) water
  • 2 tbsp (30 g) mini chocolate chips

Instructions:

  1. Preheat oven to 350F.
  2. Drain and rinse beans.
  3. In a food processor or a blender mix everything but the chocolate chips until smooth.
  4. Spray an 8x8 with oil and pour in the batter. Top with or stir in the chocolate chips.
  5. Bake for 23-25 minutes.
  6. Let it cool completely and cut into 10 bars.

Perfect Chocolate Cream Dream Angel Bake

This version of the Perfect Chocolate Dream Angel Bake incorporates some cream cheese to make a brownie/cheesecake hybrid. It is made by whipping egg whites to create lots of volume.

CourseCuisineTime - 38 minutes
Dessert, SnackAmericanPrep - 15 minutes
Cook - 23 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
172kcal4 servings
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates15.4g40%
Fat3g7%
Protein20.8g54%

Ingredients:

  • 9 tbsp (138 g) liquid egg whites cup + 1 tbsp
  • cup (113 g) unsweetened applesauce
  • 1 scoops (45 g) vanilla casein protein powder
  • 1 tsp (4 ml) vanilla
  • 2 tsp (8 g) stevia
  • tsp (1 g) baking powder
  • 2 tbsp (30 g) mini chocolate chips
  • 3 tbsp (15 g) cocoa powder
  • cup (113 g) plain non fat Greek yogurt
  • cup (113 g) fat free cream cheese
  • 1 tsp (5 g) oat flour

Instructions:

  1. Preheat oven to 300F
  2. Beat the egg whites, vanilla, & baking powder until stiff peaks form.
  3. Add tsp stevia & cocoa powder.
  4. Add in applesauce & casein. Youll lose a lot of the volume here.
  5. Pour of it into a greased 8x8. top with chocolate chips.
  6. Melt cream cheese in microwave. Stir in 1 stevia, yogurt, and oat flour.
  7. Spread a layer of the cream cheese over the brownie. Add the remaining brownie to the top by the spoonful and marble with a knife.
  8. Bake for 20-23 minutes. Let cool before eating if you want it to be solid.

Perfect Chocolate Pudding Dream Angel Bake

This is my favorite dessert recipe I have ever developed. This entire 8x8 pan is only 511 calories. It is made by whipping egg whites to create lots of volume. This is more souffl-like than brownie like but the longer it sits, the more dense it becomes.

CourseCuisineTime - 32 minutes
Dessert, SnackAmericanPrep - 10 minutes
Cook - 22 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
511kcal1
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates60g54%
Fat11.9g10%
Protein40.9g36%

Ingredients:

  • 9 tbsp (138 g) liquid egg whites cup + 1 tbsp
  • cup (113 g) unsweetened applesauce
  • 1 scoop (30 g) casein protein
  • 1 tsp (4 ml) vanilla
  • tsp (2 g) stevia
  • tsp (2 g) baking powder
  • 2 tbsp (30 g) mini chocolate chips
  • 2 tbsp (10 g) cocoa powder
  • 1 pack (92 g) chocolate pudding the snack packs

Instructions:

  1. Preheat oven to 325F.
  2. Beat the egg whites, vanilla, & baking powder until stiff peaks form.
  3. Add stevia & cocoa powder.
  4. Add in applesauce & casein. Youll lose a lot of the volume here, thats okay.
  5. Pour into a greased 8x8. Top with chocolate chips. Swirl in the pudding.
  6. Bake 20-22 minutes.

Perfect Chocolate Dream Angel Bake

This is my favorite dessert recipe I have ever developed. This entire 8x8 pan is only 420 calories. It is made by whipping egg whites to create lots of volume. This is more souffl-like than brownie like but the longer it sits, the more dense it becomes.

CourseCuisineTime - 32 minutes
Dessert, SnackAmericanPrep - 10 minutes
Cook - 22 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
420kcal1
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates42g45%
Fat9.4g10%
Protein41.9g45%

Ingredients:

  • 9 tbsp (138 g) liquid egg whites cup + 1 tbsp
  • cup (113 g) unsweetened applesauce
  • 1 scoop (30 g) casein protein
  • 1 tsp (4 ml) vanilla
  • tsp (2 g) stevia
  • tsp (2 g) cream of tartar use tsp baking powder if you don't have any
  • 2 tbsp (30 g) mini chocolate chips
  • 2 tbsp (10 g) cocoa powder

Instructions:

  1. Preheat oven to 325F.
  2. Beat the egg whites, vanilla, & cream of tartar until stiff peaks form. This is important.
  3. Add stevia & cocoa powder.
  4. Add in applesauce & casein. Youll lose a lot of the volume here, thats okay.
  5. Pour into a greased 8x8. Top with chocolate chips.
  6. Bake 20-22 minutes.

Strawberry Shortcake Cookies

A cookie/shortbread made from casein protein powder and coconut flour and topped with fresh strawberries and a Greek yogurt whipped cream mixture.

CourseCuisineTime - 28 minutes
Dessert, SnackAmericanPrep - 20 minutes
Cook - 8 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
68kcal12 cookies
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates4.9g44%
Fat3.4g30%
Protein4.3g39%

Ingredients:

For the Cookie

  • cup (28 g) coconut flour
  • 2 Tbsp (30 g) coconut oil
  • 1 scoop (30 g) vanilla casein protein powder
  • tsp (2 ml) vanilla
  • tsp (2 g) baking soda
  • 1 tsp (6 g) stevia
  • 1 (1 ) egg

For the Filling

  • 7 tbsp (100 g) plain non fat Greek yogurt cup + 3 tbsp
  • 1/3 scoop (10 g) vanilla whey protein powder
  • tsp (2 g) stevia powder
  • tsp (2 ml) vanilla
  • 14 tbsp (35 g) fat free whipped cream cup + 2 tbsp
  • 5 (200 g) strawberries

Instructions:

  1. Preheat oven to 350F.
  2. Mix the dry cookie ingredients together until incorporated. Mix the wet ingredients separately (melt the oil first).
  3. Combine dry and wet and mix thoroughly.
  4. Split the dough into 12 balls and place on a oiled baking sheet. Press into cookie form. (Note: Youll see in the picture the cookies are in mini muffin shape. I pressed the dough into a mini muffin tin to create wells to hold the filling. It was way too much work do to this so just make regular cookies.)
  5. Bake 7-8 minutes.

For the Filling

  1. For the filling mix everything but the whipped cream in a bowl and mix vigorously. When all of the protein has incorporated, add the whipped cream and fold in gently.
  2. Cut the strawberries into small pieces.
  3. Top each cookie with the filling and strawberries once cooled.

Double Chocolate Chip Muffins

A gluten free, chocolate muffin topped with chocolate chips. These muffins can be made regular sized or as mini muffins if you prefer. They are made from a combination of oat and coconut flour and use Greek yogurt instead of oil.

CourseCuisineTime - 30 minutes
Dessert, SnackAmericanPrep - 10 minutes
Cook - 20 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
106kcal11 muffins
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates15.7g74%
Fat2.7g12%
Protein4.8g22%

Ingredients:

  • cup (50 g) oat flour
  • cup (37 g) coconut flour
  • cup (20 g) cocoa powder
  • 2 eggs
  • 6 Tbsp (92 g) liquid egg whites
  • cup (113 g) plain non fat Greek yogurt
  • 1 medium (125 g) banana
  • 2 Tbsp (42 g) honey
  • 1 tsp (4 g) baking soda
  • 2 tsp (8 g) stevia
  • 3 tbsp (45 g) mini chocolate chips

Instructions:

  1. Preheat oven to 350F.
  2. Mix all of the dry ingredients together to prevent clumping.
  3. In a food processor (by hand is fine) mix the dry ingredients (except chocolate chips) with the wet ingredients until incorporated.
  4. Stir in 2 tbsp of the chocolate chips.
  5. Spray a muffin tin with oil and fill the wells about of the way. Dont use liners, they will stick. Top with remaining chocolate chips. I got 11 regular sized muffins or 24 mini muffins.
  6. Bake for 20 minutes for regular sized or 15 minutes for mini.

Banana Chocolate Protein Frosty

Frozen bananas blended with a bit of milk, protein powder, and cocoa powder to replicate a Chocolate frosty.

CourseCuisineTime - 10 minutes
Dessert, SnackAmericanPrep - 10 minutes
Cook - null

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
195kcal3 servings
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates23.8g55%
Fat2.7g6%
Protein18.9g43%

Ingredients:

  • 2 medium (250 g) frozen bananas
  • 2 scoops (60 g) whey protein
  • 1/2 cup (120 ml) whole milk
  • 2 tbsp (10 g) cocoa powder

Instructions:

  1. Put the frozen bananas in the blender and start churning.
  2. Add the milk slowly until you reach your desired consistency. If your bananas are bigger or smaller you may need more or less liquid.
  3. Add the protein and cocoa powders and mix until incorporated.
  4. Makes 3 servings.

Cheese Pizza Bites

Gluten free Cheese Pizza Bites that are freezer friendly for you to have available to you whenever you need a quick snack.

CourseCuisineTime - 35 minutes
SnackItalian, meal prepPrep - 25 minutes
Cook - 9 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
29kcal24 bites
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates3.7g92%
Fat0.8g20%
Protein1.9g47%

Ingredients:

  • cup (90 g) oat flour
  • 3 tbsp (45 g) liquid egg whites
  • cup (165 g) plain non fat Greek yogurt
  • 1 tsp (4 g) baking powder
  • tsp (2 g) onion powder
  • tsp (2 g) garlic powder
  • tsp (1 g) salt
  • cup (100 g) marinara sauce
  • 5 tbsp (40 g) shredded mozzarella cheese

Instructions:

For the Crust

  1. Preheat your oven to 425F.
  2. In a large bowl, mix the oat flour, egg whites, Greek yogurt, baking powder, salt, onion powder, and garlic powder until combined.
  3. Spray a mini muffin tin with oil. Put a spoonful of dough into 24 wells. Do your best to get the wells filled evenly. I find that a small cookie scoop is easiest but a spoon works as well. With some practice you'll get better at eyeballing the size.
  4. Form the dough into the shape of the well. I find this step easiest if you use a pointy spoon, put the spoon in the center of the dough, and drag the back of the spoon up the sides while applying a little pressure on the well of the muffin tin on all sides. I like to fill all of the wells first, then go through and form the wells, then redistribute any dough as needed to make them more even.
  5. Parbake the dough for 3 minutes.

For the Topping

  1. Measure out the sauce and cheese. (If you're not worried about exact calories, just eyeball it. Your life will be easier.
  2. Top each pizza bite with sauce and cheese over the top. Bake for an additional 6-7 minutes.
  3. Remove from oven and allow to cool.

Storage

  1. Once the bites are at room temperature, add them to a gallon ziplock bag. Label the bag with the name and date and freeze.
  2. To the reheat the pizza bites, microwave them for 1-2 minutes or until thawed based on the power of your microwave.

Smores Pizza Bites

A gluten free pizza bite that is freezer friendly for you to have available to you whenever you need a quick snack.

CourseCuisineTime - 35 minutes
SnackAmerican, meal prepPrep - 25 minutes
Cook - 9 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
29kcal24 bites
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates4.5g90%
Fat0.6g12%
Protein1.4g27%

Ingredients:

  • cup (90 g) oat flour
  • 3 tbsp (45 g) liquid egg whites
  • cup (165 g) plain non fat Greek yogurt
  • 1 tsp (4 g) baking powder
  • tsp (2 g) stevia
  • 2 tbsp (28 g) chocolate chips
  • cup (28 g) mini marshmallows

Instructions:

For the Crust

  1. Preheat your oven to 425F.
  2. In a large bowl, mix the oat flour, egg whites, Greek yogurt, baking powder, and stevia until combined.
  3. Spray a mini muffin tin with oil. Put a spoonful of dough into 24 wells. Do your best to get the wells filled evenly. I find that a small cookie scoop is easiest but a spoon works as well. With some practice you'll get better at eyeballing the size.
  4. Form the dough into the shape of the well. I find this step easiest if you use a pointy spoon, put the spoon in the center of the dough, and drag the back of the spoon up the sides while applying a little pressure on the well of the muffin tin on all sides. I like to fill all of the wells first, then go through and form the wells, then redistribute any dough as needed to make them more even.
  5. Parbake the dough for 3 minutes.

For the Topping

  1. Measure out the marshmallows and chocolate chips. (If you're not worried about exact calories, just eyeball it. Your life will be easier.
  2. Top each pizza bite with the toppings. Bake for an additional 3-5 minutes. Watch them carefully to make sure the marshmallows don't melt and they brown like you want them to.
  3. Remove from oven and allow to cool.

Storage

  1. Once the bites are at room temperature, add them to a gallon ziplock bag. Label the bag with the name and date and freeze.
  2. To the reheat the pizza bites, microwave them for 1-2 minutes or until thawed based on the power of your microwave.

Supreme Pizza Bites

A gluten free pizza bite that is freezer friendly for you to have available to you whenever you need a quick snack.

CourseCuisineTime - 45 minutes
SnackItalian, meal prepPrep - 25 minutes
Cook - 20 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
37kcal24 bites
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates4g57%
Fat1.3g18%
Protein2.4g34%

Ingredients:

  • cup (90 g) oat flour
  • 3 tbsp (45 g) liquid egg whites
  • cup (165 g) plain non fat Greek yogurt
  • 1 tsp (4 g) baking powder
  • tsp (2 g) onion powder
  • tsp (2 g) garlic powder
  • tsp (1 g) salt
  • cup (100 g) marinara sauce
  • 5 tbsp (40 g) shredded mozzarella cheese
  • 2 oz (57 g) turkey sausage Jimmy Dean sells a bag of frozen precooked sausage, I use it for ease.
  • 4 slices (8 g) pepperoni
  • cup (38 g) onion diced
  • cup (38 g) pepper diced

Instructions:

For the Crust

  1. Preheat your oven to 425F.
  2. In a large bowl, mix the oat flour, egg whites, Greek yogurt, baking powder, salt, onion powder, and garlic powder until combined.
  3. Spray a mini muffin tin with oil. Put a spoonful of dough into 24 wells. Do your best to get the wells filled evenly. I find that a small cookie scoop is easiest but a spoon works as well. With some practice you'll get better at eyeballing the size.
  4. Form the dough into the shape of the well. I find this step easiest if you use a pointy spoon, put the spoon in the center of the dough, and drag the back of the spoon up the sides while applying a little pressure on the well of the muffin tin on all sides. I like to fill all of the wells first, then go through and form the wells, then redistribute any dough as needed to make them more even.
  5. Parbake the dough for 3 minutes.

For the Topping

  1. Weigh out the sauce, cheese, onion, peppers, sausage, and pepperoni. Cut the pepperoni into small pieces to fit on top. (If you're not worried about exact calories, just eyeball it. Your life will be easier.)
  2. Top each pizza bite with sauce, then the toppings and cheese over the top. Bake for an additional 6-7 minutes.
  3. Remove from oven and allow to cool.

Storage

  1. Once the bites are at room temperature, add them to a gallon ziplock bag. Label the bag with the name and date and freeze.
  2. To the reheat the pizza bites, microwave them for 1-2 minutes or until thawed based on the power of your microwave.

Pepperoni Pizza Bites

A gluten free pizza bite that is freezer friendly for you to have available to you whenever you need a quick snack.

CourseCuisineTime - 45 minutes
SnackItalian, meal prepPrep - 35 minutes
Cook - 10 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
33kcal48 bites
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates3.5g58%
Fat1.1g18%
Protein2.2g36%

Ingredients:

  • 1 cup (180 g) oat flour
  • 6 tbsp (90 g) liquid egg whites
  • 1 cup (330 g) plain non fat Greek yogurt
  • 2 tsp (8 g) baking powder
  • 1 tsp (4 g) onion powder
  • 1 tsp (4 g) garlic powder
  • tsp (3 g) salt
  • 1 cup (240 g) marinara sauce
  • tbsp (84 g) shredded mozzarella cheese
  • 15 slices (30 g) pepperoni

Instructions:

For the Crust

  1. Preheat your oven to 425F.
  2. In a large bowl, mix the oat flour, egg whites, Greek yogurt, baking powder, salt, onion powder, and garlic powder until combined.
  3. Spray a mini muffin tin with oil. Put a spoonful of dough into 48 wells. Do your best to get the wells filled evenly. I find that a small cookie scoop is easiest but a spoon works as well. With some practice you'll get better at eyeballing the size.
  4. Form the dough into the shape of the well. I find this step easiest if you use a pointy spoon, put the spoon in the center of the dough, and drag the back of the spoon up the sides while applying a little pressure on the well of the muffin tin on all sides. I like to fill all of the wells first, then go through and form the wells, then redistribute any dough as needed to make them more even.
  5. Parbake the dough for 4-6 minutes.

For the Topping

  1. Measure out the sauce and cheese and pepperoni. Cut the pepperoni into small pieces to fit on top. (If you're not worried about exact calories, just eyeball it. Your life will be easier.)
  2. Top each pizza bite with sauce, cheese, then pepperoni over the top. Bake for an additional 6-10 minutes.
  3. Remove from oven and allow to cool.

Storage

  1. Once the bites are at room temperature, add them to a Fresh & Save Bag, label the bag with the name and date and freeze.
  2. To the reheat the pizza bites, air fry or microwave them. I air fry at 400F until they are hot or microwave them for 1-2 minutes or until thawed based on the power of your microwave. Air frying to reheat is my preferred method.

Sausage Pizza Bites

A gluten free pizza bite that is freezer friendly for you to have available to you whenever you need a quick snack.

CourseCuisineTime - 35 minutes
SnackItalian, meal prepPrep - 25 minutes
Cook - 9 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
42kcal24 bites
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates3.3g47%
Fat2g28%
Protein2.7g38%

Ingredients:

  • cup (90 g) oat flour
  • 3 tbsp (45 g) liquid egg whites
  • cup (165 g) plain non fat Greek yogurt
  • 1 tsp (4 g) baking powder
  • tsp (2 g) onion powder
  • tsp (2 g) garlic powder
  • tsp (1 g) salt
  • cup (100 g) marinara sauce
  • 5 tbsp (40 g) shredded mozzarella cheese
  • 4 oz (114 g) sausage

Instructions:

For the Crust

  1. Preheat your oven to 425F.
  2. In a large bowl, mix the oat flour, egg whites, Greek yogurt, baking powder, salt, onion powder, and garlic powder until combined.
  3. Spray a mini muffin tin with oil. Put a spoonful of dough into 24 wells. Do your best to get the wells filled evenly. I find that a small cookie scoop is easiest but a spoon works as well. With some practice you'll get better at eyeballing the size.
  4. Form the dough into the shape of the well. I find this step easiest if you use a pointy spoon, put the spoon in the center of the dough, and drag the back of the spoon up the sides while applying a little pressure on the well of the muffin tin on all sides. I like to fill all of the wells first, then go through and form the wells, then redistribute any dough as needed to make them more even.
  5. Parbake the dough for 3 minutes.

For the Topping

  1. Brown the sausage and break into small pieces.
  2. Measure out the sauce and cheese. (If you're not worried about exact calories, just eyeball it. Your life will be easier.)
  3. Top each pizza bite with sauce, sausage, then cheese over the top. Bake for an additional 6-7 minutes.
  4. Remove from oven and allow to cool.

Storage

  1. Once the bites are at room temperature, add them to a gallon ziplock bag. Label the bag with the name and date and freeze.
  2. To the reheat the pizza bites, microwave them for 1-2 minutes or until thawed based on the power of your microwave. Air frying to reheat is my preferred method.

Cherry Peach Crisp

Cherries and peaches baked underneath a oat crumble sweetened with honey.

CourseCuisineTime - 50 minutes
Dessert, SnackAmericanPrep - 10 minutes
Cook - 40 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
249kcal4 servings
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates40.2g78%
Fat8.2g16%
Protein3.5g6%

Ingredients:

  • 2 (200 g) peaches
  • 1/4 lb (115 g) sweet cherries
  • 3 tbsp (63 g) honey
  • 1 tsp (5 ml) lemon juice
  • 1 tbsp (7.5 g) tapioca flour or cornstarch
  • 11 tbsp (55 g) oats cup + 3 tbsp
  • 1/4 cup (25 g) oat flour
  • 2 tbsp (30 g) coconut oil
  • 1 tsp (4 ml) vanilla
  • 2 tbsp (10 g) fat free whipped cream

Instructions:

  1. Preheat oven to 350F.
  2. Wash and cut your peaches into slices. No need to peel. Pit the cherries and cut in half.
  3. In a large bowl add the peaches, cherries, tapioca flour, 1 tbsp honey, and lemon juice. Mix and allow to macerate while you make the topping.
  4. In a separate bowl mix the oats, oat flour, melted coconut oil, 2 tbsp of honey, and vanilla.
  5. Add the fruit to an 8" cast iron skillet. Top with the oat mixture.
  6. Bake for 35-40 minutes or until the top has browned.
  7. Top with whipped cream if you wish.

PB&J Donuts

A baked, gluten free donut topped with peanut butter and filled with a quick homemade jelly.

CourseCuisineTime - 40 minutes
Dessert, SnackAmericanPrep - 20 minutes
Cook - 20 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
151kcal5 donuts
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates22.4g70%
Fat3.4g10%
Protein7.7g24%

Ingredients:

  • 4/5 cup (80 g) oat flour
  • 1/4 cup (57 g) plain non fat Greek yogurt
  • 1 tsp (4 g) baking powder
  • 1 tsp (4 ml) vanilla
  • 1 tsp (4 g) stevia
  • 2 eggs
  • 2.5 tbsp (20 g) powdered peanut butter
  • 2 tsp (10 g) honey
  • 1.5 tbsp (25 ml) water
  • 1 cup (140 g) sliced frozen strawberries
  • 2 tbsp (30 g) maple syrup

Instructions:

  1. Add the strawberries and syrup to a saucepan and bring to a light boil. Break up the strawberries as it heats.
  2. Allow it to boil and thicken then use an immersion blender/blender to get a smooth texture.
  3. Add it back to the pot and boil to thicken again. Place in the fridge to cool.
  4. Preheat oven to 375F
  5. Mix the oat flour, baking powder, and stevia together until no clumps remain.
  6. Add in the eggs, vanilla, and yogurt. Mix thoroughly.
  7. Add the batter to a plastic bag to pipe into the donut tin.
  8. Divide half the the mixture between 5 wells.
  9. Evenly divide the strawberries between each well.
  10. Top with the remaining donut batter.
  11. Bake for 9-10 minutes.
  12. Allow the donuts to cool completely.
  13. Mix the powdered peanut butter, honey, and water. Top each donut with the frosting.

Maple Peanut Butter Donuts

A baked, gluten free donut recipe topped with a peanut butter and maple syrup glaze for sweetness and flavor.

CourseCuisineTime - null
Dessert, SnackAmericanPrep - 10 minutes
Cook - 9 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
137kcal5 donuts
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates17.8g65%
Fat4.5g16%
Protein6.4g23%

Ingredients:

  • 4/5 cup (80 g) oat flour
  • 1/4 cup (57 g) plain non fat Greek yogurt
  • 1 tsp (4 g) baking powder
  • 1 tsp (4 ml) vanilla
  • 1 tsp (4 g) stevia
  • 2 (2 ) eggs
  • 2 tbsp (30 g) maple syrup
  • 1 tbsp (16 g) peanut butter

Instructions:

  1. Preheat your oven to 375F.
  2. Mix the oat flour, baking powder, and stevia together to remove any clumps.
  3. Add in the eggs, yogurt, and vanilla. Mix thoroughly
  4. Filled a greased donut tin with the batter. It will make 5.
  5. Bake 9 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes away clear.
  6. Mix together the peanut butter and syrup until smooth.
  7. Once the donuts have cooled, top each with the icing.

Mini Pumpkin Muffins

Mini muffins made from pumpkin and oat flour and topped with a cream cheese frosting. The frosting here is made from Greek yogurt and fat free cream cheese but if you wanted them to taste even better you could use the real thing.

CourseCuisineTime - 24 minutes
Dessert, SnackAmerican, meal prepPrep - 15 minutes
Cook - 9 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
45kcal12 muffins
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates6.9g86%
Fat0.9g11%
Protein2.3g28%

Ingredients:

For the Muffins

  • 4/5 cup (80 g) oat flour
  • 1 tsp (4 g) baking powder
  • 1.5 tsp (6 g) stevia
  • 1 egg
  • 3 tbsp (45 g) liquid egg whites
  • 1/3 cup (75 g) canned pumpkin
  • 1.5 tsp (5.5 g) cinnamon
  • 1 tsp (3 g) Pumpkin pie spice

**For the Frosting **

  • 1.5 tbsp (20 g) fat free cream cheese
  • 1.5 tbsp (20 g) plain non fat Greek yogurt
  • 1.5 tbsp (10 g) powdered sugar
  • 8 tbsp (20 g) fat free whipped cream

Instructions:

  1. Preheat your oven to 375F.
  2. Mix the baking powder, cinnamon, pumpkin pie spice, oat flour, and stevia together until combined. Then add the eggs and pumpkin
  3. Fill 12 wells of a mini muffin tin and bake for 8-9 minutes.
  4. Mix the sugar, yogurt, and cream cheese together until smooth. Gently mix in the whipped cream.
  5. Top each muffin with frosting.
  6. Makes 12. Nutrition info is for each muffin.

Pumpkin Donuts

A gluten free, baked donut made from canned pumpkin and oats. These donuts are topped with cinnamon sugar and make for the perfect fall treat.

CourseCuisineTime - 19 minutes
Dessert, SnackAmericanPrep - 10 minutes
Cook - 9 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
132kcal5 donuts
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates19g70%
Fat4.1g15%
Protein4.7g17%

Ingredients:

For the Donut

  • 4/5 cup (80 g) oat flour
  • 1 tsp (4 g) baking powder
  • 1 tsp (4 g) stevia
  • 2 (2 ) eggs
  • 1/4 cup (60 g) canned pumpkin
  • 1/2 tsp (2 ml) vanilla
  • 1 tsp (4 g) cinnamon
  • 1/4 tsp (1 g) Pumpkin pie spice

For the Topping

  • 2 tbsp (25 g) sugar
  • tsp (2 g) cinnamon
  • 2 tsp (7 g) melted butter

Instructions:

  1. Preheat your oven to 375F.
  2. Mix the baking powder, cinnamon, pumpkin pie spice, oat flour, and stevia together until combined. Then add the eggs, vanilla, and pumpkin
  3. Fill 5 wells of a donut tin and bake for 8-9 minutes.
  4. Mix together the sugar and cinnamon in a bowl. Melt the butter in a different bowl.
  5. Dip the donuts in the butter then the sugar mixture to coat. Dont coat them until you eat them FYI. The sugar will dissolve if it sits long enough.

5 Minute Cinnamon Roll Center

A quick dessert that takes about 5 minutes from start to finish and has similar texture and flavor to the center of a cinnamon roll. All it takes is a bit of measuring, mixing, and microwaving.

CourseCuisineTime - null
Dessert, SnackAmericanPrep - 3 minutes
Cook - 2 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
221kcal1
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates26g54%
Fat4.8g10%
Protein18.5g38%

Ingredients:

  • 2 tbsp (12 g) oat flour
  • 2 tbsp (10 g) powdered peanut butter
  • 2 tbsp (10 g) tapioca flour
  • 2 tbsp (35 ml) water
  • 2 tbsp (25 g) liquid egg whites
  • 2 tbsp (12 g) vanilla casein protein powder
  • 1 tsp (4 g) sugar
  • 1 tsp (2 g) cinnamon
  • 1 tsp (3 g) butter

Instructions:

  1. Mix the oat flour, tapioca, PB, 1g cinnamon and casein together. Add in egg whites and water. It will make a dough like consistency.
  2. Spread out the dough in your bowl to even thickness.
  3. Melt butter, stir in 1g cinnamon, and sugar. Stir. If its too thick, add water to thin it out but no more than a few drops at a time.
  4. Pour the cinnamon sugar over the top. Microwave for 90-120 seconds

Chocolate Sprinkle Doughnuts

A homemade, baked, gluten free chocolate doughnut. These take under 20 minutes to cook so they are a perfect option for a weekend breakfast.

CourseCuisineTime - 19 minutes
Dessert, SnackAmericanPrep - 10 minutes
Cook - 9 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
143kcal5 donuts
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates16.2g60%
Fat6.1g22%
Protein5.7g21%

Ingredients:

  • 4/5 cup (80 g) oat flour
  • 1 tsp (4 g) stevia
  • 1 tsp (4 g) baking powder
  • 2 (2 ) eggs
  • 1/4 cup (57 g) plain non fat Greek yogurt
  • 1 tsp (4 ml) vanilla
  • 2 tbsp (30 g) Chocolate chips
  • 1 tsp (5 ml) coconut oil
  • 2 tsp (10 g) rainbow sprinkles

Instructions:

  1. Preheat your oven to 375F.
  2. Mix the oat flour, baking powder, and stevia together to remove any clumps.
  3. Add in the eggs, yogurt, and vanilla. Mix thoroughly
  4. Filled a greased doughnut tin with the batter. It will make 5.
  5. Bake 9 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes away clear.
  6. Melt the chocolate chips and coconut oil together in the microwave. Stir to combine.
  7. Once the doughnuts have cooled, top each with chocolate and sprinkles. Allow the chocolate to harden. I put mine in the freezer to expedite the process.

Microwave Chocolate Chip Cookies

A gluten free cookie recipe made from oat flower and casein protein powder that can be made in the microwave or the oven. It makes 4 cookies, the nutrition information is for all of them.

CourseCuisineTime - 12 minutes
Dessert, SnackAmericanPrep - 10 minutes
Cook - 2 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
288kcal1 servings
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates24.4g46%
Fat14.1g26%
Protein15.9g30%

Ingredients:

  • 2 tbsp (10 g) oat flour
  • 1 tbsp (5 g) coconut flour
  • 2 tbsp (10 g) vanilla casein protein powder
  • 1/4 cup (60 ml) whole milk
  • 2 tbsp (10 g) powdered peanut butter
  • 1.5 tsp (8 g) butter softened. Coconut oil works too
  • 2 tsp (10 g) mini chocolate chips

Instructions:

  1. Mix all of the ingredients together. Save some of the chocolate chips for the top if you want it to look cool.
  2. Microwave for 1-2 minutes or until the center has set. Thats it. Cool. Very easy. It makes 1 Cookie bowl/skillet or 4 cookies. The nutrition information is for the whole recipe.
  3. You can also bake them at 350F for 7-8 minutes if you want them in cookie form as seen above. I think they taste the same whether they have been cooked in the microwave or the oven. If youre going for aesthetics, use the oven. If youre going for time saving, use the microwave.

Single Serve Chocolate Chips Banana Bread

These individual Chocolate Chip Banana Breads are a great way to use up any overripe or frozen bananas. They are gluten free and can be refined sugar free if you use sugar free chocolate chips.

CourseCuisineTime - 33 minutes
Dessert, SnackAmericanPrep - 15 minutes
Cook - 18 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
135kcal9 muffins
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates22.3g76%
Fat3g10%
Protein4.6g15%

Ingredients:

  • 1/2 cup (40 g) old fashioned oats
  • 1/2 cup (120 ml) water
  • 7/8 cup (80 g) oat flour
  • 1 tsp (4 g) baking powder
  • 1/2 tsp (2 g) baking soda
  • 2 (2 ) eggs
  • 2 medium (200 g) frozen and thawed bananas
  • 2 tbsp (42 g) honey
  • 1 scoop (30 g) vanilla casein protein powder
  • 1 tsp (4 ml) vanilla
  • 1/4 cup (60 g) mini chocolate chips

Instructions:

  1. Preheat oven to 350F.
  2. Microwave the ripe frozen bananas to thaw. Frozen bananas are sweeter and more liquidy. Non frozen will work but not as well.
  3. Mix the oats and water and microwave for one minute in a large bowl.
  4. Mix in the banana and stir until it is well incorporated. Allow to cool a bit.
  5. Add in the eggs and stir
  6. In a different bowl mix the oat flour, casein, baking soda, and baking powder until no clumps remain.
  7. Pour into wet ingredients and mix.
  8. Spray a regular sized muffin tin with oil and fill 9 wells.
  9. Bake for 16-18 minutes.

Honey Nut Bars

Almonds, cashews, sunflower, pumpkin, and chia seeds held together with a honey mixture and topped with dark chocolate. A cheaper alternative to store bought counterparts.

CourseCuisineTime - 1 hour 20 minutes
SnackAmerican, meal prepPrep - 1 hour
Cook - 20 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
278kcal14
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates24.6g52%
Fat17.2g36%
Protein6.2g13%

Ingredients:

  • 1 cup (140 g) cashews
  • 1 cup (140 g) almonds
  • cup (90 g) pumpkin seeds
  • cup (33 g) sunflower seeds
  • cup (43 g) chia seeds
  • cup (60 g) dried cranberries
  • 1 Tbsp (16 g) peanut butter
  • cup (168 g) honey
  • 2 Tbsp (32 g) coconut oil
  • 1 Tbsp (20 g) maple syrup
  • 1 tsp (4 ml) vanilla extract
  • 5 Tbsp (75 g) melted dark chocolate
  • Cooking spray

Instructions:

  1. Preheat your oven to 350F.
  2. Add all of the nuts, seeds, and dried fruit to a large bowl. Chop the almonds and cashews before adding if you would prefer smaller pieces.
  3. In a smaller bowl, mix together cup of honey, 2 Tbsp of coconut oil, 1 Tbsp of peanut butter, 1 Tbsp of maple syrup, and 1 tsp of vanilla.
  4. Pour the mixture over the nuts and mix until evenly coated.
  5. In a 13x9 pan or cookie sheet add a lining of parchment paper and spray with oil.
  6. Press the nut mixture into the pan and distribute evenly. Bake for 20 minutes.
  7. Remove from oven and allow to cool for 15 minutes. Then lift out of the pan using the parchment paper and spread 5 Tbsp of melted dark chocolate over the top. Allow to cool in the refrigerator completely.
  8. Once the slab has hardened cut it into 14 bars.
  9. Store the bars in the refrigerator to ensure they stay together.

Po de Queijo - Traditional

Po de queijo is a popular Brazilian treat that is Portuguese for cheese bread. Whats great about these is that they are gluten free so even those who are gluten sensitive can enjoy them!

CourseCuisineTime - 40 minutes 25 minutes
SnackBrazilian, meal prepPrep - 20 minutes 5 minutes
Cook - 20 minutes 20 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
63kcal13
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates7.3g66%
Fat3.2g29%
Protein1.2g10%

Ingredients:

  • 1 cups (180 g) tapioca flour check the health aisles at your store or on Amazon
  • cup (28 g) shredded parmesan cheese
  • 2 tbsp (20 g) shredded mozzarella cheese
  • tsp (2 g) salt
  • cup (60 ml) olive oil
  • cup (144 g) skim milk
  • 1 egg

Instructions:

  1. Preheat your oven to 400F.
  2. Mix all of your ingredients in a blender until the ingredients are homogenized.
  3. Spray two mini muffin tins with oil and fill each well about half way with the batter. It will make about 24 pieces.
  4. Bake for 20 minutes or until golden brown.
  5. These are best after they have rested for a while. The day after is when I prefer to eat them because they become much softer.

Greek Salad

Cucumber, red onion, red pepper, green olives, and feta cheese dressed in an garlic and olive oil dressing. A nice dish to keep in your fridge as a healthy snack.

CourseCuisineTime - 15 minutes
SnackGreek, meal prepPrep - 15 minutes
Cook - null

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
172kcal10
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates6.8g30%
Fat14.9g67%
Protein2.9g13%

Ingredients:

  • 1 large (300 g) cucumber
  • 1 large (200 g) red pepper
  • medium (100 g) red onion
  • 3 (180 g) Roma tomatoes
  • cup (100 g) green olives
  • 4 oz (113 g) feta cheese
  • 2 tsp (10 g) garlic
  • 1 tsp (2 g) oregano
  • cup (60 ml) red wine vinegar
  • cup (120 ml) olive oil
  • tsp (2.5 g) dijon mustard
  • 1 tsp (3 g) salt
  • tsp (1 g) pepper

Instructions:

  1. Cut the cucumber, red pepper, and tomatoes in half and remove all of the seeds. Cut the cucumber, red pepper, and tomatoes into a large dice. Add the cucumber and red pepper to a large bowl.
  2. In a strainer, add the tomatoes and sprinkle with salt. This will encourage the tomatoes to release some of their water.
  3. Cut the red onion into small slices around thick and add to the bowl.
  4. Add the olives to the bowl.
  5. In a smaller bowl, whisk together cup olive oil, red wine vinegar, tsp dijon mustard, 1 tsp oregano, 2 tsp minced garlic and salt and pepper to taste. Pour over the vegetables in the large bowl and add the feta cheese. Toss lightly and allow everything to blend together for 20-30 minutes before eating.
  6. Plating
  7. This recipe makes 10 servings. Divide it evenly 10 ways.

Chicken Kelaguen

This is a Chamorro dish and is a staple in the Mariana Islands. It is a combination of chicken, lemon juice, onions, peppers, and hot sauce and is served cold, making it perfect for a quick snack right out of the fridge.

CourseCuisineTime - 1 hour 20 minutes
SnackAsian, meal prepPrep - 30 minutes
Cook - 1 hour

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
157kcal10
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates2.2g7%
Fat7.9g28%
Protein19.2g68%

Ingredients:

  • 1 (1135 g) broiler chicken 4-5lbs (use 1135g of the pulled meat)
  • 3 (120 g) lemons
  • 1 medium (200 g) sweet onion
  • Salt to taste it will need quite a bit
  • 2 Tbsp (30 g) Tabasco
  • 2 small (15 g) serrano peppers optional
  • 5 (20 g) green onions
  • 1 Tbsp (10 g) olive oil
  • Pepper to taste

Instructions:

  1. Preheat your oven to 400F. In a baking dish place the chicken breast side up. Remove the giblets from the cavity and pat the chicken dry with a paper towel. Drizzle with olive oil and season with salt and pepper. Cook the bird for 1 hour (plus or minus 10 minutes) on a lower middle rack in the oven. Use a meat thermometer to temp the meat and ensure it is around 165F.
  2. Once the chicken has cooked and cooled, tear the meat away from the bones, remove the skin, and dice the chicken into small pieces.
  3. Finley chop the onion, green onion, and serranos into small pieces and set aside.
  4. Spread the chicken out in a shallow dish and add the juice of three lemons, diced sweet onion, serranos, salt, green onion, and hot sauce. Mix everything together and taste, adjust the salt and hot sauce levels to suit your liking.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 10 servings. Divide it evenly 10 ways. My finished product weighed about 1550g so each serving will be around 150g, which is roughly a fist sized amount if you don't have a scale.

Buffalo Chicken Dip

This buffalo chicken dip is best utilized as a snack. You can eat it with carrots/celery/bell peppers or heat it up and eat it by itself.

CourseCuisineTime - 3 hours 20 minutes
SnackAmerican, meal prepPrep - 20 minutes
Cook - 3 hours

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
178kcal10
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates3.7g10%
Fat6.1g16%
Protein27g75%

Ingredients:

  • 2 lbs (908 g) boneless skinless chicken breast
  • 1 cups (339 g) 4% fat cottage cheese
  • 1 cups (341 g) nonfat plain Greek yogurt
  • 6 slices (60 g) bacon cooked
  • 1 cup (118 g) kale chopped
  • 5 Tbsp (75 ml) buffalo sauce
  • Salt and pepper to taste

Instructions:

  1. Add the chicken and 1 cup of water to a crock pot and cook on high for 3 hours or until cooked.
  2. While the chicken is cooking, chop up some kale leaves until you have 1 cups worth. Use a food processor if you have one, you want it small.
  3. Heat a skillet over medium high heat and cook 6 slices of bacon. When the bacon is cooked, remove it from the pan and pat with paper towels. Keep the bacon fat in the pan.
  4. Add the kale to the bacon fat and cook until it has shrunken and is crisp, around 3-5 minutes. CAUTION: Use a lid to shield yourself from splatters when you add the kale. The wet kale can mix with the hot oil and splatter easily.
  5. Drain all the excess fat from the kale. Using the back of a spoon or spatula, try and squeeze out as much grease as possible.
  6. Chop the bacon up into small pieces and set aside with the kale.
  7. Once the chicken has cooked, transfer it into a large bowl and shred thoroughly with two forks. Allow the chicken to cool before mixing in the remaining ingredients. Once it has cooled, mix all of the ingredients together until incorporated.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 10 servings. Divide it evenly 10 ways.

Chicken Salad

This dish is meant to serve as a snack, not a meal. You can keep this in your refrigerator and always have a snack that is quick, easy, and high in protein.

CourseCuisineTime - null
SnackAmerican, meal prepPrep - 10 minutes
Cook - 4 hours

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
249kcal10
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates6.5g15%
Fat13.7g31%
Protein24.8g57%

Ingredients:

  • 2 lbs (1135 g) boneless skinless chicken breast
  • 1 cup (240 ml) chicken broth
  • 1 cup (150 g) red grapes
  • cup (110 g) mayonnaise
  • cup (113 g) plain non fat Greek yogurt
  • 2 Tbsp (30 g) Dijon mustard
  • 1 Tbsp (21 g) honey
  • 2 Tbsp (30 ml) lemon juice
  • cup (50 g) slivered almonds
  • Salt and pepper to taste
  • 3 Tbsp (6 g) parsley chopped (optional)

Instructions:

  1. Place chicken breast in a crockpot with 1 cup of chicken broth and cook on high for 3-4 hours or until cooked through.
  2. Remove the chicken from the crockpot and shred with two forks, allow to cool.
  3. Cut grapes into 4s until you have accumulated 1 cup
  4. In a bowl mix together the cup yogurt, cup mayonnaise, 2 Tbsp lemon juice, and 1 Tbsp honey. Pour over chicken with almonds and grapes and mix thoroughly. Add salt and pepper to taste.

Plating

  1. Divide evenly into 10 snack size portions.

Cauliflower Cheese Sticks

Riced cauliflower baked with eggs and cheese to form a crust, then topped with more cheese. Serve with a side of marinara sauce for dipping.

CourseCuisineTime - 35 minutes
SnackAmericanPrep - 10 minutes
Cook - 25 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
72kcal16 cheese sticks
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates2.4g21%
Fat4.4g40%
Protein5.6g50%

Ingredients:

For the Crust

  • 20 oz (568 g) frozen cauliflower rice I use the brand Birds Eye
  • 2 (2 ) eggs
  • cup (28 g) shredded parmesan cheese
  • cup (28 g) shredded mozzarella and provolone cheese mix
  • 1 Tbsp (6 g) Italian seasoning

For the Topping

  • 1 cup (112 g) shredded mozzarella and provolone cheese mix
  • cup (56 g) shredded parmesan cheese
  • 8 oz (120 ml) can of marinara sauce

Instructions:

  1. Preheat your oven to 400F.
  2. If you use frozen, riced cauliflower, thaw it in the microwave until it is no longer frozen. It doesnt need to be cooked, just thawed.
  3. Using a cheesecloth, squeeze as much water out of the cauliflower as possible. If you dont have a cheesecloth use a thin kitchen towel or paper towels. This step is crucial, get as much water out as you can.
  4. In a large bowl, mix together the cauliflower, 2 beaten eggs, cup parmesan cheese, cup mozzarella and provolone cheese mix, and 1 Tbsp Italian seasoning.
  5. Line a sheet pan with parchment paper and spray with oil. Press the cauliflower mix onto the pan with your hands until it is about of an inch thick. Bake for 15 minutes.
  6. Remove from the oven and add 1 cup of mozzarella and provolone cheese mix and cup shredded parmesan cheese to the top.
  7. Bake for an additional 5-10 minutes until the cheese has browned.
  8. Cut into 1 inch thick slices. It will make around 16 cheese sticks.
  9. Serve with a side of marinara sauce. You can make this fresh if you please, but canned is just fine.

Storage

  1. Keep in the refrigerator for up to 3-4 days. I wouldn't reccommend freezing these.

Chicken Taquitos

A healthier version of one of my childhood favorite snacks. These taquitos are corn tortillas filled with minced chicken. These are great to make a large batch and freeze them for a future snack.

CourseCuisineTime - null
SnackMexicanPrep - 10 minutes
Cook - 35 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
119kcal15
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates11.8g51%
Fat4.1g17%
Protein8.7g37%

Ingredients:

  • 1 lb (454 g) boneless skinless chicken breast
  • 1 cup (240 ml) chicken broth
  • cup (180 ml) tomato sauce
  • 1 tsp (2 g) paprika
  • 1 tsp (2 g) chili powder
  • 1 tsp (2 g) cumin
  • 1 tsp (2 g) garlic powder
  • 1 cup (112 g) shredded cheese
  • Salt and pepper to taste
  • 15 (345 g) corn tortillas
  • Cooking spray

Instructions:

  1. In a crockpot add 1 cup of chicken broth and 1 lb of chicken breast and turn it to high heat.
  2. Cook for 2 hours or until it is easily shreddable and completely cooked.
  3. Preheat your oven to 400F.
  4. Shred the chicken using two forks. Place the shredded chicken into a blender with cup tomato sauce, 1 tsp paprika, 1 tsp chili powder, 1 tsp cumin, 1 tsp garlic powder, and salt and pepper to taste and blend until the meat is a paste like consistency.
  5. Heat your tortillas in the microwave for 20-30 seconds so they are pliable for folding. The fresher the tortillas the better. If you have dry tortillas they will be more likely to crack in the oven.
  6. Add a few spoonfuls of meat to each of your tortillas, sprinkle with cheese and roll. Aim for taquitos with a diameter of about of an inch. Place on a sheet pan seam side down.
  7. You should have enough meat to make around 15-20 taquitos.
  8. Spray the top of the taquitos with cooking spray and bake for 10-12 minutes.

Storage

  1. Keep in the refrigerator for up to 5 days. They will also keep well in the freezer. Put them into a ziplock bag, remove as much air as possible, and label with the date.

Chipotle Stuffed Mushrooms

Baby bella mushrooms stuffed with ground beef and red peppers mixed in chipotle flavored Greek yogurt. A perfect healthy snack for between meals.

CourseCuisineTime - 45 minutes
SnackAmericanPrep - 10 minutes
Cook - 35 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
87kcal15
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates2.2g15%
Fat5.5g39%
Protein7g50%

Ingredients:

  • 1 lb (454 g) ground beef (85/15)
  • 1 lb (454 g) baby bella mushrooms
  • cup (76 g) plain non fat Greek yogurt
  • 1 tsp (5 ml) lime juice
  • 1 (20 g) chipotle pepper in adobo sauce + 2 tsp of the adobo sauce
  • (100 g) sweet onion
  • 1 (100 g) red bell pepper small
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) olive oil
  • 2 Tbsp (14 g) shredded cheese
  • Salt and pepper to taste

For the Sauce Topping

  • 2 Tbsp (28 g) Greek yogurt
  • tsp (2 ml) lime juice
  • Salt and pepper to taste

Instructions:

  1. Preheat oven to 375F
  2. Dice the onion and red pepper.
  3. Heat a skillet over medium high heat and add 1 Tbsp of olive oil. Saut the onion and red pepper for 5 minutes. Add the beef to the skillet and brown.
  4. While the beef is cooking, clean the mushrooms and remove the stems. Use your fingers to remove some of the underside of the cap to create more room for you to stuff the mushroom. You can save the stems to use in other recipes or discard them.
  5. Lightly salt and pepper the inside of the mushrooms.
  6. In a blender, blend cup of Greek yogurt, 1 chipotle pepper + 2 tsp of adobo sauce, 1 tsp lime juice, and a pinch of salt and pepper. Add to the meat mixture once it has browned and mix.
  7. Stuff each mushroom with as much of the beef mixture you can fit on each one. Top with a small pinch of shredded cheese.
  8. Bake for 25 minutes.
  9. While the mushrooms are baking, mix together the ingredients for the sauce. Add the sauce to a ziplock bag and cut a small opening in the corner to pipe the sauce over the mushrooms.

Note

  1. How many mushrooms you make depends entirely on how big or small the ones you buy are. For reference, I made 15 mushrooms but you dont need to be exact. Store any extra meat on the side.

Storage

  1. Store the mushrooms in the refrigerator for no longer than 5 days. If you wish to freeze them, put the mushrooms into a ziplock bag, remove as much air as possible, and label with the date.

Vegetable Latkes

A latke is a jewish food traditionally made using potatoes. In this dish they are made using broccoli slaw, carrots, and zucchini. These are the perfect healthy snack as they are mainly veggies!

CourseCuisineTime - 40 minutes
Snackmeal prepPrep - 10 minutes
Cook - 30 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
93kcal15
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates4.7g33%
Fat6g42%
Protein4.9g35%

Ingredients:

For the Latke

  • 2 cups (227 g) broccoli slaw
  • 1 cup (100 g) shredded carrots
  • 1 (250 ) zucchini
  • 2 (2 ) eggs
  • cup (63 g) almond flour
  • cup (56 g) parmesan cheese
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) olive oil
  • 1 tsp (2 g) garlic powder
  • 1 tsp (2 g) seasoned salt
  • tsp (1 g) pepper

For the Avocado Cream Sauce

  • 1 small (100 g) avocado
  • cup (113 g) plain non fat Greek yogurt
  • 1 tsp (3 g) dill
  • Salt to taste

Instructions:

For the Latke

  1. Start a medium pot of water over high heat and bring to a boil.
  2. Cut your zucchini into small, matchstick sized pieces to match your carrots and broccoli slaw.
  3. Boil the carrots, broccoli slaw, and zucchini for 5 minutes and then strain.
  4. Using paper towels or cheese cloth, get as much water out of the vegetables as you can.
  5. In a large bowl mix together the vegetables, 2 beaten eggs, cup almond flour, cup parmesan cheese, 1 Tbsp olive oil, 1 tsp garlic powder, 1 tsp seasoned salt, and tsp pepper.
  6. Heat a skillet over medium heat. Spray with cooking spray before cooking. Place the mixture into the pan using a cookie scoop and flatten into a pancake shape with your fingers. If you dont have a cookie scoop make balls about the size of about 1-1 in diameter.
  7. Cook for 2-3 minutes on each side.

For the Avocado Cream Sauce

  1. Add the avocado, cup Greek yogurt, 1 tsp dill and salt to a blender and mix until smooth.

Storage

  1. Keep these in the refrigerator for no more than 5 days. If you wish to freeze them, put them into a ziplock bag and remove as much air as possible. Label and date the bag. I would not freeze the yogurt sauce.

Turkey Nuggets

The greatest snack you will ever make, a healthy version of a chicken nugget without any breading. This recipe uses ground turkey but you could just as easily use chicken.

CourseCuisineTime - 35 minutes
SnackAmericanPrep - 15 minutes
Cook - 20 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
42kcal26
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates2.5g35%
Fat2g28%
Protein3.6g51%

Ingredients:

  • 1 lb (454 g) ground turkey or chicken
  • 1 (240 g) sweet potato youll need about 2 cups worth
  • 1 (1 ) egg beaten
  • 3 Tbsp (10 g) green onion
  • 1 (20 g) jalapeo pepper optional
  • 2 tsp (4 g) garlic powder
  • 2 tsp (4 g) seasoned salt
  • 1 tsp (2 g) pepper
  • 3 Tbsp (18 g) almond flour oat or wheat flour will also work
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) olive oil

Instructions:

  1. Preheat your oven to 400F
  2. Wash and peel your potato. Using a food processor or grater, cut your potato into a mince. The food processor works the best here. You want the potato to be in riced form.
  3. Cut your jalapeo into a small dice and saut over medium heat.
  4. While the jalapeo is cooking, wash and cut your green onions into a small dice. Use the whites and greens to until you have 3 Tbsp worth.
  5. In a large bowl, mix all of the ingredients together.
  6. Spray 2 sheet pans with cooking oil.
  7. Divide your meat mixture into nuggets using a cookie scoop. Start with a ball around 1-1 inches in diameter and press into a disc with your fingers.
  8. You want your nuggets to be about 2 inches in diameter and - inch in thickness. They will shrink. I made 24. Depending on how big your cookie scoop is you may have a different yield.
  9. Bake for 10 minutes and then flip and bake an additional 10 minutes.

Storing

  1. Keep the nuggets in the refrigerator for up to 5 days. They will also keep well in the freezer. Put them into a ziplock bag, remove as much air as possible, and label with the date.

Garlic Parmesan Roasted Chickpeas & Edamame

Chickpeas and edamame coated in garlic and parmesan cheese, roasted in the oven to achieve a crispy texture. This snack can help to curb your cravings for a salty treat.

CourseCuisineTime - 25 minutes
SnackAmericanPrep - 5 minutes
Cook - 20 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
113kcal10
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates13g56%
Fat3.3g14%
Protein7.7g33%

Ingredients:

  • 2 cups (300 g) shelled edamame
  • 15 oz (425 g) can of chickpeas
  • 1 tsp (2 g) garlic powder
  • cup (28 g) grated parmesan cheese
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) olive oil
  • Salt and pepper to taste

Instructions:

  1. Preheat your oven to 400F.
  2. Thaw the edamame and drain the liquid from your chickpeas. Pat dry with a few paper towels.
  3. In a large bowl, mix together the edamame, chickpeas, 1 Tbsp olive oil, 1 tsp garlic powder, and cup grated parmesan cheese. Toss to coat.
  4. Bake for 10 minutes and remove from oven to stir. Bake an additional 10 minutes, removing it again to stir after 5 minutes.
  5. This recipe makes 10 servings. Divide the mixture evenly 10 ways.

Baked Falafel

A baked version of the Middle Eastern treat. Falafel is a combination of chickpeas, onion, garlic, parsley, and spices. It is easy to make and dangerously tasty.

CourseCuisineTime - 28 minutes
SnackMiddle EasternPrep - 8 minutes
Cook - 20 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
52kcal14
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates6.1g61%
Fat2.1g21%
Protein2.2g22%

Ingredients:

  • 15 oz (425 g) can of chickpeas
  • cup (20 g) red onion diced
  • 3 cloves (15 g) garlic
  • 1 Tbsp (8 g) cumin
  • 1 tsp (2 g) paprika
  • 2 Tbsp (30 ml) lemon juice
  • cup (30 g) parsley chopped
  • cup (10 g) cilantro
  • 1 Tbsp (15 ml) olive oil
  • tsp (1 g) salt
  • 1 (1 ) egg
  • Cooking spray

Instructions:

  1. Preheat your oven to 375F.
  2. In a food processor or a blender, add all of the ingredients except the cooking spray and pulse until the ingredients have been thoroughly mixed. You dont want this to become a paste, so be careful with how long you blend.
  3. Spray a sheet pan with cooking spray and use a cookie scoop to create 1-2 inch balls from the falafel mix.
  4. Place on the sheet pan and lightly press down on the center to flatten each ball slightly.
  5. Bake for 20 minutes or until the falafel has set and browned.
  6. This recipe makes anywhere between 1015 falafels depending on the size of your scoop. For reference, I made 14.

Sweet Potato Turkey Sliders

Thinly sliced sweet potatoes topped with turkey, cheese, and green onions. This dish works great as a healthy game time snack or a post work/school treat.

CourseCuisineTime - 28 minutes
SnackAmericanPrep - 8 minutes
Cook - 20 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
87kcal15
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates8.8g48%
Fat2.2g12%
Protein8.1g44%

Ingredients:

  • 2 (400 g) sweet potatoes
  • 1 lb (454 g) turkey breast lunchmeat
  • 8 slices (88 g) thinly sliced provolone cheese
  • 2 tsp (5 g) garlic powder
  • cup (15 g) green onions
  • Cooking spray

Instructions:

  1. Preheat your oven to 400F.
  2. Wash and cut your sweet potato into slices, longways.
  3. Spray a sheet pan with cooking spray and spread out the potatoes. Lightly spray the tops of the potatoes with cooking spray as well.
  4. Lightly season with garlic powder.
  5. Bake the potatoes for 10-12 minutes or until the potatoes have softened and have started to brown.
  6. Remove from the oven and top each potato with turkey and a half slice of cheese. Put the pan back in the oven until the cheese has melted and browned.
  7. Remove from oven and top with green onions.
  8. This recipe makes anywhere between 12-18 sliders. For reference, I yielded 15 but it will depend on how big your potatoes/slices are. Divide the total nutrition information for the recipe by the number of sliders you make to get the most accurate nutritional data.

Banana Berry Muffins

A gluten free muffin for you to enjoy as either a breakfast option or a snack. These muffins are made with eggs, bananas, and coconut flour instead of wheat flour.

CourseCuisineTime - 28 minutes
Breakfast, Snackmeal prepPrep - 8 minutes
Cook - 20 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
93kcal9
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates10.8g63%
Fat3.7g21%
Protein4.2g24%

Ingredients:

  • 2 (250 g) ripe bananas frozen and thawed is best
  • 4 (4 ) eggs
  • 1 Tbsp (16 g) peanut butter
  • 1 tsp (4 ml) vanilla
  • 1 tsp (4 g) baking powder
  • cup (37 g) coconut flour
  • 1 cup (140 g) frozen berries

Instructions:

  1. Preheat your oven to 375F
  2. Add all of the ingredients to a blender except the frozen berries. Blend until smooth.
  3. Spray a muffin tin with cooking spray and pour the batter into the wells. It will make around 9 or 10 muffins depending on the size of your bananas.
  4. Top each muffin with the frozen berries.
  5. Bake for 18-20 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into the center of a muffin comes out clean.
  6. This recipe makes 9 muffins.

Chocolate Chip Protein Crescent Rolls

Chocolate Chip Protein Crescent Rolls, a more macro friendly version of the crescent rolls from the tube, these ones are made with a flour mixture and casein protein powder to thicken the dough.

CourseCuisineTime - 25 minutes
DessertAmericanPrep - 20 minutes
Cook - 5 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
296kcal6 rolls
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates40g63%
Fat8g12%
Protein15g23%

Ingredients:

  • 12 g vanilla casein protein powder
  • 20 g oat flour
  • 17.5 g cornstarch
  • 1 g baking powder
  • 40 g milk
  • 15 g egg whites
  • 3 g melted butter
  • 12 g chocolate chips

Instructions:

  1. NOTE: The hydration of this dough is very important. Precise measurements are required. Because of this, I can only recommend making this with metric weights. Get a digital scale.
  2. Mix together the casein, oat flour, cornstarch, baking powder in a bowl until well incorporated.
  3. Add in the egg whites and milk. Mix to form a dough
  4. Place the dough in the fridge/freezer for 10 minutes until it has solidified to a place where it is workable.
  5. Place down two pieces of parchment and spray lightly with oil. Roll the dough into a rectangle about 1/8-1/4 thick.
  6. Clean the edges of the rectangle and make sharp cuts down the sides. Cut the dough into right triangles to form the shapes. Reroll out the scraps and repeat.
  7. Spread melted butter over the top and add the chocolate chips.
  8. Roll the fat end of the triangle over the small end to form the roll.
  9. Place onto a sheet pan/cast iron and bake at 350F for 4-8 minutes. I used the air fryer so it doesnt take as long. The oven will probably take closer to the 8 minute mark. Just watch it and pull them out when browned.
  10. Cream cheese frosting on top is a nice touch as well.

Giant Protein Pancake

A gluten free, high protein pancake made from oat flour and a blend of whey and casein protein.

CourseCuisineTime - 10 minutes
Breakfast, Dessert, SnackAmericanPrep - 5 minutes
Cook - 5 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
283kcal1 Pancake
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates29.2g43%
Fat2.2g3%
Protein36.5g54%

Ingredients:

  • scoop (25 g) vanilla whey/casein blend 50/50 blend. I mix 12.5g of whey and 12.5g of casein together
  • cup (20 g) oat flour
  • 1 tbsp (10 g) tapioca flour or cornstarch
  • 1/4 tsp (1 g) baking powder
  • cup (60 g) liquid egg whites
  • cup (75 g) plain nonfat Greek yogurt
  • 1-2 tbsp (25 g) water

For the Toppings

  • cup (100 g) mixed berries frozen is fine
  • tsp (2 g) splenda optional
  • 1 tbsp (5 g) fat free whipped cream

Instructions:

  1. Mix all the dry ingredients together so no clumps are present. NOTE: I have tested this with only whey protein and it doesn't turn out as well. Only casein will work but you may need more water in the batter. The 50/50 blend is best.
  2. Add in the wet ingredients and mix thoroughly.
  3. Heat a griddle/skillet on medium heat and spray with oil. Add the batter and cook for a couple minutes, then flip.

For the Toppings

  1. If your fruit is frozen, defrost it in the microwave. Sprinkle the splenda over the top and allow it to macerate for a few minutes. This will pull out some of the juices and allow you to use less syrup.
  2. Top your pancake with the fruit and whipped cream.

Macro Friendly Protein Cheesecake

Macro Friendly Protein Cheesecake made from plain nonfat Greek yogurt to yield a higher protein, lower calorie alternative to the classic favorite.

CourseCuisineTime - 3 hours 38 minutes
DessertAmericanPrep - 8 minutes
Cook - 30 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
136kcal8 slices
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates18g54%
Fat0.4g1%
Protein15.6g47%

Ingredients:

For the Filling

  • 3 cups (681 g) plain nonfat Greek yogurt
  • 1 oz (30 g) sugar free vanilla pudding mix
  • 2 tsp (8 g) splenda
  • 13 tbsp (200 g) liquid egg whites cup + 1 tbsp

For the Crust

  • cup (75 g) protein pancake mix (you can probably use cup of any flour with a few grams of splenda and it will be fine)
  • cup (113 g) unsweetened applesauce

For the Topping

  • 1 cups (200 g) frozen fruit
  • 1 cup (64 g) fat free whipped cream
  • tsp (2 g) splenda

Instructions:

For the Crust

  1. Preheat your oven to 350F.
  2. Mix the protein pancake mix and applesauce together until it has combined.
  3. Spray an 8 inch pie pan or springform pan with oil and add the crust mixture to the dish. Using a spoon, spread the mixture around the bottom of the pan (and up the sides of the dish if using pie pan) in an even layer as best as you can.
  4. Parbake for 5-10 minutes or until it is no longer wet to the touch while you prepare the filling. The pie pan will likely be ready quicker as it isn't as thick.

For the Filling

  1. In a large bowl, mix together the yogurt, splenda, pudding mix, and egg whites until incorporated.
  2. Once the crust has parbaked, pour in the filling and smooth out in an even layer.
  3. Bake for 30 minutes. Use a waterbath if you don't want it to crack.
  4. Allow the cheesecake to cool to room temperature and then place it in the fridge to set for at least 3 hours, preferably overnight.

Serving

  1. Thaw out the frozen fruit in the microwave and sprinkle splenda over the top. Mix and allow to macerate for a couple of minutes.
  2. This recipe makes 8 servings. Cut the cheesecake into 8 equal slices and top with frozen fruit and 2 tbsp of whipped cream each.

Pumpkin Cinnamon Rolls

A fall inspired pumpkin cinnamon roll. These are sweet, breadlike, and satisfying while using a combination of rice flour, cornstarch, and vanilla casein protein.

CourseCuisineTime - 32 minutes
Breakfast, DessertAmericanPrep - 20 minutes
Cook - 12 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
77kcal8 small rolls
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates13.3g83%
Fat1.5g9%
Protein2.8g17%

Ingredients:

For the Dough

  • cup (50 g) rice flour
  • 3 tbsp (25 g) tapioca flour
  • scoop (20 g) vanilla casein protein
  • tsp (2 g) baking powder
  • cup (80 g) canned pumpkin
  • 2 tbsp (30 g) liquid egg whites

For the Filling

  • 1 tsp (7 g) butter melted
  • 1 tbsp (20 g) sugar
  • 1 tsp (2 g) cinnamon

For the Frosting

  • 2 tbsp (24 g) whipped cream cheese frosting buy premade, its easier and better

Instructions:

For the Cinnamon Rolls

  1. Preheat your oven to 400F.
  2. Mix the flours, baking powder, and protein powder together until incorporated. Add in the pumpkin and egg whites. Stir until a dough forms.
  3. Spread out two large pieces of wax paper. Spray each side with oil.
  4. Place the dough on the wax paper and cover with the other wax paper. Roll the dough out until it is between " and " thick and in a rectangle. You don't want it so thin that it tears and so thick that it can't roll.
  5. Mix the sugar and cinnamon together and melt the butter.
  6. Spread the butter out over the dough and sprinkle in the cinnamon sugar.
  7. Lift up the bottom layer of wax paper to help roll the dough. The tighter you can get the roll the better.
  8. Once you have rolled the dough, cut it into 8 pieces.
  9. Spray a sheet pan, baking dish, or cast iron skillet with oil. Add the rolls to the pan. In the picture, I used a small cast iron skillet and placed them all together so they were touching. This is a fine way to do it but you will have to cook it longer and I think it prevents the rolls from being as soft as they could be. If you were to place them separately on the sheet pan, it will cook a bit more evenly but if you aren't able to achieve a tight roll, they will tip over. Not a huge issue but something to consider.
  10. Bake for 10-12 minutes if you put them on the pan apart from eachother. Bake for 17-18 minutes if you place them next to eachother.
  11. Spread the frosting over the top of the rolls. Makes 8 small cinnamon rolls.

Apple Fritters

Air fried Apple Fritters made from the pancake mix from the protein pancake recipe. The mix is combined with butter, sugar, apples, and Greek yogurt to form a dough.

CourseCuisineTime - 25 minutes
DessertAmericanPrep - 10 minutes
Cook - 15 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
261kcal2 fritters
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates38g67%
Fat6.6g11%
Protein12.4g22%

Ingredients:

For the Fritter

  • 2 tbsp (11 g) whey protein powder vanilla
  • 2 tbsp (11 g) casein protein powder vanilla
  • 3 tbsp (18 g) oat flour
  • 1 tbsp (9 g) tapioca flour or cornstarch
  • tsp (1 g) baking powder
  • medium (60 g) apple
  • 1 tbsp (14 g) butter
  • cup (50 g) plain nonfat Greek yogurt
  • 1 tsp (4 g) cinnamon
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) brown sugar

For the Frosting

  • 3 tbsp (25 g) powdered sugar
  • 1 tsp (5 ml) milk

Instructions:

For the Fritter

  1. NOTE: If you have the pancake mix from the protein pancakes premade (which you should ) you can measure out 50g of it and use it here.
  2. Mix all of the dry ingredients for the fritter together so no clumps remain.
  3. Cut the butter into small pieces and press it into the flour mixture with a fork until it is incorporated.
  4. Add in the apple and Greek yogurt and mix until completely hydrated.
  5. Cut out two rectangular pieces of parchment paper about 5 inches by 3 inches. Spray lightly with oil.
  6. Divide the dough into two halves and spread out on each piece of parchment.
  7. Preheat your air fryer to 325F on the air fry setting for 15 minutes.
  8. Spray the top of each fritter with oil and add to the air fryer. You could probably bake these but I would guess they will come out more bread like if you do. It may take longer in the oven.
  9. Keep an eye on the fritters and flip them over about half way through or when the top has browned evenly.

For the Frosting

  1. Mix the powdered sugar and milk together.
  2. Top each fritter with frosting.

Protein Pancakes

A gluten free, high protein pancake recipe made from oat flour and a blend of whey and casein protein.

CourseCuisineTime - 10 minutes
Breakfast, Dessert, SnackAmericanPrep - 5 minutes
Cook - 5 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
266kcal4 Pancakes
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates26.7g43%
Fat1.9g3%
Protein35.4g57%

Ingredients:

  • scoop (25 g) vanilla whey/casein blend 50/50 blend. I mix 12.5g of whey and 12.5g of casein together
  • cup (20 g) oat flour
  • 1 tbsp (10 g) tapioca flour or cornstarch
  • 1/4 tsp (1 g) baking powder
  • cup (60 g) liquid egg whites
  • cup (75 g) plain nonfat Greek yogurt
  • 1-2 tbsp (25 g) water

Instructions:

  1. Mix all the dry ingredients together so no clumps are present. NOTE: I have tested this with only whey protein and it doesn't turn out as well. Only casein will work but you may need more water in the batter. The 50/50 blend is best.
  2. Add in the wet ingredients and mix thoroughly.
  3. Heat a griddle/skillet on medium heat and spray with oil. Add the batter and cook for a couple minutes, then flip.

Protein Waffle

A gluten free, high protein waffle made from oat flour and a blend of whey and casein protein.

CourseCuisineTime - 10 minutes
Breakfast, Dessert, SnackAmericanPrep - 5 minutes
Cook - 5 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
183kcal1 Waffle
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates17.9g41%
Fat1.4g3%
Protein25.1g58%

Ingredients:

  • (20 g) scoop vanilla whey/casein blend 50/50 blend
  • 3 tbsp (14 g) oat flour
  • 1 tbsp (6.5 g) tapioca flour
  • tsp (1 g) baking powder
  • 3 tbsp (40 g) liquid egg whites
  • 3 tbsp (50 g) plain nonfat Greek yogurt
  • 1 tbsp (20 g) water

Instructions:

  1. Mix all the dry ingredients together so no clumps are present. NOTE: I have tested this with only whey protein and it doesn't turn out. Only casein will work but you may need more water in the batter. The 50/50 blend is best.
  2. Add in the wet ingredients and mix thoroughly.
  3. Heat an 8 waffle iron on medium heat and spray with oil. Add the batter and cook for a couple minutes.

Raspberry Poptarts

A fun, homemade version of a Raspberry Poptarts made from gluten free flours and homemade raspberry jam. I use the air fryer to cook these but an oven works just as well.

CourseCuisineTime - 38 minutes
Breakfast, DessertAmericanPrep - 30 minutes
Cook - 8 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
196kcal2 poptarts
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates34.5g76%
Fat1.9g4%
Protein10.3g22%

Ingredients:

For the Pastry and Filling

  • cup (30 g) brown rice flour oat flour works as well, just not as pretty
  • cup (30 g) tapioca flour
  • 2 tbsp (16 g) vanilla casein
  • tsp (3 g) butter
  • cup (60 ml) water
  • 2 tbsp (30 g) raspberry jam homemade or jarred

For the Frosting

  • 2 tbsp (30 g) plain nonfat Greek yogurt
  • 1 tsp (5 g) vanilla casein
  • 1 tsp (5 g) powdered sugar
  • 1 tsp (4 g) sprinkles

Instructions:

For the Jam

  1. Make the jam or use pre-made. Its just 280g frozen raspberries, 120ml water, 20g of sugar reduced and a bit of cornstarch to thicken. Bring to a boil and mash then thicken with the cornstarch.

For the Pastry

  1. Mix the flours and casein together. Add in the water and butter. Stir to form dough. Place in the freezer for 10 minutes. Gluten free dough is often sticky so the freezer will help it dry out a bit.
  2. Lay out two sheets of wax paper. Spray lightly with oil. Roll out the dough between the paper to 1/8 thick. Trim the edges to form a rectangle. Cut into 4s.
  3. Place a spoonful or so of jam at the center of two of the squares. Place the empty squares on top and press down the edges with your finger and crimp with a fork. It's easiest to use the wax paper to assist you in the folding and then peel the paper away.
  4. Make a ball with your scraps and cook that as well, it's included in the nutrition information so you might as well cook it.
  5. Preheat an air fryer or oven to 325F. Air fry for 8 minutes. Baking might take a bit longer.

For the Frosting

  1. For the frosting just mix everything together. Place in the fridge for a bit to chill.
  2. Top with frosting and sprinkles.

Chewy Chocolate Chip Cookies

A gluten free, chewy, chocolate chip cookie made from oat flour, a bit of casein protein powder, and pureed sweet potatoes. These cookies are low calorie and have great flavor for a cookie that has no butter or sugar.

CourseCuisineTime - 16 minutes
DessertAmericanPrep - 10 minutes
Cook - 6 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
55kcal12 cookies
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates8.5g77%
Fat1.3g11%
Protein2.4g21%

Ingredients:

  • cup (50 g) oat flour
  • 2 tbsp (20 g) tapioca flour or cornstarch
  • 3 tbsp (16 g) vanilla casein protein powder
  • cup (140 g) mashed sweet potatoes
  • 3 tbsp (50 g) liquid egg whites
  • 2 tbsp (40 g) mini chocolate chips
  • tsp (2 ml) vanilla
  • tsp splenda optional

Instructions:

For the Cookies

  1. Note: I use metric measurements for any baking recipe I develop. I reccomend you buy a scale and do the same.
  2. Preheat your oven to 350F.
  3. Mix the oat flour, tapioca flour, protein powder (and splenda if you're using it) together until it is fully incorporated.
  4. Add in the remaining ingredients and mix until it forms a dough.
  5. Spray a sheet pan with oil and use a cookie scoop to form each cookie. It will make 12.
  6. Wet your fingers and press each cookie into shape, they will not spread in the oven.
  7. Bake for 6-7 minutes. Let the cookies cool before serving.

Homemade Cinnamon Rolls

I have spent 3 years trying to make a gluten free, yeast free, cinnamon roll that had a similar texture and taste to the real thing. These are sweet, breadlike, and satisfying while using a combination of oat flour, corn starch, and vanilla casein protein.

CourseCuisineTime - 40 minutes
Breakfast, DessertAmericanPrep - 30 minutes
Cook - 10 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
324kcal2 rolls
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates49.2g70%
Fat7.9g11%
Protein14.1g20%

Ingredients:

For the Dough

  • cup (40 g) oat flour
  • 5 tbsp (35 g) cornstarch
  • scoop (23 g) vanilla casein protein
  • tsp (2 g) baking powder
  • cup (80 g) milk
  • 2 tbsp (30 g) liquid egg whites

For the Filling

  • 1 tsp (6 g) butter melted
  • 1 tbsp (18 g) sugar
  • 1 tsp (2 g) cinnamon

For the Frosting

  • 2 tbsp (24 g) whipped cream cheese frosting buy premade, its easier and better

Instructions:

Note

  1. This recipe was developed using a digital scale for measurements. They are far more accurate than volumetric measures and I recommend using a scale for this recipe as the hydration of the dough is crucial. If you use volumetric, and find your dough wet or dry you will have to add more liquid or casein as necessary.

For the Cinnamon Rolls

  1. Preheat your oven to 400F. You can also use the air fryer.
  2. Mix the flours, baking powder, and protein powder together until incorporated. Add in the milk and egg whites. Stir until a dough forms. Place in the fridge for 10-15 minutes to help it set up and become less sticky.
  3. Spread out two large pieces of wax paper. Spray each side with oil.
  4. Place the dough on the wax paper and cover with the other wax paper. Roll the dough out until it is " thick and in a rectangle. You don't want it so thin that it tears and so thick that it can't roll.
  5. Mix the sugar and cinnamon together and melt the butter.
  6. Spread the butter out over the dough and sprinkle in the cinnamon sugar.
  7. Cut the dough in half down the center of the rectangle, long ways.
  8. Lift up the bottom layer of wax paper to help roll the dough into a cylinder. Roll one strip first, then place that at the start of the second strip and continue rolling to create one super roll.
  9. Once you have rolled the dough, cut it in half to make 2 rolls.
  10. Spray a sheet pan, baking dish, or cast iron skillet with oil. Add the rolls to the pan.
