  11. Bake for 8-12 minutes in the oven. Watch closely and pull them out when they have just begun to brown on top. If you use the air fryer (how I cook them) it only takes 6 minutes.
  12. Spread the frosting over the top of the rolls. Makes 2 large rolls.

Peanut Butter Cookie Dough Frozen Yogurt

Frozen bananas, Greek yogurt, cookie dough, peanut butter, and maple syrup blended together and frozen to create a refreshing treat that is perfect for summer.

CourseCuisineTime - 1 hour 15 minutes
DessertAmericanPrep - 15 minutes
Cook - null

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
208kcal3 servings
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates35.7g79%
Fat4.2g9%
Protein6.9g15%

Ingredients:

  • 1 medium (125 g) banana frozen, ripe
  • cup (60 g) plain nonfat Greek yogurt
  • 3 tbsp (20 g) powdered peanut butter PB Fit
  • 2 tbsp (28 ml) water
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) sugar free maple syrup

For the Cookie Dough

  • 1 tbsp (12 g) brown sugar
  • 1 tbsp (12 g) sugar
  • 1 tsp (8 g) butter softened
  • 2 tsp (10 ml) water
  • 5 tbsp (35 g) oat flour
  • 1 tbsp (10 g) tapioca flour
  • 1 tsp (6 g) mini chocolate chips
  • 2 drops vanilla

Instructions:

For the Cookie Dough

  1. Cream together the brown sugar, sugar, and butter.
  2. Mix in the water and vanilla then the flours and chips. Stir together until a dough forms.

For the Frozen Yogurt

  1. Place the frozen bananas, PB2 mixture, yogurt, and syrup into a food processor. Blend until smooth.
  2. Place the mixture in to a shallow baking dish. Break up the cookie dough and mix in. Spread evenly. Place in the freezer for an hour or so until it has set.

Serving

  1. This recipe makes 3 servings. It is best to eat it fresh although it can be kept, covered, in the freezer.

Blueberry Frozen Yogurt

Frozen bananas, Greek yogurt, blueberries, and maple syrup blended together and frozen into a low calorie refreshing treat that is perfect for summer.

CourseCuisineTime - 1 hour 10 minutes
DessertAmericanPrep - 10 minutes
Cook - null

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
92kcal3 servings
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates19.7g93%
Fat0.3g1%
Protein2.6g12%

Ingredients:

  • 1 medium (125 g) banana frozen
  • 1 cup (125 g) blueberries frozen
  • cup (60 g) plain nonfat Greek yogurt
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) maple syrup

Instructions:

For the Frozen Yogurt

  1. Place the frozen bananas, blueberries, yogurt, and syrup into a food processor. Blend until smooth.
  2. Place the mixture in to a shallow baking dish and spread evenly. Place in the freezer for an hour or so until it has set.

Serving

  1. This recipe makes 3 servings. It is best to eat it fresh although it can be kept, covered, in the freezer.

5 Minute Carrot Cake

A gluten free, lower calorie Carrot Cake made in the microwave. This cake uses applesauce instead of oil and oat flour instead of wheat flour. I use whipped cream cheese frosting but you can also make a lower calorie version from fat free cream cheese and Greek yogurt.

CourseCuisineTime - 5 minutes
DessertAmericanPrep - 3 minutes
Cook - 2 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
242kcal1 cake
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates36g67%
Fat6g11%
Protein11g20%

Ingredients:

Dry Ingredients

  • 2 tbsp (10 g) oat flour
  • 1 tbsp (8 g) vanilla protein powder
  • tsp (1 g) cinnamon
  • tsp (.5 g) ginger
  • tsp (.5 g) nutmeg
  • 1 tsp (1 g) baking powder
  • 2 tbsp (30 g) egg whites
  • tsp (2 ml) vanilla
  • 2 tbsp (25 g) grated carrots
  • 2 tbsp (35 g) unsweetened applesauce
  • 2 tsp (8 g) brown sugar

For the Frosting

  • 2 tbsp (24 g) whipped Cream Cheese Frosting

Instructions:

  1. Wash a carrot and shred or grate using a box grater or microplane.
  2. Squeeze the carrots with a paper towel to get some of the water out.
  3. In a mug, mix the applesauce, egg whites, and vanilla together. Then mix in the whey, baking powder and spices individually and stir vigorously. You want to make sure these are well dissolved.
  4. Mix in the flour and sugar and stir. Add in the carrots last.
  5. Microwave for 2-2.5 minutes and remove from mug onto a plate.
  6. Let it cool to room temperature before eating or frosting.

Monster Cookie Skillet

A combination of sweet potato puree, a combination of flours, and M&Ms mixed together and baked in a cast iron skillet to make a lower calorie, satisfying cookie alternative.

CourseCuisineTime - 19 minutes
DessertAmericanPrep - 5 minutes
Cook - 14 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
411kcal1
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates72.3g79%
Fat8.3g9%
Protein11.8g12%

Ingredients:

Wet Ingredients

  • cup (55 g) unsweetened applesauce
  • 3 tbsp (50 g) sweet potato puree
  • 3 tbsp (50 g) egg whites
  • tsp (2 ml) vanilla

Dry Ingredients

  • cup (37 g) oat flour
  • 1 heaping tbsp (10 g) tapioca flour any starch works
  • 1 tbsp (7.5 g) coconut flour
  • tsp (.5 g) baking soda
  • 1 tsp (3 g) stevia
  • 2 tbsp (25 g) M&M's

Instructions:

  1. You first need to cook your sweet potato. You can either roast this in the oven or poke a few holes in it with a fork and microwave it. After it has cooked, peel it and and puree it in a blender or food processor until it is smooth.
  2. Preheat your oven to 375. Note that when I develop these recipes I use metric measurements. I reccomend you do the same for accuracy.
  3. Mix all of the wet ingredients together in a bowl. Mix all of the dry ingredeints, except for the M&M's in a separate bowl.
  4. Combine the wet and dry ingredients and mix in the M&M's.
  5. Spray a 6-inch cast iron skillet (any baking dish works but cast iron is cooler ) with oil and add in the mixture. Spread it evenly in the skillet.
  6. Bake for 12-14 minutes or until it has cooked through in the center. You can use a thermometer if you wish. You know it's done when it is at least 170F.

Carrot Cake Cupcakes

A gluten free, lower calorie Carrot Cake Cupcake. These cupcakes use applesauce instead of oil and oat flour instead of wheat flour. I use regular cream cheese frosting but you can also make a lower calorie version from fat free cream cheese and Greek yogurt.

CourseCuisineTime - 40 minutes
DessertAmericanPrep - 20 minutes
Cook - 20 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
202kcal14 muffins
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates30.9g73%
Fat6g14%
Protein6.2g14%

Ingredients:

Dry Ingredients

  • 1 cups (150 g) oat flour
  • 1/3 cup (50 g) tapioca flour or corn starch
  • 2 small scoops (50 g) vanilla whey protein powder
  • 2 tsp (6 g) cinnamon
  • 1 tsp (3 g) ginger
  • 1 tsp (3 g) nutmeg
  • 3 tsp (12 g) baking powder

Wet Ingredients

  • 4 eggs
  • 2 tsp (8 ml) vanilla
  • 1/2 lb (227 g) grated carrots
  • 1 cup (226 g) unsweetened applesauce
  • 1/4 cup (48 g) brown sugar

For the Frosting

  • 1 cup (280 g) Cream Cheese Frosting

Instructions:

  1. Preheat your oven to 350F.
  2. Wash 3-4 large carrots and shred using a grater. The smallest shredding option you have is best, not grated though. Squeeze the carrots with a paper towel to get some of the water out.
  3. In a large bowl, mix (sift if you can) together the dry ingredients.
  4. NOTE: You can probably sub the oat and tapioca flour for an equal amount of wheat flour but I have never tested it. Any protein powder should also work.
  5. In a separate bowl mix together the wet ingredients. Make sure all of the egg whites have incorporated.
  6. Combine the wet ingredients and the dry ingredients until incorporated.
  7. Prepare a muffin tin. Use muffin liners or don't, it doesnt matter. Spray before you fill though regardless of if you use the liners or not. Fill each well - full. Makes 14 cupcakes.
  8. NOTE: I know 14 is an awkward number as most muffin tins have 12 but that is just the way the recipe came out. You could probably distribute between the wells and make the cupcakes bigger. You could also microwave the remaining batter to eat while you wait for the others to bake.
  9. Bake for 20 minutes at 350F or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.
  10. Allow to cool and then top each with 20g of frosting.

Chocolate Fudge Brownies

A soft and fudgey brownie made without any butter or oil and sweetened by maple syrup. Chocolate chips are mixed into the batter and sprinkled on top to add an even more chocolatey layer.

CourseCuisineTime - 17 minutes
DessertAmericanPrep - 7 minutes
Cook - 10 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
270kcal4
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates47.9g82%
Fat6.2g10%
Protein5.6g9%

Ingredients:

  • cup (67 g) oat flour Just put oats in a food processor or blender
  • 2 tbsp (16 g) tapioca flour any starch should do the job
  • cup (20 g) cocoa powder
  • tsp (1 g) baking soda
  • cup (113 g) unsweetened applesauce
  • 1 egg yolk
  • cup (60 g) maple syrup
  • 1 tsp (4 ml) vanilla
  • 3 tbsp (45 g) chocolate chips
  • 1 tsp (4 g) splenda

Instructions:

  1. Preheat your oven to 325F.
  2. Mix the oat flour, tapioca flour, cocoa powder, and baking soda together until no clumps remain.
  3. In a separate bowl, mix the vanilla, egg yolk, syrup, and apple sauce.
  4. Combine the wet and dry ingredients and add in of the chocolate chips.
  5. Spray an 8x8 baking pan with oil and add the mixture. Top with the remaining chocolate chips and bake for 10 minutes.
  6. This recipe makes 4 servings.

Chocolate Chip Cookie Skillet

A whole grain, gluten free, chocolate chip cookie skillet that takes less than 15 minutes to make. You can make this recipe to create a dense, chewy cookie ore a fluffier one to fit your preferences simply by omitting or adding a touch of baking soda.

CourseCuisineTime - 15 minutes 15 minutes
DessertAmericanPrep - 7 minutes 7 minutes
Cook - 8 minutes 12 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
238kcal4 servings
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates39g75%
Fat6g11%
Protein7g13%

Ingredients:

Dry Ingredients

  • cup (75 g) oat flour I just put rolled oats in the blender
  • 2 tbsp (20 g) tapioca flour 2 tbsp + 2 tsp
  • 2 tbsp (20 g) powdered peanut butter optional
  • tsp (2 g) baking soda

Wet Ingredients

  • cup (113 g) unsweetened applesauce
  • 1 tsp (4 ml) vanilla extract
  • 1 egg yolk
  • cup (60 g) maple syrup
  • 3 tbsp (45 g) chocolate chips

Instructions:

  1. Preheat your oven to 325F.
  2. Mix your dry ingredients in a bowl and stir until no clumps remain.
  3. Mix your wet ingredients separately. Combine the wet and dry ingredients together and stir to incorporate.
  4. Add in 2 tbsp of chocolate chips to the batter
  5. Spray an 8x8 pan or an 8" cast iron skillet with oil. Add the batter and spread to fill the container. Top with the remaining chocolate chips.
  6. Bake for 12-13 minutes or unitl it has set in the center.
  7. This recipe makes 4 servings. The nutrition information is for of the entire pan.

Chocolate Frosted Mini Brownies

These brownie bites are made using Greek yogurt instead of butter so they have a denser, more cakey texture than traditional brownies. These bites work awesome as a remedy to cure your sweet tooth.

CourseCuisineTime - 22 minutes
DessertAmericanPrep - 10 minutes
Cook - 12 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
76kcal16 bites
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates12.7g84%
Fat1.8g12%
Protein2.4g16%

Ingredients:

  • cup (115 g) plain non fat Greek yogurt
  • cup (100 g) sugar
  • cup (60 g) cocoa powder
  • 2 eggs
  • cup (50 g) oat flour
  • 1 tbsp (10 g) cornstarch
  • 1 tsp (4 ml) vanilla
  • 2 tbsp (30 ml) milk
  • 2 tbsp (28 g) chocolate chips

Instructions:

  1. Preheat your oven to 350F.
  2. Mix the eggs, yogurt, vanilla, and sugar together.
  3. Stir in the oat flour, cornstarch, and cocoa powder. Add approximately 1 tbsp of milk to thin out the batter.
  4. Spray a mini muffin tin with oil. Fill 16 wells with the batter. Bake for 12 minutes.
  5. Melt the chocolate chips in the microwave. Slowly add in milk to decrease the viscosity. It may be nice to add in more Chocolate than youll need just so frosting is easier.
  6. Top each brownie with frosting once they have cooled to room temperature.

Banana Chocolate Chip Muffins

If you have ripe bananas that need to be used up this is a great recipe to reach for. They are high in calories because they contain a lot of peanut butter so you should be aware of your intake but they taste great. If the caloric load isn't something that you are worried about, give them a shot.

CourseCuisineTime - 18 minutes
Dessert, SnackAmericanPrep - 10 minutes
Cook - 8 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
100kcal24 muffins
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates7.5g50%
Fat6.5g43%
Protein2.9g19%

Ingredients:

  • 2 (250 g) ripe, frozen and thawed bananas Non-frozen is fine, frozen bananas are just a bit sweeter
  • 1 cup (256 g) peanut butter
  • 2 eggs
  • 2 Tbsp (42 g) honey
  • 2 tsp (8 ml) vanilla
  • 1/2 tsp (2 g) baking powder
  • 1/4 cup (56 g) chocolate chips

Instructions:

  1. Mix all the ingredients except the chocolate chips in a blender until smooth.
  2. Pour into a mini muffin tin and top with 4 or 5 chocolate chips.
  3. Bake at 400F for 7-8 minutes

Raspberry Dutch Baby

Frozen raspberries and chocolate chips make up the filling of this oven baked pastry. The dough is made from a combination of oat and tapioca flour to provide a gluten free alternative to wheat flour.

CourseCuisineTime - 25 minutes
Dessert, SnackAmericanPrep - 10 minutes
Cook - 15 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
248kcal1
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates32.5g63%
Fat8g15%
Protein11.5g22%

Ingredients:

  • 4 tbsp (20 g) oat flour
  • 2 tsp (4 g) tapioca flour
  • tsp (2 g) baking powder
  • 1 egg
  • tsp (2 g) stevia
  • tsp (2 ml) vanilla
  • cup (60 ml) skim milk
  • cup (35 g) frozen raspberries
  • tbsp (8 g) mini chocolate chips
  • 1 tsp (2 g) powdered sugar

Instructions:

  1. Preheat oven to 425F.
  2. Mix everything except raspberries, chocolate chips, and powdered sugar in a blender.
  3. Spray a 6 cast iron pan with oil and pour in batter. You can add the raspberries and chocolate chips before or after baking. Your call.
  4. Bake for 12-15 minutes or until it has set.

Apple Cinnamon Turnover Bites

An oat base filled with cinnamon apples and baked to form a bite sized apple turnover. These bites are topped with a whey protein and Greek yogurt icing for added sweetness.

CourseCuisineTime - 33 minutes
Dessert, SnackAmericanPrep - 20 minutes
Cook - 13 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
41kcal12 bites
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates6.5g81%
Fat0.4g5%
Protein2.8g35%

Ingredients:

For the Base

  • cup (60 g) oat flour
  • cup (120 g) plain non fat Greek yogurt
  • 3 tbsp (50 g) liquid egg whites
  • 1 (100 g) apple
  • 1 tsp (4 ml) vanilla
  • tsp (2 g) baking soda
  • tsp (2 g) stevia
  • 1 tsp (3 g) cinnamon
  • 2 tsp (10 g) coconut sugar

For the Icing

  • 3 Tbsp (50 g) vanilla Greek yogurt
  • 2 tsp (5 g) vanilla whey protein powder
  • tsp (1 g) stevia
  • 2 tsp (8 ml) water

Instructions:

  1. Preheat oven to 350F.
  2. Cut apple into small dice. Heat a skillet over medium heat & spray with oil. Add apples and sprinkle sugar over top. Saut for a few minutes until soft. Toss in cinnamon.
  3. Mix the dry dough ingredients together then add in yogurt, vanilla, and eggs.
  4. Spray a mini muffin tin with oil. Divide the dough in half. Fill 12 wells using half of the total mixture. Use a spoon to form the dough into the well shape as best you can.
  5. Divide the apple mix between the wells. Add the remaining dough over the top.
  6. Bake for 12-13 minutes.
  7. Mix the icing ingredients and drizzle over the top. Its best to ice them when you eat them and not in advance.

Cinnamon Sugar Bagels

A gluten free alternative to regular wheat containing bagels. These aren't a perfect 1:1 swap but they taste great and have a wonderful texture and chewiness.

CourseCuisineTime - 25 minutes
Dessert, SnackAmericanPrep - 10 minutes
Cook - 15 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
77kcal5 bagels
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates12.9g80%
Fat0.7g4%
Protein4.9g30%

Ingredients:

  • cup (50 g) oat flour
  • 2 tbsp (15 g) tapioca flour
  • 6 tbsp (80 g) liquid egg whites
  • cup (120 g) plain non fat Greek yogurt
  • tsp (2 g) baking soda
  • 2 packets (4 g) stevia
  • 1 tsp (3 g) cinnamon
  • 2 tsp (10 g) sugar

Instructions:

  1. Preheat oven to 350F.
  2. Mix all ingredients in a bowl except cinnamon and sugar.
  3. Fill a donut tin with mixture. Makes 5. Mix half of the sugar and cinnamon together and sprinkle over the top.
  4. Bake 13-15 minutes.
  5. Sprinkle the remaining sugar over the top.
  6. Makes 5. Nutrition is for each bagel. Wait for it to cool before eating. It will be better.

Lower Calorie Apple Crisp

Puffed millet, oats, and apples sweetened with maple syrup and baked to form a perfect after dinner sweet treat.

CourseCuisineTime - 1 hour 5 minutes
Dessert, SnackAmericanPrep - 10 minutes
Cook - 55 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
236kcal4
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates55.6g95%
Fat1.1g1%
Protein2.1g3%

Ingredients:

  • 4 (400 g) apples
  • cup (30 g) tapioca flour (I used tapioca, anything should work)
  • 2 tsp (8 g) cinnamon
  • 5 tbsp (75 g) maple syrup
  • 1 cup (15 g) puffed millet
  • cup (40 g) oats

Instructions:

  1. Preheat oven to 350F
  2. Cut apples into slices or chunks. Cut the skin off if you wish, it doesnt make a difference.
  3. In a large bowl, add the apples, 1 tsp cinnamon, 1 tbsp maple syrup, and 3 tbsp of the flour. Mix thoroughly.
  4. Pour apples into a greased 8x8 pan.
  5. In the bowl, mix the oats, millet, remaining 1 tbsp of flour, and 4 tbsp of maple syrup. Mix and pour over apples.
  6. Bake for 55 minutes or until you can easily insert a knife into the apples.

Superdeluxo Chocolate Spacecake

This recipe is called Superdeluxo Chocolate Spacecake because I don't quite know what to compare it to. It's like nothing else I've had. The best way I can explain the texture and flavor of this loaf is a cheesecake crossbred with a donut.

CourseCuisineTime - 45 minutes
Dessert, SnackAmericanPrep - 10 minutes
Cook - 35 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
138kcal10 slices
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates15g53%
Fat3.9g13%
Protein10.6g37%

Ingredients:

  • 1 cups (340 g) plain non fat Greek yogurt
  • 7/8 cup (80 g) oat flour cup + 2 tbsp
  • cup (30 g) tapioca flour cornstarch works too
  • cup (113 g) unsweetened applesauce
  • 2 scoop (60 g) vanilla casein protein powder
  • 1 tsp (4 ml) vanilla
  • 1 tbsp (10 g) splenda
  • 2 eggs
  • cup (60 g) chocolate chips
  • 2 tsp (8 g) melted butter

Instructions:

  1. Preheat oven to 350F
  2. Sift flours so no clumps remain. Mix the flours together with casein until incorporated.
  3. In a separate bowl mix the vanilla, splenda, applesauce, yogurt, and eggs.
  4. Stir the wet ingredients and dry ingredients together in a large bowl.
  5. Spray an 8x8 or loaf pan with oil. Pour mixture in. Spread it evenly. Bang it against the counter to get as much air out as possible. If you use an 8x8 you may need more chocolate for the topping because of the extra surface area.
  6. Bake for 24 minutes if using an 8x8 or 30-35 minutes if using a loaf pan. Check doneness using when a toothpick inserted comes out clean.
  7. Allow to cool. Once cooled melt the chocolate chips and butter together. Pour over top and allow to harden.
  8. This recipe makes 10 slices.

Funfetti Protein Cake Bites

A low calorie cake bite made from coconut flour, casein protien powder, and egg whites. Sprinkled into the batter is rainbow sprinkles for color and sweetness.

CourseCuisineTime - 33 minutes
Dessert, SnackAmericanPrep - 15 minutes
Cook - 18 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
34kcal7 bites
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates2.8g40%
Fat0.4g5%
Protein5g71%

Ingredients:

  • 3 tbsp (48 g) liquid egg whites (1 egg white)
  • 2 tbsp (15 g) coconut flour
  • 1 scoop (30 g) vanilla casein protein powder
  • tsp (2 g) stevia
  • 3.5 tbsp (50 g) plain non fat Greek yogurt
  • 1 tsp (5 g) rainbow sprinkles
  • 2 tbsp (35 ml) water

Instructions:

  1. Preheat oven to 350F.
  2. Mix the dry ingredients together until incorporated making sure there is no clumping.
  3. Add in the Greek yogurt, egg whites and water. Stir to form dough. Add in sprinkles.
  4. Use a cookie scoop to create balls and place on a greased cookie sheet. If you dont have a scoop make ~1 balls. Makes 7.
  5. Bake for 18-20 minutes.

Crunchy Granola Bars

A crunchy, sweet granola bar made from oats, puffed rice, chocolate chips, and dried cranberries. These bars have protein powder mixed in as well to increase the protein load.

CourseCuisineTime - 40 minutes
Dessert, SnackAmericanPrep - 10 minutes
Cook - 30 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
180kcal24 bars
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates25.7g73%
Fat6.7g19%
Protein4.2g12%

Ingredients:

  • 5 cups (400 g) oats
  • 3 cups (51 g) puffed rice cereal
  • cup (112 g) melted coconut oil
  • 2 scoops (64 g) vanilla whey protein powder
  • 1 cup (240 ml) maple syrup
  • 3 tsp (12 ml) vanilla
  • 1 tsp (3 g) salt
  • cup (60 g) dried cranberries
  • cup (56 g) mini chocolate chips

Instructions:

  1. Preheat oven to 350F
  2. In a large bowl mix the salt, oats, and oil. Pour onto a baking sheet and bake until toasted, about 15 minutes stirring every couple of minutes.
  3. While the oats are baking, stir together the syrup, whey, and vanilla until the whey is dissolved.
  4. Mix the oats, puffed rice, cranberries, and syrup mixture together.
  5. Line a sheet pan with foil and spray with oil. Pour the mixture into the pan and press firmly. Add a layer of wax paper over the top before you press to keep your hands clean. The sheet pan should be a standard size ideally with a lip. If you have a smaller sheet pan youll probably end up with chewy bars.
  6. Bake for 10-15 minutes and remove from oven. Cut into 24 bars while still warm.

Dark Chocolate Drizzled Protein Rice Crispy Treats

Rice crispy treats made from cornstarch and protein powder instead of marshmallows to make these into a high protein treat.

CourseCuisineTime - 10 minutes
Dessert, SnackAmericanPrep - 10 minutes
Cook - null

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
161kcal4 servings
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates20.9g59%
Fat2.8g8%
Protein13.1g37%

Ingredients:

  • 2 cups (66 g) crispy rice cereal
  • 2 scoops (60 g) vanilla whey protein powder
  • 2 tsp (8 g) cornstarch
  • cup (60 ml) water
  • 2 tbsp (30 g) dark chocolate chips

Instructions:

  1. Mix the cornstarch and protein powder together.
  2. Stir in cup of water and vigorously stir until it is completely smooth.
  3. Pour in cereal and stir to coat.
  4. Press into an 8x8 pan.
  5. Melt chocolate and drizzle over the top. I added a bit of liquid to make it a bit less viscous. Allow it to come together and set up.

Strawberries and Cream Crepes

Crepes made using a gluten free flour blend and filled with strawberries and a Greek yogurt cream sauce.

CourseCuisineTime - 30 minutes
Dessert, SnackFrenchPrep - 10 minutes
Cook - 20 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
126kcal4 crepes
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates17.9g68%
Fat2.8g10%
Protein7.4g28%

Ingredients:

For the Crepe

  • cup (74 g) gluten free baking flour
  • cup (60 ml) skim milk
  • cup (60 ml) water
  • tbsp (7 g) butter
  • 1 egg

For the Filling

  • 4-5 (60 g) strawberries
  • cup (57 g) plain non fat Greek yogurt
  • scoop (15 g) vanilla whey protein powder
  • Stevia to taste
  • dusting (1 g) powdered sugar

Instructions:

  1. Mix crepe ingredients in a large bowl. Whisk until smooth. Add more water if its too thick. It should be fairly runny, not like pancake batter.
  2. Heat an 8-inch skillet over medium heat. To form the crepe takes a bit of finesse. Its not hard but if youve never done it before it will take some practice. Pour about cup worth of batter in the center of the pan and tilt the pan in a circular motion to evenly cover the bottom.
  3. Flip when ready and cook the other side. It will take a few minutes on each side.
  4. Mix the protein and stevia to taste into the yogurt and stir vigorously.
  5. Spread a spoonful out on the crepe, fill with strawberries and roll or fold. Top with powdered sugar. Makes 4.

Blueberry Scones

A gluten free alternative to scones. These scones don't use as much fat as normal ones in order to be more calorie friendly so the texture isn't like a traditional scone but they still taste great.

CourseCuisineTime - 32 minutes
Dessert, SnackAmericanPrep - 10 minutes
Cook - 22 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
92kcal8 scones
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates14.5g76%
Fat2.4g12%
Protein3.1g16%

Ingredients:

  • 1 cup (100 g) oat flour
  • cup (150 g) plain non fat Greek yogurt
  • cup (140 g) frozen blueberries
  • 2 tbsp (42 g) honey
  • 1 tbsp (14 g) butter
  • 1 tsp (4 g) stevia
  • 1 tsp (4 g) baking powder
  • tsp (2 g) baking soda

Instructions:

  1. Preheat oven to 375F.
  2. Mix the oat flour, baking powder, and baking soda together in a small bowl.
  3. In a different bowl mix the Greek yogurt, honey, butter, and stevia together.
  4. Slowly stir in the flour and then fold in the blueberries.
  5. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper and spray with oil. Plop the batter down and form it into a circle with a thickness of about 1 inch.
  6. Cut into 8 pieces and spread apart.
  7. Bake for 20-22 minutes or longer if you want it crispier. Top with more honey if desired

Double Chocolate Chewy Cookies

Double chocolate chip cookies made from a base of white kidney beans, flour, and applesauce. These are miniature cookies and have only roughly 27 calories per cookie.

CourseCuisineTime - 24 minutes
Dessert, SnackAmericanPrep - 15 minutes
Cook - 9 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
27kcal24 mini cookies
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates4.7g117%
Fat0.6g15%
Protein0.8g20%

Ingredients:

Wet Ingredients

  • 1 cup (150 g) drained white kidney beans
  • 3 tbsp (45 g) unsweetened applesauce
  • 2 tsp (10 g) stevia
  • 1 tsp (4 ml) vanilla
  • 1 egg

Dry Ingredients

  • cup (75 g) gluten free baking flour
  • 2 tbsp (10 g) cocoa powder
  • tsp (2 g) baking soda
  • Pinch (0.5 g) salt
  • 2 tbsp (28 g) mini chocolate chips

Instructions:

  1. Preheat oven to 350F
  2. Drain the beans and rinse. Dry as well as possible. Use a food processor or a tool to mash the beans into a paste.
  3. In a large bowl, mix the beans, apple sauce, egg, stevia, vanilla, and egg.
  4. In a different bowl mix the dry ingredients.
  5. Slowly add the dry ingredients and half the chocolate chips to the wet ingredients and mix to incorporate.
  6. Spray a baking sheet with oil. Use a small sized cookie scoop to create little balls of dough. Press into cookie shape and top with remaining chips.
  7. Bake at 350F for 8-9 minutes.
  8. Makes 24 cookies.

Chocolate Chip Banana Bread Muffins

Muffins made from oats, Greek yogurt, bananas, and protein powder. These muffins are topped with chocolate chips but you could also do blueberries if you wanted something lower in calories.

CourseCuisineTime - 32 minutes
Dessert, SnackAmericanPrep - 10 minutes
Cook - 22 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
103kcal10 muffins
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates14.3g68%
Fat2.6g12%
Protein5.6g26%

Ingredients:

  • 1 cup (80 g) oats
  • cup (150 g) plain non fat Greek yogurt
  • 2 medium (250 g) total ripe bananas
  • 1 scoop (32 g) whey
  • 1 egg
  • 1 tsp (4 ml) vanilla
  • 1 tsp (4 g) baking powder
  • 1 tsp (4 g) stevia
  • 3 tbsp (45 g) dark chocolate chips

Instructions:

  1. Preheat your oven to 350F.
  2. In a blender, add the oats and pulverize into a flour. Add in the remainder of the ingredients minus the chocolate chips and blend until smooth.
  3. Spray a muffin tin with cooking spray and fill the wells half way with the batter. It will make 10 Muffins.
  4. Top each with some dark chocolate chips
  5. Bake for 20-22 minutes. I think the muffins are better when they sit overnight

Post Workout Weight Gain Chocolate Milkshake

A high protein, high calorie milkshake that would work well for gaining weight. Being in liquid form, this shake is an easy way to get in lots of calories.

CourseCuisineTime - 5 minutes
Dessert, SnackAmericanPrep - 5 minutes
Cook - null

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
614kcal1
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates52g43%
Fat26.3g21%
Protein42.4g35%

Ingredients:

  • 1 scoop (30 g) whey protein
  • 1 cup (240 ml) whole milk
  • 1 medium (125 g) frozen banana
  • 2 tbsp (32 g) peanut butter
  • 2 tbsp (10 g) cocoa powder
  • 6-8 ice cubes

Instructions:

  1. Place all ingredients into a high powered blender and blend until smooth. Adjust the ice as preferred to get a thicker or thinner shake.

Banana Cream Pie Milkshake

A banana cream pie flavored milkshake made from frozen greek yogurt, a banana, and honey nut cheerios to act as the crust.

CourseCuisineTime - 5 minutes
Dessert, SnackAmericanPrep - 5 minutes
Cook - null

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
408kcal1
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates45.7g46%
Fat1.7g1%
Protein52.5g53%

Ingredients:

  • 1 scoop (32 g) whey protein
  • 1 cup (227 g) plain non fat Greek yogurt frozen
  • 1 packet (2 g) stevia powder
  • 1 medium (100 g) banana
  • cup (9 g) honey nut cheerios
  • cup (120 ml) skim milk

Instructions:

  1. Place 1 cup of Greek yogurt into the freezer.
  2. Mix all of your ingredients except a small handful of the cheerios in a blender and blend until smooth.
  3. Crush the remaining cherrios and top with the crushed cheerios.

Peanut Butter Chocolate Mug Cake

A cake made from protein powder, cocoa powder, and applesauce that is cooked inside of mug and microwaved. If you're in need of a quick sweet treat, this is your recipe.

CourseCuisineTime - 7 minutes
Dessert, SnackAmericanPrep - 5 minutes
Cook - 2 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
351kcal1
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates29.4g39%
Fat9.3g12%
Protein37.3g49%

Ingredients:

  • cup (113 g) unsweetened applesauce
  • 1 scoop (32 g) whey protein
  • 2 tbsp (10 g) cocoa powder
  • 2 tbsp (10 g) powdered peanut butter
  • tsp (1 ml) vanilla
  • 1 egg
  • tsp (2 g) stevia
  • 1 tsp (5 g) rainbow sprinkles

Instructions:

  1. Mix everything in a mug and stir until incorporated.
  2. Microwave 2-2 minutes.

Chocolate Mug Cake

A cake made from protein powder, cocoa powder, and applesauce that is cooked inside of mug and microwaved. If you're in need of a quick sweet treat, this is your recipe.

CourseCuisineTime - 7 minutes
Dessert, SnackAmericanPrep - 5 minutes
Cook - 2 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
268kcal1
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates21.2g37%
Fat6.7g11%
Protein30.8g54%

Ingredients:

  • 1 scoop (30 g) whey protein
  • 2 tbsp (10 g) cocoa powder
  • tsp (2 g) stevia powder
  • 1 egg
  • 1 pinch (0.5 g) salt
  • tsp (1 ml) vanilla
  • cup (113 g) unsweetened applesauce

Instructions:

  1. Mix all of your ingredients in a mug.
  2. Microwave for 2 minutes or until it has set.

Chocolate Chip Cookie Bread

A gluten free, sweet bread recipe made from oat flour and plain greek yogurt. These bites taste similar to a chocolate chip cookie but have texture more similar to bread.

CourseCuisineTime - 27 minutes
Dessert, SnackAmericanPrep - 10 minutes
Cook - 17 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
67kcal11 bites
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates8.7g72%
Fat2.4g20%
Protein2.6g21%

Ingredients:

Dry Ingredients

  • 14 tbsp (80 g) oat flour cup + 2 tbsp
  • tsp (2 g) baking soda
  • tsp (1 g) salt

Wet Ingredients

  • 1 small egg
  • cup (150 g) plain non fat Greek yogurt
  • 1 tsp (5 g) splenda
  • 1 tsp (4 ml) vanilla
  • cup (60 g) chocolate chips

Instructions:

  1. Preheat oven to 375F.
  2. Stir together the dry ingredients and the wet ingredients separately.
  3. Mix the wet ingredients into the dry ingredients.
  4. Use a cookie scoop to make balls. Place on a greased cookie sheet and bake for 15-17 minutes. Makes 11.

Peanut Butter Marshmallow Bites

A quick dessert/snack to make from puffed rice cereal, marshmallows, and honey. Powdered peanut butter is used in place of regular peanut butter to lessen the caloric load.

CourseCuisineTime - 15 minutes
Dessert, SnackAmericanPrep - 10 minutes
Cook - 5 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
41kcal19 bites
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates8.2g91%
Fat0.3g3%
Protein1.3g14%

Ingredients:

  • 3 cups (51 g) puffed rice cereal
  • cup (54 g) powdered peanut butter
  • 3 Tbsp (63 g) honey
  • cup (30 g) mini marshmallows
  • 2 Tbsp (24 g) rainbow sprinkles

Instructions:

  1. In a small sauce pan, melt the honey, marshmallows, and peanut butter together. Mix the powdered peanut butter with the necessary amount of water as instructed on the packaging first.
  2. Pour over the cereal and mix in sprinkles.
  3. Form into balls with a cookie scoop and store in the refrigerator so they firm up. Makes 19.

Chocolate Chip Puffed Rice Cookies

Chocolate chip cookies made from puffed rice instead of flour for volume and applesauce instead of butter to add moisture.

CourseCuisineTime - 20 minutes
Dessert, SnackAmericanPrep - 10 minutes
Cook - 10 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
49kcal11 cookies
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates7.8g86%
Fat1.4g15%
Protein1.2g13%

Ingredients:

Dry Ingredients

  • 2 cups (34 g) puffed rice cereal
  • 6 tbsp (40 g) oat flour
  • 1 tsp (4 g) baking soda
  • tsp (1 g) salt

Wet Ingredients

  • 1 egg
  • cup (113 g) unsweetened applesauce
  • 1 tsp (4 ml) vanilla
  • 2 tsp (10 g) stevia
  • 2 tbsp (28 g) mini chocolate chips

Instructions:

  1. Preheat oven to 325F. Mix dry ingredients and wet ingredients separately. Combine into one bowl with half the chocolate chips.
  2. Allow the dough to rest and hydrate for a few minutes before scooping.
  3. Grease a sheet pan. Using a cookie scoop place the dough onto the pan. Form into cookie shape, top with remaining chocolate chips. I yielded 11 cookies.
  4. Bake 10 minutes.

Mint Chocolate Chip Banana "Ice Cream"

Frozen bananas blended with a bit of milk, protein powder, chocolate chips and mint extract to replicate Mint Chocolate Chip Ice Cream.

CourseCuisineTime - 10 minutes
Dessert, SnackAmericanPrep - 10 minutes
Cook - null

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
209kcal3 servings
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates26g55%
Fat3.6g7%
Protein18.2g38%

Ingredients:

  • 2 medium (250 g) frozen bananas
  • 2 scoops (60 g) whey protein
  • cup (120 ml) whole milk
  • 1 tsp (4 ml) vanilla extract
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) mini chocolate chips
  • 1-2 drops green food coloring
  • 1-2 drops peppermint extract

Instructions:

  1. Add the frozen bananas to a high powered blender in small pieces.
  2. Slowly pour in the milk and start to churn.
  3. Add in the whey, mint, and coloring.
  4. Fold in chocolate chips.
  5. Makes 3 servings.

Chocolate Chip Cookie Bars

These cookie bars are made from beans, casein protein, and oat flour. If you didnt know that there were beans in this recipe I have a hard time believing you could guess what they are made of.

CourseCuisineTime - 35 minutes
Dessert, SnackAmericanPrep - 10 minutes
Cook - 25 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
101kcal10 bars
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates16.2g73%
Fat1.5g6%
Protein5.7g25%

Ingredients:

Wet Ingredients

  • 1 can (425 g) cannellini beans
  • cup (60 ml) maple syrup
  • 1 scoop (32 g) vanilla casein protein powder
  • cup (58 g) unsweetened applesauce

Dry Ingredients

  • cup (20 g) oat flour
  • tsp (2 g) baking soda
  • 1 tsp (4 ml) vanilla
  • 1 (1 ) egg
  • 2 tbsp (30 ml) water
  • 2 tbsp (30 g) mini chocolate chips

Instructions:

  1. Preheat oven to 350F.
  2. Drain and rinse beans.
  3. In a food processor or a blender mix everything but the chocolate chips until smooth.
  4. Spray an 8x8 with oil and pour in the batter. Top with or stir in the chocolate chips.
  5. Bake for 23-25 minutes.
  6. Let it cool completely and cut into 10 bars.

Perfect Chocolate Cream Dream Angel Bake

This version of the Perfect Chocolate Dream Angel Bake incorporates some cream cheese to make a brownie/cheesecake hybrid. It is made by whipping egg whites to create lots of volume.

CourseCuisineTime - 38 minutes
Dessert, SnackAmericanPrep - 15 minutes
Cook - 23 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
172kcal4 servings
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates15.4g40%
Fat3g7%
Protein20.8g54%

Ingredients:

  • 9 tbsp (138 g) liquid egg whites cup + 1 tbsp
  • cup (113 g) unsweetened applesauce
  • 1 scoops (45 g) vanilla casein protein powder
  • 1 tsp (4 ml) vanilla
  • 2 tsp (8 g) stevia
  • tsp (1 g) baking powder
  • 2 tbsp (30 g) mini chocolate chips
  • 3 tbsp (15 g) cocoa powder
  • cup (113 g) plain non fat Greek yogurt
  • cup (113 g) fat free cream cheese
  • 1 tsp (5 g) oat flour

Instructions:

  1. Preheat oven to 300F
  2. Beat the egg whites, vanilla, & baking powder until stiff peaks form.
  3. Add tsp stevia & cocoa powder.
  4. Add in applesauce & casein. Youll lose a lot of the volume here.
  5. Pour of it into a greased 8x8. top with chocolate chips.
  6. Melt cream cheese in microwave. Stir in 1 stevia, yogurt, and oat flour.
  7. Spread a layer of the cream cheese over the brownie. Add the remaining brownie to the top by the spoonful and marble with a knife.
  8. Bake for 20-23 minutes. Let cool before eating if you want it to be solid.

Perfect Chocolate Pudding Dream Angel Bake

This is my favorite dessert recipe I have ever developed. This entire 8x8 pan is only 511 calories. It is made by whipping egg whites to create lots of volume. This is more souffl-like than brownie like but the longer it sits, the more dense it becomes.

CourseCuisineTime - 32 minutes
Dessert, SnackAmericanPrep - 10 minutes
Cook - 22 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
511kcal1
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates60g54%
Fat11.9g10%
Protein40.9g36%

Ingredients:

  • 9 tbsp (138 g) liquid egg whites cup + 1 tbsp
  • cup (113 g) unsweetened applesauce
  • 1 scoop (30 g) casein protein
  • 1 tsp (4 ml) vanilla
  • tsp (2 g) stevia
  • tsp (2 g) baking powder
  • 2 tbsp (30 g) mini chocolate chips
  • 2 tbsp (10 g) cocoa powder
  • 1 pack (92 g) chocolate pudding the snack packs

Instructions:

  1. Preheat oven to 325F.
  2. Beat the egg whites, vanilla, & baking powder until stiff peaks form.
  3. Add stevia & cocoa powder.
  4. Add in applesauce & casein. Youll lose a lot of the volume here, thats okay.
  5. Pour into a greased 8x8. Top with chocolate chips. Swirl in the pudding.
  6. Bake 20-22 minutes.

Perfect Chocolate Dream Angel Bake

This is my favorite dessert recipe I have ever developed. This entire 8x8 pan is only 420 calories. It is made by whipping egg whites to create lots of volume. This is more souffl-like than brownie like but the longer it sits, the more dense it becomes.

CourseCuisineTime - 32 minutes
Dessert, SnackAmericanPrep - 10 minutes
Cook - 22 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
420kcal1
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates42g45%
Fat9.4g10%
Protein41.9g45%

Ingredients:

  • 9 tbsp (138 g) liquid egg whites cup + 1 tbsp
  • cup (113 g) unsweetened applesauce
  • 1 scoop (30 g) casein protein
  • 1 tsp (4 ml) vanilla
  • tsp (2 g) stevia
  • tsp (2 g) cream of tartar use tsp baking powder if you don't have any
  • 2 tbsp (30 g) mini chocolate chips
  • 2 tbsp (10 g) cocoa powder

Instructions:

  1. Preheat oven to 325F.
  2. Beat the egg whites, vanilla, & cream of tartar until stiff peaks form. This is important.
  3. Add stevia & cocoa powder.
  4. Add in applesauce & casein. Youll lose a lot of the volume here, thats okay.
  5. Pour into a greased 8x8. Top with chocolate chips.
  6. Bake 20-22 minutes.

Strawberry Shortcake Cookies

A cookie/shortbread made from casein protein powder and coconut flour and topped with fresh strawberries and a Greek yogurt whipped cream mixture.

CourseCuisineTime - 28 minutes
Dessert, SnackAmericanPrep - 20 minutes
Cook - 8 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
68kcal12 cookies
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates4.9g44%
Fat3.4g30%
Protein4.3g39%

Ingredients:

For the Cookie

  • cup (28 g) coconut flour
  • 2 Tbsp (30 g) coconut oil
  • 1 scoop (30 g) vanilla casein protein powder
  • tsp (2 ml) vanilla
  • tsp (2 g) baking soda
  • 1 tsp (6 g) stevia
  • 1 (1 ) egg

For the Filling

  • 7 tbsp (100 g) plain non fat Greek yogurt cup + 3 tbsp
  • 1/3 scoop (10 g) vanilla whey protein powder
  • tsp (2 g) stevia powder
  • tsp (2 ml) vanilla
  • 14 tbsp (35 g) fat free whipped cream cup + 2 tbsp
  • 5 (200 g) strawberries

Instructions:

  1. Preheat oven to 350F.
  2. Mix the dry cookie ingredients together until incorporated. Mix the wet ingredients separately (melt the oil first).
  3. Combine dry and wet and mix thoroughly.
  4. Split the dough into 12 balls and place on a oiled baking sheet. Press into cookie form. (Note: Youll see in the picture the cookies are in mini muffin shape. I pressed the dough into a mini muffin tin to create wells to hold the filling. It was way too much work do to this so just make regular cookies.)
  5. Bake 7-8 minutes.

For the Filling

  1. For the filling mix everything but the whipped cream in a bowl and mix vigorously. When all of the protein has incorporated, add the whipped cream and fold in gently.
  2. Cut the strawberries into small pieces.
  3. Top each cookie with the filling and strawberries once cooled.

Double Chocolate Chip Muffins

A gluten free, chocolate muffin topped with chocolate chips. These muffins can be made regular sized or as mini muffins if you prefer. They are made from a combination of oat and coconut flour and use Greek yogurt instead of oil.

CourseCuisineTime - 30 minutes
Dessert, SnackAmericanPrep - 10 minutes
Cook - 20 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
106kcal11 muffins
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates15.7g74%
Fat2.7g12%
Protein4.8g22%

Ingredients:

  • cup (50 g) oat flour
  • cup (37 g) coconut flour
  • cup (20 g) cocoa powder
  • 2 eggs
  • 6 Tbsp (92 g) liquid egg whites
  • cup (113 g) plain non fat Greek yogurt
  • 1 medium (125 g) banana
  • 2 Tbsp (42 g) honey
  • 1 tsp (4 g) baking soda
  • 2 tsp (8 g) stevia
  • 3 tbsp (45 g) mini chocolate chips

Instructions:

  1. Preheat oven to 350F.
  2. Mix all of the dry ingredients together to prevent clumping.
  3. In a food processor (by hand is fine) mix the dry ingredients (except chocolate chips) with the wet ingredients until incorporated.
  4. Stir in 2 tbsp of the chocolate chips.
  5. Spray a muffin tin with oil and fill the wells about of the way. Dont use liners, they will stick. Top with remaining chocolate chips. I got 11 regular sized muffins or 24 mini muffins.
  6. Bake for 20 minutes for regular sized or 15 minutes for mini.

Banana Chocolate Protein Frosty

Frozen bananas blended with a bit of milk, protein powder, and cocoa powder to replicate a Chocolate frosty.

CourseCuisineTime - 10 minutes
Dessert, SnackAmericanPrep - 10 minutes
Cook - null

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
195kcal3 servings
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates23.8g55%
Fat2.7g6%
Protein18.9g43%

Ingredients:

  • 2 medium (250 g) frozen bananas
  • 2 scoops (60 g) whey protein
  • 1/2 cup (120 ml) whole milk
  • 2 tbsp (10 g) cocoa powder

Instructions:

  1. Put the frozen bananas in the blender and start churning.
  2. Add the milk slowly until you reach your desired consistency. If your bananas are bigger or smaller you may need more or less liquid.
  3. Add the protein and cocoa powders and mix until incorporated.
  4. Makes 3 servings.

Cherry Peach Crisp

Cherries and peaches baked underneath a oat crumble sweetened with honey.

CourseCuisineTime - 50 minutes
Dessert, SnackAmericanPrep - 10 minutes
Cook - 40 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
249kcal4 servings
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates40.2g78%
Fat8.2g16%
Protein3.5g6%

Ingredients:

  • 2 (200 g) peaches
  • 1/4 lb (115 g) sweet cherries
  • 3 tbsp (63 g) honey
  • 1 tsp (5 ml) lemon juice
  • 1 tbsp (7.5 g) tapioca flour or cornstarch
  • 11 tbsp (55 g) oats cup + 3 tbsp
  • 1/4 cup (25 g) oat flour
  • 2 tbsp (30 g) coconut oil
  • 1 tsp (4 ml) vanilla
  • 2 tbsp (10 g) fat free whipped cream

Instructions:

  1. Preheat oven to 350F.
  2. Wash and cut your peaches into slices. No need to peel. Pit the cherries and cut in half.
  3. In a large bowl add the peaches, cherries, tapioca flour, 1 tbsp honey, and lemon juice. Mix and allow to macerate while you make the topping.
  4. In a separate bowl mix the oats, oat flour, melted coconut oil, 2 tbsp of honey, and vanilla.
  5. Add the fruit to an 8" cast iron skillet. Top with the oat mixture.
  6. Bake for 35-40 minutes or until the top has browned.
  7. Top with whipped cream if you wish.

PB&J Donuts

A baked, gluten free donut topped with peanut butter and filled with a quick homemade jelly.

CourseCuisineTime - 40 minutes
Dessert, SnackAmericanPrep - 20 minutes
Cook - 20 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
151kcal5 donuts
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates22.4g70%
Fat3.4g10%
Protein7.7g24%

Ingredients:

  • 4/5 cup (80 g) oat flour
  • 1/4 cup (57 g) plain non fat Greek yogurt
  • 1 tsp (4 g) baking powder
  • 1 tsp (4 ml) vanilla
  • 1 tsp (4 g) stevia
  • 2 eggs
  • 2.5 tbsp (20 g) powdered peanut butter
  • 2 tsp (10 g) honey
  • 1.5 tbsp (25 ml) water
  • 1 cup (140 g) sliced frozen strawberries
  • 2 tbsp (30 g) maple syrup

Instructions:

  1. Add the strawberries and syrup to a saucepan and bring to a light boil. Break up the strawberries as it heats.
  2. Allow it to boil and thicken then use an immersion blender/blender to get a smooth texture.
  3. Add it back to the pot and boil to thicken again. Place in the fridge to cool.
  4. Preheat oven to 375F
  5. Mix the oat flour, baking powder, and stevia together until no clumps remain.
  6. Add in the eggs, vanilla, and yogurt. Mix thoroughly.
  7. Add the batter to a plastic bag to pipe into the donut tin.
  8. Divide half the the mixture between 5 wells.
  9. Evenly divide the strawberries between each well.
  10. Top with the remaining donut batter.
  11. Bake for 9-10 minutes.
  12. Allow the donuts to cool completely.
  13. Mix the powdered peanut butter, honey, and water. Top each donut with the frosting.

Maple Peanut Butter Donuts

A baked, gluten free donut recipe topped with a peanut butter and maple syrup glaze for sweetness and flavor.

CourseCuisineTime - null
Dessert, SnackAmericanPrep - 10 minutes
Cook - 9 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
137kcal5 donuts
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates17.8g65%
Fat4.5g16%
Protein6.4g23%

Ingredients:

  • 4/5 cup (80 g) oat flour
  • 1/4 cup (57 g) plain non fat Greek yogurt
  • 1 tsp (4 g) baking powder
  • 1 tsp (4 ml) vanilla
  • 1 tsp (4 g) stevia
  • 2 (2 ) eggs
  • 2 tbsp (30 g) maple syrup
  • 1 tbsp (16 g) peanut butter

Instructions:

  1. Preheat your oven to 375F.
  2. Mix the oat flour, baking powder, and stevia together to remove any clumps.
  3. Add in the eggs, yogurt, and vanilla. Mix thoroughly
  4. Filled a greased donut tin with the batter. It will make 5.
  5. Bake 9 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes away clear.
  6. Mix together the peanut butter and syrup until smooth.
  7. Once the donuts have cooled, top each with the icing.

Mini Pumpkin Muffins

Mini muffins made from pumpkin and oat flour and topped with a cream cheese frosting. The frosting here is made from Greek yogurt and fat free cream cheese but if you wanted them to taste even better you could use the real thing.

CourseCuisineTime - 24 minutes
Dessert, SnackAmerican, meal prepPrep - 15 minutes
Cook - 9 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
45kcal12 muffins
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates6.9g86%
Fat0.9g11%
Protein2.3g28%

Ingredients:

For the Muffins

  • 4/5 cup (80 g) oat flour
  • 1 tsp (4 g) baking powder
  • 1.5 tsp (6 g) stevia
  • 1 egg
  • 3 tbsp (45 g) liquid egg whites
  • 1/3 cup (75 g) canned pumpkin
  • 1.5 tsp (5.5 g) cinnamon
  • 1 tsp (3 g) Pumpkin pie spice

**For the Frosting **

  • 1.5 tbsp (20 g) fat free cream cheese
  • 1.5 tbsp (20 g) plain non fat Greek yogurt
  • 1.5 tbsp (10 g) powdered sugar
  • 8 tbsp (20 g) fat free whipped cream

Instructions:

  1. Preheat your oven to 375F.
  2. Mix the baking powder, cinnamon, pumpkin pie spice, oat flour, and stevia together until combined. Then add the eggs and pumpkin
  3. Fill 12 wells of a mini muffin tin and bake for 8-9 minutes.
  4. Mix the sugar, yogurt, and cream cheese together until smooth. Gently mix in the whipped cream.
  5. Top each muffin with frosting.
  6. Makes 12. Nutrition info is for each muffin.

Pumpkin Donuts

A gluten free, baked donut made from canned pumpkin and oats. These donuts are topped with cinnamon sugar and make for the perfect fall treat.

CourseCuisineTime - 19 minutes
Dessert, SnackAmericanPrep - 10 minutes
Cook - 9 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
132kcal5 donuts
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates19g70%
Fat4.1g15%
Protein4.7g17%

Ingredients:

For the Donut

  • 4/5 cup (80 g) oat flour
  • 1 tsp (4 g) baking powder
  • 1 tsp (4 g) stevia
  • 2 (2 ) eggs
  • 1/4 cup (60 g) canned pumpkin
  • 1/2 tsp (2 ml) vanilla
  • 1 tsp (4 g) cinnamon
  • 1/4 tsp (1 g) Pumpkin pie spice

For the Topping

  • 2 tbsp (25 g) sugar
  • tsp (2 g) cinnamon
  • 2 tsp (7 g) melted butter

Instructions:

  1. Preheat your oven to 375F.
  2. Mix the baking powder, cinnamon, pumpkin pie spice, oat flour, and stevia together until combined. Then add the eggs, vanilla, and pumpkin
  3. Fill 5 wells of a donut tin and bake for 8-9 minutes.
  4. Mix together the sugar and cinnamon in a bowl. Melt the butter in a different bowl.
  5. Dip the donuts in the butter then the sugar mixture to coat. Dont coat them until you eat them FYI. The sugar will dissolve if it sits long enough.

5 Minute Cinnamon Roll Center

A quick dessert that takes about 5 minutes from start to finish and has similar texture and flavor to the center of a cinnamon roll. All it takes is a bit of measuring, mixing, and microwaving.

CourseCuisineTime - null
Dessert, SnackAmericanPrep - 3 minutes
Cook - 2 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
221kcal1
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates26g54%
Fat4.8g10%
Protein18.5g38%

Ingredients:

  • 2 tbsp (12 g) oat flour
  • 2 tbsp (10 g) powdered peanut butter
  • 2 tbsp (10 g) tapioca flour
  • 2 tbsp (35 ml) water
  • 2 tbsp (25 g) liquid egg whites
  • 2 tbsp (12 g) vanilla casein protein powder
  • 1 tsp (4 g) sugar
  • 1 tsp (2 g) cinnamon
  • 1 tsp (3 g) butter

Instructions:

  1. Mix the oat flour, tapioca, PB, 1g cinnamon and casein together. Add in egg whites and water. It will make a dough like consistency.
  2. Spread out the dough in your bowl to even thickness.
  3. Melt butter, stir in 1g cinnamon, and sugar. Stir. If its too thick, add water to thin it out but no more than a few drops at a time.
  4. Pour the cinnamon sugar over the top. Microwave for 90-120 seconds

Chocolate Sprinkle Doughnuts

A homemade, baked, gluten free chocolate doughnut. These take under 20 minutes to cook so they are a perfect option for a weekend breakfast.

CourseCuisineTime - 19 minutes
Dessert, SnackAmericanPrep - 10 minutes
Cook - 9 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
143kcal5 donuts
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates16.2g60%
Fat6.1g22%
Protein5.7g21%

Ingredients:

  • 4/5 cup (80 g) oat flour
  • 1 tsp (4 g) stevia
  • 1 tsp (4 g) baking powder
  • 2 (2 ) eggs
  • 1/4 cup (57 g) plain non fat Greek yogurt
  • 1 tsp (4 ml) vanilla
  • 2 tbsp (30 g) Chocolate chips
  • 1 tsp (5 ml) coconut oil
  • 2 tsp (10 g) rainbow sprinkles

Instructions:

  1. Preheat your oven to 375F.
  2. Mix the oat flour, baking powder, and stevia together to remove any clumps.
  3. Add in the eggs, yogurt, and vanilla. Mix thoroughly
  4. Filled a greased doughnut tin with the batter. It will make 5.
  5. Bake 9 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes away clear.
  6. Melt the chocolate chips and coconut oil together in the microwave. Stir to combine.
  7. Once the doughnuts have cooled, top each with chocolate and sprinkles. Allow the chocolate to harden. I put mine in the freezer to expedite the process.

Microwave Chocolate Chip Cookies

A gluten free cookie recipe made from oat flower and casein protein powder that can be made in the microwave or the oven. It makes 4 cookies, the nutrition information is for all of them.

CourseCuisineTime - 12 minutes
Dessert, SnackAmericanPrep - 10 minutes
Cook - 2 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
288kcal1 servings
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates24.4g46%
Fat14.1g26%
Protein15.9g30%

Ingredients:

  • 2 tbsp (10 g) oat flour
  • 1 tbsp (5 g) coconut flour
  • 2 tbsp (10 g) vanilla casein protein powder
  • 1/4 cup (60 ml) whole milk
  • 2 tbsp (10 g) powdered peanut butter
  • 1.5 tsp (8 g) butter softened. Coconut oil works too
  • 2 tsp (10 g) mini chocolate chips

Instructions:

  1. Mix all of the ingredients together. Save some of the chocolate chips for the top if you want it to look cool.
  2. Microwave for 1-2 minutes or until the center has set. Thats it. Cool. Very easy. It makes 1 Cookie bowl/skillet or 4 cookies. The nutrition information is for the whole recipe.
  3. You can also bake them at 350F for 7-8 minutes if you want them in cookie form as seen above. I think they taste the same whether they have been cooked in the microwave or the oven. If youre going for aesthetics, use the oven. If youre going for time saving, use the microwave.

Single Serve Chocolate Chips Banana Bread

These individual Chocolate Chip Banana Breads are a great way to use up any overripe or frozen bananas. They are gluten free and can be refined sugar free if you use sugar free chocolate chips.

CourseCuisineTime - 33 minutes
Dessert, SnackAmericanPrep - 15 minutes
Cook - 18 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
135kcal9 muffins
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates22.3g76%
Fat3g10%
Protein4.6g15%

Ingredients:

  • 1/2 cup (40 g) old fashioned oats
  • 1/2 cup (120 ml) water
  • 7/8 cup (80 g) oat flour
  • 1 tsp (4 g) baking powder
  • 1/2 tsp (2 g) baking soda
  • 2 (2 ) eggs
  • 2 medium (200 g) frozen and thawed bananas
  • 2 tbsp (42 g) honey
  • 1 scoop (30 g) vanilla casein protein powder
  • 1 tsp (4 ml) vanilla
  • 1/4 cup (60 g) mini chocolate chips

Instructions:

  1. Preheat oven to 350F.
  2. Microwave the ripe frozen bananas to thaw. Frozen bananas are sweeter and more liquidy. Non frozen will work but not as well.
  3. Mix the oats and water and microwave for one minute in a large bowl.
  4. Mix in the banana and stir until it is well incorporated. Allow to cool a bit.
  5. Add in the eggs and stir
  6. In a different bowl mix the oat flour, casein, baking soda, and baking powder until no clumps remain.
  7. Pour into wet ingredients and mix.
  8. Spray a regular sized muffin tin with oil and fill 9 wells.
  9. Bake for 16-18 minutes.

Appetizer

  • Broccoli Bites
  • Air Fryer Buffalo Boneless Chicken Wings
  • Maple Sriracha Boneless Chicken Wings
  • Irish Nachos
  • Nashville Hot Chicken Stuffed Potato Skins
  • Buffalo Chicken Tenders
  • Spring Rolls
  • Faux Cheddar Bay Biscuits
  • Nashville Hot Chicken Tenders
  • Maple Sriracha Chicken Wings
  • Garlic Parm Fries
  • Tomato Soup
  • Gluten Free Bruschetta

Broccoli Bites

These Broccoli Bites are the most highly palatable form of vegetables I have ever encountered. If you are looking for an easy way to get in more vegetables, this recipe is it. If you have a food processor these can probably be prepared in minutes.

CourseCuisineTime - 35 minutes
Appetizer, SnackAmerican, meal prepPrep - 15 minutes
Cook - 20 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
16kcal48 bites
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates3.2g106%
Fat0.1g3%
Protein0.5g16%

Ingredients:

  • 2 lbs (908 g) frozen broccoli
  • medium (100 g) onion
  • 1 cup (120 g) maseca
  • 3 tsp (12 g) garlic powder
  • 1 tsp (8 g) salt
  • 2 tsp (4 g) pepper
  • cup (60 g) water
  • (10 g) oil spray optional for reheating

Instructions:

For the Broccoli Bites

  1. Thaw out your broccoli in the microwave.
  2. NOTE: If you have a food processor you can probably just add all of the ingredients (minus the oil spray) and pulse it until it forms a "dough".
  3. If you don't have a food processor, pour out all of your broccoli onto a cutting board and chop it as fine as you reasonably can.
  4. Cut your onion into as small of a dice as you can.
  5. In a large bowl, add the broccoli, onion, salt, pepper, garlic powder, and maseca. Mix to combine.
  6. Add in the water and stir to hydrate. Keep moving everything around until the maseca becomes sticky and a dough like consistency starts to form.
  7. Line a large baking sheet (I used 17"x11") with foil or parchment and spread out the broccoli mix. Press it into all sides of the sheet pan to get a dense, thin product.
  8. The thinner you make these the crispier they will get in the air fryer. If your sheet pan is too small and you try to fit the entire mixture on to it, your final bites will probably be too thick. It may be necessary in this case to use two sheet pans. You want about "-" in thickness.
  9. Place the sheet pan into the freezer and allow it to freeze until solid. This will make it a breeze to form into pieces. You would have to do it by hand otherwise which would get messy and time consuming.
  10. You can just form them by hand and air fry immediately if you don't need them for Snack City.
  11. Once frozen solid, remove from the pan and cut into 48 pieces. I achieved this by cutting it into 8 rows and 6 columns.
  12. Transfer the bites to a ziplock bag and store them inside of Snack City in your freezer.

Cooking and Serving

  1. Preheat your air fryer to 400F. Place the frozen broccoli bites into the air fryer. (Spray with oil if you wish). Air fry for 16-20 minutes, flipping half way. Cooking times may vary depending on thickness, just keep an eye on them.
  2. Serve your broccoli bites with a bit of pasta sauce for dipping. Choose your favorited jarred sauce at the store.
  3. Note that the nutrition information doesn't include the pasta sauce, just the broccoli bites.

Air Fryer Buffalo Boneless Chicken Wings

Air Fryer Buffalo Boneless Wings made using the popcorn chicken recipe. If you keep the popcorn chicken in Snack City in your freezer, these boneless wings are only a quick air fry away.

CourseCuisineTime - 10 minutes
Appetizer, SnackAmericanPrep - 5 minutes
Cook - 8 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
294kcal1 serving
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates24g34%
Fat41g59%
Protein4g5%

Ingredients:

For the Chicken

  • 15-20 pieces (227 g) popcorn chicken

For the Sauce

  • 2 tbsp (37 g) buffalo sauce

Instructions:

For the Wings

  1. This recipe uses the Popcorn Chicken recipe that you should have in Snack City in your freezer at all times. If you do, all you need to do for cooking is to pull them from the freezer and reheat in your airfryer. I put them in at 400F for a few minutes until they are hot.
  2. If you don't have the popcorn chicken made, here is the recipe: Popcorn Chicken
  3. Add the sauce and chicken to a large bowl and toss to coat.

Serving

  1. This recipe makes 1 serving. If you wanted to use it for a meal, serve it with a side of rice and a vegetable.

Maple Sriracha Boneless Chicken Wings

Maple Sriracha Boneless Wings made using the popcorn chicken recipe. If you keep the popcorn chicken in Snack City in your freezer, these boneless wings are only a quick air fry away. Pair with some rice and a vegetable and you've got a nice meal.

CourseCuisineTime - 10 minutes
Appetizer, SnackAmericanPrep - 5 minutes
Cook - 8 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
378kcal1 serving
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates45.1g50%
Fat3.6g4%
Protein41.3g46%

Ingredients:

For the Chicken

  • 15-20 pieces (227 g) popcorn chicken

For the Sauce

  • 2 tbsp (30 g) maple syrup
  • 2 tsp (10 g) sriracha

Instructions:

For the Wings

  1. This recipe uses the Popcorn Chicken recipe that you should have in Snack City in your freezer at all times. If you do, all you need to do for cooking is to pull them from the freezer and reheat in your airfryer. I put them in at 400F for a few minutes until they are hot.
  2. If you don't have the popcorn chicken made, here is the recipe: Popcorn Chicken
  3. To make the sauce, mix the syrup and sriracha together in a large bowl. Add in the chicken and toss to coat.

Serving

  1. This recipe makes 1 serving. If you wanted to use it for a meal, serve it with a side of rice and a vegetable.

Irish Nachos

Irish Nachos made from air fried potatoes topped with cheese, salsa, green onions, and Greek yogurt. This is a quick, easy, and flavorful snack you can use to curb your midnight cravings.

CourseCuisineTime - 13 minutes
Appetizer, SnackAmericanPrep - 5 minutes
Cook - 8 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
291kcal1 serving
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates45g71%
Fat8g12%
Protein10g15%

Ingredients:

  • 1 medium (200 g) russet potato
  • 2 tbsp (30 g) salsa
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) plain non fat Greek yogurt
  • 1 tsp (2 g) green onion
  • 1 tbsp (14 g) cheese
  • (1 g) oil spray

Instructions:

For the Potatoes

  1. Preheat your air fryer to 400F on the air fryer setting.
  2. Wash and slice your potato into chip sized slices.
  3. Add the potatoes to the air fryer and spray lightly with oil. Fry for a few minutes then shake/turn. It will probably take 5-6 minutes depending on the thickness of your potato.
  4. Remove from the fryer and salt. Sprinkle the cheese over the top and then microwave to melt.

Serving

  1. This recipe makes 1 serving. Top with salsa, yogurt and green onions.

Nashville Hot Chicken Stuffed Potato Skins

Crispy, flavorful and filling. The perfect between meals meal. These Hot Chicken Stuffed Potato Skins are cooked sans oil using the air fryer to keep the calorie load low.

CourseCuisineTime - 1 hour 10 minutes
Appetizer, SnackAmericanPrep - 10 minutes
Cook - 1 hour

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
90kcal5 potato skins
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates7.5g39%
Fat2g10%
Protein10.7g56%

Ingredients:

  • 5 (50 g) potato skins
  • lb (227 g) chicken breast tenders
  • cup (40 g) baked potato crumbles
  • 2 tbsp (14 g) shredded cheddar
  • 2 tsp (7 g) brown sugar
  • tsp (.7 g) chili powder
  • tsp (.7 g) onion powder
  • tsp (.7 g) cayenne
  • tsp (2 g) garlic powder
  • 2 tsp (8 g) hot sauce
  • tsp (3.5 g) water
  • 1 (10 g) green onion

For the Spicy Ketchup

  • 2 tbsp (25 g) ketchup
  • 2 tsp (10 g) hot sauce

Instructions:

  1. Bake some potatoes. I used the air fryer at 400F for 40 minutes. Doesnt matter how you do this. You can use the oven too.
  2. Halve the baked potato and scoop out the insides.
  3. Preheat your air fryer to 400F on the air fry setting for 8 minutes.
  4. Lightly spray the tenders with oil and season with salt and pepper. Cook for 4 minutes then flip.
  5. When the chicken has almost completed cooking, mix the seasonings together and stir in the water and hot sauce.
  6. Chop the chicken and add to the sauce. Coat evenly.
  7. Stuff 5 skins with chicken, top with some of the scooped out potato and cheese.
  8. Air fry at 400F for 3-4 minutes. Watch it closely to make sure it doesnt burn.

Serving

  1. Top the potato skins with with green onions. Mix the ketchup and hot sauce together for the spicy ketchup

Buffalo Chicken Tenders

A quick snack you can make in the air fryer. These Buffalo Chicken Tenders are the perfect meal for when you need a big dose of protein.

CourseCuisineTime - 11 minutes
Appetizer, SnackAmericanPrep - 3 minutes
Cook - 8 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
221kcal2 servings
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates0.3g0%
Fat1.2g2%
Protein52g98%

Ingredients:

  • 1 lb boneless skinless chicken breast tenders
  • 2 tbsp buffalo sauce
  • salt and pepper to taste

Instructions:

  1. Preheat your air fryer to 400F.
  2. Season the chicken with salt and pepper and add to the air fryer. Cook the tenders for around 4 minutes and then flip and cook an additional 4 minutes.
  3. Toss the chicken in the buffalo sauce.

Serving

  1. This recipe makes 2 servings.

Spring Rolls

These Spring Rolls are made using rice paper, rice noodles, chicken breasts, lettuce, carrots, and cilantro. They are served with a side of peanut sauce for lots of flavor.

CourseCuisineTime - 40 minutes
Appetizer, SnackAsianPrep - 25 minutes
Cook - 15 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
107kcal15 spring rolls
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates15.5g67%
Fat2.1g9%
Protein6.4g27%

Ingredients:

For the Spring Rolls

  • 15 sheets (135 g) rice paper
  • 1 lb (454 g) boneless skinless chicken breast
  • 1 tbsp (14 g) mayo
  • 2 tsp (5 g) sriracha
  • 2 oz (75 g) rice sticks
  • 3 cups (250 g) romaine lettuce
  • 1 large (200 g) cucumber
  • bunch (20 g) cilantro
  • 2 tbsp (30 g) rice vinegar
  • 1 medium (100 g) pickled carrots

For the Peanut Sauce

  • 3 tbsp (50 g) peanut butter
  • 4 tsp (20 g) soy sauce
  • 2 tsp (10 g) sriracha
  • 4 tsp (20 g) lime juice
  • 1 tbsp (30 g) honey
  • water to consistency

Instructions:

For the Spring Rolls

  1. Cut the chicken to even thickness and cover with the mayo and sriracha on all sides. Air Fry at 400F for 8-12 minutes, flipping it halfway. You could also do shrimp or pork if you wanted.
  2. You'll need to prep the pickled carrots in advance as well if you don't already have them in your fridge. You can either use a vegetable peeler to create ribbons or just buy pre-shredded carrots. To pickle them mix 1 part water and 1 part vinegar with 1 tbsp of sugar and 1 tsp of salt. Put them in a container and allow them to pickle overnight. Make a bunch. These are great and they will last in the fridge for weeks.
  3. To start your prep work, place the rice noodles in a bowl of hot water and allow them to soak for 10-15 minutes or until they have softened.
  4. Wash and cut your lettuce into thin slices and pick the leaves away from the cilantro stems.
  5. Using a vegetable peeler, create ribbons out of your cucumber.
  6. Once the chicken has finished cooking, cut it into thin slices.
  7. To prep the rice paper, submerge it in warm water or hold it under the faucet. Place it down on your work surface and flatten.
  8. Add a small amount of rice noodles, lettuce (dressed with rice vinegar), chicken, pickled carrots, cucumber, and cilantro. I like to include a drizzle of sriracha as well.
  9. Roll the ingredients in the wrap and fold in the sides. Repeat for the remaining rolls.

For the Peanut Sauce

  1. Melt the peanut butter and mix all of the ingredients together until smooth. Add water as needed to thin out.

Storage

  1. To store this for meal prep you should keep it in your fridge, deconstructed, and make the spring rolls whenever you plan to eat them. Store the lettuce and cilantro in a container, the chicken, the cucumbers, pickled carrots, and rice stick in their own containers. Store the rice sticks submerged in water to prevent them from drying out.

Serving

  1. When it comes time to prep the Spring Rolls, remove the containers from your fridge, set up a prep station, and make however many you want. This recipe will make 15 Spring Rolls.
  2. Serve the spring rolls with the peanut sauce. If your sauce thickens up in the fridge you can add water and stir until you reach the correct consistency.

Faux Cheddar Bay Biscuits

A copycat version of the Cheddar Bay Biscuits from Red Lobster. I like to use these in soups or as croutons.

CourseCuisineTime - 25 minutes
Appetizer, SnackAmericanPrep - 10 minutes
Cook - 15 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
53kcal13 biscuits
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates5.1g51%
Fat2.1g21%
Protein3.4g34%

Ingredients:

**Dry Ingredients **

  • cup (80 g) oat flour
  • tsp (2 g) onion powder
  • 1 tbsp (1 g) dried parsley
  • 1 tsp (4 g) salt
  • 1 tsp (3 g) garlic powder
  • tsp (2 g) baking soda

Wet Ingredients

  • 1 small egg or 1/2 large egg
  • cup (56 g) cheddar cheese
  • cup (150 g) plain Greek yogurt non fat

Instructions:

For the Biscuits

  1. Preheat your oven to 375F.
  2. Mix the dry ingredients and wet ingredients independently then combine.
  3. Use a cookie scoop to put on a sprayed sheet pan and bake at 375 Fahrenheit for 15-17 minutes. Makes 13.

Nashville Hot Chicken Tenders

Nashville Hot Chicken Tenders made from chicken breast tenderloins and coated in a spicy, sweet sauce from brown sugar, hot sauce, and spices.

CourseCuisineTime - 20 minutes
Appetizer, SnackAmericanPrep - 5 minutes
Cook - 15 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
263kcal2
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates9.4g15%
Fat2.6g4%
Protein50.5g82%

Ingredients:

  • 1 lb (454 g) chicken breast tenders
  • 1/2 tsp (1.5 g) chili powder
  • 1/2 tsp (1.5 g) onion powder
  • 1/2 tsp (1.5 g) cayenne pepper
  • 1 tbsp (14 g) brown sugar
  • 1 tsp (3 g) garlic powder
  • 1 tbsp (18 ml) hot sauce
  • 1.5 tsp (7 ml) water
  • Oil spray
  • Salt and pepper to taste

Instructions:

  1. Preheat your air fryer to 400F on the air fry setting for 8 minutes.
  2. Lightly spray the tenders with oil and season with salt and pepper. Cook for 4 minutes then flip.
  3. When the chicken has almost completed cooking, mix the seasonings together and stir in the water and hot sauce.
  4. Add to a pan over medium heat. Bring to a light bubble, we are just trying to caramelize the sugar a bit to thicken the sauce.
  5. Add in the chicken and coat evenly.
  6. This recipe makes 2 servings.

Maple Sriracha Chicken Wings

Air fried chicken wings coated in a sweet and spicy sauce made from maple syrup and sriracha. These are crispy and flavorful and actually super easy to make.

CourseCuisineTime - 17 minutes
AppetizerAmericanPrep - 5 minutes
Cook - 12 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
85kcal22 wings
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates3.9g32%
Fat5.5g45%
Protein4.9g40%

Ingredients:

  • 2 lbs (908 g) chicken wings
  • 2 tbsp (20 g) cornstarch
  • 5 tbsp (80 g) maple syrup
  • 2 tbsp (30 g) sriracha
  • cooking spray
  • 1 tsp (2 g) ground ginger optional
  • green onions chopped, optional
  • sesame seeds optional
  • salt and pepper to taste

Instructions:

  1. Dry the wings with a paper towel and coat with cornstarch, salt and pepper.
  2. Preheat the air fryer to 400F on the air fryer settings for 12 minutes. Place the wings in and spray with oil. Shake every couple of minutes during the cooking process. If you dont have an air fryer you can try the oven but it wont be as good.
  3. Mix together the syrup, sriracha, and ground ginger in a bowl.
  4. Once the wings have crisped up, add the wings into the sauce bowl and toss. Garnish with green onion and sesame seeds if you want to be fancy.
  5. NOTE: Counting calories in things with bones is not the easiest. The way I did it here was to weigh the wings raw with the bones and then weighed the bones after eating and finding the difference. The estimate is per wing for what I had and I had 20 wings. If you have bigger or smaller wings your mileage may vary.

Garlic Parm Fries

Air fried french fries tossed with fresh garlic and parmesan cheese. These are super flavorful and beautifully crisp. The air fryer makes a wonderful french fry that you'd never know wasn't deep fried.

CourseCuisineTime - 26 minutes
AppetizerAmericanPrep - 10 minutes
Cook - 16 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
224kcal2 servings
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates43.3g83%
Fat2.5g4%
Protein7.2g13%

Ingredients:

  • 2 medium (450 g) potatoes
  • 1 tsp (3 g) salt
  • 1 tsp (2 g) pepper
  • 1 tsp (2 g) paprika
  • 4 cloves (20 g) garlic
  • 1 tbsp (10 g) grated parmesan cheese
  • (2 g) cooking spray
  • 1 tbsp (5 g) chopped parsley optional, for garnish

Instructions:

  1. Wash and cut your potatoes into a thin fry shaped. Around inch wide.
  2. Peel your garlic and mince using a garlic press.
  3. Finely chop the parsley.
  4. Preheat your air fryer on the air fry setting to 385F and the timer for 16 minutes.
  5. In a large bowl, toss the potatoes in the salt, pepper, paprika, and spray lightly with oil.
  6. Once the air fryer has heated, add the potatoes and begin the cooking.
  7. After 5-6 minutes of cooking, add the garlic and parmesan and shake the basket. Shake the basket every 2-3 minutes for the remainder of the cooking time until you get your desired consistency.
  8. Garnish with parsley.

Nutrition Information Notes

  1. I included 2 grams of oil in the nutrition information as that is what I weighed the amount oil spray I used. If you need exact nutrition information, you should calculate it yourself.

Tomato Soup

Homemade tomato soup made from canned, whole tomatoes, carrots, onion, and celery. This soup can be topped with a gluten free cheddar crouton for a fancy alternative to grilled cheese and tomato soup.

CourseCuisineTime - null
Appetizer, Snack, SoupAmericanPrep - 5 minutes
Cook - 40 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
203kcal3
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates24.7g60%
Fat7.1g17%
Protein10.2g24%

Ingredients:

  • 28 oz (794 g) whole canned San Marzano tomatoes
  • 2 cups (480 ml) chicken stock
  • 2 stalks (100 g) celery
  • 1 (75 g) carrots
  • 1 (200 g) yellow onion
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) garlic
  • 1 tbsp (15 ml) olive oil
  • 3 tbsp (21 g) Parmesan cheese
  • cup (60 g) plain non fat Greek yogurt

Instructions:

  1. Cut the vegetables into a rough chop. Precision doesn't matter here as everything will be blended.
  2. Add the vegetabels to a large pot with garlic and olive oil. Saut for a couple of minutes.
  3. Add in the stock and the canned tomatoes with their juice. Bring to a boil and reduce heat to low. Cook for 30-35 minutes.
  4. Pour the soup and yogurt in a blender and blend until smooth. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
  5. Makes 3 servings. Top with parmesan cheese. Nutrition is per bowl for the soup only. The nutrition information will change depending on if you decide to make the croutons to go on top. The nutrition information for those should be added if you need precision.

For the Crouton

  1. While soup is simmering, you can make the biscuits shown in the picture if you wish. That recipe is called Faux Cheddar Bay Biscuits found at this link -> Faux Cheddar Bay Biscuits. Follow the recpie for the biscuts. To make the crouton, cut the cooked biscuits into 4ths. Bake in a 425F oven for 8-10 minutes until crispy. Shake the pan every few minutes to stir.

Gluten Free Bruschetta

A gluten free version of the classic bread based appetizer. Instead of a baguette, this recipe uses a bread made from oat flour as a vehicle for the tomato and balsamic mixture.

CourseCuisineTime - 40 minutes
Appetizer, SnackItalianPrep - 15 minutes
Cook - 25 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
77kcal8 slices
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates11.3g70%
Fat1.3g8%
Protein4.5g28%

Ingredients:

  • 7/8 cup (80 g) oat flour
  • 1 tsp (4 g) salt
  • 1 tsp (4 g) garlic powder
  • 1/2 tsp (2 g) onion powder
  • 1/2 tsp (2 g) baking soda
  • 1/2 cup (120 g) plain non fat Greek yogurt
  • 1 large (50 g) egg white
  • 2 (120 g) Roma tomatoes
  • 1 tbsp (15 ml) balsamic glaze
  • Basil
  • 2 (56 g) mozzarella string cheese sticks

Instructions:

  1. Preheat oven to 375F.
  2. Mix the dry ingredients together for the bread. Then add in yogurt and egg white. Stir to incorporate.
  3. Put the dough mixture onto an oiled baking sheet or on top of a silpat and form it into a baguette shape. Do your best to recreate the shape.
  4. Bake for 15-17 minutes.
  5. Allow to cool and cut into slices. If you were able to shape it correctly you may be able to cut into cross sections. Your loaf may be a little bit flat if you were unable to shape the raw dough correctly. If this is the case, cut the loaf logitudinally and then into slices.
  6. Turn the oven to 450F and bake the slices for 7-9 minutes or until crisp flipping halfway through. Watch them carefully to ensure they don't burn.
  7. Cut the tomatoes into a small dice removing any seeds and chop the basil and string cheese. Mix together.
  8. Top each piece of bread with tomato mixture and drizzle balsamic glaze.
  9. This will make 8 slices. Nutrition information is for 1 of 8 slices.

Soup

  • Ham and Bean Soup
  • Tomato Soup

Ham and Bean Soup

Ham and Bean Soup made up of ham, shredded chicken, white beans, potatoes, and vegetables. A great option to add to your soup rotation for the winter. Soups are great options for meal prep if you don't have to travel with your meals because they keep the best in the fridge over the week.

CourseCuisineTime - 1 hour 1 hour 1 hour
Main Course, SoupAmerican, meal prepPrep - 15 minutes 15 minutes 15 minutes
Cook - 45 minutes 45 minutes 45 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
635kcal5 servings
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates67g47%
Fat13g9%
Protein62g43%

Ingredients:

For the Soup

  • 1 lbs (568 g) ham steak
  • 1 lb (454 g) boneless skinless chicken breasts
  • 4 medium (1000 g) potatoes
  • 2 medium (200 g) carrots
  • 3 stalks (200 g) celery
  • 1 medium (200 g) onion
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) garlic minced
  • 2 tbsp (30 g) oil
  • 1 can (878 g) great northern beans
  • 4 cups (946 g) chicken broth
  • 3 cups (720 g) water
  • 1 tsp (4 g) granulated chicken bouillon
  • salt and pepper to taste

Instructions:

For the Soup

  1. Wash and cut your vegetables. Cut the onion, carrots, and celery into a small dice. Cut the potatoes into a large dice. Cut the kale away from the stems and roughly chop. Massage the kale by squeezing the leaves a bit.
  2. Into a large pot, add 2 tbsp of oil over medium high heat.
  3. Add your garlic, onions, celery, and carrots. Season lightly with salt and allow them to brown for a few minutes.
  4. While the vegetables are cooking, cut your ham steak into a large dice.
  5. Once the vegetables have softened and developed color, add in the ham, chicken and the potatoes to the pot. Pour in the chicken broth and water.
  6. Rinse and drain the beans and add them to the pot.
  7. Cover the pot and bring it to a boil. Once boiling you can reduce the heat to low and cook for about 15 minutes.
  8. After 15 minutes, pull out the chicken and shred with two forks or a mixer. Season the shredded chicken with salt and pepper.
  9. Add in the kale to the pot while you shred the chicken.
  10. Add the shredded chicken and 1 tsp of granulated chicken bouillon to the pot and stir.
  11. Taste the broth to test for seasoning and adjust with salt and pepper to taste. The ham is quite salty so it make sure you test first before adding any salt.

Plating

  1. This recipe makes 4 servings. Divide your soup evenly into 4 containers and allow to cool before you store in your fridge.
  2. NOTE: A nice addition to the top of this soup after you reheat it is some chili garlic oil. The extra fat mixes with the broth for lots of flavor and heat.

Tomato Soup

Homemade tomato soup made from canned, whole tomatoes, carrots, onion, and celery. This soup can be topped with a gluten free cheddar crouton for a fancy alternative to grilled cheese and tomato soup.

CourseCuisineTime - null
Appetizer, Snack, SoupAmericanPrep - 5 minutes
Cook - 40 minutes

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
203kcal3
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates24.7g60%
Fat7.1g17%
Protein10.2g24%

Ingredients:

  • 28 oz (794 g) whole canned San Marzano tomatoes
  • 2 cups (480 ml) chicken stock
  • 2 stalks (100 g) celery
  • 1 (75 g) carrots
  • 1 (200 g) yellow onion
  • 1 tbsp (15 g) garlic
  • 1 tbsp (15 ml) olive oil
  • 3 tbsp (21 g) Parmesan cheese
  • cup (60 g) plain non fat Greek yogurt

Instructions:

  1. Cut the vegetables into a rough chop. Precision doesn't matter here as everything will be blended.
  2. Add the vegetabels to a large pot with garlic and olive oil. Saut for a couple of minutes.
  3. Add in the stock and the canned tomatoes with their juice. Bring to a boil and reduce heat to low. Cook for 30-35 minutes.
  4. Pour the soup and yogurt in a blender and blend until smooth. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
  5. Makes 3 servings. Top with parmesan cheese. Nutrition is per bowl for the soup only. The nutrition information will change depending on if you decide to make the croutons to go on top. The nutrition information for those should be added if you need precision.

For the Crouton

  1. While soup is simmering, you can make the biscuits shown in the picture if you wish. That recipe is called Faux Cheddar Bay Biscuits found at this link -> Faux Cheddar Bay Biscuits. Follow the recpie for the biscuts. To make the crouton, cut the cooked biscuits into 4ths. Bake in a 425F oven for 8-10 minutes until crispy. Shake the pan every few minutes to stir.

Drinks

  • Vegetable Shake

Vegetable Shake

This is my daily vegetable shake. As many of you know, I despise and hate vegetables with the fire of 10,000 dragons. This is not something to drink for enjoyment. It doesn't taste good and if you have a crappy blender I wouldn't even try to make it. I drink this purely to get in a large serving of vegetables. The blender I use is a Vitamix 5200.

CourseCuisineTime - 10 minutes
DrinksAmerican, ArgentinianPrep - 10 minutes
Cook - null

Nutrition

CaloriesServings
167kcal4 servings
MacroWeight(g)Percentage(%)
Carbohydrates35.9g94%
Fat0.9g2%
Protein3.9g10%

Ingredients:

  • 1 pint (473 ml) water
  • 2 tbsp (30 ml) lemon juice
  • 1 cup (85 g) carrots
  • 4 cups (125 g) kale
  • 2 (365 g) pears
  • 1 medium (300 g) cucumber
  • 1 medium (200 g) zucchini
  • 1 inch (15 g) ginger

Instructions:

  1. Add all of the ingredients to a blender. Blend until smooth.
  2. Store in mason jars and refrigerate or freeze if youre prepping more than a days worth.

NOTE

  1. I've started to cut all of the vegetables in advance and store them in meal prep containers instead of blending them and storing in the mason jars. This is better for preserving nutrient quality.
